reviews.review: A great place to relax. A really nice park in amongst all the hussle and bustle to give you the chance to sit down and take breath. Often so form of performance on the stage and there is somewhere you can buy a drink also.
Love the parks in NYC!. We saw this park multiple times since we changed subways nearby. It's a happening place. Right by the gorgeous NY Public Library. Love all the wonderful parks in NYC.
Great place to walk around . Great area to walk around with friends and you partner. Currently a lot of construction around the park , but is still worth every moment. 😁😎

Take a coffee, a book and your time . Bryant Park is for Europeans, what a city park is - but New York does it better - with ample tables, chairs, coffee stores, games and better than that - faultless wifi ! It's outdoor living with indoor convenience - a place of solace just footsteps from the bustle - a great place to stop and take a break

Charming Bryant Park. On the grounds of the New York Public Library, Bryant Park reminds you of Hollywood movies. It's romantic, quiet, peaceful. It's chaotic, bustling. It can be all of these things. Bryant Park is in the heart of everything all at once.

Time for a break. This is a great place in New York City to catch a quick break and unwind. For those who think Central Park is too mainstream, Bryant Park is the perfect choice. There are food vendors and nice benches to relax and people watch. A very underrated spot in the city in my opinion.
Oasis of calm. Very pleasant space amidst the madness. Great old building/hotel across the road. Good spot for a rest amongst the shrubbery, or a quick game of chess, if there is such a thing!

A Small Park near Grand Central. Visit the small outdoors near the Train. People activities including Ping Pong observe New Yorker activities in the outdoors and escaping being able to enjoy out of indoors
NICE PARK!. But it is currently closed in preparation for the ice rink. Should note there are nice seating areas with free wifi.

Great place to relax with a casual, street vendor lunch. We happened upon Bryant Park by chance. We were walking by the area and it was so, so hot that we were looking for a place to stop a while and get some shade. We looked across the street and there was a park we found out was Bryant Park. We got a lunch from an adjacent street vendor and ate on one of the many tables beneath the trees. Pleasant and relaxing to eat and watch the people and kids relaxing an enjoying themselves. There seemed to be a lot of locals. Gave us a taste of what it might be like to live in the city and be able to enjoy a neighborhood park in the midst of the concrete jungle.

Great Place for a Break. I was on a business trip and needed to just slow down and catch up on things. This is a great little park right next to the library to relax, research stuff on your phone, and just people watch. You can sit near the library for wi-fi, get some food from the booths, and see whatever is the current event in the courtyard. I found myself coming back a few times for the solace.
Quiet and lazy. Stop in this park, under the trees, to rest from touristing or shopping. It is just behind the library and under the lawn/ice ring there are millions of books!

Books in the Park. A lovely treed park in behind the New York Public Library. Books and magazines were available to use while sitting in the park. Lots of tables and chairs to sit on. The shade was a welcome on the hot day we visited.
Restful spot. This was a beautiful place to rest my travel-weary broken toe. There were plenty of chairs and the flower beds add colour to the green space.
Lovely park. Beautiful atmosphere and scenery. Lovely place to sit and day dream whilst surrounded by skyscrapers.

Nice spot for breakfast and lunch . We stayed at the Hyatt on 45th and discovered Bryant Park looking for a place for breakfast. There are a couple of quick food choices in that area but I noticed people come with lunch bags as well. The city is working on an ice skating rink. Looking forward to the winter !

Suburban Oasis. This is a cool park in the middle of mid town. Plenty of green grass to spread out on and even chairs to sit on. A great place to escape the hubbub, read a book and have a cup of coffee.

Lovely place to grab lunch or just spend a summer afternoon. Located right behind the New York Public Library, this little park is in the middle of everything. You can grab a quick lunch and eat it while people watching.

Always something going on.... The #1 thing I love about Bryant Park is that it has one of the nicest public bathrooms! I GREATLY appreciate the fresh flowers and constant attendant when I've been strolling through the city and do not want to buy another drink to earn a potty break!But seriously, the real great thing about Bryant Park is the ever changing activities. On this trip they were installing the ice rink and getting prepared for the winter market. There still were a handful of mini shacks that sold food and drinks. I noticed a South West lounge this time and even saw a free game zone where the public could sit and play games such as checkers and chess. In June I had a chance to sit on the lush green grass and enjoy a free sample of the New York Opera! Never overlook the parks in NYC, you just never know what you might discover!

Lovely, calm Park. Bryant Park is one of the smaller city parks. Fortunately, no matter how many people are walking - sometimes frenetically - in the surrounding area, the park seems peaceful and secluded. Even though construction is currently going on in some areas of the park, little noise is heard. Many folks are comfortably sitting and relaxing on one of the chairs (many chairs are colorful) by themselves, perhaps having a nibble from a one of the small kiosks on its grounds, or at a small table with friends or family. Trees or large umbrellas give some shelter if necessary.

The best park in the world. Bryant Park is a jewel. It is a grand urban ballet, with many things to do such as juggling, reading at the reading room, all sorts of classes at different times of the day, chairs to sit and kiosks where to get good food and snacks, casual restaurants, the list goes on and one. This is a wonderful spot to make one's base for exploring New York

One of my favorite places in Manhattan. The spring/summer brings this outdoor space alive with people getting away from their offices and enjoy being outside. The fall/winter the rink is open and there are vendors for the holidays. Have a drink or a bite to eat or even read a book. Movie night on the big screen. Love this park!
Small park. Nice, quiet small park, in the middle of the city. Excelent for taking a small break and have coffee on the terrace.
Beautiful place to stop for a drink or bite to eat.. Beautiful, serene and good people watching! Right behind the public library, and a small holiday shop bazaar. Cute and free. Try it out!
An oasis in Central New York. Very pleasant park with outdoor catering, seats and lovely trees. Very peaceful for a much needed break from the streets.

Great place for a coffee. This small oasis of green provides a great opportunity for coffee and snacks. There are a couple of outside vendors providing cakes, snacks and drinks. There are even reading books available. Take a break here, watch the traffic go by and take a look up and see the Empire State Building. The Bryant Park Hotel offers music on Monday evenings.

Nice stroll/Getting ready for winter. We come to Bryant Park throughout the year but the best time is in the winter when they have shopping set up and an great ice rink. We went by yesterday and they are beginning to set up the rink for the fall.

Great park for a rest!. We were walking, walking, walking and our feet hurt! Bryant Park is perfect for just that. We wished we picked up sandwiches to go. It was a lovely day for lunch in the park. We noticed many people doing just that. There were benches everywhere. Fun to rest and people watch!

Honestly not that interesting. Now all my Bryant Park friends are gonna ding me for saying this but... it's honestly that not interesting of a place to visit. Like, everything in this neighborhood is interesting except for Bryant Park itself lol
Bryant Park. What a joy to go to the NY library and then enjoy a snack outside of the madness that is New York City. Bryant Park is just a gem and we loved it.
Beautiful but crowded. It's situated in the downtown but it's very calm and had a lot of shade but I felt it was too crowded.. But worth sitting down and relaxing for a while
Peaceful spot for breakfast. A small but pretty park close to many of the sights and next to the Public Library. The trees have been grown in such a way to create a canopy over the park.

Magical at Christmas. This place is transformed into a magical icerink bordered by a Christmas market from Thanksgiving to New Year. Music, lights and crafts with some lovely eateries around too, to warm you up.

It was good but too much people. It was good but there was too much people it is a little hard to skate because of that you could skate all day but the line is really long but you could pay for the short line

Friendly atmosphere . A few beers at Bryant Park cafe overlooking the park was worth the visit. Late afternoon visit meant lots of people enjoying the relaxed ambiance. Plenty of outdoor seating. A nice place for a breathe in a busy city

Best place to be . Ideal place to recenter after the noise and hustle of Times Square.
Real people hanging out.
No one selling you a bus tour for the 50 th time.
Squirrels, dogs, coffee, chess.
Feels like the best place to lie on the grass and recoup your energy.
Rest your mind and your feet.

Christmas time. They have a plethora of vendors with a variety of gift ideas and an ice skating rink. You'll find the Christmas spirit here week prior to the 25th. There's a reading library outdoors in the warm months and often outdoor movie night. Located behind the NYC library this park is an inexpensive way to spend an afternoon. Starbucks is located across the street on the corner.

Nice park. This is a nice park in midtown especially at Christmas season. There is large tree which is nicely decorated for the season with many lights and some very large Christmas ornaments. There is also a nice size skating rink to enjoy. If you are into shopping there are many kiosks for your shopping enjoyment.
Nice place to relax in the city. There are several sits and table to enjoy a snack at anytime of the day, free wifi. A great place to chill out between long walks...
Great place to take in the city. This is a great little park in New York to just sit back and take it all in. Grab a coffee and just watch the people.

Always something going on. We love Bryant Park. A little haven from the crowds. They have great little coffee stands, nice trees and tables, and new things
are always going on there. Beautiful clean restrooms too. Enjoy
Lovely park. Lovely park definitely worth dropping by. There are a few places near by where you can grab some food and have a seat. Be sure to check out the library next door!

Chic. This is a great little park especially in summer when we visited, plenty of greenery as well as some cover from the hot sunshine. It was very clean and pleasant despite the lunch time crowds. Loads of nice monuments and buildings line the park as well as a great view to the iconic Empire State Building.
Quaint little park. Cool and quaint park. Not too much to do, but very pretty with the cobblestone path and old fashion carousel ride for kids in the park.

comfortable park but crowded. nice relaxing atmosphere but Incredibly crowded at lunch 12 - 2
clean. enclosed eating areas are expensive

FRIENDS FOUNTAIN. this is the fountain that is based off the opening of FRIENDS, the tv show. Its a great park for photos and for sitting with some lunch and enjoying the beauty NYC has to offer. Definitely stop for a moment and live like a local.
We never miss stopping by. We love the park and the vendors. It is great people watching and Hotel Bryant Park has great snacks and cocktails.

A must see for all newcomers to NYC. One can sit here and have a coffee, read the New York Times or a good book and enjoy the scenery. One of the best public parks in Manhattan. Small shops sell sandwiches, waffles and soft drinks. A play of chess or patanque is also an option.

Great place to relax. This park was just around the corner from our hotel and was a pleasant surprise. We used to come here for breakfast some mornings, grabbing something from a nearby Pret a Manger. There are always plenty of tables and chairs available in the park which is filled with trees. There are also some food outlets in the park itself. It is not large but a haven from the hustle and bustle of the city. There are always lots of people here just enjoying the surroundings, so good for people watching. Occasionally there is some form of entertainment on somewhere in the park. It is great at night when the surrounding buildings are lit up and there is also a view of the Empire State Building.

Lovely Respite While Touring. I always take my daughter to Bryant Park to ride the merry-go-round when we visit NYC in early Autumn. The trees are lovely as well as the surrounding buildings. This park reminds me of Paris. Great atmosphere and landscaping.

Amazing. Bryant Park is an amazing place,you have different activities all year round,and a lot of attraction too there,this park is very incredible during Christmas time and New years.I love this place is truly amusing.

Great park. While we were there, there was a southwest airline fair and we had a blast square dancing, juggling etc. The park boasts a lot of street vendors and even a nice cafe. While you are there, you should visit the library and learn about the history of that building. If you have younger kids, there is even a small playground and books on the first floor.
Pit stop. Nice relaxing area to recharge your batteries just around the corner fro. Busy Times Square. Sit down have a drink or snack

Great all year 'round. Bryant Park is a grassy oasis on a sunny afternoon, has films some summer Monday nights, offers free wifi in the park area, many tables and chairs for reading, relaxing or eating a take-out lunch. Music some days at lunch time. A Christmas Market and usually an ice skating rink in the winter. Overall, it's just about the best use of parkland in the middle of any city in the world. Also,clean, free toilets.

excellent. Brilliant park to visit, all sorts going on every day, Amish choir, dance classes on the lawn, carousel, drafts, lovely tables and chairs to sit at, a very peaceful, vibrant place to sit and watch the world go round.

It's in my favourite book. When you first see NY's public library you don't imagine the park behind. It's cozy and it takes you miles away from the city that never sleeps right into a very private place to rest and read ... When walking Manhattan, it's one of the pit stops you should consider to refill your batteries like so many other squares and parks all over the city. Watch for them they are precious ...
Beautiful day in the park. This park behind the library is an amazing place to sit and eat, chat, and people watch. As a tourist, I rather this park than central park for relaxing.
small but alive. It has a very central location. Its a good stop to take a break when you are tired walking around. You may love street performer or organized shows hhere in the park.
Coffee in the park.. A quint and peaceful park in Midtown, where you can grab a coffee, newspaper and watch the world go by.

Little piece of heaven in the middle of the hustle and bustle of NYC. Bryant Park is the perfect place to sit and relax during a busy day in NYC. You can read a book from the borrow-a-book shelf and spend some time shaded in the beautiful trees. Or admire the architecture of the NYC Public Library and other buildings nearby. I wish I could have spend more time here!
Beautiful green space. I happened upon this little green gem while walking. It is a pleasant little park with interesting plants and even a birding tour in the morning!

Regular music and other events in this small park. This small park between Fifth and Sixth Avenues (with 40th and 42nd) has music and other events. While we were here there was a hip hop style of band playing and the next day was the lead singer from Talking Heads and his band. It easy to get through as it has a metro station underneath (Bryant Park)
Very busy. This is a nice place in the middle of the city to people watch. Great "green spot" to relax and have a drink or a street hot dog.
Best Bathrooms. If you need a bathroom, go here, they are great!! aaaand I suppose the park is nice too, very pretty and well kept!

Great place to chill. If you need a quiet spot for lunch, and to people watch, then head to this park. While we were there we saw Jugglers, people playing table tennis and the small carousel. Amazingly, we found the Internet access in the park very strong. Intended to spend a short while, ended up staying over an hour.

4th July film in the park. Always a favourite with our party and as it was my youngests 16th birthday we decided no fireworks by the river but Top Gun in Bryant Park. Yes it rained and rained and rained but stuck it out until the end and this is a fab location for films but better if the weather was playing ball. The organisation was good although the toilets not so - yuk. Lovely little park in the heart of the city

Very beautiful park right near Times Square!. This park is situated right next to the New York City Public Library and it is also on 42nd Street and near Times Square. This Park is really nice and relaxing and romantic!

Always a pleasure to be here . This place has a lot going on from local events, lake boat rides and the fun walk thru the miles of park. Nice scenery, panic with friends and yes places u can get food.

Beautiful park set in the heart of the city. Overtime we visit New York we ensure we make time to have a few moments in Bryant Park. It is ideally located between Grand Central and Times Square on 42nd Street. It is a little oasis in the heart of a very busy city. Very relaxing for couples to share a moment together.

Love it at Christmas. Christmas is my favourite time of year for NYC generally but Bryant Park is great then too. The Christmas market is so charming and you can just people watch. The surrounding area has some great shops like Lord and Taylor for Christmas decorations, Alice and Olivia running along side for girls clothing and so close to Grand Central so handy for their food court and further Christmas stalls!! I didn't see it , but I believe in summer they show films outdoors here which would also be lovely.It also has a great view of Empire State Building and Chrysler Building.

Nice place for lunch. Bryant is a great place to bring your lunch and enjoy the surroundings. There are tables and chairs and pigeons everywhere. There are plenty of places where you can buy lunch and sit outside in good weather. Relaxing. You can also find plugs for your electrical devices.

Lovely. We stumbled on this place by accident then couldn't keep away. The bar is a great place to have a drink, snack and people watch. If you buy a coffee from a kiosk there are lots of tables and chairs to sit at. Lots of cafes hotels and open space. Absolutely lovely place to relax and watch the world go by.

Unexpected great little spot . We were walking around ny and came across this great little park. There was a square dance going on at the time which was a lot of fun. There was food vendors and beer and wine. So we just sat and people watching and had a blast !
Beautiful!!. In the middle of a rushed city is this most beautiful garden with restaurants, play area for kids and music!

A Park For All Seasons. Bryant Park is a perennial favorite all year around, from the boules courts to the winter holiday market and ice skating, the food, the environment, the history...just go there, believe me, you will love it!! Plus it is just blocks from Grand Central Station. I often go to the market at Grand Central and get eats and then walk to the park for lunch.

A Cheerful Place to Relax in NYC. This is a park that wasn't even on my radar, but one we happened to pass by while walking somewhere else. We detoured into the park area and found it to be a great place to just relax, eat, drink, and listen to music.

Special Fun Place visited March 2016. This attraction should best be done in winter, near to Christmas Time to get the best atmosphere. It does get very busy and you could have a wait time, check before you go.
Loved this parl. This is just a wonderful and quirky place to pass some time in. We read on the outdoor library. Saw modern Shakespeare in the park. Simply wonderful

An Oasis in the centre of New york. A lovely square just a short walk from times square ,Plenty of seats tables and shade to sit and watch life go by.Noisy and gets full with people having their lunch but this adds to the atmosphere and we had a couple of conversations with Locals most of whom like to chat.Well worth a visit for a drink and or snack.
Lunch in the park. Great green space. Grab lunch, find a seat and enjoy the space. We at lunch at the Bryant park cafe. Food was good. Great atmosphere. Really liked this space a lot.

Walk around NYC. Lovely park to walk around or just sit and enjoy the view. We got coffees and hung out.
We were tourists but noticed a lot of NYC professionals having lunch and coffee.

Brilliant Place. The best place to people watch in NYC. Excellent place to sit with a book from the nearby public library and relax for a few hours to see the diversity of the city. From gymnasts practicing lifts, to families playing games, to office workers stealing a moment to eat their lunch.

Best park in New York. Spent 3 weeks in New York and went here about 5 times. Is the best park by far in NYC. Great shade, heaps of different people users, free things to do, reading spots, restaurants etc. great place just to stop and escape the hussle. Don't miss it.

Great oasis in the middle of the city. Great oasis in the middle of the city. Nearby cafes are useful to take to a table in the park. Check out the library and free events. Seasonal setups are either wonderful or annoying depending on your view. Calm place to sit down.
A normal park. Its a normal and the best time to visit is in the summers. a little less crowded than central park but good place to hang out
Morning Coffee. Great place to get away from the busy streets. Enjoy a coffee in the morning with the locals in a beautiful park setting.
Busy but pretty. Despite being busy it had a lot of space. lots of outdoor seating and casfes. A very beautiful mid-city park
dancing. we saw ice skating let year but this year we watched a square dance exhibition that everyone was allowed to participate.Was lots of fun
Nice. A lovely environment and a good focal point for travellers! We found that if our family wanted to split up we would always say "meet at Bryant at this time!"

Good NYC Spot. It's a nice place to have lunch if you work around the area. They usually have things going on - in the summer they have various Broadway shows, entertainment, ect. In the winter the Winter Village at Bryant Park is fun to go to. Usually the same stuff every year but you can find some holiday gifts for hard to buy for people. Ice skating is nice, but usually a long wait. Better off going down to SSSP.
Adorable!. Lovely little park in New York. We ate lunch their one day, not realising where we were. Definitely somewhere you should go if in the city!

A great place to pause in NYC. NY is a frenetic city however Bryant Park is a great place to pause and think. Whilst often quite busy, it is an amazing place to eat lunch, meet friends or just relax. Ideal to fit in when visiting the Library.
Enjoy!
Relaxing. Friendly people and scenery very relaxing. Nice to sit and watch the world go by or people watch. Would love to revisit.

Perfect lunch stop. This green park area off 42nd street is the perfect stop for lunch if the weather is good. Lots of free seating available, and the park is surrounded by an array of food and drink outlets!!
A wonderful place to rest while visiting the city. This is a very beautiful park in the center of the city, a wonderful place to stop for a while, have a rest or enjoy a picnic!!

Great NYC oasis. It's a lovely park, just behind the NYC library. The food stalls are beaut, plenty of shady places to sit, and the gardens are pretty. There seems to be really cool thing on, for instance public square dancing on Friday night ! A real change from the do create and hustle and bustle.

Didn't want to leave.... We have been to bryant park twice...a winter evening where the lights, etc. were so lovely. This past week we enjoyed a lovely fall Friday soaking up the sun, greenery, outdoors. We simply did not want to leave.

Free tour on Wednesday. I stumbled across this -- it starts at 11 am by the fountain. And while I've been to the park many times and enjoy the Wednesday evening history talks in the summer, I learned there is so much more going on.
Bonus for travelers: free wifi, lots of phone charging spots, clean rest rooms.
Nice place to relax!. For people-watching, reading, relaxing or eating outside, the park is really amazing. Lots of seating, great take-out restaurants around the park!

Great place to visit, especially around the holidays. I have always loved Bryant Park for it's atmosphere in the city. It is a great place to visit when it is warm outside. You can sit and enjoy something to eat or drink. In the winter, there is a great Holiday Market with shops and restaurants.
Peaceful haven. Came across Bryant Park on one of our walks. Very nice eating places and bars. Had a snack at the cafe. The grill next door even has someone playing the piano.

Great place. I was surprised to bump into this place. It's pleasent to walk around and soak in. I stood around to watch some Chess games, including a very loud game which was substituded friendly banter for skill. The low skill made it more interesting for me to watch as I could easily follow it. I think having games out for the public is a great thing, wish we had this at home.
Nice Spot. This really is a little Oasis surrounded by the Library and other buildings. Get your daily squirrel sighting fix and relax with a coffee or ice cold lemonade as we did.

Small park behind the library. I visited around lunch time and there were many people having their lunch on the lawns or on the chairs scattered about. There are some food carts at one end that were doing a good trade and a restaurant at the back of the library building. A little patch if green amid the forest of skyscrapers. There's a little carousel there as well.

A Patch of Paradise in the Concrete Jungle. We visited a couple of times during our recent NYC stay. This small park receives tender loving care from its staff and is well maintained with special attention to seasonal plants and special events. Do make the effort to visit.
Midtown escape. On Summer Thursdays, there is NYC Opera at noon and a joyous sing-along from 2-4. Take your lunch, grab a chair and enjoy the free fun.

So glad we visited this park. What a beautiful place to visit in Autumn. We had a wonderful time walking through Bryant Park and hiring a tandem bike for the kids to ride around. The colour of the trees on a cool autumn day was just stunning. It was lovely having a coffee sitting watching skaters on the two skating rinks. Such a lovely way to end our six week holiday. We highly recommend a visit to this park.
Good for a break. Stopped here for a break while en route. Great sit down venue to people watch. There was though a clear whiff of weed.

Great Stop for a Sunday Afternoon. Hubby and I did a LOT of walking on our visit to NYC this weekend. We just wanted to kick back, enjoy the sun and people watch a bit. We reached Bryant Park and "parked" ourselves. Lots of tables and chairs around the park and numerous fun and yummy food options. There's also a Pret a Manger and Starbucks nearby if you can't find something you like at the park. Definitely worth a visit, especially if you are covering a lot of NYC territory and need a break!
wonderful oasis. lovely place to spend a few minutes or hours on a lovely autumn afternoon. Be sure to check out the adjacent NY public library.
Best in Bryant. One of my favourite places to have a drink and/or dine in NYC is Bryant Park Grill. Great atmosphere that makes you feel you are not in the crazy city at all.

OASIS IN NEW YORK!!. Went here with my wife on a sunny lunchtime amongst locals and tourists.
We had our lunch (bought from a takeaway shop nearby) and sat down on the seemingly plentiful chairs dotted about.
There we just sat and people watched spending an hour or so just relaxing.
Good place for lunch and people watching. This park is a nice stop after touring the New York public library. It was very crowded over the lunch time, so arriving early would be a good idea.

A Little Oasis. I stumbled across this gorgeous little park late one night. I had travelled alone and felt completely safe at 11 pm by myself. It is a little calm oasis in the mayhem of New York. I got myself a coffee and sat at one of the many tables watching the world go by. It was such a simple little thing to do but was also a real highlight for me.
An excellent place to rest. A great place to just sit and take in the atmosphere of the city, people watch and have some lunch. Watch other sight seers take photographs in front of the fountain.

Love the park. During the day many people there to relax from work, during the evening same story, during the night... well its new york so dont be scared of the local homeless people they dont bite they just had bad luck. Free wifi btw and please visit the museum there is a secret under the park

Busy as beehives. Walk across, play, find friends, read, work on the computer, all these things happen at once in Bryant Park. Watch the people enjoy life on a summer day in mid Manhattan and join the ping pong game, get the kids on the rides, or simply sit down and enjoy the view.
Great outside park. Lots of atmosphere and places to snack and sit and watch the world go by. As with everywhere nearby Times Square it was very busy.
nice park with free activities. Pleasant area with are performances, surrounded by large impressive buildings. Nice place to sit on a warm evening.

Loved every minute. We love every minute in Bryant Park, a little oasis in NYC to escape the hustle and bustle of every corner of the city. It's a little gem which was further enhanced with the Bank of America film festival showing free movies. It's clean and tidy and just a wonderful wonderful place.

Time to chill. Ideally situated piece of heaven with a nice atmosphere in this bustling city, usually music or entertainment going on but nice just to sit and relax night or day, free tables and chairs provided to take the weight off your feet with a snack or a coffee from the little cafe.
Beautiful location for lunch. We had lunch at the rooftop restaurant in Bryant Park, and not only was the food amazing, so was the view!

Nice park, lots of activites. This park, behind the NYC public library, is an easy meander with a small market on certain days, and always something happening. We saw jugglers and a pop up library, there is a carousel for children, and eateries in and around the park. It's a small park, well maintained.

Amazing Green sanctuary in the heart of NYC .Great backyard for the NY Library .. Great backyard for the NY Library that blends the contemplative serenity of the Library with the eclectic energy of the city. Transformative slice of parkland. ₩

A heaven in the city. This park in the middle of the skyscrabers is an oases - very open and welcoming even though there are trees around, you can sit everywhere, children can play, there are book reading events etc.

Cute. Cute little peaceful park easily missed.
Thought it might be bigger before I seen it but it's very enchanting and allows a bit of peace and quiet from the hustle and bustle of the big city.

Amazing mid-day lunch site. Bryant Park is a beautiful location but the mid-day scene identifies the unique and diverse way of life in the Big Apple. You can see upscale lunches at the Grill, lunches on a blanket on the green grass or brown bags at the picnic tables. People taking naps, Ping Pong tournaments on the park tables, musicians, people trying their hand juggling and more. Lots of activity going on.

Anniversary Trip. This is a great park! I love that in the midst of this great big city there are these beautiful parks. You can almost forget that you're surrounded by many big buildings. There's always something going on in the park, seems like it anyway. A nice place to sit and grab a pop and just relax before getting up and walking some more!! :)

Don't miss it!. I remember when people were afraid to roam into Bryant Park. Fast forward several years later and it's one of the best places to visit in midtown. Located conveniently behind NYPL, Bryant Park offers a grille, ice rink (in season), interesting vendors and much more.

Lovely place to relax. Spent our last few hours in New York here just chilling with a book. It has a lovely and is a really pleasant place to sit in dappled shade. Lots of people watching opportunities, still feel part of the city with background noise but feels like a community space with a reading area, chess, pétanque, table tennis and piano playing. Seems there are events on here throughout daytime and evenings - wish we'd found it sooner in our stay. Think it would be a nice place to sit of an evening and soak up a bit of Manhattan atmosphere.

Great place to relax in Midtown. On a warm September day, this was the perfect place to stop between business meetings. Wifi, plenty of seating, shade from the many trees, or lawn for sunning yourself.

Brilliant. We visited Bryant Park on a couple of occasions during our week long stay in NY.I was amazed at not only how tidy the park was kept by the wardens and people of NY but also the frequency that the rubbish bins were emptied!!!On Thurs 23rd we were fortunate to be in the park early evening when around 100 people took part in a free yoga session. Absolutely brilliant . The park is certainly a relaxing place where you can easily kill an hour just sitting there and watching the world go by!!!!

Beautiful place to sit and relax. . Bryant Park is said to have the cleanest toilets in the whole of New York. After using them I'd say that is probably true, the whole park is very clean and kept very nice. There is a lot of seating inside the park and it is a lovely place to sit and relax amongst all the chaos of Manhattan. Situated near the New York Public Library and Fifth Avenue, it feels very classy and is very peaceful.

FAB Park to people watch. I LOVED this Venue it was so good to sit and chill or join in some of the activities that they have on and they had concerts on most night that I was there in August this year it is close to the empire state building and all the shops are close by I stayed at the Edison in Times Square which is 10 mins walk so I visited frequently while I was there ,you can get drinks and snacks and there is plenty of seating a must see while your in New York

This is NY to me. Hanging at the park during the day. . Our hotel was very close to Bryant Park and enjoyed it during the week. This is a great place to sit at one of the tables near the park, relax with friends and talk about the day. We had an opportunity to walk by after exiting the subway and saw everyone simply enjoying the day. Definitely a great place to take a load off and relax and enjoy your stay in NY.

park and library. OK - I'm not one for books but the library totally inspired me - go see the mini-cinema thing which was incredible - love this place - like the highland - you can hide here for moments to get away from the crazy (and gorgeous) life in Manhattan
Relaxing. The place to go for a picnic or a light lunch. The park has plenty of seating and a lot of eateries around it. An oasis in Manhattan .

great. The park is managed by a private not-for-private corporation named Bryant Park Corporation. The lawn area provides lunch place for the workers and seats to the visitors. The park stands adjacent to the New York Public Library. Sculptures like of Benito Juarez and William Dodge stand here. The park also provides a reading room which has the books donated by Oxford University. Bryant Park Summer Film Festival brings a huge crowd to the park on summer Mondays. Films like: Ghostbusters and Sex and the city are also shot here. The park has 125 stores for the shoppers. Skate pond appeals the visitors most. It is a place for ice-skating, public concerts, free table tennis, best restaurants in the city and relaxing one's mind.
Great park. There's so much to do here. Grab a bite to eat, sit down and relax, people watch, Movie nights, ice skating in the winter and much more.
Refuge in the middle of a busy city. We loved Byrant park and all the squirrels, a Moment to take a breath before we moved on in a very busy city

Very nice park!. This is a small park with full of life. There is also a carousel in the park.
We took some cupcakes and ate them in the park.
It was a very nice program to check out the locals and the surrounding building were also fantastic.

Lovely Park at Night !. What a lovely park at night ! We visited the park after seeing Times Square. It's a surprisingly peaceful contrast from busy Times Square. It has beautiful lighting throughout, a greenbelt, and plaza area. Even late into the night, the park still had many people hanging out or relaxing with several small food vendors still open. It's a stunning little park tucked away within the busy city.

Relax in the middle of mid-Manhattan's hussle. Just behind the NY Public Library the Bryant Park is now a well kept place for a break, for reading a paper or a short story before returning to work or continue sightseeing.

Experience NYC Flavor. It was nice to walk through this park and see the locals relaxing on a Sunday afternoon. There are chess and backgammon matches being played. This is a fun place for people watching.

Nice quaint park. This small park is right by Grand central station. It's nice to visit and people watch. There are tables for you to sit at, drink tea and eat your lunch. There's also a nice Christmas fair here in the winter.

Breakfast at Bryant. If you have 30 mins or need to find a spot to eat your croissant this little oasis if fantastic.Great location, great architecture and fantastic vibeMust visit, even if you just walk through

A nice surprise. Bryant Park was a surprise treat! So beautiful and full of life in the middle of the city. There was something for everyone - quiet spots to read; game tables set up for the competitive; a carousel for the children; a putting green for the golfers and much more! A true treat if you are walking around lower Manhattan and need a break!

Nice park in the centre of New York. This is a lovely park around 40th St. It has a large lawn in the middle surrounded by tables and chairs and little bars/cafes. A delightful place to relax, have a coffee or a nice glass of wine.
Beautiful!. This park is simply beautiful! It had a lovely relaxed atmosphere. We only stumbled upon it and we're glad we did. A great spot to have lunch on a sunny day. A must see in NYC!

Lovely Park!. Bryant Park is great! We had lunch at the garden the restaurant there (mostly because it was about to rain) - which was mediocre, but there's plenty other places within walking distance so this isn't so much an issue. This park is also great for just sitting, relaxing and people watching.

Beautiful!. We accidentally found this gem as we were walking to the library. It was fantastic to watch new yorkers sit with a coffee and play cards. There is a kid zone with a mini carousel. The view is amazing. NYC is a concrete jungle and then... peace, calm, relaxing, laughing, and a breath of fresh air. Completely worth it!

My Favorite Park in the City!. Of course you'll want to visit Central Park if it's your first time visiting New York, but I would highly recommend checking out this little midtown gem as well.There is almost always something going on here. In the winter, there is an adorable holiday market, in the summer there are movies in the park, free yoga and tai chi, musical performances and more. If you're going to be in town, check out their calendar to see if there is anything fun you can attend here. I've been to countless fun events here, including a free performance by the cast of Rent!But even if there is nothing going, this is a great spot to stop and grab a hot drink or a sandwich--there are a few food booths around. There is also a park library and fun games like petanque/bocce and table tennis.Also, insider tip, this place has the cleanest public bathroom you are likely to find in the city, so if you need to go and you are around midtown, this is the best place to stop. Finally, you can always wander into the New York City Public Library here, which is another underrated treat...but that's for another review.
nice park. visited the park during a visit. There is an outside bar and restaurant nice place to visit and relax and enjoy the sites.

Relaxing Atmosphere. The place is a big lung space park surrounded by offices and commercial establishments. During lunch hour which co ing here in the park enjoying the space playing games, eating lunch and chattingd with their friends. It is a centrally located space to relax, to meet,greet and eat with friends. From 1st November there will be ice skating arrangements adding to the fun of the place.
Nice change. It was nice to see some nature with the greenery in between this concrete and skyscraper city, a good place to sit down and admire the city.

Beautiful oasis in the middle of the city. The Park has really changed for the better over the years, and is a beautiful place to have lunch outdoors or relax after work. Don't miss the holiday fair in late November/December!

An Oasis in a concrete jungle. A perfect way to relax in the shade of some trees with a coffee and croissant reading a book or just people watching, the cocktail bar at night is s bonus with a nice selection of food

Loved it!. Best park ever! I did yoga in Bryant Park.Until October twice a week you can do yoga, so it was perfect for my travel. Also there were reading corner, you can take any magazine, book from the shelves. Plus there was a brainstorming session. It was a perfect place to spend your day.

Place to relax, renew ! Get a New York State of mind. Besides being an iconic NYC location, it has one of the cleanest, retro bathrooms in the city. Go to the North East corner of Bryant Park on 42nd St. Look for a small stone building with "WOMEN - MEN over the door and a line of people waiting to use the facility. Enjoy a very clean, fancy decor room.
Awesome green space in a concrete city!!. After sightseeing all day it's a nice place to sit an relax for a time. The space is inviting and the surroundings are nice.

Open air movies are great here. I went to open air movies in Central Park and Bryant park. I would always prefer Bryant park since this is in the middle of the city and the feeling to be surrounded by the phantastic buildings and Empire State Building is priceless. For me as a woman I felt more comfortable to get there (and back) in the darkness than Central Park.

A relaxing place in the heat and bustle of New York. This was one of our favourite places and we visited several times during our stay to relax inbetween sight seeing.The park is clean, feels safe and was popular with tourists and workers stopping for lunch. It has a games area where you can play board games and a reading area which provides books and newspapers to read in the park. There are lots of places near by to buy a takeaway lunch to eat in the park- tables and chairs are provided. I wish London parks would copy these facilities and ambience.

Oasis in the middle of Manhattan. We had the good fortune to dine in Bryant Park with the temperature right around 74 and low humidity. It was delightful and the park was beautiful to sit and people watch.

Nice and pleasant in the middle of the city. What a lovely place to relax and take a break after walking or shopping in NYC. There are coffee places, some food stands, chairs to help you enjoy this piece of greenery in the middle of busy city. In the winter you can find there a skating rink and booths that sells all kind of holiday arts and craft items.
Nice Nice place.. A great place to spend the after noon a lot of events and activates can enjoy a drink or a snack , very relaxing.

Beautiful Park. I first went to this park in 1969 when the city celebrated the first World Series win by the NY Mets. There are many exciting exhibits in this park during the year. In the winter, they usually have an ice skating rink set up.
Small park. It's not a highlight. But for a break during a sightseeing tour acceptable. There are many chairs and tables to relax and having a coffee or your lunch.

Bryant Park - All Year Long. Bryant Park is a fabulous place to visit. During the late Spring and Summer months it is a haven of different activities from yoga and tai chi on the lawn, piano on the terrace, games, a carousel for young children, and just tables and chairs to sit outdoors and relax or work on your laptop. The Reading Room is an outdoor area where classes are held in writing, poetry readings and more. The is the outdoor cafe, and the Bryant Park Grill Restaurant, both serving excellent food. Approaching Winter, Bryant Park becomes a Winter Wonderland, housing a large Christmas tree, ice skating rink, and many concessions for purchasing interesting and unusual items for the holidays. Anytime of year, Bryant Park is alive with activities!

Nice little patch of green in the middle of the city. I really enjoyed just hanging out and sitting in one of the chairs in the park. The little patch of greenery was a nice break from all the concrete of the city. It is quite small but well equipped -- there are pingpong tables, a small library and coffee stands. What I liked about it was there was always lots of seating available, making it a lovely respite for tired tourists and city dwellers alike.
What a place .... I just had an hour between meetings and ended up in Bryant Park for a drink and a walk. Great place to relax, have a drink and spend some time.
Cappuccino and Bocci Ball. Take a break in the park, grab a table near the bocci ball court while you sip a cappuccino. Not sure if you can get in the game as the players looked like regulars but try

Awesome. This was the first park we visited in NY. The little oasis is surrounded by high rises and yet it's a calm tranquil beautiful park
Great for people watching too
Great Park!. We started each morning sitting in the park having Lattes from Cofeed. Great location for people watching and starting your day. Of course we had perfect weather and that helped.
Great place to hang out. Walk here several times and just watched the people. Had ice cream and they had a few shows going on. Nice place to go during the day
Great clean Park. Just walking up and going here after seeing it on TV is such a wonderful feeling. They have shows all day and most nites it seemed

A great respite from the crowds....... Wonderful park filled with trees, flowers, benches, tables & chairs - where a lot of locals come to enjoy their lunch. Located behind the NY Public Library. Grab a to-go lunch from surrounding businesses and enjoy yourself here.

Your oasis in the city centre. Adjacent to the NY Public Library it can be easily accessible on foot and by subway. Very small but has its charm. Grab something to drink and/or eat, grab a chair and just sit there, enjoying the vibe. There is always something happening in this place. Come in the evening to observe performances and experience the sunset. During our one-week trip to NY, we were there three times. It's definitely a great place to spend some time and get rest before or after sightseeing.

A little bit of calm in the big apple. 5 minutes from Times Square and next door to the New York Library. It is a beautiful park which offers everything from simply sitting and watching the world go by to watching an open air Jazz Concert. Well worth a visit - escape and recharge !!
Summer in the Park. Lovely place to catch your breath in the shade on a hot day in NYC sightseeing. Yummy food vendors nearby.
Great place for lunch. Grab some takeaway and sit in the park. So many things going on in there and heaps of chairs. Gorgeous on a sunny day.

Fun and quaint. Cute and entertaining to visit and have fun. The ice skating is a nice getaway to come to and you're not rushed off the ice or given a "time limit" like Rockefeller Center does. Also, the lines are not bad but the prices could be better. Have fun!

A lovely green park in mid-town Manhattan!. I love to visit Bryant Park when I visit New York. I have seen it in early autumn, when I enjoyed a picnic lunch at the small round tables provided. I've watched New Yorkers enjoy lecture series during their lunch hour. I've also seen it when the green lawn was transformed into an ice skating rink, and little Christmas shops. There is also a carousel for children. It is an enjoyable visit whatever the time of year, and right next to the New York Public Library.

Great park pit-stop in the midst of the city. Perfect stop to stop for lunch or a quick break n rest your feet up between tasks or meeting s , lovely spot for lunch , clean , free tables n chairs and a well maintained lawn

My garden in NY. I stay since 25 years in the Mansfield Hotel on 44th street which is arround the corner and when the wheather is nice I go here and work from there. The internet is free, so that's a very nice place to work. Internet could be faster, so not a place if you need to download a lot of volume but the place is fabulous.
Next to the NY Library.. Bryant Park has become a wonderful place to relax and have lunch. The NY Library has an art and book collection on the second floor. It is free and worth some time.

A fun place to visit. No matter what time of year, Bryant Park always has something going on.... Ice Skating, Carousel, Jugglers, Puppet Shows, cafe's and nearby restaurants. At Christmas time there are international shops where you may even be tempted to pick up a few gifts.

Straight out of a Dream. This place is one of my favorite spots in the city. It has a really nice shopping area, that is absolutely gorgeous (specially at night). They have an Ice-skating rink during winter and it has such a Christmas atmosphere, it is just lovely. The park is nice and comforting with coffee shops nearby and the city holds movie nights at the park sometimes !

Always something going on!. Worth a visit here if you're around the grand central/times square area. Always something going on, and the new york public library just around the back. Great place to relax and read the paper or catch up with a friend.

Film Festival night . We went to Bryant Park in the evening for the film festival which is being run by HBO. It's free to go and we took a picnic blanket and a picnic and wine, you sit on the grass and watch the film on the big screen, we watched High Plains Drifter starring Clint Eastwood, it was one of the highlights of our trip to New York, you wouldn't think that this park is just off Times Square, definitely recommend going there it's lovely
Lunch . How I wish the restaurant at Bryant Park was open 365 days a year. I go sit out there and have lunch and frequently as I can during the summer days.

Stunning greenery in the middle of the concrete jungle!. This was such a happy surprise for me as I was heading the the nearby New York public library. The flowers were so beautiful and well thought out. I noticed to eateries where you could grab a snack and then sit in the beautiful respite from the noise, hustle and bustle of the city. Sit and relax while the kids have some room to stretch their legs, be noisy and run around.A MUST visit!!

Oasis Amongst the MidTown Bustle. Bryant Park is one of the best public spaces in the world. Friendly faces, weary tourists relax here with a drink or carry out lunch. Flanked by the majestic New York Public Library, the lawn is always a great place to sit and read or to simply enjoy the greatest city on Earth.

Relaxing afternoon watching Pétanque. We had a few hours to spend on our last day, temp was 31 deg so we decided to enjoy the tranquility of the park, we happened to sit by the elderly guys playing pétanque, we were hooked, so relaxing, one of the park staff asked a man near us to stop smoking, this is banned in the park.... Recommended
Relaxing. Great park for people watching we spent an evening relaxing with coffee and cake everybody is friendly a good mix of ages well lit up and security watching never required as its so safe

An oasis in Midtown.. Bryant Park is a great place to chill out after a hard days shopping or sightseeing. Sit at one of the tables and sip your Starbucks or crash out on the grass and enjoy the almost unbelievable architecture of the American Radiator Building on 40th St. Quite often there is some sort of event being staged in Bryant Park so you might just get lucky. It's strange really, I used to live in NYC in the 70's and Bryant Park had a big wall round it and you wouldn't go in there without an armed guard !! Now it's a haven of peace and tranquillity. How times have changed !!!
Lovely. This was a lovely park and Brooklin hotdogs are fabulous. Great little finder. Very busy but still got a seat to take all in. My daughter and I just for a bit and people watched.
Oasis in the city!. Its a lovely place to have a cuppa, rest your aching feet and people watch! It really is an oasis in the middle of New York City

Just a park. There was nothing our of the ordinary going on in September here. I was told I. The winter they make an ice skating rink here but right now it is just a relaxing area to hang out. The bike trolley ride around the park was great.
Dinner before a show. this was the perfect place to have outdoor dinner before a Broadway show. Prompt service and food was excellent
Relaxing in the city. This is the ideal place in the city to sit and have a nice relaxing drink or food. On certain evenings during the summer months you can sit and listen to a free concert

Lovely place for a break. What a beautiful park. Lost of places to sit in the shade and rest your weary feet. Start your day with a coffee/pastry from any of the shops surrounding the park, sit & enjoy - a peaceful way to start your harried day in Manhattan.

Serene place to sit and relax. We stayed just opposite to Bryant Park so had opportunity to walk across the park quite a few times. The park is behind the library with plenty of places to sit on the chair or on the ground. Public tours are available at specific times. However we chose to just walk around and watched people mostly studying, exercising or simply idling in the park.
Amazing oasis in the middle of the city. This is the best place to go at the end of the day to have a coffee and watch the world go by. It's very friendly and has a great community feel

Beautiful. Green place in the summer, ice skating in the winter. A park surrounded by skyscrapers (NYC style) that provides a respite to tired tourists and a lunch spot for locals. Great for people watching as well.

Lovely break in a busy walking day. Surrounded by amazing old buildings- including the library, this lovely park is always full of life- music, food. Very well maintained, surrounded by great places to stop and have a bit to eat (Maison Kayser, pain quotidien), it's one of the best place to rest your tired feet!
Manhattan Marvel.. This gorgeous park on 42nd Street is a much loved fave with locals and tourists alike. It should not be missed. Adjacent subway station makes it easily accessible.
Tranquill. Small but beautiful park can get busy it's a little gem.surrounded by madness Nice place to chill and rest your feet
Gorgeous park. This is a lovely tree lined square. Lots of tables and chairs all around the perimeter to sit at, and have your coffee, or just enjoy the outdoors and the surrounding architecture.

Our favorite!!. Stop for a cup of coffee or a Belgian Waffle and sit down at their many tables by the lawn. It is our favorite square and we went there a few times while we stayed in the city. Very peaceful, great environment, and even clean restrooms :)

A surprising little park to chill out, restaurants, bars. Highly recommended.. We found this little gem on our last day. Lovely place to chill and people watch. Wish we had found it sooner we would have eaten out here.

The very best of the Parks. The very best of the parks in the city. They are teaching Petanque ( french traditional bocce game), and you can play many more games such as chess, Ping pong or just hang out enjoying this full of life park.

Wonderful little park for a coffee. Not too far from Times Square (behind the NY Library) is this gem of a city park - surrounded by coffee vendors and plenty of tables to relax it is great for a mid-morning rest.
There a Carousel in this park and lots of child friendly activities.
Great place to take a break. One in our group needed to break up the walk. Bryant Park was perfect. It's big yet has lots of seating. Also, several places to get food and drinks.

Great. Went here last November and it was really good as they had Christmas markets up. They were little stools selling all sorts of things which made a nice change to go to rather then your generic store.

Beautiful. This is a most beautiful and relaxing place for a respite. Next to the main New York Public Library which is also a place not to overlook while touring or visiting New York. The park has places to eat and have a refreshing drink (ask for an Arnold Palmer) while taking in the beauty of the part and surrounding area.
Serene. Such a serene park in the middle of the city. Great place to lay down in the grass or simply sit and watch all the people. Options for food and drinks.

Little bit of nature in the city. There are many such spots throughout NYC, and it's a joy to go find them and explore. Just come and sit and people watch, or grab a bite from a vendor - it's what makes NY such a great city.

Not like the old Bryant Park , thankfully!!. Once a hangout for passed out druggies, this park has transformed into a beautiful city respite. Our tour guide Max from CityRover brought us here. There were tables for people to sit and create art, play games, sit in the shade with a book or lie on the grass and soak up the sun. Beautifully kept , clean bathrooms, this park has truly transformed into a gem you must see.
A small but lovely park in NYC. This is just next to the library and it's a great little area for sitting and relaxing, it has activities most days during the summer months and a small carousel.

Oasis . A great place to visit and relax when in Midtown, a lovely oasis in the centre of New York's Midtown. The restaurant at Bryant Park, is the perfect place to take dinner, and watch the world go past.
Pleasant suprise. Came upon this on our first walk around NY and returned on a couple of occasions. Lovely open space in this bustling city.

Fantastic park in central New York. This is a small park not to be missed for the atmosphere. Locals and tourists alike take their own lunches (you can buy there but most take their own from nearby takeaways) and sit around chatting in the green surroundings. Friendly atmosphere. there are often free things to do (tai chi, yoga etc) and there is a gaming area where you can play chess or cards or many board games.
An Oasis. We just love this park, whether it's watching skating in the winter or the guys playing boules, just sitting in the park is great, can't recomm enough.

Lovely on a Summers Day. We were staying at a hotel nearby so walked through here a few times and had a coffee break here. Small but a lovely peaceful area in the middle of the concrete.Interesting to see it at different times of the day, early morning its so serene, lunch times is busy with the neighbouring workforce on their break, early evenings chill times or business meetings.
Relaxing. When you're tired of the crowded streets of New York stop a few minutes in this park to relax. In the winter you can practice in an ice ring.
Wonderful Oasis!. The Porch in Bryant Park was a fabulous spot to eat, drink and people watch. Food was good - huge hamburger! Atmosphere made it well worth it.
An oasis on a hot day. Plenty of places to sit amid greenery as the new york traffic drives around you . Kiosks for food and drink available and the architecture of the National Library to admire
LOVED !. A fantastic hub with always something happening. Movie nights, musicians, a game of chess, or just lunch or dinner on the grass, a great place to hang out and relax.

A perfect setting for a nice evening out :). This park is a MUST see regardless of the weather. It's not an ordinary park -tons of boutiques, people playing table tennis, a huge skating rink in the winter season and a short walk from Times Square. I love Bryant Park!

The Park . Years ago it was very deserted. Not without people but very low renting bying area. Not any good food or entertaining. Changed like the whole picture of Manhattan. The change started with mayor Giuliani. Cleaned up the city . Right now . Apartments are expensive. High end food stores. Business at the top. There is a Hotel there. The park very often has entertainment. Great place. See it yourself!!!
Green Space. A lovely little bit of peace and quiet in the heart of mid town. Worth taking a few minutes to chill out and relax amidst the mayhem of Manhattan!
Lovely park. It's a great place to just have a stroll or sit and meetup with friends. On their website you can find lots of stuff happening ,so that you can catch a Tango session in the park.
Loved this place. What a fabulous park.... Free movies on a Monday night... lots of other things to do (games etc). Chilled out one afternoon between touristy visits

Lovely place. The park is very nice. Has a lovely atmosphere. Full of persons from different places and backgrounds. It is nice where you can have fun, eat, drink, listen to music or even meet new people. It was a nice experience..
Lovely park. Sat in the park and watched the world go by, very nice. Many families sitting and playing, music being played, very quaint.

Relaxing . We visited this park on a recent visit. Lovely chilled out area in the middle of a busy city. Plenty of seats and eateries nearby. We were really pleased just to hang out here after a really busy day.

Lovely clean Park. Went to the park the day after arriving, and wow what a lovely clean park it was, the toilet facilities were very very clean, the cafe was stocked with lots of naughty goodies, like chocolate and other items, staff were very helpful, lots of seats were available, but you must get there at a reasonable time, to get seated, the local workers come to the park to have there lunch, around lunch time it gets very very busy.
Best restrooms in NYC. NYC is notoriously light on public restrooms. The ones here are clean, free and safe!The park s lovely too :)

Great park in the middle of everything. We had a great time sitting and people watching while enjoying coffee from a nearby coffee shop. Books for the kids to read. People playing chess. A yoga class going on. Nice park for a break from your day.

Nice Place to Relax During Lunch. There are kiosks in the park that sells food and is a very nice place to sit and read under the trees. In the winter they have small shops and they open the skating rink to the public.

Favourite Place. Weather was excellant.This place is so beautiful and peaceful.Every inch a gem. Readers park where an array of books and seating is dedicated to those who seek relaxation,Piano performances at Piano in the park.Stage plays on the Lawn and a glass of Chardonnay in the open restaurant ,under the awnings or a coffee and pain au raisin eaten on the many pieces of garden furniture dotted around the square park . A little touch of heaven in the city.
Bryant Park, a midtown gem!. Stroll through the park to experience the beauty, grab a bite to eat and feel totally safe in the middle of Manhattan! This park is a gem

Shared a table with a student from Japan ( was attending a school to learn English). Brought in coffee and chocolate almond pastries from French bakery across the street and enjoyed cooler temp under the umbrella and lovely live musical performance

Bring your lunch / dinner for a picnic!. This has been a favorite during my Midtown visits over the last 20 years and still doesn't disappoint!Suggest bringing a picnic and enjoy the seating around the edges of the park. And of course the performances, movies etc in the evenings during good weather.
Lovely Park for a bit of peace and quiet !. Lovely park which was close to our hotel .. we spent many an hour with an ice cream or a coffee, reading the paper and regaining some energy !!

Posh cute park. Within the fashion district you can find this cute posh little park with its french style trees and the working people in the area that come around lunch time to sit around... I was there in summer, but I guess it becomes a skating arena in winter...

Tiny park downtown. This small park seems to be the real heart of the city: Dance lessons for everybody, Tai Qi sessions, Yoga, music, picnic, drinks...the essence of Dolce Vita...all activities are free and the volunteers are friendly and helpful.Right behind the New York Library and 5th Avenue
I enjoy it more than Rockerfeller. It is especially good for ice skating in the winter time. Pay the extra 5-10 bucks to skip the massive line waiting to skate.
Relaxing and great for people watching. Relaxing place to take a break from exploring the city and they even have ping pong tables in the park.
Lovely oasis in the city. Beautiful little park near the public library in Manhattan. Subway stop below, greenery above. Small cafe and benches for a picnic lunch.
Diamond in the ruff. This park is well situated location for solace, if that can be done in NYC. It's well maintained and good food vendor options.

Fantastic on a sunny May day. 2 mates and I spent a morning at the upscale outdoor bar. This was after a bit of a drinking session the night before. Midway through my fantastic yet pricey Bloody Mary, I had to answer the call of nature and was kindly directed to the public toilets. Making a mad dash to the unassuming stone building, I found the facility to be clean and well appointed. I can vouch that it provides access to differently a led persons as I did have to wait for a gentlemen in a mobility scooter to finish. Overall, it was a breath of fresh air.
Nice park with plenty of seating. There were tons of people here but we still found seating in the shade. There's a nice grassy area and places to eat or relax. Very nice.

Lovely little oasis between central station and Times Square/ Rockefeller square. Great little oasis that was a drug den in previous times, nice family atmosphere, large bar to one side. Worth popping in when exploring the area, particularly in early evening

If you're passing take a restful break. This is certainly as tranquil a park can get sitting as it does between 5th and 6th Avenues. The 5th Avenue end is occupied by the city’s main library building, which is also well worth a visit. Lots of birds to watch although most seem to be attracted to the crumbs from those taking their lunch break in the park.
Girls trip no 2 . Beautiful park to enjoy. You just sit in the benches or have lunch or a smothie under the umbrellas. Nature at its best. Better to go on a cool day.
My Favorite Park!. I found myself coming back to this little park again and again. It is well organized and a wonderful place to have a rest or a snack.
Interesting place. Go here if you feel like sitting Down and relaxing while looking at all the stressfull People running around.At Winter time this is a great Place to go ice skating.
Attractive Park. Bryant Park is a nice little oasis to sit and relax whilst sight-seeing.They have live entertainment here at times.

Best when a park. Although ultra crowded with people sitting every where; there is nothing like a park in New York. Nice restaurants around or on the grounds. Take a ride on the old fashioned carousel. Its fun- but supper crowded in the summer - be warned.

One of my favourite parks. This park has a very positive energy!It's a beautiful park in midtown behind the public library.It's packed with people who come to relax,play table tennis or other games.There are some kiosks to order coffee, a nice restaurant and a bar.You can even simply sit on a table to relax and read your book.It has some live concerts during summer.Truly amazing atmosphere! Loved it!

Not much to write home about.... There was so much going on at the time of my visit including a Brazilian day festival. The park was busy, but the surrounding festivals took away from the action in the park. Park includes seating, nearby restaurants and food vendors.
Little patch of heaven in the middle of the hussle. Loved finding this park! Lots of tables and chairs, trees, just a nice place to stop and take a rest!!

Great for any season!. From picnicking in spring, summer, or fall to free ice-skating (to Broadway show music!) in fall, winter, & spring, it's a fabulous place to visit. And free! Bring your own skates and lock for the locker, and it is ACTUALLY free!! Don't forget to peak your head into the NY Public Library. Another iconic NY venue...
A NY GEM. Always enjoy the vibe and energy of Bryant Park. the seating options and charging stations make this park a ny gem
Great with the Ice Rink. Really enjoyed the atmosphere here with the skating rink and all the different places selling food ,drink and Christmas goods.

An Oasis in the City!. Visiting Times Square can be overwhelming. How nice to stop by Bryant Park and just relax amid the beautifully kept gardens. This park is behind the exquisite library that is on Fifth Avenue. In recent years, there are many free activities in the park. Outdoor movies in the summer, yoga on Thursday nights and a free reading room from the library. People exercise on the grass or just hang out and watch the city walk by. This part of the city reminds me of Paris....quaint and beautiful. A great place to visit and relax!!

Great place for people watching. I loved this park, more of a square actually, at any time of day. We eat our breakfast here, and came in the evening as it was just near our hotel. There are tables with board games of all sorts, drinks and snacks available, and a number of bands play here. We had a meal in the Bryant Park grill and just took in the atmosphere.

A hidden gem!. We came across Bryant Park by chance and what a little bit of heaven within the bustle of New York! A large expanse of grass with tables all round to just sit and relax, eat, catch up on your phone or just enjoy the sun. There are various places to buy food around the park, you can play table tennis, borrow a book, enjoy a piano performance, watch juggling or just wait and see what daily activities are taking place!

Great place for breakfast. This is a large park next to the public library. The park is large but gets very busy at lunchtimes. We used to have breakfast from the food kiosks in the park. They sell a good selection of food all reasonably priced. There is free wifi in the park and the toilets must be the cleanest I've ever visited. In the evening the park shows films. (This may just be in August)

Lovely little park for people and bird watching. We stumbled on this little treasure just behind the city library and returned again to sip juice bought from Jamba Juice and people watch. Lots of seating around a green and a little reading room where you can borrow books and paper to read. It's very peaceful with a variety of different birds to see even when there are lots of people around.

Do some reading . This park is not like any other park. Beautiful gardens are not its best quality. What I think it is, is the fact that you can read inside of it and you won't be disturbed while doing it, the park has its own quiet area and reading material, incredible. You must visit it.
One of my Favourite places. One of my favourite must visit sites in NY. I love this park especially around Nov. I love walking through the stores located there and ofcourse the Ice Skating!
Beautiful time in Bryant Park. Took my family to New York City, this weekend. We had a fun time at Bryant Park. My daughter especially loved the Carousel.

Love this park. Bryant park is an awesome place to explore. You can walk through the park, tour the lin=brary or have lunch, snack or dinner overlooking the park. During the summer they have author readings in the park. Two years ago J.K. Rowling was there. The New York Public Library is a sight to behold itself. Numerous movies including Ghost Busters were shot there. It's a beautiful historic building that's worth a visit. Maison Kyser makes Bryant Park worth visiting all by itself. If you crave true French pastry it's glorious! We went everyday to have raspberry tarts and the Carnegie, which is raspberry mouse - delicious! Maison Katser can be found throughout paris, France and the two locations in NYC we tried did not disappoint. Bryant Park is also home to some great shopping, restaurants and Macy's is a five minute walk away.
Nice park. It's a small but charming park. There was a music festival on open for the public, quite pleasant. Plan to walk by.

Beautiful!!! Mid week mornings are perfect. What a beautiful park, we spent time there during midweek in morning,it was quiet and just glorious to escape the craziness of Times Square and its surroundings,there are little food vending vans and a restaurant/cafe.Apparently it gets extremely busy,and also has concerts/ice skating, we didn't experience any of this,we just relished & relaxed in the beautiful gardens & peacefulness.
One of my favourite parks. A cute little park surrounded by the concrete jungle. Check out the summer movies. Of course, one of my favourite quotes is underneath Bryant's statue.

Best park in the city. I've found my zen! The park is situated on 6th avenue behind the library. Food and coffee outlets both in and around the park. Great for people watching, have a game of table tennis or sunbathe! Back in the UK now and Bryant Park is the one part of New York I miss the most.

Great place to rest tired feet. Right now there are chairs and tables where you can sit, snack and people watch. The area is quite busy and crowded(all the time) and sometimes you need a break. It's a good place for it.
Lovely park to relax and unwind in. Loved this park. Amazing view of Empire State Building from where we were sat. Nice to just relax and have a drink. Fountain is nice too.

Pretty cool place to chill and people watch. There was an art cart when we were here; it's actually pretty cool to relax here and people watch. Grab a book from the library and chill with a cup of coffee while you read and people watch.
Lovely little gem. Enjoyed this park for a cup of tea from nearby tea shop and a sandwich. Flowers are beautiful and the carousel is sweet!

Some down time in the heart of NYC. Beautiful little park with lots of shady areas to sit and watch the world go by. There are quite a few good vendors for food and while we were there some activities taking place
Perfect for a summer afternoon. We spent a couple of very happy hours eating strawberries and drinking ice cold white sangria in this lovely oasis
Great, especially at night.. Visited Bryant Park, in daytime and nightime, the atmosphere at night is buzzing. Even visiting in the day is good as it's quite chilled out.

Lovely Park. This is another lovely park in New York, which is directly behind the NY Library, and a great place to rest and people watch. Plenty of seating, and places to buy snacks and drinks, even a Starbucks on an opposite corner.
Lovely little park. Such a nice area. There were activities on the lawn while we were there (looked like thai chi). Nice little area for children with seating area, carousel and childrens books.
Cute park. Very small but nice coming across these areas of green in the middle of the city, when we went the fountain hard turned to ice as it was so cold!

Bryant park . I love this park , I've been in the winter when they had the ice rink out (Nov) and I've also been in the spring (may) both of which I loved I actually think I like it better than Central Park theres places to eat and drink all over the park or you could take your own and relax and eat it there too, well worth a stroll.
Midnight At The Park. The park is right by the hotel.There is a restaurant,plenty of lawn space, plenty of chairs and tables.plenty of people even after the midnight hour.

Love this park! . Everyone thinks of Central Park which I love but Bryant park is a fabulous place ! Great vibe, movies in the summer , places to eat. This is another beautiful attraction in NYC that I highly recommend.

Green oases in the hard of the city. It's a green oases in the NYC center near Chraystler building an Library nearby. You can seat down, eat waffle and enjoy for a few moments a relaxed atmosphere in the park.

a pretty park in a great location. This is a small inner city park just off Broadway. There is an outside bar area, a concert area, picnic chairs and tables and a great way to take a breather from the noise and busyness of NY. We took a picnic, bought a cup of tea and just enjoyed watching NY go by.
lovely place to be in the winter. it was small but we enjoyed watching people ice skating. The market stalls were lovely and we had a good time browsing

Nice park to stop by. We were in the hotel straight in front. This park is lovely and lively. Activities, people only sitting ... A nice place to stop and make a break for few minutes laying on the grass .

An interesting little park in central Manhatten. We were doing a recommended walking tour and walked through this fine small park in central Manhatten. It was Saturday and the people watching was superb. The park is near many of the recommended attractions.

Nice park. Park is a lovely place to sit and relaxe lots of seats although at times a very hot day in August at lunchtime it is hard to find a seat very popular area for local workers to come and have lunch.
I had a shake (drink) from one of the stands in the park it was the best ever tasted.

Vibrant park I'm Manhattan. Worth visiting. Just lay back and relax. Look at the world around you. Free tables and chairs to sit on.
A gem in Manhattan.
Not the place to go if you are looking to relax. It was alot busier than expected. Very nice place to sit and have a bite to eat with friends. But too noisy and busy if you are looking to relax
Beautiful but busy. Beautiful park behind the public library on 42nd street. Gets very very busy and overcrowded. Otherwise just like any other park
