Nice little park. Nice park, wondered through a few times during our visit. Park has a few bars on the edge for a drink in the evening.
There always seemed to be something going on, live music etc.
Worth a look if your in the area!
Pleasant Break from hectic city. Wonderful respite from the hustle and bustle. Lawn, tables and chairs, restaurants, fountain, and kiosks. Just a pleasant place to enjoy the day.
People watching feast. Busy park. Lots of people, but pleasantly shaded for an outdoor break after spending time in the library.

Lovely place to relax. If you want to take "a load off" and relax ,just go to Bryant Park. You can sit wherever you want with your own drinks or food. No questions asked. Also in summer they organise lot's of things to do in the park.

A peaceful oasis in the middle of New York City.. We walked to Bryant Park from our hotel and were surprised to find such a lush, family-friendly space in the heart of New York City. We admired the greenery - beautiful delicate trees and lovely planters filled with a variety of blooming flowers with various colored leaves. We were charmed by the old fashioned carousel boasting a frog and a rabbit, as well as the traditional decorated steeds. I took time to sit in the shade at one of the bistro tables and wrote postcards to friends and family. We walked from one end of the park to the other and discovered the classic architecture of the library with stone lions guarding the entrance. After that, we treated ourselves to a delightful alfresco meal at the Bryant Park Grill.

What a quaint little park. LOVED this park! So much to see and do and it's much smaller than Central Park. They have little sections of the park for different activities: chess tournament, games section, quiet reading area, table tennis, etc. All the materials are provided in each section. There are lots of shade and chairs around the perimeter and the middle area is more open. During the summer, there are many events happening.
Fantastic. Had the shrimp very good. What a great atmosphere we were sitting outside the service was fantastic, wonderful time.

Loved this little park!. In the heart of New York, yet very secluded and cosy. Just behind the Public Library (which is definitely worth a visit), and you get great view of the Chrysler Building. Lovely little park if you need a bite to eat and to rest your feet a little!
Nice park. Take a break from a long walk at this park. It is small, but nice place to relax and eat your snacks. Free events during summer.
Nice park with many activities . This is a nice small park with some f&b stalls surrounding. Many free activities conducted here, such as movie night, yoga, Zumba etc.
small good for natives. nothing to see ,good for locals who live in congested places and come here for work,some jugglers were performing or learning juggling dumbles

Scond best park. This is very charming park behind Library when you walk on 5th avenue. Go into park, get a coffee and there is a lot of bakery or small caffee places around. Seat in shade of park and enjoy, there are also musical performers and sometimes movies at evening on a big screen.

Best park in town. In one word "cosy" that how you call Bryant park. If you ask me one of the best but smallest parks in town. If you just want to enjoy some green and rest in the busy city, visit Bryant.
Movies in the Park. Wanted to walk through Bryant Park and they had a crowd watching an old time movie. It looked like fun - we stayed for awhile and then continued our walk.

Nice enough. Its quite a small park, and there are some people hanging around it at night which was not so desirable. I tried to get a drink at one of the bars at around 11pm but it had sadly closed. I walked back the next evening at an earlier time and more was open, such as waffle and coffee places. Also there are reading areas to the park which was a nice touch. I was approached by a man chatting me up however. Perhaps this is just a New York male confidence thing?! Central Park is obviously bigger and better.

best place to lunch in nyc. i try to get there a few times a week to eat outdoors . plenty of cafes / restaurants to chose from - trick is to get a free table . very enjoyable . a diamond in the middle of new York city
Relaxing . Loved the park, free game section, reading area and unique relaxing feeling in the middle of the very busy city! Cute relaxing gem!
;Trip to the BIG Apple. Nice quiet place to go and enjoy a quiet lunch of a few moments out of the hustle bustle of the big city.
Great in the sunshine. Great range of bars and coffee shops, watching the different skill levels on the table tennis tables was highly entertaining

Tranquility while all around is crazy. This wa s alovely little park we stumbled upon between tourist attractions. It was peaceful and green - great for people watching and lovely to see the world go by and take a few moments out to relax.

Great place to chill out . Spent an hour or so just chill-axing after the days sites
Kids books and games available for free as was the juggling workshop when we were there on Tuesday evening
Brilliant to watch the speed chess pros just along the edge
Fabulous!!!

Such a beautiful park!. Bryant Park is one of my favourites to visit in NYC (and there are lots of nice ones). We had a wander round and then stopped for a sit down to take a drink and cool off in the heat. There was a girl playing the violin on the main grass lawn that we listened to which sounded amazing and was great to listen to.

Perfect place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the streets around it.. Perfect place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the streets around it. Peaceful, but busy. Plenty of public seating in the shade and a large lawned green. Perfect place to relax with charging points dotted around the park. Very clean and tidy with numerous cleaners working the park throughout the day.
An oasis between 40th and 42nd street. Not on a par with Central Park but a great place to sit and rest for a while, grab a snack and watch the world go by.

Don't miss this NYC gem. I pass through this park almost every day and it is a lovely park. Expect lots of people during lunch time but there plenty of chairs everywhere. During the day people can play chess or engage in other activities. At night there are frequently shows or movies during the summer. During the winter the place is converted to a village wonderland with free ice skating. Try to catch a glimpse of the ceiling in the rooms on the top floor of the Library- they are magnificent!

Great Place to People Watch. Stopped here after visiting library. There are quite a few tables and chairs to sit and relax in the shade of the trees. A few food stands offer beverages and food. Great place to kill some time and watch people.
Fun and food in Bryant Park!. Great little park in the middle of NYC! Great for sitting and relaxing, people-watching, and grabbing a bite to eat at Le Pain Quotidien!
Lovely Park for a stroll or rest. This was a very lovely park to have a seat and listen to music and people watch. Plenty of shady places to sit on a very hot day.

Quiet spot near Times Square. Only a few blocks from Times Square, this is one of my favourite parks to visit when I'm in New York, as it is away from the crowds but not isolated. It is quaint and perfect for summer evenings to relax or meet your friends.

Amazing!. This park encapsulates NYC. It has a quaint yet busy ambience with restaurants and a lot of people all taking life as it comes. Fab for coffee and a people watch. Brilliant for ice skating in the winter, so the locals told me 👍

Beautiful.. This park is well placed. It is used by many in the summer evenings to just sit and be, or to visit with friends, or take out the laptop, iPad etc. and enjoy the air and the bustle of the city. Garden flowers are all in bloom. The grass all manicured. Winter time the park becomes an ice skating rink. Portable white tents become out buildings for the parks patrons. Excellent use of space.
Pokemon Stop. Well- go here to catch and do whatever with Pokemon. It's on the back side of the library. Very nice park. Everyone there seemed very comfortable with the quaint environment.

Favourite place to relax near Times Square. A perfect place to meet up with friends and family or sit and relax yourself. There are organised activities on a daily basis. Loved the free viewing of Wrath of Khan. Hundreds of people there but no trouble and felt safe.

Lunch in Bryant Park. During the summer, Bryant park is an excellent place for nice stroll or perhaps even a picnic. Everyday there are numerous events happening in the park, such as live piano music, book readings, various games (ping-pong, chess, etc.) and much more. There are lots of eateries around the park, so it's very easy to grab something and head back to the park to eat. Also, there is no need to bring a blanket if you don't want to, because there are a lot of tables and chairs scattered throughout the park. Truly New York Native. Allaboutjessica.com
beautiful views. This is a beautiful relaxing park. Grab lunch and sit and admire all the tourist around you. see and hear all the birds chirping!

Little oasis in the city. Fantastic place to sit and watch the world go by! Grab a drink and sit at one of the tables by the park and relax for a while. Very pretty and clean, just minutes from Times Square and Bloomingdales.
pretty park. Just stopped for a drink and a browse but worth a look. Apparently better in the winter as they have skating there

Best People Watching in New York. This park is fairly small, there's a few places you can see the whole park, which makes this the perfect place for people watching, and the midtown location means you get a great mix of people.

Lovely park and great games. We sat here for a good few hours relaxing and enjoying the warm weather, an excellent idea was the games stall in a small area of the park were we collected a few games to sit and play. very clean and well maintained area, we also watched the start of an outdoor yoga class that is being run throughout the summer.
Bryant Park. Nice and relaxing, just outside the Public Library, and bonus, Monday nights form June- August outdoor film festival so managed to catch a movie, this was a great time just to chill.

Must See The Carousel!. A great park to stroll through. Watch the children enjoying their ride on the historic Carousel & in the playground. See the men at the board games. Take a drink & a snack at one of the Cafes. Enjoy the trees & gardens. Opposite is the Bryant Park Hotel & if you look closely at its facade you notice why it was formerly the American Radiator Building!

My favourite small park in NYC. I love Bryant Park it is such a lovely park right in the heart of the busy city, it is great for a rest and a drink after trudging around the streets of the city. Sting once played a gig here!

Fantastic place in the heart of New York. The perfect place to enjoy a coffee and watch the world go by! Became something of a regular place. Very clean and people going round all the time emptying bind and clearing tables!

A lovely place to rest weary feet. Plenty of trees and a good variety of cafes with plenty of chairs make this a good place to stop for a coffee or lunch. The backdrop of the public library against the surrounding skyscrapers makes for some lovely views.

Lived here for 18 months - still my favourite place to take visitors. It thrills me to see that TripAdvisor reviewers have gotten it "right" about Bryant Park. It is the quintessential place to sit on a patio, nibble some decent finger food, and watch the world go by. I have a constant stream of friends coming to visit - and many are foodies with a long list of restaurants they want to try. After we have exhausted their bucket list - I bring them to Bryant Park on a sunday afternoon to have chicken wings and a bottle of wine. And it is always the dining event they remember....

Great urban park! Quaint. We wandered in during a Shakespeare play. So cool to see people having a Picnic in middle of the busy city. Check their event schedule. There are kiosks for food and a restaurant - looks like a great spot to grab an adult beverage or happy hour. It was a nice place for a break from our touring.
take a seat and relax. stopped off to relax for a time, lots of people with lots going on at different times a very pleasant place

Nice atmosphere. Come and relax at Bryant Park.On Fridays it has an amazing time for happy hours and also some live music.Games for children and also adults. Nice to site on a table or relax laid back wandering about life.
A place to rest. Sit m, have a drink, have a snack, watch a movie,people watch, catch a movie. A centrally located oasis near Times Square.
Breathtaking. Explore and meander. Do not pass by, step inside and experience a fresh breath of air in the middle of the city.

Better than central park. This is a small but very comfy park surrounded by skyscrapers. I liked it more than central park and people seem to enjoy it. There are small food shops, tables and chairs free to use to play a round of chess with the locals or just read a book.
Nice place to take a drink. A great place to stop, sit, take a drink, be inspired by nature and relax, feel the spirit of New York

A haven in the city . We picked up cheesecake from Juniors and headed over to Bryant Park to sit. How lovely to have tables and chairs all around! We ended up staying longer and having a game of cards! You can also borrow tabletop games and sit and play, or make use of one of the table tennis tables.
Loved it 😊

A beautiful place to wile away a summer afternoon or eve. We spent an hour today sitting in the shade at a little table drinking lemonade, reading and watching kids play mini-golf and a group having a baby shower. On Friday night, we enjoyed a free jazz-classical fusion concert. So happy to have Bryant Park in the neighborhood of our hotel.

Great atmosphere . This place doesn't need a lot of words. I stopped in this park just after dinner. I had a good feeling. A lot of people were seated it was very nice watching people around. Lovely place
Stop, pause and watch the world go by!. Fantastic place in mid town to stop and grab a drink and just get out of the hustle and bustle of NYC. A must if you are in the area!
Oasis in the heart of the city. Beautiful green space right on 42nd street. Lots of seats, games, eating kiosks and free Wi-Fi. Perfect retreat from the shopping and the city bustle!

A lovely little park!. We walked through here after going to the New York Public Library, which is just behind it. It was around lunchtime and luckily we managed to find a table and chairs. It is a very popular park with the locals. It is such a pretty little park, with plenty of trees to sit under in the shade as when we went it was close to 100 degrees.It's a great place to spend a while relaxing, away from all the hustle and bustle.

one of my fave places in NY. Bryant Park was one of the first things I ran into when arrived in New York and decided to go for a stroll without a proper plan. I fell in love with it straight away and i can't even explain why. As every love at first sight, it just happened!
Cozy mini park.. Great place to rest after lunch. Lot of people laying on the grass or drinking a coffee just enjoying the day.
A little Oasis. To stop and have a drink, have a rest, watch the world go by or watch offices works play table tennis. Worth a stop off
Beautifull park. Beautifull place, where u can spend a day with your friends or by yourself. There are a lots of bars and a resturante. Smoking is not allowed.

An oasis in chaos. While Central Park is 'the' New York park, in reality Bryant Park is the Oasis Park. Yes I know I used Oasis twice, but it sums it up. If you want a time out while building blisters in New York then this is the place. From watching the boules, to admiring the architecture, to watching the hula hoops this is the place. All the locals use it, which says more than I can.In the winter you have the ice rink and market, in the summer you have space to stretch out, either time you have the best public toilets in New York City.There is a reading area, with real books not comics.....Look, just go and chill for an hour, you will not regret it.
Relaxing. In a mad city full of hustle and bustle it is so lovely to find this lovely tranquil park to sit and relax or people watch

Enjoyable little park near Theater district. . This is a small park on 41st between 5th and 6th Avenues. There's an open air reading area, tables and chairs for snacking, plenty of shade and a good sized sunny open area for whatever. There are scheduled events for mostly amateurs. We watched several jugglers of varying levels of expertise. A great spot to rest a bit.

Just like home!. We were on out way to the NYC library and noticed how lovely it looked here. We sat by the fountain with our lunch and just people watched. Then as we walked toward the library we came across the game area. Well we sat and played games for about an hour! They had many of our favorites, jenga, mancala, banagrams, checkers, etc. We even played a few new ones. On our way out we noticed the carousel, so cute! The park was so nice and clean and not very crowed for NYC. We will definitely wander here again!

Green gem!. Bryant park is fabulous, a green gem, clean and spacious, directly behind the New York Public Library on 5th Avenue. It has a list of events but in the summer the coolest thing to do there is the outdoor cinema. Take something to sit on and your goodies/picnic and enjoy a relaxing evening in a beautiful setting.

Great place to stop. We stopped by as we were walking from the library. There are lots of places to sit in the shade. We ended up playing ping pong right there in the park. They have all you need, the tables, paddles and balls. It was a fun stop in the city.

visit to the city. This is a great place to people watch & eat or have drinks. We really enjoyed relaxing in the park I understand they have a lot of entertainment there but we were there on a weekend & were not able to see any. Our family lives in the city & I guess this is a place to go. It is right down from the Hilton Garden Inn where we stayed

One of our favorites!. Whether you want to take a break, grab a bite from a vendor, watch a movie on the lawn, experience a variety of unique shops, go ice skating (or have a cocktail and watch the zamboni clean the ice), eat at a upscale restaurant (or host an event there), Bryant Park is the place to go.

Peaceful park right in the thick of it. This park is very central. People just go to relax and have lunch. They have bands and other events at night sometimes. You can just chill, grab a coffee or get a hotdog or pretzel from the nearest vendor - they're on every corner - literally. There are some interesting buildings surrounding it too and little plaques to let you know what's what
Very Busy. Not visited on this day But on Monday evenings there is a free Film shown in the park on a summers night I imagine this would be great

Very nice . This place is just in the middle of shopping,cafes and historical library.Very near to Thames Square but quiet.Take your coffee and book,have a rest in the park.Also there are music and film evenings.Wi-fi is free.

Film night. Went to this park just behind our hotel, lots of stuff to do, check there website. Film night was ace, take a blanket, some food and drink and chill, watch the film and people watch. We was there for about 5 hours, really well organised and some freebies too

lovely. If you are in the area , let yourself take a few minutes of a relaxed break , watching other tourists and locals doing the same nothing you are doing right now .There are other squares and small parks around the city , where you can enjoy having a calm break : Herald Square near Macy's; Madison Square Park ; Union Square ; Stuyvesant Square ; Gramercy Park ; Chelea Park ;Also try to visit Tudor City Greens (See separate review) .Have a calm Break .
Fun part of NYC lifestyle. The park's location makes it a natural gathering point for LOTS of people, most quite interesting. This is a great place to relax and people watch, lunch, or read a book.

Beautiful place to pass the time of day.. Lots of seating to eat lunch or just a coffee. It hard to imagine that it is right in the heart of Manhattan. A very tranquil spot to sit and read a book for a few hours, weather permitting.

Lovely oasis in New York. Great Park just off times square. We spent a couple of mornings having breakfast in the park and watching the world go by. Add to this the free screening of a movie in the evening, free games such as chess and tia chi in the morning makes this park a great place to unwind after pounding the streets of New York.

A Taste of New York. If I feel I need to experience New York as one does in film, this is one place that can bring me back. There are so many places to visit and so little time. Hang around here for a few minutes and just people watch. Shop if you like. The place is centrally located and probably on the way to wherever you are going in NY.

Incredible!. This park gave me the ultimate Christmas feeling in December. With the ice rink, pretty market shops, colourful lights and declarations, food stalls and a little old merry-go-round, the atmosphere is incredible. Everyone is cheery and the smell of the food enhances the experience. There's so much to do and see for what is technically considered a small park in Central New York! Do not deny yourself a visit!

A beautiful oasis. This park is next to public library and in the middle of 42nd Street and yet, it feels like it is a million miles away. It is very laid back and even at busy times there are plenty of chairs. There are food vendors scattered around the park but you can also bring your own picnic. The tree provide shade or there is a grassy area where lots of people were sunbathing. We will be making good use of this area for the rest of our visit.

An Oasis in the middle of the City!. Came across this park on a recent visit to New York City. Our shuttle from the airport dropped us near here for our hotel nearby. It was a bustling and beautiful oasis in the middle of the city. Many residents were enjoying it for lunch while enjoying Broadway entertainment on their lawn stage. Beautiful place!

Oasis of Free Events. There is no way to be bored on a summer afternoon at Bryant Park. A couple of weeks ago I enjoyed an outdoor movie, a dance performance, and theater show. Last week I danced barefoot at the grass with the accordion festival happening each Wednesday and on Friday I enjoyed a music concert with local bands. If that is not enough, consider the architecture around, the proximity to the New York Public Library and the vibrant culture just having a break from the city. Go and check at the website the calendar of free events for the coming weeks.

Vibrant Bryant!!!. What a lovely park around the corner and just a few blocks from our hotel, film festival was on, people watching the the old Star Trek film, lovely outdoor restaurant, not cheap but nothin is in New York, lots going on that I could have just sat there all day/night, only downside is, there's only one toilet block, hence a queue......!!! We even bumped into people from our hometown, amazing!

Very nice park. We had tremendous weather, so we decided to hang around Bryant Park for a while. It was not disappointing! Grab a coffee or tea, enjoy the view of the surrounding buildings, the music, and all the different activities the park has to offer. While there, don't miss the opportunity to visit the Library!

Bryant Park - Always something going on.. Located by the NYC Library and Times Square. Always concerts, singers - Artisan fairs...even in the winter things are happening. We went to an Artisan fair last visit..and I got some beautiful, silver, hand-made jewelry. Also..another visit we saw a string band from Trinidad.Great place to just sit on the grass and relax or walk around.

Inner city oasis. This is a really welcome oasis in the city. Good bars dotted around, a carousel for the kids (not sure this is permanent) and a good place to find a chair in the shade and watch New Yorkers go about their business. There was no access to the lawn in the center which was a pity.
You gotta love this park.... A nice place to bring lunch and sit, walk around and look at the varied kiosks, take a step back, chill and take in all the sites.
Rest place in the city. Bryant Park is a small park behind the library. Is is tranquil and provides an escape from the hustle and bustle.

Small park behind NY library . Located behind the new york library this small park is a nice place to relax. Its surrounded by tables and chairs and has some small cafe stalls (ie le petit quotidien). In a concrete jungle its a nice contrast. There appears to be concerts held here as well. There isnt a great deal to see or do but worth visiting if at the ny library. Only negative is being occasionally approached by homeless people.

Our new favourite place. We travelled to NYC with 2 teens and stayed near Bryant Park. What a neat place! There was constant activity, whether it be movies, live bands, yoga, games, and many PokeStops that always had active lures. There are tons of tables and chairs, so we would grab some take-away for dinner and go eat in Bryant Park. Stunningly beautiful skyline views at dusk, especially from the Bryant Park Hotel - and so close to everything.
A nice place to unwind in. Although Bryant Park is a busy place there was always a chair and table or a patch of shaded grass to sit for a break from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Beautiful . Stayed in the Residence Inn by Marriott T'S so this was on the door step. Stunning and so relaxing. We under used it due to our busy agenda and only sat here once but it was a joy to walk past every day.

What can one say except hip, cool and NYC. How can you NOT love Bryant park? For me, this place IS NYC. Everything that is going on here is just classy. NY Public Library, movies, Empire State Building view, tables to sit and hang, - it just exudes cool. Anyone who badmouths Bryant Park just has no class and no life. Get there and see NYC in all of its coolness.

Small and peaceful place to relax. Bryant Park is a delightful, small park to relax and people watch. There are books to sign out (sponsored by the Public Library next door), there are coffee and food stands, small tables to eat at, ping pong, movies at night, a carousel...You can't get lost like in Central Park, but there are no fields, ponds, etc. Just a small, tree-lined peaceful park.
Nice green spot. One of the many nice, charming parks in Manhattan. A lot of coffee shops around so you can enjoy a breakfast or lunch at one of the tables available in the park.
Middle of city. Middle of city, but when we r staying its only water...November.can still easilly imagine it would be nice on "winter" time at Nyc.

Such a lovely park. My husband, kids and I would just sit in the park for a restful time after our excursions. It was just lovely. It may sound contradictory but even with entertainment in the park, busy Manhattan with people buzzing around us it was so peaceful and relaxing. If anyone visits Manhattan going to the park is a must

Family Friendly Fun. Bryant Park is not a big park, however it is big in appeal! It has an area set up with tables for people to play games, like chess, etc. It has a couple of ping pong table also. Both of these come complete with hosts that provide the paddles, balls and games. This is all set in a small shaded park. There s aso a carousel and a area that has gliders and porch swings. It is a good place to take a break from the city or have a picnic. We were here in July and they had weekly screenings of movies in the middle of the park on the grass. In additions they had yoga and medication classes. A nice relaxing place to while away a couple of hours...
Relax. Right behind New York Public Library. A nice spot to sit back, relax, enjoy a hot or cold drink. Worth a visit.

A green haven in the middle of the city. There is always something going on in this park, but still it can be a quiet place to relax and soak up the atmosphere. Films in the park, merry-go-rounds, chess games, readings, cafes, yoga, etc. The park is also very shady and provides a cool place to sit when the sun is beating down on the surrounding busy streets.

Sweet place to go. There's always something happening at Bryant Park! It's great place for people watching as they leisurely enjoy nature. Plenty of places to sit, snack, and there is also a little public library in the park!

An Oasis. A wonderful spot to pass a quiet and cool morning or watch the world go by with a lunchtime snack. Bryant Park is on 42nd St and so handy for Times Square, 5th Ave shops, Grand Central Station and Grand Central Library.

It's a great park. We visited on a Friday afternoon and the place was packed. We had a cocktail and you sat and watched people. They had live music it started at about 6 o'clock and was very interesting. There were the usual street vendors and jugglers playing around on the grass. Nice place to go and relax at the end of the day.

Perfect park. What a great picnic day, all the amusement, the table tennis, the food around, the Japanese bookstore across the street, the open to public library for free, mini gulf all sorrounded by historical
buildings and skyscrapers

A treasure with a long, interesting history. So much to do!! It's tough to add anything of value to all the great reviews here, but this is an interesting factoid.Bryant Park staff counts everyone in the park twice every day, at 1 p.m. and 6 p.m. You might be there minding your own business, but hanging out in the park during those hours means you've become a part of all sorts of systematic data used in making decisions regarding future park developments.Daily attendance counts often exceed 1,000 people per acre, even on days without special events, making it the most densely occupied urban park in the world.I can't visit the area without walking through just to see the people and reflect on the history here.

There's always something going on in Bryant Park. It's a relatively small park, located in midtown Manhattan, but there's always something going on, whether it's just people relaxing on the lawn or playing frisbee; or a communal yoga session; or a summer film screening.... I just sat at one of the free tables with my coffee and read my kindle in the summer evening air after a hard day's walking and it was just what I needed.

Underwhelminh. We stopped off here for a sit down during a sweltering hot day trip to NYC. I was surprised how small it was, there are a number of eateries and public toilets. There is also a stage area however there was no entertainment on at the time of our visit. The gardens were ok, I put this place well down the list on the places to visit in New York.

Beautiful relaxing park near times square. Great place to just relax and enjoy. We went in the evening and it was really peasant. We saw kids playing on lawn. Beautiful lighted buildings around us. Lots of people catching pokemons.

Best Parc of New York. Bryant Parc is like a oasis in the middle of all chaotic atmosphere of NYC. Peaceful and green for spending a summer evening after a tiring day in the city as a tourist. ( i am curious how it looks like in winter)
boradway in bryant park. bryant park has various events in the summer- I like thursdays when you get to see broadway in Bryant park through August it is over now- must get there early to get a chair

This is New York. I find that the more I visit New York, the more I appreciate the open spaces, the green spaces and the places to pause. I think Bryant Park is much over looked by tourists - or, at least it was by me. I used to think New York was about the rush. That's certainly part of it, but I've learned that the beautiful spots, like Bryant Park, are to be treasured as places where the city will parade and reveal itself to those with the patience to let it do so.
Just strolling in the city. Lovely place to visit great restaurantMake fill like a little square in Paris.And visit all the small store.

Best public bathrooms in NYC. Wow, have been living in NYC my whole life (30+ years), and these are hands down the cleanest public bathrooms in the city. Come to Bryant park for the movies, table tennis, ice skating or whatever else brings you here, but just note, this is a great place to do a quick pee break if you have the need.
Magical. We walked through Bryant Park at night. It felt like we were in a movie scene. The lights and the fountain were beautiful. I would definitely visit here again when I return to New York.

Always something to do!. I've visited Bryant park in every season and there is always something going on. From ice skating to ping pong to concerts to holiday shopping. It's a great place to sit with a coffee and snack while waiting for arrivals to Grand Central. A short walk from Times Square.

Lovely park with tons of activities. I enjoy sitting in Bryant Park and having lunch, people watching or enjoying the free library. There are awesome events happening every day and while it is incredibly busy, the park is well maintained.
Loved this park more than central. Quaint park in the middle of the city with cute bars and restaurants surrounding it. I enjoyed this park more than central park!
winter in nyc. fabolous in winter, people can skate in winter and thats wonderful! love the place and weatherYou can go and relax, hava a drink, walk , skate etc .... wonderful times

Great place to sit and watch the world go by. A little oasis in the middle of New York. It was just round the corner from our hotel so we walked there at some point each day. It has a nice feel, with places to buy food, drinks and ice cream if you wish or you can choose a seat around the grass or sit on the grass. One evening there was a table-tennis competition going on another night there was a film shown on a screen. Really nice vibe.

Heart of Manhattan. Beautiful garden, skyline, light, joy, food, chairs, tables, fountain, people reading,children playing,people talking, dating, resting, eating and even working. Lovely place. A "must see" in NYC

Great all year round!. There is ALWAYS something going on in Bryant Park. From the ice skating rink in the winter months to music festivals in the spring and summer. Great place to relax and be close to a lot of store. They also have small stations set up around the park with smaller shops of all kinds.
Amazing park, picnic and entertainment. Only a 10 minute stroll from our hotel. Collected a salad and wine along the day then enjoyed free entertainment late into the night. Beautiful place.
Nice park!. This park is really nice. In the summer on Mondays they show movies and you can bring snacks, wine, etc. Nice!

A peaceful haven. We stopped here for a picnic, food is expensive so we brought our own. It is interesting to people watch, there are tourists here as well as New Yorkers lunching. There are plenty of seats and shade. When we were here there was a pianist playing. On a Monday evening in summer there is a free cinema show. I think there is always something happening here.

Nice stroll. My fiancé and I walked through on the way to the library one morning. It was a very nice park area in the city, good to relax in. There were heaps of tables and chairs and can see it getting busy as the day goes on.

A Great Place to Hang Out & Have Lunch. After getting take out at Chick Fil A we sat here and ate lunch. It's pretty trendy and scenic. While we were there we witnessed about 300 people performing synchronized yoga, which was pretty cool. They also have a pretty cool carousel.

Lovely old Carousel. We walked through Bryant Park and enjoyed a ride on the lovely carousel. It was $3 for a ride. Lots of people eating lunch or enjoying a drink in the park with friends. They must also have entertainment as we saw lights and a screen.
This is a neat spot in the city. You and stop by shop for the unusual, get a pickle or a macaroon while ice skating in the winter, it is just a bite of NYC.
Very big screne television playing the Big Easy. We walked around and heard music, it wasn't live it was the sound track to the Big Easy that was playing to many hundreds of people.

Great quare to sit and what the world go by. There is a grand restaraunt and anice cafe plus normal street vendors. great place to stop for a while , on 42 street . nice grass square where they show films in the evening sometimes. lots of places to eat and drink.

Nice!. A place to kick back, and take in conversation with a friend or just relax in the shaded areas at a table. Giggling children around the small merry-go-round made me smile.
This place is eye candy for those tired of looking at city buildings.

Vibrant green oasis. For a small city centre park it was full of activity. The centre grass was packed with people and ther was not a lot of space between. All around were all sorts of games that could be played from bowling to board games at tables plenty to keep people entertained.

Skated after watching a marriage proposal 😍. We visited Bryant Park when the Winter Village was there & had a wonderful experience. Wandered through the stalls & huts, picked up some gorgeous Christmas decorations, had great food & drinks then as I went to go on the ice rink to skate the ice was cleared while a young gentlemen got down on one knee in the centre of the ice & proposed to his girlfriend. The staff were great, most helpful & explained everything & kept everyone informed of what was happening & how long the ice would remain cleared for. It made my night staying upright on the ice after not skating for over 25 years & the proposal just made my visit feel extra memorable.

Fairly peaceful oasis in the middle of the city. It was 96 degrees in Manhattan last week and having checked out of the hotel on our last day we needed to fill some time. We grabbed the free chairs and sat in the shade to relax. Thats it. Dont expect too much. There is a statue of Mr Bryant to see. On selected dates they run movie night on a big screen.

Bryant beautiful 💕 . Bryant Park is such a beautiful family park. Perfect in size and attractions for people visiting. They have restaurants, and I've skating rink, little stores inside, great around Christmas the decorate beautifully.

A Xmas Must. Best iceskating location in the city during the holidays. With the gorgeous tree, festive markets and iceskating rink I kept coming back here! Iceskating is a little cheaper than Rockefeller or Central Park, well worth booking prior online, we skipped the sizeable queue and went straight to the front. Great atmosphere and one of my favorite places.
Lovely park.. This is a fab place for a coffee a chill out and a wander. Perfect. Close to Times Square and a haven in the hubbub. Look out for stuff on their too.

only free space for people who live around here. I stayd in a hotel round here Bryant Park for five nights.Bryant Park allday even night was full with a lot of people.There is a big screen and shows a drama.Many people enjoy drama at nigft time.Around park there are smoll shops, some rear cars which sells sun protect caps and others.I boght a cap for only $10 .It is very useful for me. After come back to my home, I use this cap every day.

Go over the holidays. Just beautiful!. Love going here with my family over the Christmas holiday. The tree is gorgeous, watching the ice skaters is so nice, sitting at the restaurant having a hot drink & all the vendors selling some great stuff. We like going here better than Rockefeller Center to see the Christmas tree. Not as crowded & the tree is gorgeous at Bryant Park. Nice there all year long!
great people watching. One of the reasons to go to New York City is to people watch. This is as good as any. Grab a drink or snack, sit and watch.

A good place to take a brief break both during days or evenings while touring the city.. Bryant Park is a very nice looking park with food services aplenty. It is located next to the NY Public Library, which our family took a good tour while we were there. There are a lot of seats and tables that you can rest your tired legs or get a drink while resting. There is also a public reading room (actually reading tent since it is located outside) that you can read while you rest.

Beautiful park at night. I went there to watch a theaterical performance. I met my friends there and we bring food and drink to eat at the park. It was beautiful perfomance and as well the park. Free entrance and clean our own trash after the dining, of course..

Stop, take 5 and People watch. A gem of a park in the thick of it! take a seat, have a drink and just watch the world go by! Visit the Bryant Park website to see what is happening in the month of your visit.

Serene. For me to meditate is a place that where people my be present but peacefulness is there even there's crowd. I go here once in awhile for that. And you cannot find that piece of place in the city except Bryant park.

Beautiful park. Very pleasant small park, lush with trees, activities for the whole family and a reading corner full of news papers. There are also a few monuments and the New York Public Library is adjoining this beautiful park.

An oasis in Midtown. I've lived in Manhattan for just under 30 years and this is one of my favorite outdoor places possibly in all of the city let alone Midtown. When I first moved here it was a decrepit run down place that you didn't even walk past but oh how things have changed. When I have enough time (and it's not 98 degrees & 110% humidity) I come here with my lunch, or just over coffee in the morning. Winter has ice skating and the Christmas shop stands and when it starts to get warmer they open the lawn (and make a fun production of it). There are movie nights (not my thing) and all sorts of things going on through the day (yoga & tai chi in the AM's, jugglers, piano players at lunctime. Tons of office workers just like me just hanging out. Oh yeah, and one of the most LOVELY public restrooms you'll ever see (at least the last time I stopped in)

A great place to relax. Ideally situated at the bottom of Times Square, this quaint little park provides spaces to read, play games or just relax under the sun umbrellas. If you're feeling energetic, you can engage in table tennis or petanque. After a long day on your feet, it's a great place to while away an hour and recharge your batteries.

A Park and More!. Just saw Broadway in Bryant Park, which showcases performers from various Broadway plays and it was delightful, although very hot. The sun was in full force. Tip:Bring along a hat or something to block the sun. In addition, there are other things to do within the park such as: miniature golf, carousel riding and ping pong. You can sit in the park and have lunch or just people watch! There's also midday music, evening movies, Kids Food Festival, Shakespeare in Bryant Park, birding tours and even a winter festival! With so much to see and do, make Bryant Park on of your travel destinations.

Bryant park. Great shopping during the holidays
A lot of everything
Something for everyone
Also kiosks with different foods to snack

A perfect Oasis of calm in the middle of Manhattan . Manhattan can get exhausting. I find Bryant Park like a chill pill when people come to just sit and watch the world go by. You see mothers with strollers, friends meeting to have lunch, a couple having a romantic date, families with young children after school and of. Purse tourists hanging around with cameras and day packs. During the summer there is an outdoor screen where you can watch movies and there are a lot of drinks and coffee vendors around. Def a place to relax!
Beautiful place to hang out in the evening. Gorgeous views of the empire state building. Not too busy, you can watch movies, eat, or just relax on the grass.

Spectacular Setting.. One of the idyllic outdoor gems in Midtown Manhattan, this splendid space can be transformed in using it for all sorts of activities and events all year around. The Winter Village in the park at Christmas time is one of my favorite, the free admission for ice skating and skating shows. The holiday shops, featuring several boutique-style shops in the park's tree-lined allées, complete the park's transformation into a winter wonderland. In the Summer there are loads of free activities, music, opera, film, yoga, Chess & Backgammon, language and painting classes, etc., spectacular setting.
Perfect with Kids. Nice green space was clean and comfortable. There were food vendors and places to picnic. There were free supplies for kids to do arts and crafts and an outdoor free library.

Lovely nigth!. It is a busy and fun park, always it has activities. You can go anytime and you Will find something to do...in summer they have movie nights ,a very good selección clasics movie; but if it is winter you can skate.

What you see in movies!. Bryant Park looked to be just out of the movies. Cute food stands, tables and chairs, shade, a concert area, and a game area! The game area included a cart that contained laminated Apples to Apples cards, Connect Four, Uno, Scrabble and many other familiar games. The tables were covered by umbrellas. Many held chess or checkers games. The park provided a great place where locals and tourists relaxed. A nice break!

Carousel - Intermittently Open. We had a trip to Bryant Park on our list for our visit to NYC and found that they carousel was not open. When I asked an individual at one of the local kiosks, they said the carousel was only open very sporadically - so word to the wise, check the times for the carousel before you go if that's the intent for your visit.

LOVE THIS PARK!. I go here almost every time I go to New York. Love it at Christmas time, venders set up so you can Christmas Shop and the ice-skating is great! there is always something going on and the bar there is really good too.

Beautiful!. Our flight was delayed by 4 hours and we were worried that our day would have been wasted. We ended up walking to Bryant Park and the park is just beautiful. It's serene, it's surrounded by city, but somehow you feel secluded within nature. The NYC public library borders it, and the architecture around the park is just so well designed. I love NYC parks, especially this one.
Beautiful . A really nice tranquil spot qith plenty of seating and a reading area too! Cafes and shops nearby as well as the bus and metro. Good chill out spot.
A park to rest up in with hordes of NYC workers. It's a great place to people watch after visiting the nearby attractions. It's right behind the public library worth a visit inside.

A great place to relax between the skyscrapers.. We stayed close to the park and on a hot summers day no better place to come and relax. On a Monday night they have a film night where you can sit on the grass and watch the large screen and on a Thursday night performers from Broadway perform songs from the Broadway musicals and all for free. A great place to chill in between a hectic schedule in this great city.
Very cool . Just a nice big square with some many cafes it looks like a giant terrace. Very nice setting at the back of the national library.
Birthday Trip for my Husband. Walked by Bryant Park at night on our way back to the hotel from dinner. In the early fall it was nice just to sit at one of the tables and look at the
Always a favorite!. Generally visit several times during any visit to NYC for people watching, relaxation, or grabbing something to eat.

Parklife. What a cute little park in the middle of the high rise jungle , hotel nearby and found this place to be very charming for people watching in the sun or drinks at the bar at the top end overlooking the park . Lots of different activities going on everyday and even a giant movie screen showing evening films , I loved this place ..

Active park near Times Square . Stopped by while visiting New York. The park is very active with folks trying to get a little sunshine in the concrete jungle. It's next to the library and has a reading area and stage nearby. Great place to chill when the weather is nice.

An oasis in the heart of downtown. Right besides the city library, this park is a real jewel for those looking for some air and just relax. There is always something happening in this park..so watch out!

Just strolled through to enjoy the excellent vibe. Watched a little ping pong. People were playing chess. Considered getting a waffle or coffee but needed to get to dinner. Would love to catch an outdoor movie or concert here sometime.

I want to be at Bryant Park every day.. If Bryant Park was just a park, it would be worth a visit just for the lovely fountain, trees, and grassy quad. However, an intrepid band of genius NYC natives work tirelessly to make sure Bryant Park resembles a carnival as much as a park. There are books-on-wheels, accordion festivals, movie screens, bocce ball, and a freaking carousel. You can eat, rest (don't sleep, a cop will poke you), drink, or check out the historic NY Public Library. It's like a French artist had a dream about a park, so cute.

Sit and Stay Awhile. CLose to Grand Central, Bryant Park is a greta place to sit and stay awhile. There are plenty of benches and chairs but you could bring your own blanket as well. Bring your lunch in or dine and the wonderful restaurant there. Bringing the kids...be sure to take a ride on the carousel!

This was a little Gem. The park was filled with people having lunch, Talking, and enjoying the New City PARK Life. It was very clean and pretty much in the middle of everything! I cant get enough of NY parks. I feel like when your in the city you must stop by and have a bite on a bench and relax your feet for a little bit, before you go cruising the City again!
Played chess with my sons under the trees. It was a nice stop on our way to Times Square.We played chess for a couple of minutes before resuming our walk.

Nice place to rest and take in the atmosphere. Outside of Central Park, this was the first park we visited. On 42nd St, situated between Grand Central Terminal and Times Square. Of the evening, there was a film being shown on the wide screen. Restrooms, food stalls, waffles and drinks stalls close by. In the day, a place to relax and take everything in.

Your tax dollars at work. Wonderful place for summer activities!. Bryant park is a great public space, with plenty of colorful plant baskets and gardens. It has a fountain, a huge outdoor screen, plenty of covered spaces and even more chairs. Activities include movies at night ... thus the giant screen :), classes ... yoga, Spanish, etc., etc. , a lending park library ...it even has a children's section, and a kiosk full of games like chess and monopoly to lend to park patrons. There's an old fashioned children’s carousel as well. You can easily spend several hours here ... they even have charging stations for your phones!
NYC . In the summer Monday's they show movies you sit on the lawn got get there early it gets crowded in Christmas it's all in the spirit good place to visit relax have drink
Loved it . This is a small Park but it has everything. We had a light lunch at the cafe and went down the steps to relax on the grass then took our son to the carousel and off we went.

My favorite spot to chill. I always stop at Bryant park to see what's going on. Festivals , tiny shops and it's spectacular around thanksgiving and the holidays. This week there was some kind of juggling contest. Great place to unwind and at time go by.
Always a great time . Whenever we go to NYC in December we always make sure to go to Bryant Park. The shopping and food is great. We also love the ice skating!
Christmas in the city. Great time in the city during Christmas time lots of nice shops to get unique gifts and fabulous hot chocolate
OMG !. I loved this park so much. Just sit out on the grass and watch movies in the summer or have a bottle of wine and chill out. Very close to everything and the skyline at night is gorgeous!

A retreat from the hustle and bustle.. Within striking distance of Times Square this small park surrounded by skyscrapers is a little gem. It's as though you are entering a different world as everyone is relaxed and chilled.
Beautiful park with many activities!. We went by and they were getting ready for a yoga class. Then, in the afternoon, they had singers on stage and we ate at the cafe.
Great place to hang out!. It is great place to hang out near Times Square. You can have coffee/drink right in the park. Many chairs available for you to sit. Sit and Relax!

Unknown Jewel in the city.. We were staying at Mela Hotel on 44th and 6th Ave and passed this park several times. Stopped there at one of several food kiosk for coffee and some sort of feta and spinach filled pasty. The park, located behind the NYC Library is a delight to explore for what is publicly offered and people watching. The park provides a outdoor reading library with free newspapers and magazines to borrow, many areas for games, including a putting green, chess classes, language classes. This is a model of what a big city park can be.

Bryant Park is always a favorite spot especially at Christmas. I've been to New York 75 times and used to stay very close to Bryant Park during businessI make it a point to always stop and spend a few minutes sitting on a bench to people watch but my favorite time is to bring my spouse during the Christmas season when the ice-skating is going and all of the Christmas tents are set up. It reminds me of being in a small Colorado Main Street town browsing the small shops  You should Google the story about how Bryant Park came to be as the story is fascinating and a credit to people who believe in changing the status quo

Nice place to visit near Times Square.. We visited Bryant Park on the way to Times Square on a Friday around 7 PM. A warm August evening, workers had streamed onto the grass to relax, the last rays of sun reflecting off the glass covered buildings gave a surreal lighting as the music played out of the local bars.A nice place, almost magical.
Posers paradise!. Fantastic views of the rich and beautiful people of New York City. The cocktails aren't bad and this really is an oasis in midtown. Come early!

Worth Seeing. Bryant Park is a great little gem in the middle of the city. You can check out the central New York library and see an amazing building. There are also a number of great restaurants here including Bryant Park Grill.

Bryant Park. The day we saw Bryant Park it was raining so the outdoor activities were not going on. Broadway actors perform short portions for free at the park. That would have been nice to see, otherwise, nothing special.

Peace and tranquility . This is a lovely small park to walk round and spend some time reading (there was a small library!) play chess or table tennis. It is an oasis compared to the noise and crowds in Times Square! It was so peaceful and cool under the shade of the trees when we first visited on Sunday morning that we returned later in the week as we were staying nearby. Even the public toilets were impeccable with no charge to use them and a vase of fresh flowers in the doorway.

Great place to grab lunch or a drink and people watch or read. Many food options to grab and go and many chairs and tables, so try to snag a seat. People watching is great and other activities are available (posted times) as well as books from the Strand. It's behind the NY City Public Library which is fantastic and had a great free exhibit of Hamilton.

A Good Park in Central Manhattan!. Bryant Park is a great place to visit in Manhattan. There are all sorts of activates going on from concerts to lectures to table games, etc. You can sit and people gaze and take a break from the hectic sight seeing life of Manhattan while you are still in Manhattan. Check out the schedule of events before you go because it can get very crowded when special.things are going on.

Beautiful. visited here in the evening - lots going on beautiful place to take a seat and people watch. A great space in the middle of the city - lights in surrounding tower blocks etc were lovely at night.

Useful public convenience stop. By the time of reaching this point we were needing conveniences. These are very clean and managed throughout the day. The park oils a good stop to have a bite to eat, with cafes around the edge.

Always something different. Love Bryant Park! Lively and busy, but easy to find a table or seat. Music, concerts, lecture, ping pong tournament all going at once. Look on their website and plan to be entertained free of charge. Grab some street food or restaurant to go and eat in the park. A lovely evening.

Nice Breakfast Spot. We just stayed 3 nights around the corner from Bryant Park. The park is set up for you to enjoy some food/drink while slowing down the midtown madness that is all around. In addition to the breakfasts we had from the vendors just inside the park, we stopped by to get a mid-afternoon drink & snack as well as people watch from our seats. Try a fresh waffle ice cream sandwich from the waffle stand!

Have you SEEN those Public Bathrooms!!??. Bryant park literally (and literarily) has something for all ages - story time, book readings & signings, free library, game tables and fields, foods and fountains. I've stopped by to rest at lunch and seen scenes from current Broadway hits, small concerts and people learning lawn bowling. But, if you come for no other reason, come for the public restrooms - clean, lovely, safe - they are an oasis with fresh flowers! Who would guess it?

Lovely green space. Nice area to sit and relax with a snack or cup of coffee. Several snack booths available and plenty of tables and chairs throughout the park. Not overly crowed, very pretty landscaping. Nice place to rest while sight seeing.
Summer Impromptu Music in the Park. Wandering through the park and suddenly a group of singers burst into song! What a treat and very talented too.

Escape the Concrete Jungle. What a great spot right in the middle of all they chaos. This small patch of of greenery amongst so much concrete, steel and glass is located right next to The New York Public Library. It provides the perfect escape to relax and get away for a moment or two. Grab a coffee or a snack from one of the vendors and find a spot. Seek out a shady spot, relax, breathe and then back to all the touristy stuff.

Always something happening here. In the winter, ice skate for free and sip hot chocolate under the heat lamps. In the summer enjoy the fountain, the scenery and the shopping. There are free concerts in the summer and always an upbeat vibe. Don't miss it if your time is limited in NY
It changes everytime. I've been there twice, summer and winter and it always looks different but undeniably fun and with nice people arround

The best Park in NYC. Such a diversity of activities all year long (reading, ball playing, juggling, knitting, yoga, listening to live piano, outdoor movie...and the list continues). Many food options around for a take away in the Park, it's heaven amongst concrete building. When you want a 'stop & relax' time Bryant Park is the place to go.
crowded. This park is generally very crowded. That said, if you can find somewhere to sit it's a great place to people watch.

A favorite spot in NYC. Bryant Park, located right behind the New York Public Library, is a favorite spot for guests and locals. Beautiful grounds, a merry go round, a library area and so much more. There are places to eat, including Bryant Park Grill, that has a great brunch. In the winter, there is ice skating and a Holiday Shopping area to enjoy. In the summer, there are movies on the lawn. It can get very crowded but it is always enjoyable and in a great location. If you are walking around the city, it is a great spot to sit and relax for a while.

One of my favorite places to go!. In winter, the park turns into winter wonderland, ice skating, European market stalls, hot apple cidar that makes you feel magical.In the summer, the park is a place for yoga mornings, free salsa dance nights, a place to have a drink, lie down or just chill. It's got great energy, I go there and its always a pleasant experience. So accessible to everywhere Manhattan based.
Great location to eat , relax & people watch. Bustling venue with lot of seating under shady trees. Behind NY public Library and a really crowded restaurant.
Relaxing. There's so much to do here. An oasis in Times Square. When you need a break from the hustle & bustle, this is a fantastic choice!!!
Lovely park. Nice little park in the middle of the city. Lots of places to sit down and also little cafe booths to get a sandwich and coffees.
Oasis of Green. Pleasant place to enjoy a coffee, watch the table tennis players and check out the free lectures. After the hustle and crowds of New York it was nice to sit among the trees and relax.
Nice open space. A pretty area which has seats and shade too. A calm in the storm area if you need a rest close to lots of attractions.

The Place to Be!. What a wonderful green respite, right where it is needed. If you can call a halt on running from place to place, Bryant Park is the perfect place to sit and watch everyone else run from place to place. Day or night, in whatever season, (well, maybe not in the rain) this is such a welcoming spot. On this visit we saw only a few chess games in progress but often there are tables full of them - sometimes there will be a single chess expert playing several games simultaneously. If you grab a sandwich or salad somewhere, Braynt Park is a great place for some al fresco dining!

Great Place to relax. After our tour to Toronto we came back for a day to Manhattan and made a stop in Bryant Park which is close to the Grand Central Station, Chrysler Tower and Times Square. It is a great place to relax. I recommend that you buy some food in the market in the Grand Central Station or other places close to the Park and take your time. Many local people stay there to eat and enjoy. Often there are public shows. And finally - it is somehow quite compared to all the noises in the streets.

pretty cool Place. This park is pretty nice, you can go have coffee, a couple of restaurants are near by, you feel like a true new yorker with your coffee and with the sun (of course during summer). really nice place to have coffee and enjoy the view
Chilled!. Lovely park not far from Times Square. Food and drink stalls within the park with tables and chairs to chill whilst eating lunch.

Love this Park. Extremely safe environment. There is something for everyone. The winter offers a skating rink for the entire family. The summer offers the great lawn to lounge and read a book from the library that is close by. You can enjoy a hearty lunch purchase from many vendors in the park. Love this park, small and quaint. You can take a short walk next door, and tour the New York Public Library, which is free to do.
A wonderful taste of the City. I had never been to Bryant Park. Lovely. A taste of the City with none of the negatives. Thoroughly enjoyed.
Nicer than years ago¡. Bryant Park is now much beauty than years ago. Now you have food trucks, in a nice park in the middle of the town.

Serene quiet little pocket. Beautiful little park not far from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Lined with cafes and food trucks. Offers free board games during the day! Weekend movies in the park. Cute and quiet.

Reading Room a nice use of time. I have always admired how pretty Bryant Park is when I'm walking to or from Grand Central but have never actually stopped by. I remedied this on a Saturday morning - first stopped to get delicious Belgian waffles at Wafels & Dinges, located in a stand in the corner of the park. After our waffles, we used the bathroom (a really nice, if crowded, bathroom - tip the helpful attendant if you have any cash!) and then settled into the Reading Room. Sponsored by HSBC, the reading room is open every day from 11-7 and is completely free. It was great to settle down and read a magazine to spend some time relaxing before lunch and a Broadway show. They also have scheduled talks and children's events in the reading room. A really aspect of a truly beautiful park - I will definitely be back!
Relaxing. Stopped by here for a coffee and a rest ....live entertainment on stage ......lots of seating and shade .
nice. Wonderful! full of activities with net to re-charge phone or laptop, ping pong table, free cinema during summer Monday.Nice place to spend 2-3 hours to read, play, work, or just relax.

I love visiting this park when in the city on business do destress and have some me time. Lovely park in the middle of the city. Grab some food from a street vendor or all the great organic eateries around and pull up a chair and enjoy this gorgeous park.

Movie at Night. Throughout July and August they show a movie once a week in the open air. All films by HBO this was another individual moment in the city that never sleeps. Take a blanket or a waterproof jacket to sit on.
beautiful little park. beautfiul little park to watch the world go by. Free outdoor cinema , table tennis , cafe . lovely clean toilets .

What a wonderful place!. We had never heard of Bryant Park before we went to New York but enjoyed our rest at one of the tables here. Here, as well as in Union Square & a few other places, there are small tables with chairs that do not belong to a restaurant or café. You can bring your lunch or just your book/newspaper and sit here for a break. We loved that idea!Online I saw that many classes are offered at Bryant Park, including yoga and juggling. There are also movie nights here - I believe free of charge. The atmosphere was really great.

Great stop.. Lovely little park with live music on a Thursday and reasonable food and drink. If you eat at restaurant bar drink are pricey but we thought it was worth it. Broadway understudies put on shows from the musicals currently showing on Thursdays and its a nice way to relax.

Love this park. Gorgeous and reasonably peaceful park. Lots of social activities for everyone, and nice eating options too. A great place to sit and relax in the middle of all the chaos that is New York
Small but lovely park. Where you can eat your take-away lunch, chairs and tables are available, a nice place to relax in the middle of the day.
Small park. It's a small park , nothing much to do , they have few attraction for kids and place to play games like table tennis , chess etc , could be avoided if you don't have time.

Quiet oasis. This park changes identities during the day. Starting out as the coffee meeting place and bedroom for some it provides shade and a place to recharge and rest your feet during warm days to change again later in the day for friends and business people to have meetings before it changes again to a dining room and movie venue. It was clean, well maintained and felt completely safe. While nowhere near the size of some of the other parks, this little gem is smack in the middle of a number of tourist venues and a welcome piece of shade on warm or rainy days.

What a surprising gem!. We happened upon Bryant Park at lunch one day as we were searching for a place to eat lunch with a friend. Seats were plentiful and there were a bunch of activities for kids and adults to take part in (ping pong, board games, chess table). Also a boon for Pokemon Go hunting for those into it! The park was well staffed and clean and just a great place for a break in Midtown.
Lovely park. Lovely place to sit and relax in heart of busy area. Nice French cafe and plenty of seating areas if you don't want to eat or drink

Good place to relax mid Manhattan. Right next to the NY public library, is a large space used by the public for relaxing, events, picnics, whatever comes to mind in some cases.There is a restaurant and bar at one end. Free chairs and an open lawn make it easy to find a place.Lots of trees and plantings make the space inviting as well.Recommended

wonderful any time of the year. I've visited Bryant Park in both the winter and the summer and both seasons have their special charm. In the winter you can sip hot cocoa at the restaurant as you watch ice skaters on the rink. If you're there on a weekend, the Christmas market is amazing! In summer you can rest in the cool shade and people watch or ride the carousel.

Beautiful park. One of my favourite parks in NYC! To start, it's right behind the New York Public Library (one of my favourite buildings in NYC..). There's usually something going on in the park - dancing, juggling, piano, reading, etc. In the summer, there are movie nights on the lawn. In the winter, it turns into a winter wonderland with an ice rink and village of booths selling Christmas goodies, trinkets and what not. The area itself is well preserved and with an open lawn and lots of seating around. The carousel is a unique touch - a real carousel in the middle of the city! Perhaps I'm biased because I work near here but it's an urban oasis for me and a perfect place to just unwind.

Bryant Park Oasis. Beautiful park in the middle of the city! Quiet and pristine. A lovely spot to escape to. There is a lovely little spot to borrow a book to read. The Bryant Park Grill is a beautiful restaurant to have a delicious lunch on their patio.

Beauty of nature all here. What an awesome park. From the natural beauty of its green spaces to the natural beauty of mankind.Great for a family outing or for one to just get away and be one with nature.

Simply Charming...Romantic...and Relaxing...Heaven.... I visited Bryant Park twice on my first and last day in New York. Summer is hot in New York, but Bryant makes it easier to relax. Make sure you get there early on hot days because the chairs and tables in the shady areas will go fast. So much green to enjoy in the middle of the city. This is a great place to have lunch or a picnic with your friends or family members. They also have music, movies, shows, board games, and even tai chi in the morning. Can you believe it? Lots of stuff to fight off the stress of Manhattan. There are places to buy food and drinks around. Of course, this is the summer. In winter, there is an ice skating rink. This is definitely another must-visit place in New York.

Quiet little park to Relax...... Small little park with a couple coffee shacks on premise. Benches are there for you to relax and take in the sights. People watching is the best thing to do here....many interesting sights. Nice quiet park to relax in.

If you are in midtown and on 42 no street stop by and relax. Great place to grab lunch and one of the restaurants or street vendors and kick back and relax as the city lives and breathes around you. It has a certain peace about it and is worth the stop

Charming park in the way to the Empire State . Small and charming park with a romantic atmosphere in city.Was a market there on Sunday and we enjoy our time there. Great for a stop and also is near the public librarie.

Beautiful Park, lots to do.... We walked through this park on the way to Grand Central Station. It was beautiful. There were a lot of seating options and things to do. We saw a mobile library cart that a mom and her young child were perusing, a couple of guys playing checkers, a kid playing on playground equipment, and people just chatting or listening to music or taking in nature. It was a nice, relaxing atmosphere. I look forward to visiting again on my trip to NYC.

Free Broadway preview on Thursday. We went to Bryant Park so we could watch the Broadway preview. Basically, four shows are featured and snippets of them are performed on Thursdays. (Check the calendar--not sure what months are included). This is a great way to see some performers, learn about some shows, and enjoy a picnic in the park. (Bring along your own food.)Do be sure to arrive early on a hot day because the tables and chairs in the shaded areas around the park perimeter will go quickly.

Great Scenic park. This place is very lively and also very clean they have small shops on the outskirt where you can get a drink with a bar and TVs and people watch all night long. In the winter they have an ice skating rink here and you can watch the people on the ice as you walk around and you can shop in the little shops that look like a Bavarian village. Definitely a must visit and a nice place to walk
Great place for a picnic lunch. We got take out from Pax and enjoyed this green oasis in the heart of NYC. We were there around 1.30 so probably beat the lunchtime rush - easy to get a table
NYC. So much to do: board games, music, restaurants, movies.... My favorite is Tai Chi in the mornings (all free) relaxing and clean.

Great place to relax and eat in Manhattan. Bryant Park is located in Midtown Manhattan of 42 street. It is a great place to get away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan . There are numerous restaurants with outdoor seating , a waffle and Ice cream booth , a small bakery booth , a merry-go-round for the kids , etc. They offer free entertainment , and plenty of chairs to sit and relax. It is very safe as well.

Great year-round. We are usually in NYC for Christmas, and really enjoy Bryant Park for the ice skating and their Christmas market. We were there at the beginning of August, and it was lovely. There are plenty of open seats in the shade, plus a few places to sit down and have a drink or some food. We sat down for a few minutes and had a drink at the open air bar and watched people go by. A great place to take a break from the City!
Ice skating in Bryant Park. Brilliant experience of ice skating in Bryant park, well priced and an experience I would never forget.
A few hours in the park. A very nice park. They had musicians playing music and singing. They were all in formal theatre costumes. There is a bar there and we stopped for before dinner drinks.

A Place to Relax. While this park is small, compared with Central Park, it still offers visitors shade and a place to rest. Not as busy as Central Park (when we were there, at least), it still served its purpose.
Relaxing park behind the library. Rested here for a bit while touring the city, and it was really a lovely and relaxing park in the midst of the concrete jungle. I loved the atmosphere.

A Zen Sanctuary in the busiest city. Take some time-- for a stroll and maybe some yoga-- or perhaps just take some time to sit on chairs and benches bearing dedications to loved ones from those that they loved. Such special touches await in Bryant Park...right behind the New York Public library. We go every year and it never fails to calm and give us an appreciation for the contrasts within NYC.

Oasis in the city. We had planned to take in movie night however it was cancelled due to weather. We walked over the next evening and enjoyed a summers eve with the mix of locals and travellers relaxing at the small tables and chairs surrounding the green space that was filled with picnickers and families playing catch and frisbee. Juggling was also on the agenda. Such fun watching the pure joy of children on the carousel and tossing coins into the fountain. Sitting back, looking up at the labyrinth of buildings surrounding the city-block of park, was a reminder to how little it takes to create a quiet and gentle green space in a concrete jungle.

Such a nice park. Wonderfull park with lots to do. Free teracces, an open air and free library, playing field, music and off course food. It is just a small park but very busy. When going through NYC, being so busy and for sure and that part it is a very good place to sit down an relax for some moments. I loved it and went back several times during my stay.

highlight of my trip. I had been to NYC several times but had never been to Bryant Park until this trip. My friend and I made a point of stopping in the park every day to watch the world go by. We watched a game of bocce and other play ping pong. We were there early in the season so it was transitioning from the winter garden to spring. I will definitely make a point to visit again on my next trip.

Relaxing in the park. They have many wonderful programs in the park. You can watch a movie on the lawn or sometimes they have performances. In the winter you can go Ice skating and they have market set up.

Pleasant park in middle of Manhattan. We were
Looking for somewhere outside where we could enjoy the warm sunshine and there was Bryant Park just a few blocks form our hotel. We were able to enjoy (an expensive) glass of wine in pleasant surroundings in the middle of Manhattan.

An amazing space in the middle of chaos. Bryant Park is situated right in the middle of traffic and other attractions that make the place a wee sanctuary in the middle of it all. Sat having Prosecco watching the world go by brilliant a must see
So relaxing, pretty grounds,lots to see. So relaxing, pretty grounds,lots to see And do..can play all kinds of games..grab a bite to eat as well as a cold beverage..love it there alot
Nice area.... Stopped here for a break and found this to be a nice relaxing area. A bar was operating here as well, so we had a drink and watched the people. Worth an hour if your time.

Great spot to rest. It was hot and humid during my time in NY but this is a great place to get a cold drink and rest in the shade. It is currently set up for night time movies and it would be a great site to see as an ice skating rink in winter

A quiet place to take a coffee!. Where you can rest from the confusion outside,it's really calm and peaceful,love it!!
You can take lunch with you and enjoy a quiet momement just watching people passing by!
Best Winter Park in NYC. Outside heaters and a Christmas market and skating rink and outside bars make Bryant Park the best park during the Fall and Winter in NYC.

Beautiful rest arewa. When it's 100 in the shade, you need the shade and this delightful small
Park provides that and more. Take five mins out to grab a coffee and sit with the locals here.

Beautiful place to relax -- even at night!. Even though it was nighttime and raining, we still had a fantastic time chilling in Bryant Park. Highly recommend stopping in and grabbing something at the cafe there. Then, when you're done, head over to Blue Bottle Coffee for a coffee and walk around the New York Public Library :)

Love Bryant Park. There is no reason to pay anyone for a tour to Bryant Park. The park is free. It is located right behind the NYC library, 5th Ave & 42nd Street. Go relax int the park or there is a restaurant and 2 separate bars outside with good food and drinks. If you want to do it a little bit cheaper, there are places, including and a salad joint right on 42nd for takeout. You grab your takeout go over to the park and enjoy a beautiful day.
Enchanting. Tucked in a corner near the Empire State Building is this enchanting small free public park. Beautifully maintained with several market stalls added to this goddess experience.
Amazing little park. In this park especially on weekends at evening time the musicians and theater actors did very interesting performances. And also they have very beautiful fountain in territory.
Take a break. Having to sight see with visitors, this is a great place in the middle of it all to sit, rest and catch your breath in the middle of it all.
