Loved the relaxing vibe in Bryant Park. Lots to eat, shade, places to sit. When we were there we listened to an accordionist from the Accordions of the World program. That was fun quirky addition to our after dinner relaxing.

A piece of green in the concrete jungle.. It was 34 degree's (that is 94 Fahrenheit) . It was nice to find a place with some shade.Large green lawn surrounded by trees with seats and benches. At the top of the park there is a collection of restaurants, they are a bit pricey. There is the normal collection of touristy vendors selling hot dogs drinks and nick knacks.Nice little park to stop and get some shade and rest on a hot day but if i did not stumble across it I would not go out of my way to visit.

Peaceful oasis!. This is another beautiful park in a bustling area of NYC. It's a place to relax, enjoy the scenery, read a book, have a meal or snack, or just people watch. We ended up here twice in a span of three days. It is next door to the New York Public Library and also very close to a subway stop.

Impressive! . We stopped over after lunch, the Morgan Museum and a walk through the NY Public Library. We sat in the chairs and tables (some with umbrellas) and had a blast people-watching. There were jugglers, people rolling diablos, basically a lot of fun being had at the Park. The flower pots had beautiful arrangements. Flower boxes at the nearby Bryant Park Grill were overflowing with colorful blooms and added to the cheery atmosphere. I had heard that there were bathrooms at the Park and nearly died when my daughter said she needed to go. Not knowing what to expect, we approached the restroom building with trepidation. The bathroom facilities were shockingly nice. The walls had beautiful mosaic tiles. Upon entering the bathroom building, you are greeted with a huge floral arrangement. Yes folks, that's right. Fresh flowers in a public NYC bathroom! Lilies, Sunflowers, etc. A large, beautiful fragrant arrangement. Once we got inside (of course there was a line for the Ladies Rm), there was a smaller vase of fresh flowers on the counter. Bravo to the two bathroom attendants (one in the Men's Rm, one in the Ladies' Rm) who worked tirelessly keeping the bathrooms in their tip-top condition! We were very impressed.

Seeing the park on the 4th July with Top Gun. Great to see the lawn fill up at exactly 5PM as it opens and everyone runs for a perfect spot to sit, picnic and wait for the movie that starts at 9PM.Lovely to sit in the sun, watch the world go by and enjoy the street food stalls out for the 4th July and the movie. Enjoyed a quart of homemade raspberry lemonade and relaxed.Be prepared to wait for the movies and bring something to sit on.

One of the Most Beautiful Places in the City. I have been coming to Bryant Park for about 5 years now. They have continued to add activities over this time. Its location is very close to Times Square but not as crowded usually. The Park has a nice grassy area coupled with wooded places along with cafe's and an outdoor bar. There are events such as Theater in the Park, movie nights, live music, square dancing and ice skating. There are also tables to play chess and board games. I would highly recommend stopping by when in NYC.

Great place to see the Statue of Liberty. No need to take a ferry over to the Statue unless you want to. Views are incredible here. Also easy to get to by subway. Splash fountain for kids and hot adults! Look for the best grilled cheese sandwiches at an outdoor cafe. Loved Bryant Park. Another great free event!

A small scape from cement city. This is a smaller park but it is well taken care. Good place to take time to rest and have a cup of coffee and a snack. There times they show free movies. There are lots of metal chairs to sit or if you prefer you can lay down on the grass.
Springtime is the best season . Shaking off the Winter freeze at Bryant's Park was fun with a longtime friend. We spent hours catching up about our families and friends.

Chill out and watch. Top place to sit back and watch a few locals soak up the day. Free ping pong, reading area and movies in the evening. You could spend time there every day if you lived near by. I would.

Excellent food in noisy venu. This excellent restaurant with location in central Manhattan has a goon menu, fine food, a crowd of business people as well as tourists. Unfortunately, at least on a week night, it is very noisy!
Nice place to chill near Times Square. When you need a break from the noise and are looking for some shade on a hot day, this is the place to head.

Nice place to chill. If you are a tourist, this is a great place to stop by between shoppings marathons. There's a lot of restaurants around the park and inside as well. During summer, on selected nights, there's free outside movies... One of my favorite places to just chill and watch 'em pass

Amazing Transformation. Anyone that has been in NYC long enough knows Bryant Park was at one time an awful seedy place and not safe to walk through. Fast forward a number of years and this place has become the jewel of the neighborhood. There is always something happening. It’s movies and music in the summer / skating and pop up shops in the winter. I work in the building facing the park and have a great birds eye view out my window of all the activity. It’s a fabulous place for lunch as salad shops and delis line the streets around the park. There are plenty of seats and tables, but they fill up fast. The New York library is right there and worth a visit on your way check out Grand Central.

Great Park, so much to do. From the ping pong, chess and backgammon, to the screen where they show movies, this park has it all. So cool to have a place to gather. Tables and chairs everywhere, places to eat and people watch.
Love Bryant park. It is very beautiful, and also a smaller if you compare it to Central Park, but we loved to relax a little and enjoy nature surroundings

Great family park. What a fun area in the middle of a concrete jungle - close to the Public library - there is something for everyone - concession, checkers , board games, books for kids , on certain days - movies in the park - great place to find shade on a sunny hot day

A beautiful place to sit and rest. After walking for hours we decided to just sit and take in the surroundings of this lovely small park. It was around 10pm and the park looked so nice with all it's lights. It was busy with people playing table tennis, reading or just listening to music. A few people heard our accent (from London) and came over and started asking us questions about the UK. There is a restaurant in the park but it was too late to start eating but it looked lovely. It was a place that parents obviously take their kids as there is not much grass around. I enjoyed the tranquility of the place

Bryant Park. Beautiful park to relax . There are vendors and restaurants surrounding it and plenty of tables to enjoy your food. There was a Broadway review performing when I was there. Really enjoyed it.

A Cute Place to Unwind. NYC is loaded with hustle and bustle so whenever a quiet little place pops up to break away for a little change of pace, stop and enjoy the break. Bryant Park is just one of those stops. Nestled amongst busy city streets is this small park with places to kick back and relax. If you want a quick bite it has little pizza places and various other goodies. If you happen to stop early evening, street performers will bring a little magic into your visit. Really, a magic show, street band and various other performers. Usually a little box or cup will be sitting out for those who enjoyed the show to throw in a buck or two. Nice experience.

A nice break in Bryant Park. While you are walking along the 5th avenue towards to south,you will see a very nice park on your right side which is Bryant Park.Even though it looks like a tea garden area,when you raise your head and look through it,it has a field to relax on it and one night I went there for the open air movie and it was so enjoyable.

Bryant Park. Bryant Park is a beautiful little Park.it was July when we visited so it was very hot. If you want to sit in a park it's very pretty and can be a relief from the city. I preferred spending the time I had in New York actually being in the heart of Times Square.

Go there every other day, beautiful park with cute cafes. If you are in town for 3-4 days may be you don't need to go there, but if you want to feel like a local - definitely pay a visit on a weekday, this park is really awesome ....

Dirt. When you spend so much time traveling and on trains, planes and automobiles you wake up one day and realize your feet haven't touched real dirt, earth and grass. Bryant Park is my favorite place to stop at on the way to/from the office for some dirt. Take off your wing tips or pumps and dig in.

Bryant park . A great place to rest on a very hot day. Public toilets were clean and the attendant was lovely. Plenty of seats with live music, free newspapers and books. Only complaint - no ice cream seller!

Great place to sit and relax. This is a great pit stop and such a beautiful park. There is plenty of shade for those hot days in the summer. They have plenty to do also:play chessplay table tennisread in the outdoor library that has books and papers already providedwatch a movie on the lawn (certain nights)grab a sandwichplay mini golf (for small children)
Lovely place in the middle of NYC. Great place to sit and share some good coffee with friends. There are always lots of things happening there: restaurants, movies, ice skating in the Winter...
Cosy and intimate . Stopped by for a drink on our way back to the hotel after a walk to Times Square. Really nice at the bar there. Outside seating and not too many tourists

A Gem. I can never get over how fabulous most of NYC parks are. I lived behind a beautiful NYC park for years and always enjoy them. Bryant Park will leave you wondering how you could possibly be only a few blocks away from Times Square. This last time we picked up flyers for the schedule of free events. We were both amazed at the amount and diversity of events for free that take place here.Morning YogaChess TournamentsPing Pong tournament Fly fishingConcerts Board gamesPutting contestsThe list I promise you will amaze you.Free tours of the park as well which me and my wife committed to going back for next week.
Green and fresh air. While visiting NYC, nothing best that find a fresh area where you can sit and relax and freshen up your mind.very nice place
A cosy park in busy surroundings. Sit down and have a rest in Bryant Park! You can have a drink or enjoy a nice meal in the restaurant.

Nice place to relax. Bryant park was smaller than we had anticipated. It had a couple of bars/ restaurants to the back of the park and a nice green open space which we chose to sit down on to take the strain off our feet for a while.On Saturdays they show plays and there were people gathering early evening before we left in preparation of the play. A nice contrast to sit in the park whilst surrounded by the New York City skyscrapers.

BEAUTIFUL. What a lovely retreat in the middle of the city, after the hustle & bustle of Times Square just walk a couple of blocks & relax in the park. Lots of free entertainment in summer. Lovely clean toilets but beware always a long que to use them.
Lovely Park in the middle of NYC. Great place to sit and share some coffee with a friend. We had been walking for quite some time, so it was a welcome rest.
Very nice park. Very nice park. Stopped to have an afternoon snack on afternoon. There are plenty of places to sit and talk.

Lovely Christmas Market. Loved browsing round the Christmas Market at Bryant Park while staying nearby. There was something for everyone here and lots of choice for snacks and drinks too. If you like Christmas Markets then it's definitely worth a visit.

Always something good going on there. Be sure to stop by Bryant Park. There are always things happening there - some movies, some lessons, ping pong, ice skating in the Winter. There are nice places to eat there too.

nice small park. I love this park in the summer cause it's small and a nice place to rest. In the winter, it turns into an ice skating rink and a wonderful winter festival with merchandise to buy, food, and a huge decorated tree.
Christmas time booths are set up. You can go between Nov and Dec and shop for all kinds of gift ideas. My 16 yo daughter loved the shopping. Lots of food vendors as well. Good crafts vendors also.
First time in New York. Walked around Bryant Park and the best thing about it was it was on a Beautiful Day! I would love to visit that park again. I loved the water fountain.

Very Intersting. What a great place to take a break in the middle of your sightseeing. A lot of things going on for locals and visitors if you choose to participate, Very Clean and Well Kept. Close to the NYC Public Library, get a book and enjoy the park for an hour or so.

A spot of green to relax. We found out, by chance that there are shows open to the public in the park.
I recommend to check the websites of the different parks to see what in during the time of your stay.

Little Gem in the middle of Busyness. So many free shows. Great place to relax from sightseeing and just watch the world go by. Lots of seating. Shows from Broadway and Shakespeare. Music and films....so much to watch, it is a lovely spot in the middle of such a busy city.

ALWAYS ALIVE. I have skated in winter, run past it in 4 seasons, played chess against a local, visited the markets and ate at the many hawker stalls there on most weekends.
Bryant Park is a smallish little gem in the middle of NYC.
a must see!
Love it. Leafy, interesting and relaxing. Plenty of free seating space - u can actually relax here though its the centre of Manhattan
Ice skating. My Mother used to take us ice skating when we were young. I Enjoy it every year and I take my family members.
Great park. It is not Central Park, but you still can enjoy the outdoor here with several show during summer with cute cafes.

Bryant Park. This is a very beautiful park. Lots of people always in the park. Food vendors are set up around as well as space for possible season/stage entertainment. Flowers were beautiful when we were there.

An Oasis of Outdoor Fun in the Middle of the City. This Park is full of entertainment during lunch hour. It is like day camp for an hour. Lots of places to eat, sit, watch, or participate in simple fun events.

Lovely Park Behind the Library. If you visit the New York Public Library, be sure to go behind the building for a visit to Bryant Park. It's a lovely oasis with great trees, landscaping, greenspace, a concert stage, cafes and lots of people taking a break from sightseeing.
Always a chess game to watch or book/paper to read. Lots of places to sit , some shaded some not. Nice little outdoor restaurant and lots of people watching.
A getaway from the loud city. I went during the day. I hung out and read. Also great for people watching. This is a popular lunch spot for the neighboring businessmen.

Place to relax. This was a great place to just relax after a full day of sight seeing, great place to people watch and just take in all the sights and activities going on around the park while enjoying an ice cream or cool drink from the vendors located at this park.

My favorite Park in NYC. It's like a slice of Europe tucked in behind the Public Library and the skyscrapers of 42nd and 41st Street. beautiful Paths and a gorgeous lawn. Look at the schedule you may find that they are playing a movie or have a Broadway cast performing on the lawn.
Take a break in the heart of NYC. After shopping you should take a break:) Bryant Park is close to Times Square so you can take your time and have an ice cream or somethin'. Gotta go there:)

Try the reading room. The park is a nice place to get shade, enjoy a sandwich and visit the reading room (not a room, it's open air)where there are tables only available to people reading either their own books or the free books and papers available there.

A lovely park. Shakespeare in Bryant Park presented "As You Like It". The play was well done. There were plenty of seats. There were plenty of places to get drinks and snacks. Since this is outdoors, it was sometimes difficult to hear the actors. They had mics but the ambulances screaming by and the police cars often interfered with the program. However, I would go again. Bryant Park is a lovely place

Great place to rest in the middle of high rises.. We passed by this park, looking for a bookstore.Decided to take a seat and enjoy the green after a long walk during our NYC trip.It gave us so much peace of mind that we ended up going back everyday, at the end of our walk, just to take a break and relax.It's just a nice place to sit and watch people. Free entertainment like domino and other stuff on the table.Wonderful place to rest.

Just bliss in the middle of the city!. What a find on a very hot day. This park located between 5th and 6th ave and 40th and 42nd Street next to New York's public literary is a blessing for tired shoppers. Lots of shade to sit and enjoy a cool drink or ice cream and people watch at it's best. Walk around and you will see people playing chess and table tennis then you'll come across a quiet reading area where you can pick up a book or newspaper. Your only asked to replace them when you have finished. A carosol and water feature for children, this green area is just bliss in the middle of the city!

A little gem. Heard a lot about this park on our previous visit to New York so decided to check it for ourselves this time round. The park is so beautiful with a lot of greenery and colour. Very well maintained and a great place to relax in a hectic city. We were not disappointed. Definitely worth visiting if you are in NY.

free wifi. In the Depression the Public Library extended to the park. These days it has free wifi which amounts to the same thing. Lots of shady outdoor seating, and amazing Elvis waffles (peanut butter, banana and bacon).
Lovely patch of grass. In the heart of midtown, it's a lovely little respite. There's often movies and events here. And lot's of TV/Movie shoots.
Nice park. This is a nice park to visit. They offer movie showings and booths to get coffee and waffles and dinges. Lots of places to sit and relax

Bryant Park!. Right across the street from our hotel and was beautiful! There are tons and tons of chairs so you can sit and relax anywhere. There is a large field that a lot of people came and had a picnic. While we were there they had outdoor theater and movie night. The space also has a few cafe's and a restaurant (that is a bit pricey), a carousel, and was in the same block as the NY Public Library. The surrounding buildings are very unique and it is a fun and pretty place to sit and eat your lunch or take a break from your day.
Ice in the middle of town. Visited in March 2015. Outdoor skating rink. Outside bordered with flags of all the coùntriès. Places to eat around the rink. A day of self entertainment. Great experience.
Beautiful.. (One of) the most beautiful parks downtown. Don't miss the Public Library. Restaurants in the park are excellent. Free shows for the public almost every night.(very good!!!)
Awesome!. Great free park with free reading stations. A lot of seating and a lot of activities worth checking out, even not too busy on a Sunday!
One of the many gems in the city. Another slice of nature in the busy city. Have a seat, relax and watch the birds before going to the next shop or attraction
Great park in the city. My daughter and I loved our little escape to some greensapce in the middle of the city! We got coffee and just sat and relaxed!

Love this Park. Our second visit to New York and our second visit to Bryant Park. Plenty of eateries within and surrounding to choose from if you are hungry or just need a drink. Sit at a table or on the grass and watch the world go by. An oasis in the middle of a crazy busy city. Some evenings they have an outdoor movie showing, on Independence Day they showed Top Gun.
Perfect place for a stroll. Went for a walk through here, great views and people were all friendly. Good location to consider going through when out for the day.
Lovely park. Walked through here on our way to the Empire State Building. A little gem in the middle of the city.

Great Park!!. We came upon this park as it was by our hotel!! There is a restaurant, bar, food carts, coffee and pastries. Lots of sitting. Nice lawn to spread a blanket out. Even a carousel for the kids!!
Lovely shady spot. Beautiful setting to escape the frenetic pace of downtown. Calm and cool even in the midst of a heat wave. Green!

Great gem. Another urban park that's value can't be quantified. What a great area to bring the family. There are different areas in this park that serve different purposes. A large central area is ready to host concerts or provide the space for an ice rink. There are ping pong tables under the cool shade of beautiful trees. Plenty of tables and seats around the center provide a place to relax. Fitness classes are offered if you live close enough to come regularly. Just a couple blocks away from times square!

Nice area to chill. A nice spot near 5th Street and Madison Ave. Rest. Relax. People watch. What I did not like is all the people coming up to you asking for money. Annoying. Pretty park with a lot of shade...good spot to rest while shopping.

Gorgeous place in the summer to sit and relax with a drink. Loved this Park. Small but perfect to sit with a drink/ice cream and relax on a summers day/night. Lots of ice cream vans around the park and lots of little coffee/snack places in the park. Great for a stop off when you have been walking around NY.

100% improvement. As a former NYC'er, I was pleasantly surprised at the great improvements made here. In the mid 80s this was not a 'fun' experience to venture into - now it's a must on any downtime a business person has to visit a site in NYC.

Activities abound day and night. Bryant park is an amazing space. A small (square block) city park, it is chock full of activities ... FREE activities. From movies to music to juggling to ping pong and bocce and reading and learning a language. A great spot to people watch. Conveniently near multiple subway lines. Check the schedule and find an event you'd enjoy or just go to relax.
Always something to see or do!. I love to visit this park when I am in NYC! There are so many things to see and do. It's a great place to sit and read or just to take a break :)

A real Oasi in the city... To see and to live!. I discover this Park only in this visit of the city and fall in love with it! Is nice, easy, super green and perfect made! You got a lot of seat to enjoy it, some nice bars and service, ther's a wifi and a nice restaurant. Is a perfect place for a small stop, like to spend some hours. Is in the middle of the city but so quiet and nice, is very very special!
Bryant park. Fun to walk thru. Also has several booths where food can be purchased. There are places to sit and observe NYC at night or during the day.

Nice park to chill . This is a great place if you want to have a coffee and cake , quiet chilled, can get busy , the public library is also here too , there are toilets too . Nice place for a stop off to rest your legs.

Great green space in the middle of the concrete field . A perfect place to rest during the busy day .Sitting under the green trees with a bit of breeze holding a glass of cold beer may change the entire day .

Lots happening all around!!!. Get down at 5th Av station if you are taking purple line and bryant park if you are on orange line. The park is delight for those who don't want to get lost in the very big central park.
Must visit. Enjoyed this park, always some form of entertainment or you can just sit down and relax. Outdoor movies while I was there

My Favorite Park in New York City. This is a perfect place to hang out, meet friends, bring food, listen to music, watch a free movie under the stars, or simply sit and write one's memoirs.Bryant Park is only a couple of street blocks long and an avenue block wide, but it's intimate and cozy and has a lot of tables and chairs where one can sit and relax for hours.To those of us who remembers when this park and its environment were totally forbidding, as vagrants and drug addicts occupied it, it's a joy to see what it's become today.
Very small, but nice park. Usually nobody have this park in the short list to visit NYC, but I recommend the visit. I has several activities and a nice view of the local culture.

Beautiful Park. Bryant Park is a wonderful park and they had Japanese dance going on the day we were there. Beautiful park behind the New York Public Library. And beautiful buildings surround the park.

Great park. Bryant is right off times square, near the public library. Great food/lemmonade stands, and a great place to chill for an afternoon. They have events going on at night during the summer as well.

just down the road from Times Square. a lovely relaxing little park with many activities going on a large lawn or seated area is free to sit on.
really loved the peacefulness after the bustle of Times Square

A Green place between enourmous buildings. Very quite and clean city Park, i appreciate the relax you can enjoy just so close to midtown. Green grass and high trees helps you integrating the vision of ny
Love Bryant Park. There is always something to see here. I love to people watch and this is the perfect place to do so.
Feel good factor. Sitting at an outside bar and having an evening meal followed by an out door movie. What more could you ask for. We even dressed for the occasion.

Lovely afternoon break. After walking the city it was nice to come to the park and be able to sit outside and actually feel like you aren't in the middle of a huge city. People were there eating, drinking coffee, reading books and socializing. It was a nice little break from the hustle and bustle of a big city

Cool Park to Relax. Not so far away from Times Square, Bryant Park is always my go to stop when in the city. Sometimes you want to just grab a book, grab some lunch, put your feet up and relax in the park. BEST PART IS: the Bathroom!! Super Clean!!!!

Lovely . Such a great place to sit on a nice day to eat, read, or relax. I could sit there for hours and people watch. One of the greatest things about New York is the people. I definitely recommend a visit to this beautiful park when in New York.

Best place to relax at the end of the day with a beer. Very lively park visited by New Yorkers in summer to sit on the lawn, play games or drink a beer. They have free games and several bars. Toilet may be busy at a sunny day.

Something for everyone.. Bryant Park between 40th and 42nd streets and 5 and 6th ave. An excellent place right in the beating heart of the city. There is a good restaurant, a good bar. A piano player outside the bar. there are games, park games, a chess club, an outdoor reading room. There is ping pong, and language lessons. They show movies on certain nights on a huge screen that folds away at other times. Enjoy a coffee from the booth or give the kid a turn on the carousel. There is tons of stuff to do, all free, plus a full program of events during the summer months. Enjoy!

Pleasant Stroll. We passed through the park one morning on our way to the adjacent public library. What a great park! It is such a nice green space in the heart of mid-town. We found ourselves slowing down to soak it all in. Everything and everyone seemed so pleasant, as if the park itself had a calming effect. Later, while passing by the park in a cab, it was lunchtime, and the park was filled with people escaping their offices to enjoy this wonderful setting.

peace. this is also another park to relax in right in the middle of the busy part of new york. it has lots of seats ,shops outside it and bands. in the evening the lights around the edge are switched on to give a calm and different feeling to it.
essential to visit. I like very much this park, it has a very New York air, you can sit free (there are tables and chairs) and contemplate all around you.
Ideal for a stop in New York City. This beautiful park is located behind the Library of New York.Clean, beautiful flowers, well kept and rich cafeterias.Ideal for a stop in New York City

My favorite hang out. I have been to NYC three times and make a point to stop at Bryant Park. It's small but beautiful and always so much going on. Ping pong, board games, yoga, boot camps and many more. I did one of the 6:30am boot camps while there. So glad I did. There were 60 participants and so much fun. What a great team. There is many food places and a nice bar. I can't wait to go back.

Wonderful Park buzzing with activity!. Bryant Park is melting pot of City activity, including competitive chess. Beautiful gardens and comfortable seating offer an very pleasant oasis in the heart of New York City. It is easily accessed by subway.
A nice place.. It is a very pretty place and in this time of the year, they offer events, such as outdoor movies. I liked it.

A jewel in the middle of Manhattan. This park, just behind the public library, is a very lovely place. From the reading areas, the lawn, the play areas (even ping pong), it is a respite in a very busy and populated area. We had ridden by several times on bus tours, and felt it was worth a separate stop to visit. We would go back again, for a quiet time in a noisy city!

ANOTHER of NYC'S great parks!. Ice Skating in the winter, beautiful place to sit in the summer! Grab lunch, eat at some restaurants there...and just enjoy the sounds of the city and the big big trees!
Nice Park. This is a nice park during the summer, some bars around the outside to visit and eat if you wish and some nice areas to sit in and relax

Awesome!!!. Loved it!! Great place to just relax and unwind after a long day. Great food, entertainment and just a nice place to sit and have a moment for yourself or with someone special. I visited with my daughter and this was our time to just sit and talk and enjoy our coffee together. Live it.

Bryant Park. A nice park to do in NY Manhattan is Bryant Park. It is very small park located next to the Grand Central Terminal where people spend sometime there for relaxation. Most of the employees comes to the park after the working hours to grab a drink before going home and enjoy the nice atmosphere. The park has a library in which you see alot of people reading in the park. Some employees have their launch in the park during the day. I find it very attractive and I personally like spending sometime there. Times Square is just one block down as well as Madam Tessude.
Summer Delight. Great connecting spot for trains and shopping arcades all around. NYC never ceases to amaze me. Can't wait to go back there in winters again.

Love walking through there!. Such a great natural space right behind the library! They have everything from free reading materials to ping pong tables! The restaurants are pricey but they also have less expensive food booths with decent choices. I also read they are doing a free live theatre series on their stage with all the popular shows participating. Unfortunately, it's during the week when we can't be there.

Very cute park amid the crazyness of NYC. This park is right behing the NY public library- which is a sight in itself. Highly recommend you take a break to sit down and people watch. A few little cafes around make that very feasible. Go enjoy the semi calm surrounded by the madness.

Bryant Park. We didn't actually go in the park, but we walked by it many times as it was fairly close to our hotel. It always looked clean and had people in it. They were having a celebration when we were there and we could have watched a movie on a big screen for free.
Nice Park. Very pretty inner city park. Lots of shade and benches. Several cafes around it also. Public restrooms also available.

Nice pocket of grennery !. Not far from our hotel so quite nice to have a stroll round in the evening . Lots going on , drinks and nibbles with tables & chairs . Just a lovely oasis in the middle of the city , nice .

Quaint. Bryant park is literally across the street from part of the NYU sprawling campus, that's why I was there. The park is pretty and shady (part of it), with some booths to purchase various items. It's literally next to the public library and on 42nd street, a very busy street (not that Manhattan has any quiet streets;). This is a nice place to enjoy outdoor relaxation... but not on a scorching hot summer day!
Beautiful Park. I had the pleasure experiencing Bryant park, perfect for lounging after hours of walking. They have movie in the park every summer and close to subway.
Lush greenery. A great place for picnics. It is pretty serene and tranquil. Works just as well for one who wants to read a good book under the clear blue sky.

My fav park in NYC. This park is way smaller than central park, but nevertheless cozy and perfect for spending time with friends or family. You can just throw your blanket on the grass and then just lay down and relaxed. In the winter, they have local artist market and ice skating.

An enchanted small park in Midtown Manhattan!. The park has been there for many many years, between 5th and 6th Avenues and 40th and 42nd Streets in Midtown Manhattan, with the New York Public Library in its background. Amazing location! Completely renovated in 1992, this public park privately managed is an oasis of peace, cleanness and efficiency. Lawns and shaded areas, with plenty of benches and chairs, make the perfect scenery for relaxation and quiet meals. Adequate eating facilities are available. The beautiful "Josephine Shaw Lowell Memorial Fountain" at the western gateway, welcomes all visitors. Enjoy!

Gem in the center of it all. This, and many other parks in NYC, probably often get overshadowed by the granddaddy, Central Park. Not that Central Park is bad! We love it too. It's just nice to experience less-known parks. We were here late morning on a Friday. Just in time for the bar to open! Terrific little bar in the park, offering light bites as well, but we just had beers. Sat on a swing (yes, a swing) in the bar. Very fun colors and decor--I think it was sponsored by Southwest Airlines. So there you go. Friday nights they do free movies in the park. There are also other food kiosks, a lending library (people still read! Yay!) and lots of games. It's a throw-back to they way people used to use public spaces. Before tablets and i-everythings. It was refreshing to see people have conversations and interact.

Wonderful surprise!. This park is an oasis in the middle of the city! Apart from the tables and chairs where you can relax while having a drink or snack, what really impressed me was the toilet! OK, this might sound funny, but I was dying to go to the toilet and since I couldn't find a place nearby, I decided that I had no other choice but to use the public toiet..... I stood in line, expecting to see a dirty, smelly place, but I was impressed by the cleanliness of the place! Also, if you're lucky, you might have the chance to watch one of Broadway's plays or some other kind of event for free!

Surprise find. An oasis of relative peace and quiet we came across where you can just sit amongst some greenery and relax for a few hours. We ended going here several times on our wanderings since there were plenty of eating options and it was a nice spot on a hot day. Good proximity to the Empire State, Grand Central, Broadway and Times Square being on 42nd street behind the Library.

When trees aren't enough. Bryant Park, the 2nd largest in lower Manhattan, is a lovely park in its own rite, but always has TONS of stuff going on, for anyone wanting to spend some time outdoors doing things. Learn to juggle, dance, hear music, learn Japanese, join a book discussion group, play boule or chess or classic games, ride a carousel, take a historic tour of the park, ice skate in winter, watch a free outdoor film, do yoga at sunrise or sunset, and more. Just check out the calendar listed on the website. While there, don't miss the public bathrooms - yes, seriously - complete with flowers and classical music! How can you not visit!?!?!??! Oh - and for a fun fact - all the NY Public Library stacks sit below that beautiful lawn.

Beautiful and peaceful in the midst of the city. We went through the park in the evening and it was peaceful, a change from the hustle of the surrounding streets. It felt like a piece of Paris in the middle of the city.

Green Space in the Middle of NYC. We came to Bryant Park for dinner, and the ambiance of the Park enhanced our experience. I understand this is a very active park with movies and other events - on Saturday night there were lots of people but no organized activities.
Central hub, great vibe and great views!. I love Bryant park, I would frequently get a drink or breakfast and just sit there taking in the views and people watching.

Really Nice . NYC is so cool. This park belongs to NY Public Mina library and they have tons to chairs and tables but you can sit on the grass too. Tons of New Yorker are in this park too. They have carousel, books, chess, board games and bathrooms. Lots of places around the park to get something to eat and go in the park and eat. They show free movies too on certain evenings. The schedule is in the park and on their website. Great people watching spot if you are into that. Winter time they turn have a ice skating rink too with cool unique vendors. If time square is to crazy for you this is alternative spot that not to crazy and definitely no one will bother you.

Yes! You can Bird in the Middle of NYC. Our feather friends visit this place at least as often as our two legged friends. We birded in this small urban park in New York City with New York City Audubon. This park is an important place for migratory birds to rest, eat and drink. So next time you visit. Look and listen. You may be amazed at the diversity of bird life in the City.

Lovely open space in a concrete jungle . Lovely park space lots of seating and some lovely restaurants with all sort of prices . There were different events going on , free pianist and meditation classes . Welcomed the park for the open space

Bryant Park. Beautiful park oasis in the middle of the city. The library had a book reading while we were there and evidently there are even movies on the lawn and other activities. The quaint French themed snack sheds are a nice touch and had yummy juice which was refreshing on a warm day.

Perfect park for a break, breakfast or lunch. Very nice a busy park. Quite and green, lots af free activities (movies, music, yoga...). Great espresso coffee stand (Coffeed) and bread stands. Our favorit breakfast "restaurant" while in NYC, yougurt/bread from Le Pain Quotidien and cappuccino/flat white from Coffeed - and peacefully starting the day with NYC. Also free wifi in the park.
Nice. Nice relaxing place to sit and gather yourself together after walking all over the place. Lots of seats and shade. Good place to people watch and catch your breath.

Beautiful oasis in the city!. We ended up here by accident. We were in a throng of folks headed south from Times Square, when I spotted trees! We veered left and were delighted. Bryant Park is amazing. Folks were playing ping pong. The Reading Room was up and running. A juggling class was going on for kids. It was a terrific spot to cool off and soak up some serenity before we rejoined the hustle and bustle.
Cool place, didn't know it was there!. Food, shops, activities (Ice skating in winter) and nice place to stroll if in the area. Not real crowded as people use other avenues. Nice view of city.

Favorite place in NYC . Beautiful place! I love nature and the city and this park is very special to me.
I went all day at night until the police officer asked me to go out!
I just loved every minute in Bryant Park

Graeat quiet open space. We were fortunate to be there when there were open air movies, broadway show etc. You can try your hand at chess, backgammon etc on tables using equipment free to use; there's a book swap area, a number of concessions for food and drink. Clearly a nice place to be, a number of folk, including families, students with laptops, etc
Nice park. It's a nice park where you can enjoy walking around or have a drink in the outdoor seating. Occasionally they have music, movies, Tai Chi at no cost.
A pocket of serenity in NYC. Love this park - I think one of the prettiest in New York - lovely place to eat, read, relax and just sit and people watch.

History and New School Energy. Great place to have lunch and crackling tourist energy. It can get very very crowded so you have to have that in mind. However its literally a melting pot of all kinds of people. I also found it very charming, airy, where no one was pretentious or too keen to do any other thing other than relax.
BeautifulI. Such a nice park! Lots of tables and chairs, a cafe, a fountain. Would be a great spot to read a book. For us just a nice stroll while in NY, a little greenery!

Nice park. Stumbled upon Bryant Park on the Fourth of July. When they were setting up for a movie night in the park and food Festival. Looked it up online and took their brochures and it seems that there's always something going on here. Maintained very well and nice activities. Would go back there.

What a great little gem of a park. Bryant Park used to be years ago a place to avoid and run past as it was so dangerous for years. It has long been cleaned up and well maintained. I love coming here to read a book or write or just people watch. On a nice day, it is a nice place to just sit by the fountain and talk to a friend. There is a great restaurant in the park and the movies on Monday nights in the summer are a lot of fun.

Quintessential New York Experience. Central Park is more famous, but Bryant Park will give you a more genuine New York experience. Why? Because is such a mix of tourists and locals. Local office workers fill the park at lunchtime; the Southwest Porch and the BP Cafe are an after-work cocktail spot for locals as well. The park has cultural activities ranging from Tai Chi and Yoga in the summers to movies on Mondays nights (FREE! But get there very early, 5ish for a show that starts at 8 PM); free lectures and writing workshops. Lots of informal and formal food options: Belgian waffles or the cafes at SW Porch and BP Grill and Cafe (one is pricier than the other; I get them mixed up). The Porch is great for casual drinks; the food less spectacular. The BP Cafe or Grill on the other end of the park are better food options. But be prepared to pay premium prices. The bar at The BP Cafe is lovely and a bit more formal than SW Porch. But probably a great location to see the Monday PM movies without having to camp out on the lawn for hours! Close to Times Square and Grand Central, sites also worthy of visits. Close to the garment district (a few blocks to the south) where you can find great deals on evening dresses and a not so bad German beer hall (Reichenbach Hall at W. 37th). With a carousel for kids, putting green, ping pong tables and Petanque area. All free except the carousel. An amazing winter market during the holiday season with craft and art shops and great food stands. Best of all: the ice-skating rink. Free if you own your own skates.

What a wonderful park. We had walked quite a distance & came across Bryant Park. We stopped to sit & rest a bit. We noticed a game being played (knubb) as we walked thru the park we came across a section with people playing board games at several tables, a merry go round, table tennis (2 tables) which had a waiting list to play. Many places to sit & just relax. Some individuals were sketching the beautiful buildings surrounding the park. There was also a stage where, I'm sure at times they have music playing. What a lovely place to spend the afternoon, just people watching or enjoying the wonderful weather we experienced while we were there. I wish we had a park just like Bryant Park here where we live. We just stumbled upon this park. We hope more tourists would take a stroll through this wonderful park. We are sure they would love it as we did.

Perfect place to chill out after sightseeing. I absolutely adore BP. It is one of my favorite places in NYC, and I love to just get a coffee and sit in one of the tables around the park to chill and watch people go by. It always offers something new: from movies in the park, to free yoga classes, to topless protests.It is truly New York
chill out time. loved this park lots of seating and a lovely cafe and grill and bar. large screen with free viewing of movies and a rest room.

My favorite place in NYC!. This park is a refuge of peace and calm in NYC. Beautiful garden plantings, flowers, sitting areas, ping pong areas, chess and backgammon tables, gravel walking paths, a carousal, and green space are abundantly found within its confines. We visited during the HBO Bryant Park film festival and watched The Palm Beach Story on its large outdoor screen. Located in Midtown next to the amazing Bryant Park Hotel, this oasis has regular yoga sessions, concerts, workshops, and reading clubs. Check the website for what's scheduled.

Chilling out . This is a great place to chill out and people watching. They actually have ping pong tables in the park. Not that I'm a fan but it passes the time. Also the seem to be filming here all the time.

Unexpected Find. I stumbled across Bryant Park whilst walking along 42nd Street towards 5th Avenue. It's a good escape from the noise of the city, and you get good views of the Chrysler Building and the Empire State Building too.
Favourite Place!. A lovely park with plenty of places to sit and while away the hours. Film festivals in the summer and many places to get food and drink

We LOVE the Bryant Park Grill. This is a favorite of ours. We always visit several times each time we're in NYC.The Grill is terrific for Breakfast Lunch and Dinner - the outdoor area is wonderful when the weather is great - I taught my niece it was okay to have Champagne for brunch (French of course) she still reminds me of that !! The park also has little food venues around it which are great for a quick bite to eat. they old Merry go round is a favourite as well.

Bryant Park a Winter Wonderland. Bryant Park was transformed over the holidays to a wonderful Winter Wonderland with market stalls & ice skating rink. There was something for everyone in the family if your there around the Christmas holidays don't miss this.
Broadway concert. We watched a Broadway concert in the park and it was great! Sunny skies, chairs to sit in or camp out on the ground while watching some great singing and dancing.

New York city of parks & skycrapers. This is nice break place after visiting Times Square or Empire State, also great place for lunch break. We were there after dinner this time and enjoyed as a daytime

Convenient. The bus line that I needed to use on two separate occasions had a stop right in front of Bryant Park that I used to board. The park is a great place to hang out, kids to play, or get a bite to eat in one of the many nearby eateries.

Bryant park. located just outside 42 subway.
surrounded with "Le pain Quotidian" , "Pret a Manger", etc.
Good place to sit down for a summer lunch

Nature, Food And A Carousel In the Middle Of Manhatten. Bryant Park has a long history and was minutes from our hotel. I took every opportunity to walk through the park when going to or coming from downtown Manhattan.There are restaurants and daily activities. The 9 acre park has a carousel, games, chess, ping pong and places to sit and watch the world go by. The carousel would be great for the kids as a pastime. Check the schedule online for activities in the park every day. If you tour on foot it is a great place to relax. The food prices are a little steep at the "Southwest Porch" but it has a well stocked bar and if you want to relax and have a drink or two I recommend a visit.

My fav park in NYC!. This is my favorite Park in NYC. Not that there is a lot to see or do there, but it's just a calming little oasis pretty much next to Times Square, where you can sit, relax, and watch the world go by.A couple of really cute little bakery stalls, which done nice food.

Place to hang out with the locals. I spent a few very enjoyable few hours at Bryant Park sharing some drinks with some native New Yorkers. Bryant Park is adjacent to the New York Public Library. The bar is welcoming and prices are around average. In all, it's a great place to meet people. These days, with an iPhone, you can work almost anywhere. while you have a drink and soak up a few rays.
Free events in the park. Check out free events weekly in Bryant Park - movie nights, Broadway entertainers, special performers, etc.
Great little park in the middle of everything. We walked pass this beautiful little park on a sunny day. It was so cool and relaxing. It is next to a great library as well

People watching!. A beautiful tree lined park behind the New York Library. We used to visit the Southwest porch bar each afternoon after a busy day sightseeing for a couple of drinks! It can be quite busy after 4pm. Its a perfect spot to watch New Yorkers and take in this wonderful city!

One of my favorite ice rinks in nyc . Such a nice place in the summer, perfect for relaxing. During the winter you can find an great ice rink. My favorite place for skating, despite the fact that it can get very crowded some days, specially in the weekend. Well located and close to several subway stations - 42 St Bryant Park Station for the B, D, F and M trains - 5 Av Station for the 7 train - as well as the Time Square 42nd St.

Nothing much to see.. It's literally a small lot with trees and grass, surrounded by chairs and table where tons of corporate people eat (in summer) and tourists roaming around. It's just too crowded that you wouldn't even appreciate walking around.

Magnificent respite in the city. In Bryant Park it is all about the spectacular, huge trees and the 'outdoor library' extension of the NY Public Library. Nice tables, free newspapers and magazines, and lots of coffee/snack options make it a great place to relax, people watch and enjoy life in the city.

Nicest Public Bathroom EVER. I know I'm a freak for writing this but it's true! First of all, go to Bryant Park for ice skating instead of Rockefeller Plaza, no waiting for hours to get on the ice. AND the public restrooms are worth a visit to the park just for that! I'm telling you, go check it out!

Perfect Local Park. This is exactly what a local city park should be.
My sons and I found ourselves stopping by here almost every day of our week-long trip, finding a different way to relax each time, and just hanging out with some NYC locals.
Nice place to hang out and eat some cheap food. This is a very happening place in the day as well as night time. Lots of street vendors with cheap food. Great place to eat and just hang out.

Take the weight off.. A lovely little park where we sat for a long time watching the world go by. We watched a homeless girl drying her clothes on the railings and combing her hair in the reflection of the overhead art works. Very sad to see but enlightening to see someone down and out but still had dignity!
Rest . This is a Nice area to spend an hour or so just chillin or having a drink At The restaurant. Summer time The show movies om a big screen. Nice big lawn in The middle and library on The corner.

A great little oasis in Manhattan. Loved Bryant Park, my only beware is along you the nice open air (expensive) bar and restaurant along the top edge, they have no wash room facilities. You are expected to use the old small stone public toilet building in the park. And on a busy afternoon or night their limited facilities can get stretched with long lines to enter

Bryant Park Near Times Square--an Urban Oasis. Bryant Park, which is behind the NYC Public Library and its beautiful lions, is very relaxing oasis in the heart of the city. It often has concerts, night time movies and skating in the winter. What I like to do most is sit in the Park and admire the fantastic tall buildings surrounding the Park. The architecture is from many periods and styles and makes a great photo souvenir. So, if you are in the neighborhood, stop by for a visit and sit in one of the many park chairs and drink in the view. You won't be disappointed!

Summerstage at Bryant Park. Every Thursday afternoon in the summer, cast members of Broadway shows come to a stage in Bryant Park to do a few numbers from their shows. IT IS ALL FREE!!!! You can sit on the lawn or bring over chairs from around the lawn to sit on. There are plenty of chairs. We went with some out of town guests and even though it was terribly hot, everyone had a wonderful time. The stated hours are 12:30-1:30. If you get there a little before 11:30, you will get a better seat and you will see performers warming up and doing parts of some of the numbers. The actual show ends a little before 1:30. They had some tents from their sponsors and you could go over there before or after the show. They gave out some freebees and there was a contest or two. Also, some of the performers stood around after the show to sign autographs.You can spend the day there - there are books to read, games to play, people to watch. There is an actual restaurant there as well as street vendors nearby selling all sorts of things to eat and drink. What a lovely way to spend the day in the middle of New York City. And, if you are not from the city, walk around to the front of the library and take your picture by the famous lions in front of the library, as millions before you have done. Great to post online.
Christmas wonderland. Only went here (twice) around Christmas. It is set up like a European Christmas marketplace. Nice to walk around and shop and look at all the decorations.

Great place for a picnic!. We purchased lunch at Grand Central Station and took it to Bryant Park. This is a gem of a park with tables and chairs for visitors to sit at. It also has trees around the perimeter which is great on sunny days. After lunch we stayed for Broadway in the Park which is held on Thursday's in the summer.

Bryant. We love just strolling when on holiday and this park is perfect to just sit and grab a lemonade like we did as it was so hot, and table and chairs dotted around to see at, so its was lemonade and cards and shade.
Dont miss out on this gem. What a cracking little park, sit in the sun and people watch, have a coffee, join in one of the free classes, yoga etc or watch some life classic music.
so new york. well, I'm not new Yorker but every time I pass by bryant park I have this feeling that it so new York.

Treasure in the City. Making our way back from the Empire State Building,we happened upon Bryant Park. On this Sunday night they were showing cartoons and a movie. What fun it was to rest our feet, enjoy some downtime in the midst of NYC. Great way for the kids to relax at the end of a day where we walked over 12 miles.

Nice place. I used to watch project runway on tv and they did some fashion shows here in the first season finales. So it was great to be here in person. The day I went there was a film festival and people were chilling on the grass. Its a nice little spot to sit after a long day's walk around NYC.

Wonderful Park. Has everything you want an urban park to have. Food? Yep, both carts and brick and mortar restaurants. In the summer they have lunchtime performances by members of Broadway plays and musicals. Grassy areas to set a blanket or benches and chairs to sit on. It is just a wonderful little oasis in the metropolis. Also, the park is right next to the huge and historic New York Public Library, very much worth visiting.

Favourite Park. This is my favourite park in NYC even compared to Central Park. It's just so pretty. Sitting behind the public library it's a cool, peaceful haven dappled in shade with plenty of seating and several places for refreshment. Planting is very pretty and it's always free from litter.

Shakespeare in the Bryant Park. It´s always a renewed pleasure to walk in the Bryant Park. Last June, for instance, it was very surprising to attend a complete text by Shakespeare by an excellent performer group. The play was: Much ado about nothing, a first class Romantic comedy .

Watching a monday's Movie. Bryant park is a perfect place to relax and have a cup of coffee after walking through Manhattan. During Summer you can watch a movie on monday's. Take your blanket, a Bottle of wine (we were allowed) And Some food and relax. The movie starts depending on sunset (we were there The 11th of july And it starred at 21.00). To have a good spot on the lawn come between 17.00 and 18.30

Nice but crowded. in the summer with the lawn open, it's crowded. in the winter with the skating open, it's crowded. it's great for lunch if you work in the area, but if you're a local try to avoid. if you're visiting, there are much better parks downtown.

I like parks - if you're also visiting the Public Library, check the hours!. I love hanging out in parks. They have a peacefulness about them. I came here partly for the park, but also for the New York Public Library. In this library is the original Winnie the Pooh teddy bear. I hung out in the park for a while, rather peaceful environment. Later on a man came and sat down and just started rambling to me, he said some nice things, but I scurried away, not sure if I should talk to him. I saw the Empire State Building from far away as I passed the library, which, seeing as it was Sunday morning, was closed. Came home for a decent nap. Some people had managed to nap in the park on the grass, but I just couldn’t see how, maybe I’ll acquire it!

My Favourite park that we saw. such a beautiful setting and well treed great atmosphere and views of the skyline Empire state building. Nice view of the Chrysler building from the north of that block. The Library is right there and a carousel and waffles and dings. there was art in the park at the library and people playing chess and games. At night free movies open air.

great chill out spot at night. loved the vibe here with varied (free) entertainment options each night. was the closest park to our hotel and within walking distance to many attractions. had a great grammy award winning Cuban band on 1 night with free salsa dancing lessons - great open air party with food carts, ice cream outlets and good restaurants in the immediate surrounds. felt safe and very new yorkish on a balmy summer night.
so beautiful, and bustling. Lots of people hanging out, eating lunch, enjoying the hot weather in the shade of this park. Jugglers, vendors, fun!
Cool park. Brynt Park is a welcome place to take a break when exploring the city by foot. Nice place for relaxation and known for its open air cinema and many other live music events!

A small but pleasant green space. This small park is next to the New York Public Library and is a good place to take a break from sightseeing. There are plenty of seats, a "Carrousel" for the children, a reading room, places to get food and drink, and restrooms. There are also lots of flowers and shrubs, and very good information boards about the various statues, the history of the Park, and some of the buildings which surround it.

beautiful park lots to do. In November the ice skating was open here this park was only a couple of blocks from my hotel so great to go and look st all the little stalls selling lovely little things purchased some nyc Xmas decorations while here carousel was quaint and there were lots of people enjoying the park top notch

A wonderful European style park. I stop at Bryant Park for a visit almost every time I visit NYC. In the summer the gardens and planting a are beautiful, and you can enjoy lunch and/or a beverage at one of the tables and chairs scattered around. There are ping pong tables and a little library cart with books and magazines. During the holiday season there is a skating rink and small shops selling all sorts of interesting and often unusual items. It is a happening place but also very relaxing.
Winter wonderland. We visited Bryant Park on our pre-christmas holiday. So beautiful with the ice rink and all the little Christmas sale stalls. Would definitely recommend.

Little green haven in the middle of the city. I went to Bryant Park during the day for Shake Shack burgers and also passed through in the evenings. On one evening a film was being shown free to the public on a wide screen and was filled with market stalls of food and drink. On another evening it was very quiet and not somewhere I would walk through alone.

I really enjoy my time here. I went here several times just passing by or looking around but during Christmas i went here with a friend of mine and we just sat on some random chairs and watched people ice skating. it was fun! fun to see those ice skating people and fun to be able to sit down. I dont know, i guess a lot of people were joyful that day and their energy was all over the place. me and my friend were just walking quite a lot and we ended up there to just stretch our legs and relax a bit. i bought some hot choco which is okay and enjoy the view. it was nice but can be crowded but again i was there during a busy week. I would love to come back.

Nice place to take a break. We stopped at Bryant Park on our way across town because my daughter likes to ride the carousel. It is $3 per ride, which isn't cheap, but they have a cat and rabbit to ride, not just horses, so we go. On Monday nights in summer, they show a free movie, and there are board games set out that you can play. It gets crowded at lunchtime but is small enough of a park that it's manageable for a nice break from the heat.

A nice little park. Bryant park is a nice little park to visit and it is right next to the library, there is also an old fashioned carousel for kids to ride. They play movies on certain night which can be a fun thing to do.
Love Bryant Park!. Whether it's yoga in the park in the summer, skating in the winter, or grabbing a coffee any time of the year, this is such a nice space to stop for a break to take it all in!

Relaxing, depending on time of day . Came here at dusk-they were showing films and it was a nice atmosphere. A nice place to chill with friends if you're after a bit of chill time in the middle of the city

surprise. We ended up here a few times during our weeks stay in New York. It is a lovely little park with hundreds of seats and little tables under the shade of beautiful trees. There are lots of kiosks in the park and lots of nearby cafes to buy a coffee, ice cream etc and then you can sit and enjoy. There are books to borrow if you wish, free WIfi ( handy for the euro traveller with dubious phone contracts) and surprisingly lovely clean loos at the NE corner. Its in a handy palce to stop for a rest and The Bank of America Sky scraper contrasts with the older Public Library.

Nice in summer, better in winter!. As nice as it is to sit outside and soak up the sun, I think Bryant Park is even better in the winter. You can ice skate, and for the month before Christmas, there is a fabulous market with all sorts of handmade goods. I bought some ornaments that were made in a women's cooperative in Guatemala with proceeds benefitting the women.

A lively oasis in the middle of Midtown. When I was growing up in NYC no one would go near Bryant Park--it was a place for junkies and drug buys. Today it is a fun, vibrant oasis just behind the main branch of the Public Library.There is always something happening on the center lawn--dance troupes, Broadway show snippets, and in Winter an ice skating rink. But my favorite sections are the tree-lined paths on either side of the main green. The shaded area has lots of tables and chairs at which to grab a bite from the three or four different take out places in the park. There is also a small lending library in the summer where you can select a book, pull up a chair, and read for the rest of the afternoon.They also have a section for chess and other board games, a small carousel, two ping pong tables, and two sit-down restaurants.In the warmer months this is a great place to sit and watch New Yorkers walk by. In the winter they have an outdoor Christmas market and hot apple cider.
This is a delight. We did what the locals seemed to be doing. Grabbed a cheap meal from one of the stands, found a table and settled into a good book. It's worth the visit.

So relaxing on the grass. Its like an oasis in the summer, we had walked all the way from the docks and when we stumbled upon the park it was like heaven to have a break in the shade of the trees, laydown on the grass and have a drink. Really enjoyed it!!! My daughter loved the Merry-go-Round, I think she went on it 5 times haha
Nothing special. Go to central park instead, way much more to do there. This is just a small park with really nothing interesting to see.

Really nice little park. Stopped by here after shopping at Macy's on our way to Grand Central station. There were dancers performing for the crowd on the stage. It has a very relaxed feel and nice to sit for awhile to catch your breath from the hectic pace of the streets.

Great place to spend a few hours outside. Bryant Park is a wonderful place to stay outside in a warm summer weekend. People are entertaining with all kinds of games. The café with outside tables are also wonderful to have a drink or lunch
Excellent. Had a fab day here on Thursday 7th free concert every Thursday at 12.30 this week it was the cast of various musicals from Broadway excellent lovely space to sit

Community-centric!. Small but great layout. In the middle of this bustling city sits this great place to sit and relax. Located directly behind the New York Public Library, this park has a little library set up for children and adults, movie nights, concerts, a carousel and ice skating and shopping during the holiday season. Wonderful shade trees offer some respite from the hot summer.

Interesting. Seen this park "on a pass by" but it looked very family friendly. It had park benches and picnic tables and is in Manhattan. Of course not nearly as big as Central Park, but a nice place to visit and/ or perhaps take your kids.

Quaint, small park. Has white lights surrounding it come dusk. Great place to relax in the afternoon. Surrounded by restaurants and other things to do. Not large and complex like Central Park, just right. Don't tell everyone cause it's perfect the way it is now. Hidden gem.
4th of july. great central location, showed the film Top Gun on the 4th of july, great atmosphere, difficult to get drinks and food due to the number of people :-) but no problem to us

Beautiful park!. Lovely park in a prime location. Everyone should be visiting this park during NYC visits. It is kind of small though. When you are done relaxing in the green, head next door to the New York Public Library!

Oasis in middle of big apple. Cute park, where you can do yoga, latin dancing, drink coffee, eat a waffle and ride on the carousel. Great place to sit and have your packed lunch or met up with a friend for a coffee.

great park but VERY crowded 12-3pm. Nice park, big lawn for a picnic or napping, few things to do for kids - fountain, free board games, old fashioned carousel...however, the place is surrounded by offices so during the lunch time it is PACKED!!!! Everyone leaves the office to have lunch outside so on a nice day it is almost impossible to find a table or a spot on the lawn. I would recommend to visit the park early in the morning.
Best Park in Midtown. For me the best place to rest... Seeing people around with some fresh food to eat...You'll find seats and the best place um December!

wonderful place. Loads of activities going on here specially on a nice day, loads of seating for resting while having a bit of lunch/dinner/snacks. Always packed, shame about the queues for the restrooms.
New york parks. great park in midtown, also excellent eateries nearby!in the hub of everything shops etc, also close to Times Sq for shoes.

Paradise. Bryant Park is one of New York's hidden gems, with its open air library, table tennis, boules and many vendors where you can purchase coffee, food and ice cream, there is also a bar, it is a people watchers paradise, it is one of my favourite places in NYC.

Place to sit and relax . This park is really nice. The restrooms are excellent! For a public park. There was a free band playing music, they have an outdoor bar, an outdoor library, merry-go-round for the kids, different stands to buy food and drinks. This is a good park to sit and take a break from walking all day when I visit NYC

Beautiful park and nice view of Emprie State Building and American Radiator Building. Beautiful park and nice view of Empire State Building and American Radiator Building. Lots of mature trees. There are food trucks and places to eat in and around the park. It is within walking distance of Times Square, the Empire State building, and Grand Central Terminal.

Lots of free tables and chairs. What my husband and i enjoyed here was the fact that there wrre sooo many tables and chairs set up around the park, all for free. Great vibe there at night, with tons of people hanging out and enjoying the summer.
Slice of Heaven. Always worth a nice walk through or short stay in Bryant Park. Lots of simple food choices and wonderful shade under the trees.

Beautiful!. Although I don't feel this is a must see in NYC, I'm glad we accidentally got to visit. We stayed over an hour relaxing under the tall leafy trees. One could spend the whole day there reading a book or just watching the scenery. If you're close, take time to visit and relax for a few minutes. A great change of pace from the busy streets.

Winter Fest. Every year, we go to Manhattan for two nights in December. One of the highlights is visiting the Winter market in Bryant Park. It is never too crowded, the vendors are generally pleasant, good deals and unique items can be found. We normally buy a few holiday gifts and stop for dessert at one of the food booths. Watching the ice skating is always fun. It is like a big outdoor club.

Very nice little park to sit and take a break.. Right behind the public library. Chairs and small table to just sit and relax. It not like Central Park. You are still sitting in the midst of the city noise and smells but it is relaxing all the same.
Little haven. Nice spot of greenery to sit and recharge. Snacks, loos and seating. Apparently winter markets and ice skating here too

Great park right in the middle of the action. A nice little park in a great location with many different options. We walked around on a Saturday and there was a performance on the stage. Great place to read a book, have lunch or just take a break from things in this quiet(ier) setting. You have access to a lot of things from the park - subway, food choices, and of course tons of shopping right down the block. NYC public library is adjacent to the park as well!

Sunday in New York. Bryant Park was the perfect location for a leisurely Sunday morning. Lots of breakfast options, free reading material and strolls in the park. Just a couple of minutes away from Times Square and Broadway
Holiday Market. We were lucky enough to go there during the Holiday Market at Christmas time. In fact, we went several time. Many booths, skating rink, good street food!
So much happening - great for a stroll. Buy a sandwich and spend time in Bryant Park... they have free books you can swap, early morning meditation... great place.
LuigiSLP. a really attractive and well located public park adjacent to public library and great store and restaurants adjacent and stores in proximity

Wonderful little oasis!. Stopped in to rest while exploring the city before heading to the fireworks. It offers food, relaxtion and entertainment. There's an area to play chess and they were preparing for a movie/film night. Not too far from Time's Square but closer to Herald's Square. It's a great place to catch up and determine the next stop on your itinerary.
An Oasis in the City. A little park in the middle of the hustle and bustle. Visit the cafe and enjoy tea in the park or a waffle from one of the booths. Rest a while in the middle of your shopping.

What a great little hidden gem of a park. We brought a picnic lunch and met up with some friends here. Lots of tables and chairs under umbrellas and usually they allow you on the grass but they were preparing for 4rth of July celebrations so had that roped off.

Great for a break and relaxing. Great spot with a view to Empire State Building and The New York Public Library. A place to sit on the lawn relaxing and maybe enjoying a pick-nick. A place to read books in specific reading areas. They have a lot of activities like Summer Film Festival with open-air movies.

An amazing park in the middle of New York. We had lunch in the park on a beautiful May Day
What a great park to relax and enjoy in between the sky scrapers of New York next door to an amazing library
Loved it

Relax and sit. Nice little spot to relax and sit for a while having pounded the pavement all day. Just take some out of your day and catch your breath and recharge the batteries to go again as after all New York is the city that doesn't sleep.

Great park and worth a visit!. Bryant park is an amazing turnaround story. It has become an iconic park right in the heart of Manhattan. Movies play during the evening. Mass yoga sessions. Chess. Ping pong. Merry go round. Coffee shop, bars and restaurants. Amazing place and convenient spot to meet. Enjoy the outdoors!
Clean, beautiful and busy!. Every turn this park offered a beautiful sight. I recommend packing a lunch and umbrella, and stay late one afternoon. Simply gorgeous and great eateries around!

Every season, night or day. in summer choose chess or draughts or even monopoly and in winter the grass is rolled up, the gardens tucked away and it becomes an ice skating rink! Movies screen regularly throughout the week for a wonderful evening experience

Fun, bustling and lots of activities . Stop by for a quick break on a busy day. Grab a quick bite at any of the small food outlets and stands. Play some cool games like Viking games, ping pong , miniature golf and board games

Great Park to relax after walking all over NY. Bryant Park is quite a gem in Manhattan, allowing you to have a cup of coffee and sit down after walking in the area.It has Coffeed (coffee and pastries) and we also have seen some activities for children during the weekend (there was a magician show for kids when we were there).During the summer, they also project some movies on certain weekends.

Movies in the Park!. Just wandered through BP the other day, it was jammed with people lounging on the lawn, playing chess at the tables, eating lunch in the cafes... This park is a great place to chill right in the middle of all the chaos.

Such a lovely place.. We spent some time here when we visited earlier in 2016, and loved the atmosphere of this little square. The little cafes and restaurants around it are so lovely, the ice rink was super busy with lots of excited people and children, free board games and just generally the sort of atmosphere where you feel New Yorkers come here to get a reprieve of the hustle and bustle of New York City. A little haven amongst the sky scrapers.

No better place to dine al fresco in Mid Town. Enjoyed a leisurely lunch in Bryant Park on one of the days I holidayed in NY lately. Obviously, enjoyment of the amenity is weather dependent! But, it is just gorgeous on a dry (and sunny) day. Tons of food options (several cafes onsite), lots of seating, and of course, a huge expanse of lawn to also stretch out on. There's also a ride for small people to enjoy....

Great place to relax. We stopped on here while sightseeing with our 9 month old and 3 year old. Our 3 year old really enjoyed the space in the grass to run around. I enjoyed sitting back with a coffee and taking in all of the surrounding architecture and scenery. During the summer they have movies in the park so be sure to check that schedule.
Lovely little park. Lovely little park near times square to stop for a rest and drink with plenty of chairs available, Nearby Joe and the Juice to buy a take out then relax in the park.

A Respite From Midtown Madness. I love Bryant Park in the winter when the Holiday Fair takes over, the Christmas tree is ensconced at its eastern end the ice-skating rink sets up. On the coldest of evenings the fountains freeze and create magnificent ice sculptures. In the summer, every bench is taken, people relax on the grass and a different ambiance takes over. And always, always, there is the thought that we sit and rest on level after level of tunnels of innumerable books.

Free board games. We had a great afternoon sitting at a a table playing checkers. They had several board games you could play for free. It was a great way to take a break from a busy day. The park is a busy place for locals to come and have lunch. It's fun to sit back and take in the business of the city.

My oasis in a day of walking around midtown Manhattan. I visit my daughters working in midtown Manhattan about twice a year. It's an easy walk to get here from Grand Central Station, and there are plenty of places to grab food and then go find a place to sit down at Bryant Park just to get off your feet and do a lot of people-watching! My favorite place to sit is on the west side of the park, facing the NY Public Library, which is also worth a stop if you have a bit of time. And yes, you can typically find some chess playing if that's your deal. There is often some live music or other activity going on, so check the Bryant Park website in advance. Last time I was there in mid May, it was a picture-perfect weather day which meant the park was loaded with people during mid-day rightfully enjoying the beautiful weather. I then high-tailed it to nearby Lord & Taylor to take advantage of their huge sale - nearby to other good shopping.
Beautiful. We happened upon the park on one of our walks and really enjoyed it. Not as grand as Central Park but worth a visit.
its nice. its a nice heavily policed interesting area of Manhattan. there isn't anything really exciting there unless there is an event but if you are a park person id def recommend it

Nice place to take a break. We didn't find this park to be anything particularly special. There are a few trees and a stretch of grass, which was closed off. It was nice to sit down for a few minutes to take a break from walking.
Fun and relax. After long walks in the city it was fun to sit and relax in Bryant park, many people fun atmosphere.

What a beauty!. We stumbled upon this jewel while walking around the city. The weather was perfect and the scene was beautiful-not crowded, the flowers were gorgeous and it was shady. I could have spent half a day there!

Beautiful. This is definitely not a place to run and play, but it was beautiful. There were several tables and chairs, but I didn't see anyone on the lawn.
