When I think of 'park,' I think of running and playing, maybe a few pets. But I didn't see any of that along my stroll. But it was nice to see greenery and colorful flowers in such a gray city.
Holidaymaker. Everyone enjoys Bryant park not that it's that big .monday nights are film nights enjoy .its good for the whole family

Bryant Park, a little gem of an oasis in the middle of Manhattan. We stumbled across Bryant Park on one of our many walks.The gardens are exquisite, a perfect little,gem of an oasis in the hurly burly of Manhattan.Look out for it.

An Unexpected Gem. I didn't expect this at all. In the middle of sky scrapers, this beautiful green space with live music and great food. A wonderful place to stop in the middle of the day to catch your breath and just enjoy being in New York City!

Beautiful park in a great location. Visit the Library, too!. Bryant Park was just beautiful. The lush green grass and abundance of trees created such a peaceful dome in the hustle-bustle city that is Manhattan. There were plenty of people in the park when we went, but it did not seem that busy or crowded. We easily could have spend hours there and enjoyed the scene, but the public library is right on the park.We visited the library and had a wonderful time. It's definitely a great building to walk through if you're close to Bryant Park. After a long walk through the library, go back to Bryant Park and grab a milkshake, coffee, smoothie or your favorite drink and/or lunch and enjoy more time on the grass, or by the beautiful fountain. I definitely recommend a visit here.
Classic NYC. After Central Park, one of the must-visit parks in New York City. Always something going on, and the grand and historic New York Public Library at one end is also worth a brief visit.

Great place for lunch. I think, that it is one of the busiest parks in the city. I used to walk through this park many times while I was in New York on my business trips. Yesterday, I met with my friend and we fully enjoyed a quick lunch in the park. The park became more groomed and I would say, better.If you plan to visit, check their web side – you’ll find plenty of interesting events – concerts, yoga, thai chi, music, etc.

Where to hang out with out spending money LOL!!!. This is a fantastic place to visit on Saturdays and Sundays . We went on Sat afternoon and came back on Sunday after. Stay on Times Square and it was a nice little walk over to the Park and just so much going on there. An Awesome place to go with children. Cool Merry Go Round, clowns, games and more games, and people to teach tricks.etc. Great food around the park and in the park ... super pastries, too. Just like a small town square not one a couple of blocks from Time Square behind the Library!! Would love to duplicate it in Dallas!
Beautiful!. A great place to sip a cup of coffee and relax for a few minutes. Really cute cafes on the perimeter.
Lovely retreat in Midtown. An unexpected, lovely retreat in Midtown by the public library. Come here during the day for a cup of coffee or at night for an ice cream. Don't miss out on the waffles.
Nice Oasis for Lunch. This is a nice shady area with lots of seating for lunch or drinks. My daughter and I had lunch here after visiting the library. It is peaceful and very pretty.

Nice little park. We didn't stay long, but strolled though. They were getting ready to show a movie at night. Pretty landscaping and portapotty's just outside of the park. If your in the area stop in, but I wouldn't go out of my way to see it.

Small haven in the midst of the tall NYC buildings. Sat down here in Bryant park with work colleagues while we watched a musical performance. Good location to rest your tired feet from walking around NYC
great place to take a rest in nyc. i love this park because it is very peaceful to rest. you can get a jambajuice near by and chill by the chairs.

The other Rockefeller. When Rockefeller is totally jammed with people looking at the tree or ice skating, just go down a couple street and you can do both without getting an arm jabbed into your side when moving. Very family friendly

My toddler's favorite place in NYC. I've always loved Bryant Park, so we stayed nearby for our toddler's first NY trip (I go often for work), and it was the highlight of her trip. She loved riding the carousel (she nearly bankrupted us on $3 carousel rides!), running in the grass, going to story time next door at the NYPL, watching street performers, and chasing pigeons. Most of the city was a little overwhelming for her, so the park was a great chance for her to stretch her legs, relax, and have fun. I can't wait to bring her back near the winter holidays.

Gem in Midtown . I use to go to NY Public Library without thought to the beautiful park behind it. I now appreciate it for the summer outdoor movie series, or even sitting in the outdoor cafe just taking some sun.

Great Park. We met some friends in Bryant Park for drinks and conversation. Unfortunately, you cannot take alcoholic beverages out of a designated area, which was very crowded, so we opted for fruit juices and soda. The park is a great place to people watch, and on a sunny day New Yorkers flock to this patch of green.

Lovely place to sit and get your breath back. Very popular with locals and tourists. Loads of seats and tables to enjoy your lunch at or just sit and get your breath back. Locals seem to love it and there is even entertainment going on at certain times of the day. Group exercise and entertainers. 10 minute walk from Times square. A little wooded park area right in the middle of all that concrete and glass. Right next to the library.

Beauty within a concrete jungle. This park is less than a 15 minute walk from Times Square. Chairs & tables are free & many available, so you can sit in the shade & play with your phone or people-watch. It is a nice place where you can buy a croissant & eat breakfast outside.
Relax. Relax in this park and take in some of NYC. Grab some to go food and eat and chat with friends while chilling in the park. Catch the sunset through the skyscrapers. Good times!

Relax Park!. Relax park at the center of Nyc! A oasis to sit,relax and enjoy the place! You can drink coffee,read a book, or BETTER go with your wife at your honeymoon trip or in a special occasion, and discover this place like we did!
Beautiful park full of life!!. Beautiful park full of life near Macys. Free internet, clean, with lots of choices for street food and coffee.

Lunch is the Park. After leaving Bryant Park Grill, we went across the street to Zeytinz which offers an amazing selection of take out food.The park was packed at lunch since it was a gorgeous day. An amazing amount of tables and especially chairs.
Good place to relax after a walk.. Was walking around and stop there for a play.you need to search for all the events and it is worth a visit and have a coffee there.

My Favorite Park!. This park is just so pretty and has such great scenery. We came here twice on our recent trip to just walk around, sit in the grass and enjoy the city. The carousel is inexpensive and cute (though very small). This is a good park for kids and adults to enjoy.Try going before the afterwork rush to avoid the "happy hour" crowd.

relaxing. it is a refreshing oasis in the centre of new York, buy a sandwich sit in the shade watch the world go buy, at night have a drink at the park bar great atmosphere, lots on book club , chess, film screen.

Fun and lively!. We accidentally came across the park while walking back to our hotel. What a beautiful, fun surprise! We stopped for a bit to listen to the band, grab some coffee, etc. Its so pretty!

Pride Day staging area. We got off at Bryant Park as we thought we would be several blocks away from the parade craziness, but we ended up in the thick of it. The park was surrounded by floats and happy parade-goers, plus several straight couples in wedding attire taking photos with rainbows in the background. Southwest booth right there, and the stage was set up for the summer concert series. The Pride flag team gave an impromptu show that everyone enjoyed. Lots of food options, and the gorgeous grill behind the NY Public Library meant we had to stay for awhile. A lovely oasis.

A change of pace rather than tranquil. Bryant Park is definitely one of the better kept parks in NYC. We really enjoyed meeting friends for lunch there. It can look really crowded upon approach, but it is pretty large, well set out with heaps of tables and chairs everywhere. On a beautiful day just be patient in getting a table (south side - 40 St - in the shade) - same technique as getting a shopping centre car park, just cruise quietly looking for the slightest sign someone is moving! Once there the coffee and brownie at Cofeed is good, and the fresh rolls on the other north side also excellent. Try out the table tennis on the north (42 St) side along with a newspaper from the Reading Room. So much in such a small space - very NY actually.
Great for an evening stroll . Listen to the music, grab a cocktail and enjoy a pleasant evening. Stroll around the park or settle in to people watch. Always a fun evening.
Energy, urban park, crowded...but great people watching. I love neighborhood parks in NYC. People actually use them! Here there was a summer free film being shown and the place was packed even more.

Actually my favorite spot in NYC. There's just something about Bryant Park that is comfortable and relaxing that totally agrees with me. The park itself - green, open, casual - and all it's surroundings - the NY Public Library, Bryant Park Hotel, Bryant Park Grill, tables, chairs, and benches, bounded by 5th and 6th Aves and 40th and 42nd Streets, is an absolute gem. There is a quaint carousel, lots of families there with little ones, old friends playing checkers and chess, and an outdoor cocktail lounge complete with love seat swings to cruise in and watch the world go by. The huge lawn is there to plop blankets on to nap or picnic, big screen outdoor movies are shown in the summer, and there's a great mixture of locals and visitors from all the world over. If you can't chill there and enjoy the environs, something's wrong!
great for summer. In the summer there are a lot of attractions there (like free movies in the garden - check online) and great for drinks with people that work in midtown.

Great Place to Spend A Summer Day! . Bryant Park can be whatever you make it, whether you are looking for a romantic afternoon for two, a day at the bar with your friends, or an afternoon to reflect on life by yourself, Bryant Park is the spot! They have both an outdoor cafe for the Grown & Sexy and a classy indoor restaurant if you want shelter & fine dining away from the elements. There is a beautiful grassy lawn if laying out on a blanket with your loved one is your thing. Bryant Park is conveniently located near Times Square. A great spot for an afternoon first date! ❤️
Lovely. Lovely little spot in the middle of the city, always with different events going on, sure a place to visit !
Great Christmas market. We loved the atmosphere at Bryant Park on our pre-Christmas break. The markets were great, as was the skating. A brilliant place to get you in the festive spirit!

I nice break from the city. We were out in June and we stumbled appone Bryant park trough out the summer they are showing movies. During The day you can sit in the bars or restaurants or just grab a chair from the rake a play a bored game which are available to play .

Beautiful park. This is a must see while visiting the city. It is a smaller park with lots of heart. There is all kinds of activities for families and singles...plays in the park and movie nights too! Great outdoor bar that serves good food and great cocktails.

A quiet oasis in a busy vibrant City!. This park was literally 2 blocks away from our hotel and once you go you will keep going back....there are coffee/breakfast/lunch huts and chairs and benches galore either in the shade or in full sun. There is a children's area with carousel, an adult reading area, ping pong tables and much more. We loved it and it was such a lovely escape at the start or end of each day.Subways are literally a few steps away too!

Nice stop in the madness of New York. Lovely little park in New York. Nice spot to relax and have a drink, something to eat or play chess. Minimum public toilets so you will have to line up (men as well). Public toilets a bit of an issue in NYC

A lunchtime treat. I find Bryant Park more of a New York experience than Central Park for a midweek lunch spot.Loads off office workers with take out sandwiches park on the grass or supplies chairs. There's a free book library, chess, coffee carts, a bar, a few food vendors & heaps of locals.To me an essential NYC lunch spot. Grab some take aways and head for a casual lunch.

A great space in the heart of the city. A great spot to take a time out after walking the city. It sits just behind the New York Public Library and has the Southwest porch in one corner,here you can take an outside table and order a drink and a burger. There is also a Carousel for the kids within the park and loads of seating around a very large lawn if you just want to kickback and watch the world go by.

Inspirational!. After watching the decline of my neighborhood park across the street from my condo I was amazed at what Bryant Park once was and what it is now. It is a true community park that inspires getting to know people in the area. I spoke to vendors, security and people who live/work in the area. They all gave me stories of the changes in the park and how much they love the park and enjoy all of the activities. I hope I can do the same for my park.
Great restful break on a hot NYC day. Beautiful place; very restful and pleasant. Plenty of places to sit and enjoy the scenery. Grass, mature trees and fountains, etc. very pleasing. With a stop in!

beautiful. a small but beautiful place in the middle of the city. not too many things to do with kids. (check events nyc parks) we happened to stumble across juggling lessons which our daughter loved!!

Nice Historical Park. Stopped in to visit the downtown library. Then came out and sat in Bryant Park and was lucky to catch a magic show at what's going on in the court yard. They have very Nice tables that you can purchase food from a food restaurant and sit outside and enjoy people watching.
Quaint Location. This small park in the middle of midtown is a nice breath from pavement and stoplights. Plenty of tables and chairs are available to sit for a break.

Fantastic find just around the corner from our hotel. What a wonderful park! We found it on our first day and there was so much going on - a reading room area, a graduation ceremony, mass crowd bingo for starters! The park is an oasis of calm in the noise city, lots of lovely shade and places to sit for beers, coffee, pastries, and lots of areas set out for games for children and adults alike. The park also hosted live music, dancing lessons, and had a lot of activities advertised for upcoming festivals over the summer. It also backs on to the New York Public Library which is an absolute must to wander around on a hot day!

Great People Watching spot!. We found seats at "The Porch" in Bryant Park, which was amazing. Watched about 300 people on the grass doing Yoga while we had a couple of drinks. It was a short walk from Times Square. Its a beautiful place to relax on a warm day.

Oh, yes. Take a breath.. The outdoor cafe on the 42nd street side of the park, just behind the library, gives you a lovely view down the arched lane of London plane trees. They give you a marvelous sage-colored view of the world.

A green sanctuary in the middle of the city.. This green square occupies most of a block on East 42nd Street in Midtown between Grand Central Station and Times Square where people go to sit in relative quietness. There are variety of food outlets from street food to coffee and bagel dispensers and restaurants. Take a break from the bustle of city life.
Relax and watch the world go by. This is a favourite haunt of ours when visiting New York, relaxing in a busy city, watching the world go by, Bryant Park is the place to go.
In the heart of the city. To me, one of the most enjoyable (and less touristic) spots in NYC. It's a beautiful garden area, a street-performance place, and a nice pleace to eat/drink. Don't miss it.

Nice Park. It is amazing that NYC residents have to come here to lay on the grass and enjoy themselves. I am spoiled to my midwest home. However, with that being said, the park is very nice. You can get a beverage or a meal and just sit and enjoy the beauty of it.

Nice Place to Cop a Squat. Nice park to sit for a few moments after shopping all day in NY. They had plenty of seating and tables to relax. There were a few vendors out there. This a great place if you like to "people watch."
A little treasure. This park not far from Times Square is an oasis in what is a very busy city. Shade in the sunshine, refreshments and lots of seating to just chill.

Great place to chill. Immediately behind the main branch of the New York Library between 6th and 5th Ave, 40th and 42nd St. Pret A Manger has 2 locations across the street for take away food to eat in the park. Very relaxing location for people watching, reading or visiting. Huge lawn surrounded by multiple sidewalks with lots of tables and chairs and trees!

Great NYC location. Bryant Park is great at all times of the year! The shows, restaurants & activities make it a definite go to if you are visiting NYC. The Bryant Park Grill has delicious food & brunch, the skating rink & holiday booths during the winter months are great. In the summer, just relax on the grass, grab a drink or take a yoga session. Very relaxing & convenient location.

Never disappoints. I love this park. In the winter, before Christmas, there is a really neat shopping area set up . During the rest of the year, it is a great place to people-watch. Its location is terrific,too...right next to the NYC Library.
Fun Place Year-round. There is always something going on in Bryant Park, from winter ice skating, to fashion week, to various bazaars--there's always something going on.

Great Park in the middle of midtown. This is a great park to just go to on a sunny day and chill. If you want to get out of your hotel and do pretty much nothing other then people watch. You will find a huge grass area where you can sit or have a pick nick and catch some rays. You can also play ping pong which is free and regulated by Park Staff, which is nice so everyone gets a turn. You can read a book, there is a book stand which provides free books for you to read and you can sit there for hours at a time with absolutely no one bothering you. In front of the park there are vendors where you can get a meal, drink or snack. All in all a great place in the middle of the city.

A magic place right in the heart of Manhattan. This is a small but beautiful park just a short stroll from Times Square.Locals tend to use the park for various activities and visitors love to sit around and sip a coffee and put their feet up to rest.If you need a rest from all the rushing around this is the place to go.

Great stop in all the concrete for a beer or coffee.. Great place to sit and soak it all in as you cover NYC's long list of things to do. The city has many green spaces beyond Central Park for people to relax, have lunch, etc. This was a great stop along the way....

Relax in the heart of midtown. Bryant Park is an amazing Park right in the heart of midtown Manhattan. Located on 42nd Street, there's the NY Public Library on one end, a great cafe in the park, a carousel, ping pong tables, a reading area, tons of grass in the summer to hang out on and a couple of small coffee bars. During the summer movies are shown on a huge screen once a week, and there are classes on the lawn in the morning. Occasionally there are dance classes taught after work, and mustical groups that perform. In the winter the Park is transformed into an amazing ice skating rink! It's a fabulous place to visit - lots of seating and tables...just come and hang out!! I walk through the Park everyday and it always brings a smile to my face.
Like being in europe. With lush flowers, shaded walks and places to sit,eat and play, Byrant Park is a delightful midtown New York spot to visit.
Love movie night. Great place to walk by...sit in ...or eat next to...all options are available...and so beautiful. Hard to imagine you are in the middle of NYC when sitting in this grass

Great time to rest and feel the power of sunny days. Wowww.. I went to this park and definitely it got my heart... I loooved lay down there and relax... if you have time on summer go there.. there are some events for free that might be interesting!!! Good vibes :)

Beautiful park to watch the locals relax. What a beautiful park in the middle of the city. Walking from our Times Square hotel to various sites in the city we passed Bryant Park several times. It was a perfect place to stop, relax and watch the locals enjoying their daily breaks. Many were relaxing and picnicking out on the grass. The fountain is lovely and we were lucky enough to catch a small band playing one day. There are several beautiful buildings surrounding the park and it just looked like a place you would visit regularly if you worked in this part of Manhattan.

Love This Park!. Loved the free yoga in Bryant Park. I was cranky because of traffic on the way to the park, but got my zen back after the yoga experience there! Also enjoyed the outdoor reading room, ping pong and bocci ball. Such a pleasant place to hang out!

Awesome park! . Love, love this park! Been here before, and there's food and every Friday night this summer there's free play or entertainment. There was a Shakespeare play happening at this time. Chairs all set up and free! Very cool! Just a cool place to visit.

Nice place to sit relax and even play games. Visited during summer - its nice green block - with scenic gardens, surrounded by stellar buildings and greek styled NY public library.Tips:there is provision lot of board games - like chess, checkers and its absolutely free.Every summer - you may even enroll for chess contest if local.Monday nights are open movie nights**tickets applyNice coffee cafes nearby - Blue Bottle coffee etc

Nice bit of green in a busy area. A pretty, but relatively small city center park. There is a small carousel and a number of eating establishments surrounding a green lawn. They had the grass roped off to keep people from getting on it while i was there. There were also a lot of areas with trash collection (and piled up trash bags) along the outer edges of the park that you had to go past to get there which wasn't too appealing. Central Park is not too far away and I'd definitely recommend going there as an alternative.

Best Park of the city!. This summer take the time to listen to a musical or watch a movie, you will not regret, or just simply stay there and relax by watching the empire state with all his lights and colors.

Bryan Park is located behind the NY Public Library. This park has a big grassy area and lots of benches or tables surrounding the green. There are eating places, an outdoor library and ping pong available in the summer. Concerts and movies are occasionally available. The restroom by the librarry is clean and small.

Great spot to stop and enjoy in the City. Bryant Park is pretty awesome. It is located right behind the New York Public Library. There is a children's carousel and a reading corner for kids. It also has ping pong and chess table for those that like to play. There are tables and chairs throughout the park for people to sit and enjoy the area, whether they are eating lunch, reading a book or people watching. During the early morning hours there are fitness classes. Fridays during the summer you can usually bring a blanket and watch a movie while sitting and relaxing on the lawn. During the winter months it turns into a winter wonderland with an ice skating rink, Christmas tree and shops to purchase gifts for your loved ones in. The park also usually hold fashion shows and special events. It is definitely a great place to come, stop, and take a break from all the hustle and bustle of the city.

Public Park . Excellent park to go . It's a small park but with a lot things to do. Summer movies , dance an language to learn. And you can sit just to rest . It's located close to the New York Library . Food and bathrooms available.

Great place to take a break from the crowds, walking or other stressful events.. WE actually stopped 2 times in Bryant Park as it seemed to be convenient both days we were walking NYC. The park seemed very peaceful in the early evening before they close part of it, we really enjoyed the view of Empire State Building from the park. Bryant Park was a great place for a short break from the rigors of walking the city

Lots events going on . I like Bryant park. This is a nice place to walk round and just chill or to watch the world go by. Plenty of seats if you fancy grabbing something to eat nearby and bringing it into the park. The toilets in the park are spotlessly clean with fresh flowers in and always attended. They have a big screen and on one evening I visited they had a film night that was free for everyone. Few eating stands and restaurants here also so caters for all needs.

Fabulous around Christmas. We really enjoyed all the outdoor shopping and kiosks a few weeks before Christmas. The skating rink brings a nice feeling to the square as do all the Christmas decorations and music. Magical place.

Great neighborhood size park!. Love this park! Great food options available, tons of cafe tables & chairs, lovely landscaping. Just go...enjoy the people and wonderful atmosphere. Play, chat, eat or read a book. This is just a delightful park.
Nice place to visit in the busy City. It is nice place to relax and get some food , talk to the people after the long and hard day for the tourists .

Have lunch here. On our only wet morning in NY this park was a quiet little park. However, at lunch-time it came alive! There are chairs and tables, table tennis tables, a reading area and a brilliant atmosphere. It's definitely worth a visit.
Always very popular. This is a lovely little park. Lots of activities going on and areas to play games like petanque. Nice cafes. Loads of seating. Good place to people watch.

Quiet haven. A little bit of peace and greenery in a bustling part of the city. Reading materials are available to borrow for certain hours through the day. Plenty of tables and chairs under lovely leafy trees and near to the public library. Films shown once a week through summer. One to keep in mind if you're staying nearby, especially with children.
Peace on Earth!!!. Solace in the middle of NYC!!! We had lunch at The Southwest Porch!!! Food and drinks fabulous!! Relax and enjoy the day go by !!!

Better at Christmas!. So, not much was going on here last week but I love coming here at Christmas so we can ice skate and drink hot chocolate! The tiny carousel is also great for the kiddos to ride. The have occasional pop up markets where you can find nice original pieces of artwork, clothing, and artisan foods.

Wonderful . One of our favourite spots in Manhattan. We discovered this lovely park early on in our 5 day stay, and returned several times. On our last day in New York, we sat in the park for about 2 hours over lunch, which we had bought from a fab deli on Downtown Broadway. It was a brilliant experience, just chilling in the sunshine, watching people coming and going. New Yorkers are so lucky to have all these gorgeous parks.
Brunch. Went here for Saturday morning hang out and brunch. Place is very active and quite unique for a park.
Great for chilling early evening . A quaint little park which is right in the middle of the city. Open air cinema on Monday nights. Must visit but carry insect repellent for the mosquitos.

Lovely on a sunny day. Beautiful park on a sunny day and a great location to chill out on the grass in the sunshine. It's quite a busy park but there's plenty of space and chairs all around the edge of you prefer not to sit on the grass. Very close to the library and shops too!

We also ice skate here . I love Bryant Park! If I come during the winter, I will make sure to ice skating here. There is a bit less people than in Central Park or Rockefeller Center and it is amazing!
Beautiful park. This is a great park for a picnic lunch, to people watch and to just relax. There are lots of tables and even bathrooms. Great place to take a break from the city streets.

Oasis of calm. After a long day walking, it was lovely to sit in the sun, relax, watch the world go by. A well used park, surrounded by skyscrapers of all shapes and sizes. An oasis of calm a few hundred yards from Grand Central station. Lovely!!
A park. Another nice place to just relax in, i pass this park many times on my way to our office ad 39th street.
Family friendly. Nice place to relax. Great for families and to people watch. Grab a hotdog and have a seat.Crowded but not as bad as some areas in NYC.
Nice park, great movie. We visited during one of the free, open to the public, big screen movie showings in the park. Great atmosphere and beautiful surroundings!

Nice rest stop. On our way to Grand Central Terminal, we stopped here to take a break. What a beautiful day in a lovely and serene park. Many locals about, playing chess, drinking coffee, having lunch and children running about. A little bird stopped by to say Hello to me. What a treat. If I had a bit more time, I would loved to ride the carousel.
Nice /fun park. Where the locals go - a nice clean fun park. This is a must see during lunch - the locals are here is droves

A busy park. Located in Midtown Manhattan, Bryant Park provides a nice respite from all of the madness on the streets. However, the park itself has its own high level of activity, so don't expect tranquility here. There are lots of benches to sit, little walkways to meander and many people to watch as you stroll or sit in the park.

What an amazing space in the city!. There are not enough words to describe this place. its a public park but it is so much more. it is a meeting place and eating place its a relaxing place and it even has power points to charge your phone/laptop and free wifi. Lots of people meet here in the evening and there are lots of free events...

relax. on all our trips up and down the city we always stop off at Bryant Park to relax,have something to eat and read some of the free papers,magazines available at the kiosk. A great place to people watch!

a lot of people watching a dancing show. There were a couple of groups with young dancers and they gave a performance this evening. Some of what they showed was new to show.It was nice to have a seating in a complete atmosphere from New York traffic.

Stop for a Rest. A visit to Bryant park for a New York hotdog can be accomplishedby anyone visiting the Big Apple. Lots to see including people watching, boca ball, table tennis and more. A small park with lots of tables and benches on which to takea break.

Worth a visit if near this area. While staying in NYC for a week my family and I came by hear and relaxed for about an hour. It was a nice way to get away from the loudness of the city and there are attractions for the kids (i.e. running space and a merry-go-round).While I liked coming here I would not pick this park over Central Park by any means. But if you have the time and will be close to this area, then I think anyone will have a nice experience visiting.Also, the Public Library is right behind the park and is easy to see and get in if in the park.
Great NYC landmark. This is great for everyone families singles couples. It is not big like Central Park, but quaint. It was a very nice park to visit
Winter Fun. I particularly like the Christmas Market. Lots of fun little shops that are lovely to stroll through. Always gets me in the spirit!

The Best. Awesome location in the center of midtown. Winter Market is great. In summer it turns out to be a wonderful lunch spot- just bring some food and enjoy with hundreds! Ping pong, chilled beer and the sun👍🏻

Absolutely beautiful!. Beautiful park with extremely well kept grounds. Plenty of chairs around the grass even at busy times. Peaceful place to put your feet up from walking around the city. Vendors on site and a restaurant as well.

Pretty area of calm. This park is lovely and a welcome escape from the madness of NYC and the constant cars and horns. You can sit under the trees, tables and chairs are abundant and just watch life go by

Great place. I visited Bryant Park several times during my recent stay in Manhattan as it was a block from my hotel. What a beautiful, shady spot! Fairly quiet for such a busy part of the city. Plenty of places to sit. Even has a kiosk where you can purchase gourmet waffles. Very near the New York Public Library.

Tranquility is a sea of busy! . My mother and I came across the Park by accident whilst looking for Grand Central and were pleasantly surprised. This gorgeous park offers a free space to sit, enjoy your surroundings and escape the fast pace of New York. We thought it was lovely that the Park offers free classes (in knitting, languages etc) as well as a little reading area with books to borrow during your time in the Park. We were disappointed that we could not fit the open air film screenings being hosted into our schedule as we are sure they would have been wonderful in the Summer evenings. The park has great views of the surrounding buildings including the Empire State.

Love this place. A little gem of a place! First found the park during New York fashion week. Amazing experience to sit here with a coffee watching the great and the good walk by. An oasis in a busy city. One of my most favourite places!

What a Lovely Place. This park reminded me of Jardin du Luxembourg in Paris - such a nice, peaceful respite from the frenetic pace of NYC. Great place to grab a sandwich under the trees in Summer, and they have ice skating in Winter!

Nice park. In the spring and summer it is a great plae to stroll around and hang out if you have nothing to do. There are plenty of chairs, chess games, ping pong and some other stuff to keep you busy.That said it is hardly a can't miss place in NYC, but rather an ok place to kill some time.In the winter they have ice skating

Great spot for summer lounging. Tired of naked ladies in Times Square? Walk one block east and return to real NYC in this little gem of a park. Bistro chairs and tables invite you to sit and people watch, read or just chill. Pretty flower beds, operating carousel and food kiosks provide something for everyone.
Best to Chill and watch a free movie outdoors!. Great just a bunch of people enjoying the sun and free film plenty of grass but also benches to take a load off! Free water being passed out great day

Beautiful place to relax, collect your thoughts in peace, and people watch. Brought my mother here. We sipped fresh juice from a nearby juice cart and took a break from sightseeing. One of best parks in Manhattan, it's beautifully laid out with a lush green field and ample seating along its north and south borders. It's centrally located in midtown, next to the New York Public Library, cafes/bakeries/restaurants, shopping, subways. The grounds are clean and well-maintained. There is a quaint small carousel. There's a cute coffee cart called Coffeed. Great place to meet up with friends, check email, people watch, read a book, meditate, take a break. And they show classic movies during the summer months on the green field.

GREAT PARK. As a former New Yorker, I am constantly amazed at the amazing rehabilitation of Bryant Park - into a venue of activities - ranging from square dancing and film evenings to fashion week. There are many free activities - and it is so conveniently located at the 42nd Street Subway station. Take a sandwich and sit there at lunch time and people watch. There are books and newspapers to read. There's a lovely restaurant and nice snack bars too.

I love this park. This park is in a great location just behind the NY public Library one of the most beautiful public libraries in NYC and just across the street from Union Station. There are several dining options and plenty of seating options,the atmosphere is fabulous. This is a great place to meet a friend and have a drink or people watch. We happened to stop by on our way back to our hotel and they actually had the annual musical chairs competition going on! Great place to meet people! This is one of my favorite parks on the city and I believe it is often overlooked. It's absolutely a gem!!

Christmas Market - great!. If you are in New York around Christmas, then this is a great place to go early evening. Nice food (small bit), hand crafts, ice skating, Christmas tree. Really nice atmosphere.

You feel like a New Yorker here. I'm a New Yorker and I feel like I can skip the tourist (nothing wrong with tourist, thank you for coming to NYC) but this is a perfect place to have an after work , stroll, date or a cocktails without people bumping into you
Gorgeous Retreat. Bryant Park is a beautiful place to unwind and take a break from the hectic city atmosphere. Cafes were not open when we visited but menus looked impressive.

Nice green space in city centre. A nice basic park with a tree lined perimeter and good flower planting. Food kiosks aplenty. A place to relax, have a drink or bite yet still be in centre of Manhattan

The best 'back garden' in New York. This is a lovely place to spend time during the day. It fits a huge amount into its tiny are- a smallKids carousel, mini golf, boules, board games and a low key reading corner, as well as amazing toilets (yes really worth a visit).Plenty of places to get a drink or a bite to eat too.I'd recommend a hotel nearby if you are in NYC, this became our go-to place after a busy morning or afternoon of tourist sites.

Regular walk throughs and people watching. Love this place. One of the gems of NYC all day long. Get to know its history as it gives it an edge. Have seen this place in winter and thought it great then with ice rink, but now in summer it is so much more!

Pretty little park. Bryant park is a beautiful little oasis in the middle of Manhattan, it has little food kiosks around for a quick bite to eat and drink, and has a very relaxed feel amongst the busyness of the city, the grass lawn is surrounded with table and chairs for you to sit at. Situated next to the New York public library it has a very good view of the Empire State Building.
just sit and rest awhile. A lovely area to just sit and take stock, have a coffee or a bite to eat, close to the Rockerfeller centre and St Patricks Cathedral.

In love with this park. . What a nice little piece of nature in the city. We were staying a few blocks away from Bryant Park we walked there several times in the morning and the afternoon during our NYC stay. The coffee stand has wonderful coffee and pastries. We enjoyed this park very much.

Yoga in the park. I was able to experience Yoga in Bryant park. It was a beautiful site to see 800+ people doing yoga at the same time on a beautiful day. They also offered Bingo in the park which I wasn't aware of until after yoga.
Great Park. Good walking paths and plenty of things to see. This is where you can get the ferry to the Statue of Liberty, go early it gets packed.
Peace and Greeery in the city. Wonderful! Wonderful! Wonderful! Lovely choices for eating in the park. Beautiful large cafe. Very unique park. Can visit the NY library nar by. Washrooms are pristine.
A lovely little park. You can have a stroll or sit and relax and have a snack. In the winter they have a skating rink and an outdoor Christmas market.
An oasis of calm. Time to settle your nerves after Times Square and 5th avenue, this is the place for you. Plenty of seating in shade if you need it, lovely gardens and flower displays.
Delightful place to share drinks with friends or rest with children.. Some very nice restaurant/bars along the park. A great way to end a day in NYC. Something for everyone.

I miss it already!. What a beautiful park with public seating for everyone.It has also a reading space with books to read and many activities every day.Take your coffee and go relax at this beautiful place.

Special place in the heart of the city!. Really relaxing island in a sea of madness. The park is a little haven of peace and quiet to just sit and watch the world go by or listen to the splash of the fountain whilst sipping on your morning coffee. I've been here to the ice rink and the Christmas tree and shops in the winter and the sun on the lawn in summer and I don't know which I prefer more. Well worth checking it out.
What a pretty place to sit and watch the world go by.. The title says it all really. It's a Gorgeous little park right in the centre of bustling New York but it's so laid back and chilled out.

Beautiful Oasis Downtown-ish. Our company has a NY office in a building that looks down onto Bryant park so I got to experience it from above and within. A great oasis on the West Side - a good respite from the fast city pace.
people watch. live music, iconic NYC park chairs... another bucket list thing crossed off for me! little details everywhere.

A bright spot. We spent several mornings having a take away breakfast here!
It is a gem of a spot for NYC. Located next to the Public Library, it is easy to find.

Lovely Outdoor Venue. Modern dance exhibit was available the day we went - not skilled but certainly enthusiastic. Excellent June weather for NY City. Same venue provides ice skating in the Winter. Must see.

Great little park and relaxing. Close to Times Square and relaxing amongst all the hustle and bustle. Restaurant overlooking the park had a private function to night we wanted to go. During the summer has free film nights

Amazing!!!. What an awesome place literally in the middle of the city. Did Yoga in the Park with BIbi Mcgill & it was an amazing experience. Great place to stop & breath realizing where you are. Carrousel was pretty cool too! A must stop if your in the area!!!

Leafy Haven. This small park area is a nice haven away from the hustle and bustle of New York's fast pace of life.
It has seating and a grass area for picnickers, along with surrounding food stalls and restaurants.
This area is very appealing, either by day or night.
Beautiful Midtown Spot. A great midtown spot with Christmas shopping and skating rink in the winter and summer drop-in spot with movies in the summer.
Dance. One of those garden escapes in NYC that is very comfortable. With kiosks to purchase drinks etc., one could sit and watch a large group learn dance routines. Quite lovely.
Peace in the middle of the city. Great place to chill and enjoy some silence in midtown. Calm spot to have lunch, nice coffee place and next to Library

An Urban Oasis. During the Bloomberg's tenure as mayor, his administration made it a priority to renovate all of Manhattan's parks. None is more beautiful than Bryant Park. Here, in the middle of Manhattan's most bustling streets and avenues, is a quiet place to sit, snack, watch the world go by, or just that a snooze in the shade. Food kiosks abound on the periphery and,at one end, there's an outdoor cafe in warmer months. A magnificent fountain takes pride of place in the park's center.

A lovely park. We visited Bryant Park on a really hot day after stocking up with goodies at Grand Central Market. I think most a lot of New Yorkers also had the same idea as us as the Park was really busy. It was a lovely spot to sit and have lunch and to people watch. What we also found charming was the piano in the park being played by Bertha Hope.
relaxing place to eat. great place to eat whilst you are on the move. plenty of places around the park to get food and drinks.

One of our favorite places to people watch. Bryant Park was just around the corner from our hotel and we stopped there several times after walking around the city. There are food and drink vendors around the park. There is a carousel for the kids. You can borrow board games and chess sets and sit for hours. At one point there was a "performing art" type of entertainment where 50 people stood and waited for anyone to jump up on a "dance captain wanted" small stage and dance and the others would do what they did. Hard to explain but very entertaining. If you are in the area, make a point to explore this park.
Cool place to rest while walking in the city.. A nice oasis of trees and places to sit while walking in this area. People watching will fill you with what the world is made of. Get use to it.

Lovely place to sit and watch the world go by. Great place to sit down during all the walking around you do in New York.Just sit and people watch or grab a spot of lunch before resuming your site seeing.
Beautiful!. One of the nicest spots of Manhattan. Summee or winter a great green space to enjoy. Located close to Times Square is a park not to be missed.

Park Scene. It was a beautiful day to be had by all. I had lunch and did some people sightseeing. My chair was a little rocky so I thought my butt was going to meet the gravel. They had a nice resteraunts in the park. I did eat at one but I forgot the name of it. (I must do better!)

Relaxing aftertoon at Bryant Park. A perfect location right next door to the NY Public Library. A beautiful park with plenty of seating, activities, eating options and a carousel that plays french music....ahh, very relaxing.

I love this place . Bryant park is an obligatory visit in NYC . Is just a park but is beautiful,
You can enjoy just looking people singing and playing while you drink a good juice or cup of coffee.
It is a great place!!

Small and Beautiful. Beautiful little park where people sit and read under the trees and listen to free concerts. Nice restaurant at the end of the park and manicured lawn and beautiful flowers all around.

Fun Time. We visited this great small park in the winter. Ice skating was more enjoyable at this small park than Rockefeller Center. Enjoyed all the little stands they had to buy food, drinks, and souvenirs. Very enjoyable
Fun!. Nice little beer garden, among other attractions all outdoors and open year round. The southwest beer deck does sell a limited variety of food, too.

The Highlight of Midtown Manhattan!. Truly my Favorite, Go-To, Hot Spot! So much Fun, there's always something to see and do at Bryant Park. The next time you, your friends and family are spending a day in Midtown, please trek over to Bryant Park! Awesome.

Lovely small park. It is lovely small park in a crowded happening district. The park attracts it's own set of crowds on different part of the day. The mornings are generally for the fitness freaks. The lunchtime is for office goers opening their lunch pack or grabbing something from the kiosks around. The public library is just across. In summer this place seems to be an oasis in a concrete jungle. How it looks in the winter is beyond my comprehension.
Great little park!. This little park is the best! They have entertainment some nights, and there are plenty of food options around and lots of seats, too. You should go!!!
Nice outdoor Area. Nice place to meet friends. Many eating places & shopping nearby. Subway stop is near so it is easy to access. You can take your lunch & find a place to eat & people watch.

Great Break Spot. After alot of walking we targeted Bryant Park as a place to slow down and take a break. We were not disappointed. The park and its games provided some easy entertainment. Also, a great stop for a reasonably clean restroom in the midst of the city without having to buy anything!
Open air fun. Relaxation in lovely park area often with evening entertainment, great refreshments and lots of seating

Such a fun time!. I chose to go here over the Rockefeller for skating, mainly due to price and location, but I was definitely not let down! The Bryant Park Bank of America Winter Village is incredible! (So is Bryant Park in general!)

Wonderful park. We loved this quaint park right behind the public library. Great place to bring a lunch and relax. The have movies on Monday night's in the summer that I think would be really cool to go to.

Beautiful little park. We stumbled across Bryant Park on our last day. It is a beautiful little place with cafes and open green space. They were busy setting up for some outdoor movie viewing that evening. I wish we'd found this little gem earlier in our holiday
Lovely Park. We discovered this park when we were visiting the city in September and it was a great park to go straight to in the morning and get breakfast in the form of waffles.

Loved it.. We often stopped here on our way out in the mornings and again on our way back to our hotel. There's always something happening here, from dancing classes to board games, restaurants and people just catching up.

Exquisite picnic park. This side of Paris, I cannot think of a more sublime place for an urban picnic than Bryant. Leafy trees, ample Parisian-style chairs and tables, or plenty of soft green grass for those inclined to recline. Around dusk you may well find live music, and there are many and varied food vendors all around the edges to provide your al fresco dining experience. This is a grand summer experience for locals and tourists alike. Joe-Bob sez: check it out.
Great space . One of my favourite things about New York is the amount of public spaces. Bryant Park is a great space, grab a cold drink from one of the vendors and enjoy

Oasis in the middle of Manhattan. If there is an arts and crafts fair there that is an added bonus. This is a great place to sit and have a coffee or snack and enjoy the people going by. Or just gaze at the marvelous architectural wonders encompassing the park. We love just sitting here and relaxing. You are still in the heart of Times Square and also a short walk from Grand Central Station.
Brief stopover on the way to Grand central. We had a coffee in this charming little park hidden behind New York public library. Relaxing little break on the way to Grand Central.

Visit to NYC. My wife and I were dropped off at Bryant Park by the airport transportation. The park is surrounded by shops and apartment buildings and is an oasis worth a visit. Just being able to walk barefoot in the grass is a nice change of pace from walking around all day.

Lazy lunch in Bryant Park. Lovely small park next to the library in Manhattan. Plenty of table and chairs for your use, popular location for local office workers at lunchtime. Cafes and bars surround the park. There is a miniature carousel in the park as well which adds to the ambience.

What a gem!. We stumbled across this place on our way to somewhere else. What a little treasure. It was hard to choose what we like to bass. The piano bar was awesome. The carousel at school. The game area was really amazing. I think I'll go back.

Cute Park. It's a nice park with many activities. It can get pretty busy in the summer time especially with movie screenings and other activities that are planned. Great place to sit down for 30 minutes and relax after work or after walking around to see all of the sites.

Love this park. Visited Bryant Park a couple of times while in the city.
Plenty of chairs to sit on and take in the atmosphere or people watch. Plenty of little things going on and people relaxing in the grass.
Couple of places to get a drink or snack. Beautiful surroundings and a pleasure to go visit.

Improv Everywhere stages events here. Amazing how big this park is with everything from fountains, eateries, the NY Public Library, movies at night, grass to cool off and lie down in and all kinds of entertainment.

Relax in the City. Came upon this park by chance on a sunny day, it was filled with locals taking time out and relaxing. We sat down on the grass and watched the world go by for a nice peaceful rest from walking. Hard to believe you are in the middle of the city, stalls all around selling drinks and food, sunshine and grass to sit on - great place.

Oasis. Lovely area. Salsa dancing,plays,lots of different entertainment.Whem we visited it had turned a little chilly so the resturant owner brought over a jacket and hoody for us to put on.Nothing was to much trouble. Food was excellent and a lovely atmostphere.

Nice place. Didn't plan on going to this park, we were on our way to Grand Central station and just want to have a sit and rest a little. Very beautiful park with tons of chairs to sit on. Good to go with friends (they have some ball games provided), also good to go as a couple.

Tranquil spot. This is a lovely privately owned park next to the New York Public Library. The planting is excellent with shaded areas and large grassed areas to sit and chill out. Nice tranquil spot in a busy, noisy city. Very relaxing.

Another amazing NYC park!. New York has the best parks and this one is definitely one of them! We didn't spend as much time here as we would've liked but even in our short visit we fell in love with it. Huge green space with people doing various things: picnics, yoga, reading, playing with kids, etc... There's a great little coffee shop in the park too, along with some fancy restaurants. It's a beautiful view as the park is located at the foot of the NY Public Library which is a great looking building. They have public washrooms and while I was dreading the need to go in there, I must say that it was by far the cleanest nicest public washroom I've probably ever used. They have a carousel My favourite thing about this park though is that they have an area where you can borrow books to read while in the park, with seating areas that are designated as quiet for those looking to enjoy their book. And similarly on the other side of the park, you can borrow boardgames to play. They even have an "art cart" where you can use art supplies to let your creative juices run. I've never seem such things at any park and I think it's simply amazing!

Very surprising find. Wanted to visit and was pleasantly surprised. Small oasis in a bustling city. We started to watch Shakespeare but were defeated by the rain, the actors did well to keep going as long as they did. Some cute places to eat around.
Beautiful park. All the parks in New York are magnificent. Tables and chairs, some like Bryant Park have table games like chess etc.

Taking a break. I discovered this Park while walking from my Hotel on 38th st. via 42st one early afternoon and decided to have a relaxing moment there. It was quite pleasing to me and a nice place to sit if you ahve been walking for a while.
A lovely afternoon playing Scrabble!. Bryant Park offers visitors a chance to play so board games free of charge, and I must admit, this was exactly what we needed to unwind! :-)

An Oasis of Calm in a fabulous location. don't forget to check out Bryant Park, an oasis of calm just off this busy central location. At lunch times there are concerts sometimes and otherwise just sit on the benches or enjoy a coffee/lunch in this great location. Take time out to look at the Public Library and the reading room.

Relaxing. Bryant Park is a great place to sit, relax, and people watch. There is not much to see, but we paired it with a tour of the library which was fantastic. There is a carousel for the younger set and lots of chairs and tables to simply enjoy the moment or perhaps even read a book!

Walked through and was nice to see trees amongst all the concrete. . Was in our path to get from point a to point b. Was nice to have trees and grass. Was crowded and well kept for the amount of people. Not really a sightseeing place, but a nice change to all the concrete.

Find a warm night and sit and relax. It is an oasis in the midst of the city craziness. Nothing better than slipping in for to appreciate some green amongst crowed streets and tall buildings. Nice place to slip out of the madness and appreciate the city that you are in.
A Hidden Gem.. Lovely little park; a virtual oasis in the heart of a busy frantic city. Wonderful place to sit and relax.

Great lunch spot and people viewing. The park has free wifi and the library is across the street. There are food venders all over and plenty of other eating options. During the warm months you might find a street fair or a farmers market happening

One of my FAVORITE places in NYC!. You can't help but come back to such a lively and yet relaxing place. So green and peaceful but full of life! Of an evening the inner green is dotted with friends, couples and families stretched out or enjoying the open sky. The outer rectangle consists of a series of shaded paths overhung with greenery with tables and chairs placed through out. Amongst the paths you will find a variety of entertainment and food options: a reading room, waffles & dinges, a sandwich shop, live entertainment encouraging audience participation, a bar and restaurant, a fairy tale miniature carousel that steps parents into the past while the kids love to ride, 2 restaurants: the Bryant Park Grill and the BP Grill. The first is excellent especially if you can wait for an outside table. The latter is loud and overblown but a possibility if you forgot to bring your picnic. The public library is also historically interesting and can be visited as well. The atmosphere is pleasant and friendly, welcoming to all so if you have some free time come on out!During the year, the private management of the park works to bring in seasonal activities and entertainment such as movies or Shakespeare in the Summer and ice skating in the winter.You don't want to miss Bryant Park - see you there!
Great place to take a break. This was on the way to Times Square and we stopped here several times just to relax and watch the folks playing table tennis, and activities in the park.

Lovely location to stop.. This is ideal to stop for a drink or food and watch the world go by. Options to buy from catering on site, or great deli close by. Table Time. There was yoga in morning we visited.
Beautiful view and building.. Loved the view of New York City from the upper deck! The building was beautiful! View is definitely better on a clear day to get the best view of the city!

Too beautiful for words. Just sit at a green wrought iron table with chair and sip on an iced coffee from Pret a Manger nearby - look up at the awesome architecture of surrounding buildings or around at all the lovely people. Watch the end of a group dancing experience or visit on an evening when free Tai Chi is offered. Bryant Park is a place too beautiful for words- breathe deep and take more than a New York minute to enjoy!

Fantastic Green Space in the Heart of the City. We visited Bryant Square almost every day as it was on our doorstep. During the day this space is full of various activities, my sister had a free Italian lesson one day! Office workers eat their sandwiches here in the well appointed eating areas near the fountain. There are a couple of restaurants that serve lovely evening meals and you can sit outside and enjoy a drink! Loved this square!

Nice bolthole. This isn't an attraction as such, just a lovely refuge from the madness, directly behind the NYC Library. Lots of nice bars and restaurants around it, and hundreds of chairs scattered around so that you can sit just that little bit apart from the next person, and have your own space. Schedule this as a break or pitstop from doing other more active stuff. A good place to rendezvous.

Small park that's fun to hang out in. Bryant park is fairly small but it's nice to have some green space in midtown. During the holidays there is a holiday market and an ice rink. Movies in the summer. And it's surrounded by shops and restaurants.

Wonderful place to watch the world go by. Hadn't heard of this place before I came to New York but stumbled across as it was round the corner from our hotel. Unlike the vast expanse of Central Park this is relatively small, it's surrounded by tall buildings/skyscrapers, has a nice grassed area, a bar, a place to get coffee and snacks - it just has a nice atmosphere about. Definitely worth a visit if you're anywhere near.

Beautiful place to hang out. On Wednesdays in the summer, there is dancing here which is cool. The park has been renovated in the past few years and at lunch time there are hundreds of people sitting and eating and taking in the greenery and buildings around. The restaurants in the park are lovely, but expenisive although there are a few where you can get lunch for a few dollars like Breads, which has the best chocolate rugaleh and bobka. It's store is on 16th and union square and this is a small sample. It is delicious and worth trying. Pantien also is there and across the street you can get a nice salad at Chipolte and sit for as long as you like.

Awesome in NYC!!. Bryant Park is a great place to sit and have lunch from one of many vendors. It's also a great place to sit and people watch. There are plenty of chairs, the subway is close by and there is a Starbucks on the corner of 6th Ave and 42nd St. Grab a cool drink and have a seat in Bryant Park. During the warmer months, usually on Mondays they show movies.
Gorgeous . Lovely little park, warm evening we were there incredibly busy with a mass yoga session. Great place to sit and have a drink and people watch in the middle of busy area.

Park in the City. Bryant park is so relaxing in the summer. You can relax the sun or sit at the table to eat or read in the middle of the city. In the winter they have free ice skating and great small booths for shopping around the holiday's. Good place to go when you need a break.

WONDERFUL FOR AN AFTERNOON. What a surprise. Discover this for the first time this June-SHAME on Me. Have been to NY probably 40-or more times as an adult and never discoverd it although in plan sight. light snack-drink etc. Watch the people!

Don't miss it. Came across it when walking down 42nd St and what a find. Brilliant oasis to relax in amongst all the hustle, buy food and drink from the kiosks or take your own. Table tennis, chess, reading room or just relax. It is very popular but we always found a table and chairs or relax on the immaculate lawn. We went during the afternoon and at night and atmosphere was great at both. It is beautifully clean and maintained and its public toilets must be the best in NY with fresh flowers and attendants. It just has a special feel and seems to attract locals as well as visitors. Had never heard of it before but should be on everyone's to do list who visits NY, a credit to the team that run it.
A great little haven amidst the bustle. This is a lovely little park and makes a nice place to escape to. It's right by the library which is a beautiful building. Plenty of seats around the park too.

Nice place to stop on a sunny day. There's always a lot of things going on in Bryant Park nice sunny day. There's a number of restaurants or you can have lunch and sometimes there's even entertainment.

Awesome happy hour during summer. This is the place to go for a happy hour if you are working in the city for a few days or weeks, best place to relax at the grass if you are interested in a laid back evening, or lunch or dinner at any regular day. In the center of midtown this is a little heaven in a city that is always on the go
In the middle of the City and you don't feel it. Love every single corner of it. The food stands are great. You will find a lot of people but no one bothers you! My teenage boy really like it.
pinpong. I had a great opportunity to play pinpong in Bryant park . The waiting time was 45 minutes and then 10 minutes playing.

What a find. Just walking along exploring when we came across Bryant Park, an open air reading area with chairs you can only use if you are reading, papers and books supplied. Amazing. spent a very pleasant half hour or so there with a coffee.

An oasis. A beautiful spot in the middle of the bustle. There are plenty of chairs and a few places selling fab food. The subway stop is right at the park and once you're there, there's daily entertainment.
Excellent for summer lunch. There is a Pain Quotidien in the Park and it's a great idea to buy lunch and sit in the sunny park peoplewatching having lunch.
Quiet time. A relatively quiet area to sit and enjoy a bit of piece and quiet in the busy city. Central Park is still the place to truly find some solace.
nice and relaxing. just a short walk from our hotel (the langham( this is a peace of tranquillity in a busy city with coffee and eats on sale you can sit and watch the world walk by
A quiet corner.. Nice place to sit for a wee rest when you're out and about, either in the sun or in the shade of the trees.
Oasis amongst the drone. Dropped into Bryant Park a few times and it's a lovely place, games of chess await those who love to challenge a stranger. Don't forget the free Wi-Fi
A place to relax. With all the hustle and bustle of New York, it is great to find a place to relax over a coffee and snack.

Popular & Relaxing Bryant Park. Bryant Park is a fairly large privately managed public park located in the New York City borough of Manhattan. It is conveniently & centrally located between Fifth and Sixth Avenues and between 40th and 42nd Streets in Midtown Manhattan. Although, the Main Branch of the New York Public Library is located within the park, effectively it forms the park's functional eastern boundary, making Sixth Avenue the park's primary entrance. It was one of the first public space / park in USA to offer free Wi-Fi access to it's visitors. Till today it is a popular hangout spot for locals & visitors alike with lots of dining & entertainment options available.

A green oasis in Manhattan. A lovely park in back of the New York Public Library. We were here on a warm Sunday afternoon but despite the number of people there it was very pleasant. There are plenty of tables for having a earl or a cup of coffee while reading a book. People picnicked or relaxed on the lawn. Even with all the people, it was a very relaxing place to go

awesome public area. This is a very nice public park that has a variety of things to do. Fun to see people playing board games, ping pong, mini golf, reading, and doing yoga- all within a large city block. Gorgeous trees, outdoor space to enjoy with plenty of seating.
Xmas. Went here the week before Xmas , the market was good and the tree was fantastic , red white & blue. ! Ice skating was lovely to watch
Cool place to hang out!. Great place to grab a snack and chill out. Loads going on and great for people watching. Definitely worth a visit.

Small but everything on offer. We visited Bryant Park at 7.30am with our take out breakfast. People were reading, doing tai chi, yoga and taking in the fab views. In the afternoon we returned to find the summer reading room, live musicians and free juggling classes. The carousel was brilliant for our baby and offered small table and chairs for him to sit at. Get in early for a table if you want to eat.

A gem in the middle of the city. By all means, anyone who has been to New York has visited or heard of central park. But have you ever been to Bryant Park? This is such a gem in the middle of the city. It is small, quiet, picturesque, French inspired park and a must see. They have a sizable green area surrounded by benches, coffee shops, restaurants, bars, a fountain and a beautiful carrousel. There is even an area where you can rent out boardgames and play in the tables provided. I only spent about an hour there with my kids, but I could of spend the whole afternoon. Great place and a must see.

Loved it here!. Loved it! A great little park in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of the city. They do regular shows here and there are also some restaurants/food outlets. Next to the library so we visited both

Very busy, but fun. Bryant Park is usually hustle and bustle during winter (with the ice skating), but nonetheless a must see if you're there during that time. It seems to slow down a little during the summer, but a fun spot to have a coffee and ice skate during the winter.
read or browse. Bryant Park is full of benches, trees, amusements, food and activities. I passed through on a saturday afternoon and enjoyed people watching.

Green, clean, and all the fun things to be seen. I had to use the bathrooms here. Is that weird it's the first thing I'm mentioning? They are super clean. The park is well maintained, with plenty to do, and surrounded by all the huge buildings, it's a nice breath of fresh air with the greenery and a place to slow down.
Nice live Jazz. Went to Bryant park with my wife and 12 year old son. My sister and another friend joined us at the porch for some burgers. We listened to some nice music. a Beautiful evening

Brilliant park.. What a great park with a couple of eating places and a brilliant peaceful location right in the heart of the city. Peaceful that is until lunch time or finishing when the workers pile in to sit on the grass and have lunch or a drink. Loads of activities here every day and an army of guys keeping it spotless, one of our favourite places.

Always something fun happening!. Lovely green space located near tons of public transportation. Quite a few vendors around the area - hot dog carts, Wafels & Dinges, etc. At lunch time, this place is packed!Highly recommend checking out their website (Just Google Bryant Park NYC, I can't post the link) for a list of all the goings-on. I have seen Brandy perform with a small cast from Chicago during Broadway in the Park - for free!
Too busy! . Very pretty and quaint but packed full of people! The wifi is free though :) It's nice for a picture and a lot smaller than I was expecting.

Refreshing patch of green in NY. I had decided to cover manhattan on foot and was walking towards grand central when I happened to see this park. This was the first weekend of spring, and people were out after a long break. A green patch in the middle of town, this had a variety of activities for you to enjoy. You can listen to live music, watch an open play (a play on shakespeare was happening when i reached) or play a wide variety of games including carpet golf, chess etc. There are few cafes and an open air pub, which is a great place to unwind!
I love this park!. People playing checkers and chess, board games that can be borrowed and played at tables, a small carousel, large shade giving trees and places to get lunch.

Beautiful green space behind the New York Public Library. We walked through the park after visiting the library and it was beautiful. Our toddler enjoyed the Carousel, and there was a nice cafe there as well.

Nice little park. This park is located right near the main NY library (also a good place to visit). There are a lot of little shops that sell unique things. In the winter they have an ice skating rink. There is a lot of seating in case you want to take a break during the day. There are several places to get a snack within the park.
Lovely little respite. Just a few blocks from Grand Central... great place to grab a coffee and a waffle and relax in the shade. Beautiful.

Great feel for the city!. We spent an hour in Bryant Park on a Saturday and loved the people watching. A group of jugglers were practicing near the green and the park offers a full complement of activities. There are several great meal options from sit-down to grab and go. Be sure to visit the New York Public Library which is right next door.
An oasis........ Of peace or a hubbub of activity right in the middle of midtown. You can listen to live music or escape with a good book under the trees while the rest of the world scurries by.
Gorgeous little park. This little park is gorgeous, is next to the New York Public library which is also another NY highlight. The park had a few food carts. Really nice

My favorite park in NYC!. Hanging out in Bryant Park is always high on my list when I'm in NYC. It's right in the heart of the city (by the library) and it's a wonderful respite from the craziness of the city. There's a very cool merry-go-round, lots of local food vendors and plenty of seating.They do all kinds of cool programming (free movies, free Broadway sneak peeks, skating rink etc.) all year round and the people watching is spectacular.This is a side of NYC that lots of people miss. In between your crazy tours, shows and shopping -- relax and soak in one of New York's best attractions!

NICE SPOT FOR A QUIET MOMENT OR A BREAK. Nestled in the heart of downtown Manhattan, Bryant Park is a beautiful little spot for a rest where you can sit down and enjoy yourself. There are some nice tables, benches, a fountain, a little restaurant and a good patch of grass to relax on. In all the hectic parts of NYC, Bryant Park is a nice respite from the action. If you found this review helpful please say so below. Thank you!

A lively and beautiful oasis in the heart of mid town.. We strolled through the park on a lovely June afternoon. There were people everywhere, reading chatting eating in the cafes. The plantings and fountain were well maintained, We had beers in the southwest corner cafe and took in the view remembering what it had been like years ago when we lived in NYC, What a miracle of restoration!

A Favourite. Love this park! We were there in late May and it was looking sensational! Flowers were blooming and trees were flourishing. There's plenty of seating and refreshment stands and you also get a close up view of the fabulous public building on 5th which is a 'must visit'. If you have time, sit in Bryant Park and 'chill' and absorb its peaceful tranquillity amid the bustle of New York. There are also regular evening concerts/films to enjoy!

Favourite park. This was my favourite park in New York. Vibrant and full of people. There was something going on every night as were there. They also have a free large screen outdoor cinema every Monday night during the summer months

A Four Seasons urban park. Visiting Bryant Park is always a stop on my NYC visits. Sit in the park and enjoy people watching, grab a sandwich from one of the local vendors (street food) or pack your own snacks and lounge at one of the many tables dotting the park. Winter brings ice skating and Christmas market fairs; summer brings concerts, sculpture exhibits and outdoor movies. Great location next to the NYC Public Library and near Grand Central Terminal--fills the block from 5th to 5th on 42nd.

Warm City Feel!!!. When traveling through NYC, we've ended up in Bryant Park many times and I absolutely LOVE this area!! There's a warm "city" feel to it. Surrounded inside the park by small eatery venues, benches and tables, local ware and crafts and on the outskirts of the park are many fashion stores, shopping, library, sights. Our last visit was to ice skate. How fun!!! We choose it because we love the area and it was a little less expensive and easier to get into over Central and Rockefeller. Much more fun for my teen daughters than the crowds and lines and expense at Rockefeller. Better value, less crowded, nicer/safer feel!
Ghostbusters. I really wanted to go here as I am a big Ghostbusters fan. The building is fantastic and the park is a great place to relax

We happened upon this park. We actually spotted the park from one of the observatories. There was a skating rink and a hundred little shops were setup around the park. Most of the shops were local artists selling home decor, jewelry or food. It was a super find and great alternative to Rockefeller Center. I could have spent more time shopping if I had planned to visit it that day.

Great spot to people watch . This was a few blocks along from our hotel so we were there a good few times during our trip. First night we saw people putting out gym mats on the grass, thought there was an exercise class about to start, didn't realise around 600 people would attend!! Lovely wee place to sit and relax

Awesome Park - Always Something On. This park is so cool. There is always something on and they post a schedule each day. Thursday night Bingo is awesome and attracts a huge crowd, so if you want a seat, get there early.
Lovely breakfast. Gorgeous natural yogurt with pistachio nuts.Hubby enjoyed the viennese waffles with fresh berries. Really fresh and tasty, eaten outside by the fountain. Happy Monday morning!
We took the time to sit and enjoy the park. This place is a thing of beauty. The kids loved being able to just sit and enjoy the great weather we were having.

An Evening Event and Activity in Bryant Park. Well, we though we might just venture there after seeing it from the Top of the Rock and we were;t disappointed. It was a hive of activity. And to top it off, there were over 1,000 yoga participants doing a free session in the park. Sponsored presenters. mats and sound systems supported the event. But, there were also food and drink vendors and a particular stand where fashionable young peeps were enjoying a social drink in a great venue. Will be back.
My favorite place on our NYC tour. Even though it was a rainy/misty day - Bryant Park was a gem in the middle of the city. What a pleasure walking around the Park.
Beautiful. A sanctuary in the city. It's a very nice place to bring your deli breakfast or lunch and eat or just find peace in the city. It's just beautiful!

Tranquil and Cool . Located with the NY Public Library, the park is a nice green area with the shade of the trees, plenty of tables and chairs to sit and relax drink a coffee and do some people watching.
Beautiful park. We loved this park just around the corner from our hotel and Times Square. Great atmosphere and a lovely place to relax and soak up the city vibes.
fun market. I love walking / shopping through here every time I come to NYC and bringing someone who has never been is even better :)
Love the caraosol and very clean.. Caraosol was clean, different and fun. Park was clean. Grass was fenced off, so kids couldn't run around. Some construction in areas.

Loved it. We went to Bryant Park during Tartan week to hear the Pipers Band and the Highland Divas. We sat on chairs in the sun and had a wonderful time for a couple of hours. The park was full of daffodils , tulips and flowers.
Small but delightful. Such a beautiful wee park, and an ideal spot to take a breather from the buzz of the streets. It was very clean and plenty of seating. Just what was needed!
Beautiful setting. Great place to sit and enjoy a nice break from the action. The waffle stand is amazing. Make sure to get one to enjoy while you sit and take in the view.

Quaint park behind the New York Public Library. Great park located just behind the library with much to offer....outdoor ping pong tables, skating risk and shopping kiosks near the holidays, and just a nice place to relax in a busy city.
Loved it here. This is a lovely small park, very relaxing, even though it is in the middle of a very busy New York! It is next to the beautiful public library building.
Splendid . Lovely area. Came here mid-November and they had the Christmas market set up, but it was still brilliantly sunny and warm. Sat and had a coffee, watching people play table tennis.

Sightseeing . We came across Bryant Park purely by chance. We were lucky to have had glorious sunshine and temperatures in the 30's. To arrive at the park was like an oasis in the desert.
