There was a variety of street entertainers, plenty of places to eat and another fantastic place to watch the world go by and chill in this manic city. Loved it.

Lovely pit stop.. We came across Byrants park after walking from 42nd street towards Times Square. It was our first night very humid night and stopped here for a drink. The atmosphere was lovely. Nice place to chill.

Beautiful park. Bryant Park is one of many green parks scattered throughout the city. We picked up some breakfast from across the street and sat in the park for a bit, although there are several food and drink kiosks within the park as well. There is a small carrousel, a game and reading area, a large grass area, plenty of tables and chairs. The wi-fi is free and there are outlets where you can charge your phone. There is a bar and restaurant on site as well. This a beautiful, quiet respite in a busy city, obviously very popular with the locals as well as the tourists.
Tanquillity. A lovely place of calm within the city. View of the Chrysler building while enjoying a coffee in the shadow of a beautiful old library

great. We stayed nearby this park and it was great to sit and relax to get away from the hustle and bustle of the amount of people and traffic around. Although it was great to see alot of staff aound as we did get approached by an undesirable. Other than that it didn't stop us enjoying the activities that were taking place, eg, table tennis, mini golf, the reading corner and the chance to even charge up your electronic devices.
A small green paradise. Just behind the New York Public Library, this small park is just a great place to chill out, to have lunch , or even to have contact with the nature. Take some pictures!

Short walk from Times Square. wanting to kill time before our tour started we walked to Bryant Park, It was early morning and a raining day so didn't get to do a lot but the park is beautiful. Later in the day we drove back by the park and it was packed with people just enjoying lunch and the sights.
Christmas visit to Bryant Park. Best time to visit is during Christmas with all the shops set up and the Christmas Environment in November and December. Their Christmas Tree is amazing!
My favorite place in NY. I have been twice, first in 2011 and then 2015, this place has a special charm, enjoy a coffe or whatever activity but live Bryant Park moment.

Wish we'd discovered Bryant Park sooner. Bryant Park was very near our hotel but we only found it towards the end of our stay - we stumbled across it whilst trying to dodge Times Square! A lovely venue for an afternoon drink in the sunshine and the food looked great. We would definitely go back here for a meal if we return to New York.

Beautiful and relaxing. We came upon Bryant Park by accident (walking to subway) and came in to get a closer look. So many people were laying on the grass, having lunch, lounging in the shade. Gorgeous, shady park with beautiful plants and flowers. What a lovely place in the middle of the city.

Green Haven in Midtown. This park has reinvented itself to provide a quiet green space in midtown, with something for all ages. There is a magical center for children, story time, books, and a merry-go-round as well as food items for children as well as their care takers. If you are looking for serious food and drink, the park is bordered by a restaurant and bar to satisfy those desires. It's a perfect place to recoup strength, enjoy the unusual and varied architecture surrounding the park as well as the seasonal floral displays.
Gorgeous!. This was one of our favourite places in New York. A beautiful park where you can learn a language, play chess (they like a wager), have a coffee, or just sit and watch the world go by.

A peaceful park. This is a nice, manageable park to visit. They have a carousel for kids and food kiosks. There's a library/ reading area and a sit down restaurant too. In the winter there's skating and a holiday market and in summer outdoor movies.

This is worth it.. Reading the reviews makes this an appealing destination. On arrival, the street noise (coming form 3 sides) was a major detractor. Despite this, we found ourselves gravitating here every day, sometimes in the morning, afternoon, or evening. It was a lovely break from all the other “chaos”.
Bryant Park. Such a nice slice of nature smack in the middle of the city .Always something to see or do. A must,see !

What a find. This central city block is a wonderful park with places to sit and have coffee or a picnic, lovely trees and well kept flower beds, a central fountain, places to play table tennis, read or play board games. It's right behind the City Public Library on 5th Avenue.
A Relaxing Place in the City. Went to see a free play in Bryant park. Beautiful ambience especially at night to have a picnic, watch a play or just people watch!

A great spot right behind the Library.. Right behind the Library is a wonderful park. You can sit and eat or talk, right in the middle of this busy city. Bring a sandwich with you and just enjoy yourself.

Lovely place to sit. We visited Bryant Park several times during our visit as it was so close to the hotel. I love how the place has a real community feel to it. There is a book loan, games & food available
Great atmosphere

Great little park with lots of things to see. Close to the New York Library this little park is a great place to chill out for an hour or so. Refreshments are available and if you want you can sit and watch he chess players battling it out. There are occasional performances and when were there they were putting on an outdoor Shakespeare play. I have been to New York a coiple of times now and make a point of going to the park.
Another little treasure. Just behind library, ideal place for a picnic, lots of takeaways nearby. Not far from Times Square, you can see the lights from the park.

Beautiful park with a lot of things going on. At the center of Bryant Park is a nicely manicured grassy area. Along the borders of this active park are people playing table tennis, Bocce (Bocci) ball, a putt putt course, kiosks and restaurants nearby. There are lots of seats around the park and during my visit there were beautifully colored tulips growing around the park. The New York Public Library is located at the eastern edge of the park.

I love Bryant Park but it is best at Christmas. Every time we come to New York we visit Bryant Park. Sometimes to just sit at the Southwest airlines outside pub and people watch, other times it is to check out vendors and just seeing what is going on. For us the best time is Christmas when they have a skating rink and a shopping village. In our visit in May they had it closed in the late evening for a film shoot but that was also kind of fun to watch.

Nice day out. The park is a nice place to sit and relax or take a breather from walking around. The Friday night movie in the park is awesome but get there early and bring a blanket. There are vendors around for food if you don't want the pricy restaurant behind the park.
Beautiful!!!!. We loved this park! It's right next to the New York Public Library. The park is so cozy with lots of places to sit and rest and enjoy the scenery! We loved it!
lovely little park. This is very nice , relaxing park, you can buy food there or bring your own picnic. We visited in May and it was very green and pretty.

Chilled oasis, with free Wi-Fi. Good bar and restaurant at the public library end (which is also meant to be worth a visit) with plentiful seating all round if you're after coffee/tea instead of alcohol. Free Wi-Fi always useful. Not like usual skanky urban parks. Nice place to take stock if you want some peace from shopping mayhem!
A haven of tranquility in a sea of chaos. Behind the library round corner from Grand central and a lovely coffee kiosk. Space to take 30 mins to people watch New York

Beautiful Bryant Park.. great green space in the city!. Located near to the New York Public Library, I stumbled upon Bryant Park walking back from Times Square.. it was so pretty and inviting. The atmosphere was just great, busy but still space to have a seat and enjoy a nice cocktail (highly recommend) or just sit on the grass and take in the views. It's like a little oasis amongst the busy sounds and sights, and it's just so cute. I came here twice but I know for sure I will return here and would recommend that anyone in this vicinity stops off for a little sit down and absorb the atmosphere.

A nice park behind the Main NYC Library at 42nd st. This used to be a no go place made into a delightful safe park with a carousel, coffee and snack shops and plenty of tables and chairs to sit at. I would not go out of my may to visit it, but if you are passing by and need a break, great place to stop
Oasis. Located near the New York Public Library this is a great spot to sit and relax...on weekends there's a book reading service and the lawns are full of picnickers relaxing...

Parking lot of people!. I thought this would be a nice park, but you couldn't walk two feet without having to walk around someone or step on someone. It was Labor Day weekend, so maybe busier then normal. But everyone seemed like they were on a lunch break from work. It was a sea of people.

Perfect last night in NYC. We spent our last night in Manhattan by taking one last walk downtown from 61st. We arrived at Bryant Park at around 9:30pm and found an outdoor area of one of the restaurants for a drink. The atmosphere was so peaceful and somehow removed from the bustle and noise of the city that we stayed for dinner. After we strolled through the park which was deserted. ( we discovered as we exited that it was closed!) they close the park at night. Well worth a visit
A lovely place to pause.. The library next to the park is worth visiting. unfortunately parts of it were closed when we went. Could have spent much longer there.

Charming. We found this park on our last day. It has café's, a carousel, city views, an outdoor reading room, and space to chill in peace. There is also a programme of summer events in the park. Very civilised place to stop and sit

Just dandy. While traveling for work I walked across the street to Bryant Park each day and ate lunch sitting in a cafe chair in the grass. I felt safe, I felt relaxed and would highly recommend this to anyone simply trying to decompress from their work day.

Awesome park, highly recommend. I went on the free 11AM Wednesday tour here, and I have so much appreciation for this park! It was pretty empty when the tour started, and when I went back around 12:30, it was PACKED! There are so many chairs and tables, and there's even Wifi and outlets scattered throughout the park. People were just chilling on the lawn when lunchtime came around. It's really clean, and the bathrooms are REALLY nice. There's also water fountains and food places around the park. The company running the park also has activities of all sorts, which I think is really awesome! This is a great place to chill and/or do a bit of work, since it's outside, very well-kept, and very shaded. Great park, definitely recommend. Also definitely recommend doing the free tours they give for the park!
Relax here!. This park was wonderful and a oasis to relax in. From the many places to eat to the Chess area. A must see.

Outdoor movies in the summer!. It's a very pretty park. Convenient location, few blocks from Times Square. We can enjoy the outdoor movies during the summer and a rink during the winter! Overall pretty great to hang out with family and friends.

A lovely place to escape hustle and bustle. Stopped for a bit to eat,so we had two rolls and ice tea from a kiosk.Only downside was the roll had mustard seeds in,which didn't say on the board(ok if you like mustard)and the ice tea had too much ice in it.The park itself was lovely and clean.

Lovely Bryant Park. What a lovely park right in the midst of Midtown Manhattan! When we walked through the park the first time, there was a lot of daytime activity. People were relaxing on the lawn and in various seating areas throughout the park, chatting, and enjoying books in the Reading Room area. We returned on two evenings after dark to see that the center of the park, a beautiful green lawn, was now magically transformed into a well-lit, charming space. We enjoyed a good meal on the Bryant Park Cafe' patio and had a drink on the Southwest Porch. This was the perfect place to spend quiet, peaceful evenings watching people come and go and reflecting on our NYC trip. And the park restrooms (located in a stone building close to the Bryant Park Cafe') feature attendants and really are clean as advertised. We would definitely want to return.

Weekly activities. Be sure to check out the parks website for their weekly activities during the summer. I used to work across the street so I would go to events ranging from a rodeo to salsa dancing to a broadway show, to a musical chairs. All of this for free in the park.

Peace and quiet . After 4 full on days in the city. I went and grabbed a book and headed for the park and found a tree and spent a lovely 3 hours reading in the shade. If your thing is people watching you can sit and enjoy that in abundance. There are lots of places around to buy food and drink to take back and sit at one the tables that are free to use. A great place to have a nice rest if all the walking around NYC gets to much.
Small beautiful park. Go and seat, have a coffee and relax in the middle of the city on the middle of the day, it will be worth it

A little oasis in the heart of midtown. Bryant Park is a cultural oasis in the heart of midtown. It is a tiny little park yet there is something cultural all year round. Ice skating and shops in the winter. Classical movies on Monday nights in the summer. The Reading Room offers poetry on Tuesdays and a wealth of writers. There are games and yoga etc. You must check out the activities in this park or just sit and have lunch and people watch.

A little island of calm. Nestled into the hustle and bustle of New York, Bryant Park is a wonderful place to sit, relax and take stock of everything. And for those of us planning their next adventure, it comes with free wifi!

Popular green space. One of the best green spaces on the island! I always love to come and people watch!It's a little piece of serenity in the hustle and bustle of the city. Grab a table and a cup of coffee and commence with the fantastic people watching.Home to the fashion week runway, where the fashion and celebrities a like take over in early fall!During the winter months a holiday village, along with an ice rink and a pop up restaurant occupy the space. Touristy yes, but it's part of the holiday charm in the Manhattan, we come here every time we are in the city and it doesn't not disappoint!

Lunch break. Among a busy day we took a long lunch break here. We are at the cafe and listened to the live piano music. The food was really good and the sangria hit the spot on a warm day. While the park was busy, it didn't feel cramped. Would recommend for anyone to take a break from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Another gem tucked away in central NY. What a wonderful, friendly and popular place. Popular with locals, there are a wide range of activities, eateries and a bar to choose from. This does get busy, be warned. But well worth dropping by and soaking up some of the local atmosphere.
Fun in nice weather. This area has a beautiful park like setting in a very bust area. It is pretty and provides a nice place to relax for a while.
Nice place to visit and enjoy a park and a coffee or beer. Last night I played free bingo in the park for an hour. It's a pretty park with a couple of refreshment spots.
Beautiful park right in the middle of city 200 yards from Time Square. Lovely place to relax, dine or just have a drink or a nice cream, what a relaxing spot just 3 mins from Times Square

This is my favorite part in Manhattan . during the wintertime is just a little bit rough but when spring comes its just beautiful green, having a beer on the loans to just have big picnic lunch and not to think about summer or you can go to Wednesdays and watch movies drinking beers and doing your picnics

Morning, Noon or Night. My Hotel was located very close to Bryant Park so it was perfect to enjoy a pastry or coffee in the morning while reading the paper or just enjoying the morning air. (disclaimer: air may contain pollution) There is a really good french pastry shop on the southwest corner across the street. The Strawberry/Raspberry Tart was amazing. There is plenty of bistro seating in the park itself and along the perimeter. There was live entertainment almost every night I was there. You do have to sit rather close or you cannot hear 50ft back. Around 1opm I think they come through and pick up all the chairs and tables and pick up trash. Pretty impressive. Love when green space is kept green. Please do your part and clean up after yourselves. Enjoy one of many slices of nature in the middle of the city.
A pretty little park. This is a very pretty little park in the middle of town. A great place to take a break from the hustle and bustle.

Just beautiful !. Reminded me of a Parisian park, just beautiful especially on a sunny day. Plenty of places to sit free of charge and even an outdoor 'reading room' where you can borrow books from . Lovely fountain, great cafes and bars nearby for lunch too. Our favourite park apart from Central park .Well worth a visit !!!

Refreshing!. Beautiful place. Something different happening every day. Only small space but when we went there was a jazz band and couples were dancing. There were a couple of table tennis matches going on, people wandering through the lovely open space, others drinking and eating. On our way past on the way home there were juggling lessons being given. If you need a break from all the siteseeing, this is the place to go.

A lot cleaner then years ago. I used to work in NYC about 25 years ago. I used to walk past this park everyday . Back then it was full of drug addicts and vagrants. A very dirty park.Now the is a nice place visit. The city has cleaned it up. It's like thru an amusement park with shops and places to buy food . I would come here again when I'm in the area.
My Favorite Park in NYC. By far, my favorite park in NYC. Very intimate but convenient to Time Square and other attractions and restaurants. Love to spend my summer days there with a good book!
smaller but worth it. massively smaller than central park but like other parks dotted about new York this is well worth the visit

Great place to watch the world go by. This is a really lovely area. Lots of places to sit and watch the world go by. We had a nice meal in one of the restaurants. Lots and lots of seating and snack bars or you could buy food elsewhere and just grab a table. A nice place to chill.

Lovely people watching park. We spent the evening in this park, first by sitting at one of the table & chairs and watching the many people who relax after work in this park. We then had drinks in the open air café, where they have a couple of locally brewed beers on tap. They also serve food, which I'm told was good.

Just sit and enjoy the people around you. A park just 'behind' the public library.
Seats available, food stand on the corner. A variety of activities in the park.

Great evening, great atmosphere. Spent a great night here, drinking cold beers and eating great food in the outdoor cafe (nearest 6th Avenue side of the park). Our son ran and joined in the jugglers and later played chess - a safe, friendly and cool place to spend the evening
Main Library. Check out the NYC main Public Library at Bryant Park. It is beautiful inside and souvenirs in the shop are reasonably-priced!

Nice area for a drink.. Drop in Bryant Park and enjoy a coffee or a cold drinks after exploring the library. It's busy at lunch times as locals take time out from work to enjoy lunch and the free activities on offer such as juggling. Monday evenings in the summer I believe they air movies. Nice place to people watch and catch your breath while exploring the city
Fun place. Go ice skating, visit the little market place and have one of the desserts at the corner store. Such a fun place!
Must go. Such a beautiful park in the middle of the city. Right behind the Public Library on 5th Avenue. Must stop in the middle of the day to have a drink, relax and recover yr batteries !
Lovely and peaceful. An oasis of calm in the busy city! Not huge amounts to do but watch the world go by. Lush and green with plenty of seating it's worth stopping by for a coffee and pastry.

Relaxing and refreshing. We enjoyed a cocktail and a light meal in a beautiful outdoor venue followed by an enjoyable walk in the park . There were places to play games and people to play them with and later in the day there were free Shakespearean performances. The day we were there it was "Much Ado About Nothing"

Nice place to take a break, sit and take in NYC. I have walked by Bryant Park many times; this time I decided to walk in the park, find a nice shady spot to sit and just enjoy the park and people watch. It's a nice break to take.
Our favorite spot. With a little something for everyone, Bryant Park is always our favorite - no matter the season! Just beautiful.

Oasis in New York. Loved Bryant Park. In between two avenues, this green area provides space if you just need a moment to take a breath from the fast pace that is New York. Lots of opportunities for coffee, water, snacks and people watching. There are areas for ping pong, reader, chess players and then just general seating for everyone else. Well worth taking a moment in
Beautiful. We stayed in a hotel right next to Bryant Park. It is a beautiful little park with significant french influence. We enjoyed grabbing an ice cream and sitting on the grass.

Ambience. One recent balmy May evening had the pleasure to sit in this park with my family and have a couple of cold beers ; what a great ambience , no tourist , myself excluded of course , just locals chillin after work . Everyone nice and friendly , busy but comfortable al fresco bar/restaurant with prompt efficient service.Oh one issue . the bathroom is a public one at the other end of the park , literally in another time zone !

Lunch in the park.. It's a fantastic place to grab lunch and seat and eat slowely in the middle of New York City. Plenty of places to eat. The place is a heaven in the middle of all the rush. I highly recommend it.
Great spot for breakfast. Grabbed smoothies from the street and croissants from the park, not super crowded on sunday morning but definetly alive. Free WiFi AND charging sockets!

Bryant Park Green oasis surrounded by mid town New York skyscrapers. Bryant Park is a well kept secret that New Yorkers are desperate to keep to themselves. A green oasis amidst the midtown skyscrapers with food, coffee, a carousel for the kids - space to breathe and chill out. Not far away down the street is Grand Central Station and the Chysler Building
Perfect place to have rest!!!. It's a perfect place to take a breath in the rush of New York. It takes you to the silence and freedom atmosphere.. I visited frequently almost everyday.

Wonderful during Christmas. I was here on a day trip. There was a huge Christmas market with the ice skating rink. Lots of overpriced food (you can get the same food elsewhere...keep that in mind) but interesting gifts. Definitely could spend a few hours here.

Shady spot to take a break. . We were headed for the nearby subway station but found an open game table with a set of Uno cards so we welcomed the opportunity to sit and play. Other tables had board games...lots of chess. .checkers and backgammon. Coffee stand and a bar/cafe add to the attraction of this relaxing spot.

Lovely park,created place to chill with a glass of wine. We stumbled across this park on on of our evening walks. We stopped off and had a few drinks in the bar and watched the world go by. Also there was a Shakespeare performance at the other end which we could hear. As a result the park was packed and really busy. Apparently there are frequent events that take place.
Super Nice Park. it was one of the nicest parks I have ever been to. It is hard to find a seat but if you are patient you will find a seat.

A great place to people watch!. Bryant Park is a great place to sit and watch the people go by. On our recent trip to NYC it was very hot and it was nice place to sit under the trees and have our breakfast. There are snack bars and restaurants all around and lots of seating available at any time of day.

Great at Christmas time. This is a very nice park anytime of year but even better at Christmastime. The ice skating park comes out and many little shops with hot chocolate and other types of food and drink. Very fun.

Byrant Park. This is a beautiful park in the middle of all the skyscrapers. It was beautiful and we stumbled upon a couple hundred people doing yoga in the park. You can purchase little snacks from the different vendors. The park is peaceful and I loved it.

Drinks at Southwest. Nice place for outdoor drinks. Not cheap, but fun. We're there Friday night of Memorial Day weekend. Lots of options in this quaint midtown park. Next time will bring a picnic and eat at some of the many tables in the shade.

Green oasis in the middle of the Big Smoke. A public green lawn, chairs and tables, leafy trees, lots of eats all around - this is a neat little spot to stop and rest your barking dawgs and have a hot or cold drink form one of the many vendors around

A Little Piece of Paradise. Delightful shade provided by tall trees along stone paths lined with tables, chairs, ping pong, game tables, a carousel, food kiosks and more in the middle of a busy part of town. Don't miss the Library!

Delightful oasis in midtown during the spring & summer. beautiful lawn, day and evening activities, restaurants (can be pricey and not very good)- plenty of take out places in area for you to pick up your own food and picnic

Nice little park to eat lunch. The day was bright & warm so we bought nice rolls & coffee and found a free table & chairs .....yes free table & chairs!
Pretty park

Great place to stop and eat lunch. Get lunch somewhere and go hang out in Bryant Park for a while. It's a "little" park right in the middle of the skyscrapers and it has dozens of activities such as mini golf, pentaque, juggling, and just sitting and taking in the city. There are some cafes and such as well.

Lots of activities. This park was so pleasant to watch people play games, ping pong (table tennis), lunching, chess, etc. lots of Activities going on that makes this park fun! Variety of people visit and use this park. Nice places to take pictures. All types of food trucks around to eat.

Fabulous Park. We love this place, it's a piece of tranquility among the hustle and bustle of New York City. There are also lots events to look out for.
Great place to chill.
Green space. Very pleasant green space among the busy streets of NY. Plenty of places to seat and enjoy the rest and soak up the sun. Food not cheap here so be careful of what you buy.

Green oasis in the middle of the city. This park has a great deal of free seating with a central grass area surrounded by places to sit. It has a large number of tall trees and is a great place to simply sit and watch the world go by.
Several places for snacks and drinks.
Nothing much happening today. I love Bryant Park when they have vendors set up, but today all was quiet in the park. It's a great place to people watch or just sit to catch your breath.

Great outdoor space to chill out.. Really nice park in central manhattan. Great for either day or evening time ,plenty of open space with lots of tables and chairs. Many kieosk,s and a large restaurant area ajoining the public library building. Gets fairly crowded on a warm evening but can still find seats. Very clean and well looked after, great for a coffee or ice creams etc or just to rest from walking.
Wonderful!. This is such a pretty park to just sit and relax in the heart of NYC. There's numerous nearby food and drinks. I will definitely be back!
Free WiFi and great people watching. Took a break in our early morning walk to stop in Bryant Park. Nice wide expanse, a public restroom and plenty of seating. Just a nice place to rest your feet.

My favorite park in NYC. My toddler and I visited Bryant Park on our trip. We loved having a Kayser hot chocolate and croissants by the carousel (we are now obsessed with one of the tunes, La la lalala). Then we got on it! It was a beautiful experience.

Mini-Central. I call this the mini-central park. And the location is perfect in mid-town. Central Park is SO large you only see parts of it. At Bryant, it's the condensed version. Lovely all year. Christmas SPECTACULAR. Ice skating, little vendor shops. Warm waffles. Yum.
Sophisticated NY Experience. Great place to sit and be (a little) removed from the hustle and bustle for a few minutes. Good snacks and seating available.

Pretty park with regular entertainment. Happened across this park as a band was playing and marching and jugglers were entertaining another area. There's piano playing at some times (a schedule is displayed at the park); there are plenty of free seats and a carousel. Cafes and a beautiful looking restaurant - worth a stop off.

Out door yoga anyone?. This is a charming little park in the midst of the city and a lovely spot to rest your legs. On the day we went we watched a very amusing out door yoga class. The teacher's enthusiasm could have outshone the lights on Broadway!

Relax in the city. A good place to relax in the heart of the City. Pricey restaurant / bar, but tables and chairs are available around the park where you can sit and enjoy your own food and (non-alcoholic) drinks. The Fine Food Market Place on 40th provides a fantastic array of foods / sandwiches / snacks to make your own picnic.
Pretty place . Great square, a bit like Madison square. You can sit there for hours & watch the world go by. Great place to check out what the locals are up to. Pretty sitting area!

Nice to stop by, but not worth a planned excursion. This is a nice green space in the middle of the city and probably a great place to take a break during your working day. Plenty of food stalls. Stop for a while if you pass it, but don't go out of your way.

Pleasant. Bryant Park was smaller than I thought it would be, but is a very pleasant place on a nice day. From the people playing pingpong to the nice bar, this is worth a visit if you're in the area.

Awesome park!. This was a great place to stop and just sit and talk. There were lots of vendors to get various foods and drinks. It was very comfortable and we actually ended up going to the park to sit and visit several times.
Even better than Central Park. There is always something going on in the park. They show movies, have yoga, games, a carousel. Right next to the subway and the Famous New York Public Library

An oasis in midtown. On a 4 day trip to NYC we enjoyed this beautiful park twice. Beautifully landscaped with great views of the public library and the Chrysler Building. A number of food options available and plenty of seating to sit back and relax after a hectic day in the city.

A small park that buzzes. Was absolutely full of people after a hard day at work, socialising in bars, playing games (Jenga, Connect 4, boules, chess etc.). Was great to watch people! Full of atmosphere on a warm evening - quitter when cold!
Beautiful greenery in the middle of the city . Lovely place to come for a picnic in the sun. Lots of chairs and tables for people to sit on without having to purchase anything!

Nice place to relax ,experience NY. After walking through Times Square this is a great place to relax, watch table tennis or chess players and grab food from restaurants or food trucks and sit on the lawn or find an open table or bench. It's great people watching.
Best Bathrooms in New York. We love walking in Bryant Park and this is a great place for a bathroom break. The bathrooms are very nice and clean. They have an attendant there to clean all day.
Best park. nestled in between large sky scrapers but still able to get lots of sun. this park was beyond adorable and beautiful!!
Fabulous open park space. a lovely place to sit and relax, open space for everyone. There was a big Yoga event going on when we arrived, lovely greenery in a cityscape.

A great place to bring your lunch on a nice day. Grab a sandwich or salad, and sit at one of the hundreds of little tables and chairs. Watch the incredible diversity of people living and working in NYC stroll by in this scenic park right behind the NYC public library. A wonderful break for tourists hanging around midtown. No place better for a respite while the weather is nice.

Relaxing. Stopped by the park for lunch before heading to other parts of the city. Great place to have a bite with tables and umbrellas seated beside the fountain and watching families enjoy the large grassy area. There is also a bar for cocktails and the area is very safe. Lovely decorated and fun.

Sit and watch the world go by..... Beautiful park right in the thick of the madness in the centre of Manhatten. Plenty of places to sit, public toilets, sculptures and a large grassed area. Not to mention 2 bars, 1 in each corner. It was great to get a drink and watch New Yorkers going about their hectic business. One of the best open spaces in New York and such a contrast from the surrounding skyscrapers.

Less visited corner of the Big Apple. If you are staying near this part of Manhattan and like your daily exercise here is your alternative to the Central park. Not that natural tough but serves the need. Beautifully arranged city park on the coast overlooking the Statue of Liberty. Wonderful walk for touristic porpuse too. Give a break at the choices between a cafe. A beer house and a Grill and Snack Bar. If you like walking continue to the financial center.

Cute Park. Moderately busy park with lots of seating. There's a big grassy area in the middle where some kids were out playing and running the day we stopped by. There's also a carousel and a restaurant to check out.
a good place to relax. it was also on my list when in NYC, having coffee at one of the shop in the chilling 10'c oh my loved it
Worth a pitstop. Right behind the public library and an oasis of calmness. Great place to have a coffee and people watch - there was a juggling class happening whilst we were visiting.

I love Bryant park. I don't know why but I love this park whenever I go to New York I make sure to take time and have lunch there ! Very nice ! There are cute little metal tables set up and lots of shade from trees and it's great for people watching ha ha ha

Park to visit besides Central Park. The park is located on the same block at the public library and has so many activities, from the carrousel, to the games, to the play on Friday night. I made a point of stopping in Bryant Park to rest my feet.

Great Park in Midtown. It is nice to go here when they are having a festival or craft fair. There are restaurants on the park and you can spend a few hours in a lovely greenbelt in the middle of the city.
Great Little Park!. Great little park in the heart of Manhattan - well worth the visit on a warm sunny day to watch the world go by!

A little Gem. Amazing place!! It's a peaceful place to chill from the crowds, great place at night to just sit down and have a drink, there are plays in the park you can just sit and watch for free. Great spot!

Bryant Park. Beautiful park. Easy access to subway, lots of tables there if you want to sit down, chill for a bit and observe the skyscrapers the city has to offer. Lots of places to get a snack from around the park, and has a great view of Chrysler building if you stand on 42nd street facing east.

another great park in the cental NYC. had a good relax time after walk in the heart of NYC. It was a sure pleasant time to enjoy the park, there are shops around the park to get ice cream, waffles or other souvenir booths.
Very busy. A good place to stop for a coffee or a beer amidst the madness. Very pleasant but on a hot day you may struggle to get a table or anywhere near the bar.

Very nice park. A very pretty park. Weather you go for a nice lunch at one of the many bistro tables or just relax on the grass on a sunny day, you will find lots of chairs around the park. It gets crowded around lunch time.We had lunch at the bistro at the top of the stairs. Nice relaxing area and park!Great for people watching!
Turns into a café in the warmer months.... If you need a breather exploring "The Big Apple" go to Bryant Park for a coffee or a beer. Staff are friendly and forthcoming.

A cute little piece of green and flowers in NYC!. We went to Bryant park after the NY public library and it was nice to relax in a beautiful green space. So many tulips blooming and wonderful views of the Empire State building in the early evening.

Relaxed yet busy. Perfect place to sit, have a drink or ice cream and people watch! Visited the park a couple of times on our trip and it felt so relaxed. We sat and had ice creams under the canopy of the trees and watched while people played games or people took lunch breaks. Both times the park was busy but didn't feel crowded. Love the little nooks people put their chairs into to get their own space! The book section where you can help yourself to a book and sit and read for a while..... An ideal place to sit and recharge the batteries, before continuing to explore the vast place that is New York.

One of my favorite 'cultural observation' spots in NYC.. I love to people watch. This is a great space to do so. Lots of people taking breaks from shopping at Macy's, Saks, Lord & Taylors or any of the other number of high-end shopping outlets here.Last time I was there, a juggling troupe had brought all sorts of items to teach anyone who was interested. A father and his son met 'grandpa' for a bit of T-ball. Teens stopped and posed for pictures together in front of the fountain.This is a great place to relax for a while. You can grab one of the folding chairs and tables or lay out on the grass. For a delicious refreshment, check out Le Pain Quotidien on 42nd across from the park. Grab it and head over for 15-30 min rest.

beautiful Park. they have ice skating, a wonderful restaurant where you can watch the people skating, they also have chess tables where anyone can play chess definatly a hopping park it is also right next to the Public Library which is huge
A Suprise. What a great place to take a little time out, we called a couple of times just to sit, the people working in the area came out in their droves, to eat their lunch

Christmas is the time to go. I love this park at Christmas time. Lots of craft vendors, ice skating (or often water skating these days) in the middle of the park, beautiful lights. Much more calm and sedate other times of years and quite a beautiful little slice of greenery in the midst of the city. So easy to get to from Grand Central, Times Square, etc.

PARK OF EVENTS. This park behind the NY Public Library between 5th Avenue and Avenue of the Americas also known as 6th Avenue is a big area with trees and many various events take place.Besides being a refuge with seats and kiosks for small snacks and also an entrance to the restaurant by Bryant Park, this is also the place where it turns out to be a skating rink area, Christmas Shopping area around the Holidays after Thanksgiving till just before Christmas carrying a variety of things from food to jewelry and goods to give at Christmas time - very festive.It is also a place where events are held - from special cultural celebrations, movies in the summer, live little concerts etc.They used to have fashion shows here too during Fashion Week. Probably too crowded now to do so - I don't think they do them here anymore.Accessible directly by subway- check out the routes. Also by bus that stops on 42nd St and 5th Avenue. Centrally located! Short walk from Grand Central as well. Many restaurants surround it. I like the ones on the south side.A nice park to visit - has Euro-feeling.

Oasis of calm in the middle of nyc. Stopped off here for a coffee last week... It was beautiful to sit in the park and enjoy the beauty and calm when 50 yards away you've just left the busiest of city streets.
A not so excited place.... It's just a small park behind the NY Public Library without much things to do. An artificial green square place in the middle of New York.

Lots to do plus people-watching!. Bryant Park has something for everyone! There are book carts to browse through and spend time sitting and reading, ping pong to play or watch, food kiosks, free wi-fi and more. Tables and chairs are provided; some in the shade if desired. A great place to visit and spend some relaxing time. There are sometimes programs going on. In the winter there is an ice-skating rink and pop-up shops to visit.

Relax in Bryant Park Near Times Square. My young adult daughter and I visited Bryant Park, which is immediately adjacent to the New York Public Library, on 5th Ave, around 40th St, after doing a free tour of the library. The park, which has been reclaimed from illicit activity over the past 2-3 decades, is well maintained, with a large span of lush grass, a water feature, a carousel, and plenty tables and chairs set up for people to sit and enjoy the outdoors. There are a range of entertainers who consistently perform in the park, including jugglers, musicians, etc. We hung out for about 1/2 hour to rest ourselves after walking for a few hours around the area and the library. It was a beautiful spring day, good for people watching. There was an operatic performance and a Shakespeare play that was to be performed later that evening. We didn't catch those events as we had other plans, but I'd go back there for the free events any day I had time.

A great alternative to Central Park. I am so glad I came here in the winter time! The ice skating was wonderful--and much cheaper here than at Rockefeller.There are cute little food stands and this part of town is more quiet than the bustle of Times Square. Go grab a drink and relax in the Park for a while--and go look at the NYC Public Library right next door while you are there!

Almost Always an interesting place. We get to NY several times a year and try and see what's going on here. In the nice weather , it is beautiful. Not too fond of all the shopping stalls, but it is New York
Lovely place for a break. Always stop off at Bryant Park when we're in NYC. Beautiful trees edge the park and soften the city noise. Great place to bring a picnic and relax.

Peaceful and fun.. We had walked all over Manhattan. We tripped upon this lovely park during lunch. We plopped down on the lawn and just enjoyed the green grass and New Yorkers spending time relaxing.

Oasis. New York knows how to do parks right. There are far, far too few parks and green spaces in Manhattan, but the ones that are there certainly are terrific. Bryant Park offers a little of most of the things to love in parks, but no sports fields. Still, there is a beautiful and beautifully maintained grass area that is surrounded by areas where visitors can grab one of the hundreds of chairs and just enjoy the pleasure of being there. It has a lending library, snack bars, restaurant, and even a games area where New Yorkers pour over chess and assorted board games. I look forward to every visit I make to this park and encourage anyone visiting NYC for the first time to put it on your "must do" list.

Little Oasis. Excellent place to just relax and people watch - easy walking distance of Times Square, Central Station and the Chrysler Building (lots really). Was only 5 mins from our hotel but because the weather was good we bought food and ate at the park - you can buy coffee etc. New York Public Library which is adjacent to the Park is also worth a visit. Lots of tables and chairs but no sitting on the grass.

This May Be The Nicest Park in the City. This small park beside the New York City Public Library is beautiful! It is surrounded by beautiful skyscrapers but has a feeling of escape from the city at the same time.

Beautiful. A great place to walk round and take photos - The Empire States and Chrysler buildings can both be clearly seen, to sit and relax enjoying coffee and a snack as there are several cafes. It's so close to Times Square but couldn't be more different. It even has a Reading Room where you can sit reading books, magazines, papers that they have available under umbrellas

Ping Pong and gardens. Fun Fun!!. Fun alternative if you are looking for a piece of green turf and don't have time to go to Central Park! You'll find yourself in a central location close to many subway lines and between Grand Central Station and Port Authority. You can chill in this clean park with chairs and tables perfect for a picnic. Play ping pong or just sun yourself with a good book. And if it rains, you can always walk into the largest and grandest public library in NYC around the corner. Or if you're a math whiz, visit the Momath museum!!! Right on the square.

Bryant Park, a bit of calm in a sea of people. . A beautiful peaceful spot in the middle of the busy city.Looking for a nice place to sit and catch up on your reading? Or perhaps to watch an artist performing his craft. Wanted to grab a small bite.... It's all here in this tranquil little spot.

Nice little park in the middle of a busy city. We stumbled into this park while walking around midtown and south of midtown. This seems to be an oasis in the middle of the chaos that is New York City.
Buzzing and very relaxing. A little oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of New York. A great place to relax and chill out with a coffee, cold beer etc and just watch the world go by.
A surprise!. I had never heard of this park until we visited. Loved it though - a really cool place to drink in NY atmosphere and people-watch.

Winter's best place!. This is such a special place! The Holiday Winter Village it's something you cannot miss. It's open during the autumm and winter but you can check the dates online. It's has ice skating, a lot of gifts shops and food for eating while you enjoy watching the people having fun on the Village atraction. Best hot chocolate ever, also!

A lovely park, a great Christmas art fair when we went. In the early weeks of December we enjoyed our visit to Bryant Park. We watched the skaters and enjoyed walking around sipping hot chocolate. There was a very nice art fair going on and I was able to purchase a number of Christmas presents while we were there.
Great place, winter or summer. Been here several times in all seasons. My personal favorite is winter when you can ice skate. But summer is great to take a picnic lunch and people watch.

A Favorite Fun Park. Love this park. Doesn't seem to make any difference what time of year it is there is always something to see and do. We have been here with a young family, teenagers and as a couple. Amazing at Christmas with ice skating, Christmas tree, Christmas Fair etc. love watching people playing chess/checkers in summer, kids enjoy in the shade of the trees, having a coffee sitting at one of the tables ...anything really

I love Bryant Park!. We visit NYC about once a year, and we always end up in Bryant Park. It is a good place to bring a lunch of dinner to eat. Their programs are outstanding and exciting-bird-watching, Broadway in the Park concerts, board games available, yoga, dancing, etc. Plus, they have the cleanest public bathrooms I've encountered in the city.

one of my favourite places. I have visited Bryant Park in the Summer and the Winter now. Both are spectacular. This ice skating in the winter and the decorations and shops are a great atmosphere and fun to be around. In the summer however it is so lovely and peaceful.I would recommend a visit here anytime of year, not to be missed, enjoy and soak up the atmosphere
Black friday. The park was filled with Xmas. It had the Xmas spirit everywhere. Venders with their unique wares. It was truly a place to buy some great Christmas gifts.
Best Park in New York. A beautiful park which is not too large but big enough to feel like there is a lot of space and quiet in a city as busy as New York.

Cool little escape in Midtown. If you're in Midtown around 42nd and 5th/6th, this park is a great place to escape to. In the summer, it's the perfect spot to hang out on the lawn and relax, or sit on a bench and have lunch from one of the take out restaurants in the park. You can even go to the Bryant Park Grill have a great sit-down meal. On Mondays in the summer, they also show free movies on an outdoor screen after work. In the winter, they set up a skating rink, which is pretty cool. And around the holidays, they have a pop up village of shops selling holiday gifts. It's right behind the NY Library, so you can pop in there and experience one of the world's greatest libraries. All told, Bryant Park is a cool like place in the heart of NYC.
new York visit. This area was also very clean and safe to walk around in. great place to sit down and rest and people watch

Bryant Park Winter Wonderland. I visited Bryant Park on my trip to New York during the winter; it was a great experience to be at Bryant Park as I was able to watch everyone ice skating and having a wonderful time. They also have a "Winter Wonderland" whereby they had mini stalls/markets to buy food/beverages, and Christmas items. Very well set up and free to watch the ice skating. Not sure how much it was to skate though.
Cute green square. You can always sit on the grass if not enough chairs are available.After a long day walking, you can relax in this green square and look at the stars.
So much fun!. Lots to do here. You can walk around or people watch, you can watch the chess matches unfolding or the bocci games. Watch the carousel. Enjoy this oasis!

Pretty Park in the centre of Manhattan. This is a relatively calm place to sit and watch NYC go by or have a coffee and waffle from the concession stands. Locals play vicious games of ping pong on the tables by E42 while kiddies can have a ride on the carousel by E40th

What a wonderful find!. We had spent half the day in Fifth Avenue shops and as we wandered to Times Square, via Maddison Avenue, we came across Bryant Park ( which we had seen on the map & put it on our reserve list of places to go). It was lunch time, a beautiful warm day and was therefore busy with office and shop workers taking their break. We joined them and stopped for a bagel and coffee. It was very relaxing and a place for adults at that time, but a lovely place to go with the family for a picnic at the weekend and afternoon!

Beautiful, but crowded. As I was there in december, there was a gourgeous Chistmas Tree, the ice skating rink and a village of Holiday Shops at Bryant Park. And I ate the most delicious wafle ever at Wafles & Dinges.

Love it. Love this place. So relaxed. People laying all around, eating, drinking coffee. Great place to relax. We used to visit it every day after wondering around the Manhattan streets. Definitely a place to reccommend!
Green in NYC. It's a nice peace of nature in a city like New York. Best to visit on a sunny day, if you need to have a minute in nature.
Create a Lazy Day!. Start your morning here overlooking the water and viewing the Statue of Liberty. So beautiful and calming

A beautiful park. We stayed in the Bryant Park Hotel and enjoyed this park very much, it was beautiful, had great vendors and it was relaxing amidst all the hustle and bustle of the city. We have been there three times and intend on going back.

Best park in NYC!. Lovely park with plenty of tables and food options and fun people watching! Restaurants nearby too. Take a book and relax there and enjoy the sights and sounds of Bryant Park. I just keep coming back!
A small slice of calm in a busy city. A beautiful oasis and breathing space in the midst of the madness of New York. Lovely place to sit and relax between activities.

A Quick Spot to relax - right in Midtown Manhattan. I always go to Bryant Park to relax and enjoy the people watching. I always grab a glass of wine and this week free piano music everyday from 12 to 2 pm . The ambiance is delightful- a bit of everything - games to play, ping pong, good food, grass to sit down - a slight carnival atmosphere but stylish settinng !

Feet up. We Subwayed (if you can make a verb from a noun) to Bryant park and enjoyed a small coffee before heading to Times Square, which is so close.
Other travellers enjoyed the sun and snoozed. It was a lovely morning for relaxing or getting ready for the fray.
Very charming small park. The park is gorgeous, just at the heart of the city with very nice view to Empire State building. We bave been coming back each evening, it was very relaxing and calm.

Sit Outside and Enjoy!. I was there as Spring broke, and the tulips that were planted around the park made it really enticing to sit out and enjoy the nice weather. It gets crowded during lunch hour but it's still worth taking time out from a busy schedule to watch the world go by.

Great!. Was in NYC for a conference but had time for some sightseeing. I've never been to the City at Christmas time. Absolutely beautiful. A bunch of shops set up around the park, ice skating and the beautiful tree all helped in making it feel like a special time of year.

An oasis in midtown. Bryant Park is such a sweet expanse of green in a part of Manhattan that is otherwise just buildings. It has changed very little since I used to take my lunch there when I was a midtown office worker 20 years ago (except it has more and better food options now). My husband and I stopped here late in the evening, and it was just magical after dark with families, couples and groups of friends enjoying the quiet space.

Lovely park. We stopped in for a sit down after walking about 50 blocks. The weather was beautiful and all the parks are just a lovely serene break from the bustle of the streets. Bryant Park was no exception.

Peaceful piece of Midtown. This park is like an oasis to escape the bustle of Midtown Manhattan. The library is right there and there are plenty of tables and chairs to relax and take in the city. There are also ping pong tables, chess boards, etc.
Living room outside in the summer!. Great place to spend your day during the summer! Nice places to have a drink or meal! Well-taken care of park!

Quintessential New York. New York's parks make the city livable. Life in Manhattan is fast-paced and intense. Once in a while you need a break. Bryant Park can provide respite, relaxation and amusement. Located across from the New York Public Library, there is a large lawn, many trees, a beautiful fountain and historical sculptures.
We love Bryant Park. We make a trip to the city once a year and we always stop at Bryant Park. It is a great place to grab souvenirs and a bite to eat while people watching.

Sunny Days. Great place to go and see the clipper is there as well as the water taxi station, there is also a cheeky little resteraunt which does an excellent pulled pork sandwich which was so good we went twice, it is called the beer garden.
very pretty. beautiful green space behind the NY library. and full of life. not to mention a few great food options.
Free, lovely place to sit in the sun in mid-Manhattan.. Done with Paris park chairs, a comfy place to sit, sun oneself and see who else is about in the park.
Bryant Park. Love this park . Great for kids, especially the carousel. Very quaint and great place to just soak it all in!
Lovley oasis in the hubub of the Midtown shopping area. Lovely park in the main Midtown shopping district with a great café/restaurant right next to the Library (do visit - it beautiful)

The best park NYC has to offer. By far the best Park in NYC and it is the 1st ever privately run Park in the US. It has the cleanest public toilet ever and healthy activities for children n adults. They have free WiFi throughout the park since 2002 and plug points to charge your devices for Free!There are plenty of kiosk selling interesting food. Starbucks is just around the corner. There is even a full-service restaurant at the NYC Public Library end of the park. This is also another attraction of the park; the library.It is not a large park and this is what makes it all the better. At every corner there is something going on; either games, reading, music, carousel etc.Security officers are very friendly, the maintenance staff keeps the park clean at all times.

Amazing gem!. I've been to NYC many times and lived there for a time. However I had never been to or spent time in Bryant park. It is incredible. It has kiosk restaurants all around as well as the Bryant Park Grill attached off the back of the NYC Library. Plus there was an el fresco dining option on the same end. There is a beautiful lawn open most days for picnicking and sunbathing. Historical statues throughout. Cafe tables and chairs and fantastic areas for fun. A free reading area where the public can pick up a newspaper, magazine or book. Ping pong tables. Board games. Etc. Etc. It put a big smile on my face and was a great place to slow down and take a breather in the city that never slows.
Lovely park. Enjoyed my relatively brief time here. Visited as part of the free tours by foot thing. Nice place to chill and catch some rays in the summer. The free Wi-Fi is a great bonus
awesome park. this was a nice surprise to see a park in the city was very clean and fun also has the best and cleanest Bathrooms in the city
Beautiful in summertime. Spend their several ours. Very lovely on the morning for breakfast (several Starbucks or French coffee houses in the nearby).

Great place to escape. Fantastic public park, sunny day we sat down and watched the world go by. Free wifi and power charging points! (teenagers heaven!). Lots going on from table tennis, coffee shops - well worth a visit to sit in the park and look up at the high rise buildings towering over you.

My favourite NYC park!. Love this park behind the New York Public library. A green sanctuary in midtown to take a break or just enjoy a coffee or the view or the Empire State Building at night. A great place to take kids if you're in the city.

My favourite place in NYC. This is my favourite place for chillin in NYC. Grab a coffee or something to eat, take a seat and get lost in the beauty of this place. Great during the summer when they organize movie nights on the opened.

A delight. A gorgeous little park, perfect for taking a break from the busy city. Grab a seat and buy a coffee, watch the world go by, or the kids on the carousel. When you're rested, pop into the public library around the corner for a wander around.

best public loos I've ever come across. this is a welcome oasis in the madness that is Manhatton, especially on a beautiful sunny day. there are food and drink vendors, tables and chairs all over or just a seat on the grass if you prefer.Daily they have free entertaiment, we happened across a Cuban band who had evryone dancing, fantastic. any tourist in New York will know how you never stop from one attraction to the next so this is wonderful in the middle ofthe madness to just stop for a couple of hours and smell thecoffee, roses, whatever is your thing. at the end of our respite a comfort stop was necessary! on the corner of the park the public loo has an attendant who runs the line like a seargent major, but boy, she is worth her pay packet. they are immaculate, beautiful and shouldbe a visitors attraction themselves. AND FREE!!!! when I left I said thank you very much and she said "your welcome" obviously not a native New Yorker
Christmas Market is good. Bryant Park is nice during Christmas as it has the "other" Christmas market. The main one is over in Columbus Circle and is way too crowded.

Small quaint park in a busy city.... We loved sitting here and catching our breath after the buzz of NYC all day. It has a lovely atmosphere and allows you to relax and people watch and rest your weary feet!

A little oasis - not far from Time sq and Broadway. . We were looking for a drink and rest after lots of walking and sightseeing and this was perfect. The outside bar was close to a pianist giving a great lunchtime performance. Very well kept gardens and interestingly, we were told that the trees were originally from London - maybe that's why I felt at home! A great place to chill out and recharge the batteries !

I Kept Going Back. Bryant Park is located directly behind the NY Public Library, and is a beautiful green, luscious area to rest and relax in the middle of the hustle and bustle of The City. There are plenty of tables and chairs, a large grassy area, and many things are going on all the time, especially when the weather is nice. Closer to the Library is an outdoor cafe for a bite to eat and a glass of wine or beer (not sure if they have a full bar). This park is very inviting and comfortable. Enjoy!
The cutiest place in NYC. We loved this area. Near the museum. The avenue. The square. And still so... Silent. Peaceful. Green. A life. People. Escape and reality.

Lovely Meeting Place. I met a friend at the B&P Cafe on the periphery of the park - such a lovely setting. I loved feeling the energy of the city and watching the people. I had a nice glass of wine and visited with my friend.

best public restrooms in the city!. Love Bryant Park all year long.Winter - the little outdoor shops are set up as a village are perfect for walking around and tasting chocolateSummer - the outdoor movies, the carousel, the pingpong and juggling, the outdoor bar with umbrellas and shade trees, the reading room with free books and games to enjoy at the tables - it's simply one of our favorite places to walk to, to relax, to enjoy a beautiful day in the city.Bryan Park is easy to enjoy with wheelchairs and strollers. There are ramps to everything. Bryant Park shares the block with the New York Public Library on 5th Ave. If you are visiting, make sure to pop in to the library and see what is the current spotlight. (Bryant Park is actually on top of the library's book storage system.)You really do need to check out the public bathrooms - sooooo clean and fresh flowers. We were SO surprised when we first got brave enough to use a public restroom - this place is great! I know it's weird to talk about restrooms in a review, but, hey, it is difficult to find restrooms to use when you are away from home.

Lovely, especially on a sunny sunday. I went to this park a few times and the best time was on the weekend when it was quiet and lots of seats were free.There are heaps of food options around the square and you can also visit the beautiful library next to it.

Relaxing. Beautiful park in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. We love to pick up a boxed lunch or dinner and just sit and relax. It's Free and there are several tables and chairs for relaxing. Maybe sit and watch a couple playing chess or a game of ping pong.

Beautiful On A Sunny Day. We'd never come across Bryant Park on previous visits to NYC but found it a great place to stop and rest awhile from the madness that Manhattan can bestow, to rest one's feet and soak up the sunshine.Situated behind the beautiful New York Public Library on W42nd just along from Grand Central Station and the Chrysler Building it offers a superb restaurant and boasts an impressive lawn which is the longest in Manhattan south of Central Park.We took off our shoes and sat on the grass admiring the surrounding architecture to recharge our batteries before continuing our walking tour of mid Manhattan.Peaceful and serene, relax and soak up the sun with the local office workers eating their lunches..

Lovely place to stop off & relax in a hectic day.. Went there twice today - we were introduced to it by the Big Apple Greeter service when we visited New York Public Library at lunchtime as it's next door. We went back later in the day & bought food from vendors around the park & sat at the tables & chairs to eat it. Lovely well run park with lots of activities going on, including games. There was a bar & places selling food, as well as the food carts around the perimeter of the park.Well used lovely park - a peaceful oasis in the middle of a hectic city.
Nice bit of escapism in the city. Was great to sit for a while in the park and people watch. a little oasis in the middle of the busy city.
Midtown's Best Park. Great park! The bathrooms are very clean, you can have drinks & good. There's a merry-go-round, water fountain and plenty of activities.
Escape the madness of Times Square. Beautiful park, nice cafes, clean air. Great place to take an evening stroll and escape the hustle and bustle of the neighbouring areas.

Dancing Lessons!. We went past this park numerous times during our one-week stay. It was a peaceful stroll through one evening and there's a carousel for kids during the day! We also happened across dance lessons going on one night after catching the subway beside it. Gorgeous place!

A quiet and charming park in the middle of Manhattan. We visited Bryant Park during our visit to the New York Public Library. We saw a timetable inside the park listing different activities offered by the park, such as mediation walks, mah-jong playing, etc. And we also learnt from the library staff that there are a few levels below the park that are actually storage space for the library. Very interesting
Nice park.. Tree, beautiful flowers in central New York. Close to 5th avenue. Right next to the big library. Eat your lunch hear!

Relaxation in The City. This park is perfect for relaxing with a book and beverage. You can grab a table and people watch. The Christmas market in Bryant Park has varied vendors as well as a variety of food. I like to visit in the fall when the market is just starting off and sit with a sweet treat from one of the many vendors and a nice warm beverage.

Wonderful place for couples' stroll and people watching. Beautiful park surrounded by skyscrapers and NYC Library. Lots of activities going on but still very peaceful. Table tennis, chess, carousel, several food options and often piano or other musical performances taking place. Interesting designated area for reading with books, newspapers and magazines provided. Rest rooms available. Park activities do change with season.
Pretty cool. Florida Family First Time in New York. Pretty Cool site to see. Outdoor Ice Skating. It was open late into the night. 02-2016.

Sunny park life. This park is a focal point for many people, lovers, workers,lunchers and of course tourists. There are lots of seats spread around and plenty of grass, a couple of eateries and a bar...which does get busy approaching mid day..the cafe does pump out quite a bit of smoke when firing up the grills, so check the wind direction?..people watching is a great pastime and no better than this venue, look out for the quirky side of New York, and a few smiles along the way...

A little oasis. Ideal place to take a rest. There are eating establishments within the park and even a small carousel for children. Although the weather wasn't great when we went, the park does offer shade.
So pretty. Such a nice little pit stop to sit and enjoy. Stumble upon Bryant Park by accident and had to go in. Was truly beautiful and well maintained.

Love this space. Nice people relaxing and doing their thing in a comfortable setting!The park has mega amounts of seating and dinning opportunity. It is behind the New York Library and is surrounded by friendly Skyscrapers!I great place to head to when the sun comes out!

Lovely and Peaceful. We visited at Christmas time, the little market stalls sell some beautiful and unique things, well worth a look. Great spot to sit and have a drink with plenty of chairs and tables around. Fab photos of the Empire State from here and close to the library from Sex in the City.

Experience ice skeet in winter. Bryant Park is ice Skeet Park for every winter time. You can learn or practice ice skeet in winter time. Beautiful atmosphere and good place to spend time with friends or family.
Relaxing Park. Bryant Park is a great place to relax, have a cup of coffee and sit down and rest for a while. Nice location and many interesting people to watch.

Hidden gem. This park happened to be close to our hotel so we passed it most days.After the first day we decided to have a proper walk round and found that the park has free board games, mini golf and it was brilliant to sit and play a game in the sunshine. There are loads to pick from and it was just a case of sitting down at a free table & away you go.There's also places to eat including wafel and dinges and it also has public toilets which can sometimes be more difficult to find in new york.

Lovely. I've walked by Bryant Park almost everyday during my stay in Manhattan... And I never got tired of the view. There's a beautiful carrousel which photography lovers can go crazy about (I myself took a load of photos of it), and the Public Library makes it even more beautiful.In the rain or under the sun, it sure is a great portrait of NYC: trees and a great lawn surrounded by huge and beautiful buildings. Extend your visit when you go to the Library - you won't regret it ;)

Pleasant way to spend time.... Bryant Park is a good stop to rest and rejuvenate when hiking around Manhattan. Its location on 42nd street by New York Public Library makes it a great place to rest your feet and watch people. Lots of tables and chairs - feel safe even at night.
relaxing. nice place to relax and enjoy the fresh air. really nice place to go when the weather is nice. they're also a a lot of places for coffee
Great space. What a lovely area to chill in. Free table tennis, seats and tables all right next to the library on 42nd street and 6th ave.

Beautiful! . Located due west of the NY public library, Bryant park is wonderful. There was an ice skating rink set up and many little shops full of Christmas items and food. Great place to have a snack and people watch.
An oasis in the middle of Manhattan!. A very nice place to relax and hang around! You can have coffee or a snack outside if the weather is good or have lunch or dinner at the fantastic Bryant Grill!

An Oasis within the stone towers. Bryant Park is easily found just a short distance from the Central Terminal. It has two different faces for winter it houses a magical ice skating rink whilst in Summer this is dismantled to increase the grassed area with a stage on which performances of bits of the Broadway shows take place.its a lovely Oasis when you've been walking your feet off. We sat and relaxed as workers took time out from their desks to sit and enjoy fast food from the kiosks in the park. there were jugglers in one corner and the place was very vibrant but pleasantly relaxing. In one corner is a Toilet who's famed for its cleanliness and has fresh flowers every day due to log time legacy of a rich investor . Once you find it I'm sure that it will be a place you re-visit. After all it's free and if you look upwards you can actually see the sky !!!!!!!
Check it Out. Lovely spot. Great Christmas Market. Great to eat lunch in the summer. If you like cocktails then this is your place? Good events program.

A place to sit and relax. This park is a great spot to take a break from all the shopping and sightseeing. There are loads of tables and chairs to sit at and have some food and the park is surrounded by various coffee shops. The park also backs onto the amazing New York Library so its well worth a visit.
Great place to just chill out! . I always stay in this area for business. Bryant Park is a great place to just walk through or stop and relax during the day or at the end of a long day!
Beauty and Peace. Bryant Park is a great place to enjoy nature and relax. Read a book (when the weather is fine), eat, drink and people watch. The public facilities are the best I have experienced!

Nice find . A evening wander around the city found us here and what a nice oasis of quiet in a busy place.
A pleasant place just to sit and rest those weary feet and watch others doing the same. Great place for a coffee and and dink or two.
lovely. Lovely peaceful area in the centre of NYC. I feel i had to write this review as within the park the ladies toilets must be one of the cleanest ever. Well done to the toilet attendant.

Best tiny park in New York City . A tiny little park next to the New York City Public Library. The park change "dress" in every season. There is a big iceskating ring in the middle during winter month, and big patch of grass over the summer to sit down, have a picnic in your lunch break. The park also has great coffee in the 42nd/6th Avenue corner :)

Every time Im in NYC I find myself in Bryant park. For so many reasons, it is an essential part of my NYC.. Bryant Park is a great place to visit all year round. In the Summertime, it is a great place to read a book and enjoy the trees and beautiful old buildings. The Bryant Park Hotel and the Library are iconic. Bryant Park Hotel is to the south of the park on West 40th. Directly to the East of Bryant Park is the New York City Public Library. It is always cool, in temperature and tone. It offers a fantastic self-guided tour. There are quite a few good places to eat close by. The Grill at Bryant Park is solid for Brunch on Sundays or lunch and dinner. They book a lot of private parties, so call ahead for a reservation. Another favorite close by is Koi, if you are solo and need a quick bite, they seem to always accommodate at the Sushi Bar. If you want a talbel you must call ahead it seems to be consistently packed. The center of the park is a hub In winter. Check out the open-air market and the Ice Skating Rink mid-October through February. Since it is a State Park the some of the offerings are made available free of charge. Check it out before you go. My NYC seems to always include Bryant Park.

An oasis of calm . We loved Bryant park and it became our regular place to stop for a coffee or sit down calmly amidst the craziness of New York. We even sat down with our take out burgers one lunchtime. It's really laid back and you don't need to buy from the kiosks to sit at the tables. Although we had a couple of great flat whites from coffeed!

Low Key Relaxation. This park is so lovely. The flowers are amazing. The grass is green and perfect. Lots of little tables to sit at and just enjoy the day or night. They have lots of little events that go on there (I have a flyer that they have on site showing them). If I lived nearby I'd definitely be frequenting this place. Since I don't I was happy to just spend a bit of time there on the way somewhere else. Also, great view of the Empire State Building.
pocket of heaven. This is a great place to chill out. Peace and green in the middle of chaos. No pressure, just beauty.

Very nice park . This park is really beautiful to spend some time in. There are lots of food options all the way around as well as in the park. Lots of seats and tables are available and power points. The library building helps to make the park feel a bit more secluded in the busy city

Perfect Inner City Park. Obviously not Central Park, but a beautiful park perfect for having your breakfast / lunch / coffee from the shops around the park! Our hotel was in Madison Avenue, so made a point of walking through Bryant Park each time!
Pretty square. There were anew restaurants around and in the square itself. It was a warm evening whilst we were there and nice just to wander through.
Christmas Village. We were here on Thanksgiving and we loved it! Cute little village with all kinds of different shops. Found the best chocolate at No Chewing Allowed. Loved watching the ice skaters.

Just love this oasis. Whenever I'm in New York I head to Bryant Park. It has an outside reading room and games room where you can borrow books and play all sorts of games like chess and backgammon. There are also game gurus on site who can help with any queries. There are coffee boothes adjacent to park and plenty of seating. This park is pretty, tidy and always has something going on - today there was a pianist in the park. Lovely restaurant in the park as well - strongly recommend visiting Bryant Park.

Lovely Place. Visited this place in December 2014.The skating rink was great although I did not use it. The Christmas decorations were fantastic and there was a Christmas market with lots of stalls with a great variety of goods.

An oasis tucked behind the Big Public Library. If you are on 42nd St, you will find the Main New York Public Library on 5h avenue. Just behind it is Bryant park - an oasis amidst city skyscrapers. Yes, trees and benches. And sometimes entertainment - but it is a place to sit, read and contemplate - a bit of green and quiet in midtown Manhattan.
A lovely place to relax . This is really peaceful oasis in the thrum of central New York. Definitely worth a stop off for a coffee to watch the world go by
Sit in the Sun and watch the locals go about their daily activities. Get a picnic lunch and go and sit in the park, enjoy a read from the mobile book store, the cleanest public toilet in NYC

Very attractive park. Bryant Park is a very attractive park in midtown Manhattan with picturesque trees and gardens set right in amongst the chaos of the busiest part of midtown. It is small but a very attractive haven from the busy area. There are a number of great food kiosks within the park (Wafels and Dinges, Le PainQuotidien and a couple of others). It is nice to visit along with the adjacent New York Public Library.

A favorite escape . Great place to relax anytime of the year. Great views of the surrounding skyline especially at night. Great holiday market and super pls r to relax from the hustle of NYC year round.

Popular Park. Bryant Park was the perfect park. Plenty of seats, Plenty to do. Children's play area with merry go round, cafes, table tennis, mini golf. Even a library to borrow a book, magazine, paper. Lunchtimes there were office workers eating their lunch, then they could learn to juggle or a little yoga. or just enjoy the sunshine.
Enjoy the people watching. Buy a coffee and spend a couple of hours people watching here. It's a great place to take a break between shopping and wight seeing.
Beautiful!!. Worth the visit.... even if you are just watching people on the ice! Inexpensive price for skating!!

All seasons. Whether its winter and skating or summer and movies, Bryant Park is a lovely place to spend a few hours right in the heart of the city. It's surrounded by restaurants/cafes and close to all subway lines and transport

A lovely park in the center of midtown.. I come to New York every few months and I love Bryant Park. For Christmas, they had a giant trees and a little Christmas market with an ice skating ring. This week, it was just a lovely stretch of green grass with a few cafes, restaurants and people enjoying the spring.
Great place to visit. Lots of little shops that are worth exploring if you have time to visit. Close by to restaurants and shops.

Bryant Park -- Tranquility near Times Square. Recently visited Bryant Park, which is one of my favorite spots near Times Square in NYC. Bryant Park is located on the corner of 6th Avenue and 42nd Street in Manhattan.
