It is a very short walk from Times Square and provides a tranquil environment steps away from the craziness of Times Square. The outdoor bar is always a great place to have seat and enjoy a drink or two as well as something light to eat. The Park offers several activities including free ping pong, chess, lawn games, etc. Highly recommended to individuals, couples, groups, and families.
Nice park. A nice shaded park close to the hotel we had chosen. Had some tables, cafés and lots of people on a sunny day.

Must Visit. Near the Metropolitan Library and it has a very wonderful Xmas market and skating rink It is adjacent to 6th Avenue and 5th Avenue where it is a pleasure, although crowded at night, to see all the Xmas decortions
Beautiful park in the inner city. A lovely park in the centre of the business district. A great place to relax and enjoy. Lunchtime was very popular for the inner city workers.
Picturesque. Ping Pong tables outside. Bocce Ball courts outside. Merry Go Round, Endless grass. Cute little café with hundreds of tables.

An oasis in NYC.... My husband and I stopped here during a one-day bus trip to NYC. So nice to relax and watch kids practice putting on a small golf green, or watch people playing ping-pong and frisbee. Plenty of places to sit, and places to grab a quick bite to eat while resting tired feet. I took a picture of the public bathroom here, because it was SO clean, and had fresh flowers and old subway tile and mosaics. Someone later told me that Brant Park's restrooms had been voted the best public restrooms in the country(!) A bathroom attendant even chastised me for not standing in line for the bathroom the right way...I was blocking the path to the men's bathroom. (Go bathroom attendants!) Stop here to "chill awhile" if ever in NYC!
nice square. nice ambiance, always full of people, ideal for hanging out and a pick nick. nice area, between 5th and 6th avenue, always full of hip and fashionable people.

tranquility in centre of midtown . We came here quite often to have a coffee / waffle and just enjoy the ambiance and rest --there were lots if activities going on with free boom reading tai chi bowls and also a merry go around

A hidden gem!. Stumbled across this on my visit. Felt like a small park in Paris. Ping pong table. Reading area complete with books and newspapers. Small kiosks of food and wonderful landscaping. A great escape from the big city right in the middle of it all.

Bryant Park belongs on a "Must-See"List for Everyone!. If you venture into Bryant Park situated on the west side of the New York Public Library, you'll discover its many charms. Whether you pick the area set aside for readers, or depending on the season an ice skating rink or a carousel, you will enjoy its charms. But you may not know that the park sits atop the library's vast storage area. But what I find most interesting is the origin of the library and park: at one time a large reservoir. filled this area, servicing the residents of Manhattan.Bryant Park is a delightful place to visit, to walk through, to sit and rest, or have a cup of coffee. I think it's a "must-see" for visitors and a haven for New Yorkers.

Back from the Dead. Bryant Park used to be a pit, a corpse rotting behind the 42nd St. Library. Now it is a vibrant public space worth walking through & sitting down at some of the tables or benches. Various events are held here in the warmer weather. There is an outdoor reading room! Another example of a reclaimed space in NYC.
Nice relaxing place to sit and take a break. Bryant Park was less than a block from our hotel so a couple of times when I was tired of walking I went and just sat in the park and people watched.

Perfect place to rest your feet.. Fortunately we had great weather on our visit so we ate our lunch hear most days. There are plenty of salad bars, pizza shops etc close buy to get your lunch and loads of free tables and chairs in the park. An oasis of green and calm right in the middle of the city. And the cleanest public toilets I have used anywhere!!
New York at its best. Had lunch here on a sunny sunday afternoon , lovely food and selection of bars and restaurant, great place for afternoon lunch

Flowers amongst the coffee tables. We visited on a sunny day. The flowers were lovely and the park looked fresh and pleasant. There were cafes everywhere on the periphery along with a few homeless folk. The surrounding building were interesting too.
An oasis of calm amongst the sky scrapers!. Walked through on our way from Times Square to Grand Central Station. Lovely spot to people watch and grab a coffee!

A great space in the heart of the city. Bryant park is a great spot to visit at any time of the year. Grab a coffee and a bite to eat and take a few minutes to recharge or do some Christmas shopping at the pop up shops set up at that time if the year. Great spot to people watch and escape briefly from the hustle and bustle of the city
Ice skating . Winter at Bryant Parking gets beautiful. The frozen fountain .... Never in my life have I seen something frozen yet so beautiful.

Oasis in the heart of midtown . Bryant Park is truly spectacular. Located near and in between to Times Square (madhouse) and Grand Central (a marvelous madhouse) - the park is amazingly peaceful and well maintained by the non-profit Bryant Park Corporation. All year they have activities like ice skating, ping pong, book readings, movie night, yoga, musical chairs, and even an annual square dance!The bathroom is also very nice but sometimes long lines.
Beautiful, relaxing park in the middle of the city.. Beautiful, relaxing park in the middle of the city. Chairs all around to relax and soak in the sights and the sun. Great place to relax.

Quiet Street in the City. My wife and I stayed at the Bryant Park Hotel during our honeymoon. Waking up in the morning to a nice view or this park was pleasant. Plenty of people out enjoying their day, but plenty of room to relax if you are so inclined.

An oasis of calm. I spent a free morning reading in Bryant Park last week and it was lovely. Not large (the size of a large square in most cities), it is a peaceful spot in a bustling city, designed to enable its users to unwind. A real treasure.

The setting of a new incredible jewel. I arrived early for one of the libraries excellent lectures, and spent a delightful half hour walking through this beautiful little park.Even on a mild winter day, people seemed to be very happy even though there was nothing special on offer.The Bryant Park Grill was serving food and I made a resolution to stop by and try it for the first time.And, of course, one of the best restrooms in all of New York City was operational and very very clean.
Lovely!. This park is a piece of heaven in the middle of the city. The gardens are beautiful and the people watching is excellent.

Nice little oasis. It is a very nice place to stop and relax in the middle of a big city. You can sit and enjoy the fresh air with family and friends. Great place to stop especially with small children when visiting the big city.

Great for a quick stop. I made a stop here after a day of sight-seeing. The park was of a good size and the buildings around it were good to look at. There were plenty of seating areas and food options.
Lovely visit on a warm and sunny day. I sat in the pub restaurant with a craft beer (Brooklyn) and french fries and people watched. Great park to relax.

It has changed. My last time in NYC was too long ago, when this park, on then infamous 42nd street, was horrible. It is a gorgeous park now. It has a restaurant and an outdoor's bar. We had a couple of beers on the bar on a magnificent sunny spring day after walking the city. Just go, you'll love it.

Times Square Respite. If you want a quick respite from the hustle & bustle of the tourist trap of Times Square, take a quick two block detour to Bryant Park, adjacent to the NYC Public Library.Chess, backgammon, bocce ball, music, food, drinks, Bryant Park has everything you want for a short break to relax, enjoy a book, or just soak in some sun.

Loved it!!!. This was our morning stop for coffee and cake. Brilliant!! It was not far from our hotel and as we had really warm weather was a good place to stop. The other bonus was free wifi!!!!! A good place to watch the world go by. Was always busy because of the weather.
Love this place. Nestled just off 42nd Street, it is a wonderful venue to hang out in mid-town on a sunny day. Concerts and the lawn are just wonderful.

An urban oasis. We stopped at a small bar/ restaurant in the park last weekend. Food, drinks and service were average, but the park than made up for it. We were seated next to the free mini golf and there was also another game there too. Great people watching and relaxing in the heart of midtown.

Nice walk through a cute little park. Took a stroll with 2 other couples through the park. Pleasant to watch the people and their many activities. We were tired and would have liked to sit but no space available.

Great for people watching. Came across this park when we were out shopping and it was a welcome break in the sunshine. It seems to be the place where wannabe actors practice their skills as all over the park there were people acting out sketches or breaking into song. Great for people watching and seeing other peoples reactions. There are some food outlets/stalls around the park too which seemed to be very popular although we did not try any of them ourselves.

A beautiful scenic park behind NY Library. Beautiful, green leafy space in spring, in the midst of the hustle and bustle of NYC, amazing art deco building views and the Empire State....deck chairs in the sun, great place to sit and rest a while, eat lunch, enjoy a coffee, there are books to read in the pop up library, or play a game of chess, and watch the people of the world go by....slow down the pace.

Beautiful every day of the year. One of my favorite places in NY, located near to Times Square, this lovely park have a beautiful carousel, cute shops in Christmas, a ice sky park in winter with a cool bar and restaurant and in summer they have movies, and if you are hungry or want a good coffee in front of the park its Le pain Quotidien who it's fantastic.

Relax time!. I was passing through the park and rest for awhile. I had a coffee and sit for awhile. I saw some people playing table tennis, some are having chit-chat, some came there for study. I wish park should be abit bigger in New York since place is over crowded.

Just so very crowded. This park has really seen a renovation over the decades. It's a good place to hang out and have a coffee, providing you can find a seat! Well restored and a very nice little break in the day.
Beautiful at night ..... It's lovely to watch the skaters and enjoy a drink or snack from one of the little huts in the park.

Favorite park to unwind in the city.. Beautiful spot to take a break amongst the madness. Sit and chill on the many chairs available. Take in the skyscraper views or just do some great people watching. Grounds groomed year round. Particularly magical during winter festival.

Lovely on a warm day. This is an oasis from the city in the heart of it. Lots of seating even if you aren't spending money. Free wifi. A number of great places to eat and drink in the sunshine. Free entertainment. We found ourselves there 3 times over a week visit
Chilled. Brilliant on a sunny day. Garden very colourful. Chairs to sit and chill. The terrace bar isn't cheap 15 dollars plus tips for 2 drinks but great experience and the staff very friendly
Gorgeous. A much welcomed oasis in the city, nice and cool on a warm day and a great place to relax while planning your next move.

Small but pretty. Really more of a square than a park but with some grass and greenery. A quiet oasis in the middle of the city. It has a café, toilet faciliites,plenty of benches and extra activities eg an outside library and games areas. Good to sit and escape.

Walk, sit and sip. We were looking for a place to take a break for a while while exploring the city and we found this. There are some chairs you can occupy to sit down and chill for a while. We had starbucks drinks on our hand and watch people and cars passing, nice break in the city. There are some cute restaurants/building around too that adds more charm in the ambience.
holiday. quiet a little gem in the middle of the sky scrappers. we sat in this park in lovely sunshine. little cafe style buildings where u can buy snacks & sit and eat.

When in town. Bryant Park is always a must stop when in town, because where do you have a park like his in a concrete jungle( literally)Relaxing to sit here and just people watch in the crazy pace of NYC

Excellent choice for tourists to take a break. When you spend endless hours of walking around in Manhattan, then Bryant Park is the excellent choice year-round. We visited during a sunny spring day and enjoyed the relaxation of the place, right in the heart of NYC

peaceful in the middle of everything. With a big grassy area in the middle, Bryant Park is surrounded by places to eat, meet or just sit an people watch. Good place to just take a load off before you continue to explore NYC.

Great spot to chill. Sat down for an hour watching the world go by and having a few beers. What could be better. It's not far to walk but if your that side of town stop and take a breather it's worth it as an oasis which is needed

Best Christmas Market. Fabulous location. Great range of stalls with lots of unique items for sale. Good food stalls, try the soup in a bread bowl, located by the Friends Fountain. Delicious. Ice rink in the centre of the market.

Xmas market was adorable. I visited last xmas, I was there just before and was able to visit the park with the market. It was perfection. THe ice skating ring was full, the markt had from decorations to food and everything in between. Nice afternoon to enjoy the outdoors despite the snow.

Great park with many versions. This park transforms with the seasons. In the winter is an ice skating ring, in the summer they have concerts, yoga, dance classes, during Christmas they have artisans, and also in winter time the NY Fashion show!

Other parks are more interesting. We went to Bryant Park during our 14 day stay in NYC.
We did not find the park interesting, instead of going there, we would recommend Battery Park, High Line Park or Central Park, where the views and locations are much nicer.

Great All Year Round. My favourite time is when they have the Christmas tents for shopping. This is right behind the wonderful Central Library that is on 5th Avenue. Sit and have coffee and a sandwich at the spots provided and enjoy the view/people watching. Used to be run down but now another haven in this metropolis for a break. There are food kiosks year round and a skating rink in the winter months where you can rent skates. Something for everyone.

Lovely little park. We had dinner at the Bryant Park Grill our first night (recommended) and returned to this lovely park on our way to see the Library another day. Daffodils in bloom, a band practicing - it is delightful.
Decent sized Ice skating rink at Christmas. Lovely area, great craft craft market and food when we visited late November with ice skating (which we didn't try)
A green haven. A nice place to sit,and have a drink and something to eat.There are not that many green places in the city,so sit and watch.
Relaxing Convivial Fun. An oasis of convivial intermixing. Conversation. Food. Chess. Shade and flowers. Low level noise. A square of sky and and walls of glass.

A small green oasis. We were told to visit this park, but it was a very cold windy day, and we really only walked through it on our way to somewhere else. Make it 20C on a calm day with blue sky and it would be a lovely place to sit under the trees, have a coffee or similar, and rest the old legs.

MUST SEE DURING CHRISTMAS. Honestly, it is the best place to go in winter during Christmas season. You can ice skate there, as well as in Rockefeller and Central Park. But in my opinion, this place is more charming, because you are skating between very high buildings. You can even see the Empire State. Also there is a cafe in this plaza too, and they put some christmas music, jazz, that makes you feel really cuzzy and kinda feel the spirit of christmas. There is also a market, where you might find hats, christmas accesories, hot chocolate and other sweets. A must see during this season, I highly recomend this place.

Spring time magic. This is a beautiful gem of a park, located next to the Public Library, and not far from the Rockefeller Centre, Central Station, the Empire State and more. I discovered it the first morning I was in NY when I was looking for a place for breakfast. I was really happy with what was on offer at Le Pain Quotidien (there is one in Bryant Park, but also a larger one with a shopfront over the road) and thoroughly enjoyed sitting in the dappled sunlight surrounded by gorgeous tulips. Later on in the day the park was abuzz with people playing chess and backgammon, with kids on the carousel and a whole range of other food and drinks places open. The place was really buzzing. It has a subway station right underneath as well so is very easy to get to and from.
Best park in NYC. The atmosphere here is fantastic. Also a lot of locals come here in the afternoon for a drink. The small cafes and bars playing relaxed music makes it a must see and go

A touch of Europe in the middle of Manhatten. Green and gorgeous. Grab a coffee and croissant and settle in for some people watching. Alternatively take your camera and get some fabulous shots of the city skyline. Spring planting just glorious with tulips in abundance.

It is beautiful in the spring with colorful flowers. There are tables & chairs out to sit on to enjoy eating a snack or reading a paper There is also a book section where you can borrow a book to sit & read a very pleasant place to relax
2nd visit. A lovely respite from all of the hustle and bustle. Lots of seating. At holiday time (Nov), there are tents with merchants selling all kinds of goods.

What an amazing place. . Full of life and things to do. A vibrant find on our walk to Aladdin. There are ping pong tables, juggling stations, reading stations and a wonderful large fountain to name a few of the park's amenities. Bring your camera. The Empire State Building rises in the background. Next to the building where the New Year's Eve ball drops. If you have kids, you must go there.

Wow!!. Wow just wow. This park is a must see we loved seeing it everyday. It is nestled in a great safe location. Food and entertainment all in one place. See people playing checkers or chess. Relaxing in the sun or reading a book. There's coffee, tea and croissants what more do you need. Get there when your in NYC!!!

Class . December 2015. Found this place by accident. Had a great Christmas Market with loads of stalls. People playing French bowls who I could have watched for hours because they were brilliant and the big Ice skating rink but know it's only up for Christmas.
i love Bryant Park. This is a magical place any time of the year. the public library is one border. this place has a lot of tables and chairs and even a children's carosel.
Very nice. If you like ice skating, The Bryant Park is a good choice. Besides that, you're able to find many places around from the park to drink and eat something.
nice. a small park behind the new library york , nice to chat with friends and making new friends also always full of people

My Fave place in NYC. in the middle of the city, surrounded by big buildings is located this beautiful place, amazing to have lunch there or coffee in the afternoon, there are always activities like yoga in summer and an ice ring in winter, just to go there and lay on the grass is amazing. You also have a view of the Empire State Building. Totally recommended.

Nice and Quaint - but there are Better Stuff. This would be a good place to go if you have kids or if you are into skating. There are small cafes around and it's just next to the New York Public Library. If you have time and are interested in people watching you may spend some time here...
Play backgammon at this park!. Really nice park and the restaurant beside it was fantastic today. The one in the park. People playing games and seem happy.

Shakespeare's Birthday. . Beautiful day in the park! Flowers in bloom, plenty of seats, a live band, then all sorts of random -and so well organized - people reading bits and pieces of Shakespeare. Pure city magic.
A nice park on 5th Avenue. What a nice and beautiful park. But every park is beautiful in New York. A green field on which you can forget how busy New York is

Slice of Eden in amongst all the tall buildings. Busy but many sponsored seats still available. Amazed at the stark contrast between lush gardens, dense canopies of trees and tall buildings as a backdrop.Smells of food were amazing, timing not right LOL.

Cute little park, nice oasis in business district, nice restaurants. A few different restaurant options in a small park surrounding by office buildings, shops, and behind the NYC Public Library. Worth a visit to relax and people watch.

Love this park. I love going to this park! It's a nice place to take a break from all the walking around in NYC. The restrooms really impressed me!! They were well maintained and I was impressed with the automatic plastic covered toilet seat covers! Wished they had these available everywhere!

Bryant Park. Such a beautiful park to relax and get away from the hustle and bustle of the city! Find a table and chill, they also have racks of free magazines to read which is nice, put down your phone and enjoy this serine park! You'll be glad you did!
Nice little park. This is a nice spot, with stunning architecture around it, in a central position for this part of town.

Grab a sandwich and enjoy the park. If going to the park during the week go before noon. It gets very busy and difficult to find chairs. My preference would be to go early enough to get an umbrella table and chairs.

Nice and Relaxing Green Space. Bryant Park is a refreshing green space with plenty of chairs to relax and enjoy a Spring day. The tulips, daffodils and other flowers were in full bloom. After dodging the fast-moving pedestrian traffic on the sidewalks, our grandson was able to walk at his own pace without fear of being trampled. We enjoyed a great view of the Chrysler Building as we left the park on the Northeast corner.
My Favourite Park. Beautiful park when we visited in April ,lovely to sit and chill or read a book . Free Wi-Fi while you are enjoying the ambience
A mall. Great place for entertainment and recreation.There is a huge skating rink and a lot of cafes where you can get warm and rest.

Chill out in the sun. Great pace to chill and people watch. Coffee house on the corner and plety of seats around the well kept park. We couldn't believe it when a stranger came and sat at our table,we didn't realise the park had charging points and he only wanted to recharge his phone.
Delightful Oasis in Manhattan. A small park, to be sure, but not without it's charms. Delightful place to get a cup of coffee and watch the people.
Beautiful location.. Lovely flowers blooming even though it was below 40 degrees. Nice place to sit and have lunch or any meal for that matter.
Brief stop. While zipping around town did a quick "pit-stop" here... Fantastic city park bustling with activity, people watching, street vendors etc..etc... Worth your time !
Beautiful and peaceful beauty. Almost a perfect retreat in the city to sit and read and reflect. Our stop was intended to be at the library (closed) but we found this beauty. A treasure.

Love Bryant Park!. Bryant Park, perfectly located near 42nd St. for a rest and snack, is my favorite stop during the holiday season. Food kiosks abound, as do shops during for holiday shopping. The ice skating rink is great if you skate, and just as much fun for people-watching. The music is atypical of skating rinks, and lovely. Small tables and chairs are scattered around the rink. The holiday decorations are beautiful, especially their Christmas tree. And, as an aside, the ladies room surprised me - clean and monitored and very nicely appointed!
little park betwwen the sky scrapers. A lovely little park between the skyscrapers. has ice skating, and a cafe. nice area to relax. and a number of monuments

A must see attraction!!. My wife and I visited Bryant Park twice during our visit to New York. This is such a lovely park and we went to lay down on the beautiful lawn and just absorbed the cities vibes into our souls. My suggestion to any visitor is to do some research before hand and see what activities are underway at the park. Some times they air outdoor movies. Lots of photo opportunities so make sure your camera battery is loaded.

Winter visit. What another great visit to NYC this winter Headed to Rockefeller center but first stopped at Bryant-ParkDid some window shopping, had something to eat and drink It was safe and clean and the three seemed even larger than RC this past year hmmmmIf you can’t get to the RC please go to Bryant Park instead Although they had ice skating my GF does not ice skate  so I refrained
Bryant Park. 42 street between 5th and 6th avenuenext to New York Public LibraryOurdoor Restarants and cafesopen air concert

Take a breather from the bustle of surrounding streets. If you are staying in the theater district and want to relax a bit and get away from the crowds, come to Bryant Park. It's not a big park but I can always find a table to sit and eat cheesecake from Junior's or share a bottle of wine. In the summer they have free movies in the park and during the Christmas season, there is a Christmas market and ice skating rink. Quite charming.

Beautiful Park behind New York City Library. A lovely parked shared by visitor and residents of New York. There was a huge yoga class in session, a beautiful old carousel, and lots of space for people to just walk or have a coffee.

Christmas Market and skating.. Beautiful little park that transforms into a European style Christmas market around the holidays. Lots of unusual gifts and fun foods. Very cozy at night too with the lights and ice skating.
Magical place. Whether a movie in the park, ice skating or browsing the winter shops, you're in for a magical experience.Grab a glass of wine and enjoy your surroundings

A Pretty Little Park Just When You Need One.. We were drawn to Bryant Park by the sound of the bagpipes. It was Tartan Days as we arrived and there was some quality celtic singers shivering in their tartan wraps and pulling large crowds with their siren song. The park itself is lovely with a cute little carousel, a nice little shop where you can by a cup of coffee or something to eat, and a few seats and tables scattered around. The park is in the perfect spot to rest your feet if you have been exploring and need to sit and breathe for a minute. I would take several in fact. It sounds as if there is often various events held at the park and if you are lucky they my be every bit as nice as the Tartan Day festivities.

Great spot for a break. With its central location just steps off 42nd street this little gem of a park provides a place to sit and take a rest during sightseeing. Just behind the New York public library, between Times Square and the shopping of Fifth avenue it is a great spot for like much or a snack. In the winter there is ice skating and in the summer tables and chairs, greenery and a fountain. There is a restaurant on the grounds and kiosks selling drinks and snacks but your best bet is to go to one of the many delis on the streets around the park and take your picnic to one of the tables. Just get there early if it's a nice day!

Always a favorite. Great park for people watching . Always something going on according to season . They are currently taking up the ice skating rink and replacing with sod . Outstanding place to relax and get away from the city hustle --if only for a short time .

The best part of the Trip. it really was amazing sitting and watching everyone during their lunch hours really a wow , those venders must be making a killing everyone having lunch drinks enjoying the beautiful weather
Is this the rink near radio city?. If it is then I was there a week ago and they had rmoved the ice. I think they re doing repair work on it

Lovely Place To Relax. We stopped in and sat for an hour. Lovely place to soak in the sun and watch children play. Several options for drinks and snacks. Nice play areas for families. Very relaxing park!

The park with the cleanest public toilets. This little park is amazing, clean, beautiful flowers, live music and movie screens in the summer. Lots of seats to have a rest from pounding the NYC streets and it has the cleanest toilets with vases of flowers and its own Lavatory Manager !!!! Plus a stones throw from Times Square. Got to be on visit list.

Very green. I am very impressed by their lawn. There is a sign that says "Lawn closed" and no one is on it I mean this is NY and not one person was on the lawn lol. Still find that part amazing. It just goes to prove that they respect the park.

sometimes even New Yorkers have a few minutes to spare. what a great place to spend some down time. the Park has been cleaned up. It's safe, its interesting and it's size makes the people watching that much better

great space in the middle of the hubbub!. Bryant park is a great little park in the middle of the hustle and bustle. It is beautiful and complimented by free lending of books, bistro tables, benches and food carts. Highly recommend stoping by in the middle of a busy day in the city, to relax, decompress and sip or nosh on something to recharge you.

A real gem. Situated next to the Public Library and a few streets from Times Square this is a real gem of a park. We visited three or four times during our stay and had the best ice cream (next to the shopping centre there is a great cart where you can pick up dreamy massive ice cream for 7 dollars) and played scrabble and park games. Great for sunbathing, people watching and taking in the city.
Free game play. Before lunch for a fast chess play or other table game , really a relaxing place , not so touristic and out of normal travel path.
Lots of activities and people watching. Bryant Park is a must destination in the city. There is usually so much going on there, festivals, holiday vendors and great people watching.

Trip to the city. The park is beautiful in the spring. The lawn was a lush green and the flowers were absolutely stunning and colorful! We enjoyed sitting at the little bistro table enjoying the sun and atmosphere.
Lovely chilled out area.. We sat off in Bryant Park for 30 minutes to let the world go by. It has plenty of places to buy food and drink and is a real good place to chill out.
April may not be time to go. The tree lights were gone and it was just a small park near Empire State. Good for eating your sandwiches and resting weary feet but apart from that nothing to review
Sunny day out. It is a great place to enjoy New York weekend evenings. Do keep a look out for performances at this place. Last time i dropped by, there was a play being enacted.
May 2012. great are for kids and family was save place and great shopping during this time with a lot of people from different place
Lovely . An oasis in the heart of the city. Backing on to main library a nice green space popular with local workers on lunch. Nice places to eat in area, lots of seats to eat your own take out food.

Beautiful but very busy . Go on a warm day and get a table at the green side it's just gorgeous and when it's hot you get the sun all day long,,,it's a gorgeous little place to have a coffee and watch the world go by

Lovely green space. We enjoyed lunch with a friend here, great open space with lots of food vendors, a games area with chess & other games we didn't recognise:-)
I believe in the summer they show films & have other events. So well worth looking up.

Waste a few hours watching the world go by. We had a few hours to waste before our flight back to UK
The sun was out the park was busy and the smell of beautiful flowers in the air made it perfect

Great Vibe. We sat and ate our breakfast here every morning of our visit to NYC. A lovely little oasis in a very busy part of town.
There's a table tennis table, ample chairs and tables for eating, and pretty views of both the park itself, and various NYC icons.

Beautiful Bryant Park!. Bryant Park is beautiful with its trees and green grass. Everywhere is tulips and daffodils. You can sit and relax at tables and chairs admiring the beautiful buildings surrounding Bryant Park. There is many restaurants and activities. There is even an outdoor library and table tennis.

A Harbinger of Spring. Spring came late to NYC this year. We arrived at Bryant Park on a chilly Sunday morning wearing wool caps and mittens. Although barren winter trees crowned the park, thousands of bright yellow daffodils and tiny, purple hyacinths blossomed all around us. Warm coffee, winters rays of sun, and a Sunday paper. Who needs more?

Bustling. Quite relaxing and able to sit and watch world go by. Table tennis boules and other activities to do for free in this little charming park. Small carousel aswell as little places to enjoy waffles or just a drink.
Sunny spot to linger. On a frosty but sunny day - this park is a treat to sit in and soak up the rays. Get a coffee and find a place in the sun to watch people.

The good and the very good. The very good first. A great small park smack in the middle of the city. Plenty of sitting chairs and tables. Fun to walk around during lunch time and people watch (should become an Olympic sport...). The plain good - very small and due to re-planting, could not enjoy the lawn
Good in the sun. Nice in the sun to sit here and have some lunch and watch the passers by. Always seems to be something going on you can do or join in with.

great park especially for movie night. Go here when they are showing movies at night. Great thing to do for a date or for couples. I am sure there is a guidebook for when and which movies are being shown.
Beautiful. Lovely flowers and landscaping. A great place to relax and enjoy the scenery. Lots of seating and food stands all about.

Nice and fresh in the center of the city. Bryant Park is a very nice place and works well for both meeting people or just relaxing on your own. There are a lot of things going on and you can, especially on a warm summer day, spend several hours in the park without getting bored. And it's perfect to recover from the shopping spree for a while.
Wonderful. Absolutely loved sitting here, in the midst of all the buildings, having a coffee, glass of wine, watching NY go by. Public library right beside it so worth a visit.

Best Park in NYC. With its wide range of offerings of bars, restaurants, reading room, kids activities, etc. in a relatively smaller setting (compared to Central Park), I find this park a lot more enjoyable and manageable than Central Park.

Nice respite during a busy day walking the city. Spring had sprung the day we strolled through. Happy people enjoying the flowers, grass, "fresh" air, and the beverage and food vendors just opening for the day. I had been to NYC a zillion times, but this was the first time I actually stopped to smell the flowers.

So Nice on a Beautiful Spring Day. We walked through this park on our way to the New York Public Library. It was lunchtime so the tables werel full of people enjoying the beautiful day. There was a free reading area with books and periodicals. There is a table tennis area and a juggling area. It is a nice place to grab a bit to eat, a glass of wine and people watch as long as the weather is nice.

Fun place to people watch. Go in the evening, when it's cool. Grab a Starbucks and just sit and watch the world go by. At night, you can also see the Chrysler building lit up -- as well as the Empire State. Got a buddy that likes ping pong? play a game. checkers or chess? yep.

Lovely Park. On a warm evening we ventured into Bryant Park. It was large, but not overwhelming. From the waterfalls, to the decor including umbrella covered tables, to the swings, to the beautiful gardens, and the lighting, everything was lovely. The entrance to, food and service at the restaurant was great. This park is very inviting simply lovely, and highly recommended.
Lovely small oasis in mayhem of NYC. I spent a good couple of hours here enjoying the spring sunshine.Great location, good refreshments and free!

Bryant Park Public Walking Tours. It was a booking that I made to fill in some time between other tours but this walking tour around Bryant Park turned out to be one of the best ones we did while in New York.Bryant Park is located just behind the New York Public Library and under its grassy area there is a huge vault for the library that the Library / Park developed so that the library could store over 3 million books on site. Our guide was Amanda and let me tell you she knows her park's history, now and future - the park is completely privately funded that is NO Government money spent. So to be able to complete all of the changes and plans that they had without charging anyone is amazing. Amanda explained how the park was an above ground water reservoir back in the old days and how in the 1980's it really wasn't a place you would want to be near or meet friends - so the changes that this Corporation has made is just short of miraculous - the Park now days is busy every day (they count people so they have numbers to work on and amend their future plans) they employ staff to man "rooms" such as the ping pong area, reading room, games area and gardeners and so much more.But the highlight of the whole Park has to be the public toilets - in a city that isn't known for great loos these are amazing and modelled on hotel toilets - there is an attendant (1 male and female) keeping everything clean and making sure there is no funny business - seriously you just have to visit to understand just how awesome toilets can be.Along with the toilet attendants the Bryant Park Corporation also employ security that work very closely with the NYPD to ensure that the park is safe. No matter when we went to Bryant Park (which we did several times while in New York) we felt safe. We really enjoyed the tour and as a bonus it was FREE you just need to book on their website. Would defiantly do this walking tour again when next in New York to see how many of the future plans have been completed or if the way people use the park has changed their plans.

Annual Visit for Christmas Gifts. I love Bryant Park. Every year, on my birthday, I go into the city, see a musical, eat at Olive Garden and go shopping in Bryant Park. Shops open around Thanksgiving weekend and end the weekend of New Year's. There are so many neat crafters and my family always buys Celtic gifts from one of the vendors. I used to love ice skating there before I busted my knee. Overall it's a great place. For tourists, it's right by Grand Central and the NY Public Library, which is an amazing piece of architecture to explore as well.

Great play to sit on a sunny day. I love this park - I always get a hotel nearby when I come to NYC. The flowers are beautiful in warm weather. Lots of chairs and tables to sit as long as you like. Restaurants at one end - window service for drinks and snacks at the other. There are food carts around the park as well. The library is also nearby - I know you may wonder why go to a library on vacation, but it is a beautiful building inside and as a lot to offer - check it out, Also has a vey nice souvenir shop. There is a Merry-go-round for the kids.

Lovely little park!. If it's a sunny day, then this is a perfect little oasis of green situated behind the library. A choice of outdoor places to buy snacks & drinks & enjoy the views of the city, the pretty fountain or to just sit & watch the world go by. We had breakfast there one day & went back a few days later with lunch we'd bought from the amazing deli in Grand Central Station, just a few blocks away.

Love this park . An enjoyable spot, blooming flowers, and a place to sit. The water fountain is at one end, the public library at the other. In between is all green and lovely. Great French bakeries and restaurants surround the park. Great spot.
Awesome Little Park. This place is great. It is much more calmer than most parks in the upper portion of Manhattan. The Southwest Porch is super cool. Great place.

Green Oasis in the Midtown Area. Lovely little park with seats tables and shade right in the middle of Manhattan. On a sunny afternoon we sat for an hour or so no watched the city hurry by. Great idea and well maintained, with no litter despite the obvious useage.

An Oasis in the Heart of New York. You can ice skate in the winter,play chess, picnic , ride the pretty carousel or just watch the passing parade.You can also purchase food and drinks and even borrow one of the library books to read while you take a break !

European Park in NYC. Bryant Park is a small European style park in the middle of midtown where New Yorkers can come to take a break in the middle of the day. I bought a sandwich and joined the locals enjoying a break in this pleasant park.

Beautiful Park. The archetypal New York City park. Just behind the library this is a compact but restful park in the city. Lots of Parisian style chairs and tables. Clean, quiet, and peaceful with beautiful landscaping.
Quick seat. Stopped while on our walk up to Grand Central. Beautiful fountains had recently been redone. Had tables and chairs was nice

Definately go there on wed/thursdays in summer. They have free shows. We saw Brandy (!!!) sing with a broadway show demo there at 12:30. No mistaking that voice. A few free tshirts as well, but you better line up early for those. Instead of crowding into the field, chose a shady (and peaceful) park bench by the fence for a truly wonderful experience.

Walking thru New York. . I had to go on business to New York. There were certain things I wanted to see while I was there for only a few days. I happened onto Bryant Park which is a beautiful little park located in the middle of the city. They were putting on a play while I was there. It is a very nice place to stop walk through the trees hear the birds it is a calm and quiet place in the middle of a crazy city. So many restaurants nearby and shops to visit it is a great place to see while you're there.
Oh yes!. Whether it's summer movie/dance nights in the park or winter ice skating that gets you, it's always great to be at Bryant Park!@@

Culture, character and atmosphere at Bryant Park. Spring time in Bryant Park offers, beautiful spring gardens, a bar, food vendors, outdoor games (chess, checkers, ping pong, juggling), an old fashioned merry-go-round and much more

A quiet spot. A lovely location for a quiet sit down amid all the hassle and bustle. There are some good hotels here, with super friendly staff. And also the ladies in the subway booth in this square were very helpful.

Tranquility near times square. Lovely park, with plenty of seating to enjoy lunch, breakfast or escape the madness of the streets of NY. They have a few food stalls and free Wifi in the park. Only 5 mins from Times Square - a definite must.

Nice small park to get away from the busy streets. Nice small park to get away from the busy streets. It is less known to tourists and therefore it is perfect to enjoy your picknick/lunch/dinner in peace.

Oasis in the madness. . Of all the things I miss from my trip to the concrete jungle, Bryant Park is the most. It became my favourite place to soak up the atmosphere of New York. The free wifi was good, the public toilets were lovely and clean (the toilet attendant was lovely too!) and the small kiosk called Breads Bakery serve the best pastries! A must visit for anyone visiting the city!
Fantastic Green Place behind the NY Library. This place has a special attraction, is a green field with garden and trees surrounded with historic buildings, it is really beautiful park.

Gem in the heart of the city. A must see, played a few board games, some ping pong and stopped for an espresso...you ca even get a juggling lesson if the guy is around. Friendly helpers...a nice spot to borrow a book and get a little downtime amidst all the hustle and bustle.

Ice skating was great . We came from Australian for my partners birthday to ice skate! We had drinks and food and skated. Highly suggest to byo skates the hire ones were very uncomfortable - top place to ice skate

At Christmas time it's a must !. Everytime I go to New York at Christmas time we spend time at Bryant park. The littles shops are charming, the skating ring is nice, there is a few sitting area where you can chill and have a drink. I can't wait to go back !
Most happening place. Lot of hustle bustle...this place is always crowded and great during christmas time. It's the heart of times square. Must visit.

Great park. This is a small but very interesting park to visit. They have ping pong tables, chess sets, a merry go round. Ladies check out the automatic seat covers in the ladies room...it was fascinating!!!!

Awesome and wonderfull New York!. One of the nicest squares in the city not for it's beauty ,but for being pure New York style. Free wi-fi and lots of locals make this place perfect for a light lunch. Definetly a must!!!
Essential to your NYC experience. While I love Central Park - Bryant Park really feels like you are part of what is NYC daily life. Awesome!

Must see !!. One of the quaintest areas of new to visit during Christmas time. Amazing ice rink and beautiful sales booths selling all manner of trinkets and gifts (and the best hot chocolate in the city). Have never visited during December without stopping by for a walk around !

a Jewel of a Park. We happened upon Bryant Park while walking around the New York Public Library and were struck by the beauty and serenity there. In a crowded, busy, fast-paced city, such spots are real refuges, places to collect your breath and to appreciate nature. The trees were bare in early April, everything wet with fresh rain. It's easy to imagine how lovely it must be in summertime.

Great park during the winter or summer time. A nice park to visit during the summer and winter. I've done both, during winter months they have an ice skating area. In the summer it's just great to people watch and grabbing a bite. During the winter they have I closed little shops around.
Neat park. We were there during night time and it was cold but we thought it was a very neat park. I noticed coffee and snack stand with outdoor sitting.

Great place to relax in sun . Lovely place to relax over a coffee and could have sat there all day people watching. Grass area was closed off due to new lawn. They have films on big screens playing in the summer so we were told

Lovely oasis a few blocks from Times Square. This park is a great place to sit and enjoy some green space and watch people go by. In the winter there is an ice skating rink. In spring the daffodils are blooming. There are a couple of refreshment stands. You never know what you might find. We walked through the park a few times. Once we saw a group of bagpipers in kilts playing away. Another time we saw performance artists in bright yellow outfits moving slowly across the park in a giant elastic band (you had to be there).
A CLASSIC STOP NEAR TIME SQUARE. As you visit Time Square be sure to stop at Bryant Park. Great music, a full bar and a wonderful place to take a break on your journey.
Great park to relax. This is a great park for relax and rest when you are walking for hours in Manhattan, aditionally, you can find public restrooms, chairs and tables.

Stunning park! Great place to people watch and relax.. The main lawn was closed when we were there, but it's still so gorgeous! Tons of sunlight despite the surrounding buildings...would be really great spot to hang out on the grass and people watch, read or just relax.
FOC wifi and beautiful place. It has foc wifi. d park also have eateries and a scenic fountain for photos. its nex to the library and has a public toilet.
Nice park. Cool park near time square with some nice lawn and chair areas to sit down and relax. A few coffee shops and waffle places too to grab a drink or a bite to eat
lovely atmosphere. Went in October, lovely Ice rink, Lots of places to eat and Drink and little huts with craft type serviners.
Amazing place to relax. Bryant park is definitely a must for any visit to New York. Grab some lunch and sit at one of the many tables and enjoy the peacefulness and serenity of the place.

Just love it ! . The winter market is beautiful and the iceskating rink is a lot of fun. Nice location in the city, perfect to grab some food and chill with friends or with your partner!
In summer the movie festival of great go with food, company and a blanket and enjoy a classic movie for free in the nice NYC summer weather!

A surprising find. We often walked past this park to get back to our hotel. It is just a quiet place to rest after the busy shops. It actually backs on to the library and there are stands for coffee, bagels etc. There are seating areas. There is also an information board which tells how the park has been transformed in recent years.

A wonderful oasis.. Bryant Park was definitely amongst the highlights of my trip to New York. A beautiful vibrant park with something for everyone. There was live music when we visited, people playing outdoor games, others sitting reading quietly. On one visit we had drinks at the outdoor bar and found everyone to be so friendly and chatty. On another visit we had a delicious lunch at the cafe. If, (hopefully when!) I visit New York again this would be one of my must-do activities. The perfect place to catch your breath in this wonderful bustling city.
Sunday summer sun. Bit chilly but good in the sun. Nice place to chill and watch the world go by. A few street artists ploughing their skills in the area
Catch a Free Summer Concert. A great place to sit and catch your breath. Look out for the impromptu free concerts by major artists. Love this place and it really close to all of he major attractions

Nice park. We came across this park one morning- next to the library- nice green space amongst all the high buildings. It has clean toilets, lots of places to get a coffee or some food. Loads of chairs to sit on, surrounded by shops, nice feel to the place. Good place to chill out in the madness. Free wifi!!!

Lovely little oasis in central Manhattan. Bryant park was a lovely little find in the middle of our day.Surrounded by fascinating buildings, it still manages to get a lot of day time sunshine. On one side is the Bryant Park hotel, a beautiful old building with incredible detail. On the other is the 'Grace' building, beautiful in a completely different, modern way. At the 'end' is the rear of the New York Public library.In between is the park - calm, serene, pretty. The surrounding streets aren't too busy with traffic, so it's not particularly noisy. There are some 'kiosk' style cafes and plenty of seats, and trees and flowerbeds line the edges. There's also a carousel, which went down very well with 10 yo DD!It's not very big, so it's no more than a passing distraction, but it's a great place to take a break in a busy, busy city.

Nice park in between big buildings. I decided to visit Bryant Park on Sunday morning after reading about it. Small park among sky-crappers. It was dry as month was March. Chilled morning. Couldn't find worth coming again.
Fun watching ice skaters. We had fun shopping in the little shopsBought puppets too!There was food to buy.The kids liked ice skating the best.

Gorgeous! Reminded me of France! . As my first trip to New York I stayed at a hotel close to Bryant park. The trees, the flowers, and the seating reminded me of my trip to Paris years ago. It was beautiful-even being very busy it still had an elegance to it. I highly recommend taking a moment to sit here in the park. There are vendors with food to eat and a restaurant covered in beautiful vines here.

Catch Your Breath Here! Whew!. Butted up against one of the busiest areas in The City (Times Square) this wonderful park gives a spell of relief in between jostling crowds and street corner hucksters. Some wonderful kiosk-style eating options to be enjoyed on any of the many seating areas throughout the park. I understand they also run movies outdoors here in the summer. Great idea.

Love this place! . For me no trip to NYC would be complete without this place. It is a little bit of tranquility hidden in the concrete jungle. It's a lovely place to sit and chill, people watch or catch up with friends. It has Wi-Fi if you need to catch up with the rest of the world, but otherwise sit back and enjoy this place.

Jewel in the crown. Fantastic small park amongst all these huge buildings. Is for all ages, children's play area, tables and chairs to play games. Adult area to play chess, and various games. A lovely bar for a nice glass of wine.......what more do you want

Holiday. A small park by comparison to Central but rather quaint. They have seating areas for you to watch people passing by and a cafe. It is set at the back of the public library and is worth the visit.

outdoor films in summer. i love this place with its eclectic mix of old and new high buildings surrounding it .. also they have films showing in summer and its great , saw goldfinger , got a cocktail from the restaurant in the far end of the park .. happiness

Great little park. This park changes with the seasons and never disappoints. It has become a required stop when I visit New York. Take a visit to the public library then rest up among the trees of the park or stretch out in the lawn.

Stayed at hotel few feet away. I live in a big city and I have to say other cities should take a cue from Bryant Park. It is exactly as every city park should be. We went to several other parks in NY but Bryant was our favorite. At night we watched people play ping pong, and people walk their dogs. During the day we ate breakfast close by and watched people just enjoying themselves. I adore this park and want my mayor to come see it so he can copy it back home!

Great meeting place on a warm afternoon. I love to sit and people watch in Bryant Park on sunny afternoons. Lots of people lounging, walking through, having lunch or coffee. The meal at the Southwest Airlines cafe was OK, but the service was bad. Drinks OK. A nice place to sit and relax ( just leave out the food).

Love it. Always seems to be something going on, we particularly like the movies under the stars in the summer. The Cafe is a great place to people watch too, even if the 'doormen' (if somewhere outdoors can have doors) can be extremely rude (it is NYC after all).
Great little iconic "pocket" park. A nice place to have coffee, a drink, grab breakfast at a place nearby and enjoy the weather and people-watching.
Lovely little park. Lovely little park used by workers in the local area lovely waffle stall and good place to rest when walking around Manhattan a good place to see New Yorkers relaxing

A Haven from the Throngs of Mid-Town. How beautiful is Bryant Park? And what a lovely and spacious respite it provides for anyone with stimulus overload from Times Square and right by the gorgeous structure that is the New York Public Library. A great place to have a coffee, eat breakfast or lunch and just watch New York as it's diverse population wanders by. Always something going on, sometimes pop up musical Broadway reviews in summer, holiday markets in late fall and winter, ice skating... Definitely a must.
Wonderful in Winter. Particularly nice in winter when they have an ice-skating rink installed. Summer is lovely too for a drink.
Shade in the summer. This is a small park behind the New York Public Library but it's a great place to catch some shade or visit the vendors in the area.
Lovely little park - Very pretty. I briefly visited Bryant Park before I visited a local restaurant and I was so impressed with the park. It is a lovely little park that is kept very clean and tidy.
I love this small park!. Place to go and relax with good coffee, green oasis in the middle of Manhattan. Can be very busy on hot sunny days.
NYC and nice weather...what's not to love?. Shopping at Macy's and resting at Bryant Park on the way back to the hotel. A good time was had by all. People watching spot.
Broadway trip. Went with sons high school drama club, everyone enjoyed them selves and the park's ice skating seemed to have improved since the last time I was there.
Nice little park...better if you skate!. Very small park, but plenty of places to sit and chill.Best part was the library next door. Watching the skaters was a nice way to end our evening out.

Pretty park with activities frequently . Free to get in and seating is available. We stumbled across a winter festival with nordic costumes and dance, and ice skating. It's right next to the NYC Public Library which is also worth the excursion.

Charming and Relaxing . A charmingly attractive and relaxing spot to catch up with friends and people watch. Also, there are lots of chic eating options in the area where one may readily grab a quick bite.

Nice area to have a cuppa. There was no ice rink when we were there, but it was a nice area and relatively quiet, we sat wrapped up out side and had a cuppa, it was a good place to watch the world go by.
Wheelchair access in one area
Family. Small park, concerts, sitting areas, clean and take coffee or food and enjoy the big city life around you.

Lovely relaxing park. Found this hidden gem just behind the library and instantly recognised it from TV & Movies. This was a great place to just relax and soak up New York after a morning of sightseeing, def worth a visit

Oasis in a sea of skyscrapers. A beautiful square in the midst of towering buildings. The Christmas village set up along with the ice rink was magical. Would love to see it when it is grassed over for spring and summer events.

Love This Park . This is a great park to relax have a few drinks some dinner or just enjoy being outdoors and getting some sun. stop by when you have some time so you can enjoy every minute of this great peaceful place.
Lovely. This is a lovely place to visit, as there is typically so much going on, and I find it less busy than Central Park.

It's green, it's a park, end of....... Green open space behind the New York public library (seperate attraction) a fact some people fail to understand. So this is a review of the lark only. It's a park, has a cafe and places to sit. That's it very simple if your passing fine but wouldn't go out of your way unless your visiting the library. If it's raining like it is today then forget it......

Christmas markets were lovely. we visited when he Christmas markets were here, the stalls were full of unique gifts, a small ice rink and plenty of places for snacks and drinks. Not sure what the park would be like if he markets wet not there but if your passing would be worth a look!

Love this Small, Fun Little Park in Midtown. Bryant Park is one of the lesser-known jewels of NYC. It's super busy and crowded at all hours, and it's not exactly relaxing. That said, it's a fun spot in the center of New York City to get a bite and people watch. I was there most recently in the Winter where there's an ice rink set up. It's a fun typically New York City spot.
Resting in the center of Manhattan.. Fantastic place to sit, relax, eat and would definitely recommend lager beer in a bar, and a hamburger with fries.
Lovely place to rest and watch the world go by.. The rink is replaced by a lawn at the end of March. This is a nice place to sit and relax or a good meeting place (not too frenetic) in NYC.
Great oasis. A great oasis of calm in the middle of NYC. An ice rink in winter and lovely lawn in summer - worth a visit at any time
Amazing Little Park. Go have some waffles and coffee and enjoy people watching. It's not far from the Times Square and just at the back of NY Public Library.
Great waffles. Lovely park, lots of seating areas. Great waffles & coffee stands. Great place to sit and watch the world go by.

Bustling With Life!. When I went there in winter, there was a rink, a great many make-shift shops set up. It was really bustling with city life! I enjoyed, also, the Christmas tree erected on one end of the park.
Great place to hang out. Wonderful place to visit and just sit and take in the sights with a coffee. Great location for a mid day stop and a snack. Must visit.

Breakfast!. We stumbled across this delightful oasis whilst searching for breakfast on our first morning. There is a breakfast booth in the park, but it was running low on some of the menu items when we arrived. The booth assistant directed us to the café of the same company just across the road, which was excellent. We were impressed by the atmosphere in the park, always busy yet peaceful. We visited every day of our stay! On our final evening we had our evening meal beneath the trees in the park . Well worth a visit for a little bit of green in the middle of Manhattan!
Lovely park near the library. We sat in the park on a lovely sunny day before visiting the library, lovely place to enjoy a drink or lunch.
Gorgeous. Areas at the side and back of the New York Public Library to sit and relax. Went here in July 2013 and enjoyed it so much went back again this time.

Must-See in NYC. This is one of my favorite parks in NYC and only a block East of Time Square. It is beautiful every time of year, but especially wonderful in the summer, sitting under the trees at a cafe or with a picnic during one of the movie screenings (get there EARLY). There is an ice-skating rink and Christmas market in winter. There are kiosks for grabbing a coffee and snack, or outdoor restaurants for a drink or something more substantial. It is both romantic and family friendly.

Nearby Grand Central, Chrysler Building and the Library. This is a very relaxing park and in a great spot! It's so close to Grand Central Terminal and the Library and offers a great view of the Chrysler Building from the NW corner.

Don't miss the library!. We stopped here on accident while walking to Grand Central Station to look at the architecture. It was nice to sit and get out of the foot traffic. Then we used the public restrooms which were quite impressive.... then we realized the the New York Public Library was in this park. That was great. We went inside and poked around for a while. One of the best buildings we visited on our trip ... of course we love grand old buildings. Definitely worth a break to walk around and gawk.

Almost there, but still not completely people friendly. This park is a great example of how NYC has been trying to renew and refresh their parks - usually with the help of friends groups, conservancies and private business. It used to be a nasty place, but is now very nice. Ping pong tables, board games, a kiddie carousel, little restaurants. And a huge center lawn completely roped off from public use???. This park, like so many parks in NY, has a black iron fence around most of it, which prohibits entering the park except at corners, and prohibits exiting the park as well. In the park design world that's a big no-no, and is thought to make people feel not welcome, and once inside, trapped. I had thought NY had figured that out by now. Oh well. Other than that, it is well worth a visit.
Sweet 16. The children had a blast. It was a very organized system even though the line was long. The hot chocolate was delicious.

Festive atmosphere and great food. We visited NYC in January and called in to Bryant Park as we had heard about the markets and skating rink. So pleased we did! We were feeling the cold of course but there was plenty of hot food and drinks to help us out. The markets were better than expected with quality local art, craft and jewellery available. We spent a couple of hours here easily, there's a lovely carousel, beautifully decorated and massive Christmas tree, and once the skaters took to the ice it was a magical place. We didn't skate but if you wanted to be prepared to wait in a very long line, although everyone seemed very patient. We enjoyed all the various types of snacks we tried, a really lovely couple of hours.
Reading a book. Just near the public library this is a nice place to sit and enjoy some time in the sun. Good wafles nearby

Relaxing walk through the park . A lovely little park which was a great place to have a coffee and watch the world go by. A beautiful fountain with maintained lawns and a carousel for children. It is not a big park but still a little bit of tranquility away from the busy streets of NYC

Lovely place to relax!!. Check out Bryant Park for a break from a busy Manhattan shopping day. We have been several times to sit in the sunshine, get our breath back and just relax. The weather was unexpectedly bright today so we got some lunch and sat at a table, enjoying the weather and the wonderful flowers. Although it's in a busy location, it's a great place to relax.Bliss!!
Bryant Park. Amazing park set right in the middle of the bustling Times Square/Manhattan. You would not think you are in the middle of NYC in this park. Very pretty.
A little green in the concrete jungle. As I walked by they grounds crew was doing some "repair" work (decorating it perhaps). I saw people sitting on benches enjoying their day.

Green Oasis in the City. Located walking distance from Times Square, Bryant Park is well worth a visit at any time of the year. Our first visit was in late November when the ice skating rink was in operation and again during July the following year in the sunshine. Great place to have lunch either at the park cafe or bring your own from one of the busy takeaways nearby.Good photo opportunities with the Manhattan skyline as a backdrop.

a destination worth the trek.... If you like to discover this is one of many local parks along the potential route you may design and here you can live as a local to enjoy the day, a game of chess, and for me the many dogs that live the life on NYC.

Central Park, but small and cosy. Bryant Park is Central Park's little brother. Smaller, but still very nice and worthy a visit. In the winter try the icing ring and enjoy the coffee. While there, visit the NY Library also!
Mother - daughter trip . Such a little gem in the middle of the big city! Sat here and had a picnic lunch in the park, fabulous! It is a special place to enjoy the city!

Wonderful surprise. We ran across the park while exploring the city after a day of cold rain and it was such a welcome bright spot. The first week in spring had the park washed in yellow and purple from the fresh flowers.This became our favorite spot for grabbing an afternoon coffee or snack. Just sitting in the quaint chairs at tables around the park is a welcome break to a hectic day or shopping and sightseeing. Located in a great area that is convenient to Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave., and the NY Public Library.

relax w/ book, coffee, phone. This is one of those NYC experiences that can easily fit between others, like maybe the Public Library and the Empire State Building. This is the park with tons of identical small tables and chairs between trees and around a green lawn. There's a few permanent vendors. A great place to bring a book or a journal or your phone with a cup of coffee to enjoy the experience.
Great place to sit. Nice park, good to sit and have coffee and a break. Quiet and serene, good place to go after a visit to Empire State building
Great Park for People Watching. We were here at Thanksgiving!!! Great Winter Garden shopping, people watching and ice skating. Grab a snack above the skating rink and enjoy.
Birthday. Amazing park in January the ice rink was down & it takes your breath away at the wonderful site,well worth a visit,a beautiful winter wonderland

What A Find......... Came upon this park by accident on a sunny afternoon and took advantage of a great place to rest and people watch. Plenty of seating, great food and coffee concessions serving reasonably priced refreshments.Very close to other sights but an oasis of calm amidst the noise and bustle of the surrounding area. Worth a drop in and a short stay on any itinerary.
Lovely Park in the city. Lovely green space in NYC next to the library. With cafe, jugglers and a carousel what more could you ask for to pass some time and recharge the batteries.

An Urban Park. This is one of the truly great urban spaces in Manhattan but during good weather it is jamming' with people, but beside that a great place to people watch. Great views of the Empire State and Chrysler Buildings, especially at dusk, along with the Bryant Park Hotel, Bryant Park Grill,and the NY Metropolitan Library. During the warmer months there is a public outdoor bar w/food.

This area is awesome as well.. The best time to be in this specific area is during the day. The people well some are always in a rush, and the environment is always attention grabbing. There are a few more places that I feel the same about here in NYC
Christmas in New York . The park was very nice but small. There was a skating rink in the center. They had a lot if vendors on Christmas week. We haven't really bought anything there.

So beautiful. A lovely little park next to the public library. Lots of metal tables and chairs for you to bring your own food. Very clean and well looked after. Great views of the Empire State. Great for people watching!

Great little spot especially during the holidays. We went to Bryant Park on Thanksgiving night when out walking looking at window displays after dinner and before Radio City. The winter market was very cool and the atmosphere with the skating rink, decorations and winter lights in the middle of the city was amazing. I had never been to Bryant Park before and was thankful for my friend Erik taking us there.

Bryant Park and Free WiFi. Small park between skyscrapersRelax and enjoy and Free WiFi Access which work very wellSmall coffee shop and many tables and chairs around in the park...good to eat your sandwich or just relaxing in between business meetings
Stylish park in the heart of New york. Definitely worth a visit as it is so close to the New York Library, Times Square and the Empire State. A mixture of architecture around the park.

Cool little place to hang. brought a few under cover beverages and some food and hung out here for hours. Great place to people watch and just to get off the side walk and chill. would definitely hang here again.
small park with big love. i came from indonesia how .OMG this park small but with big love soo many people get around the park...they are playing ice skating..soo i fall in love with you NYC
Love the calm atmosphere. Whether you go there to just sit and people watch, have a cocktail or a hot chocolate it is great here!
Beautiful quaint park! . Relaxing and intimate park to enjoy for an afternoon! Lots to do around the area and not far out of the way from anything!!
Nice place to stop and enjoy. I was walking to National Library and got really tired so I stopped here and talk with locals for a while.
Worth a visit NYC life. There is and outdoor library for free. Surrounded by some high rises which are architectural land marks

Under construction. I've seen this park during the summer and it's beautiful.However, if you go during the winter there's no grass or it is under construction. Which happened when I was there on March.
Quaint but cute. If you visit the public library you must stop by Bryant park. It's a quaint place to rest, grab a snack or people watch.

Perfect spot to drink a coffee, read a book and watch the world go by. Bryant Park is a little oasis in the middle of Manhattan. Right behind the main branch of the New York Public Library, this park has tons of little tables and chairs to sit and people watch. There are lots of options for food and drinks in the area, so grab a coffee and enjoy.

Ice skating in Bryant Park. Wow this was great, free to skate, bring your own skates or hire for $10 adult and $7 kids
Evening skating with the bright lights of park made for a special setting
If in NY for winter this is a must do

A small and calm Park to take a break in!. A small, quiet and beautiful park. It´s a perfect meeting place. Some days there are Yoga classes for free! Really recommends that if you like it. There is a bar in the corner Ave of the Americas / W 40th St - Sorry, but the staff was not very nice when we were there i september 2015. Everything else was really nice. The park is a place to catch up an take a rest from all shopping.

Perfect picnic spot. Pick up a few times from local food vendor stands surrounding the park, and enjoy this lovely little gem, in a sea of hustle and bustle. It's situated right next to the library, so well used by locals enjoying the various seating areas. We had a lovely impromptu lunch as it was such as inviting spot to spend an hour people watching.

My favorite spot in the city. We have relocated to NYC and Bryant Park quickly became our favorite spot. From outdoor movies in warmer weather to ice skating at christmas this park has it all. The atmosphere is always top when there.

Family fun in the big apple. The winter market is great. We all enjoyed the carousel. It was not so busy here that we couldn't enjoy ourselves. If you want a fun experience without the insanity of Rockefeller Center, then this is a must do.

Pretty with the most glamorous free restrooms ever. Sorry to start my review with the basic needs prologue, but it is true. Forget the hole in the ground and I'm longing to get the heck outta there mentality, The Ladies and The Gents (I assume for the latter) are of chateau quality. The rest also holds up pretty well. Like an activities area, BP sports games sections for chess players, skating rink in the winter (doesn't quite rival Rockefellar Center but is good enough) and enough comfortable seating arrangements ro tempt the young and chic thirty something crowd stepping out for the noon meal on a fine day. Only sore spot - unless I am mistaken or things have improved - not quite enough eatery kiosks to handle all the takers so lines can be long and food is not cheap.

Many attractions for free. During summer there are uncountable free events in Bryant Park. You can play chess, read books from the reading room, learn languages, do yoga, do fly fishing, do Thai Chi, dance Tango, watch theater and much, much more. Just go there and you will find an event. Or you just enjoy the sun lying on the lawn or sitting at one of the many chairs placed all over the park.

If in NYC you have to visit this park - lots paked into a small area. You can, shop, eat, or even just watch the people go by. One minute your in a park the next your right in the heart of NYC. What else could you ask for
Nice spot. A very nice spot right in the middle of town so is a nice little oasis where you can stop and enjoy a coffee and watch the world go by.

Varies with the season. I love Byant Park. The experiences are very different depending on the season. From Thanjsgiving to NewYears it is full of little shopping kiosks and has a festive feeling. After that the skating rink is the main attraction. In warmer weather there is so much going on here it is amazing. (Much of this continues throughout the year.) You can lay ping pong or bocce ball. There is an outdoor reading room with newspapers, magazines and books. There are a variety of free classes from language to knitting. On warm evenings there is live music and dance instruction. It is an oasis with plenty of seating if you just want to chill and peopl watch.
Xmas Fair going on. Was there in December, beautiful weather and lots of neat stands to buy Xmas things. Or you can sit and watch the world go by. They have great fried pickles there.

Beautiful spot in NYC to stop and sit. On your way from Grand Central Station to Times Square, don't miss a stop in Bryant Park. Beautiful flowers and lots of people-- this spot will cheer you! Grab a coffee, sit at a table and watch the passers by.. Or read a book from the free library ... You will bask in the joy of this great city and its people. A glorious spot on a spring day and lots of fun in the summer when there are outdoor movies, games and food for sale. On the winter there is skating and at the holidays a magical shopping area appears.

Agreat place just to unwind after a dat of sightseeing. Loved just to look at the locals having a great time a nice place with entertainments and so much to see well worth a visit to this small but fun place in the middle of the week

A perfect Park in the middle of chaos. From the majestic carousel to the perfect lawn to the bar and grill - this park has it all. Beautiful cafe tables line the park as do the beautiful trees. Full of people having fun, relaxing, and meeting - you can't help but smile as you stroll thru or sip a beverage. For historians, a few plaques and statues are also scattered about. And the New York Public Library is next door!
Have to visit this place with a group of friends . A normal park located within few minutes walk from Times square I was there didn't enjoyed the place much Its mainly for families
Vibrant inner city park. Came across this by chance. Its a nice and peaceful area of the city which I totally didn't expect. Lots of photo opportunities too.
Now has an Ice Rink too. Home of New York fashion week. Noe (at least when I was there) has an Ice Rink too. Surrounded by historic buildings a great place to stroll.

Christmas tradition. I travel to New York often, but I only go to Bryant Park in December for ice skating and the vendors. Bryant Park in December is my favorite thing about Christmas. I bought my boyfriend and I matching Christmas onesies one year, and now that's a tradition we do every year, along with ice skating and stuffing our faces.
Nice . Clean. Near library. Much better than what I knew in the 1980's. Seemed like nice good looking peaceful place (quiet when I was there) in the midst of a busy big city

Lovely Christmas Fairs!. Both times I have been to New York has been over Thanksgiving/Christmas time and Bryant Square has a winter fair over this period.
Lots of little stalls with unique sellers and different products - particularly liked the handmade, unique Christmas tree decorations stall.
Would highly recommend visiting - very quaint little park close to Grand Central.

Romantic Evening Walk. The park is beautiful, full of light, people, music and shopping. Enjoyed hot apple cider and watched the ice skaters. The people were so friendly, everyone taking pictures and volunteering to take your picture so that you could have group shots. It was a beautiful and relaxing evening.

Bryant Park. Aside from being home to the New York Public Library, Bryant Park is still worth a visit. The greenery is very nice, and the presence of the Library itself is very nice. Not to mention the great views of the Empire State Building you get from the park.

Notable Pocket Park. Occupying the back of the New York City Public Library, Bryant Park is a pleasant green area with seasonal plantings and a number of bronze sculptures of assorted persons.
