From various points within the park, there are good angles from which to shoot photos of the Empire State Building, the Chrysler Building, and other interesting sections of skyline.
Amazing and beautiful. It's a small but beautiful park. Close to 5thAv, one of the biggest shopping streets in the world. During christmas its like a fairy tale.

Unexpected Little Park. We stumbled across this lovely little park and we loved it.It had little tables and chairs to sit at and watch the world go by. Little sad but just off the park the cleanest toilets you will ever find.

Nice park with lots of history.... Just happened upon this park walking in midtown by myself. I walked around looking at the statues and reading the information at various points in the park about the history that took place there. It's not very large, but has Le Carrousel, a lawn which is being resod, and a good amount of seating. It was home to the famous Crystal Palace which burned down in the mid 1800s.

A little bit of heaven. This park nestles among the large skyscrapers, a good place to relax take time out, have a coffee , ice cream or just people watch. If you you want something a bit more formal there's a restaurant at the New York public library side of the park

Sweet little park. The park was undergoing renovation when we were there so will be even better in a few months. We just walked through this pretty park having visited the public library (fab shop and book selection - they will stamp your purchases with a library stamp!) there were a couple of charming restaurants and cafes and plenty of places to sit down.
A little oasis. We stumbled upon this,park by accident when walking about. A really pretty little park in the midst of the concrete

Winter Wonderland. We came here for the Christmas shopping experience. There were a lot of tents filled with very unique things all around the park. There were also food vendors. The part is vey nice and not too big. There were a lot of varied items to chose from. A lovely way to spend an afternoon.
Hidden gem. Right next door to the New York Public Library so visit the library then sit and enjoy a cup of coffee in Bryant Park

Bryant Park. I've been here in December when the skating rink was packed and was just there again in January 21016 on a sunny day when the rink was busy, but reasonable. It's fun to sit upstairs in the restaurant and people watch... the lovers, the little ones just learning... great people-watching spot. Go just before Christmas and there is an extensive craft market. Other times of the year, they show movies. Great spot within Manhattan.

Needed a break from walking. Well kept park. Great clean bathrooms. Table and chairs are there. Next to the NYC Library too. They were working on the center part. We got a drink and sat for awhile. Nice stop!

Love this little Park. During the winter, they have tons of cute little shops and an ice skating rink! (absolutely my favorite time to be there) and during the summer, it's nice to just sit and relax and enjoy a waffle from one of the park vendors. Great area as well! Right next to the library which is also a must!

Oasis in Times Square. The open thick grassy field during the summertime invites you to take off your shoes, lie down and fall asleep. What lies below the park is interesting.. miles of book stacks. During the winter the rink, music and bustle is equally enchanting. Don't skip the library, its stunning.
Winterfest. Stopped by Bryant Park's Annual Winterfest! Can't be beat. Silent Disco, free pics in front of the fountain, and ice skating! Oh, and I almost forgot the beer garden. Good times....
Perfect Place Outdoor Fun, Food and Fellowship. This is the perfect place to stop for a leisurely break--coffee, tea, snack, lunch or dinner and enjoy the seasonal activities and fun.

My favourite green spot in the city!. We can't visit the city without coming to Bryant Park. I am not sure what it is but there is just something magical about this spot in Manhattan. I love to see men in business suites playing ping pong against a kid with dreds. The trees tower over the people reading books laying on the beautiful lawn or sitting at one of the many table and chairs. If you have younger kids they will love to take a ride on the beautiful carousel in the summer or you all can go ice skating in the winter. It is simply one of the best spots in the city to have a cup of coffee, rest your feet and people watch the inhabitants of one of the greatest cities on earth!

Love going here!. I feel like this is like a hidden wonderland! We always make a trip to NYC at christmas time and make it a point to stop at Bryant Park. We have made it a family tradition to get a personalized ornament every year from one of the little shops by the ice rink.

Quiet spot in the middle of the city. Nice for a walk through, to sit and read, or to have a drink in the spring/summer. Even though it's in the middle of town, it's a nice place to get away from the hustle and bustle.

Small, but a nice little stop. Cute little stop behind the library to sit for a few minutes and take it in or relax. Smaller than I expected, but sweet little park with chess, small carousel, and cafes.

Great Escape from the City. Wonderful little park right in the heart of the city. Fantastic little cafés. There was an ice rink there when we went. Fantastic vibe. Great place to sit and watch the world go by.

Transition time. Mid March is when this park transitions from a winter oasis with a skating rink into a summer escape. Unfortunately, there isn't much going on in March but it's still a great little Park.
Best park in NYC. This is the best place if you want to find calm, harmony and charge your personal battery. Take a Coffee and enjoy your life:) Nice view and lovely people
Nice park to wander around. Worth visiting. Its a nice place to hang out in the summer and great to wander around in the winter when the ice rink is there.

Unexpected Surprise. I have visited NYC several time and had no idea that there was any park other then Central Park. What a pleasure to find Bryant Park. A beautiful park close to the city library and a great place to people watching and relax over a cup of coffee.
Great place to enjoy a picnic lunch.. A really good vibe about this park - great to have a picnic and just people watch. Some tasteful delis close by to get a New York sandwich.

A little piece of Christmas. With Christmas light high in the trees, all sorts of artisan shops and a skating rink packed with happy people, Bryant Park in December is like stepping into a Christmas card.
The food options aren't great (at least compared to everything else in NY), but as long as you don't come hungry, it's very worth the walk around.

Beautiful. Wow Bryant park was 2 mins walk from our hotel and such a gem of a place. Just to sit there and see all the locals there and watch the world go by was great. We had lovely sunny weather on our visit and we sat and had ice cream in the sun, just a lovely place to be.

Great Location for a break for the city. Strategically located between Broadway and 5th Avenue (behind the New York Public Library), Bryant park is a lovely oasis from the hustle and bustle of the streets. The park is ringed by historic buildings and restaurants and there is a small cafe located within its gates. Nice tranquil respite.

Great Little Park. I stopped into visit Bryant Park on my recent visit to NYC. There is always something great going on and the plantings are beautiful. Lots of seating make this an excellent place to relax and people watch.

Cute space. Cute space in the middle of the city. In the summer it hosts some special events, like Broadway on park. The NY Public Library is in the same space, so take some time to visit the beautiful building.

very disappointing. This park wason my wish list to visit and was very disappointing. The park was is disarray as they were removing the ice rink and tents so very little of the park could be accessed. It may be a nice park but we unfortunately couldn't see much of it

Lovely park and great for a drink at the bar or maybe a picnic.. Lovely park which is a lovely place to sit with a drink or have a picnic, NY is very busy and these parks are great for chilling and getting away from the hustle and bustle of it all
Wonderful winter venue!. We enjoyed watching the skaters and visiting the seasonal kiosks during the 2015 holiday season. We'll return whenever we're in the city!

Small and precious place.. Lots of Kiosks with fresh food. Nice to sit with a cup of coffee and pastry at one of the tables. Last time I was there was on Christmas and there was a small ice skating ground with a beautiful decorated Christmas tree. Now there are yellow flowers around. In a sunny day it's a pleasure to take time and relax there.
Holiday. Great venue, ice rink set up on the day we called in with coffee and food outlets on the fence line made for a very pleasant day

My favourite park on Mhttn. Beautiful small city park, not much more than a green square really but cute. Always something to do. Free games, book-nook, Christmas Village in December, free ice rink in the winter (long lines), outdoor film screen, etc. Really nice vibe right behind the Public Library.
Beautiful during Christmas. This was so beautiful with the ice rink and all the twinkle lights! It seemed so magical in the middle of such a huge city. A must see during the fall.

A Nice Place to Relax. When in New York, I always enjoy sitting in the park for awhile. Sometimes, it's just to rest for a few minutes or while eating a snack or lunch bought from a near-by vendor or restaurant.

Love this park!!. What are wonderful find for a relaxing afternoon and escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. If you want to do more than relax enjoy a game of ping-pong at the free ping-pong tables or take in a knitting class or perhaps juggling. The little ones will enjoy the carousel. Something for everyone!

I love NY. Bryant park has a great ambiance. There is always something going on here. Good entertainment in the summer they have outdoor movie night. It's where fashion week takes place it's just simply awesome!
Christmas Market. We went to Bryant Park Christmas market. It was a big market with a skating rink and a huge Christmas tree, We loved the market, it was very large and well worth a visit.

Relaxing. Love it. Like Central Park, this gives you inspirational view for painting/sketching, taking the kids, great for couples, nice breeze , and relaxing.Right in between East/West side, trains, local shops, diners, cafes, restaurants, walking distance from Rockefeller Center/Radio City Music Hall, etc.

Lovely. As we travelled in Febuary, there was a skating ring and some lovely art for you to see. There is a famous carrousel and a lovely place to sit down and have something to drink. Stop by, even if it is for a moment.

So pretty!. I am jealous of NYC that they have so many nice parks in the city. They truly take care of their residents. Wish that other cities would do the same. You can go skating in the winter and take a nice picnic in the summer. Perfect park for all seasons.

Great for a lunchtime picnic. Grab some take out on a nice day and stop by to eat your lunch at the park. Lots of chairs, and a nice lawn to relax on. The Bryant Park Cafe is great for happy hour too!

Beautiful Place to Sit on a Sunny Day in Downtown Manhattan. Great place to sit in a little park and have a coffee in down town Manhattan. Watch people playing ping pong or just relax and get some sun. Then you can walk over to the New Park Public Library.
Great for a break. The park is a great place to sit and relax. Grab a coffee and people watch. In the winter they have a skating rink and hot cocoa.

A Gem in the city. In the heart of the city this tiny (by comparison with Central) park is a wonderful place to sit and chill. You can have a fine meal, go skating and people watch to your hearts content.

Nice resting place. A number of parks can be found around Manhattan and it's a great way to sit, watch the world go by after being in our feet.Great to walk through Manhattan as you can take much more in but you do need to rest up from time to time and this little park is ideal for that.

Beautiful sights everywhere I looked. It was my first time ice skating, and even if it was scary at first, it was awesome too! I wanted to visit the Library but it was already closed by the time I got there. Beautiful sights everywhere I looked.
Nice place. It is a square with many attractions. now there is a skating rink and hockey games that happen every day. The food is easy and there are great places for lunch or dinner.

Lovely!. What a lovely place to stop and breathe. We got ourselves a coffee and sat at one on the many tables.Just watching people chat to each other and make time to stop and enjoy life was brilliant, I could have stayed all day.Some of the people practice their talents and if your that lucky you basically get a free show, it's brilliant!
Nice and quiet location in a busy city. Bryant Park - is an excellent place for some tranquility and peace. the ice rink is a nice addition during winter time.

Under rennovation. The park was largely mud and bulldozers today, something big looks to be in the works. Tucked behind the NY public library, includes a coffee bar and a restaurant, manicured walk ways and elegant signage. I look forward to seeing it in summer

Beautiful Park. Bryant Park sure has come a long way in the last 20 years. It's a beautiful location to sit for lunch on a nice day, go skating in winter, shop at holiday time or catch an outdoor movie in the summer. Great place to just sit back and people watch in the shadow of the majestic NYC Public Library.

A gem of a resting spot behind the NY Public Library. A nice getaway park to sit and have coffee or lunch, read a book, play chess, or chat with friends.Bring a lunch from one of the take out places in the neighborhood and find one of the many chairs in the park, sit and enjoy the green space in the middle of the bustling city.Do not forget to go into the library facing 5th Avenue. The building is beautiful and there is almost always an exhibit to enjoy!

" Amazing ". What a fab, fun and exciting day for all the family. It was well worth a visit either to skate around and have fun or sit back in the café having a lunch. This is an enjoyable day for all the family to enjoy and have a great time together.

Great for people watching. We stopped here after a visit to the library. A wonderful spot to have lunch in the open air and for people watching. Hotel shuttles stop here and they link up with the Airporter bus. Good location to be in.
Fun and now wait on Mondays. Had a great time. Staff was friendly and the views are amazing. I highly recommend this NYC tradition.
set up for visitors. Braynt Park is right there by Time Square. It is set up right now with an ice skating rink. Free if you have your own skates but $$ if you have to rent the skates.

An oasis in Midtown Manhattan. I love Bryant Park in all seasons. During the warmer months, the Parks Department keeps the place beautiful -- whether tulips and daffodils in the Spring or other flowering plants in the summer and fall, it is a delight and an oasis in the gray, concrete area that is Midtown. Not only is there free wifi, but there are even moving charging stations where you can power up your phone or laptop. There are boardgames available from mahjong and chess to Jenga and nearly anything that you might want. There's a carousel that plays French songs. Plenty to eat, whether from the different kiosks within Bryant Park or the sit down Bryant Park Grill or any of the many restaurants that surround the area. If you want something to read, you can alway walk a block to the MidManhattan library of the Main Library with the lions (Patience and Fortitude). If you just want some peace and quiet as well as to people watch in the middle of a crazy day, Bryant Park might be one of your best choices in NYC.
Sights. Walked through Bryant Park many times to get to the avenues of america. Cool to see some spots used in TV shows like SVU while going through the park

Peaceful. We actually visited Bryant Park to try and find a memorial chair for a friend's mom, who sadly died before their holiday :-( We hadn't realised there would be quite so many chairs, but with help from the park staff we were able to find it and get a few photos to send home.Worth a visit in winter to watch the skaters (or take part if you're more balanced than us) or to have a peaceful break from the streets and just watch the world go by for a while.

Sight seeing. We came across this park on our way to the Empire State Building. It was lovely all the office people sat having lunch in there things to do ,they was just taking the ice rink down so you can skate in there very nice park.

Concerts, Great food and relaxation. Bryant Park means attending free concerts, a place for great restaurants and fast food alike, and summer relaxation in the park to me. I have been to this park many times and it is a NYC landmark. It is hardly dull in this park. Sometimes, I just sit in the park eating some ice- cream and watching life happen as I watch the buses and people go by, people hurrying into and out of the nearby F,D,B subway line, or people laying on park benches. If for nothing else, visit Bryant Park for the restaurants and free summer concerts.

lovely park right in the heartof a busy city. Bryant park in right in the middle of Times Square, not somewhere you would expect to see people relax, take time out and it has a skating rink, the day we visited the park they had a kids food event on and kids were receiving free samples of healthy foods
Great park. I really like this park and enjoy people watching here. Watched ice skating here recently, along with several people playing chess.
why. If you are in the neighborhood with time on you hands then fine but I cannot see someone going to Bryant Park just to go there.

Great little park during Christmas time. This park is in the middle of everything. It is at 42nd street, between 5th and 6th), just behind the NY Public Library (Midtown).During Christmas time – Winter Village at Bryant Park - there is a Holiday Market (shops and kiosks – gifts, food, decorative objects, jewelry, etc) and a skating rink. Of course, you will find an enormous Christmas tree.

Cute Public Space For Some Downtime. A really nice green space to sit down and enjoy people watching in the city. My partner and I grabbed some take out lunch and sat viewing the table tennis and the ice skating. This park also has some of the nicest public toilets I've ever come across!

Cute place to walk your dog. Living in a city where cost of living seems so much higher than many other countries I’ve visited, I take advantage of things I can do without spending money.Bryant Park is located right behind the New York Public Library. There are public seating everywhere- some even with umbrellas to hide from the sun or rain. This park is surrounded by beautiful tall buildings with unique architecture.Within the park there is an ice skating rink opened from late October to Early March. Admission is free, but skates rental is $19. It may be difficult for city visitors to bring their own skates, but locals can find a pair of skates online from $30-$80. So the cost of renting out skates two times is already enough to get a pair of private skates.

Small and beautiful. it is a small park, I wouldn't get the subway just to go there, but worth a visit if you are around, there is always something going on there and you will find an amazing burger place there.

Great place to sit and relax. My office is across the street and I often visit during the day to escape from office chaos and sit to watch the diverse crowd of locals and tourists. There are lots of seating options and usually easy to find a place to sit. There are also small food kiosks and a restuarant with lots of food options. The location is very central to midtown so it's a good a place to take a rest when touring midtown.

Exciting Holiday atmosphere, lots of great giftshops and stands. Bryant Park is a jewel. The shops and stands are full of great gifts without any tourist trap kitch. We picked up some great NY-themed socks for gifts and admired the talent of the many craftspeople who had their wares on display for sale. The line for the skating rink must have been 100 yards long but the people skating seemed to really enjoy themselves.
Safe and fun. I love beautiful Bryant Park for skating in the winter and relaxing at the tables in the summer. The park is small but features many vendors all year round.

Great Place to relax ...right in the centre of busy Manhattan. Wether you are a tourist / a New Yorker or for that matter anyone who is visiting Manhattan, this will be one of your favourite places to sit down ..have a coffee or grab a sandwich / hotdog and get into a conversation with friends. If you just want to sit and read a book, all by yourself , then also this is the place to visit . I loved the atmosphere in the place ...there is so much of vibrance / positivity that it would certainly take away some of your stress and also give a much needed break to your feet ...if you are visiting Manhattan as a tourist , you will end up walking a lot and this is just the perfect place to sit / relax and enjoy the experience.
Beautiful gardens. Popup shops are pricey....good café.... nice outdoor location near library - nice gardens....must drop by

Pure magic. This place is beautiful during winter you can practice ice skating for free if you have the equipment.There are a few little shops that make Bryant Park even beautiful.During summer you can watch free movies, Great classical movies, you can bring your own food, seat on the grass and enjoy a magical night. I watched E.T being alone and it is one of my fav memories of New York

Disappointed. The night we went the rink was closed for public use as it had been hired for a film shoot. We didn't get to skate but we did see Kate Winslett attempting to skate and act at the same time.
Cute Park. Really cute park with free ice skating rink whilst we were there in the colder months. Some of the buildings around it were amazing

Love this small, quiet park. Many don't know it but it's a cozy, small park which was full of druggies years ago. It has been cleaned it and includes dining places, shopping and nice chairs to sit on. Definitely relaxing and fun. A nice escape after Times Square as its nearby.

One of my favorite urban parks ever!. The lighted trees, coffee and food kiosks, and pretty view of the NY Public Library make this on of my favorite urban parks that I have visited. The skating pavilion looked fun, too!
Lovely atmosphere!!. Frozen fountain,great ice rink,lovely you just have a wonder about.what a great use of space that once was just derelict ground.Amazing!!

Hustle and bustle. We were in New York for Thanksgiving so there were a number of little Christmas huts in Bryant Park each of them had something special to sell and it was a wash with colour and excitement. There was an ice rink within the park as well. It's just a short walk along from Time Square so very easy to find and it's on the route for the Thanksgiving day parade

Terrific Park to Visit in NYC. I got a chance to spend some time in Bryant Park on my way to NY Public Library & I didn't want to leave - it was amazing! There was so much going on & the atmosphere was incredible. The park seemed to be full of local employees taking their lunch breaks & with the beautiful scenery (& food kiosks) I could see why they chose Bryant.There was an assortment of games going on like ping pong; chess, etc, & some pretty impressive juggling. There was also an open air reading room with access to children's books; magazines & newspapers. For the kids there was a carousel ride "Le Carrousel" which had an admission fee. To add to all of that there were lots of pretty trees lining the park as well as a picturesque fountain.I would definitely recommend taking some time out of your trip & visiting Bryant Park - it's great!
Nice stop at a food cart for dessert and coffee. Kind of a nice little park in the middle of NY where you can sit and eat lunch or stop for coffee and dessert
Snow on 4th of March. Very cute and I feel in real America. Ice scating on a ground surrounded with skyscrapers. A good experience for me to see New York in snow
People watching paradise. Vibrant park with food carts, seasonal activities like winter ice rink, and primo people watching next door to the NY Public Library.

So much fun!. While it's "free" to skate, if you need to rent skates, its about $15/person. However, it was completely worth it. We went on a Sunday evening, it was not packed, and had plenty of room to skate. The snack bar was pretty expensive -we spent almost $5 on a bottle of warm gatorade.
Ice skating with pretty setting for watchers. Very popular skating with people of all ages and prett sittin areas for friends and family to watch.

Beautiful Park, no matter the season. Please just visit this wonderful park if in NY. Even when the Central Park is the king, Bryant Park is the Prince! In winter, I had the chance to see the ice skating course, which was plenty and looked very much fun. In addition there were plenty of beautiful and fancy small boutiques where you could get pretty unique treasures for Christmas present. In addition, there are some spots to have a hot chocolate or coffee. Don-t miss it.

A place we always visit in NYC!. This is by far one of the best parks ever. Its right at 42nd St / 5th Ave behind the Public Library. We were there 02/15/2016 as it was snowing. The Ice Rink was still in operation and the park was transformed in the snow. A highlight of our trip. I highly recommend going there any time you are in NYC. Second only to Central Park imho. Enjoy

Beautiful park! Be sure to eat food from a vendor here!!. When we were there, the water fountain was frozen! We watched people ice skate and ate soup and sandwich from one of the vendors located inside the park. The food was fabulous!! Very entertaining place!!

Great for people watching. Great place to enjoy a cup of coffee and watch New Yorkers of all ages enjoying themselves. Tack it on to a visit to the New York Central Library, which is located next door.
Magnificent.. Love spending time at the park. Ice skating outdoors there is gorgeous. Touch on the expensive side. But lots of fun even when it's really cold.

Skating in the Park. After walking the city (12 miles) we happened upon Bryant Park and took a rest in one of the outdoor seating areas. If we weren't so tired we would have joined in on the skating. Very nice venue for skating with plenty of outdoor seating for people watching. Also had a enclosed restaurant for eating and people watching. Great idea for the winter!
Photo Shoot in Bryant Park. I have traveled to New York numerous times and have never visited Bryant Park until my last visit. What a beautiful park in the middle of activity. Definitely a must see!

A winter wonderland. We visited in Nov/Dec, when Bryant Park is transformed into an ice skating rink and winter markets. A great range of sellers, the most delicious chocolate stall (No Chewing Allowed) and beautifully decorated for the holiday season. Worth a visit for the food and to people watch if ice skating isn't your thing.

Pleasant surprise. We got off at the wrong subway station and stumbled upon Bryant Park. We were there a week after New York Fashion Week, so it was quiet with only a few ice skaters. It's a great place to sit and take a rest. There were beautiful 360 views of the Empire State Building as well as the Chrysler Building. They had a nice clean bathroom with an attendant. It was very cool.
great people watching place. great outdoor restaurant and bar.....lots of things to do !read a book, listen to the piano player, chess games or just sit and relax!

park in the middle of the city. although it's not a park in the sense that you can take your shoes off and walk through grass, but you can sit down under some trees and enjoy coffee or read a book for some time or simply watch the hustle of 42nd street

Love it. Great place to just hang out in all four seasons. Winter around the holidays is something special, from the small little shops to the tree and ice skating. Summertime movies are fun just bring a blanket and find a spot on the lawn. There are games around the outer walk that you can play. Overall a gem in the city.

One of the best in NYC!. I've been in this park in spring and winter. In winter, it's very charming and the ice skating rink is amazing. In spring, it's absolutely lovely, very green and awesome vibe. The public library in the park is also an amazing visit!!
Cute park. Worth walking through this park if in the area. Cute park with some stalls for shopping. It is located just behind the library which is also worth a look inside
Crowded but good for fresh air anyway. I've been here a few times. The latest was during a very cold spell. There were not many people loitering in the park, but it was a good place for a brisk walk!

Oasis . I love Bryant park!!! It's a little bit of oasis in amongst the hype of mid town. Often on our trips to NYC we will grab a coffee maybe some takeout & sit and people watch for a good hour or so. There seems to be a few homeless people/ex pats....they will of course approach you for change or food but I've never felt threatened by this & if you politely decline then they move on to another tourist. But all and all its a beautiful place to spend some time chilling out. In summer they put on concerts/movies and in winter there are stalls and an ice rink, lots of cool things to do in Bryant park .
bryant park. it was a very cold day and it was lovely to see the people on the ice rink there are shops all around it so even if you dont want to skate you can eat or drink and while away time .

Great Place to sit with a coffee & a book or just people watch.. Always love sitting &having a coffee here. There are usually some vendors & if you come at the right time there are various events going on. Nice clean little park to sit & pause.

One of many oasis in the Apple!. Whether you are looking for a bite to eat or a place to rest your feet, you cannot go wrong in Bryant Park! It is quaint, stylish, and so New York! Have a waffles and dinges, or a simple coffee, or for a more upscale meal, try the Bryant Park cafe. You can have a read break, look at the children on the merry go round or simply people watch!

Very nice visit. Quaint park. Chances seasonal not only the nature of the park which is beautiful but things to do. They offer free ice skating in winter , free yoga, board games, books, bocce and other lawn games. Vendors offer original merchandise.Nice public bathroomsStroll through or just take sometime out of your day and relax

Green Oasis in Midtown. In the summer, come see the free movies on the lawn - bring your picnic and your friends. In the winter, browse the craft boutique booths or rent a pair of skates and etch a figure 8 in the ice rink. A little green oasis in midtown -- and don't forget to walk into the NY Public Library across the street and go upstairs to see museum quality painting and furnishings. Works of art a midst the immense collection of books.

Great whatever the time of year. We have visited the park in October, December & January and it has always been exciting. In October we were lucky to get some late sunshine so sat sunbathing, in December we visited the Christmas market and in January we were still able to go ice skating. The park is right next to the NY public library and that too is worth a visit, it has to be one of the most spectacular libraries in the world.
Ice Skating versus Central Park. At night you can't beat this for a fun hour , less queues , better ice condition , nicer staff than Central Park

Love this Park!. This place was so inspiring, I visited in the summer from Canada and I love that they had a reading room tent set up and an area with board games so you can sit and enjoy. It was also so magical there was a carousel in the park. Fantastic and I miss it!!
Nice little park.. Bryant park is a nice park, however, if you could only manage one park during your stay in New York head for Central, much bigger with way more to do and see.

Winter Wonderland . Love coming here with my family in the winter. They have all these great pop up shops with food to enjoy right after ice-skating. And in the summertime, it's date night with their movie on the lawn

Lovely area in the middle of Manhattan. Close to the busy Times Square, Broadway, Bryant Park is a great place to meet friends for lunch or just take some time off to work on your own. Though it's busy with bankers & corporate executives from nearby areas, it has ample space & options to eat, shop around.

Sooner or later you'll meet someone you know. An on-going assembly of people from everywhere, gathered amid a vibe of fun and light-heartedness. Ad hoc kiosks sell food and souvenirs, but the people watching is the main attraction.

Missing something . People seem to love Bryant Park but I am not sure why. It was incredibly crowded and there were a bunch of stalls surrounding an ice skating rink and tree. There just wasn't a lot to this place.

Winter Ice Rink and Frozen Fountain!. This didn't exactly seem to be a park to us but it was magical none the less. In February there was an ice rink and when the temperature dropped below minus 14 the lovely fountain at the front of the park froze over!
Interesting well used park. We have been there in 2 season once for Ice skating and a great dinner at Celsius and once of the summer moving a a quick bits and one of the ethnic food stands.
Enjoyed watching ice skaters!. We enjoyed watching the skaters before we ventured into the Library. They did have tents set up but it was too cold for us to really want to check them out.

2nd favorite park with winter ice skating. 2nd best in my opinion in Manhattan. The ice skating rink is a definite bonus, in which they have an express pass at around ~25 and a regular rental at ~19. But I was short on time, so I didn't get to try it. Heard it ends on 3/6 for winter. Bryant park is easily accessible through two subway points and has a lot of table seating, so I could grab some snacks ie from Royce/Lady M and just sit and enjoy the park. Also has a carousal for the kids. It was very well designed and right next to it is the New York Public Library.

Christmas Market is terrific. Come at Christmas or from early November to find lovely markets and delicious treats. The park is always beautiful, and in summer is filled with flowers and flowing fountains. In winter, it is a holiday party with a big tree, lights and a terrific assortment of crafts.

Snuck in during fountain freeze!. Had to stop and get these shots of the frozen fountain in Bryant Park! We were in NYC during one of the coldest days! I think it was like 4 degrees when we took these photos!

Busy. Be ready for a very fast paced outlook on life!!! This is where REAL NEW YORKERS are! It's so busy here with people trying to get to/out of work, running errands, quick bite... Everyone's constantly on the go! In the winter, there's a skating rink in the middle outside- come enjoy!!! In the warmer months, people always have picnics on the green grass. Come by!!!

Christmas Show. We made advance reservations several months in advance, If you want to see the Christmas show with the Rockettes you really need to do advance sales. The lines are long, but the show was fabulous and one you will remember!

Wonderful park in Midtown. My husband and I visited Bryant Park during our trip to NYC in November 2015.It was nice to sit and watch everyone skating. The kiosks selling goods were charming, especially those with handmade knitted items.I would love to visit the Holiday Market at Bryant Park again.

Ice skating, relaxing ,and stop at the market stalls. What could be better than enjoying hot churros, then working off those calories on the ice rink? My kids got to skate with Santa one time (actually there were three Santas spinning around the ice rink). If the markets are set up, there are multiple options for shopping, and some unusual finds. Definitely worth a stop, and you could spend hours here. It's hard to remember that the park was boarded up and dangerous in the early 1990s - now it is a draw for locals and tourists. And don't forget to pop into the NY Public Library if you have a few minutes, to check out the latest exhibits.
Touch of Paris in NYC!. Directed by a fellow traveler, this is a cool space in the middle of NYC. Take a stroll through this treed space on your way to the historic New York Public Library.
Lovely at all times of year. A great place to step away from the hustle and bustle of the big city and stretch your legs. The winter market is great.
Great site to visit. When we visited it was the coldest weekend for 100yrs hrnce fountain was frozen looked beautiful plenty of people skating had a hot chock with the works at the tented area.

Ice skating on Sunday. Having skated at Central Park and Rockefeller my 12 year old daughter couldn't leave NYC without trying out this one too! So on Sunday morning, my friends took my 15 year old to Macy's, and I went with the youngest here. Out of all the ice rinks in New York I had to say this was my Favourote. It's in a nice setting in Bryant Park, there are plenty of tables and chairs all around for spectators, and stalls from where you can buy coffee and snacks. There are patio heaters for cold days and the best thing of All is that proper New York music plays subtly in the background (we were lucky enough to have Frank Sinatra!). Also, if you had your own boots, it's free unlimited skiing!! Otherwise 15$ for kids. Very good value. We have decided to purchase a pair of ice skates for our next visit as it will save me a fortune!! Recommended for skaters and spectators.

Scating area - take care. Don't fall. This is a nice area and a grelt opportunity for scating. Take care, and use a helmet. Even if you are an experienced scater show the rest it's ok to think of safety. Lots of tables located around the area.

Lovely. It is a small park, where you can seat and relax. Enjoy some Nyc skyscraper. It is a lovely park , during Christmas time there is an ice skating ring , where you can enjoy with your family and friends .

A place to chill. We stopped by Bryant Park on a Sunday afternoon, our way to 5th Avenue during our recent visit to NYC. We sat and people watched while having a drink. Relaxed, clean and interesting.

The Park. My first experience with the park was fashion week in 1993 and each time I visit the park has never ceased to amaze. This time they set up small shops of gifts and crafts and a skating rink. I can't wait to come back.

Midtown Beauty. A beautiful park that brings the Provence area of France to mind with the landscape plantings and layout. This park was designed by a French landscape architect and it shows. It's a welcome oasis in the hustle of Manhattan.

nice place. When I visit my daughter we always end up going to Bryant Park and in summer it is wonderful with lots of lovely little cafes where one can buy great muffins and other nice foods. In winter they have a skating rink and during the holidays they have small shops around the outside where one can buy all kinds of nice things. Perfect for tourists
frozen fountain. Lovely old fountain which was frozen solid when we were there, it was about -15 oC. Skating rink if you wanted, a few small shops . Next to the library.
Small Park for Chilling. Small park to sit and relax...... There is this great Wafles & Dinges on the corner, try their Wafles, really amazing...

A small patch of sky. The park extends from the New York City Public Library. It's a lovely spot to sit and ponder with views of both the Chrysler Building and the Empire State Building available depending upon where you sit. There are kiosks selling food, including Belgian Waffles, as well. I found myself smiling at the statue of William Cullen Bryant for whom the park is named. The park may be difficult for people in wheelchairs or on canes to navigate.

Tons of fun. Bryant Park is wonderful in its self but ice skating for free is totally perfect! If you don't own a pair of ice skates you can rent them for only $15.00 and that is for as long as you want to skate not hourly! nice way to spend a evening!

in the shadow of one bryant park. ok, i'm very biased about this part of manhattan. i'm a fan of the architect who designed one bryant park; the first truly 'green' skyscraper in the city. rick cook has done a lot for improving the quality of life in the city and blending incredible man-made structures with nature. the park is one of the safest places on the planet, and is a place my wife and i are sure to stroll through on every trip we make to nyc. but one of my favorite things is to try and catch a decent picture of one bryant park as the daylight fades over the hudson about a mile away.
My favorite place. A great place to visit cold weather or hot. Skating rink in Winter or lush grass lawn in the Summer. The best location as well.

Nice Place to Skate during winter. Awesome place , right in Midtown Manhattan, turns into a beautiful skating ring during winter. I had never ice skated before and this was an oustanding experience to skate in Bryant park. Awesome would definatelly Recommend !!!

Cute to shop unless you want NYC specific. Tons of shops, eats, but majority is great shops you can find at home. For example, yoga gear, ornaments (which anyone in Cleveland will write NYC as long as you are paying), I do recommend 'Fifth and Madison' home fragrances. Great packaging and scent without wallet busting. Otherwise, go skate or eat and move on. Definite bonus-cleanest public bathroom in all of NYC

Awesome place, definitely a gem. We weren't going to go here as it seemed out of our way but we are definitely glad we did. We actually went 3 times during our stay it was so good. From the restaurants, little shops and skating rink it is a great place. Definitely worth the visit!!

What a treat. If you go over the Christmas period Bryant Park has a free ice skating rink. All the others charge ( Central Park, Rockefeller etc). Lovely Christmas stalls selling food, mulled cider, and artisan crafts. We just enjoyed watching the nuns skate!

Great place for a solo traveler to meet great people.. Bryant park is one of my favorite parks in NYC, any time of the year. Locals are very friendly. I have mastered my Petanque game thanks to many friendly gentlemen. If you are not interested in playing at least watch. On a "rando" note the bathrooms at Bryant park are one of the best public restrooms in NYC. Automated self wrapping toilet seats to keep your tushy safe and spare your legs from another suat session. You walk enough in NYC!

Ice skating. Bryant Park for ice skating is great alternative to the Rockefeller Rink and a fraction of the price.The Rink is available from start of Nov until March.Would recommend the Fast Pass tickets giving speedy access, quicker time to your stakes no being on the rink.It can be busy at times and with the rink not being huge, novice skaters could find it a little imposing.Would I recommend it? Yes - great fun and facilities.

Free Ice Skating - If you have your own skates. You get very little for free but this very large outdoor rink was free if you had your own skates and only $15 to hire skates. The staff were welcoming and the ice was well looked after skated for about two hours a very enjoyable time

Terrific park near the library with skating. This is a must-see any time of year. In the summer, it's a great place to hang out and grab a meal (or get a shake across the street and enjoy it in the park). In the winter, take in the skating rink and the Christmas shops. Grab a hot chocolate or a warm Belgian waffle to keep you warm! This used to be the home of NY Fashion Week, before it moved uptown to Lincolnc Center. If you're here during the week, you must check out the reading room in the NYPL next door.

Love this gem. Bryant park is one of my favorite places in NYC. There's always something special going on - from skating to a French weekend with booths for purchasing anything you might want. It's surrounded by great places to grab a bite, and is right near Grand Central and Times Square.
Beautiful at night. We watched the skaters for a wile. Brightly lit and festive looking. Little penguins as aides for kids learning to skate.

I love this park especially in the winter.. Winter time there is the winter village with ice skating, food, artisan crafts, and beautiful Xmas tree. So I recommend checking it out but it's also a nice spot in the summer to gather with friends.
Nothing special, but there is an ice rink!. Nothing special here, not as grand as central park but there is an ice rink which is a novelty, wouldn't go out of my way to return.

A small and pleasant park. They were having an ice skating rink and it was pretty crowded when I visited but still it has a good atmosphere. Nothing much to do there but just to stop by for a rest and people watch.

Great ambience. Walked here from our hotel with my wife.we are from Montreal and were visiting for a long weekend.the ambience is great watching people skating on a rink outside in the middle of Manhattan.you gotta be there.

Skate For Free In NYC. If you bring your own skates and a lock, you can enjoy a day of skating in the heart of the Big Apple!! It does get crowded and the ice isn't the best. Great for beginners! It's hard to smoothen the ice with a consistent flow of traffic.

Always something going on!. Love this little park... have been to NYC 3 times, and this little park has been on my list each time. It is exactly what you think NYC is all about... caught in the middle of the bustling city, this park is full of trees, and there are vendors for food, and performers, and last time we visited there was a great artisan faire going on with handmade jewelry and such. If you were to make a list of what to see in NYC, this is one, and it is within walking distance of all the other places; you sort of just run into Bryant Park on your way!

Lovely Park. We stumbled upon the park when walking back to our hotel on a Saturday evening. The park was a hive of activity with the ice rink, drinking huts and a silent disco in full flow.A really nice place just behind the library and with a great restaurant the Bryant Grill on site.

A fun, happening place. We stumbled on this gem by accident. It's close to the New York City Library and Grand Central Terminal. There was a winter festival in progress when we were there. Early Sunday morning found the little city park full of families skating on a good sized rink. Tables and chairs, kiosks and food choices. A fun little spot in the center of the city.

Eclectic Shops, good eats and ice skating. Your day can be as expensive or cheap as you like. People watching will give you hours of entertainment. Excellent array of food (the crepes and veggie burgers are great!) Plenty of artsy shops to find a unique gift. Or, go ice skating with the kids or significant other.
lovely. The iceskating rink is so beautiful and you get a spectacular view of the Empire State building from any where you stand in the rink.
Great Place ,. the ice rink was open when we went , looks fab , lots of little stalls for shopping , was great . worth a trip and a look around , food also available.

Tourist stop on first trip to NY. This place was beautiful in December with the Christmas village of shops as well as the ice skating rink. It was full of joy and a great place to see for the Christmas tree and all the cool vendors.

The most charming park in the city. There was something about Bryant Park. It wasn't Central Park, and it had very little sense of grandeur about it, but it is one of my favourite places in the city. Street vendors and ornate street lights and carousels, couples with a diverse range of old trees give this park a real sense of authenticity. A great place to spend a couple of hours people watching or connecting with the city
Fun park all year round. Lots to offer. Good food places, love the carousel, Ice skating pricey but free if you have skates, fun events, good music bday night movies in summer. For n for all ages.

A favorite. Yes, its in midtown and yes there's a lot of traffic around. This is really an oasis in some ways. A grassy park in summer, an ice rink in winter. Gorgeous trees and small tables with chairs make this an ideal place for a quick pause from the surrounding madness.

A piece of relaxing greenery in the middle of the concrete jungle. Okay, it's not Central Park, but if you're in the area, it's a wonderful place to have a coffee and watch people. A nice break from the buildings.

So great to come here while still decorated for Christmas!. We visit NYC quite often but usually, because we are Floridians, in the warmer months. This was my first time visiting at Christmas and even though the city was extra crowded it was worth it. Bryant park was one of my favorite parts of this trip. We were traveling with another family and our kids had the best time here. They loved looking through all the Christmas shops that were set up and eating all the great food! The husbands enjoyed getting drinks at the outdoor bar. Overall, Bryant Park was great!

Bleak in Winter. We wandered into Bryant Park, which sprawls behind the New York Public Library, on a cold February day. Tables, chairs and benches stood empty. Myriad leafless London plane trees gave the 9.6 acres a European look. We planned to check out the great lawn here that we had heard about, but instead immediately came across a 170-foot by 100-foot free-admission ice rink with oodles of skaters.A group of people were curling in front of the rink. This turned out to be one of the ice activities offered during an ongoing, two-day Winter Carnival. We watched the curling for a while, gawked at the William Cullen Bryant Memorial and the Gertrude Stein Monument and took in the view of tall buildings surrounding the park. It was mid-afternoon on a Friday and no crowds had yet arrived for the festivities. After a short stay, we decided that, despite the carnival, nothing really beckoned for us to stay here at this time of year. But I plan to return in summer to enjoy the park with everything in bloom.
Great meeting spot!!. Love walking around the park. Bryant Park Grill is a good spot for appetizers and a glass of wine or lunch. Casual and comfortable

such a great place!. As a local I LOVE Bryant Park! In the winter you have all the little shops and so much fun all around with the ice rink. But in the summer its a real treat! you have to make sure to visit the website and check out all the FREE activities they do every day. GAMES, DANCES, CLASSES, PLAYS you name it!
Nice to sit in in the summer. Not fancy but there's a good crowd and it's relaxing to eat your lunch here. Basic tables and shares in a park.

Even on a cold night this Park will warm your heart.. Met up with a good friend, who is new to the City, at Bryant Park and she was amazed at the people ice skating and the bar and the friendliness that was apparent from local and visitors alike at the park. The atmosphere is wonderful to just hang out or ice skate or have a drink and it's location is just between 40th and 42nd right off the beaten path of Broadway and a walk away from Grand Central if you have to hope on the train out of town later. Revitalize your spirit for NYC and visit this Park at twilight and enjoy the night.

Winter Village!!!. We visited Bryant Park so my wife could Ice skate on our recent trip to NYC. It was not crowded, and far less expensive than the other rinks in the area. Only had to rent the skates. She enjoyed herself, and we will return if we are back there during the winter months.

Ice skating during holidays is fun. This is a great alternative to some of the other ice skating rinks during the holidays. The line moves quickly and they get you in and out quick. It's also a lot less expensive. The rink can get pretty crowded but not too bad. The shops around the rink make it a nice stop to spend some time during the holidays.

Nice place to visit but DON'T use the free Wifi!. We love eating lunch and walking around in Bryant park. There are events year round that may interest you. Check online. Lunch or dinner is pricey yet nice but whatever you do, DO NOT USE the free wifi. My wife's identity was stolen by using it so avoid it. Other than that it is a nice and cheap place to visit.

The Winter Market is a "Win". We were looking to take our kids for some ice skating AND show them a bit of Midtown Manhattan. The Winter Market allows for both! The only cost is for the skate rental. The skates aren't the best, but fine for an hour's skating. It was ice to take in the scenery and skate at the same time.
Beautiful. This place is very peaceful & beautiful. We went when they had ice skating, so that was a nice activity to do, and not TOO overpriced.. $15/30minutes.. hey it's NYC.. lol

Pleasant park in a great location. It's not an area to seek if you want seclusion or to be away from the crowds, but it's a great oasis in a very busy part of the city. It's great to visit during ANY season. I highly recommend a visit to Bryant Park while visiting Times Square.

One of my favorites. Bryant Park is lesser known than Central Park, but that isn't necessarily a bad thing. It has an ice-skating rink in the winter and is home to film festivals, yoga events and other fun activities during the summer. It's by far less touristy and is also located near many great eateries, while also boasting its own quaint stores which for example sell multi flavored popcorn.
Check out the Winter Market. Not sure if that's what it's called, but vendors set up shop in the park in November, and its wonderful. Booths, food and the park. What more could you want!

Always Stop By!. We've been to Bryant Park winter, spring, summer and fall. It offers something new virtually every time. I love the Christmas sops, the Winter Festival and the summertime watching people playing ping pong or jst hanging out.
Very popular at night in summer. i could not believe how popular this park is in the evening in August. Lots of people eating or just relaxing in the park.
great escape. a great escape in the heart of manhattan, with changing activities depending on the season , during last visit had a skatting ring
A GOOD PLACE FOR A REST. Right in the middle of mid-town Manhattan is this delightful little park. It is a pleasant place to relax and enjoy some quiet any time of the year.

Perfect for Family bonding!. Visited the park last January and tried ice skating.. The park was perfect for family get together I could say since it's not overcrowded. Located in the middle of huge skyscrapers..
Best at Christmas. A great local park set up with local shops from Thanksgiving thru Christmas. Good at Bryant Park Grill is wonderful and the ambiance is fabulous.

Fantastic sundowner to reflect and refresh. This is a fabulous location to relax and replenish at the end of a busy shopping day or log day at work. The location is ideal. The food is always delicious and they have a wide assortment of cocktails and drinks. If you are alone, you can find a perch outside to people watch and wind down with your thoughts. Service is just right.

Loved it!. So many activities to do. In the summer times there is free movie nights with popcorn in the centre. You can sit and relax, take a break from your busy day in New York or be active and play chess and other games.

Unique Christmas shopping . If u are looking for the not so usual gift, the Bryant Park temporary x-mas shops sell all kinds of items u are not going to find anywhere else. Imported goods, hand made items and just eclectic collections. It's worth the stroll. Plenty of foods to choose from and if the line is small, throw on some skates and see the park from the inside out.

Bryant Park in Spring or winter. Bryant Park in Spring or winter... Winter you have all shops it is so beautiful, you need to eat a Burritos in Bryant Park... In spring just before visiting Library you can have a hot drink for tea time there. excellent. I recommend this place

I love Bryant park. Bryant park is one of my favorite attractions in NYC.I love the carousel for little children and the ice skating ring in the winter ! The Christmas tree and the Christmas shops always make my holidays magic !

Take a break in Bryant Park. Bryant Park adjoins the New York Public Library, one of the world's most esteemed collection of books.. Bryant Park is a marvellous place for a break. I spent several very pleasant hours sharing drinks with New Yorkers who had decided that drinking at the Bryant Park bar while working on their iPads was much more congenial than working in their office. Anyone who thinks New Yorkers are stand-offish should spend some time at Bryant Park.

Ice skate here! . Wonderful place to ice skate. Safe, not over crowded. Good family space. Skate guards to keep things organized and assist the few folks that fall and need help getting back up. All ages!
better in summer or xmas. walked through there in February, ice skating was ok not quite rockerfeller center, but probably less costly. the shops were closed (they close in jan)

Beautiful!!. Loved Bryant parks chilled feeling in summer, and loved it just as much on a winter visit. Great place to watch the ice skating and also the ever changing colours of the Empire State at night.

Fun place to walk around.. We walked around Bryant park and got coffee and hot chocolate on a really cold day. It's fun to people watch and an inexpensive thing to do. We got a cool xmas ornament in one of the little kiosks.

Fun and Affordable Ice Skating. When you are in NYC in January, ice skating seems like a rite of passage. My friends and I were planning to go to the rink at Central Park. A kind man on the subway suggested that we go to Bryant Park--a smaller rink but the only charge is for skate rental ($15). We were headed to CP any way so we checked there first. We only wanted to skate about twenty minutes so the $40 for admission and skate rental seemed a bit exorbitant. The rink is a good size though.Next, we headed to Rockefeller Center (it was on the way) to check it. The rink is tiny, crowded (as you would expect), and super expensive. Our journey continued to Bryant Park. The employees were friendly and really hustling to get people the skates! The rink was being Zambonied when we arrived but that was not a big deal to us. We had time to get skates and rent a bag (small $8) to hold our purses and shoes with the attendant. The small bag was plenty large enough for three sets of shoes and purses. We had a ball skating! There are rules against taking your camera or phone out--and the rink guards enfore this strictly! We saw them correct lots of people in the thirty minutes we were there. Everyone skating had a terrific time and you could tell the employees enjoyed themselves as well. Thank you for a fun break in the day!
Fun during the holidays!. Great holiday market - this will be a new annual tradition for me. So many good gifts and fun things to see - plus watching the ice skating.
Fun fun park. Ice skating, kiosks galore, coffee, spices, great food spots, fun little booth shops. Great park! Get a real NYC feel.

Great people Watching. We enjoyed an afternoon drink in Bryant park, next to the New York Public Library.
A great place to sit outside and people watch during a busy afternoon.

Great outdoor space. The park is situated next to the Library which is also worth a visit.
There was a skating rink when we went and places to sit and watch the world go by. Not very big but full of character.

Lovely park in the hustle and bustle of NYC. So nice to wander around or sit for awhile after navigating the busy avenues of NYC and the masses of humanity! Great to catch a zen moment before immersing yourself into the thrum of what is NYC.

Lovely. Lovely park, close to the library, ice skating rink and seats there to sit and people watch...lovely to go to in the evening/night time with all the lights lit up (Bank of China building with the rainbow colours opposite looks great too)We went when it was bitterly cold but would definitely recommend (would be better when weather is warmer so it's not as cold but nevertheless worth visiting!)

Beautiful Place in NYC. Bryant Park is a beautiful open space in Midtown Manhattan where you can enjoy skating and markets in winter, and relaxing in the open spaces during summer. There are a number of small coffee/snack vendors around the park and loads of seats with and without tables to sit and listen to the birds singing and watch the world go by, all while surrounded by skyscrapers and only 2 minutes from the madness of Times Square

Always filled with people. Curious little park, flanked on one side by a public library and on the other by a very busy boulevard. There are always activities organized; in February, a huge skating rink filled with parents, children, young and old. Small kiosks offering coffee and sandwiches allow for a nice break.
Love it!. It is a beautiful park! Ice-skating, shops, benches, clean bathrooms, near the library, and fun all around! It's great for everyone!! Tons of events year round!

A little gem to discover as you wander down 5th Avenue.. We were lucky enough to be here when the Christmas Market was on & the ice rink was in operation. It was magical after dusk when the lights were on & some of the stalls were really interesting so we had a great time browsing for gifts.

Awesome simile for NYC. This is almost like a mini-Manhattan. During the Xmas season, it is also home to a nice gifts mall with stuff from real artisans. During the three non-winter seasons, it is home to the NYC petanque club, which even teaches novices to play this great game -- sort of like marbles for grown-ups. There are chairs and little sandwich kiosks and, under the shadow of the great New York Public Library, an outdoor bar and a great brasserie with indoor and outdoor seating.

Love this place at Christmas. We spent Christmas Day here and it was a great place to get into the holiday spirit. We loved walking around and looking in the little shops, having a drink and a snack, watching the skaters and admiring the Christmas tree. This is the perfect place to spend time at the holidays, especially if you're away from home.

Christmas delight!. We went in late Nov early Dec so the Christmas Market was there and the Ice rink. The stalls where lovely with unique gifts and christmas decorations. The lovely christmas tree was up but sadly not lit! Lovely food stalls and the fountain is lovely all frozen! great in the day or in the evening.

Beautiful Park especially at Christmas Time. We came across Bryant Park when we were out discovering the city. It had a Christmas market, Beautiful Christmas tree and lovely ice skating rink. The ice rink was much more impressive than Central park which I found disappointing.We had a lovely wander round the Christmas markets, enjoyed some hot apple cider and came across the state senator doing a press conference!We enjoyed sitting watching people skating and watching the world go by. The Christmas tree was gorgeous.The whole place was busy both daytime and in the evening. It was lovely at nighttime all lit up.Defo worth a visit.

Ice skating in a beautiful enviroments. A very beautiful and relaxing spot in the city where you are able to ice-skate (on a pretty big ice rink) with a backdrop of beautiful historic buildings. This is a great spot for families or if you need a break from a busy and stressful morning in the city.

Peace & quiet!. Just behind NY Library (which was shown in 'The Day After Tomorrow'). Has places to eat & drink, you can get free use of chairs. Sun on the grass of relax in the shade under the trees, or maybe take on someone at chess or have a go on the carousel! Remember you cannot smoke in the park! Haven of peace amongst the mayhem!
A little oasis in the city. Bryant Park is so lovely all lit up at night - with the bars and ice rink. A little oasis in the huge city.

Bryant park a little gem. We came across this little gem of a park while on the sex and the city tour . We came back later to see it at nigh t. Its a lovely place to sit for a hour listing to the music and watching people skating on the small ice rink.We were there on January 2th and most of the food marques were still up and some chrismast markets shops were still open.
Ice Skatin. Enjoy ice skating in New York. Lots of ice skaters and children skating around holding onto penguins.

Came across the park at night time - nice find. Bryant Park is lovely at night. The skating rink was still open when we visited and there were a lot of wooden huts dotted around that resembled Christmas market huts although which weren't open (possibly it was too late in the evening). Could imagine it being very Christmassy on run up to Christmas as some posts mention there is a Christmas tree here. Would be nice to take kids to.

Favourite Place in Manhattan. Bryant Park in January is fantastic. There's a great atmosphere with the ice rink, the restaurant and we were fortunate enough to catch the Christmas market. Its a fantastic place for people watching and relaxing.

Great place to visit at Christmas. We went ice skating here as it was a little quieter than Central Park . They had lots of little huts selling crafts some a little over priced. However there was some good stocking fillers . Usual hot chocolate and crepe stands but good place to spend a few hours
Lovely market. Lots of different shops selling different crafts. Ice skating rink. Lovely atmosphere. Brilliant at Christmas time.
Skate in winter. Bryant park, near the library, is a favorite place for some skating and people watching in the winter, and a meeting place for relaxation in the summer.

Great people watching and silent disco!!!. We stumbled across this park as they were setting up the food and drink marques around the ice rink. It was very cold but they had plenty of indoor heaters to keep you warm!
They then set-up a silent disco with hundreds of people all singing and dancing which was hillarious!!
Well worth a visit

Christmas Markets - a Must!. We stumbled across Bryant Park by accident, but were thrilled to find the Christmas Markets up and running. It was a lovely night time activity after a busy day of sightseeing.

Enjoy. Have been here many times and will continue every time I'm in town. Any time of the year is a great time to visit, wonderful place to revisit past memories and a wonderful place to create new ones.

Christmas Tree and Scating Ring. Beautiful urban park on 42nd Street between 5 Ave and 6 Ave.
Every Christmas season it hosts a Christmas Tree and scating ring.

Best Ice Skating at Christmas Time. Went on a family trip in December. Lots of vendors selling items. Somewhat crowded, but you don't mind. Feels like NYC. We chose to ice skate here instead of Rockefeller Center because it was a larger rink. SO glad we did. Staff is super nice. There are lockers for your skates. Everyone out there is having fun, doesn't matter if you are a professional. Music playing...surrounded by the tall buildings...the big Christmass Tree...and lights. Just magical. Wonderful place to visit during the Holidays.

Not sure what the hype is about. Didn't understand the hype. Lots of stands selling goods at regular prices. The cookies we bought were stale The people are not friendly even though we thought every other place we visited was gracious and kind. It just wasn't my kind of place.
Great skating. I love Bryant Park. Firstly, the Ice Skating is free, but you have to pay for the skates. Usually there is a queue but worth it. It's great for kids and adults.

Free WiFi, Summer Movies, Winter Ice Skating, Just off Fifth Ave. This midtown park is a great spot for a break from shopping or sightseeing. As a New Yorker, I often stop here to check emails, pick up a coffee or snack from one of the vendors and meet friends. The summer movies are a wonderful New York tradition. And adjacent to park, the NY Public Library is a museum in its own right with changing and permanent art and historic exhibits and reading rooms, rich with history, again with free WiFi.

No more Needle Park. What was once a drug den has been turned into a family friendly NYC attraction.Warm weather has a merry go round, lush green lawn and free movies, Winter has ice skating and booths to buy Xmas gifts.Always clean and great places to eat
Free Ice Skating in Winter. Shared space with the fabulous New York City Library. Great park for kids, families, tourists, and locals.

Amazing Place To Visit. Great place to take in a free winter carnival! They have free ice skating, but the skate rental is pricey. Great for pop-up food vendors, though, as well. It also is right on the steps of the public library, which always has great exhibits open to the public.

Beautiful city park...my favorite in NYC. Always something fun going on here. Best urban park for activity and outdoor fun in city. No matter when you visit, always something to do. Great tables and seating, performances, ice skating. We were just there and it was winter carnival weekend with all sorts of fun. Special oasis in city!
just stopped by and watched the skaters. really nice relaxing place in such a busy city, has wifi and toilets and a few food places. they had the ice skating on when we went.

try and go when the christmas market starts.. just happened to be there when the first christmas market opened. the whole atmosphere was wonderful, being from Canada if was great to see the family ice rink and long line up to use it. the market was great, some vendors ran out of product early though.

Jewel of a park in mid town. Every season this park never fails to impress with skating and xmas stalls in the winter to the childrens' carousel,chess games and the dark green bistro chairs and tables set out every morning so visitors can sit and enjoy this lovely place.

Wonderful park to chill out and people watch. Great music too.. Stumbled upon Bryant Park strolling thru the city and so worthwhile. Go ice skating if you have the opportunity. The outside decor, lights and music are magical! Thank you!

Free ice skating rink. I love Bryant Park in any season of the year. During winter, there is an ice skating rink, which is for free if you have your own pair (15 USD for a rental). Great place to hang out in midtown, with beautiful views!

a brief stroll through... After dinner we strolled through Bryant Park and found the rink along with a DJ party with what looked like 3 dj's spinning different music and the listeners had headphones which they could tune to either of the 3 stations. very cool to stumble upon.

Very Pretty Park!. Even in winter, can't help notice how beautiful this small park is! Had a lovely time watching the ice skaters and people drinking hot chocolate. Also loved the hybernating trees----these and the white snow made picture-perfect photography!

A jewel of a park. Designed as a classic English public park, Bryant Park, just behind the NY Public Library used to be the site of NYC's drinking water reservoir. Ignored for decades, in the 1980's it was overhauled; the gardens were replanted and the stone work power-washed and repaired. Only occupying a half city block, the park has been growing aesthetically and is now an integral-- and beloved-- part of the dense office building surroundings since then. This year, Bank if America is underwriting a Winter Carnival: ice rink, "Frozen Fingers" ping pong tables, bean bag throwing, a beer garden and restaurants- all temporary- that enliven the park day and night. During the winter holiday season small vendor booths offer an astounding array of gifts and other goodies. In the summer you can catch office workers sunbathing, free movies at night, a vintage carousel, a few outdoor cafes and more than a few pigeons. The park is one block east of Times Square, so it's an easy walk if you are going to be in the 'neib. While New Yorkers seem gruff and hurried on the street, in the park they are laughing, smiling, and trying to still look cool on ice skates.

Loved it!. I went to NYC solo so I was able to do whatever I wanted. On Sunday, I was able to sit down and watch the bocce players. It was a great break from all the walking. When I left, I caught the Gay Pride Parade. It was excellent to watch while dodging juice boxes that were thrown from the floats. Condoms were also thrown. I ended up at several stores that were giving away the parade condoms too. They were designed well and free!
Places to sit and eat. Needed a place to eat with a friend and just talk. Beautiful park and a great place to sit and share a meal.

Skating and hot chocolate. I treat myself and a friend to a skating and drinks voucher each through Groupon for Bryant Park.. We got there and it wasn't entirely clear where u needed to be but we soon got the hang of it... It's been several years since I skated needless to say my skills were somewhat lacking, my friend however was whizzing around having a great time... After some time on the ice we went to get out hot drink and sat and watched the other skaters... We got skate hire and hot drink for two for $32 which I thought was a really good deal... We got hot chocolate with cream - yummy.. A must do for the whole experience!!!

Prefer it in summer than in winter. It is a great place to hang out throughout the year, but my personal preference is in summer. Winter has the Winter Fair and ice skating rink, but I prefer lounging by the fountain with a tea and a book in summer. Do enjoy the view of the buildings around the park, and learn the names/histories of these buildings.

Great park!!. Great little park, outside vendors including food and drinks. Ice skating was nice to watch. Outdoor bars had food, hot drinks, cocktails and outdoor heaters. Really quaint!! Would recommend a walk thru.

1 week too late. Called in as we were heading back towards Times Square and caught the ice rink by chance. The stands and market had closed the week before, which we were a little sad about. Huge ice rink with lots going on.

Ice Skating. Every year I go Ice Skating in this park because it is so much fun. I meant a lot of young people and became friend with them. This is a park were anyone can make a mistake while Ice Skating and not get laughed at.

Great place to take it all in. Bryant Park is a must visit if you are in mid-town Manhattan. It is a great place to stop and look around and embrace the skyline around you. While there is often something happening in the park, there is plenty of room in the grass to sit. In the winter the ice rank used to be a hidden secret, now not so much but its free if you bring your own skates.
Georgeous Park. This Park is laid out on a square and is gorgeous with it's fountain and ice rink, very clean park, great place to stop and have lunch.
Free Skating. In the winter the fairly large Bryant Park ice rink is available for free. They even resurface the ice on a regular schedule.
Great for people watching. . Lovely views, not terribly busy. Great place to take a coffee or have a spot of lunch and sit back relax, and people watch.

Didn't skate, but the public bathroom was about the best maintained park restroom I've ever seen. Okay, admittedly I did not even know that Bryant Park was there, and I was really just on my way to visit Times Square. But the park was pretty, well-lit and bustling with happy skaters. I did stop at the restroom, which was open and unusually attractive for a park restroom. I was amazed at how clean it was, and how it featured my favorite kind of toilet, which is the one which has the seat lined with plastic that renews itself with a touchless sensor. As I've found that New York City women seem to be particularly bad about peeing on the seats in the city, it was a relief to finally get to sit on a pristine surface. :)

Fun at the ice rink. We had a wonderful time on the ice. Not too crowded and plenty of novices! Great value for money too. We had a fun couple of hours here. Nice places to sit and grab a drink afterwards nearby.

Fantastic park. Loved it! The weather was nice when we went there, and it was a nice relaxing evening at the park. When you're in the city, you need to visit the park sometimes to get some closeness to nature.

Hidden treasure. found Bryant Park by accident , have trolled through streets and stores it was a little haven in a crazy city !! when we visited the skating rink was in full use , the fountain is lovely , but it was so cold that it had become an ice sculpture !! I would think that in the warmer months it would be lovely to stop and have a coffee here and recharge your batterys . good place to people watch too . so nice that there is somewhere to sit and rest a while .

Fantastic. We went skating on our last day in New York, and all I can say what an amazing way to finish our visit. Even if your not ice skating it is so worth going if for nothing else but to watch the non skaters falling over

A super place in NY for ice skating around Christmas time - with German-style market for the non skaters. My family and I (husband and 2 teenage daughters) spent a very pleasant couple of hours here one afternoon before Christmas while holidaying in NYC. We had checked out the various places for ice-skating (my 13 year old daughter was keen to - as was I!) - and decided upon Bryant Park primarily because we understood that there was a German-style Christmas market at that time of the year. We were not disappointed. DD2 and I got to skate - usual half blunt skates - but I've never had it any other way wherever I've skated! So we enjoyed ourselves. DH and DD1 watched and took photos and then mooched around the stalls, finding a couple of Christmas presents for family members along the way. The Christmas tree was lovely and we were very glad that we had visited. Highly recommended!

All season family fun. Bryant Park is the only park that offers free ice skating. There are several events and activities for family and couples. During the Christmas season, you can purchase holiday gifts. Bryant Part is famous for the Annual Fashion Week, with designers from around the world. Summer months, a large screen is setup for movies night for the entire family.

Midtown Park. If you want to relax on a nice day. Bryant park is great for a picnic. You can bring your lunch and look at all the surroundings. It is nice that it has a ping pong table and there are plenty of places to sit and enjoy the view. There is a lot of grass and trees around the park and there is plenty of room to walk around and enjoy the view.

Funky energy filled spot. Fun to sit observe. Happily it is no longer the dangerous place of yore . A great spot to meet, hang out and observe. For writers, easy to occupy a table just keep only 1 chair. Central, dynamique real New York occupied by out of towners.
One of the better Parks to visit. They usually have a fair or event in this park. During Christmas they had a skating rink. Also walking distance to public library and Grand Central Station.
