Whether it's summer or winter, great place to hang out. Sometimes, when I have business meetings in NYC, I just sit down there, watch people or read a book or magazine. It's a wonderful hideaway place in the middle of buzzing Manhattan.

Cool but not too much to see. I have been here to see a concert and just to walk around and it's very nice but I wouldn't go out of your way to see it. It's in a great location and it sometimes has fun things to do.
Central Oasis. Small park but central, and a real oasis in the concrete jungle, and good that in winter it is a skating ground.

Fresh little escape from Times Square. Christmas in Bryant park was magical. There were stalls aplenty serving hot coffee, cider and churros YUM. The skating rink was very popular try early in the morning to avoid the lines!

Well worth a visit . If I'm honest not sure what to make of the place, yes it was good the vibe the feel but still could not work out what it actually was, the ice rink was fun and the market feel of the little shacks selling their wares was good, well worth a visit
Byrant Park. Went here on our last day to have a look around. Very Christmassy. Ice skating and lots of little stalls.

Great park!. Love this park no matter the time of year... but especially this year at Thanksgiving and Christmas-time. My husband and I got to attend the tree-lighting ceremony and it was awesome! This park was one of the first places we visited on our first trip to NYC in 2007.

A Christmas Must-See!. The ice skating rink and all the little shops set up in the park make this a must-see during our visit to NYC at Christmas time. We enjoy watching the skaters, hearing the laughter of the children and browsing through the many shops.
Fun Visit. We had such a great time at this park because it had a Christmas Fair where locals sold homemade things. Definitely a must if visiting NY.

Beautiful Bryant. We have visited several times over the past few years in all seasons; today a blustery windy winter day-still very pretty.
Don't forget to visit the NYC library, a gorgeous building with lots of history.

Ice skating and little shops. Nothing gets you in the Christmas spirit like ice skating followed by wandering through all the little shops throughout the park! I bought handmade finger puppets for my 2 year old grandson.

Great Place to Be. Bryant Park is a beautiful little park in midtown. There is always something going on. Spring and summer are great for relaxing, having a bite to eat, tai chi classes, live music, movies on a big screen at night and so much more. In the fall and winter, they set up great booths for a holiday craft fair with artisans from all over as well as an ice skating rink. It's just a great place to sit and relax for a while from the hustle and bustle.

Wonderful during the winter. We stopped by here the week between Christmas and New Years. We have been to NYC many times during the holidays in the past and never stopped here. Don't know why. It was very enjoyable. Beautiful Christmas tree, ice skating rink, and lot of cute little shops. Not sure if the shops stay open all year. Very nice stop.
Beautiful Park full of snow, love it.. Love this park, is very nice every time I go, and beautiful place to relax and take a lot of pictures.

pretty. We were in NYC Dec 2015. While walking around the city we came upon this wonderful spot. Lots of little shops and food vendors. Great place for souvenirs and local art. There is also a wonderful outdoor skating rink. We did not skate as there was a huge line up. The area is so pretty with all the trees lit up with white lights. A definite must see!

Better in winter. Bryant park was underwhelming. Much smaller than expected. However in the Winter there are nice winter stalls that offer different types of food which was fun. It added to the winter feel. I would normally give a 3 star though as that was abuot all there was to do apart from ice skate (if you can get on due to crowds).

Year Round Destination. Besides maybe Central Park, Bryant Park is my favorite outdoor space in NYC. They have a finely curated series of events and activities all year long. In the winter, the holiday shops here are the best. In the summer, the Monday night movie screenings can't be beat. Its proximity to Time Square, 5th Avenue, Grand Central and the Public Library make it a must see.
Green of ZE city. In the movie section, I introduce you Bryan Park. How cool, clever and smart it is, located right in the middle of the center of NY

Hidden delight. Found Bryant park by chance, it was Dec 30th, the skating rink was in full swing, a big plus was all the Christmas shops still being open overlooked by a super Christmas tree.A lovely atmosphere all round.
ice skating with class. We did ice skating, also getting a beginner class.A nice program with kids.They have a good structure.
The shops and ice skating was fun. It's hard to believe is was winter - I have a heavy winter coat but I don't think I will need it. I didn't realise there was so much to do and see in New York City.

Always a great place to go!. I always look forward to going to Bryant Park especially in the winter when they have alll oft he vendors openThe ice skating is great to watch. The food vendors are always unique and fun to eat at. A great place to people watch but be sure to keep an eye on your belonging Two years ago we had our back pack stolen

Cute winter market . The winter holiday market has some interesting art, craft and jewellery vendors along with different types of food and a couple of good coffee spots. Nice to watch people ice skating also. Can't comment any other time of the year.

It's a winter wonderland!. I've only been in the winter (twice) and it's great!My daughters both ice skated there. It is the largest rink, and it is completely FREE and you can skate as long as you'd like. We had to pay $15 for skate rentals since we don't have our own.There is a nice indoor area you can sit in and stay warm while watching your kiddos skate.All in all, it was a VERY nice experience. Although the rink at Rockefeller plaza is iconic and special (we did that at Christmas time 2 years ago)... the experience at Bryant Park is MUCHHHHH better!!!
Fun Especially During the Holidays. Love shopping at the holiday markets, dining right in the park overlooking the ice skaters and ice skating!
beautiful setting for ice rink. a very nice ice rink in the heart of the city, if you have your own skates its free, the pop up bar was nice but very expensive

Beautiful Park. For my first time in New York I have been so lucky to see places like here in the beautiful winter views.
Currently there is an ice rink there and it looks good fun to go on.
It's a nice place to have a drink or bite to eat and relax during sight seeing.

Something to do in every season. People watching is always fun in Bryant Park in every season. In the winter they add fun little pop up shops to browse and buy and an ice rink. In the summer you can't go wrong with library in the park, Broadway in the Park or concerts. There's also a carousel and I once saw a nun playing ping pong. Food is close and there is plenty of seating. Go into library at Bryant Park to look at the exhibits, the original Winnie the Pooh collection or the Gutenberg Bible.

Great to enjoy with family and loved ones. I happened to visit on my way back to the hotel after a quick breakfast at Le Pain Quotidien. It's a nice park to enjoy some family time, friends and with loved ones.

Nice park!. We went in the middle of summer and the park is a nice breathing space. It has food, activities in the afternoon, a place to lay down. The trees are very nice and its like taking a step out from the city. Not an all day affair kind of place but very nice to stop by and chill.
Free ice skating. As we were there in November the ice rink and winter garden was set up. This is a free activity in the park and it was not really busy.

Ice skating? Yes please. Whilst visiting New York just after new year and seeing all the people ice skating on the movies, we thought we would give it a go. There are a few places to do this, but Bryant park was close to our hotel and quiet(ish). I highly recommend doing this during the winter months, I think it's open until May, but you might want to double check. There is a bar there for those of you that wish to watch, the stalls were closed, which was a shame, but the ice skating was our main plan.A must do, even if your a beginner.

Bryant park. We walked past this on an evening stroll in the dark, it was so cold and beautiful with all the lights twinkling and music playing with quite a busy ice rink. We didn't have a go, but stood and watched for a while.

Winter Wonderland. 2nd visit to Bryant park during the winter season and it's great. The stalls have really good quality items so made a number of purchases with each stall being able to take cards which was great. The park looks great all done up for Christmas, and this time we stopped off at the cafe in the park, the food was good and it was nice to sit in amongst all the buzz of the park. My only comment about the cafe was as it was so busy service was a bit slow and they mucked up our order (to our advantage) by forgetting our 2nd chips but giving us the table next to us their chips by accident meaning they did not get their chips until well after they had finished the rest of their food. The staff were great though and dealt well with the the situation. It is initially unclear if you order food at the bar or it is waiter service again this was just due to how busy it is and they take a credit card off you when you order as security you won't do a runner which is fair. Would recommend it and will visit the cafe again if I get to go back to NYC.

Always the best park in NYC. Bryant Park is always the best park in NYC in my opinion, small but always something going on and a great spot in the middle of midtown. They had an ice rink in winter along with café etc. In summer there are plenty seats and benches for a seat and to take in the views of the city and the Empire State Building.
Christmas festivities . What a wonderful experience on a Christmas that was warmer than usual ! The skating rink , the Christmas market , Christmas tree make for a wonderful holiday experience

Winter wonderland. Bryant Park is transformed in to a lovely winter village. Dozens of little artisan units selling unique wares...couple this with the ice rink which is free(skate hire costs but if you had your own skates the skating is free) you can have a great experience... Well worth a visit....

Christmas vacation 2015 . Best new place to visit during Christmas, ice skating ring. Huge holiday market, lots of people great food great shopping Near Broadway, near the Empire State Building, subway. Just love the

Loved the outdoor ice rink!!!!. Went there with a large group of students. If you have skates with you, you can go right in for free. They do offer rentals (no time limit). And they also rent out "Penquins" for little kids who are learning the skate. There is indoor and outdoor area (no charge) that people can sit and wait or watch the skaters. They do have small locker rentals ($). They also have storage ($) for larger groups. There is also a small cafe inside for snacks and drinks. Not part of the ice rink are several cafes. One, I know overlooks the rink. Can't remember if the second one also has a view of the rink. Lovely ice skating rink.Really enjoyed it a lot!
Great market. Lovely place and individual market shops, in winter also an ice rink, gifts galore, just wished we would have found it sooner

Wonderful!. This is in my top ten visits in New York. The stalls weren't cheap but they varied and interesting. It had a relaxed atmosphere and a wide selection of food. We sampled the waffles which were ok, the coffee which was good, Mac n cheese (a treat) and these weird bread/donut cylinders filled with chocolate- be warned that you can't finish it and you will be covered in chocolate! All in all a little oasis in the city!

Loved It😊. Bryant park is just a wonderful place we were there when it was all done up for Christmas, beautiful tree, ice skating, market place and lots food stalls. Wonderful, loved it such a magical feel.

Lovely place to sit, just sit. We spent an hour or so sitting and watching the skaters in Bryant Park..seemed like a painting of a simpler time. The park was filled with chairs and lined with cafes and just beckoned one to "take a load off."

Migrating birds.... Here is some useful and yet useless information. For reasons unknown, this little city park is a haven for migrating birds in spring and fall. There are precious few chances to engage with wildlife in NYC but if you are around in May or September why not join one of the free bird walks on a Monday morning or Thursday afternoon. There isn't much else that is free in NYC!

Beautiful and not with a lot of tourists!. It is a really nice park to visit and more for locals. It has a special fair in the winter which makes it very very special....and in the summer a lot of films are being played for free sponsored by Bank of America...you must visit it!

Ice skate New york. Of the options available, this was by far the best value, but be warned the ice isnt game rink quality, and theres a few speed skaters that like carving. There is employees that cool them off, but by then the grooves are made. Hire skates are solid, but also need some sharpening. I'm not complaining, as said best value for money, and your not locked into a session.
Love this park. I was amazed with this park in the middle of the city. Skating in the park with amazing boutique type stores surrounding it all. It was breath taking and I can't wait to go back

Great skating. My partner and some friends went ice skating here during the winter festival. As it was after Christmas the food huts and stalls were gone which was a shame as myself and a friend watched as the men and kids skated round could have done with a hot drink. It was however a magical experience. Had seen the other two rinks at Central Park and Rockefeller and this I felt had the best scenery around. It cost $15 with no time limit so If your legs allow you can skate forever.
Great Winter Spot. Love Bryant Park in the winter. Ice Skating rink is open and the Christmas Tree is so beautiful. Tons of shops are there in the Winter Garden, jewelry, art and delicious food

Ice skating rink. We walked to the Park from our hotel in January. The weather was cooperative and was great for the people ice skating. The rink was larger than what I imagined. There were experienced skaters and new skaters on the rink. Any of the small kiosks were not open, assuming due to the time of year. The statues and architecture around the park are nice to look at.

Winter wonderland. Spent time here after our visit to NY public library, the park is just behind. Watched the ice skaters but it was bitterly cold so didn't fancy skating. Great photo opportunities here as the surrounding buildings are beautiful. Free public toilets available in the park which are beautifully kept with fresh flowers on display.
Iceskating . We loved Bryant park..... Ice skating was fab.... Loads of seating areas. Easy access for subway areas..... We also visited public library which was lovely
Ice skating . We went ice skating at Bryant Park which was fun to do on a winter's day. Food was expensive inside the skating area. The skates for rental were not great quality.

Skate, shop, grab a bite to eat.. Bryant Park is a nice place to spend some leisure time. Enjoy many vendors of merchandise and foods of different nations as well. There are places to sit, you can ice skate or people watch.

Nice park. Nice park, close to our hotel. Bought lunch from restaurant nearby and ate in the park. You can ice skate there, we didn't. We did buy a waffle from a vendor in the park on another occasion and it was delicious!
Great City Park. The ice rink, the food stalls, the great little shops....this is a fun place to wander any time but especially during the holidays.

Great, little park. I usually like to go here when they have Christmas village because you can ice skate, as well as, check out all the little shops to buy presents at. It's very easy to get to and near a whole bunch of other things
Perfect place for your breakfast. Nice place, not to big with few nice French bakeries on Tesla corner...very pleasant for breakfast in NY park...

Great People Watching. I loved coming here in the summer and having myself a private little picnic while people watching. Everyone seemed very happy. Games were being played on the side. Great lawn view. Cute little tables and chairs. Great spot to read a book.

Total NYC experience . One of my favourite places on my holiday . Who knew so many activities could be packed into one space !!!!! Reading areas , food , coffee, wine , carousel, games , reading area , wifi, device charging. Huge grassy area to soak up the city atmosphere . Will go back to see it in winter . And the line for the public amenities is worth the wait !!! Very cool retro design . A must see !!!!!
Visit at Christmas. Great place to shop Christmas presents all covered.Have a meal or coffee while watching the skating.

Rockefeller alternative. Rockefeller Centre's seasonal ice rink seems to get all the credit - but Bryant Park is better, cheaper and more accessible to greater numbers of people. And the fact that there is more infrastructure for the supporting cast of family members and friends to sit around the fringes of the rink, drinking coffee or hot chocolate is a big bonus. And if that's too boring - step away and visit the seasonal market stalls packed with a variety of goods.Well worth a visit.

Sunday skating. Wandered past Bryant Park on our way to Empire State Building. There was no line for the skating rink. $15 skate rental. Chairs around the ice rink were nice for the non-skaters to sit and watch. The rink was a bit crowded but seemed like the workers kept everyone safe.

Nice Stop for Lunch in a Winter Park Setting. We seem to have lunch at Bryant Park Grill every time we visit New York. Casual setting, good prices, upscale service. Nice setting in Bryan Park. We enjoy this restaurant.
Awesome. Beautiful site to see. Loved this park. We will definitely return. I can't say enough about our experience!

Fabulous visit during the Christmas markets. Visited Bryant Park Christmas Markets during our first visit to NY. Wonderful to wander through the markets and pick up some NY themed and NY made items including hand made jewellery. Would definitely visit again if in NY around Christmas time.

ice skating. Bryant Park is almost iconic in Ne York at Christmas with the ice skating and local street market vendors.
Its a must do on your list of places to go in December - Jan
Skating in the park. Great afternoon skating outdoors in Bryant Park. Skate hire reasonable with somewhere for non skaters to sit and watch.
movie location the best place. If you want to feel the real athmosphere of NYC just go there at lunch time during the work days otherwise just pass by at evening and admire the stars

SKATE at Byrant Park. We went to NYC early December. Hear so much about Rockefeller Center we almost didn't go to Bryant Park. So glad we did. We paid for the "fast pass", so worth it. On the ice skating in 5 minutes, no line to wait in. You are allowed on the ice as long as you want to skate
Skating. so Beautiful to skate in the wintes and having a nice time... skating is free and is near to all good restaurants and places... prepare to walk a lot in the area.
Great place. We really enjoyed visiting this park. There was a lot to do that could fit everyone. My husband enjoyed a beer while we shopped.

Lovely park, all year round. No matter what time of year, Bryant Park always has something going on. It's located right behind the gorgeous NY Public Library, and has ice skating in the winter and concerts in the summer.
cool!. really enjoyed watching the people ice skate. The restaurants looked very nice. Right next to the New York Public Library. Very beautiful park
Skatking. We decided to do something a little different on this trip to the city. We rented skates for $15 each and had a blast skating.
Shopping. I love the holiday season especially when the vendors are in the park. We bought so many great gifts and enjoyed walking around.
Super holiday atmosphere. Crisp, cold, sunny afternoon. Watching the skating, local craft stalls, bars and eats, relaxing holiday music - a great way to spend an hour or two during the day.

Big ice skate ring! . I think this is the bigger ice skate ring in Manhattan, not counting the ones at the Central Park but it's a nice surprise been walking down the 5 avenue and suddenly find out this park with a huge amount of people skating! It's awesome! I recommend going at night cause you can see the Empire State Building while skate!

Ice skating . Ice skating here is free. Only fee is $15 for skate rentals. Whole family had a great time. I would recommend going when they first open or at least in the morning. When we first walked by there were only a handful of people there but by the time we came back around 1pm it was packed.

Interesting Holiday event offering. During the recent holidays, there were some interesting Vendor booths ringing the ice-skating rink and an indoor eatery. Crowds were heavy for the restaurant and ice rink. The Vendor booths had some interesting items, but after a while, seem to be a bit repetitive. If walking up from Herald Square towards Rockefeller Center, coming across Bryant Park was an very nice diversion.
Festive. Many boutiques where you can find lots of handmade crafts and holiday themed goodies. Can be a little crowded but that's part of the Christmas in NYC experience. Festive and fun to visit!

Beautiful spot to relax after walking!. As a local, I love this spot. If I've had an afternoon of shopping or errands and am in this neighborhood, I love to enter the park, sit (and put my feet up on another chair if ones available ), close my eyes for a while, or check my email. There's wifi in the park now. This park gets an "A" if you're a gardener like me, or if you're a mom or dad with a stroller and just want a quick escape. Definitely pencil this place into your itinerary. You won't be sorry. Stay 15 minutes or an hour or more.
Perfect plan for a Sunday. Went with my best friend, sat and watched the people skate while drinking a coffee at one of the cafes
Skating in Bryant Park. Skating in Bryant Park, what fun, like being a kid again. And it was snowing, the first real snow in New York City!

Froze at Bryant Park. Absolutely beautiful experience watching skater in Bryant park. Nice setting and so very christmassy. Tick off my list to experience a white christmas. Too bad weather was too mild for real snow.
Quaint park with great holiday shops. Loved all the little temporary holiday shops in this park... Spent a while looking around at unusual shops

Great place to relax at Chirstmas time. We spend a happy couple of hours wandering around the stalls and soaking up the atmosphere on Christmas Eve. The weather was unusually warm but even wandering around in a T-shirt it still felt Christassy. The stalls are great and so are the food and drink stands and with the hubub in the streets around it was almost an oasis of tranquility.

Great shops and eating at Christmas. Our hotel was very close to Bryant park and we quickly figured out that was a great place to grab food. The Christmas shops were so much fun with unique gifts of all types to buy. The food selections had a good range although some were a bit overpriced. Good vegetarian selection and great atmosphere during Christmas in the whole park.

So Much Activity. Winter skating and dining rink-side... It was quite busy on a Friday night, but it's a nice experience and there's plenty of room to stay back and find an uncrowded space to just watch.

My backyard away from home . I usually stay at the Bryant Park Hotel and this beautiful park is a constant view from my room. From the ice skating rink I winter to the full blooms and entertainment during warner temps this is a great park to lay on the grass or grab a table and share a meal.
Socializing.. During summer movies played on big screen. Quite good concert offered. Always something is going in there. And with Library behind it is pleasant place to visit.

Great find in the centre of the city. What a great find in the middle of a bustling city!!! Lovely skating rink, warm stalls to browse and a nice park in general. The Christmas tree was lovely. I enjoyed a nice break from sight-seeing here.

We had an OK time . I had young children with me they became bored easily as I wanted to shop at the stores, some stores had things for children but it was crowded and a little difficult to maneuver with small children, it was fairly clean and refreshments were available.

An amazing winter village. This place is great and has a more impressive ice rink than the Rockefeller Centre. The little stores selling quaint goods are a wonder and the smell of fresh waffles is very tempting!
A nice place to take a rest. A good place to take a rest and stop a little. During some part of the year it has a free skating part really nice!
Great Xmas atmosphere. Really enjoyed a few hours watching others skating had a hot chocalate and took in the atmosphere some really nice Xmas stalls with unusual produce

Especially at Christmas. The Christmas Village, Christmas trees, and ice rink are a must visit for locals and visitors between Thanksgiving and Christmas. Delightful food, drink, aromas, and people watching. Don't miss.

Winter Wonderland!. By the public library (featured in the film Ghost Busters) is a large ice skating rink, huge Christmas tree and Christmas market, which was perfect to get me in the mood for Christmas. Go in the evening to see all the lights. There are plenty of places to sit and watch the people ice skating and plenty of places to buy food and drinks. The Christmas is in wooden sheds like German markets and they sell unique gifts.
Interesting activities. When we were there they had a chess tournament taking place for days. Interesting watching the people who were involved.

Accident. I used to love Bryant Park, I have shopped in the stores and skated at the rink multiple times. I am a native New Yorker and used to skate a lot as a kid so I revived my love of it in the last few years. However, on December 30 of 2015, a few weeks ago, I had a bad fall when some Irish or Scottish adult male tourist slammed into me, very hard, and a girl about 12 years old. I fell hard on the front of my hand and could barely move it for days. Luckily it wasn't broken but when I contacted the park I was told by someone named Kristen in the corporate offices that she would get back to me regarding filing a report. She never did. So the next day I emailed Bryant Park Corporation and someone named Rachel Zurier responded saying that their office would get back to me the following week, but they never did. So I emailed them again yesterday and asked about filing a report, but they didn't respond. Also for the record, when I fell, none of the skate guards came over to help, and then I was asked to move, while injured and in a lot of pain, by some man taking pictures of his family in front of the tree. When I told him I was injured he made a face and insulted me. Only the tourist who hit me tried to help. Be warned that when it is crowded here (and this was at 9:30am on a weekday, I went before work) there are a lot of people who can't skate at all and it is dangerous. I guess the park doesn't care about its patrons. I just hope I don't get tendonitis from the injury.

Urban Oasis. Once, one of the city's water reservoirs today Bryant Park is a bustling place to lounge, ice skate (during the winter), eat, shop (in specialty kiosks), and escape the traffic (pedestrian and vehicle) that is just on the other side of the park's borders. The Park shares the block with the magnificent central branch of the New York Public Library. In fact, beneath the park there are over 80 miles of shelves storing the library's book collection. The park is just a long city block from Times Square. Enjoy
A very cosy park. In the middle of Manhattan close to Times Square surrounded by skyscrapers there is a gem called Bryant Park. Love the ice skating and the cafes

Pleasant experience. Such a well kept area and a pleasant place to relax for a while during your time in New York. We collected our breakfast at local deli and sat at table at the park which was thoroughly enjoyable
Fantastic Place at Christmas. Love this place and all the little holiday shops, tree and rink! Don;t miss this park when in New York!
Fabulous spot. I found it purely by chance. A really lovelly place. Peaceful and a great resting place in a visit to nyc. Highly recommended.
Family Trip. Bryant Park is a must see when me and my family are visiting NY, specially during winter. You can ice skating and have amazing food
Skating rink and park. Passed by during the visit to New York. They had skating ring and some restaurants built in area for winter. Place seemed nice.
Xmas Market in the Park. Enjoyed going around the stalls and actually buying bits and pieces. Very busy with people on the ski ring which is at the back of the park.

Local hangout. Been to this park a few times, but other than the skating rink there is not much of note here. The rink itself is usually pretty busy, and so there are better places to skate for those interested in that activity. The remainder of the park is set up with shops catering to niche or tourist dollars. A nice place for a walk through, but not as spectacular as some say.

I'm sure it's better in the warmer seasons. I traveled here in January. The Christmas tree had seen better days and needed to be removed. The ice skating rink was very nice and the surrounding buildings are beautiful. I'm sure it is a great park in the summer. There was just not much going on when I was here.
Wonderful place. What an oasis in the middle of all the skyskrapers. Had lunch here a few times during my visit. Great place to sit and watch the world go by.

Gorgeous Christmas markets. We were lucky enough to experience Bryant Park at Xmas. Heated glass stalls light up the park surrounding the ice rink. If in NYC near Xmas this is a must. Awesome waffles at corner of park all year round.

Winter Wonderland. 2nd only to Central Park, the park offers a great christmas feel if you go during the holiday season. Ice skating is free if you bring your own gear and there are many shops and vendors for shopping and foodies.
A pearl in the heart of manhattan. The place to realx,enjoy and ice skate in the cold winter.i Love it very much, in spri g or summer a lovely place to drink coffe and relax from the bussy city.
Nice place in the summer. Lots of outdoors activities in the summer (movie screenings, yoga in the park, etc)... not really a place worth going in the winter.

Cold. Really cold!. Stumbled across this delight on a cold and clear night just after New Years. Great fun for the family. skate higher $19 and stay on the ice for as long as you want. bring your own skates and its free.Brilliant
Winter time at Bryant Prak. having hot chocolate while watching skaters in the park was very good. Many chairs available. Festive skating rink.
Fun Place!. We visited a couple of nights when the temporary Christmas Shops and an ice skating rink were in the park. It was such a lovely environment with many, many visitors.

So much fun!!. We visited Bryant Park in December! There was ice skating, shopping (lots of shops)!! Everything was decorated so beautiful! We truly enjoyed our visit to Bryant Park. It was right in Times Square and a quick walk from our hotel! We visit here twice while we were in New York.

Always worth a visit. Located just behind the library, Bryant Park has a lot to offer. In the summer there is an outdoor cafe, but this time we were there in the winter. The park was beautifully lit up and had a Christmas market going on and a skating rink set up as well.

Always something going on. Winter has free ice skating which is always fun. They charge for skate rentals so bring your own, and your own lock and can skate for free. One of the better viewing spots for Thanksgiving Parade (can't see anything that is not below tree line, but can see large balloons). Southwest Porch has S'mores by the Fire Pit. Carousel has free books for kiddies in nice weather and frequently a show (Flobert the Frog, Clifford, etc.). Children's library opens at 10 on weekends. Flanked by some notable buildings (Radiator Bldg, Verizon all glass, BoA tower, and Solo bldg that looks same as 9 West 57th). Trivia: names of Lions at the Library entrance are Patience and Fortitude.
Relaxing Spot. Bryant Park is a great place to visit when you come to New York City. In the Summer relaxing on the lawn or at the many tables provided under the shady trees is amazing!

Always fun, interesting - often magical!. Bryant Park used to be a seedy place behind the library. Until it wasn't. Gradually, it's evolved to be a super-special place that has ongoing special events, free classes (think Yoga), art fairs, Christmas vendors and much more. When the weather is good, it's always worth a drop-in when you're in the neighborhood.
There's an ice skating here???. I forgot about this - lol. Fun place to visit all seasons for eating/drinking ice skating & more!! Fun place to go after work for a cocktail & more....

Christmas Shopping at the Open Market. At Christmas time, there is an open market with artists, vendors, etc. and a skating rink set up as well! You cannot help but be put into the Christmas spirit if you go to Bryant Park in December!

An alternative ice skating rink.. No, I didn't skate (blades, ice and me don't go together!) but many were. The Park itself is small but with many stalls around the ice rink, it really was a charming setting. Also it was less crowded on the ice when we were there than the other more know one at the RF. Probably only here in the winter around Christmas & New Year. Enjoyable.

Wonderful little park. We were in NYC to see the Radio City Christmas show and stopped by this park (I had been past this place in cabs many times and always wondered what it was) It was wonderful. There was a large ice skating rink. There was a giant lighted Christmas tree and Christmas carols playing. There were several vendors selling very interesting gift items (cool stuff, not junk) There were also several places to buy food and drinks.

Excellent Park. We loved the atmosphere you get walking around or sitting having coffee or tea in Bryant park, The ice rink was getting ready for the end of October & Xmas,but we still enjoyed people watching.Worth going to see (more then once).

Ice skating in a New York setting. The winter village is great for ice skating! As a Brit who has been ice skating a hand full of times I'd say the standards are much higher that in the UK as winter sports is more popular, having said that it was a big rink so lots of room for everyone of all abilities. We were there in the day time so a bit quieter, can get busy at evenings. Skating is free but skate hire is about $16 (adult). If you need to check a bag bring a lock and you can use the lockers for free! Also went to the 0 degrees bar for some drinks and people watching.

Oasis. Amid the mayhem that is Manhattan this little piece of calm offers a welcome rest bite for weary travelers. Offering food, beer, coffee and even games and entertainment. It is also a good place to keep in touch as it has free wifi.
Great Christmas markets. Spent Christmas Day here going to all the stalls and having the best Nutella crepes ever.If you ever spend Christmas in New York this is a must see thing to do.

Kicking Back in Midtown Manhattan.. The restoration of Bryant Park has created a fabulous oasis in midtown Manhattan. Directly behind the midtown branch of the NYPL, Bryant Park is always bustling with activity. During warm weather enjoy lounging, eating at one of the small tables, playing ping pong, enjoying concerts and weekly events like Cowboy Night, Cajun Night, etc. During cold weather, enjoy the Christmas craft market, Christmas eats and ice-skating. It's a place to relax as well as a destination in itself.

A must do!. It's like a hidden gem in such a busy place! The ice skating ring is much better and cheaper than Rockefeller center. The food and treats around in the shops are unique. My children thought it was the highlight of our trip!

Winter, summer, spring or fall Bryant Park is always hopping!. You can skate from October till March every year at the skating rink. It is much cheaper than Rockefeller Center and lots of great things to do around the park.

Winter at Bryant Park.. A must visit place in the winter time.Great sales booths with a lot of different things for sale, everything from home made earrings to scarfs, mittens and so on.Ice skating is also a must to do when at the park. Great Christmas atmosphere overall
Lovely park. My partner and I loved walking through Bryant Park with a coffee just taking in the views and the smells of New York
Free Ice Skating!!. Sometimes crowded on the weekends, but one of the few outdoor rinks that are still free in NYC. Nice yurt available to get food or drink as well.

Visit during the winter. Bryant Park is wonderful any time of year. Centrally located and I love the library within the park. Borrow a book and relax under the trees. In winter, however, it is even more special - the ice skating rink is buzzing with happy people and lots of hot drinks abound as well as a market.
A must see spot!. Lots of specialty shops filled with interesting, unique items. Spend some time and find the right purchase yourself or someone dear to you!

Lovely Christmas market. I loved the cute park with the ice rink and lots of pretty market stalls. Bought some gorgeous chocolates and tree decorations. Very pretty area and just around the back of the library.

Pretty but pretty crowded too!. We didn't go on the ice and you wouldn't want to if you weren't an adept skater, as there are so many people on the rink and so many opportunities to crash into others. But the photograph of the Xmas tree over the ice with buildings in the background is just beautiful. And its something for the kids to do while you sit marvelling at New York activity and community spirit in a spectacular location.The markets / stalls that surround it add to the atmosphere and sell a variety of products but take your money with you!

Loved the Shops. A recommendation from a friend. Love the row of shops offering different kinds of food and stuff. It's a haven for shoppers looking for eclectic and unique items. Bought myself a few goodies from some of the stores. The skating rink was full and the benches around it as well. You won't be surprised why it's so popular

Lovely . We visited here whilst in New York. Lovely park and the library is beautiful. There is an ice skating rink and stalls for shopping as well as good shopping in the surrounding block. Worth a visit

Probably the best small park or common area in Manhattan. Excellent for chilling out and skating. Note you can rent skates if you need them, and there is no fee for skating.They have a very nice grill (The Bryant Park Grill) at one corner. Highly recommended.

Better to visit at Christmas. Previous visits to Bryant Park have been at or just before Christmas, this year we went on 10th January but were a little disappointed that the stalls had gone. Still a nice park though and worth a visit.

Very Cool Park. While in NY, we wanted to check out the winter market place. It was a cool little park with lots of little shops and an ice rink. She had a blast shopping in those little booths. We wish we would have stayed closer to the park. We could of spent more time there. It was cozy.

Better thank Rockefeller at Christmas. Bryant Park has long since been my go to park in the summer and especially in the winter. the ice skating rink is great, the very unique and eclectic bazaar is truly one of a kind a and a great place for last minute Christmas presents. In am never disappointed when visiting and the park always holds the same feeling for me.Highly recommend a visit
typical city park square. This park is nothing to write about as this is just typical park square in midtown Manhattan with stalls open space in center of concrete jungle

Christmas market. We went beginning of December and a Christmas market was on, really good stalls too! They have a lovely huge Christmas tree (I thought the decorations were better than the rockafeller centre tree) the ice skating rink was big and better than the Rockefeller centre ice rink aswell. We had a lovely time round Bryant park, it is right by New York public library and 5th avenue shops.

nice Christmas market. I was here for the Thanksgiving Day Parade..walked around, watched the roller skaters and walked thru the Christmas shops...owners handed out samples of candy, chocolates and soap...nice for kids as well.
Fun time skating. Brought 5 teenage girls to skate. They had a great time. The little shops were cute. The pop up restaurant there was nice.

Fun time during Christmas holidays!. I have visited NYC in December the past 2 years. I love to shop at Bryant Park. The Christmas decorations are enchanting. There are 100's of booths with a great variety of stores... great for Christmas shopping. There are plenty of food kiosks serving hot chocolate, coffee, hot cider, and a variety of foods as well. I didn't eat there, but had coffee and cider and they were delicious. The skating rink is a hit for families, and although I didn't skate, I enjoyed watching families have fun. If you are in NYC during the holidays, Bryant Park is a must see!

Unique bazaar. Perfect for the Christmas stocking stuffers and Christmas knick knacks Although very crowded, everyone was cordial and accomodating.Don't forget to stop by and get a couple of fried picklesThe ice skating rink was huge but the line to get in was just as daunting.
Cool little park. Cool little park next to the library. Also has the christmas market in it during the holiday season.

Another Nyc Reclamation project succes. I remember this in the 80s when you didn't even want to walk past it at night. Now any time of the year it is a great place to go. With vendors, restaurants, ice skating, hot drinks, music and friendly people.
Great little park. This is a great little park with an ice rink and little huts selling food and various items!! Plenty of places to sit and rest those tired feet :)
Christmas visit.... Ice skating , food... And a lot more staff for a good time... Just a few blocks from time square... On the way to empire state building...

Great Attraction at the Holidays. My wife and I have visited NYC for the holidays the last several years and always walk over to Bryant Park. They have a restaurant set up, ice skating and dozens of crafty type little shops. We always find something interesting to buy for someone for Christmas. Located right on 6th Ave at 42nd St. Amazed to read that from about 1840 to 1890 there was a reservoir at this location with 40' tall masonry walls. It was replaced with the NY Public Library and the park.

A Lovely Park with Poetic Connections. The history of this restful spot in the middle of Manhatten is very long and intresting.It was named for William Cullen Bryant ( a lawyer and poet) who was involved in creating Central Park. It sits amidst skyscrapers and the wonderful New York Library. In Dec. wewere able to watch the skaters enjoying the ice rink. We had a fabulous cup of hot chocolate with truffles that was being sold there. So glad they had the forsight long agoto save these natural areas in the city.
Fun For Ice Skating. The fast pass for the ice skating was totally worth it. I also had an amazing crepe. This place makes for a fun evening.

Wonderful. Wonderful setting for the holiday season. The tree was decorated, the shops were fun to explore. There is a fun outdoor café that led to the holiday season. Great hotel and boutiques surrounding.

Holiday Season in the Park. The sun was out, the market stalls were opening and filling up nicely and the ice rink was being cleaned for the days skaters. We went in for a look round the stalls which were great, there were so many and a great variety. It's a great place to pick up some unique Christmas gifts. We then got a lovely hot Mulled cranberry Apple Cider and chilled out in the November sun for a bit. A nice way to escape the madness of the city for a while.
Lovely area you should visit. December 2015 in Bryant Park allowing to look at skaters, the small shops with specific hand made gods and different handicraft.

Christmas markets . Vistered mid November and enjoyed browsing through the Christmas stalls in the sunshine as people played ping pong on the community free tables. A green oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle. If the notti toffee is avaliable grab some!
Christmas Holidays. We really liked Bryant Park and the craft stalls that were there at Christmas. A less busy skating ring than The Rockefella too.
Beautiful park. An oasis in the middle of a busy city. Sit and stop to enjoy the view.cant believe it's right smack in the heart of midtown.

So cute. I found this quite a tranquil place for saying it's on a street. It's quaint, interesting and perfect for a sit down as you move along the paths that are filled with an unprecedented amount of people.

Bryant Park at Christmas. We went to New York for Christmas experience, and Bryant Park did not disappoint!. The tree was beautiful and the ice rink was not that crowded anytime we walked by. (We walked by a lot because we used the subway station here a lot!). The Christmas Market adds to the feeling. Go both during the day and at night, every beautiful at both times of day. Night is very pretty with the tree lit up. Also make sure to walk around the corner and go into the library also, beautiful inside!

Loved the Ice skating Rink. A must do on your trip to New York. Very close walk from Macy's.Beautiful old carousel and ice skating rink there. Lots of vendors and can find some really nice local vendors.

Good oasis behind the library.. Bryant Park is a small park behind the library that provides some needed outdoor space. It also apparently hosts various activities throughout the year. In December it had a lot of outdoor booths for shopping, an outdoor bar (cafe?), and a skating rink. Skating was free but cost $20 to rent skates. There are restrooms. (Difficult to find public restrooms in Manhattan.) Also, if the library is open you can go inside to warm up a bit.

skating rink, but not much going on in the cold weather. There appeared to have been a holiday market, which was closing down. There were construction pieces lying about, looking like someone knew that they belonged somewhere and was planning on getting them there, and there were skaters which were fun to watch. But after 5 or 10 minutes, we walked on
Fun at the winter markets!. NYC just does Christmas so well! We love everything about it!The Bryant Park markets are fun and there's ice skating to watch too.

Family Fun. I heard about Bryan Park from a friend so my family put it on the list to do during our trip. So glad we did. Fun little shops different food that the street vender has (fried pickles - yum!) and free ice skating if you bring your own skates. Still cheaper than Rockefeller Center if you don't.

Ice skating!!. We tried iceskating at Rockerfeller but lines too long. Bryant Park was fab! Beautiful scenic buildings and trees. Very short wait line but you can buy express pass. Didn't need it. Free to skate but need to hire skates. Bag storage costs $8 so make sure you leave bags with family before lining up. Great market to wander around too!

Beautiful Christmas tree. Came here while on route to grand central terminal. Lovely park, we just missed the Christmas stalls, they were being dismantled while we were there, the ice rink was still present though. There was also a big ice fountain to see which was lovely. Huge Christmas tree to see, actually preferred this one to the Rockefeller center's. Food and drink stalls with seating available to chill out and watch the skaters.
Ice skate for free . Don't waste money in Central Park, skate for free in Bryant Park. Music and market stalls great atmosphere

Festive!!. We went to Bryant park in december 14 also and loved it. The christmas tree is wonderful and the Christmas market stalls are great. There is also ice skating and Santa's corner! Would definitely give this a visit if you are in new York around the holidays!!

Absolutely beautiful . Bryant Park is quite simply a Diamond in a City full of Diamonds. My visit was right before Christmas and the tree and skating rink were spectacular. The shops are great, food is great (Skip the world's best Mac and Cheese though...My Mom's puts that Mac and Cheese to shame)....Bryant Park is spectacular...Police presence was in full force to make everyone feel safe and I do not recall seeing a single frowning face...My family and I love it!

Go for Winter Village!. If you want to go ice skating, the lines are long here and not worth the wait. But everything else - the shops, the restaurants and the setup is so fun! There are several tables and chairs available throughout the park so we had not problems eating and drinking with a little one. The lights and tree are gorgeous and there is not fee to come in and look and shop. Great little kiosks for food and gifts abound and the lines aren't too bad. Plan at least an hour to explore!
Bryant Park. We visited the park and it was very busy despite being midday the shops are very good and different and the ice skating looks great.

Ice skating . Great place, nice stalls, nice food, cheaper ice skating option than rockerfella and shorter queuing times!! Kids enjoyed spending there holiday money in the various gift shops, very hand location!!

Mom and daughter fun. I absolutely love Bryant Park. The only time I've ever visited New York is during the winter holidays and I've always been within walking distance to Bryant Park. This is a great place for all ages (at least in the winter). It is beautifully decorated for the holidays, has an outdoor ice skating rink, an upscale flea market , has good food, and good views. My daughter and I spent our first day here waiting for our room to be ready at our hotel. My favorite part was sitting next to the skating rink watching everyone (especially the young children) with a hot apple cider in hand.
Wonderful. We visiting this attraction in December for the second year running and its amazing. Just standing and watching the skaters is entertaining. A must see.

Go During the Christmas Market!. Bryant Park is a nice place to relax during the warmer months, but it totally changes during the winter. First, they add a large ice rink in the middle of the park. Of course, it's expensive to rent the skates and slide around, but this is Manhattan! The best part about the park in winter, though, is the winter market. Small stalls pop up with contain anything from vintage maps to trendy clothes. There are Christmas ornaments and baseball caps. It's a great place to buy those stocking-stuffers that you still need to get. And, when you get tired, there's always the Bryant Park Grill for lunch!

Very charming . Bryant Park is very charming, it's not huge as other parks but it has a winter christmas feeling that I enjoy very much. Lots of different types of food, the ice skating rank makes it really special. I've on summer as well and it's a great place to hang out.

Always something to do. Bryant Park is one of those places that has many free events throughout the year. Free movie screenings during the summer, Christmas market during winter, and many others. I just went ice skating there a few days ago. Ice skating is free but it's about $18 to rent skates and $8 for the locker. There weren't too many people for a Sunday morning which was great. A good amount of space for all to skate. So much fun and their Christmas tree is beautifully decorated every year.
Too many people. Bad ice. Too many people. Long queues. Ouatdated rental gear. Central park is much better for skating

Perfect!. Have visited Bryant Park on a couple of occasions during NY trips. The first was at Christmas, stalls were set out around an ice rink, the ambience was incredible. The second time was during the summer last year, whilst walking around we stumbled upon an open air event where one of the local radio stations were holding an open air 'concert'. Penn and Teller, cast from Wicked and Stomp were there, all free - just grab a chair, sit and relax. Perfect afternoon in the sun.
Iceskating. There was a marketplace and an iceskate rink. it had the perfect christmas atmosphere and it is close to the library
lovely place. We were there at Christmas so there was skating and pop up christmas markets. A lovely way and place to spend a couple of hours
Beautiful park, really nice shops. this is a very beautiful park; if it is the season and the skating ring is running, it is even more beautiful. The New York Library is right next to it.
Bryant Park. Worth a visit, we were there when the ice skating rink was available, nice coffee shops and quirky shops. Nice to see for a short visit
Wonderful park. The most beautiful park in the city. You can go with your family and enjoy a cup of coffe and take the children to the carousel. Highly recommended!
CHRISTMAS TIME. the xmas tree swtich on and little market and ice skating is just a perfect NY xmassy experience. MUST VISIT and its only down the stree from times square :)

Ice Skating And Shopping. A must for december!! we had a great time ice skating twice! cheapest one to ice skate as its free then you just pay for your rentals, had a little shop around all the Christmas markets and finished off with some waffes and ice cream! beautiful park with a view of the empire state and new york library!

Bryant Park - the best one hour outdoor detour along 42nd Street. Bryant Park is a neat semi-permanent "flea market" with an upscale flair and lots to offer. It appeals to tourists and city dwellers alike, although you'll find more tourists there percentage-wise. You can buy chocolate from Max Brenner (highly recommended) or you can get graffiti pieces from The Raw Art. There's a place which sells costume jewellery and another which sells antique postcards and signs. There's a carousel and a skating rink (rink in the winter). If you're walking along 42nd or 40th, plan on spending an hour or so with this really neat distraction, and be prepared to part with a few dollars. I did say 'upscale' and flea market... there's lots of quality stuff here, but not all of it is low-budget. These most certainly are not the kiosks like the sidewalk vendors which are everywhere; this is definitely a quality place.

Must visit. We came here during the new year period and caught the Christmas markets that were set up around the park. Each stall had there own crafted goods and it gave a genuinely Christmas feel. The ice rink there is free although expect to queue for a good while before you can get on. There is a restaurant near by we didn't get a chance to go in but I would recommend going there as it overlooks the park. I would recommend coming here in Christmas time to get yourself in the mood for Christmas.

Christmas market and ice skating rink. Not sure what's there in summer, but at Christmas time, there is a Christmas market with about 20-30 stalls selling food and drink as well ad collectibles, clothing etc. interesting to look at but generally quite pricey. It can get pretty crowded (resulting in long queues at the restroom). The skating rink is quite economical (just need to pay for skate and locker hire) but compared to Wollman Rink (Central Park), the rink is quite small did crowded. The Park is short walk from Times Square.

One of my favorite parks in NYC. I love Bryant Park in all seasons. You can have a great lunch hour here, under the shade of trees in summer. In winter, it boasts a skating rink. Throughout the year, it has various events, including free outdoor concerts and movies. It is located in the very center of midtown, close to the famous 5th Avenue - the shopping paradise - and to other interesting places, such as the NYC Library. There are often Ben & Jerry free ice-cream and Starbucks coffee giveaways. Fashion shows take place here as well. What's not to like?

Nice park in the city! . We went to check out Bryant Park as it was only a few blocks from our hotel. We wanted to explore the mini shops that are set up and the ice skating rink. We enjoyed the different offerings of the shops and even made a couple of purchases. You could even have your picture taken with Santa. It is a nice park located just behind the NYC Public Library.

Beautiful setting and festive atmosphere. The setting in just off 5th avenue right in the middle of the city. We visited in December and there was a very festive atmosphere with a lovely big ice rink and lots of little holiday shops. Can recommend the mac and cheese from one of the stalls, The location is spectacular with the empire state building visible and lots of tall building surrounding it. Ice skating was free in this location with only skates to hire
Lovely. Little stalls, a quiet drink, iceskating, massive buildings encompassing it. Well done NYC.Various stalls to browse around made it wonderfully christmassy

magical. Second visit here, came along last December too.....its a magical place with an ice skating rink, lots of food and drink stalls and sellers with fab merchandise. you can pick up personalised xmas baubles, handmade jewelry and lovely clothing. the xmas tree is fab and atmosphere wonderful

Just love it!. No matter the time of year Bryant Park is a happening place. In December is one of the best times. With free ice rink, Christmas Market, pop up function suite and cafes/bars outside. The atmosphere is lovely with lots of locals mingling with tourists.This is my favourite park in NYC.

Least Crowded Place to Ice Skate. They have a really effective system of getting people in to skate when it is very busy. At Rockafeller Center we had to wait over an hour. At Bryant Park it took about 20 minutes. I would definitely go here during peak tourist times.

Stunning at Christmas time!. I imagine in the summer Bryant Park is a nice little City park, but at Christmas time it is just magical! At centre stage is the lovely ice-rink (which didn't appear to have any queues when we were there, and much cheaper than the Rockefeller Center) and all around the edges is the Christmas market, with many stalls selling lots of beautiful hand-made goods, and a number of food stalls. We visited during the day and evening and both visits were truly lovely. My daughters were too tired from sightseeing to want to skate, but had they wanted to, they would probably have chose to skate here rather than at the Rockefeller Center where the queues were very long.
BEST FOR SKATING. LOVELY LOCATION- not that busy and free if you have own skates.lovely very of old libary behind and little shops on way out

Awesome free fun for the kids in NYC. We were locals in the neighbourhood but locals and visitors alike can enjoy the spoils of beautiful Bryant park. check out their website - every day there are free activities for the whole family - yoga lessons, dance lessons, knitting lessons, puppet shows, exotic birds for the little people, live piano performances, it's such a wonderful spot behind the library and a few mins walk from Times Square in one direction and Grand Central Station in other direction. in winter, the holiday markets and ice skating rink are the highlight.

Quaint. The small market stalls are quaint, with quite a few different and original items. There is free ice skating, but you need to pay for the hire of your skates. The public toilets are immaculately spotless there.
Very pleasant in the Christmas period. The stalls and ic rink make it a pleasant place to visit. Safe and lots of people. My wife enjoys the specialist stalls.

Bryant Park Experience. While in NYC come and visit this beautiful park. In the winter it transformed into a winter village with many small shops in which you can find ornaments, beautiful jewelry and other keepsakes from soaps to netted hats. The Ice skating rink is a great for skate lovers. In the summer the park's great lawn serves as a picnic area for many or sun bathing for others. During the summer nights there is a large screen which features old movies.
Winter village is awesome . We went and loved the winter village. Great shops. The ice skating was great. The kids had a great time with the activities.
Magical!. We went there last 1st of January and we really enjoyed the Chrisrmas bazaar!! The christmas tree was AWESOME!!!!

Always Crowded But a Good City Center Park. This is a good example of a city center park that provides an attractive destination for workers during their lunch hour. The park provides a lot of entertainment opportunities and it's in a comfortable (yet busy) part of midtown.

Ice Skating and Christmas markets created a wonderful atmosphere even without snow. This was a relaxed festive area to wander around the Christmas markets and to sit with a hot chocolate and watch the ice skaters
Great during the Christmas season!. Great place to bring the family, walk around, see their tree, and watch ice skating. The vendors have options for ornaments to hot dogs!

Quaint Shops with Handmade One of a Kind Items.. New York City artisans selling handmade one of a kind items and a beautiful view of the city skyline surrounding you. Also an ice skating rink for those who want to be adventurous.
An oasis in the midst of the city. Expensive bars but worth it to chill out in the big Apple. Watching the world go by in central Manhattan it is a good place to rest up.

Nice Holiday Fair in December. I've never been to Bryant Park prior to this trip. We were there early December and thoroughly enjoyed the holiday fair there. Many vendors including gift items, Christmas, food, etc. Nice decorations and places to sit. There are bars serving alcohol in some areas (park the non-shoppers there!).

Christmas in New York 2015. Visiting at Christmas we were able to enjoy watching the skaters on the ice rink, view the big tree and shop at the market stalls.
Well worth a visit.

An oasis in the city. Lovely park with plenty of free seating even when the skating is going on.
Fantastic shed shopping and wonderful hot chocolate.
Bryant park full of real life. Take a break from 5th Avenue, and see what is going on in Bryant Park both Summer(coffee in the park) and Winter (skating)

Great happening park . Small park away from
Hectic Central Park. I could easily just sit here and watch the world go by of people watch. Lots of New Yorkers on lunch breaks etc. Lovely clean park.
Pretty Park with Winter market. Visited Bryant Park in January, when the winter market was in full swing. Lovely atmosphere, but mostly fairly touristy "craft" stalls.

Very pretty at Christmas. We were there the week before Christmas and it was great. The markets were full and alive and at night time all the Christmas decorations were very pretty.
And there was ice skating too.

Gorgeous fun people watching park. Gorgeous park, great for people watching or just relaxing and feeling the best NYC has to offer. You can read, write or listen to music quietly or you can partake in the many activities such as Bocce, table tennis or chess.
AA small haven in the city. A nice place to rest and watch city life going by. A small park with little to do but rest, but worth a visit whilst in the area.
Wonderful park. This is an active park, with events both summer and winter. Ice skating and boutique kiosks were on offer during our December visit.
Visit Bryant Park. Nice place to visit and take a break. Winter or summer a nice place to visit. Skating in the winter and a nice place to sit down and have a drink in summer, nice fountain.

nice to stop by and rest. is a nice park with a restaurant and ice skating around the park is full of multitude little boutique / both where you can buy lot of "stuff" on of my favorite there is the <?> roll and feel up with chocolate . I m sorry I dot get the name but look like a pastry pipe empty crunchy end you eat this buy the bottom and is like a couture pastry is good and you will update for a large one feel up for 10 buck. you can get café and "cruise "in a relaxing environments
Beautiful!. Beautiful!!!! This is breath taking and nostalgic! A definite to put on your bucket list! The long line is worth the wait!

Nice Market. What a lovely little market in the middle of NYC! We found reasonable priced gifts from an art dealer to take home as a souvenir. The Ice Rink looked fun and seemed better than the crowded Rockefeller version. I recommend this little market for sure!

Fun park. Even though we didn't ice skate there, we enjoyed the quaint little kiosks for shopping and the Southwest Airlines patio for drinks and hot chocolates for the kids. There's also balls and different things for the kids to try and learn to juggle. Great spot!
Small and crowdy. Maybe because of Christmastime is was too crowdy and for so many peobples it is too small. The selling boothes offer all kind of stuffs. Nice to see, but not a must.

December ice skating. A really nice park in the middle of Manhattan. The ice skating rink was there when we visited in December. Also many pop up shopping stalls and food areas. Seems to be a place many locals like to visit, worth a trip here for sure.
Winter garden magic. A magical place to visit near Christmas time but probably any other time too. The ice skating is free, not too crowded and heaps of interesting stall and fabulous places to eat

Great vibe!. Tons of people, great food options, craft stores and such, skating rink... Table tennis... Lots of seating... Just a great place to take in the sights, grab a chocolate babka and enjoy yourself!

Bryant Park. This is a sweet, small park with small tents and the artisans selling their work. If you visit during the winter the park also offers an ice skating rink.
We love Bryant Park as it is not too far from Times Square and offers a slower more leisurely pace
Such a great place!. This place is so fun! Great shopping! Something for everyone. Our boys didn't skate. It was pretty busy. But they enjoyed people watching while the moms shopped.
X'mas in NYC. great.You have to visit even if you don't want to skate. It is so much fun to watch others try. Being outdoors is
Skate in the snow.... Wonderful. We went on a very cold winter night but had the best time trying to skate and watching others on the balcony having a disco night dancing away. It's a magical place.

Nyc visit 2015. One of the first place we saw on the first day of our visit. Set up following the European style Christmas markets. Nice little market for a leisurely troll and sitting down for something to nibble bought from the market along sip of coffee. If you have some dollars to spend some good gifts are available in makeshift shops.

A nice break from the busy tourist areas. We stumbled upon Bryant Park while visiting a friend that worked nearby. I'm so glad we did! The park was set up with an ice skating rink and "winter village" of neat little shops and places to grab a quick bite to eat. We visited after Christmas, but the tree and holiday decorations were still up and they were very pretty. We spent some time here browsing the shops and had some churros and soft pretzels. It was a nice break from the craziness of Times Square and Rockefeller.

Nice during Christmas time. My wife and I stayed on W37th St and 5th Ave during Christmas time and we always looked forward to seeing Bryant Park as we finished our exhausting adventures of New York. One it meant we were close to our hotel and two it was a very happy place and well lit up. There were stalls open selling their wares, street vendors selling their food, people ice skating and it was all magical. We would stop there and people watch to catch our breath from our constant travels.

Broadway in Bryant in the summer should not be missed. During the summer (I think it's on Thursdays) they offer Broadway in Bryant. A huge stage is set up and performers from various Broadway shows do a mini-set of selections from their shows. It is free and gets mega-crowded, so get there early, buy lunch (Le Pain Quotidien is right there) and get a table right on the wall surrounding the park. What a great way to spend a couple of summer hours in the city.

Worth Visiting Especially This TIme of Year. The park is a pleasant place to be with many activities. This time of year, winter, an ice rink is open and there is a KrisKringle Markt of many little shops. During the summer motnhs, free movies are shown.
Ice Skating at Christmas. A great place to ice skate. Cheaper than Central Park and a great skating experience. At Christmas there were lots of great shops to buy Christmas presents too

LOVED BRYANT PARK!. What a surprise! This beautiful park was all decked out with Christmas shops in mid-November. The ice skating rink was there and it was a fantastic place. We went several times during the day and at night. The night time has such a fun buzz to it. It was one of our favorite places to unwind. We love Bryant Park.

Christmas market at Bryant Park. Charming Christmas market at Bryant park - reminded me of Christmas markets in Germany and Poland. There are nice food places too. There was a long line for ice-skating so we didn't make that.

best place in new york. I was here in October 2015 its a fantastic place to get a great coffee and watch the world go by. subway station very close and just behind the public library, went here every morning for a coffee before setting out to explore the city.

Loved it here!!. The Christmas Tree at Bryant Park was actually nicer than the one at Rockefeller Center. I love all the little shops of the most unusual items..from paintings to jewelry to knock off handbags.. Food all around..very user friendly..one place had fire pits and heated torches scattered about..Very popular to say the least..nice light fare menu and especially liked the "Grownup Hot Chocolate" yum!!

Great place to visit. We took my niece and her friend that is visiting from Hawaii. It was great fun to walk around visit the shops, eat a quick bite and watch the people ice skating. I would highly recommend!

Fun place in December. Fun to come to Bryant Park in December, as there is an outdoor ice rink- love watching the skaters, and their are many kiosks set up with food, gift items, sweaters, jewelery, etc. for the holidays.
Great Holiday Boutique in the Park. Enjoyed the Holiday Boutique in the park... what fun to watch the ice skaters too! One amazing thing.. FABULOUS women's bathroom!!
Library and chess. Just outside the New York City library, Bryant park is a sanctuary for those who want to either read a book, play chess, or soak up the sun

One of my favorite spots during the Holiday season. We stumbled across this gem several years ago & it quickly became one of my favorite places to visit during the holiday season in NYC. It had been a few years since we had been, so it was definitely on our to do list this holiday season. They have a nice selection of holiday vendors selling trinkets, jewelry, hats, and etc. You can certainly find some unique holiday gifts here. There is at least one eatery should you get hungry. There used to be a guy selling chocolate covered fruits, but I didn't see him this year & that was a huge disappointment for my family. There is a HUGE Christmas tree and icing skating rink in the center of the park during the holiday season. The tree is beautiful. Ice skating admission is FREE. So bring your own skates IF you have them, otherwise there is a rental fee. We have skated here in the past, but not this year. There is usually a line to get in. There is also a neat little carousel here in the park. It is there year round. It is $3 per ride. Children under a certain height have to be accompanied by a parent, but the parent rides for free (standing next to child). The carousel is really pretty and features other animals besides horses. There is a cat, frog, bunny, horses and more. Our children really enjoyed it and the ride is of decent length. Overall, we had another nice visit with Bryant Park during the holidays. I would recommend it. Only downside is that is can be crowded.

Skating expensive and busy. Park is pretty but very busy at this time of year with skaters. $19 per person but rink that busy it is difficult to skate. The little huts in Bryant park sell crafts, food and drink

beautiful!. the best time to visit is in the fall-winter because its the ice rink... Its a perfect place to sit and watch people, drink something or talk! at night you can see the lighting of many buildings around, is very nice

Rare open space.. During my visit Bryant Park was hosting an outdoor mall event with vendor booths. There was a nice selection of shops and also an outdoor bar. I am guessing events like this happen year round. It is behind the main library so the whole area is a nice public space. It was nice to watch the ice skating which is advertized as free but it costs $20 to rent skates.
Bryant Park. Loved the atmosphere in Bryant Park. The christmas tree, market and skating were all fab. Visited a couple of times while in NYC.

Great little market. We went in December when the ice skating rink was there and it was fantastic! Christmas trees, decorations and stalls everywhere to get you in the christmas spirit! Also delicious 'chimney cakes' filled with either Nutella or peanut butter, also the Mac Brenner hot chocolates are so rich! Very yum! Should see if you're in NY at christmas time!
Cute little park in the middle of the city. Came by the park strictly by accident. Quaint little shops and an ice skating rink. Lovely place to stroll and do a little shopping.

Lovely little park. Great little park and it was beautifully decorated for Christmas. My teenage children went ice skating and I visited the stalls that were selling gifts and food. A lot less crowded than the Rockefeller Centre.

Winter in Bryant Park is lovely!. I've been to the park on many occasions while visiting NYC, but this was my first Christmas time visit. I just loved the huge Christmas tree, the little Christmas market with interesting items. I didn't get a chance to skate, but we did watch the skaters for a bit. Such a lovely spot in the city.

Accidentally found this gem. We found this park by accident and as luck would have it, it was the first night of the Christmas Fair so all the stalls were setting up, it was beautifully lit and peaceful

A Christmas Staple . We come to Bryant Park when we visit during the Holiday Season. Love the venders. It's a great place to buy gifts. Snack. Enjoy Hot Chocolate. And of course Ice Skate. It's much easier to relax and enjoy your skating experience here then in Rockefeller Center. We were in and out of the park a few times over our 5 day stay. Great area if you have small kids as well. Great place for family photos and enjoying the Holiday.

Fun spot in the city . We had a great time exploring the park with our three kids (16.13,9). The ice skating rink, free apart from a skate rental fee, looked like a blast and wasn't nearly as crowded as the Rockefeller Rink, but the kids were a little too tired after our NYE celebrations to partake. We enjoyed watching the skaters while sipping hot chocolate and eating warm waffles from Wafels & Dinges. The winter market is an adorable spot to shop while enjoying a crisp winter night.

Brilliant fun!. We ended up here a couple of times during our visit to NYC this December at the Bank of America Winter Village.There are loads of stalls to buy gifts. We sampled food and drink including hot apple cider, churros and a corn cake. There was so much to choose from! We ate these delights whilst watching people skate one day.We had pre-booked ice skating for a few days later and this was fantastic fun even though the ice was busy. Well worth the money. One of husbands favourite activities on the holiday and definitely something iconic to do in NYC. Bryant Park is easy to find and to fit into itineraries along with 5th Ave, NYPL or GCT. The toilets are some of the best we used on our whole trip including better than those in Bloomingdales!

A wonderful Christmas visit . One of my favourite places in New York. The park is beautiful at Holiday time, the boutique market has some beautiful gifts and items. If you do go to the park, Christmas or not, you should definitely visit the New York Public Library as it is simply stunning. It has a fab little book shop that also sells jewellery and accessories, there is also a coffee shop too if you need somewhere to take five minutes in some beautiful surroundings.

Love this Park. Situated by Hudson River you have great views of Staten Island, Liberty island and Ellis island . You can buy tickets at castle Clinton for the boat tours don't buy off ticket agents they are expensive .
Festive . The park had an ice rink and lovely little huts with different gods for sale. It was Christmas time so I'm unsure what it's like at other times of the year.

Holiday Village and rink are delightful!. Bryant Park is always lovely, but I was dying to the see the Holiday shopping village. So many adorable little shops, great snacking opportunities and even public restrooms!
nice place both in winter and in summers. I have been to the place in the summer time where lavish restaurants serve great food and its also a must visit place

Family ice skating . Great location for the ice skating which I believe is only there over the festive period. $19 for this skate hire and free to get on the rink - lockers are $9 and you are lucky to get a handbag in! If you bring your own padlock the lockers are free so a great tip to have! An hours ice skating is more than enough - skate guards are there to support and help out if needed

Nice small park. In the middle of the bustling city you find Bryant park, much smaller than the most famous Central Park, but still pleasant and even more enjoyable. In winter times there is an ice skating ring, a very popular attraction during week ends.
Unchristian must. We love to go to Bryant Park at Christmas for the ice skating, shopping and for the Max Brenner hot chocolate. Fun day!

Great for Ice Skating and Lots of Vendors. In our research prior to a week-long trip to NYC we discovered Bryant Park. This is a great location for ice-skating and seeing lots of various vendors in the heart of the city. It's also adjacent to the NYC Public Library, and is definitely worth combining the two for an afternoon or morning. This location is less crowded than Rockefeller Plaza but has plenty of restaurants and places surrounding it. This is well worth the visit, especially with combining a stop over at the library in the adjacent block.

Great fun on Christmas Day night.. Took the Grandkids to visit the market and had a ball. Very interesting place to visit, good truck food and lots to see. A really good way to spend Christmas Day in NYC.
