Passed it everyday. We were staying near Bryant park and passed it every day. Finally we went in to the Christmas market. All I can say is the bit I saw was rip off city

Outdoor skating rink, Christmas market. Steps away from the New York Public Library - around Christmas time Bryant Park as a gorgeous Christmas tree, as well as many boutique and unique shops to shop in. However, since the items are unique, the prices can be quite high
Great market. Lovely little collection of shops similar to convent garden stallsEnjoyed the smellsof the various food vendors and places to take a drink and just watch the world go by

Loved the Iceskating. This was the first place we visited when we arrived in New York. Around 10am on Christmas eve and Bryant Park was blissfully quiet, giving our family a lovely time to learn to Iceskate. Good value for skate hire and time was unlimited. Lovely way to spend a few hours.
an OASIS in midtown. since the park was renovated several years ago, and saved from the crack den that it had become, it is a MOST WONDERFUL Oasis, in midtown, and a must visit for anyone in NYC

The most relaxed place to be for a sit down and watch the world go by.. Really like visiting this place usually go the bar and have a few drinks after walking around NYC a great place for a break. You meet so many nationalities and mostly friendly people just sharing the same idea as you for a snack or a drink break. Always something happening hear never the same every time we visit so much to see.

Great Christmas experience. This was our first time to visit NYC at Christmas. It was a whole different type of fun in Bryant Park. We loved the whole atmosphere, and shopping in the little stores. It was fun to watch the ice skaters. Lots of places to sit. We ate at the Bryant Park Grill, but it wouldn't have been necessary. There were so many places to buy food, with an international flavor, throughout the park.

We love it here !!!. We love it here!Whenever we visit Manhattan we always visit Bryant Park. This year, it was quite mild in New York City for the time of year. However, it still felt very festive. You must have a Apple Cider Hot Toddy at the bar. In fact we had a few !!!:-)

A piece of low level in a high level city. Bryant Park is like an oasis in a high rise city. We visited in December 2015 so the ice skating was on which probably restricts the park area.Surrounded by small artisan shops in huts, there is a permanent carnival feel to the place. It is also surrounded by interesting buildings and has views of the Chrysler and Empire State Buildings, so something for the photographers.There is a wide variety of crafts available from glass shades to friendship threads, to photos to mettle work.Well worth the visit
ice skating. The ice skating here is much cheaper than the iconic one at Rockefeller Center and, I think, a more romantic setting.
Nice park . Skating, food stalls, very good. Enjoyed the Bavarian stall. Got to see the NYPD prep for NYE celebrations, the pride displayed by the boys in blue, cool experience
Wonderful Place!!. An amazing and relaxing place to shop, skate, enjoy the city. Beautiful park and night skating a delight! Reasonable price and wait time was less than 30 min during NY eve

Great iconic place. Hubby and I went here for the first time and just fell in love with it. So atmospheric and special (especially enjoying a hot chocolate and watching the ice skaters). Lots of little specially pop up shops to buy that special unique souvenir too. It is incredibly busy but we went here a few time and always found somewhere to sit and enjoy the scenery. Beautiful in December when icy cold and wintery with all the Christmas decorations.

Christmas/Winter Village. Enjoyed window shopping in the various market stalls set up for the holidays. Some of the shops had the same merchandise (scarves and gloves) so they are not all selling unique items. I had hoped that the shops had more unique items. Ice skating rink looked like fun but didn't have time to try it. Used the ladies rest room on one of the corners of the park - free and very clean (although small with a short wait). Can't ask for more than that in NY!

Great ice skating. The winter market is great with a load of good stalls, but the main draw is the ice rink. Unlike the Rockefeller or Central Park rinks, this one wasn't anywhere near as busy and is free to get in. You just need to pay for skate hire. It may not be as iconic but did save at least an hour queue.It was a good rink and you can stay as long as you want. Definitely recommend this to people who aren't as worried about the location.
Christmas in the Park. A fun mix of shops and bites to eat, skating and people watching. It offered something for everyone. Quite crowded this year due to the warm weather!

Love this park!. Parks in NYC are special simply because they're there in the midst of the concrete, glass and asphalt. But Bryant Park is just cool. It centrally located in midtown with easy walking access to many other sites. If there is music being played, as there often is in the summer, then just sit down and enjoy it. The park draws locals, tourists, families, couples, and singles. Have a picnic; throw a frisbee; enjoy the skyline at sunset.
Nice little park. Even more nicer during the christmas holidays with the three, stalls and ice skating. Relax, have a drink, go skating

So disappointed most of the shops were closed. We visited on a rainy Monday night and unfortunately most of the vendors closed shop which I don't understand. It was still full of people and not even raining that hard. Very disappointed I didn't get to shop at some of my favorite stands . . . .

Well worth a visit. Seriously? Has this place always been here? We normally visit during the summer months and have never noticed the hustle & bustle at Bryant Park, and it is really cool. You have the option to go ice skating during the winter months - we were tempted to go skating in NYC, however after seeing the massive long lines, we decided to do something else. Without asking anyone there, I reckon the line would have been 1-2 hours long.You can watch the locals get into battle around the table tennis table which is quite amusing. Seeing different classes of people in battle against each other is a laugh. The little trinket shops around the ice skating rink is so cool. Whether you want a little souvenir, an out of the ordinary gift or just a hot apple cider on a cold winters day, this is the place to be.
Cute!. Went here with my boyfriend over the summer. Great place to sit down and grab a bit to eat! I enjoyed the scenery and access to tables to sit down at
Christmas Market. Find your way here for many unusual gifts. Lots of stalls selling refreshments as well, so no need to leave to eat!
Outside Fun. This is a very nice shopping site with nice quaint booths, and food vendors. They also have an ice skating ring and the cleanest outside bathrooms around town.
Great Christmas atmosphere. Beautiful attraction, an alternative to skating at Rockafella, lovely Christmassy stalls with great selection of goods for sale
Beautiful Park. I always enjoy sitting in Bryant Park. You can people watch and take in the sights without moving an inch. Take a 30 min break here from all the hustle and bustle.

Quait park in the middle of it all. As my title describes little park in the middle of the hustle and bustle of it all, loved the ice skating rink and also the skyline around it was so colourful with greens, greys of the tall buildings. I would have liked to have tried out the ice skating but time was against us on the day. Loved the Xmas log cabins they had around the entrance selling nick nacks etc

Ice Skating & More during December. There was a lovely Christmas Market to visit this December as well as ice skating. Shop, skate, eat and drink. A must if you are walking the sites of Manhattan. Pretty at Christmas as there are lovely Christmas trees and decorations.

Tucked away surprise. The park was recommended by the NYPD, who know where to good spots are, and man were they right. A splendid little winter/Christmas village with a lot of different shacks to buy all kinds of stuff. Food shacks had a variety, and there is an ice skating rink. You'd never guess it was NYC.

Walking or Skating in a Winter Wonderland!. First and foremost, this is a great park! It has an amazing view of the Empire State Building too! We went during December and experienced the "Winter Village" which I quite enjoyed! There were over 50 kiosks of various types of vendors from Xmas stuff or food and drink too! Almost forgot to mention there is a giant Christmas Tree there as well too! There is a Carousel and of course the skating rink too! Towards the back of the park was a nice restaurant as well.We liked it so much we went there twice!
Xmas 2015. Nice place, short walk from the Westin Grand Central. Weather was unusually warm but skating was still available. Lots of small market style stalls around the rink.Nice place
Great for a fun stroll.. Great for a fun stroll and people watching. Shopping, ice skating and outdoor chairs, tables, restaurants. Cool get away. Not a park for exercise.

Christmas at Bryant Park. As we visited Bryant Park in November the Xmas Fayre was up and running as was the ice rink. This is a great place to have a stroll around the little huts selling gifts and food, and we went here twice on our last trip.We were told you can skate here for free too which is a bonus!

I wasnt expecting. ... This park has a skating rink. Restaurants... small concesionaries selling food, cookoo clocks of all forms, winter apparels, gift shops. I found great for socializing. They are chairs around the skating rink so if you dont want skate just entertain yourself by look @t your party and others doing so. As bathrooms.
Loved Bryant Park. Great location, Christmas market, skating rink, although packed, but a great place to be in December.
Shopping!. Have not been to New York in some time. I enjoyed going to all the shops here. It seemed like they have a little bit of everything. Enjoyed it very much.
So nice. Shops were quirky and great. No skating. Open late. Bathrooms close by. Nice place to walk around and very festive with lights and holiday atmosphere. Prices are ok for the city.

Xmas in NYC. The Winter Village is fantastic. So many different vendors - jewelry, food, coffee, puppets - you name it they have it. Spring rolls at Vedge Stand were phenomenal! Ice skating was so much fun. And the tree - is gorgeous.

Holiday Season . Stumbled upon this area and was well impressed, there was a free ice skating for everyone and numerous shops around selling lovely gifts. Worth a visit as I heard in summer there is a roller blading rink.
Great Christmas stop. I didn't know what to expect...great city park with pop up shops and ice skating. Sweet place to walk around and enjoy the Christmas lights.

site for NYC Fall Fashion show. has one main sit down restaurant and a couple of outdoor bars where you can get a glass of wine and just chill in the park area especially in summer. its a pretty cool park, you can find a small line of stores including Sabon on one side of the park,
Lots of lovely boutique gift ideas . Bought lots for family members, craft ideas where amazing, amazing prices too. Picked up some last minute gifts for family that were hard work x

Crowded and Commercial. This was a disappointment to me, as are all the Christmas markets I have been to. They are crowded. Prices are inflated and there is very little that is unique of interesting. But still a worthwhile tradition if you are into that type of thing.

Disappointing. Very busy when we went there, so very difficult to walk around. Couldn't really see why it is so highly regarded. Ice rink in the middle, and many small outdoor 'sheds' selling all sorts of things. But nothing really memorable. Surrounded by skyscrapers on all sides. Perhaps better when less busy?

First Time Won't Be the Last Time!. Visited Bryant Park for the holidays for the first time, but it certainly won't be the last! It was fun to watch the ice skaters while having a bite to eat. There are tiny shops around the park where you can find lot of treasures. It's a nice place to visit to feel the spirit of the seasons!
WORTH A VISIT. While not as crowded as Times Square or Rockefeller, there was somewhat of a crowd. The shops, and vendors were rather disappointing, but the skating rink made up for it.

A great place to people watch!. After a lot of sight seeing we stopped off for a rest on the benches in Bryant Park near the restaurant. We ended up just watching the world go by and it was a really relaxing place to be. The weather was warm so this helped but I can see that it would be a great escape for office workers in their lunch break and a good place to catch up with friends. Worth a visit if you are in the area.
View of park. Love the park, and the big Christmas tree on the park. My family enjoyed the view, and we walked around the park take photos of the view.
Spectacular. Visit this park in Christmas was an experience with my kids. They adore the spectacular tree and the shops with original things to buy.

Very nice Christmas market. It's not a prime tourist attraction, but it's easy to include it in a walk together with Grand central - 6th and 5th Av. If you're around in December, you should visit the park; there is a very cosy Christmas market and Ice rink.

Beautiful. It is by far the best park in NYC.
A hidden gem in the middle of this comopolitan city.
Durring the holidays is a magical place for skating and family activities.

Busy at Christmas!. We wanted to peruse the shops that were set up in the park but the crowds were much too large on a Saturday. I would recommend visiting on a week day, if possible. The booths had many artistic items that would have been perfect for gifts. The park had a festive atmosphere.

Awesome at Christmas. Filled with booths containing all sorts of crafts and food surrounding the ice skating rink and a beautiful Christmas tree, this was a great place to visit a couple of weeks before Christmas. A great place to hang out, have a snack and get some exercise if you want to strap on some skates!
Great Outdoor Area. We were just there in late December and they had vendors and food everywhere, what a great spot to hang out and see the sights, don't walk by this park.
Perfect. Spent a few hours wandering the various market stalls & watching people on the ice skating rink. This is one of those special places that makes you feel part of the community. Rug up & enjoy
Beautiful area during Holidays. Bryant Park is wonderful year round but especially during the Holidays ~ lunch or dinner at Bryant Park Grill is a MUST !!
Ice skating in Bryant Park!. You can get a hot chocolate or a warm churro to munch on from one of the many shopping booths here while you watch the ice skaters or you can just join them!
Shopping center. So this is a park but this is also a great place to going shopping. A lot of mom and pop type places with home made items and food so it is great for families.

Nice place for skating and shopping.. Price for skating is much better than Rockefeller Center. You pay for rentals only. The rink was very busy but they moved people in and out quickly. We were trying to get a lot done in one day so, regretfully, we didn't shop in the vendor booths around the rink. Add a little extra time to your schedule for those because they had a lot of neat stuff.
classic christmas village. i was expecting more from this very popular place. Low quality shops and very noisy atmosphere. The ice skating is big but the waiting line is very long

love it. so cool and cozy in the winter. there is a popular ice skating rink and a lot of small shops (souvenirs and food/coffee) i started every morning here with coffee and breakfast and enjoying the music and happy people on the ice 👍

A nice walk around the streets of nyc. As walking to the nyc library we came across Bryant park and had a look around because of the time of year December it had a lot of Christmas fayre shop nice to have a browse around

A Must Visit During the Holidays!. Great location with Library across the way, Time Square close by, easily accessible by public transportation. During the holiday, there was a Christmas market with fabulous shops, delicious foods and a large ice skating rink.
Best if you have skates. We spend a little time here. I thought is what a little pricey if you rent skates and have them store your stuff. Otherwise, it's free. Can't beat that, I suppose.

At Christmas- don't miss it!. A friend had suggested that we go to Bryant Park (right behind the NYC Public Library) for the Christmas Mart. There are probably 70 booths and a huge skating rink. We had so much fun shopping the booths - my 14 year old daughter loved the shopping and bought several items of jewelry. Many of the booths had unique food selections. The skating rink was much larger and less crowded than at Rockefeller Center. If you have time at Christmas, go visit Bryant Park.

Pretty . Very pretty with the Christmas decorations set out. We arrived at Bryant Park around 9:00 pm on a Sunday night, and were disappointed to find that many of the shops were already closed (ok well my wife was disappointed).
Pretty cool in the winter. Ice skating rink among tall skyscrapers and lots of little shops and places to eat and snack. Nice and scenic this winter. Go check it out.
Why skate at Rockefeller Center.. A smaller version of the skating but very popular. You can get up close. Cool shops selling food to clothing.

Lovely little park. We visited when there were lots of lovely shops selling Christmassy bits. There was ice-skating too but didn't have a go. Well worth a visit in the Christmas months, not sure what it would be like throughout the rest of the year. Some shops will probably be available all year round. The warm apple and cinnamon cider was delicious!

Skating at the Bryant park Winter Village. We took advantage of the mild weather and had an enjoyable couple of hours here. Skating is free if you bring your win skates- for the normal people amongst us, that means $19 skate hire and a 30-45 min wait or pay $30 and go in straight away. Unlimited time till rink closes for the night.

Nice ice skating on the city . In winter time the park become a Christmas market and an ice skating area. Very nice and quite in the morning, while in the afternoon and evening is better to avoid, it's very crowded.

Beautiful park!. A beautiful park with shops, ice skating and food. You can just seat and watch people skating and enjoy your surroundings. Lots to see and do all in a one block park. I think on a warm day I can see myself just seating there enjoying people watching.

Intimate park to watch the real NYers do their thing. Really enjoyed this shady park, gave respite from the heat and it was a great place to coffee and people watch, we went early morning and it was bustling, must see.

Super Winter experience in NYC. With the milder weather, lots of families and couples enjoying the winter market and food and drinks under the heat lights at Celcius. What a wonderful winter time watching the skaters and wandering around the shopping stalls. Crowds considerably lighter than the Rockefeller area. A must do!!

christmas magic. really beautiful around the holidays. they have a Christmas market and a wonderful Christmas tree. lot's of food options.
plan to spend some time here. it's nice to just linger and take it slow.

Nice. This park on 6th Avenue used to be a spot where you could sit and relax in a park atmosphere but now it is filled with tents with local vendors. It's now a park full of white tents. NYC Research Library is on front on 5th Avenue.
Quaint. In December the ice rink is up and the Christmas market is there. It's just lovely to walk around and take it all in and see all the different stuff they have on offer.

A terrific surprise we discovered on Christmas Day!. Visiting the city, we had the list of landmarks to see but might have overlooked this stop. An ice skating rink, carousel, marketplace with little vendors--fun for the family.

Great place for spending nights. Bryant park was a twice visited spot on my december 2014 trip. The ambient there was the best. The music, the lights, the minishops, the food. Excellent place for a budget time.

Absolutely Magical. What an amazing place. Loved the skating, the Christmas market and the whole vibrant nature of the area. We had dinner outside by the rink, on a heated patio and it was truly magical during the Christmas season.

Briilain Park in the Centre of New York. This is a fantastic wee park right off 5th Avenue and is a wonderful place to stop, chill, relax, have lunch, people watch and admire all the buildings and hotels that surround it

Bryant Park has been transformed. What was, for years, a neglected and dangerous park to be
It has been transformed into a beautiful place to be. There
is a lunch kiosk that has very good food. It's a treat
to sit in the park and eat lunch - or, to be there any time
of the day.

A gem. Back when I was in college in Manhattan, this was a scary place. Now it is truly a gem! In front of the NY Public Library (go in!) and surrounded by beautiful architecture, it is lovely year-round.
Christmas Market at Bryant Park. The Christmas Market at Bryant Park is wonderful and full of Christmas Spirit, as well as Spiced Cider and excellent Hot Chocolate.

Beautiful Skating Spot!!. We were in NYC for Christmas, out and about and came across Bryant Park...Great place for family skating...enjoyed watching that for a while and there is a market right there with lots of vendors selling various interesting things!!!

Beautiful Park. Beautiful park all year round. Particularly beautiful at Christmas time. The ice skating rink is very well maintained and is the best value for money in the City. An added bonus is the holiday shops and the Christmas tree. This is a ' must do' activity before the shops close.

Christmas visit. We visited in the run up to Christmas when the ice rink and Christmas shops/cabins were in the park. Thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere, shopping and drinking good wine under the heater on a swing in the bar.
Ice skating. A lot of small shops. Ice rink in winter time. You can spend the morning ad the park. Nice to have an active event for the children. They enjoyed the ice skating

it's a park with history and ice skating rink. been here multiple times, good place to take a walk if you live around, and to visit if you are passing by mid-town. for rest of the year it's just a park with iron grill railing (old school), some carved sculptures, fountain and walkways. During christmas it transforms to a beautiful small market with all kinds of boutique shoppers, there is a restaurant on one side which looks fancy (i have never been inside), and an ice skating rink @center (bigger than the one in Rockfellar.

Wonderful Family Vibe. We were here 2 days before Christmas and the ice skating was wonderful. Queues are long for skating, but food was easily accessible and families were here in abundance soaking up the holiday spirit. Park was beautiful.

Winter Wonderland. We loved loved loved Bryant Park!
We discovered it by accident on a mild winters evening when they had the ice skating and winter market.
We found a small bar and sat and had a couple of drinks under the heat lamps. It was a perfect evening and one of our favourite memories of NYC!

Great Christmas market. Can be a bit crowded, but interesting market stalls and good vegetarian burgers!
Not sure the ice rink is a good idea, but fun to watch for a while.

Passed by. Walking past and dropped by a welcome change to all expensive shop around by.
Lots od cheap trinket souvenir shops and finally good cheap food especially a little chinese vendor in there they had great wontons and spring rolls all fresh and served hot .
Great area

Perfect Christmas in NYC atmosphere. The park is beautiful and provides the perfect spot to enjoy the Christmas season. We loved sitting by the skating rink in view of the Christmas tree and the beautiful NYC skyline sipping our wine and listening to the Christmas music. Coiuld not have made for a better first Christmas in NYC memory.

Best feeling of Christmas. We fell upon this smallish Christmas park by accident, what a lovely little find.Sadly this is not hugely advertised, but we thought this gave us the best Christmas feeling of all. We would stop here for an hour and enjoy a drink before heading back to our hotel. ..... little Nordic style huts selling gifts and crafts surrounded a pretty Ice skating rink which stood beside a large, beautifully lit tree. There were various food and drink options, served by café style tables where you could just sit and soak up the atmosphere, or watch the skaters going round to the Christmas tunes being played. The whole place had twinkling lights and felt quite magical in the middle of a concrete jungle.
Beautiful place at winter time . Nice beautiful place with skating-rink and Christmas fair in the heart of NY. Must visit place for everyone especially at night.

Shopping made simple!. I visited the outdoor shops last weekend while in NYC. Each stall was sponsored by a different store featuring holiday ornaments, gifts and clothing. The weather was gorgeous so it was great doing our shopping outdoors. The ice skating rink was open, but the line was quite long. Food vendors were also on location for a quick meal or snack, and there is a bathroom in the park as well. The outdoor tree next to the skating rink was decorated in a red, white and blue patriotic theme. There is also a bandstand, but the rink had music playing while we were there.
Great attraction with markets and good food. Markets selling lots of hand made products and lots of food stalls made this an interesting attraction. Free skating rink for the young at heart

Love Bryant Park at Christmas!. We always enjoy visiting Bryant Park when we are in NYC but the holiday time is especially nice. We love the holiday shops, food stands, decorations, and vibe of the holiday market!

Amazing visit at Christmas . We visited this park at Christmas time. What a wonderful place to be. From ice skating to little market stalls to eating fine food. We loved it here. Staff and people were friendly and helpful. Atmosphere was amazing and the food too.

Christmas markets . The Christmas markets and winter village in Bryant park made for a really lovely lead up to Christmas. We visited on two consecutive days, both raining heavily, but still were able to enjoy the market stalls and food. There was limited seating undercover - only a handful of umbrellas that could seat around 4 chairs without being soaked, but the Christmas tree was twinkling and the carols made for a jolly afternoon. Lots of really great stalls to graze through, and several choices for eating, especially for vegetarians like me. Definitely worth a visit around Christmas!!
Winter Village Shopping. The shops at Bryant Park have a nice variety of gift ideas. From unique socks to paintings and jewelry. There is a nice selection of foods and seating along the skating rink.
Love Bryant Park. Enjoy this space in all seasons. Appreciate the tables and chairs and the free wifi. Love the Ice Rink and Xmas Market and dining opportunities.

Lovely atmosphere. This was our first stop in our New York visit. It was pretty crowded but in a nice way. Lots of family cheer, people having fun skating and taking group photos and some nice market stalls and food vendors to wander round.

Great Park with Lovely Christmas Decorations and Christmas Market. Loved this Park at Christmas Time. The tree is gorgeous. Enjoyed the Christmas market too. Bought all my Christmas gifts there. Sitting outside and watching the skaters was a true pleasure

Wonderful Christmas Fair. This winter has been quite warm so it has been a challenge for the staff to keep the ice skating rink usable. It turned to slush very quickly. So they had to chase the skaters off and bring in the Zamboni to get the rink back in shape.There are many stands at the Bryant Park Christmas Fair offering all types of items from perfume to hand made goods to Christmas items - as well as a variety of food stalls. This is a wonderful place to come during the holidays to get in to the Christmas spirit.

Fun. It was pouring the day we came here but it was still fun to walk around and check out all of the shops. We watched the ice skaters for a good 45 minutes. They were very entertaining. We had a great time observing and laughing and waving to the little guys. It was a very festive location. They had a large decorated tree and lots of other Christmas touches. I wish we could have tried out some of the baked goods that were being sold. We already had a food plan in mind so we didn't but everything looked and smelled delicious. This is a cool little spot to check out if your in NY at Christmas time!
Lovely Planters. always beautifully decorated for the season. I little crowded with the Christmas Shops. Not a place for strollers/wheel chairs.

A wonderful little park just behind the beautiful library. With a very interesting history this park is an oasis of character located right in the middle of everything. Sit down and admire the imposing buildings surrounding it mixing nicely with the peaceful atmosphere in the park. Also a nice place for people watching.

Unique shopping!. Definitely a must to visit for unique gifts, not souvenirs or junk. Very affordable prices! It is so beautiful and the live Christmas tree was spectacular! There is an ice skating rink and so much to see, beautifully decorated!

Bustling Bryant Park. Great fun place to visit at Christmas time.Lots of different stalls & vendors selling everything from beverages, food, clothing and jewellery. A good vibe and easy to kill an hour or two browsing each of the stalls.The ice rink looked like a lot of fun but unfortunately we didn't have time to try out our skating skills... maybe that was a good thing!

Sightseeing in the city st Christmas . Vendors and ice skating ring. We got there around 1, it was packed. So I would recommend doing early 9r maybe later to avoid crowds. Definitely something for the sightseers.

Nice to have a look.. Nice place to have a little walk around and look at the ice skating and Christmas market,the ice skating was really busy though,didn't look like there was any room to move!There fountain in the middle is really nice place to get a photo I think it's the one they used on the friends TVs show aswell.
Nice park. This is a nice park to walk around. not so crowded and you can ice skate during the winter! There is food vendors around the park.

Nice markets, pricey drinks.. Called in to see the ice skating. Lines far far too long. However, the Christmas markets were quite nice. We stopped off for Drinks and nibbles. Nice environment for it but a bit pricey really. All up, pretty good though. Worth a visit if you're in NYC at Christmas.

Great time had by all.. Great spot to have a skate in NYC. $19 per person for skate hire or free if you have your own. Plenty of seating and stalls around the venue to keep you busy if not skating. The lines are long with about a 40min wait for skates. There was a large amount of people so the wait is to be expected. Great time had and we would go back again.
Too little time to spend there. We were there right before Christmas. I wish we had had more time to spend at Bryant Park. The Christmas market and ice skating looked like so much fun.

Absolutely loved it!. What a wonderful park in the middle of NY and with so much atmosphere. We were travelling with our teenage sons and visited on Xmas day. Loved the stores, the food stalls, the Xmas tree, the skating rink andthe overall spirit. The crepes were to die for! We all rated this park a 5 out of 5.
Stalks and skating. Lovely to see unusual little stalls and skating was very quiet later on in the evening Had already been skating in Central Park though

Fun, relaxing place. We hit Bryant Park for Christmas Eve. Large crowds but we could easily get around. The winter village setup is a lot of fun with very unique shops. Ice rink is easy to do but save time for the small shops.

Only went there on the way to the library. Most of the shops were filled with mass-produced junk I did find some inexpensive cold-weather gloves. Hopefully they will last. There were numerous snack kiosks set up but we had just eaten lunch so we didn't sample their wares.The ice rink was nice enough but interesting enough the people skating didn't seem to be enjoying themselves all that much. Have to mention that it was raining and in the 60's and even with an umbrella, the holiday mood was dampened (?). Frankly, I would have gladly used the time spent here to spend more time looking at all the exhibits at the library.

Holiday spirit @the park. Enjoyed the holiday spirit,Small cozy shops and cafe's, nice ice skating ring for the adulta as well as kids.Great family and couples place.Try the apple cider hot/cold as well as the neat pickle shop loool

Christmas Village :). Visited the park just before Christmas while the Bank of America winter village was up and running. It really had a nice feel to it and the ice skating is actually free if you bring your own skates (we didn't, so payed the 20 dollars) which really is great value either way considering the cost of the rinks in Central Park and the Rockefeller Center. The market was also nice which sold a lot of little trinkets and Christmas decorations. Well recommended :)
Postcard Christmas. Big tree, out door skating and Christmas Carols. Everything you imagine Christmas to be in New York. Plus the best Mac n Cheese

Magic December 2015. During the summer, NY es fantastic! Well, we need to deal with the heat. BUT for the holiday season, is Magic! The weather was perfect this time. Only 60°F! You will enjoy with your family, kids, couple, or just alone. They have an ice skating rink and many shopping village set up: food, gifts booths, etc. Only a few blocks from Grand Central Station.
Christmassy. Loved the little huts with all the christmas gifts you could buy. Then we enjoyed a cup of tea watching the skaters on the ice Sat by the big Christmas tree. Magical worth a visit
enjoyable experience. great time of year, charming xmas market, enjoyable for skaters, warm feeling place. we visit every year

Christmas Markets at their best. Visited this park during the Christmas season. Christmas shops are set up in this park during the Christmas session seeking everything from food, to clothing and everything else.Very peaceful place, and very clean. I would highly recommend it.

Lovely in Summer and Winter. I've sat outside to eat lunch here during the summer, and in December watched the ice skaters on the Rink and shopped in the cute stalls around the edge of the park, both times were just lovely. There is a fabulous Christmas tree up in December and it is well worth a visit any time of year.

Great local park,great Christmas fair with ice rink. Lovely stalls-good variety an all so friendly. Ice skating on offer too. Nice evening entertainment. We saw it from empire state an had to find it!

Christmas shops & skating rink. Countless shops to visit with very unique items. Great food venues in the area and theskating rink did not have the usual long lines. Just a short walk from Times Square, there's no need to miss this once a year attraction

Start New York Here!. Forget the usual NYC attractions (Statue of Liberty, Battery Park, Macy's) or at least put them off for awhile while you start your NYC tour at Bryant Park. It's a small area, but the city packs in more to do than you could imagine. Start with the row and rows of vendors tents where you can browse (and purchase!) just about any thing: clothing, scarves, hats, gloves, candles, Christmas ornaments, jewelry, art supplies.......and so on. It's like being in a mall of tents. Food items are also available; hot coffee is a must in NY in December and there is plenty of it. Stop by the skating rink, or rent a pair of skates and have a go yourself. Don't forget to go around the corner and visit the iconic lions keeping watch over the New York Public Library. Bryant Park is also ideally located and you can walk to Times Square, the Hard Rock Cafe, and even MoMA if you're wearing sturdy shoes. Take the time to visit Bryant Park......it will be worth your time.

Located behind the New York Public Library. This park has a great location in midtown Manhattan. During the summer months, they have concerts or it is just a pleasant park to sit down and relax. For the holiday season, they have an ice skating rink and shopping village set up.It is only a few blocks from Grand Central Station.

Christmas personified. The weather couldn't have been better for a trip around the marvellous Christmas market. Bright, cool and sunny. Lots of stalls selling quality goods (in most cases) plenty of food and drink available and an ice-rink as well.Festive atmosphere, people enjoying themselves and the area was spotless.

Lovely. A great spot to feel the pulse of New York. During the day executives from the nearby offices come to relax or bring their brown-bag lunch. After business hours the park fills up again with the restaurant at its edge doing a great fast business.

Magical around the holidays. Little pop up stores all over when holiday time comes around. A beautiful tree - rivals the Rock Center one except for its size. Even if you don't purchase it's nice just to walk around and get the holiday feeling.

Fun Afternoon. The Gingerbread Village is such a neat experience for adults and children. The little girls in our group loved the carousel ride and the pigeons! What can I say - they're young! The adults loved the wonderful variety of items available in the shops. Such a pleasant way to spend the afternoon.

Outdoor Skating and Quaint Shops!. Had a great time here as we skated amidst the big Christmas tree and surrounded by quaint shops. A very quick walk from most Time Square hotels. Skate rentals are easy if you don't bring your own.

Mr and Miss. Busy caft market, visited every day for cinamon spiced hot cider (Fab), Restaurant there is exellent as are all the Stalls, too many fine things to buy, if in New York, its a must to visit

Bryant Park in December. What can be better than watching the ice skating, visiting the boutiques, eating the food at the stands, watching the men play bacci. A should not miss during the holdiay season
Beautiful especially at Christmas . Visited here a few days before Christmas. Was beautiful. lots of quirky stalls and the ice rink was cool. Pretty lights lots to eat. Definitely recommend.

Winter Village was Nice. We stopped by Bryant Park to visit the shops at the Winter village. The crepes were amazing and worth the wait! It was was just watching the ice skaters and looking into all the shops.
Christmas shops. Cute park. Went Christmas shopping at the pop up shops. They were a mix of artisan and junk shops. Worth a stroll through. Didn't try out the ice skating rink.
was very crowded the day we were there. too crowded to enjoy - but we walked through holiday market stalls on way to Public Library- didn't stop to shop or skate

Wonderful Ice Skating. This is THE place to go if you are wanting to ice skate in NYC. But here is your tip if you are renting skates: GET THE FAST PASS a couple of days before you go. They do sell out and allow you to skip the sometimes very long line. It's only 6.00 more and so worth the price. Great old-school music, too, like Sinatra, Bing and Deano. Great place to skate!

Fun place. Nice place all decorated for Christmas. Skating rink here is free. The only free rink in the city. Shops are cute, plenty of little snacks and things to purchase. Nice to walk through on your way to somewhere else.

Nice Park. Lots of eateries. Great place to stop and relax on a nice day.. Bryant Park is a great example of urban green space. Activities, eateries, and nearby major attractions. Definitely worth checking out.
Very nice. Came here in November, and they had an ice skating ring set up. Along with lots of shops/ stand to buy lots of different things. Very beautiful Christmas themed experience
Xmas Shopping. Wish I could skate? The atmosphere was electric with the spectacular Christmas lights and even seeing a proposal on the Ice Rink was a highlight.
Great winter festival. The ice skating rink is great. The Christmas festival vendors offer a huge variety of items & food. The fountain is very pretty as well. Great outdoor venue.

Christmas Village at Bryant Park. This was absolutely charming. We arrived in the early evening and stayed until about 9:30PM. There was a lot to see and we took the time to see it all. Great shopping, watched the skaters at the outdoor rink, enjoyed seeing the families with children on the merry go round. Enjoyed a light dinner at the outdoor bar. Very relaxing, right until the rain started. But even the rain did not ruin the day. It did not last long.
So full of holiday cheer. The park was decorated beautifully and there were street vendors along with the skating rink. It was a beautiful holiday atmosphere.

favorite ice skating in NYC. so quaint and so beautiful, especially at Christmas, when the ice skating rink is in full force and the pop up holiday market is there. the tree is gorgeous and the ice rink much larger than Rockefeller. They blast great music and the Celsius bar is great for people/skater watching. The quintessential NYC experience--grab a cup of "no chew" hot chocolate at one of the market tents, lace up the skates and soak it in!!

Lovely park with lots to do. Great family outing with something for everyone. Went in Dec so ice skating offered for reasonable rate....better that Rockefellar Cener which is expensive! Lots of little shops ... Carrousel for the little ones is great fun.
Shopping bazaar?. We expected to find a park, but instead we found a crowded, gross shopping arena. Any beauty was hiding by the rows of tents. Won't return.
Christmas time. Lots of fun kiosks with great presents at Christmas time plus places to eat. Places to sit and you can watch the ice skaters. Worth a stop

Crowded at Christmas. Bryant park has several winter shops that are open around the holiday season. Depending on when you visit, it could be potentially very crowded! The closer you are to Christmas, the more busy it will be. Regardless, it is a beautiful park.

hot spot park. Bryant park is not only wifi free but it is close to the biggest NYC library, so when it is sunny , go crab a book and enjoy a snack and read your book or do your work in a nice view, and when it is winter , get a cup of hot chocolate - i recommend - and go skate, they turn the park to a skating circle that all ages/gender can enjoy.. the park is famous for the white dinner event.. where dress code is white in that gala dinner. concert and sometimes a movie show can be happening.. Bottom line this park always busy with something creative activity.. well You are in NYC .. centre of creative activity

Great vendors in a market atmosphere.. My daughter and I were visiting NYC and went to Bryant Park for their holiday market. There are so many great vendors and beautiful items. Only down side ...it was raining and an umbrella purchased from a vendor broke within 15 minutes. The park is beautiful. Their Christmas tree was really pretty.

Lots of neat shops. Heard about Bryant Park from a friend-- so glad we went! Tons of neat little shops and a beautiful Christmas tree and ice skating rink? Go at dark it's beautiful all lit up but the shops close around 9
Love it here!. If you want a break from the crowds at Rockefeller Center then walk north to Bryant Park. Everything is less expensive and a little less crowded. The park vendors are fun and trendy!
The Best. Love The Grill and the Christmas Market was THE BEST. The skating was charming and the overall vibe wonderful.
gem in manhatten. the ice skating ring is free if you bring your own skates , there are restaurants , shops ,etc . it is a lot of fun place - easily to spend 2-3 hours there .
Little 2 crowded. Was a little to crowed. Had a large school group at the time we were there. But the line did move fast.

A little sanctuary in the middle of the city!. Located at the back of the New York Public Library this little pocket of paradise is a great spot all year long. Take a twirl on the ice rink admiring the huge beautifully decorated Christmas tree or grab a hot chocolate and sit awhile to people watch. When it gets too cold your steps to enter the library and appreciate the architecture.
Worth a visit!. Just a fun place to walk around. Always busy when I have been there. Many little stores with all sorts of items to purchase, ice skating and more.
A great place to vidit. During Christmas this is a place to visit. There are great little shops, all types of food and a skating rink and only a short walk from Times Square

Christmas at the Park. We go here every year and look at the different vendors at the park, as well as watch people ice skate. This year we had a drink at the designated outdoor bar and our bartender (nice chap from England) was just so friendly and helpful! He talked to everyone and carried on great conversations! He really made our visit that much better! New York gets such a bad rap for being rude - every single person we met on our extended weekend was so friendly & nice and this guy was no exception! Wish I remembered his name. If you go to the park, stop by & have a pint!
One of the many good parks. Bryant is one of many good parks that NYC offers. Changes based on time of year and in a great location

Nice Little Park. This little park behind the public library is a great stop. It's a great stop in the warm weather for sitting outside to enjoy lunch. During the Christmas season there is a Christmas village of shops and an ice rink which is free. Worth the stop.

Do not miss this park!. This was the nicest little oasis we found in NYC during our entire trip. Not only is the park itself lovely and peaceful, but it also boasts a large array of events for everyone. During our week in NYC we stopped by Bryant Park a handful of times, at many different times of day, and we loved it more each time.We went in the evening after the hustle and bustle of Times Square for a waffle and break. We went a few mornings later for breakfast where we ran in to Bocce Tournament, which was a unique way to start the day. We also went in the afternoon to simply sit in the sun, surrounded by picturesque greenery. There's a few food stands with European inspired food, a carousel and many chairs and tables. Definitely a must.
fabulous. love to visit this park when we are in New York fantastic with the ice rink and all the little shops just great.
Christmas Cheer. Bryant Park has a hip, festive vive at Christmas time with holiday pop up stalls, the tree and iceskating. They have a restaurant, Celsius, set up if you need to take a break.

Never get tired of this small oasis. This is a great little space in the city. Nice place to go in summer to sit and watch the world go by. The winder ice rink is fun and the pop-up shops offer an interesting range of crafts and niche products.

Lovely little park in the middle of Manhattan. We visited Bryant Park to do some ice skating. The rink is a nice size but can get busy at weekends. There are loads of tables to just chillax and watch the skaters, along with a fantastic Christmas Tree. There are some lovely little Christmas shops to peruse around. A thoroughly enjoyable way to spend a few hours on a wintry December day.

Quaint, but crowded and overpriced.. Especially around the holidays, Bryant Park is very nice. It FEELS Chrismassy. With an ice skating rink and lots of stalls it gives a suburban feel, right in the middle of NYC.But the lines for the ice skating rink are always REALLY long, and the food sold at the stalls is tourist-priced. Still worth a visit.

Christmas card ice skating . The Bank of America brought this ice skating area for free...well almost for free. The reality is that we pay $47 for two pairs of skates, and a storage bag. So if you are more than 2 people, it could be expensive. Morning before 11 hrs is the best, unless you and your family don't t mind to staying on a long line. The quality of the ice was excellent and safety is well preserved with few monitors checking that you act in a civilized way( no selfies and no bringing coffe while skating, or no bullying to the beginners)Certainly a great idea to share with those you love.
Fun, hip, lovely Christmas feel.. I liked the Christmas tree, skating rink and little shops. Had an empanada for $3. Yummy. Family friendly and nice city views.

Best Christmas Park and Mart.. Whether it be ice skating, dining in or outside, entertaining, shopping or just plain old people watching, Bryant park triples it's wonderful experience at Christmas time.
Busy but a holiday must. It is Christmas in NYC. It is crowded but nice. I like all the little shops, some very unique shopping. Worth battling the crowds over.
Nice scenic walk in NYC. Bryant Park is the perfect place to go for a scenic stroll on a sunny day. Plenty of places to sit down and enjoy the view and do a bit of people watching.

Skip It..... Bryant Park is okay if you're just in the mood for a wander or a quick bite at the cafe, but the shopping value wasn't anywhere near as interesting as in years past (seemed like mostly hand crafted junk), and the ice rink was too grid-locked to even think about skating. Extremely crowded everywhere, too, which became rather tedious.

Lovely park, worth a visit if you're passing. We walked past this park every day on our way from our hotel to all the attractions. It's a lovely park with a nice chilled out atmosphere and we stopped several times to have a drink, a rest and soak up the sun. A nice break from the hustle and bustle.

Christmas time in Bryant Park a must. Always enjoy all the shops here at Christmas. No pressure or hassle. The skating rink here much better and bigger than others in the city. All kinds of food and snacks

Great potty. Flowers, attendants, spotlessly clean. A real joy and worth a visit even if you don't have to go. :)Bryant Park has many ever changing activities -- it's worthwhile checking what is available when you are in the area. Many surprises; today for example there is a jugging exhibition.Pétanque and ping pong almost always available.People watching ... some of the best in the City

One of my Faves. I always make it a point to stop by Bryant Park when going to the city in the winter. When Christmas shopping, I can always find great gift ideas purchased from small business owners. Items are sometimes more expensive but you are spring small business, or at least that's how I feel. I always find amazing chocolates there and will get a snack a watch people ice skate. The tree is beautiful as well. If you are heading into the city, I strongly recommend a walk-through (more so on Friday afternoons)
Very nice. Love Bryant park at Christmas.From seeing the kids playing in the ice rink,to wandering about the stalls was all good.Food was not that great,but didn't spoil the day.
December. I was just there. During the christmas season, there are many booth that serve food and interesting items for sale. I recommend going there at night. it is very very scenic
Bryant Park at Christmas time. This will always hold a special place in my memory. Walking through here in the evening with the Ice skating rink, Christmas markets and all the lights was wonderful.
Fun place to skate and shop. We visited during the holidays and the kids were able to skate without too much of a crowd. The shopping and food surrounding the rink were interesting too

Skating and shops at Bryant Park. We visited Bryant Park at christmas and saw the well looked after ice rink with the Christmas Tree at one end. The rink is open to the public for everyone to enjoy themselves. If skating is not your thing, there are small shops and kiosks around the edge selling a variety of goods, something for everyone. I recommend it as it is nearer to most hotels than Central Park and much fun to be had.
Christmas Market at Bryant park. Nice ithems, expensive. Food available and outdoor seating. Wear comfortable shoes for the uneven floors.
Fantastic Christmas atmosphere. Large ice Skating rink surrounded by a Christmas market beautiful Christmas tree very festive. Lots of small stalls selling various bits to eat
Nice christmas market. went here by mistake they had a great christmas market and ice skating on when i was there, was nice to kill an hour or two, near lots of places to eat, certinaly worth a visit

A little Tranquility. I stay opposite Bryant Park whenever in NYC. A lovely park especially in spring and summer. Winter is interesting with the ice skating and Christmas kiosks, but this takes away some of the natural beauty of the inner city park. Very well managed with plenty of activities going on. Security keeps it safe and pleasant to be in. Typifies the success of private enterprise as opposed to a City run park.

Christmas Shopping. We love the park in the summer but we were pleasantly surprised to find the park is filled with little shops, some local, mostly small vendors, with all kinds of cool items for Christmas.

Such Fun. We LOVED Bryant Part. We went there for the seasonal Christmas Market and the stalls had so many unique things. We shopped and ate and watched the ice skaters and really enjoyed the nice views from the park.
Pretty Place. We visited Bryant Park during their holiday market. There were little shops set up along with different types of food vendors. There was a lighted tree and a skating rink too.

New York film festival. On our first evening in NYC we came across 'Bryant Park' which was close to our hotel. They were showing films that had been filmed and based in New York, free to the public on a giant screen outside. There were plenty of food vendors selling very overpriced food & drink at this attraction but it didn't spoil it. We watched 'Marathon Man' with thousands of over people sat on the grass with all the sky scrappers in the background. Brilliant night.
Did not enjoy this. Had high hopes for a visit to Bryant Park. Lacked atmosphere and full of over-priced stalls. Very busy and noisy. Overall a real disappointment.

Fab Christmas Market.. What a lovely place, the Christmas Market is really pretty, there is an Ice Skating Rink, and a Giant Christmas Tree, Also I must comment on the public loos there, they were spotlessly clean, we were so surprised. Bryant Park is well worth the visit.

Great space -good skating available. Bryant Park was just near our hotel, a lovely space especially with all the Christmas decorations and Christmas Market.
Ice Skating is availabe all day until 22.00, we would recommnd you visit.
Beautiful. We loved walking around and watching the skaters. The little shops were cute too. We had a little Turkish snack and it was delicious. Nice walk from our hotel.
Brilliant.. Went and visted the christmas markets. Amazing atmosphere,really unusual things to buy. Really worth a visit .

Magical Christmas night. Beautiful night to spend some time with family and friends at Bryant Park. You can ice skate, see the wonderful Christmas tree and sip Hot Chocolate. Everyone there had smiles on their faces. It's a magical time of the year
Beautiful tree and Christmas Village. Thoroughly enjoyed the all the lights and decorations. The Christmas booths had a variety of eats and gifts. Very festive at night.
Amazing relaxing area right in the middle of the city. Lots of places to eat, drink or just sit.......plus a great ice rink to either try out or simply enjoyM
Wintery Wonderland. Ice skating rink and Christmas craft stalls were adorning the park in November. Count really tell what its like without all the seasonal stuff.

Favorite Park in NYC. What a really nice park. There is a huge ice skating rink, they had a massive Christmas tree, lots of shopping and food and drinks. I was more impressed with this park than Rockefeller Center. We sat for hours people watching and eating and shopping. There are bathrooms located out side and they are really clean. The Park sits right in front of the NYC Library.

Surprised and delighted us!. I thought i was headed to a park with some benches - but clearly we had not done our research. Nov/Dec in the park is crazy fun. Did we ice skate? no. however we managed to spend 2.5 hours enjoyed the ice skating, music, atmospheres, markets and general christmas vibe.I could not believe that the skating was free - wow. so great for families and travellers on a budget.And i must say that the crepe guys are NOT TO BE MISSED. Ummm - yum. I am now 100% converted to the crepe evolution with their fancy performed cardboard crepe holders...If you are like me- start slow with a nautili and strawberry...but I could have returned every day for the whole trip to try more option.Sweet tooth - over and out.#goodworkbryantpark
Lots to do in such a small area. They had so many nice vendors for eating and shopping. You can also go ice skating. Their tree was very pretty. The bathrooms were super clean.

Beautiful Winter Village Feel. Bryant Park is a a hidden jewel in NYC. Most tourists don't know about it so it attracts the "locals." Winter at Bryant park is so much fun. With a large ice skating rink and lots of kiosk restaurants and specialty shops, there is lots to do. How awesome to have a cocktail at the outdoor bar in the middle of December! Don't miss this great location when you visit NYC.

A December visit.. First time to Bryant park. I have no clue what the park looks like during any other time of the year, but Christmas time is gorgeous there! The ice skating ring was so pretty and very festive. The park's tree was absolutely gorgeous! There was a Christmas market all around the park. My teens loved this place a lot. It felt very cozy and perfect there if you're trying to get into the Christmas spirit.

Very exciting, especially during the holidays!. ice skating, vendors, people watching, all make this stop a must-do in NYC. Some great fast-food vendors. Can be very crowded, to get a seat at the vendors, go during the day. Sjort walk to Times Square.
Loved it!. Fabulous, all set up for Christmas with the ice rink and Christmas tree. Looked really smashing. There were little stalls all around showing some really nice fun gifty bits.Loved the park.
Not that special. There is nothing special in bryant park..atleast not in the summers. Maybe in the NY winters people would love to be here. Not many food and drink options, nothing much to do.
Bryant Park. Nice park with ice rink, restaurants, and assorted vendors. Everyone was friendly and helpful and the vendors' wares was generally high quality.

Loved this little jewel!. Other than Central Park, this was my favorite park visited in the city so far. Lots of sitting space. It is almost like a small market center. It was actually a calming place to visit and peruse in the middle of the holiday madness! Great little food vendors. Handmade and other small specialty vendors carry great gift items for the "hard-to-buy-for" person. Even though you are in the middle of midtown, it definitely does not feel like it. Great rest spots. Sit by the ping pong tables and enjoy watching the matches.

Favorite Family Oriented Park. We love Bryant Park! There is a really nice skating rink; great local shops and lots of restaurants. There is always a family atmosphere at Bryant Park. It is a must visit NYC Park!

Fun, Festive, and Tourist Friendly. Cute little shops, delicious foods - waffles, cinnamon rolls, crepes - all to tempt you. Fun place to people watch or just relax after you have walked about the city or want a quick breakfast and coffee or lunch.

Good place for a winter visit. Nice array of stalls selling all sorts of things,with plenty of Christmassy stuff.
Nice place to have a drink and a snack while watching the ice skating.
Christmas market. Great place to visit at Christmas when there is a lovely Christmas market. Great stalls and food. Also skating. Plenty going on and a great atmosphere

A Delightful Park in the City. While we were there before the skating rink was set up it was easy to see that the park was a popular place for families and visitors to town. It is in the most urban area and soshowed off the excitement of the big city. In the blocks adjacent and nearby are many excellent and interesting restaurants for a myriad of choices of eateries. If you know where to look there are also interesting businesses to visit and shops to check out. Itis a fun place with the character of the city all around.
not open at the time of visit. We arrived before it had opened, but it looked very interesting. We didn't get the chance to go back. Lots of craft stalls and a lovely water feature.

Lovely Christmassy atmosphere. Weather in NYC was more like summer in Scotland but visit to Bryant Park created Christmas feeling and a beautiful tree. Watched the skating and browsed the lovely Christmas stalls.

Greenery in NY. In the middle of this bustling city, a small patch of greenery. A welcome place to stop and rest. You can buy drinks and snacks. Just sit, chill out and watch the mad mad world of NY go by. Nice place to relax amongst the hustle and bustle.

Christmas market. Went here in December , Christmas market much the same as any other Christmas market you can visit, but great to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city and sit with a drink and watch the world go by
December 2015. We were so pleasantly surprised by Bryant Park. It was GORGEOUS, so lovely to walk around. The bathroom was the cleanest public bathroom in the entire world- very impressive!

Plenty to do. No matter what time of year you visit Bryant Park, there is plenty to do and see! We happened to go during Christmas season, so the pop-up holiday shops are there, and the ice skating rink is open. Highly recommended for locals and tourists!
An every visit experience. We love Bryant Park, very festive with ice skating, crowds and booths selling all kinds of products.

A must-go place if you are in New York. This park is so beautifully landscaped, vibrant, and energetic all-year round. It has a great restaurant and ice skating arena in the winter. The shops are unique. The outdoor cinema is fun. The public bathrooms there are very clean. An ideal community park!

Felt Like a Local. This was the second Christmas visit and will definitely return. I love the tree and rink along with a nice selection of food and boutiques to browse. It is the most relaxing sitting sipping on soup in the cool air watching the skaters.

Fun place to stop during holiday time for ice skating, cocoa, shopping. Fun place to stop during holiday time for ice skating, cocoa, shopping. We did some holiday shopping, had kids ride the carousel, and got some nibbles.

A nice place to visit during the holidays. If you're visiting New York during the holidays you must visit Bryant Park. They have multiple shops set up through the park.They have unique gifts that you can't find anywhere, also they have unique snacks to eat. You can also ice skate and it is really nice because they have a Christmas tree set up and there are lights everywhere, which makes it very pretty.
Wonderful shops. Great shops to browse through. Very pretty at Christmas. Also nice to skate or sit and relax while watching the skaters.

Quaint park, beautiful. This is a small park, but when I visited in Dec, there was a Christmas market, a nice big lovely tree, lights, and free ice skating. I thought a stunning park, and the New York library is just next to it, definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful outdoor shopping. Lots of small shops. Variety of shops and food vendors.Ice skating rink during winter months. Fun and cheery atmosphere.

Great spot in Midtown. The recovery of Bryant Park was a success. Nowadays, families, couples, solos, can have a lot of fun. There is always something going on. Ride at the carousel, watch a movie, a performance, yoga classes, dinner, lunch, brunch, a glass of wine or two!

Beautiful tree!. Honestly, I love this tree! It's big and beautiful! I love the fact that you can see the tree, go skating, eat dinner and go shopping all within the same block! A little nyc treasure!

Great place for unique holiday shopping ideas. Bryant Park is a neat place to walk around anytime, but during the Christmas season there are many stalls with unique gifts that span the range of affordability and chic.

Great place to take a break.. Stopped here for a cool drink on Monday when the temps were in the 60's. Nice change to relax and watch the ice skaters. The shops are great and the tree is beautiful. If you are in NYC for the holidays take a few minutes to take in the atmosphere.

All year long.... I enjoy walking through Bryant park any time of year, a respite from the harsh lines and concrete of the cityscape to a green oasis in the middle of the action. In the warm weather I will meet friends at the restaurant/bar for a happy hour break. At the holidays, the skating rink and the Christmas Market booths offer fun strolling and entertainment for all ages.

A nice outdoor shopping venue but nothing extraordinary. We saw the myriad small gift stalls lined up in Bryant Park and decided to take a stroll through it. This Park is easily found along 42nd Street and is adjacent to the Public Library. The stalls are well organized and lit for night time browsing. The stalls offer small gift items, clothing, jewelry, trinkets and the like. It is a nice stroll through but we did not find anything unique or eye catching.
festive. beautiful park,full of christmas cheer! lots of stalls selling arts and crafts,food and drinks.ice skating was lovely to watch,

Make Sure to Stop during the Holiday Season. The city puts up an entire outdoor gift market in the park; there is ice skating and plenty of places for a quick bite. It's a wonderful walk and browse location in a central location.
Nice set up at Christmas. They had a Christmas market set up and also a skating rink. It was nice to stroll through and take it all in.
Something for everyone. From the great little street shops, to the games area and the ice rink being set up this is a great park to explore right in town

Nice Holiday market.. There was a "Holiday Market" in December. It is too politically correct, no mention of Christmas or any hint of Christmas items. It actually felt like a craft fair with little "holiday" feel. Good food stalls.
Beautiful oasis in the middle of the city!. Great location for holiday shops and free ice skating! Great place to grab a bite to eat and people watch.

Christmas Treasures. Visited Bryant Park in December and greatly enjoyed all of the Christmas gifts, especially New York themed gifts. Lots of people but lots of great stuff to view and buy. Great prices too.
Great pop ups and ice rink. This was one of the best stops on our December visit to NYC, large ice rink and Christmas tree. Lots of good food choices and quality shopping in pop up holiday shops.

Surprise Winter Wonderland. We were completely surprised by this park across from our hotel as it was completely transformed to a winter wonderland with an ice skating rink for young and old and a great tree of its own. We could have spent a lot more time there if we didn't have other places to show and see.

Presents galore. Bryant park, located behind the NY library, has a holiday market place comprised of numerous 10x12' buildings used to sell food, crafts and clothing. There is also a restaurant and ice skating rink. We did some shopping because items there are much cheaper than on 5th ave.

Relax. Bryant Park is nice to go there to relax and have lunch or even dinner it's also great to be there during Christmas time or really anytime of the year. Throughout the year events go on in Bryan park

Saturday in the park. This was our 3rd time to stop at this park on one of our trips to the city over the past few years. My son and friend skate, husband takes a break and I get to shop at the market. The rink was pretty packed, but they said they still enjoyed it. I love the shops and the tree is so beautiful. The city overall seemed extra busy than in years past, but tis the season. Check out Bryant Park if you are in the area.

What a difference 30 years makes.. When I was a kid growing up in New York, Bryant Park was an ugly and scary place. Now it's a beautifully groomed public square, with multiple eateries, an ice skating rink in season, and a lively holiday market. It's a great place to rest from business or shopping downtown and enjoy the trees and atmosphere of relaxation.

Great for the Holidays. Bryant Park had a Christmas Village with all kinds of crafts and food and other things for sale by local vendors. They also had the ice rink set up and it was packed with people enjoying themselves. It would have been better if there was some snow but a beautiful sunny day in Bryant Park was just fine.

Went for the Holiday Market. Many cute shops and the skating rink was full of people having fun. Had the best hot chocolate I ever tasted. Chairs and tables next to the rink and the beautiful Christmas tree.

The Challenge . Had a great time proving to myself I could still skate...after decades of absence. Hugged the rail first two laps then ventured in towards the middle...awesome.Bryant Park was a great spot with lots of little shops to walk around and has an amazing backdrop of the city buildings and lights....certainly worth a visit and lots of fun...be game and get on the rink..you'll love it.
Christmas. You have to visit Bryant Park at Christmas. The beautiful tree and all the little shops offers everyone something to buy.

awesome! NY Library good food and skating!. We spent 2 hours exploring the park and old American Standard building, then we visited the NY Library right next door! Awesome place to visit. We didnt skate as lines were too long.
Perfect site for a Gala!. The perfect time of year, ideal location, so much to see and do any way you look and in any direction your feet (or taxi) take you.

Small and Quaint. Bryant Park is small park to sit and catch your breath when walking around Manhattan. It has quaint little buildings that serve as gift shops and food kiosks. We found it a brilliant place to watch the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade from. Be sure to check out the public restroom.

A really well kept park.. This park was awsome, just outside of the madness nesseled in among some big buildings offers ping pong, ice skating, christmas shops, food and a huge library and is truely awsome. Definaty worth seeing and having some fun with family or freinds.
Bryant Park Christmas Market. Small with some repeat booths but if in the area worth it. Restaurant right behind it was very good.

Lovely Park. This is a nice little park behind the main branch of New York Public Library. During the summer there is an outdoor reading room and in the winter, there is a Christmas market and free ice skating sponsored by the Bank of America. It is a very nice place to relax.

Respite from the city. Sit under beautiful shade trees and rest your feet, while you watch people. There's a gorgeous fountain, children's carousel, and during the winter, an ice skating rink and holiday shops.

Bus stop. Bryant park is where we got off the bus. There is a winter village with shops and a free ice skating rink. There is a large Christmas tree that is very pretty also. It is centrally located and within walking distance of times square, Macy's, Rockafellar center. I plan to go back to nyc and this area is where i would like to stay.
Unique gifts and lovely spot. Fun spot to shop for local unique gifts, grab a great snack, ice skate and do fun people watching. A real New York experience.
Wow great Christmas winter fun. Ice skating. Cozy eateries French yummy melt in your mouth chocolate Not to be missed. Shopping stalls.

Winter wonderland. We were here the week of Thanksgiving. The ice skating rink was set up and there were all sorts of Christmas market booths set up. We came here 3 times during our week in NYC. Very nice nighttime place to visit.
A park you don't want to miss. Don't miss this park. You can go ice skating or visit the many shops surrounding the ice skating rink. Lots of fun, lots of happy people.

Christmas in New York. ... means the Bryant Park shopping bazaar opens. There is a lot to choose from... and they're all a step up from fridge magnets. Scarves, sweaters and hats seem to have the majority of the booths, but there are quite a few jewelry offerings.. with most showing original and handcrafted pieces. Plus... hand crafted pottery and assorted objects. And there's food too. I worked in NYC for 22 years... and this is one of the best holiday traditions that New Yorkers and visitors alike can enjoy. Don't worry about the hustle and bustle... it's safe. Even if you can't find that perfect gift for that special person, you'll have fun.

Perfect Pit Stop. Went to New York for a weekend getaway. Stopped in at Bryant Park. Really enjoyed checking out the skaters on the ice (didn't have time to do it ourselves). We were able to find a Christmas gift for my dad in one of the shops, and we also found an ornament for the tree (a tradition with every trip we take). It was the perfect pit stop on a trip that was packed with shows.

Great Evening There!. Bryant park was so beautiful as we are fastly approaching Christmas. We had the chance to stroll around and watch people ice skate for an hour. I love the fact that the backdrop is the NY Library as well. Such a beautiful place.

Great park and not nearly as crowded as Rockefeller. What a gem of a park. Located near the beautiful library! The park was decked out with a lovely Christmas tree and an ice skating rink which the kids loved. Free to skate but $20 to rent the skates (still a better deal than the $60 to skate on the rink at the Rock). Great experience.
Something for everyone!. We stayed in the area and visited Bryant Park each day for something, coffee, shopping, drinks, skating! Unique shops in a family friendly atmosphere, open at night!
Love the Holiday Fair!. The winter fair is tons of fun. Lots of great booths with crafts, gifts and food. Have visited with our family over multiple years.

Lovely little central place to sit down. We went during the holiday markets so quite busy, but over a 6 day period, we went 4 days even if it was just to sit down to eat breakfast that we'd picked up from a nearby bakery. Very atmospheric with the ice rink and tree.
Xmas markets in mid town. Nice park with a restaurant in midtown, visited the Xmas markets which was a disappointment and quite repetitive. Needs to be a dry day to make the most of it.
Lovely. Coffee time here and a snack. Watched the old guys playing bowls. Charming small shops. We stumbled across the park rather than planned and it was a treat but don't make a special trip.
Winter Village. We stumbled across the Bryant Park Winter Village and it had great independent food and product stalls, as well as an ice rink. Lovely atmosphere and reasonably priced food.

Lovely at Christmas. We visited when the Christmas market was on and it was great. Lots of beautiful (if expensive) gifts and food options available.
We didn't try ice skating but it looked fun and Bryant Park has free wi-fi and some of the best public conveniences in Manhattan.
Christmas marked and ice skating. We went to Bryant Park in December. There was a lovely Christmas marked and a ice skating rink. Very cosy with a lovely atmosphere.

Amazing in December!. Read about this spot and a must (especially in December!) with pop up shops, holiday gifts, skating rink and food.. This all in one attraction is fantastic and soo glad I checked it out during my trip!
Gotta go. Just love Bryant Park! Great in the summer and great in the winter. Nice place to stop and take a break from the hustle and bustle of the city.

My all time favorite. Every time I visit NYC I try to have my lunch in this place. If the weather is good.
Take advantage of the furniture all around and relax with a good takeaway.

A Break in our Walk. Bryant Park is so beautiful year round, but especially during the Xmas - Near Year's holiday! The Shops are a delightful reminder of old times. The skating rink is so beautiful. What a great atmosphere!

Ice Rink and Market. Firstly the Ice Rink was HEAVING! I don't know how anyone could skate with every Inch of the ice being taken up. However pottering round the market stalls with the back drop of the Park and impressive Library was great fun.
Though it was busy it was accessible and we ended up eating a burrito on a table and chairs.
A gem!. A Christmas tree and ice skating rink as nice or nicer than Rockefeller Center without the crowds! Very nice safe park close to Times Square
Christmas Spirit. Great place to visit to ice skate and get into the Christmas spirit. Grab a coffee, hot chocolate, or hot apple cider and sit at a table and enjoy.
great christmas market and ice skatin. it is a great place to see ice skating in November and December. Cute Christmas markets and it is set up really neat. Great place to grab a quick snack as well

A nice place to spend an afternoon. Right down the street from our hotel, I walked over before the rest of the family arrived and enjoyed perusing the shoppes and checking out the action on the skating rink. The lighting of the tree was scheduled for that evening and preparations were under way. I did not purchase anything, but enjoyed meandering around. A light rain was falling that diminished the crowd somewhat, but this is a nice place to get a taste for New York Pop-up park shopping!

Favorite park in city. It is not the biggest or the best per se, but this is a gem in NYC. A nice outlet from the concrete jungle. I like to go on a work break and sit on the grass looking at the tall buildings. Lots of activities going on around and great for people watching.
pit stop. Made a pit stop here on our way to our hotel and its a cute area. I would love to visit this around Christmas time, I hear that is a must in winter.
Great Christmas Markets. If you are in the mood for some ice skating or Christmas shopping i woudl definitely check this out.

Great views and great people watching. Behind a great NYC treasure, the main public library features wonderful views of the city and both New Yorkers and tourists bustling. Depending on the season many great activities and wonderful snacks available.

Worth a visit, especially in December!. My husband and I made a stop at Bryant Park in our recent NYC visit. It was the first time either of us had been and was easy to get to by subway. The Christmas Market they have set up is huge and filled with shops for everything from organic lotions to christmas ornaments to comfort food. We had a quick bite at the Wafels & Dinges booth, and loved it! Can't beat a warm waffle with tons of sugary toppings, even with the fall-like weather we've been having lately. We also went skating. While a little pricey (free admission but $19 per skate rental. Lockers are free if you bring your own lock. Lockers are small so I'd bring two locks depending on the size of your party. Locks were $9 to rent from them, I believe), it was a fun experience.
