I skate frequently so, compared to what I'm used to, the ice was pretty bad and beat up and it was too crowded to get much speed going, but that's not really the point of going. It's more about the memory with the people you're with and the experience. We went during the day but I bet it looks beautiful at night with the tree all lit up too! Definitely worth a visit. Another plus is that your visit could be anywhere from 15 minutes to 2 hours, all depending on you and what you want to do.

Great Anytime of the Year. Great place to relax in the summer. Read a book, play chess or just sit with a cup of coffee. During the Christmas holidays they have the winter village with ice skating, gift shoppes and food. It get's a little crowded, but worth at least a walk through. There are chairs and small tables to sit at. You can get a peak of the Empire State building from the park. Go to the Bryant Park Grill for an indoor restuarant.
Great atmosphere in the evenings. At this time of year with the decks up and the tree lit it's a lovely hub to spend the evening, although using the ice rink during the day is a lot quieter
Pretty grubby. Went to Bryant Park to see the ice rink which was good. Christmas market there when we went so lots of food on offer, but don't spend much time there

Magical. Went night before Thanksgiving, magical and even though the tree wasn't lit, the rest of the park had the lovely Christmas Market surrounding the icerink, with the trees around twinkling with the lights, and the smell of mulled wine, great

Great Place in the City. Bryant Park is a great little place in the city. They show movies in the park in the summer time. In the fall there are lots of unique shops set up with crafts, food and one of kind type stuff. There is also a skating rink in the winter. Neat to watch people playing chess and ping pong. There is a nice restaurant at the edge of the park that you can sit on the patio in the warmer month.

Beautiful park, great iceskating and beautiful tree. Wonderful place to visit for the holiday spirit. Food, ice skating, christmas tree. The craft fair this year was disappointing. Not the quality of crafts that have been on display in previous years.

Great day skating. Visited the Winter Festival at Bryant Park with my wife and two boys, 13 and 10. My 10 year old had never ice skated before. The park was crowded but not overwhelmingly so, especially considering the great weather and Christmas crowds. The rink was well run and the staff very helpful. Rentals and storage for our shoes was easy and relatively inexpensive. Admission to the rink is free. The ice was not too crowded and we had no problem teaching our son how to skate there. A much better experience than trying to skate at Rockefeller Center with the huge crowds. Many kiosk shops in the park for food, drinks, and Christmas gifts. Overall, a great set up and a must-do when visiting NYC over Christmas.

Great Sunday Morning . Very nice place to visit on a Sunday morning. Lots of great shops, foods and people watching to do there. They also had outdoor ice skating if that floats your boat. Short walk to the public library from there. So you can see several things at once.

Great atmosphere. We visit ever year and it always gets better. The shops have great gifts ad food, We went ice skating pay the fast pass its double the price but not wait. Always get the hot chocolate and Macaroons,, Spebt time at the bar in the restaraunt Below 32 I beleive that is the name.

Great fun with Christmas village!. We loved the little shops- good snack food. The kids skated- much nicer than Rock Center- I know blasphemy! Price was so much better- less than 1/2 of the price. This was a busy weekend and we were there in the middle of the afternoon so we opted for the "fast pass" skating option. Skates and no wait for $28. The other line was pretty long and think it was only $15 but we were on a tight schedule so opted to pay more for time management. This was for an unlimited time too. Could have spent more time there than we did.

Crowded but fun. We were there during the holiday so they had tents all over. Inside each tent was a business or some sort. It was very nice to walk around and see all the different shops in the tents. The tree in the middle was beautiful. They still had ice skating going on but we did not do it. Nice place. Very clean.

Shops at Bryant Park are unique. If you are looking to spend some time walking around, this is a great place to do it. The shops have unique gifts items as well as handcrafted jewelry and much more. There are ample choices for street food and in the winter the skating rink is a great attraction.

Hot Chocolate and watching the world go by.... Came here a few times on our holiday, both during the day and night. Free to skate here if you have your own skates but we were quite content to sit at the park and watch the world go by. Amazing hot chocolate was available near by and we even got some free cookies! Lovely holiday village there too selling all things Christmas related! A must see!

Lovely lively Park. Very nice park.It has always something to offer.Ice skating in Christmas time, catwalk during fashion week.You can enjoy a nice/quick meat in it.During summer time it is nice just to grab something to eat in the neiborghood and eat there.
Christmas Magic. There was a skating rink and Christmas market on when we visited, lovely little stalls, and the skating rink was very popular, well worth a visit,

LOVED IT!!. We loved Bryant Park. Very clean. It was fun looking through all of the little shops that were set up.....I'm assuming through the Christmas Season. Also, very enjoyable and relaxing to watch the ice-skating.

Beautiful outdoor market and ice rink!!. Enjoyed taking a stroll and seeing the many unique items (ornaments, lots of jewellery, sunglasses, recycled coin purses and wallets from waterproof material, soaps) so many hand crafted by locals. Bought a beautiful lamp made in Turkey from one of the vendors. They have a beautiful outdoor ice rink in the winter where you can rent skates. Many coffee and food shops. A section with tables to enjoy your coffee or relax and enjoy the scenery. If you're visiting New York City definitely a must see.

A totally NY experience. During the holidays, a gift shoppers delight. Small craft shops line the skating rink by over 100 shopping cubes with everything from crafted candy to crafted wood burl cutting board. If you have hours to spend looking for that special gift. Go there. Being a project runway fan.... The big tent made way for the big ice rink.. Slightly disappointed but not that much.
Love it at Christmas time. Great shops and good food. Love watching the ice rink with all of the skaters. The tree was lovely. Great place to pick up unique gifts for Christmas.

Ice-skating!. I worked next to the park for a few months. It is a wonderful place to take your lunch when the weather is good. In the winter, there are dozens of stalls and a great ice skating rink. A lovely break from all the concrete!
Christmas shoos. Love this time of year at Bryant park w/ the Christmas shops and the ice skating...does get very crowded but a must see. Just the smells and the atmosphere are worth the visit.

Lovely outdoor market!. What a pleasant surprise to see so many vendors! There are so many things to look at, and the weather cooperated the day we were there. The ice skaters looked like they were enjoying themselves, and we shopped till we dropped!
Great time if year. This is a great time to visit NYC. Bryant park located in mid town has to offer holiday booths and skating arena.

Surprised. I was surprised to see that the small shops selling souvenirs etc all seemed to be selling very cheap articles made in the third world. Even more pricey options were still made in China, Taiwan and Bangladesh. Come on USA, if you are going to highlight your culture, do it with homemade articles. I would be willing to pay for articles made in the USA, but not "tat" made abroad. I could find that in any dollar store
Christmas in the Park. Perfect Day to watch peopleSo glad my skating days are overGreat booths selling interestingItemsA great way to spend 2 hours

Big fun on ice rink. I had to go to NY to remember how big fun can make me ice skating. Great place, nice surroudings, Big fun for all of us.Watchful and helpful staff. Many children and adults which start with their on-ice adventure.

Skating . Such a great way to spend a few hours outdoors. Bryant park is a lovely place with lots of shops and a great outdoor rink. The line looked long to get in, but no more than 20 mins and well worthwhile.

Christmas Markets. The array of little shops are so different and vibrant I can't recommend it enough if you are there or planning a trip before Christmas check it out some really beautiful gifts available
Christmas Markets. great atmosphere ice rink open and markets are great if you're looking something a bit more different
One of my favorite spots. Beautifully reconstructed little park. I will be back and will make sure to have al fresco lunch, read a book for a while and just observe the life around.

An unexpected little haven in the city.. Not realising Bryant Park existed, it was wonderful to come across it by happy accident following our visit to Grand Central Terminal. The park atmosphere is enhanced by a little carousel, a skating rink and lovely, artisan style stalls. You can sit and relax and watch the world go by in the little oasis in a busy city.
Fun at Christmas. Love the Bryant Park pop up stores and watching the skaters. Second only tomRockefeller Center. Wouldn't miss them on my annual holiday visit.
Just pass by. You can go ice skating. Crowded and food booths are horrible. See it on tour bus but don't waste your time

Lovely park . A smaller of the NYC parks. Has a lovely festive feel with the ice skating rink and lines are significantly shorter than Central Park ect! The xmas market is great for gifts and getting into the xmas spirit

Beautiful and bustling at the holidays. We stayed right by Bryant Park in December. It was full of cute shops and little places to get a snack. Loved the holiday decor. Puts you right in the Christmas spirit!
My favorite place to visit. We come here every year! Love it. Absolutely beautiful. Very crowded but that is the only draw back.
Bryant Park. was a nice place yo chill and people watch.my friend and I just got some coffee and rested here after some shopping...nice energy lovely people and friendly.

Skate Skate and enjoy.. Fabulous spot. You can skate or watch others. From one corner you can see the Empire State Building all beautiful lit up as you sit and enjoy a beverage. There are markets stalls full of things to buy and eat. We walked though at dusk and then came in time for a late dinner at Celcius where we sat and had dinner and under heaters and watched the skaters play.

Small Park...but great place!!. Bryant Park, to me it's like a "Plaza", it's small...but great place...all year around. In Christmas you have a ice skating and little shops to sale of different kinds of items...including pastries and hot drinks. During the Summer...you can enjoy FREE movies weekly, mid-day concerts..all Free. They have little tables with chair, free, you can just sit and relax, or buy something to eat enjoy while sitting...next to it, you have the magnificent NYC Public Library ...where you can visit too. Please note there is a very clean public restrooms there...this is handy to know, because you don't find public restroom in NY easily. Come to Bryant Park when you visit NYC...!! Great place.

Ice skating in Bryant Park. My grand daughters loved the ice skating in Bryant Park. Due to unseasonably warm weather, the rinks in Rockefeller Center and Central Park were not opened so it was nice to have Bryant Park ice skating available.

Three Cheers for Cheer. Bryant Park's major December attraction is, of course, the Christmas market.To enjoy it well, you will need 1-2 hours so that you can see the attractions at leisure and work your way around the lines of visitors also weaving their way in and out of the narrow passages between the booths. The venue also has places to sit to enjoy something to eat and drink or just to sit and enjoy the sights. The handcrafts on display represent an impressive variety of crafts, and each booth exudes exuberant holiday cheer, even for those who do not celebrate Christmas. The ice rink also offers its own attraction, either for those who would like to skate or for those who just like to watch the skaters. Late in the afternoon shortly before dusk I find the market particularly attractive with the lights increasing in intensity--although not too much--as the evening advances. Bryant Park also has another advantage in its location because of its proximity to famous department store window displays on Fifth Avenue. Not to miss are those at Lord and Taylor on 39th Street and then advancing to Saks Fifth Avenue directly across from Rockefeller Center at 50th Street with its famous tree and esplanade of musical angels, also especially beautiful by night-light.

A great Christmas Venue. Very nice venue for the Holidays, many merchants and Ice Rink
A nice place to visit, shop have an espresso

We Never Miss This Place. We visit NYC every year between Thanksgiving and Christmas. Bryant Park is always on our list of places to spend time regardless of the weather. This year it was 'dripping rain.' Head to the corner with the little outdoor restaurant with the fire pits. A little disappointing that they don't use real wood anymore. The smell of 'fuel' is a little overwhelming. Propane heaters help beat the chill in the air. Every type of gift can be found here from personalized ornaments to bamboo clothing. Allocate about two+ hours and enjoy the sights and sounds of Bryant Park.

Wow what a park 😃🎄🎅🇺🇸. We were walking round NY & found the park by chance one evening, it felt vey festive with the stalls selling all sorts of gifts, the big christmas tree looked lovely in front of the ice rink. The hot mulled cider was good too whilst walking round.Highly recommend a visit if your in NY

Holiday Stop. Bryant Park is great to visit all year round but Christmas time is very special. The decorations are beautiful, lots of shopping, music, food vendors and ice skating. If you dont skate, its fun just to hang out with the music playing and watch. All the food I've ever tried there was good.Wide variety of shops.

Bryant Park for Christmas!. We strolled around Bryant Park one night while in NYC. The pop-up shops were set up for Christmas and we were even able to find a few gifts. It's much bigger than I thought it would be, and the ice skating rink added so much to the Christmas shoppiing experience.

My Favorite Place in NY. At Christmas, this place is magical. I love the little shops and people watching. The hot chocolate is amazing, the Christmas music and decorated tree make the atmosphere magical. Watching families enjoy time together on the ice brings a smile to your face.
Great shoping. The Christmas booth at the park are pretty unique and fun. Great shopping for small gifts. The park is decorated for Christmas including ice skating for free!

Christmas in NYC. Nice day with friends in NYC at Bryant Park. Multiple vendors for shopping and buying Christmas gifts. Food available and crowds not bad...walkable without feeling claustrophobic!Christmas tree was beautiful!
Christmas time. The Christmas tree and the ice skating are very nice. Lots of little small Christmas huts with sales of goods and a wonderful Christmas spirit.
Christmas Markets!. Everyone should go check them out now! Its a great place to take a date for a late night stroll and maybe pick up a holiday gift together!

Happy Holidays. The park had an ice rink which attracted a lot of people. Surrounding the rink were many novelty shops with a lot of them selling Christmas items. You could also get a hot or cold drink as well as food. Very atmospheric at this time of year.

Amazing at Thanksgiving and Christmas time. We visited here a few times on our Thanksgiving holiday. The place is transformed into a winter wonderland. Big tree, Christmas market, ice skating and a great indoor / outdoor bar and restaurant. Worth a visit.
Christmas is great. In December there is nothing nicer than spending time at Bryant Park, either skating or just watching the addition of pop up Christmas shops makes a visit a must

beautiful. Bryant Park is a lovely place to visit while in NYC. it has a lovely range of little wooden huts selling all sorts of paraphenalia, ranging from handcrafted toys, to NYC christmas decorations. you can buy lovely mulled wine and churros, and relax beside the christmas tree while watching the skaters go by on the ice rink. gorgeous to visit.

Holiday Market. Beautiful park. Holiday Market is cute with glass buildings, ice skating. We expected market items to be handmade but a lot of stuff we saw was imported. Worth a visit but if you really want locally made artisan stuff I would suggest the Columbus Circle holiday market at Central Park. Way better. The Bryant Park Grill is beautiful but we didn't get to check it out since it was closed for a private event.

A must stop when in NYC. It's the holidays in NY and Bryant park is fully in the spirt with their shopping village even selling hot apple cider and everything else you can think of. The skating rink is set up and there is even a party venue that I had never seen before.
Rollover the holidays in the park. Great restaurants and great holidays in the park vendors with ice skating. Free!!! If you have your own skates. Otherwise 15.00 to rent.
Bryant Park. Nice place to spend sometime watching the ice skaters and shopping at the little shops that surround the rink.

Must go now. the park is a must to see anytime but in the winter with all the shops and the ice skating ring is a bonus. Some of the shops have locals and other stuff is overseas made :(. BUT a must see while in NYC
Never dull. We enjoyed the shops, decoration, ice skating and atmosphere. As well as the coffee, which was not price-gougey.

Love it!. Beautiful. Especially during the holidays. The rink is great and not as packed as Rockefeller. The shops are cute and small so be ready for crowds. Great spot for people watching and getting a feel for the magic of the city during the holidays.
Christmas Village at Bryant Park. Bryant Park is always a great place to visit. But at the holidays the Christmas Village opens and offers unique holiday merchandise for sale.

Christmas Spirits. We were here the first week of December. The skating rink was busy as well as restaurants and party tents. The tree was grand and it was fun to explore the Christmas booths selling everything from small gifts to hot drinks and foods.

Picturesque. My mom and I spent a Sunday morning at Bryant Park to shop, see the Christmas tree, and watch the ice skaters. With the city skyline all around and the festive Christmas music playing, it really felt like a scene out of a movie! We had a fantastic time and loved browsing all of the stalls for Christmas gifts. We also had the most amazing hot chocolate with a truffle in the bottom and bought some macarons for our train ride home. We didn't actually skate this time, but my mom has before, and she definitely enjoyed it. It was an easy walk from Times Square, with a subway station located right there at the park. We spent several hours here and weren't bored at all - definitely a great morning or afternoon activity! I would highly recommend visiting Bryant Park!

Wedding Venue Scene. Bryan Park was the "photo" shoot setting for my Neice's wedding this summary. The bride and groom meandered through the park and staged about photos with the family and wedding party in about 8 locations. The park is quite charming and great photo back drop. The wedding and reception was held in the 2nd floor venue space in We-Work building adjacent to the park.

wonderful alternative. An awesome place to go when you want to go to NYC for the holidays without the craziness of Times Square. The winter Village is great for shopping (little shops), Christmas tree, ice skating, dining or snacks.
My favorite park in NYC next to Central Park. Smaller park. Great to visit in December because of the open air vendors and ice skating rink. The outdoor tree is so exceptionally pretty.
Super park. Great with winter village, lots to do, presents to be bought, ice skating, food and the lovely Christmas tree

Free, clean bathrooms!. Always worth a walk around, any time of the year. The library, the grounds, the statues, all of it. Listen to the free podcast walking tour narrated by Matthew Broderick. Take in the free wi-fi. Grab a coffee and a sandwich. Sit on a little green chair and watch people.
Christmas market one evening. We stumbled across the christmas market at Brrryant Park on our visit It was fun. The park is a gorgeous space in the summer, too.
Way Different Than It Used To Be!!!!!. Lots of shops and fun watching the ice skaters at Christmastime. Good place to take a break when sightseeing in the area.

Fun day at the park. Great visit. Loved the ice skating and all the shops. We not only visited the park and the shops but enjoyed touring the NYC public library next door. Great location for family fun!

Perfect at any time of year. From ice skating at Winter time to pilates/ juggling classes in the Summer, Bryant Park is an oasis amongst concrete and glass of ManhattanWhether you are a people watcher or an activist, this place will have something for everyoneIt's not a park, so don't be confused by the name, but it's one of the rare open spaces available and attracts people like a magnet- you'll love it

Better Ice-skating than Rockefeller. The park is quaint and the ice-skating area looks bigger than Rockefeller. There's many cute and quaint pop-up shops during the winter. This is a gem in the middle of Mid-town!

Great visit at Chrismas. Went to watch the ice skating against the background of a large Christmas Tree and the New York skyscrapers. We returned in the evening when it is possible to see the Chrysler and Empire State Buildings lit up.There is also a large Christmas Market with local artisans selling their crafts. Took us quite a while to go around. Plenty of food outlets to take a break.Whilst it is in the centre of Manhattan, it was not too busy on the weekend and we found a seat to soak in the atmosphere.Nice place to spend an hour or more.
Not only Central Park... Nice, park in town that means you don't have to go all the way to Central Park to get nice views and relax.
Beautiful location for ice skating, dining and shopping. Free skating rink (you only pay for skate rental) very pretty park with tables to sit and enjoy food and the view.

Christmas market - very crowded. We decided to visit Bryant Park as there is a Christmas market. It was rather overcrowded so we had a quick look around and decided we had had enough. We didn't see that much in the way of Christmas decorations although they did have some arts and crafts.

Love it but too crowded!!. Visiting NYC during December is our favorite time and visiting the shops around Bryant Park is a must. However, this year it was very crowded...shoulder to shoulder. The experience was not pleasant and hard to take in the tree, the skating rink and the surroundings due to the crowds. As for the shops, you will find the same ones near the west side of Central Park and it was not as crowded.

relaxing place in the centre of the vibrant city. as captioned. i was very tired because of too much walking too many blocks(did not want to miss anything). the park was small but quite and relaxing. had a great time there regaining my energy. apparently, there are many events held here too. hope next time, i will be in town for one of those.
So much fun!!. Great activities and winter things to do. We had a great time - wonderful ice skating area for families.

Fun place to visit for the holidays.. It's always delightful to visit the holiday markets in New York and this year was no exception. It did seem as if there were more food stalls than last year which is great for some but not so much for people heading for lunch such as ourselves.Merchandise stalls thinner as a result and it was a shame not to be able to view the skaters on account of the bubble - probably because of the mild weather.

Holiday Market and Skating was a fun time. Really good quality gift items at this Holiday Market. Roasting chestnuts and hot mulled cider added to the festive environment. Pretty lights, a lovely tree and a skating rink that appeared larger or at least the same size as Rockefeller Center.
Must visit. The atmosphere in this park is electric!Massive Christmas tree, Christmas market and an ice rink make it all the place to be
Christmas Market and Ice Skating. Lots of different, quirky stalls. Well worth a visit. Good place to have a drink and watch the ice skaters.

Christmas Markets. What would Christmas in New York City be without a walk through the Christmas Markets in Bryant Park. How festive, with a combination of gifts, smells and tastes from around the world. C'est bon.
Lots to do.. We visited in November and there was ice skateing, lots of fun. Great little shops throughout the park. Great little oasis in the city

Fun place to visit in December. I have never been to Bryant Park outside of December, but this month is a fun one to visit. There are tons of little shops to buy gifts, a few food stands (& one in the middle at which you can buy & drink adult beverages) and free ice skating.
Cool skate park!. A cool gem in the city, take a break from shopping and go skating! Skating is free - you might have to pay to rent skates - if you dont bring your own.

A winter wonderland. My first evening in New York took me here. The skating rink in a square edged with autumnal trees is very attractive especially in Thanksgiving week with a huge brilliantly lit Christmas tree and a village of rustic wooden shops selling a pleasing variety of craft work,souvenirs and food options.
Xmas Market & Skating. A lovely rink and a great range of little shops for the Christmas market, the tree here is also beautiful and the market feels very safe with police around at all times.
Not so good. Not as good as last year. Less all fresco. No mulled wine at the side of the ice rink. Ambience not as good as before.
Beautiful not too crowded . Lovely views, beautiful park. Beautifully decorated at Christmas and ice rink. Lovely little stalls. Not as crazy busy as other places in NYC.

Lovely all times of the year, but especially holiday time. This is such a lovely park at all times of the year but really blossoms at holiday time. The market surrounds the rink in the middle and is filled with lovely NYC based businesses displaying their best items for people to buy. There is a large array of different shops with lovely business owners and workers inviting you to come see everything. There is also a sampling of different NYC based restaurants. An enormous decorated christmas tree sits next to the rink. The skating is free, but you have to pay for skate rental (or bring your own!). Because it is free, is tends to be pretty packed. This is such a lovely place to visit to get yourself in the holiday spirit!

Lovely park during Christmas time. What a gem in New York city. I absolutely recommend visiting this park instead of going to the boring rockafeller center... You have nice little cozy shop all around the park, the skating rink is in a much better condition and its way cheaper to skate! You have beautiful views of the skyscraper all around you also. It is a very nice place to enjoy during the holidays. Its a must!!

Shops, Shops, and Shops. And ice skating. Bryant Park is a lively center of activity with several places to get various trinkets, items, and food as long as you're not too late getting there. There are plenty of people watching opportunities, and you could certainly spend some time wandering around and window shopping.

Park in the middle of the city. I have visited Bryant Park so many times it has become a landmark on my itinerary. First of all, it was beside the public library. I left my daughter at the library for an hour while I walked to Grand Central Terminal. Second, it was a stop for most of the tour buses (we purchased OPEN LOOP bus tour from groupon, really good deal!). And third, the park was across the famous mille crepe cake shop Lady M (everybody loved their green tea mille crepe cake..except for me). Lucky for us, was able to try their yoga in the park activity which was sponsored by athleta. Didnt even have to bring my yoga mat, altheta provided the mats.Before I forget, there's a clean public toilet near the library.

Cruise 42nd Street and check out at Bryant Park on the way!. 43nd Street is one of my favourite walks in NYC, so much to see and you feel full of the New York vibe here. Along the way you can stop off at Bryant Park for food/drinks or ice skating in the winter time!

Nice surprise . Walked upon this marvellous find by accident. Cute park turned into a winter market with ice rink. Stopped for hot drink and bite to eat from one of the stalls. You could spend while perusing the vendors stalls. Well worth planned visit if in the area.

My favorite stop. My husband and I go to NY every year and Bryant Park is my favorite stop. We typically go in the wintertime and walk around while enjoying the hot chocolate they sell. We watch the skaters, do some shopping and enjoy people watching. It isn't a NY trip without going to Bryant Park.
Great place to people watch. This is a piece of green in the middle of a hectic city. Great people watching spot. Fun to take a coffee and just relax.
Great little park - cute little shops. Visited this afternoon and found the park to be very cute. Loved looking at all the little shops and watching the people ice skating.

Shopping break. It's a great time around Christmas,plenty of stalls with Christmas things ,plenty of food stalls,also open ice ring,also some lovely cafes and bakeries all around,a must to see,especially at christmas

Buzzing!!!!!!⛸. Visited last week. This park is a great place to fill a few hours. Ice Skating, bars, food and loads of stalls selling goods that you don't normally see.
Well worth a visit, especially in December.

Awesome place to skate and do some shopping. Bryant Park was wonderful even in the rain. Lots of shops with off the wall stuff. We picked up a Christmas tree ornament and had our na,Es added to it while we waited. There is a cell phone charging station in the park near the coffee shed. Beautiful fountain and the tree was nice. Skating is cheaper then Rockefeller Center and it was spacious.
No Crowds. Great place to ice skate without the crowds of Rock Center. They also had a very nice tree set up and plenty of places to eat and shop.

Fabulous Xmas market. The Xmas market in Bryant Park has some beautiful unique gifts. The decoration stalls are out of this world and there was a soy candle store which sold the most beautifully fragranced candles I've ever smelt! Worth a visit.

Pleasant surprise during the holiday season. We drove by the park at night on our way from the airport to our hotel and it looked adorable. We went back and it has huge ice skating rink, little shops and food stands. I highly recommend visiting this at night. We walked here after viewing Rockefeller Center.

An oasis of excitement in the middle of Manhattan. My wife and I have to visit this park every time we go to NYC. It is a vibrant part of the city regardless of the time of year. Thanksgiving and Christmas time are very exciting because of the small shops, what they have to offer, and the ice skating. We always do some of our Christmas shopping here for the family because of the uniques stores.
Christmas Booths. This year when we went to Bryant Park it was filled with a collection of arts and crafts. It was very croweded this year but there were some good items for Christmas shoppers.

A mini winter wonderland. Love the set up at Bryant Park. Didn't Ice skate as not our bag but spent a while mooching around the winter stalls and enjoying the mulled cider. Bought back a beautiful watercolour of the NYC skyline too
Morning visit on the way to the Library.. Lots of shops with handmade crafts, beautiful Christmas tree - but it wasn't lit yet and ice skating.... fun area.
Wonderful in December!. The park had an ice skating rink with inexpensive rentals, Christmas craft booths, seating areas, food vendors, lighted trees.

This place has it all.. We visited this Park on a Sunday, and we first went to the Restaurant there, the food was very good, the service was good, and it was a very pleasant environment all around. The vendor kioks in the park selll MANY different things, mostly artisan types, not the Tshirt kinds of things. Handcrafted items of wood, paper, etc., glass, you name it. The vendors almost exclusively have unique items not sold in another of the kiosks. We had a great time, and bought items thee to take with us on our 2000 mile trip home..
Watching the Ice Skaters. Lovely setting watching the Ice Skaters it was well organised plenty of ice skating staff on the ball

Girls' weekend in NYC. What a neat place to visit. All of the little shops around the edge of the skating rink were fun to browse through. Good hot spiced cider!!! Unique gifts. Place families can enjoy together. Ice skating rink very nice and safe for all ages. Lovely Christmas decorations.

Lovely little park. Wandered through here whilst in NY and it's lovely and quaint!Ice skating rink in the centre was beautiful with a high Christmas tree behind.Loads of wooden stalls selling beautiful gifts and presents.

Great way to spend a sunny winter day outside. The outdoor ice rink, the music, the Christmas markets, the food booths, the Christmas décor all helps to get everyone in the Christmas spirit. Lots of seats for people to sit and enjoy the ambiance around them.

Great in the evening walking around the shops. What a lovely park, great for skating and has the Christmas spirit in abundance. An excellent area for just walking around the Christmas shops and having a mulled wine. Just a short walk from the main area but well worth a look.

Christmas market and ice skating. Bryant Park has been decorated for christmas and features a small christmas market with lots of various booths. They also have an ice skating rink that is a lot less crowdy than the one at rockefeller center.
Holiday skating and shops are freat. We enjoyed ice skating and shopping during the Christmas season here. Lots of really unique shops. The ice skating rink was large and not too crowded.

Visiting during Thanksgiving weekends--enjoy the shops. There are many small shops setup during the Holidays. The ice rink is open if you want to skate. There are many nice things to see and eat. Worth an hour or more and nice break.

Tourists Everywhere. But still the best possible outcome.. Great park at all times of year. I walk though almost daily and have seen Shakespeare plays here, gone to the winter markets, watched the jugglers, read the paper from the free library, and met many friends! It is usually busy, with winter brining out the ice rink and summer brining out the grass, but it is still worth a wander through.

Christmas in the park. This holiday market is very well done. Such a variety of quality things from around the world and local. You can spend all day visiting the vendors. They have a sit down restaurant but we decided on having the crepes from a stand. Plenty of tables to sit at while eating which I appreciated. They apparently have this throughout November and December. I wonder what they have there the rest of the time. And it said that it's the only free place to ice skate in the City. Of course if you don't have your own skates you have to rent some.

At Holiday time Bryant Park is transformed into a Holiday Mart. In addition to the ice skating rink, you can sample all sorts of items from various craft and food vendors. This is my fourth time taking it in and I was disappointed to not see some of my favorite vendors from previous years. There are still many hand crafted items. There is also the nearby fair within Grand Central Station, that I didn't have the time to take in this visit.

Crafts and food vendors abound!. There was skating and little independent vendor booths. Fun to explore with a cup of coffee. I went on a rainy Tuesday morning just as the shops were opening. Perfectly nice to enjoy alone or with friends.

Christmas in NYC. Visited this in November and December day and evening. It's a little oasis in a bustling city. We were there for the start of the 'Holidays' and had a very warm November day where we had a picnic having bought various foods from the holiday market there. Good choice of foods with vegetarian and organic food and drink available. The ice rink was in full swing and it's cheaper than the Rockerfeller rink - free if you bring your own skates. Bryant Park had a lovely atmosphere and lots of locals use it too which I think is a good sign. We now understand the American term 'Happy Holidays' as it incorporates Thanksgiving to New Year and various religious festival in between. Well worth a visit.

Like any other similar park . Bryant Park was a fun, easy place to visit. It's like any other similar park really, with friendly home-made type things for sale and friendly locals to chat with. Great if you want to get the local take on the art scene.
Nice gem which does not attract the major yourist. Always try to come here at Christmas. Great little Christmas market, great restaurants in the area, very nice ambience
A must. Skating, shops, lovely decoration - it was all at Bryant Park - the tree was beautiful and the stalls had amazing different products. Well worth a visit
I'm a local and it's one of my favorites NYC spots . Charming and always something fun going on. Free wifi. Carousel , food , coffee. Depending on the season it goes from ice rink to a large lawn

BYO. the markets are really nice but very overpriced, the ice skating rink also is a lot cheaper than the Rockefeller centre however the skates were so dodgy so bring your own if you have them! they also make you hire a locker like it's compulsory, you aren't allowed to leave your shoes on a bench inside or with someone who wasn't skating which was annoying. Not only do you have to rent a locker but if you don't bring your own padlock then you have to buy one or you can't use the locker, so there's a few extra hidden costs which they don't tell you about until you get in there. It cost me about $40 to go ice skating which was a rip off but at least it got ticked off my list right? The rink was decent, nowhere near as crowded as Rockefeller centre and the Christmas tree in Bryant park was really amazing.

Has come up . This park has come a long way. Under DiBlasio I'm certain it will go back to the crime & drug ridden place it was previously, but get in there while you can. Nice place for lunch & drinks. Way better than the sewer it was before Guliani

Christmas Market. The Christmas Market remains one of mine and my husbands favorite traditions with the shopping, little pop up restaurants and ice skating rink...it is what you dream of when you think of NYC at Christmas. Best of all it does not have the crowds of Rockefeller Center. We come here every time we visit NYC over the holidays.

Holiday fun . During Christmas time this can get very crowded. I think the layout of the shops could be better to help with the flow of foot traffic but they have a beautiful tree in display if you want something a little less busy than Rockefeller center.

Always a treat to get you into the Christmas spirit. If you're considering ice skating at Rockefeller, fuhgetabout it and visit Bryant Park instead. Lovely little shops, great food and drink and a beautiful setting. It will be busy, but not like the crazy crowds at Rockefeller.

Great place during the holidays. Bryant Park during the holidays is a great place to visit! It is not as crowded as Rockerfeller Center or around that area, and it offers great shops to find unique gifts. The ice skating rink looked like fun (I didn't try it), and the tree, although not as big as the one at Rockerfeller Center, was still magical. With many shops and food options, it is a great place to spend a couple hours.
Great winter wonderland. We were lucky to see Bryant Park in full Christmas dress . Tree Stalls & skating rink. Great atmosphereLoved by kids & adults alikeStall were great but pricey

Good Christmas Market Fun but badly organized. Bryant Park looks GREAT but definitely falls short of being well-organized. It is in reality chaotic. Easily solved with a few coordinators to allow a flow a bit. The people are nice the vendors sre varied & their prices are fair and the scene is festive though. An ice rink in the middle of the city is enchanting. Christmas music joyfully playing. Organize it a bit and more fun it shall be for the masses.

Christmas market. Lovely little haven in the middle of the skyscrapers. Watching ice skating, listening to Christmas songs, wonderful food smells and gorgeous things to buy from the stalls. Really put me in the holiday mood!! Bought some quite expensive Christmas tree decorations. Then went to Macy's and got some real bargains there!

Very Quaint. Wasting time before our show off-Broadway we went to Bryant Park and strolled through the little holiday shops and markets. In my opinion the Christmas tree in Bryant Park is so much prettier than the over-hyped one in Rockefeller Center.

Vendor Delight. We visited on Friday, December 4th, 2015 evening. Clean & well lit park. 125 vendors selling all kinds of trinkets and hard to find items, but pricey. There was a great cookie shop on sight. Skating rink in the middle of park with an extremely long line. Didn't see a public bathroom. We enjoyed a stroll around. It took 45 minutes. Nice Christmas lighting.

Amazing little Park. Our visit coincided with Bryant Park being turned into a mini winter wonderland with ice rink and lots of little Christmas Market shops.Wonderful atmosphere....wonderful park.Loved it

Fun stop!. When we stopped at Bryant Park the first time, it was raining...so we didn't really stay long. But we did stop back later in the week to wander through the holiday shops and watch the skaters for a little bit. You have to try the chimney cakes - we had ours filled with peanut butter and it was SO yummy!! We hadn't ever heard of them before - but glad we stopped to try them.

Lovely place to visit and near the library. There was a christmas village when we visited and skating rink and tree which was very pretty and lots of stalls selling gifts, food etc. Worthy of a visit and also near the library.

Christmas!. We stumbled onto this on the way to the Top of the Rock! the Christmas market was open and this was really fun with lots of options! Had some great hot chocolate! The ice skating was open here also! Definitely worth a visit!

Fun day at the Park. Bryant Park is a great time to enjoy with family and friends. I had family day there. The kids enjoyed ice skating while I enjoyed some delicious food that was set up around the park. Highly recommended.

Lovely at Christmas!. It is much smaller than I imagined it so the walk around is quite easy. They have street vendors little shops but not great food areas. The skating rink is lovely and great to see people enjoying it. Nice little visit you can go around in around an hour.

'Tis the season to Visit. The small vendors are already in the park. Ice skating for the price of the skates rentals. If you got your own, bring them.Local artisans:jewelry and knitted accessories. Food: Rughalah, Colombian empanandas, waffles with the smell of hot chocolate and sweet pastries will drive you in to the park, Turkish, and gluten free snack.
Holiday shops. Nice little park with shops to fill out your christmas stockings. Ice skating an option but it seemed quite busy. Local restaurants available.
Loved the Chirstmas village. I have been to NYC in the fall and Summer but the winter carnival in this park was a lot of fun. They have so many artist to see and local food fare too.

Nice Park In Winter. It was nice to see the ice skaters on our recent visit. They'd also got stalls selling all sorts of gifts. It's all very Christmassy. Plus, you get a good view of the Empire State Building. They have toilets too.

Fun, Festive & Free!. A beautiful park behind the NY Library (which is also interesting to visit. In Bryant Park, there are two nice restaurants which abut the back of the Library. Additionally, there are numerous boutiques and coffee kiosks. Enjoy the shops, skating (winter), sun bathing (summer) and eating (any time). There are numerous chairs to use as you people watch or sip your lattes. The atmosphere and ambience are very European. It reminds me of many of the parks in Paris. Wonderful way to take a brief time-out from the normal fast pace of NYC.
Visit. We went when the rink was up and little xmas shopping outlets dotted around. The tree was out up 2 days after just before the Rockefeller one.
Lovely at Xmas. Quite magical in the middle of New York.Excellent ice rink ,and a good range of individual Xmas themed stalls.Well worth a visit.

Beautiful Christmas Tree and holiday markets and ice skating too!!!. Walked through Bryant Park on December 2, 2015 to see the holiday markets and the beautiful tree. Although it was an off and on again rainy day, there were a few ice skaters there on the pond made up just for the holidays. Very enjoyable!!!

Fun Christmas Market. We visited the market the day before Thanksgiving. We were lucky because the weather was awesome. There were a wide variety of shops. Some unique items that I had not seen before. Really a great place to spend an afternoon in a very nice park atmosphere.
best in winter. Nice walk around the rink, good for photographs, tried my hand at skating, not very good at it so i stuck to Togging
Nice Christmas Village. Easy access from Times Square with fun Christmas Village for Shopping. Many different hand made and unique items.
Loved Bryant Park Winter Village. A truly relaxing place in the middle of such a big city. We visited the Winter Village and the ice rink and really enjoyed our time there.

Great all year long, but magical at Christmas!. Bryant Park is still a very busy area, especially during the holidays but it isn't quite the craziness of the Rockefeller area. There are wonderful holiday vendors set up throughout the park, along with an ice rink added in the winter. Great place to take a break, get a bite to eat and enjoy the holiday crowd while gazing up at the Empire State Building.

Winter fest is enchanting. We were there mid November in the evening after visiting the library. There were several booths set up like a charming European Christmas market and a beautiful skating rink in the center and music playing. Just lovely!!!
A lively park. Skating ground and dozens of arts- and Crafts shops. A nice break from the buzzelings streets. Recommended!

Lovely Christmas atmosphere. We went to Bryant Park while the Christmas market and Ice Rink were there. It had a nice relaxed Christmas atmosphere. We didn't skate as we didn't have time but everyone looked like they were enjoying themselves on the rink.
Fantastic. what a great place to spend a winter evening,ice rink open with a good crowd surrounded by a christmas market with a lot of very interesting stalls, really enjoyable time
Fun fun fun. I love Bryant park throughout the year. During summer it's way fun to lay on the sun and watch free concerts. During winter you can ice skate or just walk between the stands.

Holiday dazzle and ice for Christmas. Spending time browsing the holiday shops, watching the humanity on the ice rink, or downing rich hot chocolate is a perfect way to take in Christmas in New York. The Holiday Market at Bryant Park is worth the walk!

Holiday Market to enhance your NYC Christmas Experience. We spent Saturday, November 28, visiting the Holiday Markets in Union Square, Grand Central Station and Bryant Park. Unfortunately, Columbus Circle's Holiday Market didn't open until Tuesday, December 1. Of the markets we visited, I must say that Bryant Park is by far my favorite. Maybe because I have visited it before, maybe because the layout feels a little less congested than Union Square, maybe because it is not as expensive as Grand Central Station, maybe because it has a nice eclectic selection of shops, or maybe because it has the skating ring, but whatever the reason, I came away feeling much more festive and ready for Christmas. Even with the light rain, the sights, the smells, and the sounds all left me with a greater anticipation for the holiday season. Great place to "window shop" and find "one-of-a-kind" gifts/stocking stuffers.

Little Oasis in city. This park had loads to offer, a lovely place to relax after a busy day, to recharge and then start all over again.Outdoor reading library, table tennis, mobile recharging point, And special events throughout the season.

Husbands 50th birthday treat . We visited at night, absolutely romantic little Park with ice rink. Lovely little craft stalls selling everything from food to little gifts. Nice outside areas with sofas and heaters to allow you to sit and people watch

Not what I expected. More of a crowded fair than a city park.. We were there at Thanksgiving.
I expected a pretty park but it was a crowded collection of tents, selling all sorts of items, with many people milling around. It had the feeling of a very crowded flea-market.

Multipurpose, fun, all attractive park. Whether you are there in the summer (with LOTS OF great nightly events from movies, yoga night, live music, public opera, plays, etc.) or during the winter... (to just sit down, or ice-skate, or have a hot coffee / chocolate)... this is a GREAT cheap, affordable, fun place to be.Romantic, quiet, with a great skyline views of Bank of America, HBO, MetLife building, Empire State building, etc. etc. JUST SPLENDID, fun, and cheap !!

First glimpse of Christmas in NY. We visited in mid Nov so Christmas decorations weren't really on show but Bryant Park made up for it. Only a short walk from Times Sq but so different. There is an ice skating rink surrounded by small chalets/winter houses each containing a different shop. They were all decorated for Christmas which was beautiful in the evening. Some really good small independent retailers plus some food vendors. A lovely place to make you feel Christmassy, loved it.
Charming. It's a place to see all people, to eat a wonderful waffle of Dulce de Leche or Nutella!Nice to take pictures and to enjoy NYC.
Fun for a bit. If you skate its good I suppose.Now the Christmas shops are open its nice nothing earth shattering but worth looking around.
Christmas market, ice skating, nice to sit and relax. We shopped in the Christmas market, enjoyed watching the ice skaters and sitting a while to rest our feet. Very festive

Glitters Even in the Rain. NYC this time of year is just lovely with holiday decor and this park is one place with a beautiful tree and a lively Christmas market filled with a wide range of interesting things from soaps to scarves to jewelry to baskets and hats and more. Fun to walk around, even in the rain, and see a bit of what's happening early December in the Big Apple.

Ice skating and warm apple cider. I love Bryant Park, went nearly every evening for a week. The atmosphere is great and it's in the middle of everything, really stunning place to be this time of year! The small shops and bar are not cheap but that's expected at these kind of festive markets and it didn't stop my wife walking away with a bag or two each time!
A Small Haven in the Middle of NYC. I recently visited the holiday market in Bryant Park with friends. The park is lovely and well kept. It was my second visit there and I plan to return every visit.

Lots of tiny interesting shops. We went there during the end of November where they had set up an ice skating rink surrounded by lots of tiny shops. The shops sold lots of unique hand crafted items, which made them the perfect place for Christmas shopping and trying out new things. The atmosphere was great, with lots of good food and drinks and everyone having fun on the ice.

A Happening Place. Our cousin's granddaughter LOVED skating at the park and the kiosks had lots of interesting items for sale. [I remember when Bryant Park was drug infested, so it's wonderful to see it regenerated and flourishing. A fun time was had by all!

Awesome Christmas markets. Awesome Christmas markets with ice skating lots of gifts to buy and food and drink options.
Well worth a visit to get the Christmas spirit going

Winter wonderful!. We live just a couple hours away in PA. Knowing this great place is so close is like having a treasure chest in the attic! Loved the concentration of diverse shopping, food kiosks and skating. The lights of NYC at night, breathtaking. This trip will now be a new Christmas time tradition, gladly!

Lots to see in this lovely outdoor winter attraction. Huge variety of arts and crafts stalls, food stalls and free ice skating - you just need to bring your own skates, or rent for $15 a pair. Lovely location right in the center of town

LOVED Ice Skating!. Visited here last week, the ice skating rink is fab & free you only have to pay for skate hire.
Love all the little Christmas stalls/markets too! Lovely to spend some time here.
Great skating. Very busy but the atmosphere was great and not that expensive. recommend that you arrive early to avoid the crowds

Charming. Always charming, and especially around the holidays, Bryant Park is worth visiting on its own, for ice skating, or in combination with a great many sights nearby, including NY Public Library, Grand Central Terminal, Rockefeller Center, Roosevelt Island tramway and Times Square.

Visited "Bryant Park" New York City April 2014. It was the first Public Park which we visited during our visit to New York in April 2014. We found the park was full of people who were relaxing & enjoying with snacks and other eatable while sitting in different parts of the park. The rush of people was probably due to Easter.
New Yorkhaseverythingfor all ages!. It had a variety of things to see and do !theskyline,shopping, The Grand Central Terminal, 11/9 Memorial and of course plenty of restaurants/ pubs to eat.

Slightly Disappointing. Went to the Christmas market here, which was a bit of a disappointment, very few stalls were open and the ones which were open were very expensive. The ice rink is cheaper than others, however this was very busy. The park itself is a lot smaller than I imagined!
Good Holiday craft shopping. This was a good place to sit and have a snack , ice skate or do some holiday craft shopping. It was nice to sit and people watch
Winter village. Loved Bryant Park and the winter village shops,bought myself a Christmas ornament,and sat outside and had lunch.
Umpredictable, full of life. Went there a few days ago. Small shops all around the park very cute, the ice skating ring is up. Public bathrooms and they are well taking care.

Lovely area at this time of year. There were seasonal stalls offering high quality merchandise and ofcourse the ice skating rink there for the holidays, it's a nice place to visit and experience the holiday mood.

Christmas market. We visited several times during our stay in New York. The pop-up Christmas shops are lovely. My only complaint would be that there are no opening times posted on most of the shops. One visit was just before noon on Monday 23rd November and several of the units were closed, with no indication as to when or if they would open that day. The ice rink is cute, with plenty of room for spectators.
Loved It. Graet to watch the Ice Skaters and all of the different types of shops selling all kinds of weird and wonderful items. The United Leather shop was particularly good

Nice winter wonderland. They did a really nice job transforming the park into a winter activity. There's lots of small shops to look at all around the park with the large skating rink in the center. The skating is free although skate rental will cost you (more $$ between Thanksgiving and Christmas). There were LOTS of people skating so it was just fun to watch them.This is a great place to visit if you are in the city looking for things to do. If you're not ice skating you could spend an hour walking around looking in all the little shops they have setup.
Just great . This is our 5th visit to new York and we always head to Bryant Park where normally my wife nearly always buys something just a great place to wonder round on cold November day

Skating and specialty shops without the rush. We seem to happen upon Bryant Park everytime we go to the City. Situated right next to the NY Public Library and only a block or two from GCT, it is a perfect place to really just relax, take in the scene, paruse the various little shops, eat churros, and go ice skating. I consider this a mini- Rockefeller center without being packed in like sardines. By eye, the skating rink there is larger than the one at the Rock and somehow, the buildings are situated just right to have some great basking sunshine in November at 1 in the afternoon. There is a nice seating area, set up above the ice rink, with tables and cozy heaters. The variety of the shops are unique as they are plentiful. You could get some holiday shopping done here while stopping by for some tea. I think this is one of the nicer places in this area where you can feel quite free to relax and take it all in.

walking site. Nice location, just behind the library. I was there in november. Part of the square was prepared for ice skating. A lot of christmas shop were opened. Very nice atmosfere. During summetime it's a very fresh place to rest during a office pause.

Nice during festive season. Pass by here during off season, quite a small park with nothing much to brag about. Nevertheless it is an oasis in midtown. Walked pass yesterday (Nov 29) and it is very vibrant with stalls selling varieties of goods and vendor selling hot apple cider and hot chocolate. There is the big Christmas tree and skating rink. Quite a bit of traffic and a very enjoyable stroll.

Winter Wonderland. What a lovely park! Offers free ice skating in the winter, all you pay is for the skate rental. It can be very busy with kids for this reason but it is definitely worth a trip. In the Summer they screen movies

My Favorite Park in NY. theres a lot parks in manhattan, but Bryant Park have something different that make you back for more. its full activities & most of them are free for public.very fun for family & kids or just to get some lunch. & yes, theres free wifi :)
Interesting stores on Bryant Park. Lots of interesting items on display. Great to see the ice skating rink open. Good option after touring the library - lots of food and drink options available

Free Ice Skating. The only place in NYC where you can ice skate free! This park offers many venues from shopping to people watching to enjoying a cup of coffee or a bite of food. It is located behind the Public Library. What a gem!

3 1/2 stars - nice . I wouldn't necessarily go out of the way to go to Bryant Park unless you're going ice skating. However, if you're in the area it's a nice change of pace within the skyscrapers. Small booths with small business goods line the park on the outside of the skating rink. In November there was a large Christmas tree and a Santa Claus. You can also buy some street food in some of the booths. This reminded me of the Christmas markets in Austria and Germany.

Great place to skate in NYC. We chose to come to Bryant Park for Ice skating to avoid the crowded Rockefeller center. $7.50 for skate rental and that was for 90 minutes. Didn't feel crowded and great views. I highly recommend.
Nice stroll in good weather. The skating rink is open and good fun watching everyone - the craft fair was quite crowded and I wish we had more time to browse for gifts.

Small business shoppes for the holiday. A mini village set up with unique shoppers and food to walk arounf like a market. Fun place to get gifts for the holiday and ice skate for free, just rental fee for skates. Easy walk to more shopping.

WORSE Customer service AT THE ICE SKATING PARK. I loved the park and the area, but when we went to get out tickets to ice skate the lady (I wish i would have gotten her name) took our money and I asked if we needed to know anything before going to skate. She said no and joked around about not dying on the rink... okay my husband and I go skate and I get in trouble because I have my purse... well the lady NEVER said anything... so i go inside and ask the SAME LADY what to do... she said there are free lockers on the other side..... I agreed and thanked her... went to the lockers and the man said you have to have a lock for the locker to be free... okay... i go back to the SAME LADY and she said oh, yea you have to have a lock... and then directed me to go get a red bag to place my stuff in and they would hold it.... I go over the the bag service and the guy said you have to get a bag when you pay to skate....... SO I GO BACK OVER TO THE SAME LADY pretty upset and express my feelings.. she did not care.... i go to the next booth over and the lady was very nice and helped and was sorry for the service of the other lady....... Anyways, by the time i was ready to skate it took me at least 45 min to understand where to place my tiny purse...... LOVED SKATING HERE BUT DONT GO TO BOOTH #4

Not worth going out of your way for. This was a nice enough place, good small stalls and an ice rink - i wouldnt go out of my way to come here though - there are plenty of other nice places to visit in Manhatten

Winter Village Ice Skating at Bryant Park. Each year the park transforms into Winter Village, sponsored by Bank of America. The ice skating rink is the centerpiece of the village and offers free admission. If you bring your own skates and a lock for their lockers you can have a completely free experience. Or you can rent skates as well as locks or check your bags. No backpacks, purses or cameras are allowed on the ice. They're also strict about no phones on ice. We rented skates at $19/pair. And checked our bag for an additional $8, so it all added up. It was fun though. So much fun that I'm certain we will be back this winter. My daughter took to the ice like a penguin and sailed across it as if she's taken lessons before. The rink also offer stabilizing penguins which we saw some kids using to aid in balance but I'm not so sure they made it easier. Based on the amount of slipping happening around them I think it may have made it harder. We brought our own helmet, which I also recommend, you can rent as well. The rink wasn't too crowded, the staff manages everything well and it's kept safe so everyone can enjoy themselves. It was unseasonably warm yesterday so we wore just a light jacket and gloves. We probably should have brought a change of jeans or worn water proof pants. We ended up in wet pants for about an hour after skating until they dried.For the non-skaters, there is plenty of seating available so you can still enjoy the experience rink side. Or you can bypass skating all together and stroll through the open air market set up for the season. They have more than 125 boutique-like shops with items ranging from apparel to jewelry, decorative goods, local foods, and much more. You'll be able to find something for everyone - adults, kids, and even pets.We enjoyed some delicious warm churros with nutella after skating and took a much needed break sitting down and watched the hustle of busy shoppers and vendors.After our refueling we walked around to the front of the New York Public Library and marveled at the beauty of the building as well as the decorated famous lions out front. I always think of Ghost Busters when I see these guys.Then we walked back over to the carousel, it was swarming with giggling kids, trying to decide which animal to ride. For $3 each we took a ride, which was fairly long for a carousel. The actual carousel is quite small, and nothing particularly special, except that it's in a pretty awesome part of NYC. It's really cool riding in circles taking in the views of the park, the skyscrapers and all the holiday shops.That wrapped up our morning! It was a nice way to have special time with my little girl, getting us into the holiday spirit. If you're looking for a sweet 1/2 day family adventure, this is a great one if you're up for being on your feet most of the time.
Nice place during the holidays. There are small Kiosk selling stuff and I took it upon myself to buy some of said stuff. The Cranberry cider is good and the bagel excellent.

Oasis in the middle of chaos. Found this area on our first day. Stopped one evening. Nice little shops and food stalls to visit. Unique items for gifts. Skating rink looked inviting though we did not do. Less busy than the Rockefeller rink. A quieter area, more relaxing in the middle of the holiday rush. Great way to spend an hour or two.
Bryant Park. Great NYC nook. This place is sheer joy winter and summer. Right in the heart of Manhattan: Christmas shopping, Ice rink. Merry-go-round.

What a renovation and improvement!. Bryant Park is lovely! So many options - many crafters and shops, restaurants, ice skating rink - even the tours at the NYC Library! You could easily spend a day or more there. Enjoy!

One of my favorite spots in NYC. Always relaxing to stroll through Bryant Park, and to just sit at one of the little tables and people watch. Very romantic spot for a date night. Love all of the Christmas booths available beginning at Thanksgiving. I'd personally prefer that the park didn't have the hideous temporary building next to the ice rink because it takes away from the feel of the park, but it is what it is, still plenty to enjoy!

One of my favorite places to meander around when visiting NY. A bunch of reasons to visit:1. Plaques around the park explain the uniqueness of the architecture surrounding it2. Right behind the library - another free site that often has exhibits, and offers interesting public rooms to explore3. Library walk is on the other side of 5th - great fun to look down and read quotes in the sidewalk - save at least 15 minutes for this if you are a bibliophile4. Christmas market is best ever (2015) - the Tibetan jewelry man is so proud of his product.5. Lots of places to sit, relax, and sip on something cool or hot

Day trip to NYC. We go to Bryant park every year during the holiday season. We like the way park is set up with the vendors,a wide range of arts,jewelry,clothing,food and lots of other shopping. They have a ice skating rink. Great place for the family of all ages to spent some time. Walking distance from grand central station. It's a must see during the holidays.

LOVELY LUNCH IN THE CELCIUS POP UP RESTAURANT BY THE RINK. Went for a wander around the holiday market on the 23 november. Good arrays of interesting stalls. Decided to have lunch and chose the Celsius restaurant - sat outside despite it being 8 degrees as sat under a patio heater near the skating rink. Lovely ambience - great service , good food and great value. A very enjoyable lunch people watching !!!

Love the Vendor Market. Made a special trip by to check out the vendor market which I believe is only on this time of year. It was a beautiful day and the market wasn't too crowded. There were lots of skaters on the rink and it was an enjoyable stroll. Worth the trip for sure.

Great shopping, food & rest stop. We saw this square while riding in a cab, and made sure to walk to it the next day. Glad we did, as the many kiosks featured local artists and artisans offering many unique items. There were even perimeter paths and chairs offering a respite for the husbands waiting for their shoppers. What a nice oasis in the midst of the city!
fun. The winter festival was happening,something for everyone. Lots of vendors also an ice skating rink. Good way to spend an hour.
Shopping. A lot of fun little shops and food. Bring your pennies because it is very over priced! For example:$12 for a pair of socks! Book ahead for the ice skating, it gets very crowded

Fun Shopping Experience. Nice little artsy shops containing artisan items and some unique gifts. Spent about an hour going in an out of all of the little seasonal shops. These shops are open in November and December each year. You will find unique offerings in jewelry, leather goods, Christmas décor and glass works. Unique hats, scarves and gloves are also available. Most shops have unique boutique type items. There is also an ice skating rink in Bryant Park which really adds to the holiday spirit. Go and have some fun!

Ice rink and German market.. Definantfly worth a visit, plenty things to do to spend a few hours away from the all the hussle.There is an ice rink which is always fun whether your skating or watching others.There are food/drink stalls as well as stalls with lovely handcrafted Christmas decorations as well as other goodies.

Don't miss the Winter Village. Bryant Park is a pretty place to visit during nice weather. During November and December, it can get a bit chilly but the Winter Village is not to be missed! Fabulous local merchants and craftspeople selling their wares in a nicely done "village." You can make a day of it as there is food, ice skating, and people watching galore!

A very nice atmosphere. . We visited the pre Christmas booths at Bryant Park. A lot of interesting (low 'kitch' factor) booths.Really nice atmosphere when the darkness arrived and beautiful lightning on the building surfaces.

Greatmeeting place. Was here in November and they had a great christmas market with. Lots of craft stalls built around a ice skating rink. The place is really beatiful and very busy with people enjoying thierselves but areas where you can just sit relax and enjoy the world going past.

Christmas in Bryant Park. Bryant Park is so nice this time of year with the Christmas Village in full swing and the ice skating rink full of skaters. The tree is about to be lit so make sure to visit this little gem in the middle of the city. For the holiday season it is decked out like a European Christmas village and in the summer the movies are wonderful and it is a nice place to just read a book and sit and talk.
Great Park. I love sitting on a bench in Bryant Park with a coffee and people watching. Great at the holidays as well, so festive.

I go every year for Christmas. This year we were early and it was still open and really fun to shop. I hate shopping retail but this market, and the skating rink, and all the folk from the world over, has got my heart now I've moved away from Europe.

Love Bryant Park . We love Bryant Park at any time of year but it's just brilliant at Christmas. The atmosphere is buzzing with the Christmas village and ice rink. The food in the Celsius restaurant was good and it was lovely to sit under the overhead heaters outside watching the skaters while having dinner. A must do.

Problems with accessibility. I had Bryant Park on my Wish List but cruising down the Avenue I was unable to find an accessible pathway. It seemed to be steps everywhere. Maybe there were some on one of the other sides but then SIGNS would have been good on any one of the corners indicating which way for people on walking sticks or wheels ... just a suggestion! But the park was full of big tents with gifts for the holidays so it wasn't a possibility to get up there. A pity as the park looks a lovely venue, as are all the parks in the middle of Manhattan.

Winter holidays Ice Rink & Holiday booths. Love coming here in the winter holidays. Ice rink open Oct 30 - March 6th. November & December holiday booths for gifts & foods. Free wifi. lots of seating year round. next door to the NY Main library.

Christmas Village Shops in November. Went to Bryant Park to shop at the Christmas Market shops - nothing special, just like a flea market with nothing that I was interested in. Some shops had pretty Christmas ornaments but were too expensive. We already have Christmas ornaments that have 'New York City' on them from previous trips, so we didn't buy any more. There was a skating rink there and lots of people were skating - that was fun to watch.
Great Park. Walked through it many times always enjoyed it ice rink shops restaurants right behind the nyc public library

Any time of year is nice. Christmas has the park chock full of kiosks that sell hand made and interesting items.A lot of one of a kind things . The center is turned into a ice skating rink that always hasan extremely long line no matter what the weather. Lots of food vendors with things likeBelgian fries and Pomegranate cider. Fun time for kids and adults. In warm weather itis one of the most pleasant spaces to relax near the hustle and bustle.

Loved it. Beautiful location with some very quaint shops - if you want to skate in NY do it here amazing value (free entry and pay for skate hire) with no time limit and it's much quieter than the other ice rinks

skating in Bryant Park. This was one of the best entertainment we had such fun skating in Bryant Park, got some gifts however they were a bit expensive, however all in all a great day , you can skate for the full day for $20 which is great value.

great people watching. this is a small park by the library in midtown. There are restaurants and you can eat outside during nice weather. This is a great meeting spot and the city holds rallies there. Any time you can find green area in Manhattan, take advantage of it.

love love love. one of the best spot for the romantic couples. a small green spot in a mad city! early morning walks inside this park are truly romantic...grab a coffe and a muffin and enjoy the silence before the city turns into a jungle.
Nice!. Glad we took a break from shopping to stop and enjoy this cool park!It is transformed to a Winterland! Special place for the Holidays!

Beautiful Bryant park. Wonderful park with a skating rink and many little shops selling seasonal goods.we went on a crisp day and although we didn't go skating we stood and watched people.the shops had beautiful Xmas decorations which we bought to take back to the uk.

Beautiful. I had never heard much about this little park. So delighted we come on it. It was host to a beautiful christmas market and ice rink. Great variety of stalls and the ice rink was free. Anyone visiting newyork nov/dec should drop in here.

My Favourite Park in NYC. In the summer they have film club on the lawn!
Don't go too early, lot's of homeless people sleep here at night.

Love Bryant Park!!. Beautiful stores erected for the holidays, wonderful holiday atmosphere. Interesting, one of a kind jewelry made by NY deisigners Go try the hot chocolate at No Chewing Allowed, they add a chocolate truffle to your cup of cocoa. You'll never drink the stuff from the packet again!
Bryant park holiday shoppes. We love going to Bryant Park in November when the ice rink and the shops are open. So much fun!! It's a great place to people watch too!

Kiosks galore. Every year around the first of November, Bryant Park transforms itself into a mini-Rockefeller Center, complete with a huge decorated tree and an ice skating rink. Vendors of all types set up kiosks around the area and one can peruse until your heart's content on all sorts of trinkets, clothing, jewelry, food items, and more. People watching is also quite prevalent. They publish a map of the kiosks so you can track your favorite spots as you like. Skating can be had for just the cost of rental skates. If you want to relax and shop in the middle of Manhattan in a different manner, then a trip to Bryant Park should be on your itinerary the next time you're in NYC.

Must See for the Holidays. If you love European Christmas Markets, you must come here! Beautiful Tree, lots of ice skating (for a good long time-not like at that "other big tree", delicious food, mulled wine, craft, and spots to make photo memories for life1
Fun in Bryant Park. Fun time in Bryant Park with fun shopping for Christmas, delicious food and interesting people wathcing. Next time I will try the ice skating rink.

great to people watch. We had decided to take a visit to Bryant Park as there is a holiday market here at the moment, well located within walking dustance of the Rockefeller centre and Times Square. It is a lovely green space to sit and watch the world go buy.Really nice small hut like shops selling all kinds of more unusual gifts and cute pop up eateries.There is also a really nice restaurant thats undercover where you can warm up and still enjoy the atmosphere.Not forgetting the ice rink located at its heart, something for everyone
Nice park. If you are near the area, stop by Bryant Park. Nice park to wander around and see the atmosphere especially now before Xmas.

Skating here too!. I was surprised to find there was four places in the city set up for ice skating. BRYANT PARK was set up for the holidays just beautiful and lots of places to purchase gifts and eat. Beautiful decorations take time to visit here.

Small park with a lot to do!. I loved Bryant Park! They have really cool markets pre-christmas and an ice rink. So entertaining to watch all of the happy families and tourists - it makes the week of Thanksgiving so appropriate - being thankful w=for what we have. This place is so special. Enjoy the hot chocolate from Max Brenner - it is super thick and super yummy. All kinds of wares - worth walking and looking at each market on show. Ping pong tables are set up - take on a friend!!!
Skating in the park. Pleasant way to spend an hour - watch the skaters, visits the kiosks, have some hot chocolate and enjoy!

Lovely winter market. We were lucky enough to visit the winter market & ice rink at the beginning of November. The are lots of different stall selling jewellery, Christmas decoration, handbags and lots of other goods. Great for Christmas present. There were also various food & drink stalls. It had a lovely atmosphere.

Friendly and fun. Take a break from shopping and go for a seat or skate during winter season. Lovely to do or watch. Great coffee and try hot cider to warm up. Lots if Christmas stalls and tree is amazing. Must see.

Stroll through Bryant Park. We enjoyed a stroll through Bryant Park after breakfast. Many winter vendor huts to see and purchase handmade crafts. They were ice skating in the outdoor rink, the sun was shining and it was pleasant weather. A sweet gem!

Great place to walk, and a great seasonal attraction. Our hotel was two block away, and the Subway near Bryant Park was our main way to move up and down town. So we had the chance to walk through it several times, and because of the season, it had shops and the traditional ice rink. The attraction changes from a quiet park to strive to a noisy, smell full, colorful place just from day to night. We really enjoyed shopping and having a walk every day of our stay. Loved it!!
Holiday Shopping. Great atmosphere and the shops are adorable! There is also a skating rink that didn't appear to be too crowded. Nice for a stroll through after dinner!
