CHRISTMAS MARKET. always visit when we visit new York excellent atmosphere either day or better a night time visit free skating if you take your own boots but plenty to hire at reasonable cost, grand mix of food stalls to suit all tastes plenty of seating and a small carousel for the younger people and various entertainers

Busy place. There is always something interesting going on in Bryant Park. After a recent visit to the library, I noticed that they were gearing up for the holidays (a bit early for my taste), so I got a preview.

Nice little place to shop. Unique shops in all price ranges !
From Christmas ornaments to all types of socks for the entire family !

Lovely stop. Lovely little stop when strolling down 42nd Street. Quaint little stalls selling g anything from Christmas decorations to scarves and hot chocolate. Nice little seating rink, very Chrismassy.

Great Evening Walking Around on This Nite. Late night on this November walking around and 50 degrees out. The park is just outside our hotel and there's lots to look at and see. Venders For food and things to look at and or buy, people ice skating. We had a good time walking and talking.
Decent place. This is a cute place to kill some time and have a snack. There are several vendors in the park. It wasn't fantastic but offered a great little stop while walking the city.

My favorite, small NYC park. BP is a lovely little island of (relative) calm around 42nd street - in winter it features some neat small stores; in summer, different stores and a chance to sit down and relax, all in the middle of a busy area of the city.

Bucket list ticked off. I wanted to skate as part of my first trip to New York. After reading posts on tripadvisor, decided Bryant Park was the one for me and after doing it, and seeing the rink at Central Park and Rockerfellers, definitely made the right decision. Hubby sat at the side as he didn't want to do it and lots of tables and chairs for spectators.It is a lovely sized rink, surrounded by xmas huts, selling some really unique gifts (not crammed full of tat like xmas markets in the UK either). I went along just as it was getting dark and it was gorgeous to beskating amongst the lit buidlings at night. The rink is free and you just pay if you need to hire skates.I managed to stay on my feet and celebrated with a hot cider afterwards!.Would highly recommend skating at Bryant Park as it's a beautiful setting and I left very happy
Well worth the visit. . We stopped @ Bryant Park . Ice skating admission is free but you pay for skate rental which was $19. The winter village shopping was interesting too

A Jewel in the city. And awesome park with an outdoor public ice skating rink, a market place peddling interesting item and Club Celsius Restaurant.
Outdoor coffee, tea, and hot chocolate vendors provide a warming environment.

Excellent Place to Christmas Shopper Unique Gifts.. Lots of unique vendors - jewelry, trendy and unique socks, food, t-shirts, and home items. Some vendors are only their for the Christmas season. Walking distance to Times Square and Herald Square

Ice Skating Thru NYC Movie Adventures. Have you ever noticed the best romance/comedy movies filmed in NYC have scenes taken at ice rinks in Manhattan? If you want to do a real NYC adventure bring your ice skates with you and ice skate at all the sites of the movie scenes. The rinks you have to visit are Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center, Wollman Rink in Central Park, and Lasker Rink at the North end of Central Park. At Rockefeller Center (Home Alone, Autumn in New York, Elf) you can skate really early with their First Skate program which starts at 7am--it will cost you but it is worth it to be one of a handful of people skating at this famous location which shows up in almost every movie from Harry meets. Bryant Park opens at 8, and you'll be part of a group of locals who show up every morning. Glee was filmed here. Nothing beats the free skating between the Market and NYC Library. Wollman Park was in Serendipity and Home Alone 2 and it is a large rink that gives a great workout. Another day head for Lasker Rink at the North end of Central Park. And then there is a teeny rink at South Street Seaport. My wife and I will head out to the rinks early in the morning, get our hour and a half of exercise and then head out for our annual traipsing.If you really want a different kind of NYC adventure, bring your ice skates!!!!
great time. Lot of great vendors selling everything you could image. Place was very clean too. The set up of the vendors made it easy to get around.

A nice find.. We came upon the park while walking from Times Square to the Empire State Building. There were a good number of interesting vendors there, and they had a ice skating rink set up. We spent a good 45 minutes browsing and watching the ice skaters at the rink they'd set up there.
Christmas markets. The Christmas markets are currently open and are well worth a visit, there are numerous food and drink stalls as well as the skating rink.
Christmas time shopping in the park c. Love the park in the summer, but now at Christmas they have many, many heated little buildings of specialty items.

Love it, love it, love it. Oh, what a great park to just chill, refresh yourself. We stopped here a couple of time during our stay in NY.There is a free little book library, table tennis available, eateries, coffee shops etc. One time there was even a dancing show.

Nice little park. It's quite small, so it'll take you about a 1 min or two to see the whole park, but it's beautiful, the plants, place to have coffee if need be, good photo location, and skyscraper all around. Worth a look if you are around the area.

Currently there is a holiday market going on surrounding the ice skating rink. We were staying quite close to Bryant Park and went there before we went to the New York Library. There are numerous vendors there selling everything from jewelry to leather goods to candles, toys, tea, coffee, and hot chocolate - a fun place to do some holiday shopping

Glad we came across this park. We happened to come across this park while walking through midtown. They had the Winter Village set up which included a lot of small shops selling everything from socks to Christmas ornaments. The highlight for my 12 year old son was the ice skating rink in the middle of the park. We rented some skates and away he went. The weather when we visited was very pleasant and there was plenty of seating around the rink. Very fun way to spend the evening.

No Rush No Crowds Good People. Watch the skaters; shop the shops; try the fresh tasty offerings all in one beautiful Park setting. Come away from an hour of browsing and enjoying the outdoor experience and you will want to return the next evening.

Shopping kiosks and a skating rink!!!. NY has maintained a perfect balance between glass and concrete structures with nature and open spaces. As if the Central park was not enough, the entire city is full of parks. And Bryant park is one gem of a park right in the heart of the city. The entire park has shopping kiosks lined up on the edges and an ice skating rink plonked right in the middle. I went here in the evening. The atmosphere was enchanting. Kids skating in the middle and doting parents cheering them on. Great place.

Shopping in the park. I have a problem with a "Park" being taken up with buildings.This does not seem to bother anyone else as it was full of people wandering and shopping in all the small structures.
Very Christmassy. They had the ice rink up and running with lovely Christmas stalls, worth a look at. Food stalls all around.

Great Midtown Small Park with a Skating Rink in Winter. Bryant Park is a lovely midtown park which is great on a pleasant day for relaxing, eating or people watching. In winter they have a wonderful skating rink (for a fee) which is not far from Rockefeller Center but much quieter. The New York Public Library (with its iconic lion statues at the front stairs) is right next door if you want to knock out two sights in one swoop.

Gem in the middle of Manhattan. Bryant Park today is one of the hottest park spaces in NYC. In the winter there is an ice rink and during the rest of the year there is grand lawn behind the New York Public Library. The park also has a schedule of arts events and movie nights. Free wi-fi and power outlets is available to everyone in the park, as well ping pong tables, and small vendors of coffee and pastries. Great for a break on a nice day in NYC or with families looking for a place to let their children run free.

Nice Park . Its nice to see an open air ice skating rink in the middle of a cosmopolitan city. They put up sitting areas at the perimeter of the rink and there are many booth-like shops within the park that sells all kinds of merchandize from clothing to chocolates to art pieces to F&B etc. Worth spending time here, if not to check out the potential shopping, then it is just to chill while watching people skate...since I cant do it myself. I have been told the best time to be here is at night, but i personally didnt manage to come again at night time. Do check Bryant Park out.

Not to be missed.... We went here or rather stumbled across it as we were on our way to Macy's, and we were glad we did. Very relaxing, just watching the time go by...lots of different shops??? We walked round here as there is so much to take in...lots of unusual souvenirs to bring back with you, and there was also a skating rink, which is free, you only pay to hire the skates

Peaceful and relaxing park. This park is very well located. You can get there by subway. It is by an outdoor restaurant where you can have an awesome Sunday brunch. The park has ping pong tables, places to sit and eat. The gardens are beautiful. The place is soooo relaxing. Really quaint. A must go!

Great place for Sunday brunch. This was the second time I had brunch at the Bryant Park Grill and it did not let me down. You need to ask for a seat by the window in the main room the view is great and the food is excellant
Experince. We went watching everyone skating on Wednesday night it was a lively place to sit and watch and take in the experince whilst in New York a place to see

Go before weather turns Cold! Nice midday break in busy Manhattan. Plenty of seating to rest your feet, with food and wine and beer to sip and for best "people watching". Next to NY Public Library, the best oasis in busy 42nd Street/5th Ave for an outdoor Fall, Spring, Summer break. Recommend to use the Library's toilets--lines are long at the Park. But, still with lite food, drinks, shades...even some books from Library....perfect rest stop!
Nice. Lots of lovely shops to visit, an ice rink and obviously the park itself was pretty, nice to see a park in the middle of a busy city! Somewhere to relax.
A Vibrant Park with lots of Happenings. Performance, foods, sunshine and many other things can be found in here. Easily accessible by New York MTA Subway - 42th - Bryant Park station.

Loved Bryant Park. We loved Bryant Park - there is currently a winter market with a skating rink and lots of little stalls selling unusual gifts and hot food to take away. The smells were amazing. We were only staying around the corner and visited the park every evening.

A joyful stroll. Enjoy this urban green space in the middle of everything. With the holiday season approaching there are little shops, ice skating, a merry go round and warm drinks to ensure you relax and start the merrymaking.

Quaint park...LOVED IT. Bryant park is a must in my opinion. It is exactly the kind of park you see on most tv shows depicting New York....the chess games...ping pong...late night movie showings...coffee kiosks....music..... we found it very charming. Could definitely see myself grabbing a coffee and spending hours in this park with a good book or just people watching.It has a real comforting, relaxing feel to it.

Great Park with wonderful shopping experiences from local vendors. I stumbled upon Bryant Park by accident. It is a fun place to shop, eat and ice skate. the park has unique feel with shopping from local vendors. anything you can imagine you can buy here.
In love with this Park!. The Christmas market is beautiful and the whole park just feels filled with energy and good times to come...

Good to look around. Nice park to have a walk around and see the little bazaar they have for Christmas. We got to see a great ice skating ring if you're up to it. We sat and had a hot apple cider and enjoyed part of the afternoon.

Christmas Vibe. Absolutely loved this place..I had already reead about it and had included in our to do list for our visitWe were up top of Empire State Building when we spotted it.Loads of wee shops selling loads of different gifts/foods/knick-knacks.The other half got a few tree decorations.On first night we had a few hot ciders and another night we had hot chocoalte.I can't ice skate so did not partake.Lovely big tree and certainly not as busy as rockerfeller centre.Even managed to get a few photos.A must see if visiting in the next month or so.Really gets you into the Christmas feeling.
Unique Winter Village. Beautiful, unique shops and ice skating. Beautiful opening weekend. Fabulous view from the Bryant Park Hotel. Lots of chairs, security, and well-lit at night.
go to Bryant park to see the Christmas market.lovely carosel. en loved the Caroselvery busy with lots to see. Lovely stalls with handmade goods for sale.Grandchildr

Love Bryant. We love this little oasis within the bustling streets. We walk around the numerous stalls, sipping on our cup of hot cider with a cinnamon stick. the many outlets sell often quirky and unusual items (good gift shopping). This time around we purchased a piece of artisan glasswork
Wonderful park. They have a Christmas shopping village set up and have food, ice skating..... its very festive for Christmas! Fun, safe place to walk around.
Great place to eat lunch. Lovely small park setting with interesting events, good food, nice place for lunch while you are out and about in the city.

Bonus. Take in Bryant Park when out seeing all the sights in and around Times Square, nice little neck of the woods to have a nice coffee and a rest, if one feels one needs a rest, also some quirky stores.
Fun times. Bryant center is very easy to get to and spot out. No fee to enter.. lots of little stalls to buy from and ice skating rink bigger than the Rockefeller

Christmas Village. Being the holiday season, there's some really small and quaint holiday places. It was great to just walk through some of the smaller stores, since its the holidays, they do this just for the season. We ordered some hot chocolates and just sat and watched the people ice skate which is free by the way...can't pass up on that! Great place to just have some good conversation, relax a bit, grab a bite and enjoy the holiday season!
Put on your to do list during the holidays. with an ice rink and terrific shopping at kiosks Bryant Park should be on any visitors list. I am a native and never tire of going here too.

A very nice place for children. Located behind the public library in New York one can spend hours looking around the various kiosks selling very beautiful articles. There is an ice skating area too. There is a restaurant .

Winter Village. Winter Village was perfect. Little shops and kiosks along with an ice skating ring made Bryant Park a perfect stop. Had tea and waffles at a small outdoor table, did some Christmas shopping, watched the ice skaters. Awesome.

Cute little park!. Imo the best park in the city except Central Park! Not to big, not to small. Public restrooms, many events, no smoking area which I like cause I don't smoke. Clean and with free wifi! Cute little tables and chairs and a small carousel! What else you need?!

Should have come back with my girlfriends . Admittedly not as good as the first time around but consistent. An afternoon shopping experience and a must if you're in the city. My husband was with me this time around and not feeling well, so I blame him for a non-eventful experience this time around.

Winter Village. What a magical place to experience the Holiday Cheer in NYC. My husband and I spent time browsing the shops and then grabbed something to eat and watched the ice skating. A must do if in NYC during the Holidays.

Winter wonderland with a great bar. Ice skating and the Deck Bar made a visit to the park in NYC special
Not sure you can do this anywhere else in the world.
Margueritas on ice!
A lovely area to explore. This was a really fun way to spend a Sunday afternoon. Loads of choices for food. A varied selection of stalls , good relaxed vibe

An evening visit but in the rain. We visited this when it was raining. A lovely park and the ice rink was open but wet. Lots of little christmas shops that were lovely and plenty of places to eat.
Just a lovely little park

A Great Iconic Park. Tucked right next to the famous New York Public Library and Times Square is this amazing park. From events to dining to just playing chess or lying on the grass it is a small relaxing oasis in the madness of midtown.

A place to sit down and enjoy. By day,by night
Just sit on the lawn,relax and make the experience out of it
Nice experience from every angle
Christmas. Christmas market with lots of stalls selling gifts, foot outlets and free ice-skating. Great to while away an hour or so.
Nice little park. I wouldn't be visiting it as a destination, but take a stroll if you are in the area, just to wash away all of the high-risers with a little green:)

Great spot to sit and relax. This was one of our favorite spots in NY.
During November till January there is an ice rink and a small boutique shops around the part.
We had a lovely time just wandering around the park, listen to a relaxing jazz music and see the empire state building in the background.
A Lovely Day in the Park. We at brunch across the street and noticed all of the tents. My wife enjoyed browsing in the tents and found several crafty items to purchase.

Beautiful green space with little shops and a carousel. . Great space to watch people. So many little shops and food and beverage vendors. Very relaxing. Good vibes here. Bryant Park Grill is lively for lunch.

Best late night find for amazing Arepas. Even though we were full from dinner earlier, we decided to try the Arepas (grilled corn meal stuffed with mozzarella) then topped with a unique variety of toppings. I went with my arepa topped with pesto, goat cheese, and sun dried tomatoes. Oh my!!!!! My friend had the feta, pesto, and mushroom and still won't stop raving about it.

Winter Village. This is a must!!! What a wonderful shopping experience in the winter village. Lots of Christmas treats and gifts. It was perfect.
October 30, 2015 – January 3, 2016

Enjoy ice skating during winter. The park is maintained at zero degree C. People gather here and enjoy seeing or doing iceskating . Kods, young children and elder one can be seen enjoying the skating. One can ariund here justbto,get entertaing here. Beautiful place to enjoy
Great place to people watch. We recently had some time to kill before our show. We picked up a dessert at one of the small vendors and sat and watched the ice skaters. It's definitely a fun place.
booths of local artist around the ice rink, nice sitting areas to enjoy. We would have liked to stay longer, and enjoy the people watching, but walked to see Time Square also - so much to see and do!
Gorgeous in the autumn. Dotted with a variety of handicraft for sale, this is the perfect place to buy some out of the ordinary Christmas gifts while enjoying the park!

Fun place to shop and people watch. At Christmas they have a lot of vendors, ice skating and plenty of food stands. It's fun to walk through, pick up a couple of things for the holidays or just browse. The area if fairly small, doesn't take a lot of time to look at everything but if it's warm enough out, you can sit and watch as people stroll by.

The park itself is scenic as behind the New York library. But they had a really mediocre Christmas style market with terrible food stalls, don't eat here but go to urban space or grand central for snack choices. The ice skating in Bryant park in winter is fun.

Ice Skating under the view of the Empire State by Night. What a fantastic way to go ice skating, boot hire all included for $15.... and all under the view of the Empire State Building. It has a really lovely feel about it. Highly Recommend.

Don't Overlook this Park on Your NYC Visit. While Central Park has lots of trails and amenities, don't miss this well-located downtown park, especially in winter. Easy to get to between 6th and 5th Ave @ 40th and 43rd Sts. Can be combined with visits to other midtown attractions like the Public Library. On a clear winter day, it's a great place to visit. I liked the ice skating here better than at Rockefeller Center. There is also a carousel for kids.There are a number of options for food ranging from the stalls selling cider, soup, crepes. Pain Quotidian turns out a nice baguette sandwich and NY dog. There are free cafe tables for seating. Or there are a couple of sit-down places with fancier menus and dedicated seating.The 'Winter Village' market stalls remind me of the old stamp market in Paris. There are lots of choices for a souvenir or stocking-stuffer or just to window shop.
Watch skating all winter. Sit at a table, have a hot drink and watch the ice skaters -- much easier than Rockefeller Center. Craft shops for the holidays, lots of people day and night.

Outdoor library. A wonderful little park with all sorts of activities including birdwatching walks, concerts and boules but best of all an outdoor library where you can enjoy papers/magazines and books at your leisure. Good take away eating places scattered throughout.

Every season a new experience. In the heart of Manhattan, amazing park, a great relaxation in the middle of the hustle bustle around. Take a break for coffee of lunch, take the children for a great time in winter or summer on a weekend and feel the open athmosphere and relaxing mood.

A Short but really sweet sojourn. I stopped here for lunch one day while walking the major streets of Midtown. I watched a couple of guys play table-tennis and walked through the various seemingly impromptu shops set up in a "community park" where the community is made up of pin-stripe suits and well dresssed women from sky-scraping office buildings. It was a REALLY enjoyable lunch sitting on a concrete wall with a dog in one hand, a soft-drink in the other and watching the cross-roads of the world pass by. Better than attempts to do the same in Toronto.

A winter wonderland and a summer hot-spot. Winter visit to Bryant park is as important as a summer one! You must ice-skate when there is ice and must have a picnic when its grass..the shops around it are quite cute..A perfect chill-out place

Lots of atmosphere!. We went to see the ice skaters and visit the Christmas market and we were not disappointed. The lighting is beautiful, some of the stands are gorgeous, and it has a very nice atmosphere.
Great place for excellent food. Stayed on 42nd St right beside this beautiful park. Fabulous restaurants - a few to choose from. Well worth a look
A great find. Bryant park was around the corner from our hotel and had a fantastic Christmas market, ice rink and festive feel, surrounded by skyscrapers. A unique experience
Bryant Park. Great park. Lots of unusual shops to buy gifts or souvenirs and there are also great places to eat. Don't miss this park when you are visiting NYC.

Fantastic evening. My family played board games in Bryant Park and sat at one of the bars afterwards for some drinks.
Great fun in a great location.

Ice Skating and Winter Village. What a lovely atmosphere,
Ice Skating was great value compared to other rinks at Rockerfella Centre and Central Park
Winter Village stalls had lots of lovely gift ideas.

Good kiosk shopping in very touristy area. This place is tourist central - and for a reason. With the ice rink in the winter months, the shopping kiosks, food outlets and just a good place to hang out and enjoy the city, Bryant Park is a great place to be.

Nice park. ryant Park is a very nice place to chill out, there tons of activities organised in all seasons and for all ages, also plenty of opportunities to eat out.
And if it is raining you can go to the Public Library.

Great Fun. Bryant Park is great fun for both children and adults. Great scenery, fun games, interactive exhibits, Friendly people. A beautiful getaway from the hustle bustle of the city streets right in the middle of Mid-Town.
Friendly park. Great place to hang out in the sun and meet locals at night. Close to Times Square, but far enough away. They add an ice skating rink in the Winter.
Cozy park in NY. I like Bryant Park a lot. In autumn/winter with the ice skating field and all the delicious food places, it's a nice place to spend some time.

An enjoyable place to walk around.. If you are in the mood to walk and view a lot of little kiosks full of all kinds of interesting things to purchase, walk over to the park. When the day was done, we still wanted to do a little something and really enjoyed the park and what it had to offer. A lot of people around which makes you feel safe.
Lovely outdoor market. if you like the Christmas Markets in Europe you will love this, and with the ice skating rink in the middle of the park this was lovely to visit.

Bryant Park rest, eat, watch, play, events. 1. good clean safe restrooms2. across 40th are take-out salad bars: get a meal and eat in the park3. enjoy the games, the books, the carousel, people watching - actual New Yorkers come here to eat or kill time or meet people4. there are often events - research ahead of time.5. it is pretty and has plenty of chairs, tables to re-group and look at maps, etc.6. if you like history, take the tour of the NY Public Library - very very interesting7. the food they sell in the restaurants is expensive: BYO.
Starting Nov 1 they have shopping. We were there when they were setting up lots of christmas shopping and the ice skating rink. It was such a cute place to walk around

The holiday markets are so fun!. We loved the holiday markets and ice skating in Bryant park. The stores have such a variety of products and many items that one doesn't find in other places. Our favorites were the ornament shops and the funny sock shops. Lots of places to get a quick bite to eat and somethings g to drink. Don't miss this annual holiday shipping.

Lots to do and see. fun to watch people on the rink but when we were there it was a very long wait to get on. there is a very nice viewing area where you can sit and relax and at this time of year the park is full of vendor buildings selling almost anything you can think of. We purchased some Christmas ornaments and a wonderful pastry with bananas and Nutella.

View Christmas tree and Shop and Ice Skate. The Christmas tree is an awesome experience to see. You can alsogo to exquisite shopping and do ice skate. This is a wonderful site toenjoy and do a lot. Broadway shows are not too far. Couple of blocksand you are there with more shopping and good restaurants.
Christmas season. can feel the Christmas season here as the ice skating goes. here you'll see a very impressive store that made robots or some figurine from motor parts.
Good day out. Lots of little personalised shopping booths. Ice ring, and a nice selection of places to eat. Good for a quiet strolle. Fun place for kids.

Coolest Park in NY. We got there just as they opened the "winter village" were full of hot Food Stands and tasty food all types, people who work there smiling and giving good service, Shopping Stands (expensive but nice wash the Eyes), right in the center of the city, the place is really cool and fun

Revitalized City Spot. No matter what the time of year, Bryant Park has something going on. right behind the library, you can people watch, enjoy a concert, enjoy a snack, ice skate in winter, join in a giant chess game and at the holiday time, it is a mecca a little stalls with unique shops and gifts. The area is hosed down each morning and bathrooms are very clean. If you're in the Times Square area, it's a great place to regroup. Close to Port Authority and Penn Station.
Fun. Some neat little shops. We enjoyed watching people ice skate. Had a great Belgium waffle here with strawberries, yum!
Lunch at the BP Grille was superb. Great view...large and lovely room...and just right lunch food. Way better service than I expected. I thought it would be snooty...it wasn't.

Special holiday activities in december. Bryant Park is especially vibrant in December when many vendors have booths with interesting crafts and other goods. The park has added some informal restaurants so you can spend several hours in good weather just strolling around and sitting in the chairs provided.

Little gem. When we visited the winter market was in full swing, with a number of stalls selling various items, and a ice rink for a bit of added fun. A really nice place to wander and buy some quirky gifts.

Love to visit!. Every November, I take a girls bus trip to NYC, and this is one of my favorite places to visit. Love all of the little shops and places to eat. May spot a celebrity...ran into Katie Holmes and Suri one year. Nice little ice rink, too. Very clean bathrooms for a park in NYC. You won't be sorry you took time to visit this gem.

Charming Fun - Markets at Holidays & Picnic vendors in warm weather. If you are at Grand Central November/December stop by nearby BRYANT PARK for it's OUTDOOR CHRISTMAS MARKET, food and Skating rink. IN SUMMER the same spot at Bryant Park has a PICNIC ATMOSPHERE with a few food vendors. DIRECTIONS TO BRYANT PARK: Go out GRAND CENTRAL'S 42nd ST doors. Turn right and walk 1.5 blocks westward to 5th Ave. Right there --behind the stately white-columned Library-- there is the BRANT PARK MARKET.).

Books, Trees, Flowers and Food. Bryant Park is conveniently located adjacent to the New York Public Library at Fifth Avenue and 42nd Street. The park directly behind the majestic 100+ year-old building has all the greenery, shade, amenities and convenience tourists and locals could desire. In warm weather there is an outdoor "reading room" with newspapers and magazines, chess games going on, classic film screenings, music and dance performances and of course food kiosks with public seating and a central lawn which morphs into a free skating rink in winter surrounded by holiday food and craft booths. It is one of the best NYC public spaces right in the heart of the city.

Don't miss Bryant Park!. Great place to visit while you're walking around the city. Lots of little shops during the Holidays and an Ice Skating rink . Fun time with many places to pick up a snack or sit down to a meal.

Great Place to Stop, Eat, Relax & charge your phones for free!!!!. I work right across the street from Bryant Park and it's by place to go to relax, eat, people watch, shop during the winter holiday season and you can even ice skate!!

Men in suits. What a business park, men in suits how wonderful. I really enjoyed the spark in this park it was so nice in the summer people sitting outside on the grass and all around the park there is little spots to eat and have wine I really enjoyed the one bar in the corner where you could sit and have a drink and talk
Nice place, nice area!. A good place to sit, relax, enjoy, eat, do a little shopping at the stores located in the park close to Christmas time.

Winter and summer fun. Always something happening in Bryant Park. The skating rink had just gone up as had the temporary eating tent. Its a wonderful place to watch skaters and look at the handicraft booths, just a fun place to stroll enjoying the atmosphere
pre christmas must.... when in ny for the pre christmas season, make it a point to go here... lots to do for kids and adults... take in the season...
Great little park. I spent about an hour walking around all the little shops and then watched folks ice skating. it is a grat place to just hang out and people watch.

Great holiday festival on going. This is a great get in the holiday mood spot with everything you need for the holidays outdoors. You can even go ice skating on a quaint rink. There's many vendors for unique holiday gifts as well as hot cider and donuts along with all the other food goodies. A must stop for the holidays.
Beautiful Park in Midtown!. Bryant Park is beautiful at any time of year! Often there are free events held in the park. In the wintertime, they have a skating rink and shops set up.

Always enjoyable........ We always seem to end up going to Bryant Park at least 3-4 times during our month long visits to the city. The winter shops are now open and what a wide variety of vendors there are. One of our favorites, Mladen jewelry, was back and as friendly as ever. The park is also a great place to sit down, relax, have a bite to eat and people watch.

Magical. Walking past and discovering Bryant park made our holiday even more spectacular than it had already been. Incredible atmosphere, amazing ice rink that was very well run, a huge number of things to look at and a beautiful view of the empire state building. We would definitely go back at the same time of year again.
Accidental visit. Came upon Bryant Park by accident and so glad we did. Ice skating in progress with lots of seating available and lots of little shopping outlets to brouse.

great time out from the midtown crowds. Close to our hotel. We ended up visiting three times to relax under the giant trees and sit at the outdoor BP Café for a drink under their umbrellas. Popular spot. Some informal business meetings happening but people were mainly out of towners (like us). English, German and Aussies in particular. I think the ice skating rink is up now, but we were there when grass was still down. Carousel, chess tables and library with lots of available seats around the park made this a little oasis. If you want some time out from the crowds in times square/mid town, this is worth a visit.

Full of Suprises. Lots of little huts selling all kinds of knock knacks ideal for presents and keepsakes, lots of novelty ideas for all ages. Toilets are said to be the cleanest in the world, you could eat your dinner off them, not that you would want too.

Great spot anytime of year. My office is close by, and so I get to see Bryant Park through all the seasons. In the warmer months, it's a pretty great place to bring a book and either grab lunch in the park or bring it from one of the many close restaurants. Even in the colder months, it's a great place to sit with a coffee and a friend. I also like it in the rain. Nice oasis in the middle of NYC.

Amazing space in the middle of NYC. We were there over the weekend and were surpirsed to see it all set up for the holidays. Heated tents to sell various goods as well as selected foods. Ice skating for all ages and even beer vendors.Amazing how quiet this place is even while in the middle of Manhattan.

Little oasis.. A great little spot for a break whilst shopping, although the park is full of stalls selling all kinds of stuff. There is an ice rink in the middle which wasn't too busy. We had a few drinks in a couple of the bars dotted around which helped make the stalls more bearable. Definitely worth a visit.
Have lunch here . It's a lovely little park with lots to see. Definitely grab a bite at any of the restaurants. Good for kids too
nice place to hang out. I was pleasantly surprised by the ice rink in the middle of the park and also all the booths with a variety of goods. There are plenty of places to eat/or drink also.
Ice skating and Christmas markets. Bryant Park is a pleasant spot to enjoy some casual outdoor eating and great people watching. It's cheaper to go ice skating here than at Rockefeller Center.
great. Great little park in midtown when we were there they had installed ice skating ring for the winter. A little oasis in the middle of the concrete jungle.
Sales in the park. Small stalls were placed overe much of the park. I found several imported items at great prices. Great day for walking and looking.

Great little park . The park is directly connected to the NY library and great for a stroll and to find some unique gifts. The art is great which is sold in the park and there are also little cute food stalls for a small bite. All in all a great place to enjoy some sun and peace in the big city.
Coffee al fresco. Open area with market stalls indoor ice rink when we went great place for a chat and a coffee worth a walk through

Perhaps my favorite NY park!. Bryant Park is lovely in all seasons. I was just there for the ice skating and the holiday market, but I have been in the past for summer concerts as well. The holiday market has great gifty-type stores, but also a LOT of food/coffee/dessert shops, so we had a great time watching the skaters and snacking.

A lovely spot for a stroll. Bryant Park has several little shops (covered so you can visit even in the rain) with nice seating areas with chairs and tables. Now that late fall has rolled around, the skating rink is open as well, and it has award-winning public restrooms. It's nice to visit by day when the shops are open, but even after dark it's a nice place just to walk around.

Shopping and skating and sitting.. The cute little shops in the old greenhouses were fun to walk through. The ice skating rink was neat and the cute little tables and chairs under umbrellas and benches under trees offered plenty of seating.

Great pop up shops, fun merchandise . Bryant Park is right by out hotel and they are promoting Winter Village. Great cold weather accessories, jewelry and food. There was a whole gluten free small pie shop. I picked up a gluten free pumpkin mini pie.
Awsome winter market and ice skating . Don't miss this. Great winter market with craft shops, food, and coffee etc. The skating here is not too crowded.

Loved!!!!. Bryant Park was set up with Christmas Vendors when I visited. They had the ice skating rink set up in the middle with the vendors set up all around the rink. Also helped that the weather was great and the leaves were turning colors. Would highly recommend this Park, it was very peaceful.
Favorite park. In summer nice classical music when I visited, now ice skating rink. Nice place to eat lunch with all the food places nearby
Midtown Manhattan oark. We were not here for a long time, but it was a great break from our walking excursion of midtown Manhattan. Its a fine place to stop and rest- to eat and enjoy.
Fun Holiday Markets. Lovely to see the stalls set up for the Holiday Markets as well as the skating rink almost ready for its official opening.

Christmas shopping. We were in the city in early November 2015. Bryant Park was already decked out with their merchants for Christmas shopping. We weren't shopping but it was fun to stroll around and sight-see.

Best Bathrooms in NYC!. Take a few moments to dawdle here by the Merry Go Round. Listen to the music, have a soft drink or two, play a game and enjoy a most beautiful park in one of the most hectic of cities in the world!
Great Time of Year to Visit. Lots of kiosks and the ice rink already in full action! A beautiful warm day for a stroll with a stop off at Bryant Park Grill!

Must-see Library!. A beautiful place, inside and out, the Stephen A. Schwarzman Building is a free must-see. Excellent art, permanent and changing exhibits, and an architectural gem. A beautiful, quiet oasis from the noise and bustle of mid-town!

Monday night movies.. Wow. The atmosphere here on a Monday night in the summer is magical. Step away from the typical touristy traps and experience what New Yorkers love about their city. A picnic in the park on Monday night to a HBO classic...
Calm in the heart of city life. Came across this place by accident in the evening after a show on broadway a really relaxing place, just a place to unwind and have glass of beer or wine and reflect

Love it in spring, love it in winter.. It's a perfect place for a coffee in the spring sunshine but the winter village adds a whole new fun side to Bryant. Really enjoyed perusing the stalls with a cup of hot cider, skating is always fun.

Great for running and great views. It is a beautiful park to go for a run and right by the water with views of Jersey City, Statue of Liberty. They usually put installations around the park that is interesting to visit and close to the pier to take ferries to JC.
An oasis. Great stop when your legs and feet start to scream for rest. You can have a snak or just admire the gardens and how they fit in the "glass" jungle.

2nd time at the Bryant Park Hotel and now don't think we will ever be able to stay anywhere else!. Fantastic location with a great outlook to Bryant Park, where there is always something interesting going on. Great service from all the staff we encountered during out stay. Good size room, and excellent facilities. We love it.

Pleasant Surprise. Was just trying to kill a few hours before heading to the airport when we stumbled across this pleasant little oasis. This time of the year there are little shoppiing carts and restaurants in tents. We watched office workers taking a break in a juggling "pit." and a Halloween decorated carrousel. Was a nice break from the frenzied pedestrians and noisy traffic.

Xmas Village & ice skating .. Let the Xmas spirit begins!. It's the time of the year where they will convert Bryant Park to a Christmas Village where there have little shops selling arts, gifts, food , etc and not to mention the great ice skating rink. I really enjoy this where you can just hang out and enjoy chocolate banana and peanut butter crepes, have a beers and absorb the atmosphere .. And then skate around the rink with the cool music! Just love this Xmas spirit.

Nothing very noteworthy.. Just a small place to sit in, if you are tired walking around. Nothing very note worthy. When we visited it in early October,m there was lot of construction activity going on. Did not understand what was the hulla-bulla about this place. Highly over-rated.

Crowded!. This could probably be the one to go if you are wanting to ice skate around Christmas time, the on in Rockefeller center can get really crowded and it could take you up to two hours before you actually get to do something there. Nice little park.
Great area in the middle of NYC. This is the BEST place in NYC after Oct 30. We were there on the 29th and it was good, but on the 30th it came alive.

Relax in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city. Nice square, very well maintained with restrooms. Nice park with some food stands where you can sit and relax and re-charge your batteries whilst visiting the city sights.Winter market starts in November, ice skating and Christmas goods.

Lovely place to spend some relaxing time, conveniently located!. We saw this small park during our hop-on-op-off tour and were glad to happen to bump into it on foot later. it reminded me of Paris with its free chairs and the lovely vegetation. After an overpriced soft drink at the café nearby the subway station, we walked around and found there were some tables where people played games of all sorts, e. g. rummikub (reminded me of Paris again!), and I really regretted not having more time to spend there!There was a Mariachi band soudnchecking and it seems there had been some kind of food fair, some stands of which were still selling. I could spend the entire day there!

Worth visiting. Located next to the New York Public Library, one of NY's architectural treasures. In the summer, people go and read in Bryant Park.In November and December there's an ice skating rink and a Christmas market with lots of nice shops and restaurants. Bunch of vegan options, from burgers to soups to vegan sushi and desserts.

Nice place to chill after a day of sightseeing.. On recommendation of a few friends, we decided to visit this small park. It was also on the way to our hotel.. Maybe it had to do with the time/date(October 2015, around 7pm) we were there but the park seemed unfinished: Lots of unfinished vendor stands with people working on them, supplemented by one or 2 bars. The bar we visited (in one of the corners of the park) was quite nice albeit slightly expensive. One thing to note is that if you need a restroom, you need to go to a public one on the side of the park (while you're paying $10 per small beer) but what can you do: it's a park...
Go skating in the evening. From the first of November on there is a free skating park in Bryant Park. So cool to skate with the New Yorkers in the evening with the Empire State just behind you....

A Lot of New Shops, Cafes and Places to Sit and Chat. My business colleague and I stopped in Bryant Park to drink our Starbucks and catch up. This was in November 2015. The park was jammed packed with people and had a lot of new little shops set up. We were told that this was special for the holiday season and that after January these shops would be closed down. There were also a couple of outdoor cafes. Bryant Park had a lot of outside tables and chairs where you could sit and hold a business or any type of conversation. Bryant Park is especially pleasant when it is nice sunny day as today was. Nearby by is the famous New York Library and Times Square.
Lovely park. Ice rink that is free to use. Little market shops and places to sit. Lots of small cute birds chattering away in the trees but aren't a nuisance. Lovely little park.

Amazing place. This is an amazing place so different from the hustle bustle of the busy New York City. There is always a fun activity going on here, so great place to walk around and enjoy. Tiny souvenir shops and eateries add on to the beauty of the place. Nov 15 to February 16, they have an ice skating rink ( dates might change). It is super fun to be here especially with friends around!
Loved the winter park. Great place for skating in the winter and far cheaper than central park. Everyone there was very helpful and the shops are nice to browse through.
Beautiful. It such a beautiful park to see at any time. Nov they set up shops, and an ice skating rink, it looks so beautiful.

My favorite holiday spot - and prettiest Christmas tree!. I love Bryant Park during the holidays. The Christmas tree is beautiful, set next to the ice skating rink (fun) and the holiday shops all around. Plus several nearby restaurants to make the trip to complete - as well as the library, which is a neat place to stop in and take a look around.

Totally underrated - beautiful park right next to the Public Library.. There was a lot of construction happening at this park which only makes me want to return to see it completed. It was a fountain, unbelievable trees, benches, cafes, it has it all!

Love this place!. It is such a joy to find a place where you can shop, take a sit, drink a coffee enjoying your time in the middle of the city. This little park is amazing. In the wintertime there is an ice skating rink and the music. I loved it!

Nice park right next to the Public library.. Nice park rightnext to the Public library. When we went last week they were obviously starting to prepare for the winter wonderland so apart from getting a coffee and having quick sit down for a coffee there wasn't a lot more that we could do. Think we went at the wrong time really but it looks like it would be lovely before and after the transformation!

Nice place. Visited this park in the evening, it was around 10 p.m. already. There were lots of people there, sitting, drinking coffee and having fun. It was more loud than central park (considering the location, it was quite peaceful). It was really nice to just sit there and look around.

Lovely to sitdown with a cup of coffee. Located just behind the New York Public Library Bryant Park is a lovely space to take a break and enjoy a cup of coffee.When we visited they were just in the progress of setting up the ice skating rink for the winter. We also enjoyed watching some young children enjoying the complementary books as well as taking a ride on the carousel. We could have also enjoyed playing a complementary board game (from a large selection available).

Christmas market at Byrant. Byrant park opened the Christmas market when we were in Manhattan on Oct 30th. interesting craft shops to wander and purchase unique Christmas gifts for friends and family. It included a number of Christmas ornament shops as well. Prices ranged from cheap to expensive so there was something for everyone. And then when that is done you can ice skate or drink delicious hot chocolate while watching others ice skate!

Bryant Park is an amazing hang-out place in the heart of New York.. We just happened to walk right into this park one evening. There were lots of tiny shops with a variety of crafts and food. The skating people looked like they were having fun, but we walked a lot during the day, so were happy to find some table with chairs and we had a good rest under the London Slate trees. We were very surprised to see 2 table tennis tables that were surrended by friendly competing people. The shop owners were friendly, but not pushy. I was chatting with one about how they stained the store furniture. I was glad we found this nice place.

My favourite place.. During the last week of october this place transforms to a winter wonderland with skating and adorable shops... I simply love this place... an easy stroll through the markets.. relaxing amongst the hustle and bustle of the city.
Cute small park. Good to pop in if you are walking by. Vendors and some things for the kids to do. Safe location as well.

Haven in the high rise. A great little park to sit and watch the world go by. It's at the back of the library made famous in the film ghostbusters. There is a kiosk for coffee and a restaurant and always some sort of activity going on like yoga or plays.
Paradise in the middle of midtown. There is always so much going on in Bryant Park. Whether its a movie night or drinks at the bar, its a great little escape right in the middle of mid town.

Holiday market and ice skating add to the charm of this partk.. Popped in for a quick visit while walking down to Madison Square Garden. The ice rink was bustling and there were tons of little stalls filled with things to buy as holiday gifts. Am very sad I didn't have the time to explore them more thoroughly.
Great . When we visited they were setting up the Christmas stalls and ice rink. One day there was a bird talk. Plenty of seats. Check out on line what is going on
A park with a view. this park is right behind the big library on 5th ave. perfect place to enjoy lunch. and if your there in the summer they show free movies in the evening.

Lively park behind the library, near Times Square. We walked past the park on our way to Times Square and stopped for a drink in one of the many bars behind the library. There were many people enjoying the park and the restaurants/bars despite the torrential rain that started soon after we arrived! There is a skating rink in the winter, and apparently they have films in the summer outside. It's worth a stop if you're in the area.

Lovely Historic Park with Lots of Character. Bryant Park always reminds me of some of the parks and outdoor markets I have visited in Europe. The stalls and outdoor cafes are a nice diversion from the busy streets of Manhattan -- great place to sit for a beer and relaxing lunch.

My favourite park. I should start by saying that I LOVE all NY parks but this was definitely my favourite. There are chairs everywhere for you to sit and people watch and a few food places arond.Brilliant for a mid day rest of your weary feet!
None. This is my favorite spot in nyc. Love the stores. Love the people watching. Love the outside bar with fire pit. Great food great people great place

Enjoy it in summer and winter. Pay a visit to this small delicious park on the 42nd near to the Public Library on the way to the Chrisler building. During the Summer early morning squirrels everywhere coming to eat from your hands; have a burger @ original Shake Shak, a bear or a cocktail @ Briant park cafe, come in the week end and see people laying on the grass, relaxing, reading surrounded by skyscrapers... Come in the winter to ice skating

A quiet haven in the middle of New York. My friend and I spent 2 lovely hours in Bryant Park, it was being refurbished (building the ice rink) so the outlet huts were empty but we were still able to get coffee's etc. we sat for 2 hours in the sun chatting, looking at the skyline through the trees and watching the world go by. A Great Space to chill, the ice rink and 'Winter Wonderland' is magical but unfortunately we missed it be a couple of days. I was lucky enough to see it 10 years ago though, one of my favourite places in NY.
Always something happening. We walked through as they were setting up for the Christmas Market. An interesting space with lots of activities, just a stone's throw from the craziness of Times Square.

Vibrant neighbourhood park. Stumbled upon this little gem of a park which was not far from our hotel. Free and fun. You can have a game of table tennis, pull up a chair to read or borrow a game to play (we chose Guess Who) all while watching the mass communal yoga on the green.

Nice park. Lots of small 'sheds' selling a variety of goods; jewellery, cosmetics, ornaments etc. Like a Christmas market, not sure if its there all year. There were just getting the skating rink ready. This is free except for skate hire. Nice place to sit and watch the world go by.

Christmas construction right now---Oct 2015. Oct 2015...they are installing a major size shopping experience in this park, thus it is not really a "Park" right now...after holidays, I assume will be the park again...

Magical place during winter. Absolutely magical during evening. The big rink, the delicious food stands, the absolutely coolest shops in town with the best gift options in the whole city and the incredible music in the background from tje giant speakers make this an incredible spot. Don't skip no matter what!
Public restrooms are at place.

Always need to visit my favourite little park in NYC. My daughter, friends and I visited the park a couple of times this trip. It's really a very special place to get a real sense of NYC. I love that the locals sit and enjoy a coffee and game of chess or cards.
Nice place . Stopped here there is a bar restaurant in the park and it's well worth stopping here and watch the world go by , there is always something going on .

Great Free Ice Skating In Winter. Another wonderful New York Experience: Skating in winter, free, at Bryant Park's wonderful huge rink. The trick for an inexpensive trip is to bring your own skates. You can rent skates there, if you need to, but bringing some (even just for the kids) really keeps the costs down. There are wonderful little shops with jewelry, gifts, and artisan foods all around the rink, and heated outdoor cafes to get hot chocolate, something stronger, or even a meal. It is a romantic idea for a date (my adolescent kids all thought so), a great family venue, a good place to meet a friend and have a drink and a skate. Or don't skate...shop, watch the skaters, walk around and soak up the atmosphere.

Gorgeous Christmas Stalls. The scene in Bryant Park during winter is almost magical. We visited a ew days after Christmas and all the stalls were still up. There were a huge selection of different things on offer in the stalls that were great for presents for people. The view around the park was amazing and was definitely one of my favourite evening that I spent in NYC.
Ice skating. Be sure not to miss ice skating in Bryant park around christmas. It is truly a memorable visit to one of the most famous locations in the world

Bryant Park during the Holidays. No trip to New York during the holidays is complete without a visit to Bryant Park. The dozens upon dozens of small shops are filled with unique last minute gift items for friends and family. The ice rink is nearby to watch the skaters. Food stands are just waiting for you with hot chocolate, cider, coffee, all types of food to snack on. Plenty of chairs to sit and take a break. Short walk from Broadway. Nothing fancy, just plain old fashioned shopping New York style.
Very nice park, now with a ice rink. Very nice park!!, really nice behind NYC library! its really big. Now in winter they are construction a ice rink!!!
Always something to see. especially in winter with the ice skating. I love to wander around the outdoor shops. The artisans have unique jewelry and other hand-made crafts to browse.
Go for a Concert!. We happened on a free concert and took a table at the restaurant in the park. It was a lovely way to spend some time on a beautiful day.

best park ever. big,clean,peaceful green area..we enjoyed so much with friends..you can either have a picnic or watch a theatre there..
and I can't forget the amazing building in front of the park..
You must see the holiday market at Bryant Park!. Great evening stroll after dinner or mid day relax with a coffee or wine. Tranquility in the middle of the city.

Bryant Park walkthrough.. Just getting the new ice rink ready for the upcoming holidays. Beautiful inter-city park. Centrally located and well maintained. The surrounding buildings are beautiful and it's located around the corner from the New York City Public Library.

Wonderful place in which to chill. I live only blocks away, and I consider this park my backyard. It's an oasis from the tumult and stress of Manhattan. Outdoor reading rooms, games, juggling, movies, meditation and yoga classes, ice skating in winter...-the list goes on. For a genuine taste of one of the joys of New York living, a little while at the park is well spent.
I Love It!. Bryant Park is undoubtedly one of the great surprises regalatemi the Big Apple! A city park in the middle of the chaos of New York, where a stop both day and night ... spellbinding !!!

Nothing too special. Bryant Park is a decent place to enjoy lunch, but there's nothing too special about it (especially relative to other parks in the city). Also, parking here can be a real hassle. Either take the subway or book parking in advance through an app/website like SpotHero.

Very enjoyable place to spend time now that the weather is cooling down. We recently stayed in NYC for a few days and greatly enjoyed our stop at Bryant Park, finding it a most enjoyable place to spend time during this time of year when the weather is beginning to cool down. Trees are still flush green, food stands like Le Pain Quotidien and the smaller coffee kiosks are open and serving, the game tables still going strong on the south side of the park, carousel operating, just great. It is nice to see Bryant Park lively and being fully utilised by local residents and visitors. Autumn does seem to be a good time to spend time in Bryant Park for anyone looking for a bit of green space and escape from the chaos of the city streets.Grounds were being laid for the Christmas Market stalls and the ice-rink which should go up soon and be ready for visitors intending to be in New York during the upcoming winter and holiday season.

Something for everyone...and free wifi!. A beautiful park in the middle of Manhattan with something for everyone. There are ping pong tables, people playing chess at tables, a cafe , places to sit and read and also free wifi! What more can you ask? Seasonal activities make this a fun place to visit, they were putting in an ice rink and lots of artisan booths selling jewellery and cookies etc round the oark when we visited in October.

Surprising. Tucked amongst the many tall buildings we found this little oasis. There are seats, food kiosks and even nice toilets! They were just assembling the ice rink for winter when we were there.
Wonderful place to just hang!. Great place to people watch and hang out. Whether warm or cold, day or night, a treat for sure. Not to be missed!

Gorgeous little spot.. Took advantage of the chance to sit and enjoy lunch among the trees. Lots of seating, a bar, several food options around the park. Also, as of Oct 30, the skating rink will be operational.
Gorgeous. Getting ready for ice skating, amazing seeing the builders full throttle at 11pm,nice stores and cafes
Lovely little find. Lovely park hidden away behind the bustle and neon of Times Square.Perfect spot to catch some sun and chill out, beautiful.
Lovely spot of green in a bustling city. I love going to Bryant Park when I am in NYC. It's a lovely park with loads of seats and it was the Belgian waffle truck there too now! Yum!!
A quiet oasis in the centre of a busy city.. What a difference since our first visit toNew York. This people financed park is something the locals shoo;d be very proud of.
stop and catch your breath. Nice surprise to see inviting place to regroup and do some people watching after hectic experience of trying to find the right train!

Located behind the beautiful NY Public Library. The place is homey with so many things going on. Carousel, people drinking coffee, playing chess, beautiful buildings surrounding it. A little park paradise centered within the chaos. I love both. A great place to unwind and take in the beauty of NYC.

NYC Christmas!. Bryant Park is a favorite spot in NYC at Christmastime. It is free to the public. Beautiful fountain in the front of the park. Skating is nice to participate in, or just watch. Lots of fun to people watch. Unique shopping with lots of vendors in little greenhouse-like structures. Don't miss the french hot chocolate. BEST tree in NYC. Yes I said it... Prefer this tree to Rockefeller Center tree!

wonderful park. A great oasis so close to Times Square. Restaurant in the park & lots of great cafes around the park especially Maison Kayser. The park was being set up for winter ice skating when we were there.
Oasis in the center of the city. New York City is one of the best at incorporating serene park spaces in the middle of the controlled chaos of the city. Great place to go and eat take out lunch.
Great People Watching. Ice skate in the winter, picnic in the summer, watch the leaves turn in the fall and the flowers bloom in the spring .... some of the best people watching NYC has to offer.
Time to rest. A peaceful and relaxing place to rest awhile. Plenty of places to sit and people watch while you enjoy a refreshing drink.

Great Green Space in Manhattan. Spend as much time as you can in Bryant Park, its a great place to gather and spend time with friends. as winter approaches the Holiday season brings tons of vendors to the park and that's always fun to shop there for the season.
Good and nice. Good and nice place. Interesting for all ages. If you can't to do something , see and enjoy how another do that.
Pleasant green area. Pleasant green area amid concret. Not easy to see if you are not looking for it. Wonderful space, beautiful view.
NYC for free. A great space in the middle of NYC for free. a major chill out space with lots going on table tennis art it's all there
Sorry to be between two seasons. Charming park ? Most probably if you are not between two seasons and discover a big building site in the middle to get prepared for Xmas
Pleasant, relaxing park. This park is right next to the New York Public Library. We visited in October and the plants were still in bloom - quite a pretty little park! Great spot to people watch!
Park activities. Loved all this different venues including the yoga class, the kiddie class, and the beauty of the park

Ajacent to the NY Public Library. Beautiful spot of green. We sat and enjoyed people watching there and planned our next location to see. NY Library brings out rolling book shelves for an outdoor reading rooms.

Under construction / remodel.. Under construction / remodel now.
Great for people watching.
Lots of small food vendors.
Active crowd milling about.

Sit down, relax and enjoy!. Perfect green square with lots of chairs. Great location to just sit down; watch people or read a book. There are also often performances (concerts, movies etc.) - so keep an eye out for that!

Relaxing Afternoon. There is so much to do in this park. It is a little oasis among all the skyscrapers. Grab a coffee and chat with a friend or people watch by yourself, have lunch from on e of several cafes or restaurants, play a game of chess with some serious chess players, play a little ping pong, or just relax and read a book while listening to someone playing music.

A mini spot of green in a lovely location. A little oasis of green and a great place to book a hotel around (lots of reasonably priced places)Lots of tables to sit at as well as loads of places to eat. We didn't spend long there but I can see it being a hub in the summer. Lovely!

A park for all seasons. Even on an early morning in late September, the park held a quaint charm conducive for reading, picnicking, visiting in a compact urban oasis. Now that I have found this park, I look forward to seeing how it dresses in another season.

Nice place for a respite from mid town Manhattan. The day we went (over Thanksgiving weekend) there was a great crafts market filled with local artisans and their wares. So much fun and a nice change from the department store shopping in the area.
Hidden gem. Interesting park behind the New York Public Library building. They were building a free skating rink while we were there. Free board games available, a bar with swing seats. Lots of fun.

Center of Midtown. Surrounded by skyscrapers this backyard of the New York Public Library is just that.
Seating, games,even reading areas dot the park. Oh yes a carousel and bar for the opposite ends of interests.
Come November a Christmas Village and skating rink, make the Park a great stop when seeing the Christmas lights and windows.

Lovely little park. Centrally located in Midtown. It's a small, quaint park. An oasis in the middle of the busy city. The French carousel is a nice touch as well as the children's library. The park was being prepped for ice skating while we were there.

extradonary place. Theres ice skating in the winter and shops to buy things food to eat restaurants music concerts all year round you have to look schedules they light their own tree I loved it went their with my sister spend the evening it was great.

Green space. Good to find somewhere to sit in a green park while surrounded by skyscrapers. Sometimes you just need to rest your legs. There are some snack eateries in the park but we didn't sample any as had lunch at the grand central station. Ok, I know there is the huge Central Park but there are not many green parks in manhattan.

Never a full moment. There is always something happen here especially during the summer.....packed with activities. Fall and winter is still enjoyable since it is so near to Times Square, it is good to go to observe a New York minute from the sidelines

Beautiful Park in the Middle of the Chaos. This park is definitely a great spot to take a break and enjoy NYC. Not too big, though, so it can get crowded. You can also iceskate here in the winter! Great views of the Empire State Building too, and it's right next to the New York Public Library.

A special treat for all seasons. One of my favorite things to do when I am in Midtown at sunset (or at night) is to walk on 40th Street, West of Fifth Avenue, stroll along the Southern side of the New York Public Library and, as I reach the end of the building, look up, through the trees of Bryant Park and look up at the incredible dynamicity and electricity of the skyscrapers, which seem to englobe this small, yet enchanting jewel which is Bryant Park. Come in Winter for a fun-filled experience on the ice skating rink r some holiday shopping, or in Summer for one of their open-air free movie nights. Or even in the Fall, and stop by the melancholic Merry-go-Around, with kids laughing while accompanied by songs of Edith Piaff... And in all seasons, enjoy some lunch or dinner at the restaurant overlooking the lawn.

Happiest Spot in New York . To me on the happiest spots in New York is Bryant Park. It's small, classy and centrally located behind the library. Each season has a new delightful charm, fashion shows, bocce ball, markets or ice skating it's a hub of activity all year long. It's where New Yorkers and tourist meet to enjoy the outdoors. I love to find a table, sip a coffee and just people watch here. This is New York at it's very best!

An oasis in the middle of midtown. Movies, concerts, chess, read, relax!. Byrant Park is a true oasis in the middle of mid-town. It offers a place to sit down and bring your own lunch (lots of free chairs and tables, a large lawn in the center, a carousel for the children (or kids at heart), a 'reading room' in the summer, and space for free concerts (midday often) and movies (every Monday evening in the summer). This beautiful park in the 'back' of the Public Library building also has an ice-rink in the winter, and a holiday-market full of wonderful booths during the holiday season, but no matter what else is going on, there is always a place to sit down quietly and enjoy a small break in a well-tended, diversely visited garden in the middle of the busy city. There are even (rare in NYC) public restrooms, that can be surprisingly clean a lot of the time.
Lovely little park - a must see. The park was just being fitted out with festive holiday stalls and an ice rink. It has a lovely fountain and is nice to just sit and watch the world go by!

Oasis in Midtown Manhattan. Bryant Park is a wonderful place in any season. In the summer there are outdoor movies on the lawn, people playing checkers, chess, and bocce. There is a lending library, jugglers learning and showing their skills, concerts and people just soaking up the sun on the lawn. There is a carousel for the kids.In the late fall and early winter there are dozens of shops that sell everything from jewelry, hand made goods, skin care items, art, tea, food, candy and novelties. It is decorated for the holiday season with the center of the park being a beautiful ice-skating rink.This park even has its own restaurant, the Bryant Park Grill, that looks out on the rink or open grassy area depending on the season.If you are around the Times Square area or visiting the New York Public Library which is just in front of the park, you should definitely visit this park.

Cute park in early Fall. This is such a pretty park. Not huge, but has a lovely bar at one end with lots of outdoor tables when we were there in late Sept.Centrally located right in Manhattan Midtown. It was spotlighted the evening we were there. We just had to stop and people watch.

A must see every season.. The park changes with the seasons and is a tranquil space in the midst of a city. The Carousel in spring, summer, fall, the ice skating rink and shops for the Holiday season, restaurants and bars and lots of seating make it an ideal location to relax and enjoy.

Winter Village. If you happen to be in New York City during the holidays, you MUST stop off at the Bryant Park Winter Village. The vendors are super, the food vendors are great. Haven't tried the ice skating, but, ..... there's so much to see and do!!! The Christmas tree is simply breath taking!!!!! Must see!!! They set up October 30 and goes on thru Christmas. It's outdoors, but, who's afraid of a little cold and great shopping!!! The hot chocolates are a must.
Ice skating and movies. We go for the outdoor ice skating every winter. They have great shops along the perimiter. In the summer we go for the free outdoor films. Love it.
Average small park. Nice park, with some places to eat but it's small. Nothing special.If you are going to Grand Central Terminal from south you can pass here and see.
Whats not to love?. From the morning Yoga, to the free movies on the lawn during summer, & the holiday village? This is one of my favorite parks in NY.

I love Bryant Park.. I walk through the Park almost every day and often enjoy lunch there. It is a small oasis in the Time Square area. In the summer you can learn to juggle, play chess or check out reading materials from the mini outdoor library. In the Winter you can ice skate and enjoy all the reflected light from near by buildings. Just about any time of the year there are events here - and it is a good place to spot celebrities. At Christmas time they have a great Christmas market. You can have a hot cocoa and get some of your Christmas shopping done with the unique vendors.
Pretty Park. Pretty little park, which during the holiday season turns in to a skating ring - they were just building it when we were there

relaxing spot to take a break. We stopped at Bryant Park several times. There are several things to do but we were just relaxing and eating lunch. Skip the hot dog stand on the street and instead, purchase food from one of several restaurants across the street--Pret Manger, Jax, etc. The food and drink choices were great, ready to go, reasonably priced and range from indulgent to deliciously healthy.

Relax for a moment..... On our last day in New York, my friends and I decided to visit Time Square, where we promptly split company to do some last minute exploring (me) and shopping (them) before our flight back to L.A.What a nice discovery this was...Bryant Park! Just a lovely little oasis in the middle of the city, perfect for people-watching and just getting away from the hustle and bustle of NYC.Free wifi, a reading area that provides magazines and books, areas set aside for chess or miniature golf, lots of dining options....it's all here. You see everything from young couples lost in conversation, to a pigeon perched atop the head of William Earl Dodge's statue to a dignified, well-dressed matron you'd expect was one of those "ladies who lunch" that you read about....except that this one had big pink polka dots painted on her face. Only in NY, I guess.Everyone knows about Central Park, but this park, although smaller, is just as charming and offers a calming respite for locals and tourists alike.

Oasis. Lovely little park in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of NYC.Plenty of chairs and tables,exceptionally clean toilets, nice coffee hut.Just a nice place to sit a while and chat or just people watch.

Fun day at the park. There's nothing quite like a fall day in NYC. With many sights to see and limited time to see them all in Bryant Park was a relaxing break from the madness. Bryant Park was not even on our radar and my girlfriend and I proceeded with our yearly jaunt into the city. It was about the time between "isn't this great and I really need to sit down" that we stumbled on the park. Upon entering the park you can't help but notice the wonderful fountain bursting forth in all it's glory. The patrons were just lingering there taking in the beauty the fountain was offering. The leaves were turning, and the sun was casting a wonderful glow over mother nature. As we joined the on lookers in the park it was a wonderful feeling to sit and feel just for a moment refreshed. Plenty of tables and chairs peppered the park for places to take in the magnificent views.After a few minutes of rest we were off and running again. It wasn't long before this wonderful sight caught our eye. We found the carousal, age doesn't matter, everyone needs to reach in and feel their inner child. Time for a ride. This being my birthday lucky me I got an extra long ride on the magnificent beast. Fond memories flooded back and yes it was great to be a child again.After a walk thru the park it was on to the rest of the itinerary we had for our day. I will always remember the park and that lovely ride. So if you need a place for solace in the midst of the hubbub of midtown, consider Bryan Park you won't be sorry.

Wonderful surprise!. We went to the park the first day of our visit since it was near our hotel and we were exploring the neigborhood. Loved it and visited almost every day of our honeymoon. It is amazing and has a wonderful view of the surrounding skyscrapers. Also very nice for breakfast!

Relax and rest your legs awhile. On /near/42nd. Twixt Times Square and other attractions. Great situation for a rest in both directions and to have a look at your map when you have undertaken a walk around the numerous tourist must- sees. Plenty of seating and greenery. Refreshments and snacks available; some of the outlets are seasonal.

A Good Place for an Al Fresco Lunch. Not advertised as a tourist attraction, this is one of central Manhatten's few green spaces of any size. Grab a lunch from one of the many delis nearby and join the city workers in the park. There is always some free entertainment.
Green space. Just next to the library and it provides so much shade. A nice leafy spot to sit and read with heaps of seating

NYC's mid town oasis.. Sitting right behind the NYC public library and steps away from Times Square, this little park has it all, no matter the season. In the summer, you can grab a book from the free reading stacks, settle down at one of the many chairs and tables, sip on an iced coffee and enjoy the shade under the towering trees in Bryant Park.In the winter - especially around Christmas - the park is transformed into a little winter village, with a skating rink and a multitude of vendors selling their wares from white 'huts' that line the walkways... No matter the season, there s always something happening there (check out their website) and it's a great place to rest, regroup and carry on with the rest of your NYC day.
Christmas Market & Skating. Free skating (have to pay for a locker and skate hire) and a host of market stalls offering a range of goods and hot food and drinks. Great winter attraction.
Construction. There was construction going on in and around the park. A bit noisy, but we still stopped to enjoy the area and take a rest.
Jewel in midtown. Bryant Park is a really nice mini park in midtown. Lots of places to sit and people watch. Plenty of things going on in the summer and ice skating in the winter. Love it.
Lovely oasis in a busy midtown . You can relax and spend ,some quiet time here. Safe, green, steps from all g b r midtown action. What is not to love here?
Green space. A very pleasant leafy park in the centre of a very busy part of the city. It must be a lovely cool place to sit in the height of summer.
Bryant Park. Pleasant park with good facilities. Best toilet in New York! Only place to be sure of getting The Loop Hop on Hop off Bus.

A walk in the park. In the middle of the busy "big apple" this oasis of tranquility irrevocably invites you to be visited. There are free seats and nice terraces to have a drink or to eat a typical "hamburger". You hardly are disturbed by the car noice as it is a really green spot to take fresh air and power to continue afterwards your walk or visit. A real must !!!!

An oasis of calm!. This is a great little place - just behind the library. Shady trees, rare birds, provided tables and chairs this is a wonderful place to chill - speaking of which they lay on an ice rink in the winter.

Superb NYC Central escape. Who doesn't love Bryant Park? I was introduced to this super location by an NJ resident who wasn't wrong on its beauty and sheer quality. Visited here at Christmas time and it was truly magical with stalls, ice rink and so many food stalls it was amazing. Also visited here in the spring time and its quite different.
