A super escape in the heart of NYC, very urban, always friendly folk to chat to and a great place for a coffee and a chill out anytime of the year, anytime of the day.

Kick back and enjoy.. Walking distance from the New York Public Library, it's a place to sit have lunch or coffee. New York at its finest. A Bohemia feel. On occasion you will treated with Broadway performance or film in the park. Great during fashion week. Worth a visit. If you ever need to use a public restroom you would be amazingly and pleasantly surprised.

Winter Village - so fun and festive!. Really enjoyed spending some time here over Christmas - the market stalls, the ice rink and the decorations - all made for a really good time. Definitely recommend a visit!

Beautiful Park for Lunch, Dinner & Drinks and Meeting Friends. What a fun park! There are people here at all hours of the day, enjoying lunch or dinner and playing chess, Ping-Pong, golf and other games. In October they were preparing to put in a ice skating rink. The beautiful New York Public Library is at one end, Times Square is just two blocks away and the Empire State Building is about four blocks away. The park has its own subway station. We purchased lunch at a restaurant across the street and sat in the park at one of the tables with the rest of the lunch crowd.

Wish we could do it like this. walked through the park, just loved the fact that there was tables and chairs everywhere, just to sit and watch the other people go sit down have lunch, some people playing chess, some playing boules, and there was even a free reading room .Also the cleanest toilets in New York .
A great find. Fantastic little park right outside the New York Public Library. You can bring your lunch or a cuppa,and relax here and soak up the surrounds on 5th Ave. I love it.

ALWAYS COOL. I have been coming to Bryant Park forever. I love it in May when the lawn is open and hundreds of people sit around enjoying a relaxing time. This place converts to a beautiful kiosk type mall in the winter, again, a fantastic place to be.
Chilled Out. Great place to have a sit down and relax , with a coffee, or wine .in a small park in the middle of sky scrapers ,
Stunning. Just a gorgeous part of Manhattan, always so nice to visit. Whether its random guys reciting poetry and playing ping pong there is always something happening.

A delightful oasis in New York. Providing the weather is OK then Bryant Park is quite delightful. A place to rest sit down and have a coffee. There are lots of seats, a number of kiosks and you can also take advantage of the books available or play games.

Cute park. Stayed right next to it at the Residence Inn by Marriott and hence passed this park a lot, in fact spent the first evening in NYC here. Nice cute park with some outdoor activities happening all the time I was there

Calm in the midst of the storm. Bryant Park is a few minutes from Times Square and situated amongst all the hustle and bustle of NYC and yet is calm and quiet and great place to spend a hour. There are interesting sellers there, refreshment kiosks, seating under the tress, often entertainment taking place and it shows the opposite side of NYC to all the hype and city noise and fast pace........but right there, surrounded by it all. A great place to take a breather, grab a drink and just relax before heading into the rush of the city again
A great place to meet and have a break while in NYC. Great location next to the NYC amaZing Library. Grab a table, people watch - highly recommended place that's a favorite spot for many New Yorkers
Beautiful park in the heart of the city. Park is right behind metropolitan library, it has a carousel and two restaurants bordering the park with outside patiosLots of seating throughout the park
Nice. Had a drink at. Bar here. Nice open space in the middle of chaos. Good to people watch and rest your feet the wine is on the pricey side

Spend at least one afternoon here. Wow, what a fantastic piece of parkland just south of the theatre district on 42nd street. We purchased a sandwich nearby, easily found a beautiful spot at a table in the shade, sat back, ate our lunch. Although there is a lot of people that gather here, it feels so peaceful to sit, eat, read or just people watch. After we ate our lunch, we wandered around Bryant Park, there was a pianist playing, jugglers, yoga and merry go round for the kiddies. There is a small section of the park, where you can put away your electronic devices and play the old style games like checkers, draughts, guess who and lots more. A great find in busy NYC.

Christmas Markets. We had a wonderful time here wandering around all the market stalls set up for Christmas and watching the ice skaters sliding around the ice rink. Great place to visit with children.
Small spot in the city. A nice little green area in the city. Coffee shops in front, and a nice view on the landmarks/buildings around.

Really nice park, cleanest bathrooms. Stopped at the park for Lunch, really nice small park, has chairs, tables, trees and more trees! ping pong table, putting green all courtesy of NYC Parks Department. The food is expensive but the views unbeatable.
Lovely oasis in the middle of the city. This is a lovely park in the middle of the madness of Midtown and Times Square. We just sat down and people watched, The park is well looked after and a joy

Piece of Heaven. Bryant Park was the first and last place we visited on our amazing trip. On Our first day we sat, had a drink at the cute bar - order the Sangria, and watched a bocci ball competition that was so competitive and professional!! What a dream this park was!! All the trees, grass, birds, carousel, reading room, ping pong, some stick game,fountain, Waffles and Dings, and the cleanest public washrooms in New York!!! The next day as we walked through " our park" we came about a commotion!! All the grass in the middle of the park was pulled up and the preparations for a ice rink the size of a football field is being installed with great care!! The park is still beautiful and full of fun activities!! We went through this park a couple times a day and it definitely is a slice of heaven!!! Also, easy access to the subway line on either side of this park.

Nice Place to Rest. If you've spent all day on your feet, exploring the streets of New York, this is a good place to take a break and just breathe. There are a lot of small tables to sit down at and just enjoy the nature.

Lovely place to have lunch, a coffe or just sit on the grass and enjoy the autumn sun.. We just sat on the grass and enjoy the surroundings. a lot of people were at their lunch break sitting on the outside tables of the restaurants or just sitting on the benches of the park.

Small but well-maintained. This mid-town park - the one with the clean bathrooms! - is a pleasant oasis just behind the NY Public Library main facility. Tables and chairs available, as well as a cute kiddie carousel.
walk in the park. we just strolled around and took in the views, sat and had a picnic . lot of history here good place for kids to run around in too.

Relax and enjoy!!. Bryant Park seems to be always packed regardless what time of the day I visited. I have been here several times now, and it's always fun to see everyone enjoying themselves. There are plenty of tables and chairs outside the grassy area, a fountain to keep you cool during the warm summer months, and movie nights happens here too during the week I was told. Bryant Park also has one of the most beautiful views of buildings.There are also a few places nearby here for coffee or drinks, and on the sidewalks, there are plenty of hot dog stands that will make you feel like a New Yorker.Whatever Bryant Park is for you, be it love, hope or inspiration, enjoy your time here because this is what this park is all about!! Until then, Cheers! ~ :p
Midtown Melllow. This park is a chill spot to take a break, catch some local recreation (ping pong, chess, checkers),

European style park with nice food options, ping pong and people watching behind the NYC public library. Found this gem by accident. Had a great latte and some very good croissants/pain au chocolats and watched the people. Nice respite in a very busy section of the city.

Beautiful quaint little park. . This beautiful little oasis on a warm September day refreshed us! To walk through watching the chess players, the people lounging and enjoying each other's company. A gem of this amazing city.
Sunday brunch. Beautiful Sunday weather. We had a delightful brunch in Bryant Park. The setting was perfect and so was the service. Caters to tourists. afterwards a wonderful stroll thru the park.

Just like the movies. A carousel, at least 20 languages overheard, chess players, sun bathers, plants, trees, flowers and next to the NY Public Library. Compared to Central Park, it is downright cozy but just as beautiful. Plan to spend some time. As they say, stop and smell the flowers. Peaceful, serene and rejuvenating.

Great lunch spot on a nice day. Stop by Bryant Park for lunch on a sunny day - it's got heaps of seating and there always seems to be something going on. There's lots of cafe's nearby to pick up something to eat. Blue Stone Lane on 43rd and 6th is a block away and does the best coffee in town!

A Hidden Gem. We have been to NYC numerous times but did not know about this hidden gem until researching for our latest visit to NYC. How could we have missed this park? It is located right behind the NYC Public Library. A great place to relax, have a cup of java and people watch. It is also a nice break from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Christmas sparkles . Spent a lovely afternoon walking around the market stalls and watch the ice skating. It was beautifully decorated and felt very festive

great for enjoying lunch in manhattan!. Bryant Park is an excellent place to have lunch outdoors in crowded Manhattan, lots of tables and chairs and plenty of food options in nearby shops. Just take your food and enjoy a picnic!.
Really close to Grand central Station and NYC Public Library.

Very proud of New Yorkers. I have been to New York several times and never seen this park until it was pointed out by our walking tour guide. We found it very pretty and relaxing. An oasis on a hectic city. The story is even more remarkable,I haven;t see it because people didnt use to go there, not even the police as it was full of unpleasant characters. But the neighbours got together, cleaned the park and now maintain it with their own funds. At least that is what the guide told us, this being true I really take my hat out to the citizens that care so much for their city

An oasis in a concrete jungle. I love the park in any season of the year, but spring and summer are the best, it's so relaxing with great restaurants in the park and in the nearby streets, lots of people and so great vibe. love it!

Perfect place to take a break . In the shopping mile of the 5 ave you need a place to stop and rest. Behind the public library you can find this perfect spot to give your self a time to rest and catch you breath for the next stores ahead This is a good place to go in Summer in Winter the the is no much life in this area. To coold
Great park. I wished I had more time to spend at Bryant park, very nice little clean park! like Central park if you visit new York it's a must stop!

A breath of green in midtown Manhattan. Adjoining the New York Public Library, Bryant Park is a lovely counterpoint of much-needed natural landscape. Though still buzzing with the sounds of the city, it offers a respite from the hectic pace of the surrounding area. A great place for taking a few moments to relax and think.

Hidden gem. Which ever angle you enter your leaving/ turning the corner from high rises and you come across this small garden, not really a park, it is beautifully planted with trees/ flowers, you can get coffee,pastries etc, but what's best is to sit and watch the madness of those around you on the streets as they rush past, it's such a chilled place.

How have I missed this?. I've been to New York many times and somehow missed this park. It is just beautiful...day or night. At night, the Empire State Building can be seen through the trees and is so cool. Take a few minutes to check it out.

Pretty but no depth. Like so many restaurants that offer special locations(think: waterfront, atop a tall building,etc), this one trades its Bryant Park site for less then valued food. Nothing was wrong with the selection or even the look, the problem was taste-nothing tasted special , it all tasted common; maybe even industrial.The kind of place you go once and then let 5 years go before trying again and finding out its only 'okay'.

Best escape ever.. On a whirlwind tour of the city and it all gets too much for you. Head to Bryant Park, a small gem perfect for a brief respite. With the feel of a Old World park it has places to eat, chairs upon which to sit, large tress to give shade, and a grassy lawn to enjoy the sunshine. Of course there is a fountain and a very small carousel for children, but it also has areas for playing games such as table tennis and Petanque, and a library area in a quiet zone where you can borrow a book. It also has daily activities such as bird watching and an art cart. I returned for an evening stroll and especially enjoyed a Sunday morning visit.

Take a break in the city. Beautiful park behind the library. Several small food kiosks for breakfast coffees and light lunch. People watching is outstanding (and not in a bad way, just lots of folks to watch). Free reading material if you have extra time. During our stay we had a breakfast and lunch break in this park due to its great location. Convenient short walk from Times Square, 5th avenue, Broadway and the like if you need a quiet time.
Amazing. The most beautiful square even the Rockefeller center! You´ve got everything to do and to see here! Can eat, buy stuff and take many many pictures

Cute Park. We visited this Park many times, its a place to sit and relax and have a bite, walk around the park and check every bit of it, grab a book and read, then visit the NYC Library next to it. We fall in love with this Park
Bryant Park is a great hangout!. This is a very cool place to sit, have a coffee and people watch... or have a game of chess if that is your thing!

Rest & Refuel. Really cute park in the midst of everything we went there a few times during the afternoon to take a short break and have a quick bite to eat and drink. Ideal with all the tables and chairs on the grass and the proximity of a public bathroom, McDo, Pizza place, etc.
Pleasant Park. Nice place to site and enjoy a coffee and the sites. Check their schedule for free outdoor entertainment.

Great spot for an hour to relax. One of our favorite spots to enjoy an hour among the trees. Bryant Park has so much to offer.offer - towering trees, surrounded by even taller buildings, and wonderful cage tables and chairs. You can choose to sit by the fountain and enjoy the gardens and the birds, perhaps read a book or a magazine in the free reading area, learn to juggle, putt a golf ball in the one whole putting green, or ride the merry-go-round. There are several outdoor cafes in the park, and numerous restaurants within walking distance so you can brownbag it. Highly recommend taking a break to enjoy the people watching and a spot of shade and greenery in the middle of Manhattan.

Beautiful. This park was well lit up when we went at almost 9pm. The lighting is subdued though so it felt like a safe, relaxing place to sit by the trees or by one of the lit up fountains. Food stands were nearby and restaurants around the outer edge.

An Oasis. This small well kept garden is on 6th Avenue/42nd Street. There is plenty of seating with foods and drinks available from a kiosk. A pleasant place to stop if walking from Broadway to Grand Central, of rest. We dropped in there for a few minutes on a Sunday morning and stayed for hour watching a Petang competition. Very enjoyable
Excellent people watching spot. Excellent place to explore, people watch and have lunch in the park. It's also just around the corner from the NYC Public Library.
A fun filled park, complete with carousel!. My daughter and I were fortunate to visit on a beautiful day. We had drinks and later had waffles at Waffles and Dinges. Amazing!

Some Green Near Times Square. A small park near Times Square next to the New York Public Library. A sandwich place and a bakery there, carts of books, magazines, and newspapers you can read in the park, people playing checkers and chess.

Worth the visit!!. Spend an hour, especially during the weekend. It has a wonderful park atmosphere as well as all kinds of excitement on the fifth avenue side of the park. The food is delicious and the people watching is great.

Love Bryant Park. A little gem in the centre of the hustle and bustle of NYC.
Great place to take a rest with plenty of eating places in the park and adjacent streets,
Lots of seats to sit and relax amongst an great setting.
Bryant Park. A great place to meet up and have lunch in park the place turns into a ice rink close to Christmas. The toilets are one the cleanest in new York.
Pleasant resting spot. Located close to Grand Central Station. A great little green oasis with cafes around it. Plenty chairs to sit on or grass to watch the world go by.

Bryant Park has great Community Vibe!. Bryant Park - next to NY Library - favorite park in NYC! Teeming with community activities from "Learn to Lasso", to chess, ping pong, picnicking, NY Mobile Library reading area.

Lovely little park.. This great little park packs such a lot in, there were stalls selling lots of different things from handbags to fridge magnets etc, also has a little ice rink as well as Christmas markets.
A gem! . One of my favorite places in NYC. Lay on the grass or take the newspaper and read for a while as you rest. Awesome!
Never knew it was there. Even though I have been in NY many times and even lived there for a few months I never knew this park existed. Lovely place. Great if you need to sit and are in the area.

My 3rd favourite Park in NYC . Nice seating area, chilling Park next to subway, great place to get a takeaway from the deli and chill out, keep a look out for local events that go on throughout the year.
Wish we could have stayed longer. This is a small park but there are places to sit and people watch. The trees are unique. Not a park to run and play in just to sit and drink coffee.

WOW !!!!!. Just a small place with a great Grill restaurant where the New Yorkers eat.Outside in the sunny weather it's a beautiful place to see so many people enjoying their food and just relaxing.
Don't miss this place,it's wonderful.
Good place to take a break in the city. Good place to relax and watch the city walk by. Grab a good book and coffee and feel the bliss. Its location adds to the charm.

A lot of events during the year, lots of seating and a nice Christmas Market in winter. The Bryant Park has many different "faces" through the year, from free Music events in summer to a Christmas Market with a large ice scating ring in winter. It is used by many for a lunch break who work close by. And with alot of chairs it is a great spot to get some rest during a NCY sightseeing trip.
A small relaxing area. In the middle of the skyscrapers you can read a book, newspaper, play table tennis, drink a coffee or simply relax. I fully recommend it.

Oasis just blocks from Times Square. My wife, two grandsons and I were crossing Manhattan on 42nd Street and we came to Bryant Park. We went in and sat down with several hundred other people. Everyone was considerate and we watched the players at Ping-Pong and watched the people go by. They have reading areas for adults and children, complete with reading material and there is a merry-go-round (we are told it is not technically a carousel). This is a wonderful place to get away from the crowds of 42nd Street.
Crowded must mean its the place to be. New York is so spoilt for parks, I found one on almost every block. This one has great outdoor move nights in summer, and was very popular
Check out in December. Love visiting Bryant Park in December. It is turned in to a Christmas market with many different types of vendors. I always find unique gifts for friends and family.

Everything Free. Located 42nd street between 6 & 5 ave...Every activity free , reading "room", putting green, ping pong tables, ice skating in winter..NYC Public Library adjacent to park,, books are stored under park,,, 80 miles of shelves of books under park grass lawn..

beautiful bryant park. Bryant park in the winter months is magical. If you're visiting NYC in November or December, grab a hot chocolate, go ice skating and enjoy all the small shops. My wife and I go every year and it never gets old.

A lovely park next to the library.. We saw the park in two different kinds of weather this time: wet and glorious sunshine. In the wet, it seemed a bit sad, but the Bryant Park Grill made up for it! In the sunshine, there were hundreds of lovely tables and chairs arranged for people to use in the spacious park - with a lovely reading area - and the atmosphere was joyous with everyone just enjoying the sunshine in the middle of their working day. I felt we saw real New Yorkers going about their lives here and it felt great!
The best park in New York. I would have liked to spend a whole day relaxing in Bryant Park but time was too short. A lovely, relaxing and well-kept park in the centre of New York
Peaceful and Fun to Stroll through or Stay a While. Love walking through Bryant Park or just taking a break and having a coffee or a glass of wine. A must visit!
People watching. Great weather to enjoy the park and watch the people. We ate at the southwest porch and a couple of beers. Lots to do around the park.

A great place to relax and catch your breath. Bryant park is a great place to just sit and relax and watch the world go by. The park offers plenty of free seating, free WIFI and a restroom which is sparkling clean and has fresh cut flowers in it everyday (a real difference to Starbucks and McDonalds Bathrooms). During the summer the park offers free film screenings, ping pong, chess and books to read. I'm also told during the winter the park offers ice skating :)The park itself is kept to the highest standard by dedicated park staff and is especially beautiful and peaceful in the evening. If you are looking to sit and relax for a few minutes away from the hustle and bustle of time square this park is the place for you as its located just a couple of blocks away :)

Peaceful Park. Bryant Park was a bit of a surprise. It is located behind the New York Library and is a tranquil oasis compared to the nearby Times Square. There are many seats and tables and relaxing activities of all sorts such as reading, with books available. There is a subway station below. A recommended spot to unwind after hectic site seeing.
Beautiful at night. Have been here dozens of times during the day. At night it's just magic. Worth a stop on your next trip to the city.
walk in. We walked past here every day nearly and so we went in and had a look. Very busy but nice. Eat places not enough seats but worth a little look. Clean toilets here next to the library

Love the holiday shops at Bryant Park!. Shopping haven in the fall and for Christmas! Love the ice skating rink they set up and all of the little shops in the park. We will be back just to visit the shops!

Park Exploration. Beautiful park and I loved walking through this park as we were sight seeing around Grand Central Station and Times Square. It was night time and a little drizzle but I could totally imagine myself outside on a sunny afternoon enjoying the beautiful foliage drinking a cup of coffee.
Enjoy the beauty. This park is well maintained and very clean! Grab some dinner and hang out on a bench or the grass and people watch. We didn't visit the library but would like to in the future!

Beautiful place to rest in the middle of the city. What I like more of New York is the several green spots between all the huge buildings, without them would not be possible to live there like an human! I guess this park it's probably the nicer between this spots
Lovely place to take a break. Lovely place to sit and take in the city with a coffee. Very fancy public toilets too. Well worth a visit

People watching sipping a glass of wine. We spent a lovely couple of hours sipping wine, enjoying the music and people watching right
in the middle of Manhattan;who would have known about this jewel in N.Y.C.
Oasis in NYC. Good place to have coffee or go to the cafe for a quick meal. Just down the street from Rockefeller Plaza and next to NYC library and Grand Central Station.
Lovely park. This is a lovely park with lots of seating and things going on, it is a great place to relax for 10 minutes between sightseeing and shopping!

Sit and chill i the Park. A great park to watch the world go by in. the fine NYC Public Library at one end and a nice cafe too.
Cool place to sit in the heat of Summer and looks to be great in the winter too.

Pleasant green space in midtown Manhattan. Twenty years ago you could go here to buy drugs, sleep rough or get mugged. Now it's an oasis nestled between skyscrapers with attractive gardens, a carousel, a reading and games area ( chess, table tennis etc ) with renovated statues and fountain and booths to buy snacks. Worth a short detour if you are in the area.

Great place to relax in the city. Bryant Park is my favorite park in the city! Lots of small tables to sit at and relax. Also several food vendors within the park to get food. I also enjoy walking around the park as there are lots of neat things to see - chess games, bocce games, interesting people!

meu lugar preferido em manhattan!. O Bryant Park fica na 6a avenida, entre as ruas 40 e 42, o lugar perfeito pra descansar das andanças na 5a avenida. Um grande gramado no meio de NY, rodeado por mesinhas, cafés e um carrossel. É um aconchegante espaço de convivência que tem atividades, dependendo da época do ano, tem cinema ao ar livre e empréstimo de livros e jogos. /// The Bryant Park is located ate the 6th ave, between the 40 and 42 st, the perfect place to rest from the walking around the 5th ave. A big lawn in the middle of NY, surrounded by tables, coffee places and a merry-go-round. It is a cozy living area that has activities, depending on the season, there is an open air cinema, and books and games are available for lending.
Mrs Johnston. loved this place. So many things to watch. Everyday new things happening, plays, music mass yoga!!! Two lovely places to eat also different cocktails

Remarkably quiet in Midtown. Bryant park was a remarkably quiet and calm place in the middle of the city. I visited at around 7pm on a weekday. The park was lit from one of the neighboring buildings and there were people all about enjoying the trees and tables.

The Christmas Market is the best. Bryant Park is nice any time of year, but it is especially nice at Christmas time when the little markets open up and the skating pond is open. Because the park is gated, and in the center of the street, it's very private and cozy once you're in the park. The little markets have a variety of wonderful items you don't see everywhere else and it's nice to shop and chat with the owners and catch a glimpse of the skaters and stop to sip a hot chocolate. It's a nice way to knock out some of your shopping in a winter wonderland and avoid the craziness of the shops on Fifth Avenue.
Quaint. A Lovely Park set in amongst the high rise buildings.Excellent for people watching, or take a bottle of wine down in the evening, to enjoy the beautiful weather.

Small but nice. Another park where you can take a break from the hustle and bustle of New York. A very welcome break. Take you lunch there. Many locals do, or just go for a break and a little bit of sanity.

Fantastic Little Park. Granted there is no playground, but they have a small carousel and plenty of events for kids. My child and I attended one of the free magic shows on Sundays during the summer. It was great. Maybe 20-25 kids, my child got called up to participate which made her day. We've also been there at Christmas time and it is far less crowded than Rockefeller Center. You can get much closer to the tree and ice skating rink. Check it the website for special events. Worth going
Busy Oasis. Cute little park near Times Square. Nice to take a break, enjoy a bite to eat, play a game or ride the carousel. So many tables and chairs make it perfect to relax in the sun or shade.
Bryant Park. Love this park in the middle of Manhattan. Great place to take a rest, have a snack, let kids run around and people watch. They often have activities so check the schedule.

My Favourite Peaceful NYC Park. This was one of my favourite places in New York City. The first time we came across this park we were making our way North along Sixth Avenue after we had visited the Empire State Building. We climbed the stairs and approached the beautiful fountain which is adjacent to the Bryant Park Stage. At the edge of this fountain sat a Fellar Down & out on his luck but had set himself up feet up on the edge of the fountain with a stub of a cigarette and a the remnants of a discarded drink preparing to watch a country band who had just finished setting up. I knew we were in a good place to relax after the noise and bedlam of the NYC Streets. The Country Band who were playing for free were really good and we stayed here for a while with a drink and drinking in the melodic country sounds. we returned here on a few occasions.

Stop and relax. I remember this park at the beginning of the 80s when it was a badly maintained,dusty and dirty patch of ground with trees,besides it wasn't safe to enter at night.Now this park is a real attraction for hundreds of city guests and New Yorkers where you can relax on the grass,play ping-pong or just take your lunch and meditate.Great place to stop and have some rest amidst the pandemonium of NY noise and traffic
It worths. Really bryant! It worths! Its near to the library and it`s a good place for have a rest. It really suprised us.
My favourite place to rest.... Bryant Park is my favourite place to sit after a long day of walking New York. Indulge in a beer, snack and/or ice cream. Watch the people...

Lively little park. We came a few times to this lively little park in the heart of Midtown New York City. It is nearby the New York Public Library and offers nice outdoor seating and plenty of people to watch,

Another Great Visit. Awesome experience. Plenty to do and always something new every time I come here. Wether it's a mini festival, a farmers market, or small pop-up boutiques, Bryant Park is always happening.

Quality village square. Bryant Park is one of our favourite places in New York. Tucked behind the New York Library the park has a large open grass space, but around the sides there are areas for very different activities. There is a reading/poetry area, pentanque (French boule) courts, mini putting course and plenty of seating areas to sit and watch. There is a nice bar area with mixed seating including swings and adjacent to the library is the Bryant Park Grill restaurant. This is a lovely spot to stop for a breather in hectic Midtown
Cute Park. We were wondering around Manhattan and discovered this little park by accident. We decided to stop for a bit and had a drink there. Nice park.

Relax in Bryant Park. A great place to relax with an ice cream or coffee after long walks through the NY streets or after a load of shopping, or just to sit around reading a book.I loved the carousel & wished I was a child!The buildings surrounding the park are impressive. Of course, the New York Public Library is an imposing one, but the Bryant Park Hotel formerly the American Standard Building was impressive.A nice green spot amid the soaring concrete jungle!

An great little park in the heart of mid-town. Bryant Park is such an unexpected surprise if you're on Fifth Avenue around 42nd St. You turn the corner and you are in a green (except winter of course), people-fillled gathering place where there are solo readers, photographers, locals, tourists, and the usual diverse crowd of characters that makes NY a great city. And, there are a couple of nice spots to eat. The wonderful Bryant Park Grill and its less formal sister, the Bryant Park Café (open in warm weather only). Definitely worth a short detour if you are in the vicinity. For the views (Empire State Building looming on the north side) or just to enjoy a break from the hustle and bustle.
Nice little park. Place is beautiful and peaceful next to crowded Times Square. There are lots of small coffee places and places to eat.

Pretty park in a central location. This is a beautifully kept little park that seems popular with people of all ages. We visited on a lovely sunny day so it was busy with people making use of the games provided and children reading books that were also provided.
It is worth going just to use the loo!

An English persons ideal scene of winter in New York. We wanted to see the ice skaters in Bryant Park as they seem to epitomise winter scenes that you often see in films and we weren't sure if we were going to have time to get to Central Park. We were there at the beginning of January and were so pleased that the beautifully lit Christmas tree was still there. Happy days. We decided a go at skating wasn't advisable in case of injury ! Cowards I know !

Great place to relax. Bryant Park is one of my favourite places we visited in NYC - I loved it! It's only a small park but lovely to sit and have a coffee in the sun. Plus it's really close to a few other attractions - Grand Central Terminal, Empire State. Worth a visit!
Always something going on. A nice green oasis next to the Public Library. There seems to always be something going on so there's always something to do in this small park.

Love this little park. This is such a lovely little park to sit and have breakfast or lunch. Chairs and tables are plentiful and if you are lucky you may catch someone playing the piano. There is a cafe but I would advise visiting one of the magnificent local delis for a take out and enjoy the sunshine and people watching.
Great Oasis. Great place to sit, chill and relax, walk round park before you settle there is so much going on, chess, backgammon,library bar and lots more!!

Bryant Park & Free Yoga in the Summer. It's a lovely park, smack in the middle of Manhattan surrounded by skyscrapers. It's fairly small, but perfect to have your lunch, take a break or do yoga, which is what I did. Throughout summer there are 2 free yoga sessions organised by various instructors and magazines. Mats were provided, free magazine on leaving. It was a fantastic experience.

Best Place for the Holidays to get You Into the Spirit. Bryant Park is an absolute must when the Christmas Shops are up during the holidays. Go early to get into the spirit and find all of your gifts on your list in one place. Take pictures by the magnificent tree, skate in the rink, take a load off with a cup of hot chocolate or apple cider at one of the outdoor tables or plan a break inside at one of the restaurants. Take the kids, old and young, and shop, eat and celebrate together. Even your worst day and a small budget will make it a worthwhile trip.
Nice park to relax. Park is good to just sit, have a drink grab a hotdog from the food stand, read a book or just relax after walking around New York. afterwalwalking all over
Soft greenery admidst the buildings and traffic. A place to catch buses to the airport from, but this looked a lovely soft green area admidst the buildings. A place for entertainment too.

Pretty Park.. Nice relaxing place to sit and watch the world go by with a cup of coffee. Has it's own free library. Plenty of tables and chairs to sit on. There was a country dancing weekend going on while I was there and it was fun to watch.
Lovley Small Park. Great park to sit and enjoy a coffee, food or a drink and watch the hassle and bussle of the city pass by
Lots of local workers hang around.. A very nice place to have lunch, walk around and the carousel there is fun to ride, although it is kind of small.
Short cut. Good location to walk through as a short cut. There is food and liquor that can be consumed in park for sale.
gorgeous park. Lovely Park in the middle of Manhattan. Gorgeous borders and cute looking stands that sell food, especially liked the look of a Belgian wafel stand.

Stroll in Summer.. Ice skating by winter. Great park centralized next to the NY Public Library and Bryant Park Grill. Over the winter months you will find a great ice bar with everything iced inside from chairs to glassware. Bundle up and enjoy the sights with those ice skating

Nice!. Cute park and a nice place for a short break from shopping, sightseeing,... Get a coffee or a sandwich and just enjoy this little place of peace. I just loved the reading area and the old men playing chess :-)

Being a Cowboy and Cow Girl in New York City. It was "line Dance" sunday - A day of activities at the Park, Line Dancing, Lassoing, Sack Race, and much more, well thought out - clean and well maintained and the food and Beverage offerings are great. A breath of fresh Air in the hustle and Bustle of New York

An oasis in the midst of frenzy. I love Bryant Park, lying between 5th Avenue immediately behind the library and The Avenue of the Americas (6th Ave) although comparatively small, for me its a lovely escape from all that is around. To see people playing chess, playing board games, reading, playing table tennis, having a cup of coffee, just sitting watching! is my great escape after one of my wife's 'serious shopping' episodes. Every time we visit New York we always have 'a relax' here.
Its just pretty. Bryant Park is a great activity park.......Movies in the summer, yoga for large crowds. Very beautiful atmosphere and near everything!

Peaceful lunch / travel with Kids?. I love Bryant Park to have a peaceful lunch away of the stress of the city. Close to the Park you'll be able to find all kind of food to go.If you travel with kids this park will be a great place to visit, because have some areas especially reserved for kids. From books and games areas to a beautiful carrousel
Gorgeous. Just gorgeous whether day or night. Loved it. Night time is lovely all out up with sparkling empire state building over looking park.

in the middle of it all!. it has it all, and the venue changes with the season. there's something for everyone, and even just walking thru on the way to wherever gives you a sense of the wonder of NYC!

Great in summer or winter. Great place to just sit and people watch, have a drink, play some cards at one of the little tables, see a movie in the Park during the summer, or ice skate in winter. The kids love the carousel too, it feels like you are in the country for a short while!
behind Library. Cool vibe, on the back side of the New York Public Library. Some placed to get food an ddrink right in the park and lots of places around
Oasis in the city. Bryant park is always a nice place to have a moment of tranquility in the city. Just sit there and relax, enjoy the music and a drink/bite or lay down on the grass.

A Great park to relax and enjoy being a New Yorker for a day. We came across Bryant park by accident. It was full of friendly folks playing chess/ checkers and various painters and singers. As it became evening, a huge screen and outside movie was presented. Ice cream and waffles, cannolies and other treats were available. Everyone was friendly and comfortable on lounge chairs and blankets. Quite a nice day from the hustle and bustle of New York.

There's a lot to see in Bryant Park. I love this atmosphere! Right in the middle of NYC. Free Wifi...seats galore to observe the activity. Mini Golf...or actually, a putting "court"! Yes! Mini golf in the middle of NYC. There are several bars, and of course, the beautiful Bryant Park Grill where I met a business colleague today for coffee. People watching is one of my favorite sports. And it's free. Not to mention the concerts, and other happenings. This is a true gem that has been transformed from a hang out of druggies and other things. Thanks to the former mayors of NY for helping to transform this wonderful area of NYC.

Nice Park - great place to relax a bit. Great place to people watch, enjoy food, and feel the local vibe.They also have a really clean bathroom on the 42nd st side.The weekend we were there, there was square dancing two nights, A bit weird for NYC, but fun.
Bryant Park, NYC. Great place to visit, doesn't seem like you're in the middle of Manhattan. Great evening activities and a nice "people watching" place.

Nice Park.. I really enjoyed all the parks. It was nice to stop and rest the feet from all the walking. There are always places to buy drinks. Enjoyed the shade of the trees and watching the squirrels play.

Lovely oasis in the middle of the concrete. Enjoy the lovely oasis in the middle of NYC concrete jungle. There are public bathrooms, is clean, and the trees, gardens, B.P. excellent coffee, made of this park a must see in NYC.

A gem in the heart of New York city.. Bryant Park is a beautiful park near 5th avenue and 39th street. There are places to sit and relax with a book,
there are tables and many board games and others to enjoy. There is a carousel in the middle and also a restaurant with an outdoor terrace. There is also a kiosk that sells coffee.

Instant favourite. Ok, I know I like it because it reminds me of a French park. That aside, its a top spot to stop and rest. Plenty of food and coffee options nearby, both inside and outside the park, and flanked on one side by the NY Public Library. Just go.
Bryant Park. visit was at the start of autumn. nice park which has a nice view of the Empire State Building at night Nice Cafe style outdoor eating.

A little oasis.. A little oasis amidst the towers of concrete and glass and car filled avenues where you can take a moment or two to catch your breath. Whether you just want to sit and relax with a coffee or take on one of 'regulars' in a game of chess or maybe even join in with the yoga classes (Thursdays 6pm) Bryant Park packs a lot into a small space. Situated between the New York public library, the Bryant Park Hotel (former NY radiator building) and the stunning, glass tower of the Bank of America, Bryant Park is a fantastic spot from where to watch the world go by.

True Christmas dream!!. for a person who lives in a sunny city like Fortaleza, Brazil . skating in Bryant Park is the real dream come true . with a great track , it will have no problems in partinar this track. But times around 20 hours are the busiest , avoid .

Something for Everyone. This park is wonderful. It is full of every kind of individual and family activity. We were there in September. There was outdoor ping pong, reading, chess, places to eat, music, small bar area, carousel, fountain, and so much people watching and more. It is located right behind the Library between 5th and 6th street. It is also near the subway stops. Another good place to see what happens in New York.

Beautiful lesser-known park close to main attractions. I had never heard of this park but my boyfriend had been told by friends we should see it. I'm glad we did. It is close to most of the other main attractions like the New York Public Library but it's a relaxing haven (although busy) in the centre of the hubbub. Great place to relax your feet, have a coffee, read a book, meet up with someone, bring the kids, have a picnic, go for lunch.
An oasis. Great events free to the public in a beautiful utdoor space surrounded by stunning skyline views. Nice seatng areas and god food -- great anytime of year,

Christmas in Bryant Park is wondeful!. Christmas in Bryant Park is wonderful! They have a great selection of booths with unique gifts such as handmade jewelry, hats, mittens, food, warm beverages, artwork, etc. Something for everyone and just fun to walk around, stop and sip a hot chocolate and people watch!

A beautiful sanctuary. Bryant Park is a beautiful sanctuary from the busyness of the city. We visited the park on a Sunday and there was a square dance event. It was great to enjoy the music & watch the dancing. There are cafes to stop and get a drink & enjoy the ambience.

A small oasis of green. Amid the madness of NYC this small park is a welcome stop. Grab a coffee, read a paper or just people watch with various checkers games, petanque and generall oddballs going on. Pleasant enough.

Small oasis in the middle of hustle and bustle. It is a small oasis of a park in the middle of urban bustle. When we went, they were screening old romantic movies in the evening and, it was house full!

Feeling like a local in Bryant Park. This park is a really cool spot to go to feel like a local. My partner and I found some tables with board games so we just sat down and played some games with a few drinks. We felt welcomed by the surroundings.
New York feelings !. A great place to walking in and watch all the people from new york or worldwide, good for have a snack and fell all the energy.
Favorite park. This is my favorite park in nyc. It's small and beautiful year around. Also close to our hotel and the library that we enjoy too.

A real surprise. Located in a mostly shaded area behind the NY Public Library, it was a pleasant gathering place with trees, paths, and three very nice cafes that served excellent food. We had lunch at one of the outdoor cafes and enjoyed the view of the park and city. Very enjoyable

Movies on Mondays at the park. This park was jam packed on a Monday night. People were playing board games, ping pong, riding a carousel and just hanging out waiting for the Monday night movie to begin. Food trucks were out and it was an evening of just pure fun. The smell of sweets and food filled the air . Lots of fun, everyone seemed so happy and relaxed!

People Watching at its Finest. We had an opportunity to sit and watch the people in Bryant Park on a nice early fall day while munching on a waffle, sipping a hot drink and generally enjoying the day. there was a group yoga class being conducted just outside the back entrance to the new York Public Library. time well spent.
Great find in the city. This park has plenty of places to sit and relax, places for you to charge your phone, a clean restroom and even a free library for you to read books while enjoying the park!
Sit and eat lunch with the pigeons. Buy a hoagie and a drink and go have lunch on a park bench. Then watch all the pigeons surround you.... a must do while you are enjoying the NYC experience!
Nice big lawn to have a picnic. Ate my breakfast here Sept 2015. Plenty of seats and I enjoyed a quiet morning with my meal. In the evenings it was very busy with people.

Good break from the streets. Beautiful little park with lots of shade and places to sit. It's a nice break if you are walking around the city and want a touch of peace. The park was quite full of people in the middle of a week day. It felt very friendly.

Charming. We were delighted to find the luscious green refuge of Bryant Park after walking around the stunning library. I had heard of BP but had no idea what a comfortable oasis in the middle of hurry up life and sky scrapers it is. As a 1st time visitor it made me happy to sit and be a part of it.
Nice little stop over on our trip.. What a nice little park to stop and catch your breath in on a busy day. So many small park spaces in NYC, and this is another great one!

Cozy classic park. Bryant park is a small and very cozy park in a very central location. It has classical decorations all over the place and nice areas for sitting and resting for a bit. Good place to drink a coffee or eat an ice cream.

My Favorite Park in New York City. Bryant Park has free ice skating, golf in the summer (for a fee), stores to shop at during the Christmas season, ping pong in the summer (free), etc. It is a wonderful stop on your visit to New York City.

My most favorite place in entire NYC. After visiting the big Apple,just before heading home..there is this gem of a place in heart of Manhattan,which may not be as big as Central Park,but it is very close to my heart.Its Bryant Park.Nestled next to the Public Library,there are two shops from where you can buy your coffee /sandwiches and then sit in the park where you can get a view of the Empire state building.You can play table tennis too.There are restrooms available close by in case you feel the need to use the bathroom
New York. A short walk from Times Square and a nice place to sit and have a coffee or glass of wine or just to chill out We had breakfast there a couple of times.

A Peaceful Square. This park is in Midtown Manhattan a block from Times Square, it has a lovely relaxing garden feel, with restaurants & bars in & surrounding the park. This can easily be done together with Central Station, Chrysler building & Empire state & even Macy's time permitting.

A great stop. This place is a great stop from the hustle and bustle of the city. Be it a morning coffee or see this place at lunch time with hundreds of suits that come down to eat a sandwich on the green grass.

there is always something going on. Check out their website before you go, as year around there is always something going on in Bryant Park - summer movie, Portuguese classes, Shakespeare in the park, and the skating rink you name it. One of my favorite spots in NYC, suitable for all age, all size of groups.

Music coming from the park. Ran across this park via leaving Grand Central Station. Was attracted by the music coming from the park. They were giving square dance lessons for over 60 people. I believe anyone could participate. Very entertaining, beautiful park in the middle of town.

One of my favorite places in NYC. I love wandering over to Bryant Park, day or night. Stopped in again last week during the day. It was an awesome day to sit outside. Sat by the outside BAr and had a few drinks with my wife. It's just a small bit of peacefulness in this large city. I look forward to later on in the season as they do a wonderful job with during the winter.
Lovely Park. What a great little park - with lots of activities such as board games and art craft tables and more... even a little carousel for the kids. Lovely little place :)
Patch of Emerald in the heart of NYC. Wonderful park where one can go and enjoy lunch, people watch and great green space in the heart of NYC
Greenery in the middle of buildings. Nice small park to relax and get a bit of green in the middle of the city. Lots of people were here.

An Inviting Oasis. Located just a few blocks from Times Square, Bryant Park is an oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city. Lots of places to relax and people watch, or you can participate in one or more of the many activities available at the park.

Love it. I just love this park. Went twice during my NYC visit. First evening attended a poetry reading, second evening there was a shakespeare play. Everywhere you look in this park people are hanging out and chilling and relaxing.

beautiful little park!!. we went here to sit and relax late at night after walking round the sights and shops allday,it was lovely,very well kept and there was people sat talking and playing table tennis at 11pm at night which i thought was cool.
Fun. Buzzing with activity day and night. Lots of places to eat and hang out and people watch or just relax

A place of tranquil beauty in a busy city. Beautiful and tranquil. Great place to take a break in the shade of large trees, sitting at one of the many tables available. Large lawn. Next to the NY Public Library. Public restrooms.

Always something happening. Bryant Park is tiny in comparison to Central Park but its still a lovely place to sit & have cuppa tea/coffee. There's always something going on, I saw adverts for bird-watching walks in the morning, to afternoon yoga. Plus there's free Wi-Fi and power points to charge your device in.

Busy but nice. A lively and lively piece of greenery in the City. Used a great deal for local office workers and tourists alike. You can get a seat or perch on a wall and watch the world go by. The Bus tour companies use this as a stop for their uptown and downtown tours so can get busy north side. Worth a peek if you're passing.

One of the best parks I have visited. This is not just a park, it tells you so much about midtown - busy streets around, food trucks, people in siuts, history of crime and drugs and now... a true urban cultural center open for everyone. Plenty of free activiteis, concets, festivals. you can learn juggling, knitting, meditation. Ther eis a yoga class - check their webpage. And of course, this is where the readers digest started so you can simply take a book from the outdoor library

Really nice little park. Although this was my fourth visit to NY this was the first time I had seen this little park area ,I stumbled on it on my way to Grand Central Terminus as the weather was in the high 80,s I stopped and had a cold drink and sat in the park it's right next to the library (a great building by the way and worth a visit )I could happily have stayed there for hours it was that nice you need the weather to be good of cause just like any other park but I would make a point of going there again if or when I,m back in NY .

Beautiful spot. We were on our first trip to NYC and we were out just walking around and came up on Bryant Park. It was a really beautiful spot to sit down for a while and have a coffee. There are numerous vendors around the outer edges of the park and a pretty fountain for a photo opp. The was they have shaped the sycamore trees makes it a pretty place to hang out and take a break.
My Favourite Little Haven in NYC. Love this park, it's a perfect lunch spot and looks amazing at night when all the trees are lit up :)

The best place in town to relax and give your feet a rest. Seems like everyone goes there . You will see a wonderful cross section of the city. Grab a bite, take in the views and plan the rest of your day.
An oasis in the middle of busy Manhattan. Such a beautiful place in a middle of Manhattan, quite relaxing to sit on the bench watching birds and other people.
So much Fun. Very cool place to go, nice in summer, there is always something going on, no matter which day of the week is. That is my favorite part.

THE place to be on christmas season. on chrismas season its THE place to be if you like this holiday as much as I do, I LOVE this place, and if its snowing its a magical place to be. the christmas shops are really cute, love this place.

A little heaven in the middle of town. This was a heaven for us while walking around in New York as they have chairs and benches or the grass to let you sit down and have a rest. Also there are tables for Ma Jong , Chess or Chinese Checkers .They looked very serious, the players. Fabulous place for people watching and sat for a long time, it was +33 c the day we were there,phu !
Lovely place to stop for a drink. Loved Bryant park!! such a nice place in the middle of everything to just sit down, relax and have a drink! Perfect place for a nice chill between sightseeing!
Relaxed and enjoyable. Went there just to enjoy the atmosphere and to see the Shakespere evening show. Very relaxed and enjoyful
A place to sit. A beautiful place to sit and rest or people watch or do business or eat. Plenty of food carts lined up. A drop off point for some of the shuttle buses from the Airport.
Relaxation. Fun in the sun watching a concert and eating in the park. You can go shopping after and return for more entertainment.

A little oasis in the heart of Manhattan. The favorite little park in the city. Briant Park has always had a special attraction for me. Anytime I want to take a break I come to this green oasis at the back of the Public Library on Fifth Avenue and 42nd street. Summer or winter this place in the heart of Manhattan is unique.
A nice place to stop and have a break while seeing the city.. What a beautiful park in-between huge buildings. You almost forget where you are at until you look up.

Crowded, small city park but worth a stop if you want to sit a few minutes. Nice enough park right in the middle of the city, but nowhere near as nice as Central Park. It's very small, and LOTS of people are there. It's sort of cool to see the free ping pong tables in use in the park and there are a lot of little metal chairs and cafe tables (all totally filled with people). We rested for just a few minutes in a couple of chairs, but didn't want to stay long as the park is just very crowded.

Lovely place to sit and take in the atmosphere. Lovely in all seasons, ice scaring and lots of little huts with original Christmas decorations and gifts but equally lovely for just a coffee and sit down amongst the throng
Excellent escape from office. It is terrific to be in a free WiFi capable venue with great visual appeal. This is one of the gems of NYC and I don't care for NYC.
Excellent . This place is always busy no matter what time of day. People sit around to enjoy the views. Great day for the family with the fountain, cafe and wifi offered. Fun for everyone.

Clean and Safe for the Whole Family. Excellent oasis in the center of the greatest city in the world - sit and enjoy the park in the spring and summer or enjoy the ice rink during the winter. A perfect place to people watch and relax. Clean and safe for the whole family!
lovely on a sunny day. last day of our holiday on a beautiful sunny day no where better to sit out and people watch. A wee oasis amongst the hustle and bustle of Manhatten. Lovely relaxed atmosphere
Beautiful park. Beautiful park and the first stop on the loop on and off bus tour. Great view of the Empire state building.

European flavor in Manhattan!. This past is the closest thing to a European park in the core of the Big Apple! Bistro tables, kiosks serving snacks and sandwiches, kids playing on the lawn, men playing cards, and others playing ping-pong. It is a great place to people watch.
A place to sit and relax and watch. A beautiful park in a wonderful city...pretty year round but magical when the skating rink and the Christmas markets go in!
Nice!. Close to view of Statute of Liberty. Additional,statues in park are nice and it's neat for relaxing a bit between sightseeing trips.

Peace perfect peace. Great place for a rest and to people watch. After a hard afternoon of walking a great place for a rest. Loads of chairs and tables scattered about for a start and some R&R. Plenty of coffee shops in the area to carry out.

A green oasis. A green oasis of Manhattan. A place where to sit and relax in the middle of the busiest place of the city, to hide away from the city noise, chill and just have a break! Not big, but very nice and beautiful. Faces the library.

Great Park!. Bryant Park is an awesome park to hang out, have a picnic, etc. New York sure knows how to put a park together! There is so much to do at this park. Take a carousel ride ($3.00), play ping pong (bring paddles and balls), they have a section of tables and chairs and they provide all kinds of games to play (checkers, connect four, etc.) It's so much fun to just hang out and enjoy time with the family.

An oasis in the midst of NYC. Spent 5 days in Times Square, and returned to this park every night to relax. Bought bakery here for breakfast every day. Ate in the Bryant Park Cafe and the Grill, next to the NY Public Library.Loved that the park is lit from above at night.

Not to miss. Bryan Park is located one block away from Times Square. The park offers some food and drinks. At dedicated hours there is a piano player who brings a wonderfull sphere at the park. Tip : buy some breakfast or lunch an take place at one of the many tables available in the park and you will have a wonderfull time. There are some game activities and chessplayers present. Or just enjoy reading a book and time will fly. Free wifi is available at the park.

This is one of my favorite places in nyc . This is such a peaceful, calm and quiet place. I love how you can escape the city's loud noises and people by coming here. Buying breakfast in one of the kiosks and sitting on the benches is something I really enjoy doing.

Pretty Little Park, With Lots Going On. Small park, with a lot going on. On any clear day in nice weather, this park bustles with activity. Most of the time when I pass, there is a television crew filming an episode of something or another, or a movie crew, etc. Lots of fun. Pretty park.
Beautiful fall day in the city. Nice place to sit and have take-out lunch. We got meals from Pret a Manger. Don't miss coffee at Blue Bottle!

Calm in the midst of madness!. I love this park, right next to the madness of Times Sq but peaceful with a nice place to sit and reflect. There are usually quite a lot of people around but it gets quieter the later it gets.

Brilliant Bryant. If New York does one thing well, it's parks!We passed through several on our visit. Central is obviously the main one, but all the other little parks, like Bryant, are also well worth a visit.There's usually something going on there, but if not, it's nice to just sit and chill and watch the world go by.

Our favourite place in New York !. We loved visiting the parks and out of all of them Bryant Park was the best.Its surrounded by sky scrapers and has an excellent view of the Empire State.There is an excellent public restroom on the park as well a wide variety of places to buy food and drink.The park gets very busy during lunchtime as office workers come down to have their break, but there is no shortage of tables and chairs supplied by the city.Great place to take a break or finish the day off !

A breathe of Fresh Air. A really nice park in the middle of Times Square and Grand Central Station. Lots of coffee shops and food outlets around if you want to sit and have lunch in the park.Worth popping into NY public library which is located at the east side of the park.

Bryant Park. That wonderful moment when you jump off on the 42 St.-Bryant Park station, and you see this beautiful park (even more in winter, when they put a ice skating park in the middle of the park). Take your time here to enjoy this park.

Amazing park. I just loved this wonderful park which is located next to the public library....in new york city.....crowded...full of activities....cafes..tables and chairs...movies are shown in the evenings... free of charge...

❤️. I ❤️ this park, just a few blocks from Times Square, Rockefeller Center, subway. It's just behind New York Public library. There are public toilets which are really well maintained & so clean. Lots of activities going on in the park such as reading, ping pong, boules, yoga, children's reading area, massive green lawn, chess, card games. There are food stalls (really pricy) but so lush. We've been back to this park several times.
Hidden gem. Beautiful little postage stamp park near Broadway. Great place to get a Belgian waffle and dine al fresco. You can also play ping-pong!

Nice place to sit and catch your breath. Nice place to catch your breath and people watch while drinking a coffee. They have an area where you can play games and it was fun watching the couples, groups, families playing games together. has a cool carousel for the little ones and a big grassy area.
Very nice place. The nicest Park in NYC! Not that big but maybe because of this very nice. Tiny little food kiosks available and the place to have good break.
Relaxing park. Great place to relax when you are shopping around, they have a lot of chairs available! Just watch out, the day I was there a tree felt, it was not pretty!

Brief visit. I only visited here briefly whilst passing but wow what a site. The park was filled with thousands of people doing yoga and it really was something to behold. It looks like a lovely park in the middle of the Mayhem.

Part of a must have NY Experience in the Winter. Magical experience getting to ice skate here over the Christmas Holiday. The shops around the area and the whole atmosphere was wonderful. I have to do when in NY.
Nice park. Lots of good people watching with plenty of spots to read and relax or riven take advantage of the free wifi.

Spring had sprung in Bryant park. We were out with our daughter and her fiancé enjoying a beautiful spring day. We took some time to walk through the park and then sit for a moment of respite from walking. The park in a beautiful design of public space and very well cared for. We come from a rural area and it made me feel great that my daughter could enjoy some wonderful greenspace while living and working in the big city.
Ice cream. New York were having a heatwave . On our last day we sat in Bryant park enjoying the heat, the peace and quiet, and the biggest ice cream I have ever had

Good place to take a break. This is a nice green area with tables and chairs also in the midst of busy midtown. The gorgeous Library is next to the park. There are chess players there. There is a small carousel. Take a look at the Bryant Park Hotel. It's gothic Art Deco and gorgeous-- formerly the Anerican Radiator Building with an interesting history!

First Night in Bryant Park. Upon arrival in NYC ask your concierge to make "walk up" reservations for you to sit outside at the Bryant Park Grill. We walked from our 57th street hotel along Avenue of the Americas taking in the diversity of people from all over the world. Such a great way to become immersed in the rhythm of the city. The evening was beautiful as was our view of the activities in the Park. Ours was a Friday night but we had no trouble finding the best seat for our 7pm dinner. The menu has many unique offerings and the service was exceptional. A "must do" each time we visit!

Urban oasis. A newly restored park next to the New York Public Library. The park offers expansive open space with plenty of seating and a beautiful fountain to enjoy. There is a very inviting food venue as well as outside live music. It was the perfect space to enjoy on a pleasant September day.
Fantastic park. Great place to hang out. Spend some time in a very vibrant local park which is used by the locals. Games areas. Chess. Exercise. Music.

A Hidden Gem. This was one of the nicest hidden gems I've never seen in all my trips to NYC. Just such a lovely park in the middle of midtown where people are just relaxing, eating their lunch and otherwise taking some time during lunch. Lovely greenery and plants. There is also an outdoor restaurant. A real gem.

Small Nice Paradise. Small and little cosy garden surrounded by lots of restaurants .There is small fountain ,many benches and chairs .Nice garden to sit and rest in crowded area of times square and back side of New York library .There was music consort in the garden on the sunday evening.

A wonderful space. ​At the rear of the NY Library, a wonderful oasis of calm found in the middle of this bustling 24/7 city.​ Very popular with all, especially at lunchtime when the park suddenly comes alive. We sat in glorious sunshine and listened to a great group of musicians who just seems to turn up and start playing. Live music in the middle of NY, just fantastic! We love this space.

A little bit of tranquillity in the middle of the big city. We spent a bit of time in the park on two occasions during our visit to New York. It's a little bit of tranquillity in the middle of the big city where you can spend an hour having a relaxing bite to eat and drink.

Great little park near Times Square but a world away.. Great little park near Times Square but a world away. Shady with plenty of benches and chairs. Chess tables here, ping pong there, a "lending library" with paperbacks and newspapers, and best of all a bar and restaurant up on the boardwalk. Beers are $12, but the setting is great and crowded with actual New Yorkers, which amy or may not be a good thing.

Stop and have your lunch at this park, why not the locals do!. When in New York visit this little bit of paradise. It's small but very interesting, the park has a number of restaurants around it but just buy your lunch and sit in the park to really experiance the tranquility.

Great for people-watching. This is a really nice spot in the heart of the city surrounded by busy roads and tall buildings of Midtown. It's great for sitting and relaxing with a drink in the evening whilst people-watching and socialising.

A little piece of serenity!. I love this park! I like to grab a sandwich and sit by the fountain and just enjoy the view! There's all sorts of things happening within the park and is a great place to just catch your breath.
Peaceful and funny. Strolled here one evening. My partner was looking all around and taking it all in, he fell over some empty chairs and a table - that gave us a good old laugh. Watch out!

Fantastic!. Its just a square, but a light of fresh air in the middle of Manhattan, totally worth to stop by and sit for a while between the hurry of the city.You have the view of the old union carbide building and the empire state, and of course, the back of the NYC library.A nice fountain is on its west side among some food booths (the crepes are nice).If you are in midtown I recomend to stop by and take a look

Fabulous park and restaurant. Glorious park and restaurant here right next door to the Public Library. Bryant Park Grill has a great menu and is in a beautiful setting. Well worth a visit if you are mid town.
City oasis.. Lovely oasis in city. Spent part of afternoon watching locals play Pétanque. Our 10 year old son was allowed to join in.
A little oasis in the middle of the busy city. Nice cozy park in the middle of the city. If you need a break from walking the noisy streets this is the place to relax!
Fashion Week Mecca. A must see park in the midst of New York Fashion. We spent time here during Fashion Week this fall and we're impressed by the varied people, events, and activities.
bryant park. lovely little oasis in the city perfect to do a bit of people watching and have a little rest from all of the walking

Fantastic Park. This is what NY is all about. This park is fantastic I could have stayed all day and watched the locals, yoga, Tai Chi, chess, golf unbelievable range of activities. It also has its own wifi. A excellent range of food and drink outlets, a must see in NY.

Unwind from the city intensity. Love that little park. It's surrounded by Manhattan's skyscrapers so it feels like a little heaven in the middle of this hectic city. It's not much of an attraction spot- more of a place to relax for a while, drinking awesome coffee from the breads bakery stand or lying down on the grass for half an hour while admiring the intense buildings view around you.

One of our favourite places to take a break. This is a beautiful park that is probably best described as a lawn with free WIFI. There is also a fountain surrounded by tables and chairs, as well as food vendors. It's a great place to go and rest your feet, even at night as it is very well lit by stadium lights atop the adjacent building.
Slow down and enjoy!. Beautiful park in the middle of the hustle and bustle. Nice place to stop and enjoy a coffee or tea.

Great collection of stores. Bryant Park has a collection of small stores and food vendors that offer a number of interesting and quirky products. It's certainly worth a look if you are nearby as it's an easy walk from Times Square. In winter you can skate for a very reasonable price. Even with a big line things moved very quickly and I was on the rink without hassle. If you bring your own skates there is no cost.
Nice and relaxing. Our first location on arrival in NYC. Lovely little park for a coffee and relaxing. Gets busy at lunchtime though.

Fun stop any season!. The Christmas tree is more ornate than that at Rock Center and the holiday market and snacks are worth a look. Every Spring, the newly sodded lawn with sparkling water fountain is a gorgeous oasis amongst the adjacent skyscraper canyons.
A must in Manhttan. This park is fantastic to stop with a coffee when you're visiting NYC and walking all over Manhattan.

Park in a city. This is a small area off 42 nd Street so don't be expecting a vast park, but what you will get is a lovely quiet grassed sq , a place to relax ,read a book or people watch, the library is on the side of park , take a picnic or grab some food nearby , it's within walking distance of the Top of the rock and Grand central station , seats provided or lie on the lawn, a small piece of paradise in the surrounding of big buildings but worth it
Very Cool park in the middle of the city. This park is very nice with lots of places to sit and seems very European. There was a cool little library where you could sit a read a book.
Sightseeing. Romantic and beatiful, summer and winter. A park in the center of Huge, high buildings, near Time square.

Just a few blocks from Times Square!. Visitors to New York know about Central Park which is fabulous, but Bryant Park is a short stroll from the crowd of Times Square. A great escape - ir really is such an amazing transition that is just there. A square block in area - places to sit for coffee and food to relax, a few places to shop for unique gifts, an old-fashioned carousel for kids, a open lawn area surrounded by large trees - a nice setting. You wouldn't think there's be a place like this in the middle of New York, but there it is! A great place to go - anytime of day or evening!

friendly, great atmosphere, visited in summertime. We stayed at the Bryant Park Hotel, and really enjoyed breakfast every single day in the park :-) plenty of good options for food in and around the park. Really enjoyed just watching the people, absorbing the relaxing atmosphere. The park contains the New York Library, is at couple minutes walking distance of Times Square.
Take out place to eat. Good place to eat your take out. Plenty of tables and chairs around. Lovely trees giving dappled shade, a real blessing on a hot sunny day
evening stroll. stumbled on the park during evening walk, nice and quiet to have an evening stroll, would recommend it after an evening meal and a good view of the empire state building all lit up

Always an oasis. The best little Park ever. The park morphs with the season with an outdoor reading g room where books, papers and such are freely lent out, kiosks of unique items for sale in the fall, skating in winter and great people watching year round. Southwest porch is very cool and the Grill restaurant always a great choice for $$$ kind of rating.
Visit if you are close by. Great Experience to meet local people in a local park. Clean and safe. Well worthy of a visit whe you are close by

Small oasis in midtown. A small midtown alternative to Central Park, we called in to relax & chill for an hour or so on a hot summer's day. As it was mid morning there was nothing going on but it is a fantastic relaxing place I would love to return when events are happening.

Resting point in a manic city. Love it, really good for taking a little break from the hustle n bustle of Manhatten, good place to people watch, have a nice cream or coffee.
2 minutes walk from Times Square and right next to the library

Lots of interesting events, learn jiggling, yoga, watch the birds, listen to piano, etc. Reading room!. I wish I had time enought to go there every day: to relax while reading papers, etc., to enjoy piano and lunch (sorry but the musician did not really mind), watch a movie free
Small park nice to relax. Lovely small park with lots of chairs to sit on and relax. There are also booths to get food and a carousel for kids.

Great summertime activities. This park is the greatest. In the evenings they have outdoor movies. In the day there are Food vendors as well as handmade gifts. In the winter there is ice skating. Great little park

Worth the time to relax from the crazy city. unless you walk by Bryant Park you'll likely miss it. In NY terms its a big park, but in most cities not. In the summer you can sit on great cafe chairs enjoying people watching, or in the evening watch a movie on the temporary screen. Its definately a great spot for photos and just relaxing away from the crowds. Worth putting this on your stop list

Bryant Park a slice of heaven amidst the hustle and bustle of New York City. Bryant Park is a slice of heaven amidst the hustle and bustle of New York City. When the noise and congestion of the city becomes a little too much, I just walked to Bryant Park to find my inner calm and centre my universe.  Highlights:Plenty of seating in a leafy and lush area,Free board games to use,A pétanque area,2 Table tennis tables to use,Carousel for the kids,A cool selection of books/mags in the reading area, Free digital charging station!! Awesome coffee, drinks and waffle eatery,The cleanest public toilet in New York!! Located on the back of the New York Public library.This is an undervalued piece of paradise in New York; I can't wait to return!!
Beautiful park. Free concerts during Summer time and lots of nice restaurants nearby. Very nice place to take a rest.

Movie night in the summer. Summertime movies at Bryant Park. Show up between 4pm and 5pm to save a place on the lawn. Then wait until dark for the movie to start. If you have a good sized group, which is what we do then you can party and have dinner picnic style. Everybody brings food and drinks and we all share. Good fun!
A model for all small parks. With tables and seats everywhere, games for grown ups and children alike, books to sit and read and food/ drink available, this is a beautiful little park
Green space with class!. Friendly, relaxing atmosphere in middle of Manhattan. Always something fascinating to see. Great outdoor bar, restaurant and food kiosks to enjoy.

Bryant Park is a hidden gem in the city!. A nice green space in the middle of a very busy city. I really enjoy Bryant Park. They show movies at night in the summer and that is just terrific. It is just a great place to sit on a blanket and enjoy the city! Love it!

Lovely surprise in amongst the streets.. This lovely park was full of workers having their lunch. What a great park in amongst the streets. It was great to walk around, have some lunch from many stalls or restaurants, or even sun bath on the grass or the many chairs available.

An oasis in the heart of a metropolis. What a wonderful Park. Reading room with daily papers , books for children and adults and seats all round under a canvas top should it rain-as it did on my visit.Gardens all around and the Carousel for the little children is so sweet.Very quiet there as all those who go are mindful of the ambience reflected by the location which is in the heart of a busy busy City. Coffee stalls within he Park.cater well for the visitor. Touring bus stances are just outside the Park.The tours are worth doing and their starting point at the Park is a great location. Beautiful Library adjacent to the Park and lovely surroundings throughout. Not to be missed.

Small but interesting park. We were staying nearby so decided to pay the park a visit. It is only small but there are so many activities; table tennis, chess, petang, crafts for children to mention a few and various events scheduled on different days.
