We had a relaxing drink and snack and just took the whole scene in. Great for people watching. It is quite small and busy but relaxing nonetheless unless you decide to join in one of the yoga or dance classes. Good place to stop, especially in the sun.
Its a bliss to sit in this park and just do nothing. I just like to sit around here on the chairs and sink in the busy stuff going on all around this crazy place. What a serenity.
Prime Place for People-Watching. After walking all around the Time Square area, it's great to pull up a chair and give your feet a rest in Bryant Park, a prime place for people-watching.
small but very nice park. One of my favorite parks in NYC. I love this place especially during the winter, when people are ice skating while others are enjoying shopping at small stores in the park.
Perfect Place to Take a Rest. It is fully recommended to follow free events such as like movie nights and yoga sessions. The park is lovely and a perfect place to relax and have a lunch/coffee.
Some peace & clean toilets. Love Bryant Park. Always seem to find our way back there. Weddings, yoga, many activities. A great place to take a break

Bryant Park Summer. Always my favourite park, great during summer, in August they have the park full of activities and stalls of all goods to buy and eat and then get comfortable to watch a movie on the big screen. All the time best place to watch and its for your entertainment .. On the other months of the year its different again, winter time you will have the snow and so on...
amazing open green space. this is a little slice of heaven in the middle of the city. Beautiful green space, lovely to relax in. Don't miss it

Oasis in the city. On Sunday morning we strolled over to Bryant Park. The flowers were beautiful and the park was so clean. There were a few places to get a coffee or small snack but we were attracted to the Bryant Park Grill. It didn't open until 11:30 so enjoyed the scenery. We were able to sit outside under an umbrella and had a fabulous lunch. Everyone was friendly and the service was great. My husband had a delicious pork loin and I had a huge salad with quinoa and amazing veggies. A lovely ending to a beautiful weekend.
Great small park in midtown Manhattan.. We stayed opposite Bryant Park and went there every day during our stay. There are lots of tables and chairs in the park and a buzzy bar which serves meals.

Urban Oasis. Bryant Park, behind the NY Public LIbrary flagship builidng, is the most beautiful urban park in this City! It is a haven for the employees of the surrounding offices, who can eat their lunch outdoors, under the beautiful plane trees. It is one park where ball playing is not allowed, so that people can stretch out on the grass and sunbathe or read. Music at midday, movies at night during the summer. Several activity corners dot the perimeter: petanque, chess, scrabble, english classes, karate, juggling, even a free reading room - open air of course. In keeping with the seven levels of stacks underground. Chairs and tables shared easily by anyone who visits, and quiet corners available. There are two or three kiosks selling overpriced sandwiches and coffee but feel free to bring your own from delis all around the park. Free wifi too. My fave place to spend an extra hour or so.

Great spot for ice skating in the wintertime!. If you have children, this is the place to take them ice skating between November and January - yes, it's still crowded but doesn't seem quite as overwhelming as Rockefeller Plaza - plus, the kiosks surrounding the rink are full of terrific crafts and other Christmas gift shopping opportunities.

What a gem. What a fabulous place. Open air space to hold events, bands etc or even just sit and relax on all the tables and chairs placed for public use. Great to grab a sandwich and sit and watch the world go by

Ideal spot to relax while exploring NYC. Lovely spot to relax for a moment while exploring NYC. Food and drink options available and an outdoor library. We stopped for a break here twice, the first time there was a mass yoga session on, the second time there were bands playing. Fantastic

Peaceful short walk. This is a lovely park very close to Grand Central. We were staying at the Grand Hyatt and took a short walk to the park from the hotel. Perfect for a little exercise and some greenery.

A pretty park. I feel like I would have loved this park soo much more if I had visited the NYC public library next to it beforehand. The park by itself is a quaint place, good to have lunch on a sunny day but quite small in size so there's normally a battle for seating and chairs. Good place to people watch but I feel as if it was just an average park.

Break time!. Take some out of your busy schedule and hang out in Bryant Park which is very close to Times Square. There are vendors in the park that offer food and drink. Many tables and chairs in the sun or shade.

Beautiful place to take a breath. My family of 3 visited NYC for the 1st time in june the weather was beautiful. We were surprised to come across Bryant park a little oasis in a big noisy city. We charged our phones and ipods took a breath and recharged. My son had fun playing a little golf with business men on their lunch break. A wonderful memory for him. (11 yr old).
Beautiful park. Visited during the summer, the park is great for relaxing during a busy day. Its conveniently located to Grand Central so both can be done together
Loved this park.. Lovely little park in the middle of craziness. Ride the carousel. Apart from tourists (which are everywhere) locals seemed to be here as well and I liked that.

A good place to enjoy lunch. Bryant Park shares a block with the beautiful Main New York Public Library on 42nd Street and 5th Avenue. Just walk west towards 6th Avenue and you'll run right into it. During the summer there is plenty of outdoor seating (benches or tables and chairs) set up if you want to purchase your lunch and sit down to enjoy it. You can also visit Southwest Porch to order food and drinks at the park. There is also wi-fi available and outlets for charging your devices. Other places to eat include Bryant Park Grill and Bryant Park Cafe.During the winter, they have the "Winter Wonderland." You can go ice skating and there are many holiday vendors with stalls set up.
peaceful place. such a pretty park to sit around and read, or people watch!! Good coffee at their onsite cafe. Always frun to come here.
Skating. Very good. Skating is very nice in the winter, and the lawn is very nice in the summer. Go there, regardless of the season.
Taking a Break in Bryant Park. Great place to take a break from all the downtown activity. Lots of seating and several options for a snack (all very expensive for what they had to offer).

Perfect Place for Lunch Break. This is my favorite place to take lunch. I work a few blocks away and regularly grab a soup (cold weather) or sandwich / salad (warm weather) and spend lunch hour here studying the buildings that circle it and the people frequenting it. With free wifi I can also work here!
See what you find. Came apron the park whilst walking back to hotel and there was a Tommy Hillfinger promotion which was fun to watch.

One of my favourite places!. I love this oasis in the city. Whether Shopping nearby, visiting the Library, sitting and watching the world go by, having a coffee - or a Water Melon Cooler from " Coffee" , a stand in the Park - it's a great place. The Cafe and the Restaurant are also both great places to eat!
nice garden. Bryant park was place of people to hang out and sitting in the garden and listen the music and some coffee shop. the place was clean also.
An oasis in the heart of the city. This was so unexpected in the midst of all the hustle and bustle of busy streets. Loved the reading room under canvas just to sit and chill with a borrowed book.

Nice small park in downtown NY. This park was bustling with activity for the 2 days we were around here. The carousal for small children is a big attraction. Also the late evening movies in the park during summer. The park was lush green and nice oasis kind of place in downtown area.
There are good eating places all around it.
A respite from the craziness of mid town / times square. Bryant park is a great space during summer to kick back with a cold juice, grab some free wi-fi and chillout

Favorite spot during our stay. My boyfriend and I visited this spot several times during our stay. After spending most of our day walking, we were so happy to find a nice clean, peaceful, serene spot to spend some time resting. We loved Bryant Park. We even had lunch here a few times, we never had a problem finding a small table and chairs. There are plenty of restaurants on the outskirts of the park and a few small vendors. It was a beautiful park, we'll definitely be back!

An oasis in a sea of buildings!. We came across this by chance and was amazed at how tranquil a spot it was in such a bustling place. Great place to sit and chill or eat and it provided a haven from the heat of the day with the fountains.
Relax. Used to go here during my lunch breaks for work. It's a nice park, small and there are a few outside restaurants to grab a few drinks at during happy hour.
tai chi in byriant park. the most amazing and wonderful attraction we did after the participation in a church in harlem! BEAUTIFUL on tuesday and thursday from 7.30 to 8.30 in the morning!

Breathtakingly beautiful. My husband and I walked into Bryant Park last Christmas and were so surprised with what we saw. There is a Christmas Market with artisan type merchandise, a mini carousel and an ice skating rink. Beautiful Christmas trees everywhere. We found an amazing restaurant called 'Celcius' that had tables set up outside with each table having its own heater. Watching the skaters while having a wonderful hot meal and glass of wine was a perfect end to our day. While we were eating we saw they were about to bring out the Zamboni to clean the ice but before doing that we noticed there was a couple at centre ice. The young man was down on one knee proposing to his girlfriend!!!! How romantic!If you plan on spending time in New York in December, put Bryant Park at the top of your list of thigs to see and do. You won't regret it.

Relaxing, Beautiful. We always come back to Bryant Park when visiting NYC whether to relax, stroll down the beautiful walks graced by the majestic sycamores, or even to visit the NYPL. Great to see others at play with chess, table tennis, etc. Bit pricey restaurant behind the library, but being outside makes it worthwhile.
NYC visit. This park is very nice and peaceful. A nice place to relax in. It is a very good location as well. No complaints.

MY FAVORITE PARK!!!!. I love Bryant Park all year round. In the summer they have concerts. All kinds, such as from broadway shows each week and jazz concerts too. They have knitting classes and language classes, etc. They have a section for children. It has food and coffee stands. They have fashion week! The winter is my favorite time when the booths open around the skating ring, and sell everything from hot apple cider to gloves to art work to jewelry and so, so much more and the Christmas tree and happy faces. It's a beautiful time of the year.

Bryant Park is a must do. There is almost always something happening in Bryant Park. This is now an epicenter of interaction in New York City. Chess, checkers, reading, performances, restaurants, movies, a carousel, picnics, ice skating, exhibits, and the list goes on.

Relaxing park in the middle of it ALL. Nice park to eat your lunch, whether grabbing a sandwich someplace and eating it there or actually sitting in the restaurant there. It is a wonderful place in the spring, summer and fall to be outside. Nice park benches to read a book, people watch or just take a break from the busy streets. This park is in the middle of it all about 3-4 blocks west of grand central station.
Great place to rest in the evening. A great place to lay down on the grass in the heart of the city. I recommend to come here in the evening after few drinks and just lay on the grass and rest.

Cute park in busy Manhattan. Opposite to Kinokuniya bookshop, Bryant park is a nice place to visit. We visited this around 11 am and witnessed hundreds of people (men and women) sitting, standing, eating, drinking and chit chatting. There is a nice restaurant inside the park serving tasty sandwiches, cakes, coffee and juice. The small water fountain is very photogenic.
Beautiful little Park. I absolutely LOVED this little park, so relaxing!!! Several great restaurants to choose from with a great view of the park and tall buildings.

An oasis surrounded by highrises. I love this park. It's dead smack in the middle of mid town surrounded by highrises. There are lots of chairs and tables for a sit and people watch. You could go there anytime of the day or night. There are usually some activities going on. There's also the Bryant Park Grill restaurant located right in it. It's just great. If you're from out of town, definitely check it out.

A charming park in the heart of Midtown Manhattan. This park is a gem, situated right behind the New York Public Library between 5th and 6th Avenues, and 41st and 42nd Streets. These few acres of green space are supremely well organised and tended, with everything one wants from a public park - lawns, trees, flower beds, chairs and tables for picnics and chess, a good café at one end and a French carousel for the kiddies at the other end. Bird life of several species is plentiful, a plethora of cultural activities is organised there round the year, and the park has the best-maintained and flower-bedecked rest rooms in any public place in the City. Coming from London, I'd be proud if we had a park as nicely-run and maintained as this treasure is.

Sweet little park. What a wonderful little park right in Manhattan! Our hotel was only a few blocks away and we walked to the park almost everyday. It was a nice place to stop and watch the world go by for a few minutes. We were always able to find a few chairs to sit down, even if it took a few minutes are more crowded days. There are several places to buy food and drinks but we never did.
A calm spot among the hustle and bustle.. We enjoyed a pack lunch here along with all the office workers and it was a peaceful space during our hectic day walking around all the local sights.
nice cosy park. nice spot to spend some time, has a nice openair cinema during summer too, good to relax a bit before immersing back into the city
great. really great park - nice place to have a sit relax or drink or eat something good location worth a visit
Relax and watch the world go by.. This is a sensational park right in town, grab a bite and park your butt and sit back and watch the world go by!

So much green!!. Bryant Park was such a pleasant surprise to find! The gardens are so luscious and green, there is plenty of seating and a plethora of food choices all around. There was even free juggling classes! Perfect mini escape for lunch.
A nice little park. Not as big as central park but it is nice to see a bit of green among all of the huge buildings in Manhattan. A nice little park to sit and have some ice cream
Love Bryant Park, .. This place is great! Several restaurants and the park is so relaxing. Saw Shakespeare in the park. Get a cup of coffee and enjoy the environment.

One of NYC's outdoor treasurers, Bryant Park should be on the list of anyone visiting midtown Manhattan. A must see any time of the year, Bryant Park always has a lot going on from the hot and humid days of summer to the cold of winter, when ice skating is popular and the Christmas Market a NUC favorite

Best place in NYC for coffee, lunch and to relax. This is one of the places in NYC I like best for lunch or to have a cup of coffee/tea. Best is to buy your food drinks upfront. Across the street are two Pret-a-Manger shops for take-away lunch or drinks and there is a Jamba Juice for your daily vitamin shot. I like the vibe in the park: people just take one of the green iron chairs, place it somewhere and relax. It is a quiet and green spot in between skyscrapers.

Bryant Park, an oasis in central Manhattan. Very close to our hotel and we visited Bryant Park several times during our visit. Lots of places to sit and enjoy the park. There are plenty of things to do in the park, a library area you can sit and enjoy books provided. Games areas with games provided to play. Table tennis, restaurants and play areas for children. Very impressive.

Amazing place i the middle of NY. Fantastic little oasis in the middle of New York.Great place to sit in the summer, particularly in the evening to have dinner and laze over a drink.Feels unreal but is great.A must place to go!
Rest for a bit. This isn't your 1980s Bryant Park. Eat some waffles and rest on the grass. Very safe and relaxing for NY.
Summer in Bryant park. Go for a stroll around Bryant park stay and enjoy the music and food. Chill out even on the hottest days.

A gem in the middle of the city!. A great place to relax from the noise and hustle of the city. Sit and play games, sit and have a beer or just walk around. Beautiful, renovated "biffy's" that are clean and nice to go into. Even fresh flowers! A neighborhood gem that has been rehabilitated from disaster. A nice touch in the middle of busy Manhattan.

Relaxing area, lots going on. We went here a few times to catch our breath, get some shade and relax in our busy week in New York. Just a little way from Times Square, but far enough to be able to sit down and chill, , families, couples and people grabbing a break from lunch all seemed to use the park at lunch times and after offices had closed there were a number of people having a drink at the bar area . Really liked it here

Lovely outdoor summer dining. Visited Bryant Park in August 2015. It's a lovely little park in the heart of NYC. In summer it has outdoor dining that looks over a small grassed park where night movies are shown. In winter it's converted to indoors dining with the grassed area of the park transforming into a ice skating rink. Had a lovely dinner in a very safe and scenic location. Food was very nice and reasonably priced. Coming from Australia it was nice to not see a fly or mosquito whilst dining outside.

It's the activities that are great. Bryant Park itself isn't that interesting, but there are many activities - from lectures to markets -- that make it an interesting place to be. So, check the schedule and see what's up.

Cute and cool place to go. A beautiful place in the middle of everything In August they have old movies and in winter have a wonderful ice skating rink; in the corner its the delicious Le Pain Quotidien so that can be the perfect ending of a date.

nice place but watch out for the rats!. centrally located, with nice viewhowever better watch out for the rats coming out at night time!!! dont forget it is nyc and this is the vermin's homeBesides that, its a nice place to have lunch or just read a book.

One of my favourite spaces in New York. This place is ideal if you want to do New York on a budget - it was one of our favourite places. Buy some pizza to take away and go to the park - there are lots of chairs and tables in the park. There are chess boards and a trolley full of board games. There is a reading area where you can swap books - you can play table tennis for free - there is a carousel, fountains and a large area of grass. They have exercise classes and films there too - it is the most fabulous use of a park. The toilets are divine and the staff fabulous - a must for anyone- it is also behind the Library which has to be one of the most beautiful places in the world - and also it is an unparalled spot for people watching
our front yard when staying at the Bryant Park Hotel. cool place to walk through, have a beverage at the Café, people watch, lounge in the sun, or take a spot in the shade.

Take a breath. A pleasant space in the centre of New York city. Always something going on. You can play a game of chess, ping pong, do yoga get a language lesson or watch a movie. Plenty of food choices and a bar if you want a drink. Catch up with the rest of the world using free Wifi. All together a great space.
One of the best spots in NYC. One of the greatest park in the city. They also do yoga twice a week and it's beautiful to see all the mats on the grass

Bryant Park: A littel piece of Heaven. We had lunch outside at The Grill in Bryant Park. Best Brie ever!!! The weather was so perfect and the staff, very friendly. We all ordered something different to try and I couldn't pick a favorite. We saw the end of a beautiful wedding.
Very clean restrooms!. Beautiful, bustling park. Full of interesting people. The park was the pick up point for our tour bus. We would rest there after our walk. Very clean restrooms!

My Happy Place. Bryant Park is one of my NYC favorites. I love to watch the ice skaters, browse the shops, watch the jugglers. It is my happy place and one of the first places I visit every time I'm in the city. Make the time to visit, sit, relax and people watch.
Pleasant park. Good location, good vendors, plenty of seating, clean, well kept and safe. Interesting to watch the people playing chess
Good central town space. A welcome stopping off point in the midst of all that concrete, a lovely fountain but could do with a few more plants

For visitors and worker bees alike. There is always something to see in Bryant Park, no matter what time of year. Ice rink, carousel, lawn chairs, ping pong, chess, a fountain. Years ago you didn't dare walk through Bryant Park as it was dank and in despair. It's transformation is an important part of mid-town for both daily worker bees to enjoy at lunchtime and also visitors at all times of the year.

Mind your head.. Whilst we were there, a branch fell off a tree and put 3 people in hospital. I cant knock it for that though, these things happen occasionally. However, it is a park. No more, no less.
The cool place to chill. I love Bryant Park! I could not have enough of it. the vibrations of the city pass by this park by sure.

Music concerts, people watching, or introspection.. Take your pick!. Summer evenings, cool music, and the serene setup of Bryant Park made my trip to New York an utter delight. I visited a friend in NY, and he took me to this place. There's a Chipotle right opposite the park, we grabbed lunch, sat in the park and listened to some live jazz by a band performing at that time. It was an ethereal experience!
Go play a game of chess - for kids. I totally recommened you go to the area where they have board games available. it is a total buzz for kids and allows ypu to take in the world around you
A lovely place to rest your feet.. A very friendly park, with all sorts of amenities, including a charging station for portable electronics.

Excellent people-watching spot. A lovely place to sit and people watch. Took my teenage daughter here awhile back and we ate an enjoyable meal on the patio of the Bryan Park Grill. New York does parks so well!

A hazen in the midst of crazy. We strolled through this park on a hot week day. The place was bustling with office workers out enjoying their lunch or just enjoying some fresh air. There is plenty of grass and shade and lots of seats scattered randomly about the park. You are sure to find a seat somewhere. The day we visited their was a pianist playing in the park and it was just wonderful to enjoy this in the middle of this crazy city.
Beautiful. We stayed at the Bryant Park Hotel so this was our oasis within the city. We found the people watching to be fascinating and it helped that the weather on this trip was outstanding.

A must do!. we stumbled across this last time we visited New York and thought it was a lovely place. Its very small but a delightful oasis in the middle of New York. There is a ' reading room', table tennis tables and lots of areas to sit with stalls for food and drinks
Nice and Quaint. Beautiful green space in the middle of a bustling city. Seating to enjoy lunch or to read on a break. It's a great atmosphere to enjoy

Relaxing break in beautiful park while sightseeing. Check the park website for concerts, we planned to visit the area when there was an Accordion Band Festival. Just sit on the grass and enjoy the views. People watch and relax.
Nice way to end a day of walking!. Perfect place to relax and have a drink before dinner! Beautiful surroundings and fun for kids, too!
Great place for a breather. Loved this piece of heaven in the city. Stopped for a breather (and a glass of wine) on our whistle stop New York tour.
I wish I could live or work nearby this park. A really nice park with small shops selling small stuffs and good cafes and food stalls. Lotsa great spots to take pictures.

A gem of a city park. This is a super little public city park of about 9 acres, hidden behind, and actually above the archives of, The New York Public Library.The park houses "Le Carroussel" for children to take rides, a huge open lawn, and The Reading Room, an outdoor library for all.Bryant Park is a lovely sanctuary form the hustle bustle of the City, and a place to sit, take stock, and people watch.

Relaxing in the City. A great little park on 6th Avenue which caters for all. Restaurants at one end, food vans and little huts at the other. Chairs and tables are provided, and there is also volleyball, bocce and chess if that's your thing. Once a week there is a free concert on the lawns.

Good for small relaxing moments. It has a very beautiful location. Amid busy Manhattan, its nice place to relax with lots of free activities. Lots of benches to have food, reading room (Public library is nearby)

the perfect midtown location for a lunch break from sightseeing. This park is just beautiful and a wonderful green oasis in the center of Manhattan. Bring a lunch or buy one from the many vendors in and around the park, grab one of the many chairs, and watch the myriad of activities going on - and feel like a local.

Sanctuary in the city. Bryant park is great because there are plenty of chairs and tables to sit under the amazing tall graceful trees in the middle of the city in midtown Manhattan. There is a ping pong table and plenty of newspapers and books to read on the north side, along with 2 small coffee and pastry mini-buildings on the northwest corner. There's a fountain and larger café and little outside sit down bar on the west side along the 6th Avenue side. On the south side there are board games and a little merry-go-round for the toddlers and little kids. On the west side right behind the main New York public library there is an outdoor restaurant on the north side and an indoor one on the south side. It's also the area where there is a live piano performance, however I don't know how often that is. In the grassed middle area there are chairs and tables on the side and plenty of space to lay down and relax on a peaceful afternoon. There are plenty of performances during the summer on a daily basis, they have a sign posted in several locations around the park and other information.

Urban park full of activities. Wonderful park with many free activities (ping pong, petanque, mini-golf, a reading room) and endless opportunities for people watching. If I lived in New York, I think I would spend lots of time here.

Sooooo Beautiful. This place is wonderful. The park has many chairs for you to borrow and sit in one of the several beautiful spots to eat your lunch. The cafes around the park are reasonable in price. Try Breads Bakery - delicious bread, sandwiches, salads and pastries. There is a reading club/library and in Summer there are activities each Tuesday for you to partake in that are free. There was a knitting club too. This is my absolute favourite spot in New York. The New York Public Library runs along side the park too. If you're visiting New York, please spend a lunchtime here one day.

Kick back and chill. Can spend a long time here just people watching, grab a coffee and choose from the ample seating provided. Also board games, reading etc provided free to use. This is a great place to chillax for a while.
Beloved Bryant Park. One of my favorite spots to hang! Nice for every season, the ice rink and the little shops are so beautiful. Typical ny park
Very nice park!. Such a nice beautiful park in the middle of the city. I just loved it! Lots of activity and food with a great atmosphere.

Beautifully set up for the holiday season. This was a fantastic spot for outdoor shopping right before Christmas. There were an incredible variety of items, as well as some great food and drink stands. When tired from walking around there were many places to just sit and do some people watching. And, if you didn't mind waiting in line, you could also try out the ice skating rink (although the ice was very crowded).

A relaxing haven. Every time I visit the city I make sure I spend an afternoon just watching the world go by in Bryant Park. There's so much going on but it's also a relaxing haven from the madness of the city.

Love Bryant Park. Our hotel was to Bryant Park. We walked to the park in the evening and got our ice cream cones (soft serve trucks were right in front of the library. It was great to sit in the park and people watch while eating our ice cream. Nice location with tables and chairs to sit on.

Great place. It's a great place for everybody except children , I guess. Very relaxing , plenty of chairs to sit. Now they have table games: chess, etc.At summer there were movie nights...Great restaurants.Store next to it, library
Nice Place Close to Times Square for a Rest. The park has lots of chairs and tables to rest those weary legs. Several vendors of food and drink for refreshment. Great place to people watch.
A little ( busy) haven. I love it here. A little haven in the city with some cafés, little shops and a merry go round. ( sadly it wasn't working on our visit). An ice rink here in winter too.
Very relaxing. I bought a slice of cake from Lady M, which was across the street. Then I sat here to enjoy my dessert there, very relaxing!
Nice place to meet for coffee. A nice spot to rest in the shade during the summer, have coffee and chat with friends. Safe and clean!
An oasis near Time Square. My favourite place to lunch. Grab some food at a nearby take out and enjoy the beautiful setting of Bryant Park. An oasis in the middle of Time Square midtown madness
Chillax. Just a nice place to sit down get something to eat and drink, and watch the world go by, there are coffee and snack bars although pricey. You cannot smoke in any of New York Parks.

A small park in Big Apple but sweet.... The park is one of the small parks in the midtown Manhattan, close to the hotel we stayed in, very nice and relaxing atmosphere. Since it is just small, can be crowded at times. There are nice place to sit and enjoy watching the crowd, the fountain, the Merry Go Round/Carousel, and sometimes there are entertainment/ activities scheduled like a pianist in one corner of the park. And there are restaurants around the area. It was a very enjoyable relaxing place in NYC.

An oasis in Midtown. A carousel, a free concert, a lawn for lounging, tables and chairs in the shade for resting or snacking, ping pong tables....what more can you ask for of a park? Oh yes, it is close to the library.

Sunday Mornings. I loved the Sunday morning energy this place exudes. The park was full of people engage in many different activities, as well as others looking for moments of solicitude. How can one place provide both so well?
A good pit stop. Nice pit stop for a coffee and a sit down, but very crowded. Good spot of greenery and relative calm away from the frey of Times Square.

Good break . We walked a Kirin NYC and places like Bryant Park offer you a welcome break (free wifi, epic toilets, food and drink, ... )I understand there are also a multitude of daytime and evening activities relative to the library or not.

Sunny sitting for an ice cream break. A very pretty park for a summer stroll or to sit for a drink and watch the world go by. We spotted it after visiting the New York Library - with all the flowers in bloom it made for a quiet place to enjoy a drink and ice cream
Ok if you are walking pass. Great outdoor space on a beautiful evening, not a lot happening but can enjoy a quite drink and sit out and rest your feet
A hub of activity. Lots going on in the park on the hot afternoon when we walked through. One area had been set aside for a birthday party. There were tables for chess and other games.
Yoga. Nice, comfortable park near Times Square. We walked through late one afternoon to a park full of diverse people yoga-ing. It was fantastic to see some many skill levels exercising together.
A nice park to sit and plan your day. Place to sit and chill, an oasis in the centre of this busy city. Time to reflect and plan your day.

Ice skating without the business of Central Park or The Rockafeller Plaza. For a less busy ice skating experience on a cold winter's day, Bryant park offers pretty scenery and cute little kiosks where you can pick up refreshments such as hot chocolate.

Ghostbusters in the park . I was in NYC for my birthday and it just so happened they were having a free event, Ghostbusters in Bryant park. It was the perfect birthday. The park is beautiful and shows a beautiful sunset. Great for lunch or a picnic.

Lovely area. Such a beautiful park! I would recommend trying one of the small food shops and enjoy your lunch in the park. It is hard to tell you are in a big city while enjoying the trees and scenery.

Great places to eat. Visited in August. Free open air cinema on offer. Lots of excellent places to eat and drink. From casual to formal all in one area. Not sure though about the toilets. Only public toilets available, and none in the bar/restaurant areas. So the lines and wait times left a lot to be desired!

Beautiful central city park. Surrounded by shops and cafes, Bryant Park is a gorgeous central-Manhattan oasis. Lay on the grass or under the trees in the shade in summer, or enjoy the fountain. Sit at a table and chairs and enjoy a snack. The park has many cafes around it and is a great stop-off on a shopping day in Manhattan.

Small park, but nice to walk through.. We walked through and snapped some pictures. It's a nice little green space. During the summer months they have tables, chairs, games, and a carousel. It would be a good place to take kids if you have them with you.

Fell in love with Bryant Park!. This is my FAVORITE Park in NYC! its small, clean, relaxing and right behind the public library. There is a small coffee and pastries shop on the corner of 42nd and 6th, must try!

A place to get away from the hustle of Manhattan. This is a small park located behind the NYC Public Library. There is an area set aside for games and people are sitting at umbrella covered tables playing chess, backgammon and even children's games. There is a carousel. Plenty of benches/tables, some food vendors, and subway station close by. There is also a summer film festival.

Worth spending some time there. Lovely green pace, crowded with people sitting around having lunch or just enjoying the sun. Worth going there for a walk or a stroll or even grab a sandwich and sit there enjoy the vibrant city go a bit calmer.

Get your Game on!. Stumbling across Bryant Park was a very nice surprise!
A very nice place with tables set up with free games such as connect 4, jenga, chess etc
A tip would be to go to the sandwich/pizza shop forst and chill out on Bryant Park!

Loved this park. We walked through Byrant Park daily and loved the flowers, atmosphere and activities. This park hosts Shakespeare in the Park and many concerts. It is well worth spending time drinking coffee , relaxing and enjoying the activities.

Wonderful, magical place. This is one of my favorite parks in the city. It is different in each season and as beautiful in on as it is in another. Concerts in the summer, ice skating in winter. Wonderful, magical place.

An absolute oasis in an urban roller derby of cars, trucks, cyclists, and smart phone zombies.... Lots of cool options here...and the statue of Gertrude Stein will bring a smile to your face...if not hers :)

Very nice park with everything you need. Everything is there!. Carousel, Free games , ping pong, food, drinks, tables and chairs, things to do at certain times, Boules, food, and beautiful landscaping.
Nice Little Park in NY. Nice park located right behind the NY Public Library. Always something going on there. Nice to relax and give your tired feet a break!
Nice and busy little park. I have only been here during spring and summer. Bustling place. There is always something going on. I stumbled upon it after leaving the library. The carousel is quaint.

On the main road. A beautiful park lots of space to relax in but right on the main street
People go on there lunch break to relax and unwind this place has a nice feel to it go and walk in this park
Convenient location to take a break. A relaxing couple of hours in the sunshine enjoying a drink. An ideal location midtown, to take a break from the hub-ub of shopping and sight seeing.

As a New Yorker. Great park just in the middle of skyscrapers.
There's table tennis available for free and also the book corner where people can grab a book and read it in the park for free.
We had lunch in the park... Lovely experience,we felt part of the city.

A Manhattan Oasis.. You can sit and enjoy the park, do yoga (there was a class in the park), people watch, bring your lunch or a coffee or just rest from walking NYC. The park is located directly behind the NYC Library.

Such an amazing spot in the big city!. This park is right behind New York public library. It's very nice spot to spend few hours there. Things you can do there are: going for a drink, or visiting reading room right in the park or playing table tennis or just simple sitting and enjoying yourself. You might have opportunity to hear some local bands. Plan to visit this charming park!
very nice. good place to people watch, good food vendors, wonderful place to take a break from sightseeing and rest. they have movie at night during the summer.
Nice break. Nice place to take a break from the walking around the city; plenty of places to grab something to eat and (since it was Friday?) sit and listen to a free concert.
Central and always something going on. Always a nice place to rest ..there is always something going on ..entertainment and in winter ICE SKATING is cool
Check schedule. If you have time. In summer, check the park schedule. They have class going on. I took yoga 2 years back. It was good!

Little piece of heaven. A lovely quiet spot in the craziness of NYC. We had breakfast here in the sunshine on a couple of occasions and enjoyed the peace and tranquility it offered.Close to Empire State, grand central station, Times Square and New York library.
lunch in bryant park.. Lovely space have been in winter and now summer lots of sections for different activities such as reading. However very busy at lunch time when the weather is good

An oasis amongst the husstle. Bryant Park is simply lovely. On a hot day it is an oasis of shade where you can sit and read or play chess. There are also plenty of cafes and a "posh" restaurant overlooking the park. In the summer evenings there are open air films shown in the park. The park is only a 10 min walk from the hustle and bustle of Times Square but a world apart.

Peace and jazz in the heart of the city. Just round the corner from Times Square with great views of both the Empire State Building and the Rockerfeller centre is a peaceful grass park with coffee bars and lots of places to sit and drink. We saw a jazz band one Friday evening and tai che and juggling Saturday morning. Lovely to grab breakfadt at one of the nearby delis and watch the world go by.

Lovely park. This was on my itinerary for our stay and we almost didn't go but so glad we did. Just a quaint little park with a good amount of tables and chairs around. A few coffee shops around the edge. Ideal to read that tour guide or just people watch. During July and August they have outdoor cinemas here which I wished we had gone to. Maybe next time. Well worth a visit.

Summer free concerts are a real joy. After a hectic week visiting most of the NYC attractions we decide to take it easy on Sunday afternoon/evening and chill around the Bryant Pk area, for our surprise the city have free concerts during the summer months. So, chilling in the park, sipping a nice cold beverage and listening to new coming artist playing = amazing. And all that for free!!

beutifull. On our first day we stumbled on to Bryant park and wow what a place everything for the kids that you would want coffee houses and chess games free for use and the views Empire State Building on one side backs onto the lbrary where ghot busters was filmed just fantastic

Don't forget this park. Though Bryant Park was only minutes from my hotel, I got there only on our final day, after a quick visit to the nearby Grand Central Station and the New York Museum. I was surprised by how lovely the park was and wish I had more time to enjoy it - to sit at a cafe or play ping pong or just gaze at the fountain.
Bryant Park. What a lovely small park with lots going on and a great place for a cold drink on a hot day. Right next to the NY Library.
Lovely City Park!. We stumbled on to Bryant Park while out walking and sight-seeing. It's a lovely park and we enjoyed our time there. Great Gelato vendor!

Nice Park!. Great pastry stands. Beautiful relaxing park to get away from the busy Times Square and just have a coffee and pastry in the beautiful shady park. Just wish we had found this gem earlier on in our trip.

Magical little park. As visitors from Canada, we stumbled across this little park quite by accident. It was a beautiful little oasis in the middle of the concrete jungle where you can grab a snack or a coffee and a bit of fresh air. Definitely a must if you want to take a little break from the daily grind or the hustle & bustle of the city.

relaxing and quaint. Visited Bryant Park while in NYC. It's a fantastic respite from the hustle/bustle of the city. Grab a drink and sit at one of the plentiful table/chairs or bring a blanket and rest on the lawn of the park. The water fountain drowns out some of the noise of the City or sit near the open stage area and listen to a band or watch a movie during the summer.

The Homeless Must Have Gone Home...... For those that remember what a disaster Bryant Park was years ago, nothing could be farther from the truth! Bryant Park is now electric and lively with live music, people on their laptops, exercise groups, restaurant/drink places and more. My particular favorite was that they have a "Board Game Cart". You choose whatever game you would like to play, take it to your table and play for as long as you like.....for free! Was also sweet to see all the kids on the Merry-Go-Round, as well. Go to Bryant Park and people watch, it's fabulous.
Beautiful - overwhelmed by vendors. Too bad a potentially wonderful park is overtaken by commerce. Used to be fun but too much is too much!!
Order a coffee and relax. Lovely park in the centre of NYC. Grab a coffee and a bite to eat and just breath. We were lucky to catch a free concert so check what is happening daily in Bryant Park.

Loved the reading corner.. Great park, chairs not terribly comfortable though. Good selection of cafes . Grass was out of bounds on some of the days we were there so had to sit on uncomfortable chairs.
Live a Little Like a Local. Great setting for brunch, dinner, drinks. Relax and indulge in some people watching. Look out for activities and movie nights in the park.

Don't overlook this oasis in mid-town. Decades ago this park was a disaster -- now it is a gem. Beautifully landscaped, surrounded with varied seating, offers many refreshment options plus movies, music, petanque, book exchange, language lessons, knitting instruction, on and on. A real community center outdoors. Something for everyone & a bit of peace and a nice chair right behind the library.

One of my favourite places in the whole city!. Beautiful oasis in the middle of the city...perfect to take time out and relax. We took coffee and pastries there in the mornings and sat at the tables watching the world go by.We went in the summer and they have films showing on the green for free which was absolutely brill. The atmosphere was amazing.
Green space. Has a nice restaurant and also an outside cafe. Several food vendors, and amusement set up for the kids. In the heart of Manhatten. Hosts many outdoor events and Friday morning concerts.
A beautiful park in busy new York.. Lots of activities held here in the summer. A great place just to sit and enjoy the passing crowds. It's a lovely garden and it's got heaps of atmosphere.

good spot to relax. Had a drink in the park one afternoon on the way back to the hotel and the people watching was great.Would love to be able to come back and watch an open air movie but time was against us

A Nice Deep-City Respite Amidst the Hustle & Bustle. I think that Bryant Park is like a chameleon. It changes seasonally with flowers, concerts, outdoor movies, ice skating rink, etc. I visit it each time I'm in New York.There is a public restroom at the park that is the most elegant & clean public restroom that I've ever seen! I think the Parks Department must have dedicated staff to maintain the restrooms!

Just nice park. Bryant Park is just nice - not too big but large enough to fit beautiful flora, with chairs, tables and food stalls. There are a couple cafes around. They also show movies there in the summer, but I didn't manage to catch one.It is easily accessible via subway and it's right next to the NY Public Library.The park is clean and cool, with a lot of nice photo opportunities.
Lots of fun. Great place to people watch. All type of people, you can grab a drink and they had a band playing friday night
Christmas Cheer!. Awesome experience with the Christmas season in the air. The children and adults were having a great time and I thank God I was able to experience NYC during Christmas.

A great little park. I love Bryant Park. It has a real hub about it. It Is only a small park but it is great for people wAt hing and eating a picnic lunch. We had a pret sandwich and watched the world go by. For half an hour. It is also right next door to the New York Library which is worth a visit.

Beautiful Day for a Walk in Bryant Park. A friend told me about Bryant Park, which is behind the New York City Library. It was a rather small park, but lovely! We got there around lunch time, so many people were lounging on the grass, eating or just enjoying the wonderful sunshine and fountains. A resident artist was painting a watercolor landscape picture of the park while we were there. It was beautiful! What a breath of fresh air this park is, both figuratively and literally speaking!

Monday night movie in Bryant Park - must do!. What a nice park just to sit and relax! We got to see a Monday Night movie during our stay! What an experience! Certainly a must do if you are NY during summer!
My favorite park in the city. Always great coffee, food and things to see around here. They were having a film festival while I visited and really enjoyed that!

Great place to chill out. One of my favorite places to visit when I come to New York. People watching here is utterly fascinating. Some good places to grab a bite around the area, and the restroom facilities are fantastic.
Bonus points in the spring / summer when you can chill on the lawn.
An Urban Respite. Always lovely to walk through Bryant Park and people watch. Good coffee and treats - an excellent diversion from otherwise busy touring of NYC.

One of my favorite parks in NYC. A colorful place year round from shops at Christmas time and ice skating to beautiful scenery spring and fall. I am partial to the winter here with the outdoor ice skating offered.
Lovely little bar. Lovely little park in the heart of new york were you can come sit and eat have a drink or just chill out they show films on some days

A park in the city. . A park away from Central Park that's still in the heart of the city. It's a hop, skip and jump away from Grand Central. You can find a seat and chill out watching the world go past or take in some food to eat and sit in the park. Different events take place in the park at night. Last night they showed Back to the Future at no cost. Worth a visit.

How Times Have Changed. Gone are the junkie/needle-infested days of old. Now Bryant Park sports a great ice skating rink and series of shops in the wintertime and is home to free movies on summer evenings. Manicured lawn and a place to rest your feet, in the shadow of the 5th Ave NYC Library and a welcome respite from the city streets.
Must go and just take in the sceneary. Beautiful to relax and just take it easy. Definitely bring your camera and be ready for stunning photos!!!

Important Landmark. This is my favorite park next to Central Park. This is a must visit if you are in NYC. Such a tranquil spot just outside Time Square. I recommend buying your breakfast bagels from Essabagel and eating them in the park while people watching. It is next to the city library as well.

Gorgeous fun filled park. Bryant park is a wonderful little area where one can watch the hustle and bustle of city life with a coffee and take a breather from the heat. There were several things happening whilst we visited such as an outdoor cinema, and live music. I visited most days to have a drink and relax. A must visit for anyone

nice small park. A nice small park to take some time out from a busy day of sightseeing. Smokers beware! I travelled with a smoker and we bailed up by a homeless person begging for a "drag" of her cigarette which took the shine off the experience.

Classy. Nice people, nice view and there's always room for one more. In the heart of ny it's a great place to take a coffee and slow down your day.
There are many of tables free so a picnic is a great idea under the shadow of beatiful plants and trees.

Lovely Park. We visited with Family and Host.
Lovely park , seeing lot of Children playing.
The Pigeons feeding is different experience here.
The big Squirrels are center of attraction

An oasis of calm activity.. Despite its relative obscurity, in tourist terms, compared to its more famous Central cousin, Bryant Park for me was easily the more impressive of the two. Why? Well, mainly because of the activities available every day, ranging from art to language learning by way of Strip Tennis, starring Rafael Nadal, courtesy of Tommy Hilfiger! OK, that was a one off, but it was good fun especially for my wife! We went on two activities, a meditation walk and a tai chi class. Both activities were a great start to the morning with the former at 8.30 - 9.00 and the latter at 7.30 - 8.30. Although you share the park with busy office workers the sessions are calm contemplative affairs. Go along when you're in New York as this innovative park deserves your support and will reward that support with an experience that sets itself apart from the hustle and the bustle of this 24 hour city.

Back to the Future..open air movies!. Went to the open air movie on Monday 24th (although think that was the last movie for the season) - great experience! If you think you might need to visit the restroom pick a spot on the lawn near the edge or else you'll have to 'tip toe' past lots of folk on blankets/rugs to get there.

Spent time with my kids there.. I gre up in NYC and moved to PA 10 years ago. So I'm use to seeing a lot of trees and having a lot of activities. I visited NYC in June and took my kids to Bryant Park. I love the fact that they have a table game area and ping pong tables. The kids and I (and the wife) a great time. It could get very crowded at times though.
Great park for picnic. People watching, picnic ;-). The outdoor movie would be a blast, next trip. Carousel, although no real playground

True urban oasis. Bryant park is probably my favorite place in NYC. There is lots to do, from learning about Nikola Tesla at the (appropriately named) Nikola Tesla corner, to the W.R. Grace building and other architectural gems (see http://www.bryantpark.org/things-to-do/architecture.html) to the famous New York Public Library. But the best part are the walking paths lined with "London plane trees" and dotted with tables and chairs where you can picnic or bring something from the (relatively decent) 'witchcraft coffee and snacks kiosks. The family-friendly Bryant Park Grill has also been very good to us and the brunch food surprisingly tasty!

Fun little park. The park is a fun little area surrounded by beautiful buildings. If you go in the winter there is usually a (free?) ice skating rink, but you have to beat the crowds. At the very least grab a hot chocolate and watch the skaters.

Enjoyed our lunch in Bryant Park. It was Wenesday around 130pm and we picked up food across the street at Chop't, found a few chairs and ate our lunch and watched people. Lots of space above. grassy area below. Did not expect this in the areas. NYC is full of surprises

You don't know your own prices?. To be honest I expected such a tourist destination to be open on a Sunday night. The only place that was could not even tell us the price of a bottle of wine in their establishment. The park was pretty but nothing amazing.
Perfect location for a outdoor breakfast . We had an early breakfast in this beautiful park. Quite and calm. Enjoy birds song or a ping pong match on one of the outdoor ping pong tables.
Nice reprieve from the skyscrapers.. Loved coming here after walking all over the city. It's very peaceful and relaxing. Situated behind the New York City library.
For a bit of peace.. We sat here on a Saturday morning after breakfast. It was peaceful and the flowers and plants were beautiful . A lovely place to sit if you want to escape the bustle.
Nice little park. This is one of our favorite places in NYC. Great place to unwind and enjoy a cup of coffee while taking in the city views.
Excellent place to Chill out. On a sunny afternoon you have to go to Bryant Park to relax. Thérèse os a bar in the middle of the Park where you can enjoy a cocktail while admirering the scenery

Where can one get a drink or snack in the park?. The park is lively and lovely, but we were seeking somewhere relaxing where we might also find some sandwiches and beverages. There are no food vendors or food trucks parked near Bryant Park, which is very unfortunate for thirsty, hungry visitors.

My Favorite Park in the City after Central Park. Bryant Park is a chameleon park, it can be transformed as a movie place, a concert venue, bazaar location and SKATING RINK!
My favorite is the beer garden which is a hangout for cold beer on a summer and a warm place during the winter.

A nice surprise in Manhattan. An oasis of peace and quiet in the busy city center. Look at the schedule of events to catch a free concert, enjoy a snack or a drink, and catch your breath while exploring Manhattan, or simply let your kids run around on the grass.
Great pit stop to recharge the battery's. Great little place for people to take a few minutes and relax as you watch the city go speeding past you!
A calm and pretty haven. Bryant Park is a beautiful little park that provides a pretty haven in the middle of a busy city. Even if you just go to sit and read the paper, it is worth it.

Movies in the Park in NYC!. Beautiful day walking along the Park enjoying the sun and having drinks. Ended the evening dinner at
the restaurant terrasse with Movies in the Park night! Surreal!
Breakfast surprise Jazz in the park. We enjoyed going and having our breakfast there- we also the enjoyed free jazz at night--loved the view and people watching

Bryant Park~ Nice for a Little Break. Nice place to rake a little break at one of the charming little tables. Grand Central & the big NY Public Library are right there, so check them out at the same time. Around Christmas, there is a lovely Christmas market here, well worth the time!

BEST PARK IN THE AREA. This park had everything, from ping pong tables to food and drinks to green space and plenty of seating. It was a relaxed atmosphere and comfortable. Highly recommend having a rest here!

Great for vacationers on a budget. Great park..lots of free stuff to do. Was hosting an outdoor concert when I arrived. Ping Pong and Chess tables. Great mix of people and great vibes in the heart of the city.

Bryant Park, Gorgeous. A definite must to do in NYC if you just want to chill for a bit. Sits adjacent to the New York Public Library. Very cool park with lots going on. Nice patio to have a drink or a bite to eat or just people watch. Much smaller than Central park so you won't feel overlwhelmed.

The ultimate oasis. One of my favorite places in the city. Love to pick up something for lunch and just chill and watch what's going on. The guys playing chess, the incredible gardens, I was their for Broadway in the Park last time, it is truly magnificent. And the library tour is really interesting as well.
Very nice people watching park!. This part was new to me. Great to just people watch on a Wed afternoon. We even rode the carousel. Great place to catch a snack or lunch.
Don't go at lunch time. Don't go at lunch time for obvious reasons, but especially if you're taking photos of the very attractive statues and busts - you can't expect people to move just for you.

Restful oasis. What a lovely surprise to discover Bryant Park just a block away from our hotel My niece was travelling with me and she participated in a dance class on Saturday morning in the park. Great setting with the library as a backdrop for resting after a tough day at Macy's or just for people watching.

The perfect city oasis. Really the perfect spot to escape the rush of the city. By night families gathered to have dinner in the park. The surrounding area is filled with take away places and cheap food markets.
Lovely square in heart of city. Fantastic square with lots going on worth a visit always a fun attraction to watch movies in the evening well kept and posh toilets !

Bryant Park.....a gem. Great space to chill, people watch, and have a relaxing coffee....drink. Free films at sundown too!
Love it.

Feels Like Europe. What a wonderful park sitting near so many special places in New York City. This spot reminds me a great deal of parks in Paris and other cities of Europe. People relaxing, playing chess and other games while others take a break and enjoy the sights and sounds.Well located and close to Grand Central and many businesses.

A loveA lovely green space to sit and rel alax a while half way along 5th Avenue. Locals love this smallish green space adjacent to the Library. It is ireat to be able to sit and have a drink or ice cream amongst the locals who might be playing chess or other board games. We have sat within the park a few times on each of our two visits to New York and it provides a great respite for a while from the various "rigours" of 5th Avenue.On site coffee, drinks and food available and the park is highly recommended.

Great park. We came across Bryant Park during our visit. This is a lovely park in the middle of the city. There's great architecture, big trees, tables/chairs to relax. Often there are events going on here. I wish we had more time to linger. Lovely spot!
Loved this park!. It's a small and cozy park where you can take a break from the city and just relax! It's right next to the NY Public Library. Will definitely go back next time I visit NY.

Gorgeous and restful in the midst of Midtown Manhattan. Bryant Park is the perfect hang out to relax on the lawn, have seat at the one of the many bistro tables under the trees, watch people and enjoy New York City life walk by. During any week day, nannies bring their charges there to exercise their legs, and students congregate in groups on the park grass. Simply a lovely break to sit, enjoy the views and soak in the atmosphere.
Views of the outdoors.. This is awesome for concerts and movies in the summer. Have been here in the past. This trip was a bit chilly but pleasant and a beautiful walk without being crazy.
Ice Skating in NY. I visited New York at Christmas to watch the HUGE tree lighting. I was above the rink and watched the skaters enjoying the festivities. Jane H.

Great little park. Lovely place. Some great ideas here. A range of newspapers and mags available free to browse whilst sitting around a table in the sun or shade. Such a good way to spend a few hours. Oasis of calm in the centre of mad NYC. NICE PLACE
Bryant Park-. a great place to chill in the midtown area. great for a coffee, people watching , shows and even table tennis and free wifi!
Hidden Gem. One of my favourite places in New York. Lovely little park in the middle of a city. Good facilities, such as the library, chess boards, ping pong tables and more.
A bit of green. Nice green park in the middle of the city buzz. Get some coffee of juice in the stands around and enjoy.

Great way to spend a day. I think the way they use this park is brilliant. Every time I go you just never know what you may find. Having said that, the prices for drinks is way too high at the bar in the park.
A haven in the city. One of my favourite places to visit in New York. Not quite as busy as Central Park but still a great place for people-watching !

My second favorite park in NYC. I love this park and visit every time I go to NY! In the summer it has yoga classes, TV screens playing movies and lots of tables to have coffee etc.
Clean toilets on site and plenty of great restaurants nearby.
Great to sit and watch, chat with friends and talk to friends.
nice and interesting. this park is a park need the library where it is oppened to public i remember that on monday or wednesday , they show a new film free and all people come to watch it
relaxing spot among the skyscrapers.... When visiting nyc, this is one of my favourite places of the city to sit and watch the life with a croissant and a cappucino.

Green Oasis in NY. Nice shaded green oasis between fifth & sixth Avenue in New York behind the Public Library..Nice respite on a hot NY morning as we headed towards Maceys store at Herald Square. Lots of places to sit under the shady trees or the handy parasols and just watch the world go by! Couple of spots where locals were sitting playing board games...all part of the colour and flavour of New York and a great place to visit with some very good cafes nearby for breakfast or coffee...

One of my Favorite NYC Places.. A great place for lunch, hanging out, and people watching. We spent a long Saturday afternoon at the Bryant Park Cafe, what a great atmosphere. Very relaxing, great food, and lots to see.
Always something to see.. It can be crowded, but this is NYC. Find a seat and just let the world spin on around you. Keep in mind, people will be watching you, watch them.

Crowded Oasis in the heart of Midtown. A nice respite along the way - stopped and sat in some shade, recharged a cell phone, had a refreshment. Amazing how New Yorkers manage to gather in large numbers yet reflect the peaceful atmosphere of the park.

Lovely place to sit and watch the world go by. Formerly a hangout for drug addicts, now this park is a breath of fresh air behind the gorgeous NY Public Library. Lots of nice choices to pick up a snack or eat at the restaurant. Or bring your picnic (from Kinokuniya 2nd floor across Sixth Ave) since there is seating galore. In summer there are free films, and in winter a skating rink. Also special events like the Christmas fair with a variety of fun stalls, or international expos.

Lovely calm space amongst the skyscrapers. Lovely calm space amongst the skyscrapers - loved the fact that you can lose yourself there for an hour with a free board game or table tennis or just grab a drink and snack and sit back.

Just like Home Alone!. Bryant Park is a must-see at Christmas time. It is right down the street from Rockefeller Center and is full of festive tourists and sights to see. It reminded me of Home Alone.

Little green spot of New York. A perfect place to enjoy Musicians play jazz or classic music and to take a deep breath within the loud and hectic Manhattan life. under big trees and next to beautiful flowers you can really do a great break.

Relaxing. The free activities and great lawn make this my favorite park in NY! You can have a drink at the bar, listen to great new bands, play ping pong, read a book on the lawn and just chill here all day. Better than central park in my opinion!
Give your feet a rest!. Great little spot to hang out and get away from the hustle/bustle of Manhattan. Things to do and eat if your inclined, or just have a seat and enjoy the people watching!

Great place for outdoor dining. Great outdoor dining areas during summer and nice months. It is very crowded and a little pricey for the food but the atmosphere in the park is wonderful. It is packed, but so lovely to sit outside in a park and eat at a nice but casual restaurant

A great NYC experience. We were here in the winter. Surprisingly there were many retailers selling an interesting mix of consumer products. We stopped for the tomato soup & grilled cheese sandwich on the South side of the park. The skating rink was going full tilt. We will be back.
Enjoying my take-out crepe cake at Bryant Park. Couldn't stand the long long queue outside Lady M. I bought a piece of cake and enjoyed it at Bryant Park.

Love Bryant Park. Bryant Park is so New York to me. Can't leave the city without a visit. Even a quick one. During the winter, it's a restful place to just sit and people watch. The Carousel adds so much to the park and there are always lots of things happening. Even in the cold of winter. Summer is a delight. The restaurant and bar are open and it's such a treat to sit in the bar area, eat and have a glass of wine or a cocktail, and just listen and watch. I love the people sitting and playing chess or checkers. It's a wonderful place to visit and seems welcoming always.
Beautiful park. Beautiful park, I went in summer and there was a nice green grass all over the park you can have something to drink and eat and there is a public restroom.

Garden in the middel of nyc. The place is just Awoesome in the spring and summer. Lots places to grab food. Lots of seating room lots activities all over the plAce. In winter it's ice skating. Just fantastic place in middle of nyc

Nice Park in NYC. This is a small nice park right by the main branch of the NYC Public Library. Our hotel was right across from the park so we walked past it everyday. The had a winter festival set up while we were there the week before Christmas. It is a pretty little park that is probably very pleasant in the Spring and Fall. However, we really didn't spend much time there other than to walk through to see the festival and buy hot chocolate because it was really cold. This is a really, really nice area though with some good restaurants, the library and some good shopping.
Good Place to Relax & Sip n Bite. Nice place to stop for a bite and people watch. A slice of New York, but not too crowded. She place to go to relax.
SUMMER IN THE PARK. First time....loved it...a beautiful Summer's Day in the park...afterseeing Union Square...had some snacks and sat and listened toa piano player ....just good ol' people watchin'

Fun atmosphere around lunch time. Happened to be in the area around lunch time, stopped to watch and ended up spending a couple of hours here. So many people to watch, so many free activities to be part of (children toys, juggling, book exchange and many more), and such a fun atmosphere.

Beautiful Carousel, great atmosphere. This is a must when you are in the city - stop here on your way to see Grand Central. If I lived in Manhattan, I'd like to think I would take advantage of all the great thing this small park behind the library offers...from Yoga to movie nights, to reading a magazine that you can borrow in the reading area, to playing one of the board games that you can borrow as well. Heck, just to have a rest and drink a hot chocolate. The Carousel is charming and my daughter rode it twice! Sometimes the city can be overwhelming, but Bryant Park is the best place to rest and regroup in midtown. Added bonus: beautiful view of the Chrysler building and the Bryant Park Hotel (that black and gold building) through the poplar trees.

A very relaxed atmosphere. When talking about parks in NY everyone speaks about Central Park. Well, do not forget this one. It s not comparable to Central Park but is is very cozy place to relax in the heart of the city, have a lunch, a drink, lie on the grass.
Great little park!. This park is great! They have books available so you can sit and read a book. Also, you can play board games, ping pong and other games! Really loved this park!

Beautiful little park!. Bryant park is a little park but very well maintained, the gardens, the kiosks, the fountain, everything seems at the right place. There are many events that are hosted at this place and as most reviews are saying it really worth a visit if you are visiting New York city.

A shaded break from shopping.. A tranquil green space in the heart of the city for people watching. There is ample seating around the sides of the park and always some sort of activity to watch, we watched a juggling class while resting our feet in the shade in between shopping.
Nice park, great location. A very nice park right next to the NY Public Library. Pretty, lively, literary people all over. Shade, food, lots of seating.
One of NYC Best Parks. The shops stands create a beautiful experience in NYC for tourists and locals alike. It is a not to be missed venue but in the winter it comes to life with skating .
Lovely Park!. Beautifully maintained centrally locate park. Tables and Chairs and kiosk are located in the park for refreshments.
Enjoy the Evening. We strolled through on a balmy summer night. There were at least 3 options for dining. We opted out because we needed AC. But we loved the ambiance of the park

Bryant Park- great outdoor retreat for book lovers, etc.. This was such a lovely park. We walked through on a warm late Wednesday afternoon, observing all the big trees and lush flowers. I especially enjoyed observing the outdoor Reading Room with book carts, and umbrella-covered tables. All of this was located directly behind the main Public Library. It is a nice natural place to take a break.
Nice small park. Love to just go hang out at Bryant Park. So much you can do there. Plenty of places to sit and eat your lunch. There are also games you can play.

Family Fun. A fun trip for the whole family! The rink is beautiful and reasonably priced, except if you want to get food. Then your bill starts to rack up the coins. It is free for those with ice skates, but it doesn't cost much to rent. The ice is clean, and fun. The staff are very helpful, and helped me and my mom with our dozen falls as quick as they could! Also, after a long day of skating, you can take your kids to the main NYPL and the carousel, or have a nice picnic on the park grounds! Fun for whatever you want to do!
Good spot for lunch. A nice respite from the roads and traffic. Plenty of shaded seating areas and chairs. Table tennis for enthusiasts and reading corner for the educated.

Great place to grab a bite and watch the skaters. Daughter and I enjoyed eating a bowl of soup from a vendor while watching the skaters. It was a cold night in December but such fun. Beautiful all lit up. Unexpected in the middle of the city.
Park for the locals. It's a nice park to see. There are a few places to eat. It's more for the locals than tourists as the events are varied.
Great views. Well the grounds were being repaired and so the grass was out of bounds but it was still a nice place to sit and have a view of the hustle and bustle of NYC .

Nice Sunday afternoon. Happened to stumble upon Bryant park between lunch and our broadway show. Glad we did it was great people watching and a neat spot for us Midwesterners to spend time and get a feel if New York!

Right by the big lions!. This park has been updated so many times since it's existence. I worked with the Garden Designer who updated the horticultural look of the park her name is Lynden Miller. She is wonderful! Check out the park to check her work. Also this park has lots of free events in the summer. I walk past it everyday so check it out!

A nice place to enjoy Ice skating near Times Square.. I just loved the way they converted a park into skating rink. Plus being close to Times Square make it a perfect and must place to visit.You can utilise the facility of Subway to reach directly to Bryant Park.
how could you forget this experience?. Even though the weather was quite bad when i visited, it was so worth it! loved every minute will not ever forget

Not your regular park.... Not your regular park by any means. Centrally located close to New York public library, this is an oasis within the high rises. Haven't been here in years and was pleasantly surprised with the little Kiosks serving coffee and treats, the numerous tables and chairs to lounge on, and the games centre, where you can play everything from chess to trivial pursuit. This time of year they schedule open air movies, and you can often see live music here (I stumbled on a Macey Gray concert many moons ago). Not sure I would go out of my way for the park itself, but definitely worth a visit if you are close by and need a breather.

THe vibrant Bryant park. Covered with show... Dazzling with lights,people and fairs! This place is very lively with music, food and various festivals. One can also ski in dec! Love the vibrance & buzz!

Lovely park to sit and relax. We loved Bryant Park somewhere to grab a sandwich or something and sit in the park and people watch. The locals play chess & draughts or some of the younger ones play table tennis when we were there there was an fitness class being put through their paces.
Green New York. Lovely green experience in New York.Take a picnic basket and blanket. Food options not great and also very pricey.
A gem location in the city!. You have to see it to believe it. The park is so precious in this part of the city. Incredible restaurants around and in the park. A lazy afternoon perfect location.

Lazy afternoons are best spent in Bryant Park. When my husband and I first traveled to NYS twenty years ago, we enjoyed a lazy afternoon (maybe we napped under the trees) in Bryant Park.Now, whenever we're in town we swing through to reminisce. It's a beautiful little oasis. Plus, who knows when some ghosts might come flying outta the library?
A small slice of quiet. Do you remember when this park was riddled with addicts? Well it is now a lovely place for all. It's a great place to sit and enjoy your coffee.

Very nice park in NYC!. This park is a great option for everyone, specially for families, always very active with live music, kiosks with sales and always surrounded by a cosmopolitan atmosphere in midtown NYC. Best time to visit is of course christmas time!

Pleasant place. We visited in August 2015. As an ex New Yorker, I had not been back to Bryant Park since the early 70's when I had a summer job with the Post Office. Back then it was a menacing area that felt unsafe to walk through even during the light of day. Not that you would really want to anyway. I remember it appearing forlorn, neglected, and hardscrabble. It is now a beautiful small park with a number of pricey restaurants; concert stage; food vendors in the periphery. This is not a destination place unless you are attending a performance of some sort, but it is a pleasant place to rest your feet.

Fun stuff. during summer time Bryant Park has a lot of activities like free movies, free concerts, yoga etc. There's carousel for kids for $3 per ride and they would set up a mini library / reading center where kids can select books to read for free. During winter time , they will set up the giant rink for skating which is fun!

Great little park with lots to do.. I have visited here at all times of the year. It is one of my favourite places to relax in NYC. There is a good bar for drinks during the summer, autumn evenings sees a big movie screen installed and during the winter there is a pop up ice rink. Great fun!
Calm in the centre of NYC. Our favorite spot for lunch in NYC. Situated in the middle of all the action of Manhattan yet an oasis. they also have some great events in the evening check the calendar.
Love this park!. The park is super cool, the restaurants are not what you would think, so avoid that and just enjoy yourselves in the park!

Small oasis behind the NY Public Library. Great for people watching in the mid-morning or at lunch time. Outdoor ping pong, two holes of miniature golf (opens at 11), some eateries and a book cart with children's books. If in midtown, it is worth a walk through the park; 30 minutes is all you need.
The perfect park. This park is organized, beautifully landscaped, full of great venues to eat, and full of great activities to partake in.

Nice park. This is a lovely park. We were in NYC for a week long holiday, and stayed at a nearby hotel. The day we arrived there was a Shakespearean production in the park. A lovely way to while away the time, eating ice cream and watching the play!

Very Parisian!. We walked through this park when it was covered by a blanket of thick snow, the carousel wasn't working and the chairs were all stacked so we didn't really stop but I imagine it to be a lovely little park in the summer!

Love the atmosphere. So many things happening here during the summer months. My husband and I just sat in the park, had lunch and watched everything that was going on - Piano player, juggling classes, language classes, chess players etc,
Rest stop. Varied activities, experiences, food outlets and people make it an excellent rest stop in a busy New York day.
Great outdoors. Great outdoors. My son loved watching the chess players and we enjoyed listening to parts of Broadway musicals.

People watching. Bryant park is a small oasis in the big city, it's a place to sit and chill with your choice of drink and watch the world go by, there is always some form of entertainment going on, and it's behind the New York City library another great place to visit with lots to see and interesting architecture

GREAT PARK. A great place to just have lunch. Ice skating in the winter and free concerts throughout the year. There is a formal quality restaurant or just grab coffee and a sandwich. Many merchant booths surround the park. Great place to spend a few hours and it's free.
A small oasis on a hot day.. Great space for chilling out as you walk through NY. Nice to sit on the benches watching the world go by.

Beauty at night! . My husband and I were wandering close to our apartment just on dusk and thought we'd sit and appreciate this green space as the lights were twinkling on...it was a lovely with the lights strung through the trees, and the fountain lit up. We take loads of photos normally but this night....I think we went overboard!
