The carousel was also a draw card....took some slow shutter speed photos of it in action...lovely way to continue to commemorate our NY trip.

NOT to be missed.. One of my favorite things to do when in NYC as it is a green oasis in the heart of the city. You can spend hours people watching as you enjoy food and drinks at the outdoor cafe. Day or night, it is relaxing, inspiring, NYC at its best. Do NOT miss it.

Traveling with teenage girls. Loved this park. We stopped and rested for several hours at this park. The girls danced in the grass, while I was able to charge my phone. It was very relaxing and wish we were able to enjoy some of the free things offered in the park.

Beautiful anytime of the year. I've been here both in the summer and winter and it was gorgeous both times. Come in the winter to ice skate and browse the various adorable shops, the summertime to relax or eat lunch while taking in the beautiful view of the fountain and library.
Green space to relax in. Small 4 acres of green in the city. Plenty of chairs to sit on with a drink or grab some lunch from one of the surrounding food carts. Ping pong and chess are also available.
A special oasis. Always something to see here and no better place to sit, take a break from walking and just take in the bustle of the city around you.

Great park ...... We picked up lunch and spent hours at this park. It was quite crowded as it was lunch time. We got a table and chairs and enjoyed the piano music. It was just a really nice area to relax and settle down from all the hustle and bustle of the city. There are many food trucks and kiosks that sell hot dogs, sandwiches, coffees, cold drinks. Very clean and security was all around. We definitely will be back to enjoy this lil gem!!!
Beautiful Park. Beautiful park right in the middle of NYC. Great restaurants surround park or bring a blanket and a bagged lunch and enjoy the city!

Little jewel of peace within a trubulent city. Bryant Park provides an unexpectedly calm and peaceful little place in the midst of the hustle and bustle of the great city, A few minutes sitting quietly on a bench or feeding the pigeons does miracles to reduce stress in the visitor not accustomed to the noise and clatter to the city,

A beautiful park. Such a great park, many table and chairs where you can picnic, play games or just socialise.
The Bryant park restaurant is also a great place to eat
There's a Suka there.. Very well located and they have a Sukkah there during Sukos. Chabad arrange for it. It's a great plus when spending a day shopping or sightseeing in Manhattan.

Good park. Went there during the summer. They didn't have the ice skating ring so my experience was more about sitting in a nice area, surrounded by relaxed people and enjoying my lunch. Good times but nothing crazy

Lovely relaxed small park near Grand Central. We visited here several times during our New York stay, in fact all but one morning as we were staying just around the corner.Plenty of places around the square to grab a coffee, then grab one of the hundreds of free chairs and tables and chill out, or laze on the grass if the day is nice. We started most of our days people watching as we supped our first coffee of the day and planned our days attack on the city.Well worth the effort, just a short walk from grand central or times square - easy to combine it with both. Wish my local city park back home was like this. PS - Public lavatory puts just about every where else to shame - clean and safe.

Basically perfect . Any time of year is A good time to be at the park. In the warm weather there is a free library, ping pong, chess, and backgammon. Plenty of seating to relax. Various events on the grass throughout the summer. In the winter the free ice rink goes up as well as all of the holiday shopping shops. A nice juxtaposition with Times Square which is only a few blocks away.

Love This Park. Nothing like a nice park to rest your feet or watch the world go by and this one is quite lovely. It's no match for Central Park but it serves the same purpose. Nice landscaping and very well maintained.
Day or Night. Great place to sit and take a break from the chaos of the day. Even at night it's charming with the tasty kiosk eateries
Beautiful any season. Nice, vibrant and next to NY Library. Take the time to sit down and just watch the activity. You will recognize a lot of scenes from movies or popular shows.

Zen in de middle.. Bryant Park is actually part of the New York Public Library, and offers that welcoming green part in the midst of the hustle and bustle of the Big Apple. On sunny days, start early and go for a breakfast which can be bought at the Le Pain Quotidien kiosk. The park also makes for a great meet up place (fountain). Free chairs and tables. Easily reached by metro. Times Square is within walking distance.

Great Summer find in the middle of the city . Great find. Walking distance to Times Square. Beautiful open space with grass and plenty of seats provided by the city. Be sure to visit the NYC Public Library--it is right there too. We found it a great place to sit and relax after a long day of enjoying the city and before dinner and seeing Wicked the musical!

Would recommend a visit to relax and get away from the hustle and bustle of NYC. Lovely place to sit back and relax in a very busy city. Drinks are pricey however the atmosphere is worth paying for, a lovely place to share with your children.
Amazing park mid New York. Nice park, lot of trees , flowers around the park. Lot of seats were you can sit and enjoy your own food

Oasis. this is either a very small park, or a large square, but however you define it, it's worth spending sometime here of you happen to be Midtown. Until a decade or so ago, it was a sad derelict place, but a combination of citizen activism and business acumen has transformed it to a place which is busy all day long, and well into the evening. There is plenty of free seating, the refreshment franchises are limited, and well chosen to avoid the worse of the fast food chains. There is a wide programme of activities from all kinds of music, to yoga, exercise and a summer film series with a large screen at one on of the lawn. You can see some lovely touches such as the free games area with chequers, chess and so on, the reading area with books from the nearby library, and charging points for mobile devices powered from solar panels.

Tranquility in a metropolis. Took myself on a walking tour of mid-town whilst my wife and kids went shopping for a few hours. Beautiful little park nestled amidst the high rise glass and bustling vibrancy of NYC. A real tranquility base to rest weary legs on a hot day on 31/7/2015.

Relaxing. Loved this Park although it is not large you feel as if your not in the middle of the city, lots of people sitting playing, chess, scrabble reading etc and there is a stage where people are performing, also the restaurants are reasonable as well
Haven in the city. nice place to sit back and people watch or grab a bite to eat at one of the nice restaurants around the park itself.

Picture Perfect. This was a park we stopped to rest in and hat night they were going to have a movie on the lawn! its nice to see that in a huge city there are so many little parks were you can enjoy time with loved ones.

Must-visit for tourists and natives alike. Amazing renovation transformed this once empty space to a green landscape with terrific food (Le Pain Quotidien has takeout), a Reading Room, chairs for chatting, or people watching. Bring a blanket or just stretch out on the lawn.

Best Park in the City!!. Bryant Park is the best park in the city. In the summer you can sit int he park to get some sun, play table tennis, mini golf, bocce ball or even catch a movie in July and August. In the winter months you have a mini village that is constructed which sells all kinds of things for the holidays, a ice rink that is bigger than Rockefeller Center and a large Christmas tree. Overall it is very quiet when you get a little away from the street and you have the Public Library on the east end which also has some restaurants that are very nice all year around. It is also kept very clean unlike Central Park with the rats.

Nice park. I expected it to be a lot bigger. There are a lot of benches and tables to sit and relax at. There are sections where you can sit and they have games you can play - like checkers, chess, boardgames. They also have a schedule of entertainers or crafts or lessons on how to do things. It changes day to day and they are at specific times---so check their website. The grounds are nice, good photo opps and places to eat. There is a rooftop restaurant as well as another place, along with your typical nyc vendors close by if you just want a gyro or a hot dog to sit in the park and relax.

A little paradise inside Manhattan. Perfect stop and go for a day in Midtown Manhattan.You can read a book, play ping pong, watch a movie or a show, stop for lunch or dinner, make friend.5 minutes walking distance from the caos of Times Square.

the nicest, most unique park. Bryant Park lies between Grand Central Terminal, and Times Square right in the heart of Manhattan. The Park is privately owned, and it shows right away with the cleanliness of the restrooms! During summer, you may wander in on a couple of thousand people doing yoga on the grass, or maybe a giant movie screening at night. But, any time of the year, you will see ping pong games, bocce, or people on the putting green. In the winter, the ice rink goes in, and the dozens of small shopping tents are booming. The park also has a beautifully decorated Christmas Tree in December. There is a small outdoor café for adults only on the west side (beer served) and many food vendors throughout the park. I rarely stop in the city without stopping at Bryant Park.
A break spot in the busy city. Excellent spot in the heart of NYC. Enjoyed the atmosphere and the momentum. Get your coffe and just sil, relax and observe the cosmopolitan city.

Full of life even at at night. Was here about 10 on a Friday night. We had just walked Time Square and was making our way to the Empire State Building. IT is true NY never sleeps. The area was still populated with ppl and it was lit up very pretty. I would love to go back and enjoy the activities that they do during the day time.

Something for everyone. Bryant Park is a classic NYC park that offers something for everyone. In the summer, there's a large, grassy lawn to enjoy (though sometimes it's closed), and in winter, the park is turned into a winter wonderland, complete with an ice skating rink. All season long, tables and chairs line the park and offer a place for people to enjoy a warm coffee or other beverage or snack from one of the many nearby food stands. The park is very clean and has beautiful trees that overhang the sidewalks. All in all a great place to visit.

Relax. Manhattan maybe a "concrete jungle" but it definitely has beautiful parks. This is one of them. Just come here to relax if everything is too fast paced for you. They have some events here and there.

Nice Park in NYC. We walked through the park taking photographs, table tennis, lots of tables and chairs, large grass open area and the large trees act as a canopy. There is a restaurant to one side, food vendors, a large bar and plenty of activity for New Yorkers that want to enjoy the sunny day and outdoors.
Beautiful green lung. Great to sit and relax or just walk past, I liked the rubbish bins - very stylish. Trash separating, too!!
Bryant Park. Bryant park was visited while we were going from central terminal to Time Square. The park was huge with several visitors sitting on benches.

Beautiful with places to sit and people watchand lots of free activitys daily.also nice relaxing. Beautiul park with so many free activitys daily,lots of places to get snacks and a lovely restaurant/bar also ...beautiful water fountain ..great place to sit and relax and people watch after long day shopping in time square
Great. Right behind the Public Library- this is a great place to bring a lunch and people watch- in the summer they will often have free shows at niight

Lovely lunch break spot.. Always stop here while in fifth ave. This park is lovely to sit while having lunch or just people watch. They also put on events like free films at night which proves very popular.

Park was there from the revolutionary war.. A park with history good and bad. Today it is a terrific park with a strong focus on what people want to enjoy. I took the 45 minute tour which was on a Wednesday and it was illuminating. The guide works for the non profit agency that runs the park. Highly recommend the tour.
Beautiful, Iconic Site. We just happened to be walikg by and decided to rest our feet at one of their talbes and grabbed a couple of beverages before venturing on. Lovely setting, beautiful fountain.

So many parks....so little time!. Walking distance from Midtown West this small park packs a punch. From free walking meditation and yoga classes in the morning to free lunch time concerts, evening movies or just taking in the view from the 2 restaurants.
So many things to do in a park. You can eat you lunch there, do some yoga, read some books, attend some classes or just sit in the grass and enjoy the park.

Summer fun. Summer is probably the best time to visit New York. Bryant Park is the best place to hang out, it's not big as central park, but it's great for you to step out of the air conditioned room.
The parade went on forever.. A fun place to explore. However there was some kind of parade that held up traffic and made walking around difficult.

A relaxing Haven in New York. Bryant Park is a relaxing tree laden little park in the centre of Manhatten. There are plenty of tables and chairs if you want to consume something to eat, just read a book or perhaps catch up on you socia media obligations. There is free WiFi which we found perfect. There is a kiosk that sells reasonably priced snacks or you can pop across the road for some hotter snacks. All this is with some prominent and famous buildings as a backdrop.

Nice quiet place to relax.. Our hotel was a block away from Bryant Park. It was nice to sit and relax in the park after walking all over the city. Some areas in the park have charging stations for your electronics. There are a few vendors around the park if you are looking for quick eats or a drink.
Nice place to people watch and snack!. Grab a cup of coffee or ice cream and watch the people go by. Sometimes there is live music which is worth the visit.
Love it. Love coming here any season. The holiday market is especially fun with all of the vendors and food stalls. It's a nice space with great activities throughout the year.

Wonderful place to relax and watch the world.. Just a well thought out green space in the middle of the city. Shade, refreshment, New Yorkers doing interesting things. A stones throw from the Empire State and Chrysler buildings, Grand Central and the Public Library.
Great Venue for outdoor movie night. They have regular events here but the movie night in the park is fun and has quite a large gathering. Oh did I mention the best part...FREE!

A little green paradise in the midst of stone jungle. Place to unwind...and it has free wi-fi. We enjoyed free "Romeo and Juliette" performance. Google and check the calendar of Bryant park events...always something to do for the entire family
great oasis in the middle of the city. lovel to be able to escape the city. Free films are shown on Monday nights and its surrounded by really lovely restaurants and bars

An oasis just off Times Square. Unbelievable but true!. Simply my favorite spot in NY. For breakfast with a newspaper, a coffee or checking e-mail via the wireless in the park. Or perhaps enjoying the park reading during the day, for lunch or over a glass of wine at night.
parque bryant. the is so nice parque Bryant great for Winter go to shopping go to nice restaurant go towalk see the town very pretty there

Lovely in summer too. Saw it last time with the skating rink and saw it now in the lovely summer weather.Great place to sit .
Do not miss the little Waffle and Dinges shop.Best place to have amazingly delicious waffles.

Beautiful atmosphere at Bryant Park. Amazing Christmas tree, wonderful skaters, stunning and warm atmosphere around the park...suitable for a day with the kiddies and transitions perfectly to night for a well rounded day.

Great at Christmas. This is great at Christmas and has a great atmosphere. Loads of little stalls to look round plus ice skating. Had a warm spiced cider and sat looking at the Christmas tree whilst watching the bustle of Christmas shoppers. Well worth the visit.

Loved the free musicals show on a Thursday!. Great spot - an oasis in the middle of the city - well worth a rest here! We enjoyed the free Broadway at Bryant show which was fabulous and a great way to see Broadway musicals for free - loved it!

Great Little Park. I loved NY in summers. When i went to this park, it was filled with people. Many people reading books, playing different games with their children and on one side bunch of people were playing chess. They were also showing film in the evening. Great festive place to spend a lazy weekend afternoon/evening.

Bryant Park at Christmas. I went to Bryant Park with friends and family just prior to Christmas 2014. The ice skating area is much larger that I thought and the vendors and restaurants in and around the square are great. It is a great place to stop if you are spending some time in NYC around the holidays.
Great Park. Beautiful Park right in the heart of midtown, with lots of seating to eat from some great places across the street!
Perfect winter day. We purchased the best macaroons there, a little pricey but so worth it, we had the opportunity to see the ice skating.
Love Bryant Park. Great park with vendors that sell so many different products, the park is beautiful and has different things going on music, etc.

Where Lovers Meet. Bryant Park; what can one say? What a special place, bordered by the New York City Public Library and so much more. So many things take place there during the course of the year. And yet, it can be a peaceful oasis for a chance meeting with a special person... .

Nice but overcrowded. What a little gem this is. A 4 acre park that always has something going on. The downside....it's a 4 acre park right next to Times Square and it is way, way, way overcrowded. Especially in the summer when all the tourists are in New York.

One of Our Favorite Parks in NYC. We love this little park! And while they have a wonderful Carousel for the kids, we feel the ONLY thing this park is missing is a playground. Other than that, no complaints!

Lovely Little Oasis in MidTown. I have walked through Bryant Park many, many times, going back to the mid-1980's when it was deserted and empty bottles and condoms were everywhere. Today, it is a beehive of human activity. The lawn is great for people watching. There are food kiosks on the 6th avenue side. An outdoor bar area is behind the Public Library. The fine dining restaurant , Bryant Park Grill, is very good in a central location. There are free movies in the summer. All in all, a perfect example of how Manhattan parks have been restored and revitalized.

Quiet place. Quiet shady place to rest up for more exploring or eat your lunch (appeared many there went to Chipotle which is right next to it) clean and maintained restrooms and lots of tables and chairs throughout park.

Great Respite!!. Always a Great NYC Site to visit. Lovely little park. Fab kiosks selling many unusual items. Numerous food cafes. Grab a drink or bite to eat, sit at one of many outdoor tables and enjoy the sites!! Fun carrousel for the kids.
Lovely. Our hotel was near Bryant Park so we walked by it every day. There is some lovely architecture that you don't want to miss.

Green oasis in mid-town. Stopped by to check out the supposed best public bathroom in NYC; there was quite a line and we really didn't need to 'go' so we didn't enter.Enjoyed watching a group doing their mid-morning exercise. Some knew what was happening, while this one poor fellow just offered us some chuckles with his enthusiasm. Plenty of opportunities for people watching.

A gem in Manhattan. My daughter and I were here in December,2014. It was a week-day,so the skating rink wasn't crowded.We even got to see some skaters from a skating club practice.The shops were open and had some very unique gifts.It's open later in the summer and has a lot of activities.
Buzzing. Friday night after work this definitely seemed the place to be. It went from being a relatively quiet haven during the day to the place to be seen.

NYC Chill Zone. Great place to chill out and watch the world go by in NYC. Enjoy the gardens, grab a seat and a cup of coffee and enjoy some free entertainment or just watch the whole gamut of New Yorkers go about their daily lives.

Fun place to visit and people watch. Spend an hour relaxing at Bryant Park. We googled it's history which made it more fun. Plenty of chairs to choose from. Lots of company. I can recommend the espresso from the coffee kiosk at the corner of the park. The best I had in New York. Great place to have a quick rest and recharge.

Super cute during the holidays!. Kiosks/stores set up throughout the park around the ice rink selling ornaments, gifts, snacks, drinks. A lot of fun to walk around -- we've been going for a few years on Christmas Eve.

I love Bryant Park. For afternoon cocktails, finger foods or lunch and enjoying the view, this is a wonderful stop. Have been here a number of times and will always go back. The staff is extremely friendly and attentive, the food is good and the drinks are tasty.We normally sit at the bar and just watch the goings on but they do have tables for dining also.The fare is a bit on the pricy side but worth it for the experience.There is no fee if you just want to go to the park. On 42nd Street (side of the park) there is a great salad place; so you can go buy a salad and sit in the park to eat and enjoy. I have done that before and it is so nice and relaxing. Also, easier on the wallet.;)

Both Quiet and energetic. Bryant Park, adjacent to the magnificent New York Public Library is a quiet but energized transition between the serene power of the library and the bustling city on every side of it. The park provides a transition between the active and the contemplative worlds and has its own special moods and personalities. There is always something to see, to experience or a place to relax and unwind. The Park Grill and street vendors provide any food from a simple hot dog to a tasty French desert. We always find a reason to stop at Bryant Park at least once on every trip to midtown.Jimmy and Catie BrownBrooksville, Florida
Good Location. Its a nice park with lot of food vendors, City tour buses around.Very convenient place to take a rest under the tree shades during the city visit.

Lovely and Relaxing. Lovely, but not much to do. Shady, relaxing. Our 4 yo loved the carousel. We had snacks and drinks at the Grill. Overall a relaxing experience and we'd do it again. Just don't expect there to be much to do. We visited Times Square, then came this way to relax. There's a bakery near by Lady M? that others had bought pastries at to enjoy at the Park. Looked delicious. I could see visiting Bryant Park regularly if I lived in the City.
You must watch a movie in the evening here!. Great place to eat, chill out, watch a film etc. I watched Footloose and it was great fun, everyone was up dancing!

Join the Throng. So many events going on behind the New York Public Library, which one MUST visit, if only to see a great landmark - the lions the stairway, the books. Picnic in Bryant Park. There are tables and chairs.Or, eat in restaurant there with out-door dining. Browse though bookstalls, admire the passing crowd. Find ones true love. You never know. There is scupture to admire, and music, too.
Nice to stop and people watch. Lots of action here, as it is close to Times Square, the huge NY Library and Grand Central and is a wonderful green space in the heart of midtown.
A must stop in NYC.. Always something happening. Great place to meet friends and have a drink at the outdoor bar. Or, just relax on the grass and watch the people.
Always something going on. one of my favorite parks to enjoy free events, people watch, and take awesome pics of the fountain. Highly recommended!

Great place to hang out!. This was very close to our hotel so we went here at least once a day. Sometimes to eat out breakfast outdoors, sometimes to watch the world go by or to watch a film etc. There is so much to do & immaculately well kept. One of my favourite places.
Outdoor lunch. Fantastic place to have lunch on summer. A lot of tables and chairs to pick everywhere in the park. Table games. Everything free and in a democratic spirit.

One of my favorite parks! Great open space with lots to do or not! Even has an outdoor library!. This park is very diverse and has a great calming feel. The landscape is amazing, there's lots of seating areas and each view is different. You can escape the busyness of the city to take a fitness class, or learn a language, play some pingpong, or just enjoy the quite outdoor reading room. This is a very clean park. There's an endless list of things you can do right inside without having to travel far. Up for a class? There's a ton of classes that are open to the public and free. For the kids?There's a Carrousel that is $3.00 a ride or you can purchase a discount card. Need the quiet?There's a reading room that is outdoors! 1st I've heard of one with a mini selection of books, magazines, newspapers.Movie night?There's a selection of summer nights where the lawn is opened for public viewing of movies. Want to grab a bit?There lots a great restaurants in and surrounding the park.O Christmas tree!Not a typical touristy tree with ice skating but definitely an get busy.The location is very close to the New York Library another great attraction you don't want to miss. Each time I visit Bryant Park brings a fresh new memory.
Very nice break in the urban jungle !. This beautiful park offers a bit of everything ! Even movies in the park, a bonus from HBO ! Great idea !

My new favorite Park! . I have recently discovered the wonder of Bryant Park! The summer brings lots of free activities, such as fitness classes, reading club, outdoor movies and Shakespeare. My husband and I recently attended the Shakespeare and it was fantastic. Lovely surroundings, not too big and great to have a walk around with a break from the city. Have a walk or join an activity.

how is it possible to squeeze so much park into so small a place?. my new favourite place in New York, first came here to avoid the heat and ended up returning again and again. they have a library, loads of games nice waffles and drinks plus most crucially loads and loads of chairs; we always found a place to sit

Bryant Park. Worth a visit for a rest in busy midtown. Walking distance from both Grand Central and Penn Stations, Empire State and Times Square. Next door to New York public library. Look out for the coffee outlet on the West side of the park. The East side is dominated by expensive restaurants.

Tranquil and Beautiful. This is a mini Oasis in New York with chairs to sit and relax, chargers in the gardens for cell phones, lovely refreshments and daily communal activities. We were in NY in mid summer and this park was the best place to sit in the shade rest and observe. Recommended

Favorite small park in city. This place is great. Situated behind the NYC Main Library it's a green space that offers a pace to relax in midtown. I love the summer movie series and people watching on a Sunday afternoon.

Best Place to Get a Feel of the City. Bryant Park is where I go to hang out. Sunsets are beautiful because the sun sets between the skyscrapers, creating a fantastic spectacle. There is always so much life going on; just this summer I went salsa dancing there, watched a movie (summer films series), watched modern dance (modern dance festival), and I've just sat there and hung out. Always check what's going on and definitely go see. Being in Bryant Park gives you a great feeling for the city and you can people watch endlessly.

Nice place for a walk. Bryant Park is a rather smallish, but very nice park near Times Square. It is a pleasant place for a walk with your family, or for a carousel ride for your kids. Many events take place in the park, so it is worth checking out upfront. It can get a bit crowded sometimes.

I love it!. Bryant park is awesome. It's such a nice area to hang out in a good location, and they offer so many amazing free things. These include Broadway songs, yoga, and language classes. It's also fun to people watch here.
Movie nights!. If you go to New York, you should go for a movies night in Bryant Park! You can come early and have a picnic on the grass and then watch a good old movie.

Beautiful Bryant Park - I fell in love. I absolutely LOVE Bryant Park. It's so beautiful with plenty of space for people to just relax and chill out. We had dinner at The Grill rooftop which was amazing to look over the park as the sun was setting (definitely recommend). They always have something happening and I believe in winter they turn it into the skate rink. Do yourself a favour and don't walk past, take time out to relax and explore the beauty of Bryant Park.
Winter is the best time. Best time to go there is winter time. In winter they have a skating ring its a lot fun during winter, but summer is cool too.

Walking around Town,. Often there is live music or a film or show going on, today in brilliant sunshine it was nice to see so many people enjoying the outdoors, Tables and chairs around the edge provide a shady resting area.

So.......haunting and visit the public restrooms. This maybe just due to the time of year I visited, it was dark and cold, but the lighting in this place gave it such a haunting feeling, very Gothic and made for some fantastic pictures, Bryant Park is also home to THE best public restrooms we used in the whole time of our stay, bravo to the staff!

Vibrant. Everything about Bryant Park was brilliant. There was so much going on during the day, excercise groups etc. Then in the latter part of the day, people relaxing sitting on the grass and at the tables. The only problem found was that we were unable to find a seat .. even the little walls were crowded. Still good though.

Great place to chill. What a pleasant surprise near Time Square. A perfect place to chill and relax. They are showing free movies every Mon night, there is a carousel, a restaurant, bar, other food vendors (Starbucks, Waffels and Dinges, etc), game section (to play chess, other board games), bocce ball, tables & chairs. Really nice park, well maintained, ideal place to spend your lunch hour having a bite to eat, read a book, take a nap, or even just people watch.

People Watching in Bryant Park. We stayed at the Marriott close by and would recommend wandering through the park as often as possible. There were movies in the summer evenings and people watching was a hoot!

Summer fun. Bustling park in the middle of the city. You will see people playing chess, petanque, backgammon. Lots of tables for lunch and in summer there is an outdoor cinema. Enjoyed spending a few hours there

Always something happening. After a long morning of walking in the city, the perfect place to sit, chill a bit, and watch a magician entertain the kids, somebody playing music and enjoying "a bit" of peace in the city
Perfect!. Great location, great atmosphere, the IT place. We even had a dinner here. Fun to see so many different people just living life.
Hidden GEM!. Who knew this place was even in NYC!! Never heard about it. Discovered it after reading a magazine article. Would recommend anyone who visits NYC to make a stop here.
Happenings in the park.. We went through this park and there was an art exibishin at this time, so a man were playing piano in the park.
Unexpected surprise. Beautiful little park in the middle of the crazy Manhattan streets. They had all kinds of things to do, ping pong tables, lending libraries, movies in the park. Very nice.

Midtown.... I like this park mostly because it is near the 42nd St Library and grand Central. It's tiny and can be hard to find a spot for sky-watching on a beautiful summer night.
The fashion show is a pain, but the Christmas stalls are fun and worth a visit.

A Lovely Park. This is not a very large park but it sure has a lot going on. In the summer you can watch some folks have a Bocce Ball game an relax under a tree with some fresh Lemonade or just walk around and people watch. In the spring they host some of the Fashion Week events and a flower event that is really awesome but many people love the holiday season there because it offers specialty shopping, ice skating, hot chocolate, Christmas music and a beautiful tree. The location is great and it is another must visit in my book.

Have a break in the evening while the sun goes down. It is a lovely park. After a day's long walk on the famous streets and avenues of NY you may have a break in this lovely park and even if you are lucky enough you may enjoy to listen and watch the "Shakespeare in Bryant Park: Romeo and Juliet"

Beautiful Park. What a beautiful park in the centre of NYC, a sanctuary surrounded by skyscrapers Bryant Park is an amazing amenity on the centre of the city; great cafes with so many areas to sit out and enjoy - I particularly enjoy Monday Night movies at sunset

Summer activities to do with families. Nice park to visit especially summer. Lots of activities organised by the park management. Look it up on the net for free outdoor movies, children activities or concerts...

Ping-pong in the Park. There's always something going on in Bryant Park. This summer the outdoor ping-pong was fun to watch and seemed to be well run. I've also never had an issue finding a table to read or eat at and the park has many areas that are quiet enough to maintain a conversation. This is one of my favorite places to take a break and do some people watching in the city.
A nice place to sit and visit.. There are wonderful places to sit and have an iced tea or other drink. We sat here for two hours with family and just visited.

A Quaint Park to Relax In. Cute little garden in the middle of the city. Lots of chairs and benches to sit on under the trees. Had a drink on the outdoor patio. They were expensive but thirst quenching. Nice looking restaurant right there as well but didn't go in. The park is right beside the New York City library. We did go in there. Looked around at the beautiful architecture and used the air conditioned free WiFi room.

Stange place for a park, but very nice!. This is a great example of an amazing park in the middle of a busy city. This park is very well kept and a great place to relax and see a movie at night. Lots of events to go to and views to see.
Fun and relaxing. Nice park to sit and have a rest after a long day of walking (meaning shopping). Cute merry-go-round is great for little kids (or immature adults).
Little gem. Very pretty park and views, though it must be crowded at all times. Liked the statues and ballustrade and plush lawn.
Lovely and special place. Excellent place to take a great time with your friends, its very nice, you have a funny place with all the necessary, food, drink and seatings.Special stop!

Chill in Bryant. Great feeling in the park. Our Hotel was just along the street from the park and when we walked through, it was full of folks just relaxing. We sat one day enjoy coffee, great way to watch life slowly meander by.. try it.
People watching.. Bryant is a great spot to people watch, the park itself is very nice with adequate seating and food and drinks available; also for those with kids, there is a bathroom in the park.

Lovely Oasis in Manhattan . Good for people watching. We enjoyed a number of stops there, sometimes to eat food we bought in the wonderful foodhall beside Central Station. Or a Pizza in the evening. There was always a table and chairs available although it could be very busy. Free booked were available to borrow which I though was really nice. Good place to people watch.

Great Oasis in Midtown Manhattan!. Great Oasis in Midtown Manhattan! The people watching is fantastic and you can grab something to eat from one of the vendors near the park and just relax in the shade!

Sit and relax. cute small space, very clean and nice people frequenting here. The waster feature was relaxing to sit by, and one day I visited there was a band playing outside a nearby restaurant so was very nice- def worth finding.

Wonderful greenspace adjacent to the Public Library. It's a wonderful space. A huge lawn, a carousel, an outdoor reading room. And great people watching! Can't ask for much more than that. Lots of places to grab a bite & plenty of room in the shade & near the fountains.

Fun in the park, year"round. Every year we add Bryant park to our visit to NYC. To think how neglected the area was before! Great kiosks! Great outdoor "warm" bars to meet new friends! Watching skaters, at an affordable charge having fun! And to top it all off, an airport connection at the bar!

Good stop to take a break from walking. This park was one of the few spots we stopped to take a break from walking on 5th Avenue. Like other parks in NYC, there were bunch of statues in the park, a lot of metal tables and chairs and even power outlets to charge your phone or laptop. The public library is right by the park. The building looked really nice from the outside but unfortunately it was closed (we were there on a Sunday).

Great place to relax and rendevous. Certainly not a park in the Central Park sense of the word, but more of a promenade and green common area. It's beautifully designed with tons of trees for shading, lots of cafe tables/chairs and an assortment of games like Bocci, ping pong, a carousel and a variety of good food vendors like LPQ and Witchcraft. I think this is often overlooked, but no matter what the season BP is one of my favorite parks to spend a mellow afternoon chatting with a friend, reading a book or escaping. Mondays in the summer there are free movies on the lawn, and in the winter it converts to a free skating ring that is lovely. The only drawback is there aren't too many bathrooms close by.

Nice place to escape the hustle and bustle of New York. Bryant Park is a perfect spot to just escape from the chaos of Times Square. Just a couple of blocks away, it is a welcome respite from the crowds. It can be difficult to find places to sit in NY, and sitting down on the grass in Bryant Park can be a welcome relief.
Free Broadway preview. Very friendly park. Sat and got to listen to broadway stars sing for one hour! Lots of familites. Close to subway and food trucks available.
Wonderful park to relax. Love this park. Just to sit and relax watching the activities in the park was wonderful. Went on my last morning of vacation again just to sit and relax.

Perfect park with the perfect scenery!. I went to Bryant Park during the beginning of March. It was VERY VERY VERY cold for a Florida girl like myself, but somehow, the sun was shining directly into the park, so it was so warm and fuzzy. I was drinking yummy cappuccinos that you can order from one of the cute little coffee huts outside in the park, I was Facetiming my family at the time (it was about 2pm), and they were so pleased to see how beautiful it looked, especially how tall lovely buildings surround the party. Definitely a lovely place to have a cup of coffee and have a chat with your friends.

Break Time. I work around Bryant Park and love to go sit and just enjoy the sun and people watch. You will find a lot of people sitting around doing the same thing, many taking pictures of the library. Great place to just relax for a minute and see nyc life.

Great experience, wonderful food, free games!. During my trip to NYC in July, my friends and I went to Bryant Park several times. It was a shady break from the summer heat! We ate at Wafels and Dinges..a turkey and chesse croissant one day and a World's Fair dessert the next. On Sunday morning there were shaded tables with free games to play. We played Apples to Apples and had a ball! Go visit Bryant Park the next time you are in the Big Apple. It will be a great experience with wonderful food and free games too!
Quiet place to sit. Nice place to sit and relax for a bit. Hot day in July and the shade from the trees made this a nice place to sit.

great park for all seasons!. Love this quaint park. Always a great place to people watch or take a stroll! The center fountain is beautiful and always on and lit. Winter time is especially fun as there are vendors selling there beautiful crafts and art all throughout the park in little tent enclosed kiosk.

Eating outside on the terrace restaurant. On a lovely Saturday night prior to a show on Broadway we enjoyed an evening meal in the outside area of Bryant Park. Good food, well priced, served by helpful and efficient staff
Nice park. This park is nice but it could use some maintenence, at night it looks dingy but during the day is quiet and nice.
Park for all. One of the best place to sit and talk in the city - changes by season - but always great. The ice skating in the winter is wonderful and movie night in the summer is fab

Children: Le Carrousel Bryant Park New York. This is our third visit to New York; this time its different, we have a 3yr old and she LOVED the carrousel in Bryant Park. The ride was CHEAP at $3 a go both for children and adults (adults I think!) and the view of high rise buildings, restaurants, a fountain and a big green area to sit or lay in the sun in; gives it a GREAT place to REST your weary feet and legs while the little one runs around(ish!) or for you all to sit and eat. The public toilets were the BEST ever and free (just expect cues ladies).
Fun "pocket park" in New York City. What a fun place to catch the spirit of New York. People watching is wonderful--lots of tables, benches, and a GRASS LAWN!

Great park. Bryant Park is always crowded and it's a great place to people watch. The New York Public Library is right across the street and there's several public transportation for you to get to or go home. I love watching the tourist enjoying our beautiful city except when they stand in the middle of the sidewalk and/or area that you're walking. LOL. There are tons of activities that occur in the park and you can always be surprised with some form of art or entertainment. There are few places for you to grab something to eat or bring your meal to the park and eat at one of the tables. It's definitely a park to check out and enjoy for a few if you're in the area.
Chill spot!. Chill time in Bryant park. This place is stunning during the winter time with the ice ring, but even in the summer provides a chill yet touristy atmosphere!

What a happy surprise!. Having been to NYC a few times prior.. I was shocked that I had managed to overlook this wonderful area of the city. I thoroughly enjoyed the beauty and the atmosphere. Sat at a table and relaxed for an hour, watching people, watching a dramatic show that was going on, taking a ride on the merry go round, and enjoying the beauty of this place. So happy to have found it, and it is now on my list of places to go every t ime I'm in NYC.

Great place to rest!. I was walking down 42nd Str. on my way to Grand Central and UN Headquarters and had a nice cup of coffee sitting on one of the chairs in the park. It looks as if New Yorkers use this park to have a short break, reading and playing games. There is also a lot of activities like yoga, free movies, etc., you just have to get informed.

Bit of Greenery in the Big Apple. A place to spend time if you are weary walking in the Big Apple. Food venders around if you need a bite. Bathrooms(Toilets) are crowded considering the multitudes of tourists. Lots of shaded areas with seating. A central place if you are in a group & want to split & meet up going & doing your own thing.
Beautiful Park in the Summer. Grab a sandwich and had lunch at the park; I felt like a local! Beautiful weather at the end of July.
Park. Excellent park near to a university , plenty of young people, The entrance of library is there with a coffee and also in the middle of the middle of Manhattan
great spot to sit ande enjoy a quick stop. I attended this park at night in summer and there was plenty of activity with good options of cafe by the park to choose from, very safe!

Always lvely, all year round.. Coming often to NY for work, I always found time for a stop here. It is lovely all year round, sit at one of the table with an iced drink or a sandwich in the summer and read a book, or simply enjoy a cosy walk in the winter snow. Can be quite romantic, if you are in right company...
Pretty. A beautiful park on a summers day but I sure its even more amazing in the winter. Not too far from where we were staying in Times Square

Lovely little green space in the midst of skyscrapers. This is a wonderful place to people watch and relax. There is a nice restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating overlooking the park, and a nice antique-looking carousel for little kids.
Passing by or Pausing. Nice clean park. Lots of seating and shade. A few lite eating shops. Periodic entertainment or activities. Nice relaxing spot.

An oasis!. Spent an afternoon in this charming park killing time before heading to the airport.
Plenty of seating and shade, we sat and listened to a lovely jazz pianist while playing scrabble and other board games provided by the park! A great spot to spend the afternoon!
see the park. go to see Broadway in the park. The kids have activities and people are always doing something there. It is near the public library of NYC
Lovely walks. If you visit this park...PLEASE do not stat away from the bay...walk by the bay and enjoy the relaxing and romantic view...breath taking

All visitors should spend a little time here. Great park for relaxing, always lots to watch and a lot of different entertainment, must also be the best public toilets anywhere with lovely and helpful attendants

Nice spot to relax. Nice little tree lined park close to Times Square, great place to sit with a drink or snack and take the weight off your feet. Lots of takeaways and street stalls very close. Large grass area in the middle where you can sit or plenty of tables around the sides. Popular with locals and tourists. There are also some events held here like the outdoor cinema in the summer months.

Sit and watch the world go by. Lots of public seats here so I nip across the road and grab a coffee and enjoy the free wifi and watch New Yorkers go about their business. There's stalls and markets at various times of the year

Easy social space. This is a welcomed green space conveniently located in a very built up area. The park hosts a number of special seasonal events which attract a multitude of visitors. In the off periods it provides space to just chill and people watch.Great place for tired feet and to meet. Hassle- free. Suggest you consult events diaries for up coming events.

FIrst time visit to New York. We were in New York for a few days and having gone for a walk we arrived at Bryant Park. This is a lovely area just to take a break and to chill out and watch the people go by.
Take a break, see some real new york. Buy a drink at the bar and enjoy the after work energy of real New Yorkers Great place to relax and see real people, unlike times square
Enchanted . I loved this park!! It has a good vibe! There are some good options to eat there. And you can enjoy your time having fun. There is a beautiful carrousel and in general a great view!!

Little Gem. Love this little gem in the middle of the city and the garment district. Always something going on here from little shows to pop up shopping and there are also 2 really nice restaurants to chose from in the park but they are pricy.

An Oasis in the Middle of the City. Our favourite park! Roughly the size of a soccer field, this park is a great place to relax, get into some activity or just people watch. There is a lawn in the centre where people are having picnics or just soaking up the sun. Every twenty metres or so there is some activity going on. There is a reading area, table tennis, kids participating in various games, a carousel, a shop where you can rent board games and other countless events that are happening in a small park. We took our time walking around and sitting on the many benches watching the hive of activity in this green magnet. Although we didn’t take part in any action, it was an enjoyable experience having a nice stroll in the afternoon and soaking up the incredible atmosphere here.

A Quiet Park full of life. This is by and large one of the best parks in NYC. On a Saturday it is good to just go sit and people watch, try your hand at some of the sports on offer or even have a drink as you sit in nature. In the built up world of NYC, it is a small escape. Do mind the odd vagrant though but a great little park
Xmas spirit. They allow you to skate free if you have your own skates and the holiday shops that surround it just ring in the xmas season
Very pleasant respite. Great stop-off in midtown with seats under the trees for shade and a grassy area for those who want sun. Plus plenty of places to eat and drink round the square

lunchtime as a newyorker. this small park caged in between high buildings is where to stop for a typical lunch in NY. BUY food in any deli around there, go to the park, take your hoes off and enjoy lunch watching newyorkers, the sky, be full part of manhattan for a while. If travelling in november you should enjoy the ice skatepark which is less touristic that the one in rockefeller plaza but still a typical ny experience.

Bryant park is a great public park in New York city!!!. Bryant Park is an amazing park in the heart of midtown. You can visit to enjoy one of the many free events like summer movies, language lessons, yoga, ice skating just to name a few. Also in December be sure to visit the Christmas Market with numerous vendors and artists.

Bryant Park NYC - a good open space in NYC. Bryant Park is a great open space with good facilities right in the middle of NYC. Good amenities around it and handy to most things. A good place to sit on teh grass and eat your lunch, or - a bit more up market go to the adjacent restaurants to enjoy a casual meal or a beverage.
Great Atmosphere!. Great atmosphere on a Friday afternoon. Peaceful, in the midst of the noisy traffic and hoards of shoppers and tourists. An amazing respite.

Eh, not much to look at. When I was there, it was pretty boring. Yeah, it was a nice park, but there were tons of vendors and people taking up all of the shady tables, leaving us to either pick a seat in the July heat, or continue to walk around. Don't really see the hype about it. Maybe moreso in the winter months.

my favourite park. Even though NYC is famous for its skyscrapers, it has also a lot of parks. The most famous one is central park and it is usually full of tourists. However there are plenty of other and my favourite is Bryant Park. It is in between time square and grand central. It is very sunny and there are tables and chairs. You can sit have a coffee or lunch or even read a book you took from the public library close by... worth the visit!

lovely Saturday afternoon. We had the pleasure of sitting in the park and enjoying a wonderful day. We purchased coffee and a nosh from the kiosk in the park. Grab a cup of coffee and a table and enjoy.
Lovely!. Lovely place to sit and watch the world go by or listen to some local talent singing. Lots of places to grab a bite to eat nearby.

Thanksgiving trip to New York City. Lovely place !!! Love it.... visited in November .To me was the perfect time around Thanksgiving .Love all the small shops very nice setting for the visitors ,tourists... the ice-skating ring full of happy faces .....At twilight the buildings start lighting up and the skyline brightness show up a walk away from so many shops and 4 2nd street. And many well known places ....Empire State Building...Macy's Store .The New York Library . A Fun place to hang around
A good pitstop. A fun and worthwhile place to see and hangout while in the city. It's especially great in December when it's prepped for Christmas
Great time ice skating. We had such fun ice skating in Bryant Park. We also loved the Christmas market! Christmas time is a great time to visit NYC.
Neat , interesting place. Sits behind the library. Interesting place to have lunch, people watch or just hang out. Little cafes, restaurants to visit with family or friends.
A Gem. This is lovely park with a great outdoor restaurant slap bang in the middle of the Big Apple. Food is relatively straightforward (good salads, burgers etc.) but service was excellent.

Brilliant Bryant,.... A very nice and quaint park. You can enjoy skating, or something to drink or eat. Very well presented. And very friendly.
Just in case you are a smoker,...remember you can not smoke within the park itself.

Theater and Yoga. NYC is a very expensive city, but there are also a lot of wonderful events accessible for free. I joined Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet performance and several Yoga sessions in Bryant Park and I really enjoyed a lot. Thanks NYC, thanks Bryant Park!

COOL place to chill. If you want a cool place to rest and relax after walking a gagillion miles this is a nice stop. Now all the things around it are pricey like the stores and the food but there awesome. Paxs is on the corner but you get way more for your money at times square paxs , the French bakeries are fantastic !!! lots of chairs and shade
Bryant Park. The Bryant Park experience and buzz is a happening within itself.There is a space for everyone and a great open-air meeting point in mid-town NYC that offers food and drink
Summer in the City. A gem tucked in amongst the skyscrapers. Beautiful architectural details in the bathroom, of all places. Lovely carousel.

Lovely venue. We were disappointed to be unable to eat in the main (air conditioned) restaurant as they said (at dinner time) that they were closing, so were forced to opt for the cafe. We really enjoyed our food and service was prompt and efficient.

Winter Wonderland. Skating and fun abound in the winter here! It's a great place to people watch, to stop for hot cocoa and to do a little shopping! there were some booths set up for the holidays, I bought this great pair of gloves/mittens that I always get complimented on there. I highly recommend taking a way through the park, sitting and watching and taking in all of New York at its best.
winter festival. great ice rink, nice backdrop with skyscrapers. i wasn't too impressed with christmas market junk - expensive and unoriginal but i suppose it would change every year
Try Broadway in Bryant Park - several Thursdays in summer. Broadway in Bryant Park - a solid FIVE! Crowded and hot and no shade but what the heck - we sure enjoyed it!
Great at night. This is a fun place to walk to for drinks at night. Lots of people are out and about, so make sure to be patient!

Gorgeous And Operational Park Right In Middle Of Town. Another oasis in the city that is a well-used but clean and vibrant park.
Always organized events going on in the park for free....game check-out, language lessons, yoga, etc... Great architecture around the whole park and yet it feels just big enough to spend an afternoon here.
Peaceful spot. Always something happening at Bryant Park, check their website for events - we enjoyed having some coffee and just relaxing and people watching.

We didn't fall!. All I wanted to do my second time in The Big Apple, was ice skate and see the Christmas tree! So that is what we did(and some shopping of course) . We chose the ice rink at Bryant Park and I was so glad we did! The shops around it, the people, the atmopshere, the skating was so wonderful!! & I am super excited that I can say, I didn't fall once! :)

Broadway in the Park. We were fortunate enough to be in town on the day of Broadway in the Park. It was not only a great opportunity to get a sample of three great shows, but with so many locals there for lunch along with the tourists, it was a wonderful peek into true New Yorker life.

Summer Trip. Every time we go into the city we arrive at Grand Central and walk right up to Bryant Park either in the summer or winter and always enjoy everything that is going on there from the shows to the view and the food and people We went and played some ping pong this time and go to the ice rink in the winter and the fountain is very nice
Beautiful day for a walk before the show. Nice to stroll around or lay on the grass. They have plays, concerts, movies for free-check the schedule.
Beautiful place. Nice bit of green in the middle of the city. It's an easy walk from Times Square if you're in the area. I personally love the restaurant there.

A beautiful park to do whatever suits your needs..... This is a great NYC park that changes depending on the seasons and holidays. You can ice state in the wintertime or sit and read anytime. I like to just people watch. You'll find restaurants and booths selling seasonal items. Or you can just relax, hangout and catch your breath.

It's like Paris in NY. We usually stay in the Murray Hill district when in New York. This park is a short walk from our Hotel and we always give it a visit. It reminds me of Paris parks with the umbrellas and wooden seating. It is lovely to sit in on a sunny day. Well worth a visit.

Great park in the middle of New York City. This is one of those parks that has many different types of events there is always something to do here...One of the things that I had the most fun doing was when they set up the ice skating rink...but there is so many of the things that go on at this park you really need to go online and see what special events they have to offer I guarantee you will find something that you would like to do here

Obsessed with this place. I've always been obsessed with Bryant Park. I'm always there. Literally I go to NYC and my friends know where to meet me or where to take me. I don't care much about other places. BP is so beautiful and relaxing at any time of the year.

Great park with a great atmosphere. As a Project Runway fan, I had to visit Bryant Park on my trip to NYC. It is a great park with a great atmosphere! There are even restaurants right within the park area. There are lots of chairs and tables also. It is right in front of the New York Public Library. It is a fun place to stop and sit for a while!

first stop, nyc mornings. this is a jewel of a venue: plenty of open space, loads of chairs and tables, a reading library inthe open, the best loo in the city (perhaps any city, with classical music, flowers, clean loos with new seat covers for each customer, all with no charge), bars, soup and coffee and ice cream stands, free movies every monday in the summer, and in the dead centre of new york city. it's perfect.
Small central park. Over rated, nothing special. Nice to have a sit down in some green space - but nothing to write home about

Good Lunch in restaurant, Great Hangout. Perfect place for outdoor lunch on a Sunday in good weather. Combine this with a visit to the nearby Morgan Museum & Library and you'll have a lovely afternoon.

Very inviting and family friendly park!. We first went to Central Park which is obviously quite large. However, there wasn't a great deal going on. There was a little playground and things scattered throughout the park but other than that people were just laying around. Bryant Park, however, had a completely different feel. There were people playing ping pong and table games (which one can borrow for free from the game cart). There were food vendors and everyone really seemed to be enjoying themselves. There is also an area where a theater company was putting on Romeo and Juliet right there in the park for free. We enjoyed this park much more than Central Park.

A touch of Paris. This is a great place to meet friends, grab a bite or to just relax. There are frequently special events, such as free movies and concerts. This park is a perfect example of urban renaissance. Years ago, it was dirty and occupied by threatening characters. Now the energy is both soothing and energizing.
Great afternoon. Went here with my gf the other day and we had a lovely afternoon. Relaxing people watching and given the position, there is plenty of people watching to do!! loved it.
a beautiful respite from the chaos. A beautiful and peaceful park with a bar that sells great food and drink. The buffalo wings are a must.
Nice Park. Very nice park. Not to busy and plenty of things to do. Located next grand central station and Times Square. Would recommend if near this area.

A wonderful urban park. We had a drink here each afternoon after our daily outings and before returning to our hotel. See how the locals celebrate summer, enjoy the sunshine and lovely gardens. Many places to sit and soak up the sun. Evening movies and other entertainment in summertime. A number of casual and pretty good restaurants and bars in the park but also a nice place for a picnic. No alcohol allowed outside the actual bars and restaurants.
Nice park in Ny. Very relaxing place. I been in the afternoon got coffee sit down and just relax. Lots of restaurants around and things to do. Good for family.

Great for people watching and taking time out. Pretty park with several cafes, not far from Times Square. Shady in the sunshine and staffed with friendly guides on hand to provide bats and balls for table tennis.Whilst we were there films were screened in the evening.
Ideal if you have children to feed!!!!. Lots of 'fast food' places but certainly not enough choice if you want a 'decent' meal. Ideal if you have children to feed, pizza, burgers, hot dogs etc.

A calm oasis in a vivid town. Only some quarters from Times Square it is possible to find a more pleasant plase to relax. The Bryant Park has places to read, play tabel tennis, or just sit and talk.When we where there, they had a free Cinema showing and old movie starring Mae West.
nice but... a little cluttered. Great bathrooms, shame about the outdoor screen permanently up on the grass and no access to the grass while we were there. Outlets to charge up are great though.
We love it. Quite nice place to be.Free wifi. Sports some times, or only relaxing before next round of shopping in 5th Avenue or After you climbed Empire State Building.

Grab lunch and enjoy. Lovely park in the middle of NY bustle. Grab lunch at a nearby shop (Pret a Manger and other take away eateries are across the street) and find one of the numerous chairs or tables and enjoy the shade and the people-watching. Also a venue for smaller outdoor events on the lawn. Busy park, but worth your patience.

Lovely Park in the Sun. Great park! clean, safe and you can hide in the shade watching people play jeux de boules. many new yorkans come here for their lunch break and it is a fun place to do people watching

One of my favourites. One of the cutest little parks in the city. It's beautiful in the winter with the skating rink and tree and equally as stunning in the summer. Monday nights they also show free movies and i believe they do yoga classes as well. If you need a bathroom use the Bryant Park bathrooms. THE cleanest public bathroom I have ever come across in my many trips to NYC.
Favorite Summer Coffee Place. I love this little city park. Lots of seating areas with a coffee kiosk that serves excellent coffee.

The Blessings of Bryant Park. NYC can be loud and full of crowds, but the parks are, for the most part a joy! Bryant Park (Find 5th & W42nd) is my very favorite! I like to get a Starbucks (on the corner) and sit in the park. You may see an elderly rabbi playing bocce' ball with an Arab friend. This time, two gentlemen were attempting to play ping pong, children were on a field trip, a noted actor was sitting under the library "be honest and check out a book" tent studying his lines, and there was a special normalcy…a quiet that made us relax as the park was surrounded by the hustle and bustle. This is where the library with the giant lions guarding it on the front steps is located. During the summer through September, movies are shown on an office building, and people sit on the lawn. That same lawn becomes an ice skating rink in the winter. Take a break in Bryant Park. You'll make a special memory of NYC.

Small park behind NY Library. It's really a pretty place behind the NY Library - you can pass through it on your way to Times Square. There's even a grill house there, so you can have lunch. However, it's simply very small.

An Oasis in Midtown. Growing up in NYC, Bryant Park was a place to be feared in the 70's and early '80s. My, has it changed. On 42nd Street between 5th and 6th Avenue (right behind the NY Public library), you'll find restaurants, food and drink kiosks, entertainment, green space, ample tables and chairs (some with umbrellas or tree shade), a carousel, a chess and game area, jugglers, lessons (language, yoga, tai chi), and more.A wonderful place to stop, sit, people-watch, eat or have a picnic. You might find a film (at night), or a concert. Or simply bring a book, grab a coffee and enjoy the surroundings.

Too many homeless people. The park is beautiful, quiet and has a lot of areas. Unfortunately, there are too many homeless people lingering. Many of them are sleeping in the sitting areas provided for eating. I hope that the city doesn't let it go to ruins

Brilliant Bryant. I really liked this park, so well used, lots to see and still a good place to sit for a while. I love the fact there are film nights, juggling corners, language lessons. The people who are looking after this park are doing an amazing job, cleaning , sweeping, emptying bins, just keeping it the great park that it is, well done them.And for every mother who has her teenage son with them on holiday.....this park has wifi...happy son, happy mum!
Love this park. This is where I go on my visits to new york for people watching.It's a true urban oasis--the nice lawn, the library steps, the fountains, the new yorkers.

Great park to relax, picnic. This is probably not a destination on its own unless there are outdoor movies available. If you are in the area it is a great place to bring or buy lunch. Lots of cafe style tables to sit at and enjoy the area - sun or shade. Food at the kiosks is good, and are plenty of other options nearby. Very handy to the Public Library.

The Center of it All. Bryant Park is right behind the Library and is always a fun place. Activities and exhibits change constantly. There are drinks and food available, as well as chairs for weary walkers. Beautiful with flowers and lots of shade.
Very clean & family oriented. This was a hub for our bus transportation, so we visited it daily. They park was very clean and very family friendly. It was in a great location as well.

Great Park for All Seasons. In the winter go skating and grab a hot drink, in the summer watch movies on Monday nights and enjoy the outdoor cafes, plus year round there are other great restaurants, shops and attractions surrounding Bryant Park.

Relaxing Spot in a Busy City. Whenever I'm in Manhattan and have a few hours to spare, I love to go to Bryant Park. It's so relaxing. There are many chairs and tables, food vendors, and a carousel with the cutest animals. I like the rabbit. I've been here in the winter too, when the Christmas Tree is up, and they have more vendors selling holiday items. A summer late morning/early afternoon is my favorite time to visit. You can read a book, sip coffee, or people watch. The park is one of my favorite places to go in the city.

Green space. What a find? A great green space in the middle of the city. On the day we visited there was a concert going on and everyone was enjoying the free performance. A nice area to stop and take a few breaths away from the hectic pace of this city.
Mama Mia. Fantastic park. Cast from Mama Mia were playing. Absolutely brilliant atmosphere. Museum is amazing.

Relaxing park with a perfect tempo. Bryant park has a wonderful beat that is resonant with Manhattan and this sets the ambience for your entire stay in New York. A must-relax destination that helps breakaway from the buzz of Manhattan with all the benefits of watching the world go by (with their pet dogs, of course)...

Fantastic oasis in midtown.... The most beautiful small park in the city. Lots of tables and chairs available to sit and have lunch, snack, or coffee.Just behind the main branch of the library. Many times there are free concerts at lunch time or after work. Once a week there are free movies in the park.
Great Space. Nice and relatively quite park to take a break from all the running around. Great place to people watch and catch your breath.
Great spot to meet friends. Great place to eat breakfast on the go or to sit and people watch. Not crowded like other parks and close to great shopping. Easy to get to from all areas.

Romance Reading in the Bryant Park Reading Room. The place was nicely set up by the grounds keeper Grant . I noticed this because I was there way to early taking pictures. The event was on time and done well. It was hosted by Blogger Joyce Lamb. Authors in attendance:Robyn Carr, Four Friends, Never Too LateKristan Higgins, The Best Man, In Your DreamsElizabeth Hoyt, Dearest RogueBeverly Jenkins, For Your Love, Destiny’s CaptiveSusan Elizabeth Phillips, Heroes Are My WeaknessMeredith Wild, HardwiredGotta love it! Harlequin, Avon, and Forever authors dish on their best-selling romance novels.

Fantastic day. I attended the Solo Piano Concerts and discovered all the free fabulous events available throughout the summer(e.g. yoga, meditation, language classes, boot camp, etc.). I loved it! Great place to enjoy your lunch if you work in the area while listening to wonderful music played by extraordinary artists or just a terrific, fun place to spend a summer day. Looking forward to going back during these fabulous summer days.
A slice of life. Great place located near Times Square. Lots to do for all ages. Food available as well as games and activities. Something for All ages

Great outdoor place to hang out!. Bryant Park is a great place and a great location to walk to shopping or walk to Times Square. There are lots of NYC souvenir shops around and a few decent hotels. My 7 year daughter and I walked through Bryant Park many times after dark in July 2015 and there were always other people around and we always had a safe walk.

Lunch scene. Park known for shows and ice skating in winter but was great for an outdoor lunch spot during s business trip. Tons of tables and chairs available with nice view of the Public Library and great people watching. Grab a sandwich and enjoy the scene.

small but perfectly formed. A small oasis of peace and calm amongst the hubbub and turmoil of Avenue of the Americas Apparently there are many events in Bryant park, but not when we were in New York.it is clean (as are all the parks we visited) . There are several coffee bars and plenty of seating around the park - or just sit on the lawn and take a break.

Nice relaxing park. It is clean, secure, and family friendly to lay out by the fountain, read a book, or have a picnic. I didnt see any swings but the library is across the street and they have concerts and plays in the park. I am looking forward to attending one soon.

Beautiful. One of my favorite areas in Manhattan. It's always clean and there are plenty of tables and chairs for sitting in the shade and people-watching. Grab a hot dog and Coke then sit in the shade and enjoy. It's such a beautiful park!

Little Oasis in Central Manhattan. I love love love Bryant Park. One of my favourite place in NYC. Listening to the pianist play for the lunch crowd, people borrowing books from the share library, have a coffee or some lunch (pret a manger is across the street if you like) and just watch the quintessential NYC just go by (oh, and the cleanest public bathrooms in NYC)!

Dear little park, this one, next to a fantastic Library.. The kids kicked a soccer ball around in a tiny space, and we watched table tennis players while we ate our cut lunch. Bryant park is easy on the eye, a place to quietly sit, nice juice carts adjacent, a good stop over on our walk through the city. And its next door to the NY Public Library.
Bryant Park. Ate at Bryant Park Grille. Delicious. Highly recommend. Bryant Park is beautiful. Park was perfect for getting some sun and relaxing or reading a book.

Great park in central Manhattan. In summer, take advantage of the free movies. Everyone brings picnic rugs and food and the crowd really gets into the movies. Great fun! In winter, the skating rink is beautiful and there are market stalls selling Christmas gifts and hot apple cider. A great little park.

Beautiful at Christmas!. I visited Bryant park in December just after Christmas, the decorations were up along with the tree. We went ice skating after dinner and loved the empire state in the background scenery.

Life Before Asphalt. Bryant Park is near the library and Broadway. It's a great place to gather if you're having an extended reunion of any kind. Tables and chairs abound, and there's enough green to throw a ball around on. A great place to go and remember life before asphalt.

Bryant Park Summer Movie Mondays. Bryant Park is just lovely, a great natural break in the city. On Mondays during the summer, enjoy Movies in the Park. A giant outdoor movie screen is set up on the green, and family friendly flicks are shown at around 8pm. Vendors are handy for snacks and drinks. What a great way to spend an evening when Times Square has worn you out.
Bryant Park. A small and nice park close to midtown. Lots of coffe shops and similar close by, and a nice place to rest and enjoy the big apple.

Great place to remove yourself from all the frantic activity of Manhattan. I often go here to simply cross through the park, or to sit and people watch, or sometimes to eat a brown bag lunch with co-workers. In the summer, there is the carousel and the al fresco movies as attractions, in the winter there is the skating rink and the kiosks with holiday gifts, and all year-round there are permanent kiosks for food and drink. When one visits, one can imagine being in "Paris--the park is studded with allees of trees, and bistro sets. The landscaping is lovely, and the shade lowers the temperatures a good 10-15 degrees Fahrenheit. It is a lovely place to forget all the stresses of life in the Big Apple.

lovely little park - nice summer escapade. A lot happening and a little oasis in the city - go sing a song as the piano plays popular tunes or play table tennis or read in the reading corner or sit around and chat and enjoy the flowers - loads happening - lots of summer colour and cheer and ambience and concerts etc - a real find.

Artistic. If you want to get a sense of what "artsy" means, Bryant Park is the place to be. It was really cool (temperature wise as well) in the scorching sun and relaxing to sit and sip coffee. There is always some performance in Bryant Park and its location is superb for some rest during a busy sightseeing day in NYC.

Whimsical!. I've been to Bryant Park twice this year and loved it both times. I went in the end of fall/beginning of winter and the beginning of spring and it was magical! There are so many different vendors and food options. Not huge like Central Park. It is great to take photos here also!
Nothing Special. It was a really small park, where the locals read or sunbathed. There wasn't really anything to do unless you're just looking for a little break from the concrete.
Winter wonderland. Love coming here especially during the winter. Christmas lights, small shops, hot chocolate and ice skating.

Delightful shops before Christmas. We arrived early for a brunch reservation nearly, and decided to explore the shops in the park. Bryant Park is just lovely in early December. Shopping in these wonderful, unique kiosks is fun. I'd like to go back for the next Christmas season.
Park with a bar.. Small park located behind the NYC library. They have different events. When we were there, a large group were doing yoga in the large common area.
Do not miss it!. We loved Bryant Park! It's a beatiful park in the middle of NYC. Try to see it at night. Some of my best pictures of our trip were taken there.
A little square of quiet. Although it was mid week and fairly cold when I visited, this square was a hive of activity and entertainment. Plenty of cafes serving great coffee and pastries.

Cool and fashionable. Spent an hour by the ice rink watching how the other half live. :) There was a private party in the glass building overlooking the rink with many a bottle of champers being enjoyed. I am not very fashionable but I was once and so enjoyed the atmosphere here

Beautiful. Very good place to visit in NYC... Located close to the main sightseeings of Manhattan and with easy access to public transportation. It offers one of the best seen to watch the Empire State Building at night.

Relaxing spot,free Wifi. Nice place to relax ,escaping business from bustling NYC.
In summer we can enjoy free musical sometimes.
It's free wifi and there are a lot of tables and seats.

Don't forget the Bublic Library!. There were so much going on in the Bryant park every day :) It's a nice green oasis just a block away from Times Square.
The New York Bublic Library is in the Bryant Park, you absolutely have to visit there :)

Acitivities vary with the season. I always associate Bryant Park with the fashion show season. When events are held here the crowds and traffic can be overwhelming. With that said it is a wonderful space and there is always something going on.

Noon Concerts occassionally. Nice oasis among the high rise buildings. Lots of tables and chairs and areas on the grass to sit and visit. Food stands and shops at the park or near-by. Occasional noon concert – we went to the Broadway in the Park production on Thursday afternoon. That was a nice treat. There are also movies scheduled for several evenings during the summer. Restrooms are available at the park. The NYC Library is right next door – which was a great place to visit before or after going to the park. There were a few individuals that were panhandling, but less than what I had expected.

Relaxing Bliss. We actually returned to Bryant park several times during our trip because it is a serene green spot filled with character and beauty. The park itself isn't very large, but it's perfect for relaxation and people watching.
Fun place to people watch. Fun place to people watch. Top level jazz bands, chess players, fun characters and just people watch with the locals and the tourists especially on a sunny day.
christmas markets end of October. Great to see Christmas markets starting up at end of October we were lucky to stumble upon them. Pretty little park.
Relaxation in New York. In the middle of a bustling city, this popular park offers relaxation, restaurants and well maintained gardens and lawns. A lovely place to sit and watch New York pass by.
