Lovely city park . This is a lovely park. My husband and I bought a coffee and sat at a table near the large grass lawn where there was a yoga class taking place. I love the large trees and green gardens, and the carousel for an extra something special.

The most spectacular place in NYC.. I LOVE Bryant Park. I like to stay in hotels that are not too far away so I can visit it late at night too. It's a hub for locals and tourists by day and by night it's magical with the Library as a back drop -which is a magnificent building by its own right. Such a sense of community having all the bistro tables and chairs. And I love the little carrousel for the children!!

The Park has a Special Aura. I loved the Aura of Bryant Park. We were dropped off here after landing in Newark from Australia and getting the $10 bus in to our hotel on Broadway. We stopped and had a rest on the steps and basked in the reality of being HERE in the Big Apple. we made our way to the hotel and then came back to this park for lunch the next day. The FEEL of this park is extraordinary. It is almost like you can sense the incredible history and stories that have gone on here for centuries - the lovers who have met here for a clandestine romance, the families who have laughed and ate while the pigeons jostled for scraps. This place has bags of character, the food stalls are good and I highly recommend it. I also found a great pasta shop heading 100m west of the park and then came back to devour my takeaway ravioli in the pleasure of this leafy historical park!
Fantastic park by night. Was the best I could do in New York, I love the bryant park by night, is a fantastic way to enjoy the real new york without spend a lot of money

Quiet Retreat. We stopped briefly at this nice city park after a day of shopping and sightseeing. There were moveable chairs to sit on and we were able to just relax and people watch. The park is clean and safe. It is not large but it is a small escape from a busy city. We were only there for about 1/2 hour, but we enjoyed its nice grounds.

My favourite Manhattan park. Such a pretty little park in the middle of Manhattan. Watch the artists sketch and grab a bite to eat at this beautiful park. If you are visiting NYC in the summer, they often screen open air movies at Bryant Park. Also, head next door to explore the New York Library.
A bit of green peace in the city. Just go and enjoy. We happened upon a dance performance in the park, what a treat! Little shops around the park are fun to check out as well.

Nice!. This park was very close to our hotel, so we would stop there to sit and eat breakfast or a snack, and people-watch. It's a nice little oasis in a sea of craziness. It's pretty and shaded, and there is plenty of seating. They have stands that sell coffee/coffee drinks and other food items. Our family really enjoyed this gem. Also, they seem to show (free) movies once a week at night (at least during the summer), but we missed that.
Beautiful park. Lovely tree lined park, relax and listen to the outdoor entertainment. A very good place to stop after a busy sightseeing morning.

Mama Mia!!. Walked through here after the Empire State Building. Attracted by the big crowd and had no idea what was going on. Was amazed to see the cast of Mama Mia bounce on stage and perform 4 or 5 of their hits!! Great timing and fantastic atmosphere. Apparently it's part of a scheduled series of Broadway Show teasers so worth checking to see who is singing!

Obama passes the Peaceful Park. This is a peaceful oasis behind the NY Public Library, and a great place to people watch and chill out. I met up with an old friend here and we had a lovely time even as the Obama motorcade passed by with a large crowd cheering. Bryant Park has ice skating and pop-up shops in the winter, and outdoor movies, yoga and a reading room in the summer.
Preztels & downtime. Great spot in escape the buzz and craziness of the city. Grab a pretzel and drink from side street vendor, find a spot on the grass, sit back and enjoy some time out!
Exacutions park. The parti was önce a places for exacutions our tour güzide said that there are many deadbodies underground but now it is a nice park.

Not a must-see, but stop by if you're in the area. A pretty small park -- really just an expanse of grass ~2 city blocks long and a block wide, with a cute carousel, some food kiosks, a high-end restaurant, a couple of ping-pong tables, and some places to sit. In the winter it has the outdoor shops, which are always fun to browse, and the skating rink. No need to go out of your way to see it if you have limited time in NYC, but if you're in the neighborhood anyway, just stop by.

Great people watching while relaxing with a snack. A lovely green space offering snacks and plenty of tables and chairs for relaxing. Kiosks offer variety of quick bites and restaurants adjoining Fifth Avenue Libraryare excellent for lunch in particular. Entertainment stage in the evening. It's a chic Manhattan version of the Town Square or Zocolo. Great place to people watch.

Lovely but very busy. We went at lunchtime when the Broadway shows were coming to give previews. Very busy. Would be nice to go at a quieter time. They show films on Monday nights during summer- that looked like fun when we passed.

See it to belive it. Grab a late night open air film or walk barefoot in the grass.
Or just sit and people watch...
Tranquility in the cauldron of New York.
Beautiful and Intriguing. Bryant park was really nice, and the walk there from 30th street was well worth it. The park was very well maintained and very clean (probably the cleanest part of NYC)

Love Bryant Park. I just love Bryant Park, a little oasis in the middle of Manhattan. Lovely relaxing space, outdoor cinema screening and an outdoor reading room where you can relax with a book in the sunshine.

Beautiful park. This park is a little oasis, a really beautiful. We were there in summer, really nice atmosphere. The public toilets are immaculate, please tip the lovely lady she deserves to be thanked.

Nice!. Amidst the busy streets of Manhattan is located the Bryant Park.Its nowhere like Central Park but has its own charm.Theres a carousel,a cafe ...have a beautiful lunch break here and watch the city go by.

Exciting Park with lots to see!. Exciting Park! Lots of people, many different events for different seasons. The ice skating rink is wonderful! Fashion shows. Sit down for Coffee and a snack.Stroll by the various vendors selling their wares!

Favorite small park in NY. Such a beautiful site! Lovely to grab lunch from across the street at one of the many cheap eateries and sit in the park. Beautiful old carrousel for kids, and many fun activities going on in the summer, plus an ice skating rink in the winter. Five star park! Also the city's best kept secret are the bathrooms- amazingly clean for public restrooms.
Family fun. I've been here with my children in the winter time. It was absolutely magnificent, like in a fairytale. My family had lots of fun!!!

Lunch in the park. A great place to spend some quiet time. Relax and enjoy the view and atmosphere. Watch the games at the entrance to the park and witness team play in excellence and New York friendly competition.

Not to be missed. It doesn't have the name recognition of Central Park but it's even better in some respects- not at all large (it shares a block with the New York Public Library) but very enjoyable. Depending on the time of year, there is an ice skating rink and dozens of shops offering everything from Christmas ornaments to hot apple cider. A great place for a quick stroll or to kill some time sitting on a bench and relaxing.
Summer relaxing place. What a nice place to relax and take some minutes and why not hours from the hectic Manhattan. You can enjoy the shadow of big trees, watching the carousel
Very nice - Clean nice public bathrooms.. Very nice. Smaller than you might think. I was very surprised at how nice and clean the public bathrooms were. The best thing around Grand central
Very Quaint. Lovely little park so close to all the action of a metropolis. The small merry go round in contrast to the huge buildings was bizzare

Bryant Park - Summer 2015. Bryant Park continues to be a wonderful place to visit in New York City with all that it offers – both permanent and seasonal. Centrally situated, it is behind the New York Public Library and Bryant Park Café, and close to Times Square, Grand Central Terminal and the Port Authority Bus Terminal. It offers shade and abundant seating allowing visitors time to catch their breath, rest their feet, people watch and more. With numerous small food venues dotted around it offers a variety of food options. It also has one of the best (if not THE BEST) public restrooms in New York City. A recent early morning visit found that Summer 2015 has arrived in Bryant Park with a program of events from early morning through to evening. Dotted through the park are games, activities and diversions. Table tennis and paddes are set up and available for matches; the New York Public Library has set up an outdoor reading lounge under a tent with books and magazine to read and swap, expert recommendations and chairs to invite you to stop and read. A variety of classes are offered (free) including yoga, tai chi, barre, chess, mah jong, meditation and juggling to name a few. Game night with Settlers Of Canaan and Scrabble meet weekly and as do the knitters and the dancers. Many entertainment options are to be found, day and evening, including on Thursday highlights from Broadway with cast members; Jazz music, magicians and Shakespeare. Mondays are movie nights with an interesting selection of films to view – get there early for seating. The list of what is on offer is long and the calendar changes daily so check the website of the park to see what you might enjoy. Definitely worth the visit.
little haven. a little oasis great place to have a lunch... always something going on in the park.Can get very busy so would get there early enough to make sure of a table.

Little park with a big heart. This park has so much to do if you walk the entire way around and depending on the time of year you go there might be movies on the lawn or Broadway shows belting out your favourite show tune or perhaps a stop of light yoga. There is plenty of seating space and yummy delights dotted around the park too.
Beautiful park. Lots going on because it's near Times Square and right across from the architecturally stunning New York Public Library. Most beautiful public bathroom in the city.

An oasis of calm. Loved this park! By far my favourite retreat from the summer heat in Manhattan. From families playing board games and reading books together to friends playing ping pong and people charging their phones, the park is a haven of calm and cool! My favourite place to relax
Beautiful Park. We just walked along and saw this park. Incredible gem in the midst of the hustle bustle. Stop and have a refreshment and enjoy the park :)

Relaxing . Sat out here by the park on the 4th of July evening, got some coffee and brownies from the 'Coffeed' kiosk. Was really good. It was nice and quiet at this time of the day but not deserted either. Really clean here, had intended eating at the grill but we weren't hungry enough.

Excellent to chill, and better on this summer 2015!. Excellent, more now with the HBO FILM FESTIVAL every monday if you are in New York this summer of 2015, you definitely need to go and watch a movie at Bryant park, the have a street food fair also attached to the cinema with they serve the best food to enjoy with the movie, TRY: GORDOS CANTINA excellent Méxican street food.Bryant Park is an amazing spot to enjoy with family and friends!
Lovely. Lovely park. Decked out with tables and chairs for lunch, or to read a book. Full of life even after dark. Right next to the library.

Love at first sight!. Had seen this park mentioned on many trip advisor reports and since we were staying just a block away decided to visit it on our way back from Time Square, what a great place to sit and chill while watching the world go by. Such an asset to those who live or work nearby,

A breath of fresh air!. Check out this oasis in Manhattan. Right next to the most beautiful building, the Bryant Hotel. Pretty, quiet, lots of activities, close to Grand Central and the library, so lots to see around it as well.

Bryant Park I Love You!. I love Bryant Park - it's green lawns, the little chairs to sit on, it's right behind the New York public library, the interesting groups of people having their lunch in the park - it's a fab space in a busy city! Grab a picnic meal and enjoy!

What a fabulous space... wish we had the same in Melbourne!. When I was told to go and see Bryant park I didn't really get what could possibly be so special but you have to go and see it for yourself - I have never seen a space like it. Hundreds of people hanging out, holding meetings, exercising, eating, doing all sorts of things but mostly just loving this unique space. They have all sorts of things to do there (for free!) including a library, ping pong, bocce, pilates, knitting... the list goes on. In winter it takes on a whole different life form but I saw it in summer and loved it. Wish I had more time to hang out there and take it all in.
Skating on Christmas day. If we're visiting over winter break, we always go skating at Bryant Park. Lots of fun and easy to rent skates so you don't need to bring your own.

Nice. Although the park is kind of small, it is still a nice place to sit and relax. In the summer time, they open the grass and have different types of events from yoga, to concerts. They even have a place to play ping pong.
Cute Little Park To Relax. A cute little park with seating, shade, a place to grab refreshments and it changes by the season. We enjoyed walking around it. Great place to relax.
Nice Park. We enjoyed our time at this park by sitting at a table enjoying hot dogs and while watching some street entertainers.

Fascinating. there is a small coffee and snack booth in the park next to an area of tables with chess boards on for people to meet for a game of chess at the park. So civilised. I purchased a latte with pastry and just sat a while watching New York wander by.

Time to relax. The park is a quiet place to sit and chat to relax by yourself or with friends. They have chairs and tables scattered around and even a small library to borrow books. The only thing is that they aren't enough space in the shades so if you don't want to sit in the sun bring your hats.

beautiful park within the madness of the city.. well looked after. not expensive to stay and eat. brilliant little piece of heaven within the city.
worth grabbing an ice-cream or a beverage and taking some time out here.

Great alternative to Central Park. Couple blocks away from Grand Central, but a very quaint mostly quiet park. Has a reading tent with no taking, smoking or cell phones (nice to unplug for a bit). Great 'get away' from the city while in the city

NOT MUCH TO IT. The place of the Fashion week NY takes place. This is a very small park in the middle of massive beautiful buildings. Is a very nice scenery but don’t really is much to it, It would not be a most for me if my time is limited, you can cross it within 5 minutes’ walk and half of it is used by the bar that is in one end. Good if you want to seat outside and grab a quick bite but other than that Bryant Park without the fashion week NY is very common.

Very Nice. a great spot to sit and enjoy, lots of food aroud, enough places to sit. Lots going on, but on the otherhand just be. A pole to load your mobile devices. Spots for some games to play, Pingpong f.i.
Park in the middle of the city!. Small green area surrounded by skyscrapers!They have complimentary yoga classes here on Tues and Thurs during the summer too:)

so full of life. I went during lunch time and it's filled with people in all walks of life, It's a place for employees lunch break . There's a book shelf provided wherein you can browse on books, pick whatever you one you want and pick your spot and read. It is pull of life. I got a chair underneath a shaded tree and people watch for few minutes ,it's awesome
Lovely place. Great place to take a break, have a coffee, and just sit and watch life go by. Loved the fact that the library puts books and magazines out for readers
Perfect please to have a few miinutes of peace. Nice green space in the middle of NYC! It's a perfect place to grab a meal from a food truck/takeout and relax on a bench.

A hidden gem. Bryant Park isn't really hidden, but I don't think many people actually look for it, unless you are a local.
I stumbled across Bryant Park a few years ago, and have visited often since. It is a quiet little park where you can sit bakc for awhile and relax, and watch the people go by.
Interesting venue close to Times Square. If you want to read or watch movies outdoors this is the place to go. Food and drink available to keep you sustained.

An Urban Oasis. On the busy 42nd street and Sixth Avenue, Bryant Park is a green oasis right in the centre of Manhattan action. It has been my favorite place of relaxation as I used to take a book to read along with a bottle of lemonade to keep me cool during the summer. Nothing is too far away from here. Grab a sandwich, coffee or an ice cream and chill out here. I have seen people playing chess or table tennis, musicians singing away and many other activities. Since it is along the extremely busy 42nd street, it is a very safe place to lounge at. It is one of myy favorite parks in NYC.
A relaxing oasis. A lively but relaxing place. Lots of room, and places to sit throughout the park. Order a lemonade and enjoy it with the view of the beautiful Public Library!

Relaxing venue. This park is compared to Trafalgar Square or any Piazza in Italy. Seeing the fountain with statue and few street food stands are quite relaxing. Lots of chairs,tables and benches to place our shopping bags and sit down while waiting for tour bus pick up are very benefial. Lots of trees and plants with very clean public washroom.
Christmas market. Bryant Park was set up for a Christmas Market on our visit. Very good for unusual gifts. Good place to rest a while and people watch

lovely quiet park. Such a lovely quiet park to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. There were squirrels running about on the grass and it was funny to see the city girls changing from their high heels into their flatties

Midtown Gem. Lovely little park, with an ice rink, rows of small shops/stalls selling various goodies, seating area with stall selling hot chocolate and nibbles - and the only public loo's we encountered in the whole of NY and they were scrupulously clean! well worth a visit

A great place to stop and shop and eat and relax. There is plenty to do at Bryant Park. You can have a bit to eat in one of the restaurants; shop at the vendors, ice skate, watch movies, or sit back and people watch. A must stop if you are visiting NYC or have never been there.
Le carrousel. The park is very nice and clean. But the main attraction is the carrousel. My son loves it and I could ride with him with only one ticket.

Bryant Park Stroll. Our hotel was close to Bryant Park and we walked over every morning to enjoy a cup of coffee and croissant from vendors close by. The grounds are lovely with flowers everywhere and lots of places to sit and enjoy the outdoors. It was the perfect small park for people watching and just relaxing.

Great place to get away from the bustle of NYC. A great place to just unwind and sit down after touring NYC.
There a alot of tables and chairs set up around the park for this purpose. Also if you need to check your email or surf the net, there is wifi, and charging stations in the park also.

Oasis in the city. If you are in midtown for any reason, whether a tourist or if you work there, this is a place to visit. It is great during the spring, summer or fall for lunch or cocktails. Where else in the city can you go for a game of bocce ball? And in the winter, you have the Christmas market where you can do some last minute shopping for your office Secret Santa. It is a great place.
A hidden gem. Nice little place to sit and watch people for awhile when wandering around the City. The park was active but had plenty of seating and was immune to the noise of the busy street

Nice place to catch your breath. A cool and shady place to rest in the heart of the city. In the summer they show open air movies in the park on a Monday night which is quirky and fun to do.Quite close to the Empire State Building, it is quite simply somewhere nice to take 5.

Relax and enjoy. Great spot to relax and take in all the activities around you.There were outdoor movies, dancing and music while we were there and plenty of options for food and drinks.Great place to people watch and everybody was relaxed and friendly.
Great spot!. This is a great spot to have lunch and have an ice cream. They show movies in the summer and sometimes have venders. In the winter, they have an ice skating rink.

Bryant is right behind the NYC Public Library. Fashion Week is often held in tents - but for the rest of the year, Bryant Park offers tables and chairs to sit and watch people. There are coffee and snack stands available for snacks. Rest here a bit and plan your day or just rest and enjoy!

A must!. This park is a little gem that most often gets bypassed by tourists. The park has a lot of activities that can make a NYC experience more fulfilling. It is right next to the Public Library. Stop for some free music, readings and a nice coffee and snack from the Bakery Le Pain Quotidien.
Chillin in Bryant Park. What a great little spot to take a break from the pavement. Bars, food and lots of grass and shade - whats not to like???

great Park. A quiet and calm place in the middle of NY , close to Times squares and Broadway.
I would recommend to take a rest in that area before going back to the crowded areas !

A little oasis within then city with lots to do. If you're in the region visiting the NY library, do drop into the park for a wander around. It's very relaxing with lots of opportunities for people watching, e.g. People playing chess, table tennis, bocce etc. The park also holds free weekly events and shows so keep an eye out if you're around!

interesting. There is always something happening there for such a small place! Lots of seats to rest on then craft shops, food from everywhere in the world but it is an oasis in the mid
Dale of a mad city!!

Great park close to a lot of attractions. This park is next to the NYC public library . There are a lot of places to sit . You can rest , read and use your tablet with a free WIFI connection. There are also a few place to eat a round the park .

Lemon ice to cool the summer heat. Enjoyed a welcome rest in this leafy park where you can access free wifi, charge your devices, watch the world go by and have a coffee, beer or something of your own choosing. We selected a lemon ice to share - food van within the park on the Broadway side - beautifully refreshing!

Good place for a break. We like Bryant Park a lot, the atmosphere is just great. Tall trees which give shade in the summer heat, lots of chairs, music, games, little food stalls. When we were there the last time an open air film was aired at night and the atmosphere, with thousands of people sitting on and around the lawn on a warm summer night, was just fantastic. The perfect place to relax in the hustle and bustle of NYC.
The scene. Cool part of the city on the park.Stiff drinks amongst other things. LOLSometimes hard to get a drink, but welcome to NYC.
A green haven. A lovely green space right next to the Library. I'd love to go back in the winter when there's an ice rink there. In summer though it's a great place to eat lunch.

A spot for relaxation.. Only about ten minutes walk from Times Square this pretty little park is an oasis amongst the hustle and bustle of Manhattan.They show free outdoor films some nights. During the day people just sit around relaxing with a cold drink. There is also a restaurant on one corner that looked nice although we never got a chance to eat there.

Nice, but small and crowded. It is a nice park to walk through after visiting the NY Public Library, but it is small and there are a lot of people and things going on there. It's great to grab lunch with friends. If you're looking for quiet, this is not the park.
Great little park in the middle of it all. Take a break while walking in the City at Bryant Park. There are places to grab a bite, a cocktail, shop, people watch even ride the merry go round.

Bryant park a place to read a good book.. This was my second trip to NYC in the last 7 years. The parks in NYC are always a place I try and visit as soon as I arrive. They set the tone for the big city life and escape to a quite place to relax and re charge. Bryant park is the perfect spot to do that.

Nice neighborhood park. Grandkids and I loved just sitting and people watching. You can get something t eat and drink or bring your won and pull up a chair and enjoy. Very vibrant and felt perfectly safe with 11 year old and 7 year old with me.
Free options for entertainment. Such a great setting. They have book readings. Love that you can do something without having to spend any money.
A place to be close to the fashion life. This Park is a point positive to the tourist because here there is very good restaurant close the Park and here is possible to have a rest
Nice little park. Cute little park, free activities and things to do. Good place to just take a break when you are out and about in the area.

July 4th in NYC. My family and I visited Bryant Park in the evening as the sun was setting. Very nice time. The atmosphere is warm with the lights in the cafes glowing dim and there are several places to enjoy something to eat and drink while taking in the view. With all the trees it's very peaceful and removed from the loud business of times sq up the street. It's worth a visit.
Bryant Park. Neat and clean even though thousands of people visit. There is golden statue which everybody takes pics

summer time in the city. It used to be my lunch break spot.. You go in.. Find your chair or a bench.. You people watch.. You join a game of chess or ping pong.. Or you strike a conversation with a stranger or he will strike it with you.. Movie in the park? Why not! Coffee... Carousel... Perfect summer time park in the city...

Great place for luncj and watch people.. Went there for lunch on the outdoor patio. People coming and going and just sitting in the park watching the world go by this is one of those places. Not a big place but nice place to get way from a walk in Time Square to get your balance back.

pretty, pretty & fun!. Carousel was charming plus there were charismatic jugglers that fascinated our 10 year old and taught him the basics that he enjoyed so much, his mother thinks he might have given up his idea of becoming a dentist and will be running off to join the circus!

A must. Its a little, adorable park, just like an oasis in the middle of this great city. People all around offices goes to have lunch sitted over the grass, leaving behind its suit or high hills. its a New York City style park! And of course it has been in a lot of movies. Maybe its more valued for locals than tourist but its a jewel.Its a kind of Europe in the middle of Manhattan.

Monday's in Summer.... is outdoor movie night! Loved it -- and what a great setting! Organized and well staffed with attentive people actually doing their jobs! They open the public washrooms for women only - men have to use the porta-potty. Staff was directing men off the queue to the porta-potties and 3 female attendants kept the line moving and scouted the queue for pregnant women and women with small children. Very impressed.
One of NYC best parks. Outdoor library, ample seating, bar outside, dining on terrace, ping pong and of course New Yorkers. Sit at the crossroads of the world and enjoy the sights and sounds.

Fun. I love stopping here during the Christmas season. There are stalls set up and I can pick up a couple of Christmas gifts. The Ice Skating Rink is always a busy place during this time. They put up a great Christmas Tree also. There are also food stalls were you ca get hot chocolate or fried dough.

My Favourite Park in New York. Bryant Park is behind the Library and its situated between 5th Avenue and Times Square. It's a little bit of heaven and can be very tranquil, even if it's busy. They have a reading room outside under giant umbrella's in the Summer, so you can sit and read in allocated seats, even if the park is busy. There's a children's activity area with helpful staff to take the little ones for 1/2 an hour and a roundabout, or as the American's say a Carousel that looks like it's been lovingly restored. On a Sunday they close off 6th Avenue by the park, and have street venders and a little market selling lots of food and gifts not just aimed at the tourists, lots of American's were there too. The café in the park was a bit slow but the hot dogs, chips etc. were reasonably prices and good for a quick snack. All of the seats and bins were specially made for the park as they have Bryant Park stamped in to the wood, and when you think if you go to London and sit in one of the parks, you have to pay for the deck chairs there, these were free, and in a city that doesn't sit still, it's a nice place to just sit and take a breather.

Nice park in the middle of NYC. Has ice skating in winter, movie night in summer (check schedule), grass area, tables and chairs, strarbucks on premises, easy to get to via nyc subway, lots of shopping in the area.

Relax your feet for a few minutes!. Bryant Park is a lovely resting place in the midst of Manhattan. Flowers, benches, trees. We were able to sit and enjoy the greenery for a few minutes on one of our walking tours.
Park life. Bryant Park is great for it's free lunchtime events during the summer (and beyond) with a could of upmarket food stands and a backdrop of the Public Library - whats not to like!

A Refreshing Oasis. We enjoyed our stop off at Bryant Park, as part of our walking tour of Midtown New York. The park was the site of a Buddhist dance ceremony on the day we visited, with numerous Asian people participating, and wearing stunning national costumes. The public were encouraged to join in and it felt like an oasis of tolerance and mutual respect amongst different cultures. Chairs and tables were liberally sprinkled throughout, so there was no difficulty in finding a seat on a hot and humid Sunday. We were slightly disappointed that the library was closed as this was the purpose of our visit.
It's a Park. If you would like to catch your breath or give your feet a rest, this is the park for you. It also has a subway station right underneath it for easy access.
Always good to take break. Plenty of benches to sit for people watching, some food vendors still out, not much trash and people presence for security but not oppressive.
Chill Spot. So much going on here, even at odd hours of the night. Always felt safe too because of the visible police presence.

Best Park Ever. it has it all: a lawn, tables to play all sorts of games, a restaurant, a bar, a coffee, a caorusel, it's magic. Central Park is beautiful but vas. bryant Park is just paradise in a nutshell. And next to a library, what else is there to ask?

The charm of square. This is very close to the subway station so the access is easy . There a large number of charming shops , eateries spread out invitingly . There are mass yoga gathering if the yoga practioners . A must watch .

Fantastic pocket park in heart of city. I cannot believe I missed Bryant Park on previous visits to the city. I loved it so much I visited three times during my brief weekend visit. The reading room, ping pong tables, carousel, large green, and restaurant were all lovely. It is an urban park so there were some homeless people, including one slightly disturbed one. A must visit for bibliophiles.

A place to enjoy!. The NY Times book fair, a movie festival or a concert during a Summer evening, even just an ice cream or simply taking the time to read a book or the newspaper, it is a wonderful park to savor and enjoy. Very well kept, lots of flowers and trees...perfect place for a breather if you are around Midtown...

SLICE OF TUILLERIES IN MANHATTAN. Great park, well thought out.Very chic and comfortable with an ease to it. Love the carousel and Bryant pk grill. Don't like that Monday movies became impossible to find a space.

Come during the holidays. During the winter this beautiful little park is home to a free ice skating rink and a pop up village of one-of-a-kind give shops and eateries. During the warmer months the fountain and the Monday night movies are pretty charming too!
Small but interesting and relaxing.. We enjoyed Bryant Park Grill for lunch and drinks. The parkis beautifully decorated with a large Christmas tree duringthe winter season.

Bryant Park - a good place to relax and regain your energy. This Park is beautifully located at between 41st and 42nd Street between 5th and 6th Avenues. It is right behind the main NY Public Library (the one with the Lions in front) located at 5th Avenue. It has sitting areas around a pleasant green lawn in the middle. There's a merry-go-round for children, and food kiosks to get a light meal and sit on the closely located patio to eat and people watch. There are also several food establishments on 43rd Street adjacent to the Park. It's a lovely place to come to sit down, have something light to eat, and rejuvenate if you have been up and about. Also, a visit to the NY Public Library is always a pleasant experience. They have free guided tours at different times of the day. There are also special exhibitions at the Library at certain times of the year. The park also has clean and pleasant restrooms on the 42nd street side. There is a very nice sit down restaurant adjacent to the back of the Library.

Great for a lunchtime picnic or a summer meeting with friends. Bryant Park is a wonderful oasis for visitors and residents of New York. There is a real Carousel. There are concerts and Broadway performances. There are Monday night movies for 5,000 plus people who sit on the lawn to watch. And there are two restaurants and two bars that are packed on Thursday and Friday nights during the summer. They also have juggling, and ping pong, and a reading area (with books), a game area, chess, and that bocci type game whose name I forget. All sorts of entertainment, and FREE! Of course, the winter skating rink is beautiful. It's a great place to meet friends or to take visitors. All in all, a wonderful jewel of New York City.

My favourite NYC park. I love Bryant Park with its village green and lovely green chairs. A place of some respite from the noise and hub bub of a wonderful city. We took our lunch and enjoyed the atmosphere. Very easy to do. Close to everything but a great green space.
Coffee in the park. Spent a couple hours just enjoying the park with our coffee and donuts feeding the birds that joined us for our coffee break

I love this park. Small but beautiful and cosy place in the heart of Manhattan. Just next to the New York public library. Go there just to watch New Yorkers, or eat lunch in the sun, or have a coffee break while sightseeing.

What a park!!. This is an amazing park with so much to see in a relatively small space. Reading areas for kids with books............adult chess games set up on tables for adults to play.......juggling...........ping pong..........adult reading areas............ I have never seen anything quite like it with so many activities free of charge for the public. If in Manhattan, it is worth the time just to see all that goes on in this park.

Great in the Winter. Bryant Park is especially fun in November and December when the market stalls are open. There's such a wide variety of shops, from clothes to homemade crafts and decor, jewelry, everything! There's also ice skating, hot chocolate, snack stalls. It's beautifully decorated and lots of fun.

Christmas Market. Bryant Park is very small but they do have a small Christmas market during the holidays near the ice rink that's fun to walk through and browse. Bryant park is also close to other landmarks like the NY Public Library which is fun to buzz through as well
Great Spot. to readto restto grab a biteto meet with peopleto make a pause in the dayto enjoy a slow Monday with a movie at the park....

Never a dull moment. Giant yoga classes, dance ensembles, jugglers, carousels. From dawn to dusk there is so much to watch in this little bit of green tucked behind the Library. Grab coffee and a little table and just people watch. Fabulous!

Favorite Place to Spend the Morning in NYC. Favorite place to spend the morning with coffee and danish and reading material. Wonderful way to start the day. Great location. Beautiful landscaping and shady sitting areas plus the Reading Room, ping pong, petanque, and best of all, people watching. Kids area too. Subway stop right on the corner too. Lots of nearby food choices to pick up and eat in the park.

Ladies Who Do Lunch.. Visited this park with my sister on our last day in New York, brought some sandwiches and drinks and just sat there in the amazing sunshine, and it was so beautiful just people watching :)

Wonderland at Christmas time. We truly experienced the ultimate Christmas atmosphere here watching the skaters, snacking on piping hot crepes, sipping hot chocolates and browsing the lovely market stalls under fairy lights. Not to be missed as part of an NYC Christmas visit.
Our favourite spot.. Pretty little park in midtown Manhatten. Has a European feel. Lovely spot to site and relax, eat lunch or sit for a coffee. We also went at night and it felt very safe.

Nice green spot in central New York. I always like to visit Bryan Park either just to sit down and relax or the have a refreshment in a bar or restaurant. The place is always vibrant and at the same time cosy.
Delightful place to shop. During holiday time this place was so much fun to watch skaters and do shopping . From Christmas ornaments to doggie gifts lots to choose from and eats too!

Twinkling Trees at Dusk. It was by pure accident I came to Bryant Park one evening. I hadn't planned for it during my trip but a friend suggested we go here to relax and talk. Normally when one thinks about Bryant Park, visions of high fashion, couture, and industry experts come to mind. I originally imagined steel and concrete. My experience was much more romantic to my delight. Bryant Park is a quiet, lovely little square. A thicket of towering trees imbued with soft lights surround the area with chairs for you and your friend to talk about life. In the busy, hub bub of the city, Bryant Park is such an unexpected, lovely reprieve. What a little treasure and an absolute treat. I recommend going on summer's even before dusk so you can catch the twinkle in the trees against the background of a velvet sunset sky.

Expansive Green Belt. If you watch Project Runway you need to see this area! Had to see where the stage would be set up, etc. When we visited the park, a Target event was happening and it was fun to watch and observe.
Movie in Bryant Park. Evening open air movie in Bryant ParkGreat idea for a warm summer eveningPark was packed out with people on the lawn with picnics or at the bistro tables with take away food

Winter Wonderland. Great visit to the ice rink with huge tree and decorations plus lots of little shops to browse in. Had hot chocolate while we watched the skaters and caught a glimpse of Beyonce....and we thought the crowds were there to see us....

Done right!. Every detail has been obsessed over and the visitor is the winner. Stop by for a visual treatise on how to do an urban park ~ or just stop by because it's enjoyable, right down to the bouquets of fresh flowers in the immaculate restrooms.

Stop and let the city melt away for a few minutes!. Tables, chairs, grass, wifi, charging stations, and a cafe. What more do you need in the middle of Manhattan??
Picturesque and relaxing. Sometimes they have concerts and movies...check the website or a NYC site.
Great place to rest, stretch, or leave the office midday for some air and laptop work.

Pretty Little Park!. A very nice little park to wander around, sit and relax, read or just people watch. There is a restaurant and also an outdoor bar if you want to enjoy a cocktail during the Summer. Great place!

Nice little park. This park seems to be a favorite of the locals and was heavily and happily used all weekend while I was in town. It is too small to offer a respite from the noise and crowding of the city, as is Central Park, but pretty and pleasant nevertheless. Not a destination in and of itself, but a nice place to stroll or eat a picnic lunch if staying in the area.

Free activities for the family. It was like an oasis in the big city! We enjoyed a free concert by a talented pianist while relaxing in the park. The kids enjoyed the game tent. There was a cart loaded with board games. You just picked one, found a table and enjoyed family time playing games on a nice sunny day. Art carts were set up with crayons, markers and supplies to create a make and take art project. An instructor did a nice class and the kids interacted with lots of young artists. a great FREE day in the park!

Very nice!. Got lost there on my way to Times Square when I arrived to NYC by bus. I thought it was a very nice spot. It was lunch time and many office workers were relaxing with their sandwhich under a tree. nice nice nice

Fresh Air in mid-Town. The place is certainly busy. However, with a bit of practice, you can find a quiet corner to read or simply watch the crowds pass by. It is good for the lungs and good for simply an escape. The complete opposite of nearby Times Square.
Nice little oasis in the city. We walked thru Bryant Park several times. It was a nice diversion from concrete and crowds, but nothing too special as far as parks go.

Well shaded area to take a break while touring Manhattan.. This park was very busy no matter what time of day we went by it. The do have movies in the evenings during the summer months although we did not attend assuming it would be to crowded. Very shady area to take a break after a long day of touring and easily accessible by subway.

Lovely park to chill out in after a trip to the library. We had a look around Bryant park after going to the library which Is also well wort a visit.beautiful building, feels like you have been there before because it is on so many films.

Relax in busy New York City. What a pleasure to have a coffee, sit under the shady trees, watching the petanque players or garden and fountain with all the hustle and bustle of the city out of your way!

Relax in the big city. this is such a peaceful park right in the middle of town, and the food at the Grill cafe is brilliant, the fact that we were remembered by the staff when we returned, made us feel special too.

An oasis in the middle of chaos. Bryant Park has so much to offer its hard to know where to begin. Fist of all it is located right in the middle of Manhattans hustle and bustle . It is located between 40th and 42nd Streets and 5th and 6th Avenues. There are many events that take place in the park, The best way to know what's going on is to Google the calendar of events. There is a large lawn area for catching some sun. there are chairs and small tables for eating and or just sitting in the park. There is a giant Carousel, several restaurants, a chess area, ping pong area. There are restrooms which I must say are kept very clean.

Feels like Paris!. This is a lovely park in which to people watch. There are events, like movies and dance performances in the evening on the lawn area in the center. Check the schedule, bring a blanket or sit around the edge and feel like you are in Paris (only better).
Chill out in Bryant Park. We traveled here in April, taking advantage of the start of spring. There is the library next door to the park.

Cute and fun atmosphere. We loved Bryant Park. It was around the corner from our hotel and it is a fun and interesting place to have breakfast or just hang out for a while to get away from the hustle of the city.

Great Park to relax after a day of sightseeing .... Great Park to relax after a day of sightseeing ... Open Air movies on the weekend, nice cafes around ... sit down and enjoy the quietness in the dawn ...

great place to stop, rest feet, and people watch. We had an early dinner at the Bryant Park Café. The location is lovely, providing it's nice enough to eat outside. Food was good, and was served quickly. Definitely more expensive that what you'd find outside NYC in the suburbs, but, it's NYC. There is a very busy and large bar at this Café which looked like lots of local people were headed there right after work.

Good location, nice to sit and watch. Good location, nice to sit and watch, grab a coffee and a pastrami sandwich and watch New Yorkers and tourists pass by, often have street fairs for you to see there, sometimes ice skating as well.
Great park to sit, relax and people watch. This is a lovely park in Midtown which is a great stopping place to eat your lunch, chill out and watch the passing parade
love this place. One of my favourite parks in New York. Even better in winter! The ice skating rink is there and all the "Pop up holiday shops" just a great place to sit and people watch!
Tranquility in a busy city. Brilliant, I loved our pitstop in the park. We visited at night as well as during the day and it felt safe. A little oasis of calm in the big bustling city.

Nice relaxing place in the middle of a big city. Bryant park was a welcome haven right outside of times square. nice benches, tables with umbrellas, a restaurant, entertainment at times, & ofcourse the little carts that you can buy hotdogs or drinks. Nice place for couples or families or even to sit alone.

Bryant Park is the place to be!. I love Bryant Park! It is so relaxing. Love to sit under a shady tree, people watch, have a cool drink, watch families enjoying themselves with their children. It's wonderful!

Great City Park. We walked through Bryant Park last November to watch the ice skating and to look at the little boutique-like shops that surround the park. Bryant Park is a fun place to spend an hour or so shopping, eating something from one of the many vendors, or just enjoying the atmosphere of this little park in the center of the city.

amazing! .. free!. Right behind the library... so much to offer.. to watch or just
enjoy a coffee and watch all the action around you!
Nice. The park was a very short distant from our hotel. It was a nice place to seat and chat and nibble on a light snack. Great place to people watch!

Quite Pretty. It's quite pretty.
There are a number of places to get a bite to eat.
The grass was all cordoned off when I went there last week.
It is adjacent to the NYC main public library (where they filmed Ghostbusters) and I would definitely recommend checking out the library.

Quaint neighborhood park where the locals hang out. Visiting New York can be overwhelming. We loved Bryant Park, next to the New York Public Library (gotta go inside and upstairs to the Rotunda). The park is a quiet respite with ping pong tables, snacks, places to sit and read. There was a book reading being set up for the afternoon, if only we could have stayed. On the immediate corner is Waffles and Dinges, get a Liege waffle and coffee and enjoy. I think I loved this experience the best - as a tourist, I felt like I had a small taste of New York life.

Must see after visiting NYC Public Library. Nice park with free summer movies Sunday and Monday Nights and plenty of free events. Perfect place to grab lunch and just sit and relax. Free WIFI is available also.

Nice little park. What a nice oasis in a concrete jungle! Grab a chair, a coffee and watch the world go by. Highly recommended if you need to stop amongs't the hustle and bustle and rest a bit. Has washrooms at the North end and is right behind the New York public library. Another "must see" while in NY.

An oasis in Midtown!. We stayed at the Bryant Park Hotel which looks down on the Park and spent nearly every morning down here having breakfast and almost every afternoon chilling out, playing a game or generally watching the world go by.Sandwiched between 5th and 6th and off 40th West, Bryant Park is just off the end of the main shopping on 5th, just around the corner from Times and Grand Central so it's a great place to end up if say you've started shopping at the top of 5th and 59th and need a place to relax afterwards.Check out the calendar of events, they're usually early morning, like tai-chi and yoga classes but aside from that they have a number of all day activities that you can get involved with that are "managed" by park employees, e.g. a board games area, ping-pong, boules, kuub and a small putting green.Plenty of kiosks for coffee, lemonade that sort of thing in the park and plenty of seating. Just off the park you have a PAX and an Le Pain Quotidian, Maison Keyser and Chipotle for food or the Bryant Park Brasserie itself for a more substantial sit down meal.If you're planning on attending the HBO summer cinema season on Monday, get there early.....!All in all, worth a visit and if you're staying in the area, a great escape from the hustle and bustle!
Pleasant outside dining. One of the most pleasant place in midtown, with good food, and normal service. Recommended for hot summer evenings

Yum, waffles and dinges make this worth visiting alone.. A beautiful park with lovely eating areas and greenery. Loved the summer in the park movies and market areas. Waffles and Dinges are a most stop for delicious NYC eating. My mouth waters just thinking of the delicious World Fair waffle I ate here with strawberries and cream. Amazinnngggg.

Broadway at Lunch in the Park. We were late. We meant to get to Bryant Park an hour earlier to find a spot to sit to watch one of part of the yearly Broadway for Lunch series. We were travelling with our two kids, 4 and 6 and were too late to find a place to sit. The kids tried standing on the small curb/planter edges to see but were told to get off. (understandable, but worth noting) We didn't end up staying long but visited the park again and it is lovely. A carousel, the reading area, the people watching. They often have interesting events so check their web site.

Take a break in Bryant Park. Great spot to sit and relax for a while. Escape the surrounding hustle and bustle by bringing a book and grabbing one or two of the chairs provided in the lovely park. If you are there on Sunday you might catch a few people playing bocce!

Beautiful Park. This is a lovely park that offers many options to sit and eat or drink. They also offer movies in the park during the summer. The large trees are a nice change from the busy city surrounding the park.

Nice walk with great music. Hard to believe you are in the heart of New York City... Such a beautiful and peaceful park. Just walk around bring a lunch sit and enjoy the beautiful trees and freshness coming from the surrounding. If you are lucky catch a concert... Highly recommend fro a early night snack or just chill after a long day.

Great midtown spot to sit and have coffee. Lovely park sharing the block with the New York Public Library. Summer flowers are outstanding, many tables and chairs available, interesting people watching. We purchased our coffee each morning (several coffee shops on 42nd at the park) and sat in park.

Beautiful Bryant Park!. Beautiful park that provides a quiet respite from the busy city. There are tables and chairs placed all around the park. We enjoyed getting something to eat from the food vendors there & eating in the park. Then we played ping pong--what a fun & unexpected activity in the middle of NYC! We made a point to stop by here several times; it's one of our favorite NYC spots!
Movie night. Wish we would have arrived a little sooner for the Monday night movie screening. We zipped over to Grand Central for a view and by the time we returned the park was packed.
Great place to hang out with friends. Loved visiting Bryant Park. Had lunch and drinks at the outdoor cafe and was very pleasant. Would definitely go back.

Great Park!. I really like this park, the way it's setup, the architecture and the location, simply perfect.
It's usually crowded but still able to find a place to sit.
Bryant Park. This is a small, but very nice park. They offer movies in the summer, several exercise activities. It is very picturesque right in the middle of the city.

Loved it!. Wow, first time here this past weekend. So much to see and do. Game area, chess area, reading area, rechargable phone area, food, bar, restaurants, juggling, and certain days concerts. All under the trees out of sun. Will be back!

must visit. love this park so well kept and lots of places to sit and relax with a drink from one of the many venders! lots of things going on from free movies to bingo! just so nice to see some green in the city!

Beautiful small park inthe middle of the city. It is a very nice little park to relax, to have your food. There are table and chairs for people to use. It is nice to buy your food at a take out and ocme and sit here to eat and relax.then continue your day.
Small & perfectly formed. We love this small space in New York. We,ve had our breakfast there.Lunch, tea,& dinner.We've listened to music, danced, & watched movies in this park.
Great to people watch. Lovely park to take in the atmosphere and people watch. Drinks and snacks are on hand, but a lovely place to relax after shopping and sight seeing.

Buzzing but quiet spot in New York. Only found this location on our last day in New York, so I recommend an early visit.
Loads of things going on during the week, or sit and relax and watch the world go by.

beatiful at christmas. walked around the park on a winter evening
had never been there and if we had gotten there sooner would have had time to ice skate
there were lots of venders for the holiday season and it was very nice
A nice break in the city. It was a very nice and cheerful event, in the middle of cold weather many people used the skaiting arena, and strol through the Stands.
God place to relax. Plenty of mingling and socializing... There was even an impromptu classic car show right at the park.
Peaceful. Love this park. Great chocolate croissants on the corner :) There are always activities in the park including yoga. Wonderful restaurants. Overall great environment

Quiet place in the city. I love Bryant Park, it's not too big but still, big enough. Lots of places to sit, nice restaurant, films screening at night, carrousel for the kids, drinks... It's the perfect oasis when you need a break.

Nice spot for a respite. In what was years ago a place to cop dime bags of weed and trip over drunks and junkies, is now a lovely pocket park (alhough it's quite large pocket. There are usually events of some sort, from the dance performance we saw yesterday to ice skating in the winter.

Has Changed A Little, But Still Nice. Was recently in Bryant Park and found out it changed a little since my last trek there. There is plenty to do: the carousel, places to eat, a reading room, and board games. In the winter there is the ice rink, which is free to skate (small fee for skate rental). Was disappointed to find out that Celsius, the restaurant that was there in the winter, is no longer there. It was unique, and sad it is no longer there. Bryant Park is not a huge park, like Central or Flushing Meadows, but it is a nice respite, if not crowded at times.

the place to meet. this is a nice place you cant eat there is plany of restaurant near by theres bathroom clean ones lol you are just behind the new York public Library if you want to give a place to meet this is the place

My favourite place for a quick bite. Such a beautiful park located midtown next to the public library.Great for having lunch or a coffee and reading a book or catching up with a friend. Really enjoyed the vibe and bustle of the crowds but there always seemed to be a seat to find.
Loveliest park in New York. This park has good food, a reading room, games such as chess, a movie screen and places to sit and picnic. Very friendly atmosphere.
Chill day . Bryant park is a lovely space to have some down time whilst being in the bustle of New York. Lots of green space, places to sit and nice views.

Great find.. We were lucky to find this beautiful park tucked away behind the NY Library. We sat in the sun having coffee & cake whilst watching some men play bocce. We didn't have a need to use the public toilets but we discovered subsequently that they are probably the best in NY. Not only are they reported to be spotless but are complete with classical music and daily fresh flowers.
A nice park for a wander. This is a nice place for a walk in summer. Lots of people were sitting on the grass and enjoying the sun. There are ducks in the pond there.

Bryant Park A Must Visit. Such a beautiful place to take some rest after walking for some time nearby areas. I just got out of the metro station (6th ave &40 st) and there it is. People are reading, eating, drinking, working, taking rest, discussing, generally enjoying life. everything is available there. A must visit place.

Love this little New York Gem. We all hear about Central Park but this little oasis smack in the middle of 42nd St on the way to Times Square is easily accessible, diverse and great for people watching.The park has many little "precincts" highlighting particular interests such as table tennis, bocce, board games, free outdoor reading room, cafes, restaurants, street food, activity lawn with a concert setting up when we were there and so on. And its right nect dior to the library. Thats a lot going on in a small park but the numerous benches and countless little tables and chairs provided by the city give it a quite enchanting, European feel. It has become one of my favourite spots in NY so do yourself a favour and allow yourself 1/2 an hour to chill out and just watch the city go bye.

Fashion. This is where the who's who of fashion participates in the yearly fashion show showing the latest in fashion to the world. Tents are set up and catwalks have the latest in fashion shown off by the world's top models. If you can get in you'll be amazed.
Pleasent place to relax.. We stopped here to get some shade in the midday heat.Plenty of trees to keep cool under and in the evening you could watch a film.

Nice place to grab a coffee, watch a performance and relax. On our way to Times Square we stumbled upon this nice little park. Free seating for all, free dance performance just starting and lot's of people and things to watch as they stroll by... Good views of the Empire State Building...
hidden gem. this is a park we needed to visit we relaxed in the atmosphere entertainment all around clean and tidy ,what a place to see in the heart of new york.
Beautiful park. Bryant Park is a beautiful Park in the spring and summer time and a fun place to visit over the Holidays!
Beautiful Christmas Tree. Very crowded due to the Christmas shops and ice skating ring ... but still a nice place to visit while in the city
People Watching at this Small park. This is a nice little park for people watching. It is surrounded by high buildings, right behind the NYC library.

A little green in the city. Passed here on a night tour bus to see it full of people laying on the grass watching Ghostbusters!! They have films on a lot over the summer and some concerts and entertainers. Went back a couple of times around lunchtime and sat and people watched. Workers take their lunch there and chill.
Excellent Free Events. Check out the park calendar to find excellent free events like films and Broadway performances. Some food options are available but I was never tempted to spend the money.
Love this place!. Lovely oasis of green in the middle of busy midtown. The restaurant and cafe don't open until late in the morning so don't go expecting to eat breakfast!

Nice peaceful place to sit.. This park is lovely and offers a nice place to sit and rest after walking so much in getting around the city. It felt like a very safe place to just enjoy watching the city go buy.
Very pretty behind The public library. Beautiful flowers and fountain. Chairs all around to sit. Lovely green space. Food trucks also there. Loved seeing chess being played in the park

Best public bathroom. Enjoy some quiet time to take a little rest as you travel around NYC. While you are at the park, stop into the NYC Public Library. It is a magnificent building to behold. Downstairs, you can visit the children's section and see the original stuffed animals from the Winnie the Pooh collection. Before you start back on your way, make sure to stop in to use the bathroom in Bryant Park. It has a reputation as being the best public bathroom in all of Manhattan. Even if there is a line, it is worth the wait to enjoy the fresh flowers inside.
Lovely. We love Bryant Park, especially in winter! The ice skating rink isn't over-run with tourists and they have the little boutique throughout during the Holidays. Just magical!

Beautiful park in the middle of the City with so much to do. This is a spectacular park in the middle of midtown Manhattan. There are plenty of places to sit, including tables and benches. The park is clean. There are games you can plan (even board games are loaned out), chess games, places to just sit and relax, restaurants, lemonade stands, coffee, and more. Gorgeous park. There is also a carousel. The NYC Public library is around the corner as well. GREAT location. Clean and fun!
Relaxing. It's a good place to relax and take a break, have lunch or just sit in the sun. During winter time it has an ice skating rink and is very popular.

Very pretty. I stayed at the Bryant Park Hotel and my room overlooked this beautiful park. When we were there it was set up for a 9/11 memorial as it was the 10th anniversary. Nice little café on site as well
Bryant park. Xmas fayre was good but not great, lovely xmas tree.The ice rink was cool no pun intended, go during the week less crowds.

In The Middle Of It All. This park is in the middle of the Theatre District and a very nice diversion from the street chaos. Although you'll find many locals and tourists here, especially in summer, it's still an ideal place to chill out in the shade and drink a cold beverage while on break from the concrete jungle.
Fantastic time. We experienced an outdoor concert where a lot of people were dancing to the wonderful sounds of a live salsa band. We had to sit down and enjoy the experience for a few hours.

Festive Holiday Vibe - Pretty. Visit the Holiday Market and a plethora of restaurants lining this beautiful little park. Don't miss hanging out in the reading room at the NYC library next door. Wonderful afternoon outing on a wintry day in December.
Great Fountain. Nice place to sit and soak up the surroundings. In the winter there are many little set up shops. Though they would have that in June as well.

Lunch in Bryant Park. There were several lunch choices in and around the Park. Lots of tables and we had a glorious day, June 29th.
Great subway access. Fun to watch or learn the local bocci ball-like game played in the park.
An oasis in the city. This park has so much going on with shops and vendors and of course, the Bryant Park Grill. All dining options and some great fun.

Hanging Out. Never without a great view. People watch, be entertained, Bryant Park is a crowded place that always seems to have an empty chair in which to sit. The homeless sleep, look for food, watch the children play and the street musicians perform. There is always food, though it is less expensive across the street than in the park. A great place to have lunch on a nice Manhattan day.

one of NYC most beautiful public spaces. Whether you're headed to Bryant Park on purpose, or you stumble upon it by accident, you will (most likely) be amazed by the beauty and the sense of welcoming community at this mid-city park. You might practice yoga with 100 new friends or watch a free movie, or if it's winter, grab hot chocolate and some ice skates. Bryant Park is one of those places that would make even a non-city lover love NYC.

Nice place to sit and enjoy some greenery right in the heart of NY.. Nice park right in the heart of the NY. I visited in summer and it is a nice place to sit around and enjoy the weather. This is well maintained and well-lit so it is secure. There are enough chairs to sit and also is pet friendly. This is well connected with the subway stations

Wonderful all seasons of the year. Always something happening in Bryant Park and the events change with the seasons. What's nice is that you can spend little or much time in the park and it is free of charge

A place where you can feel at peace.. I don't know what it is with this place, but whenever I go I feel at peace. Is not that different from any other park, it's just in the middle of the city, just behind Times Sq., and it isn't even a big place. But it's packed of people from the city that go there to have lunch in the middle of their work day, and you can lie down there, simply looking at people or taking a nap on the grass, or sitting in one of the tables that are around.
Beautiful !. Little park in the middle of the very busy part of Manhattan - great for a rest - well maintained and one can visit the NY Library at the same time

Year round excellence. Winter or summer the place is great. Have taken grandson Skating in freezing temps, have ridden carousel with him in summer, have sipped a beer with family in autumn, and have never had a bad experience here. Probably because the NY Library is right there. The library is one of the best places on earth so please try it too.

Very nice!. This is a very nice place to go during the day as it has such a great atmosphere. Perfect for a quick meal after you leave the Library. I had a very pleasant surprise one evening when George Gee and his band were playing some very good quality Jazz. Recommend it!

NYC at it's best. this is a must! for anyone visiting nYC in the summer, winter or spring Bryant Park is a great place for people watching, to listen to music or just stroll at your leisure. The spring and summer are the best times to go here. There are great restaurants and places to have coffee and enjoy the outdoors NYC style.

The Place Where Memories are Created!. Christmas in New York is amazing, and Bryant Park is a must! Beautifully decorated Christmas tree, ice skating rink, and numerous shops where you can buy personalized Christmas ornaments. New York at its best!
Heaven admist the turmoil. Beautiful, but very busy park. New Yorkers love to have lunch here on those beautiful New York afternoons.

Christmas time is the best time here. Bryant park is a lovely park but not really worth a special trip except at Christmas time when vendors set up stalls throughout the park with everything from crafts to gourmet hot chocolate. There is also a skating rink in the center.

"Gem in the concrete and metal wilderness". My daughter and I were in NYC for a visit and kept driving by this little green space. Every time we drove by, people were congregating and seemed to be having a good time, so when we had some free time one afternoon, we walked from Rockefeller Plaza to this park and we were not disappointed! First we stopped at the little kiosk that sold ice cream and other yummy goodies. The kind lady at the kiosk recommended the Spekuloos ice cream because it made her happy each time she ate it. I will vouce that it brought nothing but happiness. With ice cream in hand we sat by the fountain to enjoy our sweet treat. After that we continued around the perimeter of the park and enjoyed watching a heated chess match in the midst. There was also a birthday party at the carousel and many people were enjoying the green space and the sun. It truly was a highlight of our trip to the city and it is a place I will return.

Tranquility Amidst The Hustle and Bustle. This park is a perfect spot to take a coffee and some, read over your city maps and totally relax while setting out for your next destination. Tall trees, bountiful cafe tables and chairs. I always feel rejuvenated after a rest here. The big open lawn invites the public to sit down but only when open for a concert which is listed on a sign. The public restroom is on the NE side and has classical music playing, large real floral arrangement and toilet seats covers that rotate with the push of a button. First class and clean!

An Oasis on 42nd street. What a beautiful job the businesses and the City did in creating this oasis next to the New York Public Libraryt. Summer movies. Summer music dancing. Wintert Ice skating. Great food vendors. A French classic carasoul. My only complaint is that this surface sucks for outdoor dancing in the summer.
Ice skating. I went ice skating in the Bryant park and it was pretty cool.I also took some awesome pictures with the frozen fountain on this specially cold winter

Beautiful at Christmas. We stayed not far from the park and it was well worth the walk! They have little shoppes that spring up during the holidays where you can get beautiful haandcrafted items. We picked up unique ornaments for our Christmas tree!
Local NY feeling. We stayed next to it, nice place to relax and see how the locals do it, you can lay on the grass or take some lunch to a table or have a beverage..

Recharging point. Peaceful oasis near the Library. There are plenty of seats to sit and recover from the hectic pace of NYC. An unusual addition is the area with free books and papers to peruse while you enjoy a coffee and snack from the kiosks.
Visit and Picnic!. So lovely, so lively yet calm. I love grabbing a bit from a local place and eating in Bryant Park. In the summer - enjoy the lawn - in the winter - enjoy the tables and chairs.

The cosy park. While central park is the big sister, this small park has great accessibility with close by restaurants, the public library, lord and taylor mall and a fabulous cafe/ restaurant inside it ( the one right behind the library facing bryant hotel- called the Grill)Strongly recommend to get Eric Keyser viennoiserie facing it and enjoy a great moment. A nice carrousel for kids
Cleanest bathroom in NYC. Seems like a funny thing to say, and of course the park itself is beautiful as is the public library, but when you're looking for a bathroom, this is the place to go =)

A little green jem. Accidently stumbled on this one walking toward the Chrysler building. Charming spot, great canopy. Really architecturally interesting black building (some hotel) right to the south. Neat park all around.
Bryant park. lovely little park in the middle of Manhattan, great place to stop and have lunch, closed at night though so no moonlight walks here

Best Park in NYC. We really enjoyed this park during our stay in NYC this summer. The best thing is its location as its only a 5-10 minute walk from Times Square so we were often just walking past. There are a few choices for drinks either at the outside bar (part of Bryant Grill) or one of the numerous coffee outlets surrounding the park. A great place to grab a seat and people watch and sit in the sun for a while. Superb.
Festivals!. We always seem to stumble upon one festival or another that is happening in Bryant Park! Last time it was a French festival with awesome food!

Beautiful Park. Bryant Park is one of my favourite places in New York. It's a lovely place to sit a rest away from the bustle of the city. there's plenty of tables and chairs, and also ping pong tables and small cafes, a library etc. There's always something going on - open air cinema, Shakespeare in the Park etc, but it also manages to maintain its peacefulness no matter how busy it gets.Toilets were also clean.
Bryant park. Both in winter or Summer, on very nice spot to hang around and seat down for a while before going back to 5th.

Bryant park after dark. Stumbled on this and was pleasantly surprised. Hub of activity after dark. Very inviting. P,aves to eat or just sit and relax and enjoy the atmosphere. Hear it is good for breakfast too
Always fun!. Bryant Park is always fun but learned that they do not have the booths/shops during the summer months.....only during November and December. Still worth a visit.

taste of Bryant park. lots of pop-up restaurant tent things selling beer and sample plates of tacos, thai food, bbq, sandwiches it was really nice, plus there was seating, very cool to stroll through and choose a few different things without having to get a table at a restaurant

we love this park. It is prefect small oasis in a busy part of town.Great for people watching.When in New York for Christmas it was home to great crowded chistmas markets and ice skating, now in summer it has perfectly manicured lawn and people relaxing in the sun.We were having a drink as the 5 pm scramble for a good spot on the lawn for the 9pm Monday night movie in the park unfolded in front of us. We came down at night for a tree framed view of a lit up Empire State Building. All Very nice
Paris in NYC. Quiet and calm French inspired park in the middle of one of the busiest cities on earth. It's such a peaceful respite -- possibly my favorite part of NYC.
Lovely Park. Great place to sit & have lunch or take in the sights. In the summer they have Monday night moves, where the play old classics. If your luck you can also logon to the free wifi

Beautiful setting. Really enjoyed Byrant Park. It's so vibrant with loads of things to do such as watch Shakespeare in the park for free, read a book from the book library, play checkers/ chess on one of the tables.Such a lovely place to have a picnic
Good walkabout. This was close to our hotel so we walked through. It was packed out with people everywhere! If you visit, I would make it a day trip. This place would be scary at night.

People watching paradise.... There is so much activity around this park it's easy to get caught up in the people watching.. Great grassy areas, quiet (relatively speaking) areas and everyone from children to the elderly enjoying this midtown oasis. An easy walk to everything NYC has to offer.
A small park. My wife and I visited this small park, after visiting the State Library. Compared against Central Park, it pales into insignificance.

Great little oasis. A lovely spot by the library. Free wifi and plenty of seats. There's a coffee kiosk, obviously. There's usually plenty going on here, so it's great to rest your legs for a while and watch New York!
The Best. Small but very very well planned out. There are organized events such as boot camp, performances, bocci ball or you can just sit and enjoy a coffee at a table in a private little nook.
Beautil Park in the City. This is a really nice park right near Times Square. It is a beautiful park. Be prepared for how crowded it can get

Gorgeous spot to rest and have a coffee. Bryant Park is an example of how New York has made its parks open, clean, safe, and a wonder respite from all the busy of New York City. Stop in, grab a coffee, find a table and enjoy.
Seasonal. A nice place to visit as full of small seasonal stalls filled with Christmas goodies and local produce A beautiful tree an ice skating.

Lovely and lively. Play board games, eat your lunch, relax on the grass, pull up a chair.. Anything in this lovely park.. It was a real pleasure to spend time here in the middle of the hustle and bustle of New York

Great park!. Been there one morning in June 2015 with my wife
It's very nice and quiet, we had a picnic there.. all is green and time stands still there.
It's a nice getaway from the fast going, never stopping New York streets.
I highly recommend you visit it , even just for a few minutes - You'll love it!

Very pleasant. Very nice park,especially on a sunny day. Managed to get a seat and refreshments available nearby.grass area not in use during my visit so would hopefully be even less crowded when back in use

Beautiful and fun!. Looks busy, but seems like a nice place to eat a quick bite. There are some ping pong tables and a few food choices around the outside. Just a nice city escape, if only for a few minutes.

Huge, happening place. Huge park with a stage and lots of seats. On a nice day, lots of people are out, sitting out on the lawn. We went to the bar on one corner of the park, it was easy to get drinks and easy to hear each other talking.

Pleasure Park, confortable, restaurant/cafe. Tehre are a restaurant outside (Grill). You can seat, rest after walking 5th avenue. It is little calm but lot of energy (water fountain, benches, kids playing, trees, flowers, birds. You can enjoy reading and take snack. I love this place
Christmas Village Treat. Quaint shops, most featured local products, enjoyed being so close to watch the ice skaters unlike at Rockefeller Center.
nothing special!. short visit, didn't find attractive and clean, don't bother to visit there instead go to central park, it's beautiful :)

brillia parknt. what a lovely space in the summer weather. lots of people relaxing enjoying the sunshine watching the world go by. a assive contrast to my last visit in the winter with its ice rink. on this visit outdoor movie screenings - not to be missed

Favorite spot in the city. We've been here twice at Christmas and its a great stop. Lots of little shops with food and gifts. Watch the ice skaters in a setting we enjoy more than Rockefeller Plaza. More of a true park in the spring. Just a nice little oasis in mid-town.

Great Retreat in Manhatten. Bryant Park was a delightful surprise on our walk in New York. The park is nicely laid out and there are lots of tables and chairs. The weather was warm but the large trees provided shade and a mild breeze make it very pleasant. I admire the philanthropic effort to provide such a public benefit in a city like New York.

Need more of these in NYC!. Bad news: small and super crowded/popular. Lawn is often closed to understandably handle crowds. Good news: giant lawn, tons of cafe chairs, perfect place to get away. Great trees, can easily find sun or shade. And despite the masses, can almost always find a chair given they have so many!
And relax. Beautiful place to sit and chill, people watch and enjoy a picnic!Nice to sit and take a break from the hustle of 5th Avenue and enjoy the sites and activities.
always lively. enjoyed a drink and dinner at the bryant park cafe in a shaded open air setting - a great but also very noisy experience

Beautiful, quiet space. I had been to New Yorkk a few times but never been to Bryant Park before my most recent visit with my girlfriend. Bryant Park was something she wanted to see and I was happy we went. We had breakfast in the park and went and relaxed on the grass. It is a great place to go and relax after walking around. We went back at night and with the light shining down, it was a great way to end the day.
Nice place to go to have a break . I was staying in a hotel near by with a view of the park. I wandered over there one day and it is such a lovely green space oasis in such a busy city.
