Quirky. A quirky park filled with open air coffee shops. A brilliant escape from the city. Quite a calm and peaceful place. Lovely to walk through.

Oasis in the city. Such a great place in any season. I've been here in winter (ice skating), summer and fall and this place is always beautiful. Tons of seating under the cover of huge trees, places to eat and bathrooms. At lunch time it's packed with people. It's just a great place to rest your feet during a busy day in the city.

Brilliant Find. What a brilliant find this was - we stumbled on it accidentally and was a haven out of the hot sunshine. Lots of little tables and chairs surround the arena with grass and flower beds. Children's party underway with a clown when we were there being watched over by the regulars playing chess in the shade.... fabulous!

Some Good Programming. Bryant Park has some good programming for adults and kids alike. I've been to readings by adult and children's authors as well as some of the music/theatre productions for kids. There is a merry-go-round that adds to the experience for kids.

A MUST!. What a lovely special place to rest your weary feet in this busy city! Something different was going on each time we went. You can relax in the shade of the big trees, play a variety of games at the games tables, carousel ride or sit back with a beverage.
A community coming together.. On Monday nights there is an open air film show. Bring a picnic, settle down for a few hours and enjoy the atmosphere.

One of the best parks in NYC. Bryant Park is very good located. After your Shopping Marathon you can stopp by and sit in de lawn and just enjoying your time in NYC or join one of the Events during the year.

Best park in Manhattan!. Lovely park to strech your legs and enjoy the view of the New York city center. Located on 42nd str, between 5th and 6th Ave. Also visit The New York Public Library just behind the park.
Time to get off those feet.. What a great place to take in some sun, get off your feet for a while, have a coffee and people watch.

Perfect setting on a gorgeous day!. A wonderful ending to a day in NYC, which included lunch and a play. After the play (Beautiful) and a little walking around, we headed to Bryant Park. Arrived a little before 5 and had no problem getting a table for 6. We had cocktails and an app. Service was good even though they were busy. Grilled chicken on a pretzel roll, fish tacos, cheesburger and quesidia were all enjoyed. Convenient to Grand Central.
beautiful inner city park. Lovely park, gorgeous shady trees. shame about the plastic cups but I expect they are not by choice. nice spot foe coffes

Beautiful park in the building jungles in midtown Manhattan. I always make a point of visiting this beautiful park whenever I am in NY. Awesome place to eat your sushi or hot dogs dueto many tables and chairs in the park. One of my favourite park in Manhattan along with Central park!!
Lively spot. This park is a busy place with lots going on. Musicians playing and people dancing, I was disappointed that I couldn't get a table in the restaurant for a meal

A Civilized Oasis in the City. Loved Bryant Park. We sat at the outdoor bar and had a glass of wine, overlooking all the activity in the park. It was a peaceful break from the chaos of New York City. There were dancers on the stage, people playing chess and other games, and the brilliant Outdoor Reading Room, presented by the New York Public Library. Bryant Park is a well-kept, well-used, lovely oasis.

Fun Summer Music Events. Always something happening in Bryant Park . . . music, bingo, sun-basking, book browsing, pastries! Located behind the New York Public Library, it's a great place to visit at any time of the day.

An Oasis with many activities.. There is always something to do at Bryant Park. They have the carousel, the book library, the ping pong tables, a few restaurants and, of course, the grassy area. Its perfect for escaping for a few minutes on a lunch break or meeting friends for a picnic. During the summer they show movies on the lawn at sunset every Monday. I just went and saw "Ghostbusters" this past week and it was a lot of fun! You want to get there early so that you get a good spot(and a raffle ticket)...because it fills up fast! The movie started approximately at 9pm on this specific day.

Lovely park to take a load off, have a bite, use the restroom.. This is a lovely park behind the New York Public Library. It's a great place to take a break, weather permitting. Plenty of seating. Places to sit on the grass. There's a few places to grab a bite, a bakery, a grill, sandwich shop and a cafe. There's restrooms. About midway walking between Empire State Building and Rockefeller Center.
What an amazing place. A beautiful park on a beautiful sunny day. Lots of people relaxing and enjoying themselves. We ate at the Bryant Park restaurant. A small park but still amazing.

Worth Stopping By. Very small and cute park. It's nice to see greenery in the middle of the city. It was a nice place for my friend and I to grab a snack and rest before continuing on with the rest of our day. I've also stopped by one evening right before Christmas. They have ice skating and lights just add to the environment. The market they have set up with vendors during that time was also really cool.

Green in the middle of the City. We stayed close by to Bryant Park and it was so fun to have the movie on Monday night and have the little bit of greenery in the middle of the city. Every day there was something new and fun going one. My favorite was the day jugglers came out and taught anyone who wanted to learn how to juggle!

Nothing spectacular. The place was noisy and right on the street. We waited at the park for our vehicle to come. The park doesn't seem to have the required number of conveniences. Several people stayed on the queue to use the few available conveniences.

Knitters Unite. No matter the season, there is always something to do. Eat at Celsius in the winter and watch the ice skaters. The flowers are gorgeous always. Walked upon a group that knits on Tuesday afternoons during the summer. They make scarves for the homeless while teaching knitting to all ages. I was welcomed and pulled out my crocheting! Children and adults learning and working together.
Excellent park. It's a small park but a great place to relax. it's a popular park. it could be crowded but so is everywhere else in NYC. this park is worth a visit.

Lovely location. Great clean park with many concerts etc to entertain people. Lots of seats and tables available. Easy to get to. Great for a spot of lunch or relaxing drink or just to rest aching feet!!!only one negative, bathroom queue quite long due to the fact there only seemed to be one building available.

Bryant Park - Lovely. I love Bryant Park. I have seen it in the summer and the winter but prefer it at Christmas Time when the ice skating rink and market is on. Another great space to people watch and have a drink and watch the world go by.

Beautiful Park. This was a lovely, green park to sit with a drink or snack and watch the world go by, and what a variety of people! Newspapers, books, table tennis, chess - all provided free of charge, with the added bonus of a view of Empire State Building through the trees.

Quaint and cosy park. It's a small park not far from times square, and in the winter months there is an ice skating rink. It's a good spot to ice skate and avoid the larger crowds at the other rinks. Also, the library is at the back of the park and is a must do when in NYC.
Park. Very relaxing small park in the city, good place to cool down, next to a subway station. Its good to see some green with in a concrete walls and fast pace people.

Historic park. Very green and busy when we were there and don't miss New York Public Library next to it. Loved strolling this great green space in the heart of the city and thinking about all the people famous and ordinary who have done the same.

Nice park day. My husband and I were walking through the streets of NY and I saw this beautiful park with children playing and adults lounging in the grass. We stopped and took some selfies on a beautiful bench surrounded by flowers before heading across the way to the Library.

Good Place to Relax and People Watch. Best and Cleanest Public Toilets in the City.
Great spot on a nice day to get a Hot Dog and watch the world go by!!
Great Gathering place. Stop in this cool little park and enjoy people watching and relax! Grab a drink at the restaurant/bar. In the winter, ice skating fun to do!
Peaceful Park Paradise. What a fantastic park for a stroll and to get away from the NYC chaos. Immaculate and pristine; what a park should be. Pleasantly surprised.
Imaginative. What a pleasant surprise ....places to eat, games to play, recharging stations, ping pong table, open air library, carousel, boules. Very attractive. Top marks
Something for everyone. Came across this park by chance and what a great idea. There are lots of activities going on that you can choose from.
Nice. Nice location, great service, excellent food. The patio seating is really nice. It nice to watch what's going on in the park.

fun filled park. liked who well it is maintained.. the table-tennis board.. lots of games.. relaxing chairs.. (but is very crowded so dont expect much relaxing ) but pretty soothing... music.. dances gng around u... lots of trees n greenery...

What a pleasant surprise!. I was in New York visiting my son. I came in on a Thursday afternoon in May and met him where he works in the Times Square area. After having a cup of coffee with him, I took off to walk around while he finished his work day. It was a beautiful day in Manhattan and I literally stumbled upon Bryant Park. What a surprise to find this huge green area in downtown Manhattan. I was particularly impressed by the reading area for newspapers and magazines- essentially an outdoor library. People were sitting and laying out sunning themselves, enjoying the nice weather. I wandered around enjoying the views of both the park and the surrounding skyscrapers. I noted there is a restaurant/bar area on one end although I did not stop there. I highly recommend a visit to this park if you’re anywhere near the area. Enjoy the pictures and I hope you found this review helpful.

Relatively peaceful midtown park. This park is located right next to the New York Public Library and is worth a walk through. In May it was fairly busy approaching lunchtime. Plenty of trees and general greenery to escape from the concrete jungle surrounding it.

What is there not to love?. Mature trees, escape the city in a serene area. Cafe tables and chairs, bocce ball, putting green w/putter,wide screen movies at night, tai chi classes, barre classes, a game stand to choose a board game you like, a carousel for kids, food stands that don't stand out, a lawn to picnic or to relax.........all in the shadow of the majestic NYC Library! Simply divine!

Nice little park. Its a pleasant place to stop for resting and its right in the middle of the city, walking distance from Times square, walking East on 45 you cannot miss it. There are food stands with hotdogs and other foods.
An Oasis in the middle ofNYC. What can i say..... We loved it.The Park grill restaurant is wirth a look, notcheap but very nicePut it on your list!!!

A touch of Paris in Manhattan. What a gem to sit and relax and enjoy the people of NYC. Le Carrousel is beautiful. Take the time to read the history of the park. This neighborhood and the city is fortunate to have this beautiful park.

Ice skating. Bryant Park was my favorite ice skating rink in New York City. Nice music and atmosphere. Better to go on the weekday early in the morning, otherwise you'll be walking instead of skating on the rink. Enjoy!

ice skating was awesome. We did the groupon that included ice skating, hot chocolate, and dinner in mid January on a Thursday night. What a steal! It wasn't crowded, and we felt like the people on the ice around us were super accommodating (my daughter had never ice skated before). At the end of our visit, we did have an incident where my daughter fell and had a finger run over accidently by another skater, and I was so impressed by their first-aid worker who examined her and determined that it was not broken! I would definitely go back!

yoga in the park. The day we went over 830 people were doing a free yoga class in the park. It was great to see - plenty of seating for people to sit down - 2 bars and toilets - great place to chill out

Favourite park. This has become our favourite park in Manhattan. Amazing atmosphere and energy, so many areas of activity, e.g. yoga, board games, knitting clubs, childrens area - as well as areas for quiet relaxation. Also love the Bryant Park Cafe and Grill

One of the best parks ever. Bryant Park was such a pleasure to walk into. I had been to the New York Public Library and walked around the corner and there was this incredible oasis. The weather was perfect, hot and sunny with a gentle breeze, the park was busy but not packed, there were loads of free chairs and tables to sit at. I used the shaded quiet area where you could read or just sit and watch the world go by. The park is stunning and worth a trip, find an hour in your busy day to sit in the park and enjoy New York at its finest

my favorite park in NYC. I just love this park.. it is not too small, not too big, not too crowded... beautiful in winter with a big ice rink, lovely in summer with huge trees and a great way to relax in the middle of the town

A great sunny spot among the towers.. Nice restaurant (by Bank of America). Nice ice rink. Right after the NY Public library.The surrounding trees make the perfect effect of letting the sun come through in winter and projecting a fresh shadow in summer.

Great People Watching Place. A nice oasis near the New York Public Library. There are lots of trees for shades and benches to sit and relax - if you can find an empty one. There are food and beverage vendors on site.

A lot of activities, by foremost a place to relax. Bryant Park’s Lawn, where thousands of nature-starved office workers gather for lunch on any fine weekday, is planted with a rye/fescue/bluegrass mix. The lawn is as long as a football field (300 feet) and 215 feet wide. Along the Northern and Southern sides of the park are twin promenades bordered by London plane trees (Platanus acerifolia). This is the same species found at the Jardin des Tuileries in Paris, and contributes a great deal to Bryant Park’s European feel. These trees can grow up to 120 feet in height.Today’s version of Bryant Park—with its gravel paths, green chairs, and jaunty le carrousel—is a recent invention. Though the space has been called Bryant Park since 1842, the park has had a checkered career. By 1979, it was the site of frequent muggings and drug deals and was avoided by knowledgeable New Yorkers. An almost ten-year effort, begun in 1980, transformed the park and its reputation.
Always amazing. Amazing place to stroll around and people watch.. Free Wifi, grab some food, bring your laptop and just enjoy being in the center of the city

Broadway gospel for free. Stumbled onto Broadway singers singing gospel in the park to spread hope. Absolutely loved this. Playing piano that they donated and singing up a storm...fabulous..bravo to their good work!
Fun. We wandered to Bryant Park from our hotel. Lovely atmosphere~ we ordered out from Lady M Bakery and enjoyed an afternoon snack just sitting in the park. Nice surprise in the city

Modern Dance In the Park. We stopped by Bryant Park on June 19th and they are free modern dance shows happening all month long. Its a nice place for a rest after walking through the city. Vendors offer food/drink. Chairs, benches, and trees offer a bit of respite.
Small Oasis. Nice to stop and rest the aching feet. Lots of seats available and food stalls so plenty of choice. Good for people watching and quick rest before going on your busy way

Open air bar in a great location.. The cocktails were great, the food plentiful and tasty and the staff friendly and patient. The park is lovely and we will miss being there for the open air films and Christmas ice rink.

A place to sit, grass, a place to watch the world and have a snack. This is my favorite stop on a sunny day. The grass is really green, the wifi is free, the chocolate chip cookie from le Pain Quotetein is delicious and the tables and chairs are plentiful.

Great People Watching Spot. You never know what may be going on in Bryant Park. What you can always count on is a lot of people watching and a seat and table in which to bring your lunch or snack. Enjoy!

Love it!. My daughter loved it much better than Central Park. It's smaller and more contained, there are lots of decent food and drink to choose from, there's a restaurant, there's the New York public library nearby, shopping areas nearby, the subway nearby, some form of entertainment in the afternoons, it's a great place to hang out for hours if you've had enough of the crowded city.

Pretty. We strolled through here after visiting the Library which is practically next door. Go on a sunny day maybe on a weekend when the merry-go-round is operating and people are lounging in the park and you will get a better feel for it. Very nice park.
Oasis in the city. Great little park in the middle of the hustle and bustle of New York Grab a bite to eat and a drink and enjoy.

Heaven in Manhattan. This is my favorite place in the entire Manhattan. Little park in the middle of skyscrapers. It`s a green square with a fountain and small food stands around. It`s nice to sit there with an ice cream and relax on the sun.

Movies on the Park. When I worked in midtown, I would try and meet up with friends on Monday, pack a sandwhich, drink and snacks and a nice blanket for Movies on the Park. Get there early as it feels up quite quickly and at a certain point the close it off...Wine, beer or other alcohol is fine...be aware that there is a security check prior to being let into the grounds.

A jewel in midtown. Visiting Bryant Park is a must. You are gonna fall in love with it in any season of the year. We happenned to visit during early spring and the view of the multicolor growing tulips is awesome. You will make this spot of the city your favorite place to stop for a relaxing coffee or reading a book among your daily rush visiting the city.

A Hidden Gem. I make it a point to visit every holiday season. Wonderful kios's for gift purchases. It is smaller then most of the NYC parks that is why I adore it. A lovely ice skating ring and it' s very own Christmas Tree. I also visit in the spring or summer

Beautiful park. While on my first trip to New York, my girlfriend that lives there took me to Bryant Park. What a lovely surprise to see another park in New York. There were quite a few people sitting around tables having lunch, there were people playing chess and there was even a merry go round. The park was well kept and look refreshing after walking the streets shopping and sightseeing. I just wish we had time to sit and have at least a drink since there is a place that sells food and drinks.

Our favorite place to take a breakfast in NYC!!!. The park is beautiful, with a huge lawn where people lie down to sunbathe. It is a busy and lively place, with children playing, people resting in the shade of trees and artists performing in rapids street spectacles. It has a very beautiful carrousel, tables and chairs where it is possible to have a snack or coffee sold in existing kiosks in the park. It has a very nice restaurant, where salads and healthy snacks are served.

Beautiful Bryant!. Nowadays it's hard to imagine that Bryant Park was effectively a 'no-go' area in the 1970s/80s, because of its condition and the unsavoury characters who frequented there. This little park, situated on 6th Avenue, was rejuvenated over the past 20 years and appears as a green island within a sea of concrete, providing visitors and local people alike with a place where they can almost forget they're in one of the largest cities in the world. Free to visit with seating, cafe, free Wi-Fi and various activities including dancing, bingo, knitting, exercise classes and film screenings (in the summer) means that this little park is a resource used to best effect for all its visitors.

Busy place. This is a very nice park located right behind the main library. There's a carousel, food booths, a lovely restaurant and different activities every evening. We just missed a tango demonstration!
Wow Very nice!. The grounds where so stunning the grass smelled so fresh and the weather was plain gorgeous. beautiful to visit in the fall!

What an extraordinary place to spend time. A must see for anyone visiting NYC...movies in the park, games, beautiful shade trees, cafes, reading nooks with free books to borrow, ping pong tables, and yummy baked goods to enjoy with a latte or two. :)

Ice rink is amazing. In December, there are myriad of gift booths set up all around the park. There is no unique gift item that you cannot buy here. Not necessarily holiday, but all sorts. The rink gets very crowded on weekends, try during the weekdays.

Lovely small park.. Fabulous place. Small but perfectly formed! Various things to do, table tennis, reading area with books, carousel, games area, boules courts. Also places to buy food, lots of tables and chairs and grass and trees. Lovely!

Fantastic idea. Loved Bryant Park - the concept is great and their are a lot of activities to do (or not do!!). Like all the parks we visited in NY, this one was well maintained and very clean. The public toilets in this park are amongst the cleanest I have ever seen. Security staff were very helpful. Just beautiful. Make sure you pop in to the library next door as well!

This would be my favourite green oasis. First morning out in NYC we passed this little park on the way to Chrysler Building and Grand Central Station. It looked pleasant enough and we vowed to return when the weather had improved. What a beautiful little spot with its shady trees and almost Parisien feel o it. A wonderful place to relax with a drink from either the cafe bar or the small Kiosks and a book or newspaper borrowed. Plenty of seats to rest the weary legs and relax, gazing up at the Empire State Building or people watching. Loved it.
Nice. Stunning little park with beautiful cafes on each corner. Lovely place to just relax and unwind and watch the world and his sister go by.
Bryant Park vs Central Park. Nice park not far from Time Square. Lots of Free actiivties.Worht a visit for a night concert. Nice place to sit and people watch and have a coffee or ice cream.
Well worth a visit. Spent a lovely afternoon in this area - hopping off the bus tour - then had lunch in a beautiful itallian with an outside terrace which was just so quaint and lovely.
Love Bryant Park. There is always a lot going on there. Great place to bring your lunch and watch the people who are relaxing over their lunch break. I love this park!

lot of happenings. i love it!there are free tables to sit and rest,and maybe have a sandwich and check out the events happening all the time online...if u visit in the summertime check out the annual film festival happening there.

Beautiful park in the middle of the city!. We have visited this park in the Spring and Winter and thoroughly enjoyed it each time. In the Spring you can relax on a well manicured lawn, have a picnic, read a book, etc. There are vendors available for food. In the Winter the grass is replaced with an ice rink. Ice skating in the middle of the city was great. I preferred that over skating in Central Park. Anytime of year, it's a great place to visit.

Spectacular. Take a walk or take a break in Bryant Park. The summer reading room was open and the lovely trees were shading our way as we walked around. It gave us a chance to get our of the sun and to feel a light breeze. ther are food stands with good food and you can grab something to eat and a seat. Just a perfect way to relax.
Broadway. If you are going to a show on broadway & are a wee bit early - go to Bryant park. It is lovely. You can sit & chill & even have a drink or 2. An oasis in a big city that never sleeps
Great little park... ...with little kiosks for food and drinks, lots of seats, grass, games to play, children's bit, stage at one end for theatre or music....really lovely.
Bryant Park. Great park lots to offer...game area, ping pong, minature golf, yoga, relaxing, bringing your lunch and just chat and relax

Dinner in the Park. We shared dinner in Bryant Park one evening when we were there recently & it was lovely.The place we went to was really busy with many workers enjoying an ale or two before they went home on a Thursday evening.Lots of people were out walking their dogs in this beautiful park.We had a lovely dinner & then sat down by the sidewalk & enjoyed a cup of tea & a Cinnamon Donut as we watched a multitude of people walk by.Very enjoyable & highly recommended as a venue & place to walk around &/or sit & have a drink or a meal.

Beautiful oasis in the city. Bryant Park is a lovely green oasis in the centre of the bustling city. There is a gorgeous carousel and lots of seating where you can sit and eat or just enjoy the surroundings.

Something about the atmosphere…. There is some interesting atmosphere in this park which makes it strangely special, regardless of the fact that it's too small. If you have the opportunity, walk around and sit for awhile and enjoy the downtown vibes!
Cute Park. It s a small, well maintained park. There were kids playing soccer and a chess tournament going on. Great place to people watch!

A fun and relaxing park!. Very fine location.....right in Mid-Town. We sat for two hours just people watching, playing my ukulele, watching a bocce ball tournament, enjoying the shade on a quite warm spring June say. Also enjoyed Central Park and Madison Square Park. So much to do in NYC.

Bryant Park. This is sun a fun place to just sit and people watch. There is a reading room, the carousel if you have young ones, the green area to sit and soak up the rays, or chairs in the shade if you've had to much sun. The outdoor bar is a busy place in the late afternoon, but I felt a little out of place as almost all are young business types and I'm neither of those!! Still, the park as a whole is a fun place to spend some time.

Relaxing area in the centre of Manhattan . Sun was shining , we needed a rest from shopping & stumbled across this park. A great location. Lie down on the grass , sit on one of the many seats or just stand and people watch. Great for kids too.

Small, but beautiful. This is not as big as Central Park, but it is worth a visit. It is so nice and quiet; the perfect place to relax and have lunch or a coffee. Have to be honest here; the food and drinks are in my opinion expensive. They offer sometimes free yoga classes in this park. So if you love yoga, try if you could join a class!

Great place to stop and admire the Bryant Hotel.. This was a surprise to me as I'd not heard of it before, we found it on a guide book walk and was a lovely spot to stop and have an Al fresco lunch. There was a pianist, juggling, table tennis, people playing games or space just to stop and take a moment. Quite a contrast to Time Square!

Beautiful spot in the middle of the action. This spot is sandwiched between Times Square and Grand Central, offering trees, a carousel, games, and plenty of places to sit and observe life in New York. If you're going to Grand Central or the public library, this is a great place to recharge.There are spots to get coffee and treats as well as a public restroom. It was my favorite spot of the trip!

Hidden behind the NY Public Library. Bryant Park is awesome all times of the year. Winter brings a skating rink and all little Boutiques surrounding the rink. The fountain turns into a beautiful ice sculpture. Come Spring, summer and fall it's a great place to sit outside and have a break from work in the big city. Love this park!

A must!. I love Bryant Park! It's a little oasis in the middle of the City! Tons of places to sit in the shade of the trees. Food and coffee kiosks there too. Although I bought a fantastic hot dog and can of coke from a street vendor outside and sat in park with it.. $3 !!!
Make sure you get a cinnamon roll at the corner bakery.. We loved the personality of this park. It was a great place to relax and people watch while waiting for the tour buses.

Cool calm sophisticated. My wife loves this place more than I do, but I love it just as much as her. Lovely trees, little tables to sit at, no undesirables, cops around, very safe.. restful amidst the busy city. A calming place where you can watch the little Sparrows and the pigeons -and people.
NYC Gathering Place. Bryant Park was alive and bustling on Saturday morning when we strolled through it. Fascinating to see tourists and locals alike enjoying this green space.

Nice place. Great place in the middle of all the hustle and bustle to just sit and take time out. New York can be like one big building site with all the noise associated with it, so it's really nice that there are these green spaces to chill out in

A little solitude in the city. Absolutely a must go. Located right behind the library, this park is a must visit. If you're looking for a little peace in the city go and relax at this park. There is an outdoor eating area if you're hungry. The park is a great place to just relax with a book for a few hours.

Bryant Park Changes with the Seasons. Anytime of the year, Bryant Park is a destination for us to take a break. I love watching children riding Le Carrousel on the south side of the park. This is a calming park in the middle of Manhattan. Nice to see people taking breaks from frenetic NYC and enjoying the sunlight, drinks at the Bryant Park Cafe or Grill or sitting on the lawn. We were here in May with signs reading "Lawn Closed" - a first with the gorgeous green lawn spanning this city block behind the sign. Great location behind the NYC Public Library and its restroom facilities. Quite different from Central Park with the purposely natural, rugged look Central Park tries to maintain. Bryant Park is manicured, a park for city workers to enjoy a breath of fresh air. The Christmas tree and kiosks during the holidays and ice skating rink during the winter provide a completely different experience. Anytime of the year, it's hard to be disappointed at Bryant Park, and certainly the lawn is opened now!

Green oasis in the heart of Manhattan. Wonderful location, steps away from the buzz of Times square, yet provides ample peace and quiet. Clean public washrooms on site. Perfect place to take a break and enjoy a coffee or snack. Le Pain Quotidien has a nice selection of beverages and quick eats.
Beautiful day in the park. Visited early on a Saturday morning. Enjoyed coffee and tea and scones and people-watched in the quiet setting.
Hidden gem. Look for this park behind the library so pretty but very busy on sunny days has lots of setting and places to buy food and drinks
Lovely. We stopped in the park for a beverage while on our marathon walk back to our hotel. The park is immaculate.

Delightful midtown respite. Years ago it was a drug den, but wow is it nice now. We stopped for a drink at an adjacent restaurant/outdoor bar, and then walked the perimeter of the park. I love the outdoor spaces in the City, and while this is a tiny fraction of the size of Central Park, it is a beautifully landscaped little gem. Free Shakespeare plays in the summer, on weekends.

Interesting park. This is a beautiful park near the NY public library. We strolled around the park and found interesting things happening here. There is a reading place where authors and book lovers visit to read excerpts from books. There is even reading corners where one can borrow books and sit and read there. On one side many sit and relax after the day's work. A very interesting park with varied activities. Only dislike is the cigar smell prevalent here.
A oasis of calm & green in hectic mid Manhattan. We were there enjoying beatuful weather. People were playing chess or just relaxing and / or having a drink.

Nice Park, centrally located, right behind the library. Like lots of NYC parks plenty of rules and instructions to keep off the grass. Bryant Park is a lovely centrally located park easily found and a pleasant oasis in the city
Great location, but not near the character of Central Park.. Save yourself time and energy and go to do other things unless there is some kind of special event at Bryant Park.

Love park to sit, read, eat, people watch. Clean and lovely park. Fun place for people of all ages. People coming and going, but you never feel crowded or overwhelmed. we returned to park several times to enjoy the beauty and surroundings.

Watch the world go by at Bryant Park. Nothing nicer on a sunny day than finding a nice shady spot at Bryant park and watching the world go by. Lovely surroundings, plenty of tables and chairs to use, it's my favourite park in NYC.

A park for the people!. Plenty to enjoy in this park. Lots of seating (no food purchase necessary so bring your lunch along). Activities galore - reading room (with free books and newspapers), and on the day we visited there were juggling classes and knitting classes. Bars and food available. A scenic place to rest from walking, right next to New York Public Library and close to Times Square.
Morning yoga anyone. This park was on the way to Times Square from our hotel, so my son and I would often walk through. Very nice small park with plenty going on even yoga in the morning.

Lovely place in the heart of NYC. Free wifi and lots going on markets etc. New Yorkers going about their daily grind-love the chairs where you can sit and relax watching the world go by. Normally there is something going on you just have to go and see!
Quaint Park. Beautiful quaint park to relax amid the hustle and bustle of the city. Perfect for coffee and people watching. I prefer Bryant Park to Central Park.

Great park to sit and watch the world go by..... What a great piece of green space right in the city. Wonderful to see everyone enjoying a warm day. People were eating, chilling, playing games, enjoying books from the outside library. The large old trees offer some dappled light and shade from the sun. There were eating places near by so it was good to be able to grab a drink, ice cream, and sit and enjoy. NY has done a great job of preserving some space for everyone to enjoy....reminded me of London and Paris....nicely done, and reasonable way to spend some time just relaxing in NY :)

A nice respite from the city. Bryant Park was a nice relaxing stop on our site seeing holiday. It is next door to the New York public library. We sat watching people play petanque and chess.The planting around Bryant Park is beautiful. Came back on our last day for breakfast of waffles from the AMAZING Waffles and Dinges cart.

Never miss a visit. I never miss visiting Bryant Park whether it's in winter and drinking coffee watching the skating and visitng the stalls with Christmans gifts or just sitting around in the summer with a coffee and watching NYC world go by.
Lovely. We spent quite a bit of time here, there were shows as well as a cafe . Nice place to sit and people watch just a bit away from Times Square

You have to go!. Most favorite park of our trip. During the day & during hot weather as experienced in our trip it was nice to sit and people watch whilst having a coffee. There are reading areas, games areas and its magical at night when its lit up.
A free go to at night. Beautiful park, behind the library with cafe, fountain and restaurant, lots of place sit outside for hours and take a breather, looks like daytime in the middle of the night.

My Favorite little Park in NY. I love Bryant Park in every season. In the summer there is food, dancing, people watching, live music, kids events, shopping at kiosks,and in the winter there is all of that and holiday gift booths and ice skating, too. The beautiful giant trees provide lots of shade, and there are lots of seating areas and table all around. It is a relaxing, convenient park right next to the NY Public Library. It is in a great location for getting to the subway and many other NY attractions and hotels.

Cool little park. Bryant Park is small but something is always going on there. Not far from Times Square it offers a great place for a photo opportunity of the Chrysler Building and the Empire State Building. Booths are often set up in the area with crafts, etc. and vendors. The NY Library is right across the street. There is a sweet green area in the middle to soak in the sun when it is warm and it is used to ice skate in the winter. Take time to find this wonderful little park.

An oasis of green in a busy city!. What a lovely place to sit and have a sandwich of a salad we went to Chopt which was fab. Seats and tables are provided with often music playing in some areas. It gets very busy at times but there are a lot of seats so usually you can find one.
bryant park..hot chocolate and waffles... nothing to dislike really..enjoyed just sitting in the snow people watching...good sized skating rink too.

Great gathering place on a nice day. Lots of tables, lots of benches, lots of birds and lots of people. This is literally in the center of the city. A nice place to sit and relax after walking 5th Ave or visiting Times Square. Good place for lunch at a table under a tree. Lots to see and do in all directions.

Lovely Park!. You cannot find a better place for a picnic lunch and people watching. Lots of places to pick up a take-out meal are all around the park or you can choose the restaurant in the park. A very relaxing place to visit in NY!

Lovely park!. Had a night walk through Bryant Park during my recent visit to New York. Located in the center of the city in Manhattan Midtown, it provides a lovely oasis of peace & calm in the middle of the hustle & bustle that is NYC. The Bryant Park Grill is a lovely restaurant and there are a number of cafes as well. Highly recommended!

Nice and chill!. Nice and chill park for a brief lunch on a workday. The beauty of this place is that it is impossible to find if you do not know where to look and tourists don't flock like any other place.
One of the nicest parks of the world. So many things to do in Bryant Park. All free. Amazing relaxing atmosphere !! Even if you go there with kids they will not be bored.

This is a park with interesting, unique, and fun activities. There is food, dancing, people watching, live music, kids events, shopping at kiosks, in this relaxing, convenient park. It is in a great location for getting to the subway and many other attractions and hotels.
a good break in the center of NYC. We had a beautiful day and took advantage of it! Had the best Bloody Mary and enjoy watching people enjoy themselves.

Small, beautiful park. This is a beautiful small park near the New York Public Library. There is a painted carousel, fountain and blooming plantings everywhere. Many people were enjoying lunch at the many tables with the perfect weather. It is a great place to relax.
Ice skating. The highlight of Bryant Park is basically the ice skating rink. The atmosphere was quite romantic and fun. The music, the lighting, the environment.

Lovely park. What a great park. It has restaurants, seating for enjoying the outdoors, and a carousel for the kids. There is a lot of grass and trees which make this park a little oasis in the big city.
Chill zone. What a lovely part of NYC, Came across a Zumba class and a Tei Chi !Great place to relax and watch the world go by
Bryant Park. crowded with lunch people but everyone was friendly and enjoyed the lovely day at the park while resting between shopping excursions

Tranquil amidst the hustle and bustle. I like that it was cozy in the park, lots of sitting, clean, and loved that there was an ice cream shop there too. A good place to relax and enjoy watching people, relax, and read a book!

the best!. I went to NY for a week and I liked this park so much, I ended up going 3 times. it is a spectacular place, great public bathrooms , they even looked like a 5 star hotels public restroom decorated with amazing flowerts, the chairs to sit around reminded me of Paris, the sunset is amazing.

A park in summer. In summer, Bryant Park is a gathering spot all day - the lunch crowd for the restaurant kiosks, evening events put on by the city, plenty of places to sit or grass tio throw a towel down on (depending on the time you're there and what's going on. We scheduled lunch here mid-route from Grand Central to Times Square. As a tourist, it's a nice respite from a lot of walking. But we saw lots of natives enjoying it too.
Love the Christmas market!. Picked out wonderful Christmas gifts at the Bryant Park market. Such amazing choices made by talented artisans! We will definitely visit Bryant Park market again.
Very Nice. Was great to find a quietish area to relax in and watch the world go by. Plenty of small market stalls around the area when we visited.
Fab. Nice little park especially at Christmas time they have a massive tree and market really festive. In the summer nice and relaxing

Love it. Bryant Park is a beautiful little spot in the heart of Manhattan. It always has something going on through the year, but the best bit is just to sit on the sides with a drink watching the world go by

A quiet spot to find some shade. When taking in all the tourist sites you sometimes just need to sit quietly in the shade and have an icecream or a coffee. This is the spot - much smaller than I had expected but extremely welcome.
Ice Skating. It's so peaceful to watch the ice skaters. There are refreshments and snacks for purchase. The public library is adjacent.

"Great Family Fun". This is a wonderful park to bring the kids on a weekend. There is a fun Merry-go-round, and ping pong, and library. There are refreshments and merriment everywhere. There is always some fun activity and free entertainment going on. It is worth a stop!
Awsome. Nice place to sit for hours and relax. Get some coffee and just enjoy the view and the events they have some time to time there!
Music. Live music once a week so a good night to go. Small buy a nice place to sit and have coffee and lunch.

Own culture and character. Definitely drop by if in the area. See people playing games like cheese. Time to time have concerts. When I went this past weekend they had a large game of musical chairs going on.
Little Gem. Sat and had a drink on a lovely NY summers day .... didnt want to leave, it was idyllic!!! Make sure you book for Bryant Park Grill tho, it gets busy!!
Lovely Park. It was lovely to sit and take in the park whilst it is all hustle & bustle around. Well maintained oasis right by the Central Library.

Great place to walk, sit, relax. New York is a great place to walk but sometimes you just want to sit for a while. Bryant Park is a wonderful place to do just that. There are lots of coffee and pastry vendors as well as a couple of restaurants. Plenty of space to sit and read or people watch. Lovely oasis in the middle of a very busy city.

Bryant Park in Winter.. My wife and I along with our 2 friends discovered this little gem whilst walking up Broadway towards Times Square. It was spectacular possibly due to the lovely layout but in particular the ice flows falling from the various monuments within same. A great place to chill and watch the young ones playing ice hockey.

A nice park. Nice park close to Grand Central Station and behind the Public Library. Perfect for a little break in the sunshine, take a book and enjoy on the lawn or on the many chairs available. There is also a restaurant with a bar.
Greenery in middle of those big buildings. With the noise and bussell around you this is lovely to sit and have a rest no coffee no suck in atmosphere ..green no pleasant.

What a jewel of a park!. Right behind the NYC Library, this lovely park is so peaceful, yet there is always so much going on here! Beautiful green and shady places to relax, a carousel, a little miniature golf spot, a little outdoor library, restaurants, a pianist giving an outdoor concert, the list goes on and we enjoyed stopping in every day just to sit and take it all in.
Lovely park!. A really lovely place to grab lunch or a coffee and sit and enjoy the New York surroundings. Right next to New York public library which is a good place to see!

Something for everybody. I think this is now more the heartbeat of Manhattan than Times Square. Beautiful gardens, live, free entertainment, stuff for kids, lots of food options, right behind fabulous New York Public Library, subway stop right there. Especially enjoyed weekday jazz piano concerts 12:30-2:30. Outdoor reading room with newspapers and magazines, games.
The park. Beautiful little park that is alive with locals and visitors have a coffee and just soak up the atmosphere
lovely shady park. This is a lovely shady park in midtown. Lots of bistro tables and chairs to sit at and people watch or eat.

Very touristy, but a nice place to relax in midtown. I hate tourists and touristy areas. that's really hard when you are one when visiting the best city in the world - New York City!I generally avoid the midtown crowds since that's all that most tourists see when coming to NYC. They associate midtown manhattan with all of NYC which is so wrong! There are so many great local small parks with people running dogs and enjoying themselves over giant parks like this filled with tourists. However, on a day where I walked from Battery Park to Central Park I did grab a coffee at starbucks and find myself enjoying a nice song or two from a band playing with great views from the park of the NYC Library and the Empire State Building. It was a great place for a refreshing stop to relax for 10 minutes... but I couldn't handle the crowds and had to move on to see other things.

Nice place to relax. We were staying at the Grand Hyatt and on our first night in NYC on the way back to the hotel we came across Bryant Park which is not really a park in the accepted sense of the word, more a big square with lots of greenery and trees and a nice bar on one side and a beautiful restaurant right next to it. Lots of people were just relaxing at the numerous tables dotted throughout and it made for a nice stroll around the square. Tried to get a drink at he bar another night but it was absolutely heaving with what looked like loads of business men who had just left a conference. It was particularly hot that night so with the volume of people and the heat we felt quite hemmed in and gave the place a miss. Would go back again .

Cool place to hang out. Come there to sit around the park, grab a pastry or even have a game of chess. This is a great place to have that 5 minute rest before you get back on your feet for the manic lifestyle that is New York

Love Bryant Park. Great New York spot for all seasons. In the winter you can watch the ice skaters and shop at the Christmas market. Summer is good for a quick lunch at the outdoor café or just plain people watching!!

In the heart of the city!. Bryant park is a wonderful spot to sit in the city to watch the comings and goings of New York at work.Close to Times Square, and on your way to some of the larger attractions on offer, Bryant park offers a moment of peace and quiet!! There's seating available and food and drinks on the corners of the park. Whilst no squirrels were seen, I'm sure they were hiding in there!! There's often something happening in there, with music playing and performers around. Take a break from walking the streets and sit down in the park for a moment!!

Good vibes. I liked how there was an outdoor area. I came across it whilst exploring NYC, it was about 5pm in the afternoon and Spring had just begun so it was still quite cool. I can see how beautiful it would be to have breakfast or lunch there on a warmer day!There are cute little pop up cafes in the park, ping pong tables and chess. The gardens are also kept very well.
sun+coffe+bryant park. On a sunny day order coffee and something to eat at "LE PAIN" and seat in the sun enjoy the quite, the time off and the beauty around.

My favorite park. I love Bryant park, every time I am in NY I go there. Sometimes I just sit and do absolutely nothing. I even prefer Bryant to Central park (one of the reasons - this one has free wi-fi).

gorgeous. Such a cute little area in the middle of busy Manhattan. The lawn was closed for maintenance so we couldn't walk on the grass. The flowers could have been a little prettier as the daffodils were almost dead and the tulips hadn't completely come up. Loved all the little tables and chairs available

You never know what you'll find at Bryant Park. My first visit was to the Christmas Market a couple of years ago, and that was a blast. I bought a cashmere rug, ornaments, and a dolphin hat. We watched the ice skaters while sipping hot spiced cider. Next visit, I saw a guy setting up a box of water and an oblilsk. I forget exactly what he was doing - some kind of a measurement thing - but he was fascinating. Had the cream cheese and sweet potato sandwich at Which 'Wich. If you're wondering, there's a reason no one else has thought of that combination. But the best thing is the free restroom. The ladies' room was spotless, had fresh flowers and an attendant who didn't demand a tip - although you could leave one. Get this - it smelled great from the flowers. For a bite to eat, a respite, a bathroom break, a carousel ride or a shopping spree at Christmas, Bryant Park is the place to be.

The Sycamores Were a Highlight. Adjoining the New York Public Library, Bryant Park is a wonderful respite. The Sycamore trees filled the park and were such a beautiful choice to bring nature and shade to the park. There was plenty of seating and it was fun to watch an artist working at his easel, painting a scene in the park, and , separately, watching a photo shoot within the park, complete with a 5 person camera crew. It was just a beautiful spot in the middle of the City.
Try pastries at LadyM nearby.. One of my favourite parks in Manhattan. Always something is happening there. Summer free movie shows, winter skate ring.

Hang out with the locals. Love this park behind the city library. It is a lively place to hang-out with city dwellers. Lots of seating and street food, yoga classes, street bingo, people watching. What's not to love.

One of my favorites!!. Grab some food and come here to sit. Love this little park. Was there on a Saturday & there were juggling lessons; books for children to read & board games to borrow & play at the tables. There's a carousel, cafe & restaurant. Plenty of chairs, tables or grass for sitting. Has a sense of community about it. At the back of the library.

Enjoyed a coffee at the outside table and chairs. What a beautiful park. Stunning avenue of trees with a large area of lush green grass. I was amazed to see some outdoor table tennis set up with people having a casual game. You can get a coffee and sit at the table and chairs outside and just relax and admire the beautiful gardens and the tranquility of the park. Really worth a 30 minute visit.

Great option for a break. Found this pocket park when out for a Saturday stroll. Several restaurant options on the corners. Many people lounging on the grass. Lots of couples sitting on benches or tables having a drink or reading a good book. Saw one group rehearsing for a wedding. Overall it was clean and not too congested.

What an amazing place to be in such a great City. If you like parks, open spaces in massive chaotic cities, or playing bowls, playing table-tennis, reading, or sitting by fountains, this is the place for you. Personally I prefer the Al fresco wining and dining whilst watching the world go by in the best city in the world. Where else in the world could you witness on a Sunday a massive parade of women baring their breasts (seriously) in a demonstration called 'free you breasts' quite bizarre but only in New York. Great place to be makes you feel glad to just be.

Beautifull place. We have been at Bryant Park in December and it was something really different. You could not believe is the same place. Is perfect to seat outside the restaurant, just to watch people walking by.

Great Green Island of Fun and Friendhsip on 42nd Street. Every time I come here, I stop by this park. More so then Central Park, or Prospect in Brooklyn. There's usually something happening here - both big and small events. It's a wonderful place for people watching, relaxing, and snacking. Right behind the main library. In the summer it's wide open with day slackers and tourists meandering to and fro. Movies and concerts are shown on some evenings. In the winter, you'll find a skating rink and lots of holiday shopping. Fashion runway shows are held here at least twice a year. When I was a young man I worked directly across the street and would often have a lunch sandwich here. Then it was populated largely by drug dealers and addicts. But lunch time was O.K. Today, the people of New York have reclaimed this park as a gift to all who'd like to use it. So do so!

Always Worth A Visit. Seldom does one come across such a well maintained public park as Bryant Park. Its facilities are appreciated by all, especially by those from surrounding offices. It's spotless, there's free Wi-fi, clean toilets, a library trolley from the adjoining NY Public Library and the splendid gardens and trees all make this a remarkable spot in an otherwise bustling area.

Lovely Holiday Market. Bryant Park hosts a lovely holiday market. There is also ice skating in the park around the holidays. It is a fun place to walk around and spend some time. The only caveat is that the market is not particularly stroller friendly.

Nice to be outside!. It's a nice park to walk or ride your bike. It has plenty of trees so in the summer you can find nice shadows to stay off the sun...You can also see the statue of liberty and other sightseeings!
Evening strool. Go in the evening and sit with the locals and people watch. Not masses to do but it is quiet and you can get a soft drink and watch New Yorkers do their thing.
Green Rest. So nice to have a wee rest for 20min or so;). A few resturants, Ping Pong games, a free library, and a few free seats - bring a little snack so u don't occupie them for to long.

Oasis in the building jungle. Trees and green grass in the middle of the city. And it wasn't central park. Just big enough to relax and have a sit down after a day of strolling the streets of New York. Plenty of seats and lawn to just reflect on your day and wind down.
Oasis in the centre of town. Gorgeous park on 6th Ave between 40th and 42nd streets, lots of touristy stands around the outside but worth popping in for a quiet sit after pounding the pavements
delicious place. you can get by the afternoon, take a coffee and a croissant in the tables, magical moments, all day to enjoy in the middle of the city a little moment to yourself...

People Watching Paradise. If people watching is your thing head for Bryant Park.
Great place bang in the centre of the tourist attractions. Find a seat grab a drink or a snack and sit back and busy but relaxed and enjoyable.
Cocktails. Take plenty of money, and on your way to/from Grand Central, get some cocktails in at Bryant Park. There are probably other things to do there too (hic)
fun hour. Stopped for an hour for a coffee and the free entertainment was brilliant and fully.... sit in the sun take it in and it wont disappoint.
Beautiful. With a view to beautiful New York Library this a the perfect place for an outdoor lunch. Even though the park is close to 6th Avenue, you can relax and have a good time here.
Amazing Atmosphere. This quaint set up is a must see for all who visit. Trendy shops are set up for unique gift ideas. There is a great bar next door and a small ice rink as well.

Charming Park- Great Special Events. I've worked across the street from Bryant Park for five years, and I'd choose to visit the park over Times Square (which is nearby) any day. Bryant Park is basically lovely. It has a pretty fountain in the middle, and a few restaurant/bar options-- it even has a tiny carousel! There are some trees, and even a big lawn of grass in the warmer months that people lounge on. There are plenty of chairs and tables (but it's difficult to nab one on a nice day at lunch hour.) In the late fall the park is transformed into an enchanting Christmas village of shops, and the lawn becomes an ice skating rink. All in all it's a great place to take a break, do some people watching, and feel like you're in touch with nature a bit in the middle of the big city.
Bryant Park. Great place to chill if a lovely day and people watch, next to New York Public Library and short walk from Madison Avenue
Great reprieve in the city. This is such a great park with the gourmet booths and ample seating. Its a great place to stop and enjoy nature and the views of the library.

One of my favorites in the center of this city. Near the 42nd st. library with free WiFi and chairs, of course plenty of grass and free toilet! Where else would you like to take a break and let your feet rest from walking in the city?It is close to 5th Ave, 2 blocks away from Times Sq. There is a cafe on the east side and a kiosk on the west. My favorite snake is to get a NYC hot dog before I enter this park and eat it there.There is a colorful carrossel for the kids (for a small fee). In summer you may hit a movie in the evening or an excercise session in the morning. Enjoy.

Peace for reading. Green place, next to NY Public Library.
Tables and chairs for everybody.
Place for running.
Coffee and pies kiosks.
Like a oasis in the midlle of the city

Love it!!. Great place to hang out! Just a block away from all the bustle of Times Square. Nice park with spectacular views of Empire State Building. Grassy area to relax in as well as some food vendors to grab a snack. Very laid back area.
Very large nice park in nyc. Just down 42nd st it's a pretty cool park to just have your lunch in. In the fall they have lots of vendors selling arts and crafts.

Just Magnificent. Walked around this park in the spring when it was really coming into full blossom and could also imagine what it would be like in winter with skaters etc around. We were most impressed with the games available and spent quite a time watching while we enjoyed our coffee (coffee service was a bit slow but who cares).

Ok. This was also right near our hotel and we thought it looked nice and decided to try and have lunch there one day. It was hard to find a table because it was very busy all the time, but you know, it's NY! Cute area though, very fun for "people watching". We ended up having lunch at the BP Cafe, which was actually kind of disappointing.

Go to the movies. In the heart of midtown this park has host of events all summer long. Concerts, Movies and Tennis Matches. The restaurant isn't bad but quite pricey so bring your Amex and Visa cards. you will enjoy whatever event you opt to go to because you will be in the greatest city in the world.

Nice retreat. We happened upon this park at night, it's a quaint little gem and worth a trip. It was clean and had seating a mini carousel, and other amenities, but they were closed at night when we went, yet we still enjoyed.

Great place to shop, eat and ice skate. NOT Handicapped accessible. This is an especially good place to visit during the Christmas holiday season. There are many shops to purchase unusual holiday gifts, interesting food selections and the opportunity to observe one of the most beautfiul trees in the city. Try to make your visit in the evening when the tree is lit. This is an easy walk from the Times Square area. Last year I did take a wheel chair bound person with me and could not find any way to access the site proper(could still see the tree and the shops). If you are an ice skater, the rink is quite large.

Go for movie night or the free shows in Summer... This is a nice small park in center of midtown... nothing so special except for wjhen they have free Movie nights or broadway performances.. so check the newspapers for schedules... otherwise, experience Central Park instead!

Best for Ice-Skating. I went to NY for Christmas and it was the best place to do ice skating, it wasn't really crowded, as every other place in NY for Christmas, I went at night and it was beautiful! Nothing to envy to Central Park or Rockefeller
Rest time. Visited this small park just a few blocks away from Times Square! Lovely surroundings and plenty of take out places to eat & relax!

excellent. I also sat in this park on many times just to rest , its surround by lovely buildings , beautifull grass and they had things to do ,they had free zumba and certain days and was a lovely coffee stand plenty of seating , also pretty lawns and water fountain

too crowded with office goers lunching. beautiful pocket of green but too crowded with office goers lunching. Avoid it on weekdays at lunch hours.
This park always has some live music/ book reading/ open air movie screenings.

Good place to relax on the grass. A good place to take lunch, sit down and relax / escape from the busy city for 30 minutes.
There are plenty of seats and tables where you can take your own lunch. [Several shops around the park and surrounding streets]
Great find. Lovely park in a v busy part of town to take a break. great bar/restaurant where service and food were excellent, but only public toilets to use. They were clean but you have to queue.

A haven in the city. A wonderful haven in the city. Where all can sit and enjoy the atmosphere eat your lunch or just sunbathe.
Food stalls close at hand are ready to serve your needs.

Pretty Sites, Interesting Views. Visited Bryant Park with friends. There were chess games being played, there was a cool outdoor bar to encounter. There was a lot of activity and so many interesting things nearby to encounter. The park is a lovely green respite from the concrete jungle that is Manhattan.

Bryant park nyc. What a fantastic park, even the toilets are immaculate and the attendants so friendly. The lawns are kept lovely and gorgeous seasonal flowers, even plenty of tables and chairs to choose from all free of charge.

Fun. It's fun and relaxing.It's located near the library and 5 minutes walk of time square. You can find a place to sit and relax, to drink a cup of coffee or to eat an ice cream,. and look at all the people who comes here just to chill.I love it especially during night when the weather is nice and it's enlighten by a mighty spotlight.

favourite park in NYC. A lovely park, loads of seating views of the empire state and lovely shade under the trees. We were lucky enough to catch a free Jazz session being played. Grab a coffee and take some time to rest and relax with the rest of New York. A great way to escape from the craziness of NYC
Holiday treat. Love how Bryant Park transforms itself during the holiday season. Ice skating, lots of stands with holiday trinkets and warm ciders, hot chocolates and other treats.
Nice. Nice park, not too big. A good place to sit down under the sun for a little while in front of the NY Public Library.

Lovely park night and day. This is a small park with beautiful fountain and at night lights give a lovely feel. Surrounding buildings look magical at night also.
Plenty of chairs to sit and a bar area at one end overlooks the park
Worth a visit if passing
Well groomed park with cafes, lawn and events. Something of an oasis between neon TImes Sq and shopping 5th Av. Take a break from the full on NYC! Take the subway if you are not near by.

Great to sit and watch the world go by. A great way to pass an hour or two people watching. Grab a drink at one of the outlets and just sit back to watch and listen to the locals at the end of a long working day
Nature in the City. A beautiful place to relax and have a cold drink on a hot day. It is very small but the trees and the birds and nature made my day.
Lovely oasis. Great public toilets very clean. Had a lunch ion the outside terrace very nice. Lovely and peaceful in the middle of New York chaos

On the way to Empire State Building. This is a lovely tranquil garden that we strolled through on our way to the Empire State Building. Plenty of seating areas to chill and relax and an outside library of books for little people to enjoy which I thought was neat.

Paradise in the middle of NYC. Hard to imagine that this little park can do so much wonders for New Yorkers. We came here for a rest on a Thursday late afternoon but stayed to see the huge Yoga session as well as the social street dancing afterwards. Great place to people watch and soak in all the New York experience. We could hang out here all day.Tip: Blue Bottle coffee is across the street with the killer ice coffee New Orleans style. if hungry then go get some baked goods from Les Pan Quotidien or Martin Kayser, or a burrito and tacos from Chipole, or Royce Chocolate for some sweets.
Beautiful. It is a beautiful park. Surrounded by sky scrapers. Full of life. We enjoyed our time there. You should definitely go there if you'd like to take some pictures.
Nice place to stop and rest. Stopped here to take a break from walking the area. Good food court, street vendors and lots of places to sit in the shade, talk and relax.

Beautiful Park. We were able to walk to Bryant Park from our hotel, it backs onto the library, lots of seating available and we were able to get lunch from any number of places nearby and come and sit in the park, eat lunch and people watch. They have seats and tables laid out around a lawn however we did not see people seat or walk on the grass! There are board games to play on some tables and a kids library. I believe they show films here in the evening during the summer . If you visit new york make sure you visit Bryant Park.

The best city park I have ever been to. Both my wife and I were delighted by this French-style park/square. Except I don't know of any European city park, let alone a French one, as good (and I live in France). It is all the more inspiring if you know the story behind its restoration from the no-go area of the late 70s and early 80s to a place which is both beautiful and full of things to do - play table-tennis or chess or a host of different games; borrow a book and read...or leave one for others to do so; eat some simple but delicious food in or from the various cafes and booths. Pick up one of the many leaflets about the park and what it offers from the racks distributed around it.

I love this park. This park is obviously very well run. As well as looking beautiful and well maintained, there are lots of activities available like free table tennis, mini golf, a reading room, yoga. I loved it and went and fetched a coffee and secured myself a swing seat! Bliss!

Lovely place, full of activities. If you're in NYC during the summer, don't forget to check Bryant Park programme of activities! There are plenty of things going on there - open air movies, yoga, literature meetings, etc. It is a place where life happens. If you are a kind of traveller that likes to feel how is to be a local, attending one of the activities of Bryant Park is a good way to do it. Also, you can check the programme in advance in their website. Have fun! :)

Urban Life with Greenery. A green oasis in one of the busiest corners of Manhattan, this park has whatever you want. Stop to munch a hotdog from a nearby vendor, listen to musicians, watch kids play ping pong, eat at a fancy restaurant, or head to the library.

People watching at its best!. We love Bryant Park. It's not huge like Central Park but offers a lot. Big green space in the middle, beautiful fountain, bocce courts and ping-pong. People playing chess, reading , chatting and people watching. There's also a carousel! They even have an outdoor reading room offering books and newspapers! Every time we come to NYC, we pick up a pizza at Joey's and enjoy lunch in the park!
Look at the statues. Very cool statues throughout the park. A very pretty green space. Many chess games going on. Needs a bathroom!

Re-aquaintance. My husband and I recently stumbled into Bryant Park while meeting up with family in the city-hadn't spent time here in almost 50 years!Wow, has it been transformed!! Sort of like Washington Square Park used to be-people strolling, juggling, doint Tai-Chi. Plenty of places to sit. Sun and shade.
Lovely. A lovely oasis to sit, relax and enjoy a latte in the middle of the city. Beautifully lit at night with great views of the Chrysler building in the background.

50th birthday. We love bryant park , when we where in NYC the world cup was on , it was great to stop and eat and drink watching some of the matches with people from around the world, its our favourite park to stop for a well earned beer or two after a day of siteseeing
Cute place. We loved this little park just off time square. They had areas to play games, areas for the kids and tables and chair around to relax in the sun.
Just stunning. A great spot just to sit and soak up the atmosphere plenty of places to sit and relax. Was there on a sunny day

Free Juggling Lessons. We visited during the lunch hour and there were so many different things going on in the park. The highlight was watching the FREE juggling class taking place near the Chipotle, which is where we also happened to eat lunch.
Very nice park. Great little park in the middle of the city. Nice place to sit and relax and take a break from sightseeing or shopping.
Lively. Always seemed to be something going on when ever we went by. Vibrant and busy in the evening especially when I visited because it was hot.

A lovely space next to Grand Central Station - and a delightful refreshment hut!. We managed to take a pause from the heat & the hustle around 42nd Street/Grand Central Station by popping into Bryant Park for a sit down and a drink. A lovely haven in the midst of the commercial chaos and surrounding sky scapers. And what a delight to enter an exchange with the young lady dispensing drinks from the small cafe on finding no hot tea was served - and finishing with the nicest orange juice of my visit. Great little park.
Nice place to rest and see and being seen. Great place but need more restrooms. Lot of food to eat from street vendors as well as the coffee shop.

Fantastic atmosphere. Was sat there yesterday in 85 degree heat with hundreds of people enjoying a live band. The atmosphere was fantastic and people watchers will love it. Nice place to chill and watch the world go by.

Bryant park. We didn't find this till the last day but it's worth a visit just to relax for a couple of hours. There is so much to do but I'm assuming only in summer. There are plenty of cafés for takeaway eats, and the entertainment is abundant and all free. There are yoga classes, juggling classes, foreign language classes, as well as music recitals, a reading area, table tennis and stories to listen to. All in all well worth a visit.

Relaxing park near the Public Library. On our way to the Public Library, we passed by this park. It is small but a nice anď relaxing place. I Spent around 30 minutes here before finally going to the library

Surely the best park in the world. Thank god my wife booked us in at a nearby hotel, otherwise we'd have missed so so much. This park has its own community and it's only about 5 mins walk from Times Square. From Shakespeare plays, to yoga, to boot camp, to dancing, and open air cinema, this park has loads and loads of FREE varied family activity. You can also just sit or lay down on the many chairs/benches or grass should you wish and watch the interesting NYC life go by.....
Rather small. But worths to visit. Unusual park surrounded by skyscrapers. Otherwise, nothing special inside - big lawn and places to sit and rest.
Beutifullll paradaise. We have a toure and just went on this park for a snack and we stay for 4 h ther so this is a GEM in NYC its soo nice and plesent hope you will have a great time like me
Go in the morning.... It fills up like a busy day at a very busy place (dr suess right) but before lunch in the early morning it is quiet and beautiful; worked on my laptop for 2-3 hrs. Really cool.

Beautiful Park Right Behind Historic Public Library. There isn't much you can dislike about Bryant Park during Christmas. Heated 'mini-cabins' sprout up all over selling a little something for everyone. Vendors also sell warm cider, roasted chestnuts, cookies, and more to munch on as you slowly make your way through the shops. The ice skating rink is busy but not crowded and the tree was beautiful! The lights reflect off the of the back of the historic New York Public Library. Overall, it is a sight to behold and an absolute must-see should you be lucky enough to see New York City during the holiday season!
Wedding Belle in the Grill. Lovely green space, lively yet restful in the heart of Mid town Manhattan. We were attending a Wedding at the Bryant Park Grill. Amazing food in a magical setting.

Petite and cute. This park is conveniently located near all of uptown manhattan's world class places. Just about 200metres north of this park is the world famous Broadway Times Sq. Its also 5 min walk to the Empire state building. Its also just about 100 metres to the famous 5th Avenue. Its about 7min walk to the Grand Central station. This park is very small but beautiful and aays packed to capacity probably people just taking a rest after visiting the landmark points in its circumference.

fun on a nice day. It was a nice day to sit outside for a drink and some food. Bryant park was a great place to do it. Bartender was really friendly and my appetizer was good. Didn't stay long enough but wanted to explore more of NYC

Relax in New York. A lovely park, very central. A great stop for a time to relax. Enjoy an ice cream from the kiosk. Nice to sit and people watch, as not only do the tourists visit, but the locals take their lunch breaks there too.

First visit to NYC. Found this little park on our first outing to explore. Loved the games area where you can play a number of different board games, and there is someone on hand to explain how to play some of the less familiar games. A lovely little green oasis amongst the skyscrapers.

What a relaxing spot in the center of so much hubub!. We sat here after an afternoon theatre matinee and enjoyed coffee and people watching. It's beautiful! Trees shade from the sun or the lawn allows you to sit in the sun. The park is filled with families, couples, friends, and we even saw a marriage proposal! There are plenty of tables and chairs. If not, you can sit on the steps. The kiosks selling food and drinks are efficient, reasonably priced for NYC, and the offerings are very tasty.
Nice park. Very nice park, but a little dirty and sad to see so many homeless people sleeping in the park. Very crowded as well as all the shuttle buses stop there.

A relaxing place that's close to many things. We were in NY for a week, doing touristy things. Bryant Park was only a couple blocks from our hotel and was a much more relaxing place to read and hang out. We'd grab our Kindles and a couple Cokes and head for a shady table.The park is pretty big with plenty of tables ringing the central lawn. The carousel and kid's stuff was on one side of the park and the restaurants on another. Other areas were nice and quiet.Around the park were several coffee shops and delis. Many people, us included, would grab food/drink and take it into the park.

Many attractions. This park was lovely to sit in the watch the world go by, everybody seems to come and have their lunch here and a lot going on, jugglers they were willing to teach you, free papers and a library for the children sponsored by HSBC bank.

trendy park. There are always vendors in Bryant Park. The coffee shop is excellent! You get to meet people from different cultures some are friendly and some are not so friendly but a you always learn something new!
Fabulous. Such a wonderful place to wander through of an evening with so many people out enjoying themselves dining at cafes, ice skating, shopping at stalls or just walking around.
Nice park.. Very beautiful park it is kept up nicely for visitors. Nice place to catch the trolley. Just lovely.

Beautiful little gem!. This wonderful park was very close to the hotel we stayed at during our trip. It is just behind NYC library. There is always plenty of free activities going on if you want to take an hour away from the craziness of the city. There is free art materials, a reading 'room', ping pong, juggling and more. Worth a visit!

Always Something New Going On!. A lovely place to find a place to sit and take it all in; get something to eat, "fall into something" you had no idea was going on; and just some great vistas in every direction

Lovely Setting. Bryant Park is a 9.603-acre privately managed public park located in the New York City borough of Manhattan. It is located between Fifth and Sixth Avenues and between 40th and 42nd Streets in Midtown Manhattan.Although technically the main building of the New York Public Library is located within the park, effectively it forms the park's functional eastern boundary, making Sixth Avenue the park's primary entrance. Although part of the New York City Department of Parks and Recreation, Bryant Park is managed by the private not-for-profit corporation Bryant Park Corporation. The park is cited as a model for the success of public-private partnerships.Bryant Park is built entirely over an underground structure which houses the New York Public Library's archives. In the 1980s, the park was closed to the public and excavated. The new library facilities were built below ground level and the park was restored above it.
Beautiful in the city, worth a look. It was a very well kept, pretty park. I saw it in the evening and there were still people using the area.

Oasis!. Such a pretty and calm location in the middle of Manhattan. We stumbled upon this spot after visiting the NY Library and the place was so nice that we came back for brunch the next day and spent an hour watching the flowers grow and people playing table tennis. There are dozens of free tables and chairs and many eateries near by to get take out coffees etc.

Small Park...Lots of People Sitting on the Grass. There is a small carousel for the kids...many restaurants...lots of places to lay out your blanket and chairs is you don't have a blanket and places for kids to run or to just sit and read. Sometimes they have a play there, There is even a giant fountain for making wishes.
Park Life. Peaceful and interesting, coffe shops market stalls and flower gardens. Central to where we stayed. Views from the park were amazing, would definitly visit again next trip.

What a transformation. This was a scary place when I visited as a young person; now it's so pleasant it's eerie...perfect on a sunny spring day. Should have left more time for coffee and people-watching...

A Breath of Fresh Air. If you need a break, visit this park to relax and enjoy the weather (if nice). Plenty of seating and a couple places to purchase beverages or take in the Bryant Park Grill (good food).
