Spring Saturday. Bryant Park is a gem - filled with tables under the trees. We loved the Saturday morning Bocce (or bolle?) players.

Best little park in Manhattan. We loved Bryant Park where everyone seemed to be a local having their lunch in the noontime sunshine. I grabbed a steamed hotdog even though we had prepared a lunch picnic. People played mini-golf, boules, it felt like we were like the locals just taking some time out from our busy day to sit in a park

Love this place. I have always gravitated to Bryant Park, winter or summer. It is a nice little oasis and the restaurant and cafe look good, but not tried them yet. In winter it is a skating rink and in summer somewhere to chill out.
Always Beautiful in the winter time! . I love how Bryant Park is in the winter time. There's always nice shops in Bryant Park along with tables and places to sit. I love how it looks in wintertime.
Rangers game!. Noticed a crowd when walking by the park. There was a large screen set up with people watching the Rangers play Tampa. Big outdoor party and lots of fun!

Lovely Park. I had no idea that Bryant Park existed and we came upon it by accident. Such a gem in the middle of the city.
At night it is all lit up and it is as bright as day.
Great place to hang out and people watch.
park. Great place to sit outside and relax. Lot of people doing the same and real close to our hotel. Lots of table and chairs to sit.

Floral escape in the heart of the city. Times Square is glitzy and gaudy and fun yet only 3 blocks away is a quiet, green oasis, Bryant Park, with a beautiful fountain, lots of chairs, take-out food shops and even a lunch time pianist to accompany your sandwich. The park has the most charming public bathroom facilities, kept immaculate. There's also a gorgeous restaurant if you want to spend a bit more for lunch.

A haven. In the middle of noisy, busy part of Manhatten, Bryant Park is a haven. Tree lined and grassy but with excellent salad and coffee bar and bigger restaurant if needed. There are table tennis and chess tables an open air library or just comfortable chairs and tables to sit and read, write journals, eat lunch or just watch life
Great Place behind the public library. Went there to relax and have a few drinks.....it was a great people viewing place and there was a clown school going on. Lots of fun.
Love this hideaway!. I love Bryant Park for it's atmosphere especially in early evening. The outside bars/cafes are set out with little lites and everyone gathers for a drink/food and to unwind.
Nice, quaint park - Library is at this location. This was a nice part to sit and just admire the location, there is a carousel for the kids and pack a snack, visit the library next door.

What a wonderful gathering place. We walked t Bryant Park twice during our stay. There is an area with board games you can sit down and play like checkers or chess. We also played a lawn game called Kubb. There was a small putting green and plenty of green space. People everywhere. A 2 piece jazz band playing at one end, the carousel going in the middle and the amazing NY library at the end of the block.

a relaxing place in a stressed city. Just sitting in Bryant is relaxing...a nice enviroment with stolling people, people just sitting there, talking, reading or taking a coffee...I just like beeing there.

The nicest place in midtown. Bryant Park is just beautiful - when the sun is shining you can always find a nice spot to rest. The pace of the Big City makes you love this breathing space.The old carousel is both wonderful to watch and so nice for young visitors.
Great place for nice weather. The park is perfect like every other in NYC! Great to have a quick lunch and rest for long walks!!!!
Nice Park. The park is nice but nothing special. It may be better when the weather is better or during the weekend, but nothing special in the week during the day

My Favourite Park in New York.. The most enjoyable dinner I had in New York was at Bryant Park. Seated at a table with takeaway Chipotle under the shade of the willowy trees as Shakespeare played a few metres away from me, it was pure heaven and a refreshing contrast to the noise of Fifth Avenue.

Really unexpected. A quiet green park in the hustle of a city with lots of tables and chairs and other seating areas.
Beautiful lawn and flower beds. Local people having picnic food and just enjoying themselves.
No rubbish , no graffiti , what a treasure to have.
A surprise. Walking back to our hotel, we came upon this delight park surprising quiet resting place It's clearly a New Yorker place. Happy we found this place

Quite Visit. Very relaxing and really enjoyed the peace and quiet, Lovely setting and sat down and watche dthe birds for a bit. What a nice place - hard to believe it wa sfull of drug dealers in the 1980's!!!!

A place to relax in the city.. I love sitting in Bryant Park watching the people go buy. We were there on Saturday evening when there was an outdoor concert. They have places to sit and drink, a cafe and restaurant, space for the children to run around whilst you rest your feet. I was also there in the winter when the park was a skating rink with bars and outdoor shops to buy gifts or taste some alternative cuisine. I love Bryant Park for its variety. A great place in the city.

Wow, what a place to people watch. We visited this place twice. It is a microcosm of New York. We had a drink in an outdoor pub with people who had just completed their work day. What a buzz. The service was great and typical prices.We went back to eat an out door lunch. It was full of office workers but we still got seats.Around the park you will see chess players, ping pong and reading area. It is a must visit place as it is always busy but full of fun.Given how busy the place is, it is so tidy. Some one is constantly emptying bins and cleaning the walk ways.You will feel like a real New Yorker here.

What a great space to have in NY City. This is a lovely park situated next to the City Library and in the Garment District. A short stroll from Grand Central Station and Broadway. There are a number of activities dotted around the periphery of the park including an open library/reading area as well as some games/activities for young and old kids. A number of bars overlook the park but there's a nice cafe/kiosk at one end with plenty on offer. I particularly liked the vast amount of free seating available for visitors. A fine place to while away some time away from the hustle and bustle of the NY sidewalks.

A beautiful little park. Our hotel was nearby so we spent a lot of time here. It reminded me of the parks in Paris. Lots of people stroll here. I love that you can borrow different board games to play from a little stand there for free. There's also a restaurant here where you can eat inside out called the Bryant Park Grill, and a kiosk where you can buy drinks and pastries. In the winter there's an ice skating rink here. This is a lovely oasis in the City.

Lovely little green space in centre of Manhattan. Found this by chance. Lovely green space to stop for a break amidst the noise and hustle of Manhattan. Cafe and award winning restrooms. Also free WiFi which is a bonus.

My favorite area for breakfast in the park. This park is absolutely beautiful! My friends and I got coffee and breakfast to go and came to Bryant Park and thoroughly enjoyed our morning. The park offers a great lawn to relax in, chairs and tables to sit at, swings, an area for kids, chess and checkers tables, fountains, etc... The trees are beautiful and the landscape is well maintained. Take in this park if you're ever in NYC!
good food.. loved the environment but food was ok. The people appeared to be very nice and well educated but food remain average.
Great little Park in the heart of Manhattan. Lovely place to sit and relax - do some people watching while you sip your starbucks drink or have a bite to eat. Lovely little park in the city.
Love love love!. I lived in the city and was oblivoius to this park's existence until recently. I love it! So picturesque, peaceful and a great place to simply hang out.

Little unexpected gem !. We came across Bryants Park on our way to visit Grand Central Station. It is a lovely location to relax and unwind in- very green, peaceful, attractive ( it overlooks the magnificent Library building) and popular with locals and visitors alike. There are a number of refreshment options dotted around( mainly cafes, but an odd restaurant), and plenty of seating. A great stopping place to rest our weary legs for a while !!

My Favourite Park In The Whole World!. Every visit I have ever made to New York I always need to go and sit in Bryant Park for a while. It's one of my favourite places and we came here a few times during our two week stay earlier this month. The grass was closed off at first to protect it whilst it grew but then opened up on 11th May. It's beautiful. It just has the nicest atmosphere right in the heart of the busy city. There is even free wi-fi. I never saw any but they were advertising summer fitness classes such as yoga and tai chi which is lovely. And the carousel is so cute!

TRANQUIL. Visited here on my own whilst shopping - men had gone to Intrepid aircraft carrier. Lovely tranquil spot to sit and sip a Prosecco cocktail. Bowls green and Italian language class all added to the atmosphere

Lovely spot on a beautiful day. Great spot for people watching and having a sit on some lovely green grass.
Lots of activities - toilets very clean but a long line up!
Nice spot to chill in the city. Staying at andaz so Bryant park on our doorstep lovely park with nice places for food and drink stop by this little oasis in NY

Nice in the early morning.. Got here around 8 am and it was so peaceful to just sit and watch the world go by. It is very well kept and a beautiful piece of nature in the heart of the city. It was also perfectly safe, no worries like in Central Park.

A little oasis in midtown!. A beautiful park bang in the middle of Manhattan where you can stop to people watch, read and relax, and have some lunch. Very well kept and tidy. Although its well used there is always a space to grab a seat in between sightseeing or shopping. Food and drinks available and reasonably priced. Love it!

Lovely little park. Went here 3 or 4 times, lots of little table and chairs to sit and eat lunch in the sunshine with a view of the Empire State Building and the Chrysler building. Smaller than Central Park but I prefered it.

Pleasant cafe, in a great position.. On a warm day, after a tour of the Library next door, we had a pleasant meal here. The outdoor cafe overloks the lovely Bryant Park, a great midtown place to relax.
Quick visit. I've only been here during the Christmas season. So I was pleasantly surprised at the activity going on there when we recently walked through it.
Nice park. At the end of a very tiring day, feet hurt, just wanted somewhere to sit down! Was this where I saw beehives? Can't remember now!

Urban Paradise - Our Favorite NYC Park. We absolutely love Bryant Park, and its our favorite park in the city. In Bryant Park (unlike Central Park) you always feel like you are in the city while simultaneously being in a peaceful green oasis. Its an ideal spot for admiring architecture, people watching and getting what we think are the best hotdogs in the entire city. A visit to Bryant park is never complete without visiting one of the world’s great libraries (New York Public Library) and its famous Lions. Just take it all in, it simply is Urban Paradise.

Nice experience, though somewhat crowded and commercialized. Back when I worked in the area -- during the Paleozoic Era -- this was a den of bums, junkies, and undesirables. It was completely transformed during the Giuliani and Bloomberg administrations, and is now a great space, though with the requisite restaurants and other commercial touches. The game rentals are a nice touch, though. Nice place to stop on a warm day. Watch out on the tiny chairs scattered throughout, though, or you could find yourself on your butt; they're minimally functional.

A Peaceful Interlude. Nice to see green grass freshly laid following the winter & a variety of bulbs & annuals surrounding the park. The trees & characters sitting around the park provided a terrific atmosphere. To top it off, there are a few coffee/cake "shops" around that enable you to partake in some yummy treats whilst soaking up the atmosphere

A very special park. Right in the heart of Manhattan sits a wonderful park with a really special atmosphere. Lots of tables and chairs to enable you to sit, read and relax for hours on end taking in the spirit of Manhattan. A number of restaurants and bars to choose from within the park and lots more just across the road.if you fancy a sandwich or a latte while you relax. A Great place to soak up the NYC atmosphere. Fabulous reading library as well.

Surprising park. Came across this park by accident. Beautifully maintained with lots of seating areas and kiosks and takeaways near by. Very popular with Empire State Building and Library in background

Lovely park. Walked past here in the day and came back in evening. Very nice chilled place to just sit and enjoy. We went for meal in nearby restaurant and then just sat and enjoyed the park. Pretty gardens and chairs tables to sit.

Perfect when weather permits. Bryant Park is an oasis within few minutes walk from Grand Central Station. There are a couple of bars where you can buy food or drinks and there are many ways to sit down with your own Beverages/food/snacks if you don't want to buy them at the bars. Also, on good days, it's great to sit at the big lawn in the middle of the park and just enjoy.

Great for live, free entertainment. A lovely oasis in the centre of Manhatten. Go on a weekend when there is often some entertainment. This time it was Two Gentlemen of Verona, set between Mulberry Street in NYC and Milan! All done in a modern style but using Shakespeare's original language. Take a drink and something to eat, chairs and tables are set out for you to use.

Great at Christmas time. There was an ice rink, Christmas tree and lights everywhere making this a magical place to visit. There were many little shops to buy various food, Christmas trinkets, etc. Plenty of places to sit and enjoy your surrounds and well kept toilet facilities - though there can be a line to get in.

Loveliest spot in the city. Bryant park is the sweetest place in NYC, a green, lively, happy spot amidst the sky skrapppers. Right behind the nyc library, it's the best place to sit and have a takeaway lunch, looking at jugglers, sun-bathers, and high school kids stretching thier social muscels.

We really liked it here. Bryant park was just 2 blocks from the hotel we were staying at in New York. It's basically a big public park with lots of cafe's, bars, street vendors around the edges of it. It has got loads of tables and chairs all around the park, anyone can go and sit in there, you see tourists, families, workers on their lunch breaks. It made me smile to think that if something like this was in England someone would wreck it or would have stolen all of the tables and chairs after a few days of it being open. Places like this in England tend to lock down their furniture. We found this just by accident really, we came out of our hotel after we had landed in New York and just stumbled upon it, we just sat outside with a soft drink and enjoyed the weather. We said we would come back one night because it was so peaceful and relaxing but New York is so big and there is so much to do we never found time.

Excellent place to visit with Christmas Village.. Visited the weekend before Christmas with my daughter, lovely park and the Christmas Village had some great unique items we bought for gifts and ourselves. They have food and beverages. It is a great view with nature and the skyline. The "frozen fountain was not frozen yet when we were there,it is lovely!

got to have a drink on the terrasse. great park, wendsday night is dancing night, lot of dancers !
the atmospher is relax and the trees are really huge

Always something going on there.... Love that park, there is always something to do, to read, to eat. You can just grab some food nearby and sit on the grass in summer, take some classes, or ice-skating in winter. Love it.

BEST park in NYC. I love Bryant Park! You can people Watch here for hours. They have tables and chairs (and A LOT of them), so you can bring your food, coffee or whatever. When we are in NYC we love taking a break here, and perhaps bring a book and read for a while. Also, I've never seen a public restroom this nice before :-)

Great People Watching Location. Bryant Park is one of my favorite places in NYC to people watch. During the holidays, the park is turned into a market with vendors selling wares for holiday gifts. There were many interesting crafts and gift ideas, something for everyone. Bryant Park also houses a seasonal ice skating rink that is fun to watch others skate if you don't participate yourself. I've also been to Bryant Park in the spring and summer. The park has plenty of seating at bistro tables which make it a wonderful place to enjoy breakfast or lunch from a nearby vendor. During the summer, don't miss Broadway in Bryant Park which showcases current Broadway shows performing selections from the show at lunchtime for free.

Sanctuary in the Midst of the Bustling City!. We accidentally came across this gem of a park. It is manicured, clean and a refuge when walking around this incredible city! Take a moment to relax and take in your surroundings...
Beautiful.... It is small...it is common...it is simple...and that is why it is beautiful to just grab a sandwich from the nearby options and bring it here to eat...loved it!
Breathe in deeply . Green calm fresh and quiet. An oasis in concrete Midtown with little eateries of all types around it I recommend the Waffle kiosk on the 6th Ave end

Great spot in NY. Bryant Park is such a great spot to stop by and either walk around the grass, enjoy the fountain, or check out a chess game to play or just sit at one of the tables and people watch. There are spots to plug in and recharge your phone or computer. Our children rode the mid-sized merry-go-round that was only $3 per ticket. The green trees and grass give your eyes and spirit an nice respite from the steel city scape.

Hop on hop off bus leaves from there. Cute little park. Very relaxing for NYC. Good atmosphere in the heart of Manahattan. Clean . All the main hop on and off buses leave from there. Restroom facilities

Wonderful in autumn/spring--a horror in winter!. Worst example of commercialization in this hemisphere! Central Park is a spectacular respite from the crush of humanity; Bryant Park reminds is an example that the 'highest bidder can dominate and destroy the character of a park concept. The landscape is exceedingly commercial, and this model, while innovative in the 1970s, does not work today.

A little jewel in th city. This is a great park for the young children (adults too). there is a carousel , plenty of seats , swings, benches, fountain. They had books and games to borrow for free, They also had a little putting green to use for free. Also a wooden ball game that was kinda cool. Of course there is always people watching and catching a bite to eat from a vendor

Classic Urban Oasis. Flanked by the Central NY Public Library, HBO, Bank of America and Met Life offices, Bryant Park is a busy urban oasis that hosts events like ice skating, movie nights, corporate events, concerts and outdoor cafes. Most of all, it's a bit of green tranquility amid the chaos that is Midtown.

Bryant Park is great for the locals.. If I were a tourist and there was nothing scheduled to happen at the park, I wouldn't go out of my way to see the park.BUT, if u happen to be there during the summer, the city puts on old movies in the park at dusk on Mondays FOR FREE! Get there around 4 ( at least) to grab a spot on the grass(once work gets out at 5 it will be hard to get a spot) and have a little picnic. Then once the sun goes down u can enjoy a great movie under the stars with your friends. Most ppl bring snacks, sandwiches and wine(don't make it obvious as open containers of liquor are not allowed in NYC).Happy hour is pretty good at the restaurant, but don't expect it to be cheap. The summer is a great time for free activities in NYC. Get a copy of Time Out Magazine New York and it will list everything for the week.
Beautiful at night. Well kept beautiful park in the middle of the city. A great place to enjoy a coffee and people watch.

Major FREE midtown gathering. Each time I pass by Bryanat Park, I am still to this day incredulous at all the major demographic changes - revolutionary to be exact - that have occurred on NYC over the last 20 years. As a child growing up in the prosperous suburbs, I was repeatedly warned by family and teachers to avoid the Times Square area at ALL costs. Bryant Park, like most the neighborhood, was filled with drug dealers, drug addicts, street walkers, beggars, homeless people - just the worse face of America. A Russian TV station from the old USSR did in fact a documentary on the homelessness and destitution in America - and filmed exclusively around Bryant Park/Times Square.Fast forward 20 years to today and Bryant Park is the "Jardin Luxembourg" of NYC. Clean, hip, cool, trendy cafes and kiosks, real green grass without dog litter. It all shows why foreigners are willing to pay $5, $10, $50 million for an apartment in NY!!

A garden of delights!. It is my favorite spot in midtown. A veritable gem, centuries and hundreds of miles away from Times Square being only a couple blocks from it. The library right there, the carousel with Edith Piaf's songs, Goethe's bust next to it, the lawn to stretch out on and an old world style fountain. A reading room on one of the meadows. And a ping-pong table. And music shows at times. And peace and quiet and books. And all of it right by the subway stations with most of the city's trains.

An Oasis in the City. I visit Grand Central and the Ny Public Library everytime I'm in the city. Manhattan is wonderful, and so busy, it's nice to grab some lunch and head to the Bryant park after I check out two of my fav places and relax before I continue on my next adventure

A Litle Oasis. Great place to grab a cup of coffee or an ice cream. Kick off your shoes for half an hour or more and watch the world go by from this little oasis of calm in the hustle hustle of the city.
a gem of a park. We passed this park, and then stopped and strolled around it. Chess players, people enjoying the park and the excellent bar and restaurant on the edge of it.

Oasis in the city. A lovely, well-cared for park to rest in, right in centre of the busyness of the city. The reading room is a delight - wide choice of books to read whilst relaxing on one of the many available seats - some with tables. A little branch of Le Pain Quotidien in a kiosk means top-quality coffee and eats are on hand.

Good in every season. During the winter, it's a slam dunk for their Holiday Shops (Max Brenner, Sabon, awesomely fun socks, authentic Irish gifts, baby clothes, and an abundance of handmade jewelry, THE BEST French Truffles from No Chewing Allowed, and killer empanadas and frickles!). During the Spring, once the grass is back open you can grab a lunch from Wichcraft or Hale and Hearty (just on 6th Ave, across from the park) and eat in the sunshine, or enjoy an outdoor movie in the summer!
Delightful oasis. Warm weather brings everyone to Bryant park, it's just a beautiful place to relax at the restaurants or on the grass.

Relax in the centre of craziness. Found this little Park on the first day of my stay in NYC.Returned from time to time to just sit down, have a cup of coffee, watching the people enjoying their life, writing, reading...Loved it - I will leave New York today and I'm pretty sure I will spend my last hour exactly there :-)

perfect for early morning run. perfect scenery if you choose to jog/run around the area. early morning means very few people around, no crowd rushing. very relaxing. there were squirrels looking for food, dogs being walked. babies pushed on their strollers, people on bikes, and runners/joggers.

Great people watching. Bryant Park is a great location to take your lunch and just sit and watch the world go by. I loved how there was an outdoor "reading room" for kids as well as adults. Convenient place to relax before doing more shopping or site seeing.
Nice quite park. This is a beautiful park. It is a great place to relax, read a book, people watch, etc. It's a small park, benches and tables so you can just enjoy the scenery,.
Nice and peaceful. A small square of garden in the city... Nice to enjoy a drink or your lunch... You can sit on a chair and enjoy the view

Lovely park in the city.. Well kept. Plenty of places to sit. Light refreshment stand in park. Very friendly staff. On the day we were there there was a mobile newspaper and book reading area. Nice touch.

Oasis in a sea of people. lovely park to sit and watch the world go by or eat your sandwiches. There are lovely toilets as well....very Art Deco and have fresh flowers and an attendant, no charge to use either!There is a reading room, which basically consists of trolleys with books and newspapers for anyone to read free whilst in the park.There are places to eat or get snacks and drinks, so a great place to head forWe were told it gets used more than Central Park, which by the volume of people in it when we went is true!
Great little park. Great little park for gathering. Nice table and chairs for relaxing and getting a little green space.
rest. I love the park, the cafes around, the stores around the park. There are patisseries, and a Turkish store also. And the best is the NewYork Library. You can visit the library. that is wonderful
Nice park. Well worth a wander round on a nice summer days. Quiet busy as it is very popular with the surrounding office workers of which there are thousands

Morning yoga. Green spot among among the tall buildings, just behind the library. Nice place to relax and to watch life pass by. In the mornings you can participate in yoga classes. Later a coffee and the latest news papers.

Fantastic Inner City Park. We loved this park. We played table tennis, they had board games set up for you to play compliments of the Park, there was free Wi-Fi & the sun was shining. A beautiful sanctuary in the middle of the City.
beautiful. an oasis in the middle of the city. It is a great place to relax. it also has free wifi! it is overcrowded when people get out from work

Loved this little park. I have visited this park several times during all seasons but Christmas was amazing. The holiday market was a wonderful place to wander around and the ice skating rink was so much fun!

Nice park area to see. This small park near the NY public library is a nice stroll. There are many benches to relax in and people watch. The park was clean and free of any type of transients/homeless people.

Sit Silently & Watch the NYC World Turn: An Absolute Must (In my humble estimation). I simply love this place: amongst the hustle & bustle, noise & fumes, of the big city, Bryant Park is the equivalent of the oasis in the middle of a desert.If you really want to see the NYC world turn, then sit here for an hour or so, at any time of day, and watch the people, events and wildlife, you'll be surprised at the richness and diversity and all that makes NYC what it is.During my seven day stop, I always ended up back here: whether for breakfast, lunch or a light dinner - it really was my watering hole, where I could either plan the day ahead or review what I'd achieved and done. There is always something happening whether yoga/qi gong/fitness in the early mornings, to evening theatre & entertainments. And even if it is quiet, there are always the people, getting on with their lives, to watch.The Park is very convenient to get to with it's own subway station, and is very close to Grand Central and Times Square etc.
Great fam fun . Full of fun. So many different people doing different things. Never boring great for kids. They have food entertainment entertainment etc. Should def visit if ur n the city

Cute but small park. This is a pretty small but cute park. It's very restful and on a nice day it's very pleasant to relax on the benches and just people watch. There seemed to be some free performances of Shakespeare plays planned for May, June and July in the park, which are probably nice to see.As a sidenote I also managed to find free wifi here. While you're there, make sure you stop by the library that's just around the corner- it's gorgeous.
An Oasis In NYC. Brilliant Oasis from the Hustle and Bustle of New York, lots of people using the park to get away from their busy lives. Coffe and snacks were available and ice cream mmmm!

Wow Bryant Park. Possibly one of the best community spots in NY. I have been to Bryant park in all seasons and no other park, in my opinion, changes with the seasons like Bryant park does. The fact that it is right in the middle of Manhattan helps. Must Must go.
small but cute. Bryant park is small but in a fantastic location. it was a lovely quiet break from the noise and people of the city.

Beautiful and a great respite. There is a beautiful fountain here, and it's a very restful spot during the day even though there were little craft booths and activities happening. Great "Green" location not far from Times Square and from the Courtyard Marriott at 40th.
BEAUTIFUL AND INTERESTING PARK. We liked the park, you can sit here and enjoyed the place, drink a coffee, play chess, or just to watch the people, it is like an oasis in the middle of the city.

Great place to chill or have breakfast. Love this place, quiet, relaxing (especially early morning). Been here before at Christmas - has ice rink, then not so quiet. Grab breakfast in a local takeaway bring into park and just chill

this is food truck paradise. you can get anything you want here including mixed drinks.
i got a lobster roll with 1/4 pound of lobster meat.

Little bit of heaven. Red hot day and we sat around the grass, hard to imagine you were in the middle of New York. Had a cold beer at one of the bars surrounding the park. $24 for 3 bottles of Coors Light...ouch !!

sunny day hangout. We usually stop here to rest out feet after a day of beating the streets sightseeing and shopping. We can usually find an empty seat near the lawn or at the bar on the terrace. It was particularly busy on this sunny spring afternoon, with loads of metro sexual males and single gals swigging cocktails and choking on the spring pollen. Really, it was lovely; the carousel was operating and the lawn was packed with people chilling and enjoying the beautiful day.

Exhale…. An oasis in the city. Plane trees, folding chairs on the large square lawn and along the gravel paths, free WiFi, bar & resto too. A gorgeous urban break from the thrum of Manhattan. Also there's a mobile library if would forget your book or your gadget.

Lunch in the park. Great place to pick up food - eg at Le Pain Quotidien - and eat outside in the summer.. Walking distance from Penn Station and some good shops in the vicinity as well as the New York Public Library.

Enjoyed walking around. I went to enjoy the free salsa lesson. I didn't realize it so close to 5th avenue. It's a quiet park with lots of people sitting around. There was rush near the fountain where the salsa lesson took place at 6 pm. I enjoyed seeing the energy of the people dancing. It was a fun evening,

Great oasis to sit and watch the world. Bryant Park is a great place in the middle of NYC to sit and watch the world. A lot of New Yorkers sit here to eat at lunchtime as there is much seating and many food outlets surrounding. It is at the back of the city library.
Great when the sun is shining. What a little gem in the City. Great to rest your tired legs after a gruelling mornings shopping! Beautiful in the spring with all the tulips and blossom on the trees.

Quaint spot to relax.... Not some where you hear as much about when planning a NY trip but worht a visit. There is a lovely, relaxed feel to the park due to its Parisian inspired design. Lots of little quirks such as game hire, cafes, places to sit in the sun and musicians and free concerts- lovely!

Beautiful little park in the middle of the city. We visited the park twice on our trip to NY. The first was around 9pm on a Saturday evening. There are tables and chairs for the public to use whether they are buying food from a stalls within the park or bringing their own. The atmosphere was very relaxed with mostly couples and families milling around the fountain and coffee shop, enjoying the warm evening air and unobtrusive lighting.The second time was on a sultry Tuesday afternoon around 12.30. The park was full of people enjoying the sun on their lunch break, Although there were lots of people sitting on the grass and using the table and chairs on the paved area, there was still plenty of space to sit without being shoulder to shoulder. Nothing like the scary place NY was portrayed as being in any movie from the 1980's!

Bryant Park. Visited in May & weather was superb, Bryant Park was so busy and had a great atmosphere, heaps of seated areas around a big green lawn in the middle. A bar / restaurant at one end with great cocktails but you will pay the high end of the price scale for them, about $15 a drink. Lots of people chilling, having a quick lunch break or meeting after work on a Friday night at The bar. Old fashioned carousel for the kids, small putting lawn there too.

What a haven. Lovely spot in such a busy part of the city. We were lucky enough to visit a few times but also on the day they reopened the grass. Lots of lovely people relaxing and the Merry Go Round is fab.

Cozy Stop in Manhattan. What an absolutely delightful place to spend a few hours!! This is at the Public library and is well worth a visit . Very serene, food available, carousel for kids. Music at different times. within walking distance of the Empire State building.

Nice place to rest. My wife and I have visited here before, during the holiday markets, this time, the weather was warm and just right, great place to relax and people watch, a favorite thing to do in the City

perfect for all seasons. We skate here in the winter and it's delightful. Nice music (Ella Fitzgerald not Lady Gaga - go to Wollman for that) city skyline, clean and free with your own skates = fabulous! Summer is nice under the trees with a book or meet up with friends for lunch. They have kids books for reading too.

Must visit place in Manhattan. May time to spend some time here when you visit the big apple. Located in the middle of Manhattan with cafes all around so you can grab a coffee or enjoy a lunch and sit and watch the world go by. At the library end there is a licensed cafe for you to sit outside, eat and enjoy a nice glass on wine. There are games to play, a reading area and there is no better people watching place in the middle of the City. There are Plenty of seats and tables and a restaurant in the park. Sun shines onto the park and is well looked after. Visited there several times over the years, always enjoy it immensely.

No Smoking is allowed. Ok. Someone needs to put more and bigger signs in the park saying 'No Smoking'!! Tonight I saw at least 4 people lighting up at about 8pm. Either that or have more security, rather than the one guy we saw, letting people know it's illegal to smoke in the park. And could result in a fine.

Ice skating. Ice skating was super. We went on a Sunday and it was way busier than Central Park the day before. The ice seemed also seemed much more slippy than Central park. Our kids didn't want to leave!

Great place to stop and soak in the atmosphere of the city. I like to stop here and have lunch or a coffee when I'm visiting New York. There always seems to be something happening in the park that gives you a taste of life in the city. There are couple of eateries in the parc itself or you can grab some takeout from the many restaurants in the area and dine al fresco in this green gem!

Brant Park is an oasis.. A beautiful green space with lots of activity in beautiful surroundings. Check out the ping pong tables on the north west corner and the carousel in the south east corner. Several nearby cafes and the NYC library next door make it a must see place when touring Manhattan.
So pretty. Sat in the park on a beautiful day a rest in calm amongst the flowers with a coffee and a pastry just a lovely place to sit for a while
perfect way to unwind at night!. Grab a beer and sit under the twinkle lights of the porch umbrella's and relax and enjoy with a nice selection of beer and wines and spirits.

Impressed!. This is a great little park with ample seating and lots to do. They have reading area with books available, game tables with a variety of board games, a carousel. The gardens are well taken care of . A nice spot to get away from the hecticness that is NYC.
bistro lunch. Food was delicious with great presentation. However, it was extremely noisy and difficult to hear my dining partner

Lovely. We ate in BryantPpark Grill on a Thursday. The staff were very attentive, The food was delicious. We both had the tomato soup to start, I had the spicy shrimp bolognese, while my friend had the salmon. The atmosphere was very nice & nice view of the park, The portions were ample, sadly we had no room for dessert.

Beautiful. I'm visiting this park and really enjoy the atmosphere... lots of sitting places and also free games provided like ping pong table, chess and reading area.
So I grab a chair, a latte and read a book while enjoying nice sunny afternoon :)
Beautiful Park. Not a lot to do here but it's a beautiful green space in the heart of Manhattan, some nice restaurants in the area.
Lovely park. This park is not big, it's near from the fifth avenue with several restaurants. You can see several outdoor activities in this park. Also, it's a good idea to have lunch and dinner here.
Great Park - Music, Ice Cream. This is in the middle of NY. You will probably hear music being played. Just sit and relax and enjoy the atmosphere. Buy a ice cream and just enjoy. Not to be missed.

Little Green paradise. This is a very nice little parks between the mess of the centre of the city: but is so nice and tidy, so green and beautful that you should not miss to sit in in for a while and enjoy the sun reading a book or a newpaper!

Great place to enjoy the outdoors!. Once you find a place to sit, it is a great place to enjoy lunch in the outdoors. If you are there close to lunchtime do realize seating is limited because everyone has beat you to a seat!

Great place to watch the world go by and having a coffee. Located in the middle of Manhattan with cafes around so you can grab a coffee and sit and watch the world go by. Plenty of seats and tables and a restaurant in the park. Sun shines onto the park and is well looked after. Visited there a few times.
Fav place in NY. I loved the park, however, our last day in NY, there was a thug trying to mug us in bright daylight.
An oasis. Lovely small park complete with gardens and carousel. Tables and chairs dotted about.Refreshment kiosks.

Oasis in middle of madness. Found Bryant park so relaxing in the middle of all the hustle and bustle, free wifi was great too.
Sun shone while we had a sandwich and coffee at one of the park tables

A place to sit a chill. One thing that I found lacking in New York was to find places where you could sit outside and have a beer or coffee... I'm sure there are hundreds but we found a bar here where you can sit and people watch... A nice prelude to the madness of Times Square.

A thing of beauty. We randomly stumbled accross this park on our walk back from Macys, and my gosh were we glad we did. Lots of seats surrounding a large grass patch and some fantastic surrounding buildings, amazing place to soak up the new york lifestyle and watch the world go by without being in the centre of the hustle and bustle. Few areas to get a drink or food but some corner shops close by for a quick refreshment. It also has the public library behind it which is a good
disappointed. We were disappointed in the opportunities that were lost to this park due to it being closed for numerous reasons.

Great Park.. in ANY season. Have become a somewhat regular visitor to Bryant Park.. I love how it changes, evolves, and adapts through the seasons. In summer, enjoy the Monday outdoor Film Festival, in winter (especially over the holidays) enjoy the skating rink, and Crafts Village.. year 'round fun in this midtown oasis behind the NY Public Library.

Brilliant in the winter. Came to Bryant Park a couple of times during stay in NYC. Ice skating rink and Christmas market was open. A few stalls had food and drinks; plenty of places to sit, eat and watch the world go by.
Ice skating. They had an ice rink with lots of little stalls. Getting ready for the Christmas shopping. Centrally located with easy access to the subway system.
Christmas at the park. A magical place to visit at night in the lead up to Christmas Christmas tree, Christmas market stay an hour or two drinks and food available
Nice place to rest. I like that Bryant park was so close to the Library and tons of places to sit and relax. Very well taken care of also.

lovely view. You can see the statue of liberty from Bryant park. They also have the globe that stood outside of the twin towers at Bryant park which is very emotional to look as its got a huge hole at the top of it from when the towers fell. Bryant park is definitely somewhere where you can go and relax and have a picnic or to just watch people coming and going from the ferry's over to the statue of liberty. This is also where you would get your tickets and the ferry over to the statue of liberty and Ellis island.
Pretty Area. We visited at night & the lights, fountain & flowers combined to make this a stunning area to sit. Also a restaurant on the edge of the park that looks good.
lovely. i didnt realise i had been to this park on previuos visits but hadnt remembered the name . it was lovely all in bloom with beautiful red poppys (i Think )

Nice park right in the middle of NYC. Both my wife and I spend great time together at the park. We pack our brunch and had it at the park and in the evening we also spent some time to play games (board games, jenga, etc) that is free for public too. Go to 42nd street to get your coffee at Starbucks and salads at Chops. The street is just opposite the park. At least it has better choice of food then the one in the park :)

A Nice Place to Visit in the Middle of Manhattan. Bryant Park is beautiful and a nice place to relax. You can casually walk through it or sit and relax on the many benches and tables. It is very picturesque for some great picture taking. Location is good, close to the New York Public Library.
Beautiful. Beautifully cleaned with coffee shops on site, especially during spring time...all the flowers are bloomed.

What a gem. Prior to my visit I hadn't heard of Bryant Park but as my hotel was very close we visited on our first evening in New York. What a wee gem - in the midst of all the madness that makes New York, Bryant Park is an oasis of calm where you can play table tennis or petanque or have fabulous waffles or a swift half after a hard day's sightseeing. I loved it!

Peacefulness on 42nd street. Public bathrooms! Small (3 stalls for ladies) but spotless. Even has flowers in vases in it. Located right next to the public library. It has a carousel. Lots of tables and chairs for hanging out. Various ala carte stands located along the edges.

Beautiful Park in the Heart of Midtown. This newly restored public park is beautiful and centrally located. Its a great place to grab a coffee or cold drink, sit, and watch the people go by. It's the one place in Manhattan that reminds me the most of Paris. Between Thanksgiving and Christmas there is a ice skating and a nice Christmas market. Definitely worth a visit.

A very special place. A peaceful place in the heart of the busy city. Plenty of tables and chairs to sit and enjoy the park, the buildings that surround it as well as the plants and trees. To make it even better, a little bar at one one, to sit and observe the world going by with your favourite tipple. Perfect when the sun shines.
Best piece of lawn in NYC. The surroundings, the lawn, the tables and chairs... Places to eat, to relax but at the same time, right in the middle of the action.

nice park. very nice park to just sit and relax or play the games available. Very cool that they have books there that you can read while in the park. food vendors are available if you wish to eat. the caraseoul is really cool

Ping pong tables provided needed activity for my boy. What do you with an active boy who is used to playing sports all day, and is bored by the never ending tours? We stopped to play ping pong for 30 minutes after a visit to Grand Central Station and the NYPLibrary. It was the perfect respite for everyone.
What a great park!. This place is so beautiful! It was May, it was green and there was people at the many small tables. The trees are magnificent.

An oasis in the big city. If you need to take a break in Midtown, head to Bryant Park. It's a nice little place to grab a snack and plan your next stop or just enjoy a nice day. The small kiosks offer some snacks that are worth the money!

Peaceful and clean. What a lovely park. This is in the middle of a busy city but it doesn't feel that way when you are sitting there enjoying the sun, trees, food and wonderful atmosphere. For me this was one of the highlights of my trip. Extremely clean bathrooms and the park in general is well maintained.
Its Green, its pink its nature.. If you are tired of looking at cement this can really feel like a mini oasis. The trees were in bloom when I visited and that was all I needed.

An oasis in the middle of the city. A fine park in the middle of the busy city. Good food, perfect place to sit down after a visit to the NY public building. An oasis! Near to the Chrysler building and Grand Central Terminal.

My favourite NYC spot. I visited Bryant Park in November, thanksgiving week, so all the Christmas displays were set up. Fantastic ice rink in the centre, playing festive tunes, it was lovely to watch everyone skating in the evening. Lovely stalls selling all sorts of gifts, locally made products and the usual touristy knick-knacks. A real romantic place to be in the evening. A real sanctuary in the middle of the city, but makes you forget where you are.

Lovely park. Park was lovely, visited in December, the ice skating was very busy but looked fun, nice location and atmosphere. The shops though didn't seem to have any interesting stuff for sale and was a bit crammed together.
An outdoor party. This park is mainly for adults. They have a nice bar with food and tables and chairs facing 6th Ave. You meet people from all over the world as you people watch in the city.
Piece of Nature in the middle of everything.. Great place to be. You can sit down, relax, read, eat, play ... An Oasis in midtown Manhattan. You can't go wrong there

A lovely place for breakfast. we went on a sunny Sunday morning, 4 days into our break and wished we found it earlier. Had croissants and a coffee and sat and relaxed, it was a lovely place to go and would have spent more time there if we had discovered it earlier,

A nice resting place after a long walk up 5th Ave.. Had a nice rest after a long walk down 5th Ave. Got a nice ice cream & just chilled. The weather was lovely & sunny which made it more pleasent. Nice little park.

Hidden gem. Bryant Park is NYC's best kept secret. Lovely just to sit here, good take outs nearby. Lots of free entertainment, from opera to jazz to the US Navy Big Band. Go there ! You'll love it ! And world class rest rooms ! Mozart ! Fresh flowers !

Beautiful Park. On a recent visit to New York City, We bought our lunch in a deli called Pax on the corner of 40th and 6th Ave.( which was very tasty ) and we took it to Bryant Park and ate it. Bryant Park is beautiful and would highly recommend a visit to it. We sat in the sun and watched the world go by.Before we left the Park we paid a visit to the toilets there and what can I say ? I've never seen toilets like them in a public park. They were spotless clean and very well looked after. The Fresh flowers around the toilets were really beautiful. The day we were there, there was a Lady called Rosanna on duty. She was such a lovely friendly lady. It was obvious she was very happy in her job and I just hope she's appreciated.

I liked this place. This park is a small area with lots of seating, a decent bar for drinks and some small food kiosks both in and just outside the park. It has an old styled carousel for the kids, and a sort of open air games area for chess, table tennis and a library! I believe they also show movies in summer and ice skating in winter. Also a public loo. Great for people watching

An oasis in the garment center. Bryant Park used to be a bad place to get close by in the '90. Then a private association decided to redeem the Park to the people and started renovation. It became a place to go tofor a brake from the office, for outdoor meetings or lunch. The real estate around the Park flourished and better stores and hotels came in. Today it is a landmark destination, with a great schedule of events. It is a tourist must see for inspiration.

The little gem in Manhattan. This park is a lush place to just sit and whileaway a little time. Plenty of seats/tables, no littler at all, enough places to have a bite to eat. Even in the rush of daytime it feels very quiet. At Christmas time there is a market selling all kinds of stuff, booths selling hot drinks, i am led to believe the spiced cider is nice. Even if you dont want anything to eat or drink, its the best free place in Manhattan!

Peaceful place - beautiful gardens. Bryant Park is a peaceful place in the heart of busy NYC. Plenty of tables and chairs to stop and have a snack or a read. The gardens are beautiful in the spring. Well maintained and very clean. Plenty of places in the area to grab a coffee, drink or food.

Beautiful, Peaceful park. This is a lovely well kept park by the side of the NY Public Library. Well worth a visit if you are walking around, bring your own picnic lunch or buy something from one of the local sandwich shops. There are always plenty of chairs and tables to sit at even on a really sunny warm Sunday. Completely free, a beautiful peaceful park surrounded by fantastic architecture.
Nice place for a rest. nice to get a bit of space in the park. Not at its best in March.... Still a couple of piles of snow around but gives space and a very nice restaurant in one corner
Peaceful place to be. This park is near everything and the best of all is that it is very peaceful and calm place to be spacially when we fell stressful after a very long day at work
Quiet and flowery place. It is very pleasant to spend some time in this park. A lot of flowers salute you anywhere. Sit there, enjoy the sun and sip a coffee. Enjoy life

Festival Festival. I happened to go to Bryant Park during the Bryant Park summer festival and there was great food ! Great food stalls, entertainment, free sponsored things and how can you ever miss this FREE HUGS. It's right near herald square hence a good place to sit and rest your legs after you've had a busy day shopping. Bryant Park won't let you down !

One of my fav places in NYC. Go at noon on a sunny day when all the employees go to bryant park for lunch .. Then you ll get a real feeling of NYC. You can grab a snack or coffee from the nearby stands .. I also loved the reading area the park offers.

What a pleasant surprise!. On a morning walk around town I happened to turn around the 42nd. Street library and discovered this lovely park setting behind it. There is plenty of seating on metal chairs surrounding a grassy area. The area surrounding it are very picturesque. If it's sunny, take a rest and absorb the entire scene.

So peaceful and relaxing. This park is right beside the library. After so much walking we were ready to sit down and relax. The spring flowers were blooming and the weather was great for a day outside. There are many chairs and tables spaced all over it. We sat there to rest and sketched. Others were eating their lunches from street venders, etc. Enjoyed.
Relax and Eat Al Fresco. A great place to sit around and eat a picnic lunch or dinner. Also, there is an outdoor bar that is relaxing in the evening.

its adorable. I cant wait to return to this wonderful little park in the middle of the city where everyone just sits around having drinks and chatting. The locals were all there doing what they do on there lunch time. I sat and watched the game of French bouls

Beautiful park!. We stopped in Bryant Park for late Friday afternoon espresso and thoroughly enjoyed people watching! The entire park is well-maintained and offers a couple restaurants, a coffee "shack" that also has sandwiches and salads, and the Southwest Airlines Porch. Seating is abundant and the fountain is lovely.

Great Place to spend some chill time. We had an hour to pass so having eaten in the Bryant Park Grill one evening and had lunch outside in a cafe we choose to sit in the sunshine and take in New York. It is peaceful in amongst the hustle and bustle of the city. A regular with office workers who take their lunches and I can see why. Would recommend a visit.
little gem. It's a lovely park hidden in the heart of Midtown . A nice place to sit and have lunch or just watch the world go by.
Peace and Quiet. Absolutely beautiful park with so much to do or not to do. Made me want to just sit and read a good book or just people watch :)

Breakfast place. I found this park by accident it is so peaceful and busy at the same time. It's just of Times Square and a great place to have a bagel and coffe from the vendors of the silver carts and sit and chill out at breakfast or just listen to the people playing on the stage. I loved sitting here any time of the day. DONT SmOKE there you will get £100 dollar fines you can't smoke in any public parks

Can't go on the grass. Came here with friends because we wanted to sit down and take a small break but unfortunately all the seating was taken and there was no access to the grass so we couldn't just go lie down on a bed of green! It's a pretty park but that's about it....

Very Pretty Park. Lovely small park that we visited after Grand Central Terminal. It is next to New York Library and has a lots of tables and chairs to sit and relax. We enjoyed a coffee and cake in the sunshine. Very relaxing. Worth a visit.

A beautiful peaceful place in a concrete jungle. We wandered through Bryant Park on 42nd St during lunch hour and after such a harsh winter, people - singles, couple, groups were chatting or eating their lunch. The leaves are starting to come out and there was a pleasant peaceful ambience.Such a nice green place with a view of the Empire State and "Ghostbusters" building.

A SMALLER CENTRAL PARK................. Merry-Go-Rounds, lush gardens, peaceful surroundings, ping pong tables and something for everyone is in this park. Food available for purchase as well as a sit down restaurant facing the park.Great escape for lunch or just relaxing before more sight seeing!

Bryant Park is a lively gem in mid-town. This lovely little park has always got something going on. Winter skating and spring / summer boutiques and cafes. There are band events and one of the tv stations tape live productions during the better weather months. Check listings for special events. It's a great place to just relax and people watch in the middle of a hectic work or touring day.

Little Gem. This park will only makes sense on a nice day or at night when you can grab a drink of any kind, take a picnic or just stop for 15 minutes and sit in the park and take in the amazing surrounding view. Just stop there and enjoy being in New York
Love the set up & green oasis. Just around the corner from hectic Times Square- peace and a nice set of pace for an afternoon coffee outside in the sun.
Best park in NY. Beautiful park located in 42th st. beside the NY public library. Cannot miss the chance to have a sit and enjoy the city rythm while having a coffee.

Such a pretty place!. It really is amazing, how these beautiful green spaces can be found throughout Manhattan. Bryant Park has lovely seating throughout, so the thing to do is to sit and people-watch for sure. So clean, is this park. Nice to see~

Free, green, and easy. Weary of walking? Sit here and admire the plantings, the back of the 4th Ave. library, and all the people. In good weather you may catch free concerts, movies, street entertainment. As in any big city center, mind your wallets and handbags.
Nice. A lovely place to take a break from 5th Avenue shopping and recharge your batteries. Near all the big shops and the library.

Oasis near Times Square. This little park is a city block of flowers, grass, trees, benches and tables and is the perfect oasis as a break from the bustle and noise. Surrounded by skyscrapers. Beautiful spot.
Great Spring Park. Lot's of spring flowers are out. A good place to people watch and stroll. Also a good place to catch a subway to anyplace in the City.
Great place to take a break. Pleasant part in the middle of a buzy area of the city. There are lots of tables to sit at., places to buy lunch or snacks, and sometimes entertainment.

Beautiful Park. The park was a nice place to stop and relax while I was touring the city. Very clean, relaxing and people were so friendly. Great place to people watch and sip some coffee and recharge.

Nice. This is the coolest park if you are near the library. They have what they call the "reading room," an area where there are books/mags you can read. They have Ping-Pong tables. It's just a nice area to stop and relax.
A small Oasis in the city. This is one of our favorite places to just sit, relax, take in the beauty of the flowers and greenery, people watch and catch some sun rays on a nice day.
Great place to people watch. Give your feet a rest from the walking and relax in an oasis of calm in the city. Grab a coffee and watch the world go by.
Great Park. One of the best parks in NYC. Always nice and clean. Chairs available to sit and enjoy the sun (if any). We had a great lunch here.

Beautiful Park on a nice day. Fantastic place to sit on a sunny day and has the only free outside toilets in Manhattan
Lots of eating places,cafes and places of interest nearby too
A great rest stop. When treading over NYC, Bryant Park is a great place to stop and relax. It's an oasis in the concrete jungle!

Lovely oasis for a tired sightseer.. I discovered Bryant Park while walking around the city. I understand it is the most visited park in the city. There were seas of daffodils in bloom. lots of tables and chairs to sit and a stand to buy snacks. A great place for people watching and a great place to rest tired feet.

Peaceful and Relaxing. What a find! We spent a couple of lunchtimes relaxing in this Park in central Manhattan. Within a few yards you leave the hustle and bustle behind and enter a tranquil world! Tables and chairs everywhere so you can eat your lunch in comfort. Table tennis tables and a free library area really made it. And a good mix of people. Recommended.

Relax. Green space in the middle of busy Manhattan, great space to meet friends, stop and enjoy a coffee, enjoy café or Bryant Park Grille all are great. Seats are moveable and it is a joy to just walk through from 40th street from the Bryant Park hotel to 42d street and access to airport bus shuttles, too!
Pretty Park. We went at Christmas and there were lots of little market stalls to shop at. We loved it! it's a definite place to stop at anytime of the year though

Lunch in the Park. 5 minutes walk from the Grand Hyatt Hotel and Grand Central Station a lovely tree filled oasis in the city. We had lunch in the BP Cafe in the sunshine amazing sandwiches very nice waitresses and the washrooms were the cleanest I have ever seen!

great time of year to see this park in april. The daffodils and tulips were out so pretty such a pretty park just behind the library.you can sit and read books there too and just delx in the midde of the city. Wish they had a decent coffee place there that would have made it the best

Bryant Park. A nice place to walk thru and grab a coffee. Small stalls set-up sell mostly junk. The ice skating rink in the winter time is a nice addition. If you are in the neighborhood walk thru it. Not worth a special trip.
Go in Summer for the Movies. Free outdoor movies are shown in summer. Check online for titles and showtimes. Go early and take a snack!

A green oasis in NYC. A pretty park, we grabbed sandwiches at an Indian take out and sat in Bryant Park to eat them. The park is always different depending on the session. Last week it was full of tulips and had outdoor games set up to play for free (2 ping pin tables, 1 hole minuture golf, a reading area with newspapers, children's and adult books, and p,entry of chairs and little tables to sit and just relax. The park is located behind the main NYC Library which is a very interesting place to visit in itself.
A nice place to sit down for a bit. It can be a bit crowded obviously but a day with nice weather and a bit of luck it can be great for a break from all the walking you probably are doing.
Love it!. I just love this little park. Nice to watch people. Nice to be close to the New York Library (which is great by the way)
nice atmosphere. Very nice place to get away from the hustle and bustle. Quiet and nice atmosphere. Would love to visit again.

Breakfast in the park. We had breakfast at the park and sat near the fountain. We purchased coffee and muffins from one of the kiosks there and just enjoyed the atmosphere. Cost of the coffee and muffins were pricey but it is NYC.
A cute park at New York Public Library. I loved this park. Charming! And you can have a sit, look to the water fountain, the flowers e the beautiful lawn. I recommend this!

Beautiful spring flowers. Bryant Park is one of the true gems in New York City. We stopped by most days to have a coffee just as the day got going. They have so many beautiful spring flowering bulbs - narcissus and hyacinth - it's a wonderful sight and beautiful oasis tucked in behind the library.

Great place to visit year round. It's always nice to be in Bryant park whether you're visiting the market and ice skating during the winter or grabbing some food and having a nice picnic in the summer. I love strolling over from my office to sit outside and eat with friends on a nice day.
A jewel of NYC.. Not a huge park but lovely and a nice place to relax and enjoy the day. Good for people watching! It's our favorite go to for a beautiful park not named Central.

One the City Less Known Gems. Although on the axis of Port Authority, Times Sq, Bryant Part, The Public Library, 5th Ave, and Grand Central, rarely do you hear a recommendation to see Bryant park and that is what makes this place an even better gem of a park.First in recent years the park is filled with chairs and tables that added tones of sitting and resting space. It is also has a bunch of little stores and kitchens that sell unique food and crafts. The mix is easy and not daunting or overwhelming. In the winter they have Ice Skating and in the summer books, table games and table tennis. During Fashion week the place is even more interesting, but access to the park is limited. During that time People Watching is the THING. Stop here for a break from the city.
So pretty!. Loved the spring flowers!! So many tulips and hydrangeas planted and or in pots. They were grouped and positioned really pretty all through the park! Very enjoyable!
A busy park!. This was almost across the street from our hotel. This is where several cultures unite and mingle. It was a great place to people watch

A wonderful green escape in the middle of the city. Weather permitting, don't miss the outdoor Bryant Park Cafe located on the northeast corner of the park, right behind the Library. Had an excellent Cobb salad and shared very good Calamari appetizer.

A Pretty Oasis. While Bryant Park isn't anything like Central Park in size, it is a wonderful oasis from the running you are doing in NYC. I love the trees and flowers. We were there once when the Christmas mart was going on. There was tent after tent of handmade items and gift items. What fun.
Stunning. What a gem in the middle a bustling city! It's a beautiful city park and the public toilets are quite possibly the best in New York - I kid you not!
An amazing place to chill out.. This park is an excellent place to chill out in the sunshine. Plenty of seats and a little oasis in the madness of skyscrapers.

People watch. This small park with lots of seating is a lovely place to take a coffee or ice cream. You can watch the world go by.small putting green in one corner. Coffee stall . Is located at the back of the library .
Always worth a visit.. My favorite park in the city I make it a point to go by it every time I go to NYC. Now it offers free wifi.

Lovely park. Lovely park in the centre of the city.. the fountain had been left on and had frozen when we were there in February it looked beautiful although we didn't use the ice skating rink it looked like people were enjoying it. The toilets are also lovely, well maintained and very clean
Best public toilets in New York. If you are finding it tough locating toilets in New York, head to Bryant Park. They have the cleanest, most pristine public toilets in New York, perhaps the world.
Good peaceful stop!. Had a coffee here. The park also has toilets! Gardens are pretty. They were trimming tree's when we were there so half closed off.

peaceful park - best washrooms in NYC. This was a great park near our hotel. Nice place to sit and people watch. as the best cleanest washrooms in NYC. They have classical music piped in and fresh flowers. The park has lots of chairs. THere are also two food outlets which sell coffee , pastries and other food so can sit and enjoy. Because it is by the Main Library - there is an outdoor reading room where you can sit and read a book. If you are tired of the noise of other parts of Manhatten - this a place that will give you some peace

Take a Break in Bryant Park. In the middle of Mid-town Manhattan, we just happened upon Bryant Park - a place to take a break from walking, sip our coffee, check out the skyline around us and people-watch. Clean, beautiful, safe.

Marvelous little retreat in the heart of it all. I have been to NYC twice in last 2 years and made it here both times. The first was at Christmas, and it was magical with shops, food vendors and skating. The most recent was a gorgeous April evening when we got take out and ate in the park. While the trees where still bare the grass was green and flowers where blooming. It was a very relaxing way to enjoy some of that good quick NYC eats.
Love this park!. Quaint park in the heart of the city that offered a break from the foggy, bleak day when we visited. I would visit this park everyday if I lived in NYC.
nice park. i enjoy my day at this park , good during summer and winter, have nice outside seating and the ice rink is very good.

people watching. Great place to sit and people watch even in the cold weather. We grabbed a coffee nearby and went and took a well deserved sit down in the park. I expect it would be very popular in the summer.

A really enjoyable park in the centre of NY. We came across Bryant Park on a few occasions during our visit to NY. We enjoyed the fact you could go and play board games, chess, monopoly, etc. In different areas, there were table tennis tables and a little library where you could read books. The restrooms were extremely well kept and a credit to the city, we were impressed that there were flowers giving it a well cared for appearance. There were also points to charge your electrical equipment which would be extremely useful to some people. A lovely park where you can escape from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Nice, quiet and historic area. Very charming, little kiosk of people selling souvenirs and stuff. The skating rink was installed when I got there. Much fun too look at people skating, walking around and the squirrels everywhere. This remind me of many films I watched.

A Favorite Spot in NYC. This is one of the best places to visit in NYC, no matter what time of year you are there. It is always changing with the seasons and it is always a beautiful place to stop and relax for a bit or have a bite to eat. Lovely Spring flowers this visit, but different each time I go. Not to be missed!

Gorgeous!!!. What a beautiful gem of a park! Located behind the New York public library it is a green patch of heaven in a cement jungle. There are three restaurants in the park, one is a sit down grill with waitstaff, and the other two are take away. Lots of tables to sit at, a carasouel for kids, flowers everywhere!!! It was bustling but not crowded and a great place to sit and have a wonderful lunch or break in the city.
Lovely little hidden park. It's a gorgeous little park hidden in the heart of Midtown Manhattan. A nice place to take a drink or quick lunch.

Cool Little Park. This is a cool little park in the middle of the city. They have ping-pong tables and my kids enjoyed watching some of the locals play a few games. There is also a fountain and numerous sitting areas. The bathrooms are very nice as well. Definitely a nice place to sit down and catch your breath in the middle of a bustling city.
One of the best parks of NY City. It is a smallish park with coffee shops and green tables and chairs (just like Paris, France). There is a great atmosphere there when the sun is shining.

Favourite park in NYC. I love this park. Visited previously in november 2013 when the fountain was frozen and there was a winter market. Loved it then and still love it now. It is such a relaxing place in amonst all the skysrappers and the busy streets. Ideal just to sit and relax.

An Oasis amid the chaos of the city. The park offers many wonderful diversions. There are terrific restaurants located here, a number of local food stalls selling a variety of great food stuffs. At the holidays they have a village of vendors selling holiday fares surrounding an ice skating rink. During the summer they have movies nights on a large screen and a lawn in which people picnic and otherwise amuse themselves. In the park there are numerous benches, easy chairs and drinking fountains making this a go to spot in an otherwise drab midtown area. I love the energy of the place and all visitors whether young or old like to come and gather here.

Nice place to sit in the sun. It was the first sunny week in NY and everyone was out enjoying the sun, flowers getting planted, loads of seats for everyone and space for having a relax in busy Mid Town. So pretty.

Lovely little park. This park is very small but once your in it gives the illusion of being very big! There are a variety of different seating areas, ping pong tables and a lovely grass lawn. The park backs on to the library, which provides a wonderful backdrop.

Beautiful Oasis in NY. The park is beautiful green and full of flowers. The carousel is open and when I arrived at about 10am there were plenty of seats to rest and people watch while having morning tea. by 1230 ping pong and juggling were underway ... free books to read. I love it here. Beautiful.... busy but still a place to sit and unwind. I happened to arrive for Lilly Pulitzer fashion event offering free juice, hammocks and lawn chairs..pink water in the fountain, designers painting, fashion show and of course a huge tent set up to sell her apparel (soon to be available in Target). A neat treat.

on a sunny day great place to take your lunch. lovely green open space in the centre of New York. In April the planters and borders looked amazing with hyacinths and pansies. in summer the trees shade the many seating areas. usually there is some entertainment or music playing in the park. winter time has a great skating rink. a really nice place to sit and relax and watch the world go by.

Big park that feels like a separate almost peaceful place from the busy streets and sidewalks.. While on a self guided tour of midtown, I took a break in Bryant Park. Got some great pictures during sundown and had a semi comfortable seat on one of the many wooden slat chairs throughout the park. There is a big grassy area in the middle with chairs and table on three sides. Some people played chess, others just hung out and took in the peaceful feel of the park from the busy streets and sidewalks in midtown.

Not clear why this is listed as an attraction. There are some seasonal activities there - overcrowded outdoor movies in the summer, a pleasant-seeming ice skating rink in the winter, and a semi-obnoxious holiday shopping set up before Christmas. I can't imagine making a special trip to come here.
Great for People Watcing. A great place to visit and people watch. In the heart of busy Manhatten you can watch the world go buy. A great place to relax after a busy shopping day

Wonderful city gem for the whole family. We visited twice on a recent trip to the city. It is a comfortable park surrounded by the city but an escape at the same time. There are many sitting areas, including a section for reading (with items on loan to read right there) and an extensive game area where one can check out board games or play chess or backgammon, which is set up at several tables. My 12 year old daughter got to play 3 games on our visits and she got some invaluable "coaching" from a very nice park worker in the chess area named Greg. We will definitely return on any visit to the city.

A little disappointed but still an experience. We wanted the experience of ice skating in NYC. Bryant Park was very busy & only allowed so many on the ice at one time. Skates were uncomfortable so I didn't skate much. Restaurants were hard to get into.

Nice place to sit and enjoy the sunshine.. Quite a place to sit. full of office staff taking their lunches. Also a few activities being used in the park, Petanque, table tennis reading area, and juggling. A good place to people watch.
Beautiful park!. Beautiful space in the middle of the city. Lots of places to sit and people watch. In the spring, an area was set up for anyone to sit and play a game, board game, chess,etc.

A Peaceful Refuge!. I had an hour-long rest in Bryant Park under a table umbrella during a light rain. What a beautiful, peaceful refuge right off Times Square! And a beautifully appointed public restroom.
Relaxing. Lovely little park, especially if the weather is nice. You can sit, relax, watch the world go by, read, watch jugglers and even play table tennis.
Lifetime of memories.. We have never enjoyed a park so much.Bars...food..relax..read.i have never experienced so much relaxation .

A Very Nice Park. The grass was very green. We were told that in the winter, that was a skating rink. The toilet was very clean and the attendant was very friendly (she spoke Spanish). It had a big fountain without water. There were nice plants all over. A good place to watch people.
A spec of green. Lovely place to sit and watch the world go by, the park was clean and being well kept, it's quite small, but nice to sit in the middle of the city in a green space
A gem , in the Heart of Midtown NYC. Wonderful park for kids and adults. Lovely Restaurant, with an outdoor Bar. Rides for the Kids. Plenty of benches to rest your NYC tired bones.

Gorgeous, well kept and full of flowers!. This park is SO worth a stop. It is colorful and beautiful. The perfect spot for 'people watching'. There are professionals relaxing in the park, families, locals and few tourists. The perfect spot for lunch and taking a rest.
small but well formed. small but nice flowers and iron work lamps and building views, chairs and seating make it useful for a rest

fabulous park...and toilets !!!. Was in New York recently with family. Had our lunch in Bryant Park which is a beautiful place and so well maintained. The toilets were exceptional ; clean, fresh smelling and did not look at all like a public toilet. The attendant on that day, Rosanna, was very pleasant, friendly and and helpful especially towards those with younger children.

Nice space to have a sandwich in the sun. Bryant park can give you a bit of a break from the noise etc in New York when you are sightseeing all day. We got a sandwiches form a deli nearby and were feeding the sparrows in the sun too. Shame the park is not bigger so it would allow you to be a bit further away from the noise.
Beautiful at Night. Spent some time in the park during the evening. Beautiful view of the Empire state building. Peaceful little place to rest in the middle of a busy city.

relax. Relatively small park, but it is very park to be healed.
I had autograph session of events of the original major leaguer when went.
Here seems to various events are carried out well.
To seem a family to relax on the day of rest a lot, it is very good relaxing park pleasant.

Peaceful space in New York. Nice space in the middle of a fantastic city, have a coffee, Ruebans sandwich and literally watch the world go by befor entering the stunning and amazing arena known as Time Square, Broadway and Maceys ( yes I was with my beautiful wife and gorgeous shopaholic daughter) Tiffanys, Sacs on 5th and Bloomingdales Very soon followed, ha ha , Enjoy and Love it.

Oasis in the city. gave the feel of a Parisian square. A booth selling nice French food though the authentic disorganised service was not needed :0)... There were people playing boule and free seating in a well maintained park.
lovely park. The park is based in a great setting, right next to the flatiron building. Many buildings are based around it. It is a great place to go to on a sunny afternoon.

Cool park in the middle of the city!. This park was close to our hotel. It is well manicured and line to just grab a coffee and relax. At night, you get a nice view of the Empire State Building in the background. Also there is a train and bus stop right there.

Oasis !!. Favourite place in NYC , just sit down and watch the world go by . People playing chess , table tennis and reading books from the free library . Several places to buy food & drink . Can't wait to go back .

Beautiful park wonderful location. This park is a place to sit, enjoy the day, your lunch, or maybe take a look at the merry go round... we just loved walking by the park everyday and just getting hot chocolate to sit and watch the city go by!

Springtime Sunday in Bryant - Nothing like it!. Had about half an hour to kill post-brunch, pre-show on the first nice day we've had this Spring since a terrible Winter. So we sat in Bryant park for a bit to soak in the sun and people watch as always. Such a quintessential NYC scene. Great views of the city, and it's amazing how relaxing it is even though you are surrounded by people and activity. Love BP.
