A lovely park in the middle of the hustle and bustle. This park was close to our hotel. We love that the city has set up areas around NYC with chairs and tables. This park also has a small carousel so a nice place for a young family to visit .
Lovely Relaxing place. With the library on the back and the park seatings set in one side - It is a lovely place to sit and relax.

Great Activity in the middle of Manhattan. This wonderful park on 42nd Street is well worth spending some time at. Just a couple of blocks from Times Square it has all kinds of activity including several ping pong tables.
Lovely park. Great place, children's play area, quiet corner for reading all in all a lovely spot to rest your weary feta!
Chess. Had a blast playing Chess in the Park... a Chess Players Dream! Was able to walk to the park from the hotel, passed by Time Square.. Nice Area!
Walk the park and have lunch. The park is organized for activities. From miniature golf, pingpong, and board games. A relaxing oasis behind the Public Library.

Unexpected. We had some time to kill before going to the airport and wandered into this park. It was the only nice weather day of our trip and a bunch of bagpipers were playing. It was very nice to relax there.

Gorgeous, quiet park. What a great place to sip coffee and people watch. The buildings surrounding this park are gorgeous. It is a block from the craziness of 7th avenue/Times Square and it is quiet and beautiful. The flowers, fountains, carousel and game tables make it a fantastic place to sit and relax.
Nice place. NY Public Library is situated next to the park. Nice building with beautiful staires, statues and paintings. Guttenberg Bible is a must see!!!
So cute!. Lovely park in the middle of the hustle & bustle of Manhattan. It was a chilly day when we visited, but we will certainly be back in the Summer.

How Brave of Live to Come Through Snow. Have you made your way back to Bryant Park as Spring approach. It was a cold and bitter winter full of snow. Now they have dressed Bryant Park up for spring, with daffodils and pansies. Soon the the vendors will open. This is a huge space in the heart of NYC. Larger that Rittenhouse Square in Philly. There are small tables for two with a open supply of chairs in the public spaces. The carousel is up and running. I'm sort of glad its off to the side. It is so hard to find the semblance of peace and quiet. There are public toilets there. It is Wheel chair accessible.

Great place for an outdoor lunch and awesome toilet!. The bathroom here is a MUST see!! It is adorned with gorgeous flowers and the toilet seat has a plastic liner that automatically changes for you when you wave your hand in front of the sensor!
Lovely hand soap and the bathroom is immaculately kept!
The only public toilet of its kind!
Right near Grand Central!
Amazing. Bryant Park is an amazing sight. Lots of wonderful public art on display. Beautiful landscaping. Lots of places to sit and enjoy the view. Definitely a must see.

Something for every season. If you come here year round, you will find standards. Merry go Round, coffee shops, tables and chairs snacks and depending on season a large green lawn There is the cities prestigious library next to the park with it magnificent statues. Head to there in the winter and find an ice rink, and an area full of boutique shops great for finding some gifts and collectables. The energy and fill does not always make you feel you are in the big apple, but is just how a city center should be this time of year. Is a beautiful place. In the summer, they show movies on the great lawn, bring a friend, snacks and a blanket and enjoy

Awesome park, especially for ice skating in winter. When there are activities occurring, there are several shoppes & vendors. There is plenty of food and even a bar. However, it is not always open. Check their schedule.

Brilliant place. This is a brilliant square with free books, library, table tennis, live music etc. My family were taught to juggle and apparently they have free fencing lessons and all sorts in the summer. A great haven for workers in their lunch break but great for visitors too.

The Spring Blooms -its happening. I'm a fan of this pretty park, with the beautiful Library in the background, in winter it becomes a winter wonderland with an ice rink, but in Spring it becomes a gorgeous floristry of tulips and Daffodils, spring bulbs, sadly Spring is very late this year, the trees haven't burst into buds yet..
A very relaxing place in the city.. It's a lovely relaxing place right in mid-town and even when it's just warmed up in the spring it's perfectly amenable to sitting around when only 40+F :)

On a sunny day it can't be beat. The park is full of locals (and tourists) sitting and eating lunch from the sandwich stands owned by Tom Colicchio, I believe it's called Wichcraft. When it's warm out it's a beautiful way to spend some time to relax and eat a great sandwich. Fun stuff!
A green oasis in the centre of town.. This very small park included places to sit and eat your lunch a small park for the children and somewhere to read or sit quietly and take a moment.
Oasis. a beautiful spot right in the middle of Manhattan with the best public toilets I have ever experienced. Fantastically helpful staff as well. So pleased we found this place
The kids enjoyed it.. The kids played there on Saturday afternoon. The park has all sorts of games available. Locals were playing board games on the outside tables and just enjoying the weather.

reading and cards. we stay there quite often in summer time to play cards or to read books. as it's in the back of the library very cool to grab a book there and get over into the park and start reading.

Nice park for break between sightseeing. Very nice park in the middle of all the skyscrapers, not too far from Times Square. We grabbed a table and ate our lunch there one day. Loved the reading room where you can loan a book or magazine to read, as well as the table tennis and bowls areas. Bathrooms were very clean. Whole park seemed to be well maintained. It was freezing when we were there but I am sure it must be a great spot when the weather is warmer (although probably much busier then too).

Disappointing. Situated behind the library. Paths and skating room closed, debris around. Until cleared it really is not worth a visit.Tthe nearby fountain was the only attractive feature when we were there.

Great place to relax and people watch.. I love Bryant Park. Grab a chair and people watch, or have a snack and relax. There is a small carousel for the kids and a large grass area. This park is right next to the library which is a popular place to visit. There is a peek-a-boo view of the top of the Empire State building, look at it at night to see what color it is for that particular day. The area is clean and well maintained.
Walk through to see it!. Another classic! They have games, a reading "room" dining, – a great place to stop, relax and catch your breath!

A must at Christmas. We have only ever been here at Christmas, to see the ice rink and the market. It's a very New York experience, easy to find behind the Library, with a tree, food and drinks on hand -- best after dark I would think, which is when we were there.
Great Place to Relax in the City. Lovely oasis in the city with lovely little places to grab something to eat and lots of space to enjoy your lunch.
Lovely Park. It's a beautiful park and filled with holiday spirit. Ice skating ring, souvenir shops and little coffee and chocolate shops. Nice to walk around and a romantic date at night.

Park in between tall skyscrappers. Loving the park and just sitting in a corner having a coffee.There is a reading corner that you can exchange books and read. Love looking at the carousel that lights up beautifully at night.The park is under maintenance for now so missed out on sitting on the grass for a small picnic.
a relaxing place Bryant Park. Lucky to have found this place to relaxe and meet locals people, a must for traveler with kids, un caroussel !!! public lecture, shows and juggler.
Bathroom was clean !. Park was average, not impressed. The public bathroom was surprisingly very clean. I guess if you were going to an event at the park it would have been more impressive.

Sat, had a sandwich lunch in the sun and watched world go by.. Great green spot in Mid town to grab a table and enjoy the midtown scene of workers tourists and locals rushing by. Just behind the library there are various events organised throughout the year and we were lucky enough to enjoy the space quietly between seasons. Would recommend for a quick wind down in New York.

Great Place to People Watch. Bryant Park is a well defined park to sit and enjoy your own food (too early for kiosks) sit, talk or read. Activity really picks up as the weather warms, so does the surrounding gardens. A carousel for kids, a mobile library, a bar on the grounds. There's a Japanese book store across the road worth visiting and it's a subway stop.
Nice park. One of NYC parks I enjoyed the most. It is small and has a cozy feeling about it. We were there during the summer and there were movie screenings from now and then, which is really nice.

Lovely Midtown Respite. Bryant Park has come a long way since the 80's and is now a lovely place to visit while in midtown, finally worthy of its position behind the main branch of the magnificent NY Public Library. If I have any complaint it's that it's often too crowded now, but it's still a good place to relax and enjoy the greenery among the concrete jungle of midtown. There's a 'wichcraft sandwich kiosk that serves terrific sandwiches, so you can try to snag a table and enjoy lunch outdoors in the good weather, which I do sometimes with colleagues since I work nearby. There's lots of fun stuff to do, such as the ice rink and carousel, and in the summer the evening outdoor movies.

Nice park. It seems to be a nice park, sadly it won't get more then 3 stars from me since it was kind of chilly and not very green yet, i bet this place is 4 stars when late spring and summer comes. So i guess i just went there at the wrong time of the year.
Good place to take a break. Must go to the public restroom. There is a maintenance crew so the restroom is super clean. The park is a nice place to take a break, sit in the sun and relax.

A tranquil place amongst the carnage. Favourite place so far! Very peaceful amongst all the hustle and bustle. Sat for while and took all the architecture and tree lined park in. Nice just to sit and watch the world go by! Lovely place ; well worth a visit.
Always something going on. I go to Bryant Park every time I go to NY. They have movies, poetry reading, Tai Chi, ice skating, food, and more. Love to people watch!

Cutest park ever! Family fun!. There's something for everyone at this park...and it's FREE! There's a game section with free games of chess, chinese checkers, and assorted board games. There's a section for kids to read books. There the beautiful park area where you can sit and enjoy the scenery. A beautiful family park!

Main branch of the NYC library. Loved this little park! Seeing the lions in person after seeing them in so many movies was epic. Word to the wise: this branch is not a branch that circulates books. It's more like a museum and reference building, but my son loved the architecture and photography exhibits.

A Place to Relax in a Busy City. I was just in NYC looking for a place to sit down, relax my legs, and with poetry--this was the place. Bryant Park is the perfect spot to take a break from the city with still a beautiful view of it.

Cute cute cute park - bring the kiddies. My favorite park in the city, it has a mini library of childrens book outside near the merrygoround. I love it in the winter with the decorations and the spring, as they decorate it with pots of flowers. Its a nice spot to eat a packed lunch and admire the buildings.
Nice park with free Wi-FI. Nice to just hang around in the sun and have some coffee while you utilize the free WI-FI. It does not have the same charm in the winter.

Always something going on. I have been here many times and each time, there is something new. I was here at Christmas for their world famous holiday market and the day I went also was one of our first snowfalls, so I was able to get some really nice pictures of the fountain, the Christmas Tree and the Empire State Building. IN February, they had a winter carnival, complete with curling and ice hockey. January was so cold, that the fountain froze completely over and they had to turn off the water to avoid severe damage. The skating rink is gone now for the season and there will now be movies in the summer, there is ping pong, and a carousel for the children. The main branch of the New York Public library is right next door, so you can check that out at the same time.
I love Bryant Park. Its like a big rush rush everywhere -then a park to stroll through. So some guys playing Chess, saw couples sitting together having lunch, kids playing, its a wonderful park.

My favorite park. Sorry!. I know it's blasphemous to say your favorite NYC park is Bryant, not Central, but it's true. With the dainty antique carousel, the Mason Kayser across the street, the Bryant Park Grill holding court beside the Library, it's perfect. I love nothing more than coming here alone, with friends, or with lovers.
A little gem in NYC. A lovely piece of greenery in the middle of Manhattan. Go there to eat your lunch outdoors or put your child on the carousel. Don't miss Broadway in the Park - it's free.
So festive!. Ice skating in BRyant Park is a must at Christmas time & shopping in all the cute little shops is a bonus!
Beautiful place. I love Bryant Park it is always so clean. I love the flea markets they have so many cool things to buy.
Great shows. Every Thursday you get to have a glimpse of some of the Musicals on Broadway great idea give you the urge to go see them and more Well NYC and the park itself is a great place to relax.

Beautiful and historic . Bryant Park is a beautiful spot in midtown. There is so much history behind this spot - look it up online, you'll be amazed. The park is surrounded by beautiful architecture and landmark buildings, yet it was quiet and serene when we visited. It was still very cold for March, but there were signs of spring - the pansies were planted and the bulbs were coming up. Looking forward to visiting again soon.
Lovely Park. we stayed very near this park and walked pass it practically everyday, there is a carousel and a nice reading corner. Recommended to go and spend time there.

quiet park - lawn was closed. The lawn in the middle was all closed off as was all the stalls around the lawn. The carousel was open and one of the restaurants but otherwise was a bit disappointing. It would be much better in summer when the trees have leaves and the stalls / lawn are open. was a bit disappointed. Timing is obviously crucial to the beauty of this park.

Bryant Park is worth a stop for coffee and reflection. The history of New York City astounds me. Everywhere, literally, something important happened in history and Bryant Park is no exception. I went there to reflect the retreat of George Washington's men. Across the street is the old Aeolian building - location of the Rhapsody in Blue premiere where George Gershwin unknowingly changed the face of American popular music.

Small, but Special. This mid town park midway between GrandCentralStation and Times Square, is worth a visit. It is a refuge from the noise and towers close by and provides a place to just rest, enjoy a good cup of coffee, some yummy food, do some people watching and take a ride on a gorgeous carousel. If you're there in the winter, rent skates, go iceskating, and shop at the beautiful crafts shops before and during Christmas. In the summer, you might be lucky enough to spread a blanket on the lawn and see a classic movie as you picnic along side thousands of friendly New Yorkers. It's a place with a great vibe.

Bryant Park - a little piece of heaven. Bryant Park is the most beautiful little spot within NYC. It offers a spot to just relax in the heart of the city. The park is beautiful with lovely trees and plants, lots of tables and chairs for you to sit down with a cake and a coffee if you like. Oh and if you look towards the beautiful building of the Bryant Park Hotel you can see the Empire State Building.Once you visit the park I guarantee you will want to return and enjoy.
Great place to relax. Lovely little park in NYC. Highly recommend the restrooms (so clean!) and the park has a charging station for mobile devices.
Such a neat spot in the middle of crazy but sensational NY!. Always something to do or see at Bryant Park, ice skating, an exhibition, always something!Love Bryant Park!

Magical place in the dark.. It is a quiet, almost deserted oasis when it gets dark. You can literally stand there alone looking at the lit up skyscrapers right in front of you with the beautiful library in the back. On the night that I was there the workers had just planted fragrant hyacinths. It is one of my favorite places in NYC, particularly at night.
Bryant Park. I go Ice skating here once in a while, it gets a little crowded but it is fun around the holidays....Instagram: @tommiesox
Cool. A great little park that had an ice skating rink set up in the middle. A great place to meet friends and watch the skaters do their thing.
a good NY park. A medium size park, very pleasant and conveniently located.I pass there regularly. It is a typical park in NY.

Great place to skate in the city. We loved Bryant Park and I almost don't want to post this because maybe I would be giving away a local secret. The skating rink here is a great place if you want to skate in the city, with the tall skyscapers surrounding you on every side. If you bring your own skates, it's free! Go early on in the day, as it gets busy after lunch time. A few restaurants around, and lots of shops pop up right before the holidays. We went in November when the weather was still warm and it felt great to skate outdoors without freezing. There are tiny lockers inside, or you can pay $10 (I think) to rent a gigantic bag to check in all your shoes and other items that you don't want to hold while skating. You can also buy hot chocolate and some other snacks for a reasonable cost.

A great stop off. this probably constitutes one of the nicest parks in New York. It was being fully overhauled when we were there as they had just removed the skating rink. The seating around the park provide a welcoming space to relax and have a bit of lunch while doing the usual New York sites. There are points around the park where you can recharge your phones etc. The public toilets at one corner near the library are perhaps the nicest toilets in New York and they are free. The attendants always have flowers around the toilet area and often have classical music playing. A true spot to visit.

With jugglers. Park in the city near the library. Lovely little park even with the trees denuded of leaves in the cold winter! Jugglers seen in action which added interest to the park. Nice just to wander in.

Ice Skating and Christmas Shops. This formerly dangerous place has become a wonderful gathering spot for families and friends to meet and have a great time shopping for the holidays and ice skating! It is a nice change from the hectic pace at Rockefeller Center, where the people are usually packed dozens deep at the rail of the ice skating rink. Here you can actually sit at a table and watch the ice skaters! The Christmas shops have so many wonderful things! We loved the chocolate shop and the ornaments, and the knitted mittens were very popular in the frigid weather!Everyone should check out this fun destination at Christmastime in NYC!

Bryant Park. Loved this little park. It is a great place to sit or just walk through. So cute and was a great stop along the way. They had jugglers out juggling and helping kids learn how to juggle. The little merry go round was cute to see too.

The best place in New York on a Spring day. My wife and I go to NYC two or three times a year and have for many years. This is the very best place in the city to enjoy a snack, rest and watch people. None better in the City.The New York City Library is on the same block and should be seen, although its currently under partial renovation. The public restrooms in the park are busy and just barely acceptable. The Library puts out magazines, papers and books in good weather. There are also game tables available.

Didn't realize it was the site of many movies and tv shows.. Walked by this park many times in the summer on my way to Times-Square. I didn't realize that it was the site of the skating rink featured in many of the movies or tv shows I'd seen like Serendipity or Glee; otherwise, I would have paid better attention. It's quite a popular park in the summer and is filled with all kinds of local colour.
Winter Village. The Winter Village is wonderful. Things from all over the world to buy. Food and skating makes this place a must see for all the family. We went pre-Christmas and really enjoyed it.

Such a cosy park. Since we went here in winter, they had an iceskating fields and were playing music. The sun was up and we just sat there with others and just enjoyed the moment, life...a fresh breath in the middle of the city. It´s also just behind New york public library, one of the most beautiful architectures in the city.
Small Park. Not a great deal to say about this one, although it's a nice small park, and the toilets are kept insanely clean (fresh flowers!). I can imagine this would look very nice in the summer.

serenity in the centre of NEW YORK. amazing experience.The carousel was the highlight as my granddaughter enjoys the gentle ride on her favourite frog! the little restuarant and the ambience of the place is so nice.

A city gem. This park quickly became our favourite in NYC. Just a couple blocks from Times Square this elegant park boasts free wifi (as do all NYC parks) and the very best public washrooms you will ever find). Sit a while, ride the carousel, watch NYC life unfold.....and use the washrooms.
An Oasis of calm. This place is awesome, so relaxed in what is a manic city. Come here, have a coffee and let your brain have a rest.

Bryant Park. Didn't plan on stopping by this place because we had no idea about it. The skating rink is very large and they had a beautiful Christmas tree. There were also a lot of little shops around.

Another beautiful NYC Park. Stunning beautifully landscaped. Outdoor movies in the summer, ice skating in the winter, plenty of places to eat, central location, surrounded by skyscrapers right in the heart of the city and next to the beautiful Public Library- highly recommended.

for the weekend. nice little park in midtown manhattan, they have cute shops set up during the holiday season, along with an ice skating rink; several small eateries within the park, or plenty of places to eat outside nearby. Nice place to hang out and rest in the summer from walking aound the City. Restaurant in the park looks quite expensive.
Nice Park. A nice little open area where you can relax and take in the sounds of the city all around. In the summer, Broadway shows stage teaser performances there with the current casts.

Small urban park with lots of mojo. Sure. Central Park is 17 blocks up the avenue and no doubt you will go there. Check out Bryant Park.
In winter it has vendors and skating. In spring it has supermodels. In summer it has big screen film at night. In autumn, it has colorful trees.
It's always beautiful.
NIce park. Nice, quiet park in heart of city - behind library. They had just removed the skating rink and hadn't put in the summer stage, yet. Pretty muddy.

Nice views, centrally located, good food. Location is great overlooking the park there. The food is current, drinks are good. I like coming here for drinks and appetizers in the summer and around the holidays. The lights are pretty and in the summer you can have drinks outside. Food is very good and service is too. I have been here with family and business situations. Never disappointed.
Fun restaurant. We ate out side with friends we hadn't seen for a while and the staff was patient with us nursing a glass of wine.
Great to sight-see. This is a great park to just sit and people-watch, or to walk around and just enjoy the sights. Right behind the NY Public Library, so it's a great area.
Iconic Park. You cannot call it a complete visit until you visit this fashionable park location. As seen in so many movies, it is so central to all and a great people watching location.

A little treasure in the middle of the concrete jungle. Central Park is a big treasure in Manhattan. Bryant Park is the little one. So many cute shops, surrounded by more shops. The Library is great next door. If you're a nature lover, this little park actually packs in lots of close up bird encounters - most don't even realize. During migration some birds are seen close to humans where in Central Park and other areas they would fly away at the slightest movement. Keep an eye out!
Green Space in the City. This is an active space, changing with the seasons. Always visually pleasing and a good spot for people watching.
Surprising little park!. Wonderful green space right behind the NY Public Library. Especially lovely at Christmas time and in the Spring.

Nothing like Bryant Park during the holidays!. We love going through the park when it is all set up for the holidays... one of our favorite spots to go to during the holidays.
The Kettle Corn is world famous... you can ice skate (or just watch!)... and when you get really hungry - head across the street to Koi for some sushi!
Chistmas in Bryant Park. It was a nice surprise when we went to Bryant Park and saw all the vendor booths & ice skating rink. So much fun shopping and watching the skaters!!

Favourite open space in the city. A lovely small park just behind the library between 5th and 6th. Especially good pre Xmas with the stalls, food and drinks and then the skating rink. Welcome splash of green in the city centre in the summer
Great Place. An interesting place. They were shooting a movie when we were there this time. Sit and relax and watch the hussle and bussle go by. Close to Times Square and a nice walk.
Small park. It is small park surrounded by impressive buildings. Nice atmosphere when three are festiviteit going on.
We missed the ice rink.. They were just taking up the ice rink so we couldn't use the park much. It was very cold so we didnt stay long.

Want to learn about this hidden gem...?. You will not see too much on your own, but if you join the FREE Tours by Foot (see website) you'll learn about all the buildings around this park, their history, their architects, plus lots of valuable anecdotes and interesting information from the savviest of tour guides!!!

Lovely. Lovely detour from 5th Avenue shopping trip. Nice park and we found a lovely place around there to eat (Italian-Asian market with a window view overlooking the park). We went then to explore New York City Library, 2 min away.

Very cool place. Bryant Park holds one of the often-photographed fountains in NYC. When we visited the shops were set up in all over the park-perhaps for the oncoming Christmas shopping season. The shops were very, very cool and unique! Many handmade items and unusual things. We wished for more time as there is also a skating rink, but we didn't have time for it. Highly recommend a visit!

Magic little spot. A lovely small park area with seats and tables to sit at a great view of The Bryant Park hotel and the New York Library and a great view down the street of the Chrysler Building. Lots of trees and bird song, wonderful.
Quaint and beautiful park. Charming carousel, ice skating rink, benches, food vendors, holiday activities, yoga, movies, etc. Restaurants nearby. Next to NY Public Library. Love it!

A little slice of peace. Bryant Park is one of those you could easily miss, but it's so worth a visit. Even piled with snow, it was beautiful. The merry-go-round would be delightful in spring or summer!
Small place in a built up area. This little park was a nice place to visit but the main park does close quite early and then you can only walk round the outside.

Always lovely. I used to live near this park like 12+ years ago and it's really transformed over the past decade. I came here to rest on a day trip with mom and it was the end of the day, there was a champagne/ wine bar going al fresco plus a wichcraft stand and some ping pong tables set up for general use. Heads up, it's got one of the cleanest public bathrooms in any public park so there's always a line.

Great location, really cute park. Stayed at the Marriott Residence Inn a few blocks from here. Really cute park! Well maintained and a great space to sit and relax, perhaps people watching or reading a book. During the warmer weather and near the holidays, many many vendors set up shop here. Lots of fun to get a cup of cocoa and shop!
Frozen fountain. Love Bryant ParkAlways hit it for Shake Shack and a respite from midtownThe surrounding architecture is so Belle Epoque

Xmas on ice in Bryant Park, perfect!!. We took our two daughters, 19 & 11, to the ice rink while we were in NYC for Xmas and New Year and they had a wonderful time.Such a great venue, wonderful atmosphere and some amazing shopping in those little kiosks located all around the venue.It was a wonderful day and the girls absolutely loved it, a once in a lifetime experience for us coming from our Australian summer right into NYC's icy winter, memorable.
I love this place. I love Bryant Park in winter, summer, spring and autom. Trees, birds , The ski rink is one of my fav

A Nice Park for Lunch. Bryant Park is really a nice place to stroll around and weather permitting, sit/lay on the grass or sit at the many tables and chairs and enjoy lunch. There are also two nice restaurants right in the park as well - one is a café for a beer and quick bite, and another a more upscale restaurant for a sit down meal. A good place to people watch...

The BEST place to Ice Skate!. Half the price of Central park ice skating and much better rink conditions and the skates were fabulous compared to the latter mentioned. So glad we took the kids!! Beautiful!
Cosy park. We visited this park last February during Valentine's day. It's a lovely small park which you should visit.

Little Gem. This park in conveniently located in 42st on busy intersections. They have activities all year around. It great rest stop..they have reading and game section..they also have a carrusel for kids...during the summer they host movies..beer garden and host various eating pop up shops...during the winter they host an Ice Skating ring which is free....also during Christmas times...they host a market with plenty of shops and eateries...you will always find tons of seating and greenery.....
Great park. Just a great park to hang out. Lots of chairs and table to sit and in a great location. Wonderful in the winter when all the vendors and the ice skating rink is up.

A gem in midtown. Nowhere in midtown NYC has more happiness than the ice rink in Bryant Park. People of all ages and skills skate to soft music, arms interlinked, and heads mentally present. It is just like in the movies, the slightly older ones, where couples and kids follow the same rhythm as they stumble or stride, surrounded by Sinatra or Cole's famous lyrics. Even better - admission is free. And if you do not have skates, you can pay a small sum to borrow them.
Ice skating by the Christmas markets. Lovely destination in winter. Kids loved the ice skating, while mum loved the markets around the edge.

Charming Ice Rink. Bryant park is 'cute' by any park standard but the ice rink in winter is just magical. I can't skate so I stood by the side of the rink and enjoyed watching other skaters old and young, couples, families and a few show-offs. A good way to spend valentine's night.

My favourite. This is my favourite place in New York City. I love going and sitting down with a coffee. It's just a nice quiet place int he middle of the city. Very small but I can't wait to see it in the summer.

Christmas kiosks were a real hoiday gem. Many little shops selling a little of this and a little of that - jewelry, decorations, Irish items, incense, various food items. The close contact with the sellers proves New Yorkers can be amongst the friendliest of people. Bought an Irish sweater which became the mainstay of my winter clothing.

Go check it out!. We were here March 14th, and they were doing some work to the middle part of the park. It is a great park, I really want to go back in better weather. It has ping pong tables, cosy chairs and must be great in good weater. In one end you have the Public Library witch also seem to be a place one should see.

Great boutique shopping at Christmas. Bryant Park becomes a winter wonderland during the holiday season with great little artisan boutiques, food booths and an ice skating rink. The Christmas tree is beautiful and less crowded than Rockefeller Center.

Sheer oasis. I love the Bryant Park Grill, but also the loads of food and dining options opposite---everything from Japanese to Chipotle! March is not the best time to be here but tea or lunch in summer is a must do at the Grill. Something I would change- the Grill serves food from 5 pm -- so if you miss lunch hours you have to hop across to one of the regular restos.

Surprised to Find a Park Near Grand Central. When we were visiting, the park was being transitioned from a winter skating attraction to the spring and summer mode. Temporary buildings were being removed and we were disappointed that there was no longer ice skating available. It sure was cold enough. There were nice benches to relax and nice views. I imagine we would have enjoyed it more in the warmer weather.Tip: The Macy's Parade usually goes right past this park.

Great park!. I love Bryant Park. It's right in the middle of everything and is a nice tranquil spot to take a chill moment or eat some take out. There is lots of seating. Great spot for people watching too.

Wait a bit to visit the Park. The park has had to deal with the snow. The weather channel had shots of the frozen fountain but it was in a state of unhappy thaw when we were there and crews were slowly shoveling away the melting snow. It's a great little oasis in the city when the weather warms up but it will take a few weeks for its winter closed up sections to be opened up and ready to welcome guests in appropriate NYC fashion. Chairs are out and New Yorkers are bringing their lunches, but it's the restaurant behind the Park that's the real draw.
NYC trip. Nice place to relax in the city . They were setting up for Christmas stuff when we were there big variety of Christmas items think there was coffee shop restaurant place there also .
Free WiFi and lots of seating. Good location and a great place to sit and rest in the winter sun. The free WiFi was a suprise. Conveniently located behind the Library.

great place to meet up, relax outdoors and people watch. Year round outdoor area to meet others, sit and relax, people watch and take in NYC. Winter ice skating, summer shopping...if you dress right Bryant Park can be enjoyed year round. It is very safe, centrally located and a small but pretty place in the middle of the best city in the world.

Frozen fountain. well it was winter and the fountain was frozen, the ice rink was there and busy, there are places you can get a drink alcohol, soft drinks coffee and grab a snack, and generally just chill out watching the skaters
Frozen. It was wonderful to watch the skaters, and diners enjoying the good weather that day, but it was amazing to see the frozen water fountain in the middle of the park.
I just love this park!!!. amazing view, skyscrapers & nature at the same time! Whenever I visit NYC I definitely have to pass from this wonderful and small park!!!
Too cold.. It was so cold the fountain was frozen over. But one could tell it was great to have an outdoor park right smack dab in the middle of the city.

Under construction. Workers were busy shoveling snow to access utilities. It was a beautiful and warm day to just enjoy a moment to relax in a little park with a great location. If it hadn't been for all the workers I would have given this review 5 stars. I realize that stuff needs to get done but this seemed almost to a point of over-kill and with all the equipment that had been set up it took away from a neat little green space that many people enjoy daily. Worth the extra couple of minutes to sit down and enjoy a coffee break.
Bryant park. Is near Time square . It is like a common in any local town where they have fashion shows and many festivities. Large pretty area of grass

Beautiful little place to watch the world go by!. We loved it here .... We would often at the end of the day, if we were passing by, grab a cuppa sit inthe park and just people watch ! Beautiful little park, would love to experience in the summer
Fountain. What a lovely park..was very pretty and the fountain that was frozen which looked spectacular .would recommed

interesting market style shops and ice scating. We travelled here in winter so I don't know what it's like in summer, but in winter it well worth a visit with a great variety of small market-style shops, food and a well used ice skating rink. The fact that it backs onto the excellent and grand NY Public Library is a bonus. The Metro station at one corner of the Park makes it easy to get to.

In the heart of Manhattan. Great to visit.. I liked the location. Is right there on 42 St in the heart of the city. I was just walking around and ended up right in front of it so I decided to visit but I went now (March) and it was cold but I enjoyed walking around anyways. It's a beautiful park

Escape from it all!. Winter or Summer this is a great escape from the bustle around the corner! Situated right behind the library it is a breath of fresh air.At the moment it is very snow covered, with ice rink (where we watched some ice hockey) and the fountain is very very frozen which is spectacular to see by itself! Coffee shop on the corner and an ideal place to relax.Oh and apparently they have the best and cleanest public toilets / bathrooms / washrooms (whatever) in the world!

Bryant Park,walk,eat and relax.. A great park in midtown with places to buy food and find a table to enjoy it.Relaxing yet vibrant.A must see from October thru January,ice skating,dozens of small kiosk type shops for the hollidays
Very picturesque. Unfortunately due to the weather we couldn't do muchThe fountain was frozen, but the atmosphere was very New York winter
best park ever. I love Bryant Park, it is the oasis in the middle of NYC, with the classic green chairs and perfect upkeep the park is a place everyone should visit while in NYC

Beautiful park in the heart of the city. Fell onto this park by accident. But so glad we did. we were there from 23rd Feb 2015. The ice rink was fantastic fun and romantic, the music was classic New York. The hot chocolate helped us take on the fantastic surroundings and the most amazing frozen fountain. Loved the winter village.
loved ice skating. the ice skating was excellent. Went with friends and family and we all had a great time. Don't go on weekends if possible because it's very crowded

Cute little space...icy tundra in NYC!. I bet Bryant park is beautiful in other seasons! In February it is an icy wasteland! Although, like most of New York, I went there to look at the fountain, frozen in mid-stream by the brutal temperatures. Looking forward to going to this lovely little space again when it's somewhat warmer though!
First time in New York. What was awesome about Bryant park when we visited was the skating there was free and you don't get anything free anymore which is awesome...

Unless there is something going on, you could skip. It's just a park like many in NY - it has some nice things, but it's a park - if there's no special event going on that you HAVE to see (like an art exhibition or fashion week), you can skip it. There's lots of nice parks with better trees/flowers/atmosphere.

Good place for recreation. This is much smaller than Central Park but Bryant Park has its own uniqueness. Which walking down the park you will find live bands playing in the park. Good food options also available here.
Good place to walk or hang around with your loved one.
A place to read a book. What i love about parks in NYC is that you can sit anywhere you like and open a book and read. There are few artist who sit here and you can get a nice sketch of your self.
Absolutely worth a visit. Especially on a gorgeous day. You can also sit outside in the summer and have a drink or even a meal. Wonderful spot.

an oasis of calm amongst the 'madness'. It's a great place to chill and have a coffee and watch the world go by! The cafe is good and seating area is also good - a great place to take a rest from the hustle and bustle!

december shopping. strolled through the boots for fair/vendors, LOTS to choose from! GOOD DEALS! one ornament in brand store was over half price for exact same thing! shop their first before hitting department stores!

Great lunch spot for people watching. I used to go here for lunch at my last job. We would go in groups of 3-10 people. Finding chairs is a chore sometimes. There are a lot of lunch options close by. Great spot for people watching.

felt like a kid again. My daughter & I just went to look at the skaters, but when we got there we said lets go skate! I am 44 & haven't been ice skating since probably my early teens. It was $15.00 per person to skate , for as long as you wanted to skate. I was quite scared , but the staff is so helpful they come around on the ice to make sure you are ok & offer assistance if needed. They also give great advice. We skated for over 2 hours and had a blast.

Stunning little festive offering! . We came across this on our sightseeing through New York, we thought it was brilliant, with a fanstatic range of shops and coffee stalls along with a ice rink! We came here nearly every day just for a coffee and to watch the skating! Loved it! Worth a visit
One for the ice skaters. Bryant Park is quite small, but it offers a lot. An ice rink and restaurant had us set for the night. Not cheap, however you pay for the atmosphere.

Fantastic Skating!. Wonderful effort next to a MOST beautiful library! Good job, NY! Way to bring the Outside, outside! But the coffee shops weren't opened before 12 so rink side wasn't available--that would have been worth the cold.
out of place. This is a wee gem in the middle of the streets. When we were there the skating rink was in full flow. In the better weather what a fab place to have a coffee and watch the world go by!

Great Shops. When we were there, they had the ice rink and shops set up. Lots of cute little shops selling foods and lots of handmade and one off kind of things. A great way to spend the afternoon and trdelnik!!
Great anytime. Lovely in spring, summer & fall to just sit and enjoy the open park space. From thanksgiving thru Christmas there is a wonderful gift market and ice rink.

My Favorite Park in a City Full of Parks. This is a quaint, Victorian park, with ornate fencing and fountain, in winter a skating rink, kiosks of goods for sale, a carosel, and it's full of New Yorkers and Visitors. There's also a restaurant, and plenty of fast food. The charm of this park is what draws me and especially at Christmas with the enormous tree given to the city by Canada every year, which has a special ceremony one night to light it. Lovely place. Glad the city hasn't destroyed it.
Great Family Visit location.. They have the rink, great restaurants, and just a wonderful open space in the middle of the crowded city.

Limited by winter. We were there a couple timse on a blustery winter weekend when there wasn't much to see except well-tented activities mostly for kids (we didn't go in) and an ice skating rink. Had a super late Valentine's dinner at the Bryant Park Grill after going to the theatre and spending a fair amount of time walking all around trying to find open restaurants. Nice view of the park, very good food. We were grateful that they let us in and didn't limit our menu choices at such a late hour.

Christmas visit was awesome. I loved this little park - little compared to Central Park. It was very welcoming and homey at Christmas time with lots of little vendors and food stands. Definitely a place to go anytime

Ice Skating and shops!. Part of the family went ice skating (way more reasonable than Rockefeller Center and so much more lovely, could see the lights changing on the Chrysler Building) and the other part of the family went to visit the tents/shops that were set up in their village. Not sure if this is here year round, or just at Thanksgiving/Christmas, but we all had a grand time!

The nicest Ice Rink in NY !!!. Lovely Bryant Park is very beautiful at christmas time, when there takes place the Winter Village with the charming Ice Rink at the Back of NY Public Library! Much more greater the the Rockefeller Center … New York at it's Best !!!

What a view to Empire State Building. The park itself had a really nice winter lights and positive atmosphere (I could imaging the place full of people enjoying piknik etc during the summer time) when adding the stunning Empire State Building to the background it was really worth visiting!

Lovely little park. Wish we could have gone skating but a day of walking around = extremely cold and sore feet! We went for a wonder through the park and it was getting dark, the park was lit up and very snowy, looked lovely! Nice to find this in amongst all the massive buildings
There's ice skating!. Loved it. Loved it. So close to things but nicely nestled away. NYPL is right there. Historic. Fun. What else could I ask?

Nice place to sit. Bryant Park is conveniently located on 42nd Street and it is a great place to sit and watch the city go by. There are some shops, coffee and a great restaurant $$. Is a must visit in NYC.

A fun evening Ice-Skating!. With free entry, all you need to purchase is your locker and your skate rentals. A cheap evening and lots of fun.Of course you shouldn't laugh, but it's hard not to with all the people slipping and falling around you!The lady who served me at the till was very kind and patient, however the man who took my bag off for me for storage could have had a better attitude. It seemed like he was grumpy as everyone around him was having fun and he was stuck sorting out people's bags. Well tough; put a smile on your face, and cheer up. There was no time-limit to the skating and so we spent a lot of time on the ice, just whizzing around and having fun. It was a brilliant evening, filled with laughter.
Haven . In the hustle Bustle of NY, this place is heaven. A library, newspapers, games, place to eat.. Movies at night ... I can and have chilled for a day there

Beautiful Park in the middle of the city . Nice place to sit back and take in the atmosphere. Toilets here are very clean. Enjoy the views of which you can see Chrysler and Empire State at the same time. Pleasant place to people watch.

Great NYC park for all seasons. During the winter season ( late Oct to late Feb ), I often take my son here to ice skating ( free, bring your own skates ), then we walk north to see the Christmas tree at Rockefeller Center. During spring, summer, and fall, this is a good place to enjoy your lunch or snack break ( brown bag lunch ). Some evenings during the summertime they even show classic outdoor movie.The public bathrooms were small but very clean.
Fab Christmas tree. The Christmas tree was huge and the day we visited it snowed. Very cold but a great place to walk around

Awesome NY winter vibes! . You won't find me on ice much, willingly that is but, I was pleasantly surprised at the quintessential NY feel of it. I went (secretly reluctant) for the kids sake, compliments of my sissy's employer, and had quite the time. It was one of the coldest days in NYC in years (hence, the frozen fountain) but the temperature was no bother. The hot chocolate (w/ marshmallows) was more delightful than I remember, the penguin guides for the amateur ice skater, children and adults alike) was ever so clever (and costly), and the crowd of families/friends enjoying quality time together was heartwarming. I love NYC for everything it is. I haven't been to many cities but I can't imagine any other being as great, on so many levels. Perhaps I'm biased. I love this city!!!! Happy winter!
nice place to watch and relax. Great location for winter festivities. Couldn't believe the fountain frozen in the position it was. The ice rink was cool too.

Smaller than I imagined. A little private owned gem of a park in Manhattan,I walked past it first of all when on my way to New York public library,it was only on my way back to Times Square that I noticed it.There were tables out for people to sit at but at my time of visiting,NYC was experiencing extreme cold temperatures and were not in use,the park though did have an ice rink.Because the weather was so cold,I didn't spend much time here but on my next visit and with warmer weather I intend to
Lovely park just off 5th Avenue.. The park was covered in snow and the fountain was completely frozen, totally unbelievable! There is an ice skating rink and it is pleasant to walk through.
little gem. We were there at valentines day, the place was full of snow, people giving out free flowers and watching people skating it was brill.
Nice Winter Spot. Great little park in the middle of the City. The winter festival area is really nice with a skating rink to use in the winter months. In the summer they have some great concerts.

Quintessential NYC Experience. What's not to like about Bryant Park? It's seems to be the magnet for foot traffic in this part of town. Just think a chance to walk through a charming sun-drenched park with trees and green space instead of on concrete between sunless skyscrapers. Located behind the New York City Public Library it's easy to find and enjoy - no matter the time or season. It's a wonderful gift to the people of New York and the world.

always the trendy NYC vibe. and always good to be back,a bit for everything according to seasons.. the outdoors overlooking the public library, people and surrounded by skyscrapers, what else NYC can be..
Late Evening walk. enjoyed seeing the lights in the park and skating rink - beautiful but chilly with sub- zero temperatures.
Beatiful as always. Even it was a very cold day, the fountain was frozen, the ice rink full of skaters, we could still enjoy the view and the peace the park offers you.
Great spot. I love visiting Bryant Park- there's always something going on and it's such a vibrant neighborhood! There were penguins skating there on Valentine's weekend!

Year round activities. I travel to NYC frequently and stay/work in the block around Bryant Park. In the summer it's a great place to sit and enjoy lunch with lots of tables outside. In the winter they have the Christmas marketplace and ice skating rink. Great location to enjoy a moment away from the reality of city life.

Gorgeous!. Bryant Park is beautiful, a small haven in the hustle and bustle of the city. In the wintertime there is a skating rink and it's right behind the New York City Public Library which is the most beautiful library I've ever visited! There is also a great pastry store called Lady M across from Bryant Park under the Bryant Park Hotel/ American Radiator Building.
Frozen fountain. Always nice to stop by on the way back to our hotel, always something going on...............loved the frozen fountain
Awesome. Really good place to go during the winter time.Plenty of activities to do and good ice rink to skate.Good Street food at a reasonable price

Lovely oasis in the middle of Manhattan if you don't want to get to Central Park. We walked to Bryant park a few times during our visit in New York and just relaxed and enjoyed the good weather. We sat down and had a drink and it surely is the perfect oasis if you need to relax while discovering New York.

Winter Wonder Land. A superb ice skating rink with skate hire and unlimited skating. What more could you ask than for the Empire State to be your backdrop. Lots of little cafes and bars on the edge, along with live music. Perfect.

Christmas wonderland with ice skating too!!!. Bryant Park is an outdoor shopping experience. In the winter it holds a certain magic with ice skating and glimmering fairy lights.
Take a brisk stroll and buy a trinket or two..or eat some fried pickles.
In the summer, it takes on a whole new experience. Check it out..another New York attraction.

Gem of a Public Park with Much to See and Do. There are live events all the time in the temperate months. Live music, Films, Kiosks, Chess, Table Tennis, Books, all provided by the agency that runs the park. Fine dining to ice cream is available here. Check the website for the impressive events calendar. www.bryantpark.org

White fluffy snow everywhere. I normally know Bryant Park because of attending Fashion Shows there. But this trip was different, it had been snowing days before we arrived in NYC. My fellow travelers had never seen snow before especially the little ones. What a surprise for them as we walked towards the park. The little ones had a ball!! Throwing snow, laying in the snow, eating snow, amazed by the frozen fountain and the people ice skating. It was so cold out there but it was wonderful to see the little ones enjoying themselves.

Bryant Park, so nice in winter. Bryant Park is a little park near the heart of the 5th Avenue and so surrounded by skyscrapers.It is really nice, especially in winter, when there is a sort of market and the ice rink.

Come year round.. This is a beautiful park in the heart of Midtown New York City. A Gentle walk from Grand Central Station or Time Square, it offers the joyous stop anytime of the year. In the winter there are the Christmas shops and ice skating rink,and in the summer the outdoor restaurant at the back of the New York library. You will mingle with office workers eating their lunches, children waiting for the carousel, and young lovers... all this is NYC's most accessible block.

Lovely . One of my favorite places in Manhattan to relax. The atmosphere is really nice and safe. Its a nice place to drink a coffee and watch the world go by or get stuck into a novel. If you're having a busy day sight seeing in Manhattan this I'd definitely recommend some down time here :)

Lovely park. We visit Bryant Park every time we come to NYC. Last year at Christmas time there were all types of little booths set up selling their wares, the ice rink was packed and the Christmas tree was beautiful. We missed the tree and the booths this year, but the rink was still packed. Even during non-Christmas times of the year, the park is beautiful and things to do. You can sit and people watch and also play checkers at one of the tables. Very peaceful and relaxing part of the city
Not promoted enough. This is a little secret that I discovered on a previous trip. Very pretty area that can be seen from Empire State

Ice skating at Bryant Park. When visiting New York City, ice skating in the snow was on our list to complete. We got the subway straight to Bryant Park and walked across the road to the ice skating rink. The hire of skates was just $15 which is much more affordable then the skating at Central Park! We throughly enjoyed the experience and would return when in NYC again in the winter.

green oasis in the garment district. this park used to be horrid when I lived on 39th street in the 80s. Now it is an oasis for the lunch crowd of the businesses around. There are alsways activities in the summer evenings. Films, concerts etc. and in the winter there is an ice ring.

Beautiful park; close to library which one must se as well. If you are close to the Chrysler Building, you are close to Bryant Park; nice park! Do not miss! A very nice area; great people watching location, but then just about every place in NYC is a great people watching place!
Midtown Oasis. Skaters this winter were joined by a New Orleans jazz band on Saturday in defiance of the cold weather. Delightful!

Year Round Enjoyment. Bryant Park is enjoyable year round. In the winter months it has a lovely market selling anything from wooly hats to hot chocolate. The ice rink is also free (you just have to rent skates). In the summer the grass area is lovely to rest on and Broadway Stars often perform at lunchtime on the greens!

A wonderful Christmas Market. This has been a Christmas highlight of a bi-annual visit to New York. The small studio stalls are a delight with many creative ideas. The stall holders are full of Christmas cheer and a very pleasant. A fist full of dollars are needed

A great place for Ice Skating & Hot Chocolate. Instead of going to Rockefeller plaza to skate, we found this park close to our hotel. We purchased family pass the same day we went and printed the tickets in the lobby of our hotel. Doing that saved us at least an hour wait to get in. The Skating rink was pretty large and the skates were in good condition. It was a great experience. We also loved the little kiosks with different foods and retail items. It was fun to shop in that area as well. I highly recommend this for skating over the other places in the city.

Great park - all seasons. Love, love love this park! There is always something going on, something to see, something to do. During the winter and before Christmas there's shopping kiosk's and FREE ice skating continues weather permitting until spring when the lawn games appear. During the summer and fall kids play, families picnic and film nights are held. One of my favorite places.

So center but so quiet !. Unbelievable ! We're in the heart of NYC, and not a sound from outside the park comes and disturbs the quiet atmosphere ! Also, between Xmas and NYE, the Winter Village is quite nice to see, the ice rink is lots of fun, however do not buy hotdogs around the park at this time of the year as they are a real rip-off of cold bread with almost uncooked sausage for 5 bucks each...

Great all year round.. A place to relax in the warmer weathers. But in the winter, there is FREE ice skating (if you have your own skates, there is a fee if you rent skates), a nice restaurant, and holiday shops. Enjoy!
Skating in winter. This is the perfect place in NY for Ice Skating during the winter. The park itself is beautiful and no one cares if you fall. You just rent a pair of skates and have a good time.
i like it.. as with all parks, visit it on a nice day. it is like a street fair. many shops are set up inside it. get anything from socks to dinner and enjoy the open air

Cute shops set up all around Bryant Park. We went in December and it was really cold, but we loved walking I to all of the small shops that are dotted around Bryant Park. There's an ice skating rink, plenty of places that sell hot chocolate and lots of shopping if you're looking to take a gift back to someone. One store made these amazing, large ginger cookies but I unfortunately can't remember the name of it. If you see these, be sure and buy one. I imagine Bryant Park is beautiful and fun in the Spring, Summer and Fall seasons. I'd definitely go back during one of these seasons and hang out for a few hours. Plus there are markets that sell fresh fruits and vegetable.
great park. love visiting this park, i am from ny so i vist often. in spring/summer always events going on..also a great place to people watch

Always go back. We go to Bryant Park everytime we go to NYC around the holidays, before or after. Great place to walk around, not as congested as other parts of NY for us. Great artisians selling their wares and plenty of good food in the area.

FREE movies in the park. You have to get there at 5pm on a Monday in the Summer for the movie series. Blankets, wine, sandwiches and a free outdoor movie amongst your closest 500 friends. It's a blast!

Excellent Toilets!. The park is a little piece of heaven in the hustle and bustle of the city, and like other big cities its difficult to find nice toilets. These are really good, nice and clean, with jolly plastic seat covers, a first I've ever seen. If you remember the films like Death Wish etc. this park was once a no go zone, so to see it how it is today is a good story.

My favourite green spot in Manhattan. Just behind the Public Library is this small cute park, love the tables and chairs available to everyone to play chess, cards, or just sip your coffee, a little oasis of peace away from the mad crowd of 5th Ave.
Ice skating in Bryant Park. Loved the ice skating in Bryant Park, it was amazing! If you're there during winter it's a must do. I think it was about $50 for 2 people to skate & a locker.

Nice oasis. Nice oasis in middle of Manhattan. Obviously Central Park is great, but it is in a league of its own. Bryant park seems pretty populated on a nice day. But, it was fairly easy to find a free table and chairs. If, you have room and time, play some friz-bee :-)
Beautiful respit in the middle of the city. This is my favorite park in NYC. Located right in the middle of midtown. This park is a great place to enjoy people watching.

Winter Wonderland. The park was close to our hotel and often on the walk back of an evening we would stop and have a nigh cap around the fire pit. It was lovely to amble around all the little christmas cabins of an evening. Lovely ice rink too. Very friendly atmosphere

A Real Gem. Had no idea that we would even be passing Bryant Park as we headed out to explore on our first day of a 4 day weekend. The grove of sycamore trees (at least we think they were sycamores!) caught our eyes and in we strolled. Visited there day and night for 3 days in a row. Always something fun going on. Great, great music for the skaters!! The fountain totally froze over which made for a great picture.

Winter Wonderland. We stumbled across Bryant Park on our way walking to 5th avenue from our hotel, it had a huge christmas tree to rival the Rockerfeller Center, a big ice rink under an even bigger marquee and lots of stalls selling christmas fayre, magical.

Dont Miss !!. This is one place in NYC where you go and watch people doing Ice skating most of time. If you can like doing Ice skating this is must visit place is NYC. It is surrounded by some landmark buidlings and luxurious hotels. Just adjacent to New york public library.

Another magical park. When I arrived in 1979 this place was just plain scary. I mean really scary.Now it is a midtown jewel. A really grand, but very utilitarian space. In the winter there is a great ice rink, at Christmas a pricey, but fun market, in the summer outdoor films and year round a restaurant and bar very popular with the midtown accounts, lawyers, etc.I just love this space. In spite of being on 42nd St, it can actually be quite peaceful. A visit to the NY Public Library is a must (SUCH a wonderful, wonderful building and free!!) and a drink afterwards in Bryant Park will give a you feel of being a New Yorker.
Christmas Market. Nothing to dislike. Shops are unique. You can watch the ice skaters or partake in this sport. Puts you in the holiday spirit.LoisD

A wonderful shopping excursion!. After many years of seeing Bryant Park on television and in movies, I finally went to visit. The shops are delightful and eclectic. The park itself is so iconic and beautiful. Bryant Park is a wonderful place to spend a peaceful afternoon eating, shopping or just sitting and watching the people as they stroll or rush through.

Ice Skating in the City!. We met an old friend here while we were in the city with our daughter and he told us about ice skating here. The line at Rockefeller was too long for our short stay. It was a beautiful day and she had a blast ice skating in NYC. We felt like insiders!!
Really Fun. One of my favorite destinations in the City, it is a truly beautiful park, although it is relatively small. So nice to look at the incredible buildings through the trees!
Ice Skating and Dog Walking. Bryant Park is a true city park. It is a great stroll in midtown and nice for dog walking. The Library is there, too. Ice skaters were a joy to watch.

Skating in Winter. We travelled in jan 2015 and the rink was open. It is worth a try though it is crowded. So, going early might work better. There are places to eat around Bryant Park which makes it a good hangout place to get some breath and food.

Great spot in the Summer or Winter. Bryant Park is a smaller park in the Midtown area set between 40th and 42nd streets and 5th and 6th Avenue. The Central Library is on one side and taller residential buildings and office blocks on the others. Although it sounds closed in it has a cosy feel to the place, not to big or to small. We visited in February and although there was snow on the ground the park had lots of visitors and the area was set up for a skating rink and had stalls selling hot food and drinks. I met a local lady whilst there who told me that it was her favourite park in New York and she visited all the time. In Summer it is particularly well used especially in the evenings and weekends when families use it and have pick-nicks on the grassed areas. If your passing its a lovely place to visit.

Great place to take a break. Great place to take a break from shopping or kill some time before a show as it's quite close to Times Square and Broadway but not right in the middle of it. The shops that go up around Christmas are fabulous.

Great Spot. A nice little park that is a fantastic place to sit and relax for a short time while you are visiting Midtown. In winter you can skate here for free (just have to rent skates if you don't have your own) and there is a cool little winter festival the last weekend of January, first weekend of February. The New York Public Library is right in the park so you should stop in there for a peek while you're in the area.

Smaller than expected. The park is more of a square than a park! It has some good spots for sitting and watching the world go by, the ice Rink was very busy, the frozen water fountain was beautiful and the buildings surrounding it are very pretty, worth a visit

Very Festive. We have watched Fergie here during a GMA concert in the summer; and, have now visited during the Christmas season. It was very nicely decorated with an ice skating rink in the middle. There were also may kiosks that sold everything including crafts, food, art, clothing, jewelry, seasonal items, etc. We wish we had more time to explore the shops.

Ice Skating. Not sure why anyone would go anywhere else to ice skate in NYC. It's free with a great backdrop. Granted it gets crowded but when I went an hour after the first session it wasn't that crowded. Really nice.

Skating rink. We always stop by. Great place to skate and grab some coffee. The lines to skate were long at all. Occ there will be lots of shops set up there to buy different knick knacks. The fountain on the west side of the rink was partially frozen over and a beauty to watch!!!

winter skating. What I liked was, it's closeness to Greyhound/Port Authority, Grand Central, Times Square, and Public Library. What I liked best, was sitting outside and watching the skaters on a winter day.
LIght up night. The wintry night scene had a beautifully illuminated ice sculpture, and lively well used skating rink, and outdoor seating. A happy, energetic family atmosphere.
Great Place. This is a great place in the heart of Times Square, there is a nice fountain and sitting area, free ice skating in winter. Well worth a short stop to sit down and relax.

Take a moment to scan the skyline... Gotham. I love this square. Nestled behind the Public Library it's a little treasure. Fashion in spring, ice-skating in winter, a funfair, restaurant and a casual seating/cafe area... Best of all though is the skyline. From the southern end you have Gotham (check out the Bryant Park Hotel's distinctive black and gold facade and you expect to see Batman at the top), the Library, the skyscrapers in glass to the West and the wonderful swoop of the buildings to the north.
Very nice. Up until march, I think, there is the winter garden with skating rink which is free, there is a few tents with coffee etc and another a bar. Very nice atmosphere there.

A Little hub of activity in NYC. We walked through Bryant Park on the way to Grand Central Terminal during our visit. It was in January with sub-zero temperatures and as such, the fountain had frozen up whilst the water was still running - it looked really pretty.There is also an ice rink here, which gets busier as the evening progresses. A lovely little find to sit and people watch.

Lovely Spot!. My girlfriends and I were here and stumbled upon Bryant Park. We were tired from a long day of walking but were rejuvinated by the Christmas Shops and Food shacks. We enjoyed browsing in the little shops with very interesting wares, and had a cup of spiced cider, as well as endulged in some macaroons and a caramel filled churro (whoa! SO good!). Such a lovely find!

always a treat. Whenever we are in Manhattan, we always pay a visit to Bryant Park. Any time of year, it is a pleasant stroll in the midst of the giant skyscrapers, with various activities always going on. It only takes a few minutes to see, but don't miss it.

I can spend a whole day here. The location is great. It is right in the middle of the city and next to a library. It's very close to Times Square. There are tables and chair that you can sit without being have to order anything.
Bryant park, NYC : an oasis. In the middle of so many high buildings, crowded streets, Bryant Park deserves a visit. In winter, the fountain gets icy and that's a beautiful picture!
The Christmas market and ice rink. A Christmas wonderland, magical and intimate. Nestled in the city and yet welcoming and small. The winter food stalls were amazing
ok. Looks like a nice enough park right in the middle of a busy citycenter. Maybe nicer in summertime. Wintertime just an iceskating ring.
Bryan Park. What a sight. The skating looked awesome, although we didn't get an opportunity to do so. So much to see and appreciate. Beautiful park.

Pretty trees. Okay park. Wouldn't put it on a must see list. Beautiful trees. Christmas market wasn't very good, but last year we were in Germany soooo maybe it's an unfair comparison. Lots of "made in China" wares.
Beautiful park to relax. We really like to stroll through Bryant Park with the lovely buildings all around. Very nice atmosphere just before dawn with the beautiful street lanterns

Watched ice skating, had a bite to eat, and relaxed. Great stop. Nothing fancy, we just got app's and watched the skaters. Was a good location for a drink and little bite to eat. Would go back again. In the Winter around the holiday's they have 'shops' setup to do shopping, which we did in December, THAT was a lot of fun, would do that again in a minute.
Ice skating in Bryant Park. A nice park on 42st and 5th, this time they had put a ice skating rink, it was fun to see people of all ages enjoying themselves in the freezing air.

Winter Fair. Bryant Park was smaller than I had imagined but it was really cool to be walking by and see that they were having a Winter Festival. It included a ice rink, biergarten, one act plays in tents, food and other things. Pretty cool to stumble on.
Great for ice skating!. Loved the scenery and the ambience and it was wonderful to browse the kiosks during the holidays.Much less crowded than Rockefeller Center!

The best Christmas tree in NYC!. Wow~ so many booths at the winter market! The Christmas tree at Bryant Park is, dare I say it, better than the Rockefeller tree!?! Yes, it is. Sure, it's cold out, but there are heaters set up, so get a hot drink, sit back and take it all in. Love the chairs! There's a great skating rink, but it's not cheap. I'll bring my skates next time.

Nice group of shops with ice skating. We enjoyed walking around this area and doing a little shopping for some original items, trying some NY treats and watching the ice skating. Nice place to hang out and relax.
Fun for winter as well. Always filled with lots to see and do. Love going here! Ice skating, music, food and wine. What could be better. What a beautiful park!

Always pleasent. I live three blocks away from the park and its one of my favorite spots in the city. Summer, winter, it does not matter: is always great. You can see live shows and even movies in the summer- last year, we were able to see ET. Amazing!

Beautiful and Relaxing. This is a beautiful park in the city to sit and relax. It is close the library and a Starbucks. We visited in late May and it was a lush green and enjoyable to sit with your coffee in the morning and enjoy the outdoors.
My favorite park in NYC. This park in the middle of NYC rash is my favorite! Great place to stop for a lunch or after work relaxing time or to meet with friends to have a cup of coffee!

Great park, lovely coffee... A hidden gem x. This is a lovely park next to the main library ( which starred in the film the day after tomorrow) and is lovely for coffee, cakes..
Lots of space to relax....outdoor cinema n summer...just lovely. Avoid the restaurants as they are overpriced and the food is not great...gongonthenlittle coffee stalls in the park instead much cheaper and great snacks.

The TREES in Winter are Fabulous!!. What drew us into this park on a January afternoon were the bare-branched tree trunks. They were SO beautiful with the sun shining on them. I looked them up and found that they are London Plane Trees. They were SO charming. We also loved watching the skaters!! What a treat to find this park close to the NYC Library.

Beautiful set up at Christmas time. We spent Christmas night here, watching the ice skaters and walking around absorbing the atmosphere. There are stalls around the rink, some closed, but most of them open, quaint little set up with a beautiful Christmas tree.
Picture perfect
Lovely park. I used to go to school right across from Bryant Park in 2005. This was like my playground. Very good memories there.

Great to people watch.. We stayed in the Strand Hotel a few blocks away and as it was winter, the ice rink was set up. It was great to watch all the people ice skating and to sit and have lunch from one of the many cafes around.

Just the Park you wish for. They had ice-skating going on during the period of my visit, got into the line and into the ring, was a fun experience, took my time to enjoy the hot chocolate.
Various food stalls, good family crowd, a must visit place
Beautiful ice skating rink. We love the ice skating rink and the christmas market during the christmas season. It really puts you in the right Christmas mood.
Small park. In winter this park loose its glow as trees have no leaves, many shops and some public events are held, but the lights makes it bright at night, small park to stroll, seat, have coffee.

Frozen Heaven. Sure, Bryant Park is a great place in the Summer, but in the Winter, especially when the temp is below 32 degrees, the place is a wonderland. Free (practically) skating, great little shops and food joints, and a frozen running fountain (yeah, I know it sounds like a contradiction) all make for a great experience.

Small park with seating area. There was a small ice rink located here when we visited. It is a small park with a small seating area. I I agile it is very nice to sit here during better weather months but it is next to a busy main road so is quite noisy. It is more of an area to walk through than visit.
great. This is a beautiful place but is so big I would definately take the tour guide as we did and do it in warmer weather it was so cold
relaxing park off 5th ave. I have often stopped for a break from sight seeing and shopping in this mini park, it beats walking upto central park. also my fave place le pain quotidian is there

Ice Skating!. Brilliant location for ice skating, only had to pay $15 for skate rental, friendly staff and ice skaters, who helped when you fall over (which was alot for us!)
Music and lightening was perfect for a group skate!
Thanks!
Magical. Was able to ice skate here for free just put your skates on and away you go magical at night. It was very cold but no one seemed to notice.
Lovely all year round. Love this place. In the summer you can sit out and enjoy the people watching and in the winter you can ice-skate!

Fun during the holidays. Bryant Park was a great place to visit during the holidays. The ice skating rink was a lot of fun and all the vendors were so fun to peruse. We also got some great food out there at different vendors. I would definitely suggest going at night. The Christmas lights were really cool looking. It's a very cool park location right smack in the middle of NYC, just minutes from Times Square. I've only visited this location during the holidays, but would definitely recommend it.

Romantic Iceskating. I haven't been to too many ice skating rinks but from the ones I have been, this was easily the best! It's made even better when you are with a well beautiful girl. I went on a Friday night and despite it being in the centre of Manhattan it was wasn't very busy and there was plenty of room to ice skate at leisurely speed. I would avoid any other ice rinks in the city and come here instead!

Lovely atmosphere. Bryant Park is a lovely central area, when I went they still had the ice skating and Xmas markets that were so much fun!
Well worth a visit
Nice. Park is Nice and has lot's of events all year long...Big $ area. In the middle of all the sights and action in Manhattan.
Bryant Park at Night. Went there to check out the ice skating and the frozen fountain very cool in every sense, neat seeing people skating at night the christmas tree and the music playing

Great Coffee and views. A friend and I were passing by and stopped for some coffee, which was great. Cute shops and food kiosks. We were able to grab a table and had a nice view of the Empire State Building.
Beautiful skating. I loved the outdoor ice skating, the many places to sit and watch the skaters and the trees in the middle of the city.
Oasis. A lovely little oasis in the middle of a big, busy city. Upon entering one can take a deep breath and leave stress out on the sidewalk.

I love this park, it's not as touristy. This is a better park to ice skate and see a Christmas Tree for the holidays and they have cute little huts for shopping. Good place to buy things that are unique. Fun park without the huge crows that Central Park and Rockefeller Center bring.

Nice play in the middle of the city. When I was there in the evening there was a ice-ring for skating and a lot of cozy stands with food and drinks. Pretty nice to see something like that on a small scale in such a big city.

Retreat in the busiest city. Bryant Park is a tiny paradise in the middle of the skyscrapers. At night fairy lights are the witness of reunions of friends with a glass of wine and some comfy cushions.
Tore up the ice. A great spot for ice skating, a mix of experienced and newbies (like me) but what's a visit to NYC in January without some ice skating?
