A nice scape from times square. This park is a nice escape to the craziness of times square. The park has a very nice restaurant, although a bit expensive. In winter there is a skate ring that is very lively and nice. In summer, there are concerts.
quaint. a lovely place with lots of little shops selling food drink and bits and bobs also there was a ice skating rink there aswell we went in nov so it may not be there in the summer months

Time to kill. What a great place to hang out, visit with a friend and people watch, This treasure in Manhattan not far from either Penn Station or the Port Authority is a great place to visit with friends before heading out to dinner or a special occasion. There are enough vendors in the area to grab a beverage or a snack, lots of tables for snacking, and relaxing. And of course the green area for youngsters to let off steam.

Beautiful Space in the heart of the city. This is a great park located right next to the Library. There is Ice skating in the winter and lots of little shops. They also have concerts in the summer. I just love to go and sit there and people watch.
Carousel. Bryant Park was really nice, even during the frigid day we went. My girlfriend and I went on the carousel in the park and had so much fun. The attendant was funny and kind.
All year round. Sitting , coffee, a drink if you are so inclined, and ice skating and shopping in the winter season.
This is a gem of a park near Times Square. For a little sunshine, a cup of coffee, people watching or a stroll this is a wonderful gem just south of Times Square.

Really liked it!!!. The ice skating rink wasn't nearly as full as Rockefeller Center's (not that we were skating, but it's always nice to watch people enjoying themselves). Got great little shopping kiosks with a variety of items, both seasonal and "permanent"... It's a great place to hang out and decompress in such a fast-paced city.
We there Christmas night and had a great time.. Convenient walk from the hotel and beautifully decorated. I have been there many times and it is always full over fun and good energy.
want to go there when things going on!. We were there on friday afternoon and there wasn't anything going on but walked through it and it would be great to be there when they had stuff going on,

Historic Area, Great for People Watching, Relaxing.. Just below Times Square. A very scenic and green area for people to hang out. Art in abundance, food, drinks, crafts, carousel and William Cullen Bryant himself looks over all of it.

Upscale Outdoor Vendor in Square Near Library. Bryant Park has many vendors with quite a few one-of-a-kind things--I would describe it as an upscale craft show--nice jewelry, scarves and other accessories, glass, pottery, wood, and, of ,course,food and entertainment. Centrally located--stop by and pick up a hat to keep you warm.

Ice Skating at Christmas. We went to this park solely to see the ice skating and because it was so close to Times Square and where we were staying. It was beautiful and there were shops/stalls around the rink and a giant Christmas tree. Well worth seeing especially at this time of the year.
Quaint. Great location, free ice skating in central NY!! Sit and relax with hot drinks or watch the skaters...quiet and has shops too
Nice to have a wander round. We went and saw it after going to the world trade centre site. Nice to have a walk around after the emotional visit

Fabulous Spot. Bryant Park is a great spot in New York to stop for a coffee or snack (in Winter when they have the food stalls set up)
It was great to stop, and watch the Ice-Skaters while warming up with a coffee :)
Great range of food and stalls on offer!
Enjoyable winter evening!!. We enjoyed the quaint shopping booths and the ice skating rink was much larger then the one at Rockefeller Center. Ice skating admission is free!

Great park in mid-town. Go slightly out of your way to be in Bryant Park. Lots going on in all seasons, but plenty of open space and little beverage and food stalls if you just want a snack. Surrounding the park are restaurants and shopping. I really nice outdoor space.
Fun. Love to hit the little market shops and get gifts at Christmastime. And go ice skating! Hot chocolate a must!!!

The best part is the smell!. We visited Bryant Park in the winter, which was probably why we didn't fall in love with it. There was a skating rink that seemed really busy, and a few little shops, but nothing spectacular.My favorite part was the smell- let's face it that are not many areas in NYC where that is the case. The air smelled like a mix of pocorn, choclate, and cinammon from the food stands around the park. One sold Nutella treats, another popcorn and funnel cakes. Another nice thing was seeing the fountain frozen over. Most places shut off their fountains, but here we saw a frozen fountain and it was beautiful.
Winter. Nice with rink and little shops. But the hot chocolate was terrible. Way to sweet and thick. Melted chocolate would taste Bette so don't waste your money on it.

Cute. I really loved this park, I visited Christmas time and they had the tree there and stalls selling lots of different stuff. You wouldn't walk away from the park and not buy anything. It is easy to get to also and just very cute and quirky, just my cup of tea.
What an experience!. Was there when the christmas shops and ice skating was there and it was fantastic. What an atmosphere. There was so much to see it was great.
summer movies. Love this park with free WIFI, love sitting here. Summer you have free movies playing while you picnic on the grass. Love it

Good in winter. I visited Bryant park both in summer and winter seasons.In summer the park was full of green with trees and plants. I like this park in Winter for ice skating. There are many little shops around the park which you will see only in the Winter.

Holiday Market. The Holiday Market around the ice rink was great! Lots of thing to see and to eat! Kids loved the ice skating...even if they did stay on the rail! The choices of shopping and eating were varied...something for everyone ! One drawback was that some of the restaurant booths closed early! Felt very safe there. A real CHRISTMAS experience!

beautiful park. A wonderful park to relax and sit in no matter what time of year. Centrally located and lots of little cafes inside. There is often entertainment and it's just a great place to sit for a little while.

Great Christmas Market. This is such a fun place to be around Christmas time. The market is always great and watching people skating and going about their pre-Christmas routines is so enjoyable. Don't miss this place if you are there around Christmas time. It's great!

A Great Place To Visit In Winter. Bryant Park is just a great place to visit during the winter because of the free admission “Rink At Bryant,” which is the centerpiece of the Bank of America Winter Village, the bocce ball court and numerous places to sit reminiscent of Barefoot In The Park.
I just love this park.

Winter Village was Amazing. We visited here in December and a few weeks later in January. The winter village is fantastic with the skate rink and food areas. In December the Christmas markets were running and added an amazing element to the park. The variety of stalls was great ranging from soaps to yummy waffles! It had a wonderful atmosphere and added to the Christmas vibe. When we returned in Januray sadly the markets were packed up and no longer running but the ice rink was still going strong. The line for the ice rink was very long in December but in January the line was almost non existent - still busy bit no long line!
Relax and refresh in the middle of Manhattan. This small park is a green hub of activity in a very busy part of NYC. It is a great stopping place to regroup, get a snack and watch other visitors.

Beautiful winter wonderland. We visited during Christmas so there was the Christmas market and ice skating going on. It was a beautiful atmosphere both during the day and at night. It was also good to go back after Christmas day when the sale starts as we managed to get some good bargains at this time!
Nice Christmas Day Walk. We went here after seeing the memorial. Lovely park to get a great view of the statue of liberty. People walking dogs, running etc. Great place

Fun park with Christmas shops and ice skating. Our hotel was next to Bryant Park so we walked over to check out the tents and ice skating. We found a great cookie and macroon shop and had coffee while watching the ice skaters. It was very nice and fun watching the people. It was not very crowded compared to rockfeller center and great to stroll around and check out the shops.

Brrrrr i Brrrrrryant Park!. A nice respite in midtown even in the cold. A good sized ice rink. It smelled so good during our visit as they has just ground up Christmas trees for the mulch around the beds. A lovely memory with no pressure. Only down side is how often we were approached by folks in need.

Lovely park transformed into Christmas Market. Visited the park one morning and looked round the interesting stalls selling Christmas goods. Watched the skaters on the large ice-rink - (some better than others!) and also some very good table-tennis matches. Everybody seemed to be having a good time and there were plenty of seats scattered around to rest your legs. The place felt very clean and safe and it was an interesting couple of hours.

A real gem. This is a great place to relax at all times of the year.In summer it's a great place to rest and have a long lunch. At Christmas there are some very interesting stalls in the market and lots of fun to be had on the ice rink, plus the beautiful Library is just around the corner.

Great escape in Midtown in every season. I've been to this park in every season of the year and am never disappointed. Bryant park offers shopping, craft booths, food vendors, an outdoor bar, ice skating , merry go round rides just to name a few. In the summer the grass is full of people relaxing and enjoying the sun. Great stop in NYC that I never get tired of.
Bryant Park. Bryant Park in December is a magical place to stroll and view fountains, shops and a merry go round for the children.

Lovely place to stop for a breather!. Lovely at Christmas when the Christmas market is there. Make sure you have a glass of hot cider! Very busy but full of atmosphere. Lots of places to get snacks. Good for buying souvenirs & gifts.
Tiny oasis in this vast city. A lovely little square, when we visited the ice rink was still in situ, also little stalls selling hot drinks and snacks. It was that cold the fountain was frozen
Favourite park to relax. Loved this little park to just sit, eat, drink something and read a book. The place to be if you're done running around New York or just need a break.

A peaceful Oasis in a crazy city. As a person working in NYC I walk through Bryant Park on a regular basis and regardless of season am always glad I did. Whether in the summer with the food shops and tables in the shade, in the winter when the fountain freezes into a fantastical ice sculpture, or any time between, it's a wonderful place. Definitely worth a visit anytime you're in the city, and so close to the library that it's easy to combine a visit.
Lovely. Came in January. Ice skating going on. Beautiful surroundings, nice snack booths and fountain. Very nice place to spend an evening stroll or have an afternoon lunch.

Beautiful. Very peaceful for December. The buildings surrounding the area is lovely. Loved the little shops near by. There is a great starbucks adjacent to the park. The park has great little tables for people watching. One of our favorite places during our trip.

Lovely little Christmas Market in December. A great little holiday market with quality vendors plus scenic and festive iceskating. There are plenty of food stands as well where you can grab a quick meal or hot drink.

A very nice city park in NYC. Bryant Park, formerly known as Reservoir Square, has a very interesting history that reaches back several centuries. After a rather turbulent time during much of the 20th century, Bryant Park seems to have been revitalised as part of the Bryant Park Restoration Corporation back in the 1980s. Today, you will find Bryant Park to be a lovely city park, particularly during the winter time when the ice rink and Christmas Market are taking place at the park. Park benches a plenty as well as a restaurant and summer kiosk/bar makes this a great spot for visits during warmer months as well. We highly recommend passing by Bryant Park during the winter if you are in NYC. It makes a nice resting point if you have visited attractions in the area or are walking back to the Times Square area from Grand Central Station. Park environs are festive during the holiday season and you can you really appreciate this well maintained city park for what it has become in recent decades.

We loved Bryant Park. Bryant Park was one of our favorite spots on our first visit to NYC. It was the holidays, so there was an ice skating rink and large, pretty Christmas tree, as well as a large holiday "village" of shops. We actually strolled through twice, once in the evening, when the skaters were out, but many shops were closed. The second time was mid morning, the shops were open, and we enjoyed perusing. We stopped and had a Turkish coffee, baklava and borek for a snack. So yummy!Love the neighborhood, with it's obvious mix of tourists and locals walking their dogs, and the international vibe so prevalant all over the city. Just one of our favorite spots!
Nice Park. Small park in the 5th Avenue with small fountain in mid along with Ice skiing area for lover of ice ski. Couple of cafes on corners to enjoy a drink there.

GREAT place to spend a lazy afternoon. Try the Viking "bowling" it is really a blast. This is just a perfect place for families or artists or musicians or tourists. Something for everyone here: Picnic space, restaurant, bathrooms, fountain and people watching (as well as special events).

Bryant Park at Christmas is fun!. At Christmas time, Bryant Park becomes host to multiple small shops selling Christmas goods and gifts, hot cider and hot chocolate, and several tasty treats. It also boasts a large tree - not quite as big as Rockefeller Center, but this one has pretty ornaments decorating it. And it has an ice-skating rink. There is a waiting line to skate, but not nearly as long as the ones at Rockefeller Center and Central Park. It's so close to Times Square, so if you need a break from the stores and hustle/bustle of the Square, head down 42nd Street to Bryant Park. In the summer, it is also a great place to relax and sit a while.

My favorite place in NY!. Bryant Park is a lovely small park nestled in midtown! During Christmas time it becomes a winter wonderland! There is a beautiful Christmas Tree which is decorated! There is an ice skating ring and many venders selling their wares during the holiday season... There is also a restaurant on the property. During the summer, Bryant Park is a favorite spot for people to gather, eat, or read. Forgot your book?? There is a rolling, free library cart which u may borrow a book from! The Park also displays movies on the big screen for people to watch in the summer! Simply bringing your blanket or chair and you are set.... A lovely space, for any season!!!

This was on my bucket list and I got to check it off. I always wanted to ice skate in NYC and this year I got to skate with my daughter. It was a beautiful rink with a Christmas tree in the background. My mother got to look at the shops which we always love to browse during the holidays and they had a nice seating area inside the rink area for my father to watch us. My daughter had the best time.

Outdoor dinning in winter time!. Don't let the cold put you off! the ice skating, market and dining at Celsius made for a great evening. The food at Celsius was great but be prepared for a wait to get an outdoor dining table. The market has lots of home made delights, especially the 'no chewing allowed; French truffles - yummy!!!

Great start to the New Year!. Every year we travel into the city on New Year's day to skate. We have done Rockefeller Center, Trump Rink and Bryant Park. Bryant Park is a nice size, is full of holiday cheer and is in a great location to follow up with lunch at Carmine's. We arrive early and park right on the street! And skating is free! Perfect way to start the year!
Bryant Park. Had a lot of kiosks in which to shop. Musicians while we were there made it fun. Nice place to wander, shop, eat, relax, and people watch.

Really had a Christmas feel. Did a couple of visits over new year and found the small art stands good although the sellers a bit pushy. This was great place for a coffee although maybe at my age and size I should not have tried the ice skating? Was glad Greenpeace was on hand to get me off the ice

Very Well Organized!!! Lots of Fun!!! Excellent Food!!!. My kids LOVE IT!!! the Ice Scatting Arena very well organized, they give you a bag for you shoes there is storage, docent fell so crowd because its HUGE!!! one little complaint they dont allow to have cameras inside the Ice!!! after scateing we have plenty of good local choices to eat a snack, hot chocolate, or a pickle!!! my kids docent want to leave!!! we also use the Carrousel that its quite small but its OK!!!

The Winter Park was great!. Although this shopping market is only up for the holiday season, it is worth a visit. There was a wide variety of shops– sort of like Etsy in person. We did more of our shopping at the various winter markets in NYC than anywhere else. And, of course, it's fun to see the tree, carousel, and skaters.I highly recommend stopping by if you're in the area before the holidays.

Christmas Markets. We arrived the day after Christmas and walked around Bryant Park in the morning. There was market stalls everywhere selling jewellery/scarves/candles/who knows. The skate rink was very popular and the line was very long. We grabbed a donut from a stall and sat at a table to watch the goings on.

The best hot chocolate in Winter. For second year in a row we spent Christmas time in NYC. And for second year we had the privilege of tasting the hot chocolate that makes a kiosk near the water fountain. Simply the best in that cold. The nearby rink, the Christmas music, the little shops, all is so very Christmas in this place. A visit to Bryant Park is a must in Christmas Time.
Bryant Park at Christmas. Absolutely beautiful, lots of Market Stalls and Ice Skating.. Just a great time and a great place to get away from the crowds in Times Square

Bryant park at christmas..yay. One of my favourite places to go on the build up to Christmas. Always grab a hot cider and ponder around browsing the green houses on a dark cold winters evening....a perfect way to pick up those weird and wonderful gifts they sell

We fell in love with Bryant Park!. Bryant Park at Christmastime will forever be one of my favorite things. There are young carolers singing in the rain. Shops with trinkets and toys from around the globe. Gourmet food and drinks from the world round. Unique and tasty treats. And fun and fresh gifts. The skating and scene were much less crowded than the big tree at Rockefeller center. But the area is still hopping even in the rain. We spent two days exploring and did our shopping on the second day. We loved pinkcloud and st. Petersburg shops. This will be part of many return trips to NYC at Christmas!

Winter fun. Skating outdoors in New York City is as good as it gets.Sometimes too crowded.It's wonderful on a chilly day.Stop for coffee and hot chocolate after.The rink is surrounded by vendors with all different types of merchandise.

Winter village fabulous!. The skating rink is big enough for no one to feel crowded, the staff fun and helpful, and the little shops around the park were great! Would have spent more time shopping there and trying foods and drinks if it hadn't started pouring. Holiday decorations were beautiful!

Tranquility amongst the business of Manhattan. Take to the ice or simply sit and watch others enjoying the experience. Lots of gift stalls and a variety of delicious delicacies to tempt your taste buds.

Must Visit Spot in New York. I love this park. There is always a good vibe when I visit and I love all the shops added at the holiday time. Food and drink abound and I've always found a spot to stop and relax and enjoy the surroundings.

My favourite NYC park. I really love it here. Always seems to be a free chair around so I was able to sit and read and get away from the business that is NYC for a few moments. Really beautiful at night when the buildings around are all lit up. I would highly recommend stopping here for a picnic lunch.

AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!. I felt like I was in an episode of "Sex in the City"....people everywhere....shopping in the little shops...hot apple cider....ice skating...LOVED IT!!!!!!!!! would love to go back during the summer....

We were there when the ice rink was in place. Enjoyed all the stalls with crafts to buy. The ice rink had a long queue so probably best to book, if you can. Enjoyed the spice hot apple cider, warmed us up on a freezing cold afternoon. Plenty of places to sit down and people watch. I expect during the summer months people watching will be just as good.

ice Skating. We hit the ice for a few laps while we were here. We got lucky as it was after the holiday so the rink wasn't too crowded. The skates area little beat up and not too sharp but we still managed not to fall!

Nice Place to Visit. Bryant Park reminds me a lot like Fanuiel Hall in Boston. Outdoor attractions, places to eat, shops to visit and people watching. Except there is a little more to do and more eccentric people to watch.
Very much enjoyed my time at Bryant Park and would tell anyone to try it.

LOVE!. I LOVE coming to Bryant Park during the holidays. It is a magically beautiful place, regardless of how crowded it gets. The little shops that surround the ice skating rink are the perfect shops to pick up little gifts for family and friends. The ice skating can get crowded of course, but once you're in, it's perfect. Perfect date night! There is a restaurant within the park (right behind the library) with delicious food and it always busy.During the summer, it is the perfect place to sit with a group of your girlfriends and enjoy the beautiful weather. I have spent countless hours doing just that. Again, regardless of how crowded it gets, there is a tranquility to this location.
Perfect for the Holidays. The park is filled with little shops for the holiday season, little eateries, and an ice skating rink in the center. Great place to go as a couple or as a family.

Christmas market and ice rink. The Christmas market stalls were quite serious shops, selling candles and jewellery, not just the little trinkets of most seasonal markets. The ice rink was incredibly popular, with a huge line but the evening lighting was great.

Love this park!. We love this park for relaxation and people watching. There are always so many interesting people in and around here! We love to buy breakfast at a nearby deli and bring it to this little oasis of the city.
Bryant Park Is A Delight During the Christmas Season. Go to the Christmas Market, and enjoy the skaters. It's guaranteed to get one in the Christmas spirit.
Winter Wonderland. Watched the ice skaters, shopped the many stores. Great place to people-watch. Carousel for the little ones.

Lovely Park Great For Shopping And Skating. My wife and I visited while vacationing in New York for our anniversary. The park was one of our favorite places to relax, shop and have a relaxing drink. The park is clean and has a safe and relaxing atmosphere. Plan to visit next time.

shopping and ice skating!!. In this park in january, there was an ice skating rink and many shops. Each of the shops are in semi-heated cubicles. The shops are varied. Some carried hot drinks and others food. Some shops had fair trade products and others had locally made products such as soap. It was very nice and going into the shops was a nice break from the cold weather.

Magic in the evening. This park is one of my favourite places in New York. You can see Empire State Building and Chrysler Builing at the same time - and have green grass around you! Crowded in summer until very late ... this is hands down a magic park!
Winter Wonderland. Skating, kiosks, lots of food options. A big beautiful tree. I don't know what it is like at other seasons but it wS lovely for the holidays.

Christmas shops, ice skating and great Apple cider!. We visit every year at the holidays. The shops are pretty much the same every year but we don't care. The ice rink is busy. The apple cider is fantastic! It is a fun family day in the city.

Winter in the park is magical!. When visiting over the Summer, I loved the Park for it's hustle and bustle and community. In the Winter, it blew me away--like a true Winter Wonderland! So many pieces brought it together perfectly:-The Skating Rink: crowded almost all the time, fun to watch but long lines to skate. Skating is FREE but there are fees for skate rental and lockers/bag check. I wanted to skate, but hours in line was not appealing. So I went one morning right as the rink opened at 8am. No line, no crowd, a wonderful and serene experience! -The shops: LOVED all of the artisan shops from all over the city with unique items. So great to see talented artists and custom items that you would have literally had to scour the entire city to find all in one place. Bought a ton!-The food: Seasonal food everywhere, cider, hot chocolate, coffees, sweets, everything! My favorite was the tried and true Grilled Cheese and Soup from 'witchcraft. Went everyday we were in town. So festive, so much to see!

Bryant Park. Living in New York, I pass near Bryant Park from time to time, and it is a quiet, open yet intimate retreat from the busy streets. Located behind the NY Public Library between 5th & 6th avenues and 40th & 44th streets, the park offers plenty of seating out on a lawn or in under shade trees, a couple of snack kiosks for a quick bite or lunch, a restaurant and an outdoor bar + about the nicest W.C. in NYC. The surrounding buildings are both architecturally distinctive or modern-style but not overwhelming glass and steel office towers. Once called Needle Park, what an amazing transformation.

A gorgeous little quiet space in a bustling city. The Winter Village was there when I visited & it was lovely to wander around the christmas market stalls. I sat with a steaming hot cup of Hot Chocolate & people watched.

Can you say fun!. If you are ever in NYC during winter, you must let your kids ice skate at Bryant Park! We were there with friends the Sunday after Christmas. The kids had a great time. My friend and I enjoyed walking around and visiting the shops in the Winter Village. Would definitely come back again!

One of my favorites. I'm not a fan of Central Park -- I prefer the city's smaller parks. Bryant has a lot to do in every season: movies and petanque in the summer, skating and shopping in the winter, etc. The movable seating makes it easy to find a spot for whomever you're with -- friends, couples, families. Great people watching. And being slightly elevated from 6th Ave gives it a sense of calm.My only gripe is the food and beverage offerings. The Southwest Porch is always out of food or not serving food and is generally lacklusters. The 'wich booths are with closed or just boring. Bring your own Chipotle from across the street.

Great time. We paid the $25 p/p for a fast pass and was definitely worth it to skate in the park not having to wait in the huge line and included the skates and hot chocolate. The rink was crowded but it was fine because it kept the kids going at a slower speed.

Check it out during winter. Great scene, great date venue, great family outing.
Especially during the Christmas season, Bryant Park is booming with holiday shops and small eateries. Like Rockerfeller, there'll be a large Christmas tree and long lines for ice skating. Hot apple cider and great hot chocolate would be ideal complements for a cold day.

Do this at Christmas!. This park is beautiful during the holiday season. You can watch skaters, see an incredible tree that you can actually stand right next to, and there a dozens of small shops to browse. I've been to Rockefeller Center which is beautiful, but this for me is hands down way better and way less crowded. I visited both and enjoyed this one so much more.
Lovely park. We'll worth a visit all seasons. Atmosphere with skating rink and tree in winter beautiful. Could imagine sitting here in summer also

Nice little Park. We found Bryant Park on our first day in New York. There was a Craft Fair on with lots of stalls. The main lawn had been made into an Ice Rink which in our opinion was much better than the one at Rockerfeller Centre. Busy when we visited but I would imagine it could be a quiet little haven from the crowds and traffic. It had a Carousel for the kiddies.
Cute park. It was quaint, the time I visited the place, they had booths that sold different variety. They had food, my favorite and a bunch of different stuff too.

Festive little place. Bryant Park is next to the New York Public Library. During the winter months there are about 100 small specialty shops and food vendors. It's a wonderful small place to experience winter in NYC. It's like a very small version of the Germany night markets. There is an ice skating ring in the center. Skating is free and there is a long line at night.Nice place to stroll after dinner to watch the skaters. Has a very festive Christmas atmosphere. Definitely one of the sights to see in NYC.

Holiday atmosphere in a tiny park. It's a great spot right behind the famous library building in midtown. There is a marketplace with many small shops and food vendors, as well as a skating rink with a big Christmas tree and holiday music. There is a restaurant with seating overlooking the rink, as well as a seating area next to it. We grabbed a cup of hot apple cider and watched people skating.

Skating!!!!. What a great place to go skating on Christmas morning!!!! Skating is free! Bring your own skates or else you must pay for rentals. You can not take a bag or backpack onto the ice, so bring some change for the coin operated lockers for your shoes.
Nice stroll . A great place to stroll through and visit the shops. Ice skating available too. It was like going to a flea market or craft fair. Lots of shopping to choose from.
Xmas market joy. Loved the market loved the ice frink loved the atmosphere and best of all it is free and trimmed up with xmas tree and lights.

Here during the Holidays~ Beautiful. Loved to watch the folks ice skate and visiting the booths selling crafts and other items. Not sure if this is seasonal, but many of the items were higher end and would make lovely gifts for someone special (or yourself). It was very crowded the day were there but loved the coffee and people watching.

Great place,not impressed with the workers attitudes. Went here the other day,great area,however it was about two hours before closing it was very busy. The workers were constantly screaming at people to move up and to get out of the way....I understand there were a lot of people however it made it less enjoyable. Also the amount of people they let on the ice is unsafe being an experienced scater,having 400+ people on a small sheet of ice was very dangerous...I was frequently taken down.
Great, unique area!. Something to experience in NYC! What a neat area - but not for little kids and strollers, the walking space is too limited for that unless you go really early in the day.
great little spot. we stopped here every morning for coffee at 'Wichcraft. The shops were quaint. Wished we were there for the skating but it wasn't finished when we visited.

Great place. First time in Bryant Park, what a lovely place to spend and afternoon. The shops are really nice. We had interesting food, churo, pigs in a blanket and deep fried pickles and an amazing hot chocolate. We also laughed a lot looking at the people trying to skate.

Many beautiful gifts. I like this market and have a soft spot for it since it was the first I visited during the Christmas season. I think the variety is better than some of the other markets and it is fairly large, but not overwhelming. It has a variety of goods with varying costs, so you could spend several hundred dollars or $20 on gifts here. I particularly liked the some of the jewelry stores and the artisans who did fused glass and spun silver. In addition, I never pass a shop that has cup towels and wine bottle aprons without smiling at their cute sayings on the linens and, of course, I always have to buy some of them. I think this may be the most "useful" market in that I can almost always find something for some of the people on my list for whom it is difficult to find gifts.

Beautiful little spot . Great place to stop if you've been walking around all day. Lots of Christmas themed stalls. Jazz music playing in the background whilst watching the skaters go by. Such a peaceful place in this busy city

Restrooms, Shockingly Good!. I love Bryant Park but mostly at Christmas when they have a huge skating rink the the booths. It is so colorful and you can get almost anything in a festive atmosphere.I never planned to use the restrooms as the ones in parks are usually bad. I've never seen any like these where you wave your hand over a sensor and a sanitary seat cover slips over the seat. Maybe I should keep this a secret.

Highlight of NYC Christmas. The holiday market, ice rink, tree and atmosphere at Bryant Park were the best in New York. Hot chocolates while listening to Christmas tunes and watching the world go by, and iceskaters; it was everything I had imagined for my New York Christmas.

Great winter market. This park is an excellent stop if you are walking around at the holiday season. A ton of little shops in rows that have crafts for sale. It is set up nice,also food and drinks are available. There is something for everybody on your Christmas list. Must stop if you are there.

Great place to hang out in DEC.. We love this park. Have only been here in the fall or winter. Great shopping in Dec that includes a lot of specialty shops and places to grab some good food items and drinks. Ice skating rink is also very nice. Take the time to visit this park!

Winter Village in Bryant Park is AMAZING. Winter Village in Bryant Park is a must-see! There are over 100 boutique-like shops with fun gift ideas and food. Grab a cup of hot apple cider and peruse the shops. I was there around dinner time so I got a grilled cheese sandwich and a cup of tomato soup, which was perfect because it was pretty chilly! I went by myself since my husband was at a work social, I had a wonderful time, but it would also be lots of fun with a friend. Perfect place to go in New York during the winter. Magical!

Prettier Tree than Rockefeller Center. I visit here every winter as it gets decorated very nice, in fact I think without the publicity-they end up with a gorgeous Xmas tree that is much nicer than the one at Rockefeller Center, the ice skating rink is bigger and has more people taking advantage of it, it's just a fun place. There are some very interesting booths selling all sorts of knock knacks which will gladly sell to tourists at very overpriced fees. The restaurants are very prettily decorated, there is a merry go round go round for the youngsters-even during none holiday time, this is a nice venue
So much fun. Is one of those places where you can hang our with friends, solo or even date, you can skate on winter, watch a movie on summer and always have a good snack or brunch!

My second favorite NYC park, such a great vibe. It's hard to beat Central Park, but I find Bryant Park a very close second. It's a wide open oasis right in the heart of Midtown. I've worked in Manhattan for two years, and I'm moving next week, and this is one of a handful of places in the city I will truly miss.There's just something magical and quintessentially NYC about it for me. The great view of the Empire State, the view of the equally picturesque "radiator building", the well manicured open "green" in the middle (except in winter when it becomes an equally lovely ice rink and winter market), the beautiful classical architecture of the library framing one end, the bustle of 42nd street framing another, the little food kiosks (love the tuna sandwich at Wichcraft), the bevy of nice tables and chairs (with "Bryant Park" stamped on them) set out, where people can often be found reading books from the free outdoor library, etc.Grab some food, find a chair near the fountain overlooking the green, and people watch- it makes for a perfect NYC lunch break. I've been here in summer and winter and I love it every time, in every season.

Holiday Market. We enjoyed the holiday market and the atmosphere around Bryant Park for December. However, there were no additional bathrooms established and with low temperatures and weather conditions it created long and unnecessary lines. With that said, the park is still wonderful regardless of the time of year you visit.

Winter Village Ice Rink. i had a great evening the day after Christmas in Bryant park there's so much to do vendors selling food, trinkets, arts & crafts. The hot chocolate is delicious you can . also enjoy a cup of hot apple cider the whole experience was wonderful. I found a nice seat. Sipped my cocoa ate my honey roasted peanuts purchased also from a street vendor and just enjoyed the Christmas songs while watching the ice skaters. A day well spent if you go dress warm please

great place to be alone, with 5000 other people. I really like Bryant Park. The tables are tiny, and kind of packed in. I like to drink coffee, and write, so this was perfect for about an hour or so. I guess you really could sit there all day, but it is a popular place to sit and eat, so it is courteous to allow others to have their turn.

Christmas Market. We stumbled across the market and ice rink at Bryant Park by accident. There is a good selection of traders and we can recommend the hot cider. A warming drink watching the ice skaters, it's Christmas.

Holiday Shops great area restaurants and ice skating. Bryant park in the summer is a casual great place to be to just sit and enjoy a lazy afternoon or take in a summer movie. However, during the holidays it transforms into a fantastic winter wonderland of little holiday shops and an ice skating rink complete with some rink lined restaurants including Celcious. It has its own tree lighting ceremony with a lovely Christmas tree to rival Rockerfeller. The area is flanked by some great restaurants Bryant Park Grill, and Koi just to name a few. If you are in NYC during the holidays this place warrants a stop on your list.

Great Ice Skating and Shopping Alternative. We travel from Oregon to New York City every December. It's the best time of the year to visit. We love the shows, restaurants, shopping and ice skating. We have little kids that can't stand in line for an hour or two. The thing we like best about ice skating at Bryant Park is that we can go on line and pre purchase a family "fast pass". No line. And when you're done, there's a great bunch of little shops in the park with good Christmas gifts.
Enjoyable. With the skating rink as a background to all the tents full of various wares and foods, how could this holiday scene not be a must-see for all tourists?

Bryant Park Winter Village has it All. During our stay in NYC in Nov/Dec we came to Bryant Park Winter Village several times as it has it all! We spent a lot of time wondering around the markets and got several unique Christmas presents and souvenirs. We ate at Celsius which was really nice, as well as having interesting snacks and meals from the stalls. We also went ice skating at night which was a lot of fun. The decorations and lights gave the park a beautiful Christmas feel.

Not much to see. My wife and I visited the Christmas markets at Bryant Park on 25th December. We were pretty disappointed with what was on offer when compared to the Columbus Circle Christmas markets near Central Park. There were limited food options and most of the shops/stalls sold stuff that you could find in a retail shop - there didn't appear to be many unique or special products available. The ice skating rink seemed less busy than the Rockefeller Plaza, but we didn't bother with it.

Charming and buzzing. A very pretty park with a joyful atmosphere. The Christmas tree was beautiful and all the lights in the trees and the cute kiosks selling all types of food and ornaments are a festive site that should not be missed.

Wonderful little Christmas Village. Bryant Park has many pop up Christmas displays and stores for the holidays. They are done in a very cute way and decorated to make the park come alive as a Christmas Village. It was fun to walk along the paths and see the displays. The outdoor skating rink was exciting to watch as the skaters whirled around. I had an enjoyable afternoon here and would recommend it to anyone as a great way to spend the days.
Christmas Time Markets!. Lots of fun shopping at the Bryant Park Xmas time markets. Lots to see and shop for!Out door seating for food and hot drinks seem popular.

Felt like a small German Christmas market. The ice rink is larger than Rockefeller plaza and the rental house was much roomier and quicker to get through. The park is charming and the rink is surrounded by glass walled tiny shops selling everything from hot chocolate and food to unique gifts and jewelry. There's a restaurant at one end of the rink but we did not visit it. Very pleased with the experience - felt like I was in Europe.

Great Ambiance and Ice Skating. We enjoyed walking through this park, and seeing the holiday market and food vendors. It is across the street from the library, which you must stop in while you're there. My wife and kids enjoyed ice skating. It was crowded (on a Sunday late morning), but not as crowded as Rockefeller Center's rink. The park is beautiful to stroll through and enjoy, and there are chairs and tables to sit down.

Holiday Season at Bryant Park. Stopped into Bryant Park on the way back to our Times Square hotel. Holiday fun! Wonderful outdoor skating rink, seasonal decorations, and cute little shops. There appeared to be a party or wedding going on in a 2 story building overlooking the skating rink - what a wonderful setting for an event. Charming and recommended!

Wonderful holiday market. I thought holiday market are all the same around the world. But obvious the tourism industry is improving and there are many interesting little things to see here. And there are also many different types of food to try.
Winter Wonderland. WOW, what a surprise! Had no idea that there was a mini winter wonderland going on there. Complete with Christmas tree and ice skating.

Winter Wonderland in the Middle of NYC. Located behind the NY Public Library, The Winter Village in Bryant Park is a not-to-miss attraction when visiting the city for the holidays. From October through March, the park is transformed into a winter wonderland, including an ice skating rink, holiday shops (Oct-Jan) and a pop up indoor/outdoor restaurant called Celsius. Ice skating is free and open to the public from 8am-10pm each day (skate rentals are $15 for 1.5 hrs). The line for skating does get very long, so queue up early. There are several dozen kiosks within the park featuring a wide array of crafts and goods and eateries. In the middle of the park is a beautifully decorated Christmas tree. An outstanding restaurant called Bryant Park Grill serves a great brunch on the weekends along with lunch and dinner. And the wonderful Celsius is a great place to take a moment for dessert and drinks, or light snacks as you watch the skaters. I recommend sitting outside on the couches under the heat lamps. The cocktails there are yummy, cold or hot. A popular kiosk is Max Brenner's Chocolatiers where you can pick up a creamy, rich cup of hot chocolate as you browse the booths. Perfect for a night out in the city. In the summertime, the park becomes a calm resting area, with trees and flowers, along with a year-round children's playground and carousel. You can also play a game of table tennis for free at one of the four ping pong tables. There are benches and lounge areas throughout the park and a pretty fountain in the middle. A great place to relax among the chaos of the city.
Lots of Little Shops. The tree was nice but not as nice as the one at R. Center. Rink was crowded. Nice choices for something to eat and a variety of shops.

Decent at Christmas but can't imagine at other times. The shops were alright. The skating rink looked nice and big which was better than Rockafeller center. The whole park was pretty packed though. We didn't end up spending a whole lot of time there.

A NYC Gem.. Bryant Park was my default station during my NYC Christmas visit. I was so impressed by the wonderful atmosphere. Good natured crowds of people skating, shopping at the shops of the Winter Village and the great music backdrop, make it an ideal location. Surrounded by the great office blocks and the impressive Library, Bryant Park is a New York Gem at the best of times but at Christmas It is an absolute delight. It's another "must" for any Christmas Time visit to the city.

Loved the atmosphere.. The Christmas market was great. Try the hot cider only $5 for two! The ice skating looked fab but we didn't participate. The lights at night were another lovely must see. The Christmas tree didn't rival the Rockefeller but it was quite beautiful.

Cute Winter Village. Bryant Park has a great winter village that is very cute for couples, family, or even a solo shopping trip. They have cute little shops to buy Christmas ornaments, winter accessories, or unique little trinkets. They also have quaint cafés with a wide selection of food. I recommend the crepe cafe for a delicious crepe with anything you can imagine on it and a hot chocolate or coffee. The ice skating rink is very spacious and located in the middle of the winter village with a Christmas tree that may not be as big as Rockefeller's but it certainly gives it competition. The winter village is also nice if you want to experience some of Christmas in New York without the giant crowd at Rockefeller Center.

A great representation of Christmas in NY. Oh we LOVE visiting Bryant park at Christmas. We love the shops, the Christmas tree and the whole atmosphere. The highlight of our visit is Max Brenner's hot chocolate. We overheard someone calling the hot chocolate a winter prize. We could not agree more. This hot chocolate is worth waiting in line for as long as it takes.

A Respite in Midtown. This is a great park for anything that is offered. I would like to recommend the Lecture Series Bryant Park offers in Cooperation of the NYPL. They also have a nice Winter Shopping area and Ice Rink which is free but you pay for skate rental. If you have your own skates better as the skates they rent are intentionally uncomfortable to prevent you from skating all day there. just as crowded as Rockefeller Plaza. Places in the area to sit and have a hot chocolate are: Pan Quotidian [41st Str.] and FIKA [43rd. Str. off 6th Ave. FIKA is better, in my opinion

Concrete Oasis. Beside 42nd Street and behind the New York Public Library it is a comparatively small park amid all the skyscrapers around. A few trees and mostly concrete with some flowers in-between. The Winter Village was bustling with activities with many stalls and kiosks selling knickknacks and food items. Lighted up with fairy lights. Some chairs and tables where I sat and saw the world go by. It was pre-Christmas so there was surely lots of people. Carousel rides too. A appropriate place to be for a break after the hustle and bustle of the city.

Skating in downtown NYC. While a little pricey for a skate- $46 for two to rent skates including a locked bag- it was priceless! There are no cameras/phones allowed on the rink so you have to ask bystanders to take your picture. Of course, they are happy to do so! After your skate you can browse among the Christmas kiosks or have lunch at the restaurant. It was a nice break from shopping.

Ice rink, such a bonus for the keen skater. Been skating here before on previous visits and so this time took my own skates, - this makes it a free skate !! I went Five times during my stay - best stick to early morning to avoid the crowds and the once a decade skaters which can be hazardous when the ice is full. The ice rink is well maintained and there is plenty of seating for those who would rather watch. Great fun, followed by hot chocolate form one of the many kiosks and then some retail therapy to get your land legs back - perfect - better than the more iconic rinks around NY in my humble opinion

Skip Rockefeller center and go to Bryant park. Bryant park for the holidays is a definite must do for visitors and locals. You can go ice skating, see a big Christmas tree, drink hot cider and cocoa, eat some snacks, and go shopping for gifts at the holiday market. Grab some pics at Rockefeller then head over to Bryant park to enjoy holiday festival atmosphere without the ridiculousness of overcrowded Rockefeller.

Nice skate and fun stores . The free skate and comfortable change facilities are well done. The skating is good but the setting in the buildings and the stores in the park provide a good variety of things to do.

Quiet oasis. Much less chaotic than Rockefeller Center, I had a nice afternoon Christmas experience walking amongst the shops there, watching the skaters, and sampling great food. The ice rink seems bigger than at the "Rock", and the kiosks are tasteful and reminded me of Christmas markets in Germany. In the summer the park is a quiet oasis downtown. Reading in the park is encouraged, and with the big, beautiful public library sharing the block the location is perfect.

Come early. With the little ones came in early. No line plenty of room. Place for your stuff. Free admission only pay for skate rental. Happy to observe without having to pay. Amazing snack bar get the chocolate chip brownie. Organized and looks like the evening venue with heated tables and viewing area would make it a nice date.

Special Place. Bryant Park is a great place in the city during the holidays. The holiday music and Sinatra classics played at the skating rink bring a classic romance to mind. The decorated tree, although not as large as Rockefeller's, is just perfect for the park and at night almost magical. If you are lucky enough to catch it while covered with snow it brings the holidays to life. Located in an area close to the popular shopping areas, most people visiting the theater and Times Square area can easily access it by foot. Also the holiday market offers unique gifts.

A Wonderful Happening Place. Food, drinks, ice skating (in-season), shopping, benches, and all in the middle of Manhattan. Dozens of kiosks selling everything from donuts to glamour gowns are distributed around this lovely park directly behind the New York Public Library building. If you are in Manhattan at any time, Bryant Park is a great place for a respite from the usual NYC hustle & bustle. Find a bench to simply relax or grab a bite or a sumptuous meal in a sit down restaurant, or shop in some eclectic shops. Whatever you choose, you will not be disappointed!
Ice skating shopping eating in the park. Terrific oasis right behind NY Public library on 5th ave. see a Xmas tree, ice skate or just chill. There are shops with all sorts of goodies

Better than expected. Love, Love, Love this place. It has a wonderful Christmas Village of shops with unique things offered. I wish we had gone here before Rockefeller center. It was less crowded and more interesting.The tree was beautiful and the skating rink was well populated.There were chairs and tables to sit by the rink and just enjoy a coffee or hot chocolate.

Ice skating is the icing on the cake!. Biggest attraction was the ice skating ring which is fun for the beginners. Those inclined to serious ice skating will find it too crowded for their liking. Make sure you get into the ring soon after they clean up. They have to clean it every now and then to remove flaked ice and firm up the ground and it could be a long wait while they do it!The X'mas shops were also open and offered many off beat and largely hand made products.

"mum and the Bryant". Brilliant! This is a must. Relaxing part of the city. Lawn to lay on and seating for everyone, fairy lights at night. One of the best parks in the city. Right next to the library. Stoll down 42nd st West to Midtown. This is New York...

Relaxing in Bryant Park. A beautiful place to grab a bite to eat, a drink and sit down to watch the skaters. If you prefer to shop, there is a wide variety of kiosks hawking just about anything. It was clean and safe the day I visited and would go again.

Christmas fair and ice skating. At Christmas Bryant Park has lots of enclosed kiosks selling a variety of goods and food. It is fun to walk around the shops, but what I enjoy most is watching the ice skaters. There are people - young and old - of various skill levels. Some are showing off their fancy footwork while others are clinging to the side of the rink shuffling along holding on "for dear life" (that would be me!!). My only complaint is that there are no bathroom facilities considering the number of food stands they have. They need to construct a bank of "job johnnys" for the comfort of the visitors.

Perfect people watching . Beautiful little ice rink with its mini Rockerfeller xmas tree! We sat with hot chocolates and crepes and watched the world go by! Perfect ending to our busy day! Worth a visit for the Xmas markets
Christmas market. .. was there which did help my grading as that had some excellent specialty booths. The ice rink was a nice touch. The tree with the backdrop of some fab buildings was just sublime.

A great little stop.. When your guide says you should see it you should. This is a place know for an ice skating rink and the shopping kiosks that surround it. It backs up to the Central Library. Also worth seeing.

Christmas in NYC is Bryant Park. I love this place year round but especially in December when the Christmas market, ice skating and all the spirit of the holiday can be found everywhere. Plenty of unique shopping stalls, some great seasonal food and drink and of course the huge ice skating rink. You should never visit NYC without a visit to Bryant Park!
Beautiful During Christmas Season. If you're around during Christmas, it's worth a stop to Bryant Park, as there are beautiful Christmas shops as well as the famous skating rink.

At Christmas this is the place to skate n see. The famous Rockfeller center is way to crowded to see much less skate. Shoulder to shoulder spilling over into the street, but not Bryant park, great rink, many holiday market booths, you can get food and drink. Crowded at times but not bad. The library is there and a wonderful place to see and visit. Recommend Bryant Park

Lovely park.. Great stalls selling a wide range of unique gifts. The hot chocolate stall is amazing - they actually put a truffle in the bottom of the cup before they pour in the hot choc.
The whole park is lit up - truly magical at Christmas.
Rockerfeller Center Lite. Really cool venue complete with Christmas Tree, Ice Skating, and rows and rows of street shops. Grab a cocktail and watch folks skate beneath NY second largest tree.
Adorable with the ice rink!!. Everything is great about Bryant Park! The wifi zone, food around, the ice rink, the atmosphere!! I loved it!!

A little bit of Christmas..... We stumbled upon Bryant Park but accident and so glad we did. It was like a nice little Christmas village. Loved watching the skaters and enjoyed walking by all of the little shops. A beautiful Christmas tree AND Santa too....Definitely something nice to do when visiting the city.

Park. This is a very nice oasis in the centre of town .while we were there there was skating going on also they had the Christmas markets on even if you don't buy it's lovely to wander around the booths with a steaming cup of hot chocolate
Go on weekends. We walked through the park on a weekend and it was packed with stalls selling food, souvenirs, handphone gadgets etc. A nice change from 5th Ave and the branded shops.

Holiday/Christmas Village. So much fun shopping in all the little unique shops set up and an ice skating rink in the middle. Great for holiday shopping whether it be scarves, ornaments, teas, soaps, art glass, etc.

Holiday shops. Mini shops set up surrounding the park FULL of unique, quality, original, items for gifts, enjoyed the view of the skaters from this rink & $5 hot cocoa was a tasty treat, holiday decorations festive

Bryant Park more than a walk in the park. One of my favorite parks in manhattan - skating in the winter - eateries - unique gift shops - and a safe wholesome environment -
Bryant park welcomes everyone to share in the experience
Holiday Market. Lots and Lots of things to buy...ice skating rink and food and drink abundant. My wife found several Christmas Tree ornaments along with a scarf and other items.

Great place. This was recommended by a friend and so glad it was. It held all the allure of Rockerfeller Center,but much more accessible to watch the skaters or just sit around and enjoy the Winter WonderlandThe array of booths were unique, offering goods out of the ordinary, and the same was true of food!Dress warm, be outside and just enjoy the tree and NYC at Christmas

Fun shopping at Christmas time. Love to walk through Bryant Park during the holiday time. Many gift giving ideas in all of the little shops surrounding the ice skating rink and the tree is always nice - it's great to get up close for a photo shoot.
Watching movie scene being shot. Lovely atmosphere, clean toilets, free books, chess and calm moments in a busy metropolis! Just around the corner from the library and a nice place to take a break.

Great during the Holidays. The Christmas/Holiday Fair at Bryant Park is lovely at Christmas time. There is a great variety of moderate to high-end vendors, all displaying handmade and unique items. Although it may be cold outside at this time of year, there are food stalls selling hot chocolate and other teats to keep you warm. The ice skating rink is larger than the one at Rockefeller Center, plus there are chairs and tables available and no where near the crowd. There is also a beautiful Christmas Tree and the views of the surrounding buildings also contribute to the festive atmosphere.
Christmas spirit in NYC. My family and I really enjoyed the Christmas oasis in NYC. The ice rink was large and the shops were fun to visit.

Lovely place to visit during the holiday season.. I love Bryant park and we go every year. The shops there during Christmas are wonderful and browsing is cozy and enjoyable. It's a nice break from the crazy pace of the city this time of year. I enjoy getting unique Christmas gifts there as well and there are always tasty treats!!

Great holiday market. If in NY in december, the ice skating rink, the holiday vibe and different stalls that sell gifts or custom made cChristmas articles, don't miss it. Stop by for some hot cocoa, or waffles or dinner and lunch and take in the atmosphere. Fabulous!

Really nice. Nice park in the middle of the 42nd street mess. On this time of the year you have the rink and a winter fair with a great number of small shops were you can buy all sorts of things. Just don't expect to find any bargains, its all expensive here

Ice Skating in Bryant Park. We enjoyed the opportunity to ice skate outdoors and see the Christmas lights. The rental figure skates are dull, so bring your own or choose the hockey skates. The hockey skates are better quality for the same price.

Very Pretty In The Winter. Bryant Park is very pretty with an ice rink and market stalls. Free Wifi in the park.
Just watch out for the little "monk" who will greet you with peace, give you a beaded bracelet and then hit you up for a $20 "donation". We wished him peace and gave him his bracelet back!

Go for a nice park and skate and eat and shop....... Went for the Christmas fair. A lot of unique & unusual booths with many hand made in NYC goods. Multiple food booths and just nice NYC ambiance. Great for a couple of hours.

A holiday market and more!!. One of the best holiday markets in NYC and free ice skating also!!! There are so many goodies here you will not believe. An outdoor cafe with a fire pit!! Hot chocolate in many flavors! Truffles! Several bars and did I say FREE ICE SKATING??? All in the shadow of the main branch of the NY Public Library. One of the true "finds" in NYC.. Go visit!!

A slice of serenity in the midst of Midtown hubbub. With its skating rink and beautiful Christmas tree, Bryant Park felt very festive. Right in the heart of Midtown, merely blocks from Times Sq and next to the Public Library, Bryant Park feels is an oasis of quiet. Great views of the skyline too, including the Empire State Building.

Great christmas spot. Going to Bryant park during christmas time is a wonderful treat. The ice skating ring is much larger than others around NYC. So with that being said, it gets really packed. There are a lot of little shops within the park. So you can go shopping and enjoy the sights.

The line for skating was 6 blocks long so we didn't do it but, it looked like fun.. The city is always beautiful at Christmas time. The "Believe" sign was lit up on Macy's and it was SantaCon, so there were hords of drunk people dressed as Santa everywhere.

shopping at Bryant Park. Stopped to do a little shopping at Bryant Park. Another great place to get a little spirit at Christmas. Not only some shops but food also available. You can watch the skaters or even skate yourself. If you want you could just get a hot chocolate and relax and enjoy the season...

Beautiful Park. This is a great place to stop and and slow down from the hustle of the city. Tons of people to watch and not far from a few of the big tourist spots like the Empire state building and Times Square.

The Best place to skate in Manhattan. I love the view as you skate in Bryant Park. There is no fee to skate, only a fee for skate rentals. (The other venues charge for both.) In addition, the Winter Village has many quaint shops with so much to see! It is definitely the place to find a unique gift.
A green pearl in the middle of NY. A magical place mainly during the winter and the holidays.Ice rink, Christmas market, hot chocolate, festive lights and atmosphere.

Winter Wonderland. Ofcourse the first thing someone wants to visit in NYC during Christmas time is Rockefeller Center to see the tree, but actually I think visiting Bryant Park's Holiday Shops/Ice Rink/ and Tree is more amazing! There are tons of shops containing all kinds of items, perfect for youself or for people you are shopping for. Items range from jewelry, winter acessories, christmas decorations, artwork, nyc photography, perfumes/lotions, world shops (inlcluding but not limited to Irish and South American shops). There are also food vendors that have anything from hot cider to fried pickles! I haven't personally used the iceskating rink but it is fairly large and the tree resides right behind in near the library, a perfect photo op! I have heard it is much cheaper that iceskating at Rockefeller Center and the lines are shorter. If your looking to lounge in the park all day they have tables, as well as ping pong tables to keep any sort of traveler occupied!

Oasis in the city. Great smaller park to take a break from the concrete and hustle of the city. Christmas season skating and local vendor shopping booths are added. Not to mention the best hot apple cider!!! Safe, clean well maintained!

A jewel in the city. Free ice skating without time limits skates not included. Christmas shops plenty of seats to relax and people watch but the food kiosks are just ok. Great view of the Empire State building and the Ball in Times Square.

I have an ongoing love affair with this place. Either in the summer for a free "movie in the park" or during the holiday season for the Christmas Markets and Ice Skating Rink....it's just absolutely wonderful !!!

Lovely Park during any Season. Bryant Park, located 42 Street and 6 Avenue is such a nice park anytime of year. During the winter there is an ice skating rink where you can rent skates and it's so pretty there. There are little booths set up selling all sorts of trinkets, special candy, etc. You can grab a bite to eat and a hot drink and sit and take it all in. In the summer time, there are concerts on the lawn and chairs and tables to sit, ping pong tables, bocci, library and a carousel for the children. They also have puppet shows by the carousel. There is a lovely restaurant on the grounds also. There is a public bathroom which is kept immaculate, yes that's correct crazy as it might seem.

Festive at Christmas. Love visiting Bryant Park at Christmas time. Watching the skaters on the rink, sitting and having some hot chocolate or a hot specialty coffee. Walking through the maze of small booths selling Christmas themed gifts and novelty items. The tree is lovely, all decorated with LEDs and Christmas balls. It really puts you in the Christmas spirit. The bathroom facilities are very crowded so plan to pay a visit before you get there...It can be crowded, so pack your patience and put on a holiday smile. Be sure to experience Bryant Park if you are in the city, it's well worth it.

Good Cute Park. We visited the park while our trip to New York and it was a cute little park. It has a central area where one could sit & enjoy a little picnic during the summers. There are a few eateries inside the park along with chairs. There was a film screening week going on where one could get a nice blanket & lie down and watch the film. It sounded so romantic.One cannot compare it with the huge Central Park but this one is a cute park perked right in middle of all the activities in Manhattan.Overall, a cute experience.

Loved the visit to the Holiday Shops at Bryant Park. We toured the park and really enjoyed the festive atmosphere and all the shops for the Holiday Shops event. We loved watching the ice skaters and all the beautiful Christmas decorations.

My favorite place in NYC....... We make a point to visit Bryant Park when we go to NYC for Christmas, it is simply awesome. You can ice skate, sit and take in the sights, eat and drink. At Christmas time they have small huts set up for regional food, and wares. Plus they have their own Christmas tree that is lovely as well. This is a great spot to rest and spend some time taking in the Christmas spirit that NYC has to offer. Highly recommend.

Winter wonderland. Park has ice skating (free with your own skates otherwise rental is $19--cheaper than $30 at Rockefeller Center). Currently there is a Winter Market with all sorts of things and food. Would go back to try the restaurant (Bryant Park Grill). Christmas time is utterly charming at the Park.
Wonderful at Christmas. Went to the Christmas market and it was beautiful and I even bought a bauble with the park name on it so I know I have been there.
Nice holiday addition. Stop by before or after Rockefeller center tree visit and 5th Avenue during the holidays. Book online for Fastpass ice skating which is a must during holiday weekends.

Great Chrismas Market. Bryant park is one of our favorite places to visit in NYC on our Christmas trip it NYC. The Christmas market is fun and a good place to pick-up gifts for the family. The ice rink and decorations put in the Christmas mode. It easy to get to on the subway and one of the Christmas markets along with Union Squire, Grand Central Station and Columbus Circle. Stay in Newark, NJ and save some money on your visit to NYC. It is only a 45 min train ride to NYC from Newark.

This was soooo nice. Loved it. This was absolutely beautiful. The decorations. The amount of booths and food. The ice skating and of course the merry go round. Whoever set this up did an amazing job. Very cool and unique items. Great gifts. The booths were set up so nice. Of course it was busy. It's new york at christmas! The tree was beautiful. Got some cute things. So happy we made it!!

awesome. Great foods and fun shopping. Wished I liked to ice skate. Loved the atmosphere and the carosel for kids built a long time ago n still working. Smelled and made me really feel the spirit of Christmas.

Fun Christmas Market!. Went to the christmas market at Bryant Park and it is great for a little christmas shopping and some iceskating. Most booths are reasonably priced and the ice-skating is reasonable (especially compared to Rockefeller). There were a lot of people but nothing unbearable. Don't miss it during christmas season!

Must visit during Christmas. One of the most beautiful parks I have been to. This looks amazing during the night when its all lit up. you could also do some shopping if you are looking for some souvenirs. Winters have an additional attraction of Free Ice Skating equipment for which you can get on rent within the park (no additional charges for Skating) Really nice place to visit.

Magic. I visited the Park during the thanksgiving week and there was the ice skating ring, all the small kiosks with Christmas decorations and very nice and original gifts ideas or hot drink and snacks. We loved the magic Christmas atmosphere. ..
lovely park. good place to walk through as a tourist. lovely xmas decorations whilst i was in NY for holiday in november.....

Festive holiday booths!. Had the opportunity to visit Bryant Park during the winter holiday season midweek. The park is filled with holiday booths for trinkets as well as specialty foods. You can iceskate in the middle of the park while your loved ones look on.

Christmas Festival. Nice Christmas Festival going on. Lots of small booths with unique items. I enjoyed my time here. The decorated Christmas tree is nice to look at right near the skating rink. If you're in the area, take the time to check out this place.

Lovely compact park in Manhattan. Bryant Park is one of the parks we always frequent when we are in NYC. It's not very big like Central Park but it offers a respite after a long day of gallivanting around the streets on Manhattan.I like the ever-changing scene in this beautiful, tiny park. It becomes a cute wonderland during the cold season when it's decked out with tiny lights at night and you see plenty of ice skaters enjoying their time in the rink. There are also the usual market fair with plenty of merchants selling Christmas stuff. Another great stuff about this cute park is that it offers park goers the chance to grab some packed meals from nearby food outlets in and out of the park. There are plenty of tables and chairs to use when you want to have a quick bite, enjoy a good book, tinker on your computer or smart phones/tablets (due to the free public wi-fi access!!!) or just simply sit there to soak it all in because it's a lovely park.It's very near the New York Public Library and subway station (42nd/5th). 2 blocks away is the Grand Central Terminal, 1 block away from Times Square and about 15 mins. walk to the Port Authority bus terminal.

jolly good time. It was just lovely setting drinking hot choc watching everyone ice skateing and have a wonderful time , The tree was fab, and the market area around it was great ,i picked up a few presents for christmas ,,
go and browse. We loved strolling through the booths, shopping and just enjoying being out on the street and then getting coffee and watching the ice skaters. How fun.
Christmas Shopping Fun. Aside from the rain and umbrellas we tackled as we shopped through the jewel boxes- there were some great little shops and unique gifts to be found here.

Slip, Slide and Glide. The best ice skating rink to watch skaters and people. You can get a hot drink and a snack, select a rink side table and watch as skaters slip, slide and glide by. If you feel adventurous rent a pair of skates and slip, slide and glide away. The holiday and seasonal themed kiosks are a browsers delight. Afterwards walk east to fifth avenue and visit the historic New York Public Library and admire the Beaux Arts Architechture.

Nice little christmas market at Bryant Park. Stopped off at Bryant Park to have a look around a nice little Christmas market. It's also got an ice rink setup as well as a heated outdoor lounge (I think it was called the snow leopard lounge). Though the lounge does it busy.

Wonderful respite with changing scene. There is always something a little special going on in. Bryant Park. Now there is the ice skating and the wonderful,holiday shops. I love to,just walk through and watch the people. Summer there are movies, beautiful gardens. Always worth a stroll through if you are in the area.

Great little place to eat. If you need a break visit Bryant park and have your lunch. The park is right next to the New York Public Library and has free wifi. There is a christmas market currently on, which has some lovely little shops. The ice rink (which is free) is up and running and the park is surrounded by numerous eating places. Great place to sit and relax and it is decorated beautifully for christmas.
Christmastime perfection. Beautiful at Christmas. The tree is stunning. The Christmas market is very cool. Make sure you visit!
Great Christmas Faire. Lots of crafts, snacks/goodies, and Christmas gifts. Definitely worth a visit. My friend and I go every December.

Christmas market :). We kind of stumbled across Bryant park and decided to take a look and were excited to see that the Christmas market was on! (Went October so wasn't sure if there would be many xmasy things around the city -there were!) there was also a huge Ice rink in the park, the atmosphere was great and Im glad we found this place!
Beautiful park. We went here at Christmas and I liked it better than Rockefeller Center. It was so well decorated and not to busy and the little shops they set up are just great!

This is what christmas in new york should be. Of my five night stay in New York, this was probably my highlight. We had a quick look round as it was opening one morning, then returned one evening, when but the place just comes alive at night. The setting is lovely, the skating rink surrounded by little stalls, kiosks, selling food, drink, Christmas novelties, clothes, sweets, and loads of other things. Sitting having hot chocolates watching the skating was brilliant. Then at the top is the Christmas tree, as good as the one on the Rockerfeller Centre, but the setting is much more magical. This is what I was hoping all of New York would be like for Christmas. Unfortunately didn't get a chance to go ice skating, as I had a few too many wines....

Great Christmas market. This is a lovely oasis behind the New York Public Library, we watched the skaters and did a bit of Christmas shopping at the market stalls. On our last day we sat and enjoyed a cup of coffee in the park with a view of both the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building from our seats.
Pretty. There was a Hoe Down at Bryant Park the night we were there. It was so much fun to see the mechanical bull and all the people in cowboy hats and boots.

Christmas Market at Bryant Park - OMG. Love going to NYC during December for the Christmas Markets as well as all the beautiful lights and window decorations! This year .... Bryant Park Christmas Market was my absolute favorite market - something for everyone, including chocolate! My best buys .... beautiful handmade knitted/crocheted scarves! Of course, it was cold, so I had to indulge in the thick Italian Hot Chocolate from Max Brenner's little shop! Absolutely adorable dog themed clocks, charms, and lockets handmade by a local artist.... my favorite .... the Yorkie that looked just like mine!

Ice skating. Eating. Great shopping. Very beautiful now with festive atmosphere for holiday shopping. Many many little enclosed and warm booths selling all kinds of jewelry and crafts, and clothing, and much more. Also a neat food court, and the permanent Bryant Park food corners round out excellent choices for a bite. Then there is the free ice skating. The fabulous main library anchors the south side of this unique park which is close to Macy's and a slightly long walk to Times Sq.

Ice Skating and Christmas Markets. They set up a mini ice skating ring and the Christmas markets. There is plenty of shopping and food stalls. The best is a little shop that sells Irish t-shirts and goods.
dont miss this. Bryant park had excellent ice skating the market was great and the toilets were the cleanest in the city, in my opinion. It was lovely to get waffles and sit a people watch

Nice escape from a busy city. While visiting NYC with our granddaughter, we stopped at Bryant Park and to her surprise, she got to go ice skating. It was a fun thing for her and I enjoyed the vendors during the holiday season.

Bryant Park during the Holidays. What a fun place to visit during the holiday season! The ice rink, the holiday shoppes full of unique gifts and plenty of food options make Bryant Park the perfect place to spend a few hours during the holiday season.

I love Bryant Park in Every Season. I absolutely love Bryant Park, no matter what the season. My daughter went on her first Carousel ride here in the Spring, and experienced her first Winter Festival this December. Even when there are no events going on, it's a beautiful place to spend some quality time. We love that there are always books to read if you happen to forget your own. In the Winter, the park transforms into a magical Wonderland, that feels like the joy of the season captured and tucked into this heart of a park in the city. Everything smells wonderful, the Vendors are generally cheerful and helpful, and watching the ice skaters is always fun. The best part is there is no cost to get in, window shop, or watch the ice skaters. Having grown up in NYC, going back there always feels like returning home, and Bryant Park is always one of the places I miss most.

Run.... Don't walk....so much fun..... Very European. We felt like we had arrived in a European City. A skating rink full of skaters of all nationalities, ages and skills. Small green tables & chairs around the rink & through the Park. We moved at least six times..... Eating lunch we brought ourselves; collapsing for a rest after shopping at the wonderful boutiques filled with treasures from all over the world & every price; to watch the skating & to enjoy a hot cider drink froma great food kiosk. Have fun....we did!!

Interesting park. Walked through Bryant Park in December. It was beautiful, the tree, the skaters. Unfortunately it was raining so we didn't spend much time. Bought something to eat but had to stand in the rain to eat it. There are many little kiosk type shops that looked interesting but the rain made us not want to linger. This would be a nice place to hang out if the weather was nice.

Very charming park in the middle of New York City. We stayed at the Bryant Park Hotel, so most of our days began and ended with a stroll through this enjoyable park.
