Eclectic shops are setup along the park offering a variety of items for sale. The park was always full of people and we always felt perfectly safe there. There is good subway access from several locations along the edge of the park.

Iceskating and Christmas Market. We visited on a Friday night and it didn't disappoint. It's just a few blocks away from the Empire State Building (5 minute walk). There was a little market with stores selling all kinds of things that could be given as Christmas gifts- jewelry, scarves, etc. Fair prices. There's an ice skating rink and a big Christmas tree (similar to Rockefellar Plaza) and a lot of tables with umbrellas where you can sit and enjoy a bite to eat. Christmas music playing. Lots of holiday fun here!!

Beautiful Christmas Tree. I found this park through tripadvisor; so glad I did. Lovely vendor stalls. Nice place to find unique gifts. Loved the ice rink and Christmas tree. Even though it was pretty crowded, it was still a relaxing time in NYC.

A great place. An amazing area overlooked by the Empire State Building. Lit up lovely at night which makes the park look truly magical. Lots of places to eat, a huge choice of food. A great place to sit and chat.
Christmas Market. Marvellous market and ice rink great deals Wonderful stalls with friendly helpful traders lots of gift ideas and handmade items with a lovely ice rink and great food outlets
Great place for kids. It is a great place to bring the kids for ice skating and we got to watch a free magic show as well as ride the carousel.

Bringing People Together in the heart of NYC. Bryant Park is a must visit location! At night the ice rink is the centre of attention surrounded by numerous stalls, shops and food outlets in small 'huts' offering something for everybody. Plenty of outdoor seating to rest your weary feet and do some people-watching - or warm up with a hot chocolate!

Nice Option for Ice Skating. I don't skate - so having the place to sit, stay warm and have a cocktail while the kids skate- it the best.
It changes its feel seasonally- I like it best at the holidays....
Don't eat at the restaurant there- poor quality and service-

Outdoor shopping in a trendy, fun setting.. We visited Bryant Park after hearing about it on TV and through friends. It is a really quaint little "village" of shops offering a nice variety of items, many hand-crafted, including lots of jewelry (some vintage), imported teas, baked goods, vegetarian cuisine, and (during our visit) even ice skating! We enjoyed strolling along, popping in and out of the booths. It was like a really upscale craft fair (minus the crafty junk). I would have loved to spend more time there! We would definitely recommend Bryant Park to anyone who wants to soak up the NY atmosphere in a more relaxed setting! Can't wait to return some day!

Added review, excellent second visit. Great day in NYC accented with my second visit to Bryant Park. Additional shops were open for the season and we were quite pleased with what we found. Great place to stop by to spend some time, watch the ice skating that is happening, enjoy some fantastic edible treats. I look forward to a return visit.

Tranquil. Believe it or not this little park offered some tranquility away from the hustle & bustle. It's all set our for Christmas with stalls & an ice skating rink. Really lovely atmosphere that evokes memories if what Christmas is all about. Not as big and brash as others. Give it a visit

Christmas personnified. A lovely oasis in NYC. The stalls were exciting the skating magical. the Apple Cider fabulous. The Christmas tree was stupendous and attracted a lot of visitors. Pity it shuts early at night.

An oasis in Mid-town. Just a fabulous place to sit and visit... bring your lunch or buy from one of the many vendors. There is also a restaurant and bar that serves very good food but does not gouge you like most tourist places do. The Christmas holiday season is great since they create a skating rink in the center and it is surrounded by booths of vendors selling gifts, food, etc.

Quaint Park in middle of The City. Visited the park on Thanksgiving Day. Holiday shops were all open and we enjoyed a lovely lunch at Bryant Park Grill. The ice rink was open and not crowded. We loved being outside & enjoyed spending our day here.
Loved this place!. this was the first place we visited when we arrived in the city. Loved it! People watching at the rink, hot choc, hot apple cider, a walk around the market. Was brilliant

great stroll. Bryant park is a treasure in midtown--cute shops--good food stands and a wonderful festive mood especially at holiday time--the ice rink was packed however it is larger that at Rockefeller center

Nice little place to take a Break. The park is in the back of the Main New York Public Library. There are plenty of tables and chairs to relax and enjoy being outside. A number of places to grab a bite to eat, or right across the street. There is a lovely old fashioned carousal with painted wooden horses the you can ride. In the winter, there is a wonderful free ice skating rink to enjoy and a large Christmas Tree. How delightful!If you want to go shopping around the edge of the park there have set up many little boutique shops to buy that perfect Christmas Gift! Something for everyone!

Christmas market now on. Love this place when the Christmas market is on, it is a must visit late November / december, I think ther are possible other stools / cabin shops all year round? Better than the offering at grand central

perfect to relax, shop eat and drink. There is so much seating and tables , so its perfect to sit and relax while the world goes by. During winter time , can watch the skaters on the ice rink. Plus all the little shops , with known brands as well as new entrepreneurs selling their goods. A few restaurants surround the park too.

Quirky. Bryant Park was interesting, although the little shops in front block off the view of what is actually there. I found it more interesting in the evening than the day time.. it had more character. The shops are quite over priced for there products.
Great little shops. Not only is this a park it is a great place to visit for shopping. So many shops to visit. Some very expensive and some very reasonable. Worth the visit.
magical. beautiful area behind the NY library, Christmas stalls, ice rink, very pretty and worth a look.. has a very special feel to it..

Nice little place. We bumped into Bryant park on our first night in New York. The place was full of seasonal stalls and an ice rink. Very quaint and it was nice just wandering around. Good luck to all the guys selling their products, hope you have a good Xmas.

A Piece Of Christmas in Manhattan. Bryant park a small square located off 6th Ave between 40th and 42nd, Its a must place to visit whilst in New York especially for the holidays. Just pop by if you have a an hour to spare or need something to do before dinner in the city. Its has a lovely quaint feel with an ice rink in the middle where you can watch the skaters, seating all around and a bar and restaurant too. Around the perimeter you will find many stalls like those found at the german christmas markets. It looks and feel instantly Christmas with Hot Chocolate stalls to keep you warm and all this under the amazing back drop of the stunningly lit empire state building to set the perfect scene. You will have many photo opportunities here especially at night.
Ice skating. Bustling with people, young and old. Plenty of vendors selling food and trinkets. So many folks ice skating outside, beautiful music and lights.

Bryant Park. This is a small park at the New York Library. It is a nice spot to hang out for a while in NYC.
Do check this place out when in the city.

Great park, especially in December . This park is great to visit year round, but it's even nicer now it's decorated for the holidays. There's a lot of seating and tables in the park. We usually visit the carousel where the children are buckled in with a safety belt. There's an ice rink but there was a huge line but it didn't seem to crowded on the ice. The Christmas tree was decorated but not lit. The small holiday shops were open which reminded us of the lovely Christmas markets in Germany.
Quaint market. Most of the park has been taken over by the ice rink but around the edges are great market stalls. Lots of choices of food, drink and knick knacks. Fun way to soend 40 minutes.
Winter wonderland!. If you enjoy ice skating the have a nice skating ring, a Christmas tree and many little shops for your Christmas shopping! You will enjoy walking around!

So beautiful at night. An iconic place, it's much more central that what I thought. At the time of our visit, there was lots of semi-permanent stalls selling all sorts of stuff. The landscaped parts seem functional and well thought out. Nice for a wander though on your way home from the evening's dinner or whatever to chill out and grab a hot chocolate and have a browse. We didn't buy anything but the market merch seemed above average in quality, if you like that kind of thing.
Bryant Park. Hang out there with a sandwich at lunchtime and join the hundreds of others doing the same! Fun. It,s next to the NYC Public Library and near all the Trendy Fifth Abe shops.
Great place to people watch. Love the park. So much to see. During the summer I hear they show outdoor movies. You van people glaze in the park.

My favorite place in NYC.. I met my husband there five years ago.I was just a young Frenchie lost,looking for Best buy.Discovered the park when I got off the wrong stop.I'm happy I did.It's a special place for me but it's also magical.There's nothing like Bryant Park at night with the lights on.There's nothing like Bryant Park early morning ...try sitting and eating breakfast there.It's beautiful .There's usually activities there in the summer .Check it out if you are in NYC inn the hot summer.

How have we missed this for so long..... What an exceptional surprise to find that actually walking into Bryant park would lead to hours of fun. We shopped, we ate yummy hot chili, the kids ice skated while we had a glass of wine by the fire pit. It doesn't get any better.

Relax in the middle of NYC. Bryant Park has a host of offerings for every season. In the fall and winter season it has ice skating, a restaurant and some shopping. The only drawback is that the shops are temporary and if you buy something, you probably will not be able to return it. The restaurant, Bryant Park Grill is a fun place to go and sit and have drinks in the summer under the umbrellas. There are live performances of Broadway shows once a week in the summer and also movies at night.

Busy but fun. We went ice skating here instead of Rockefeller center. We figured it would be less crowded. If you bring your own skates its free. They only charge for skate rental and for lockers to hold your shoes. But if you have a lot of people with you rent a bag for $8.00 and they will hold the bag for you with capacity of like 10+ pairs of shoes including boots. Not bad they also have the bar right next to the rink where you can warm up with a nice whiskey or what ever, while watching the people skating.

Excellent. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the ice skating which is free if you have your own skates or about $19 if you don't. Great value for money as you get quite a while on the ice. The market that surrounds the rink is also really good with some excellently unique items.

Good holiday shopping. I was here during the thanksgiving weekend and the place was beautiful. The Christmas tree was up (not lit though) and the small shops full of Christmas gifts and decorations were very pretty. It's a good 20 minute walk around the park and is quite crowded.

Even Better during the Christmas Season!. The ice skating rink is open from early morning until late in the evening (try to go off hours for a less crowded experience) and the many little shops & restaurants are chock full of interesting things to buy. My original review of the pasrk from the summer folllows: "Bryant Park has become, next to Central Park, the best park in NYC for tourists or even locals needing a quick break. Besides just being a great place to chat with friends and people watch over a coffee, soft drink or cocktail at one of the many little cafe tables scattered around the park, it now hosts dozens of interesting events every week. As I walk by the park each morning, I often see FREE yoga or tai chi classes taking place or a morning TV show hosting a concert. Each evening, there's always something going on - from FREE summer movies, concerts (from classical to jazz to rock), yoga classes, ballroom dancing, square dancing, fencing demonstrations, fly fishing classes, readings by authors & poets, pep rallies for local sports teams, juggling classes, etc. Throughout the day, the park also offers ping pong, putting, petangue, bocce ball, board & table games (including chess, Uno, Scrabble, CandyLand, Life, checkers, etc.) and many other activities. There's a stocked Reading Room for adults and also one for children. Kids also have the fabulous Carousel! All of this is in a great location near many tourist hotels. Its just a block from Times Square and not far from Grand Central Station, the Port Authority or Penn Station." Still HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Little peace of heaven. This was our first trip to NYC during thanksgiving and the winter markets. We had heard about the Bryant Park market couldn't wait to attend. We were so lucky on the Sunday after we arrived we went to park to find the weather warm enough to take your jackets off, watch the ice skaters and drink hot apple cider. A dream in the middle of Manhattan. The stalls were great also offering many things for sale, food and no alcoholic drink, although ther was a bar area which we did visit during our other visits which was fab. On a side note the public toilets at the park have staff within and they keep them spotless. Will defo visit again if we visit during the festive period
City haven. Discovered the park when visiting the New York public library,it was a welcome and relaxing alternative to the frantic pace of 5th avenue. Nice little market and ice rink .

Nice place with ice skating and holiday market. I really enjoy the holiday market here. Location is behind the main NYC library. There are many shops, food places and the ice skating, nice festive atmosphere. When the market is not there, is still a nice place to stroll and enjoy a fountain, statues and trees. Very pleasant and restful spot

An Oasis in Manhattan. My family and I stumbled upon this gem while walking back to our hotel in Times Square, and boy are we glad we did! We absolutely loved the park, and our kids loved the grilled cheese sandwiches and hot cocoa from WhichCraft. We also took the kids ice skating here, which was lots of fun because it resulted in no broken bones for Dad! Lots of cute shops for the Holidays, and the awesome NYC Public Library is right next door. Check it out when you need an hour or two to unwind in Manhattan!

Beautiful !!. We stumbled across this Bryant Park on our return to our hotel. What a surprise, it was gorgeous. It has a scare rink, quaint little outlets with gifts, food, etc. and a beautiful xmas tree in the middle. We will go back Tuesday for the tree lighting :)
Bryant park. beautiful little park,small retailers, ice rink which was free,absolutely loved this park,our favourite little haunt,very pretty at night.

Winter Village is worth a visit to Bryant Park. From October thru December, Bank of America sponsors Winter Village in Bryant Park. Winter Village features an outdoor ice rink and numerous local merchants with clothing, jewelry, food and food item, and housewares just to name a few. It really puts you in the holiday spirit. When you are done shopping, a visit to the NYC library is a nice way to finish your visit to the park - the Christmas tree in the lobby is beautiful.

Interesting. Stumbled across this walking Manahattan. Upscale version of the vendors on every street corner with a skating rink when we were there in November. Line out to the street for the skating, though.
Beautiful in Winter. Well decorated with tree, ice rink and lights. Brilliant winter market with a great selection of stalls, novelty Christmas decorations. Worth a visit.

Festive Fun. winter market is a delight. Bryant Park seems to have something for everyone, skating.food vendors. Pop up shops, the Grill, chess and checkers. The holiday decorations are very nicely done!
Fun skating in park. Good fun on a cold New York night. Excellent atmosphere. Interesting market stalls and fun on rink. Reasonably priced - small charge for skate hire but free to go on the rink.
Xmas. Great Christmas shopping with the little booths that pop up at Christmas time from novelty to lovely gifts.
Christmas wonderland. This park is transformed into a winter wonderland. Ice skating rink with numerous one of a kind boutiques. Great eats and coffee.

Very festive and great atmosphere. We went here to see the ice rink following seeing it from the Empire State. There are lots of little stools selling a range of items surrounding an ice rink. The whole park has a great festive feel with wonderful atmosphere.

A lovely park in the heart of the action!. This is a beautiful park right on 42 nd Street--not far from Times Square. There are tables and lots of food stalls selling goodies. It was beautiful weather when we were there and many New Yorkers were enjoying the park and having a nice break from the busy city. Next door is the New York Public Library---don't miss it.

Beautiful Christmas Village. Okay Bryant Park is beautiful in both the summer and the winter, but in the winter it is cranked up a notch. With a variety of shops to do your Christmas shopping to the large skating rink, to the restaurant submerge and enjoy!

Skating and shopping all in one. Went twice in the last week to Bryant Park. The first for ice skating and the second to have lunch at the Bryant Park Grill..which I would recommend. Great little get away in the middle of the City.

Great Location. A large group had this location as a meeting spot, after a full day of touring New York. Full of vibrancy and.in a terrific location, a perfect place for many of us to reassemble for the next part of a special time.

Great atmosphere. Bryant Park is a sanctuary from the buzz of Times Square. From people watching, having a coffee to watching the lunchtime juggling classes, it is a great place to visit. Must be the cleanest public toilets in the world

Hidden gem; do not miss. This wonderful little park is behind the main library - 5th and 42nd - Patience and Fortitude (the lions), stand guard in front. The park has music (May - Oct), bouls, fencing lessons and in the winter the main lawn is flooded for FREE ice skating. There's also a readers corner, a place to purchase yummy sandwiches (at reasonable prices). Subway stop and many buses will get you there.

Lovely oark and not as much of a zoo as Rockefeller Center. This is a lovely park with Ice Skating and much more accessible than Rockefeller Center. It is located on 41st St between Fifth and Sixth Avenues.

Christmas Market. They have a wonderful market with lots of christmas stalls. A really nice atmosphere and so pretty. We went on a Monday evening and most stalls were closed. I am not sure if this is the norm or just because it had been raining all day.

Decked Out for the Holidays. The park is magical in spirit. Food vendors and an ice skating rink on premises. It is a Winter Village, with shops galore where you can truly buy something for everyone. If you are a chocaholic, this is the place for you. Lots of free samples and the most amazing variety of flavors and gift options available.

Love this Market for Unique Gifts. I've never been to Bryant Park when it's not the winter holiday season, but when it is, always take time to visit. Then the park is bustling with an outdoor holiday market filled with unique gift stalls, food stands and an ice rink. The shops are wonderful, and we always take away an item or two for the more difficult people on our shopping list. It can get crowded on weekends, so prepare for the holiday bustle. The food stands are great, and include some unique tastes, including wonderful soups, arepas, and Southwest favorites. The holiday market starts shortly before Thanksgiving and runs through early January.

Hidden little gem. Visiting from the UK, not heard of Bryant park before probably gulfed by the more notorious New York signs.This place is beautiful, ice rink, little boutique shops, atmosphere fantastic. Reminded me of Covent garden in a way with all the quaint stalls.You don't have to ice skate or buy anything here to enjoy it....it's just a great place to be

Holiday market. The holiday market is fairly large and with a good variety of vendors. There are a number of places to eat and drink, too. But beware that, except for the southwest bar, there were no drinks containing alcohol/wine. I was really hoping to walk around with a cup of gluhwein, but couldn't figure out how to do that. The shops were mostly interesting and fun - something for everyone and most budgets. Ice skating is available, too. You could see a portion in a short amount of time, but plan on 60-90 min at least if you shop/eat much at all.

Beautiful!. We didn't know about Bryant Park before our visit from UK, but came across it when on a tour bus around town. We visited in November so it was lovely and festive, the ice skating rink was buzzing with people of all ages enjoying a skate, plenty of Christmas/festive themed little shops (almost like a market) and some generic shops too. Lots of refreshments available and the toilets were bizarrely beautiful! Would recommend for a nice relaxing shopping trip.

A huge backyard. There is nothing like putting up your feet and relaxing in your own backyard...except spending time in Bryant Park. I love seeing a Broadway Matinee and later enjoy dinner and another show with family and friends. When the weather is nice, a great place to spend some time is Bryant Park. I usually take a book with me wherever I go. For those who are not as prepared, daily newspapers and books are in the park to borrow. You can grab seating and put up your feet or just grab a piece of land and relax in the grass. During the Jewish holiday, Bryant Park provides a Sukkah for the observant to eat in. Whatta city!

Bryant Park Toilets. Wow!!! Bryant Park is one of my favourite places in New York. So different in both the summer and winter. One of the best places is the toilets. Amazing, beautiful tiles, so clean and even flowers in the entrance. All you need and fab coffee as well.

A must see for those in the area. We kind of stumbled upon Bryant Park whilst on the way to the Empire State Building and ended up going back most evenings.Its a great place for watching people ice skate, sampling some delicious food and drinking lots of hot apple cider (a great way to warm you up)!There are lots of lovely little market type stalls around the park with the ice skating rink in the centre and it looks lovely all lit up at night. A must see for people in the area plus you can pick up some great unique gifts to take home.

Holiday Market shopping perfect.. Enjoyed the Holiday Market. Shops for every interest. Gifts a plenty. Studio Manhattan Vintage was by far my favorite with upcycled vintage jewelry. Wonderful way to spend the afternoon.

Great to sit and people watch. We had lunch in one of the outside cafes there before heading to the airport and our flight back to the uk Lovely to sit in the sunshine, overlooking a green space, surrounded by the skyline of New York Great way to finish our trip

A must!. For some reason we totally missed this place and just stumbled upon it by accident and what luck! A smallish park with lots and lots of small shops that sells just about everything. It was a really cold day but you can warm yourself with hot cider that you can buy there. One of my favorite sports in NY so far!

Found the carousel!!!. My recent trip to NYC had me searching for holiday markets. This was the only one that had opened since the city is just starting to prepare for the holidays.As previously noted, there is a big ice skating rink, although you have to rent your skates. I wanted to browse the holiday market and they were basically the same vendors whom I saw last year at this time. In some ways it was handy for me to try to get a head start on my holiday shopping.I walked around the complex and was delighted to find the carousel I read so much about. Carousels have always fascinated me since I was a child and this one proves to be no exception.They do have a map of the vendors showing rink and shop hours and lots of other helpful information. It encompasses two large blocks and they have eateries throughout. It is a lot easier to get around than Central Park.
Cool place. A cool place to grab a pretzel during winter nights! It's a nice place to walk around and overlooks awesome buildings! Not far from Times Square also!

Love It. After a long stressful day in class or at work, this is a place you come to sit down and unwind. It is a random park in the center of tall sky scrapers and it absolutely fits well. If you have not had the opportunity to just lay on the grass and read a book here, than it is something you must add on your bucket list.

Lots of quirky little shops to browse. When we visited this place, there was a fairly big Ice Skating Rink in the centre. This was surrounded by lot of quirky little shops. I would recommend to visit this place.

Christmas Market and Ice Rink included!. Beautiful little 'park' transformed into a winter wonderland with outdoor ice rink. Wooden huts housing various shops and food outlets- lots of seating and atmosphere! Visit if you can!

Put this on your agenda. Bryant Park now has an ice skating rink, a carousel - oh so fun for children and fun at heart adults - yes - 4 adults went on the carousel and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves going up and down on the horses and bunnies! The best treat was walking through all of the amazing vendors - selling their wares - I purchased a cork belt for my son and he bought me a handmade pair of earrings in sterling silver! It was so much fun to check out all of the Artisans and their wares. Way more fun getting amazing food from the food vendors - fried pickles, an array of french macaroons, homemade round pretzels filled with chocolate, vegan delights, mexican hot chocolate, chamomile tea with little chamomile flowers, savory bites, sweets galore. It was a wonderous day at Bryant Park!

Small, but Great Place to Unwind. This was out third visit to the Park. We have loved coming here, and received good vibes each time. We found it when the "frozen fountain" was featured in the CBS news last year.There are a lot of vendors in tents / kiosks around the area, so we got a chance to browse around until, by pure luck, we found some chairs right next to the fountain. So we relaxed and people-watched for a little bit before making our move.Over coffee and hot chocolate, we chatted with some locals who gave us a little history of the place. We loved the Reading Room with the mini-library, and got to watch some people all bundled up playing chess in that cold.The nicest and cleanest public bathrooms here were a welcome surprise. The rotating seat covers were really a plus.This is a very cool place to chill. We came in the daytime this time, so we noticed the fences and huge trees surrounding the Park. We plan to come back during the Holidays and enjoy watching people skating on the Rink.This Park guarantees a lot of rest and relaxation, so we highly recommend a visit here..
Loved the winter market.. Spent a wonderful afternoon checking out the winter market and watching the ice skaters. Picked up a few gifts. Loved it.

Must see place in NYC. Been to NYC many times and finally got to see Byrant park decked out for the winter.Nice spot to skate, parents can watch from sides. Bathrooms inside for skaters.The holiday shop huts are so cute and festive. You will find some unique gifts here.Nice wooden chairs through out the park to sit and people watch.There is also a merry go round and kids area.Worth a visit for 1-3 hours.
Bryant Park is very nice!. We got ourselves a crepe and a hot chocolate from one of the many vendors in the park and sat down to watch the people enjoying the large ice skating rink.

Great Venue. Staff at our hotel recommended a vist as it was only a couple of blocks from our hotel.It's a perfect small park not far from the hustle and bustle of Times Square.Lots of booths selling decent quality goods including Christmas decorations.Lots of seating and food stalls and a great place to stop off day or night for a break and to watch the world go by, background views of iconic buildings reminfd you that you are in the middle of Manhattan.

Totally Unexpected. Before our visit we never even knew this place existed. We passed it on our first day on the tourist bus and made a note to come back the next day. Lots of little booths selling everything from Christmas decorations to reusable heat pads. We had a snack stop at a booth selling mulled apple and cranberry with churos. All for about $9 - well worth it.There is an ice rink there at the moment and unlike the Rockefeller Center it's free. Ice skates can be hired if required.Well worth a couple of hours of your time.

A lovely spot for an escape from Times Square. Bryant Park is a nice place to have a sit down and people watch. It's a lovely area with views of the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building. Can't get any more iconic than that!

Great place. Perfect green spot in the midst of the megapolis - benches, skating rink, food and shops
Great place to have a rest, enjoy a snack and observe a NYC crowd

Exciting. Happened to wander into Bryant Park on Tuesday 11th November - veterans day.There was a good atmosphere with the Christmas/craft stalls and the ice skating rink was buzzing. Good to see so many people enjoying themselves.We ate at the Celsius Restaurant overlooking the rink - a perfect place to people watch.An excellent place to have a break and to wander around aimlessly - just enjoying the atmosphere.

Great park. People watching at its best! This park has changed so much over the past 30 years. They have made this a great park. A place to ice skate, shop, grab a bite to eat and able to buy flowers.

Bryant Park - Holiday Shopping. Bryant Park is a great park because it always evolving with fun things to do each season.Right now they have a ice skating rink and the holiday shops with food and products that are unique to the New York experience.
Ice skate. November sees the Christmas pop up huts and an ice rink! sit and watch the skaters while you Sup a mulled wine or soak the winter sun before taking off to the library

Beautiful park in the city centre. Next best thing to Central Park. Absolutely amazing at this time of year with ice skating and holiday stalls around the park. Vast range of one off, hand made items like knitwear, jewellery and home crafts. Not to mention the crepe stalls. Well worth a visit.

A little gem. Quaint area with an ice rink (not used by me) seating, a place to eat and take a beer. Surrounded by a host of small stalls selling all sorts of jewellery, NY products and a host of other items. Not the cheapest but a great way to spend an hour away from the bustle and noise of the city..

Beautiful. We were within walking distance to this wonderful park. Although we did not ice skate the rink was set up and there were a lot of people skating. There were a lot of little shops and a beautiful carousel, right in the middle of all the skyscrapers. A gem for sure and I recommend going there.

I love this place!. thsi park is amazing... in the middle of a crazy district, it shows quintessential people and atmosphere of NYCdon't miss to spend half an hour just looking at people and places.don't miss movie in the park, during the summer

iconic place to visit. good place to visit, as well as famous. if you spend any real time here in the city you are going to sooner or later eventually end up here. so might as well just make it part of your plan. be prepared for crowds, and bring a camera.

Great environment.. I remember when this park was not as beautiful as it is now. NY has done a great job sprucing up this park. On one side is 5th Avenue and the NYC Library. The Library is a real gem.
Winter village. Lovely Christmas/winter villGe with skating rink in the centre - worth a wander round, close to Broadway

Bryant Park a must see!. Bryant Park is a little diamond in the middle of the City. You feel like you your in Paris...Went in the day and late evening both equally beautiful. People just pick a stop and sit or lay down and relax. Beautiful Restaurant attached to the park.

Ice and Easy~. Meander through Bryant Park before Christmas and pop into the little kiosks selling crafts, art and jewelry. If you're feeling less like bracing the crowd at Rockefeller Center (ice skating rink), you can always opt to sip a hot beverage and watch skating at Bryant Park instead.

Sunny Sitting. Bryant Park is the perfect location to forget that you are in the middle of a major city for a few minutes. Located behind the NY Public Library, it has lots of benches and even WiFi to help you relax. Starting in November, the Christmas Shops and ice skating rink open for business. The food is also great.TIP: On the North side of the park on 42nd St is an award winning public bathroom. It looks like any other small green building, but take another look.

An oasis in a crazy city. What a lovely park, nestled in the middle of this busy city. Lovely carousel and quaint reading trolley for children. Very clean park, well patrolled with security, who watch for beggars and remove them from the area. At the moment there are lots of stalls selling some lovely home crafted products. Some fantastic food stalls, with the best hot chocolate with huge marshmallows. A must see!

Second only to Central Park. Much smaller in size to CP and easier to navigate because of. Depending on the time of year there is different events going on. Summer time there are movies, grass and tables to lounge and people watch, as well as dining and drink venues. Winter brings an ice rink and vendors selling various goods in kiosks lining the park.

Shop, Skate and Relax. Going to Bryant Park is a 180 from the early 90's where no one in their right mind would walk around this park. Since its renovation, there are movies, concerts, a merry go round and wonderful bars and restaurants to choose from. If you just want to sit by the fountain and talk on a sunny day, that is fun too. The Christmas shopping village and skating rink are fast becoming New York traditions and on a cool night in December, it puts you right in the holiday mood.

Great Holiday Stop. Directly behind the NY Public Library is Bryant Park. Before you go into the park area, stop and pay respects to Patience and Fortitude (South and North respectively) the stoic guardians of the Library...I'm referring of course to the famous Lions sitting there through all seasons for decades. During the Christmas holidays the park comes alive with skaters and a "Christmas Village" filled with make shift stores with all sorts of goodies; clothing, jewelry, food etc. You will definitely get into the holiday spirit watching children and adults alike skating around the ice set up for the holidays. You can rent skates and there is also a restaurant right there but I would tell you go from booth to booth and sample what's there instead. A great tree is there beautifully decorated and waiting for you to pose in front of it for a picture...See you there this coming!!!

Small and Charming Park. Located very close to Times Square, the small Park somehow had an impact on me the first time I saw it. It was at night back in August, and it offered calmness amidst the brouhaha of New York City. Lots of couples were there and enjoying their night out.During my second trip, I went during the day (since it was so close to the hotel I stayed in). An event was built right in the middle of Bryant Park and along 6th avenue. There was an ice-skating rink with small stands all around it, selling great food, clothes and gadgets. It was a pretty cold morning, but lots of people were there. It was very peaceful and I enjoyed it tremendously. Hadn't I had a flight to catch, I could've spent my entire day there.If you happen to pass by Bryant Park, pause for a while and enjoy the moment whether alone, with your partner or friends.
Very enjoyable. Nice stalls, and good to sit with a hot drink and watch the skaters. Lots of original items in the stalls. Good available and skates for hire if you want to book a session.

A great little park. We stumbled across this as we were walking. This is a lovely little area to look around and very relaxed. There were some really unusual shops in booths and a really nice little ice rink. Not what we expected in the middle of New York. I would definitely recommend a visit.

beautiful park for hot chocolate and people watching. We walked around this park and saw people ice skating, shopping, playing pingpong and just sitting outside on the benches in the warm sun of October. We enjoyed looking at the shops. very unique shops and there are some vendors that are very persistent for you to buy their products so be sure to walk away before they try to trap you in their store. Seriously. the ladies with the lotion and moisturizers wouldn't let me leave and kept lowering the prices down fron 200.00 to 100.00 and no taxes, I just had to be rude and say I have to go, so sorry. Other than that the hot thick chocolate drinks are good but you can't drink the whole cup because you could actually feel sick bc its so sweet and the thickness of the chocolate is just too much for someone my age. Other than that enjoy the view and the park on a sunny day or night.

The stone jewel in the middle of the NY Apple. This is a tiny piece of NYC, but it all seems to come together here - there is always something going on during the day and it is vibrant at night. Fun spot to sit and watch NY go by.

nice park. it was not quiet but always something going on plenty to see and experience, if you want a peaceful quiet park this is not it but you are only a short walk away from Times Square and a host of tourist sites

Great afternoon. We went to Bryant Park to use the ice skating rink, $15 per person skate hire. The shops around the park made the experience better and it's well worth a visit. A restaurant/bar is also available called 0° Celsius.

beautiful winter village. just come back from new York and this place was beautiful, I wanted to go ice skating either at the Rockefeller or central park but they were to far and the Rockefeller was abit small and looked like it was for people that knew what they were doing. we only found about this from the big bus tour guide who said it was free. we went down here on our last night and it was beautiful like something you see in a film. although it was free to skate you have to hire skates and a locker (worked out about $35 for 2 people) I cant skate to save my life as it was first time but there was a mix of tourist and regulars, couples and families. it also wasn't too busy. they have people that are willing to give you a few tips as well which really helped. this made my holiday and was a must do for me :)
Wonderful Park. Love walking through Bryant Park, not too big, you always can make time for it. Nice little shops in booths. Had a delicious warm cranberry cider.

Wonderful Place to Visit, Shop, Grab a bite/drink & Spend some Time. Bryant Park has everything from eating/drinking establishments, to art & crafts, to reusable hand warmers, to tee shirts, to jewelry, etc., etc. It's a great place to visit, especially when the skating rink is up and operating and you are looking for a place to visit within a relatively limited area.. The shops are numerous with good quality varied goods and, of course, New York glitch. There's so much to see in Manhattan, but this is a good destination, centrally located, that enables you to take in other sites during your visit, as well. Several restaurants are in the Park and on the border too.

A Nice Surprise. We literally stumbled upon Bryant Park when we were looking for New York Public Library. What a great surprise. They have an ice rink and also an outdoor market under the trees which sold some really nice stuff. It was October so they were starting to gear up for Christmas too. If we go back to New york we'll definitely stumble again only this time it will be on purpose.

Favorite park in all seasons. Bryant park is a park for all seasons, great skating in romantic atmosphere in winter. Free open air movies on monday nights in the summer. Lunch piano concerts from late spring untill the autumn. Chess, open air library, knitting, free modern dance classes on Saturday mornings. Something for everybody!
Great Location. Right behind the Main New York library. On 42nd Street. Several very nice restaurants including the Bryant Park Grill. Great for people watching.

Great Place to Have Breakfast. My daughters and I went to Bryant Park every morning for breakfast, people-watching, and wandering through the little shops. It was the perfect way to start our NYC prowling day.

This quickly became one of our favourite places. In November, when they have all the little shops and the ice rink, it is such a lovely romantic place to be. Sitting have a drink and a snack while they play lovely music, while watching the ice rink, it is so relaxing. There is so much happiness here.

Bliss!. Having seen this from the Empire State whilst jet-lagged, walked past late on evening, my teenage daughter and I decided to while away the time before our flight home by spending 3 glorious hours in this marvellous public space. Take a book, get a coffee, watch the skaters, eat whatever you want from almost any continent in the world for a pittance, get a sore neck from admiring the buildings and simply relax.Not, perhaps, the most famous of NY's sights, but a haven of peace and civility that has the added attraction of letting your legs take a break. Wish I were there now!

Great Public Space for Families. We were there at Christmas time and Bryant Park was all decked out with decorations. They had an enormous ice skating rink which was FREE. During the day there were beautiful little stalls set up in the park selling everything you could think of from hats to Christmas Decorations. We visited everyday for two weeks. I have seen pictures of it in summer which looks just as beautiful with green grass and bands etc.

Nice Park. We went to Bryant Park and it was really nice. There were people ice skating and people selling stuff in the holiday market. Bryant Park is located on 40th Street and 6th avenue. If you go to New York go to Bryant Park.

Beautiful place to walk, eat something light and buy a souvenir. Bryant Park is a beatiful public place to take a walk in the middle of Manhattan. Chairs to read a book, newyorkers at noon´s time, Little shops to buy sthing to eat, Beautiful Little shops to buy a souvenir . Dont miss it. There are one or two restaurants too to have lunch

So much going on here. Bryant Park has become a New York Play Ground. From the board games area, to music evenings, and yoga after work. This is such a resource for New Yorkers and for those visiting. Don't miss it. ,

hey its a good hang out after the library. Its a square piece of grass . It has food , it's outside , hey it is what it is and I really would not waste an afternoon there unless I lived there and was on my lunch time .

One of my favorite places in the world. I don't know what it is about the holiday season in NYC, but Bryant Park captures it in this amazing little space with a skating rink, little kiosks, and people just enjoying being around each other. I always leave with a huge smile.Get your free truffle at Max Brenner's, as well as some thick hot chocolate (this is a holiday ritual for my family)

Charming Place. Was here right at the end of Sep and they were just lifting up the grass before putting in the ice-rink but even then it was a charming place to have a sandwich and watch the world go by. Loved the outdoor free library and the games tables.
Enchanting. An oasis in a hectic city. Food available, small boutique shops and an ice skating in the middle of the park

lovely cove in the city! dont miss!. we didnt think we would love it as much as we did here, we came here on our last night and it had the christmas market up, which we loved, we bought a few New york christmas ornaments as a memory, and even got them personalized at the xmas shop at the market called 'its all christmas in NY' it really is always christmas here. we went round all the stalls, watched people ice skate and then got two hot chocolates from one of the christmas market stands and watched the ice skating with hot chocolate with the Chrysler building in sight, almost dream like!!I loved it! almost more romantic in a way than rockefeller also!highly reccomend!

little gem. I love this place, when we arrived they have just set up little stalls for xmas, so nice homemade gifts and good food, with ice skating if you fancy that which is free but you need to either hire or bring your own. Nice to go and chill out and take 5 away from the busy street. So close to times square about 5 minutes and right next door to the library. Have an explore
A lovely small park. The park was getting ready for Christmas and so there was an ice rink and lots of small Christmas shops - it was quite lovely and well worth a walk through.

So New York. Suddenly, I felt like a New Yorker when I hanged out here. It is simply New York. I love the live jazz music played freely at the park. With wooden benches everywhere, the park is truly made chill out. And for 5.00$, you can have hearty and healthy salad meal amidst the trees, building towers, pigeons, green grass and flowers. There are a number of food vendors outside the park.
Great to people watch. Great way to take a short break from the busy streets taking a few minutes to watch the ice skating and looking around the Christmas market stalls.

Bryant Park. When we go to Broadway shows, we often take a stroll over to Bryant Park afterward as it is a very short distance from the theater district. In the spring and summer months we usually have a cup of coffee, a beer or a glass of wine and sometimes a little picnic that we've picked up at a nearby street fair or one of the concessions in the park. We sit and listen to live music or grab a seat to people watch as we enjoy our drinks and eats. In the fall/winter months, we go to Bryant Park to browse the many tents filled with vendors selling everything you can imagine. It's a great place to pick up unusual Christmas gifts, they have pretty much everything, clothing, leather bags, art work, pottery, jewelry, you name it. There is also an ice rink in the park if you like to skate or just watch. That along with a hot cocoa or a hot chocolate and some roasted chestnuts make for a perfect winter evening.

Wonderful. The park is fabulous with and ice rink and winter market and bars and seating all around it. visited during the day but passed it at night and it looked wonderful with all the lights on the trees.

Christmas spirit. This is a lovely, small park. We visited it on Christmas Eve in the early afternoon and spent many hours here perusing the many unique Christmas stalls selling many very arty items. Even made a few purchases. Enjoyed hot chocolates under the huge Christmas tree and watched the ice skaters. This was our favourite Christmas location in NYC.
Nice park in the city. Nice park in the city. There are shops here that sells interesting stuff. There is a skating ring in the center.
Shops & More Shops. We liked the many small shops and food dispensaries. It was fun to watch the ice skaters and all the people walking around. There are lots of places to sit down and rest.

Ice skating in NYC. Had a great time here, it feels really festive right now. Good value for skate hire. Just to point out to the Brits, they skate to the left here (UK skate to the right!).....good for lefties....not so for right handed Brits :-)

Winter market and ice rink. Certainly a hidden gem in New York .
Free ice skating but take your own skates otherwise only $15 to hire.
Fabulous quirky shops selling lots of jewellery and Christmas gifts.
Worth a two hour visit and good views of Empire State Building nearby.
An oasis in the city. Relaxing place for lunch or just to step away from the rush and crush of N Y streets. Food, shops, flowers, children's books and a merry-go round.

A lovely place. We were staying very close to the park and was fortunate to be able to enjoy the Christmas market as well as the ice ring. Great selection of small shop. It is a fantastic place to have a drink and partake in my favourite occupation, people watching.

Oddly Calming. Located just behind the library, this is the one place we always come to gather our bearings in New York and get into the groove of the city. All life passes through the park every 5 minutes and there is always something or someone to look at. Love it here!

Chilled out Area in New York. This park is a lovely chilling area for many people but is not on the other hand is not too overcrowded - plenty of tables and chairs.There are a team on site teaching people circus skills - Diablo and Club-Juggling when we were there - & the response was amazing.A great sized ice rink us there which appears to be very popular and very well managed and kept - again not too overcrowded again.Lovely fountain and amazing tall buildings around including a great sight of the Empire State Building.The stalls and the food area was great with many vegetarian and vegan options which (of course) we tried!!Recommended - Enjoy

An Open Air Theatre In Central New York. Having visited in December last year with the Skating and Market in full swing we expected a quieter scene in October. However we arrived during the opening week of this years build up to Christmas and fully enjoyed the atmosphere including gift and food stalls already in place. A great place to relax and watch the world go past from an excellent choice of open air seating. We particularly enjoyed watching first time skaters of all ages progressing from grasping the side rails to tentative solo steps. GO, there is something for everybody.

nice park in the middle of midtown. Bryant park is a lovely little park in the middle of midtown.great for people watching or just to relax for a while.unfortunately the park was in the middle of having the winter market built up so there wasn't a lot going on the day we visited.would have been lovely to see when all the Christmas stalls and ice rink are up and running

Food, shopping and skating. My daughter wanted to go skating at Rockefeller Center but we convinced her the rink at Bryant Park would be more fun - it was. Larger rink, less crowded, free entry and cheaper skate rentals. After skating there were so many options for a snack and shopping.

Refreshing Stop. On a cool autumn afternoon, stopped to sit and relax- saw the sun going down at end of day- ice skating and many shops. Relaxing with nice cup of hot coffee- clean and worth the visit!

An Oasis in Midtown Manhattan. Just behind the main NY Public Library, this park stretches from Fifth to Sixth Avenues. It contains chairs to relax upon, a carousel for kids and food stands for lunch while relaxing in the park.During summer there are evening movies, in winter, ice skating and during the holidays a Christmas bazaar. It is a wonderful spot for native New Yorkers and visitors alike.

A Surprise!. What a buzz to stumble upon Bryant Park one night and witness New Yorkers and visitors soaking up the balmy weather in a remarkable venue. It feels like a modern day Common, with a huge diversity of people resting, reading, chatting, playing backgammon and chess, on their computers, doing deals, watching television being filmed, etc etc etc. I just loved the vibe here, a real treat.

An oasis behind the library. From early morning until late in the evening Bryant Park is alive with New Yorkers and visitors having fun. Quite reading areas, boules, table tennis, chess, children's carousel, bars and food outlets are just a few of the things on offer in Bryant Park. It's a place not to be missed on a visit to New York.

Lovely Area to People Watch and Rest Tired Feet. We stumbled across Bryant park as we were just getting our bearing on the city. It was the perfect spot to grab a coffee and regroup. I can imagine spending many hours here whiling away my cares and watching all of the colorful personalities strolling by.

Beautiful - an oasis in the city!. I went to Bryant Park a couple of times - once pretty late at night on the way to Times Square and it was so peaceful. A couple of people here and there but everyone was relaxed, sitting with friends on the grass or just watching the world go by. My second visit was on a weekday lunchtime and the place was totally different - very busy (there are several cafes to grab lunch and a decent coffee) but we were still able to find a table among the trees. A wonderfully alive atmosphere. We noticed a woman next to us was crying - a cop gave her a flower from the park. You don't see that everyday. There is also a "reading room" - a group of tables with quiet signs and plenty of bookshelves for those who would like to read and relax in the park. If you are in the area you MUST visit the public restroom here - it's beautiful and pristine! I think Bryant Park is my spiritual home.
Great atmosphere... This is a gorgeous park with great atmosphere! We bought some take away food on our last day in New York and ate at the tables outside.

Haven of relaxation in the hustle bustle. Centrally collated the park is an interesting fusion of craft stalls, outdoor eateries, entertainment and greenery. Worth a stop for a bite to eat and a 'chill out' when our exploring. Ample seating from which to choose.

My haven in the City. I fell in love with this park during our 3 week stay in NY ... I just loved the feeling of the park sitting on the grass reading a book while being surrounded with tall skyscrapers, bustling crowd and yet it's like time stills there ...

Great people watching spot. We were just too early for the icerink and the stalls which were being built but even so, the atmosphere here is so relaxed with a very secure feeling given it's slap bang in the middle of the city.There's a couple of coffee stalls, Fro-Yo etc and bar in the corner with another bar/grill in the other corner - public loos (free) are spotless too.Would spend hours there given half a chance and decent weather.
Can't wait for Christmas. Watching the skating rink and Christmas stands get set up on a nice warm Autumn day was fun and wets my appetite for Christmas!

Fabulous hotel in a great location. This is my favourite NYC hotel. Welcoming staff, great views over the park. This was our fourth weekend stay and we will be back again.Only negative is that the Cellar Bar is not as good as it used to be. Despite offering guest free drinks during happy hour period, few people attended hence the lack of atmosphere between 5-6pm. We returned later around 11:30, again more staff than guests. Music was so loud I thought my ears were going to bleed, conversation was impossible so we took our drinks back to our room.

A welcome place to escape the mayhem!. This is only a small park and certainly not a "must see" but it is a welcome place to escape from the crowds and enjoy a bit of green space. Very clean and tidy with lots of places to sit and cafes nearby.

Bryant Park with plenty to see and do. I have been to Bryant Park many times. Usually on bus trips to the city in December. The Park is the drop off and pick up spot for many bus companies. Bryant Park in December is decorated for the holidays. Including a big decorated Christmas tree and ice skating. There are little kiosks set up all over the park with people selling just about everything. Prices are reasonable on items. You can also find food and drinks in the park.When I went to the park in Summer it was to see Broadway in the Park. We took the Metro train out of Poughkeepsie which takes you to Grand Central Station. We walked to the park from there. Which is not very far. We got to enjoy different songs performed from Broadway shows by the original casts. They hold Broadway in Bryant Park on Thursdays and the best part is it's free!!
Relax in the heart of the city.... Wonderful place to put your feet up. A nice refuge from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, which is located nearby.
A small but wonderful respite in NYV. This park is near the New York Public Library and is a great spot to enjoy your lunch outside. Enjoy the beautiful outdoors here
In summer is special!. I love Bryant but in the summer only. In summer this small park is like a gem even though not so hidden , love the open air cinemas as well as the concerts!

Very nice little respite in the middle of midtown. Went there on a near full moon autumn night. Beautiful weather, people out socializing, eating and enjoying the cool night air. It reminded me of nights in Rome and Paris. Pretty soon their ice rink will be open (the only free rink in Manhattan). Great little park right behind the New York City Library's Main Branch.

Pretty park right in Midtown near everything!. Bryant Park is prominently featured along Manhattan's Fifth Avenue. This park is a pretty place throughout the year. It has fabulous activities! There are festivals, music and film showings for the public outdoors under the stars. There are tours and major events.The accommodating seating makes it easy to enjoy the park. You can stop there for a stroll, or to have luncheon or a bite to eat on cafe tables. There is also a cafe for lunch and dinner. Bryant Park is so quiet and pleasant in the morning to savor coffee and a bite to eat. The features of the park and fountains are special. The library is a landmark seated on the grounds that is worth a visit. Bryant Park is close to all trains. Times Square and Grand Central are nearby. It's so convenient to stop here. It's easy to relax and enjoy being in the middle of town.

Beautiful, even in the rain. Walked through Bryant Park on a drizzly morning. The greenery seemed much brighter and greener in the rain--very pretty. There was some construction going on, so we did not see the merry-go-round that day.

Beautiful park, great coffee and mini cafe stalls, lovely walks. This is a fab park near to the main library ( which starred in the film the day after tomorrow) and is lovely for coffee, cakes..Lots of space to relax....outdoor cinema n summer...just lovely x

Nice park in the middle of busy city. I enjoyed sitting there to see the world to goes by after a long walk around the area! Although nothing like Central Park; it's quite nice to get a little rest and drinks before the next activities.

Beautiful place. Beautiful place in Manhattan , sometimes noisy , sometimes quiet , New Yorkers live the parks and is a good place to see the people walking by and having a pause in the busy dayWorth the visit!

Great place to sit for a short while. Nice folliage, great view of some diverse arctiecture. Good place to stop and have a drink while relaxing. Very much enjoyed the comfortable Adirondack chairs, which helped encourage taking in the higher sites.

Wonderful park. What a nice place to relax for at least an hour or so. You could see all types of people doing their own things. It was a pleasant day, sunny but not very hot. I fell in love with this park
Nice park. It is a nice and calm park next to the library, and near the busy Times Square. It is a good place to stop and relax for a while.

Beautiful and romantic. This is a very beautiful park, very romantic. It is in the back of the New York Public Library, very cozy, when I went, there were tiny craft shops. It has an incredible quietness for it's size and location. I recommend to at least walk it, to have a different sense of the city and if you can take a moment to sit and enjoy the space, it's lovely!

Small park close to Times Square. Been there after visiting Public Library . We were having a break at the coffee shop which is facing the Bryant Park . There was an event . Lots of people enjoying the lovely day . Clean ,small but beautiful .

One of the best parks in the city. Bryant park is a very clean park. A lot of things to do throughout the year, concerts, ice skate ring, ... Just have a drink there, relax, chill out, look people playing chess or other games. This is a really nice place to stroll around and relax.
Oasis in the middle of NYC. We got some lunch and ate with the hundreds of New Yorkers on their Lunch break, Small interesting park next to the elegant NY Library. Worth a visit.

Cleanest toilet. Nice place to stop and rest. Nice bars and cafes to stop and have a drink. Loved carousel even though I am of the older generation. loved the outdoor library. Loved to see people relaxing in such a busy city.

Hidden jewel. This is the first place my wife and I stumbled upon on our first trip to NYC last Christmas. This place was great with ice skating, a huge Christmas tree, and a bunch of little shops set up to duck into. Between the music, the activity and the fact it was Christmas eve it was a pretty magical first experience in the city.

Jewel in the city. We stumbled upon Bryant Park when wandering up from Madison Square Garden. It is a beautiful, well maintained park which is a hive of activity in the summer. We grabbed a Starbucks nearby and found a seat to take in the atmosphere. From people eating breakfast to people playing table tennis to people working on laptops. It's all going on. Its hard to believe you're right in the middle of the city. A great place to take 10 minutes to chill out and relax.

Always busy and loads of free activities. This summer there were LOADS of free activities to do in the heart of Midtown - yoga, knitting, jazz piano. Expect lunchtime to be crawling with business suits looking to get a nature fix in their break. while you are there visit the library and the exhibits they have on.

Magical. Absolutely love Bryant Park without doubt it is my most favourite place in NYC the atmosphere at Christmas is brilliant people skating, the markets, the tree, music playing, food and drink just perfect it's so magical it was the place where my mum and I just stood there watching everyone skating at night and had an "oh my god we did it we're in New York at Christmas" moment I'll never forget it!It's nice to get a hot drink and just sit and watch everyone you can see the ESB through the buildings and although it's busy you feel like your'e a million miles away from the City it's nice to wander around the Christmas markets and there are plenty of places to grab some food.I would love to experience it during other seasons also, forget Times Square give me Bryant Park any day!

Best park in the city. I love Bryant park sooo much in the summer. Apart from the free yoga, it is just a lovely spot to grab some food and meet up with some friends after work. It has such a lovely vibe and is a nice way to unwind after work.

A Relaxing and Lovely Oasis in Midtown. I love the way they have re-created Bryant Park. The plantings are gorgeous. It's a peaceful space to walk or sit and have a cup of coffee. A great public space!

Small but Perfectly Formed!. Had read about Bryant Park before we came to New York and it quickly became our favourite place to chill with a cappuccino and people watch. There is so much going on in this small park, surrounded by skyscrapers in Midtown Manhattan. There is a small reading area, ping pong tables and a carousel. There is also lots of locals playing chess.( my wife was convinced one of the chess players was George Clooney in disguise!) All in All a great place to temporarily escape from the hectic streets of Manhattan!

An oasis in the midst of NY. Bryant Park is a wonderful treat close to the chaos of the Times Square locale. It is green, quiet and there always seems to be a table a chair available for all visitors. But a highlight of the park is one of the best public toilet blocks ever visited. It is nice to know that you can find a nice and clean facility when required!

Using public toilet. Beautiful park in the middle of a busy city, loads of people sitting around having their lunch in the sun. Went to use the public toilet there, was told it's the cleanest public toilet in NY, and yes it defiantly is! With auto plastic seat protectors at a wave of a hand! Highly recommended!

Great park, centrally located in midtown. Bryant Park is a great park. It's centrally located in midtown and I enjoy walking through it. Its green chairs remind me of Paris' Luxembourg gardens. Often there's something going on in there, from movies to little holiday pop-stores and ice skating in the winter.

Great little park. I was really surprised how nice this little park was. There’s so much to do: there’s a library section where you can read books, ping pong tables, lots of stands to buy food and drinks, a carousel and lots of seating. I had a nice time eating some frozen yogurt here and planning what to do that evening. A lovely place to relax in the center of a busy city.

Peaceful People Watching with Many Activities. Bryant Park is one of the best parks in the city located behind the Public Library. Surrounded by skyscrapers and restaurants, you can relax and people watch or join in one of the seasonal activities - ice skating and shopping in the winter and yoga in the summer. Check out their website before you go to see all of their events.

Tiny park surrounded by skyscrapers. Located just behind the public libary this park offers a nice bit of quiet from the hustle of the surrounding area. It's ghostly empty on a wet day but soon fills with people on a sunny day. Don't visit especially but if you want somewhere to have a shop bought lunch in the area this is the place to go

Little hidden treasure. We came across Bryant Park without knowing it was there. Very charming oasis with ornate garden tables and chairs. Food kiosks and very peaceful atmosphere. Not large but charming. Hadn't heard of it but stumbled across it after viewing Grand Central Station.

A great place to chill and watch the world go by. We spotted Bryant Park as we were driven to our hotel on arrival in New York and stopped there for some coffee during our first morning exploring the city. It quickly became one of our favourite places to stop and take a breather from the sometimes hectic pace of the city. There are plenty of nearby delis, coffee shops, and street food vendors. The park is also used for various events - during our week in NY there was a concert given by the Armed Forces band and also 3 evenings of Country Hoe down line dancing. As other reviewers have said it's a great place to just sit and people watch - NY doing it's thing !!

An oasis of calm. Just a few blocks away from our hotel we found Bryant Park. What a contrast to nearby Times Square! An oasis of calm to sit and people watch or if you've a mind play petanque or table tennis or just sit and read a book. Refreshment stands are available and the rest rooms are spotless. During the lunch hour(s) you may have difficulty finding a seat as office workers and tourist alike converge to have their lunch. Evening time is just as nice but this time with the lit up Empire State Building overlooking the park. Well worth a visit.

Relaxing Piece of NYC!. We took a break from walking around and grabbed a beer at the Southwest Airlines drink vendor and listened to music and people watched. What a great place to take a break from all the walking and sit back in a quiet green area and sip a cold one.
Great park in a big city. What a great park in the midst of this huge city. Lots of folks take advantage of it...a very good thing!

A Little Piece of Peace. It's no Central Park because nothing is but it's a nice little piece of peace in the midst of craziness. A first time visitor will probably find themselves in this area. Get a gelato around the corner and take a good rest here. A great place to reflect.

Busy busy. Nice park well kept . Hard to get a seat as this park is very busy with people from the area around having lunch and coffees . When did manage to get a seat interesting people watching . Good cup of coffee from coffee shop .
Green oasis!. Awesome green oasis around 40-42nd Street. Have a coffee and enjoy the varying activities such as pingpong, library reading corner, chess and some others. Relaxing yes!

Beautiful Park in midtown Manhattan. We stumbled upon Bryant Park on our way to the Empire State Building and took a leisure stroll through it. It is very picturesque and restful. It isn't very big but well worth a visit.

NY treasure. Bryant Park was close to our hotel in Murray Hill. We ended up here almost everyday as we explored the city. The services offered in this relatively small space are phenomenal. We ate takeaway breakfast and lunch here, enjoyed the live piano music, watching a children's chess tournament and simple peaceful surroundings in an otherwise busy area. There's something for everyone here, free activities, entertainment, a carousel, cafés, a lovely restaurant and plenty of tables and chairs. It's a beautiful space.

A gem right in the city centre. We came across this by accident, while walking. Stopped off for refreshments and have to say, it didn't feel like you were sitting in the middle of New York. There was a large cinema screen erected and would have been nice to stay for the movie. Always seem to be something happening. Give Bryant park a visit and enjoy a glass of wine.

Really amazing .... This very good and placed near by port authority to terminal .. Lots of activity are encouraged here .. Like yoga , musical chair ,knitting ,language classes ,food ,games ..etc they have a guide book for reference ..here I have participate the 67th US AIR FORCE birthday celebrations .. Air force music band performed their musical excellence .. Free wi fi is available .. People are enjoying here .. Nice

Peaceful. This is one of the best parks in NYC I find it to be amazing, peaceful and full of simplicity. Lots of tables and chairs, clean, not that many homeless people and it is quite well served. I would defiantly recommend it to any one who enjoys simple and green areas.

Beautiful place to sit and ponder. Bryant Park was close to our hotel (the Archer). Once a rundown and drug dealer infested area, the City has transformed it into a mini-Luxembourg garden space. Lots of tables and chairs, plug-ins for electronic devices, a "read-only" space, coffee stand, bar as well as some of the most beautiful public bathrooms you'll ever find anywhere. Tranquil amidst the constant traffic nearby, it a wonder respite spot in mid-town. Well done NYC!!

Wonderful green space in the heart of the city .... We found Bryant Park entirely by accident, and were drawn in by the sight of hundreds of people doing yoga on the lawn. Walked around the paths, where little tables and chairs are doted around where people were eating their take out food. We tried to track down the source, but our intention was subverted by the cafe and restaurant behind the library. We got a table outside, overlooking the park.A lovely green space in one of the most urban places on earth.
Wonderful park in NYC. Easily one of my favorite parks in NY. The park has a lovely atmosphere, and is a wonderful place to relax. Bryant Park is truly a beautiful place to visit.

Tranquility in the Big apple. I loved Bryant park when I first visited it in the Winter when they had a quaint ice-skating rink.I loved it even more when I visited it in the summer and went to the free yoga classes.Right in the middle of this bustling city is a peaceful haven

Beautiful Escape in Midtown. Bryant Park is the perfect escape for lunch outside when in Midtown. It is also located right next to the library, which is a must-see. The restaurant in the park is delicious, and the bar is quite lively after work in the summertime.

Lovely little oasis of calm. On a sunny day this is a lovely environment in which to sit and relax, really beautiful space, the reading room is such a great concept. There is something for everyone here and it's really central to other great attractions

A favorite park for New Yorkers and tourists alike. How many other urban parks provide chairs and standing umbrellas--abundantly--for reading, conversation, people-watching? When a downpour began we huddled cozily under a big umbrella and continued our conversation. BTW, if you need to buy an umbrella, the gift shop inside the New York Public Library sells decent ones quite inexpensively. There seems to be something for everyone here. A wonderful urban oasis.

WELCOME GREEN SPACE. One of my favourite parks ever. A postage stamp on 6th Avenue. Nearly always something going on. Plenty of shady places from the sun when it's hot and openness when it's not. The park has been transformed for the better in the recent past and we always try to visit. Worth finding.

Lucky New Yorkers. Every time we visited or went by this park it was being enjoyed by many many people What a beautiful place of tranquility in the centre of a frantic busy city! And what a variety of activities or places of calm reflection there are within the boundaries The beautiful and lush vegetation must be doing its bit to purify the air in this densely populated city also
Lunch with Style and a View. Always enjoy eating here when in midtown. Make reservations. Very crowded with well heeled businessmen in suits. Sandwiches are attractive and hearty.

Oasis in busy NYC. When we visited there was a stage set up with actors from Broadway musicals performing. Lots of people were sitting watching and just enjoying the atmosphere. It was a lovely place to relax after a tour of the library and just enjoy a bit if greenery in a bustling city.

Wonderful spot in the busy city. Bryant Park is easily one of my favorite places in New York. I watched the USA-Belgium World Cup game here, which was shown on a disappointingly small television. Nevertheless, the atmosphere was great and classic New York. I also came here for Broadway in Bryant Park and brought a blanket and lunch. The audio could have been better, but the performances were wonderful. I often visit this park to read or relax in the sun to take a break from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Ice skating and winter market. Bryant park is lovely in the winter when it transforms into an ice skating rink surrounded by a Christmas market. In the summer they have open air movies here. It is very close to the theatre district.

Table for 2?. I really enjoy this little park with all of it's little bistro tables set up every where. In the warmer months it's the perfect park to sit down and have a bite to eat, ready a book maybe. For some reason this time you could not go out on the lawn. The is an open air seasonal restaurant/bar as well as a permanent one(Park Cafe maybe?) In the month of November I know there are several venders/kiosks selling a variety of goods- I am always in NYC in November so know that the shops are there but am not sure when they open or close up for the season. It is located right behind the library on 5th ave. If you have the chance check it out. well worth it.

A little bit of calm near Times Square. Great public park. Visit the reading room where newspapers and books are on display and enjoy the ambience of this lovely area. Met a lovely elderly gent who goes there every day to read the newspapers and is happy to tell you all about the park-proud New Yorker who will share the insider secrets with you-introduced us to Michael who manages the reading room.Fantastic facility for locals and visitors alike.Nice coffee bar . Movies shown on huge outdoor screen during the summer months and grass turned into a skating rink in the winter, Give this a visit while n New York-a little bit of calm just off Times Square!

Fabulous. An absolute gem of a place !!! honestly a must see for a NYC goers !! Take some time amidst the chaos of sightseeing to sit with a coffee and a bagel and take it all in !!! People watching opportunities a plenty !! Right by the famous library too!! Lovely clean well kept seating, gorgeous lights and ambience, a little vintage carousel, open air cafe and bars !!! Love love loved it ... We kept going back !!!

Relaxing. If you can relax with hundreds of people around this would be the place to go. Everyone in the park in the center of NYC was having a great time during their lunch hour. Some just laying on the center lawn sunbathing catching the last rays of summer, others having their brown bag lunch or enjoying a lunch from a vendor while sitting on the park bench under a tree. There is also a merry go round ( a double decker) for the children to enjoy. Bathrooms are located in the park and a subway station is adjacent as well. With all the people around you might expect the park to be littered which it was not. Take a break and enjoy while visiting NYC if only for a few minutes or an hour or two.

Enchanting. A little slice of enchanting beauty in the city. I absolutely loved Bryant Park. The trees and landscaping is beautiful, there are plenty of places to sit, and refreshments sold at the corners of the park. It is stunning.

A good time. We came to Bryant Park not once, but TWICE on our trip to the big apple. we loved the cute little shops, even though they were a BIT pricey, we still had fun roaming around- get Macrons, and Apple Cider from the little lady in the booth- you wont regret it

A gem of a place!. This park was an unexpected find during our first trip to NYC. The park is quaint and beautiful. I wish we had packed a small blanket to enjoy a picnic. However, there are tables and chairs everywhere as well as a sandwich/coffee place and then the Bryant Park Grill for a sit down meal. A great place to relax, watch people and enjoy some down time. So glad we spent some time here.

Nice place to sit.. We stopped off hear to rest our weary feet, and what a nice place to stop. Lots of people sat eating lunch, on their iPods, chatting and generally enjoying a lovely park in the middle of a very busy city.

Unexpected find!. Spent our last afternoon in this Park. A very pleasant, surprising find while walking around the Streets of New York. Surrounded by tall buildings and very busy Streets,you can relax and soak your feet in the fountain, play chess, table tennis, bowls, read quietly in the reading area where there is a great selection of newspapers and books,sit and have a picnic, or just relax and watch the world go by.There is also a very good food kiosk serving everything from soups to icecream. A place for the very old and young to enjoy. Was very impressed with the Restrooms! A beautiful, large floral display greets you at the door. Not the norm!
great place to relax. great place you can grab a coffee, bagel anything really, a clean place in a big city, lots going on when we went, restaurants in the middle of Manhattan.
