The beautiful of green "lost" between buildings . I stayed in a hotel near to this park, so I had opportunity to walk every day in the green carpet of this park during my 6 days of stay in NYCThis is a chamois park with tables where people can sit, stay and talk looking outside of the city that never sleeps.Go and visit this small piece of green near to Timessquare. Amazing !!!!

An Urban Oasis. When I lived in New York almost 30 years ago I would cross the street to steer clear of Bryant Park since it was considered quite a disreputable, dangerous area. Now I make certain to spend time there every time I visit the city. The park now has a very European feel. It also offers a lot of free public activities from tai chi to knitting groups, public reading areas, and music. Best of all, it is a fabulous rest stop for people watching amid a bustling part of the city. It also is next door to another great free city treasure, the NYC Public library. What's not to like?

Perfect to relax and grab a snack. I love this park ProsYou can relax in the middle of the hustle and bustle. Grab a snack or eat lunch at witchcraft cafe. Lag on the grass or grab a table. It's perfect for people watching!There are even places to charge your phone .During Christmas they have a beautiful market, stunning Xmad tree and they add an ices hating rink which is a lot of fun.ConsNone

Beautiful setting. We purchased lunch and sat down to live piano jazz entertainment.The park has many shaded areas. There are beautiful fountains, a large green space in the sun, & a restored carousel to be enjoyed by all.

Lovely. Got off the train at Grand Central and walked down 42nd street and just past the Beautiful NeW York City Library is Bryant PArk We arrived in time for an outdoor Piano Concert and enjoyed our picnic lunch at one of the parks lovely picnic tables and chairs joining the many people who were doing the same The weAther was gorgeous and the jazz pianist and songstress was sensational there is. Beautiful carousel and a gorgeous fountain rolling lawns and ice cream concessions An oasis in Nyc where so many visit all day until sunset We love to go when we are in the city at lunchtime So much is happening and it is a joy

A little haven. What a lovely park.we sat on a lovely day, had breakfast and then just relaxed and watched the world go by. There are plenty of tables and chairs, all clean and it was just so pleasant to be able to sit there and relax. Just beautiful.

Just go!. This little oasis behind the New York City Library on 5th is my favourite spot in NYC. It has a real European feel with all the activities, the bars and restaurants and the lemonade and coffeekiosk. This is a great place to hang out at a table or on the grass and people watch, chat or read. Just lovely! ( the nicest public washrooms too! NE corner!)

Like living in a Christmas card. Skating on the open air rink, walking through the Christmas market all lit up and festive, the atmosphere was electric. We were there on Christmas Eve and Christmas night and it was magical. The staff at the ice rink were great really helpful and the smallholders really gave the whole experience a little magic.Soxateer had an amazing range of novelty socks at reasonable prices. There were stalls selling tree decorations which could be personalised or bought off the shelf.We all loved it there.

Nice gem in the middle of NY. Excellent spot for relaxing your feet when wandering around fantastic NY. Nice that you can take chairs and a little table and enjoy a coffe, read a book or just look at all the other people in the park.

Great place. What a find. A very nice respite to get away from the hustle and bustle and overwhelming noise of the city. Lots to do and see. Nice for a beer and people watching. Our hotel was close to there and we went there 3 afternoons straight and one morning just to chillax for a half hour or so. Next hotel I book in NYC will prolly be close to the park. Highly recommend.

Oasis in the Heart of Midtown. Bryant Park deserves its status as one of the most beautiful small urban parks in the U.S. We visit NYC often and almost always spend time in BP. It sits behind the NY Public Library to 6th Ave. ( Ave. of the Americas ) and from 40th St. to 42nd St. This central location makes it a perfect stop. On Sat. August 30 my wife and I enjoyed a picnic lunch and enjoyed BP's beauty. Hard to believe that thirty years ago it was run-down and crime-ridden, and the transformation to the lovely public space of today is remarkable. This park boasts so many amenities and charms, and organizes so many programs I cannot list them all here. They have great and varied food options, excellent craft beers at their Southwest Porch bar near 40th St., and what must be the most opulent public bathrooms I've ever seen. They sit in BP's northeast corner and are themselves a great reason to visit. But with BP so many reasons exist. It is truly one of NYC's crown jewels.

A pause in the middle of the great city. Bryant Park provides a great front yard for the heart of Midtown. Allowing residents, workers and visitors a pleasant break and rest in a green space, surrounded by the great buildings and backed by the Library, giving all the chance to step aside one moment and catch their breath. The park varies seasonally with different outdoor activities and markets being set up according to the time of year but there's always something to do.

Nice green place. This park is in a busy place. Well maintained green park. It was nice to be able to stop for a couple of hours to have lunch and enjoy the green. Washrooms are kept very clean despite of how busy it is.

A haven of greenery. It was evident just how New Yorkers love their parks. This green pocket is located on 6th Ave and backs on to the NY Public Library. The activities available within its borders are many and diverse. There is a heritage carousel, and areas for reading, playing chess and table tennis, performance, snacks, or just sitting and relaxing. If you need a break and are in the area, then head here and pretend to be a local!

Beautiful place to unwind in the city. This is where people do their lunch, reading, mini gathering, jogging, yoga, ce skating and basically anything to unwind your stress. Visit here, maybe buy a few snack or food, enjoy it at the park while people watching

Peaceful and good to relax. You are always rushing to see everything in NY and this time we were heading to the Public Library. The park is small but relaxing and I believe there are some kiosks that sell some coffee or so. Lots of people on the benches talking and if you´re tired of walking up and down 6th Ave, stop by,

Bryant Park a little gem in the midst of Manhattan. During my many many stays in NYC I loved visiting Bryant Park, usually at the beginning of the morning, middag or at the end of the day. Having a bite to eat, a drink, shooting images of the surrounding buildings and during a week in the summer at night watching a movie in the park offered by HBO. It's green, enough trees to provide shade in the hot summer, a magazine and newspaper stand which provides free reading materials. a big grass field to pick nick, read or just relax or meditate. Awesome in a nutshell. Positioned on the corner of 6th Avenue and 42nd Street it is a great starting point for the day and also a greatplace to watch the NYPD snake that runs along side the park once a day (10's, 20'2 or more squad cars driving by with flashlights and sirens)

An Exquisite Urban Oasis. Walked to Brant Park from our hotel and the walk was worth it. Tall sycamore trees surround a beautiful urban oasis in the centre of skyscrapers and the park is beautifully landscaped with flowers and ground cover. The centre is a huge grassy area where people were laying about enjoying the summer. Surrounding this area are hundreds of tables and chairs all embossed with Bryant Park and these were being used by families and groups playing board games, eating their dinner and just talking. When you walk in through the main gate there is a large fountain and on the side of the park facing 40th avenue (I think) there is a gorgeous carrousel which you can enjoy for $3 a ride. There are lots of places to eat and best of all a gelato sorbet kiosk beside the carousel!

Movie Night. Stumbled across this place on the way home from Broadway one night.
The whole park full of people all having a drink watching "The Shining" on the big screen.
Great idea!!!

Wonderful space!. We enjoyed the group, Thiefs, who are very talented. I love the trees. What a lovely space for NYC. I encourage the people to add a park like this every few blocks or so. Very joyful respite from the surroundings.

Lovely little park in the city. Nice grass area in the middle, surrounded by trees and tables with seats. Great place to stop off for a coffee while walking around the city and relax. The Reading Room is a great idea, with all the daily newspapers free to read there.

Great place for wedding photos. Bryant Park is a great place to just chill out in the sun with friends, or, like me, you could be part of an American-Australian wedding party and head there to take some beautiful NY themed photos.

It's certainly the best park!. I loved it. I loved it on weekdays, I loved it on weekend, by day, by night... It's a really quiet, well maintained oasis inside of concerete that surrounds it. During the summer there were screenings of world famous movies from past 30 years and the park was packet with young people who spread their blankets or sat on the chairs aside. Truly a great place to rest.

Nice park in the middle of the concrete jungle. Had a nice time in this park which is in the middle of the city , have a few places to eat and drink and something for the kids to enjoy . Good option to relax especially on a weekday - gets quite busy on the weekend though ..

Agréable, endroit idéal pour un café ou pause letcture. You need a break of the chaos of NYC but want to do it outside. Bryant Park is the place in middtown. At night, it is lighten by giant bulb attached to a building; you can almost think that it is daylight. Fascinating!

Relaxed hangout. Very nice grass area surrounded by trees and seats/tables. Relaxed. People hanging out. I was lucky enough to be there when they showed a movie in Summer. Nice to watch a movie outside on the grass surrounded by skyscrapers.

Perfect New York Lunch. We stopped at Shamsa deli at 38th and 7th after a meeting...yum...then trotted over to Bryant Park. You need to get there by noon to get a table easily. After that you just have to watch as people pack up. But once you are seated, its a real New York experience. The temps were perfect on the August day we visited. Chairs abound if you cannot get a table. There is also food for sale in the park.

What else can you ask?. Lovely place. Full of flowers and green. The perfect spot for reading, relaxing, eating something, sharing with people you love, for a break (at any time of the day). Shade, fresh air, plenty of seats, a relaxing atmosphere. An oasis in the middle of the chaos. Some nice statues (pay attention to them: Benito Juárez among others – On the 6th Avenue or Avenue of the Americas). Clean public restrooms, with fresh flowers. Free concerts and films. What else can you ask?My favourite place in busy NYC. Enjoy it!

Beautiful Evening in the Park. We were here on a Friday night in July and it was magical! The weather was perfect and we watched the beautiful sunset between the skyscrapers. The park wasn't to crowded and every age group was there enjoying themselves. We had drinks at the grill and then came out to listen to the "Punk Rock Chamber Quintet" perform. A very different but awesome musical experience. A great place to people watch and relax. Except for the skyscrapers you forget you're in the middle of NYC.

A Must See for Tourists!. Bryant Park has become, next to Central Park, the best park in NYC for tourists or even locals needing a quick break. Besides just being a great place to chat with friends and people watch over a coffee, soft drink or cocktail at one of the many little cafe tables scattered around the park, it now hosts dozens of interesting events every week. As I walk by the park each morning, I often see FREE yoga or tai chi classes taking place or a morning TV show hosting a concert. Each evening, there's always something going on - from FREE summer movies, concerts (from classical to jazz to rock), yoga classes, ballroom dancing, square dancing, fencing demonstrations, fly fishing classes, readings by authors & poets, pep rallies for local sports teams, juggling classes, etc. Throughout the day, the park also offers ping pong, putting, petangue, bocce ball, board & table games (including chess, Uno, Scrabble, CandyLand, Life, checkers, etc.) and many other activities. There's a stocked Reading Room for adults and also one for children. Kids also have the fabulous Carousel! All of this is in a great location near many tourist hotels. Its just a block from Times Square and not far from Grand Central Station, the Port Authority or Penn Station. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Enjoy the Green. Bryant Park is a wonderful place to park yourself during a busy mid-town visit or lunch hour. It's good to see a little green space in the heart of the city.At Christmas time there is a market where one can purchase unusual gifts that are not mas produced. Just sit for a while and watch the world go by.

Very Nice Park. Bryant Park has changed a lot, for the better.Right near the NYC public library, the park now has many kiosks, places to grab a bite, or just to enjoy the day, reading a book, or taking a stroll.Particularly pretty around Christmas time, lit up, with an ice skating rink there, and kiosks selling Christmas merchandise.If you haven't been there in a while, I would recommend visiting the park again.

definitely deserves a brief stop, watch other tourists and enjoy season's activity..oner ayan. during winter you can ice skate, during summer you can relax on the lawn (if they didn't close it for maintenance), listen to a mini-concert, watch a night movie on a giant screen, participate yoga activity, read free books and paper, play table tennis, listen to an author and so many more. it is an ingenuiity of New Yorkers to turn this park from a drug-dealer infested location to a family friendly park. spare some 45min-1hr for this park and enjoy it comfortably, very close to Times Square, Broadway and Grand Central Terminal. I have heard that ladies' bathroom (on the 42nd St side) is the cleanest in New York City. Oner Ayan

Beautiful park, library and lunch place. Bryant park is fantastic in the summer, there are plenty of tables with seats to enjoy the weather, some food or a good book, free wifi is available from the library. It has nice cafes/ kiosks to grab a bite and free concerts outside. In the winter the middle turns into the ice-skating ring with the christmas tree next to it and an inside complex along with a shopping market. Its a fun place to visit.

Wonderful for an afternoon. It's been beautiful in NY this summer, and our go to place to have an al fresco lunch is Bryant Park. Sitting on the lawn takes us out of the city for a while...and let's us enjoy this beautiful weather. Get here before the winter does!!

A favorite for visitors and locals. Bryant Park is one of my favorite New York City parks. The park neighbors one of the city's most revered landmarks, The New York Public Library. During the summer, you can catch a breather on one of the many green chairs in the shadow of the tall trees. During the summer, you can catch a movie in the park or witness a friendly game of bocce. During the winter, you and try you hand at double axles around the ice rink. During the winter, you can find that gift for that special someone in one of the many colorful holiday booths. For any other time of the year, you can just relax and remove yourself from the busy avenues and streets for just a moment. What's not to love about Bryant Park?

Best bathroom in midtown Manhattan. Bryant Park behind the NYC Public Library is a perfect place for a midday break. Food, drinks, coffee, free outdoor seating, free outdoor reading tent and the nicest bathroom ( free) in midtown. Summer outdoor concerts and evening films. Who could ask for anything more ?
A treasure. What a beautiful little oasis tucked in the busy city. Nice to sit in the park to have some frozen yogurt and watch people play chess, bocce ball or just people watch!

Beautiful cozy park. I loved Bryant Park, it was really pretty and cozy ! After a long day of sightseeing this was our pick up spot, they had ping pong tables, they had chairs and tables and benches throughout.There is a Starbucks across the street, so it was nice to have a coffee and and just people watch. The bathrooms were very clean as well.
Small but beautiful. Beautiful park , next to the public library. It has special events such as fashion shows, film festivals, etc.

Perfect park in midtown. I thought the trees that lined the walking path were wonderful. It hides you from the city, yet you still know you are in the city. There are chess players, newspapers to read, tables to eat and relax, and a center yard for entertainment and relaxation. Perfect location right next to the library in midtown.
Great place to visit in summer. Lots of table and chairs seating, no access to lawn area, due to summer films screening. Piano concert for all to enjoy, carousel for children, chess tables available

WOW!. I really loved passing through Bryant Park. I wish we had more time to just sit and read or people watch. It was expansive and beautiful. Places to play bocce ball and chess, etc. So many different people there and just a beautiful park amidst the NYC hustle and bustle.
A gem. Love this little park. Carousel for the kids, great outdoor rooftop dining at the grill. Shade, fresh air, plenty of seats. Relax!

Super fun free skating. Bring your own skates and skate free anytime! Mornings are wide open, you can be the first one on the ice if you try. Ice is in decent condition and long blades (short track speedskates) are allowed.

Great place to eat lunch!!!. First time walking thru Bryant Park on our way to the library and it was absolutely beautiful! So crowded with people eating lunch or just relaxing to enjoy the view. Great place to just sit and do nothing. Plenty of tables & chairs to sit and relax. Cafes around to get some food.

Sweet little oasis of space, middle of New York City. Sure, it's no Central Park, but this is a great spot to relax, grab some food, even take in a free evening summer movie! Situated right behind the NYC Public Library. Food is available there in a couple of spots, or cross over to the street to the East and grab a bite at Chop't (amazing salads to go) or Chipotle. Lots of tables/chairs to sit at and relax. Especially great place later in the evening, we never felt uncomfortable.

Like a little piece of Paris and New York. The Bryant Park Conservancy has made this lovely area just behind the New York Public Library into an oasis. The gravel walks, the shady trees, the wrought-iron lawn furniture, the carousel, the food stalls. A lawn to catch the sun on, or a movie on some summer evenings. So reminiscent of a good Paris park! But my favorite memory is from last Christmas, when the holiday fair set up shop in rows of tiny kiosks and the snow was falling, and people were laughing. So reminiscent of the good part of New York, too. Look for the lending library, pull up a chair, read a book and drink your coffee. Even a work day can have a little Paris added.

Great Place to Eat Lunch. We love stopping to have lunch here. My daughter also loves riding the carrousel. During our last visit the lawn was closed, so she was pretty ticked she had nowhere to run around, but we just rode the carrousel about a million times instead. They have plenty of chairs and tables and there is a cafe you can buy food from our you can pack your own lunch. Plenty of shade from the trees as well.
Oasis in NYC. A great place to do nothing and when you are shopping with teenage daughters in NYC you do need time to do nothing. Go there on Monday evening and enjoy the free films in summer
Perfect spot for an outdoor nite cap. So beautifully lit under the trees. Fun spot reasonably priced. Awesome setting for a group or a date. So much fun. Heard food is good too so it's on the list

Nice place to relax. Had the idea to have lunch at Bryant Park Grill but unfortunately they had a private event scheduled. Had lunch in Times Square but made it back to sit in the park and enjoy the sound of live music playing. We relaxed as the sunset in the well lit, manicured lawn. Don't forget to take a pic at the beautiful fountain at the end of the park.

Beautiful. New York Public Library is across the street from the park and it's also pretty close to other points of interest such as The Chrysler Building, and the 5th Avenue. It's definitely worth the time on a sunny day.

Worth A Walk Through. If you are walking around midtown and need a respite, stroll around Bryant Park behind the NY Public Library. There are several nice restaurants with indoor and outdoor seating and food vendors as well. There are moveable seats all of the park so you can make yourself comfortable and people watch. Especially good people watching at lunch time or after work.
Very Nice. A lot of great views here in my opinion. I really enjoyed taking a break from walking through the city and seeing life pass by. I really enjoyed it.

A lovely find.. We stopped here quite by accident after noticing the public toilets. A rare find and they were and very well looked after too. The park is beautiful. We bought a couple of salads, found an almost shady table and enjoyed a bit of people watching.

Wished I would have gone before ! . Check out the summer nights where they show their movies in an outside screening thingy ... I think Mondays, and schedule visiting there when going to the public library . It's a classy park, sit down for a reading of sorts ( library influence I guess) or jus enjoy eating your lunch on the nice green lawn with mostly nice looking people around with some descent restaurants, and great ice creams...! Picnic your afternoon away or movie night for fun..!

Stopped for a drink. Here with 19 exchange students. They shopped and I took lots of pictures while sipping a drink at an outside bar. Very relaxing. Some great pictures. Would like to spend more time there.

A nice piece of green in the middle of Manhattan. It is a small park in midtown. Within walking distance you can reach Grand Central Station. The New York Public Library is just next to the park.There are lots of activities going on everyday. During my stay in NYC, we saw mass Yoga practice, movie night, reading corner, Accordion day etc. There is also a carousel on the side of the park. We appreciated the Game corner in the park where there are different kind of board games of which people can borrow and play. My boy came there almost every day after summer class to play chess with the New Yorkers there. According to Gregory, the game stall staff, people have been visiting and playing chess for many many years. The good thing about playing chess here is that it doesn't cost you a penny. Some places in NYC may need you to pay or people may gamble.I must thank Gregory here as he spent a few days with my boy and taught him a lot! My heartful thanks Man!The Cons about this park is the bathroom. I think it is too small. For men it's all right. For ladies, there is always a line of 15-20 people. It broke once during our stay and the men's bathroom then turned to be a unisex one with along queue outside.

Great park in Midtown. If you can't find a seat in Times Square just head a few blocks over to Bryant Park and there's plenty of seating and grass to enjoy. The park can get really crowded around lunchtime (12-3) on nice days, so if you are looking to grab a bite to eat from one of the restaurants there try to go before or after.

A lovely place to stop. This square is lovely. It has a number of table and chairs that you can stop at for a breather and some peace and quiet in the heart of the bustling city.It's also a great place to stop and have some lunch from one of the many places located nearby.

Beauty in Bryant. Beautiful park on the lower E side. When we visited on a Friday afternoon, there was a live jazz band and many people relaxing and lounging. Beautiful flowers and foliage, very well kept and pretty. Nice place to relax!
Lawn Closed!. Not often you see opening times for a lawn :-) Lovely little park to sit and watch the world go by.Lots of free seating, bring coffee or a lunch...

Broadway in Bryant park. That's right, every Wednesday about 11am they show 10 min previews of the shows currently showing on broadway , all live, with the stars of the shows, a show in itself, and all for free, a must do.

Great park in the middle . Stop in the park at sunset. Great location and quaint. Big screen for movies on Mondays. All free for the public. Lush lawn is welcoming in the summer heat and there are trees abounding giving good shade.

Nice place to relax + free WiFi. Is a really nice place to relax for a while, read something, maybe eat, play or just enjoy the day. Is very calm, especially considering that is i the middle of Manhattan. There you'll also find free WiFi!!

My Favourite Place in New York. An oasis of calm in the middle of Manhattan. Great for relaxing, you can borrow a book from the outdoor reading room, kids can ride the carousel, grab a snack, drink, or ice cream from the many kiosks. You can even charge your phones at one of the several charging stations dotted around the park and use the free WiFi. There are also a number of bigger events during the week such as Yoga, outdoor movies and music. At one end of the park sits the impressive New York Central library, which is also worth a visit in itself.

A relatively small green scenery between the skyscrapers !. Bertween the Sixth Avenue and famous Fifth Avenue found its place on earth, this very nice park.As to the streets, that are the 40th and also very known 42nd street,that border the greenery from southwest and northeast. This privately-managed public park hosts the main building here, that is must-a-see, the New York Public Library. Though, the principal entrance is from Sixth Ave. on the west. There are a lot of benches and seats, that are within this longest expanse of the grass in Manhattan, south of the Central Park. We decided to take some time to repose our legs after long walk along the streets and avenues in the Midtown, and that was the perfect place for such thing. Not only serves this park as "the lunchroom"" for midtown office workers but it is a spot of the seating area for major events,that take place here in the center of New York. One of the happenings is for sure the HBO/Bryant Park Summer Film Festival. Also there is Citi Pond skating rink, used by the New Yorkers in the winter time. So as You see, the fun is not only in the Central Park or Rockefeller Plaza but also here in Bryant Park, amidst the busyness of the institutions around it.Really wonderful !

Great place for buses to drop off and pick up large groups. I took in a large group and people for a day in the city. Bryant Park was a great starting and ending point. The park is small and worth a visit. The best thing is the park is right next to the NY Public Library which is a must see! Plan on visiting the Library for a least 2 hours than go back to visit the park.

Lovely park. As with all New York parks, the greenery is very welcome after the busy-ness of the city! The summer evening screenings of classic films are just wonderful- we saw 'In the Heat of the Night' and had to arrive rather early to get a good picnic spot because of popularity. Really lovely toilets!

A social hub.. An open green space in the middle of high rise buildings, this part has become a bit of a social hub. There are numerous seats to sit and read a book, or have some food. You can sit on the grass and do the same. While we were there they had a film festival and were showing movies to the general public on a big screen.

Cool park - perfect loos!. A lovely park with a nice feel. We spent 3 hours here playing games in the games area. There are lots of tables, shade and plenty of games to while away a few hours. Picnic lunch from the deli opposite was great as everyone could fill own bowl with choice of salads, sushi etc. There are 2 bars for a quick beer or 2. Very busy at lunch time but had a good happy feel about the park. Best loos in NYC so far with fresh flowers, classical music and cleaners working hard to keep it spotless!

A great place. I spent a great day relaxing in Bryant Park. It offers a lot of places to sit, both in the sun and in the shade. There was live piano music, some jugglers performing and there's the reading room, with books, newspapers and magazines. Two ping-pong tables are also a great idea. So grab something to eat from nearby takeaways and enjoy yourself.

My Favourite Park....in the World!. Ok, I haven't seen parks all over the world! But if I had....Anyway, as a landscape architect, I have seen a lot of parks and am fascinated with how they work, or not. And this one is the best I've ever experienced. I went every day during my stay in a nearby hotel. I went at different times of day, for breakfast, during the week and on the weekend. It was always fabulous. It's always busy, yet never crowded. There was a full programme of exercise, religious and musical events, which were clearly regular and free to partake in or enjoy watching New Yorkers at play....or at work (business meetings) or at study (students) or kids (quaintest carousel). The kiosks are not rip-off prices. The toilets are clean. There is sunshine, or shade. It didn't used to be like this. I knew this. You should find out what it was like before, before you go, and then you will surely appreciate it even more. But even if you're not consumed by park facts like me, you'll love it. Sit on one of the infamous green folding chairs and watch New York. Everyday.
Always something to see. The perfect spot to to relax and people watch. Great eatery options, and many rotating programs for kids and adults. Great gathering spot!
Great place to relax.. On a hot sunny day you can sunbathe on the lawn whilst looking up at the skyline. A nice break to rest your feet whilst walking the streets of NYC.

Great place to relax. Took the wife here on our trip. Loved the park. We sat and enjoyed all things happening around us. I like this park because of the tables and chairs allowing you to sit down and relax. Another option is the great lawn area where you can sit on the cross and soak up the son. There are also books available to read. This park is a must visit while in NYC.

Bryant park . Lovely place to just go and sit or have a drink and watch the world go by. Lots of things to take part in but going on in the background and seem to be free of charge. Table tennis, chess, kids reading, Pilates class.... Monday evening in the summer (check dates) there is a film showing, literally thousands of people go to watch and there is still enough space to be comfortable and see. Great atmosphere. Well worth a visit to the library next door too. Close to grand central station and Times Square

Small but perfectly formed.. I was thrilled to see that Bryant Park is now so clean and safe. It used to be know as needle park and you would never consider bringing children. There. It is now a lovely tranquil space that you can happily sit and watch the world go by.
Captivative park in the middle of city. It's active and crowded park but it's not unpleasent. Sitting on the grass or bench I stared diverse people and it has so much fun.
Beautiful park. An amazing area of natural greenery preserved in the centre of so many structures. Always various stalls / activities happening. Another beautiful Manhattan park.
If you have time. It is a small park in nyc. There are a few things to see. Do not miss the public library. Instead, spend more Time in Central Park.

Been a while & improved. My wife asked me what that park was when we were on the observation level at the Empire State Building. I pointed out the main branch of the public library and told her that the branch was part of the park. We decided to walk over since it was a beautiful day. Lots of people enjoying the park on this glorious day. There was a yoga class going on while we were there. What a nice park in mid town
Nice spot!. Too nice to believe! Love the open space and the tables and chairs!!! Next time need to spend more time enjoying the view

Sit and relax!. In the middle of hectic midtown, just behind the public library of NY this is the place to grab a chair (or bench), a cup of coffee from one of the coffee/drink booth and simply relax!

A great place to spend an afternoon or evening. This park, near the Public Library off of fifth avenue is a wonderful place to spend an afternoon or evening. This place used to be run-down and seedy but is now family-friendly. There are many benches and chairs to sit, as well as a large lawn for sunbathers. It is a great place for a picnic and there is a very nice restaurant there, to sit inside in the winter, and outside in the summer. They also show free movies sometimes on the weekends.

A Family Park in mid town. Monday night movies during the summer, ice skating in the winter, chess tables or the small Merry-go-round set up all year long. Bryant Park is a more intimate Park to navigate with your family. We visit this park every time we come to New York, have coffee, lunch with the local business men, and take a break from all of the sight seeing.

Relax, sip a coffee and watch the amazing architecture around. Watching American Radiator Building, Bank of America Tower, Grace Building, Condé Nast Building, NY Public Library and enjoying a coffee while sitting in the middle of this wonderful park. A true NYC experience!

Bryant Park. This little gem is located between 5th and 6th Avenue, right behind the NY Public LIbrary, in the heart of Manhattan. Just a few blocks from Grand Central Station, it has a huge lawn behind the library, as well as excellent shaded seating all around the park. Stop by for their free reading library, table tennis, bocce ball...get a danish and coffee from one of the vendors and enjoy some quiet time. On Friday evenings in the summer, come for the movies that are shown, free of charge. Oh, and it has clean bathrooms - with a nearby attendant if there is an issue!

A Great Escape!. Just when the hustle and bustle of the city starts to get to you, take a moment to step out of the crazy an into this gem. If Central park is too overwhelming for you, this is a great alternative. Food stands and even a small bar can be found within this oasis of calm in the center of the storm that is NYC. Great people watching and plenty of seating areas too!

A dynamic oasis. You can watch people learning to juggle, men playing petanque, kids playing ping pong or just sit at one of the many cafe tables scattered throughout the park and enjoy a drink or lunch. A respite that has clean restrooms and plenty of shade.
Favorite Park in NYC. My husband and I recently visited NYC for a week vacation. Bryant Park was our favorite park in NYC. We found the park very relaxing and welcoming.

Great spot to people watch. Much smaller than Central Park but just as beautiful and clean - has some interesting statues,a water fountain, and carousel; seemed like a meeting place as people were sitting around either reading a book, eating lunch, or chatting with each other; has lots of shaded seating - close to Times Square, subway entry/exit (BDFM),food carts at the park and library is next to it - Worth a stop after a visit to the library.

Great little nook in the heart of the city. This park is worth walking around just to see a big patch of grass among the concrete and steel. A few different vendors are set up as well. Good place to grab a cup of coffee, have a seat somewhere and enjoy.

Relaxing Place in the middle of a city. Its just a relaxing place. take time out to sit down have a coffee and just watch the busy city life go by. Im almost sure there was a place to get food on the grounds of it.

An oasis in the centre of Manhattan. Always enjoy a little stop at Bryant Park with its trees, 'reading room', lawn, bar corner, restaurant... Ideal on a nice day for sitting down with a lunch pack from the local delli.

A Midtown Lounge in the New York Public Library backyard where you can sit down and have a cool beer in the shade. Every green spot is welcome in a big city, but especially for congested, noisefilled ones like Manhattan, NYC. Bryant Park has a lot going for it. It shares a Block with the NYC Public Library, the International Center of Photography, HBO Store and Rockefeller Center is nearby. So Bryant Park could be a Nice Place to rest after visiting those Places. There's a very clean Public toilet in the North east corner, a cafe and a lawn that's open to the Public - at least sometimes. We went there for the HBO Bryant Park Film Festival, which in the summer of 2014 showed Movies every Monday after sunset.

Lovely place to sit and take in the ambience. This park is a must if you are visiting new york , we loved sitting on the hundreds of free tables and chairs ( yes free ) and people watching ! There is a bar at one side of the park ( near the road ) where you can have a nice cool pint on a hot summers evening ( 17 dollars for 2 ). A bit pricey but you are in new york city . There also an open air bandstand which plays live ( free ) music in the summer months . Go take a seat in this park and take in the new york atmosphere !!!

Relaxation among the hustle and bustle. This is a great place to relax and people watch. The locals dine there on their lunch breaks. It is beautiful and well maintained. One evening the were showing a movie on a big screen( like in the movie The Wedding Planner). Didn't even see any homeless or people selling stuff(unlike every other NYC street). I recommend making this a stop to relax and listen to the piano player.
Oasis in Midtown Manhattan. This is a great place to relax, grab a bite to eat, have your little one ride Le Carousel, and people watch. It's my favorite place to relax in NYC.

Love this place!. What a wonderful park to just sit and enjoy the magic that is new york! from an outdoor bar to ping pong - book readings - jugglers - movies in the summertime and yummy gelato.What's not to like? Great people watching and a beautifully kept park. I'd go everyday if I could
Shady place on a hot NYC day. Sat in the shade with a cold drink watching the table tennis games, Jazz piano in the background - a perfect stop off during a busy, hot day sightseeing in NYC.

Lovely place to sit and relax . We decided to go and sit in Bryant Park after a couple of recommendations from friends and weren't disappointed. Although it was very busy and a little tricky to find a seat, the park was clean and shady, with a real mixture of lovely people. We sat and watched the table tennis for a while which was very entertaining. The locals were all extremely friendly and the atmosphere was great. Lots of things to do and see. A lovely place to sit and watch the world go by.

Bryant Park. We really Enjoyed sitting in bryant park.We went to New York for the forth of july.We purchased us some food from a out door foodvendor and sat in this park.It is very clean and close to Everything!

Nice place to rest during a busy day. I love Bryant Park, it is convenient, free and overall a nice place to stop and rest during a busy day in NYC. They sometimes have events/music in summer and skating in winter. They have a cafe, restrooms even a reading room. It is a nice place to stop by and just enjoy being in the city. Check out their website to see what events are going on:http://www.bryantpark.org/

Perfect for a rest after visiting the Central Library. We visited Bryant Park after a trip to the Central Library. It was a lovely sunny day and the park was filled with New York office workers having their lunch. You can play chess, table tennis and borrow books to read on the grass or at one of the many tables and chairs. Second best park in New York.

Summer Film Festival at Bryant Park. Definitely make plans to attend one of the Movies in the Park.Every Monday, FREE! You can find a schedule on line.Bring a blanket, picnic food, and relax on the grass under the stars.The grass area opens up at 5pm. We arrived at appx. 6pm and there were still lots of good spots to be had. Of all the things we did on a recent visit to NY, the movie at Bryant Park probably rates as the most fun we had.

A breath of green air in midtown. I tend to stay at a hotel just around the corner from Bryant Park, and every season I delight in the space. Kudos to the city and those who manage the park for doing such a great job. As a resident of Baltimore, visiting Bryant Park always reminds me that yes, you can make changes.If you are under 40, it would be pretty easy to dismiss how lovely this park is. You only have to remember visiting the city in the late 70s or so to be stunned at the difference. I ALWAYS feel safe in the park now, and make sure to visit it every time I am in the city. It brings a sense of peace, calm, and a reminder of how people from all walks of life can get along just fine.Each season brings its own brand of magic - ice skating in the winter, Shakespeare this summer, chess games, juggling lessons. The lovely little carousel. In the 70s or 80s you would dread to ever use a public bathroom in the city. In 2011 the bathrooms at Bryant Park were voted best in the world by a travel website. I can tell you my surprise when I used one - spotlessly clean and even had fresh flowers. Wonderful!So, if you are at nearby Times Square or seeing a show, do yourself a favor and walk a few blocks over just to sit and enjoy Bryant Park. It is a little gem.

Relaxing spot. I loved that there was plenty of seating and food kiosks surrounding. I went there to see the modern dance festival, but it was raining. Impressively, the dancers still went on with the show and danced in the rain. Much appreciated!

Tranquility. We had 3 hours before our flight home so sat here and watched the world go by, talked and took photos. They have an outdoor library, people of all ages were in there and all types of people from homeless having a nap to business men on their lunch break. They have electric points for laptops! The man collecting the rubbish and emptying the bins goes round quite a few times every hour. The planting is really good and lots of birds in there too - particularly having dust baths along the pathway! They have films during the summer months and Tai Chi. Also spotted table tennis tables.

Nice to see some green in NYC. We stopped by after visiting the Empire State building and the Library. It was nice to see some green in this part of Manhattan but I am frankly surprised at all of the 5 star reviews. The park is small and really crowded. I guess for NYC it is a nice oasis away from all the cement and blacktop, but compared to parks in other cities this one is very small and urban. For those that can have lunch here and can't make it to Central Park I guess it would be nice but it was really crowded when we were there so not really much peacefulness. Central Park is gigantic by comparison.For what it is Bryant Park is a nice little urban park, but the crowds and people trying to sell stuff take away from the peacefulness. We much prefered Central Park. Thanks for reading.
nice calm place. nice calm place in between a bustling busy city. you go to this park and turn your head around to see all the big buildings around you. it is a very nice place to relax
A Lot Better Than it Used to be. This was a place you would not set a foot into 20 years ago. Now, it is a nice place to visit. The ice skating is very nice and the shops are OK, but not unusual.

A hopping place. I just so happened to stumble upon Bryant Park as I was walking the streets and was delighted with what I had found. There is a big yard that was full of people doing yoga the duration of while I was there. While that by itself is interesting, there were also several games that I had not seen before set up where I watched families and couples play. It is a fantastic place to people watch while you get something to eat or drink (there are several places of all styles). The public library is around the back and is worth a quick look around. Quite a nice place to visit if you have some extra time.

Tranquility... This park was along the block from our hotel. Beautifully tranquil little park with refreshment area, games areas and lawn. A real gem in the city where you can sit and watch the world go by. Perfect!

Peace in the chaos. What a gem Bryant Park is, we we staying at the Metro Hotel, 10 minutes walk from the park, felt so peaceful, went there a couple of times during our stay, sat on the sunshine people watching having a delicious sandwich from the stand on the park. Even though it's very close to the busy streets & traffic it doesn't feel that way, well worth a visit.

Amazing Gem in the Middle of Manhattan. Small park that has a lot to offer. Movie nights, chess and backgammon tables, free music and a reading room. Went there to watch the World Cup. Even though ESPN blocked showing the game on the large screen, the crowd collectively cheered for Team USA as we watched on big screen tvs brought in to the park. A great experience.
A must in N Y. This place reminds me a an oasis of peace in the middle of center of the capital of the world as NY is. Fully recommended for a brief pause in NY

Bryant Park, NY city. Came across this lovely park....42nd Street and 6th -avenue.....an oasis amongst the hectic traffic of the city. On the eastern edge (I think) there is a beautiful open air restaurant with green umbrellas.....lovely food and service. While there you must check out the adjacent public washrooms.....be prepared to line up and wait.....when you get inside...lovely fresh flower arrangement and classical music but wait till you get inside!

A Popular Place on a Sunny Day. You will see people relaxing on the lawn, playing chess, enjoy the beauty and atmosphere of this lovely park, in such a busy city. There is even a mini library set up in the park sometimes, so people can enjoy reading as well. It appears to be mainly for those who are unable to go to a library or don't have the means to buy books for themselves. A thoughtful idea! It's a great place to take a break, have a picnic, people watch & of course take a few pics.

Great People Watching. Lots of people fill this park at lunchtime. Its a great people-watching location. Lots of food and seating, although you'd be amazed at how hard it can be to get a table.....It's worth it just to walk through if you only have a little time.

Watching workd cup football in the park. We stayed just around the corner from this park , so we visited it on a few occasion during our stay. There was an out doir bar there with a big tv screen so we could catch up on the world cup.It looked like the bar was wellnused by the locals as well as turist as a picnic area in the middle of the city, brilliant park, and very ckean restrooms as well !

A Lovely park. We walked through and ended up sitting and watching people play games and the park was setting up for a movie night, so couldn't get a great view of the fountain, but was very nice anyway.
A pleasant place to catch ones breath. Enjoy a sit down and a coffee in this pleasant park in the hubbub of the city. Perhaps not a destination in itself but a good waypoint.

Lovely community based park. Delighted to find this park! Great large community park with people at small cafe tables chatting and eating (sandwich shop at the park), reading area with books and newspapers free for the time you sit there, free table tennis, lots of trees and shade. At night they show outdoor large screen movies or have music. Metro lines to anywhere on edge of park. Easy walking distance to Time Square and Broadway theaters. Negative: long lines for women's bathroom.
Great find. Although we've visited New York before we never came across this gem. Lovely place for lunch or to just sit and soak up the atmosphere

Bryant Park Movie Night. We visited NYC June 15 thru June 18, 2014. On Monday the 16th, we took inMovie Night in Bryant Park. The movie was Saturday Night Fever. There were over a thousand people attending the free movie. Everyone had a great time. If you visit NYC this summer, you should check it out.Dave & Theresa Blanks
visited many times,love it. great place to sit and have lunch in the middle of the city, games in the summer and skating in the winter

oasis in the middle of chaos. We had unplanned layover in New York and decided to just walk around Manhattan. Since we were just wandering around, I was pleasantly surprised to find this park. People were playing chess, ping-pong, and reading in the "reading room". There are bistro style tables and chairs available for all to use. There is a tree covered area for those wanting shade and a large grassy area in the sun. What a great respite in a busy city.
one of the busyest parks. the park is not so big ,but very visited.ideal for walking and resting.is near the 5th avenue .recomended for fresh air

Serene Bryant Park. What happens when you have a city with very little grass and trees? You make the most with what you have and that's exactly what NY does with Bryant Park. This is a gorgeous area full of trees and a giant lawn where they show movies during the summer. There's a great little bar and grill and a fantastic restaurant, The Bryant Park Grill. Don't let the term "grill" fool you, it's not cheap, but they have amazing food!

Love this Park; Wonderful Merry-Go-Round & More. This park is a gem, only bigger--more like a whole bracelet. Behind the fabulous Main Library, there is an historic and delightful carousel, and during the Winter free ice skating. Throughout the year there are great special exhibits, shady spots to sit and have coffee or lunch from pretty good food vendors.

The Bryant Park. This is such a fantastic place to go and relax.all around the park are different activities, from reading rooms, to chess games, TaiChi, and out door Shakespeare Theatre.The little bar at the far end is excellent and you can get a some simple grill type food. Not to be confused with the Bryant Park Grill at the Library…thats a completely different experience.Load of people just relaxing, talking and playing. No hassle any where at all…well worth spending some time in it.

Relaxing break.. We found park while walking and exploring the streets or NY city. Very clean, pretty and a lot of people enjoying themselves. Apparently certain evenings they show outdoor movies. We watched while the large grass area was empty and people were all lined up around the perimeter watching for the signal to run on the grass and grab a spot to enjoy the movie, it was hysterical! And this was about 5:00 and the movie didn't start till 9 pm. There was a few areas to sit and order a drink, many chairs abound and many different types to sit in, even swinging benches. There was even a large TV in the bar area since the World Cup was going on. We ended up hanging out here twice in our short stay in the city. In one far corner was the cleanest bathrooms in a free standing building, even had fresh flowers!

A must see. This is the Bryant Park of NY Fashion Week fame. However, this is a wonderful place to grab lunch and enjoy the outdoors. There's a wide array of food and drink options, and plenty of benches for you find your haven in such a bustling city. During the winter, take the kids ice skating for a one of a kind experience. You will be so glad you did.

nice place to unwind. amid the concrete jungle of NY, a bit of oasis. One can always spend an hour relaxing here in the lap of nature before proceeding towards the much-loved Times Sqaure or the Broadway. I saw some painters too. ideal place to unwind yourself and perhaps flip a few pages of a book sitting on the benches of the park. Would love to go again.

Lots of cool free stuff. I've been to NYC a bunch of times but have never been to Brant Park until today. Originally, I wanted to go because they said they were showing the USA-Germany World Cup match on the big screen. When I got there, it was on this small tv at one of the food places, and the audio didn't even match the video. So that was pretty disappointing. But after the game, I spent most of the afternoon playing their many board games. I picked up a brochure and it looks like there's a bunch of stuff happening here, including music, dancing, movies, etc. Very cool.

Gorgeous! !!!!. We walked through Bryant Park several times during our NYC stay. It is probably my favorite place in the city. Soooo pretty and relaxing. We grabbed 2 Bros pizza a couple of blocks away and enjoyed a shady spot to eat. Lots of free activities for the family and it's simply a gorgeous place!
Perfect spot for lunch. On a sunny day, a great spot to sit out for lunch and do a bit of people watching. Movies in the evenings during the summer too.

Tech friendly. I agree with what everyone is saying about Bryant Park. It is a great way to be in the middle of the hustle and bustle without feeling like it. The one thing no one has mentioned is that near most of the areas around the perimeter that have tables and chairs, there are power outlets. They are not USB, but it is great to be able to power your devices while people watching. I forgot to charge my camera battery and NYC is not the place to be without a camera. I was able to plug in and charge while I enjoyed the serene setting.

Loved this park!!!. This was an adorable park with something for everyone! I was surprised how big it was! There is lots of seating under the shade of the trees and tables and chairs for relaxing. There were a couple of restaurants and a free water fountain. People were laying around the grass on blankets. There is an old merri go round for the kids. It was a cool spot to sit and watch the world go by. I enjoyed reading about the history of the park too.

A green oasis In a concrete jungle. Its just a few steps off west 42nd street around 6th. Yet for some reason theres a very pleasant 'far from the madding crown ' atmosphere . You can sit there and watch the world go by, read a book from the outdoor library or play table tennis. There's snack stands here too. Usually there's some form of entertainment going on if your in the mood for it. Also while sitting in the green leafy park you forget your in the midst of a concrete jungle. Often stopped here on the way back to Times Square to unwind

A pleasant spot. Right by the Public Library (the branch with the iconic lions out front), this is a very pleasant park. Most of the seating areas seemed to be for the cafe but might not have been. It seems like it would be a good place to see a concert or something.

Great space to chill. We went here looking for the Rangerstown sign (which was moved that morning to Winter Garden) so we ended up on our grand tour of NYC. Bryant Park is always peaceful. When we arrived, we found a large group of people practicing yoga… now that was new and different. Wish I had time to join in. We were able to sit and chill for a couple of minutes in this nice shaded park and have a snack. There are plenty of places to sit. This park along with many of the other great green spaces it what make NYC so great and enjoyable. While you know you are still in the city because you can hear it, you can still step away from the insanity of it all even if it is just for a few moments to catch your breath.

new york's living room. Shady and friendly with lots of seating...outdoor library, excellent people watching and the most charming carousel ever. There's often music...and the park also features movies in the summer, on the lawn. Add a variety of kiosks serving coffee, sandwiches, ice cream etc. and it's a perfect New York experience.

This is "What's Happn'n" in NYC.. In the shadow of the NYC Library this is a gathering spot for 'locals' on weekends and nice evenings. It is different from Central Park in that you can still hear and see the city but it is a great oasis for reading, resting, or family fun. ... And "TA-DA!" The have a Carousel with a Frog. It isn't a Hershall Spellman but a carousel anywhere is an isolated joy. The Frog's name is 'Flaubert' ... A distant relative of 'Hershal' (the resemblance is remarkable). On this particular Saturday there was a flea market on one end of the park (food and craft booths) that added to the ambiance. I felt very safe in this park as well as all of the NYC attractions ... The long arm of the law is everywhere.
Excellent !. One of the first places I make for in NYC . There is always something going on , and a perfect place for people watching .

Lovely oasis in the city centre. Bryant Park is a lovely park where there always seems to be something happening. There are sit in Restaurants or you can buy from stalls and eat your purchase sitting watching the world go by. There are some nice photo opportunities with both the Chrysler Building, the Empire State and the impressive American Radiator Building Skyscraper in view.

Lovely Park. Been here at Christmas time and now in June. It's a wonderful place to stop and sit awhile and people watch. Many food stands where you can grab a decent quick bite to eat. Movies are offered in the park on weekends, but unfortunately, not when I was there. There's a merry go round. At Christmas time there are many vendors selling christmas gifts, everything from jewelry to dog coats! You can also ice skate in the winter. If your dog is with you, this is a great potty place......just be sure to clean up after them.

Safe, and a lovely green space. We were told that years ago the area that is now Bryant Park was considered one of the most unsafe in the city. What a transformation now! A beautiful public area at the side of the wonderful library.

Pretty. This is a pretty setting for a nice evening movie. You could go sit and watch a movie with friends during the summer and it was so close to everywhere that after you could head to Times Square.

Bar and Yoga. Wandering around New York City you are likely to come across Bryant Park on 5th Avenue, something of a minor contrast to Central Park. Stop for a drink at the open air bar but preferably not when it is raining as you may like me go back to your hotel with a soaking wet shirt. A visit the next sunny day was more comfortable and provided an opportunity to watch the mass yoga class while supping a well prepared cocktail. Seeing a large expanse of grass surrounded by crowds enjoying a sunny lunchtime break without so much as one stepping foot on the forbidden turf was an enjoyable surprise.

Great set up for Winter and Summer. Bryant Park is always a great place to visit. In the winter you can go ice skaing. In the summer it is open and the trees provide great shade at the periphery for stopping and people watching.

Finest Park for Tourists in Manhattan. Bryant Park has become one of the most interesting parks in all of NYC for tourists. It's great midtown location is easily accessible, being only a block off of Times Square and halfway between Grand Central Terminal and The Port Authority Bus Terminal. The schedule of events has grown over the past few years and now has something unique almost daily - including mid-day and evening concerts, classes (including Tai Chi, yoga, fencing, dancing, fly-fishing, juggling, etc.), morning TV shows occasionally broadcast from the park, birding tours, activities (including ping pong, chess, petangue, bocce ball, board & table games, kubb, mini golf/putting green, etc.). Other features include The Reading Room (which often has readings for kids or lectures by authors), The Southwest Porch (a great place for an after-work drink) and The Carousel (which is is a kid favorite). Whether you're in midtown morning, noon or night, there's something for all in Bryant Park!

An oasis in a concrete desert. We stumbled across this little gem on our way to the New York Public Library. It is located at the back of NYPL and the green canopies provided us much respite from the scorching afternoon sun. The park has a great vibe. We saw people reading, chatting, playing chess and having a cuppa. There is an area for playing pétanque and another, for table tennis. There were people playing both games when we were there. I was delighted to find book stands with books for children. There is also a pretty carousel and kids' seating. Even the restrooms are delightful.Would have loved to spend much more time there.

HEAVEN IN THE MIDDLE OF THE CITY. Loved this place this was amazing. first park we walked into soon as we checked it. amazing place to grab a cupcake from Crumbs bake shop, and sit by the fountain on one of many tables. amazing and peaceful place to read a book and take a break from the busy streets which being right by time square.

Nice park in the heart of Manhattan. Bryant park is pretty little park right inside the heart of Manhattan. Located only blocks from Times Square and offering a nice place to sit and relax away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square . Bryant park has really beautiful public restrooms complete with fresh flowers arrangements which I found shocking considering its a public restroom. Be sure to grab a crumbs cupcake ( right across tge street from the park) and sit and relax while eating your cake.
Relaxing green spot. A relaxing green spot in the middle of Manhattan, great for a green moment in the busy big apple. There are things to see, eat and read. Plus a great clean restroom!

The best place in central New York. Great for people watching, events, cinema, the public library, food etc. we spent hours watching New York go by and enjoying the atmosphere. Great piano player and outdoor chess.

A beautiful treasure!. This wonderful park is a great place to rest and take a break from the busyness of the city. There appears to be always something going on here and there are lots of places to just sit and people watch. It was neat to see that there were board games that could be borrowed as well as a reading area with books available. What a great place to bring a family! I never imagined that I would find this oasis in the middle of NYC!

My favorite place in this city. There is something about this park that I truly love. It is bordered by the public library and lots of fun shops. We missed the movies in the park but you could sit out here with some wine or some ice cream and have a nice peaceful time between all of the city hustle&bustle :)

Take a Break!. In the midst of all the hustle and bustle, it's great to find a place where you can just sit and relax and feel at peace. This is a wonderful park situated just behind the New York City Public Library. There are lots of seats, a large lawn and vendors for snacks / drinks. This is a great meeting place or a fantastic site for people-watching ... feeling the vibe of the city.

Beautiful park next to Times Square. I was on vacation recently and we stopped by Bryant Park. Such an awesome place to sit with a coffee and read a book. The grass in the middle is used for movies on Monday night's in the summer time, but there are plenty of little food shops and activities going on around the lawn that makes this little park so enjoyable.

A nice spot of green between all the hustle. Nice place to stop and relax. There is a nice cafe and a restaurant or simply sit on the grass, benches, etc. close to a Times Square. Nice for families, couples.

Spirit of Christmas. We went to the park at christmas time and there were loads of stalls and little huts selling christmas items. As we wandered here by accident on thanksgiving we found loads of great offers and their prices had been reduced. If you are going to go then that is definitely the time to do it.Had a lovely wander round and there were plenty food stalls to for the hungry the crepes were lovely.A nice way to spend an afternoon.

Perfect place to chill out. Since I saw the first picture of this park in a magazine I wanted to visit it. It's like a small paradise in the heart of New York, situated next to the New York Public Library. It's a small but very nice place that offers different kind of activities during the day from yoga to juggling or even thai chi. In summer the HBO Summer Film Festival take place as well here , an event that we had to miss sadly because it starts just in the middle of June.But even like this, it's the perfect place to chill out with the friends in a warm afternoon or just to read alone under the trees.Oh and something else: free wifi!! ;)

Beautiful oasis.. I stumbled upon Bryant Park by accident and am so glad I did. It is a green oasis in the heart of Manhattan. There are so many options on offer: people watching, watching performances, eating and drinking at the sandwich bars or the cafe, putting golf course, bocce, children's carousel. Park staff are lovely. I loved the 'library' in the park with designated seating area and free books, magazines and newspapers to read. This park is perfection.

Nice holiday market. Bryant Park provides a pleasant alternative to one of NYC smaller parks. Situated behind the NY Public Library the park turns into a winter wonderland during the holiday season. Ice skating is free, however; you must pay to rent skates if you don't have any with you.They have a beautiful Christmas tree and a nice holiday market skirting through and around the perimeter of it. You can find affordable gifts and souvenirs for that special someone on your list. There's also food vendors there along with hot chocolate, hot cider, coffee, or whatever else you desire to keep warm.It is located on 42nd St which is a quick walk over to Times Squares and other midtown destinations. It is a nice place to "get away from it all" when you need to take a break.

if you want to chill out. Nice to just relax in the sun and take some food / drinks to just unwind for abit, especially if you're closer to this place than central park, alot smaller obviously, but still a nice park. Free wi-fi at the park is a really good touch as well. Bathrooms also available, shops nearby etc.
Will go back for sure.

Great place to watch the world go by. This tranquil square is a lovely place to stop in the warm weather. Sit in the shade under the trees or on the grass in the sun, there is something for everyone. The planting is lovely, the surrounding buildings very nice and there is a cute little merry go round.

Beautiful and Relaxing. We were in a hotel very close to this and we seemed to go through it several times. It is very well manicured and well taken care of. Gorgeous area. We saw people reading, eating at outside cafe-style tables, and enjoying the scenery and view.

Quintessential NYC - Great for chilling and some selfies. Had wanted to revisit Central Park initially but settled for this slice of green oasis in the urban city instead. Visited on a lovely sunny spring morn and Bryant Park was crowded with people basking in the sun. There was a lovely unhurried step in everyone's walk so Bryant Park never seemed jam packed. Great picture opportunities abound with the green foliage in high contrast with the sleek buildings. Don't give quintessential NYC a miss.

Excellent getaway from reality of city. Bryant Park is a remarkable little park surrounded by the bustle of New York City. Plenty of lawn space, chairs and tables this park features games of Bocce, chess and others going on at all corners. There is also a nice park pub as well as a restaurant at the head of the park.

A little piece of Heaven in NY. Effectively the backyard of the NY Library, the setting here is very pretty. The weekend we went, they had different activities set up in the park, with instructors as well. The park is great for people watching, reading, or just a nice place to sit for awhile when walking through Manhattan.

Good place for taking pictures. Great details for great pictures. You can get the reflex of the empire states in the buildings in the north side of the park. Ping pong tables, table games, people chilling in the middle of the chaotic city.

Great for Kids!. This park is the cutest park I've ever seen. I should say off the bat that it doesn't have a playground. However, it has the cutest carousel I've ever seen and a little reading library with little tables for the kids. There are some restaurants to eat in the park as well. It's great for people watching too. There is a public restroom which is the nicest I've ever seen (marble countertops) equipped with an attendant.

A green oasis in the middle of city. Lovely green space with lots of folks relaxing in the sun or just chilling. Heaps of benches, chairs or pull up on your own bit of lush green grass for a rest. Sits between grand central and Times Square on 42nd so a good place if you are walking

Coolest, calmest place in NYC. The bus from Newark Airport dropped me off here and I kept gravitating back. It's just such a cool place to chill out for an hour, either with a coffee in the daytime or a beer in the evening. Then back to the sight-seeing....or another beer.

A pretty little park. A pretty little green area behind the NY Public Library, with plenty of tables & chairs to relax & catch your breath from sightseeing in the city. There is a nice cupcake shop, Crumbs, over the road & it's within easy walking distance from Times Square.

Nice in the winter. Nice to stroll around here in the winter when thrice rink is up and the stalls are out, although the stalls do sell tat! Should be more places to eat and drink throughout the year.

A great escape. Beautiful city park for a short stroll or to decompress. Check out the shops, carousel and eateries. Plenty of shady seating and of course the lawn for sun worshippers. Yoga on the lawn, concerts and movies under the stars are very popular. Perfect to people watch, have lunch and just escape. Enjoy!

Great park near shopping. Bryant park is a great place to relax and have a cup of coffee or just sit down while shopping nearby. We stopped in the park to eat lunch before heading down the street to do some shopping. A calm atmosphere with lots of trees for shade!

Nice place. We sat here for an hour or so with a cold drink and it was just beautiful. Very relaxing place which is smaller than I expected.
Lots of people just enjoying a warm evening on the grass and surrounding areas.
Probably has the nicest public bathroom I ever saw.
Bryant Park. A great place to chill out in New York City. One of my favourite parks and a great alternative to the busier Central Park!!

Not missing out on much. It's an okay park but I wouldn't plan it on your itinerary in a to do list if you're not spending too much time in NY. It’s a great place to spend it during the winter time when they add the ice skating ring to it though.

Lovely Oasis in NY near Times Square. Bryant Park is a beautiful, little park with soaring trees and offers a calm oasis among the bustling energy of NY. There a metal tables and chairs for working or eating a snack. A few eating areas in the park. The Reading Room area offers free books and magazines and a children's section. Ping pong tables, plenty of comfortable seating, charging stations for electronics. The main grassy area is really wonderful place to lay down and to feel nature - when it is open. There is a carousel for the children, a fountain for picture taking, and the Chess Area, located in the 40th Street Plaza, provides chess, checkers, and backgammon boards for a small fee. The Southwest Porch has rockers, swings, and Adirondack chairs and charging stations.
Pretty Park. Had brunch at Bryant Park Grill - a lovely location. Walked around the park later, enjoyed watching New Yorkers soak up a little sun and enjoy the carousel with their children.

Part of heaven. I have never seen a place like that in my whole life Sooo greeny, extremely clean, and a unique spot with tall surrounding buildings. It's the right place if you need time out. Kids playing around, people napping, even I noticed some playing POI and it was awesome. Must go place.

Part of heaven. I have never seen a place like that in my whole life Sooo greeny, extremely clean, and a unique spot with tall surrounding buildings. It's the right place if you need time out. Kids playing around, people napping, even I noticed some playing POI and it was awesome. Must go place.

There's always a surprise in the park!. Bryant Park always entertains, whether there's an ice skating rink in the winter, a pop up concert by SWIZZ Beats, shops and food stands there's always something in Bryant Park to see and do! Movies play in the park that can be seen while resting on the grass or sitting in the convenient chairs around the park. It's a great place to grab something to eat nearby like Junior's cheesecake then sit in Bryant Park to enjoy it. With a stunning view of the Empire State Building, Bryant Park is a peaceful escape from the vibrant Times Square & busy 5th Avenue. It's a great place to take a break, rest and relax and also take in the beauty of NYC! I live in Queens, NY and I love to frequent Bryant Park whenever I'm in the city.

Nice little park in the middle of the city. Recommended by a friend, It has something for everyone - from lying on the lawn, to sitting in the reading section, to playing a free game. Something for everyone.

Not A Must See. New York has many attractions. Bryant Park is wonderful and has a fascinating history. However, Central Park is probably best for tourists to start. And few ever make it to Prospect Park in Brooklyn. Nevertheless, if you are midtown, do take a look. Oh, and the massive 42nd St. Library is right there.

Great Gathering Place. We took our daughter-in-law here to show her the fountain - she called it the 'Friends Fountain". It is the fountain used in the beginning of all the FRIENDS TV shows. The park is always lovely, filled with activities. It's great for families, couples, friends. I love to visit NYC parks to get a glimpse of what it's like to live in the Big Apple - where the locals go to find refuge from the concrete jungle or just the fast pace of life for a few moments. Go to the New York City Public Library then take in the park.

Gem of a greenspace with so much to do. I think I like Bryant park better than Central Park. We enjoyed cocktails in the Southwest Airlines porch.n There are free books and magazines in the reading room area. Ping pong tables, plenty of comfortable seating, charging stations for electronics, free wifi, juggling, yoga, music, dancing, movies....fun! Great spot for a picnic.

Gorgeous spot to stop and take a breath. Bryant Park is such a lovely little gem, and on a beautiful day, it's packed with folks soaking up the rays and getting a little work or rec in using the free wi-fi. So beautifully maintained. Reminds me of a little Parisian park. Lovely carousel.

Great way to spend a sunny afternoon. On the last day of my last visit to NYC I have to say I was feeling pretty down about leaving the city but I stumbled upon Bryant park with a friend. It was a lovely sunny day but was starting to get pretty stuffy so we decided to put our feet up in the shade at the little out door bar there for a few cold drinks. It is a lovely spot, like a little oasis in the middle of the city. It was a nice way to spend our last few hours in NYC.

Nice to visit. A nice park i NYC where you can sit down on the grass, or a chair that are everywhere. We went for the restaurant Bryant Park Grill and had some food and beer, sitting outdoor. It's a nice area and good to relax when you have been walking a lot as we had.

Great slice of green in busy city. This park is a perfect way to de-stress in an incredibly busy city. There are shaded areas where there are tables and chairs and places to get coffee or something to eat. The park is sandwiched between buildings on all four sides. There is a large patch of grass bordered by a gravel path with plenty of chairs and tables for seating. The area was filled with people with children who were playing, people laying in the grass catching some rays. Others were reading or just relaxing on their lunch hour. You can sit at a table on the gravel path in the shade or sun or you can take a chair and/or table onto the grass. They are lightweight and easy to carry. The day I was there, a band consisting of sailors from Norfolk, VA performed for the crowd. People grabbed a chair to sit in front of the band and enjoy the sailors' performance. What a great way to spend some time in New York City.

Scrabble in the sunshine. This amazing little oasis behind the library is a must in a hectic schedule. You can sit with a coffee and watch the world go by or play any game you can think of at the game tables near the children's area which is also incredible with a trolley of books to browse. Just a wonderful place in a wonderful city.

Great vibe on a nice day!. A fantastic park just behind the NY City Library building. Make sure you walk through it, and if you have time, stop and have a drink at one of the bars. We were on a girls trip and met at the end of the day to rest our tired feet and have a drink. We ate at the restaurant bar at the back... food was average but recommend for drinks and bar snacks. The bar at the front of the park looking onto the street has a great vibe. Wonderful atmosphere.... go and sit on the grass or around the fountain. Was one of our favourite locations.

Wonderful Little Gem - Plus Carousel. A wonderful smaller park near Times Square with sandwich shops, bars and a sit down restaurant. Also a Carousel for a "youthful ride". Very clean and green, loved to sit here and people watch.

Nice park with great atmosphere. This is a nice park with great atmosphere. Worth a stop, when you're at 5th avenue. Liked the mexican grill close by and you can also visit the national library.Mr. and Mrs. Wiborg from Denmark

Better picnic than Central Park!. We had planned to picnic in Central Park but found ourselves hungry a bit early and decided to enjoy the luxury of tables and chairs in Bryant Park instead! coming in from out of town this was a great decision as it meant we didn't have to worry about our lack of a blanket - Bryant was a perfect little oasis to keep three preteen/teens happy, lunching and without complaint of bugs or dirt:-) the connection to project runway helped keep their interest, too!

Bare and Bustling. When we went to Bryant Park the trees still had no leaves and I thought the bare branches made a very striking picture against the buildings surrounding it. Was a lovely warm April weekend and there were people out enjoying the sunshine, buskers and it just seemed like a lovely place to chill. Next time we will hopefully have time to actually walk around rather than walk past :)

Beautiful. It was fun finding a beautiful spot to rest. Great small park in the middle of a busy city with all kinds of things going on, from quaint little tables and benches all over. people seem to enjoy just reading the paper or people escaping from an office to a beautiful oasis.
