Quite a nice place. Bryant Park is quite a nice place to sit, enjoy the view and the sun. A very beautiful park to get to know in NY. There's this restaurant (seems nice) inside the park, which seems a great option to spend some more time in this beautiful place.

Fantastic Park In NYC. This park is both unexpected and perfect.Situated close to the Public Library it's an oasis in the middle of New York. There is just so much to see that you could easily spend a couple of hours just people-watching.A great plus is that there are electrical sockets and usb ports available free of charge to charge your devices while you just sit and relax. Also, there's free wi-fi.There is a series of 10 podcasts available, read by Matthew Broderick, which give a great insight into the park. It's really interesting and really helps you to understand what the park is all about. Highly recommended.Overall, just a really nice stop in the middle of a frantic city.

Beautiful green space in the busy city. Bryant park is a little oasis amidst a bustling city. NY really knows how to do parks well!I can't say there was anything in particular,just a nice space, quiet,beautiful trees and flowers and very pretty at night. A great place to sit and rest your feet on the way back to 33rd from the theatre district.

More than just a pretty place. Bryant park is an oasis of green surrounded by the fantastic architectural diversity of NYC. Here you will find an outdoor library, great food kiosks, a fountain, sculptures, yoga classes etc.

A civilized park. I love this park at 40th Street and Fifth Avenue. It reminds me of the parks in Paris. There are gravel walkways, little metal chairs, a carousel, restaurants and bars, and even movies in the warm summer evenings. In the winter there is a nice skating rink where you can skate for free. It even has European lawn bowling games too, like bocce. It is a wonderful place to walk, sit, read or have a cup of Java.
Slice of tranquillity . Bryant park is just gorgeous. Nestled in behind the Public library and 6th Avenue, it is a little slice of heaven. Cafes, games areas, grass... Beautiful.
Amazing. Found this on Tuesday evening by chance , it was magical with all fairy lights and all people sat on tables enjoying an evening drink there were some place to eat as well

Lovely. Went into Bryant Park to chill out for half and hour after a lot of walking and sight seeing. Very nice area, I did almost get hit in the face by a pigeon that went insane, but hey, that's New York!

Love this park. What a great find! We came across the park on our way to Grand Central Station on our first morning. It's beautiful and we spent a peaceful couple of hours there one sunny afternoon. Not sure how it would work in London as chairs and tables are available round the park and appear to be left out overnight. Games are set up for people to play in the shade - chess etc, newspapers and magazines are available in a reading section and a BBQ was being set up on our last morning following a very wet night. The height of the tulips was impressive and beautiful! Location is perfect, right behind the library. Definitely worth a visit.

Obsessed with Bryant park. Well I just love this park. Just around the corner from my hotel. Beautiful lush grass, nice place to sit down and eat breakfast that I picked up on the go. Played a couple of games of connect four at the free "games" tables. Watched salsa dancing on a Wednesday night (open for anyone to dance). Lovely park

Bryant Park In Winter. Bryant Park is still beautiful in the winter. We went inside the rec area to watch the ice skaters. There was a big tree up and we took pictures by it. There was a heated outside restaurant that looked interesting. There are cute little shops along the side. Even in winter it's beautiful!
Nice spot ....... Nice spot next to the public library and worth a walk through. There is a seating area which is handy.

Beautiful park with carousel. Travelling with a 4 year old and 2 year old and stumbled across this park. Lovely place to stop and have lunch, a ride on the beautiful carousel and play a free board game in the sun. Kids loved it. Only issue was the line for the restroom but they were very clean and well maintained.

Quaint for a big city. Bryant Park is a gorgeous and happening place. There are handfuls of cute little set up shops where you can buy anything from chocolate, to dog treats and art. There is also a mini carousel and ice skating rink that are definitely worth checking out. If you're traveling with a significant other I would recommend coming here for the evening.

A surprise find on our way to the library. We came across the park as we were walking to visit the New York Public Library. It really us a beautiful place with an extensive lawn (just laid I think), beautiful flower beds full of magnificent tulips, shrubs, trees, cafés with plenty of outdoor seating and organised scheduled daily activities. It is very peaceful and well worth a stop off.

My favorite park in NYC. Bryant Park is an oasis in a big bustling city. Free wifi, the cleanest public restrooms I've ever seen in the city, reading area with newspapers and books to read,plenty of cafés to choose from. Simply love spending time there and taking a rest.

Europe in NYC. Instantly it makes you travel to Paris. You feel the french ambiance, flowers, gardens, all while in the middle of the busiest city! The gardens are luxurious, the whole park is incredible, the cafés and coffee shops are outside with lights hanging on the ceiling and there is music and fires.

A gem in the middle of the city!. I had the luxury of watching The Wizard of OZ, one summers eve here, for free might I add. A surreal experience made better by the fantastic New York crowd who are not shy about getting up to dance a sing. If you do come here to watch a movie, come earlier and don't be afraid to push an old person out of the way. They will do it to you. Manners go out the window when people want the perfect place to sit. Bring food and towels to sit on. You won't be moving for a while so get comfortable.

I love Bryant Park. Bryant Park used to be called "needle park" back in the 80s, before Guliani cleaned it up. Now it is a delightful park space, with a book lending area, summer events, a Christmas ice skating rink and craft booths. To sit and read, or have a bit of lunch is a delight. There are some good restaurants nearby, it is directly behind the main branch of the NYPL, and a few blocks from both Times Square and Lord and Taylor. A nice walk from Macy's in Herald Square. A really delightful spot. And a good subway hub.
Love it at Christmastime. This is where we come to ice skate at Christmastime. The atmosphere is quite festive and while it does get crowded it's no where near as bad as Rock Center.

Peaceful place in town. Just a charming park in the heart of the Big Apple. In the back of the New York Public Library you find this oasis in the city. It is crazy how sitting by it is like you are miles away from the chaotic city. I really love summer film festivals when movies are showed and everybody meet up there with wine and cheese (or a salad or a donut). There is no place like this in the city: its located between 5th Av and times Square and still feels like you are in the quite place on earth. Beautiful and breathtaking. No doubt its my favorite place in NYC.

Just beautiful! Gem in the city.. After visiting the New York Public Library, we walked around back to sit in Bryant Park. The vibe was European almost. People were sitting around, having drinks, relaxing, reading, talking with one another. There was no hustle and bustle here. The grass lawn was very pretty, and so were the tulips, daffodils, etc. Definitely worth a look if you are nearby!
Cute little green space. I really this park. Don;t know why. Maybe the carroussel for the children or the flowers...just go see it

Take a seat, a break, snack and watch the people go buy. By conincidence we ended up at the park without knowing we were at Bryant Park. There was plenty of seating and we decided to take our pick nick there. It was so lovely and a great place to take in the park. It is a real gem, because the small park is cute but surrounded by the many sky scrapers.While you take a break you have a perfect excuse to watch the people going by.
Great part of the city!. I loved this park and this area (situated right by the NYC library). I would have loved to see a movie there.

Really relaxing place!. This was one of my favourite areas of NYC. In the summertime there is no better place to pick up something to eat and relax in the sun! It is placed perfectly next to Central Library.In the summer, if you're lucky enough, you can catch a movie which is shown in the park. It's free to watch - and although they usually show classics, it's quite cool to sit in the middle of Manhattan in a park watching a film on a projector whilst enjoying some drinks!There is also quite a nice restaurant which is adjacent to the Central Library - we ate there for lunch one day in between shopping.

Such a great place in NYC. I really love stopping by Bryant Park on an early afternoon during Spring or Summertime. There are few better places in midtown. The inner grass area gives you direct access to sunlight, and there are chairs to post up and relax. On the outer areas, there are tables to read, play chess, work on my laptop and sit in the shade while enjoying the beautiful weather outside. I would highly recommend this as a great break area for anyone traveling to NY and in the midtown area. Small but gorgeous.

Beautiful park!. Bryant Park is my favourite park I've ever been too! It is so beautiful there no matter the time of year! In the summer the trees are full and green and in the winter there is a cute market and skating! There is a ton of seating through out the park which makes for a beautiful place to just sit and relax or enjoy lunch!

Lovely oasis. Great place to stop and relax in the middle of so much. At Christmas, you'll enjoy shopping in the craft booths--unique items. Got a cupcake across the street and enjoyed people watching as I enjoyed my snack.

Place to rest and recharge. Bryant Park is a small oasis of quiet in the West midtown of NY. You can hear the sound of running water from the fountain and the birds and also take in the panorama of interesting buildings in all directions. There are chairs everywhere, water fountains and lots of food options. We found ourselves there several times and the carousel makes this is an attractive family option for a relax at any time throughout the day.

Nice place to relax. Went here when we arrived as it was the end of the street from our hotel, so glad we did. After a transatlantic flight we rested with a drink amongst the locals on a lovely warm sunny afternoon. This is an oasis of green without the vastness of Central Park. Wish the weather had been better and we could have gone again!

Garden delights in the shade of Patience and Fortitude. Ask a native New Yorker for the names of the big Lions in front of the Main Public Library on Fifth & 42nd and you would most probably get a surprised look: they don’t know. But that does not stop Patience and Fortitude to stand majestically at the entrance of the library and observe the reading public around. In their backyard, on the back of the Library building, you will find Bryant Park, a place with long and quaint history. It started as a Potter’s field, served as Union Troupes barracks during the Civil War, then became Reservoir park, adjacent to the Huge Croton Reservoir which was built to bring fresh water to the City and once resided at the place of the current library. The park nowadays is pleasant, even if small. Movies at night in the summer, ice skating ring in the middle in winter, free chairs you can move around to sit whenever you please and interesting architectural buildings around. But I like most spring and fall: if you get tired just sitting and reading, you can move to the Bryant Park Café, where the food is interesting and sensibly priced, service is prompt but not pushy and the Prosecco chilled. Try the Gazpacho, served with fresh cucumbers and chopped mint. If you are interested in more formal dining, go to the Bryan Park Grill. Then stroll around and take pictures of the kids riding the Carousel on the background of French street melodies. And don’t forget to look at the stunning black and gold building that the American Radiator and Standard Sanitary Company commissioned in 1924 (now Bryant park Hotel). Enjoy!

lovely in the sunshine. An oasis in the middle of the city. We visited here on a lovely, crisp April afternoon and enjoyed soaking up the atmosphere for a refreshing drink and people-watch. Not far from the Library and Grand Central Station, it was busy but a respite from the noise of the main thoroughfare.

Just Beautiful. We took a rest stop at this park and we were surprised at it's size and how beautiful it was. There are many table and chairs to sit at, food vendors, a carousel, and books and magazines to look at.A perfect place to recharge and people watch!
a great place to explore. Loved just looking around at the Bryant Park Library. We spent quite a lot of time in the gift shop alone and it's free.
Lovely, quiet park. Great place, clean park with plenty of seats and tables. Kiosks selling drinks etc. Table tennis tables as well.

Stunning Park. Wow - this creeps up on you on 42nd Street, nestled between buildings and behind the library. A great spot to sit and relax and take in a drink in the sun before visiting the Library or Grand Central - a must see park on your visit.

great park, ice skating in December. It's a great small park behind the public library (which is also a recommended place). We were here late December and it had an ice rink and all kind of small shops for winter clothing and hot cocoa. Buy a pastry in one of the great bakeries around and sit to enjoy the city atmosphere in the serenity...
An Oasis. Take the time to visit Bryant Park. Really centrally located and just as good as Central Park only on a smaller scale. Cafes and restaurants on site but also great for picnics.

You never know who you will see. Went up to NYC for the day with a friend, we went to Bryant Park to people watch and Seth Myers came to film a skit for his show. Its a beautiful park to relax, eat lunch, read a book or just people watch; I highly recommend you stop by and sit a while
Bryant Park. Nice, small little pocket park behind the NY Public Library. In the summer movies are shown at night. Perfect escape in midtown.

Bryant Park - Beautiful. I have been to Bryant Park twice, once in April 2009 and again in December 2013. Firstly in April we were very lucky with the weather it was a lovely warm day where we relaxed by the fountain having a drink. When we went back in December, the transformation! Little Christmas stalls, a pop up restaurant a huge christmas tree and an Ice Skating rink. Unfortunately we were unable to skate as it was too busy. The park is lovely not too big, a hidden gem behind the New York Public Library.

Smaller Park. I like to eat at the restaurant here, Good people watching as almost any outdoor spot in the city is. Good food and pleasant atmosphere. They show free outdoor movies at night. Give it a try. Fun.

You Don't Know How Much You Miss Green Space. Until you see it! So great to actually see a patch of grass in the city. If you have a minute you can let your kids stop off at the $2 carousel ride. The fountain and the surroundings make it a great respite in the city.
Enjoy this oasis. A great place for a quiet lunch picnic. Clean and tidy and well maintained, it's well worth a visit. Food sellers nearby if you don't have your own.

A little haven. A lovely little bit of peace in the middle of the hustle and bustle. Plenty of places to sit for a while and watch the world go by with a drink. Free wifi and mobile charging stations a bonus.

AMAZING. I love this place so much. Absolutely gorgeous. This place doesn't get the credit it deserves. I went around christmas time and it was beautiful. The ice skating was great. I love all the little shops and food stands around the park. Such a great place.
People Watch. This is very interresting with the night movie screen and tables set up even free wifi. Take you picnic lnch and sit and enjoy the park cathing up friends

Good place to chill or lunch when it is warm enough. This is a lovely little park just behind the public library. It has lots of seating so grab lunch from one of the near by deli's and cafe's and enjoy the view when it's warm enough. The space is well managed and quiet with a little carousel and reading area for children and lots of space to relax. Great views of the impressive Bryant Park Hotel building (and currently the inflatable rat, warning about the dangers of asbestos poisoning). For a more formal dining option there is the bryant Park Grill restaurant in the park as well.
Amazing!. I am working just 2 m from rhis beatiful park :)I was amazed to see how ice skating rink become green park again...Nice and calm, beutiful peopleLots of activities

Bryant Park. What I like most about Bryant Park is that in the winter its a ice skating ring and in the summer its green grass. They perform shows during the winter and summer. I enjoy Christmas time because they put up the Christmas tree and it looks so beautiful and they have a lot of out door shops that sell everything from food to clothes, etc....In the summer you see a lot of people enjoying the grass reading books. They also have tables where you can sit and enjoy lunch. Its close to Times Square, the Library and many other tourist places. Great place all year round. Must to do list, highly recommend it to all....

Simply Devine!. Bryant Park is the ultimately the loveliest attractions in New York city as far as I'm concerned. This park is ideal to take a break from the hustle and bustle of the busy city. You can simply go there, and enjoy a peaceful moment since there are little bistro tables and chairs set up outside. There is a beautiful fountain right in the middle and people just can't help themselves but stop and take pictures. In the winter there's a skating rink and during all other seasons there are different events that are set up at Bryant Park. You feel like you are in Paris or some lovely European park. A must see!
great, even in rain. Ice rink in winter ... restaurant nearby.Nice open location ...close to Grand Central and New York Library.
Wait for spring. We have been here before and it is a lovely setting to rest the feet and have a coffee. It is still suffering the after-effects of winter but will be worth a visit soon.

Reclaimed Urban Space. Back in the day, Bryant Park was like a lot of faded New York--tawdry and threatening. But since the 90s, it has come roaring back with lunchtime loungers, noontime concerts (free) from Broadway shows, and a Christmas Holiday village complete with shops and an ice rink! On summer evenings, local media companies bring back the heyday of the drive in movie with outdoor screenings of Hollywood classics.

Make a stop here - or have a wonderful walk through. This is a terrific stop or a terrific walk - or both. We went to Bryant Park on our way to a wonderful visit to the New York Central Library. People watch or be caught up in your own world. Right now (March, 2014), Bryant Park is under some construction so some areas are not accessible. However, we thoroughly enjoyed the visit in spite of the ongoing construction. Walk, watch, and enjoy!

Very Quiet Park in Busy Manhattan. Close to Grand Central & N.Y. Public Library, it is an ideal place to get relaxed and imagine thatone might be a New Yorker. You can see also Chrysler building in appropriate distance to takepictures of it.

Sweet retreat. It was such a cute little park in the middle of all the hustle and bussle! People playing chess, ping pong, and just enjoying the beautiful day! Great spot to stop and enjoy a cup of coffee/tea and have a lite bite.
cute!!!. it is a small park in the heart of manhattan with great coffeshops an plenty of trees! i enjoyed walking there!!
Quiet spot in a big city!. This park was very quaint and had so much character and very 'pretty'. It was a jewel in a big city! The restaurant at the rear is housed in a gorgeous building.

Relaxing comes to mind!. How could you not go into Bryant Park while in the city? This place is an absolute little gem in the heart of a city that does not seem to have enough of greenery all around. The fact that this park also host one of the most incredible buildings in the city, the NYC Public Library even makes it more attractive to visit. They also will have random showings of movies on a huge screen every now and then and what an event that is when this happens. Definitely worth the stop!

Love shopping here!. Bryant Park has so many great shopping vendors in the winter time. Great food, jewelry, trendy items and artisan crafts. Walked past yesterday and all the booths were being broken down. I wonder what's coming next?

Great little oasis. Bryant Park is a great little oasis in the middle of Manhattan. A great place to relax, have a bite to eat, etc. During the holidays they have a ice skating rink and lots of vendors.

Anytime of the year!. I have been to New york many times and it always was the perfect place to relax, see Newyorkers in their daily life and tourists taking a break from the crazyness of the city. The library next to it is involved during the summer, there is coffee, light lunch and children playing ping pong. During the xmas period there is the outdoor shopping til beginning of January and skating til the end of February.

Chair and a sandwich, eyeballs on the city. on a warm day, lounge and watch new yorkers bustle around at lunch. Occasional events are always worth watching. Check out the NYPL site for events here. If there is square dancing, do not miss it.
Urban oasisbb. In warm weather, a place to sit, picnic, dine, read. There are chess boards, table tennis, sometimes yoga classes and night time films. Christmas brings a market and ice skating.

Winteractivities. We werent looking for the park but found it walking by. It has a nice atmosphere and when we were there we saw a lot of winter activities. A restaurant called Celsius but also the ice rink where we watched a local 3-on-3 ice hockey game. If you are in the neighborhood dont miss thjs!

Skating. Always wanted to skate in New York City. Found Bryant Park ( free skating )on tripadvisor. I had my own skates, arrived at 9:30 in the morning. I skated for about 3 hours with a few other people. The ice rink was clean, well maintained. Listening to Frank Sinatra just added to an already amazing experience. After skating I visited the library, just steppes away from the park. This was a great morning!
Christmas in the city!. Love the small boutiques at Christmas. Skating, good food, shopping, meeting place. If you've never seen Bryant Park at Christmas you don't know what you're missing!

Bryant Park Skating Rink (Tourist in my Own City). There are several ice rinks to choose from in NYC: Rockefeller Plaza (crowded, touristy); Lasker (small, crowded, dirty locker room), Wollman (spacious rink used by natives and tourists alike, $), Riverbank State Park (good skating, but way uptown), and Bryant Park (free if you have skates, $15 if you don't). Located in the shadow of the historic Main Library, Bryant Park rink is clean, well-tended, and a one-two punch to hit the rink and library (if you have kids, visit the renovated children's library, complete with stuffed animals and scheduled readings). All skating rinks have terrible food, so venture elsewhere if you want to nosh (NY for snack). The best part was the music, which was retro (Sinatra, Fats Waller, Ella Fitzgerald, Rosemary Clooney), which gave the experience an old New York feel. If you squinted away the Conde Nast building, you could pretend it was the Jazz Era, when New York Clubs reigned and the M&M store was just a twinkle in Time Square's eye.

Great place to skate . Doesn't offer the views of Central Park skating, but is cheaper and has much better opening hours! (This place closed at 10pm whereas central shut at 2pm).Also if you have a padlock bring it along - use of the lockers is free if you bring your own, $9 if you don't.

A very "european" vest pocket park. Bryant Park, behind the New York Public Library, has become a place for families and fun. it has tables, an ice rink in the winter and is clean, neat and patrolled. There are kiosks that serve food or coffee and a lovely restaurant fronting on it.

Lite lunch, a drink and a great view for people watching & taking it all in.. A great midtown place to have a simple lunch or after work break, drink, and enjoy people watching. May to September brings the best in people and some guests are as hot as the food. Men and Women will enjoy this location. Not great for families but you can still enjoy it just the same I guess.Skating in winter is beautiful for everyone including tourists, families, dates etc...Enjoy!!Chris

Lovely small park with a very populat ice skating rink in winter. Visited twice, once early on a Saturday morning when all the little cabins were shut but the ice rink was comparatively deserted and fantastic for the children to skate on. Went again later in the week on a sunny afternoon during mid-term break and the rink was way too crowded and really uncomfortable (both inside getting changed and out on the ice), but there were a lot of nice food offerings open in the surrounding park.
Good value for skating. Our daughter and friends had a great time skating here today - $15 is great value compared to Rockefeller at $40!!!!

Nice. A nice, fairly low key park in a great location. A fairly quiet hide away in midtown where you can relax in the shade or get some work done at one of the cafe tables. The Christmas market is also pretty nice though crowded.

Year Round Fun. Yoga in the Summer, Line Dancing in the fall, Skating in the winter and Table Tennis in the Spring... This place is a haven for free fun that few people actually know about... Half price hot drinks from 3-6pm add to the value... Go now... Go on... Stop reading and head out... Well done
Always a Fun PLace!. We love Bryant Park, especially in winter. Lots of people, ice skating and all the great specialty kiosks make it a real oasis in the city no matter what time of year.

Winter Wonderland. This place is an oasis in the middle of town. Beautifully lit. Been here in the spring when you can sit outside on the tables with a picnic lunch. Now there is a skating rink, music, and a bar/cafe set up. Urban glory.

I'm Loving this Winter Wonderland. Winter at Bryant Park is one of the most amazing experience ever. I was there last november and I could feel the Christmas spirit and love in the air. They literally set up a wonderland there; with ice-skating rink, shops, carousels, etc. Even having a simple cup of coffee in the park (or ice-cream - which I did tried) is such great simple pleasure in life.

I simply love Bryant Park anytime of the year. Bryant Park is real, authentic, romantic, cozy. You enjoy it anytime of the year: during the xmas holidays there are xmas markets with all the small NY gifts that you can buy; during the whole winter the iceskating area allows you to enjoy the skyline while skating in the park; in the summer there are outdoor movies, dance classes, yoga classes and on top of that there is wifi all the time and the possibility to share books, chairs, tables. Around the park there is a nice shopping area with Zara, BCBG etc, nice salad bars and restaurants where a take away allows you to sunbath in the park while eating or reading. Time square right close but it is a very quiet park.

My favorite spot. I love to go back to Bryant Park every time I go to New York. It is quite small but busy with little shops featuring local and foreign artists. There is the skating ring which is famous and there are restaurants right there on the spot to do the people watching activity. Very nice spot.

Le carousel. We love love Bryant park, so eclectic, alive (packed duh), with everyone enjoying themselves on the lawn, at the tables, on the steps, in the carousel, under the shade..perfect place to be alone together with everyone.

Small park, big presence. This little park has a lot going on! I was here in November visiting my sister and she recommended I check it out as it was close to her work. Within walking distance of the Empire State building, 5th Ave shopping and Times Square, it was easy to find. There is a beautiful historic public library next door (as featured in the film "The Day After Tomorrow") and the park itself is relaxing and vibrant. In November, I enjoyed an artisan market and watching the public skating. Much better than Rockefeller if you want to skate or just watch the skating. There is a carousel and cute little bistro in the park as well.

Don't miss this at Christmas. What a lovely place. We were lucky enough to see this park at Christmas time when the tree was up. Just a total wow and worth the trip to NYNY just for that alone. Fabulous atmosphere.

Unexpected discovery. Came across this whilst visiting NYC and couldn't believe a place so quaint exisits here. It has a lovely European relaxing feel about it. So cute. Recommend as a refuge from the madness of NYC!
less crowded. As far as watching skaters, this is a better spot than the Rockefeller Plaza rink. There was room to walk and market stalls to visit as well as the people watching

Always something good happening. Bryant Park is a great example of public space put to good use for locals and tourists alike. I have traveled all over the world and Bryant Park makes me truly appreciate the concept of public space and public parks. You will not find anything like this anywhere in Europe or Asia for sure. A FREE lovely oasis in the center of Manhattan where you can sit down and rejuvenate.Bryant Park has a free wifi zone, free yoga & tai chi classes during warm months, outdoor movies at night, concerts, and tables and chairs for anyone to use. Before the holidays, from Nov through the first week in Jan the park is taken over by small holiday boutique shops selling items that are supposed to be handmade or imported from afar and not generally available in chain stores. Some of it is very high end and I applaud the vendors who sit in those booths during the cold weather. It is beautifully set up and magical. "The Pond" skating rink is free if you bring your own skates, and rentals and lockers are available for a fee. They open early in the morning, and it's not usually crowded at that time.If you are visiting with a family and want to get tickets on the Two-fer line at Times Square, this is a great place for someone to hang out with the kids while a few folks wait in the ticket line. The "Witch-craft" sandwich shops are slightly overpriced but decent fare. Surrounding the park are some deli's and food vendors. And did I mention a little carousel for kids?When my neice & nephew came to visit, we waited in line for the Empire State Bldg a long time, and then came here for bagels while my sister-in-law went to get theater tickets. The kids enjoyed running around on the grassy lawn, while I laid down and stretched my back after having been on my feet all morning. The garden beds are well kept, and the fountain plaza makes a perfect setting for tea/scones. Many people come here at lunchtime, as there is both sun on the lawn, and shade under the trees.The Public Library has an outdoor reading room with umbrellas, newspapers and books, including childrens books and small tables, story hour and writing workshops for adults all free of charge.And perhaps the BEST KEPT SECRET about Bryant Park is their opulent public bathroom located right on 42nd Street near the side entrance to the library. It has an attendant, and stunning floral arrangement between the marble sinks.Check their website for a calendar of events.

Cool park whether is hot or cold. Well, besides central park, this is my preferred park in the big apple, theres always something to do over there. Presentations, market fairs, anyone else likes ice skating?

A peaceful place in the middle of the jungle.. Beautiful park. It's crowded, but everyone has its own place. Take a book, or headphones, or nothing...just sit and enjoy on one of the many chairs and tables or benches in the park. Great place for having a stop for lunch while exploring the Big Apple. If you want to escape from the crowded New York streets and be away from the fast and crazy city and still to be in it - this is the place.
Chess anyone?. This is one of my favorite places to just hang out in the city. Great for people watching, playing chess, and really close to the library. I visit here every time I'm in the city.

Always something on. Regardless of the time of year, there is something happening at Bryant Park. A short walk from the Yotel (or catch the M42 bus). You can walk around it and listen to the audio tour with Matthew Broderick. Summer - free movies. Winter - ice skating. Magic!

Great little park with ice skating. This park was just a few blocks from our hotel on Madison Avenue, Its a nice quaint area with a carousel, bar/restaurant area and free a ice skating rink as long as you bring your own skates, otherwise its $15pp and you need money for a locker unless, again you bring your own lock.We went in the cold winter snow but there are lots of seating areas around the park its right next to the New York public library so its easy to find, there's also power plugs all around the park to charge up your electric items a nice touch I found in our modern tech world!

Pretty park. We went in the winter and the cafe was closed. there was an ice skating rink and a lovely fountain
Would be lovely in the warm weather.

Great food fair. There was a great food fair when we last visited Bryany Park on our last visit to NY. Number of stalls by leading restaurants participated and we could hop from one to the next and pick up a variety of delicacies that we later ate at table set out in the park. There was a children's play area where the kids had a whale of a time. And an ItalianA work of art display by a local artist across the park. And an eatierie across the road which sells biscottis to die for. An enjoyable way to spend a fall weekend evening.
Little oasis in the city. I love to watch the skating here. Great views of the surrounding buildings too. It's just nice to see this little oasis in the city.
nice park in the city. i love this park. in the summer it is very nice as well. it is near the library and it is good place to sit and relax.

A peaceful place in Manhattan. During our visit to NYC in July 2013, we loved this peaceful, green oasis in the middle of busy Manhattan. It's got an European feel to it, not a big park, more intimate. The edge of the park is shady due to many tall trees. There was an open-air "Reading Room" with books, magazines and newspapers, small tables and chairs, electric plugs to recharge your phones or tablets. In the middle, a large grassy area with a big screen for open air movies under the stars. Outlets to buy food & drinks, a restaurant on the other side, public toilet (very clean although a long queue for ladies). It's located behind the NYC Library building. We walked a lot and somehow ended up at Bryant Park again and again. Absolutely loved it!

So charming!. We had an outdoor lunch in the park. It was full of flowers and lots of colors. Bryant Park is great for people watching & the lunch spots are good. Inside the ladies' restroom is even beautifully decorated with fresh flowers!

Most attractive park. I visited this park in the morning. I was really surprised to see such a beautiful and clean park. Since I was there in the morning at about 10 , not many people were around. I saw some Yoga practice going on in the park. Else it was quite calm and cool. I had the occasion to go through the entire park and enjoy the beautiful flowers and trees.The fountain is Gorgeous. It is one of the beautiful and prettiest fountain I have seen. There are some tables and chairs for people to sit and relax. These are used for sitting and relaxing. People come and enjoy here have picnic and play a lot.These chairs will be removed and used as a skating rinc during winter. I had no opportunity to see the skating in this park as i was visiting the park in summer. We can always see lot of Manhattan skylines around this park.  Very near to lot of attractions including New York Public library. Toilets are clean.

Holiday Botique at Bryant Park. I've been here for two holiday seasons in a row now and it's a great little place to walk around in on a winter night. Plenty of places to stop for snacks, dinner, and hot drinks, while taking in the sights, people skating, great restaurants, and quaint places to shop for holiday gifts. It's an interesting experience to be in the heart of the city, but on a plot of land with huge trees, walkways, and park-like areas.
Excellent. One of the nicest places in nyc the skating was great, we had hot chocolate seated in the fountain it was really great

Beautiful. We attended Le Diner En Blanc here this past year. As a native NY'er sadly, I had never been here before. The park is truly beautiful, situated amongst some of the prettiest buildings in the Manhattan skyline. The fountain is gorgeous, the grounds are well kept and there are a ton of things to do in that area alone. You'll love it!

The most wonderful park in the City!. in the winter the park's a draw for ice skaters and those who like to watch. There's lots of small temporary vendor stalls for visitor to shop. In the warm weather the park is a refuge from the clitter-clatter of 5th avenue. Schedule a stop here, get a coffee, sit and relax before sallying forth.
Little Gem. Huge Christmas tree, ice skating ring, wide variety of small booths selling artists items and a few selling food beverages. An excellent place to balance the hectic surroundings.

Ice skating was fun but busy. We I've skated here. Prices were also able at $15 a head and rink is quite large but they let a lot of people in so it was pretty packed and a little crazy given we aren't that skilled at skating. It was snowing out so was worth it just to skate outside in the snow in New York.

Festive markets and Ice Skating. Bryant Park looks beautiful in the snow, with pretty market stalls selling jewellery, art, scarves and trinkets. The Christmas Tree and Ice Skating rink give it a very festive feel and the hot chocolate needs to be purchased wisely (with Max Brenner being the place of choice). Glad to pass through this park
Also a Beautiful park.. Great to walk around and see all of the artists items. All kinds of different stuff and it is interesting.

PRETTY SMALL PARK. Bryant Park is a lovely small park that has kiosks selling arty things,an ice skating rink where any one can skate or site in the restaurant and bar where you can just enjoy a drink and watch.

good atmosphere. Huge Christmas tree. lots of little shops/booths. ice skating.
Busy and bustling. nice place to visit
Great for ice skating. ice skating is free if you bring your own skates. Love the skating without time limits.Then stop for a hot cocoa when done. An enjoyable afternoon always!
Cute Park, but very busy.. Walked through on a Friday evening. Work had just let out and park was bustling. I imagine this would be a great escape from the city during non-rush hour times.
Winter fun. The skating is free (only cost of skate rental if you need) and not as crowded as Rockefeller. The Carousel is small but my kids loved it.

Oasis in a sea of shops and streets. We stumbled upon this Park whilst wandering around finding our feet. Great ice skating opportunity and Xmas market in holiday season. Guess this will be a great place to visit in spring /summer too. Buildings in immediate vicinity have character and close to main attractions of midtown Manhattan.

great city feel. This was a lovely spot to ice skate and really get the NYC feeling b/c you are surrounded by tall buildings. My husband and 6 year old son had a great time. The plus is its free if you have your own skates. The downside is that if you do rent the skates for $15 they are terrible...plastic skates! You still have to wait in line to get an arm band. There is space to hangout inside the rental area where its heated and has lots of windows to watch the skaters. The non skaters in our group opted to go to the Celsius bar instead. There are free lockers available but you have to rent a lock. We just left the shoes in the lockers without a lock.We went around 7pm so its was beautiful to see NY all lit up. It was crowded but my 6 year old had no problem navigating through the crowds while he penguin skated his way around the rink.

Fun spot. Fun spot with Christmas Village for shopping and delightful Grill for dining. Watch the skaters and then warm up with a warming drink and very adequate food. Definitely a tourist location but popular with repeat locals. Busy and bustling, very NY.

Excellent park. We loved this park, it's so nice to sit and people watch we got a burrito from the place across the street and sat and ate here on the tables and chairs rather than in the heaving restaurant. The ice rink was packed with skaters and New York music was playing it was very pleasant indeed.

Statue of Liberty. Brilliant, awesome, very visitor friendly. Views are just magnificient. Loved it! Ferry staff were incredibly helpful ensuring that everyone boarded safely. Staff at the Statue itself were equally helpful and knowledgable.Flora

Park with tent buildings, ice skating in winter, waterfalls fountains and flowers come summer.. Great people place. Enjoyable flexible all purpose tent buildings. Quite attractive and functional. Ice skating in winter.Beautiful gardens in summer.Cross the street from the library.One can rent a book, grab a coffee and find a spot to lounge away the day. Or simply take a break. Must return or see for the first time.

Just beautiful. Bryant park was lovely there was lots of stall selling some unusal items we went at night so it was all full of lights and Christmassy atmosphere was just beautiful also watched the ice skating too. Bryant park is bigger than it looks

Wonderful Christmas feel. We went to Bryant Park on Christmas Day and watched the skaters and had a drink on Celsius Bar. It is a lovely family place to browse in the shops and absorb the New York vibe.

Lovely holiday market. We had a lovely afternoon browsing the stalls in Bryant Park. Lots of individual artists along with the mass market telephone covers and animals hats! Worth a trip very pretty. The ice rink was very busy and there were people waiting in line for a long time.

Winter activities. This park is really nice specially in christmas time, u can find booths selling interesting things including food and gifts, Don't miss the hot chocolate it is special. U can also perform many winter activities like skiing. U can also find a nice christmas tree

Fantastic. as we were they in winter the American Airlines ice rink was set up and int he middle of the city it was just so perfect with the stalls selling all the trinkets, driking hot apple cider and watching everyone skate

Nice Shopping Alternative. Very crowded with local and tourist holiday shoppers, even early in December. However, that's what makes Bryant Park fun. Lots of shops with unusual items, and reasonably priced. Always a good place to find unusual gifts. The tree and skaters add to the holiday spirit. Well worth being among the crowd.

Small park in the heart of midtown with lots to offer. Bryant Park used to be one of the examples of urban blight. Nowadays, it couldn't be nicer. With 42nd street on the north side, and the back of the NY Public Library on the east side, the park has a nice lawn and gravel paths all around the sides flanked by lovely trees. There is a fun bar along the Library side as well as a very good restaurant. Towards the 6th Avenue side, you can find coffee and snacks. Plenty of cafe tables and chairs are available but on a nice day you'll be well advised to grab one on the early side. During the summer months, movies are shown for a gourmet picnic crowd. In the winter months, vendors set up a gift fair and an ice rink is a popular stop. If you are in the midtown area, don't miss this.
the best on 42nd street. Not so great on a very cold day, but in the good weather the best place to sit and just enjoy the city pass by. It is New York

They left the tree up for us. We wearily stumbled upon Bryant Park after a long day of museums. We were instantly rejuvenated by the ice skaters and the very beautiful tree. We were so grateful that the tree remained up for us to enjoy, even though it was early January. This park offers lounging spots where you will be served wine or coco while watching the skaters and passersby. It's a twinkling part of the city that invites you to sit and rest and absorb this part of New York's magic.

A quaint park area during Xmas. Very festive drying the month of December with a christmas market, tree, lights and ice skating. No where near as busy as the other skating options, and a little to a lot cheaper.

Great New York Park!. While visiting the city we wanted to ice skate, and the crowds at Central Park were not very appealing. But when we arrived at Bryant Park we were able to ice skate and for a much cheaper price! It was busy, but not nearly as crowded as the rink in Central Park.
Beautiful Place to hang out. Bryant Park in the winter is filled with ice skaters enjoying the free admission to the open air rink. The snow on the ground and the bare trees are beautiful.

Small and beautifull!. What a nice park, close to the Grand Central Station and National library. In Christmas it had an ice ring and small fair.It is samll and beautifull. Great for a small stop or have lunch around.

Great people watching. Be sure to visit the park around Christmas when they have the skating rink up and craft boutiques set up. Lots of good coffee and pastry shops across the street, so come hungry.

Ice Rink and Christmas Shops. During the Christmas season they have a skating rink and shops all around the park. They also have a great restaurant to visit that is attached to the New York Public Library if you would like a nice lunch.
Nice place to visit.. This is an example as to why private enterprise is best suited to manage places like this. It is safe and family friendly.

Great park and Christmas market. Wonderful Christmas atmosphere, skating rink, Christmas shops/market where you can find the best little trinkets, gifts, handcrafts and jewels. It is a great place to wonder through and just relax cause this is needed when you are constantly in a crazy busy city like NY. Grab a coffee and just sit and watch the skaters or walk through and brose the stalls.
Beautiful in the winter. LOVED the skating rink. Enjoyed the atmosphere in the middle of midtown without the bedlam of Rockefeller Center.
Loved It !. Lovely little park the tree was gorgeous and I bet with all the little market shops before Christmas was just amazing.

A pretty space in the city centre. Apart from Central Park, spaces like Bryant Park are a bit rare in midtown. Usually its a haven of quiet where people go to meet and share a coffee. In November it becomes an ice rink and full of small individual Christmas shops, a great place to look round and then stop for coffee!
Park restaurant. There is a great restaurant in the park, good food and good value. Great service. We went for lunch but the dinners are even better. There is plenty of choice.

Open market where one can have a coffee break. We were walking from Chelsea Piers/SoHo/Greenwich all the way to Central Park and broke our walk at Bryant Park. During this (winter) time, there was an open market, a skating rink and delightful sitting areas where one could savor cups of hot tea, chocolate and coffee.

Loved it in winter!. Visited on a snowy evening in early January. It was so cold and wet, but the skaters and music and decorations were a delight! We did not skate, but I was told the rink there is free. Definitely got the feeling this is where the locals go to skate, as opposed to the chaos at Rockefeller Center. The market was still there, too. It would be nice if they had a place to get a hot chocolate or something, without having to go into a sit-down restaurant (Celsius). They may have it there, but we couldn't find it.
Nice little park. I dont know if it was because there was a Christmas fais when I visited the park, but I loved this little park in the middle of a lot of buildings
Winter wonderland. Spent a morning here in and out of cute shops and found lots of unique Christmas gifts. Didn't skate, but it looked like a lot of fun for younger bones than my own.
Couldn't see the fuss. Nothing special to draw my attraction here, better options available, but not unpleasant for a stroll

A nice place to relax and watch the crowd during Christmas. Went through it a few times during our visit our Christmas. A nice vibe and energy in it and some really nice festive shops around it. Nice place to people watch too.

Alternative to Rockefeller Center. During the Christmas season Bryant Park is an overlooked delight. Instead of trying to ice skate at Rockefeller Center try skating at Bryant Park. The rink is almost as large but the lines are much shorter. There are also kiosks with vendors selling their wares. Many of the kiosks are filled with homemade and handmade items.During the summer, Bryant Park is a great place to take a break and have your lunch.Bryant Park is only a very short walk from Grand Central. Thus, it is easy to reach.

Ice skating. We paid for our two children to go ice skating $30 in total. As we were putting their skate on the heavens opened and the rink was closed. We asked for a voucher to use another day but were told by 5 different members of staff this was not possible and if we came back we would have to pay another $30. After a long discussion we finally got our vouchers. Only to turn around and see a woman from NY get a full refund no problem. Very disappointed and poor customer service. Aa

Great Place to Chill. Great location close to Time Square and 5th Ave. As it was 1st January the Christmas Tree was up, carols being sung, ice rink full of people, small shops to look at and great places to eat. The atmosphere was charged. This was our favourite place in the city

Bryant Park with christmas lights an all. Bryant Park is situated close the the public library (worth a visit on it's own) and during Christmas the ice skating ring is open and the park is full of temporary shops selling everything from food delights to hats and gloves.Very nice atmosphere, lots of people and definitely worth a visit

Magical. Yes it IS! We were there shortly ater New Year, the ice rink was packed, there was a chill in the air, the Christmas tree was up, the floodlights brought it all to life, and the restaurants and little shops made it all the more intoxicating. Just GO

Bryant Park is Like a Slice of Heaven in the Middle of NYC. I just love Bryant Park. The first time I was exposed or saw it was when I went down on a bus trip last year(2013) You literally wait for the bus to pick you up right in front of Bryant Park. Inside the park are plenty of benches if you want to sit and relax. There are food and drink vendors. When I went this December 2013 there were shops set up underneath these tent like structures selling all kinds of goods right before Christmas. I dont know if they do this every year at Christmas; I was there in the summer of 2013 and they were not set up at that time. There are people playing chess and other games and Im told that you can join in the games if your up for the challenge. There was a beautifully lit tree with pretty blue lights dazzling the evening sky. There was an ice skating rink set up as well as what looked like a building to warm up or rent your ice skates from. The surrounding bldgs were lit up as well making it a very warm, chrismas feel. In the summer theres plenty of flowers to look at and they do a wonderful job of landscaping this park. There are people playing different instruments, we seen a big screen set up and people in the park with their lawn chairs watching a movie...there always seems to be something really cool going on at the park. We really enjoy stopping at this park as part of our NYC experience. P.S.....The park has a very small set up stairs to climb and then its all flat. Easy access. But the best part is that it feels private even though its in the heart of the city.

LOVE IT!. Definitely one of the most special places I've visited in NYC. We didn't stand in line to iceskate, but enjoyed watching others and browsing around the stalls/shops. A special view of the Empire State Building at night.
Quaint Park. This is my favorite park in NYC. It's small and quiet. Ice skating and vendors at Christmas make it very special.
Spectacular!. The Christmas tree was spectacular! The ice rink was packed with people, so fun to watch! The little tented shops were divine! Something for everyone to enjoy in December!

one of the most happening parks that I know of. Is there ever a time this park is not busy....Fashion week, Christmas market, Summer Broadway show previews, winter ice skating, lounge bars, fountain.....everything one can think of

Superb park near to Times Square. We visited over Christmas and the park was set up as a winter wonderland. The ice skating rink was in the middle of the park surrounded by lots of little stalls selling Christmas items. They park was decorated really elegantly and was well worth spending the time there we did, the markets were selling food from around the world and had different taste to cater from most people. The ice rink was really busy but was much bigger and cheaper and the rockerfeller center rink.
Winter Wonderland!. This was lovely, christmas market, christmas tree, ice rink - what more could you ask for when in NYC at Christmas time! Lovely place to go to.

Simply Beautiful & Fun!. My husband and I had the pleasure of walking through Bryant Park in the evening last month (Dec 2013) while on the way back to our hotel in Midtown. It was beautifully decked out for the Christmas holiday with an enormous Christmas tree, lights & an ice skating rink that looked much less crowded than the one at Rock Center!! It was a real festive family affair as people were skating, sipping hot chocolate and visiting the many food and crafts booths located throughout the park. We stopped at three different booths for a couple of Parmesan cheese pops, hot chocolate and the best Macarons we've ever tasted! It was cold & crowded for sure & the outside seating area tables were wet and not well maintained, but overall, a pleasant experience we would repeat again.
Excellent outdoor shopping and skating!. Excellent Wonderland set up, but with lower prices than Rockefeller Center! Lots of boutiques set up for the holidays!
christmas market. loved it, loads to see and buy and could go skating and not wait hours in queue unlike Rockefeller Centre!

A good weather stop. The park is right behind the public library off Fifth Ave and is a good place to rest when wondering around the city. The restaurant that is on one side of the park has very good food and you can dine outside in good warmish weather. Worth checking out.

Lots of fun!. Bryant park is a great spot to see in NYC. During my visit the Christmas pop up shops were all open. I easily spent an hour just visiting those! Of course getting to watch everyone ice skate is a nice treat as well.
Awesome place to visit. We stopped here as part of a night tour of the city. We were able to take some photos and do some shopping at the various booths set up around the park.
Excellent place for a brief stop. That's a good place to stop to catch breath and maybe relax on a busy day, a little oasis in the middle of Manhattan. Close to the public library and attractions.

Beautiful in winter.. We were lucky enough to go just before Christmas after an amazing day in the New York State Library, and while we didn't skate, it was beautiful to see the trees and Christmas lights from the top floor of the winter-only seasonal restaurant and wander through the Christmas markets in the snow.

Magical. We went at Christmas, you should go here and avoid the crazy busy Rockerfeller. Its got the ice rink, and so much more. They have stalls with food, drink and things to purchase, and christmas music to keep you in the mood. Magical place to hang at christmas.

Gorgeous on a sunny day.. This is a lovely park in the midst of all the hustle and bustle of the city. Get a take out coffee and just sit and observe or treat yourself to a lovely lunch at one of the restaurants.

Beautiful - I never knew. Wow! To me this was New York's best kept secret. I had heard about Central Park or Rockefellsr Center but Bryant park is easier and very family friendly. All the kiosks make holiday shopping so festive. Their tree was gorgeous as well. They have this great looking eating place there where you can sit outside with heaters to eat. I saw great looking as we tried a couple times to eat there and the wait was very long each time! I recommend for the holidays.
christmas time at bryant park. great groupon for ice skating there. includes skate rental and hot chocolate:) great boutiques to shop. max brenner hot chocolate a must
Beautiful!!!. It was a great surprise to see families and people of all ages here. Such a beautiful park. Very very family friendly. Need to go back and visit in good warm weather.

If you're gonna go, make sure to get there really early. My first time going wasn't that great. Its a beautiful park but the line was blocks long, we went in the winter at night & it was obviously freeezzing outside. If youre gonna go, mKe sure you're prepared.

Best skating, tree and shopping. Christmas in NYC can be defined by hot cocoa and watching or going skating all with a beautiful tree and dozens of tiny Christmas "huts" for seasonal shopping with very unique items. Thats Bryant Park between Thanksgiving and New Years.

Lovely park. I love this park. It's so nice and beautiful with the buildings in background. The winter village is really nice with the ice rink and the holiday markets. The Christmas tree was so big and beautiful.This is my favorite park in NYC. In summer it's absolutely awesome!!!

Beautiful Bryant. This is always a great park during any season, but during the Christmas season it is even more complete with an ice skating rink, Christmas shops, and various food stands. Remember what's below you when you are shopping, skating, and eating--thousands and thousands of books sent up to the adjoining New York Public Library!!

Represents America and New York. This was the nicest place for me during Christmas. Old and new were together with Christmas lights, songs and skating. In the winter village there were a lots of crafts, so definitely could by something special. I liked this Christmas tree better than the Rockefeller one. Therefore, I've got the special American - New York Christmas feeling. Thanks, that was my purpose to be here.

Lovely park in Midtown Central. This is a lovely park in central NY. It is full of life at every hour of the day, has various quieter corners to sit and enjoy the view of the skyscrapers embracing the park. It also has a lovely restaurant with a conservatory on the higher part of the park, close to the NY Public Library building. They set up skating ring during winter and all sorts of eateries and stalls selling souvenirs etc.

Quaint. Over Xmas & New Year Bryant Park have its own Ice Skating rink - very popular. Also a kind of Xmas Market where you can buy something different but at a reasonable price. Unique stalls as well as a place to get a coffee

Loved this place. The atmosphere was second to none especially as it was near Christmas and all the little shops and places to eat spoilt for choice really then watching the ice skaters everything was just so so festive x

In my favorite City in the World this is my Favorite Place. This is one the World great spots, At Christmas its magical , In the fall spring or summer its just a great place. Must see . Get a cup of coffee watch the world go by.

Must see during Christmas season!!! Very festive. We went there during the christmas season and just loved the holiday spirit there. Cute little shops and dessert places around the ice skating rink. The christmas tree was huge! I have heard it is beautiful in summer time too!
Neat park. We took the kids ice skating here!! They have awesome little shops all around the park!! We all had a great time!!!

Must see!!!. This is an absolute must see during the christmas season. The little shops set up with goods and food are amazing! The prices are very reasonable and you can get things that are very unique. Skating here is just as good as rockafella center.

Holiday Spirit Extraordinaire!. To my wife's displeasure, I brought my skates to NYC with the intent to visit the rinks at Rockefeller Center and Wollman. Our hotel is about a block from Bryant Park . . . we stayed in a different hotel adjacent to Bryant Park a few summers ago and very much enjoy the area. This was our first holiday-time visit to Manhattan and we cannot wait to return. Bryant Park's holiday market, skating rink, and Christmas tree . . . officially referred to as "Winter Village at Bryant Park" is a must-do activity. The seasonal market includes "more than 125 boutique-style shops". Food, jewelry, handcrafts, clothes, skin care products . . . all the items you would expect from a first-class holiday market. My wife shopped while I skated. Well, "skated" may be an exaggeration! Gridlock crowds everywhere . . . on the ice, in the market, throughout Manhattan! Neither of us is particularly attracted to crowds, though everyone was cordial and everyone seemed to enjoy the festivities.With very rare exception, every one of our activities during our week’s stay in NYC was fabulous; and of all those fabulous activities, the Winter Village at Bryant Park was the best!By the way, bring your own skates and admission is free. The Rockefeller Center rink is much, much smaller and charges $27 for adults. Rent skates and it’s a total of $39 at Rock Center and $19 at Bryant Park.

Always A Must-See, Especially During Christmas!. Having visited New York City on many occasions, we feel as though we're somewhat seasoned in giving helpful reviews. Bryant Park is one place we never miss...we love visiting the beautiful glass 'huts' which surround the ice skating rink during Christmas time, very festive with lovely foods and gifts for sale. This is not your local 'craft market' but rather offering somewhat average-to-upscale gifts, jewelry, gloves, hats, scarves, socks, wallets, and toys, in addition to food and beverage offerings such as hot chocolate, warm Belgium-style waffles with strawberries or bananas, delicious pastel macaroons, fudge, hot cider or coffees. Always festive, there's a beautifully-decorated giant Christmas tree adjacent to the ever-busy ice skating rink, and plenty of seating nearby for people-watching. Don't be surprised if you are asked to take a picture for someone in front of the big tree, and remember to offer the same for them!Note that within the limits of the park, is the cleanest (and attended) restroom in New York City, complete with a vase of flowers at the entrance and rotating automatic toilet-seat covers! Everyone's happy at Bryant Park!

Wonderful shops and skating. Skip the skating at Rockefeller Plaza and head to Bryant Park. Go early to beat the lines - $19 to skate as long as you want. Tons of little shops in the Winter Village that sell just about everything.

Restful. This is a well manicured space. Just behind the Library, is this great wide open space, shaded but great shade trees. There are tables and chairs as well as benches to sit and people watch, or have a cup of coffee (bring your own in a thermos). In the great hub bub of New York City, this is one of those wonderful places to pass by, pass through, or take a rest.

Christmas came to Bryant Park. This park had a perfect atmosphere, with its ice rink, Christmas tree and unique collection of Christmas markets. I would take the beautiful ambiance of Bryant Park every time over fighting the tourist crowds in Time Square and Rockefeller Center.

Love it at Christmastime!. My husband, two kids, 16 and 21, have been going to Bryant Park in December for several years. It's our first stop in the city on our overnight trip. There are dozen's of cute shops for gift buying. We eat lunch there, people watch and then enjoy watching the skaters and taking pictures by the Christmas tree. We always stop for a pickle at the pickle store.

Making you feel better than Times Square. Ice skating right next to the Empire State Building, the energy, the shops and the best Christams tree ever will leave you feel warm inside. I would not want to miss Bryant park.

Cute park with nice atmosphere. We came straight from the Rockefeller Center there since it was so overcrowded and expensive, we found the real NY Christmas atmosphere in the Bryant Park.It's a cute little park located just one subway stop from the Rockefeller Center, it also has a nice Christmas tree and the ice skating rink. There are nice little shops around the rink, it had really nice Christmas atmosphere which we were looking for.

Ice Skating in Bryant Park. We went to the Bryant Park Christmas markets two or three times during our stay in New York, it was just such a lovely place to be. There is a great view of the Empire State and it is definitely the best place to ice skate in the city. The queue seemed long but we were on the ice within half an hour (not bad for a busy Saturday afternoon) and it was well managed.We really had a great great time.

Bryant Park During the Holdiays. I actually enjoy going to Bryant Park over Rockefeller Center. There is ice skating going on and bunch of neat little shops. Plenty of snack places and restaurants on site and near by.

Lovely Park to hang out. We were there last week and the immense lawn area had been transformed into an ice-skating rink. All around it dozens of stalls were selling Christmas gifts, trinkets and food. We were lucky with the weather and it was warm enough to sit outdoors with a cup of coffee and watch the skaters. Best to walk around on a weekday, as weekends get very crowded. Great fun!

Must See ... In NYC anything can recover. 30 years ago, Bryant park was a disgrace. Loaded with bums, street people, drug dealers and prostitutes. Today it is one of the Gems of NYC.Additionally proof that the City has tremendous resilience and can bounce back from almost anything.
Love the tree. Great place to shop watch the skaters and love the Christmas tree. You can also dine there too. Great place to visit all year long.

Awesome christmas market. There was a christmas market that sells good apple ciders! Ice skating ring for anyone who finds rockerfella too crowded. For those who went after christmas, you may be keen to play table tennis in the park! There is a public space there for table tennis! Great park to walk around and do people watching.

Wonderful. We found the park this summer. A wonderful place to spend good times. There is a pretty fountain and nice little shops and at night the trees are lit with white lights that illuminate the area. We returned a few days before Christmas. To our surprise, a large ice rink embellished the place and a beautiful Christmas tree sat there at the end. It was a real pleasure to skate especially that the weather was good. For lunch we ate at the Southwest Porch. The place offers outdoor heaters. It was really nice to eat outside especially that the food was excellent. And to finish our visit, we took advantage of the small shops to purchase our last Christmas gifts. Over all, a place to discover. Ho yes, have to mention that it is free to skate there.

Bryant Park on Christmas Day. What do you do on Christmas Day when you haven't organised anything and its -7 degrees celcius outside? Ice skating of course!We wandered up from our hotel a few blocks away in the cold all bundled up. It was freezing. When we arrived at the park there were plenty of little shops set up for the holidays and we were able to get some gloves and scarves for those of us who were underprepared. There were lots of people on the ice already when we arrived at around 10.30am. The line to get in and the boot hire was quite quick and the service was excellent. We asked for the lace up boots that are better quality than the blue plastic alternatives on offer. There were people grabbing on to the sides, some gliding very slowly around the rink and a few select people with more of a grasp doing ice dancing movements (not me). The best thing was it was warmer on the ice. The sun was shining on the rink. It was the warmest I felt for the rest of the day. A very special Christmas Day experience. Highly recommended.

A wonderful oasis. A great place in summer and winter. In the summer, be sure to grab a drink at the Bryant Park Grill and enjoy the great food as well. In the winter, this is the better place to skate over Rock Center with more room on the ice and bigger facilities....very well run and organized.

Worth a visit. It's a small park compared to the huge Central Park located on the back of the New York Public Library. The most interesting thing about the park is that the citizens and the tourists of New York will never suffer from boredom while the park exists. There's always something going on there. In winter has a great ice skating rink and beautiful shops with christmas items.During the summer the park is the site of concerts and various performances. It is the ideal place to take the children.
Christmas Market at Park. Great skating rink and amazing food stalls. Overpriced Christmas tree decorations, but a great atmosphere for December.

Nice park with small shops, an ice skating ring and a big Christmas tree :). Bryant park is just behind the public library. It is not big and it has quite a few shops and a cafe / restaurant where you can enjoy your coffee or cocktail.There was a Christmas tree as it was Christmas when we visited it and an ice skating ring for the brave ones!If you just want to have a walk through the littles shops and just get a couple of pics of the Christmas tree then you will not need more than one hour (at the most).It is better if you go there after 17:00 when it is dark outside so to see the great lights!

Christmas time . Visited Bryant park while walking back to out hotel .
It just started snowing heavy at the time and was just so beautiful to see while standing in the Christmas themed parks.
The park had a beautiful ice skating rink with pink lights and Christmas market stools.
It was really beautiful
Too commercialized now. Wow this place used to be really nice but ever since they let the vendors over run this park it has gone downhill. Tourists now only go here.

A Greenspace in the Midst of the Asphalt Jungle. Bryant Park is a beautiful, but oh so crowded with people, greenspace in the asphalt jungle of Midtown New York. Most of it consists of a lawn, on weekdays totally covered with people; trees flank the sides. What's more interesting is the view of the Midtown buildings from the park. To the south-east is the towering Empire State Building, just to the north-west is the Bank of America Building (at the moment the city's second-tallest completed building), to the south is the architecturally interesting Bryant Park Hotel (1924), & to the east is the art-deco New York Public Library. Here, as everywhere in New York City, it's worth strolling with the architectural guidebook AAA GUIDE TO NEW YORK CITY.
A nice Christmas atmosphere. Bryant park at Christmas had a Christmas market and ice skating. I think the skating was free but I did see a skate rental sign for $19. It was nice to walk through.

Ice skating is amust. We went to Bryant Park to see the winter market which was beautful loads of different stalls with unusual xmas things it was quite expensive but you are in the middle of new york. We even went ice skating for three hours which only cost 15 dollars each with your skate rental. What could be better then ice skating to Michael Buble with a 60ft xmas tree at one end of the rink and the Empire state building at the other sheer magic and one of the best things to experience whilst in New york
Brillian Park. The Christmas shops are fun, the food is varied and delicious and the bar is a great place to sit under a heater and chat.

Lovely at Christmas Time. Really liked this place, so pretty at Christmas Time with the Ice Rink, big christmas tree and all the festive huts; christmas decorations, gifts, warm cider etc - very festive!
Rest Stop. Great spot to sit with a hot beverage, enjoy the skaters, and take a break from shopping or sightseeing. Warm, welcoming, family atmosphere.
This is The epitome of New York!. We visited during Christmas so there were vendors. It was quaint, great skating rink, and Christmas tree. We liked it better than Rockefeller Center.

Love Bryant Park. We went to NYC in mid-December 2013. Bryant Park had an amazing tree and ice skating rink along with some shops. It was less crowded than Rock Center. I loved it. It was so pretty when the snow was falling. It was one of my favorite places that I went to during my most recent trip!

Must visit location at Christmas time. We just visited Bryant Park and it was simply wonderful. Many local vendors sell their wares in a very classy setting, ice skating at the rink, a huge Christmas tree, good Christmas music, and just a beautiful setting very close to Times Square. We had a blast here.
Nice little park. It's small, but worrhy a visit if you're nearby. You can see the beautiful public library building as well as the grand central station nearby (both recommended)

Do Not Pass Go....... We try to get into New York as often as possible and one place we always go to no matter what time of the year is Bryant Park. During Christmas it is even prettier and more fun, if that is possible. Ice skating, wonderful food and lots of creative little booths with wonderful shopping. Great for people watching and just having all around fun place to go.

Beautiful place!. We weren't initially planning on going to this park, but while walking we came across it and decided to check it out. I'm glad we did. It's really beautiful, with all the decorations and Christmas songs. I recommend you to check it out :)

Great place. Walking on 5th Ave this is the place to stop and look around.Especially Christmas time is the best time visit.The shopping booths are lovely.The handmade goodies are very special here.You can not find them in the stores.The whole setting with the ice skating rink is just perfect,gets you in the holiday mood right away.

Beautiful park. Bryant Park is a great little park. I visited the park over Thanksgiving and I could definitely feel the spirit of Christmas with all of the little shops they had set up in their Kristkindl Market. My brother and I went ice skating at the ice rink. We had to wait in line for a few minutes to pay and get our skates, but once we got on the ice it was great. Not too crowded and no wait. The whole atmosphere of the park is amazing, Christmastime or not.

Need to relax or try something different. Whether you're site seeing or need to rest your feet, come here. Great place to wander around or catch your breath after a day of walking around NYC. At Christmas time, it's a must see. Great view of the Empire State Building lit up in green, red and white for the holiday. Also have about 100 vendors set up with food, arts and crafts, jewelry etc. Some fabulous shopping and unique gifts Easy walk from the Port Authority bus terminal. Continue east on 42nd Street to Grand Central Terminal for another NY site.

A lot of things to take in....a perfect place to unwind.. For a tourist, this is good to check out. Especially in the summer as they have so many activities - they have a carousel for kids, the table games abound in the park and at night they have a free public movie screening plus we were able to catch a food fair going on. Not bad! A sample of everything the city can offer!

Christmas wonderland. At Christmas time this place is magical. There is an ice skating rink in the middle and a beautiful Christmas tree at one end. There is shopping all around for all kinds of great hand made goodies and of course places to buy hot cocoa and hot tea to warm up. A must see for the holiday season!

Christmas market. Visited Bryant Park's Christmas market. Great selection of crafts, memorabilia, foods and drink - this is as close as you can get to a German kindlemarkt. They have a big skating rink but be aware it could be crowded, like today on Christmas Eve.

Great stopping point on a stroll down 5th avenue. If you are walking down 5th avenue, this is a nice stop that you can make. It is a beautiful park in the heart of NYC right behind the New York Public Library. Now during Christmas season is a great time to stop by this park as the Winter Village has been set up and there are many shops set up in the park as well as a skating rink. Obviously if you come during the popular times such as a weekend you will have to wait on line to ice skating, but I think that the wait times are much better than the rink at Rockefeller center.
Great Shopping. Looking for that special gift - the shops at Bryant Park are where you need to be! Found so many one of a kind items for friends on our Christmas list!
Lovely oasis. It's fun to stroll through this lovely little park, peruse the Christmas shops in winter or just enjoy the ambience in nicer weather. Check out the New York Public Library nearby.
SKATING RING. Good watching or skating, lots of christmas shops and food choicesgreat for kids and families, and the christmas tree is great

Christmas bazaar and ice skating.. I don't know if they always have the booths set up in the park or if it was just for the holidays, but there were so many different booths and so much variety, that we thoroughly enjoyed it. We bought several Christmas gifts and enjoyed watching the ice skaters.

Such a pretty little park. My SO and I came here for dinner, and then sat in the park at night looking at all the lights of the city and watching the world pass us by. A very nice little park in a really great part of the city.
Nice set up for holidays. They have a lot going on for the holidays. The ice rink is bigger than Rockefeller. Lots of pop up shops selling things. Nice views and not a far walk from Times Sq.

Love it here, especially at Christmas. Love Bryant Park, especially at Christmas time, the holiday markets are wonderful and the FREE ice skating is great. Even if you just want to watch, it has a lovely atmosphere. Could spend hours here people watching without even noticing. Great place.
