Beautiful. Very beautiful Park to bask in the Christmas spirit. The Christmas market is interesting and offers quite a variety of items for purchase. The Ice skating rink is also the best background for perfect pictures to be taken. The restrooms were clean even though it was free to use for all.
Love the Parks. Free skating!!!!! Lots of wonderful shopping and people. Looking forward to going back to sit and people watch. The day I was there it was a bit cold and windy.

Beautiful xmas tree. Very relaxing to stroll thru people watch very cute little unique shops. Enjoyed watching the ice skaters . Interesting delicious food choices very interesting. love the park.Tables with people playing checkers and chess.

Christmas Markets. Bryant Park had some great Christmas Markets. I found that unlike back in Australia many of the things sold in the markets are unique. It was rare to see something the same in any stall visited. This was true across all the Christmas markets we visited.

Best Christmas shopping in NY. Bryant Park has the best selection of unique gift buying options of any place in the city at Christmas time and it is one of the best venues for people watching anywhere. Their skating rink is bigger than Rockefeller Center and a lot easier to get on if that`s your thing. Plenty of food and beverage choices to go along with the shopping and the whole atmosphere will really put you into the Christmas spirit. We are always able to find gifts for those hard to buy for people on our list.

Great place to relax in winter or summer. I visited in Sept. and there was a great French fair on with a hot air balloon and everything, it was a great time. Was even better when I visited this week (mid-Dec. 2013) when I saw the ice skating rink for the first time. So many vendors selling items and some good food, drinks for sale also. The rink seems bigger than Rockefeller and is a lot less crowded. Just a great place right in middle of everything to kick back and relax or do some people-watching.

Great in winter nights. It's a small park but very beautiful indeed. We visited one evening close to christmas. Very nice skating rink and christmas tree; worth a visit during that time of the year, though it's no match for the Central Park.
A fun, funky, friendly little park!. Great little shops, cool bars to sit and enjoy, and free ice skating. What a perfect place to get in the holiday spirit and people watch!

no more needle park?. I'm old enough to remember when Bryant Park was known as Needle Park & was full of junkies, drug dealers & other asst crime in the NYC Bad Old Days. By around 1990 it became so bad that the park was closed for several years for a complete makeover. Overgrown bushes & hidden walkways were replaced by a large lawn surrounded by benches, tables, & chairs for midtown office workers to eat lunch & hang out in warmer weather. Bryant Park is behind the main branch buildings of the NY Public Library, & the Midtown Branch is right across the street, so many of the library visitors use the park now too. NY Fashion Week has shows in Bryant Park, & there are many other events, including outdoor film screenings in summer & a Holiday Gift Market every year from Black Friday - New Years Day. Last year, about 50 sheep grazed in a large pen in Bryant Park to celebrate, yes, Ntl Wool Week, & there's a Bocci Ball Court that's always crowded. Bryant Park has been totally gentrified & mainstreamed, but there still seems to be a bit of the old Needle Park vibe remaining. There was a shooting there last month (over the attempted theft of someone's coat), & lately there are more & more pickpocketing complaints during the summer film screenings. The free WiFi is widely publicized, but the signal is always weak & often nonexistent. Even as a lifelong Nu Yawka & a big fan of our local parks, I've never been able to warm up to this one, & the spiffy, wholesome Bryant Park doesn't really appeal to me any more than the seedy old Needle Park. There are so many wonderful parks in NYC ... my advice to out-of-towners would be to visit the other ones instead of Bryant Park. By the way, check out the 1971 movie "Panic in Needle Park" starring a young Al Pacino in one of his first leading roles.

Lovely little park with a Christmas atmosphere. The skating rink and Christmas tree are one of the loveliest we saw in New York. The Christmas shops are great (if a little overpriced) and the Google lab is good fun.

Calm in the midst of craziness. This is a great place to stop and chill out, have a coffee and just watch the people go by. Relaxing place to sit for hours in the summer and fun to shop the stalls around Christmas time.

Fantastic at Christmas!. This is a wonderful place to visit if you're in NYC around Christmas. There was a Christmas market set up - great places to shop and eat. There's a skating rink in the park. We didn't skate but enjoyed watching and eating the fantastic empanadas we bought.

Ice Rink and Holiday Markets. Bryant Park which is on 42nd Street, smack dab between Times Square and Grand Central Station is a great holiday stop. In the middle of the park is a ice skating rink fronted by a big Christmas Tree. Surrounding the rink is the Bryant Park Christmas vendors, with everything from designer hot chocolate ($5 a cup but yummy on a cold day) to designer clothes. If you have never been to NYC during the holidays, these holiday markets are located throughout the city at some parks, Columbus Circle at Central Park, Union Square, Washington Square, and Bryant Park are some of the more central locations. We like Bryant Park because it is so near to many of the main tourist attractions, such as Times Square, Grand Central Station (which has an upscale holiday market indoors) Rockefeller Center and the shops on 5th Ave. A good NYC experience for the holidays.

Neat place. Stopped by here one afternoon, as this was on the way from our hotel to Times Square. It's a pretty neat place...lots of little, unique shops and a large ice rink. We did not skate the day we visited...rink was very crowded. But I loved the atmosphere...worth a visit.

Christmas in the City. All the Christmas booths are up at Bryant Park and it is worth a visit if you want to grab a bit of the NYC Christmas Spirit. Lovely place to wander with locals and visitors and and easy stroll from here to Times Square or up a few more blocks to The Tree at Rockefeller Center. Merry Christmas Everyone.

A place to rest after rushing around the Big Apple. It,s a place to meet,a place to look at people a great free. Wi Fi and there is always SOMETHING happening,both weird and lovely:-music,dancing,singing there even used to be this lovely guy who for a quarter promised NOT to read you his awful poetry
I love this place!. For people watching, shopping/ice skating during the winter, nearby restaurants, did I mention people watching!? My dream is to live in an apt overlooking this park!

Amazing. Stayed in New York over thanksgiving and absolutely fell in love with Bryant Park. We happened upon it walking from our hotel & thought it was so nice and quaint. I loved it even more when my boyfriend proposed so we will definitely have Bryant Park as a special place for us. I thought it was a lot nicer than Rockefeller Centre for the ice skating and the little shops around it were lovely.

Always fun.... Bryant Park...especially at Christmas is just a wonderland in the middle of a concrete forest. Children and adults enjoy the big ice skating rink, some hot cocoa, and the lovely tree. Vendors loaded with all things unique and pretty entertsin the shopper while the smells of hot cider and international goodies permeate the fresh air. Just a great place all year round but really special at Christmas

great in the evening. When its cold, on your first night in New York and not thinking to take hat or gloves as it was mild when you landed, its still a great visit. At Christmas with the stalls and the ice rink, a truly captivating little world away from the high rising buildings that encroach on all sides- with a kielbasa sausage and a cranberry cider, watching the ice skating.
Busy busy. Just back from NYC and we were staying quite close to Bryant Park so we would have a mooch around when we were passing.Great xmas market. ice rink too busy for us,we prefer Central Park.

Shopping adventure. It was great with it's own tree, skating rink and places to eat. It is all outside except for 1 restaurant. Great outside bar with heaters and nice seats. Bring a blanket. Some very unique shops and the prices were not over the top.

Christmas Market one to see. With the christmas market and the ice skating in the park, it was a lovely way to spend a few hours and just around the corner from 5th Avenue and the Empire State Building.

GREAT SPOT FOR XMAS FAYRE. We visited NYC the other week and came across Bryant park, just behind the old public library on 5th Avenue and found a winter wonderland. Although it is geared up for xmas at the moment, it seems to be a little oasis all year round. Christmas lights, skating rink and a bunch of small little shops adds to the general xmas feeling you get when you go this time of year. But, I would love to see the park in the summer months when all the blooms are out.

Christmas In the Air. Bryant park has all the traditional Christmas activities in one place. The ice rink, Christmas tree, concerts, shopping stalls, et. al. are there. A not miss when in NYC at Christmas time.

Christmas shopping and ice skating in the park. Winter is a great time of year to visit Bryant Park. Lots of locals with booths in the park so you get a chance to try lots of 'off the path' eateries and shop in 'off the path' shops.

Great atmosphere. Following reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, we added Bryant Park to our visit and we are so pleased we did.Ice skating, Christmas tree, Christmas market and a great atmosphere on every visit.Well worth a visit
Christmas fair. What great shopping for unusual gifts. It's fun to watch the skaters and a great place to pick up a quick interesting snack.
Very Christmassy. The square has a Christmas market, ice rink and Christmas tree. Nice areas to sit and restaurants/cafe area. Worth a visit.

Great Spot to Relax in the Big City. Visited Bryant Park for ice skating. It was a great experience. Even though I struggled to stay upright, it was well worth it. The food and shopping stalls in the park were great too. Had some awesome creeps after a tough morning of ice skating. It was just great to unwind.

green in the middle of Midtown. a small piece of nature in the middle of the city. Seats for your bagged lunch underneath the trees. Great spot to people watch it is a nice quiet break is you just walked through Times SQ or Herald SQ

Christmas 2013. Bryant Park sits directly behind the famous NYC City Library. At Christmas there is a wonderful Market, Ice Rink and large Xmas Tree. Also it's a fantastic place to visit all year round with lots of table and chairs about to have drinks and something to eat

A Holiday Experience you shouldn't miss!. Even though I live about an hour from NYC, I don't usually make the trip to spend the day shopping. Recently I needed to spend a few Saturdays while my high school age daughter took full day classes and I decided to explore the holiday shops at Bryant Park. I had a wonderful time looking at beautiful art work, ornaments, hats, scarves and jewelry. Food vendors were varied and plentiful, the decorations gorgeous and the ice skating rink looked like a lot of fun. Most of the days I spent were fairly warm and the heaters in the shops were effective except for yesterday, during a blowing snow storm. Despite the cold, vendors remained very helpful and cheery and were not too pushy. Of course most items were a bit pricy (it's NY after all!) but you can find wonderful items in your budget if you look--and some vendors are negotiable. If you are in NYC before January 5th--don't miss it!
awesome. We visited bryant park in december, was stunning...the tree the ice rink was so christmassy.Lovely little shop/stalls around the rink some lovely gifts to buy.Must visit this park

Place to rest while walking NYC. Lots of little gems as you walk your feet off in NYC and this was one of then. we stopped here as we walked from Penn stn to grand central stn... hard to find a bathroom in NYC and this park has one!! odd to comment on a bathroom but it has an attendent and the BR was CLEAN. had a large bouquet of fresh flower at the entrance... awesome. funny how little things make a memory and an impression. time square and the bathrooms at bryant park

Made me smile!. Just a lovely break in the city! Ice skaters, hot chocolate, little boutiques, twinkling lights, and just enough overhead music to break out in a spontaneous dance! And oh, the fire (heaters) are so delightful. Let it snow!

Beautiful!. My mom and I visited here in November and the ice rink was open, as well as a bunch of other little shops perfect for Christmas shopping. It was my first time ice skating and I had a blast. There was good food all around and it was beautiful.

Lovely Place. Great place for iceskaing however when we went the ques were around the block! Beautiful Christmas Tree and Merry-go-round and chrsitmas markets just how you imagine christmas in New York.
Little gem. What a great little find this was, a lovely Christmas market was on along with ice-skating, a lovely tree and surrounded buy beautiful buildings.Worth a visit

Picturesque Winter in NYC. Bryant Park is your picturesque NYC winter scene. The ice skating rink with bright lights and couples holding hands, families enjoying eachother, friends hanging out. If you are not up for skating, there's the #wintervillage which consists of 100+ shops of knick knacks and gourmet foods. There's also a massive Christmas tree that makes for a great backdrop in pictures. Additionally, the Empire State Building is nearby and you can catch a glimpse. It happened to be bright blue last night, but changes colors often.My roommates and I came to the skating rink here last night after work and had a blast! I was always intimidated to skate here because it's usually SO packed, but it wasn't last night. Maybe because it snowed earlier in the day, or it was a random Tuesday. Whatever the reason, it made for a nice night. I'm really glad NYC has some activities with free admission. You just have to pay for skates and bag check. Luckily, I have my own pair so I just paid for bag check.

Cute!. It was a very Cute little place like a little village with all these tiny "stores" covered in liiittle little snowwhite houses . The iceskatefield was also very cute and made the ambience so comfy and peacefull. The crêpes were really expensive!!!!!!!

Unexpected goodness in NYC. During the holiday season, there's a skating rink and swanky white tents with nice furnishings for you and your friends to enjoy the atmosphere. Also, there were some semi-permanent stalls setup for vendors to sell their crafts. Some of them offer handmade crafts at reasonable prices.

Give yourself a couple of hours. We walked around all the booths and watched the ice skaters. The rink seemed much less crowded than the one at Rock. We bought a couple of NYC specific ornaments at a vendor, and made a video in the computer store.

Lovely Christmas setting. Just a short walk from the Westin, where we stayed, and it was a perfect Christmas setting. The sessional ice rink was full to Christmas revellers.
Had the most amazing hot chocolate from a stall their! "No chewing allowed"

I love Bryant Park. Who doesn't love Bryant Park? It's been renovated so it's a place worth visiting all year round. In summer and spring, a great place to picnic and find shade. In fall and winter look for the holiday stalls, buy a hot chocolate, watch the skaters or rent some skates and get in line. There's a tiny working carousel, and the cleanest public restrooms in NYC. And the NY Public Library is right next door, the Morgan is close by.

Winter wonderland. Bryant Park is totally transformed from the summer. In the winter, there is a FREE skating rink for those who have their own skates. The rink is surrounded by Xmas stalls, which were by in large tasteful.

Fun Iceskating. Ice skating is family-friendly and fun. Staff is courteous and friendly. Admission is free to the ice rink, but skate rentals are $15 and if you're a woman, you can't bring your purse or a bag on the rink, you will need a locker. The lockers are free but to rent a lock is $9, so bring your own lock if you have one. If you bring your own skates and lock, it will cost you nothing!
Very nice area. Vendors were there selling their wares for Christmas. People were enjoying the winter sunshine by playing ping pong and ice skating. Great park to visit.

Awesome place for holiday merriment!. Bryant Park is a holiday wonderland in December. There are darling little shops with lots of unique gifts, there are decorations and food vendors, and even a bar with fire pits and heaters to sit around and enjoy some holiday cheer. I'm so glad we spent time here during our holiday visit to NYC!

Fun to walk around.. This used to be called "Needle Park" because of the drugs and drug users camped there. It was cleaned up years ago and is now safe and fun. Much of what's for sale is of little consequence.
nice Christmas market. Shopping, skating, food vendors - and a beautiful tree! The Southwest Airlines Back Porch is a great place to sit and have a glass of wine while people watching.
Great place to stop on walk to hotel from Port Authority!. Christmas village atmosphere. 125 vendors, plus the ice skating. People friendly and much to explore at Christmas time.
Christmas village. High prices and not novel but fun to move around and look. Nicely decorated tree. Food and beverages available.

Magical Christmas spot.. Bryant Christmas market is really something special. Went there with my son and daughter in law Thanksgiving weekend and it was wonderful.
Sitting under a heater, sipping spiced cider, watching the world go by and it started snowing.
Very special place.

Fun Location for Holidays. Bryant Park is a really nice place to visit that doesn't attract huge crowds but has plenty to offer. The ice rink is used and enjoyed by all ages, plus it's bigger than Rockefeller Center rink. Lots of little shops set up for the holidays with a variety of offerings.

Winter festival was happening. We stopped here while wandering around the city. There was a winter festival with skating and tons of vendors. The day was warm for December and tons of sites to see. They even had a skating rink set up!

Great food and shopping. Really enjoyed walking through Bryant park and sampling some of the many food options. Most all places offer small inexpensive servings so you can easily and affordably try a variety. Favorites where the waffle and meat ball sliders!

always fun. best time to visit is at Christmas time when all the kiosks/shops are open and ice skating and the Christmas spirit is alive and it is pretty! Fun shops and nice to just stroll, enjoy a hot cocoa and be outside in the city! love the park, go over to the NY library while in the area!!! amazing building!!

Chic park. I just love Bryant Park, it is a place where you feel like transferred to another world. People just chill, read books, picnics. The park is right in the middle of tall buildings and next to NY public library. Beautiful scenery. It is the mixture of the past and the future, the fashionistas and the literaries.

Holiday Shops are Awesome. Bryant park is always great but even better with the holiday shops and ice rink set up. It is a great place to do some Christmas shopping. With hot cider and some other yummy (but fattening) snacks it is easy to spend some time here. There are bathrooms on the side of the park - kudos to the wonderful staff that manages to keep them extremely clean. And they are beautiful buildings in their own right.The park is an oasis in the middle of all that concrete!

My Favorite Magical Place at Christmas!. I have been going to Bryant Park every year at Christmastime. Was there last night and it never gets old. The skating rink is great and not very crowded. The Christmas Tree was lit and as beautiful as ever. We took our traditional picture under the tree. There were about the same amount of vendors this year as last. Most vendors are pleasant to deal with. Grab a drink and sit in the middle of the park where they have nice chairs and heaters, or grab a snack at one of the vendors. There is something for everyone. For me, the serenity of the park, amidst the hustle and bustle of the city is priceless. A must see for anyone.
Loved this Park. Just a short walk from Time Square, this Park is a haven and this time of the year is a Winter Wonderland with the Ice Skating and Christmas Market.

Watching the skaters. Went to NYC for the Radio City Christmas show. Wanted to watch the skaters at Rockefeller Center, but they were setting up for the next day's Christmas tree lighting TV special. After my date and I enjoyed the show we walked towards Times Square. We looked over at Bryant Park and saw shops set up for Christmas and heard music. The were having their Christmas Tree lighting event. There was music galore and the numerous shops were a delight to visit. We sat down and watched the skaters for over an hour. Young, old, couples, singles, men, women all forgot their problems for a while and were enjoying the ice. Some were very talented, while others were still learning. A great visit during the holiday season. Take time if you are in NYC during the Christmas holiday to visit this site.

Great to relax and enjoy the festive atmosphere. This park is just a wonderful place to sit back relax, watch the world go by and enjoy the ice skating. Plenty of nice stall selling hot drinks and food and lots of lovely wee novelty shops

One of my favourite spots in NYC. This was our first trip to NYC and we never even heard of Bryant Park until we got here. We have spent portions of two of our four days in NYC here. It's great to have a bite, enjoy the outdoors, people watch and grab a few gifts... Or even window shop. Honestly love it!

Great park - year round.. Any time of year, this is a great park to meet at and enjoy. The winter village is fantastic and available ice skating. It takes you out of the hectic city and infuses the magic of Christmas.

A relaxing, enjoyable, and fantastic winter experience.. I've been to New York countless times and have always enjoyed strolls through Bryant Park after visiting the NYPL. This was my first time, however, visiting at Christmas time.I've never enjoyed this park as much as I have until last night. Bryant Park takes the bustle out of New York and really places you into an intimate, cozy, and warm setting. Winter Fair is a vacation on vacation in the heart of the city.Multiple vendor booths make walking around quite fun, encountering new finds and interesting things to purchase.Take the time out of your day to decompress and relax. Enjoy a skate (cheaper and FAR LESS busy than the sometimes insane rink at Rockerfeller).Sure, you may not have that magical "Rockerfeller" experience, but being surround by lights, lovely people, and a great view of the lit-up Empire State Building make Bryant Park a must-see, particularly at this magical time of year.

A New York Experience. Every city should have a Winter Fair like Bryant Park. It's minutes from Macy's. Vendors were set-up throughout the park along with food booths. There's even a restaurant. Tables outside had tabletop lamp heaters. Free ice skating. A must see if you are in Manhattan for the holidays!

Ice Skating Adventure. We had an amazing time ice skating in Bryant Park in the Winter Village. The regular line wasn't too long, about 25 minutes, and the staff was super helpful for those who were slow skaters. All the surrounding shops and tiny bars were great too. Super nice people!!! Can't wait to go back.

A pretty little oasis amongst the madness. Plenty of places to sit and people watch. Good concession stand, though a bit pricey. Clean, relatively quiet and a nice place to decompress right in the middle of NYC.

Everyone loves this amazing Park. besides the fact, this park is just right beside New York Public Library which is one of the top 10 must see in NY from my prospective, it has a lot of things you can find it fancy. If you are a person who is tired of big Central Park, this park would be your one of the best. This is just about the size for hanging spend your day time with your friends and family. You can find nice restaurants just across the road. Starbucks is around the corner you can have coffee and bring it to the park. You can bring some quick bite as well.

Great to meet. Love this place and you can always find a spot to sit in comfort. I often take a book and have my lunch in the park. Good for people watching and brilliantly situated between Grand Central and Times Square. For me always a place to take visitors.

A must during Christmas time. December 2012....Love this park especially during Christmas time. If you want to sit and eat inside, I've tried the make-shift restaurant there called Celsius and it was fairly priced with good food. My favorite thing is the crepe stand and sitting by the firepit. They are SOOOO good and so many to choose from.

Lovely garden park with free internet. I love Bryant Park! It has something for everyone. You can visit as a solo, couple, family ...and still enjoy it. You can read a book, play or watch table tennis, or simply sit and admire the beauty of nature. It's a recommend stop for a tired tourist who just wishes to catch his breath.There is free internet, so your phone, ipads, laptops will work and the speed is pretty good too.Because i saved the internet log in, each time i passed by (it was walking distance from my hotel), all my mails will be downloaded and i can quickly check them.There are cafes to get a snack and have coffee. It also has a library.They have bathroom facilities for guestsIt's about 10 minutes walk from here to Time Square and also about 6 minutes walk to Grand Central Station in the opposite direction. (almost in between )Take some time out to visit Bryant Park. You'll love it!

Bryant Park. In spring and summer you can sit and enjoy the park. Bring lunch or buy it at one of the local eateries in the area or the park itself. In the winter come skate and browse the shops for the holidays. Summer also brings outdoor movies.

I love this park!. I've been here several times. When in NYC I always make a point of spending a bit of time here. I love the feel of this place. It's a quaint, user friendly green spot in the city. Many activities going on all the time, free of charge. Books, chess, checkers......and the list goes on. I've only been in Spring, Summer, Fall so I have no info for the winter season. Great place to take a break. It's right behind the public library, so if you get there, go around back and check out this great park.

Cute little Park. A very cute little Park in NYC , we were there during Thanksgiving, they had Shops set up there like a Christmas Market,very cute,my kids went skating,nice little Bar Stand with Heating Lamps and a Fireplace in the middle.
The Best!. Great little park behind the NYC Public library. Relax, play or dine. Great day or night. Without a doubt our favourite NYC spot

Exciting. I love this park! There are so many restaurants and cafes surrounding it... including one of my favorite bakeries, Lady M, which has the best crepe cakes anywhere. The park itself is quite exciting with food stalls as well as an ice skating rink during winter. Love it!
Nice market and ice rink. No idea what it's like at other times of the year but in Nov / Dec, there are loads of food stalls and an ice rink so nice to drop in and wander around and have a look.

Winter Park!. We went during the winter park set up. The skating rink was full and had lots of kids skating. The shops were cute. Purchased some hot chocolate to stay warm. NYC public library at other end of block.

Busy during holiday season. Nice place to shop / skate. we stopped at Bryant Park after dinner on our way home. There are so many little unique shops to check out. It is also a good pace to people watch and if you get cold standing around - go into a nearby shop to warm up. Check out the wares also and you may find something cool. we also like to watch the skaters while drinking Hot Chocolate. It is a fun time any time of the year. There is a charge if you want to go skating and the waiting line is usually quite long.

Fun place to spend an hour or so. Happened upon the Holiday Market at Bryant park on our first evening in NY and subsequently made several visits there to browse around all the stalls. Lovely atmosphere, several yummy food and drink stalls, gorgeous arts and crafts and the skating rink far more attractive than the Rockefeller centre's. Not sure what's on offer there the rest of the year.

Great Stop!. Cute shops with varied items although vendors can be a bit aggressive. Skating rink is just so inviting. Kids are already planning a return trip. Nice options to eat and drink-- really an iconic and festive stop with a great Empire State Building View. Really worth the trip!

a bit of europe in the middle of midtown manhattan. No matter what time of the year, this park is decked out to celebrate the seasons. The best part of this shaded and well groomed park are all the chairs and sitting tables for patrons. The park is slightly raised so that is not literally on street level and it makes a world of difference. The big surprise in the late November and december timeframe is the ice skating ring and bavarian market place similar to the christmas markets in eastern europe; quite impressive and well laid out for visiting.

Ice skating in the heart of mid town. An amazing scenery!! The ice ring seats on the middle of Bryant Park, limited by small charming shops and surround by the tall New York buildings.If you plan to do same ice skating in NY, this is the spot. On the other and, if you are an experienced ice skater, you may find the ring too crowded.The skates rental fee was 14$ in Dec2012
always fun. the holiday bazaar, ice staking and setting in the heart of manhattan are hard to beat. by all means go.

Winter Village at Bryant Park. If you visit Bryant Park during the holiday season, be sure to check out the Winter Village. It is a holiday event with boots set up with local artists, specality booths selling hot chocolate and many crafts that are unique and most of them made in NYC by local artists.

great winter holiday shops. we loved the shopping indeed(there until like January 1 or so); watched the skaters, too. ((we were there when the shooting, random, yet a shooting of two, happened at night Saturday Nov. 9))granted that could happen ANYWHERE, yet it did seem to take a while for police to arrive from a block down at Times Square...Next morning, all was back to normal and like new...just to mention...

A gem in the middle of the city!. Bryant Park is a gem. I make sure to enjoy it each time while in NYC. There are so many entertainment opportunities...piano at lunch, chess/checkers, putting range, drinks on the Southwest Porch, french merry-go-round, out-door library, free wi-fi through out the park.....where to stop, I could keep going. It's a very relaxing atmosphere and wonderful for families or friends to meet. Don't miss it!

Cute little park!!. As a New Yorker, I have seen the park through all four seasons. In the summer, you can have coffee and a snack at a table while people watching and listening to the heartbeat of the city. In the evenings, if you're lucky, you can check the activity schedule and catch a movie on the lawn if you get there in time to grab a spot. In autumn, you get to "observe" NY Fashion Week. Unless you're an insider of course, receive an invite and attend a show. I always enjoy just watching the tents and seeing fashionistas come and go. In winter, you can grab a coffee and go ice skating on the ice rink. If you're too cold, you can have dinner and drinks in the restaurant at the other end, next to the NY Public Library. In NYC for a visit? You have to stop by!!

Lots of unique items . This park was neat. We were here in early November, so aside from the creative gems for sale in the tiny store fronts within the park, there were many vendors selling goods on the street. Lots of good food to try as well--loved our snack from Mighty Balls! Merry-go-round is very cool as well.

Holiday market at Bryant park. This is a really fun holiday event. There are glassed-in booths set up all throughout Bryant Park. They sell a variety of crafts, jewelry, soaps, hats, gloves, scarfs. There are many booth selling food and hot chocolate as well as hot cider. There is am ice skating rink in the park with free admission, but paid skate rental. There are many benches and tables throughout the park, and a carousel. You can sit and sip a hot drink and watch the skaters or the children o the carousel. It is best to go on a day when it's not too cold as you will be outside most of the time.

Holiday craft fair and ice skating behind New York Public Library. My wife and I went to Bryant Park between 41st and 42nd streets off 5th Avenue during a recent trip to New York City. The park was set up with a series of booths selling crafts items and food. In the center there was an open ice skating rink. We had fun strolling up and down the aisles and popping into booths that looked interesting. Strolling is appropriate because of the crowds of other people doing the same thing. In addition to the crafts artwork and clothing there were a number of booths selling ethnic foods of various kinds. We did not participate in the ice skating which was crowded as well. The area is family friendly though I would not recommend trying to navigate a stroller through the narrow aisles.

Great place to go for a pleasant stroll. My wife had a great time walking around Bryant Park. We enjoyed having a banana hot chocolate while watching people skate on the outdoor rank. There were several small shops open for the holiday season. It was a very relaxing and pleasant way to spend an evening.
Be there in the Winter. In the winter they have winter shops and crafters along with ice skating and food. Wonderful place to visit and easy access alb by subway

Wonderful city park. We went to Bryant Park a few times during beautiful fall weather, and other than a bit of construction noise (they were installing the ice rink) it was serene and comfortable. We watched older men playing chess and backgammon, ate our lunch at a little table under the plane trees, and even noticed a small bookcase with children's books in the playground area! Of course, it's just behind the wonderful public library - I will bring my grandchildren next time.

love it. we spent hours and hours at the reading room in Bryant Park- what an absolutely outstanding and unique experience.also happened to be in town for the Taste of France festival held at Bryant Park.The park itself is a beautiful huge area and we enjoyed sitting here on many occasions.
Lovely Place for Holiday Shopping. Great place to shop for holiday gifts! You can't go wrong with a thick, hot cup of hot chocolate and ice skating after some light shopping!
Al;ways worth a visit.. Go ice skating....it's free! ($15 if you need to rent skates) or challenge a local to some ping pong. Tables are on the north side of the park.

Green Spot. Absolutely wonderful green spot right in the middle of Manhattan. Five minutes walk from Gand Central Station. Perfect anytime during the year. Have a sandwich and a cold drink and relax in the shade on a hot summer's day. In the winter - hot drinks, Christmas Market and an ice rink.

Lots of kiosk style shops and a skating rink. Great little park located behind the New York public library. This park has an outdoor skating rink with a ton of shopping. The shops are all outdoor kiosks selling a wide variety of unique products. One was selling vinyl records cut out with your name. We had hot cider from one vendor and it was really good. Great little park to visit especially if you skate.

Eventful and pleasant. There was an ice skating rink set up in the back that had great music playing and people of all ages really enjoying it. There was a vendor in the front that had Nutella Crepes. My wife swore it was worth every penny... a delicious, warm, sweet and well-made crepe on a cold winter night!

Lots to see. Enjoyed watching the skaters at the rink and would like to have had a go myself but didn't have the time. I believe that this is one of the cheaper places to skate, free admission but fee for skate hire. When I was there, there was various little markets to visit.

Lovely in November. Visited 3 times in our 9 day stay in NYC. Just loved the atmosphere of the Holiday Market (esp the Max Brenner Hot Chocolate) and the Ice Rink. Beautiful buildings to admire while strolling the park, esp the NY Public Library which is a must-do.

Cute little shops and great "scenery",,. We were very lucky that we visited on a beautiful, warm day. It was so much fun to sit and have lunch and watch the ice skaters - which is free!! The little shops were adorable - with lots of unusual gifts!! The ones with the chandeliers were my favorites!!

Amazing stop on your NYC trip. Bryant Park is a great great spot. In the Winter you can go skating without the long lines of Rockefeller. Great little craft vendor/booths with anything you can imagine. This place is just flowing with creative artists, coffee and baked good stands, and the most amazing smelling popcorn in the world. Definitely make sure that Bryant Park is on your NYC to do list.

Always something new. We visited Bryant Park several times during our four day stay - it was close to our hotel, the weather was beautiful and it was fun to people watch. We happened to catch 'A Taste of France' one day, which was a blast. The street entertainers, mini golf and fountain create a wonderful ambiance.

Lovely. It's such a special park and very French in feeling. During the holiday time of year, the ice rink and surrounding shops are lovely. Most of all, the rest of the year, this is the oasis from the bustle city that it's meant to be. It's a lovely place to stop and relax midtown.

Holiday Fun. Bryant Park, at least during the Fall, is a great holiday stop. The Park is loaded with interesting stalls selling food and merchandise, there is an ice skating rink in the center of the Park, and there is a restaurant/bar from which you can enjoy the view while eating/drinking. We enjoyed it enough that we made two visits to the Park on our most recent NYC trip.

Nice stalls. Really liked the small market stalls and the different food available and the nice warm fire around the bar area,the ice rink was pretty busy when we visited and there had even been a shooting the night before !z,

Nice area. This was right next to the New York public library so you would wise to put these two together. There were lots of maret stalls and a skating rink (I guess this is seasonally dependant!!). Nice areaof town

Visit the holiday boutique!. The park was set up with it's ice skating rink and holiday kiosks and food vendors already (11-10-13) which was a plesant surprise. Prices were average for New York City, skating rink not as crowded as Rockefeller Center. You can sit and enjoy the skaters while having a hot beverage and some food. I would go back again.

Cool spot for ice skating. We brought our two tweenagers here during our NYC visit for a quick spin on the ice. Our daughter was a bit reluctant to try out the ice as it was very busy with loads of youngsters buzzing about. My son took to it like a duck to (ice) water. Prices were reasonable for skate hire and the changing area was well laid out. We were there too late to enjoy the shopping around the park but there did seem to be some quaint and unusual outlets for your Christmas shopping.
Quaint, tree-lined park, next to public library. Lovely park with shops, tree-lined places to sit and eat, rest, etc. right next to the public library.

Great place to relax in the summer. We were there in July (sorry for the late review). we wandered around, had a sandwich, watch a show in the square of Asian drumming, played scrabble in the park and just sat and people watched. The scrabble game was cool. on the north side of the park, they have a little area where you can pick out a game and sit and play. It was a scorching hot day, so it was nice to sit in the shade and relax.AND I got my highest score ever!!!!!!!!! 412!!!!!!!!! : )

Great park for kids of all ages!. We always try to stop by Bryant Park and take a carousel ride. This year we lucked into the Christmas Market, the ice rink, AND the carousel. Such a nice place to stroll for adults and children.
Great place for a relaxing pint!. Lovely outdoor heated area for drinks after checking out the stalls and skating!! Loved this leafy location surrounded by sky scapers! Worth seeing.

Relaxing spot in busy Manhattan. Bryant park is in the heart of Midtown surrounded by skyscrappers. when warm the park is busy with people relaxing, enjoying lunch or taking a break from the urban jungle. one thing i like about NYC is the seating provided and Bryant park has this in abbundance. the small shops provide food and drink or you can buy your food elsewhere and picnic.its well worth a stop on your busy stay.

A beautiful park with street fair and ice skating. Located behind the New York City Library is Bryant Park. Lovely setting in the middle of Manhattan with an extensive semi-permanent street fair. Many artisans and food stands, several organic or free trade. Also available is ice skating on a fairly large rink, they even have a Zamboni!Strange side note: my wife used the public ladies room and commented that it was spotless with a woman diligently cleaning surfaces and stalls non-stop. She said it was almost the cleanest she had ever seen...and it's a public restroom in NYC!Great for an afternoon browsing for something special. Try it, it's a unique NY experience!
Ice skating. We came across Bryant park on our wanders and the ice skating rink in the centre. It was magical to watch and great to see many young people out enjoying themselves.
Ice skating. By the Centrla library is Bryant park. Small business units have been installed. There are tables and chairs available to all. The ice skating rink was fun both for users and viewers.

Cute little park. A fun NYC experience is to check out the free Monday night movie in the summer time. Bring your blanket, wine, cheese and friend. Show up early as lawn space goes fast! (lawn opens at 5 and movie is at dusk) it does get crazy crowded so a health dose a patience will go a long way as people creep into your space and walk on your blanket... Welcome to NYC!
Ice rink bars and market. We were here just as yhey are getting ready for thanksgiving so the park was really buzzing. lovely by day or evening

Nice park in middle of city. When we visited, they were setting up for the holiday market so lots of construction around. It would probably be more fun in December. Park seems to get a lot of visitors but not crowded.

Renovation in progress. Locate near The New York library. Some renovation works is on going, and some oart are closed due to private event at that time. So no much to see but the area is quite big wih some chair to sit.

A summer place. Great place in summer for free big screen films and to relax on the lawn or the seating around the park and right next to the Library with the Lions seen in most films about that area.
Holiday season must. When we visited Bryant park it was setting up for the holiday season. Lots of little kiosks with all manner of merchandise and a ice rink. A good spot for some seasonal fun
All year round. There is seating and lawns in the summer and ice skating in the winter. A great place to take a break that's only a few blocks from Times Square.
Another oasis. Lovely spot. great icecream. Children's entertainment. Lawn, plenty of seats. Great for people watching.
green music meets & greets. right in the middle of the city a place for kids (caroussel), lunch-time, chess players and tourist... there is a restaurant with good seatings!
lovely park. This is a lovely little park beside the Public Library and it is nice to sit here and watch the world go by.

Nice place to sit. We found this park whilst waiting for the theatre one evening.
It has a bar a reading room lots of games for people o play and is a really lovely space in the middle of busy New York a little gem.

Sitting in the sunshine and eating lunch. What a great place to people watch, eat lunch and enjoy the sunshine on a lovely October day. Lots of people to watch, relatively clean for an outdoor spot, and little noise. What a day!

Delightful Oasis in NYC. What a wonderful small park. I felt like I was in Paris, only it was NYC. The park is definitely worth seeing and sitting in, enjoying a little coffee. It's where the New Yorkers hang on a beautiful day. It is adjacent to the iconic New York City Library. While NYC tends to be a hectic place, I just sighed "ah" when I got there and relaxed. Savor this place and don't miss it as you are walking on the famed 42nd Street.

We love it here!. Free ice skating in the citipond during the winter. Very clean bathrooms! I was so surprised how clean they were for public bathrooms. Great place to relax and sit when you need some downtime in the city. Starting in November they have great 'huts' set up for shopping - specialty shops. We just love it here!
Surprise. Hadn't read about this park but we stumbled across it and had lunch siting out in the sunshine. Was lovely, there was also a number of activities you could participate in

I love this park!. Every time I go to New York City, I make time to stop by Bryant Park whether it's in the summer or winter. This park is quaint with personality that almost seems a bit out of place in the middle of New York but it's a welcoming place.If you're lucky enough to go after November, the skating rink will be up and you can skate for free. Also, the local's display their wares, and it's a great place to buy souvenirs or presents for yourself. I highly recommend this unique little park.

Who knew?. I wouldn't make this a destination - but if you're wandering through New York at night - this is a lovely place to stroll into or have a drink. After years of serious neglect and degeneration the park is enjoying a renaissance and is almost there aside from the lingering smell of human urine, which unfortunately, given a city this size and the impact of housing the city's homeless for so long, cannot be helped.

Great park in a hectic town. I loved Bryant Park. It was a nice haven in a very busy city. I loved being able to stop off, grab a sandwich, sit in the sun and just watch the people.I especially enjoyed the children's carousel, it was nice to be reminded that children still had a fun place to visit in a very adult town.

A Nice Sunday Afternoon. We happened upon the park on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. As an outsider it was neat to see typical NewYorkers enjoying a lazy afternoon...a birthday party among friends, parents reading to their small children, families riding the carousel and people just enjoying the.lovely park. The next time I go to New York I would love to spend more time there.
Beautiful at Christmas. It's very busy at Christmas time, but it's absolutely beautiful! It's enjoyable to watch all of the people on the ice skating, and the lights and tree are magnificent!
I love this park. Small part but always something going on. Nice place to sit and visit. Now has a bar and coffee house.

Nice Spot to Relax. This was on my list for this trip to NYC. It is right behind the NYC Public Library, which was also on my list. While waiting for the library to open, we toured the park. It is very nicely landscaped and amazingly well maintained. They were setting up for winter with the installation of the ice rink, and what looked like booths for vendors. There are spots to order food and drinks, and also a little carousel. Seating is available all over the area. Kind of a nice oasis in downtown... Need to put on your list

Great space in centre of NY. On my first full day in NY I was stumbling through crowded streets and Avenues, rather enjoying the noise and bustle that goes with all of that, when I came upon Bryant Perk, quite by accident. I had seen it marked on the map but did not imagine it would be such a pleasing and peaceful green space. Such a delightful place to sit and and while away some time midst the craziness of the city. Some fine dining available close by, and a delightful round-a-bout for small children to ride, or should it be called a Carousel here? I'm not sure. Close to the library so a place to come and read your book, or an ideal site for city workers to bring their sandwiches and just chill out for an hour. Such a delightful space.
One of my favorites. Bryant Park is one of my favorite places in New York. The atmosphere is fantastic. But I rather go there when the Citi Pond is not operating.
Pretty sweet park. Lots if history, lots of lunch time folk milling about. As far as NYC parks go, it's great. All it's missing is a Wichcraft in the middle of the park.
Very enjoable. The park is behind the public library, a beautiful building... Calling it a park is a little strange if you're expecting central park... But is a wonder anyhow!
Great visit!. Atmosphere was perfect! Great place to sit and soak in the city! Convenient to midtown, Grand Central Station, and the Empire State Building.
Sandwich in the park. Great park for people watching, very close to Grand Central. Ok sandwiches from the stand in the park and lots of tables to loll about at, passing the time.
nice little get away. After lots of walking, a nice place to relax, eat and chat. You might enjoy a peaceful lunch. Is very near New York Public Library too.
Get the Audio Tour. A real gem. We went there to kill time before a show and had a great time. But download the audio tour - we did it on iTunes - before you go. It's free and it's very well done.

Enjoyable park. This is one of my favorite besides Central Park . I come here all year round. Winter months they have the ice rink, holiday shops,restaurant and bars. You can get sandwiches, hot chocolate etc. warmer months they have out door cafe where you can have cocktails . Definitely after work scene. They have a calendar of events going on. Movie night, yoga, bocce, and chess. Truly a great park
Just joy!. Great atmosfer, place to relax and take some pictures all year around! I love have a cappuccino just have nice conversation.

Tranquil Oasis. Right in the middle of Midtown Manhattan lies this wonderful medium sized park which ideal for taking a relaxing break from hectic sightseeing and shopping. The local workers obviously love going there to eat their takeaway lunch and just sit and relax. A great people watching area, public toilets and subway are all there

A nice place to relax. A place full of beautiful trees, offering its guests the opportunity to relax, reading a book, listening to music or simply enjoying the tranquillity of the place in the hustle and bustle of the big city. Great view of the Empire State building at night and close to New York's Public library.

Looking forward to December. Great park with reading area and games area. They were just putting the skating rink together this weekend. Look forward to seeing it and the little shops around the edges in a couple of months. Still a great place to get away from the bustle of NYC and sit and relax

Great location. We took a much needed break from a crazy day sight seeing on our walk from times square to grand central station. Beautiful park. Get some food, relax, people watch, nice little spot in the middle of a hustling city.

Enjoy it like the locals. What a great tip this was for us. Right behind New York Central library. A lovely park with informal seating and great atmosphere. There is a brilliant little cafe within and you can just suck up New York. Make sure you check the website as there is always something going on whether there be dancing, music or other form of frivolity. A real nice evening after wandering round in the floodlight park, the locals are not wrong..

Perfect park for a mid-day rest. I love this park! its location is perfect for those roaming around mid town, it's near grand central, the public library, Times square, etc. The park is clean and full of a mixture of locals taking their lunch breaks, parents with young children, and tourists. There are a few small eateries, beer (which can be consumed only in designated places), public restrooms, a merry go round, and games. There is WiFi.

Serenity Surrounded by Skyscrapers. Bryant Park is a destination everytime we are in NYC. In the winter, the ice skating is relaxing to watch or a fun family experience and the Christmas tree is spectacular. Before the holidays, shops, little kiosks, are set up on the park to walk in and shop for anything - hats, chocolates, ornaments, CDs, jewerly in the usually green, grassy summer park. Such a fun time after lunch at the Bryant Park Grill. Our friends were unaware of the shops and delighted by this 'new' experience. These local New Yorkers met us for lunch and then discovered the shops and chocolates and just about anything you might need or not...but definitely fun.Bryant Park is transformed during the holidays into this winter wonderland of shopping, having lunch and relaxing with friends. Just blocks from Macy's, Herald Square and the Chrysler Building, this park is the perfect place to relax - summer or winter. Great photos of the Chrysler Building, and my friends, and husband, still indulge my photographing of the glass, steel, skyscrapers surrounging this beautiful, quaint park - the juxtaposition of these buildings adjacent to this serene, peaceful park is captivating.

Lovely park!. A cab driver told us that Bryant park is his favorite park in the city. He described it as fairy tailish and he is correct. A great park at the New York Public Library. Grab coffee and breakfast and enjoy a peaceful morning at Bryant Park.
I love Bryant park!. I love it! This is very good place to have a rest and have some very pleasant atmosphere!! Trees and grass glads eyes!!!

Oasis in Midtown. Next to the Public Library. This park is a well-used public green space. People respect the lawn closure when it's in effect. There are plenty of tables, chairs, & benches to sit, relax, & people watch. Apparently, the park used to be the haven for drug addicts and street people, but that aspect has obviously changed. There's even a carousel for the kids!

Quiet park in the middle of the city. Bryant Park is a pleasant area to escape to. It’s behind the New York Public Library. The first thing I saw was a sign “Reading Room”. This started in 1935 during the depression for those with no job, no money and nowhere to go. No cards required, just sign the books in and out. In the 1940s it closed with the onslaught of jobs. It has reopened in 2003 with the same idea has back in 1935. There are plenty of tables and chairs to sit and relax, perhaps read a book or work on your laptop. Probably for some office people nearby bring their lunch and enjoy the sunny day.There are 14 animals to pick for a ride on Le Carousel plus listen to French cabaret music. There is also a restaurant with an outdoor patio as well right behind the library in the park.

A nice place to rest in the big city. The park is located behind the public Library building. Park is not particularly large, but very nice and clean. Great to do a short break in the middle of the day and give your feet some rest after a long walk in the city.

A little Oasis. This is a very nice park, in the middle of the city, near 5th avenue. It's a little oasis, so relaxing, the perfect place where to stop to have your lunch or rest for a coffee during your busy day in NY. There is also a bar/restaurant where you can go in the evening for dinner or for a drink. This is one of my favorite spots!

A lovely surprise. We were walking back to our hotel from 42nd street to 40th and stumbled across this wonderful park.All the different little shops of craft etc were just wonderful and so interesting. We could have spent all day there just looking at what was on offer. We didn't skate, but we did have a lovely time watching those who were skating.We visited in October 2012, before the hurricane!

Been there when they made a construction work for a concert. I've been there during the fall by night.It seems like a very nice place to fang out maybe sitr on a cafe nearby.While we've been there they started assembled a stage for a concert or something. There were lots of maintenance personnel and the place was less attractive. I'm sure on other days this place looks much better.and while you are there go and have a look at the public library nearby.

Best park in the city. This park is exciting and relaxing at the same time. Small enough to walk around the whole thing during lunch, big enough to have a lot of fun things going on at all times. Bring your lunch, or grab a sandwich on site and enjoy a mini vacation from your work day..
Hit the Shake Shack!. During your stroll in the park... If pangs of hunger rumble your tummy visit the Shake Shack for great burger , shake, or ice cream cone.
Love Bryant Park. Bryant Park is a nice cozy park. Easy to get to and walk through. Right next to the library and lovely at night. Perfectly safe lit with tiny lights. Very romantic.

One of our favourite spots in NYC!. This park is just amazing! On the same block as the New York public library, it has a large green space, tree-lined walkways with lots of chairs and tables, beautiful fountain, a carrousel (which grown ups can ride too!), coffee + bagel shop, chess boards and ping pong tables, all in the centre of bustling downtown Manhattan just off 6th Ave. We came here many times over our 7 days in NYC just to relax or to make a stop for a coffee/bagel on our bike trip. Cannot recommend this little oasis enough! *NYC secret* This is one of the cleanest public bathrooms you can find downtown!
Very cosy. A very enjoyable park in the middle of the city. Perfect for some rest, some food or just some walking.It's great to have those thousands seats and benchs in the grass and just relax.

Oct visit - love to relax in the park.. A great full size park just behind NY Public Library. Nice big green lawn (in Oct) with a trek surrounding the lawn. The trek is dotted with a Carosel, board games, drinks & foods, reading area (books/magazines/newspapers available), a nice big water fountain,-- all smack in the middle of a bustling city. After a previous day of constant running and ending with a late broadway show, this park was the perfect remedy to calm the nerves the following day to just sit back, stroll, and enjoy the day and people watching.We visited the same park in February when it was converted into a full scale ice skating center with tents/food venues, etc. A totally different feeling in February, but still a nice way to kick back and relax in the city.

Nice park. Nice park next the New York Public LIbrary. Loved the grounds, the people watching, the statues in the park, the sandwich place, the coffee shop, the chairs to sit and people watch and the proximity to the library. Nice park.

An amazing green space amongst the skyscrappers. Bryant Park is a real gem, it was very close to the Marriott Hotel where we stayed..we made it "our park" during the stay and passed through it/sat in it/watched the world go by every day.. to be so close to the action and yet sitting on the grass, drinking at the bar was what holidays are all about. Real American workers came to the bar after work, all friendly. A film crew was shooting a German movie and we watched it taking shape. There was an outdoor movie on a big screen each Monday, weather permitting, it was Tootsie, and the atmosphere was brillant, families, young couples with rugs, deck chairs.. other days there was Free Yoga, free board games set up on tables, it made our holiday very relaxing which helps when you are having a busy sight seeing holiday in New York - very special memories

A small favorite. Whenever we're in mid-Manhattan, we almost always stop at this small park at least once. Close to the crowded Times Square and surrounded by tall buildings yet wide enough to have sunlight, this place offers a relatively quiet place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. There are a few restaurants nearby and even free Wifi. Throughout the year, there would be activities such as a bunch of temporary small shop and a ice skating rink. There are 2 subway stops (B/D/F/M and 7) at the edges of the park which makes it easy to reach the park and to leave from it.

My favorite spot in NYC. This is, in my opinion, the best spot in the city. The outdoor food/drink options are great, the proximity to the library is special to me, and it's just a lovely place to take a break in the middle of the city. I love Bryant Park!
lovely park. Next to New york public libary; lots of seats to relax in whilst enjoying your deli food, snack vendors in the park too. New Yorkers sit and enjoy the view

Oasis in Middle of a Big City. My husband and I love this park. Every year we visit NYC in early December, and this park is always on our list of places to visit. Sitting around the open fire, drinking hot libations, and people watching are favorite activities The unique shops are fun to visit and generally not too crowded. The people on the ice skating rink also provide plenty of entertainment. Evidently, several years ago this was a seedy area to be avoided. What a refreshing feeling it is to see the transformation. It is located right behind the New York Public Library. There is a hotel across the street. Many times that we've been there, there have been movie shoots going on. There is plenty of seating, sometimes live music, free books and newspapers to read. This park is certainly a place not to miss.

I looooove Bryant Park! :-). What an oasis, a gem, a real pleasure! Just loooove this place, it is so cozy and relaxing, such a charming & luvvvy place to be! Last time I visited Bryant Park was early October, both in the evening and during the day, lots of people, just relaxing, jugglers are here everyday, there are ping pong tables, as well as chess/backgammon tables, free newspapers at the outdoor Reading room, welcome for everyone to use. Kid Friendly. And best of all....: Free WIFI throughout the park!!!! Wow, how cool is that!! I want to move to New York!! :-)
It has restrooms!. Restrooms, bathrooms, dunnies...call them what you will....are as scarce as hen's teeth in New York so finding them in this park was a bonus!

Nicest private park in country open to public. Check out the free tour from neighbor Matthew Broderick downloadable on iTunes. Lots of interesting folks, concerts and events are held here on weekends.

Could be my favorite place in NYC. I happened upon this little green space and, honestly, it made me gasp in delight! It looks like a Victorian gem, but apparently it has been made to look that way and 30 years ago it was quite a seedy park. Now it is the best place ever to relax ( on the many little chairs) and people watch.It is located on 42nd Street right behind the NY Public Library. It has gravel paths and lush foliage.Look for it-- you won't be disappointed!

Cool park in the middle of NYC. We were walking by an we saw this neat park in the middle of the city. It was a nice day, and right around lunchtime, so there were a lot of people outside enjoying the day.

Lovely. Hard to believe that you can find an oasis like this in the middle of an urban jungle, but Bryant Park is one place where you can. Plenty of seating, food stalls, free wifi and clean, well kept public restroom! Can't ask for more!
Oasis in the city. A real pleasure to take a break here. Plenty of tables and chairs set on the lawns and terraces to sit.
An oasis of calm. Wonderful spot to relax and have a coffee before continuing on the walking tour of the city. Recommended especially on a sunny day.

The most beautiful place in NYC. This park is the most amazing place in the city. Situated in the hear of Midtown between 5th Avenue and 6th Avenue, just behind the NY Public Library, this is the place to go. A quiet spot, where you can have free language, yoga classes. You can also listen live music or watch outdoor movies in summer time, read free books and newspapers, watch broadway show in the park... All the world pass by the park. On the evening from 5pm to 7pm the bar are full and you can meet people from all over the world. All the buildings around are amazing like the Empire State Building or the Bank of America Tower.If you come to NYC you definitely have to come to Bryant Park and enjoy its wonderful atmosphere !

Great little oasis on 42nd street. Plenty of seats available to take the weight off your feet when shopping & great people watching space to watch the world go by. Multiple refreshment choices for as much or as little as you want to spend.

Great well maintained park; horrible and surly 'wichcraft restaurant workers. Bryant Park is a lovely, well maintained oasis in the city. The park is clean and the staff keeps the homeless from bothering the visitors.I am disappointed to say the 'wichcraft restaurant food kiosks are horrible. The workers ignore the customers and wretched service. I was somewhat shocked as this was the only poor experience I had in an otherwise wonderful trip to NYC.
Percy place for breakfast. Absolutely wonderful place to begin your journey of the day and reflect on the previous days adventures. Quiet and relaxing ambiance.
What a Park Should Be. Just hang or get into the many changing events that take place in the park - day and nite. Lunch near the noontime piano gig is the best!

Awesome little park in the middle of it all!. Can this park be any better? Next to Time Square and Grand Central. Right on 5 th Avenue. Close to the Empire State Building, all broadway shows, and the fashion district. The park itself has many interesting features including a carousel, fountain, games, the NY public library, reading area, and endless people watching. During the summer, they show movies on the lawn on a giant screen. During the winter, the lawn is replaced by an ice rink and cute shops. Quintessential New York.

My favorite park in the city. Something about this park brings me back like a magnet! As a photographer this is one of my favorite places to meet clients. The bordering gardens are always well maintained. Plenty of seating around and the grassy area is great for throwing down a blanket and chilling with the kindle or people watching. The grill is great for a brunch and a quick bite, not cheap, but a nice treat. The little bar on the southeast corner is a regular stop in the evening. Also, one of the nicest public bathroom there is in the city, fresh flowers and beautiful tile work. I'm only in Manhattan a few times a year but this park is always on my list. Great hotels and restaurants close by and subway stops for nearly every train it seems!

Tranquil slice. Bryant Park is a gem! During winter the grass is transformed into an ice skating rink, and during the summer yoga sessions are held. There are lots of tables and chairs, and an outdoor children's library for kids to pick a book and read out doors! The library is next to the gorgeous New York Public Library, which is definitely worth a visit on its own!
Tranquility in the city. Just sit, eat and watch the world go by, use the outdoor reading room, meet friends or pass a quiet 10 minutes, we really enjoyed this oasis in the middle of Manhattan
lovely at night. this time, i happened to pass by at night when the fountain and lights were all on. its a nice place to relax and sit and just take in the views

This is a very happening place!. There is so much activity going on at this park during the middle of the day. It was fun to walk through. We also sat for awhile and enjoyed watching people and taking a little rest. Very fun!

Pretty park right in the middle of it all. Visited the vendor market during the Christmas season, the park was decorated for the holidays and has classic charm. There is a restaurant overlooking the park that I'd love to try, looked very classy. A great place to unwind and get off the street.

Nice Park. Stopped bye as we were on the way to madam tussards. The place was busy and full of people playing bocce ball and jugglers. Places to buy lunch and to sit and eat. Really a nice enjoyable park.

Hidden gem. My partner has been coming to NY every year for the last 10 years and never knew about this place. It is so lovely - great chill and food option. Right in the heart of Manhattan but a little oasis of calm and city life.

Such a pretty park, especially at night. I love this park. On my first trip to New York i remember driving past it as part of a bus tour and thinking how beautiful it looked. It was night and the park was lit up so beautifully. We never got chance to return that trip but i was very pleased to be able to spend time there on my recent visit. It is a very open and serene space in the city, the kind of place you could go and get lost in a book. Just lovely.

A special place.. We stumbled across Bryant Park one day and went back again and again to each lunch and people watch at the little tables. When we go back to NYC we will be heading straight for Bryant Park. It is just such a special beautiful serene place in the middle of the city. There was always a table to grab and sit down at and we never felt rushed.

A real disappointment as a public park. Bryant Park is located in midtown Manhattan, where millions of people live and work. For many of them, me included, its lawn is the only public green space that's easily accessible for quite a distance in any direction. And the park is beautifully appointed so you'd think this would be a magical place for those park-starved locals, as well as tourists visiting midtown. But you'd be wrong.The problem? The lawn is virtually never open. The park is public but "privately managed," and the management company is constantly leasing out the lawn to corporate sponsors, who do stunts on the lawn for publicity purposes. While these "events" might satisfy the boredom of some, they close the lawn for long periods of time, depriving the public of its primary purpose -- quiet enjoyment of a green space.For instance, during the summer, there is a movie shown every monday night. The lawn is invaded by yuppies who cram in -- the entire lawn is packed. What this means for the average park goer is the lawn is closed all day Monday, and then it's "rested" from the event, so that it's also closed all day Tuesday. So, in other words, it's closed 40% of weekdays, ALL SUMMER. For what? A Yuppie-pleasing event?Similar stunts are done now in the early Fall, with a "square dance" held on three occasions in September, each of which similarly closes the lawn for two (or more) days each. What you will often see if you arrive at this park is confused and disappointed tourists being unceremoniously booted off the lawn to close it to prepare for the latest event. Honestly the lawn seems to be closed more often than it's open. In fall, usually when the weather is still nice, an ice rink is planted on the lawn -- a nice idea for winter, but do we really need an ice rink in late October? Brought to you by Citibank, of course.Bryant Park is the public green space that isn't really one. Until the management company starts thinking more about the public and less about corporate sponsors, BP rates no more than one star. It's a tragedy for the green space-starved locals who need to sit or lay on green grass now and then.

A lot of activities. Amazing views, relaxation, sunbathing and a lot of activities in addition to food and drink.There is a small library for families and kids. There is a nice area where a family can set and rent (for free) a board game to play. There is a ton of other activities in addition to the amazing carousel.

An Oasis of Tranquility In the Centre of the City. I had the pleasure to stumble upon this park in 1999 on my first visit to NY, and it really is a lovely place. I have visited it, 4 times now, most recent sept 2013, and its a real oasis.Leafy, and green - no where near the size of central park yet, a lovely chill-out zone. I sat drinking an ice tea, in the shade of some lovely big trees, while watching some fotness followers working out to music at the far end of the park (its not that big).Well worth stopping by for a coffee, or a refreshment, or even just some fresh air in the city, and some greenery! Visit it, try it, love it!

Beautiful!. This place is so cute! You drive past at different times of the day and you see so many different things. As it is the end of Summer now there are a lot of people with their families in the Park which is good to see considering they all live in apartments with no backgrounds. Being Australian it is always good to have a backyard. There are chairs right around the Park, there is food available and it is close to the Empire State Building and Times Square. Highly recommended!
Magical. See it at night. It's lighted from a skyscraper above. The Italian fountain is beautiful and to see people lingering feels like being in Rome

Delightful. We found this park by accident and what a happy moment that was. Having just been into the Public Library, we felt the need to just rest for a while and this was the perfect place. There are quite a number of chairs and tables under leafy trees for shade,or of you prefer,just sit on the grass. There are places on the edge of the park where you can get food and drink. The carousel adds a European touch and the free outdoor Reading Room, a lovely NY one. It's just a nice quiet green space enjoyed by locals and visitors alike.

An escape from the concrete jungle. I usually pause at Bryant Park during lunch hours just to soak up the sun and enjoy a brief meal. Last week I upgraded to the BP Cafe and enjoyed the wings meal. It was well prepared, the atmosphere and staff were extremely pleasant. Will definitely return!

Not much going on in Bryant Park. I heard that there were many activities to do in this park but when I actually visited there were just a bunch of people sitting on the grass or having lunch. I had budgeted some time to spend in the park but it didn't seem worth it when I arrived.......nothing special.

Well worth a visit.. Discovered this place on our way back to the hotel at about midnight and glad we did it was very chilled out and a great place to sit back and just relax or have a drink from the park cafe.

Many places in one!. In Bryant Park you will find a very pleasant place to walk, rest or even have a drink with your friends. Its location is also great, on the 6th Ave, between 40th and 42nd sreets, just behind the New York Public Library!

Best park in NYC!. I've worked around Bryant Park at various companies for the last 7 years, it seems I can't get away from it! But no complaints..it's the best park in the city to take your lunch and enjoy some fresh air outside of the office. You will often see men in business suits laying on the grass and groups of friends and coworkers gathered around the small rickety tables (that is one thing that could be improved!) On summer nights, you will find groups of people playing ping pong and chess, and watching movies on the big screen on Monday nights. With two semi-upscale restaurants on the East end of the park, and 1 sandwich shop and 1 bar/lounge on the West end, it has something for everyone.
beautiful, quiet park near to our hotel. Visited the park prior to viewing the Public Library. Calm oasis in the middle of the noise and bustle of the area.

A breath of fresh air. Walking upon Bryant Park felt like a little oasis in the concrete jungle. The trees are beautiful and it's a wonderful place to visit with friends, read a book, play a game, or whip out your laptop. I love this place in the winter and the fall!!
Nice place for a pint. Awesome place to have a pint in a summer cafe.Small but cozy, right in the middle of midtown. Excellent place to relax.
quiet place. lovely place to sit and relax when you have a few spare minutes to catch your breath nice place sells coffee and snacks

Grab a takeout lunch and while away an hour. Set next to the public library, offering plenty of space to sit and eat a take out lunch, and offering a break from the street and avenue pounding. Take the camera and get some good views of the top of ionic buildings framed by the park trees

Great Park to take a break. Traveling in November the ice skating was in full swing as to were the Christmas markets. Picked up a cake from Magnolia Bakery at Grand Central Station walked down to Bryant Park. The kids grabbed some ice skates and were off for an hour or so while sat back and ate our Magnolia cup cakes. The Christmas Stalls were full of interesting bits and pieces. Well worth a visit.

After the hustle and bustle of Times Square.... take a break in Bryant Park next door to the New York Public Library. It's a lovely, shady well cared for park - with tables/chairs and benches. Grab a coffee from one of the vendors. It had the cleanest public washroom I've ever seen - fresh flowers and a full time attendant

Great Place to Kick Back and Relax. We passed this park while ambling around the streets of New York as and decided to rest for a while.There is ample room to just sit or lie on the grass, or as we did have a glass of Champers at the restaurant on the edge of the park. Being a warm, barmy night the drink was welcome but so to was the atmosphere. Hundreds of people were just sitting around relaxing.Certainly worth a short visit in this green oasis wedged between multi story building blocks

A little oasis in Mid town Manhattan.. The whole area is very pleasant. The park is surrounded by some lovely buildings. The park has a cafe/restaurant . There are some tables and chairs to rest upon whilst walking up 6th ave. The park has a lovely feel and judging by other reviews it has various attractions staged through out the year but there were none at the time of my visit but it was still a very pleasant experience.Sitting in the shade and people watching was something many people seemed to be enjoying.

An oasis in the middle of the action. What an excellent space - it has something for everybody - games for adults, books and a carousel for the kids not to mention a great place to sit and relax or browse the internet (the park even has free WIFI and charging stations). I have been to this park in all seasons and weathers and there is always something new and different going on. It really is a great place to sit and relax and find some calm in a city of madness.

Wonderful park in the city. A wonderful park in the heart of the city. Lovely atmosphere with people relaxing, playing table tennis and frisbee. There is a small library with books for children as well for them to sit and read in the park. There was a childrens birthday party when we were there near the carousel.
