Plenty of seating and well kept borders full of plants. Good city views including the Empire State. there are also piano concerts, yoga and other activities too. will go back on my next visit to NY.

Lovely all year, a MUST SEE at Christmas. Outdoor movies during the warm weather in the middle of NYC....pretty amazing, but if you can, visit during the Christmas holidays. Cute little shops, good restaurants and places just to grab a snack. Best of all, you can skip the Rockefeller Center madness and crowds, and come see their tree, their skating rink, and the year round carousel. An oasis in the heart of the City.
Peace from madness. Lovely park loved just sitting enjoying the peace after the hustle and bustle of Times Square loved the fact they had games to play and a reading area.

People, trees, grass and a Carousel.. Bryant park is located behind the NYC public library. The day we attended it was packed with office workers enjoying an end of the day drink, people just hanging around with friends and folks from around he globe, like us. A great open space in a densely populated city and it has a Carousel! What's not to like.

Something always happening. This busy square behind the City Library always has things going on. It is where you can play pétanque, table tennis or chess or draughts (checkers) with one of the resident grand masters. You can do the latter at Union Square ax well.
Fantastic Park. Wonderful park, with so much atmosphere, my little girl loved the carousel and was most upset when she had to come off. The gaming area was such a good idea too.

Nice place to visit. An oasis of quietness in the middle of the city, plenty of space to enjoy the food you can bring there. Quite clean and full of seats and tables available, a charming place, surrounded by magnificent buildings, hard to believe the stories that are told about its recent past.

Lovely Bryant Park. Imagine a park open year round and tidy as a pin. The old Merry Go Round gives it such appeal. Clean restrooms, outdoor reading and ice rink give the gem in mid town all it needs. Please enjoy!

HBO Sunset Screenings. I love Bryant Park. Visited on the last day of the HBO Sunset Screening in the Park (ET). A great crowd and a great atmosphere. A NYC experience! Park is lovely and looked down upon by the Empire State Building. A real taste of the real New York, right in the Centre of it all.

Lovely oasis in New York; popular with locals and visitors. There are always lots of activities in Bryant Park, and it's a wonderful place for a break from the hustle and bustle of the city. We stopped at the Southwest Porch on a perfect fall afternoon. The guacamole and tortilla chips plate was amazing, way better than we had expected it would be, and the perfect accompaniment to excellent margaritas. Their grilled sandwiches were also tasty. There are lots of other choices for food and drinks throughout the park. There's even a clean public bathroom!The carousel is beautiful and great for kids, as is the large grass field. Go at Christmas time for the wonderful Christmas market and the ice skating rink. Definitely a must visit!

Lovely. When I first went to Bryant Park, the holiday market was on. There was an ice skating rink in the center of the park, and numerous stalls scattered around the outside. The atmosphere was lively and vibrant and it was just so.... perfect. Bryant Park is awesome during the summer too, especially when there are performances or film festivals, but the holiday market is the highlight for me!

A welcome surprise. We came across this park by accident. Lovely. Small enough to be intimate, large enough to have a sense of space and tranquillity. Loads of attractive tables and chairs, a reading area complete with books, a cafeteria and different attractions: we planned to go there the following Monday evening for the open-air cinema, but New York offers so many distractions that we forgot about it. Maybe next time.

A peaceful place to sit & relax. I love this park! Plenty of seating, this is a clean quiet safe area where there is food available, great for photography. Enjoy the view of many of New York's historic buildings, ride on the carousel, enjoy street performances, and so much more. This park is just the right place to rest after walking the busy streets. Stay as long as you'd like, enjoy a book from the library nearby, this park is central to so much.

Easy to get to and close to New York points of interest. summer has lots of interesting people watchingnear lots of New York places of interest... including TImes Squarealways some event planned there - winter has shopping and ice skating....easy to find - subway stop right there

Lovely Park to Visit. Bryant Park is situated behind the New York Public Library. For a city centre park this is a lovely spot to have a rest after a long day exploring the City and the sights. The large expanse of grass in the evening is under spotlight from one of the large skyscrapers surrounding it. The Bryant Park cafe is also worth a visit. We had our evening meal sat outside under the trees. The food and the service was excellent. We had a chicken caesar salad and crab cakes. To drink we had Huckleberry Lemonade which was a vodka cocktail. Delicious!! I would hightly recommend this cafe.
Happy to have found this green oasis. Happy to be there on a sunny day in July, just relaxing at one of the many tables, enjoying a smoothie from Jamba Juice across the street.

great!. Bryant park is a great place to spend a few hours when you have time to kill in the city. If you are hungry, you can get sandwiches from the stands, or any of the eateries surrounding the park. If you check the website before, you will see which activities are happening that day: Fencing, yoga classes, movie night on the lawn... are just a few free activities that are offered. I like to sit with my laptop and do work whenever I have a couple of extra minutes in the city. There are many outlets hidden in green boxes next to the table. The only problem is that I had trouble getting wifi lately, although it could be problem with my computer.OH! and the bathrooms are VERY CLEAN

Great small part just few steps away from the Times Square. Don't miss it! Just a few short minutes away from Times Square (or one subway station away) is an oasys of green where you can sit down, play table tennis, read a book (pick one from a Library stand on the north side of the park), get a coffee or a meal and enjoy urban life at its best before you dive back to the Times Square crowds!

Sanctuary in the middle of New York. If you are visiting New York city then you must spend time in Bryant Park - its a micro world within a big city - good food and a place to relax and watch the world .... there are so many employees keeping everywhere clean and tidy - they were even washing the litter bins ...

Peace. Fresh air. An escape for the sometimes intrusive smells of the subway as you walk around New York. Great with all the tables and chairs to sit at, a couple of coffee shop stands, an "outlet" from the library where you can sit quietly and read the paper and open air cinema on occasions. A well used park but not over crowded. On weekend the seats get gathered and people play pétanque and other games.

mellow manhattan. beautifully planted oasis offering a chance to rest and recharge in the heart of the city. there are activities for all ages ranging from a petanque court to a carousel. seasonally, there are concerts and film-screenings. there are kiosks offering a quick bite and cafes offering more substantial repasts. there's a spotless restroom. and there is prime people-watching.
Beautiful and Relaxing. Bryant Park was withing a couple blocks of our hotel when we stayed in NYC. It was a nice area to just sit, relax, and enjoy the sights and sounds of the city.
stop and relax in the shade. when you need to sit down and take a deep breath and watch people walk by, Bryant Park is there for you, a good place to take a break from shopping on 5th Avenue!

Lovely little park. We visited Bryant park while we were in New York for a week at the end of August. It's such a lovely little park, especially for just sitting and people watching. The afternoon we were there it was lovely and sunny. They have table tennis tables, as well as chess tables. Well worth a visit even if its only for a little while.

Quiet Spot in the Middle of Manhattan. Don't miss out on Bryant Park, a lovely and quiet spot in the middle of Manhattan. During the warm seasons, you can participate in many activities, such as playing chess, ping pong, scrabble, mancala and other tabletop games. During the summer evenings, there are free movies and at lunch time there are free concerts. There is also an open air reading room where you can read and write. During the winter, there is a skating rink on The Pond. Sit down, grab a coffee, breakfast or lunch from a kiosk, and watch the kids have fun on Le Carousel, or take some time to sit on the lawn and read a book. There is also bar/restaurant and the nicest bathrooms in NYS.

Daffodils.. Gorgeous in Spring when the daffodils are "fluttering and dancing" in the breeze.: Wonderful to have a green oasis like this in the 40's,(streets) near the New York Public Library and the Empire State Building.

Great city life outdoors!. The Bryant Park is a great place to take a break from the city life. Wireless internett troughout, table tennis and good cafes make the best surroundings. And the people there are mostly reading, sleeping og enjoying a cup og cooffee. It all makes you feel the peace you only find in America!

Incredible place to rest. Squeezed between the skyscrapers in midtown Manhattan, it is an oasis of silence and relaxation. Enough space and amenities for people to chill, to read, to play, to listen music... A lot of free offers there.

Don't miss the other park in Manhattan. What a wonderful oasis this is.Such a civilised and civilising place. You can sit, eat, drink, sing, listen, watch, play music, play chess, browse books , just about anything that enriches every day life.

Lovely park. Simply delightful, sit back have a coffee & cake as you people watch - picnic in the park, play a game of chess/backgammon, relax in the sunshine, enjoy dinner at the seafood restaurant or Grill whilst watching the twinkling lights atop the trees lining the park edge.
Oasis in NYC. Loved this park near Times Sq. Day and night a place to rest, cool down and have a cold drink on these humid August nights.
Movies festival. We enjoyed a night out in the Bryant Park to watch a movie. Very funny, although there were a lot of people

Oasis in a hecktic world. Bryant park is a true gem of a mini-park that offers busy downmtown workers and office tower staff - and tourists, a green space with plenty of umbrella covered tables to eat their meals from home or buy a quick snack and coffee -- and relax. The central grass field hosts regular evening free movies and events, and Thursday between 12:30 and 1:30 P.M. hosts a free tunes of Broadway musical delight.

Quiet spot compared to Time Square. Located just behind the NYC library; this quiet spot offers a green space to dine, people watch, relax and just experience a different site in NYC. If you on this side of town take the time to walk up to Grand Central Station to take in the history.

A getaway from the city chaos. There is always a spot to sit on the grass or in the chairs for either a relaxing time to read or eat. It is less than a 2 minute walk from Times Square and it is a nice place to take a break. In the summer there are movie showings on the lawn and during the day/afternoon there are bands or performers. Definitely a place to check out and it is right next to the NY Public Library.
lively park. type of park only in nyc. lots of activity, vendors and people watching. also free movies, yoga, good subway and usually a positive energy

Very cool atmosphere. This was one of my first stops after getting off my flight from Australia. Bryant Park had a very cool, relaxed feel about it. I could imagine myself sitting on the seats, reading a book and sipping a coffee in summer!!

What a park should be like!. This place blew my mind! Outdoor cafe seating for free. Sponsored book room New York papers to read for free. Late night cinema, concerts, beautiful and free restrooms (toilets to you and I) why aren't our parks in UK LIKE THIS?

A great place to observe the life in NYC. Stumbled here by mistake when I was visiting the Library. Its quite a beautiful park located just in the middle of Manhattan. Was surprised to see so many activities and now I know that lot of events are conducted here as well.

A taste of New York life. People playing chess. A library area where one person was reading out loud from a book. A large expanse of grass, which no-one was using. Plenty of tables and chairs to sit on. There is a bar at one end which was lively and noisy. Also on the Park is what looked like an expensive restaurant.

Great park to stop in on your way to other sights. While in New York last week I stopped in Bryant Park and it was a wonderful experience. I got a sandwich at one of the stands in the park and sat and people watched. I enjoyed watching folks play ping pong. I was able to get great wifi reception and do some work while sitting in the middle of this slice of park in the middle of the city. Warning: The park is very small its it a square block however it is a great place to sit and relax especially if you've been all over the place sightseeing and just need a rest.

A gem. I have walked past Bryant park many times and assumed it was just a few pretty gardens along the street. Today, I climbed the stairs and went in. What a treat. This large area is lined with shade trees and beautiful gardens. There are lots of tables and chairs at which to eat a snack. There is a merry go round. So pretty. The park is at the back of the New York City Library and is a wonderful place to eat lunch, play a game of checkers, enjoy green space or just rest your feet during a long walk around the city.

Wonderful place to take a break. I wasn't fortunate to get to go to one of the concerts, but it was a wonderful place to stop after walking for a couple hours. Right in between Times Square and the Empire State Building, it's a nice place to grab a bite to eat and relax.

It's a big city park AND a neighborhood park!. From the "Reading Room" to the pingpong tables to the exercise class on the greens to the juggling class, to the dining options, Bryant Park is there for everyone! My trip to NY is not complete without a stroll through the park.

Every city should have one. A great spot to relax, rest, people-watch, and partake in the many activities the park has to offer. There's a 'reading room' with tables, books and magazines, tasty sandwich stands, a gorgeous carousel, a board game area, men playing petanque (free lessons!), and all kinds of scheduled activities, from free movies to free yoga lessons to concerts. Also, as an fyi, the bathrooms have an attendant and are super-clean and pleasant if you are looking for one.

rest and people watch. This the place to stop for refreshments and rest your feet from all the walking and shopping! Has food, a carousel for the kids, and it is so open yet enclosed with beautiful greenery. A definite stop

A Calm, Restful Park. Bryant Park is a wonderful place to spend time in the middle of NYC. If you want a quick break, you can just sit down and relax for a few minutes. If you have more time to spend, they offer free activities every day in the summer, including yoga, tai chi, juggling lessons, piano and Broadway performances, and movies. The park is especially beautiful in the evening, an oasis amongst the brightly lit up buildings. There are also well kept public washrooms.

Any Day, Any Time, Always Satisfies. It took me five visits to actually stop in and relax in this park. Everyday in the summer there is something on in this park - yoga, juggling lessons, Broadway Live and HBO Summer Movies. There is a carousel for kids, food kiosks and of course plenty of shade and seating for relaxing. It even has wifi.This park definately needs to take a bow.

A small slice of heaven in NYC. Comfortable grass, plenty of chairs, no dog, only the locals, being local.A BIG Plus is the free wifi. How cool is that.Highly recommended, worth a visit, and a chance to cool your engines while huffing it around NYC.
An oasis. It is right behind the public library so grab a book and escape for a little while in a serene place. We had lunch at the cafe and the food was good, just don't bother with the coffee.
always a nice resting point in NYC. we always seem to come back to this ideally located park (close to 5th Av) to take a pause and drink some coffee

My favourite park in NY!. I love this place, its small, it has a number of bars and pubs for a rest stop, and it holds yoga classes and moonlight cinemas throughout different times of the year. Check out its calendar of events.

Beautiful park in the heart of the heart of NYC. This park was recommended to my wife and I as a must see on our first visit to the Big Apple. We were not disappointed when we found it. It was a bustling oasis amidst the towering skyscrapers and we enjoyed a glass of wine or two as we watched New Yorkers take in the film festival, play table tennis or just enjoy relaxing amidst the trees. It was also interesting to see so many pairs of chess players sitting quietly contemplating their strategies amidst the surrounding hubbub. A definite must do on your first visit to NYC.

City gem. What a great surprise! Happened to pass by in taxi and made effort to find on foot. This is a gem in the middle of Manhattan. Table tennis available for free, chairs, tables, lawn and much more. Enjoy a bit of peace in the city

Depends a bit on when you go.... Bryant Park is nice, but at certain times of year it is really little more than a large patch of grass. Which is nice in a concrete jungle, sure, but isn't really much of a destination. However, they have ice skating and pop-up shops in the winter, and show movies weekly in the summer.

Oasis in the center of Manhattan???. What a pleasant surprise, walking in the center of Manhattan in the night and suddenly to find Bryant Park. It is a beautiful square park in the heart of the city, with a lot of chairs available if you want to relax and enjoy the atmpsphere, live music, if you are lucky enough and a lot of people lying around on the grass or having a pic-nic. A magic and absolutely relaxing atmosphere. Take your time, do not rush. This is really something that you will remember when you go back home with nostalgia and peacefulness.

A rare place..... On a sunny day, nowhere beats Bryant Park. When we last visited you could play chess, table tennis, pétanque, take juggling lessons, read books at the on site book store, listen to live music or just sit and relax. A great place to visit in the middle of the city.

Nicest Public Bathroom Ever. Bryant Park is great overall, but if you are in need of a public restroom in midtown, this is the place to go. There may be a line but it is worth it. Cleaner than the bathrooms in my office, fresh flowers, automatic seat covers, always clean with attendants on duty.Beyond the bathroom there is always lots to enjoy in the park, an outdoor library, carousel, lots of seating in sun & shade, ping pong and other games, food kiosks, two restaurants, Monday night movies in summer and a shopping area and skating in winter.Overall a great place to take a break on a nice day.

Great place to recharge. This small park is a great place to rest and recharge.We atopped there a number of times, both for a srink abd just to relax.We were very surprise by the rest rooms. Clean and beautiful presented which is not what you would expect for a public park.

Great people watching. The park is just behind the NY Public Library and there are lots of chairs for a rest or to eat a sandwich. At Christmas there is a holiday market around the park and there has been ice skating in the past. There is a restaurant with outdoor space just behind the library and reservations are a must. Last summer there were also outdoor free movies on some nights. A nice respite just off of 5th Avenue.

A very active park. There was so much activity going on from people eating lunch or laying on the grass in the sun to playing chess and riding the carousel. There were people playing guitars and some playing ping pong. There were several food options, although we didn't eat here due to the heat. We still enjoyed a stroll through the park.

Beautiful Park in center of bustling city. This is a beautiful park in the middle of the hustle-bustle of midtown Manhattan. I stopped by for a walk through this beautiful, shady park one afternoon last week and never realized how much there is to do there. In addition to many activities for adults and kids, there is a "reading room" that has books, magazines, newspapers and nightly speakers. After reading the schedule of events, I returned a few nights later to hear one of the speakers, a NY Times reporter discussing the origins and historical significance of Grand Central Terminal. I urge anyone visiting Manhattan to stop by Bryant Park for at least a quick walk through to see all the things it has to offer.

Scene in the park. Public library in the park.. We we went to Bryant park, there was a scene on which several actors from broadway promoted their shows singing and acting. As it rained a little, we went under a tent intalled for the public library in the park : magazines, books and newspapers were available. Check the free 'Metro' newspaper available in the subway stations for daily free events or shows.
Next to the library, why not stop by.. During winter, they have a market place at night. It's really cool to see many stores with unique stuff. It gets bit crowded, but it was really nice place

Love it in Winter. It becomes a Winter Wonderland at Holiday Time. Take my Grandson there as he loves the Carousel and the ice skating. Many Holiday Boutiques are erected in the Park also. They carry a variety of items...perhaps some not as unique as others and also more pricey. Definately woth a look as one can also see the Main Library as it is right behind it.

A nice treat. This park was close to my hotel. It is rather small but does offer a respite from the hectic NYC pace. There are nice opportunities to get drinks or snacks if desired. Good photo ops as well.
Relax in the middle of the manhattan!. Pleasant place to take a rest in the sun while watching the intense moviment of NY. Ideal for a pic nic!

Great park with nice events going on. Loved this little park! There are nice views of the Empire State Building from it.
There are great little events on it it too- check it out online to see what's on when you're visiting. We went to an outdoor cinema in it and it was brilliant. Really safe and just generally nice. We even got free popcorn and water!

Visit the South West Porch for a ber in summer. Bryant Park is a great place for a cold beer in summer. Try the SW Porch!
It is also amazing in winter when they hav the ice skating rink and all the little stalls from local artists, sculptors and designers.
Can't miss Bryant Park

Nice place to take a break. We went here after being inside the library. I did not find anything WOW at this place, just an average park where you can rest for a while. There are some cafes and snack things around where you can have a nice lunch under the trees.There were some summer activities going on which maybe good for people living here, for me as a tourist was very regular stuff.But it was a good experience based on the fact you want to know the city. My sis and I had lunch in a cafe in front of the park in a very nice street, little quiter than other NYC places
Relaxed. Just sit and watch NYC life go by, an oasis of calm in a busy city.Liked good shops on 5thConvenient snack bar on 6th side
A gem of a park behind the main library. Sit and have a refreshing beverage, buy food from one of the vendors, or simply relax at a table and watch the people.

City Life is Wonderful. Grab a cup of coffee and go sit in Bryant Park and be still.. There is so much going on in the middle of this beautiful city that we don't always notice, but sit here and enjoy.. Sssshhh.. :-))
Great place to relax. Fantastic greenery in midtown...carousel, ping pong, ice cream, eateries, dusk time movies and more! Or just relax and people watch...

Movies, Wine and fun. There is always SOMETHING happening in Bryant Park. Movies in the summer (get there early with a blanket and wine), shopping during the holidays, ice skating, Ferris wheel. Something for everyone! Great seating for brown bag lunches. Great food options all around it. GO!

A Happening Place. Located behind the Public Library on 42nd Street and Fifth Avenue, Bryant Park has many attractions all day long. From a small carousel to scheduled events, this is certainly someplace that should be seen. It"s an expansive lawn right in the heart of midtown. Lunch time it's very crowded and hard to find a seat. You're better off going after 1pm on a week day or try the weekend if you would like to just relax here. There is a small sandwich shop called "Witchcraft" that never disappoints!Lynn and Howard RossNew York

An oasis of relaxation at the base of Times Square. Surrounded by shade providing trees, people of all races and creeds, with surprisingly large selections of entertainment, this is one place that should not be missed. Directly behind the New York Public Library, this park has something for all. Free books, Ping-Pong tables, chess/checkers tables, musical entertainment, and most importantly, people watching, can all be had here. Don't miss it, especially if you are in Times Square or are transiting through Grand Central Station.
Very nice park. The park was very nice and had lots of things going on to people to see. I recommend checking out the website to look for events such as plays etc.

A nice getaway in the City. I toured this park on a business trip and must say I was pleasantly impressed with not only the variety of amenities and things to do within the park, but with how well it is maintained and managed. There is something for all ages (they have a juggling class, petanque, and outdoor reading room, as well a carousel, games tables & check out for free) but also they do many activities on the great lawn. There's quite a few options for eating or snacking, and its overall a great place to come during the day on your lunch break (it can get crowded) or if you just want to kick back and people watch.

Just Brilliant!. We have visited this park quite a few times. In winter it is a wonderland, complete with ice skating and Christmas market. Now in summer, it is a hive of activity! There are tables and chairs for anyone to use and they were all full! Then there is table tennis, lots of fun being had there, chess sets, also in use. There is an outdoor reading room, where a long list of activities take place.So well used, just to have a rest and a drink, or you could be there in the shade all day.Not a speck of litter, nor an undesirable in sight.Well done whoever organises this!

What a lovely park for free things for families. I went this with my seven year old son and we were very impressed with the range of things to do. We played chess for $6.50 each for using the backgammon and chess set for an hour. We also played with the free games next to the chess / backgammon area. There were a wide range of free well known games - Scrabble, Ludo, Dominoes, etc as well as games we'd never heard of but made up our own rules for. There is a volunteer with the games if you need help. There are also other free games like table tennis, a viking game for two, and a golf putting hole. The games finish at 7pm.There are lots of places to sit to bring your own picnic / refreshments. A grass are for running around. An outdoor selection of books from the library next door, a beautiful Victorian style free toilet (expect to queue), free language classes, and a Horse Carousel for $2. There is a bar / cafe on site. There is also an ice cream van near the toilets.My son loved this and he was very keen to return. Highly recommended for families and couples, friends and people on their own. There are leaflet stands near the entrances to see what various events that go on in the park, music events, films, talks, etc.

Very interactive entertainment program. Before visiting Bryant Park, please check it's events calendar. Every day there is something going on... My favorites are movie screenings every Monday evening, yoga every Tuesday and Thursday, piano concerts and Broadway shows during the lunch time. Enjoy the nice atmosphere of the park!

Don't miss it when in mid-town. I used to have a 9th floor office overlooking Bryant Park, quite a few years ago, in what is now the Bryant Park Hotel. How it’s improved since then. Before, it’s unofficial name was Needle Park. Today, it’s a centre for relaxation, culture and entertainment right in the middle of mid-town. It’s bordered by Sixth Avenue, 42nd Street, 40th Street and the Central Library.In good weather there are plenty of tables and chairs, hot dogs, burgers and soft drinks vendors, plus cafes and takeaways, there are enough trees for shade, and all that makes it a great place for lunchtime and evening concerts and events. There’s usually something going on. How about turning up and seeing knights on horseback jousting with each other? That’s Bryant Park. And it’s free!It’s no surprise to me that out of the 756 New York City attractions listed in Tripadvisor, Bryant Park, a small area of green in mid-town, is ranked #24.

Little Hidden Gem in the City. We passed by this park several times as it was close to our Hotel. It looked really nice and quaint. During the day, there is lot of hustle and bustle in the park but it's still very nice. At night time, it was absolutely amazing! It was so quiet and peaceful. So many sitting there but the atmosphere was just wonderful. It became one of our favorite spots in the city to just sit and chill at night. Check it out - you won't regret it!

GREAT FOR THE WHOLE FAMILY - AND COUPLES. Let me start off that i'm a nyc native and i love the wintertime in nyc. The skate rental is very cheap and its for the whole night, and if you have your own skates its completely free. You do have to bring a lock to get a locker. It is very busy during the weekends but its perfect on weeknights. I came here 3 times last year twice with my whole family and once on a date. There is very loud music.. Its very pretty specially during Christmas time makes it almost magical. Its really great. i would recommend it for everyone .

cute park. Bryant park is such a cute little park & i never realized until the last time i went that their are 3 sections to this park.i liked this park it was nice & peaceful & people could enjoy relaxing or eating lunch their & i did not dislike anything about this park

Free lunchtime Broadway concerts!. We spent a few hours in Bryant Park last week in order to attend one of their lunchtime Broadway concerts. So glad we came. We had such a nice time. Found a table in the shade, then sent part of our party across the street to "Chop't" to pick up a wonderful picnic meal. The concert series is sponsored by106.7 Lite FM. There are 6 concerts total, all on Thursdays from 12:30-1:30. Our concert featured the lead roles from the following shows: Phantom Of The Opera, Chicago, F#%king Up Everything, and Sistas The Musical. Wow- the talent was phenomenal. What a treat to relax in the shaded park and enjoy such wonderful music. Such a nice, calm park-right in the middle of the busy sidewalks and mammoth skyscrapers of Manhattan!

Hidden Gem. You know it's true what they say about getting lost in New York that you'll find a hidden gem. It was the highlight of our holiday and we will be raving about it for months to come. It's very spacious and a lovely spot to get a drink and people watch. There is a lovely seating area and bar to allow you to sit and relax, soaking up all the atmosphere.
Lovely space. Such a lovely, spacious park in the middle of the hustle & bustle of New York & next to NY Public Library. Buy lunch & sit at one of the many tables & chairs & enjoy the atmosphere.

Don't miss the movies at Bryant Park on Monday evenings!. Great movies at Bryant Park on most Monday evenings during the summer months; tomorrow night is the African Queen with Hepburn and Bogart. There are usually enough chairs for everyone and there is light food available (early). It is a wonderful experience to be there. I saw Frenzy there a couple of weeks ago and it was one of those perfect summer nights to be out of doors enjoying a classic movie.
The epicentre of nyc summer entertainment. Bryant park is great,it's as simple as that.Music,theatre and cinema awaits you here all summer long for FREE

Cute oasis in a concrete jungle. Walked by, multiple types during my visit but finally came to one of the activities. It was accordion Thursday where different people played along the park and you just sit where you like the most. They do plenty free activities like yoga, tai chi, reading out loud( for adults),etc.I think is like a little get away in the city to sit and relax for a second. Its great for families, friends or if you are a loner and just like to be by yourself

Wonderful public space. The best place to have lunch and feel the vibe of New York. Located just next to the Public Library and surrounded by impressive and imposing buildings and trees it makes a perfect place to sit down and relax and still enjoy the greatness of the city.The are loads of tables and chairs so you'll always find a place to sit down and there are also clean public toilets available
Beautiful little park. Great park for ice skating. Much better than Rockefeller Plaza as there is no long lines and it's free.
Wonderful NYC Park. I enjoyed walking through this tree-lined park, especially when various artists were displaying their work. Lots of benches to sit & relax on or to watch passerby.
resting place. nice place to rest and have a snack.. seems new Yorkers go here for lunch; you can play chess or watch the locals play chess

magcial in winter. I have been to Bryant Park during several seasons and each time it has been different. In the fall, the beautiful autumn leaves and hustle and bustle are great but my favourite time is in December, they have the best ice skating rink set up and the market stalls are brilliant. loving the whole atmosphere that bryant park brings. you can sit and just chill out with a latte or participate in the activities they provide.. do as little or as much as you want.
A GEM!!. Wow!! How cute is this park!! Gorgeous place to soak up the sights, sounds and smells of the city .. Refreshing, glorious and a real beauty spot!! Xx
Bryant Park charming. My husband and I had a drink one early evening just enjoying the park. Highly recommend going there after checking out the NY Public Library. Bryant Park is right in back.

Beautiful. Loved sitting in this park. It has a great vibe, and is a really pleasant place for a sit down. Looks like a nice place for locals to hang out during the day. They also show old movies in the park during the summer.

merry christmas to us. my family always comes here for brunch/lunch on christmas eve. bryant park itself becomes a winter wonderland with decorated trees, a skating rink and a europran-style christmas market with dozens of vendors in small tents. The bryant park cafe serves great food at fair prices all overlooking the winter wonderland
A day in the park .... Lovely park "smack, dab in the middle" of Midtown !!! Had a wonderful time soaking in the sun. People watching @ it's best ... Cool hang out for free !!! Priceless !!!

Refreshing stop in the middle of the city. What a wonderful park in the middle of the city. Stopped with children to take a break from the hustle and bustle of the sidewalks. "The bird lady" is there on Tuesdays and she is amazing. What a wonderful way with kids she has! The carousel is sweet and there are game tables nearby. Really a lovely park.

Nice piece of green in NYC. We visited Bryant Park over the weekend while in NYC. It is a nice park. They offer movies during the summer. There are tables to just sit and relax. Near the famous library.

Great people watching. We went to the park for lunch 1 afternoon with the family. We brought in food from Grand Central station where there are plenty of foods to choose from. There are plenty of table & chairs and some umbrellas to cover the table when sunny. The people watching is awesome. There are places to play ping/pong they have a library area for reading. The chess players have an area where they have about 6-12 games going. Just a real interesting place to chill

Relaxing. This is a place where you can lay around in your mat and read all day. There was a lot of people when we went there but it looks like a nice place to hang. I'd love to go back again in the fall.

Briant Park. I spent some hours in the evening with my friends. It has an awesome atmosphere, I loved the lighted trees and there were a lot of people.
You must visit this place!

Nice open space. We stopped off here for an hour one day to relax after lots of walking around. Unfortunately all of the little drinks booths were closed so we had to use the food place on the corner. Lovely little park with some interesting architecture around the park. Nice place to spend an hour and relax during a busy day in New York

Cracking park, especially at christmas.. We went here on our first day in NYC and it was great. When we arrived the ice rink was packed with Christmas songs playing and with all sorts of Christmas stalls and great to try all different types of food. immensely atmospheric, and a great stop off point.

Beautiful small park right in the city. Beautiful setting with gorgeous skyscrapers and buildings behind it. Kept very nice,e ven the bathroom are famous for being clean and having fresh flowers and an attendant. Peaceful. Right next to the Library. Ping pong, chess, chairs and tables to sit at. An open field if you want to be in the sun, or lots of pretty trees to sit under.

Peace in the middle of the city. This is right next to the NYC library. If you need a quite place to sit and catch your breath, this is the place. You should be able to find a game of anything going on that you can join happily.

A quaint little park in the middle of NYC.. A charming park had hundreds of people enjoying what it has to offer on a very hot July day. I saw several ping pong tables in use, a charming little carousel, children's books available to read, several folks on their laptops as there are tables with outlets, people trying to stay cool with their feet hanging in the park's fountain along with brave souls laying in the grass in the scorching sun. A beautiful park to relax.

Great Park, Location. This park is great. That's why it's used so much for outside events. If you are able to visit it between events, if you are that lucky, do so. A park is a park, but there is only ONE BRYANT PARK.

Community building at its finest. This little gem in the middle of the city required a second visit. I loved seeing the chess and table tennis games going on, the reading area being used, and the environment with the seemingly endless display of greenery and flowers pulled the whole experience together. A great place to rest your feet, grab a snack, and enjoy respite from the busyness of the streets.

Classic NYC experience. Try a visit in the daytime and a separate evening visit. The park is well - lit at night by spotlights from a neighboring tall building. If you are lucky you can watch the Empire State building change colors. They also so movies in the park in the summer. There are numerous kiosks that sell coffee, light meals and ice cream. There is an impromptu chess playing area. The park is framed by buildings creating a unique location for picture taking, serene green space with urban surroundings.

From Hell hole to Oasis. Bryant Park used to full of drug dealers and very disreputable people. Sometime back in the nineties the people living in the area and the city government decided to take back the park Today it is wonderful oasis in the center of the city. And be sure to take a look inside the library, especially the great reading room. Similar to Central Park, this shows what can be done when the citizens and the government join forces to retake a beautiful space in the city.

Excellent small park. This is great to relax in, generally quiet. Sometimes they have events happening but none were on during my visit. Good location to relax, tables and chairs available if you don't want to sit on the grass.

Urban park in Manhattan. A small urban park in Manhattan, located between Fifth and Sixth Avenues and between 40th and 42nd Streets in Midtown. Technically the main building of the New York Public Library is located within the park. It always attracts the crowd and is always buzzing with local people and sightseers.

Pulse of the City in Midtown. We were first attracted to the park by the wonderful shade only to find so much more. Many nice places to eat, sit and watch the people, play a game, watch a movie in the evening or just sit with a cold one when your feet are worn from walking. NICE!

cell phone recharging stations. Bryant Park is a nice park to sit and take a break in while recharging your phone. Just bring your plug and cord for your phone with you and you can plug into the outlets that are scattered about while you sit and have a coffee. :)

Beautiful park in the middle of NYC. Great place to take a brake. It has a beutiful view and nice picture spots.
It's centrally located and very easy to find.

Great. Bryant Park is beautiful - set in the middle of the city, close to Times Square and lots of shops. In the summer there are lots of free classes and movies in the evening, and in the winter there are lovely markets!
A lovely place in the city!

A Tranquil Haven In a Busy City. It is pleasant to spend a little time people watching and relaxing in this lovely small park. Spent an hour sat in the shade watching the activity on the petanque court.
Popular with locals and visitors alike

lots to do and see. Bryant Park is great any time of year - ice skating in the winter and lots of events, including plenty of people watching in the summer. We visited the park over the June 21st weekend and had a fabulous time. The Southwest Porch provided a nice resting spot for a sangria and prosecco. Service was great. During the week during the summer (Wednesdays or Thursdays) a Broadway show performs a piece or two during the lunch hour. Don't forget to take a peek into the New York Public Library. The architecture and exhibits will take you back in time. Great place and it's all free. (except the drinks!)
Trip Highlight. You must see this park. It offers entertainment, learning, a reading area, ping pong, food and an atmosphere of community. It was the highlight of our 4 days in Manhattan.

Oasis in a Sea of Concrete. Beautiful Little Park in Manhattan with a distinctive English feel to it. It looks as though the lawn should be a bowling green with people in whites playing bowls on it. Traffic is all around and yet it is not noticeable and just sitting and resting here appears to provide a total sense of tranquility.

Lovely urban park. Located behind the magnificent public library this is one of New York's gems. A beautiful small urban park full of people and activities. Delightfully maintained with trees, open areas and walkways. A must visit when in this part of town.

The perfect late afternoon break. We love going to the bar at Bryant Park late in the afternoon. On a hot day to stop by and have a cool drink and watch the crowd is the perfect way to relax and get yourself ready for a night out on the town. Try to get there before 5, because soon after that the crowds get really thick and you will never get a spot to sit down. have a seat at the bar and just watch the crowds congregate and meet some new friends.

What a lovely, relaxing 42nd St. oasis. The only reason we visited this shaded spot is that our bus dropped & picked us up here. It was a Saturday & there were tents on the nearby street selling food, drink & other items to buy. In the park, people were sitting at tables & on benches enjoying the day as well as those playing chess. The city library has an area with access to books, magazines, & newspapers. A film is shown shown every Monday night at dusk.

An oasis of calm in the city. Bryant Park was the first place we visited the day we arrived in NYC after 22 hours of travelling from SA. It is an oasis of calm in the middle of the City and the second we stepped behind the Library all the noise and heat of the streets retreated. Beautiful grass that nobody stepped on, people sitting at the little open library that provides free books and comfy seats to people on their lunch break or little children with their families or nannies, who could also enjoy the beautiful carousel, people juggling, playing table tennis and boules or learning a new language. There is something for everyone to be found and it was the moment my husband and I fell completely in love with NYC & the USA.
A little bit a peace in busy NYC. What a find! Totally beautiful place, calm and beautifully kept! A piece of heaven! Perfect place to just sit and take in the wonderful views of NYC
A place to rest. This parc is very close to Time Square and is an excellent place to rest and piknik. A lot of chairs and table available. Very nice at night.

Don't miss this gem. This park has been transformed in the past 15 years from a run down area used by drug dealers to an oasis of calm and relaxation. Activities are provided (table tennis, boules, and even books and newspapers to read in the outdoor Reading Room). Outdoor movies are sometimes shown in the summer and there are various musical performances. Whether you go for a quick coffee or take part in a free activity or just to snooze in a chair do not miss this lovely facility.

Best palce for a tiny park. This is my favourite park for the size it is. Great lunch spot great anything spot for anyone and everyone. Yoga in the summer, ice skating in the winter. Free books to read, the outdoor seating the lawn and the music all provided for everyones entertainment.
Fun,fun,fun. From laying on the lawn, to standing near the fountain,playing board games at the tables, having a cup of coffee near the movie screen you cannot have a bad time at the park!!!

Gardens. Bryant Park is in Time Square, 5th Ave & 42nd Street, near the NY Public Library. It is amazing how the park has been updated. It is a beautiful park. Visitors love food, and there is much there. There is entertainment, beautiful gardens, various activities. Just to relax and enjoy the sights. You can spend the day in the park, different world.

Best park in NYC. Love to sit in this park. Chairs and tables for you to use, an outside library when the weather is good and you are framed by tall buildings. This is where I get my New York feeling!

Beautiful open space in city. A real oasis in the city - big lawn, lot of tables and chairs, fountain, library area with books to read, free yoga lessons, just an amazingly lovely place to sit - went there most days for breakfast which bought at the nearby Pret a Manger. During summer months has lots of activities, including a screen for films.
Great Family Park. Find some time to sit and people watch, take a picnic, or just a drink and sit under the trees. Busy place but lovely.

Oasis & hidden treasure. Here you can play ping pong, read a book, have a coffee, or just chill... it was wonderful to see so much community interaction in a hidden treasure of a park... so worth while finding it

An urban Oasis. a local gem behind New York Public Library. Bryant Park is a great place to sun bathe, read, sip a coffee or just stroll. For children there's even a Merry-go-round. During summer there are plenty of shows and usually a big screen where they display films at night.
Serenity in the City. This wonderful park in the heart of midtown provides a wonderful place of peace for the traveler who needs a break.

A little piece of paradise in the city. This famous park was very close to our hotel so whenever we had enough of shopping to site seeing, we would sit in Bryant's park and have a drink and watch the world go by. People who work around the area have their lunch here and some play french bowls or just read. Its very relaxing even though you're right in the center of the city. Its great!

Great Atmosphere. Bryant Park is just beautiful. You have to spend some time here so you can really soak up the atmosphere. Some small takeaway shops and bars are within the grounds. The park is situated right behind New York Public Library and surrounded by huge buildings and busy streets, yet the park is so peaceful and relaxing. There are heaps of tables and chairs. My husband and I pulled up a chair, ate our snacks and just took it all in. Beautiful!
Bryant Park. Great to see these parks in the middle of a very busy city. Also went to Washington Square park and Uniion Park. All great

Betanque was played. People were playing betanque and there were sets you could borrow,some of the gents playing encouraged visitors to join them. A lovely park in the hub bub of NYC a great place to relax under the shade of the trees

Nice place for a quick break!. We stumbled upon this park while looking for a place to sit and eat nasty pizza.I enjoyed my little rest here. It was night, but I felt safe. Not sure if there were restrooms, but I could tell that food was available for purchase during the day. We hung around after eating, Im certain it was for the atmosphere, and not just because we had indigestion.

A beautiful place. A perfect example of an urban park. A wonderful place to eat, have a cup of coffee, a drink, or just relax and watch people. A sunny open lawn surrounded by touring shade trees and beautiful gardens. And you must even check out the restrooms...I was stunned, expecting a grubby mess the first time. They are beautiful, with fresh flowers no less. Always nice to remember where a good restroom is in a city.
Fantastic Park. Bryant Park is hidden behind the New York library and it is a small oasis in a bustling city. You can sit and people watch for hours if you wanted to.

great spot to relax. I always try to spend at least a few minutes relaxing in Bryant Park when I'm in New York. My last visit there in March 2013 was no exception. I love the green cafe tables and chairs that remind me of Paris. Sitting near the carousel is always fun. There are some fantastic people watching opportunities to be had in this little park. On my last visit there was some construction work going on blocking sections of the park and the hot chocolate stand was closed but hopefully that has all been finished by now.

A place to relax. Bryant Park is an oasis in the city unlike Central Park. It is small but so lovely and a wonderful place to stop day or night to take in the sights and sounds of a beautiful city. There is food and drinks if you like or just sit at a table and people watch.

A quick visit.. I just walked through this area on my way from and to the library but was immediately taken with the atmosphere and the fanatstic stride pianist who was just getting into gear. Will visit properly on my next visit.

Lunch with music. You can buy yourself lunch across the street on 42nd st, for instance at "Pret a Manger", and find a nice place to sit in the Park, at the back of the public library. There is a music shell there, and usually free music during the nice weather. In winter, they transform the lawn into a skating rink.In summer there are free movies there.Don't miss the public library under the trees!

Need a place to put up your feet after a day of shopping on midtown Manhattan?. Not much going on here the day we stopped by to re-fuel after a day of walking and shopping on midtown Manhattan. It is a good place though to rest, put one's feet up, and enjoy a cool drink :-).

Relaxation Central!. Bryant park was a beautiful oasis in new York. In particular, check out the fountain if you're there in the summer! You can dip your feet into it and sit a while, which I did for an hour while figuring out accommodations for the night. Highly recommended!
Cute Little Gem. Great spot to sit a spell and enjoy the sights and sounds of NYC. Have a coffee or cool drink and people watch and enjoy the seasons, or take a ride on the carousel.
A little oasis of green!. Next to the NYC public library, this is a great outdoor space to chill out. Grabbed a coffee & people watched, with the sun shining down.

A green oasis in a concrete world!. This is a great place to relax in the midst of the hustle and bustle that is Manhattan. We bought sandwiches and were able to find a table in the park and enjoy lunch next to a beautiful lawn. Highly recommended!

A mobile library in the park. There's multiple of little book stands where people could just grab a book and sit down in the park. A lot of chairs, a big lawn, enough shade - this makes it my favorite park in downtown.
Small but sweet.. This place is right next to the NY Public Library. It is lovely and should definitely not be missed!

Great refuge in NYC. Bryany Park was a nice place to relax as we explored NYC. There are several vendors providing refreshment and a restaurant if you need a full meal. The fountain provided a great photo opportunity.
Quiet space. Buy a coffee and bagel and sit and eat your breakfast here and watch the workers rush around! Like the tables but rubbish bins need emptying.

Lovely and peaceful. Spent an hour in here on our last morning and just chilled watching the world go by.
Lots of people doing just the same as us.

Perfect Oasis. If you fancy an alternative to Central Park...check out this beautiful oasis of calm ...life in the slow lane. Perfect for lunchtime picnic or afternoon siesta. The park is tucked away behind the beautiful City Library and has small eateries, shaded games areas...try to beat a local at Backgammon...or just sleep away a few hours on the manicured lawn. Bliss.

Beautiful. What a lovely park in the heart of midtown Manhattan! It definitely has the Paris feel to it. The lawn was being treated when we went so it was a little less crowded. Would go again with extra time to just sit and enjoy the scenery.
Pretty Park. Pretty park , good spot to stop and relax after walking around the city, also has some of the cleanest public bathrooms in the area. My kids love the carousel there, too.

A Relaxing Park. Always full of people on a pretty day. This is a place for New Yorkers to take in some sun or relax in the shade. There is green grass to lay or sit on, and table under the trees in the shade, places to buy a snack, or a delicious but a pricey meal in the Bryant Park Grill.
Excellent athmosphere. The park is good option for people walking on Time Square who wants a place to rest for awhile and grab something to eat near the trees.

My favorite park in NYC. NYC should be proud of it's beautiful parks which are located throughout the city. My favorite park is Bryant Park located at 40th and 6th. The NYC library backs onto it and provides a stunning backdrop to this majestic park. The grassed lawn always green in the milder months and the wonderful "halo" of trees surrounding the park make this place a magical place to sit and have lunch or a drink.

Tranquility in the middle of Midtown!. We loved this park. It was a welcome place to stop having walked miles around the shops! Located in the heart of NYC adjacent to the Public Library this is an ideal resting location. Loved it!

A beautiful green escape between concrete skyscrapers. Absolutely stunning. There is something for everyone: a large green lawn to place a blanket on to soak up some sun or have a picnic, a reading share area to rent books, ping pong tables, chess sets with all pieces provided, charging stations for your electronics, tables to sit and chat, a carousel for the kids, extremely clean restroom facilities and places to purchase snacks and beverages. A must to visit if your in the city.

Beautiful little park in the middle of NYC. Loved this little green space off Avenue of the Americas. Nice to just hang out and enjoy a coffee and the little bit of tranquility in the middle of it all. During the business part of my trip dined on the patio of the restaurant in the Park - Bryant Park Grill which was quite good!
nice. Scenic park out of the movies. Very nice ice rink. There is a small market next to it, and the stores are very pretty.
A great break. So much you can do or not. Play ping pong -chess -read a book -surf the net. Or just relax. The best bathrooms in NY. Check there site always something going on.
Great people Watching Spot. Enjoyed coffee and cupcake store is right across the street. Great tables spots to sit and enjoy the view. Library is right next door.

Nice relaxing spot in Midtown. A very pleasant area, though perhaps a little smaller than I envisaged. Located at the back of the NY Public Library. Excellent well tended park but quite commercial with lots going on- a great and popular spot for NY Office Workers - they certainly seem to enjoy the covered bar area after work.Great to sit down and take stock, and maybe eat a few sandwiches from local shops or mobile takeaways. There is a good website with events/facilities listed.Its not something that a tourist not staying nearby should aim to visit - reserve any special trip for the outstanding Central Park.

Great park to sit and watch or catch a bite to eat.. Shade is everywhere. A great place to sit on a hot day. There is a lot going on everywhere you look. The view of the Empire State building is impressive.

Lunch here is special. Enjoy the piano or reading room. Pick up lunch nearby and sit on the grass or at one of many tables and enjoy this gorgeous park. It's clear this is what many NY workers do too! Always something on - currently piano playing at lunchtime and there is always the free reading room. Fantastic place. One of our favorites.

Nice Park to Relax. We took our lunch here to eat. They have plenty of tables and chairs. There is plenty of greenery and flowers with a large open grassy area that is perfect for little ones to run around. There is also a small outside bar area in the park, carousel and water fountain.

really great at winter!!. We went in november just as it began to get colder and they had ice skating and market stalls which was a lot of fun!! i loved the atmosphere of the park! worth taking a look
Ice Skating. Not too big a que, great stores and things to do while the kids skate, can get a bit packed, but great to get amongst it in NYC, If like being up and about, this is great spot.

A lovely breakfast spot. A beautiful place to sit and enjoy a meal. We visited in the evening, as well as the morning. In the evening, you’ll find that it’s a quiet refuge from the hustle and bustle of Times Square a few steps away. In the morning, you may find people playing La Boule or reading their newspapers. We purchased coffee and breakfast at a small walk up shop right in the park. Then sat and enjoyed watching the games of La Boule and children playing in the park. It was a great way to start a lazy Sunday morning.

Best place for Ice Skating in NYC. Completely free if you have your own skates and a lock! There is no better place in this city for Ice Skating. The rink is surrounded by holiday shops, they play holiday music while you skate and if you get cold you can rest at the rinks indoor seating where they also have a snack bar and bathrooms. Be sure to check out Bryant Parks website for events. The rink has been known to host small Disney on Ice performances and outdoor movies.

Heaven on earth, eye candy of Midtown!. After each day of a long tour in Manhattan, I tend to have a rest at Bryant Brilliant park, love the atmosphere and nice summer breeze.I love it way more than central park.

Bryant Park is the Jewel of Midtown. Free Ice Skating in the winter, movies in the summer; There is always something going on here. Its a wonderful place to eat lunch when you are in midtown. There is a "reading room" with books and magazines, ping pong tables, bacche courts and occasional musical performances.Check out the Library while you are there.

green in the city. Located behind the New York Public library, this is a nice place to relax and people watch. It is one of the few green spaces in Midtown until you get to Central Park going uptown. Their are a lot chairs to sit and several places around the edge of the park to get food and drinks.
BRUNCH. The park was a-buzz with locals basking in the sun! We enjoyed "Mother's Day" brunch at the Bryant Park Restaurant! Great menu and the food was fantastic!
nice :). loved small park where you can sit and enjoy your meal by the sun :) near the public library. A good getway to relax a bit

Relax. Are you looking for a nice place where to get out of the city rush? Bryant Park is the perfect place. Not that quiet as Central Park considering the dimension of this green block and the short distance from the avenues, but it still represent the perfect place where to take a cool break in the heart of Midtown. You can here enjoy two of the most interesting and contrasting levels/characteristics of the city: the green and the surrounding skyline ( from some vantage points you can also spot the Empire State from here ).

My favorite NYC park. Everyone loves Central Park - who wouldn't? But for a more cozy and relaxed scene, Bryant Park is my all-time favorite. Running on the grass barefoot, a $2 carousel ride and a beautiful fountain. What more could you want? Every time we go here, I feel like we are in Paris. So lovely.

Beautiful spot in the city. On a Sunday with the temperature around 68 and bright blue skies this park was absolutely crowded and great for people watching. It would have been a great for Seurat to do a painting! It is easy to see why people are drawn to the spot especially on a nice day.

Lovely, Peaceful Little Park. Just down the road from our hotel, this park was a great place to stop and take 10 mins out. Very pretty and peaceful. It is only a small park so don't know whether I would say people should visit it if they are not in the area, but is definitely worth a quick visit if you are in the area.

Close to theatre district. This park is a miracle. It has many activiity zones. It has a carousel. It has some eateries. It has lovely seating. It is behind the main branch of the public library-you can enter form 40th or 42nd Sts or from Sixth Av. Also known as Avenue of the Americas. Technically, the library sits in Bryant Park along Fifth Av. When I first came to NY it was a place to be avoided. Now it is a highlight. There are some special events-check times-such as birding, yoga, etc. It will remind you of Paris!!!

Nice park, shame about the Wifi. I spent a short time chilling here and its a lovely place to go to "just get away from it all". I tried for around 20 mins to connect to the free wifi but couldnt for some reason.
A real chill zone amongst the chaos of NYC. A lovely surprise. Leafy green park, with lots of seats, chess, eats and a library! Great people watching; a real oasis.
The coolest park.. Next to Fifth Avenue and the New York Public Library, Bryant Park offers seating and outdoor wi-fi in a nice urban setting. Very cool.

Beautiful park in the middle of the hustle & bustle. My wife and I were just here to see a concert at the Southwest Porch. The park is beautiful. It was clean and offered many diiferent things to do. You can people watch, eat, drink, play free board games, read, ride a carousel, or do nothing and enjoy the surroundings. If you are in the area I would highly recommend a stop here to take it all in. It was truly a gem in NYC and we look forward to going back soon.
Great park. What a wonderful place right in the middle of the city - great spots to sit and people watch, many free activities for children and adults. Nice restaurants and clean public restrooms!

An outdoor MUST for NYC visitors & locals alike. Even though I have lived in NYC for over 9 years, I still get very excited for that first day in Spring that its warm enough to eat lunch in Bryant Park. Available sit-down restaurants include Bryant Park Grill, Cafe, and Southwest Porch. If you're not in the mood to eat, bring a blanket and soak up the sun on the spacious green lawn. The juxtaposition of nature and architecture (see Grace Building, NYC Library, and Bryant Park hotel) makes the park a true New York treasure. Visitors can also visit the park in the winter when it is transformed into a seasonal skating rink in The Pond, with its own restaurant and snack bar. The atmosphere is eloquent & charming- quite a good idea for a brisk December night.

Transported to another time and place. This gem is a compact oasis in the middle of NYC. Near the lions of the NY Library and shopping, it's a refuge from the bustling city. Enjoy the Merry Go Round in the warm weather. Reminds of a mini Tuileries in Paris. Many dining options nearby

very chill park, show respect to Nikola Tesla. One of those city parks where you forget you're in the middle of everything; great place to take it down a notch, and if you're an egghead-revere the signs for Nikola Tesla Corner. Long overdue recognition for the man, but back to the park-like everything in NYC, it has a unique life of its own. Fall into its slipstream and catch your breath before heading back into the crowds.

Hard to Believe. If you're old enough to remember Bryant Park when it was known as "Needle Park" & too dangerous to walk through, it's hard to believe the park today. Indeed it's hard to believe you're not in Paris & a recent sunny spring day at the transformed park with its tubs of tulips & pansies was enchanting. Underneath the pale green trees & seated at little round tables with metal bistro chairs surrounding the glorious fountain & lush fresh grass, visitors from all over the world enjoyed the vibrant scene, while eating interesting sandwiches (pole tuna, chopped chick peas, goat cheese with avocado, etc.) from 'Wich Craft kiosk at the northwest corner of the park or one of the many delis & restaurants surrounding it. For a more leisurely experience, sit for a while with a drink on a swinging bench at the bar at the southwest corner. At the southeast corner an old-fashioned carousel adds to the charm & nearby a cart full of books is a lending library for children - how thoughtful! At another jugglers invite observers to try their skills, while across the park, French/Italian/Spanish/Japanese language lessons are offered during the lunch hour. Seated beneath Jo Davidson's famous statue of Gertrude Stein - not far from the looming statue of William Cullen Bryant for whom the park, nestled behind the majestic public library (another must-see) was named, I was transported to Paris, while listening to a piano concert, performed every weekday lunch hour by professional musicians.

Relaxing. Staying at the Andaz 5th Avenue during an unexpectedly warm April, we spent lots of time just relaxing in Bryant Park. Sadly, no-one was allowed on the grass as it was new turf, but it was a great place to chill out, read and enjoy a coffee.
Glorious. If at all possible try to visit Bryant Park in December. The Ice rink will be in full flow and defy you to get better hot chocolate. The whole experience is a beautiful memory.

Poets competition. a great place to have something to eat and sit outside, not far from our hotel and Times Square. Right behind NYC library and the famous stacks, carousel in the park for kids, petanque played daily.

Downtown oasis. Bryant Park is a nice oasis close to Times Square. A relaxing green space, next to Library, beautiful Bryant Park Hotel building, view of Empire State Building, Bank of America Building next door, and from street can see Chrysler Building afar. Also steps away from Grand Central Station.Enjoy the fountain, carrousel, and even borrow board games on the spot.Wonderful.

Such a cool place to relax. Bryant park is lovely at any time of the day. You can just sit and relax, enjyoing the great city views. We liked it best in the evening though. It's well served with bars and restaurants and it's a really vibrant place. I recommend BP cafe for an early evening cocktail. We ended up there several times during our visit - we just liked it so much.

Splendor in Spring!. Just gorgeous - must see! Lovely flowers and majestic skyline - tons of photo opportunies. Check ahead of time to see about special events - there is always something going on in Bryant Park.
Restful. A nice stop after walking around town. Shady trees and green grass is always a relief in a city. There are food and drink stands but very pricey. Enjoy the people watching.
Day or night, you must visit. Lovely place to sit and soak in the atmosphere.We ended up visiting the park a few times, day and night.Toilets are the best, super clean!

A Stroll in the sunshine. Lovely park and very relaxing place to sit and watch the world go by.Lots of people sat at their Laptops working as numerous connection points.Well kept grounds and cafe on site to enjoy a drink

Very well kept with things to do. We were pleasantly surprised how well kept Bryant Park is. They now have added ping pong tables in the park, as well as a mobile library. You can select from many different places to eat or just grab a beverage. There is always plenty of seating at a table, if you choose or a park bench.This is usually the location the tour buses pick up and drop off at.

Relaxing. Visited on a nice sunny day. Very relaxing. Fun to people watch. I got myself a coffee at Starbucks across the street and found myself a nice table with my family to just enjoy the nice weather and being in the city. Many people were sitting at tables and sitting around the grass area.
Winter is best at the Bryant Park. Very lovely experiance at the Bryant Park - The entire family enjoyed and had lots of fun trying to learn skating. This place has great ambiance and good crowd.

THE "secret" PARK. Behind the New York Public Library there is a small pretty park called Bryant Park, surrounded by marvellous builgins, some of them Art Deco. The visitor can make himself comfortable by sitting at one of the many tables just tu take a rest and admire the building around him. Not well-known by many visitors, not often mentioned in guides, the Park is like a little secret treasure te City offers them.There is a very nice restaurant at the right-hand corner facing the back of the Library. I was told to go there during the day and avoid it after dusk. Carmen Huguet.

Green oasis with drinks. Bryant Park on a lovely spring afternoon was just the ticket to sit outside and relax after walking all day. If I were a young, single professional, this looks like a good spot to meet someone. Everyone, and even the park and seating areas seemed well groomed and right out of a magazine.

One of my favorite parks. Since I worked nearby I would go to this park everyday during my lunch break to eat, sunbathe, read, etc. The park is non smoking and is best when they open the lawn in the warmer months for outdoor movies and in ice rink during the colder months. Be sure to check out the guys teaching people to juggle every week day.

Favorite NYC park. Nice place where you can stop and rest a little while. It's very near and always on your way if you use Grand Central Terminal. I love it early in the Sunday morning when it's almost empty - you can sit with a lemon pound cake and a coffee... but be careful and control your look: you can later see yourself in a TV series.

Loved it!. This wasn't on our list of places to see, but we ended up here after seeing the NY Library and I found it enchanting on a sunny Spring day. If I lived in NYC, I'd be at the park a lot. Perhaps all the concrete was getting to me, because the park's grass and flowers drew me and made me want to sit and stay a while. The outdoor Reading Room is really charming. It had the feel of parks in Europe, or do they have the feel of Bryant Park?

Great view, nice park. If you want to enjoy a park while wandering around at the south tip of manhattan, bryant park is a good choice. Nice view to the statue of liberty and ellis island. During nice weather some street performers might brighten your day.

A nit too big but beautiful park. Bryant park stands in the middle of the bustling New York city nesteled in between the famous Fifth Avenue and Madisson Garden. Its one beautiful parkwhere you can sit a nd relax, eat and enjoy yourself.

A little breath of fresh air in a crazy city!. A brilliant little park for New Yorkers and tourists to go relax in and enjoy the beautiful flowers while having lunch or a coffee - a bit of an escape from the frenetic pace of the city!

A little breath of fresh air in a crazy city!. A brilliant little park for New Yorkers and tourists to go relax in and enjoy the beautiful flowers while having lunch or a coffee - a bit of an escape from the frenetic pace of the city!
Pleasant location. This is an excellent place to sit and relax. Great place for lunch. Salads are excellent. Weather was warm and pleasant and spring flowers were blooming.

A little gem in the city. Beautifully maintained little park in the city centre. Always room to sit somewhere to watch the world go by. Everyone feels welcome, always a happy place. We went every day at different times to savour the atmosphere. Plenty of snacking and watering holes as well as cafes, bars and restaurants. A little oasis. Super clean well maintained public toilets with fresh flowers on site open during the day until about 8 pm (free).

Great park. Great little park. Went there almost everyday during our vacation. Has a beautiful christmas tree during the winter that lights up blue. And also if you go, definitely recommend getting a crepe from there. The best crepe i have ever had

Visit on a winter day. We sat down by the outside rink watching the buskers and the skaters . A cold drink after walking for a couple of hours.visited the little boutiques some nice home made trinkets,a great place to visit now that they have refurbished it
Great at Christmas. Fantastic place especially on Christmas Day. Fantastic market and ice skating, real Christmassy atmosphere..a must at this time of year!

There's always something going on. There's always something going on in Bryant park, so take the load off, rest in the shade and enjoy the respite of pounding the pavement to take in some of the stores, ice skating or shows that are going on at different times in the year.

Great place for morning coffee and bagel. A fantastic little park in the centre of manhattan with free wifi and great coffee and bagels. The area is an oasis of calm to settle down, read the paper, drink some coffee and catch up on the emails. It is a well laid out area with lots of tables and chairs to settle down for a rest amidst the non-stop New York life style.

Rest a bit. I remember well the drugs, prostitution and crime in this park during the 70's and 80's. Due to the hedges or what was left of them, you actually didn't want to walk on the sidewalk outside the park much less go in! Now, the park is a different world entirely, thankfully so. You can just relax on the grass or just sit in one of the many chairs. You can play ping pong, take the kids for a carousel ride, ice skate in Winter or watch movies under the stars one night a week in Summer. No chairs are allowed on the grass but you may bring a blanket to sit on. There are vendors inside and outside the park as well as restaurants all around ( even on the park grounds) The land the park sits on is filled with history, as is most of Manhattan. Once a potters field, also a revolutionary war battlefield as well as a onetime reservoir for the City. You'll be fascinated to know that when standing in Brant park, you are standing atop storage for millions of research books! They are sent back and forth to the NYC library just to the East via a conveyor system. You must visit the Library too..

One of my favourite places on Earth.. An oasis of green surrounded by skyscrapers, Bryant Park has cute cafe tables and chairs, free wifi, luxurious washrooms, free books and magazines to read (it's adjacent to the NYC library), a carousel for kids, board games, great people watching, and lots of coffee/breakfast/lunch options nearby. (I'm partial to Le Pain Quotidien on the south side.) It is everything an urban park should be.

Nice City Park. Bryant Park is located in Midtown about 6 blocks north of the Empire State Building and directly behind the New York Public Library. It is on the intersection of 40th Street and 6tth Avenue. I visited in March so it was a little chilly and the Park was not busy. The Park has 100’s of green chairs to sit in and relax and watch all the people go by. It is also a great place to rest, relax and have a soda if you are on a long walking tour of NYC. Also, if you like Ping Pong you are in luck as there is a table on the North end of the park that anyone can use. There is a small carousel for the little ones but there was only one kid on it due to the chilly weather.If you are in Midtown and are looking for a place to relax for a few minutes, I recommend checking out Bryant Park.

a great little rest spot. a great place to grab a cup of coffee and morning snack. plenty of benches to sit on, a reading "room" and flowers and fountains. we stopped here on our way from time square to the UN.

A nice green area in between the massiveness that is New York. Bryant Park is a nice oasis of green in between the towering buildings of New York. People grab a seat and a snack in a nice restful setting. There are even ping pong tables. Rest a while and watch how New Yorkers take a break.

A must visit on a nice day. The day we passed by Bryant Park was warm and sunny so we decided to pop in and enjoy it. There are plenty of table and chairs plus benches to sit and see the world go by...

Elegance in Midtown. What Washington Square Park is the hip and cool in NYC, Bryant Park is to the elegant and sophisticated. I have only recently come to know Bryant Park, but I love it: from the carousel to the beautiful green spaces, this is a place where you could hang out reading a book, while listening to classical music on your iPod. So grab some coffee, your favorite classic novel and some Mozart, and head over to Bryant Park for a chill session.

Very pretty, clean. We passed through Bryant Park on the way from Grand Central Terminal to our Times Square hotel. It is a beautiful little park, bustling with people. It seemed very clean and safe, and had a gorgeous lawn area and flowers. The carousel was closed for maintenance when we were there, but it was interesting to see--much smaller than I'd expected. I have not been at night, but during the day at least, it is definitely worth a walk-through.

Nice place to chill. Not a lot to say really, it has a nice fountain and tables and chairs. There is also a restroom and it is right by the Chrysler tower and city library. Perfect place to stop after a little sightseeing.
