Regular Spot. Nice little area to stop and shop, or just sit and rest, to get out of the main hustle and bustle while hurrying around the city.
Don't miss it!!. One of the most lovely and beautiful parks of New York! Small but really neat. With free wifi, take a seat in one of its metal chair and simply enjoy the views.
Pretty little park. Beautiful little park in the middle of the city!!! Lots of little seating areas to drink your coffee and sit back and relax your feet for a little bit!!!!

My favorite little park in NYC!. I love this park. It is convenient to all the different subway connections and as a starting/meeting point for almost all trips into the different areas of Manhattan.During the summer everything bustles and they have, so many restuarants and outdoor seats that this is just an awesome location!Oh Yeah... probably the cleanest public bathrooms in all of the city at the W42nd street side near subway entrance!

Nice Walk. We headed down to Bryant Park to catch the ferry to Ellis Island to the Statue of Liberty. We had been told that the ferry was free but when we got down there it was a $25 per person fee and Ellis Island was closed for repairs from Hurricane Sandy. I was not going to pay $25 per person to just take pictures of Ms. Liberty. We walked around the park and took pic's from a distance. The public bathroom facilities were horrific. The city needs to clean this up.

Lovely Park & great pit stop for kids in the middle of manhattan!. I visited with my 2 children in January 2012 and it was amazing. Such a beautiful spot during the day and lit up at night when the ice skating rink is there. I would & have visited here every time I go to NYC.

My favorite park....small but beautiful. If it's Christmas time, you;ll find that Rockefeller Center is jammed packed and thick with people. Head over to Bryant Park. It has a tree, an ice rink, shops all around and food choices galore.

Oasis.. Love. Love. Love Bryant Park! Fantastic place to chill out and eat your lunch. Tons of shops around its borders, including the tiny but awesome HBO Shop and Asics Store. Try to avoid using the public restrooms though (as you should all public park restrooms).

Our favourite NYC park. Central park may be the famous one, Washington square park is great for people watching but our favourite NYC park is Bryant park. Smaller, it has a nice intimate feel. In the summer when we visited it was lovely to sit in the sun with a drink, and when we visiited last year in December the Ice rink was out along with lots of christmas stalls selling gifts and decorations plus food and delicious hot apple cider. Always one of our top to do's in New York.

Ice Skating & Carrousel. It's worth the extra money to pay for the immediate access pass to the skating rink. The regular line was very long. We loved the rink, and thought it was a great place to skate. Rockefeller Center is nice too, but this has a totally different fell- more like a small village. The restaurant overlooking the skating rink has a great view. The Carrousel on site is very nice, and the vendor shops set up around the rink are great for browsing. Some in our group did not want to skate, so they had had plenty to do - and a great view from the restaurant "Celsius" - which features glass-enclosed lounges.

Sanctuary in the middle of NYC. When your in the middle of Manhattan, all shopped out and looking for somewhere to catch your breath... head for Bryant Park, grab a seat and a coffee before you head back to the mayhem!

Great place to watch the world go by. This is a lovely park to sit and have a coffee and people watch. It's centrally located and an oasis of calm amongst the bizz. There are several coffee/soup stalls and tables to use.

whats not to love. Bryant Park is a must visit when in Manhattan. Centrally located and so many little specialty shops makes it a charm. Its like a picture out of a movie during Holiday season, ice skating hot chocolate, warm yummy crepes made right in front of your face. Pretty much anything to satisfy your crave whether for food or shopping. You must go if in the city.

Go there, nothing should stop you. You don’t need to skate if you don’t feel like it, but you must visit this wonderful park. Located behind New York Library, you will find multiple vendors with plenty to fill your stockings with and then some, food that you probably will not find in your home town (Mmm…Enfes-oh, it was so so good). I did visit the park twice during that visit-Saturday and Sunday. Ice skating was fun, but on the pricey side, though at the Rockefeller Center, it was more and longer line and smaller ring, so you pick.

Spring in NY. While strolling Fifth Avenue, walk around to the back of the Library and you will thoroughly enjoy Bryant Park. The gardening staff does an absolutely excellent job planting bulbs and flowers, cleaning up and making this jewel a perfect place for coffee or a light lunch, or a game of chess. Children love "Le Carrousel" in Bryant Park, and you will love the flowers and peacefulness. Enjoy the Holiday Shops, if you are there around Thanksgiving and Christmas.

Relax in the middle of the city!. Nice decent-sized park adjacent to the library. Lots of tables and chairs, library reading area, coffee, carousel,etc. Nice place to relax and take a break while touring. Plus, the subway is right there!

Excellent park just off Broadway. With a clean bathroom! Call it a reprieve from the craziness of Times Square. Big green lawn (but not at all in size like Central Park.) Lots of tables and chairs, a carousel, food carts, right behind the NY Public Library. You could stop and eat, just rest or queue up for the women's restroom. I read about the clean bathrooms in a guide book. I guess everyone else did too since the women's room had a 20 minute wait. It is a good place for a break in your crazy touristy day, or for outdoor lunch on your workday. There's free wi-fi. And holiday events and winter ice skating.http://www.bryantpark.org/

Nice place to wander in midtown. Bryant Park is really a great midtown oasis. There are always lots of chairs to sit on, and they have great bathrooms, which is really something in NYC. In the winter they set up an ice rink, which is free! There's also a little market, and plenty of vendors selling food and drinks. Right next to the Library, which is also worth visiting.
It was lifeless. No one there and was closed, i can picture what it must be like in summer and i cant wait to go back and see it

A Unique Park in the Middle of Concrete Jungle. You will be surprised to find a public park, Bryant Park, in the middle of the biggest concrete jungle – New York City. You can enjoy a smoke-free environment while visiting the park thanks to the law prohibiting smoking in NYC's public parks that went into effect on May 23, 2011.We went there around noon and saw lots of people sitting in the park, having lunch in the open air, and enjoying the sunshine. I could not recall any other big cities I visited with skyscrapers around can afford such a park with settings to allow people to relax during their lunch break. Don’t get me wrong, the park is open daily from 7:00 am until late night. It is like an oasis that makes you slow down and feel relax.Bryant Park is a WiFi "Hot Spot", so you can just bring your WiFi enabled gadgets and enjoy the park. The park even promotes its WiFi – “Go wireless and turn Bryant Park into your new office. Your clients will be impressed with your front lobby.”Bryant Park was celebrating its 20th anniversary when we visited in 2012. It was redesigned in 1992 by Bryant Park Corporation - a nonprofit, private management company. With more than 6 million visitors annually, it is the most popular public park in the world.Bryant Park is more than just a garden; you can sit, eat, talk, work, take the Le Carrousel, ice skate at the Citi Pond in the winter for free, and attend varies events - concerts, performances, product launches. You can conclude the unforgettable visit with a meal in one of the restaurants around it.

Unexpected pleasure. Small oasis in the city with books and good seats provided. Nearby  wine and restaurant bar was perfect for an early evening drink with nibbles. We didn't stay for food but it looked good and was clearly popular. Staff excellent and obliging. .

Skating and Christmas shopping galore. While I always lament Bryant Park's wonderful lawn being covered over, the fall transformation into a skating rink and Christmas crafts fair is the exception. The rink at Citi Pond is larger than other rinks in NYC (Rock Ctr and Wollman) and cheaper than others as well. And there are lots of great booths for purchasing unusual crafts for the family. By the time the crafts booths and then the rink leave after the holidays, I am always sad to see them go!
Not Really a Park. Its a place to have shops and skating and a little carousel and an expensive restaurant. It is not really a park with trees and open spaces.
even in the Winter.... even in the winter this Park has kept it' s charm. In the middle between NYC sky scrapers, it is still nice to hang around.
Beautiful. What a lovely park right in busy Midtown New York. Lovely park during day as well as at night although they close it off at night. still lovely to see with lights on.

Just love this park!. Bryant Park is a place to be. At Christmas time there are nice stands where they sell beautiful handmade things. You could also skate there or just relax with a cup of coffee and enjoy the atmosphere. You can find your Christmas spirit - at least for a while.
Beautiful. I think is not the most beautiful in NYC, but the visit worth. Really close from times square, that's an attraction that you don't will regret to visit. Great photos.

Bryant Park- Great Year round. Christmas market is wonderful. The Ice Skating rink is so neat to be around and watch the people skate in. Summer it is a wonderful place to sit and have lunch or listen to music on Wednesdays, outdoor movies on Mondays, or free yoga on Thursdays.

Great in all seasons. Winter is fun for the ice skating and if you go during the holidays, there are many unique shops for everyone on your list. Absolutely great selection. Spring and summer are wonderful too. They often show movies on a large screen. It pays to find out if there are special events planned. They are always fun and worth seeing.

One of the best parks in town. This is a big 2/3rds of a NYC block park on 42nd right behind the NYC Library. Always something going on from TV show shootings to ice skating to just sitting/laying out enjoying a sunny afternoon in NYC. Little tables around the perimeter provide a comfortable place to just sit and watch the show go by.

From Ice Skating in the Winter to Concerts in the Summer. Great place to wander for seasonal events and offerings. Free wifi, sandwich shops, a restaurant, a great lawn in the summer and a nice ice skating rink in the winter. Fashion shows, holiday shops, free movies and concerts are offered seasonally. Worth a walk through or a short stay, depending upon how much time you have. And because it's at the back of the NYC Public Library, good reading material abounds.

Ice Skating. Went on our first visit to New York, what a brilliant experienceNo queues, no lines, no crowding...fantasticIt was around $14 for boot hire and we left our belongings in the cloak room which was another couple of dollars. We skated for around 45 minutes before we were tired out, hard work for people that have not skated for 10+ years!!
Pretty park. Loved this little park tucked away behind the Library - it reminded me of Paris with the little bistro tables and sunshine!
Outdoor ice skating on the pond. The ice skating pond is free of charge and skate rental is $14.00. It is beautiful and in the middle of the city. Lots of fun, clean, well kept. A great attraction!

Wonderful place in the city. My daughter and myself visited NYC for 6 days during Thanksgiving. We absolutely loved Bryant Park. All the holiday shops were open so we were able to buy some nice things. The green space is wonderful with all the tall buildings surrounding it. The park is like an oasis. We walked around and saw all the vendors and the skaters at the rink. There were a lot of people out and about enjoying the park and the ambiance was wonderful. If I lived or worked nearby I would be in Bryant Park everyday.
The best thing I have found in NY. Small choosy park in the hart of Manhattan, it is nice to be there in a sunny day with a coffee from something else than Starbucks.
lovely park. This is a beautiful little park in the city. Well worth a visit with a coffee and book. Great place to sit back, relax and watch the world go by

Whatever is your wish.. Bryant Park is now one of the most visited places in midtown. There are booths selling food, skating rink in winter, games like ping-pong in the summer and a reading area to sit and browse through the magazines and books there. Many persons are sunbathing on the grass as well. And of course lots of places to get a drink. Films are also shown in the summer evenings.

Magical. We visited Bryant Park to do a little ice skating on my first trip to New York over Thanksgiving weekend. We went on a Monday night I hopes that there wouldn't be a huge crowd, which of course there was but the rink didn't feel over crowded other than the long line to get in and crowding in the seating areas. Skate rental and rink fee was reasonable, i think it was something along the lines of $12-16 per person. There was a bag check- either you or they would supply the bag- and lockers available for rent. There's a small concession stand, which was over priced--like everything in NYC but not too bad. Unfortunately we were there the day before they lit the Christmas tree---apparently it's the Tuesday after Thanksgiving--- but all the lights and music made it magical just the same. All around the staff were great, there were staff on the ice helping those who fell get back up. Definitely would come back.

One of my favorite parks. Changes by the season from ice skating in winter, to outdoor movies in the summer. Also hosts fashion week. has booths for crafts gifts. great place to eat lunch under a tree. excellent location on NY Public Library grounds

Skating and shops at Xmastime, movies in the summer, and lounging on the grass in between!. For those who want to go ice skating in New York City for whom the cramped rinks at Rockefeller Center and in Central Park do not appeal, Bryant Park puts up a sizable rink during the Christmas holidays, I believe just from around Thanksgiving to the end of January. Couple that with the shops that surround the rink for holiday shopping, and you can have a good deal of fun at the park for a wintery evening.At the other end of the seasonal spectrum, on Monday nights over the summer there are free movies - bring your own lawn chair, or if you arrive early, you may be able to grab one of park's own metal chairs in a prime viewing spot.In between, there is the lovely huge lawn in the center of the park that makes sitting on a chair after work and staring at the green a fantastic way to decompress and prepare for a fun evening in New York City!Incidentally, Bryant Park for a time hosted the NY Fashion Week, which meant that the center 2/3 of the park was off-limits

Urban Oasis. I go there all year round. My last visit was in December to watch the ice skating. Beautiful place to go and just sit for a little while. Adjacent to the NY Public Library which is also worth a visit.
Magical Place. Few blocks from Grand Central Station Its definitely worth a stop to rest your tired feet or to have a hot chocolateThe ice-skating is free, if you bring your own skates.

Neat little park - especially in winter!!!. The Bryant Park takes on a personality of its own - especially in winter! The ice-skating rink with avid ice - skaters, the small kiosks selling hot chocolate, popcorn and innumerable little things - transforms this place into a mini paradise! A little secret - the ice-skating rink is one of the best in the city...music playing in the background and neatly laid out tables and lounge chairs ..all make this a very enjoyable place to visit. The ice-skating is free, if you bring your own skates. The location of this park puts it in the middle of every tourists path - walking distance from Times Square, a stone's throw from Grand Central Station and just adjoining the New York Library building. The park is small and does tend to feel crowded. Its definitely worth a stop to rest your tired feet and indulge in some ice-skating or some people watching, but not worth a special visit!
So Pretty. Great place to sit and talk. And the ice skating is so fun, even when it's crowded. And sitting next to the library is definitely a plus.

A little jewel in the city!. Take the time to sit and people watch. Skaters in the winter, little shops around the square. Sit and rest those weary feet for the next stop on your adventure! Have a coffee and create another little memory. Magical!
accessible park with ice rinks. Just a park in the middle of the city. It is nice place to take a rest when you get tired with walking all through the city.

GREAT LOCATION AND VERY PRETTY. Witnessing the frozen fountain in the Winter was a highlight. Watching the skaters in the freezing bitter cold was short lived by the blustery winds but overall Bryant Park is well worth the visit.

Great time~. We were so happy to have this park so close to our hotel. The kids and I borrowed skates there and skated until our legs had enough. It was 14.00 per person but if you had a citi card it was only 5 dollars. I do believe they have a free skate from 12-1pm but you will have to check to make sure that is still true. They do clean off the ice to keep it fresh. It's a great time I'm sure people of all ages would love to spend time here.
Loved the mood in the night. Just cool in the nighttime with the ligths, trees and some mist. different arrangements in the weekends, possible to get quick bites

What a magical place!. Visited with my husband and our 2 kids.The ambiance, surroundings, activities, etc. it's excellent.My husband and 7 yr old daughter even learned how to juggle!I highly recommend this magical place.

Bryant Park, an oasis in busy Manhattan. Visited Bryant Park and was surprised how beautiful it is. We were there in winter so the ice skating rink was there but I have been told that the rink is cleared in summer and lawn placed down. The great thing about Bryant Park is that it is an easy walk from Times Square. so if you are visiting Manhattan even if you don't have a lot of time to spare Bryant Park is a great option.A friend went to the restaurant there and said the steaks were great.

Great place to visit for skating in the winter, movies in the summer, lunch on the lawn. Whatever the season there is always something going on in Bryant Park. They have skating on Citi-Pond until Feb/ March. Its a great place to enjoy the day with other skaters and they have lots of great cafes for warm beverages. On Mondays in the summer, they have movies on the lawn. It is a great time to meet/ greet and also catch a flick for FREE. Bring your blanket, some snacks, sit back and enjoy! On a nice day or even not so nice day, its relaxing to sit in the park ( at one of the many tables that they have ) and enjoy some people watching. They have cafes where you can purchase food/ drink and also the Bryant Park Grill if you want a sit down meal. The drinks are a bit pricey though if you are going for a drink or two.
Ice rink. Park had a christmas market around the ice rink. Now that Christmas is over, there's not so much going on.

Stunning!. It is really nice to take a break here. All the lovely greenery everywhere was a really nice change to all the buildings surrounding. I think it could benefit more if it had more going on during the day. A few more cafes or some games in the park etc. worth a walk through anyway!

Ice Skating in New York. Really easy place to get to from where we were staying. Nice small park, surrounded by impressive buildings so great skating outside. You cannot skate with a bag so you need a locker for it - bring a padlock with you as they do not provide one! Alternative is to pay for a bag to put your stuff in and then take that to a place to be looked after. Not as expensive as the Rockerfeller as you only pay for skate hire here (my daughter brought her own skates), and more conveniently placed in the city than the one in Central Park (unless you are staying at the posh end of town!!).

Nice Park in the Middle of Midtown. The park has nothing fancy in particular besides some chairs were you can have lunch or just relax for a bit. I heard that they features movies or make a bunch of activities but I've never seen them.One of the best thing is that the library is right there and the building is beautiful. You can check out a book a read it right there in the park. Nice place but nothing special about it in my opinion.

Excellent place to rest and relax. Went on a weekday because I heard that it gets crowded during the weekends. My wife and I had a great & relaxing time while watching people skate. The place is very clean, has free wi-fi, security, a café and a few chairs were you can seat and talk. It was a great idea to come here early on a weekday and we had a great time.

Is it literally correct to call a park Elegant. We visited this park twice on out trip, the first time on our first day, and as one of first experiences in New York, with a Big Apple Greeter. It was raining, and very cold, but we looked at the Statuary,and the Carousel, we liked the place and we moved on.We visited again on a Sunday, the last day of our trip. The ice skaters were all out, 60's christmas carols playing at volume, and we sat on fine park furniture, sipping hot apple cider and people watching. It was grand, and amoungst my best memories. It is free and it abbuts the library, also free, so its sort of a twofer deal for travellers and highly reccommended

Unexpected Christmas Fun - one of our NYC highlights. We visited NYC in early December and, following a good review in a guide book, decided to wander to Bryant Park. Boy - was that a great decision. It's just so festive. The huge Christmas tree, lovely stalls and, of course, the skating. It's a magical place. We visited a few times while in NYC and were lucky enough to see "The Piano Guys" perform: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qu5RY94ldDc

The Gem of Manhattan. In the heart of midtown Manhattan between 5th and 6th Avenues at 42nd St., Bryant Park is by far my favorite attraction in NYC.There's always something going on...Tai Chi classes, guided birding tours, knitting classes, book discussions, free movie nights, free live Broadway play snippets, chess, checkers, ping pong, petanque, and the list goes on.This is where New Yorkers work on getting a tan during their lunch breaks! For bookworms, there is a 'open air' library where you can check out a book to read. There's always a jazz pianist performing (free) during the summer. Free ice skating in the winter. And a fun carousel for children.Don't miss Bryant Park on your next visit to New York!p.s. The public restrooms were voted the best in New York.

Little unexpected gem. We found this place on our way to Times Square, completely by accident. The cold weather coupled with watching people ice skating was a lovely experience. Would imagine it would be just as pleasant in the summer.Much better than our experience of Central Park, which was cold and faceless by comparison
So beautiful . Very nice. Such a beautiful park. Great skating in the winter and what's best is the amazing views all around you. Especially of the empire State building.

Bryant Park,a place for all seasons. You can people watch in the summer, or ice skate in the winter. Have a drink with the Yuppies (or maybe B+T commuters) after work at the cafes, or Bryant Park Cafe, maybe even an outdoor movie on a summer night . To think this place was 'needle city' 25 years ago.

Pretty little park. Pretty little park that we stumbled on by accident. Skating rink was up and added to the snow from last weekend it was really nice. Fountain was beautiful with the icicles on it. Lots of seating and tables to have a rest on. Toilets to use and a Wichcraft where you could grab a drink / food.
Relaxing in Manhattan. Bryant Park is one of our favorite places in Manhattan. You can sit and relax between bustling New York sipping from a great coffee and watch the people passing by!

Improving everyday. Every time I visit or pass by Bryant Park they have added yet another appreciated improvement. Whoever is in charge of it is doing an excellent job. The shops, restaurants, and entertainment are all well thought out, located and implemented for the entertainment of the public and elevation of the entire area.

What a find ! A hidden Gem !. During my recent birthday trip research I spotted Bryant Square as the new place to skate in NY. My husband and I were staying at the Hilton Times Square and as the park was only a couple of blocks away we wandered down. What a find this little park is !! The atmosphere was brilliant both day and night. There is a lovely outside bar that has heaters all round the seating areas and a fire pit to keep you warm, there is an inside bar called Celsius which also serves food and we highly recommend the beautiful more formal restaurant called The Grill. We ate here one evening and had a wonderful meal in almost magical surroundings with the Fairy lights through the trees and the skating rink all lit up. There was even a wedding party on the ice in all their wedding outfits. We were told that in the summer grass is laid and films shown on huge screens whilst people enjoy snacks and drinks from the little stalls all round the area. We intend to do this later in the year..

Ski in the heart of NYC. If younare in NYC in winter, don't miss visiting the Bryant Park. The Park is converted to a skating rink, filled and maintained with snow. Kids love to ski here, enjoying the warmth of the sun shine. Close to the Public Library, it is a great entertainer.

Something special in New York!. The building that overlooks it contains some of the Mayor's offices so I'm guessing that's an incentive to keep it especially nice, but nice it is. The public restrooms in the park are very clean and often have flowers.The park hosts a lot of events like early morning summer concerts with some amazingly big names. There are nice bistro-style tables and chairs and depending on where in the park you are, there are several different atmospheres. There is also often filming going on either within the park or on the bordering streets. And of course the winter skating. Definitely a nice place to visit.
A little bit of green in NYC !. Great place to visit after a stressed out day at the hospital with my grand daughter. Movie on the lawn on Fridays.

tranquil spot. Behind the NY Public Library is a lovely park. Depending on the time of year different events take place. Around the holidays there are outdoor shops, ice skating, fashion week other events take place. It can be a nice tranquil spot in an otherwise bustling city.

Brings a smile to my face. A large park with restrooms and a large skating rink in the middle of it all; small shops set up in kiosks all around he skating rink with all sorts of craft items from knitted mittens to clay pots and jewelry and food, topped off with a fountain. A delight to wander through.
skating. wonderful experience during holiday seasons...skating under Christmas tree! Inexpensive rental price

My favourite place in NYC. Bryant Park felt like a dream. We visited during 20F weather and the fountain was frozen. I couldn't get enough, kept coming back. The atmosphere is magical and the location of the park is quite central so it's easy to get to and easy to use as a starting point for other closeby destinations.Highly recommended.

Bryant Park. We stopped off here on our way to the New York public library and really enjoyed what was on offer here. Lots of stalls to look round but best of the all was the Max Brenner stall a must for a chocolate love like me. A very pretty park at Christmas time well worth a visit.
Festive spot at the holidays. We visited at Thanksgiving and enjoyed the sidewalk shops and watching people ice skate. It was easy to walk through and was a relaxing spot.
Cold but fun. We were there during a record cold spell and viewed the fountain frozen, quite a sight! The skating was fun to watch with colored lights and very colorful skaters.
Great Hang Out in Midtown. Always something happening in Bryant Park, seasonal exhibits, summer movie nights, reading corner, food, drinks.

Bryant Park. So much goes on @ Bryant Park all year round. In winter u can ice skate & summer u can Roller skate! There are shops & a restaurant that is really good. a lovely place to just browse around & enjoy whatever the weather! Even have free concerts & Films!
Free wifi!. Nice little park, can get very crowded, so if you're looking for a secluded spot to site go somewhere else, but it's a great NYC wifi hotspot!
Best in Christmas. Place is at its best during the winter time. In the summer a lot of people are here enjoying the good weather and playing games.
Amazing transformation. Beautifully redone and wonderful place to visit. Far cry from needle park/dollar-a-joint days of the 70's!

Fun but crowded!. This was our second time skating at the Citipond. It is really great. We paid $25 today track which was worth it as we had limited time. Well organized. It can be free if you wait in line so there is always a line and lots of skaters. Definitely fun and enjoyable.

Magic!. Girlfriend and i went there a couple times during New years eve last december. We just found the place very relaxing even tho it was crowded. Great place to have a lunch and read a book or just to take a break from lovely but crazy Manhattan.

great experience during the holiday season!. Bryant park is vibrant and jam packed with tourists and locals of the neighbouring boroughs alike. if you are visiting between Xmas eve and New Years Eve Expect long line ups to get into the skate rental/ locker area. If you have a "New York Pass" which can be purchased online, you can speed through the line and gain entry right away. But standing in line really isnt all that bad. As you pace along in the qeue, there are small vendors selling warm food items including fresh donuts, peanuts, pretzels and such. Each vendor is in a small wooden hut type structure, personalised by some sort of art. You also get alook at the merry go round and surrounding buildings at a slowed down pace. I personally found that standing in line gave me a chance to slow down and take in the surroundings. But if your on a tight schedule and cant afford 45 mins to an hour in line, then I suggest you go with the New York pass. Skates cost 14 per pair. For some reason they are all mens skates so if you are a woman asking for your size, they just give you 2 sizes smaller in a mens skate which I found to be really tight - but they are friendly and will exchanfge sizes if you ask. You can also rent a big blue 'sac' to put your shoes and other belongings into for $5.00. if you are in a large group, rent this bag and have it put aside. It works out to be much cheaper and more convenient than a locker. Overall it’s a great experience! The big great tree covered in lights, the café faces the rink and is completely see in with all glass coverings. Its all lovely!

A little slice of heaven in the middle of a hustling city. Bryant park is a true treasure, a jewel in the crown of New York City. Nestled between towering skyscrapers and busy streets is a wonderful lush garden where you can really unwind. We always make plans as soon as we arrive in New York to have lunch at the Bryant Park Grill. The food and wine are excellent, but it's being surrounded by the beauty of the trees that is so worth while in this amazing city. We're taking my mum for her 65th birthday this April and Bryant park will be our first port of call.

Loved seeing Bryant Park in Winter with the ice skating rink!. My partner and I kept on coming back to Bryant Park many times at night during our two weeks in New York. It truly was magical with a huge blue and white Christmas tree (I liked it better than the tree at Rockefeller) and the little stalls and ice rink made it so special! Highly recommend you experience this if in New York.

You've come a long way, baby. Used to be the home of half the drug addicts and homeless in the city. The park a\has come a long way since those days and is well worth the visit. Great people watching lunch spot in the warm weather but activities all year long.

Brilliant for affordable skating. Went skating here with our two kids over Christmas, what can I say, Manhatten skyline in background with huge Chritmas tree at one end, sun shining and Frank Sinatra playing, a really special experience. Does get quite busy by lunchtime but I can see why. Loved it, however didn't really explore shops or cafes.

Very pretty. Nice little area of a few shops, ice rink and a pretentious cafe. The Celsius cafe has bar staff who think they are so above customers its unreal.Better to go to the little outdoor cafes and sit in the late winter sun.We had the best pop corn ever there tooGreat area and very relaxing

A bit tourist trap-like. We were disappointed at the park, although if you like strolling among a lot of over-priced boutiques, this place is for you. It is nice that you can skate there if you are so inclined. But otherwise it is nothing special at Christmas time.

Lovely little park. Lovely little park. We visited in November so the ice rink was there. Was able to have a hot drink sat under the heaters. Some lovely little shops dotted around. A real little treasure.

Outstanding winter spot. What a great little spot, filled with little shops and an amazing ice skating rink, a fantastic Bar/restaurant.Smack bang in the heart of Times Square, very pretty place, and we even did some celebrity spotting here, Matthew Broderick skating with his children

People watching. On our brief few days in the city of New York. We stopped twice in this little park. You may not think it much, especialy when New York has Central park. It is a place that many use to meet others. For my mom and I a place to sit down and take a break from all the walking we were doing. But may like to come and play a game of chess, or and I am sorry for the spelling Botchi. There are those that take this game seriously as they bring their own ball's. It is a place were others can come to read a book. The main library is located there. There is even a small caracel.

Favorite Park in NYC. This park was instantly my favorite when I first experienced it over a decade ago. Located behind the NYC Public Library and in the shadows of the Chrysler building this park is an oasis in the concrete jungle. Like all parks in NYC the location changes moods depending on the time of year. Ice skating and Christmas village in winter and sunbathers and concerts in the summer. One visit is not enough. Some eateries line the edges of the parks and vendor booths are inside the park as well as an eatery in the park. The park has facilities as well as all the locations lining the park. There are tables and chairs to relax under the trees or sit in the grassy areas when weather permits. Chess is routinely played here under the trees during the warmer months. The park can also be a great place for tourists of the city to take a picnic or just make a relaxing stop during your many destinations in NYC. The park also makes an ideal meeting point as the size is not large. One of the great places in NYC.
Great park. Fun to take in a film, sit on the grass, have a drink or snack at the cafe, and mingle with professionals of all ages.

Great Experience. Beautiful, cold day, but enjoyed watching the skaters. Enjoyed hot chocolate and the atmosphere after Christmas. The shops still offered holiday merchandise and was able to purchase just the right Christmas ornament momento. Would love to go back and visit in the spring/summer.

Winter Delight. Bryant park is fun, eclectic and delightful during the holidays. all the stores (small booths), outside and inside eateries, the skating rink is fun and the food at cielos is delicious. the tree rivals the one at rockefeller. great family fun and you can spend all day at the park.

Ice Skating. We recently took a day trip to New York and choose to ice skate here instead of Rockafeller Plaza. What a great choice. There is no fee to skate (skate rental fee only). It looked bigger than the ice at Rockafeller Plaza and much, much cheaper. There were also some nice little shops nearby.

Sure there's the holiday shops, but don't forget the zagat-rated Bryant Park Grill. When I'm giving a quick walking tour of midtown to out-of-town friends, I often walk them through Bryant Park and stop by the Bryant Park Grill for a nice, lite lunch. If you go a little after the lunchtime rush, it's a calm oasis and our server was attentive -- made us feel so welcome that we ordered a 2nd glass of wine :) When you're done, there are several good shops on the leeward side of street bordering the south side of the Park.
Churros and markets. Really nice place to visit ona cold winter night to eat the Churros in chocolate at midnight:))Loved the stalls and shopping

Tired. This was our 2nd visit to Bryant Park and it looked a bit tired this year. There will still people skating & the little kiosks were still set up selling their wares but I thought it lacked something - snow perhaps?

Great fun. Behind the greatest library in the greatest city, find Bryant Park and Citi Pond ... an outdoor skating rink amidst the bustle of Manhattan. For the ultimate tourist bargain, bring your own skates and padlock, then you can store your stuff and skate for FREE! Yes, rental skates are available. Also plenty of food selections just outside the rink. Nice cross-section of NYers skating and watching on this sunny, crisp January day. Good music too!
There's a bigger ice rink here. If you're here in december and Rockafeller is packed there is a bigger rink here, with a market, and a great big decorated tree. It was beautiful

Ice skating, food, drinks, and shopping.... Bryant Park was beautiful, there are so many things for everyone to do here. Ice skating for people of all ages, two restaurants/bars, shopping pavillions, hot chocolate, you name it! While we were visiting the second time, there was an acapella group singing Christmas carols. It was such a wonderful experience for us! Beautiful Christmas tree!!!!

Midtown gem. Definitely worth a stop. Just a short walk from other midtown attractions like Times Square and Macy's. Enjoy the huge lawn and seating areas in the Spring and Summer, and the skating rink and holiday shops in the Fall and Winter. If you visit any time from the end of October through the first week of January, the dozens of holiday shops that are set in glass-enclosed kiosks provide a wonderful opportunity to purchase gifts and enjoy an assortment of food items. On our recent visit, we did a lot of Christmas shopping for my wife and the relatives without leaving the park (you can preview your shopping itinerary on the Park's website).

Lovely. I really love this park, very close to Times Square and Public Library, and still a nice and quite place to relax. There are different booths with different crafts and foods. So if you want self-made jewelry or eat something different (try whichcraft!), you should definitely check it out. In the winter you can go ice-skating there and drink yummy apple cider!

Awesome New York experience. What a lovely place in heart of city! You can watch Empire State Building as you skate by! Lovely xmas markets! Value for money about $24 for skate hire and session from 6 to 10pm' and no long queues like Rockefeller centre

nice little park in midtown Manhattan. Just behind the New York Public Library on 42nd Street, Bryant Park is a small oasis in midtown. In the summer, sit under a tree to cool off; in the winter watch the ice skaters and shop at the Christmas market.

Interesting place to cruise around in NYC .. An interesting and fun place to go ice skating in the winter time, with a lovely christmas view with the bright christmas tree,or a nice walk in the park at summer time with great places to eat.

Fun Skating In NYC!. Nice place to skate however the ice is chopped up even after being flooded. You can rent skates which are in pretty good condition with very sharp blades - be careful if like us - you haven't skated in awhile or ever! It is a nice experience!! You can also buy a lock so that you can store personal items while you skate or you can "rent a bag" in which you can put your things which will be watched for you. My hubby and I couldn't decide if we should do this activity and I am so glad that we did on our last day in NYC!!

Great holiday spot!. All manner of small shops are set up for the holiday season throughout this beautiful historic park along with ice skating rink and Christmas tree. Grab a coffee and watch the skaters from a cafe table in the park. Do some holiday shopping and stop by the public library right next door.
A great place to take a break. This park was a great rest stop as we walked around NYC - there were skaters on the ice rink, and there were also little kiosk artisans selling their wares as well.

Cool Marketplace, Great Ice Skating Rink. I come here with my girlfriend during winter for the Nighttime ice skating. A cool little date night here never fails to cheer the mood. ALOT of restaurants in the are too. The rink is also surrounded by individual vendors, so you can see some interesting things here.

Often overlooked gem!. We strolled the shops, marvelled at the massive and beautifully decorated Christmas tree, enjoyed watching the skaters at The City Pond in Bryant Park then went indoors at Celcius to enjoy fantastic specialty hot chocolate while waiting to be seated in the "outdoor" restaurant. This portion of the restaurant has large, poufy leather couches with tons of pillow and radiant heaters above to keep you toasty warm while enjoying the outdoor atmosphere. Food was ok - if you're ordering a burger, ask for it well done (because med-well comes back very pink inside even after sending it back to be better cooked).

Fun skating alternative to Rockefeller Center. We went on a snowy/rainy Saturday and definitely noticed the rink better maintained at Bryant Park compared to Rockefeller which was very mushy and made skating a bit difficult. Beautiful tree with blue and white lights for a nice photo op, even if you do not skate. It is located next to Public Library which is another place to stop in and see beautiful architecture as well as gorgeous frescoes.
Great NYC Experience. Totally overcrowded the day after Christmas, but what a cool spot. The most amazing veiws. Shops, restaurant, etc. It is free if you bring your own skates.
A load of small hand crafted stalls with in the park.. Good shopping for local stuff. Food available. Good walking around and just watching. Not far from Grand Central

Great place to hang out during the Holidays. We went to Bryant Park a few years ago during the holidays and had fun so going back on Christmas day was a no brainer. In a nutshell there is an ice skating rink, a great tree gleaming in blue, food options and many vendors in cute wooden booths and it was open on Christmas Day. Walking around and seeing all the items for sale many made by local artists is fun and range from jewelry to food and clothing. It can be crazy but like most places in the city, they are all crazy. Centrally located at 42nd and 6th makes it a great place to stop and hang out while in midtown.
Greatest park. Greatest park in NYC. Ice skating in winter, ping pong and chess in summer and always a great time for free. Great place to decompress from all the stimulation.

Fun skating day. Citi Pond is nice because it's inexpensive compared to other skating places and it's usually less crowded. We went last year and it was sooo crowded on a Saturday....so we splurged this year and got the VIP passes to skip the line. Of course, we got there and....there was no line to skip!! :) Anyway, we paid $25 per person to skip the line, get skate rental and a rental to hold our shoes. It's a bit crowded in the area to get on your skates, but you could get a seat if you waited a minute. The ice was in pretty bad shape when we first went on, but that's expected after so many people skating on it. I was with my older kids (16 and 12) and my youngest who is 4. It can be chaotic with an inexperienced skater, but i have to admit that people were surprisingly pleasant and were watching out for the littler ones. It started snowing while we were skating, which was quite magical. They had a fun time skating and then looking around at the little shops on the perimeter of the rink. Overall, it was fun and a great alternative to Rockefeller Center. We walked up there later to see the tree and I'm glad we didn't wait in line to skate there. Go, you'll have fun!

Awesome during the holidays. I went ice skating to Bryant Park a few days ago and it was great. I would recommend purchasing the VIP pass which is double the price but at least you won't have to wait in long lines. The atmosphere is great as you get to see hundreds of people ice skating while you get the great view of the beautifully decorated tree. After the skating, we ended up going to take pics by the tree and got some hot chocolate which was perfect. This is a great place for parents with small children or anyone who wants to have fun.

Great at christmas. Our hotel was round the corner from this park and we really liked having a walk around. It was really christmassy with lots of little stalls and food outlets and a big ice skating rink. Skating was reasonably priced (free with own skates) and cost us $14 dollars and we could for this we could have had as long as we wanted. Really nice place to sit and get in the christmas spirit watching the ice skaters and drinking hot chocolate.

GREAT altrenative to Rockefeller Center. I HIGHLY suggest Bryant Park for ice skating! The rink is bigger than Rockefeller, cheaper, and a whole heck of a lot less crowded. Every 1 1/2 hours they Zamboni the rink and you can skate as long as you want...at Rockefeller they limit you to a 1 1/2 hour block. I also suggest paying the $28 for a Fastpass...that gives you entry, skates, a bag to check your belongings, and a skip-to-the-front-of-the-line. This was my very first time skating and I had a wonderful time!
Must do in NYC!. We had a wonderful time go early in the day can be extremely busy. We skated and then had hot chocolate and cannoli's, best cannoli's I've eaten so far.
Skating. Ice skating right in the middle of the city is sensational and gives Xmas a special feeling. We loved just watching families having fun.

A must see in Winter. I go every time I go to NYC. It is magical pre-Christmas with the skaters, the decor and the Holiday Faire. It started to snow when I was there this time, and everyone cheered. Don't miss it.
LOVE!!!. As a massive Christmas fan this place was more Chrismassy than Santa himself!! Loved the markets, the vibe and the food. It is a magical place ;)

Was fun. We went in winter, so got to see the cool ice rink and watch people skating. There were some great holiday decorations in the park. Also got an up-close view of the Empire State Building from here.. Free attraction in NYC...

One of my favorite parks in NYC. This is a very small park, but it's right in midtown, and has fun things to do summer and winter. Food and other attractions are close. But its the right mix of activities, but way more peaceful to just hang out and take fun pics of the skyline.

Cool Holiday Village. We went to Bryant Park for the Holiday Village and it was very, very cool! There is also a very pretty tree and a great ice skating rink. Definitely check out the park if you are in the city, I bet it is pretty cool even without the Holiday Village.

Skate the Day Away. Brayant Park is a wonderful place all year, but it shines bright in the winter months when Citi Pond is up and running. Great skating opportunities for the entire family with a festive backdrop. Much less hustle and bustle than the bigger rinks in NYC, but no less charm and fun.
Enjoyable. I enjoyed browsing through the various vendors' shops and watching people ice skating. I like the rink at the Rockefeller center much better, though.

Fun Time. We ate, shopped and skated. The weather was beautiful, the Park was very well kept--clean everywhere. The food and experience was simply wonderful. This is something everyone should experience while in NYC

The books are under the park!. Behind the New York City Public Library majestic building, there is the Bryant Park. It's located between the 5th and the 6th avenues, close to the Times Square, but conveniently away from the crowds that usually prefer neon ads than books. In fact, Bryant Park lays over the underground library archives! The surrounding area is quite interesting. There are some shops, the amazing black and golden Bryant Park Hotel building, and, during the winter, The Citi Pond, an ice skating rink. Le Pain Quotidien just in front the park is the perfect place to the beginning of the day. The omelets are fantastic! The Bryan Park Grill, in the rear of the library, is a contemporary international restaurant open from lunch to dinner. If not cheap or unforgettable, it is tasteful enough to please you. The outdoors restrooms are terrific - they will remember you that this is a public, but private park! Don't forget to visit the Citi Pond also during the night since the views are awesome.

Get in the Holiday Spirit at the Holiday Shops at Bryant Park. The Holiday Shops at Bryant Park are a recommended place to visit if you need some holiday spirit. The park is decorated in a charming manner, with each shop occupying its own glass enclosure. Selection is unique and prices are not unreasonable on everything from NYC ornaments to socks to artwork. Adjacent to the shops is an ice skating rink, and you can stop by one of the nearby lounges or restaurants to warm up or grab a bite. This is a terrific attraction to visit for New Yorkers or visitors.
A nice holiday stop. Spent an hour there with the family. Lots of little shops set up for the holidays. Could use a few more food choices though. We didn't use the skating rink but it looked good

Resting spot near the Major NY entertainment attractions. There is so much energy needed to see all the major attractions in the Big Apple so when you need to take a break why not see another free and fun attraction to rest your heels. Bryant Park is a few blocks (+/-) from Times Square and Broadway. Depending on the day of the week you can support the local artist/vendors that set up booths. If the weather is nice plan on outdoor dining. An interesting store nearby is a Japanese bookstore on the ave. On the second floor you can find an cafeteria. For a time out do think of resting on a park bench.

Christmas in Bryant Park: Skip Rockefeller Center. Ice skating rink, interesting kiosks, beautiful Christmas tree. The city constructs a temporary wonderful winter respite, complete with a cool restaurant and bar. Have a cocktail at Celsius, and watch the skaters or Zamboni clean up the ice. They have tables inside and outside (complete with table-side heaters). We enjoyed the flank steak, ahi tuna salad, macaroni and cheese. Buy some interesting gifts at the unique kiosks. Much less crowded, and much more interesting than Rockefeller Center!
Great Park. You can ice skate for free if you bring your own skates. The line goes quickly. During the Spring and Summer there is free yoga if you bring your own mat.
Fun times. Never heard of Bryant Park. Met cousins from Seattle in Manhattan and they said lets go skating. Kids had a blast while sane parents watch from the rails. Cute shops.

What fun!. The ice skating rink at Bryant Park is so festive and fun. I went with my office as our holiday lunch activity and we all had a very good time. (Skaters and non alike!) There is also a little "village" set up with different booths for purchasing fun items. It was like a little winter wonderland oasis in the middle of the city. Prices are very reasonable - free for non-skaters to enter and $12 for skate rentals. I would definitely recommend for the winter months.

Fun find. This was a pretty cool spot. Food, drink, ice skating, and shopping. What's not to like. The vendors were unique and very friendly. If you have time....drop by, skate, relax or shop. I noticed that the rink was on the Christmas episode of Glee the other night.

Loved it- Ice skating fabulous. Thank you to Rei, Erica, and Mike for making this a truly wonderful time for us. The music and venue are beautiful. Love the blue lighted tree! Only $14 to skate all day - a bargain and so much less crowded than Rock Center.

Must See stop when in NYC at Xmas. This park transforms into a winter wonderland. There are so many unique vendors pedaling their stuff. We bought a giant syringe of chocolate from "Max Brenner's Chocolate by a Bald Man" It tasted so good, but it was also unique to squirt quality chocolate into your mouth. Don't forget to skate on the rink. Make sure to see this free daily event in NYC.

Great Experience. Had a blast for my first time ice skating in NYC. Talked about it for years, but finally made it happen. Would definitely recommend getting the Fast Pass option before you get to the city. You get VIP treatment with little to no lines. Make sure to schedule time accordingly though because they do have to clean the ice every hour which takes about 20 minutes.

Holiday splender. Smaller ice rink than at Rockefeller but very charming. Beautiful at night and surrounded by quaint door shops. Celebrated my birthday lunch at the restaurant there over looking the park.

Christmas magic!. Visited Bryant Park a number of times during our recent visit and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We walked around the Christmas market stalls with our hot chocolate investigating all the different types of stalls on offer and then stood and watched the ice skating with a hot apple cider.The types of stalls ranged from arts and crafts items to a stall selling delicious macaroons.The Christmas tree here is absolutely beautiful and the whole place felt so magical. Absolutely wonderful place.

Magic!. We were in NYC in November and ice skating in the outdoors in Bryant Park was a highlight, and it was free! You can hire skates but there was no charge to get on the ice, the rink was well maintained and there was a reasonable amount of supervision to ensure safety.

Ice skating and shopping. Pretty neat find away from the chaos of Rockefeller Center. Small tent-like shops offer plenty of options for the "unique find" type of shopper. Many things could be personalized, too. Find socks to ornaments to jewelery. There are a few shops that have hot chocolate, coffee, snacks, or popcorn. Skates can be rented on-site.

NYC - Brooklyn December 2012. This place is sooooooo amazing, all the outdoor vendors, the park setting, the swings and heat lamps at the outdoor tavern, I had such a great time shopping, relaxing with a beverages and watching the people hustle and bustle in mid December. The skating rink was less crowded than Rockefeller Plaza, The outdoor vendors showcasesd quality items.

Wonderful haven!. We passed the park several times before we decided to top and browse. There are lovely craft booths as well as those selling clothing and gift items. We bought from 4 or 5 vendors and probably would shopped one mor if we didn't have luggage to think about. It's only a couple of blocks from time square - and well worth a visit.

Christmas market - !?. Don't go on the weekend - way too crowded to see anything or move in and out of stalls. Nothing spectacular in the stalls. Most expensive decorations one can ever find of average to mediocre quality. A tourist trap if you plan to buy, a good walk if you like to see people as you stroll. But, with all there is to do in NYC don't put this on your list. Go if you have exhausted all other options.

Enjoyable couple of hours here.. We spent a couple of enjoyable hours here wandering round the stall's and watching the ice skaters have fun on the ice rink. very relaxing time spent in a park in a busy city, felt very Christmasy.
Very nice. This is a really nice gem in the middle of the hustle and bustle. The icerink and Christmas tree were neat and the Christmas market was fun.

Another thing not to miss on your trip to NYC. This is a park that is just east of Times Square that could easily be missed. But it should not be. There is always something happening here. Additionally it has bathrooms, which are hard to find in the Midtown area.
Ice Skating and Holiday Pop-up Stores. Lovely little park with wonderful skating rink. Very romantic, beautiful at night, with adorable little pop-up stores for the holidays.

Nice little shops. Started and finished our bus tour here. We went and hung out while waiting for the bus. Nice little shops! It was rainy, so a little difficult getting around with umbrella's and all the people. Skating rink was nice. Wish we had time to visit the outside restaurant, but there's always next time. Stop by, you'll enjoy.

Very pretty!. Bryant park is very pretty, with lots of little boutiques in wooden huts. They all look very nice and stock some lovely items but they are quite pricey. We liked coming here in the evenings to watch the world fly by.

Awesine Day!. I hesitated to write this review (selfishly) - this is one place that we felt wasn't too crowded, we could actually enjoy ourselves, get a nice meal, shop, have fun.... Definitely a highlight of our weeklong trip. The kids ice skated ($14) to Big Band music - we had good food for a reasonable price and did some Christmas shopping at the great little shops - all in a clean, uncrowded atmosphere. Also took a break and went into the NYC public library which adjoins this park. We would most definitely go back here!

NYC hidden gem. Well, it isnt exactly a hidden gem as it's in the middle of Manhattan. But most NYers and tourist alike tend to bypass this beautiful park. One must really take the time to enjoy the park and sit and look up the skyscrapers around it and the busy cityscape. It's no central park, but its a great place to sit down and get away from the busy streets. Christmas time is one of the best time to visit this park. You have an ice skating rink bigger and less crowded than the one in Rockefeller Center and they also have their own Christmas Tree. The place also has tons of booth that sell a plethora of items - from handmade clocks to iphone covers to chococolate drinks to french macaroons. The public bathrooms are also very well kept! Definitely a must visit. The New York Public Library is next to it as well, so don't forget to check it out and explore.

Great to walk. We went to Bryant Park and even the public bathroom was great. There were a lot of tiny stores were you can find all sort of things and also an ice skating area which was more easy to get in than the one in Rockefeller Center

exceeded my expectations. The day before had a disappointing visit to Christkindlemarket in Bethlehem PA, so Bryant Park Xmas market was wonderful,! So many booths selling unique items, We found prices reasonable and many unique & unusual .items were there The ice skating rink was beautiful , there was a restaurant facing the rink with eated outside seating as well as inside dining. There were plenty of variety in food offered in various booths. The people working there were so pleasant not pushing their wares which was great . The restrooms were clean well maintained, better than in the public building I work in, we had such a fun time I think we will be going back before the season is over! By the way we were told that the food was great in the rinkside restaurant so I think I want to try it next time!

Bryant Park, best kept secret. I hate to give this a good report don't want to many people going. It is so wonderful, better than Rockefeller Center. You can move around, sit have coffee, hot cocoa, shop. They set up shops all around the ice rink, it was just a wonderful time. Could have sat there all day!

Nicer than Rockefeller Center. I love Bryant Park!! Beautifully decorated during the holidays. Nice little shops for some holiday shopping. The Christmas tree is beautiful and it's great watching the skaters on the ice skating rink. There is an outdoor restaurant, which we did not eat at. We did go inside to the bar and had a lot of fun. Drinks were reasonable, good music and the bartenders were fun and friendly. You can see the top of the Empire State Building from the park. There is plenty of seating throughout the park. The best thing about the park is the bathrooms! They have an attendant!! Clean and smell nice. It's a must visit when in NYC!

Fun for the holidays but not perfect. Maybe it was because neither my girlfriend or I had been skating in over a decade, but Citi Pond was a so-so experience. The prices aren't terrible, but if course you have to pay for every little thing. The wait was short and even though it was packed, it was relatively easy to move around. The only shortcomings were the quality of the skates and ice - seemed some skates were decent while others were very beat up, and the ice was tough to move around on since they have to flood it and never get it that smooth. Still, ice skating in NYC during the holidays is not a way to spend an afternoon by any means.

Great Christmas Shopping in a Park. This time of year they set up booths and sell Christmas related items. They also have clothing, arts, jewelry as well as food. You can check out their website as they have special events all year round. Movies in the summer and even a free ice skating rink open now

Winter Wonderland. What fun! Green space with Christmas trees, ice skating rink and tons of little shops set up in tents! We had nutella churrios, hot apple cider and bought amazing handmade soap. A great place to wander and enjoy the season!

a GREAT retreat in the urban landscape. This is a great park that has transformed the neighborhood. It is right behind the Majestic Public Library ( not to be missed) During the Xmas season there are holiday shops, during the warm season there are films and all seasons there are food shops with good snacks for a picnic or to rush back to the office or hotel room with. Bryant Park Hotel near by has a great restaurant worth a visit and there is also Bryant Park restaurant which is a good spot for alfresco dining on a warm night. This is an urban refuge
Fun to visit in December.. There are several little shopping stalls set up and a fun place to people watch or chat with friends if you can find a table.

Nice evening stroll. I really wanted to visit the New York Libray but it was closed for a private party, so i discovered Bryant Park behind it. Lots of little shops, nice vendors and family friendly. Was fun to see so many people skating. Not too crowded which was nice.

Lovely Any Time of Year. It is a park that feels intimate somehow... and friendly. Whether it is the merry-go-round, the lovely little tables, the summer film festivals or the warmth of being surrounded by lovely New York buildings, the park is welcoming any time of year.

Pop Up Christmas Market and Ice Skating. This is Christmas in New York City, the beautiful tree, over 100 vendors selling handmade and one of a kind trasures. Sipping hot apple cider and watching the skaters glide around the rink. I loved every minute.
Loved the skaters. I loved this little park.Visited during Christmas Holiday Season.Tree was lovely. Skaters were a joy to watch. Cute little shops.

epitomises New York. Loved this park in the middle of midtown. For me it epitomised New York. The market stalls, the ice rink, the lavish restaurants. Full of atmosphere. But give ice skating a miss at weekends because tens of thousands of people agree with me.
Love Bryant Park. Christmas is around the corner and wow this place is swarming, it was hard to get trough with some many people. The stalls are nice and plenty of food and drink option.

Wonderful Christmas Kiosks. Bring your own Ice Skates and skate for free. Visit the historic NY Public Library just next door. The Christmas kiosk were colorful with many creative artistic items for sale.
open spaces. a great place to bring a box lunch and lounge in a garden and contemplate the surrounding city. Tables and chairs and loads of people on a nice day. Occasional entertainment.

You can't beat this. So I'm not a fan of Donald Trump, and that means that Bryant Park is a place I love to skate in winter and hang out in summer. THe open air bar is quite busy and attracts a range of young professionals, tourists, HBO employees. The skate...no complaints.

Ice Skating. Hot Chocolate. Shopping. Food.. I have already reviewed the skating on the Citi Pond attraction. While at the park, we also enjoyed the shops and food. The Witchcraft hot chocolate was wonderful! I had the semi-sweet, which tasted like a chocolate chip cookie to me. However, my 12-year-old daughter did not care for it. She probably would have liked the milk chocolate better. There are plenty of food choices, from soups to waffles to corn meal cakes. My husband and a teen in our party especially enjoyed TopArepa. They said the spinach and feta was the best, but also loved the artichoke.The ice rink and giant blue Christmas tree are a perfect photo op.Bathrooms are available, but the women's line is typically long.

Big Rink. Fair Price.. We arrived on a Saturday around 6 PM and the line was very long. However, the Zamboni was on the ice, and as soon as it finished, the line moved fast. They are very strict about not letting you hold spots for other people, so make sure your entire party is arrives together. If you bring your own skates, it's free. If you rent them, it's $14. You will also need to pay for a locker once inside, so that you can store your shoes. They were out of lockers for our crew, so they had to pay to "check a bag," which was $7 and a bag was given to them to put all of their shoes in. The ice is quite full, but our teens had a great time skating. There are plenty of Skate Guards on the ice and they keep people moving and enforce the no cell phone rule.There is a large observation deck opposite the giant blue Christmas tree. There are tables and chairs that can be moved around. There are also a lot of little shops and food places in Bryant Park, and Times Square is just a couple blocks away. Public bathrooms are located in the park close to the library, but the women's line is always long (no matter what time of year).

A small park right smack in the center of the city. Bryant Park is behind the New York Public Library on 42nd Street and 5th Avenue. The small park, with chairs that can be moved around, goes to 6th Avenue. There is a restaurant and bar (two I believe) behind the Library. A large lawn where you can sit and get sun when the weather is good. Films are shown in the summer and there is an ice skating rink in the winter. Small shops line up along the paths before Christmas.

Go see the skaters at Christmas time!!. It is great to get a cup of coffee and sit outside the ice rink during the holidays. There are plenty of chairs all around the rink and a big blue tree decorated on the opposite side. It's pretty entertaining to see the ppl who are really struggling to stay on two feet but are still loving the experience! Great for free people watching! If you feel like shopping, there are also some vendors at their holiday market.Hint: grab a cup of coffee or cocoa on your way! They serve it in the park but you can get a $1 cup and bring it into the park to save some $$$.
Nice park, lots of things going on there.. Bryant Park is nice anytime of the year. Christmas time is a bit crowded, but it has ice skating, food, holiday market, nice tree and decorations.

A gem in mid town New York. We LOVE this park....fabulous 4 season destination! Skating rink is wonderful, free if you have your own skates, beautifully surrounded by many NY trees, decorated from Thanksgiving unil Christmas. just gorgeous. Charming little bistro tables for watching the skaters in winter, enjoying a snack all year round. The carousel closes off season, but lovely old fashioned construction with accompanying Edith Piaf serenades the rest of the year. Films in the summer...unbelievable!!! We ate lunch at the restaurant overlooking the rink with our 4 yr old granddaughter, it was such a fun afternoon.

Lovely eclectic range of arts and crafts. Interesting way to spend a few hours browsing through the arts and crafts of this lovely park area. Stalls were varied and interesting their wares - a delightful find.
Great place to skate. Great place for day or night skating. It is free if you bring your own skates or $14 to rent skates. Fun little shops and food vendors surround the rink.

ICE SKATING WAY BETTER AND WAY MORE AFFORDABLE. $14.00 to skate for unlimited amount of time and free if you bring your own skates... sign me up please. The skates I rented were clean and sharp. Because its the holiday season expect a wait but the line moved fairly quickly every time I went there. Why would I pay the better part of $100 to skate on a smaller rink over at Rockefeller Plaza just because there's a big tree there. Plus the holiday market surrounding City pond is great to pick up unique gifts and get awesome melt in your mouth kettle corn or hot chocolate. Concession stand staff were really friendly and in the holiday spirit but the food is ... well its concession food. Dried up "chicken" nuggets, popcorn and the like.

Very nice park in the heart of midtown. This park has something for all seasons. Being there in November with the ice rink up and running just created a lovely atmosphere. There are a lot of small shops and food stalls in the park which make you want to stay there. The large number of loose seats, rather than fixed benches are also a great idea. If you want a little bit of R&R around 40th Street rather than going up to Central Park, this is the place to come.

Fun to watch the ice skaters. After shopping through the stalls set up in the park (not sure if they were only there for Christmas, or are standard) we were able to get seated outdoors (under heaters) where we could watch the ice skaters, and order food and drinks. The park was very festive.

A gret first date idea. Went ice skating an walking through the stores. Was a lovely evening with xmas carols playing as people made their way around the ribk, some successfully and some not quite lucky enough to stay dry. Only downside was that the xmas lights werent on yet.

Good place to rest. We went several times to Bryant Park to see around the shops and eat. Great place for people with families, to walk dogs and the ice skating rink I considered it better than the one at Rockefeller Center.
Great place!. We loved shopping along the christmas market in Bryant park and seeing the people ice skating. Very beautiful area.

Beautiful city escape. In the winter before Christmas, the park is full of vendors selling unique Christmas gifts and yummy food! The ice skating rink is super fun as well. You can sit in the bar above the rink and enjoy warm drinks and appetizers.

A surprise. For a visitor to the city, Bryant Park is an ideal example of how wonderful New York can be. Beautifully restored, it always seems full of people but never overcrowded. It's one of the great people-watching places in the city. We've seen groups of people juggling, playing chess, skating and playing boules. There are stalls with food, books and a remarkable variety of other items. And right behind the NY Public Library, one of the real marvels of the city.
lots of events. Lots of shopping, too. Many office workers have lunch there. Good people watching. Special events. Shopping kiosks.

Lovely stroll especially during holiday!. Perfect stroll in the evening after or before tour play or dinner! Ice skating, stalls with art, jewelry, gifts, food & drink-lively atmosphere! Look up and see lit up Empire State building.

A Hidden Gem. Our hotel was in front of the NY Public Library and just a 2 minute walk from Bryant Park located in Midtown. It was crowded full of people catching the last mid-afternoon sun of the year. There were some nice cafe's where you could drink a coffee and have a beer. A great place to spend the afternoon and watch life go by.
Enjoyable. I love It! I go at least once a year. Christmas time is my favorite I love the tree with blue lights, the best hot chocolate and watching the skaters and visiting the cute shops.

Christmas ice rink and booths. Walked through Bryant Park yesterday on the way to Lord & Taylor and enjoyed seeing the ice rink that is created every fall and disappears in the spring. It gets bigger and better every year as do the booths that take up most of the park space at a time when no one is going to be lounging on the grass

NYC Favorite Things #2. Central Park is THE park in NYC, and a must see, but if you want a lot smaller, a lot quainter and a classic NY moment, head to Bryant Park. Before you go, check out the events online at bryantpark.org. During the winter there are holiday shops and ice skating, and in the summer there is yoga, concerts and book readings. 'witchcraft next to the fountain has wonderful (and reasonable) salads, sandwiches and soup. The NY public library is right next door, so you can see the lions (Patience and Fortitude) and go up to the Rose Room.
Great ice skating in midtown. You can't been the location for one of the loveliest skating rinks in NYC. Try it on a warm fall day. I just love to watch the skaters.

Surprisingly Uncrowded!. We spent a week in NYC for my daughter's 18th birthday over Christmas and enjoyed the whole city. Whilst walking around we stumbled upon this lovely park and found plenty of space on the ice for skating. It seemed to be a very family friendly spot.
BEAUTIFUL :). Transformed for the holidays. It was a beautiful evening for watching the iceskaters.Enjoyed all the little shops & vendors.

Surprised by the shopping. On a long weekend visit to NYC recently, my wife and I stumbled upon the Holiday Shops and Citi Pond. Loads of fun buying stuff for Christmas and watching the ice skaters. Make sure you stop at Max Brenner's and pick up some great chocolate and possibly the best, extra-thick extra-chocolaty, hot chocolate you'll ever have!

Great sights, Bad Ice. Skate for fun, but be on your guard. The rinkhas many fast skaters who zig & zag through the crowds. Large rink surface with many security guards on and off the ice. Highly organized. It is a lot of fun. I

I loved this place!!. This was a completely unexpected find, right around the corner from Times Square. The shops, the ice skating, the lighting, the perfect fall night, the laughter of children, the holiday music, and the family atmosphere, all added up to make this a GREAT attraction for families and couples of all ages.

Great Spot to Relax!!. My son and I relaxed at Bryant park and had a great lunch. The seats outside are so comfy & warm. We loved that you could watch all the people skate and enjoy lunch. It was so cold, but you could sit under the heaters outside the restaurant and be warm. We both had a great time. Afterwards we bought some little souviners from the shop's all around the park.
What a Gem. Had no idea what to expect walking to Bryant Park and when we arrived we were pleasantly surprised by the shops and skating rink, lots of fun, nice break from 5th ave shopping.

Attractive park in midtown New York. A really nice park that is situated in Midtown that has tables and chairs, free public wifi and a welcome retreat from the hustle and bustle of the day. Very pleasant in summer and partly converted in to a skating rink in winter, it hosts a variety of activities though out the year. There are books and newspapers available, food vendors and of course one can sit back and watch people pass by. Clean well maintained public toilets are available
Great place. Great mix of both tourists and locals going about there day, loads of great little shops and a free ice rink nice place to sit and people watch

Had fun window shopping. I enjoyed walking around the shops, but I didn't buy anything. It was fun to walk around and see all the people and cool paintings, jewelry, ironworks and scarves etc that are for sale. It seemed expensive to me but I was told those are normal prices for NYC. Our group had fun walking around the shops and taking in the sights for an hour. Some in the group also ate there at Wichcraft.

Free movies in summer and nice holiday decolations in winter. Skating link is small but well maintained. Around it, during the winter time, there are many different kinds of holiday shops - but most of them are non food, and more small gift oriented. When they put up a tree, it is small but cuter than the gigantic outdated Rock Center tree. I like this tree here better.During the off season, just enjoy late evening walks and look up some of the sky scrapers with lots of lights. It shall make a good memory of NYC.By the way, the public bathroom is not nice - go to the close by department store, Lord & Taylor!
Really Lovely. This place is lovely its like a little christmas village just now with the Ice Rink and all the stalls around it.

Adult and older kid friendly stop to shop and relax.. This is a great place to shop, grab a bite to eat and relax! There is an eclectic mix of stalls selling a wide range of goods (jewelry, hats, decorations for the home, etc) as well as food stalls (chocolate, popcorn, soups and salad, crepes and much more) as well as a few restaurants. They have chess, backgammon, and ping pong for public use. I found it easy to pick up a few small Christmas gifts, something for myself and a snack! Although I was with adults, this is a place I would stop with my kids (ages 10 and 14) and feel like they could, shop, eat and have fun. It is located right next to the public library so you could convienently check out the exhibit they have there, too.

A little piece of France in Manhattan. Bistro tables/chairs for relaxing/eating; beautiful trees and gravel path surrounding expansive lawn. Ping-pong, chess, carousel, summer Monday night movies, outdoor reading room, winter ice skating, holiday market. Expensive restaurant on East side, take-away inexpensive sandwiches, coffee etc. on West side. Wonderful place to sit a moment and re-group.

Good, but not what I expected . We were walking by while visiting this past wkend and were surprised to find it filled with little shops. We walked around and bought some tshirts from a really nice guy who designs his own and then had a Belgium waffle with nutella. Looked like they were setting up an ice rink too. Was a pleasant surprise!

quirky. Many quirky little stalls with plenty of interesting things you may wish to purchase. For instance when i visited i found many models made from motorcycle parts, including "predators" and "aliens" from the respective movies.
