IN addtion to the many wonderful stalls, there were some very nice clean restrooms, most sought after in NYC!

IT IS NOT A PARK ,a cappuccino to go, a book to read ,a free table to sit and enjoy. Been in New York several times , I finally choose Bryant Park as my water hole .It is not a Park by any European standards BUT ,It is a beautiful Green square,behind the public library, where you can relax eating a sandwich ,sitting in a free table, watching the people being loose in the very heart of NW , in the middle of everything You can call it an oasis, surrounded by a dramatic view of high scrapers ,looking at Art Deco? Bryant hotel, surrounded by healthy delis and coffee stands In the winter a skate ring, in the summer music performances BUT always a place to feel like a green neighborhood square A great development project that I noticed year by year to evolve towards serenity and true leisure time for locals and tourists like meNow I always choose a nice hotel near by, in order to start my day and my return with Bryant parkwitch is walking distance to any place in the heart of ManhattanHave a cappuccino on me and enjoy looking at life passing by, we deserve it.
Lovely green space near the library. I especially enjOyed the reading room: a sPace with tables and stands full of bOoks tO borrow and read in the park!

A great place to spend an hour. We walked around Bryant Park for about an hour looking in the kiosks, which are filled with lots of great stuff, from clothes, scarfs, chocolate, doughnuts, popcorn (the kettlecorn is a MUST), etc. And in the center is an ice skating rink and a merry-go-round. From what I heard from a friend, this park has really been gentrified! Don't really know, but it's great now! It's centrally located in the city, so it's a great place to drop by.

In any other City this would be tops. This park has been upgraded and updated and is constantly being fixed and tweaked on a seasonal basis. There are always things to do, or it is a great place just to people watch and take a break from the million other things to do in New York

Nice greenspot!. Pretty little park set amid a neighborhood of skyscrapers. Large ice rink set up when we were there. Lots of cute little shops/eateries throughout the small park. Worth a little stroll through if you are in the area!
Skate and Shop. What a lovely place to shop and skate (for free) in the festive season whether during the day or at night. Lovely veiws of the Manhattan skyline as well as ecellent crepes, a must !!!

Most Charming! During the holidays.. Bryant Park , all year around, is the most charming little park in NYC. Having seen the parks of Paris this park is the closest you'll get to the "Jardin de Luxumbourg".And now during the holidays you'll find plenty of quality booths set up..again reminicent of the Christmas villages of Europe...except no where near the amount of quality food. And speaking of food , Avoid the touristy "Crepe Cafe". We ordered two $5 crepes that tasted like cardboard and were truley not edible. A real ripoff indeed! How could this be so hard to make??But the ice rink is lovely and not as crowded as Rock center.Overall my favorite park...in every season.I feel like I'm on vacation when I go there!Also the nicest public bathroom in the city!

Beautiful Park. Beautiful park in Manhattan. Went to Bryant Park when visiting NYC in September, nice place to chill out and relax and take in the city. Restaurants and bars in the area or you can sit on the grass and just relax. Lots of cool people there at night time.

Quirky park in midtown manhatten. Took a wander through here, it looked like they were prepping the ice rink to open. Love all the quirky stores around the park, and they have plenty of food stalls and drink stands too. Didn't seem like there were many tables if you wanted to sit and eat, and many tables were only big enough for two people. Most but not all stores seemed like they were selling hand made/unique goods. Not much 'park' to sit down in though.

Sublime Peace. We humans need to 'get off the merry-go-round' of hectic sightseeing, when in a city like New York.Besides Central Park, one other such oasis is Bryant Park,to 'come-down' from the hectic world all-round.A Secret Garden.Bring a coffee, a sandwich and just collapse on one of the plentiful chairs just waiting to accommodate tired and weary travellers. For Christmas, the stalls are just setting out their wares, about now.(Nov.) These outlets add to the mystique of this serene place.The public toilets here, are second to none,and a pleasure to behold anywhere(well done to the people who provide this superb service). Bryant Park was donated to the citizens of New York/humanity, one welcome and very generous gift. Do make time to visit it. You will leave refreshed, with memories of trees, flowers, shrubs,- nature- co-existing amid such chaos,one step away.

Any season, any day, the perfect place to hang out.. A centrally located green space. Enjoy the carousel if you have kids, hit the library next door if you're a bibliophile, camp out in summer time with a picnic and a blanket to catch a film, or go skating in winter time!
Christmas in the city. This place is a quintessential part of our December holiday season. All the shops and music and skating is truly what NYC in December is all about

Seasonal ice rink and fair a delight. Enjoyed strolling through the vendors that just opened in the park. Bought a few items. Really wanted to buy the chocolate but held back. Didn't skate but it was fun to watch those on the rink too.

a little peace of paradise in NY. early morning, a little bit tired from a 22 day vaction in the US...we went to eat breakfat in a place a waitress the othe night :)reaching upon Bryant Park we fogret about food and decided to soak in the quietness that were there...the seconf time we went to N.Y we crossed the place again wondering to 48th it was sukot - a jewish holiday...and the HABAD guys build a suka at Bryant Parkand again charmed by the idea we soaked the quietness that were there...i demend an additional star :) :)

Ice rink right behind the iconic New York Public Library. WOW.. Loved watching this ice rink unfold over the past week or so. Have visited it in both daylight and under the evening stars. Under lights at night is well worth the visit. Not only Citipond but the other buildings surrounding the park. Over 100 small self standing shops have been erected and are worth looking at. Especially loved the 'itsallaboutthetail' shop which sells cat/dog clocks. Have bought one already and if Hurricane Sandy allows will be collecting a 'flag cat' clock on Tuesday morning to take home to Austalia. Skating is free and goes for 129 days!'

Stunning Park right in the heart of Manhattan. this park is awesome, its my favorite park in manhattan, located one avenue east of Times Square. Its a spacious, beautiful place, with tall trees and a vast green plain located in the center. In the summer, the space is used as a makeshift movie theatre, and in the winter its converted into a great ice rink.
A nice place to eat drink and chill out. Lots of places to sit and eat and drink. a bit pricey, so Best for the romantic evening. Free wi-fi which is good.

"Just a magical place at night". The Hop on Hop off bus tour passed Bryant Park and my husband and I decided to go back for Dinner. What a beautiful setting at night. Lines of tiny lights are strung up near the bar/restaurant area. We had a delicious meal with great New Zealand wines. The bathroom facilities are immaculately clean.A memorable experience.

A grEat place to chill and people watch. Lots of places to sit and relax, plus a couple of nearby restaurants. A bit pricey, but enjoyable. Free wi-fi in the park, so bring your electronic toys. Be sure to check out the library co-located with the park.
On Ice. This central small park is a breath of fresh air. I love the skating rink, the stalls and the cafe, there is always something to see and do here.

Nice place to take a breath. We stumbled on to the park at night after walking around, it was a nice park with great scenary and well lit. Great place to take a moment from the hussle and bussle of the streets.

Yoga in the Park!. Bryant Park - free movies. concerts and free yoga too. The yoga sessions are on Tuesdays (mornings) and Thursdays (evenings) - you can bring your mat or one would be provided for you. Something's always happening there. There is a lovely carousel that offers rides to the children for $2. There are mini walk up restaurants to grab a bite to eat while you sit out doors at the many table and chairs or you can reserve a table at the Bryant Park Grill

Great find!. Bryant Park is in the businessy district of New York. After work there are a lot of suits milling around the open air bar. There is a very laid back vibe though with deck chairs on the green, chess, a mini library and table tennis. Really lovely!
Great place to relax. It is a nice place to just sit down and relax. Perhaps eat your breakfast or lunch here. You will see alot of different people here during lunch time.

Great Mid-Town Location to Relax. Walked past many times. Great place to stop and relax.Easy to find between Times Square and Grand Central terminal along 42nd Street.Many concerts held and regular Chess games.Great place to enjoy a lunchtime snack.

Beautiful Year-Round. From wintertime, when a giant skating rink is put in, all the way to autumn, when the trees ringing the park turn. Very casual vibe, with free movies, Broadway excerpts, tai chi and yoga lessons,
Oasis in Midtown. Just walking through Bryant Park can help provide some respite from the usual Midtown area hustle and bustle.

An Oasis in Manhattan. Bryant Park is a great place to people watch. There is always something going on from the Holiday market to ping pong. There are tables and chairs to sit at and have a snack or people watch. There are food vendors in the area and public restrooms.

Favorite park near Times Square. I never miss a chance to go to Bryant Park when I'm in the Big Apple. First of all, the tall trees grace over the walkway, and it's so beautiful and relaxing to walk there. Secondly, there are book carts where you can choose a book to sit and read for free. Lots of chairs and tables where you can sit in the sun, or a shady spot. The carousel is awesome for the little ones and adults alike. Several little stands where you can buy drinks, sandwiches, and soup. The soup sold there is wonderful. The people watching is fun too. There is a huge grassy area where you can relax and watch a concert, etc. That area turns into an ice skating rink as soon as the weather turns cold. Also, about the middle of October they set up little shops throughout the park for shopping for that unique gift. I love this park :)

Lovely oasis. Great little park in the middle of New York. Lots of little tables and chairs where you can put your feet up and have a few moments to yourself. Lots of places to eat and drink nearby. Lovely

Victim of its own success. It was known as "needle park" before its complete transformation from urban drug den to public oasis. The transformation was so successful, that the City couldnt help but mess with perfection, and added ping pong tables, a reading corner and other interventions that have distrurbed the peaceful beauty and elegence that it was only a few years ago. Still worth a detour to have a drink outside, lay in the grass and take in NY in a kinder, gentler environment.

Great discovery. I accidentally stumbled into this wonderful park as I was looking for the way to the New York Library. It's a beautiful park, a perfect example of how city parks should be. It's great for people watching, winter skating...if you find yourself with extra time to just do nothing, Bryant Park is perfect for visiting and hanging about.Don't forget to visit the little shops in the area; they're quite charming.
Love this little park!. Love this lovely park. A perfect place to sit, relax and people watch. Plenty of places to grab a bite or drink. A gem in the city!
Bryant Park. We visited Bryant Park during a weekend stay in NYC. We were truly amazed by the beautiful condition of the park and all of the amenities provided.

Great place for chillout in a hot day. Bryant park is fantastic green spot in the middle of the hot city in the summer. You can invite someone for a chess game or just have a picnic! Great sandwiches and salads are available in the area. And lot of chairs and tables to take and place wherever you want. There are concerts going all around in the summer. We`ve seen Broadway shows spots, going on the stage in the middle of the green area. Everyone dancing in the midday, unbelievable!

Cute and fun. Bryant park is cute and fun all times of the year. It's a very low key quiet park. It's a wonderful place to meet up with friends and have lunch, it's a cute place to go on a date, or a beautiful place to enjoy the weather.

Lovely place to stop and relax for a bit. Plenty of tables and chairs to use make this place enticing to just stop and take in your surroundings whilst either starting your day with a bagel and coffee, or just in the middle of a big shop!Free WiFi is a boon here or if you just want to watch the petanque players. Plenty of wildlife to keep the kids and adults alike happy. It sits in the shadow of the New York Public Library which makes it a great little setting with the Empire State Building looming in the background.

A park for all . Loved this park we would have coffee and bagels for breakfast here daily. Has table tennis area, reading area, children's carousel and lots of chairs and tables to relax. Being here in the warmer months everyone was out enjoying the sun

Go to central park. Nothing much to do here, except in winter when they have the skii rink open... other than that they sometimes have free movie screening, but there is a lot more to do in NYC.. I would skip it!

Nice place to sit...convenient mid-town location. Park is a great place to grab a table and chair and take a rest outdoors. It can be a busy place. Oftentimes you may be approached by a panhandler. There is the usual colorful collection of locals there and wonderful place for tourists to come soak up the local color!

Sweet Place. Bryant park is a lovely place to chill and relax whilst exploring NY - it even has free wi-fi so you can surf and have a coffee whilst listening to the birds and watching the squirrels run around the place. Lovely place fist thing in the morning to grab breakfast and eat in the park before starting a day exploring.....
Cool to see and people watch!. It's a park, how much is there to say? It is cool and a must see, but not going to be your lasting memory of NYC.

Quaint beautiful park. We just happened to stroll past this park and decided to walk around and grab a coffee. It was beautiful, small and quaint and loved the contrast between the trees, flowers, surrounding buildings, both modern and old. Loved seeing people sat playing chess. Lovely.

My NYC!. my favorite place in NYC.
Incredible as it is surrounded by sparkling grattecieli, this park is a breath of fresh air and relaxation on the climate and bustle of the Big Apple.
Just sit and look!
A little oasis . What a glorious place to find in the centre of a big city. We arrived at lunch time in a sunny October day and the place was buzzing.

Always something going on!. I like to walk through Bryant Park whenever I'm in that neighborhood. Most recently, I took a FREE knitting class (thanks, Pearl of Knitty City, W.79th St.!) every Tuesday over the summer. Summer also features free films, book discussions, music at lunchtime, yoga classes...and in winter Citi sponsors free ice-skating. The holiday boutiques from Thanksgiving-New Year's are great fun also!

the very first in new york to renew itself. in the 90's BP was a bad joint full of the worst things, The BP association, a private public initiative decided to take over and did a great job with it. it provides spaces to enjoy for the people working there, during lunch breakes and also entertainment for the visitors. Great success worth a visit.
Refreshing. A beautiful park just behind the New York Public Library. A refreshing and cool retreat from the rush and hurry of having to get to the next place!
Relaxing.. Located behind the New York Library is the best place for midtown workers to relax, have lunch, people watch, and enjoy the moment as the world swirls around you.

Found by accident. Walking from Times Square to the Empire State building we found this awesome little park that offered clean restrooms and a quiet place to rest. Bryant Park is a spot the the whole family thought was cool because we found it by accident and remembered this Quiet moment between big NYC attractions

Lovely little oasis in the heart of NYC. We found this lovely bar in Bryant Park, which was a little oasis. It was great to soak up the atmosphere of the New Yorkers having a well deserved drink on a balmy Friday night at the end of their week. Had a couple of glasses of rose and watched the world go by , we even saw a couple practising their ballroom dancing. Very nice!

2 ladies NYC. Went on a trip with 6 friends and sometimes you just need to separate for a while,,,so my mom and I went to see Bryant Park,wonderful wonderful place,relaxing quite and interesting place to see.....
An overlooked gem. Not as famous as Central Park, this much smaller urban oasis is a great place to relax after walking around the city.

The best park in NYC. Bryant park is my favourite park in the city. Close to times square, it has a very relaxed atmosphere during the day and during the night while it is beautifully lit. Lots of seating available and a lawn to chill. Not sure if they still do it, but during summer a big screen would show movies and you can just walk onto the grass and watch it.Definately put this on your list!

Character Meets Serenity. When you think of New York City’s parks Central Park tops most lists, and for good reason, but I encourage you to branch out and try some of the smaller parks in the city like Bryant Park. Named after William Cullen Bryant, the great poet and former editor of the New York Evening Post, the park is appropriately situated next to the huge New York City Public Library which is famous for both its beauty and for many Ghostbusters movie scenes. This park is small but alive. The center of the park is a huge open space where folks sunbathe, picnic, or read. The park is well manicured and contains plenty of benches and chairs. A huge William Cullen Bryant statute is on the east side of the park. A nice outdoor bar is on the north side of the statute while the trendy Bryant Park Grill lies to the south. There is a beautiful fountain on the southern end of the park along with a really nice bar called Witchcraft which is located on the “Southwest Porch.” The drinks are pricey but I would definitely have a glass of wine under the breathtakingly beautiful trees that provide protection from the sun. The extreme western end of Bryant Park has contains an area called “Bryant Park Games” where you can play chess, checkers, ping pong and bocce ball while the north side has, get this, the Bryant Park Reading Room, an outdoor reading room where you can check out books (remember those) and read until after dawn. If your children are in tow, make sure you take then to Le Carrousel, a French-style merry-go-round located on the southern end.I would highly suggest having an after dinner drink or lunch the next time you visit New York City.

An oasis of beauty in the center of NewYork. Bryant Park is one of my favourite places in NYC. The events that are taking place in the park, the winter skating ring, the summer relaxation area make it a super great place to spend at least a few minutes. It is a must if you visit New York City and I gurantee that you will fall in love with it.

Room to Breathe. Bryant park might be your answer. Just like any other big cities in the world, New Yorkers are packing themselves like sardines inside their apartment buildings. Luckily, there are some parks in Manhattan they can go to get fresh air, have sunbath, or do outdoor exercises. Bryant Park is one of the choices. There are always different events going on in the park, such as ice skating in the winter, and movie screening in the summer. It is conveniently located on 42nd street. Public can take B, D, F, M, or 7 train to go there. Public can also take the M42 crosstown bus to get to the park. I watched a free movie (actually I watched just about 1/10 of the movie), got a free Sierra Mist cap, ... took a Southwest Airlines square dance lesson, and got a Southwest Airlines free flip book in the park about three and a half hours ago. Byrant Park serves both worlds, it doesn't matter if you are very rich, or if you are totally broke. Check it out if you have time, I think you will enjoy it doesn't matter if you go there by yourself or if you go there with your loved ones.

City oasis. We visited in september and the weather was nice at the park. I suggest you stop for a lunch snack like the locals do! And just enjoy being there and observe the life in the city! Near times square.

a gem behind one of nyc's crown jewels.. bryant park, a gem: something for everybody, newborns to centenarians.push a stroller through the walk lanes, swing at the playground, listen to live, professional music outside the restaurant, watch movies at night, ice skate, read at the many tables scattered all over, grab a cup of joe and a nosh at 'witch craft (1/2 price coffees after 3pm), play chess, hang out, kiss your companion, watch the leaves fall.....then leave the park at 41 st. go to the coffee/sandwich shop across the street, get your "stuff" and go upstairs to eat and look at bryant park through giant widows 2 stories above. next take a short walk to the crown jewels: the new york public library: watch for changing exhibits, savor the main reading room, marvel at the marble, the main surface of most of this phenomenal structure; sprawl on the huge outdoor stairway with the 2 giant stone lions guarding it; savor the indoor atmosphere and magnificent architecture, visit the gift shop. the nypl will be hard to leave, but all good things end. exit at 42 st., and go shopping and/or look at the incredible nyc architecture, much of which is art deco among more- recently built structures. wow, this will take up the better part of a day's outing, and leave you with indelible memories. (i hesitated writing this review as i don't want bryan park or the nypl to become overcrowded, but my unselfish side prompted me to commit this to print.) ENJOY AND SAVOR TWO OF NYC'S FINEST!

Tucked away in heart of the city.... Great city park tucked away in the heart of the city near Times Square and Grand Central Terminal. Cool place to catch some rays, read a book, grab a bite or drinks with that significant other, family, friends or flying solo. Multiple eateries nearby as well as a few in the park itself. Plenty of chairs and tables, as well as free wi-fi. You'll be glad you paid a visit!

Bryant Park, a place to chill when doing the Times Square area and/or grand Central Station. Bryant park is well located between Times Square area and Grand Central Station. It's also the backyard of the NY Public Library, a must see in NYC. There are benches and little vendors to get something to eat. The park also hosts events throughout the year so it's always a surprise top take a stroll through it.

Secret Garden. We stumbled across Bryant Park and returned there a further 2 times during our 6 day stay in NY. It was a relaxed hub of activity. A reading area, chess, table tennis, petanque for everyone to join in at their leisure. Wonderful place to escape the hustle and bustle!

Beautiful place to take a break.. After sight seeing, taking a bus tour, and eating dim sum in Chinatown it was time for a break. We didn't want to go all the way to Central Park so we stopped at Bryant park and were thrilled!! We got some coffee at the stand and laid out in the beautiful weather taking in the sites and sounds. I couldn't figure out if most people were tourists or New Yorkers, but it was a very fun and relaxing environment.

Best park in the city. Nestled just behind the huge New York Public Library, Bryant Park is the perfect oasis from the busy city streets. There are kiosks selling food and a small carousel and lots of small tables and chairs. The park is surrounded by huge trees and skyscrapers which only adds to the magical feel of the park. Grab coffee and a bagel or a quicksandwich here while takign a break from a busy NYC day.

Cosmopolitan Oasis. As Bryant Park was just round the corner of our hotel we decided to have a light lunch and rest in the sun after a morning of trips and shopping. The sun was shining and the park was alive!! Very much like Hyde Park... as soon as a sliver of sun appears the place flows over with people!! A lovely place to relax and people watch!! Sandwiches and drinks were just what the doctor ordered too!!!

Fantastic. We just loved spending an early evening here. Pack a picnic, grab a table and just relax.We were very lucky that the night we went there was a fashion show and the Backstreet Boys were performing free.A great way to just kick back and relax for a few hours. There is a refreshments booth where you can grab a coffee etc. It's a great place to just mingle.
Great Place to People Watch. The New York City public library has their archives deep below this park. Think the positive vibe seeps from the ground.

Central who?. Central Park is great, don't get me wrong, I LOVE visiting and up until this past weekend, I didn't even know Bryant Park really exhisted. I have to say that I thought it was not only functional, but quaint and enjoyable to spend time in. A nice break from the hustle and bustle of the big city, this park is perfectly placed and perfectly appointed. I can't wait to visit some day and join yoga in the park or a concert. When I was there this weekend, there was a fashion show going on. What a great community and visitor attraction!

Oasis in the heart of the city. Lovely spot to sit down and watch the world go by, or eat a picnic lunch. Near grand central station, and times square so nice to find such a peaceful park. Excellent clean public restrooms, complete with fresh flowers. Stopped here a couple of times on our visit to new york.

What a wonderful place to visit. On our last day in the city, we found Bryant Park & had a wonderful time looking around & simply stopping to sit down & relax. It is a great place to visit. We were here in the summer, so no ice skating, but it just had a lot of things to do. If we lived in New York, I am sure we would visit often.
Beautiful Haven. This park is right behind the historic NY Library and is an excellent spot for a respite. I enjoyed people watching and a good game of chess.
Beautiful Park. Bryant Park is not large. It doesn't have to be. Everything is perfect just the way it is. An oasis in the middle of NYC.

Always so nice. So nice to visit. Not much was going on when we visitied, but options for a quick bite/drink or sit down for some food. Always worth stopping by and checking out. Often they will have events there, so you never know what you'll see.

Beautiful place to rest. It is a beautiful, little park in the midtown, between 6th e 5th Avenues. It has tables and chairs, so you can buy something there(little kiosks) or you can bring something to eat and rest from shopping and walking in the city. The Public Library that is next to it is a very beautiful building, that makes the park even more interesting. At nigts in the summer you can see fims and some Broadway shows presentations in some days in the lunch time. Their site is very good and you can see their events on it. In your stay in NY, have a look on it.

relaxing. This is a nice park behind the public library. Plenty of grass upon which to sit and there are lots of benches as well. In the summer they have snippets from current Broadway shows on certain days. I think they also have some art shows as well. Central to the subway and several eateries and shops.
The PArk is great and the Bryant Park Grill a great spot!. Wonderful quiet respite in the center of bustling Manhattan. Love it in the winter, spring, summer and fall!

Magical Oasis. I happened upon Bryany Park at 8pm on a friday evening...totally unaware of its existance. It is a space of 6 acres in midtown with New York Public library at one end...with a beautiful fountain, trees, flowers, lots of seating areas...and city scape views all around. During the day there is a carousel in operation and a grassy area for kids to play. Several cafes line the perimeter. It is an exceptional place to meet a friend, have a drink and savor its tranquil beauty.

The pinnacle of public spaces. Once a graffiti-ridden hangout for criminals, Bryant Park is now a shining example of what a public space can be--a place to meet your friends, knit under a tree, pause for lunch (brown-bagged or otherwise), and just watch urban life unfold. Jugglers, an accordionist, a carousel full of kids, a table set up for board games...wherever you turn, there's something to catch your eye and get you wondering, "Why can't more cities create a community hub like this?" As a tourist in Bryant Park, I felt part of the scene. If I lived within subway distance, I'd be a proud regular. Don't miss the elegant restrooms, with seafoam-green tiles, pioed-in classical music (a bit hard to ear with the noise of the hand dryers) and--can it be?--fresh flowers. I've dined in high-end restaurants with less inviting loos.

Quiet oasis. This is a really sweet park, a great place to escape the busy street and people watch for an hour or so. its a great sun trap too. There is a bar and resturant too which sit nicely in the shade and have a nice atmosphere and good service.

every season offers something amazing. It's a glorious place to kick back and soak up some sun on a warm spring or summer day. In the fall, a good spot to sit with a cup of coffee. And in the winter, can't beat the ice skating here, just pay for the rentals! The Christmas stands here are a necessity for my holiday shopping (lots of variety, quality and originality in gifts.) And all year long there's food options in the park or nearby to enjoy.

Hidden Gem. Bryant Park has something for everyone from a bookstore to a sidewalk pub. $8 for a beer but well worth it, always a nice place to sit and watch the world go by. Free movies shown a on a huge screen. Take the time to stop and experience Bryant Park the number 7 train will take you right there.
Southwest Porch. Great spot to have a drink and people watch. Good food and prices. A lot of things going on in Bryant park, big screen movie, ping pong and other sports. Enjoyed a lot.
Love to Skate?. The winter time it is a great place to skate in the heart of Manhattan. Summer a great place to hang out relax.
Fun day in the sun. Great for a drink in the sun, or just to chill in the park. Also a nice area for kids - they have a carousel and a little kids area.

Why Did It Take Me So Long To Visit?. Been to NYC many times but have never checked out Bryant Park. I was missing out. This is probably the best park out of the medium sized parks in NYC. You can't beat the nice grassy area in the middle of the park and the abundance of chairs and tables around the park. There is a beautiful fountain on the west side of the park and from the looks of it, this park is well maintained. There are also what appear to be 2 nice outdoor restaurants/bars towards the east side of the park that give a nice view of the park. I will definitely be coming back to visit again and hopefully checking out one of these restaurants.

Oasis in new York!!. We stayed in the Bryant park hotel across the road from this amazing little place, it really is an awesome place to sit in and watch the hustle and bustle of the city. We sat at the southwest corner bar, where you can relax with a beer or a cocktail, have a bite to eat, or use the free wi-fi access inside the park to surf the net. If you want to go retro then there's an outdoor library with books and magazines. My wife loved it because a scene from sex and the city was filmed outside it. Central park gets all the headlines but next time i come back to NYC this is the park I'll be resting in.
Beautiful. We sat in Bryant Park on a balmy summer evening, listened to the piano player and just enjoyed everything about it.

Lovely Spot. Had dinner at the cafe here on summer evening. Lovely atmosphere, delicious food, friendly service, right by subway, and on the doorstep of the awesome NY public library. Check the events calander on their website for what is going on whilst you are there.
Must see. A must visit place so much to do. near the time warner building , never seen movies that are shown there, but would love to do so , given a chance.

perhaps my favorite park in the city. Sure central park is huge and it gets all the attention but I've always loved Bryant Park for its location, its beautiful layout and how it feels sort of tucked away within the city and surrounded on all sides. They've got ping pong tables and chess boards set up around the perimeter and a great lawn in the center, its a simply beautiful park. On one end it is flanked by an historic NY public library location, I would highly recommend checking this out as well as it is a very cool building with interesting architecture. There is also a cafe at one end of the park where you can sit and rest your feet with a glass of wine and people watch. If you are visiting the city put this on your list as a place to relax in between all the other things you plan to do

Wonderful Surprise. I didn't know about Bryant Park prior to visiting Manhattan but it was one of the highlights of our trip. We stopped at one of the cafes mid-afternoon and really enjoyed ourselves. It was $8 for a beer and $9 for chips and salsa which we found pricey but we didn't feel rushed in anyway and stayed for at least an hour. It was a great setting to sit and enjoy with lots of shade. It truly felt like we found an oasis in the desert after walking through Manhattan all day.

Very satisfied and lovely location. Cannot disagree more with review from UK Customer; perhaps they hit on a bad day. We happen to find the BP Cafe on a walk through Bryant Park on a Saturday evening. Lovely night; the atmosphere reminded us of cafes in Europe. My Ginger Beer cocktail was served in plastic but not hubby's Dirty Martini....both good. I ordered gazpacho soup (good flavor, but small portion) but also had the Ceviche, which was wonderful, very tasty! Hubby had a chicken skewer with Taboule salad that was terrific. Enjoyed ourselves. Would go again if we find ourselves in NYC.

sweet little park. I very much enjoyed thos park which was close by to my hotel. It always seemed to have enough activity to be safe and friendly. There were people playing ping pong at breakfast the lights stayed on it seemed through most of the night. Very clean and a nice place to go sit or walk through.

A great oasis. We wondered upon Bryant Park sort of by accident, and I'm sure glad we did. There are nice benches, tables, gazebos, and plenty of greenery to enjoy. Being situated directly beside the Public Library, I'm sure this is a great place to while away an afternoon with a good book. There were a lot of people there the day we visited, but it didn't seem crowded because of all of the seating and lawn space.
Lovable. I loved this park when I entered it.There are plenty of tables and chairs if you want to eat there, and you can do a lot of activities !

Hidden gem. We craved somewhere to escape the noise and heat of the city, Bryant Park is exactly that ! 5-10 mins walk from times square, really pretty park area with abundance of seating and lts going on
good to have lunch!!. Good to have a nice afternoon lunch and enjoy the passing people. Great location, clean area, close to cafe and small pizzeria, accross the streets.

Spent The Afternoon. After the tour I walked up to Bryant Park. Which was where our pick up was going to be. But it took me about 30 mins of walking from 49St and 6th Ave down to 42nd St. Then to past the time I just did people watching. A very interesting afternoon. I saw most nationalities. There was also a good game of chess going on near me. There is also a bathroom at the end of the park. I had no problems. A good afternoon.
Citi Pond. Had a great time at bryant park. it is a must see when coming to new york. pretty close to times square. a short walk to times square and all the shopping

Small but Cozy Park. We stayed at the park for 45 minutes, but we found so many interesting things going there; ping pong, chess, or movie. You can use free Wifi, too. This is a relaxing place in NYC.

Broadway in Bryant Park. Went to watch Broadway in Bryant Park free concert and it was amaaazing! The park is small compared to other parks in NYC but plenty of lawn space to lounge around. There's a book corner where you can grab a book to read and the Public Library is right next door and also worth a visit. While you're at it, go check out Grand Central Station very nearby!

Nice place to relax. Nice place to rest and have a meal or a break here. Had take-away breakfast at bryant park almost everyday while in New York. Good ambience with New York public library just side by side.

Movies in the Park - now I do like Mondays!. This park is small but really central (much closer to Times Square & Empire State than 'Central Park' is) and is a great place to eat a take away meal, relax, and people watch in Mid Town Manhattan. It has a grassy field, which doubles as a seating area for Monday night movies on a huge screen in the park: last week's film was Wizard of Oz, viewed in a bohemian rock festival atmosphere - trippy or what!

Lively little park.. This park was right near my hotel and was a great place to eat a take out meal, regroup, relax, read, and people watch. It's also right behind the NY Public Library, which is another free attraction. The history of the park is interesting--check out the photos that show its rejuvenation.

Love this park. Ping-pong, chess, seating areas, people watching, grassy field, Monday night movies in the park, carousel, book exchange, next to the NY public library, well kept. A perfect city park.
Lovely Park with Character. Bryant Park is a beautiful park with food and entertainment. It's a small park, but offers a perfect respite from midtown's hectic pace.

Haven of Tranquility. Surrounded by the hustle and bustle of New York city life, Bryant Part is a calm oasis. The park was beautifully kept, clean and had a couple of places to buy refreshments (deffinitely a bonus on those incredibly hot summer days!). The park also boasts its own group of park attendants who are charged with not only the maintenance of the park, but also provision of communal games such as chess, table tennis and some other game which I had never heard of before! However for me the most special thing about Bryant park was the free summer film festival, where for the summer months every Monday night they show an open air film where hundreds of people congregate to watch a film in the most beautiful setting. My favourite park in Manhattan!
A great place to relax. GREENERY in the middle of the city. Plus, plenty of places to sit, and you can smell the lush green grass....that works for *me*!

Enjoyed the visit to this park.. I admit it, I am a fan of Sex and the City however I did my own tour of the places shown on the TV series and movies, my husband was really enthralled by my commentary throughout our four weeks in New York. Bryant Park featured as part of fashion week, where Carrie falls over. Attached to the park is the library which is featured in the movie. Close by to this park is the HBO store which you can purchase items from their shows. This was my first visit to a park in New York and I was really impressed. I love all the chairs and tables, people were reading and having coffee. I wanted to sit and have a coffee but it seemed none of the cafes in the park were open, I noticed people had Starbucks coffee cups, it was around 11.30am on a weekday. There was a bar/cafe setting up but not in service, in fact, they had an attitude issue when I asked if I could purchase a drink. There is an area where they have a carousel for kids and an activity area, children were painting and reading when we walked past. It was a lovely sunny morning. There is a large lawn area in the middle which shows movies on a Monday evening during the Summer. There are many great parks in New York to visit, Central Park is not the only one!

Interesting. Stumbling across boche in the middle of new york was fun! Its great to see such a large city be involved in so much activity.Get involved in the games that are being played you'll have so much fun.Its quiet romantic at nite as well

Lovely park in the middle of all the concrete. I just love the way New York has all these high rise buildings everywhere and taxis and honking and sirensand noise and then you come across this love patch of green. This is one of my favourite parks in NY, after Central Park...of course...but there are lots of these parks...well done New York planners...I just love this place.

Delightful!. If you are not from NYC you might think the only park in the city is Central Park. And although I enjoy Central Park, I was absolutely delighted to experience Bryant Park. It is a manageable size and right in the middle of all the action of the city. It was fun to see people out and about enjoying a summer day. People were playing chess, bicycling, and just relaxing. I especially loved the lush and well-maintained flower beds and containers. I would love to visit again in the winter and see the little ice skating rink they provide in the park. The NY Public Library is adjacent to the park and the Bryant Park Grill (duh) is in one corner. I loved it.

my favorite park in New York City. This park is a little piece of heaven only one block east of Times Square. The park has lots of activities for people of all ages. In one section of the park, you can rent games like chess and Apples to Apples and sit outside and play. There are lots of picnic tables and chairs to sit in. In another corner of the park is a small outdoor bar. The New York Library is on the east side of the park. The architecture of some of the buildings surrounding the park is very appealing too. Very close to Grand Central and Times Square on 42nd street.
Nice little park. This is a small park with plenty of seating and small food vendors. Sometimes there are festivities but just a nice place to sit, rest, and relax.
Perfect Park. It's excellent for spend a good time with your family. There was a big screen and it was a movie theater for free.

All in one!. This is a fantastic public park where I went to to visit the main branch of the NYC Library and afterwards attended a revue of current Broadway Shows in the park located directly in the immediate back of the library. It was a very quick 3 minute walk out of the library and around the corner into the park.Nice seats and benches were available for us to pick up and move onto the lawn for the show. The lawn is nicely laid out so it can accommodate a large number of people comfortably with unobstructed views. Each of our 25 kids got a seat. There is always something going on from free movies on Monday nights to daily card, chess and sports activities scheduled on the main lawn. The park is frequented by Fashion Industry employees, celebrities and business people working in the trendy location.There are also cafes carts , a restaurant a fountain. The park is accessible by the D,F, and B trains as well as the M42 and M104 Buses.

A lovely spot in a busy city!. Bryant Park has something for everyone. Various lessons, entertainment for young and not so young, games and just a beautiful place to seat and enjoy the beautiful natue.

Gorgeous. Gorgeous little park! Relaxing, inviting and happy place. Great places around for food and drink and cheaper than times square and surrounding areas. We had a drink and snack to take a break from the heat and exhausting walk, while our daughter rode the carousel a few times. We got caught in the storm which was welcoming after the heat!
Ideal for reading. I would always go to this park to read when I lived in NY. It's near time square and next to the New York Public Library's main branch.
Great place. There are many activities held here! Check out the park's official website

Very nice place to walk around in the shade.. This was a Very nice place to walk around in the shade. We enjoyed walking around and seeing people do different stuff. One corner they were teaching juggling. There is food, a relaxing place after walking around the busy streets.

Great spot. We were walking through the city and sort of stumbled into Bryant Park. The atmosphere was chilled out. The fountain and spots in the shade were enticing. It was a nice stop for a place to cool off.

lovely oasis. right behind the public library is this lovely park and cafe - $10 beer was a bit overpriced, but cold and hit the spot! Lots of people make use of this park and classic movies every Monday night during the summer - Wizard of Oz when we were there
Great Place to Relax. Tables, Green Space, Lunch-time crowds, and even the New York Public Library right at the edge of the Park. Have some time to kill this is the perfect place.
Great place to relax. Walked by it all week and saw people of all ages enjoying the park. Concerts every so often and a nice place to eat close. The NYC library is next door also.

Love this park!. Bryant Park is a little oasis in Manhattan. Situated behind the NY Public library it is clean and was nice and cool during the recent summer heat. Sitting to have lunch here and people watch was a fund activity. There always seems to be something happening (We were there for Tropfest). Lunctimes they have a "reading Room" service of library books for both adults and children. Some food vendors there too.
Beautiful gem in midtown. Feels like you are in Paris. It is a cleaned up, beautiful park that is great to enjoy lunch ad relax with friends!

So much to do and all free!. We had been active tourists for 3 days in NYC with our 1, 5 and 7 year olds and they were really keen just to hang out and play a little. We went down to Bryant Park and were rewarded with being able to play Kubb, board games, learn to juggle, borrow and read children's books, run through a water sprinkler and watch dance performances; all for free! There was also a beautiful old fashioned carousel that cost $2 a ride. It was also the cleanest park I have ever visited. A great break for a family in NYC.
Water Hole. This is the best place in NY to have a drink. Sitting in a park in Midtown and having a beer but not hearing the traffic. Life can be good
Lovely park, great location. There's always something going on in Bryant Park (located behind the main branch of the public library in NYC). Check it out!
Relaxing and having lunch. Very relaxing park to sit and people watch or have lunch. There is a piano player at lunch time until about 2p.m. The park is VERY clean and so are the bathrooms!!!

Tiny and packed. This park is very small . It does offer some shade and an out door reading area complete with books but not a good selection. The park is across from the college so lots of students pack the grass

Pretty gem in the city. We visited this park every day of our 4day visit in Manhattan. It is a pretty little park with lots of events. It is on the back side of the NY public library. The first night we walked through, they were showing the Wizard of Oz for free. There were many people on the lawn. The next day we were there, Katherine McPhee sang the National Anthem for a promotion Tide was doing in the park. They had a display of the American flag. Another day, they were watering the lawn but you could sit with a cup of coffee in one of the seats or benches surrounding the park or read the paper from the media kiosk or play a game of pingpong with the free equipment(although we were there at 10am on a week day and there was no attendant to give us the paddles).There is plenty of shade here to take a rest.Such beautiful greenery in the middle of the city.
Great place to see. Great area of the city...especially the Coca Cola Exhibit
Amazing at Christmas!. Lovely Christmas tree, beautiful fountain, great little pop-up shops for the holidays and of course, the skating. Definitely a go.

Awesome way to relax after seeing the sites!. We stopped and had lunch ( from Zeytinz's - see my other review) before taking a tour of the NY Public Library (another review) and after the Empire State Building (yes, I have a review). What a nice place to just relax. The kids for ice cre and we had cocktails on the Southwest Porch. Very enjoyable.

Always Love Visiting Bryant Park!. I always love visiting Bryant Park! The park isn't that big, it is actually one big rectangle but it is truly beautiful and a site to see. The park is one big open grass field. It is great for lounging on a blanket and taking in the buildings surrounding it. Outside of the grass are chairs and mini tables for relaxing as well. There are also little coffee and snack huts set up at the front of the park to grab a bite at. The park has a really nice fountain in the front of it and the park itself is decorated beautifully with flowers of all sorts! It is definitely a place to relax and enjoy! It is also very clean there.

Free movies late at night !!!!. Clean, well lit all night, free movies on a large screen some nights. Ping pong tables, chess, coffee shop.For an ahours break from all rest of Manhattan, why wouldnt you ?worth an hour anytime really
Great place for after work drinks!. There are 3 bars right around the park. It is my favorite place to relax after a week of work. They show movies on Monday nights! Beautiful park, great location.
nice time out. Pleasant to put my feet up on a hot day. They have films here some evenings.

A NEW YORK JEWEL. Thisi s a small park, located beside the NY Public Library, it is simply beautiful.
If I lived in NYC this would be a great spot to disconnect from the city and read.
Great location for pictures.
Lovely place to relax. Lovely park with plenty of seating to relax in. Plenty of places to eat and entertainment

Oasis. Bryant Park is one of those places in NYC that stays a little bit under the radar. It is a small, but beautiful, park in midtown Manhattan. It's a wonderful place to relax in while you are doing all your other NYC "stuff" - there are lots of places to sit - clean, attractive bathrooms and food of various types if you want it. There are two Grills where you can sit and eat or drink outdoors. Both are pleasant and have good food. There are also kiosks for sandwiches, etc. It's a good place to meet for lunch in nice weather. It is right behind the main branch of the public library so there is a reading section with books available. In the summer there are movies on some evenings and you can play chess or ping pong. In the winter there is ice skating and a beautiful holiday fair. There is a carousel year-round. It's a great place.

Mafia Center Changed to Safe Public Park. Once upon a time this place was notorious for drug deals, mugging and mafia activities. From 1980s efforts began to put this place as safe and secure for public and now this park is a major center for people to meet, eat drink, and play chess, ping-pong. The lawn is open for your enjoyment until 11 PM. You can enjoy Piano in the Park, Dance in the Park: Film festivals, your private parties etc.Many restaurants, gift shops, Free Wi-Fi, are the other attractions. New York Public Library is in neighbor hood, where you can enjoy selecting books on any topic you like.

It is always a little magical.. Bryant Park is right behind the main office of the New York library. It is always a little magical.In the winter, there is ice skating. Around Christmas time, there are little booths put up that remind me of Rivendell from Lord of the Rings. It is often crowded (being near to time square).In the summer, there are impromptu performances. People are playing chess. People are eating in a cafe like atmosphere. It is more crowded than Central Park, but it has greater energy.It's really close to Grand Central. Stop by....

A Little Gem. Bryant Park is one of those places you absolutely must know about. It is a serene spot in the bustle of Manhattan with trees, tables and chairs, a charming Merry Go Round and several cafes surrounding it. The NY Public Library backs onto it with the Bryant Park Grill overlooking it. It is not overwhelming like Central Park and you can easily find a place to sit if you are weary, or just want to enjoy the park. And what a surprise to find a toilet there that is clean, well appointed and has hushed classical music in the background. For the tourist, this is a place worth noting.

Beautiful Bryant Park!. What a delightful surprise to find in the city! A beautifully manicured lawn surrounded by trees, flowers and small alcoves with seating. Whether enjoying the view from the bordering restaurant patio or sitting at one of the many tables throughout the park with your own ‘picnic’, Bryant Park is a lovely oasis where travelers (or locals) can relax in nature while still in midtown NY.

Loved the Reading Room in Bryant Park. What a delightful place to sit, it was a beautiful Spring day, people were obviously enjoying their Saturday morning relaxation. My friend and I sat in the open air Reading Room under a maroon umbrella and each chose a book from the portable bookstands. Others around us were reading the free newspapers supplied by the Reading Room. There were people lying on the grass in the sunken lawn enjoying the warm sunshine. New York doesnt come any better than this. (Don't miss the beautiful award winning restrooms near the Library.)

Our favourite place in NY. This is our favourite place in New York City. Before you go, read about it's history and you'll appreciate it even more.
This park is also well used all year round as it turns into a skating rink and holiday market in the winter.
This place is best enjoyed by packing a lunch and sitting on the big lawn.
Loved It. Bryant Park was very close to our hotel and we loved sitting at the little tables having lunch and watching the world go by. Would love to visit it again during New York Fashion Week.
Green space near grand central station -. Purshased breakfast from cafemetrony around corner with my morning starbucks --- Sunday am 8-10am wonderful. What a way to end weekend in NYC!
Oasis. Encountered an open air jazz concert. Fantastic. Backs onto the NY public library.

Christmas Market. Bryant Park is always full of fun stuff all year round. During the holidays they have a "Christmas Village" set up with tents where local artist can sell their goods. There is a small ice skating rink and a coffee shop. It was open pretty late and was a nice stop after dinner.

Relax. brown bag a beer and people watch in Bryant Park. Take a nap, walk through the "Ghostbuster's" library. It's really cool to walk through. catch a movie out back, or ice skate in the winter. My favorite park in the City.

Another Must Do!. So much going on in this little space, fun place to just people watch, talk, walk, shop or try one of the places to eat. It's one of our favoirte stops in the City. Try it you will like it!
enjoy this small park after the library. a day outside, practice yoga and just relax, perfect

Nice. This little park, situated at the back of the library is a nice place to sit down and relax, have a coffee or ice cream and take a rest from the seeing the sights. It is just a short distance away from Grand Central, the Empire State building and the Chrysler building.

I never even knew it was there.... When we first arrived and checked in to our Times Square hotel we decided to spend the beginning of the trip walking everywhere (this was her first NYC trip). After getting a lamb gyro from a food truck on 46th (i think) & 7th we kept walking south. Eventually she looked east and said "let's go this way" so that way we went. We stumbled upon Bryant Park and were blown away. There is a wide open grass area surrounded on all sides by little coffee kiosks, bars and restaurants. This is a great place to take a break from the craziness that is NYC without needing to get on a train. We ended up stopping there every day of our vacation, and to think that had we not arbitrarily turned east on 42nd we never would have known it existed. This wonderful place also gave me a better place to hang out while the girlfriend spent an hour or two at H&M...it was much nicer than sitting at the front of the store being bored.

Nice city park on a sunny day. This park, adjacent to the public library, was full of interesting people and activites on the sunny day when we were there. Great for sitting outide on the grass or at the outdoor cafe and fun people watching!

What a peaceful place when all around is mad.. This park is really peaceful. You can sit here and not realise you are in the middle of New York.We went here a couple of mornings after buying a croissant and coffee for breakfast at the local food stalls in the park.In July they have films at sunset starting with Psycho.Looking around the park it's been beautifully restored and lovely to sit and take sometime to soak up the peace and quiet

Hidden Gem. Great place to people watch and enjoy a coffee! A bit out of the way if you are just walking to see Times Square. There was lawn bowling and chess games when we walked thru. Lots of trees and tables so one can relax in the shade on a hot day!
Great Park. Bryant Park is one of my favorites! Great people watching, wonderful christmas markets in the winter and ice skating.
Great green space near Times Square. Just a beautiful park right next to the NYC library. Plenty of space to hang out, eat, play, watch people.

Absolutely Perfect. Beautiful spot to read during the day, unbelievably close to Times Square, yet you would never know. Impeccably clean and the public restrooms are cleaner than many restrooms I have entered in bars.

A lovely place to relax in the middle of concrete.. There is something so elegant about this place. Maybe it's the imposing architecture of the NYPL behind you, or maybe it's the fabulous lawn, or maybe it's the lovely green folding chairs that line the park. In the summer you can read a free book at one of the kiosks or play chess. It's wonderful place to enjoy the grass and the trees.
People Watch. Fablous place to people watch, borrow a book from the reading room of the library, play ping pong.
VRK Canada. Unique Park with lots of trees, green space, restaurant, outdoor library, ping pong tables. Most enjoyable.

Wonderful Park in NYC. Great park in NYC with a pretty good restaurant. The bars and restaurant were booming on a Thursday and Friday night. Food was good. Ice cream stand available, but closed later in the day when we were there. Tons of tables and chairs.
Tranquil spot in mid-Manhattan. Great place to enjoy a brown bag lunch, a merry-go-round ride, ice skating in winter and occasional contours and movies.
Lovely oasis of green!. This is a lovely little park. Beautiful architecture and leafy green trees!

Perfect place for a picnic. My friends and I were in NYC for a girls' weekend and wanted to be outside in the beautiful weather and have a picnic instead of eating in a restaurant. Bryant park was perfect. Grass if you like that or chairs and tables in the sun or in the shade. There are also restaurants and bars if you don't bring your own food and drink.

Ah, Lovely spot for a lunch break. We discovered Bryant Park while strolling through Times Square. We quickly grabbed a bite to eat from Pret a Manger and found a table in the park. Needless to say, we had a pleasant lunch in this sometimes overlooked park. If you find yourself in the area, stop and rest your feet.

Wonderful Retreat in the City. A great place to relax and enjoy your surroundings! Sometimes can be less crowded than Central Park, although much smaller, but wonderful and location is perfect for resting the tired feet. www.nycstylelittlecannoli.com
Great park near times square. A bustling park in midtown with lots of things going on. We sat down with an iced coffee and watched a table tennis match!well maintained and clean.
Small Park in the city. Nice park. Nothing special other than a nice green space close to Times Square. Good seating and a nice open space for a picknic.
So nice.. Just the right size. Just the right amount of adornment. Fantastic.

midtown "oases" next to the NYC Public Library. Taking that into the account the size of the Bryant Park alongside with the busy part of Manhattan where is it located I can only give two thumbs up to the person or the team who stands behind it. There is a little something for everyone in it, next to the Public Library + its maintenance is superb. There are two reading sections at each side of the park, one for adults with the variety of newspapers and magazines. and one mini- library for the kids right across, next to the old fashion Carousel ( $2 per ride) which my son loved! ( people who run it seemed nice)There are few little kiosks-cafes with the seated areas all over the park, probably good for coffee, food, snacks and beverages, but frankly I haven't used them at least not recently.The biggest surprise ( and the pleasant one!) in the park for me was- the public bathroom! It is maintained as a bathroom of some luxurious place, with the attendant on site,a disposable plastic toilet covers , most importantly it was very clean! (they even have a bouquet of fresh flowers in there :)!!)Bryant Park and its management should serve as a role model to many public park's managements.In the winter time (as all new yorkers know) the whole park becomes an ice ring- (admission free of charge if you bring your own skates) otherwise just pay for the rental.

Take a break in Bryant Park!. Bryant Park is a great place for a weary tourist to relax and recharge. Take a break on the lawn or grab a coffee and snack from one of several kiosks and recover from all the sightseeing. A great place to people watch and there is even the rare and elusive public washroom, which is not a common find in New York!

Very nice.. This place is great all year round. In the Winter, a skating rink is located in the center of the park. Its very beautiful. There are also many little shops all around the park and plenty of benches to sit on, in case you want to watch the skaters.
Relaxing. It's a relaxing break from the hustle and bustle of Tmes square. the surrounding buildings are wonderful and the park is kept tidy.
Beautiful Park!. This is one of the prettiest parks in NYC, with lots of greenery, and the nicest, cleanest bathroom you'll find in a public park!!!
Gardens in the City!. Nice place for outdoor activities and Internet connection wi.fi.
Always A Nice Visit. I love to just sit in this park and watch the happenings. It is in the middle of all the action & a great place to people watch!
What a find. Only found this on our last day while having a walk to the library, wish we found it earlier, nice little park with good surroundings.
An Oasis in the city. THis became our go to place - every night we ended up at the SOuthwest winery and beer garden. Excellent service with added ambiance of old fashioned swings.
Our top pick. A great story behind the park. inovative and fun with New Yorks best public bathroom -flowers and violins - I kid you not :)
Nice park in chaotic midtown. It is worth spending some time with your loved one here

Nice place to chill for a bit. We had 2 hours kill before seeing our matinee on 42'd street. This was a great little park to stop and have a cup of coffee while enjoying a beautiful spring day. Lots of places near by to get snacks and just enjoy the weather and people watching.

Bryant Park is amazing!. I never saw or experienced Bryant Park before in my life. This is a definite must visit again place on my itinerary. It may be smaller than Central Park but it has basically as must to see and experience as Central Park has. It is located right next to the New York Public Library. It has two restaurants and two outdoor coffee kiosks. It has an outdoor reading room, a place to place ping pong, chess, and boccee ball. It has lots of room to sit on the grass or sit at a table and enjoy the afternoon. You can even go onto iTunes and download the free audio walking tour narrated by Matthew Broderick. Oh, and if you have children, there's even a small children's carousel at the park.

As often as I can. I walk through Bryant Park several times a week on my way to work. It is one of the most beautiful places in the city to escape into some nature. The canopy of trees is stunning and now there are so many places to sit and relax, read, or surf the web it's like a home away from home or the home you wish you had.
Cleanest public toilet in New York!. I heart Bryant Park, so much to do AND clean restrooms, what luxury!

morning in the park. There is a little paradise behind the National Library,Bryant Park,and we were there in the morning,and it was almost desert,but by time more and more people was coming,more and more chairs were taken,and also the sun starded shining,the grass was really a carpet,and than a lot of young people started to sit there....we ate something on a round and cleaned little table and we drank coffe...we jast were lazy that morning and later a band started to play and sing..just a morning in a little paradise,,,,,we'll return there of couse...ciao NY

Christmas in New York. It's a beautiful place to be outside in the dead of winter and the place is Alive with Holiday Cheer. Small shops, ice skating, music what more can you ask for in the center of NYC.
Best park in NYC. Bryant Park is my fav in NYC, it maybe small compared to central PArk but it has something about it.Its a good location and its very peacful being here.

I love this little park. Well, little compared to Central Park. Bryant Park is a magical little place, great cafe's, one with a fire pit. There's a place for the kids to play, and a carousel. A restaurant with a patio at the back of the park. Overall it's a great place to people watch, relax and enjoy time with friends.

It's heaven. Between 5th and 6th Ave, next to the Public Library on 42nd St, it's a gorgeous green spot surrounded by skyscrapers,it doesn't look much from road-level but you have to go in. Lots of chairs and tables to sit on, a reading room in the open air and a decked bar towards 6th Ave. We had a beer ($8) and sat on a wooden swing.....stuff films are made of on a lovely sunny day. Buy a coffee and take a seat around the grass, it's people watching heaven!
charming. For a small park, it is charming and great place to just sit, have a coffee and read a book. Very calm and relaxing.

Our favorite hang-out. We love hanging out in Bryant Park - anytime of the year. An oasis in midtown, tables and chairs, the large green lawn, trees, carousel, 'Wichcraft sandwich kiosks - everything you need to relax and enjoy being in NYC. Bryant Park Grill and the outdoor restaurant as well as the Southwest Porch give you lots of options for eating and drinking as well. Or bring your own picnic. And the New York Public Library is right there if you want to go inside and visit a great Library.

Winter Wonderland in the Heart of New York City. This is a wonderful place to visit during the holidays. There is ice skating, a resturant and bar and a wonderland of shops. Open daily October 27, 2011 - February 26, 2012, it is NYC's only free ice skating rink. Skate rental is $14, but admission is free.Definitely a place to check out if you're in the city from October - February.

Great Fun at Christmas. Love all the ice skaters and the boutique shops at Christmas! There is also so many different food and beverage choices to enjoy while you take a respite from all the shopping!

Lovely and crowded. The Bryant park evening market is lovely to stroll through. Nice foods and warm drinks in December and have an ice-rink during December (if you can get to it through the christmas crowds) but nice atmosphere and recommend at least a short visit.

relaxing NYC park by the main library. When my husband worked in the area I would bring my son there to ride the carousel and sit at the tables and read the books they have out for the kids. Very relaxing park right by the main library. There are plenty of table and chairs, and they offer yoga, fencing, and more in the summer and ice skating in the winter. We love visiting this park when we get a chance. Fun, outdoor escape in the city. One can even bring a soccer ball and a picnic basket and make an afternoon of it. It is NYC so the bathroom as not as clean as you would like, but they are not disgusting either.

Nice park. Nice little park in the thick of the city, a welcome break from the urban sprawl. Lots of people playing chess which was interesting to watch. Pretty and well kept, definitely worth a visit.

Hidden Gem. We loved the outdoor seating, the beautiful fountain and grassy areas. Adults can relax and have a drink near the bar, the children enjoyed the merry-go-round and ice cream. A nice reprieve from the hustle and bustle of New York City.
Fun Park. There is ice skating, winter shopping village, chess, ping pong, a book lending cart, a merry go round and people watching.
Lots to see and do. The skating rink adds a lot of fun to the area, the little vendors in the winter are great too. Great use of a public space with many activities like movie night in summer

Nice park if you need a drink, and you can get a seat!. A small park where the grass is off limits but there are some seating areas available. There is a bar area but very busy i had to walk past watching people sip the beer I was in need of!! Worth a peek if you are close to Rockefeller centre.

Incredible little green place!. You can't imagine a park like this one in the heart of Manhattan. So well kept, with beautiful flowers and water fountain. Even the tables and chairs are in perfect shape. Amazing!

A great little respite!. Such a great find in the middle of a big, crazy paced city. The children and I stumbled up here today. We sat in the sun and the kids played ping pong (provided free). They even have a reading area with books you can browse. Great views of the Empire State Building. A wonderful spot to take a break from all of the hustle and bustle and madness of the city!
Very Pretty.. It is so relaxing on a nice day to sit and eat lunch here.

A Nice spot to stop for awhile. We've been to Bryant Park twice. Earlier this month and then early last winter. In the cooler temps they all the little shop stores open almost like a village marketplace and the ice skating going with a big tree all decorated. Lot of fun and good homemade hot chocolate. Ealry this month we returned and the ice was replaced by a newly sodded lawn and the atmosphere was relaxed and enjoyable. A truly nice spot to visit and sit for awhile.

Beautiful and relaxing. One of the cleanest well kept parks. Kudos to all the park employees they really take pride in their jobs. The bathroom was the cleanest public restroom I've ever seen in my life. They have a nice fountain and a carousel for kids. Also there is a food stand with delicious sandwiches and I think soup.awesome view as well

Must for lunch & Thursday Happy Hour in the warm weather. I worked right across the street from Bryant Park for over three years. Every time they weather would warm a little I would go have lunch there. They set up a big area with tables and chairs. The food at the restaurant is pretty good too but pricey. The Thursday happy hour is awesome but PACKED; get there early to secure a spot.

A smaller NY Park. This park is located between Fifth and Sixth Avenues at 42nd Street. It is bounded on the East by the main branch of the NY Public Library, a truly beautiful building and an icon of scholarship. The park itself is clean, well patrolled, and generally safe. A nice space!

Beautiful. This is a gorgeous park that myself and the Wife walked through and it is amazingly clean and we'll kept. There is a food stall on sites and I'd recommend everyone takes the time out to visit a piece of bliss.

So nice!. If you remember NYC parks in the late 70s and 80s it's time to think again. Bryant Park is gorgeous, with tulips, daffodils, hyacinth, etc., the fountain is working, the grass is green. A few days ago folks were playing bocce and chess, or just hanging out at the tables. What a wonderful spot to relax, and what a welcome change.

Like a film set - maybe it was one. This is a beautiful little park in the middle of the city. It was so nice to just sit and look at all the older buildings and smaller sky scrapers everywhere. It was the prettiest place we found in NY and there are actually clean toilets too which seemed really hard to find in the city.

Haven in the City. I love visiting this park. It's so clean and beautiful, always well maintained. This to me is my favourite hang out in Manhattan. Le Pain is right across the street too for delicious eats- you can get it to go and eat in the park! Bathrooms are top notch too, and had a bathroom assistant!

One of the coolest skating experiences ever!. I am from Canada and skate alot, but skating in Bryant park was beyond amazing! Not only is this experience awesome, it's also free! You may have to wait in line, my family went a few days after christmas and it took about 2 hours, but it was definatly worth the wait! Skating when surrounded by all the lights and skyskrapers is amazing, definatly comparable to Rockefeller, and a lot more affordable! :)

Prettiest square park in NYC!. This is my favorite square park in NYC. Bryant Park is great, whether it is to make a quick stop on your journey or to kick back and relax and just stare at the world go by.I also like the many activities that take place here, like Fashion's Week, Movie Screenings, the Ice skating rink and the yoga classes in summer, just to name a few.
at easy. Beautiful skiline wile walking by the water. Lots of joggers. A peacefull place!
A great little park just behind the NY Public Library. This is a great place to sit and stroll in Midtown, just a stones throw from Times Square. In the summer there are free movies, music, etc.

Great place to relax and grab a beer. Try the Southwest Airlines beer garten in Bryant Park behind the NY Library. Great porch swings and Adirondak chairs ... heated in cold weather .... a little bit of park atmosphere in the middle of Manhatten.

A bit of magic in midtown. It's crazy to think that something as interesting as this is sitting right behind the library, but it is. Citi Pond at Bryant Park (along with Celsius, the restaurant, and The Holiday Shops at Bryant Park) is a wonderful place to experience. Walk through the park, watch the skaters, but a hot chocolate, do some last minute shopping, meet a friend for a meal. Great place. Skating is free, but renting skates costs money.

A wonderful spot in Midtown. Although missing the Fashion Week Tents, that have moved to the Lincoln Center, Bryant Park is still a beautiful small park to have lunch, lay in the grass or attend the several Summer activities such as movie nights, free yoga...
First Visit. This was our first visit to this park. Can't believe I hadn't been there before! It was a really fun place to visit. Loved the shops.

plenty of places to sit and relax. Bryant Park is a great spot to grab a chair and people watch or read a book. There are a lot of chairs scattered throughout. During the holiday season there are tents set up with many unique vendors. Also, free ice skating. Great area in the heart of the tourist area to hang out.
Great spot!. Always something to do year round. Check out the NY public library after the park.

What a beautiful park.. We have just come back from NYC, the weather was lovely & so was sitting in this park, what a picture!
How lucky people must be to have this place on their door step, take a walk here when you visit as its a must see.

Summer or winter ....a nice place to spend an afternoon.. I love Bryant park. I used to go there all the time when I worked in the city. You could sit on a bench in the summer , under a tree and just read, have your lunch or relax. Winter is great too. The past couple of years the park has hosted a holiday market starting in November tha runs through the first week in January. There is ice skating ang lots of kiosks for food and hot chocolate. There are shops that sell everything from original artwork and jewelry to christmas ornaments anf clothing. A nice place to get your Christmas shopping done!. When you are done here it is a short walk to Rockefellar Center to see the tree. A nice way to get into the holiday mood. Highly recommended.
People watching (New York people!). The best place in New York to sit and people watch! Catch your breath and watch the world go by.

Great park, excellent people watching, terrific place to grab a cold beverage on a warm day. Just went to the Southwest Porch in Bryant Park earlier in the week! What a great place to just slip out of the office for a cold one at the end of the day. We had a terrific day to be out there and it was an excellent vantage point to people watch from the comfy Adirondack chairs. The place was booming and there were tons of people doing exactly what we were...It was hard to believe there is a park that nice in the heart of Manhattan so near Grand Central!

Great time if you are traveling light. I haven't been to NY in a long time. I was going to skate at Rockfeller Center but I decided not to because of the line. Then I happened upon Bryant Park. The staff was fine on the night I went. The cost to rent the skates was $14.00 but hey it's NY and it was better than carrying skates around. The ice wasn't completely smooth but it was acceptable.
Something for every season. Free classic movies in the summer, Ice skating & gift shops in the winter, sun worshippers in the midday, all in the NY Public Library's backyard.

Skating is free. If you bring your skates, it is free to use the link. But it gets really crowded sometimes and most people are scared to fall including myself. But if you do fall and hurt yourself, there is a first aid station and there are experienced staff on the link to help you get up.

amazing!. they always have lots of summer time concerts from big names like Justin Bieber, Lady Gaga, Christina Aguilera and many others, amazing all times of the year and lots of people watching too :)
Beautiful Vestpocket Park Next To Main NYC Library. An example of what an improvement can be accomplished when the Mayor's Office focuses on a former eyesore in a strategic visitors' location.
Pretty. I recall a day when you wouldn't set foot in this park. Wow, has it changed. It is lovely.
Pretty park. A pretty park and near the subway. We actually came to see the ice skating.
Urban Mecca. Just a nice spot to catch some greenery in midtown Manhattan. Not as imposing as Central Park, just a great spot to watch everyone walk by.
