People Place. It always gets crowded. But when they roll out the book carts and provide magazines to read, it's a great place to take a break. Lots of restaurants nearby for food to eat in park. And the rest rooms facing 42nd Street are clean.
STOP here!. Small oasis in NYC, even in the winter we had to stop and admire the park.
Nice midtown park. And it has a free ice skaing rink in the winter as well as performances in the summer.
:). gorgeous park worth a little visit very new york !!!

Worth a Visit. If you have a few extra hours to kill on your trip to New York and feel like relaxing, check out Bryant Park. Though not huge, this park epitomizes what it means to be in New York - it packs a lot in a small amount of space. If you're looking to relax, grab a table surrounding the grass and just people watch; if you want some culture, check out the free public book readings or poetry slams. It's definitely worth looking up a schedule of what's going on in the park, because from ping pong, to chess, to knitting classes, to yoga, this park offers a little of something for everything - and the best part is, it's all free.

Take a break here. Between Times Square, Fifth Avenue, and the Empire State Building, Bryant Park is a nice place to sit with a coffee or a sandwich and escape the crowded sidewalk. Two or three kiosks offer carry-away sandwiches, as do many local eateries. Tables can be hard to find in the summer, but plenty of steps to sit on.

A delightful oasis. This isn't really a destination, but if you are nearby, it is a delightful oasis in the middle of one of the city's busiest areas. Most of us who live here can remember when this park was a real nothing. The renovation shows what good planning can do for a city. Today, the park is a wonderful place to sit and read and watch the world go by. Also worth knowing about -- even if you aren't going to the park -- there are excellent clean public restrooms. In midtown, these can be nearly as scarce as lawns.
Loved this place. Got great gifts for everyone here - could have spent several days here. There was also ice at The Pond and a beautiful day to watch the skaters.
Take a moment here. This is a great spot to watch the skaters (or skate yourself), grab a cup of hot chocolate, and sit on a porch swing under some heat lamps in the middle of Manhattan!

Gets better every year. It is a nice park behind a famous library. A good place to take a break. However, you probably have a nice park back home, so you may want to treat this as a place to rest your feet, not really a destination on its own.

A fun place to people watch—and the cleanest public toilets ever!. Beautiful weather had folks out in Bryant Park—and what fun it was to people watch! How often can you watch ice skating and people playing ping pong in the same park on the same day? A wonderful spot to catch your breath in the midst of sight-seeing.
The public toilets here are a wonder—great old tile, and cleaner than home!

Not bad - slightly obnoxios staff. I generally had a pretty good time at this rink. The ice was very soft and even after the zamboni went over it, it was still quite bumpy. Rental skates were decent quality. The lockers are very small though. Anyone with a large bag or shoes will barely be able get their stuff in there,forget about sharing unless you are both not carrying a lot. They charge $9.00 to buy a lock so definitely bring your own. Staff was a bit obnoxious and would not let my friend who was not skating in without making her wait for some reason. It was still fun despite these minor annoyances and not too crowded on a Wednesday night after work.
Very fun! but crowded. The area is beautiful and the restaurant next to the pond looked awesome. Skating was expensive but i think worth it. It was very crowded though on a saturday.
Ice skating was so much fun. My mom and I went ice skating at Bryant Park. We had a blast. They make it so easy. No lines like Central Park. I definitely recommend doing it before its too late....
Awesome!. Nice location in the middle of the hustle & bustle. How a park should be, well maintained, secure and safe.
An oasis in the hustle and bustle of the city. lovely place to walk and take a minute to relax in the midst of the big city.
Go there!. If you want to relax and do some people watching after walking around the city, here's the place to go.

Beautifully Transformed. I remember being afraid to walk through this park. Now it is beautiful and at Christmas they have shops to buy beautiful items. it is great now. pass through behind the library

Small but wonderfull. Park is in the heart of it all; it's a wonderful spot for a picnic lunch. In the summer the park has free open air classic movies; there is nothing more romantic than an old black & white movie under the city skies. Get there early and dont forget your blanket!!
Events and tranquility. Many events in the Summer.including free films Check the web Also Christmas stalls and great seats and places for snacks In back of Library
It's one more park. New York has a lot of parks inside Manhattan. Great place to rest a little bit, eat something. Some statues of a lot of presidents including a Brazilian leader of last century.

Small & Beautiful. We strolled into this park while exploring NYC and found it absolutely beautiful.Its small and has a lot of character... it is surrounded by beautiful architecture and makes for really good pictures.The shops on premise are local mom and pop shops that are pricey but sell items that are unique to them. If you like ice skating there is a skating rink too.On the funny side of things we were interviewed by the Danish media for our view on renewable energy.. who could imagine 2 Canadians being interviewed in Bryant Park... lol
Another "must see" park in NY. Beautiful Park directly behind the NY Public Library. Plenty of seating, the Ice Skating rink was nice, and just a real park feeling in the middle of the hustle of NY

Pretty and seasonally diverse. We've been to Bryant Park a couple of times, at Christmas and in April/May. At Christmas I think they have a tree that's even lovier than Rockerfella - something bright white and pure about it. They have a rink where you can skate for free (BYO skates or hire them), restuarants, Christmas markets open late and bars. New York is great at placing parks and children's playgrounds in amongst it's busy concrete jungle - a lovely place to sit eat and enjoy the surrounds.
The 'Ole Bryant Park Days. I like walking past the 'shops'. I like watching the ice skating in the winter. But I remember when it wasn't all year round and you actually looked forward to it.

A free movie in summer and winter, can't be beat. To be fair, the free movies are in other boroughs, also. Bryant Park is behind the NY Public Library and is a pleasant escape from the hustle and bustle, taking a break while sightseeing or hanging out in the city. There are many events here in nice weather, it is centrally located and easy to get to by subway or bus. There is a carousel, a open air reading room, and a pond for skating in winter. And since movies are addicting, there is a winter festival, also Only in NY!
Skating with a beautiful backdrop. Although we did not skate ourselves it was fun to watch and the square has beautiful buildings round it, especially the art deco radiator building

My favourite part of New York City. I have visited New York many times over the years ... I find that the best time to go to New York is either in the spring or at Christmas time in December. City is full of beautiful Xmas markets and decorations on the buildings, parks and store windows. Doing a "xmas tour" of New York and looking at all the lights and decorations and visiting markets is one of my favourite pass times this time of year.Bryant Park is a true gem in the city. It's beautiful and it always has something happening there. At Xmas time the market is there, the outdoor skating rink and in the summer you can picnic and watch free movies in the evenings ... It's a must see part of New York every time I go visit. It's so centrally located that you can always make it part of your walking tour of the city.

Christmas Tree. I once told my kids that the Christmas Tree in Bryant Park was "The Tree" They bought it. The tree was big, beautiful and NYC. I'm not sure if I can still do that. But I like this park just to hang out.
Skate, sit or just peek through trees at the scenes. Go to NY Public Library then head here for a nice troll or skate. Good place to grab a snack or sit and watch skaters while enjoying some wine.

A day out with my son. I took my son here on MLK day. There were a lot of kids bec of the holiday but that didn't deter our Mommy and Son time. We loved Citi Pond and enjoyed skating. The ice guards were very helpful, too bad there was only 1 instructor for skating lessons. A good hour and a half of flailing around and gliding slowly was enough time spent on the ice. A time well spent.

Love it during the holidays. I always come here in Dec. I love the shops & the food booths that are here from Dec-Jan. I love the seating around the fire pits & the blue Christmas tree. The only thing I can't speak for is the ice skating experience since I've never gone here before.I always recommend Bryant Park over Rockefeller Center during the holidays.

Nice small park. Bryant Park offers something for every season of the year. Summers have movie nights and/or concerts of the some of the best talent in industry. This is also a great place to people watch during the day as it's mostly filled with locals on their lunch break during weekdays. I haven't done so personally, but hear that the ice-skating rink is very crowded. However, if you don't mind then crowd, then have fun.
Strolling Through the Park. Fun place to walk through. Sometimes there is a special display like around Christmas when the shops are open. Fashion shows are here and a nice place to just sit.

A gem!. Just discovered this gem of a park in the city this past November. I was amazed by all the merchants set up there, the ice skating rink, the restaurant, and just the ambiance of this huge park in the middle of Manhattan. It must be even more beautiful the rest of the year.
visit at Christmas. We visited before Christmas and I enjoyed the carousel.
Good to see, good to skate. If you are in the area, definitely walk through. Not worth a special trip though.

A quaint respite in the middle of all the NY bustle. Bryant park kind of springs up unexpectedly. It's surrounded by skyscrapers, but with its benches and big flowing water fountain, it is a welcome respite from the hustle and bustle that flows by on all 4 sides. You will pass by the park on your way to or from Macy's or Penn Station.

Bryant Park NYC. This is a fabulous place to go any time of year. It is really the bull's-eye of NYC. Excellent food kiosks plus full scale restaurants and cafés, skating in the winter, backgammon & chess rentals under the trees in the summer, book stalls, a gorgeous kiddie carousel, tons of moveable chairs & tables, and the view is ultra NY. Have lunch or a snack, take a nap on the lawn - this is a major NYC destination.

Ice Skating. This is the BEST spot to go to by yourself, with friends and/or family. You can ice skate to your heart's desire for Free if you have your skates, then kick back w/some hot cocoa at any of the many shops stationed there for the holidays. You can also get your shopping on as well. Unique items are sold there.

National Museum of the Native American is across the street.. I was there when it was freezing out but it was still great. The view makes you feel like the world has an actual edge! Busy, busy, busy with visitors, shoppers, vendors - very NYC.

This is a beautiful setting.. Bryant Park is right next to the main branch of the NY Public Library - a building worth seeing from the inside and outside. During the holiday season there is an ongoing crafty shopping experience. There is also an ice skating rink and lots of food to choose from. This is a very close walk to Grand Central Avenue - on the east and Times Square and the theatre district on the west side.
Rest and Eat Right on 42nd St.. A lovely little park right on 42nd St. You may want to try the Bryant Park Grille for brunch; very pleasant and they have outdoor seating in warm weather.

Beautiful park to enjoy a little bit of nature in the big city. Have 30 minutes to an hour to kill? Feet tired from a day of walking around the city? Bryant Park is an excellent place, centrally located, to wander around then sit and enjoy the trees and grass while being surrounded by streets and tall buildings. Only in New York is it out of the ordinary to see grass, here's one of those places you can spot it.

Great to go skating. Great little park, nice the market type shops and food stalls and of course the ice skating.We are not skaters coming from australia but we had 1/2 of good fun, I think/hope the kids had a bit more fun than me but was well worth the visit

Unique~. We wondered threw all the little vendors and shopped for a few hours. We found some diffrent items that you would never find in a reatil box store. The shops are on the edge of the iceskating rink, so the kids could skate while we shopped. They even had a few food vendors where you could get hot chocolate and cookies.
So much nicer than it used to be. This is always my first stop when I go to the city for fun.
beautiful park. this is a nice park to visit too, if you have your own skates you can skate for free or rent them for $14.00 for an unlimited skating time

A little diamond. I didn't know this park till I got to NY. It wasn't in my 'to do' list, but I am very happy that, by chance, we ended up there. It is a small, little, lovely park in the middle of the city. Surrounded by huge building, stores, crowded streets, Briant Park is the perfect spot to take a sit, drink a coffee and look at NY's life. In one of the latest days we had there, we had breakfast in a little cafe facing the park: it was a great way to start our day!
Nice place to read and have an ice-cream. If you want to live that Movie Scene reading a book at a park, this is the place. It's great but I don't think it's really a must in NYC.

This Is a Changeable and Engaging Place. I have seen Bryant Park in the Summer and in the Winter. In the summer the trees were full, the gardens tended and beautiful, like a green house, and on stage dance rehearsals were taking place, a delightful treat. It was a great place to relax and eat and enjoy the scenery. In the winter the whole square was transformed into an out-door market. A great place to browse and find almost anything your heart might desire. Maybe even find something for Christmas!
Gorgeous. Great location. Amazing view. Lots of fun things to do.

Lovely Atmosphere. If you are in New York in December this is such a lovely place to visit. We had been on a tour bus and just wanted to stop and have a coffee/hot chocolate and this was the perfect place to do that.We sat drinking our lovely hot drinks whilst watching the ice skaters and then had a wander round the Christmas market. Very civilised way to spend an hour or two.
Ice Skating and a Christmas Market!!. A great little park in the heart of NYC! Worth having a look and then pop into the Library that is next to it.

Wonderful park in the middle of midtown. My favorite place in New York City. Real New Yorkers love this park. The park occupies a prime section of 42nd Street between Grand Central and Times Square. Great place to sit and watch the locals. Small enough to not feel lost yet large easy to forget about the hustle of 42nd street just a block away. Many unique events throughout the year - summer outdoor films on the lawn. The best is the free ice skating rink between October and February. The park gets crowded (often uncomfortably) when the Christmas market springs up after Thanksgiving. Year-round outdoor open air bar bar in the 40th Street/6th Avenue corner is a wondeful place for a drink in the summer.

Beautiful Park to visit!. My family and I took a casual stroll through this park, and it is one of a kind. Whether it be the beautiful trees, the quirky and fun shops, or the skating and restaurant, Bryant Park is a little slice of heaven in a big city.

Can't believe it took me so long to visit. Visiting Bryant park during Christmas time was nothing but magical. The park was very busy but it was worth dealing with the crowds. The christmas tree was amazing and it was good to see the ice skating ring. The shops were also good entertainment. If you get a chance to visit during the holiday season, be sure to try Max Brenner's hot chocolate - definitely the best we've ever had.

Lots to do if you check the schedule. Bryant Park has become a summer and winter destination with Broadway in the Park events during the day, weekly movie nights all summer long and free ice skating through the winter. The new plexiglass encased bar/restaurant overlooking the park and the rink is a fantastic place to spend an evening (open only in the winter) and the market is a great place to buy some unique wares.

An Oasis in the city. A Wonderful Place. Bryant Park is wonderful. For our recent trips to New York we stayed in the "Marriott Residence Inn" on Avenue of the Americas and the "Marriott Courtyard" on W 42nd. Both are only a minute of two from Bryant park. Our first trip was in the summer and for breakfast each morning we would buy some juice/coffees etc. in a small deli called Bryant Market just down the road from the park on the corner of Avenue of the Americas and 38th Street and walk back up to the park to eat them. In the summer its great to sit there and watch the city go by. Our winter trip was just before Christmas and we would start each day with some ice skating on at Citi Pond. Summer or winter the park is buzzing. Well worth a visit.
iceskating is better than rockefeller center. it is less crowded than the rockefeller center and they play really great music :)

My favorite park in Mahttan. It's smack in the middle of huge buildings, and right behind the NY Public Library. Its so cute! There is yoga and movies in the summer, and holidays shops and an ice skating rink in the winter and a few good food shops/restaurants year round. Perfect for picnic or relaxing/people watching. You can walk here from Grand Central Station.

At Xmas-time : A break from the indoors shops but not a craft fair.... Bryant Park has a lot of pop-up shops all over it at the time we were there, early December. A very few of the pop-ups are local or not-so-local artisans and crafts ppl with genuine hand-made products, most others are not. Its still a nice place to stroll outdoors and get a cocoa or other refreshments, and although there was a line-up for skating at least an hour long while we were there, if you just want to have a look around the shops there is no problem with crowds.
Christmas Market. Really nice little stores to fine some great gifts and the Waffles are fab!

Fabulous Skating Rink. After a frustratingly long wait at Rockefeller center, we found out that the rink there had been booked for a private party. No one working there seems to know what the hours are, or how to buy tickets! The crush of the crowds and cranky people really put a damper on our day, so I googled skating in New York City to find a better option.After a short walk to Bryant Park, we easily found the long line to the skating rink. The attendant told us not to worry, the line moves quickly. He was right! Twenty minutes later my daughter and I were in skates and on the ice. Crowded yes, everything is crowded in New York, but the flow of skaters was good. With friendly attendants, lots of happy skaters, and a place for Dad to relax with coffee and a newspaper, WE HAD A GREAT AFTERNOON!
i have said all. Its a pleasant place to sit , have lunch from the Kiosk and read some magazines from the library Its a lovely respite but nothing like central park
A Nice Place for lunch or dinner in the summer. It's nice to walk around in the summer time, and the free wi-fi is great too, but the Park is too touristy and often attracts undesirables.
Nice spot. More peaceful than Times Square, a good place to kill time before a play, or catch a movie during the summer.

A nice alternative to Rock Center. Skating rink (which is much larger than Rock Center's) and Christmas markets in December. Lunch outdoors in summer...skip Bryant Park Grill and grab a sandwich when it's nice out.

Nice location, loooong wait. I visited the Bryant Park skating rink and even though we had a good time, I will not be returning. Proud to be New York's only free skating rink it seems that thousands flock to it and I feel that you pay the price in dealing with the huge amounts of people in one skating rink. We waited about and hour + and once we finally got to skate it was pretty scary with lots of people knocking down novices and old pros alike. We go ice skating every time we go to NY, and we do inline skating often at home, we're not new at this. I don't think it's the rink's fault, it's just that it was way too many people, and I would rather pay a bit more and not be scared someone's going to slam into me every other second.
Wonderful atmosphere.. Dont' miss the chance to ice skate! Bring your date.

More relaxed and enjoyable than the Rockefeller Centre. We really enjoyed Bryant Park having tried to walk round the hustle and bustle of the Rockefeller Centre. Bryant Park offers ice skating, somewhere to sit and relax with food and refreshments and some great little shops with hand made goods. We particularly liked the little chocolate shop who were offering bits to taste! Chocolate heaven! Make your way along 42nd Street and after 6th Avenue. Well worth a visit.

Nice Area. Touristy Now.. It's very touristy now. Nice Park. Lots of nice xmas booths set up and ice skating.Unfortunately I couldn't stay that long because I don't like tourist crowds but it was nice to take a fast paced stroll through!

Great Park Be It Summer or Winter!!. There is literally nothing I can complain about when it comes to Bryant Park. I love just walking thru, sitting for a coffee, taking photos or catching a movie. Great web presence; they keep you very informed on things going on.Love the ice rink in the winter with the holiday shops; even though I do not skate myself.
Great During Holiday. We walk through here every time we are in NYC during Christmas holiday. Fun and interesting vendors. Always find something we HAVE to have!

Great for family fun!. I have taken my kids skating here during the week after Christmas for the last 5 years. It's their favorite place to skate in the city. Get there first thing in the morning- by 9 and you'll have no line, really! we are usually done within 2 hours... then grab crepes at one of the stands just outside the rink exit. The experience is less costly than going out to breakfast -even renting skates @$14 - and at Christmastime, very special. Bring a pad lock from home to lock stuff in a locker.

Great for a Stroll through the Shops. Wonderful place to stroll on a nice afternoon, look at the shops, get a coffee or a sandwich and watch the ice skaters (although the lines to skate were quite long)

An unexpected highlight of a day in NYC. We spent the day in NY to see the Christmas windows. On our way around the city we happened upon Bryant Park and ended up spending over two hours just strolling around, watching the skaters, and shopping in the great little shops. It was such a treat. I don't know why this isn't on more must see lists.

Beautiful Christmas experience!. Asking at our hotel and doing prior research about local Christmas Markets led us to Bryant Park. It was an amazingly sunny warm day when we arrived. All the little shops...so very pretty were welcoming with their hand made crafts and attending artisans.The shops are quite reasonably priced for such unique gift items.We couldn't pull ourselves away and decided to have lunch outdoors at Celsius. Imagine, lunch on the patio by the skating rink watching the shoppers and skaters. It was 70o that late November day. A beautiful memory. We returned to check out the park and lights at night later in our stay.This is charming green space that we will defintely return to in any season...although at Christmas time...... it's truly magical!

Wonderful!. We stumbled across Bryant Park and I am so pleased we did. A lovely place to chill out, people watch and wander. The little stores are fab and I bought a lovely ring for just $20 as a momento.We visited when the ice skating rink was up and spent a bit of time taking it all in. It wasn't until the second time we went to the park that we realised it was the library behind it!Not far from Times Square and to visit it at night is magical.
Bryant Park was a bit boring. The winter market was on - but the stalls were very boring and not very creative. I would give it a miss and try Union Square instead.

Bryant Park is a gem during Christmas. The park had a wonderful Christmas tree (in my opinion more beautiful than the one at Rockefeller center). Locals artisans selling their handcrafted merchandise that carry the look, ice skating rink, music, a delightful coffee shop and a restaurant built for the season only, the Celsius at Bryant Park. Nice and kind waiters, delicious food, relaxing environment.We stayed at a hotel 3 blocks from Bryant park and it was great, since the park became our reference and daily stop for coffee and shopping. There is a Zara store right at the corner on 5th street with great merchandise and prices. Bryant Park is not big, it is cozy and gives you that warm feeling you get when you are home.
Christmas-time skating in NYC. Went to the fast access line and for a few extra dollars each we were on the ice in a little over 15 minutes -- crowded but fun

Summer lunch or winter ice skating. I love coming here in the summer and eating my lunch on the lawn. In the winter the park is transformed into a big ice skating rink with tons of shops for the holiday season.
Fabulous and FREE. Gorgeous skating arena....great location...festive at holidays and don't let the long lines deter you..they do move quickly..we had a blast!

More to see, do and skate than Rockefeller Center. We stumbled on this park while attending the NYC public library. Beautifully decorated formthe holidays, larger rink, lots Of shopping and a restaurant overlooking the rink. Even saw Derek Hough from dancing with the stars. You will not not be disappointed

Bryant Park - Great Anytime During the Year. Now is the holiday season in NYC, and what greater fun than going to Bryant Park with its free ice skating and terrific seasonal shops. During the summer there are free movies on a big screen, but it is especially wonderful right now in December when everyone is happily enjoying the holiday with high hopes for the new year.

A lot of fun...unusual open-air craft fair!. Bryant Park is wonderful and so unique...Aroma cafe serves great coffee, excellent crepes and treats all surround semi-outdoor handmade crafters' booths. Spent hours there enjoying the ambience and excellent shopping.

Bryant Park adapts to all seasons. Tucked away behind the New York Public Library, is a little piece of heaven. Bryant Park dresses up for the holidays with holiday vendors surrounding the ice skating rink. Places to sit, meet friends, grab a snack, drink, meal or a gift or two. It screams "Christmas is coming" and you cannot help but get into the spirit of the season. When spring arrives, Bryant Park changes her look. She sprouts a beautiful fountain as the focal point. Coffee bars and snack bars can be found selling treats. Pleanty of seating can be had to just sit and enjoy the fresh air as the park welcomes visitors.The Bryant Park Cafe and Grill is a welcome destination for drinks with friends, dinner with family or a private party. Don't miss Bryant Park the next time you are in NYC.
Love Bryant Park. I love Bryant Park around Christmas time. They have all of these cute little shops set-up. They have a little something for just about everyone.
winter skating. like the ice rink. ice is rough, but no worse than any other outdoor rink. shopping good.

Pretty at night but crowded. Definitely walk around this park and look into all of the little shops. Grab hot chocolate (and free sample of cookies!) but buy small one and share since it is five dollars and so rich! But go here knowing that it does get very crowded around those shops at night time. There is a small ice skating rink (I have never tried it out), with seats around the rink and also restaurant in the park. Beautiful at Christmas time.
Shady spot in concrete jungle. take a seat uner the lesay trees and cool off, rest up and watch the crowds.get a sammich from the vendors...they can be good.

Stores, restaurants and ice skating. There are open air stores, like a market or street fair, very tidy and lively. Also you have the ice skating rink which is cool, cheap ($14 unlimited) and fun; and some restaurants, which I haven't tried yet.

Good place to ice skate, but be careful, go slowly. For $14 only is very good. You can stay as long as you want. The skates are in good condition. I think it is the less expensive of all ice skating rinks in the city. The only thing I didn't like was that there were many skaters who went really fast and among the slow skaters and made you unstable and scared to fall. I guess it is like that in all rinks unfortunately. There should be certain hours for experts...Don't take any bags, you will have to rent a locker. There is no need.

Lovely little park. It is not big but at this time of year it is lovely with little individual shops in wooden huts. Great for things that are different to that found in the main stores. Skating is great value as it is free, on $14 for skate hire and locker free if you take your own lock.
Lively spot at Christmastime. Buzzing landscaped park with market stalls, food, a Christmas tree, carousel and a large ice rick. Cheerful, lively and free.
Christmas Market & Ice Skating. Nice Christmas market and the ice skating looked fun.

Christmas shopping in the park. Thus is a must do for anyone going to NYC for holiday shopping. Glass enclosed shops with unique gift ideas for everyone. Take time from shopping to grab a hot cider and sit in the Adirondack chairs on the porch, great forpeople watching and resting weary feet"

A different shopping experience in NYC. If the weather is cooperative, a good way to spend a few hours browsing the shops around the park. Most have unique items, and some offer food and/or drinks.
Artwork, clothing, jewelry and home goods are popular items.
If you like to visit local art festivals, you would probably like this area.

Winter wonderland!. The huge Christmas Tree and Ice Rink were a pleasant treat when we stumbled upon them on our way uptown to see the Rockefeller Center tree. This area is much less crowded and has so much charm...small boutique shops with handmade wares and plenty of tables and chairs to stop for hot chocolate or a bite to eat.
Best winter exhibit. I loved the gorgeous tree by the intimate ice skating ring. The shops were delightful filled with such unique items for Christmas gifts.

A NYC Staple. A beautiful park at a nice walkable distance from Times Square or Grand Central Station. You can fancy a lot of shopping around the square as well. This is an area that hosts so many events because it's THAT good a space. Christmas is gorgeous there.

Cutest shops!. They have the cutest shops during Christmas time, and also the ice skating under the big tree! Loved going through all the little vendors shops, and finding cute pieces for myself and friends!

Ice skating at Bryant Park!. Loved skating at Bryant Park.. bigger and less crowded than Rockefellar so more room to comfortably skate. Skate and bag rentals were very reasonalby priced and Christmas markets nearby made a fantastic afternoon!
A gem. A wonderful park with lots of seating and great shops/food booths (we visited at Christmas time). My kids especially liked the "porch" area which had a roaring fire and heaters for the seats.

Ice skating. My daughter was very excited to go ice skating there, and I was excited because it was free! However, because its New York, the sheer amount of people there make it very intimidating for a novice ice skater to skate and not run into anyone.

Surprise - natural beauty amid the tall buildings and hustle and bustle on the streets. We enjoyed shopping and the market in the park more than the stores on 5th avenue! We got some unique Christmas gifts and enjoyedthe walk in the park at the same time.
Christmas Market at Bryant Park. The Christmas Market at Bryant Park was festive and worth a stop. Lots of kiosks had basically the same things. Not much in handmade items.

Visit any season. Take in the skating, the Blue Tree, the little glass enclosed shops.
Yummy restaurant and right behind the Lion library.
In the warmer ,weather check out the lovely carousel.
Ice Skating!. Even though it was $$$$, had a great time ice skating at the pond! Very clean and neat

Must visit during Holiday Season. Bryant Park during the Holiday Season has a bunch of different vendors setup tents selling neat little things or food. I had a nice belgian waffle from one of the vendors that was tasty. There is usually plently of sitting to eat as you watch people ice skate in the rink in middle of the park.
Beautiful place to relax near the Christmas tree. My family and I sat in chair at the bottom of the large tree and watched the ice skaters enjoying themselves. It was very nice way to end the night.

Fantastic attraction. This place cannot be beat. So awesome at night. The little shops are great and fun to check out. A little pricy, but you don't have to buy. The ice skating is great to watch. I liked being able to look up and see the Empire State building. There is food and drinks for purchase as well.

Good skating rink but Christmas shops disappointing. This is a good place to get a real NY feel for Christmas. The skating rink is free to use although it costs to hire skates. The Christmas shops around the rink area are picturesque but are disappointing in what they have on offer. They also seemed pretty expensive.
Busy and just OK but skip it .... Not highly recommended. Go to Rockeffeller Center instead.

like a fairytale. so magical to stroll through the little stalls and shops on a wintery night with the smell of cinnamon and then to just sit by the ice rink watching every size and shape and age of a person performing on their skates. So Christmassy!

A must stop in Dec. A great place to watch or do some Ice skating, do some last minute shopping, have a bite to eat or just relax and have a few drinks around the fire pit. The tree is up and everyone is having a great time.
shops and skating. you can skate; the semi permanent shops are cool; similar to columbus circle with some differences; friendly area and a walk to everywhere midtown
Great atmosphere. So fun! Cute shopping... I actually think I like it better than Rockefeller!

Wow. The Park has changed significantly since my last visit, the little shops throughout the park are artistic and reasonably priced. It is also right behind the Public Library and there is a skating rink - great fun.

A nice stop to rest your feet, Winter ice skating and christmas venders nearby. After walking through the Public Library, next door, Bryant Park made a great stop to rest our feet and relax. What we liked about Bryant Park compared to other patches of green in NYC was the green ivy that crawled along the ground, instead of traditional grass. This meant that Bryant Park remained refreshingly green during our visit last week, perfectly complimenting the Xmas decorations and atmosphere that had engulfed this park. Bryant Park also has an ice-skating rink and numerous Christmas vendors stationed within the park grounds, adding to a very pleasant festive atmosphere that was easy to enjoy. We really liked what we saw during our quick stop at Bryant Park and would suggest planning a stop there during your trip to this area of NYC. It is ideally situated between Grand Central Station and Time Square so perhaps instead of taking the subway, you could walk the distance instead so as to be able to visit Bryant Park.

Can't miss if especially if you go at Christmas time. The tree, the shops, the restaurants and the Karma is what makes Bryant Park so great. Their is a ice rink their open to the public that is much more easier to get on to then at Rockerfeller Center. Bryant Park is the 2nd Rockerfeller Center with out the larger crowds.

A Bustling Unexpected Oasis. I love Bryant Park for so many reasons. It is a gorgeous SMALL park in the midst of mid-town. I enjoy people watching here, ice skating in the winter, movies on the lawn in the summer and grabbing a sandwich at "Craftwich." PS-these are some of the VERY BEST sandwiches in New York! The park is also behind the NY Public Library which is a treasure trove of history and architecture. Also, one secret of Bryant Park is they have the most beautiful, best kept public bathrooms in the city! They're very nice!
Fun place to visit. Great little shops, lots of places to get a snack and it has the skating rink with the music and the Christmas tree.

Great, any time of year!. I recently had a chance to visit Bryant park - the first time in winter, where skating is free (bring your own skates or rent for $12). A great park year round with great things to see any season of the year and little shops and boutiques set up for your perusal.
Christmas market at the park. There was a lovely crafts market in the park with a huge ice skating rank. A must see!! Don't miss the hot Cranberry cider!
Ice skating at Bryant Park. It is free and wonderful! Citibank cardholders get a perk by not having to stand in line. We skated for hours

Our favorite green spot in NYC!. An oasis in NYC, this park has so much to offer. It is surrounded by the Theatre district, NY public library, restaurants and shops, and close to Grand Central, but one can also go enjoy the quiet space, whether sitting around with friends for a drink or sitting quietly. This area has it all!During our most recent trip, it was filled with vendors for Christmas, the tree, and ice rink, all festive and fun.
Beautiful. Free Ice Skating November - January, just $15 for skate hiring. Bryant Park is just behind the New York Libary, which is also worth a visit.

You know those heart-swelling moments you only get in NYC?. Well, this is one of the spots that does it for me. Never fails, every time I walk through Bryant Park (and I admit, I'm usually just passing through on my way to/from Grand Central) I look up and see the cosmopoltan buildings along with the old ones from the 1800's, softened by trees and a small green spot in the city, and my heart swells with love for the Big Apple. Especially at night when the Empire State building lights are lit up. Plus, the bathrooms are not to be missed. Yes, the bathrooms. What other public bathrooms in NYC have fresh flowers, beautiful tile work, and are CLEAN, CLEAN, CLEAN! (thanks to a full-time attendant.) There may be a bit of a line, but it's worth the wait not to sit your fanny down on a wet toilet seat :)

Winter Christmas Markt and Skating. Lots of hubbub here at Christmas time. Small craft booths, opportunity to rents skates and enjoy the ice. There are a couple of coffee booths and a rink side restaurant. Fun, but we enjoyed the Union Square Markt more.
Lovely Spot During Christmas Holidays. Great little shops set up. Beautiful fountain and ice skating with a beautiful tree! Wonderful place to enjoy the holidays.

Holiday Market. What a wonderful market. I did my best shopping here. My mother and I both try to buy Christmas presents that are unique, and the holiday markets around New York City are the place to get them.
cool euro feel park in the heart of ny. cool park -check out citi pond in the winter for free ice skating -and great to chill and watch

Nice for a day out. They always do a nice job. Citibank has invaded this year which was an interesting addition since they teamed up with Real Simple. I found some hand made soap shaped like fruit...You will find something for everyone on your list of people that are hard to buy for...
Christmas Fair. This was excellent, really good christmas shops, with different items than you would get normally

Best kept secret within NYC parks. Very small compared to Central Park but is located next to the Manhattan main library. Used mostly by locals but offers a great place to hang out or have lunch. They show movies in the park during the summer.

A little piece of Christmas Heaven. So enjoyed a few hours walking around this park in such a frantic city, the stalls and ice rink were lovely to see and enjoyed our time there with a cup go hot chocolate. So worth a visit

A Fun Place For Christmas. Bryant Park is full of activity duing the Christmas season. There were so many vendors there with very nice merchandise. My husband bought me a beautiful bracelet for a reasonable price. It is definitely worth visiting during the holidays.

Holiday booths at Bryant Park. Every year Bryant Park is decked out for Christmas with its tree and ice skating rink. Plus, there are hundreds of vendors set up in their mini "stores" with some very interesting items for sale.
Nice at Christmas. Interesting market and fun to watch the skaters. Worth a diversion.

Very nice at christmas. There are many nice little stalls to look around at christmas and an ice rink. I would recommend getting a bite to eat at the restaurant there (can't remember the name) but the food is lovely and the view over the rink really gets you into the festive spirit!
always a great spot. it was interesting to see the thousands of hotel workers protesting in this normally bustling spot. always one of my bright spots when in the city

A lovely spot. A refuge from the frenetic pace of the City the park is a lovely area behind the City Library. From November to January there is an ice rink and Christmas market in the park which is a great spot to retreat from the crowds on 5th Avenue and enjoy a mulled cider
Very Good. Great place, love all the little squirrels running around. Although only down side was if you walk there at night time watch out for the dog sized rats!!!!!

Lovely little Christmas Fayre. We walked through this park on our last evening. Wish I'd seen it sooner as there appeared to be quite a few nice looking bars / restaurants set up around the perimeter. Maybe next time.
My favorite park in NYC. I love this park! It is so a cute and a nice break from the hustle and bustle of the city. In the summer they even show movies on the lawn.
Great hot apple cider!. Pretty good selection of artisan treats and gifts etc. A little expensive but overall pretty fun.

a great park. we have been to NY 8 times and this was our first visit to Bryant Park! I don't know how we missed it before. It is a lovely urban park with lots of cafes and places to sit. there was so many "people watching" opportunities and some lovely views of the Empire State building. There was also a lovely vintage carousel the our youngest son really enjoyed ! the also screen movies at this park once a week in the summer! it is a great spot to hang out for a little while! we really loved it!
Little Bit of Nothing. Small green square surrounded by concrete it is. A park as we would know one in London, it is not.
Relaxing yet vibrant. We spent time here on our last day before going to the airport ,it was a perfect ending to a fabulous trip.
Great time in the Park. The park was full of vendors and didnt types of vendors giving us a full experience of New York
Enchanting place!. I love Bryant Park. Centrally located, small park with a soul. Always somethign going on there. In November they had an ice rink and the winter market. It was amazing!

Great park, worths a visit!. I visited Bryant Park last Christmas and there was a great Christmas market (a bit overpriced), an ice skating ring with children playing, it had great Christmas decoration and generally great spirit. It easily reachable as there is a metro stop just there, named after the park and just few meters from Times Square.
Lunch time hookups. If you are 20-30 single and work in the area this is the place to have lunch.
Love the skating.. It has a wonderful atmosphere at Christmas. We had a fun afternoon there. The Christmas shops were good, but a bit pricey.Don't forget to visit the New York library, it was grand.
Great People Watching Spot!. The outdoor cafe is a great spot for lunch or dinner and to watch the world go by.
Lovely at Christmas. Darling shops, ice skating, and Max Brenner hot chocolate. The hot chocolate is amazing - never tasted anything quite that good before...

Perfect. We stayed just around the corner. I love walking through this park! You ABSOLUTELY have to check out Sabon. They are an incredible boutique with FANTASTIC bath and body products (www.SabonNYC.com). It was our first visit to their store and the staff was AMAZING.

Christmas Market was fun!. We enjoyed shopping at the Christmas Market though it was lots of shops selling similar merchandise, there was enough variety to please and people looked to be buying (I know we did)! The ice skating rink was doing a brisk business and it was a fun alternative to shopping the department stores.

Neat but so crowded!!!. Might have tried the ice skating but really very dangerous with all
The people. Needs to be regulated so others can enjoy. Have a
Time limit when crowds get too large.

Great Place. On our way to see Grand Central Terinal, we stumbled upon Bryant Park and its a great place, with little shops that sell very interesting things. the ambiance is great and, in the winter, the pond turns into an ice skating rink. If you're in NYC, don't miss Bryant Park.
Festive. Went to the Holiday Market - had great booths set up and found some cool ornaments.

Xmas at Bryant Park. When we visited Bryant Park the Christmas market was on with all the little shops selling lovely gifts, we sat at a bar outside under heaters and sampled some local beers then on to the ice skating rink, the park was marvellous especially in the evening all lit up.
Fun Christmas Market. Becomes a market around Christmas with some fun finds, though I don't think anything is truly unique. There is also an ice skating rink and great people watching!
Very nice park. Great park in a central location. Lots of shops and a large ice skating rink.

Pretty park in the middle of all the hustle and bustle.. This pretty little park is a little oasis in the middle of busy streets,behind the impressive library building.There are shady trees, and little tables to sit at .It is very popular with the locals as well, a great place to have a break on a hot day.It also seems to appear in lots of films we have noticed.
A stunning library. At the edge of Bryant Park is the Library - fantastic ! a must see. A Christmas Fair in the park was really good - lots of nice "stalls" and not at all tacky - and a nice ice rink
Lovely little shops. Lovely little shops, some quite unique, some fairly overpriced. If the hot chocolate stand is open, you've got to try it, it is so VERY worth the calories.

Getaway paradise in the concrete jungle. There is always something happening in the Bryant park. Snow skating rink during winter, free movies every thursday in summer and if you can't be separated from your wi-fi device, there is free google powered wireless coverage. Oh and did I mention that they also have a free books library open air right in the park(don't recall ever seeing anything like that anywhere)!!!! Also there is the NY central library right next to the park... A definite must see attraction in NYC
Little Oasis of Christmas Fun.. Ghristmas is a great time to visit Bryant Park- Skating,stalls, the Grill and the Christmas Tree.
Market in Bryan Park. this park offers very nice shop you can browse and find neat little gift

Extras at Christmas. On a Christmas shopping weekend in December we visited Bryant Park and found the extra stalls for Christmas really nice to wander around. The free ice skating rink seemed very popular and the long queue put us off.

christmas pop-up stores. We stopped by here on Sunday morning and watched the ice skaters, browsed the pop-up shops, and had amazing crepes at a little vendor. Its a great stopping point in your walk around NYC, especially around Christmas with the ice skating and shops!

Skating...Snacks...Shopping. we were staying a few blocks away and just kind of stumbed upon the park. Glad we did. They currently have a corp sponsered Citi On The Pond. beautiful ice rink and shopping kiosk around the park with fun snacks and shopping. Great way to spend sometime in the evening.
Great park!. We love to come visit this park. We enjoy the shops set up for Christmas and watching the skaters at CitiPond! In the spring/summer - it is a great place to just chillax!
Christmas markets and ice skating....wonderful. Was so beautiful to se all the ice skating and eat crepes whilst shopping the Christmas markets. Totally romantic and festive.
skate, skate, skate. Loved watching everyone enjoying themselves, like something out of the movies....all the little shops around were fabulous too, food shops great
Very nice park !. From Summer to winter it's always a nice park to go see , now you can go skiting

Fun Outdoor Holiday Atmosphere. Bryant Park is always a nice place to visit, but it takes on a special atmosphere during the Christmas season. The pond turns into an ice skating rink filled with kids and families. They do offer lockers and skate rentals, but the lines can be long so be prepared to wait.Food is offered at the Bryant Park Grill as well as vendors set up in the Holiday Shops. These shops also have numerous booths selling local art, jewelry, winter accessories and more. Many of the shops are selling duplicate products but browsing them is still lots of fun and puts you in the Christmas spirit.Again, it can be crowded because of the time of year, but worth stopping by and taking a look.

nice, quaint park. went in the evening - tons going on, don't be fooled by the small-ish size of the park. there's something for everybody: shopping, ice skating, food, drinks. especially enjoyed the southwest porch - it had a very hip, cozy vibe
Skating in NYC. The skating is free, although you can rent skates. The rink is a good size and the ice is well prepared. Chairs and tables availalble for those not skating.

Best Park in Midtown. The park is located adjacent to the New York City Library. It is always a great place to go and relax in the city. There are plenty of small cafe's and restaurants that you can visit for a snack to enjoy in the park. In the winter time Bryant Park has the cheapest and best of the skating rinks. It is a great place throughout the year to let the city kind of happen around you. It's a must see and do for locals and tourists a like.If you want more tips about life in New York check out my blog at: http://surprisedinny.blogspot.com/
a "neighborhood' park. summer finds people playing chess, winter has ice skating! Good eats in park or just across road. lots of benches, tables. Very clean and safe

Great little park. I love everything about Bryant Park, especially during the Christmas Season, when they have free skating. The shops are all unique, most made by locals, and the restaurant at the park is Fantastic!

A great stop on your way from Grand Central to Times Square. I LOVE Bryant Park. It is a beautiful place to sit for a short time in between walking everywhere! I love it in the spring and fall but it is most appealing between Thanksgiving and Christmas. There is a good sized skating rink surrounding by a lovely area with chairs and table to enjoy a hot chocolate or sandwich or kettle corn from Kettlecorn NYC, one of my favorite vendors!!! A large christmas tree is decorated in the center along with many kiosks set up around the perimeter featuring gift items and jewelry.Bryant park is lovely at any time of the year to catch your breath while visiting NYC!
Christmas Time. Wet, miserable day and was disappointed in the Christmas Market stalls - very expensive and some strange offerings - watching folk on the only free city ice skating rink was fun

A quiet place in the middle of the city.... Go if you are nearby. They have updated this park since I was there. I grabbed a few macaroons and watched the ballet. There is no shortage of benches, chairs and cocktail tables there to sit and people watch. Also, the cleanest public restrooms I have ever been in...

A wonderful haven of shops, food and ice skating pleasure in the city!. Loved the little shops and the food in Bryant Park! We didn't ice skate, but watching the people who did was priceless!!! The ice was NOT the best, but they were having a ball!!! The lines for ice skating were long! Shops had some really different items and the smells of the different foods were wonderful!
Holiday gift market. Loved it! It was fun to shop and absorb the holiday spirit on New York. I could of spent an entire afternoon here.

Fun even on a rainy day!. I visited Bryant Park during a visit to NYC to visit a friend. Even though it was a very rainy day I still enjoyed all the little shops set up in the park. Purchased some unique items for Christmas gifts. Vendors were very friendly and helpful. Watched the ice skating, but did not skate myself due to the weather. Very pretty park and we really enjoyed the day!
A wonderful surprise. Located on East 42nd Street, very unusual gift shops and a real family atmosphere - skating rink and food vendors.
Lovely oasis in the middle of mayhem. This was turned into a skating park with a fab tree and a christmas market.Very interesting stalls with unusual items.You are surrounded by skyscrapers!
nice place. nice place, nice atmosphere, loads of choice in the stalls, gifts that you couln't buy at home
Great atmosphere, loads happening in winter with ice rink. loved the shopping kiosks and ice skating rink, lots of atmosphere
Shopping was fun. My adult daughter and i enjoyed the shopping - bought a little jewelry. My adult son doesn't like shopping so sat in the chairs and waiting - worked out well.

People watching paradise. Right opposite our hotel and a great place to people watch. It was a great laugh watching the `bamby` ice skaters. 0Celcius bar was a reasonable meal but we had to wait an hour for a table. Recommend the hanger steak. Great variety of shops and fabulous atmosphere.
December shopping village. Were unable to visit the library, but were pleasantly surprised to find Bryant Park transformed into a craft/artist shopping village with a huge ice rink!
New York to its best!. Going there for free skating during the holidays is a deal in NYC. Shops are nice and food is good.

Great changes to a fun place. This park, always pretty and always in a great location, used to be very sleazy. It's been upgraded and cleaned up. They have outdoor films in the warm weather and ice skating in the winter. It's in Midtown so it's near a lot of attractions, stores, restaurants, theaters-and the main New York Public Library, as well as Grand Central Station. I used to go there sometimes to eat my lunch when I worked in the area. Since it's been cleaned up, it feels safer to visit-a plus for visitors. It isn't big. We sometimes refer to parks like this as "pocket parks." It's a nice place to have your lunch if you work around there, or to take a break from sightseeing.
Ice skating in the Park. For the season there are lots of activities to enjoy: small shops, eateries and ice skating

Holiday season visit.. Being the holiday season the park was decorated. I didn't realize they also had an outdoor rink for ice skating. There were also various booths there with a little of everything. Food, clothing. things for the holidays. My friends brought some ornaments & had them engraved there as they waited/ I've walked past the park several times previously, but it was the first time actually going into it. It was pretty cool.
Super Xmas Stalls. Spend several lunch times taking in the atmosphere and skating. Lovely food stall that were good value for NYC. Xmas market nice.
Loved It. Loved the shopping and atmosphere. Puts you in the holiday spirit.
Worth a look. Visited in December, Ice rink in the middle of a tented village selling all sorts of craft work etc. Nice to visit after dark when all the lights are on

Shopped & enjoyed a coffee. We enjoyed watching the ice skaters, but it was relaxing to sit at a small table with coffee. There were tents with vendors selling holiday gifts and treats. Locals around us gave us tips on things to see and pointed us to a location for an entertaining shoe shine.
what a mess. is this the highest and best use of a public space. cheesy retailers packed in a lovely urban park? yuck. I couldnt get out of there fast enough,
a little oasis in the heart of the city. I've always enjoyed this spot....it's a bit crowded with the holiday vendors, but still provides a brief respite from the surrounding chaos.
Pleasant Surprise. Walked through the park on the way back to hotel and enjoyed the Christmas shops, ice skating rink and a delicious crepe and hot chocolate. Excellent!
Fun area!. Busy park w/food & gift venders set up throughout. Large Christmas tree & skating ring - very "festive"!

Magical Place. We went to Bryant Park on a Sunday and they had kiosks with beautiful arts and crafts for sale, gifts that you can't buy anywhere else because of their originality. The ice skating rink was open...the smells, the music, the carousel! The day was magical. Everyone that goes to New York should visit this beautiful park.
Very lively. Came here for the Christmas market--one of about 4 going on in the city.

Lovely place to sit and relax for five mins. This is a lovely spot to sit and realx for five mins, there are many little stalls around craft and food, beautiful seating laid out with bug heaters around.

Beautiful but ruined by pop up shops. Bryant Park used to be a beautiful little park in midtown that locals and tourists alike could enjoy for a few peaceful moments during a busy day. While the park is undoubtedly still beautiful I feel the atmosphere has been lost by the introduction of so many pop up shops. Such a shame.

Park full of life in December. Bryant Park is very nice in December with its ice skating rink, christmas tree and the little "shops".There are a lot of small "shops" where you can buy chocolate, something warm to drink, a little snack, christmas ornaments, bags, clothes...you name it.The big christmas tree is popular for photographs and the ice skating rink with all its skaters and music is popular.A nice place to just walk around and look at things and people.
Magical. We were there over the Holiday Season and loved the ice rink and stalls. A very magical feeling and not as busy as the ice rink at the Rockafella Centre.
Love the books & the ice skating rink. Creative city park with reading nooks and an ice skating rink. Great winter holiday market too.
Nice. Nice park, a bit different from the other ones, very Mew York style (imho)

not very special. there are many park and gardens in nyc
but nothing like central park

Fun to walk around but Costly. This is what I would call a fun activity. Walking around Bryan Park was great. I enjoyed the trees and the sitting areas. However, the price of the merchandise was kinda costly for my taste. But it was nice to see the pieces sold.
a great find. Small and compact bur full of variety. Reasonable prices. Toilets close by!
First time at the Park. I really enjoyed the monument and the ability to see the Stateu Of Liberty
Hidden Treasure. This is a park you almost accidentally stumble on. Being Xmas time ther skating rink was well populated and a lot of great little shops around the park.

The Chameleon. Bryant Park is so many things to so many people. At it's core, it's a space that allows one to take a break, read, meet with friends, or whatever. However, during the summer months it becomes an entertainment space, featuring broadway acts, HBO Monday night at the movies, and concert space. During the winter months it houses the holiday bazaar and the Citi Pond ice skating rink and bar. It was the former home of the NY Fashion Week. The bottom line is, Bryant Park is consistently transforming itself and no matter what, there's always something happening. I love walking by and being able to have some sort of experience at the Park; whether it's watching an intense chess game, a performance or enjoying other's enjoy the park!It's a must!
Fun with all the shops and ice rink. I lke it in the summer time with all the activities but it was fun to go through the shops

Love what New York has done with this park!. I used to live in New York and work in the Garment industry right down the street from this park 15 years ago. It is amazing that a place that you used to be a place you walk around and now it is a place you want to go in and have lunch and fashion week is held there.it has internet access and is a wonderful place to land in the summer in New York
An oasis in midtown, great for a quick midday break.. Simply put, its great for a walk after lunch to reinvigorate for the afternoon grind.
Xmas shopping opportunity... Nice little craft market, and ice-skaing rink. All very christmassy in a tasteful way.
Uniquie Shopping In An Outdoor Atmosphere. Vendors selling unique items and gifts. Did not feel at all like a tourist trap
Little oasis in NYC. The ice skating was lovely to watch and all of the little stalls with unusual gifts were great to visit.
Great respite.... ....in the middle of the Big City. Merry go round and ice skating were a perfect excape for the kids.
Holiday time in Bryant Park. Beautiful tree, ice skating with lovely music, holiday shops. Nice place for a relaxing stroll.

HOLIDAY SHOPS. we spent a couple of evenings wandering around this lovely spot in central Manhattan. The atmosphere was amazing with the shops and ice skating and a nice outside bar, well worth a visit
Christmas fair. Lovely place to go for a walk and check the Christmas fair. The ice skating rink is very nice too.
Christmas. We had a walk round here on the way down to Macys,There were lots of Christmas stalls and also an Ice skating ring which was $14 including skate hire itss free if you have your own skates.

Christmas Boutiques. It was crowded, crowded, crowded four weekends before Christmas, but by and large it was a happy crowd having a good time doing holiday things. Lots to see, found some unique gifts and had fun watching the skating.

Lovely little Oasis in the concrete jungle. Great area, nice little pond with ice skating. Great holiday markets this time of year. Neat architecture immediately surrounding. It is close to many things, including the subway, and adjoins the NY LIbrary. Quaint park and again, this time of year its a great place to hang out.
go!. A fun park, lots of shops, large park and in the summer there are free broadway shows! In the winter , ice skating rink, going again next week!!
!crowded! long wait for the ice skating. the park is pretty but hope you don't want to go ice skating cause the line wraps around the park litteraly

A lovely renovation of a lost park.. When I lived in NYC in the 80s, you didn't go to Bryant Park.
Now it's a destination, with a seasonal skating rink, seasonal craft fairs, statuary, food service, etc. etc. etc.
Very nicely done, NY.
Good spot to people watch and to view the holiday displays.. Liked the entire experience--this is a great spot to see and be seen and the displays for the holiday were interesting.

Christmas delight. We went here for their little Christmas fair, they had a lovely Christmas tree and ice rink. The stalls had a lot of variety but the prices were quite high compared to other locations. The Ice rink admission is free but its $14 for skate hire and then $7 a lock to put your shoes away. The rink is bigger than central parks one and was a nice way to start the holidays!
Great at Christmas!. Beautifully decorated tree, ice skating (crowded!) rink, hoilday shops throughout the park including food vendors.Perfect place to get you into the holiday spirit!
Love it!. Excellent! Great holiday vendors, and Bryant Park Grill is the best.
Holiday magic!. Great festive atmosphere... romantic outdoor bar with fire pit and swings

A Christmas Wonderland. A must-see on any Christmas tour of NYC. Great iceskating rink, interesting arts and crafts for sale and a general holiday feeling abides. Hard to believe this once was "Needle Park".

Christmas Markets. A real buzz exists around the park with the tree lighting and the ice rink. The markets are excellent with lots of food and drinks to try whilst moving around the little stalls and stores.

Winter time kiosks all over the place & skating. Very nice place to be around Christmas time. Shops and individual vendors everyplace!! Very unique. Even if you don't ice skate, its fun to watch and sip a very nice hot chocolate from the nearby vendor, delish!!!

Great little find. We happened along this park by accident while walking down to Macy's. They had a bunch of little shops setup with some great unusual items. I bought a 1920's style wool hat that Iwore all day. It was warm and comfortable and stayed on my head when the wind picked up. Some of the other shops were for ornaments, jewelry, snacks, pictures. Great place to stroll for an hour. We then picked up hot chocolate and watched the ice skaters. It was a nice stop to take a break and not fight the crowds.
Holiday Time. Bryant Park was alive with ice skaters. The little kiosks sold many fine things. We had some nice relaxation time here. Coffee and Bryant Park!
Perfect Christmas Feel. Great in December with ice skating (optional), Christmas stalls, huge Christmas trees and some hot apple cider. Well worth finding.

Just magical. I went in November early December and with the skating rink up and running this is a winter wonderland not to be missed. Its so close to times square and grand central station take 5 mins to go and check it out.

Quiet, but full of wonderful enchanting surprises!. You never know what will be happening here. A street market, a fashion show or just a quiet day. There is a carousel a coffee shop with a fire pit and swings. Very cool.

Love watching ice skating at Bryant Park. There is market with unusual items appropriate for gifts including jewelry, knit items, housewares, etc. You can ice skate - I can't - but I love to watch. It was super busy on Saturday night but get a hot drink and enjoy!
Great place to get into the holiday spirit. Nice during the holidays. Less crowed than Rockefeller Center and good skyline view. Christmas tree, ice skating, vendor market, small outdoor bar.

Good for free skating!. Great to find a rink that you dont have to pre-book and skate for as little or long in a beautiful setting..all the Christmas stall and the Celsuis bar/restaurant fabulous addisions...Situated on 42nd street behind the library..Tip...some of the stalls are more pricey than the shops.

Bryant Park @ Christmas. It's a fun, lovely place to go on a December evening in NYC! The Ice Skating Rink, the Christmas Tree and the Holiday Shops will help to put you in the Holiday Spirit! We particularly enjoy the Hot Chocolate and Chocolate Chip Cookies!
Christmas maket on when we went. Really good christmas market was on which was nice to walk around and buy some souveneers to take home
Very nice. Nicely set up. Fabulouse ice rink. Great craft shops.

Stop for the Market and Ice Skating during the holidays.... There is a great market that is put up in Bryant Park during the holidays along with the skating rink. The market has all kinds of unique gifts and food options. There are also sculptures and fountains in the park. Located on the 42nd St. & Bryant Park subway stop to catch the B,D,F,M, or 7 trains. The NYC Public Library is just to the east of the park and only a block away from Times Square.

Hot Cocoa by the Ice Skating Rink. Decorated for Christmas, relax and shop in this mini Rock Center Paradise. You can shop as if you are at a little fair surrounded by the beautiful Christmas tree and ice scating rink with Holdiay music around!
Great. Great place loved the ice skating. Also watched the thanksgiving day parade from here

Nice place to hang out. The Christmas market and Citi Pond (ice skating) and seating just to sit with a hot drink makes it a great place to hang out and dodge out of the hustle and bustle of 5th Ave or Times Square.

Great park in the middle of all the hustle. I walk through Bryant Park almost daily on the way to work. Its amazing to see hosw the park changes with each season. However, at this time of the year, its a winter wonderland. First off, you have the ice rink set up and all the Christmas market stalls. There are some interesting shops selling a wide, wide array of merchandise. Additionally, there are food stalls. You can find Turkish phyllo rolls, crepes, designer hot dogs, hot pickles, dumplings, etc, etc. Additionally, the SouthWest grill has a fire pit, so the scent of wood smoke at that end of the park adds to the wintery holiday feeling. Even if you visit the park in the other seaosns, its usually an oasis from all the hustle and bustle of NYC. I usually walk through just to get a few minutes of relief from having my NYC "face" on. Finally, you will not find a nicer public restroom anywhere in NYC, guaranteed.

Xmas market. the markets are out in Union Sq and Bryant Park. Great for browsing and picking up stocking fillers. My tip, even if you don't want to buy anything, compliment the artists on their creations. It costs nothing to be nice!
Bryant Park. Beautiful views of New York Library, otherwise not worth going out of your way for.
Beautiful during cool season. During the cool season people to go ther to skate, to drink or eating something, to shopping...It is a nice place to spend time exposed to the sun during a cool day
Great Christmas Markets. Christmas market at Bryant Park was great. Several unique spots to buy gifts and snacks. Stop by the library when you are there.
relaxing. a great find in the centre of new york , lots of stalls that sell lots of different things , lots of seats and a ice rink in the middle
nICE time. Went for the 'free' ice-skating, by free they meant $14 (no mention of that charge anywhere until you reached the skate hire section. Plus extra for your shoes to be stored.
Behind 42nd Street Library. Fun in winter and summer. Free ice skating, shops, and in the summer outdoor tables and cafes. A touch of Europe in NY. Very safe. Free cultural events too.

Wonderful. A trip to New York wouldn't be complete without a trip to Bryant Park. The skating rink is quaint and beautifully lit with all sorts of characters to entertain you. The unique shops that they put up at this time of year are offer original designs and specialty items. The outdoor bars and snack stops are wonderful. You can have a drink and sit by a fire pit and watch the people go by. It's fabulous!

Beautiful spot to peoplewatch and just chill. I loved this small park near Grand Central. Little stalls/shops and garden as well as the icerink made this a pure NY experience for me. I will never forget the moment I sat there & watched little New Yorkers skating and Ella Fitzgerald's I've Got You Under My Skin playing - typical NY. Get there and chill.

A lush hideaway in the middle of Manhattan. We stumbled upon Bryant Park and loved it immediately! Such a great atmosphere with all the people sitting around reading, soaking up the sun, playing table tennis or sitting at the outdoor library. We ended up returning several times over the next few days to relax and lie on the grass. Make sure you check out Bryant Park, just behind the NYPL.

The place to chill and feel like a New Yorker. Loved going there at the end of the day and watching people leaving their jobs, walking by on their suits.Perfection would be to just sit down with a cup of coffee on the grass, with the Library building in the background.
Excellent Christmas Market. Spent a couple of hours wandering through the excellent Christmas stalls at Bryant Park. Lots of variety. Try the gourmet grits booth at the SW corner of the park.
just off 5th Avenue. there is a free ice skating rink here.... only if you have your own skates. The winter market is here too...... lots of hand made Christmas gifts, food & drink
Relaxing and fun. What a wonderful oasis in the center of Manhatten. Fun to sit and relax, enjoy the sunshine, and people watch.

Its a must visit & Ice Skating is a must here. We love coming to this little hide away,we had never been at this time of year,normally spring time,so seeing the ice rink and all the little christmas huts(shops) were amazing,its a great place to go and visit.You also get free WI-FI which is a bonus
Beautiful. Great little park - they had an ice rink in it - was great to pick up breakfast from a deli and sit in the park and watch the morning skaters!! Decent at night too.......very pretty!
Christmas in the park. Cute vendors in Bryant Park at Christmas Village. We didn't stay too long to see all the sites there. There is skating as well.

Good stopping-off point. Came here during our Thanksgiving visit to NY. Grew up in NY and during that time the park was a SCARY place, not even to be ventured into during the day.Now it is a neat place to sit and rest. There are merchant stalls set up for the holiday/winter season as well as a free ice skating rink--costs to rent skates. There are also stands selling snacks and coffees.We did not eat at the cafes but did use the restrooms which are safe and clean with attendants.Park is located ust behind the main NY Public Library which is worth a visit itself. Within walking distance to Lord and Taylor's.
winter wonderland. loved the small shops and ice rink...the lighting and excitement of all there was contagious...

Enchanting little charm not to be missed.. We hit this on Saturday morning as the adorable little shops began to open. The rink was also open so we could skate before the crowds showed up. What an amazing place to sit, shop and soak in the morning. One of my favorite unexpected New York delights.

Lovely way to spend Sunday afternoon. The ice rink is open in December and it was great to just soak up the holiday atmosphere in the park. Enjoy a cocktail and bite to eat in Celsius overlooking the ice-rink. Great for a much needed break from the hustle and bustle of Xmas shoppers on 5th Avenue.
Great place to shop for holiday gifts while watching the skaters. Good variety of shop stalls. Decent, clean public restrooms on corner.

Loved it!. Wonderful area to hang out. Very reasonably priced vendors set up in a sort of market setting, selling various things. Ice skating rink was up. I went there on a Friday afternoon and it was VERY crowded. A nice relaxing place to grab a drink or a snack and enjoy the city.

Fun, exhilirating, family event in a beautiful setting . . . that's free!. Ice Skating at Bryant Park is free from late Oct. through late Feb. and the hours are extensive. It opens at 8 AM and closes at 10 PM except for weekends when it stays open until midnight. Our family brought our own ice skates and locks for lockers so entry was free (though we paid to get two pairs of skates sharpened for the season). You can pay to rent skates, but there is not time limit on the skating. It was pretty crowded when our family went on a Friday late in the afternoon, but we still had a great time. There are security skaters on the rink to help anyone as needed and to keep things orderly. My husband & I went on a weekday in the morning and there were not many people. The music is fun and romantic. The skyscrapers and park surrounding the rink are beautiful. There are many vendors in booths selling interesting, handmade items. There are even ping pong tables and books to read (an extension of the library) in the park to use for free. Really enjoyable opportunity!
Ice skating, shopping. Beautiful little park where you can skate and visit artist shops.
Skating. Wonderful night time excursion, food and skating. A real Christmas market

Great gifts between Thanksgiving and Christmas. During the Spring people lay their blankets on the grass and enjoy the trees and sunshine. During the Holidays the park takes on another persona. An ice skating rink and gift kiosks fill the park. Go after dark and enjoy some hot chocolate and a stroll.

Beautiful!!. Lovely well kept park - nice to stop and relax after your trip on the Statten Island Ferry!! the girls played in the fountains to cool off (it was in the 90s in Oct!!) the Sphere statue - to remember those lost in the 9/11 terror attacks, is lovely - very thought provoking!And lets not forget the squirrills!!!! LOADS of them!! all over the park and they are not scared of anything - typical New Yorkers!!!!
Little tropical paradise in the concrete jungle!. Fantastic place to stop after dinner for a few libations! So relaxing and friendly after touring around the fast pace of this hectic city!

Great Holiday Shopping. The craft stalls set up for holiday shopping are high end, quality goods-- a number of the crafters seem to be from Massachusetts. The quality is high, there is a lot of jewelry, some clothing-- especially accessories, candles, soaps and yes HUGE yummy ($5) cookies. You can skate too!

A beautiful spot. Bryant Park is perfect no matter the season. In the summer they offer movies and a carousel for the children and in the winter a skate rink. Take yourself over to one of the restaurants for a nice lunch, but make reservations if you think you will be tight for time as there is always a wait.

What fun!. I took my family over to Bryant Park, one of my favorite places to spend a few minutes in when traveling on business, because I knew that they were having holiday tents set up. What a treat! And there was also free ice skating, a more casual version of the Rockefellar Center rink. With the trees lit, the music, a nice restaurant with open cafe area adjacent to the rink, the park was festive and a perfect place to stroll on a Friday evening!
Very Nice. Haven't been through Bryant Park in 35-40 years. They made the place really nice with little crafts shops and a skating rink! Nice for a relaxing break from sightseeing!

Great park for ice skating and shopping.. Took the family to Bryant Park over Thanksgiving weekend to ice skate. Rockefeller was way too crowded so we decided to try Bryant. It was pretty busy as well but the wait wasnt too bad. Ice skating was a little steep at $14 a person, same price for kids. The ice skates were fairly new and in great condition. The rink was crowded and didnt make for ideal skating, but in general this is a great place to skate. The views of the bldgs around you is great as well. The park was full of local vendors selling their wares and munchies. All in all a good place to skate and shop during the holidays.

Shop, people watch and eat!.
