Just behind the public library and near Times Square, a little oasis in the busy city - transformed into a Christmas shopping paradise with a lovely big ice rink and a great restaurant (Celsius).We stubbled upon it after a busy day and did some shopping ...lots of hand crafts - for Xmas. Then watched the skaters from a lovely outdoor table at Celsius (food is great there btw...try it!)Great find....give it a go :-)

A lovely park near Time square. I,was there during the 10th anniversary of 9/11 and they had placed thousand of chairs to remember the people that died during that awful incident . Stll the park was lovely an lively during the day and also at night

Great place to ice skate but get your speed pass before. we skated here on Thanksgiving day and the line to get in was very long. Even though it is free to skate, just pay the $14 for skate rentals, we paid online the extra $6pp to get the speedpass. We avoided any lines, walked right in to a special line to get our skates and onto the ice. It was crowded but not overly crowded. the staff kept everyone safe and was attentive when someone fell. Great time to skate outdoors in the middle of the city. Must grab a crepe and/or a drink afterward from one of the many vendors afterwards.It was the highlight of my kids (22, 17, 12) weekend.
A gem in center of town. Enjoyed the atmosphere of park, ice rink and surroundings. Easy going place in busy city

What a little gem of a park.... I work a few block from Bryant Park and love spending time there at lunch time or after work. Centrally located close to all the trains, B, D, Q, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, etc) and Grand Central...you can go ice skating now (free if you bring your own skates and a lock for the free lockers for your shoes and stuff). A little expensive if you need to rent skates ($15 I think). Food is not good there at all so eat before or after...I love the pop up restaurant near the rink..it has a funky cool ambiance and you can have a somewhat reasonable priced drink and appetizers there...I mean given the location and the fact that you are in NYC...adult beverages are $9-12 and cheapest app around $7 bux...IN the summer Bryant Park is awesome with free movies in the park (my all time fave), music concerts, dance and yoga classes and more! They even have a ping pong table there and an extension of the library!!! So cool. Lastly, more adult beverage places throughout the park for happy hours and such. Enjoy Bryant Park all year round...it's come a LONG way from what was in the '80's and '90's, my friends!
Nice quaint place to visit. I found tranquil here, nice to sit and watch and have a skate on the ice,I also watched Macy;s parade from here and ideal next to 42nd St subway
Wonderful!. I wasn't expecting to find little cabins selling all sorts of handcrafted gifts here! And a skating rink. Very pretty and chilled out

A nice litte mini escape whilst walking around.. It's a cute little park with a reading area for children, seats, greenery, cafe and little concerts. I love to sit and have a quick cool drink in Bryant Park.

We love this park. We take our kids ice skating here every year. It fulfills their need to skate outside without the wait of rock center. They also have all of the kiosks there so after skating, a ride on the carousel, and a warm drink, we can walk around the little shops.
lovely place to walk around. at this time of the year, there is a ice skating rink and a market around the square - lovely decoration although the fixing at the street.

Nice place to visit, watch the skaters and do a little shopping. Lovely park right behind the New York Public Library. For the Holiday season they've set up some vendor tents. Also there's a restaurant in the park (can't remember the name) where we ate lunch. Food was great and the location perfect. A fun place to spend a little time.
Great fun. Enjoyed watching the skaters especially those who fell, also the kiosks selling ornaments and pancakes
Pretty, but busy. Bryant Park is half park/half vendors and restaurant. It is a nice place to get together with friends and just to stroll around for a quick walk.

It's holiday time at the park!. Bryant Park has been transformed once again into a winter wonderland. There is Citi Rink for skaters who want an alternative to Rockefeller Center.
The rink is surrounded by small gifty shops all over the place. Many of them have great items for gift giving.

a city treasure. Sitting, eating, people-watching, skating in the winter, ping-pong, chess, books to read, holiday market, and the iconic library lions....this is a special place in the midst of the 5ht avenue/grand-central/times-square bustle.
A calm oasis. Spent a little time here taking pics and drinking my coffee. A lovely area

Continental Feel. This lovely little park is scattered with small shops within glasshouses, selling crafts and jewellery. They were closed when we went, but even peering in at them was a pleasure. There's a skating rink in the centre and a beautiful fountain that I threw the last of my cents into. The layout and chairs and tables dotted around reminded me of parks and squares in Paris, and it was rather lovely. Definitely worth a detour if you're in the area, perhaps if you've visited the NY Public Library which backs onto it.
Surprise in the City. Artist village was lovely to walk around. Ice skating rink had holiday music playing.
Ice track and halloween. The Ice track and halloween decoration made our nightly visit to the park very nice
Very crowded. It would have been better if there was more room to maneuver. There were a lot of interesting booths/shops, but it was very difficult to stop and look.
Great fun ice skating. We loved the atmosphere and plenty of small stall-holders selling hand-made items. Sitting outside under the heat lamps is fun and good for people-watching!

Creative and Festive. Great place to shop for creative, artful gifts by small, independent vendors. Festive ice skating rink with cafe to sit and drink and watch the skaters. Very relaxing and festive atmosphere.

It's Holiday Market time!. Love the outdoor HolidayMarket; we usually find some unique gifts there, and enjoy watching the ice-skaters. We always enjoy eating at The Bryant Park Grill no matter what the season.
Real Nice Place. We only spent a short time here but enjoyed watching the skaters. There are small shops and places to get a bite to eat and plenty of seating.
Just another park.... Bryant park is lovely, and great in the sun! But nothing special. Good for people watching!

My favorite Park in NYC - always something new. Please check out their website and find out events. Summer in the Park is awesome, they have movies, ping pong tables, music, chairs and tables and some food kiosks. Winter brings free ice skating (you have to pay for rental if you own your own pair of skates), the xmas shops and now they have a new two-story high restaurant/lounge overseeing the ice skating rink and shops. Also a Southwest Porch where you can hang out and have dinks outdoors with some old fashion chairs. There is always a variety in Bryant Park. I am always checking out the events

Very quiet and characteristics. We went to Bryant Park, from where it's possible to see Flatiron building. It's amazing, no words.This park is reall quiet and during weekend some artists show their ability, really characteristics. We had the possibility to assist to a live rock concert.Don't forget to come here! Really a "must" in New York!I'm looking forward coming back.

Nice oasis to get away from the city. I love this park and often have lunch there when i visit the city. I would not go out of my way to visit Bryant Park but if you are near grand central talk a walk down and have lunch.
Ice Skating and Shopes. Fun to watch the ice skating and walk around the holiday shops.

Unexpected but good. ...kind of stumbled upon this whilst walking up to the Rockerfeller centre and glad we did. Great little outdoor kind of market selling a variety of stuff, including some awesome fresh popcorn in various flavours and a skating rink in the park. Nice and relaxed.

Never knew. Never knew it was there always heard of it but so nice to see the shops, unique snacks. Sit a little and enjoy was worth the walk for sure . Winter time with skating rink. Thought such a nice idea to have carts of books for parents to read to the children in the park. Small merry go round for kids also.
special place. I love Bryant Park this time of year particularly, with the ice rink and the christmas shops
FRIENDS. Park is a lovely jewel in the bustle of New York. Didnt know how famous the fountain was. A lovely place to have some quiet time with friends and a coffee

Small but great. Right behind the NY LIbrary with food and coffee spots all around. Great at holidays, they have a bunch of tents up with crafts and food, sweets and a small ice skating rink. In summer I think they show movies there. Great to grab a bite to eat when checking out that part of town.
hot chocolate. lovely area to sit and drink hot chocolate or to watch the ice skaters.
Winter wonderland. visit this park next to the rockafeller centre in NOVEMBER/DECEMBER , it has a xmas market surrounding an ice rink , with a superb cafe /bar.
Too many kiosks. It shall be a wonderful park, but it's full of stalls and kiosks.
great place to rest up. Being on 42nd st this is a perfect place to hang out when you are tired walking around in the city. During the holidays one can just shop at all the little shops in the park.
Great little shopping booths. Great to wander around but shops didn't open until 11am
A little gem!. Its small but so nice especially in winter with all shops in it and the ice skating ring!

FLASH AND TRASH. What a disappointment; the beautiful park is now a mish mash of food booth, candle sellers, crafts, junk jewelry, and CROWDS. What happened to the beautiful open space where you could sit for a few moments and watch the world go by? We don't need another street market -- especially one that's filling a once-peaceful space. Ugh!!
Very European and lively. We really liked our stroll though Bryant Park in the evening and stopped for a coffee while watching the ice skaters. A fun place to visit with lots of little boutiques.

Revived City Park. I used to step over junkies collapsed, when crossing the park to and from work in the 70s. It's now quite respectable and safe, and a delightful haven just behind the New York Library.
nice all year round. nice all year round, a little bit of the wild, and in winter a great xmas market and icerink really enjoy a walk round here or a coffee or chocolate
Lovely park. Spent a few minutes taking in the atmosphere. Lovely flora and fauna. Nice place to sit for a while in quiet in this busy city.

GREAT ARTISTS!!!. One block from the Courtyard Marriott (TSS), this is a great place to have breakfast (patisserie across the street), stroll along the park and visit the numerous talented artists currently selling their work. What a wide variety of choices - no need to step into any "big box" or department store!!!! Great place to spend the day! Ice skating, shopping & eating - who could ask for anything more???
great place to watch the world go by. great christmas market and ice skateing good place to take children of all ages.

The Venue for The New York Public Library. Whether it is concerts, films, fashion shows, or just a place to relax, this is it. Did I mention it is adjacent to the New York Public Library? Go inside for more than books. The collections of rare books and artifacts as well as a terrific gift shop make this an unusual stop for tourists and locals alike. Also, the reading room takes the person back to a time before ebooks!

What a Great Spot!. This park has so many little boutiques and diversions - its a great place to just drop in and grab an Espresso, stroll through a few outdoor vendor's booths and then be on your way.

A Great Place for Lunch. To enjoy a truly New York experience, I recommend grabbing a sandwich or a lunch from any of the local eateries and picnic at Bryant Park. It is a beautiful spot to people watch.
Great holiday feeling. The park has a great hoilday setting with lots of vendors, ice skating rink, restaurants, and music.

BEST place to watch the city go by!. My wife and I were being adventerous and decided to just walk and walk without having any places in mind. we stumbled upon bryant park, its not really a park, its more of a huge area where there are chairs and benches you can sit, take a rest, and just watch the whole world go by. it was around noon, there were office workers and tourists just sitting down, bringing there own food and enjoying the beautiful warm weather for november! we sat there for an hour with our iced coffees from starbucks across the street. it was a great time.
Holiday Fun. The park had an outdoor ice skating rink and a Christmas crafts/gift shopping area. It was nice to sit and watch the skaters and wander through the shops.
Movie night. Fun place to relax and take in an outdoor movie on movie night.
You gotta see it. A place full of life. I visited for the first time just after fashion week pull down. Even without it's makeup on a beautifull oasis yet a bee hive of the essence of the city.
ice rink. many people visit New York and miss this spectacular venue. Lots of small shacks selling different gift ideas along with a central ice rink

An Oasis in the City. What a suprise for us when we visited the New York library to find this little piece of heaven! Filled with beautiful trees, plants and benches we saw people playing ping pong and sitting reading and chatting. We visited the washrooms and found them to be very clean and well managed! They were setting up the grounds for an ice skating rink at the time which will no doubt compliment this site.You have to drop by and see this area and have a rest!
The definition of an urban park. Its awesome because the business interests and land owners in the neighborhood recognize the value of a clean open space. They make sure it stays that way.
Free ice-skating. The park was all done up for Christmans and the ice-rink and all the market stall were excellent. Became our favourite place to eat.

Great walk in the Park!. Happened upon Bryant Park by accident - great spot! Enjoyed browsing the booths and ended up having lunch at the grill. Bright, fabulous pot for lunch - food was excellent!Canadians who enjoy new discoveries in NYC and a great lunch

A nice little park. Such a nice place to stroll or sit with a cup of coffee. At holiday time there are vendors set up that sell cool gifts as well as hot chocolate,tea and coffee. There is also an ice skating rink which is $13 to rent skates. If you need to check your bags the cost is $7-10 for a locker AND if you need a lock for your locker its another $9 so dont forget to bring your own combination lock. During the summer there are concerts and movies shown there. 25 years ago this place was a haven for drugs, but not anymore.
Nice place to walk around". Nice place to walk around or go ice skating. Nice Carosel for small children.
The spot to relax in town. Great spot to relax in town with lots of seats and restaurants.Free WIFI is brilliant, have a look at the chess players

fun shops. I enjoy wandering aimlessly through NYC. Found Bryant Park whioch had 550 or so, little boutiques. There was sonething for everyone. Artists, craft vendors, unique food vendors and an ice skating rink. There was even a mini concert going on. All in all a nice way to spend an hour or 2.
Winterfest!. Tons of small tented purveyors of crafts, food, gifts, surrounding the ice rink, with live music
Citi Pond adds to the Experience. Watch the skaters and sip the hot chocolate when you want a quick break from activities

My favourite park in NYC. We visited recently and I love this park normally but this time, as it was holiday season, there was a fab holiday market with some very quirky stalls, an ice rink and restaurant. The atmosphere was brilliant and we drank hot apple ciders most days, while swinging on chairs in the main cafe/bar area (can't remember the name).

great place. The atmosphere at this park which is now already set for Christmas was amazing. There is already the ice skating rink. The overall ambience of the place is very welcoming and the Christmas stalls make it even warmer

Beautiful. Beautiful all lit up at night with the ice rink and the small shops that surround it (though very pricey). There's plenty of seating around the ice rink so you can get a bite to eat (buy cheaper elsewhere) and sit watching the skaters having your food.

Lovely Christmas market & a place to watch the world go by. Bryant Park is a lovely public space right in the heart of midtown only a block from Times Square but feels a whole world away. We really enjoyed strolling round the Christmas Market and stopping to watch the ice skating. There is plenty of seating and we stopped several times to take it all in. I'd particularly recommend stopping for a cup of hot cider (with a cinnamon stick) which was fabulous and reminded me of the Christmas Markets in the town I lived in in Germany. We were also able to sit and watch a game of boules/petanque that some gents were playing which was good fun. I also have to say that Bryant Park has the nicest public restrooms I have ever seen; there were flowers, lovely tiling and an attendant (but not for tips).

Perfect place to unwind and relax. We visited in November when the icerink was in place and all the shops and stalls were open. It was perfect for a mooch around the shops, sipping bavarian cranberry cider (yum), and watching the ice skating before heading back into the hubub of the city!

Christmas Market is a Must!. They have booths set up all over the park, along with ice skating and many food vendors. It is a festive atmosphere, with great selection. We stopped at the Grits booth for a taste of good southern cooking, and the owner was a wealth of information, giving friendly advice in the city as well as a delicious bowl of grits!

No German Kriskindlemarkt vendors at Bryant Park. We were disappointed not to find any German vendors displaying their wonderful Christmas wares at the park. I was hoping to go home with a nutcracker or prune man.
Ice Skating. Fun park offering ice skating and a number of small kiosks selling different items and some food items.

A jewel we kept returning to!. I had read about Bryant park on TripAdvisor so it was on my "to do list" for our weekend trip. I was pleased to see it was only a short walk from our hotel. (Hotel St James) We enjoyed watching the skaters, wandering the stalls and sitting on the porch swings, enjoying a refreshment. The atmosphere was so relaxing, we seemed drawn to it. We actually made several trips there over the weekend. The park was decorated for the holidays. We didn't go skating but love that was free for the ice time. (there was a $14 fee for rentals if you didn't have your own skates.) I also loved the carousel, and the children's reading area, complete with a well-stocked book trolley. (As a teacher, that warmed by heart!) I highly recommend taking a stroll over!
A great time to visit........ is the holiday season when all the booths are set up and the ice skaters are having fun on the rink!
Christmas set up was in place. They were setting up for Christmas when we were there so we were only able to be on the outskirts but still liked the atmosphere.
a surprise treat; no idea it had to much to offer. Love the ice skating rink and all the little shops.

Free open-air movies in the Summer, and now an ice-rink!. Have you ever wanted to see a favorite classic movie lying out in a beautiful city park, surrounded by the snug of quiety imposing skyscrapers in the middle of New York's mid-town Manhattan? Well, you can; and it's free! Bryant Park's Summer movie program is a once-a-week treat throughout July & August every year, and quite honestly, should not be missed. Bring a nice bottle of wine, a selection of cheese and light crackers, and a good friend or two to picnic with, and just wait for sundown and then for the show to flicker up in the world's most incredible outdoor cinema experience. Classic movie titles range from Raiders of the Lost Arc, West Side Story and Dr. Zhivago, and often include a gem from Disney (watching the dwarfs call out the "Hi-Hoooo" to each other as the prelude to the song in the midst of the night-time hum of mid-town made for a most refreshing viewing of Snow White!). Whatever the movie though, it's pretty much irrelevant, as it's the whole experience of a night-time picnic at a movie in one of the most beautiful parks in this incredible city that makes it an unmissible must-do whenever you're in New York for the Summer. In addition to the free Summer movie program, Bryant Park itself is such a serene park at any time of the day: with deck chairs and fold-out tables all caressing the gravel sides of the park; perfect for am occasional lunch-time snooze, an afternoon's game of chess with a friend, or just the pass the day with a good book and a sandwich; and amidst all the midtown traffic, one can barely hear it around you. What is also especially wonderful about this unique city park is that it also quite small, a sort of cozier and more intimate version of it's bigger brother 20 blocks up the road (Central Park); in other words, it's a park you can truly get to know. But it's also a park that puffs up for the Winter, and at Christmas time, like everywhere else in New York, most especially. The Christmassy side shops and vendor stands all lit up to the nines, the local families out shopping (remember this park is within easy walking distance for the many families living in the Fashion District, Hell's Kitchen, as well as Murray Hill) with the soft patter of children chasing each other with snowballs, or smurf-like infants being pulled along by their fathers on baby-sleighs, and to top it all it now has a wonderful little ice-rink which is wholly on a par with the Rockerfeller. As the park essentially starts on the north-end at 36th street, it is also only 6 blocks away from Broadway & 42nd, so whatever you're night-out, or reason to be in mid-town, Bryant Park is an easy lay-away from it all. In fact, this neat, cozy, treat of a park is so quintessentially New York that I have often wondered why there hasn't been an entire movie story revolving around it. Worth a visit - at any time of the year.
Nice park with skating rink and shops. This park was 2 blocks from our hotel. It was a nice little oasis in the city with a skating rink, shops, cafes, etc....
A Hidden Gem. Loved the ice rink and the bar with the swing seats.

Bryant Park is beautiful !. We especially like all the little booths set up at holiday season selling their wares. Grab a hot chocolate and watch the skaters or better yet go skating! its a nice change of pace.

At the Holidays, always a Destination. During the holidays, they have an ice rink (free!) and little shops set up throughout the park. You can buy all kinds of hand made items, from tyvek wallets, to christmas ornaments, to candles, to costume jewelry. After that, enjoy a snack or a beverage in the cafe overlooking the rink.

Love the Christmas shops in Bryant park. Love the Christmas shops in Bryant park..
great way to spend time browsing shops and it was very close to this hotel....
Opening the ice skating rink. Bryant Park was busy, as they were planning on opening the ice skating rink the day I was there. Just busy with people.
Small but cute. It ain't Central Park but it's a small oasis in this part of Mid-town. Everyone having fun skating. Lots of little shops and places to just sit and relax. Great spot!
Great place. Nice small shops selling some really interesting things. Cool,
Extra time. If you have extra time it's ok to visit. There is also a cafe where you can have a bite.

The best urban park I've ever seen. Bryant Park was recommended to us by our hosts and we are glad that we dropped by. It is an amazing urban park enclosed by very attractive modern and turn of the century buildings and has a very cozy feel. It has a nice big lawn and a lot of tables and chairs around it under the trees where you can have a meal if the weather permits. There is a nice cafe in one corner of the park with swings to sit on instead of chairs - it was great! It is just a minute from Times Square and I recommend it for everyone to walk by, it is worth it!
Interesting square. An oasis amongst the clamour of NYLots of small shops and eateries.

open haven oasis in NYC. go for a walk in Bryant Park right in the middle of the city, sit, have a coffee, relax, big enough to feel like you got away, and small enough for all to enjoy. Location is fabulous

Cool. What a great spot. I'd never heard of it before this trip. A great place to potter about, little kiosks with different items for sale. A lovely restaurant there too. A skating rink that you can see from the top of the Empire State.
Always Fun. The park has a skating rink now and booths with a great varieity of crafts -- good place to do some Christmas shopping.

A gem. This is a lovely place to visit, day or night, with a free ice rink (just take your own skates or hire some), lots of booths selling quirky stuff and the best hot chocolate in town at the Crepe stall
Skating the night away. easy to get to. Nice seating areas. open late for skating

Wonderful small shops and ice skating. Night time in Bryant Park with the small tent shops, the beautiful lights and ice skating is so much fun. The craft shops are filled wtih wonderful gifts at good prices. Great place to stop for hot cider and a sit in the park.
Nice Park. A nice, clean, comfortable park for anything you may want to do. Very busy, but not annoyingly so.

Winter wonderland. On my visit to the park the whole place resembled a winter wonderland. The ice rink was crowded with a long wait therefore we didnt get chance to use it but it seemed to be policed well with guards on the rink for any problems that occurred. Columbia Freezer tours were in the park promoting their coats when we visited and it gave us over an hours worth of free entertainment with some great freebies - a hat, photos and a mug of cocoa! The shops and stalls around the park offer a massive variety of gifts, more than you could possibly need!!!
Love Bryant Park. Bryant Park is beautiful! Had our coffee and pastry sitting at a table in the park. Just a beautiful place!

Nice Stopping Point on 6th Avenue. Not a big park but a pretty one. Lots of little shops for those who don't want to sit down and rest their feet. Also features some sandwich and coffee shops for refreshment.
Great location. in the winter check out the ice skaing - it's wonderful. Great location and usually a lot going on around it
Unique and Fun. The shops in Bryant Park are perfect for finding unique gifts and fun apparel. Plus, great food to snack on! Great on a sunny cool day.
Relaxing but a lot of the same store over and over. It was a great location and wonderful to walk around however it was pretty repetitive with the shops. The best park was the ice skating.
THE BEST HOTEL. Love this place and the staff are amazingly warm... and good looking. It was my birthday and they brought up to my room a bottle of wine and balloon no less! Fantastic. Really sweet.
Bryant Park. Fun place, lots of jewelry and eclectic other items

Excellent food and location. The food is wonderful. This large restaurant is divided in two with the second half tented on the 40th Street side. Gets crowded and loud, but it's a beautiful spot with the Library behind it, the holiday shops and skating rink set in the park just outside. One thing: the bathrooms, although modern and clean, have an awful smell.
An oasis within a bustling city. The layout was nice, even though there is building work going on at one end. Trees and shrubs, and birds which I always like to see.
Peaceful Oasis in the middle of Manhatten. Ice skating surround by plentiful small quirky stalls, easy to lose yourself here for a couple of hours, loved it.

While away a sunny afternoon. I love the parks of NY and I particularly liked this one. We visited on the day before the labour day weekend getaway and lots of locals were stopping by for a drink, the weather was beautiful and the lovely folks we met were mines of information about the city. There was a pianist playing, also a jazz band, if you're going to NY try and fit this park into your itinerary, you won't be sorry you did.
Ice Skating in the Park. Great time to visit as you can Ice Skate until Feb 2012- $14 for the skates or free if you have your own. Also lots of Mini Shops placed all around the park. Worth a Visit!

Amazing at Christmas!!. If you are visiting the city at christmas time, visit Bryant Park with it's beautiful Christmas Tree, the Skating Rink and the Holiday shops and eateries, it's a delight the atmosphere is great!!!!

What a gem. Only went becaue Phil's surname is Bryant and had a few hours to kill. Really glad we did. Got there the day they were setting the park up with winter stalls and ice rink. Will come back again in the winter as it looks as if it will be a great place to shop and while away some time.

Skating in the winter. Skating in Bryant Park in the winter is much less crowded than the Rockefeller and as cool as. There were also a free movie exhibition and many good places to eat which also entertained those who were waiting. Definitely recommend it!!
Lovely Park. Lovely park for eating and shopping at at this time skating.Some fabulous unusual shops
always a great oasis. right now they are contructing for x mas but, its usually one of the best little parks in the city.
a little gem in the middle of the city. we came upon this by accident and it was magical. lots of craft stalls, an ice rink and even a children's library. wonderful

Holiday Shops & Ice Skating. Good time to visit end of October, not full of tourists and you can get a turn on the ice. New York Public Library is also a good spot - checkout the Rose Main Reading Room - it's stunning. It's just to the back of Bryant park.

Nice little park.. Nice little park, beautifull during summer and very nice ice skating ring in late fall and winter. Beginning at the end of October nice market with all possible decorations and art items.
Nice view of the back wall of the NY public library at the farther end of the park.
Bryant Park. Very New York-y. Really enjoyed watching the ice skaters in the park as well as visiting all of the little vendors with their wares for sale.
Holiday Shops. We really like Bryant Park, but they were already setting up the holiday shops and it wasn't even Nov yet.

I loved this park!. Slap bang in the middle of the city, grab a beer (not that cheap but worth it for the location) in the cafe and sit and watch the city go by. Went back more than once as it was lovely place to sit especially to stop with the shopping bags after hitting 5th Avenue :-)
I love this park, small but so nice. You can play games here, sit down and watch people or just the park.

My favorite park, hands down. This park was located close to our hotel. It was so pleasant. A nice retreat after the hustle and bustle of Times Square. The little sandwich shop was great (get a Limonata) and watching people play ping pong and bocce ball was very entertaining.
Pleasant haven in the middle of NYC. Small kiosks on the side and a nice place to sit to escape for a while. They were preparing for the ice rink when we were there - will be lovely I'm sure.

Surprising jewel in the middle of town. Just behind the New York Public library, once a year Bryant Park is turned into a winter wonderland with ice skating and lots of crafts booths and food choices. Great for kids - nice way to have some fun that doesn't involve eating, sitting or buying stuff!

Excellent spot for skating and more. The ice rink was up a few days ago, and the shops around were mostly open - great atmosphere in the evening! Well worth a little visit on the way to Times Square and Broadway

Bryant Park Ice Skating Rink - Magical Holiday Activity for Kids. My parents were in town with my little nephew at Thanksgiving and we were looking for kid-friendly things to do. After we exhausted the usual attractions (like the not-to-be-missed watching Macy's balloons get blown up the night before the parade - it's better than even the parade itself). Anyhow what we were really looking for was something to tire the kid out. He's four, with energy to spare, and he'd had all he could take of sitting still in restaurants while the adults chatted. What I thought would be just a ho-hum experience for the adults turned out to be really pretty magical, thanks to the holiday music the ice rink was playing and the curtain of snow flurries that started, seemingly, on cue. Pros: Free entry fee; $5 skate fee; good concession stand; good music; not too crowded mid-afternoon on a weekdayCons: Plastic skates very uncomfortable (bring your own if you have them) for adults (kids don't seem to notice); no earphones allowed for those who would like to skate to their own music

Amazing skating rink in the winter. I loved that this rink is virtually tourist free, no lines and free entry. If you happen to have your own skates then there is nothing to pay. If you need skates, you can rent them there. Lockers are not free, so a good tip is to leave your purse at home and you can't use a camera while on the skating rink. The staff did a great job keeping everyone safe in the rink.Love this park in the summer as well.
My kids love the carousel, I like to sit in the shade.. Love to stop and rest here, snacks and food not too expensive, and there is always shade here in the summer.
Relaxing in City. After a tour of the city library this was a great spot for an impromptu picnic and people watching hour.
In transition. A lovely, well-used park but it was in transition when we saw it. They were in the process of erecting an ice skating area.

Citi Pond is Back. Every winter, this is rather early for winter season, but anyway, every winter, citi pond will have its ice skating rink setup at the "lawn" section of the park. The pond opens early in the morning from 8AM till late night 10 or 11 pm. Free ice skating if you bring your own skate. I work up in the building next to the pond, so I can see the crowd from morning till late night. Before noon, the crowds are usually very scattered. Afternoon is when the big crowds start coming. I love the view from atop, especially when it is lit. There are many shops around the ring with full range of gifts and festive ornaments. Come see what midtown NY have for you and your family.
A Lovely Surprise. A beautiful place to wander and have a coffee. Best merry-go-round in NY
Oasis. Great place to sit and have a coffee in between discovering NYC.

Great place to visit some unusual vendors and trees. One of the things I like least about New York is the absence of greenery. Bryan Park is a remedy to that, with a lovely square block of trees and grass. And there are a large number of vendors selling from small kiosks -- an interesting assortment of items, all available at a fair price. Also an interesting assortment of restaurants nearby, as is the New York Public Library.

One of My Favorite Places. Bryant Park was transitioning to its winter activities when we visited in late October. The ice skating rink and little shopping booths were being constructed and should be done soon.
A missed opportunity. Ran out of time to stop here but went past several times. It was filled with pop up shops ready for the holiday season and it looked amazing. Definitely one to do next time!
a quiet place in the middle of time square. a nice rest in the middle of the day. free toilets

In the middle of construction. Nice park in general, but they were in the process of building Christmas village shops so we stayed in a cafe on the periphery watching passers-by at 6th Ave. and 42nd St. Nice day makes it great.

little corner of quiet. loved this park, sat on the terrace for an afternoon... felt like europe for a while. Nice little place for a break from the maddening crowd of New York and great people watching spot too.
Good for a brief stop. Good for a brief stop for hot cocoa and some shopping for unique items. The skating rink just opened.

Take a Break. The changing venues in Bryant Park always give the visitor something new to look at as you grab a coffee from Witch Craft and sit at the plentiful tables scattered about. Don't neglect the opportunity to catch a game of table tennis or sit and gaze at the building behind the spraying fountain. Did you know the NY Public Library houses its extensive library archives under this park? Great use of space!
A gem amongst concrete. A little verge of greenery in a concrete jungle. Great for a sit and relax after some heavy sightseeing and shopping!

Very interesting. This park is very interesting and so close to the hotel.Brazilian visitors don't miss a view of the big Andrada(José Bonifácio,the Patriarch of Brazil Independence) statue located at park entrance,gift of Brazil goverment to NY in 1953.
Watching the Carousel. A fun place to people watch and enjoy the kids and their families riding the Carousel, brings back great childhood memories.

Great little park near the library. This is a great place to have a break from your working day, shopping or sight seeing. There are tables and chairs and kiosks to buy a soup or sandwich. On a sunny day it will be very busy with lots of people sitting on the grass. Sometimes they have open air concerts playing.

Unexpected oasis just off busy 5th Ave. A lovely little square offering some peace and escape from the buzz of 5th AVenue. Unfortunately when we visited (Oct. 2011) they were preparing to build the traditional ice rink for Christmas so most of the park was a construction site. Not really something you can complain about, though. A great place to site and have a coffee and snack during a busy day's shopping!
Live ballet made it fun. A pleasant park in Manhattan, but busy the night we went as the Bryant Festival week was on - Latin American ballet. Drinks prices were high!
Tranquility. The fact there is an open air Library where you can borrow books and sit in the Park reading them is excellent. Also people playing Chess.

Love, love, love Bryant Park. Yet another well planned, well utilised outdoor space in NYC. We were there in Sept 2011 and it quickly became our favorite spot towards the end of the day to relax and have a drink before dinner. There always seemed to be some kind of entertainment on the lawn area and the Southwest Porch, while not cheap, was a fantastic spot for a drink and some people watching.
Just a stroll from the hotel. A peaceful piece of green amongst the concrete steel and glass. Very well looked after.

Nice to have coffee and a snack in the sun. There are not so many places in the middle of New York where you can sit in the sun and just daydream with a cup of coffee and a snack. Bryant Park is a good place for this. Located midtown, within walking distance to Macy's or Times Square, it is a small oasis in the midst of New York's hustle and bustle.
Lovely park. Such a nice feeling small park. Has a European feel to it and beautiful next to the NYC library.
Nice place to see and watch the world go by.. Bryant Park in a perfect small city park. It is a very nice place to sit and have a cup of coffee or tea and people watch, even in the winter.

Free fun!. Stop by the library for an amazing (and free!) sightseeing opportunity. The staff is very sweet, one of the security guards told my sister the ins and outs of how and where she could take pictures of the Main reading room while still following the rules. He then offered to take our picture for us and told a very annoyed New Yorker to relax while the man took our picture and the hurried New Yorker had to wait.
A delightful Park. With tables for two, lots of floral and trees, a wonderful escape from the crowds. The Bryant Park Grill for Brunch was wonderful!
Lovely oasis of a park in a Big City. Lovely peaceful park with plenty of seating. Great just to stop and rest awhile before carrying on with sightseeing
Neat place to sit, read, or people watch.. Nice park located directly behind the NY Public Library. Tons of little bistro table and chairs set up on the great lawn.

Ahhh.... Bryant Park is a delightful breathe of fresh air midst the towering buildings. This rather large park was filled with tourists and locals, out for a midday break on the lush green lawn. Especially the group of business folks (about 10) who were juggling in pairs! Great place for observing the diversity of people. Reasonably priced lunch nearby for takeout.

An oasis of sanity, amid the bustle of Midtown.. My wife and I live in Connecticut. Whenever we visit the City by train, we usually end the day in Bryant Park, sitting in the Café for an hour or so, unwinding from the bustle of Midtown, and sipping on a beer (or two): they have a decent selection, and it's reasonably priced by Manhattan standards. In the summer, it's a pretty good place to wait for your train.Unlike most of Midtown, it's not overrun with tourists. There are plenty of things to do, including Petanque, Ping Pong, Chess, Backgammon and a small library (and a skating rink in the Winter), but we prefer to people-watch and relax under the sycamores.When you've come to the end of a long day, trudging about the City, Bryant Park can come as welcome relief.Recommended, but keep it to yourselves.

grab a coffee and watch the people...also free Wi Fi. centrally located peaceful park in the chaos of mid town NYC. Grab a coffee from a nearby shop, find a table in the park and enjoy the experience.

Lots going on..... Bryant Park was a hive of activity when we went there. Chess games, a live jazz fusion gig, boules, food, coffee and an all round good vibe was to be found just off the chaotic 5th Avenue. Quite a hip place and more than just a park.

Great atmosphere!. This place is great! We just sat down for an hour and had a coffee but we had lovely comfortable chairs, the terrace areas were lovely and breezy, chess tables and table tennis. Friendly staff who asked if we were all right, did we need anything etc. Free wireless too! Loved this place, very relaxing.

What a nice place to be. Just loved the Bryant Park, lovely place. Sat down and had an icecream with my husband, just watching the newyorkers spend their times, reading, dating, eating... A place to return always and always. Tip.: public restroom available, and free water

Impressive. Bryant Park is a beautiful oasis in the urban jungle of NYC, a great place to relax, recharge and people watch as well. It certainly exceeded my expectations. When I visited, there was enough activity to make it interesting, and yet it still provided an opportunity for a break from the hustle and bustle in the streets of NY. There are restrooms there and some places to get snacks too. If you are in Midtown Manhattan, it is definitely worth a visit, whether you have 10 minutes or multiple hours to spare.

Find time to drop by Bryant Park. The City park behind the main library is an opportunity to relax like a New Yorker. I stop by every time I am in New York There is always something happening. performances all summer, Tai Chi in the early morning. Sometimes Yoga, always chess, backgammon and food. IN the winter small shops fill the park for Xmas. Once I even saw (heard) New York City School Chancellor Joel Klein recite a sonnet he wrote in honor of teachers. First see the library, which has tours and exhibits as well as the stunning reading room, then check out the Park.

Monday night movies in the park is fun. The city plays movies in the park every Monday night during the summer. While there we walked over from our hotel to see what it was all about and watched part of Airplane. There were 5,000+ people there and it was great. Highly recommend at least stopping by to have the experience.

So NY, so interesting!. Bryant Park is a great place to rest awhile, read, have lunch or just people watch as you enjoy a Jamba Juice (across the street). So much to see and experience ... loved the carousel, the view of the NYC library and the calm in the midst of the bustling city. Lots of people but that is what made it so intersting.

A Parisian Park in the middle of Manhattan. I was so pleasantly surprised by how beautiful and serene this park has become. Every detail is wonderful form the cafe tables and chairs to the chairs on the lawn to the leafy trees and restaurants and kiosks. I have already told so many people to make it a go to destination for reading by oneself or relaxing with friends. It made me instantly happy to be there! My college age daughter has told me that she has been back several times to study!
Best place to people watch. Take a lunch... park is clean and just people watch! Very good way to spend a nice afternoon in NYC.
Cleanest city park ever. Bryant Park is a true jewel. The bathrooms are the cleanest public bathrooms I have ever visited. Love this park with the porch, lawn, reading area.

There's just something about this park!. I love Bryant park. It's a great place to just sit, relax, and enjoy life. One of my favourite times to visit is during the evening! Take your coffee, dessert and a good book. I also love to sit and watch the people.

A nice alternative to the Rockefeller Rink. We have been here several times during our Christmas visits to the city. This is a very nice alternative to the Rockefeller rink. It is on 6th Avenue and 42nd Street. It can get crowded at times.

Great Park. This park is so great. Right near Broadway so its a great place to take a breather. Around December, they have the Holiday or Christmas Markets and Ice Skating. I love the markets with all the unusual wares.

Midtown alternative to the Rockefeller Center ice skating rink. One of the newer attractions at this park during the Christmas season has been the addition of an ice skating rink in this park. This is a well maintained rink that that is sponsored by a large corporation. Of course during the Christmas season, the park also has a nice collection of shops that are set up too.

Take a break. The first time my wife and I were going by the park we didn't bother to go in.Always in a hurry.The second time we came by the park on a very hot day we decided to go in. It seemed like the temperture dropped 10 degrees .We slowed down the pace and enjoyed a slow walk in the park. A great place to have lunch or just read a book. A little oasis in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of a big city.They had a movie screen and chairs set up for movies under the stars. So the next time you go by Bryant Park go in and give yourself a break. You deserve it.

love this place. one of my favourite places ever! went ice skating in the park then sat around a fire in an open air bar beside it drinking hot spiced apple cider a few weeks before christmas, great atmosphere! the little huts selling all sorts of things are really nice too

A perfect oasis in mid-town Manhattan. Bryant Park is a beautiful, civilized place right near Times Square in Manhattan. Whenever I am in this neighborhood, I use it frequently as a place to rest my feet and relax. There are tables and chairs to rest on. There is a small reading place where you can rent a book, a magazine, or a newspaper. There are kiosks where you can get a snack. There are ping pong tables and petanque, or boccie courts. I remember when this park was just wasteland. It is a marvel of urban planning that has turned it into such a beautiful, useful space.

Beautiful and so relaxing!. Stopped for an hour to have lunch but loved it so much that I returned a couple of times. If you join their facebook page they have plenty of events taking place in the summer and you will be informed promptly. I loved their fountain as well.

Great place to chill out in middle of the work day!. Can't believe it took me so long to venture the few blocks over to Bryant Park. It's a great place for lunch as long as you keep track of the time! First of all there is free wifi, so I can bring my laptop and extend my lunch. Second there are a ton of places to buy food all around and plenty in the park. Third there is always something going on. FREE ice-skating in the winter! Movies, shows, concerts in the summer. There were stands of magazines to read / borrow the last time I was there. And you're back to back with the NY Public Library which is a beautiful building with lots of interesting things to see.If you go lunch time it's not always easy to find a seat.

Free Movie under the stars in the Big Apple. Who says NYC is expensive? Grab a blanket, bottle of wine, good cheese and salami and head over to Bryant Park on a Monday night. Be there no later than 4:45pm and be ready to race to the grass and lay your blanket to watch a free movie under the stars in the Big Apple. This is where the locals hang out (about 1000 of them!), when the sun is down, and picnic and relax the evening away. Great fun and friendliness. Movie starts around 8:45 or 9:00pm.
Nice place !. Very nice place and ideally for a morning breakfast in one of the restaurants around the park !

So cute. This little park is so cute and fun. We had been walking for a while and needed a break and came upon this park. There happened to be performers on the stage that day and we ended sitting and using the free wifi whole we listened. A very lovely park.

A Picture Perfect Park. Bryant Park was probably one of my favourite places in Manhattan when we visited earlier this year. It's so pretty, a real little chocolate box park nestled inbetween all the skyscrapers, a great escape from the madness that is Times Square. It's the perfect place to sit, relax and people watch with a cocktail in the sunshine. Would definitely recommend!!

Lunch at the cafe in Bryant Park.. Lunch at the cafe in Bryant Park is a must to do.Lovely peaceful location in the heart of Manhattan.Food and drinks ideal for a light lunch,well prepared and presented,and very good value.On the days that i had lunch here it was extremely hot in the city,but it was lovely to sit under the shade of the trees and enjoy a leisurely lunch.

A lovely place to sit & relax for a while. As I used the 7 train to/from LIC all the time, often got on/off at the Bryant Park station, & just sitting in the park, surrounded by skyscrapers, gathering your thoughts for a while was quite relaxing, although not very quiet. Not many places in NYC that are though :)

Fantastic - the most memorable stay in a hotel we will ever have. An absolutely brilliant stay in a beautiful hotel. What made this holiday stay at The Bryant Park the most amazing break was without doubt the staff. Everyone we met could not do enough for us and truly did go the extra mile to do all they could to make our stay special. The location is spot on and within close walking distance of the major attractions in mid town. The rooms are simple and elegant, with great views if you are looking over the park and all its hustle and bustle - great people watching! The exterior of the building is also magnificent, and in case you didn't know (and what sold it for me) it was featured in Ghostbusters!The bar downstairs is great and while we were there had a free bar for an hour every weekday! The events organisors and concierge recommended some brilliant restaurants, bars and clubs getting us guest list for places we wouldn't have otherwise got in to. Darren and the team regonised we had some celebrating to do (I proposed to my girlfriend and it was my birthday) and really made it special, we felt they were sharing in our experience. I have already recommended this hotel to friends and family, and will definitely be staying again. Thanks once again to Darren, Rob, Luis, Eric and all the rest of the guys - you were all brilliant.

Great place to escape during the day!. I love heading to the park for an hour around lunch -- it's so laid back, and the people watching is fantastic -- especially the guys playing checkers and the people laying out in the sun.

Lovely atmosphere at christmas-time. The 2 occasions I have visited BP, have both been on the run up to Christmas. During this time the park is transformed into a mini xmas-market with a very large ice-rink in the middle.The Xmas market shops are beautiful, selling all sorts of goods from candles to soaps and jumpers to popcorn ! It's a lovely atmosphere just to wonder around.The ice-rink is one of the larger ones in NY and even if you aren't skating it's great to people watch with a mug of warm cider.Even outside of Xmas time I can imagine that this park is a lovely place to come and sit. It's certainly not the biggest but there are some lovely views of the Empire State the Chrysler and the library. It's fairly central and near many other tourist attractions, so whatever time of year you are in NY, I'd certainly look around Bryant Park.

Beautiful location but awful facilities. This is just such a beautiful location tucked behind the imposing Library. But the so-called "free" rink basically lets you stand in line forever to pay $13 per person to rent what must be the worst ice skates I or my family has ever seen. And then you have to pay more for a locker or a bag to keep your stuff. No problem with paying just don't pitch it as free. And for those that bring their own equipment they still force them to stand in line, which is really stupid, they should have a separate line. Such a shame as it is such a great spot but I would not go back

It's okay. Definitely not a destination.. If you are in the city and it's a beautiful day and you want to eat outdoors then you might want to consider Bryant Park. You might happen upon an impromptu concert. Also for the last couple of years there has been ice skating for a few weeks during the winter. You can get free wifi in the park. And the 5th avenue library abuts it.

Hiden oasis to hang out in Midtown. Bryant park was holding its Fall arts festival when we stumbled across it. A different performance every night for 5 nights, all for free, right in the heart of the city, was a lovely way to experience the New York arts scene on a budget.It was also a fab place to hang out with a coffee or beer in the day or evening and right between Times Square and 5th Avenue, close to shops, Grand central station . Much nicer than Central Park

Brilliant Hotel and location was amazing. Stayed at Bryant Park for a weeks holiday to see New York and I have to say it was an amazing hotel. The staff were brilliant and would do anything for you, the rooms were amazing. Bathroom was massive and was spotless and was cleaned every day. Was dissapointed about our view but you cannot get everything. Bryant Park was just across the road to chill and have a beer. This hotel is a perfect location sub way just down the street and 5 mins from Broadway and time square.

Park yourself in Bryant Park. Go to Pret a Manger across the street, grab a great sandwich and park yourself in Bryant Park for a great urbanista picnic and people-watching extravaganza. Then after lunch, let the others go shopping in the surrounding area while you kick back with the paper, a camera, and enjoy the scenery. Tucked behind the iconic NYC Public Library, this is a perfect respite from the city in any season. Bryant Park Grill, The Southwest Porch and other food there too.

Absolutely the best. I love this hotel. Great people, great location, neutral (great!) design. The view to die for. There was a slight misunderstanding with my reservation, but it was solved graciously. Opt for upper floors!
Not what I expected. I had high expectations for this place maybe too but this park was nothing special.

One of the best parks in the city!. Wow...I never expected this small park to be one of my favorite places in the city! While my husband was subjected to biz meetings, I got to hang out in the area for a couple of hours and practice my photography. I had envisioned myself exhausted from walking for blocks...but, I never left the park! There was so much to see and do here...the first time I looked at my watch, I was already late!It was December. The stark leafless trees were incredibly beautiful against the backdrop of high-rise buildings, some with perfect reflections of the sky and trees surrounding them...made for some stunning photographs. The ice skating rink was full of people...I could have watched for hours. When I finally made it to the other side of the park, I was treated to a ton of artisans and food vendors selling the most beautiful and unique creations at great prices (for the most part).I can't wait to return and see the park in the spring and summer!!!

Great place to people watch. if you can carve yourself some seating area this is a great place to just people watch and take a break from the city. Although the city is surrounding you, its a nice break from the urban escapades. There's a chocolate kiosk there w/' awesome hot chocolate and chocolate covered strawberry for a pretty good deal. Otherwise, its just that..... a nice park.

Wonderful in the winter. I visit Bryant Park every year during the holidays. The Christmas fair is so cute and fun to browse, with everything from traditional wreaths and candles to more unusual gifts, like rhinestone iPod cases. It's free to skate at the rink there (unlike the one at Rockefeller Center), and those less athletically inclined are always welcome to watch. There's also a beautiful tree. Highly recommended.

Great place to relax and people watch. Now that spring is here, Bryant Park is a wonderful place to take a break from the tourist bustle and grab lunch at one of the local eateries. chairs and tables available outside.

Great Christmas Market. We stop here every year on our Christmas trip into the city. The market so wonderful. Every year we find something new and different. the location is great too, just south of Time Square.

Beautiful and festive in the winter. We visited Bryant Park in December when the ice rink was out. It is cheaper (free admission and a fee to rent skates) and less crowded than Rockefeller Center. There are several neat shops to look at and we recommend eating at Celcius. It's a bar/restaurant that has outdoor seating (with heaters of course). We went on a weeknight around 9 or 10 and there was a 30 min wait to sit outside and a 10 minute wait to sit upstairs which overlooks the rink. The food was reasonably priced at around 12-18 and was delicious. The atmosphere is posh and remember to look up- there is a glass celing which is really neat!

Such a nice place to spend part of the day and the Xmas market was an added bonus.. Bryant Park is a bit of quiet, when compared to places that it neighbours, such as Times Square and 5th Avenue. I went in the winter and the ice rink was set up around the tree and a Christmas Market was offering various crafts to buy. I imagine in the summer it is a lovely little place to stop and unwind for a while. In the winter it was a bit too cold to do that but was still nice to wonder around. Cheapest ice rink around, from what I gather.

Make sure to visit the Christmas market. During the time leading up to Christmas, there is a great Holiday Market at Bryant Park. During my recent trip, I went there as well as the markets at Grand Central and Union Square. Bryant Park's was the best and easiest to navigate--a great place for unusual gifts for someone special.

NICE Holiday vendors, Christmas Tree, Free ice skating park, carousel & More. My husband and I stumbled across Bryant Park a few years ago. We used to go to NY to Macy's and to Rockefeller Center to see the tree. Well, one trip we happened to walk up 6th Avenue and stumble upon Bryant Park's Holiday Shops & The Pond. We stopped in and took a look around. Ever since then, we have made Bryant Park one of our must-see stops when we are in NYC for the Holidays.Our most recent visit to Bryant Park was Dec 6th 2009. We went to Bryant Park 1st as to walk around the Holiday Vendor's shops in the daylight. Bryant Park has lots of little shacks set up with various types of vendors. You can buy anything from jewelry to hats & scarves. There is also christmas ornaments, tin signs, candles, puppets and MORE. Many of the vendors have an artsy or homemade feel to them. They also sell all kinds of snacks at the little shacks including: baked dog treats, mon ami truffles, flavored kettle corn, apple cider, crepes, waffles, chocolate covered strawberries/bananas/marshmallows, caramel apples, hot chocolate, dumplings & dumpling soups, terikyaki bar food and sandwiches. We always stop at The Sweet Shop and get one of their chocolate covered fruit sticks--the banana stick is pretty good. We have also stopped and sampled the french truffles from No Chewing Allowed. We have bought them in the past, but we passed on them this year. They are pretty good too, just a tad expensive. You can probably pick up some unique thoughtful Christmas Presents here too!!Also Byrant Park has a pretty nice sized lighted Christmas Tree. It is not as big as the Rockefeller Center tree, but it is still a really nice tree. It is beautifully decorated and trimmed with lights. Near the tree, is The Pond ice skating rink. Here you can skate for free IF you have your own skates. If you do not, then you can rent a pair for $12.00 (2009). You can also rent a lock for the FREE lockers and also pay for bag check here if needed. Skating on the Pond is available from 8am until 10pm (or midnight depending on the day). IF you do not have VIP pass, then you will have to stand in the LONG general admission line. We have never gone skating since the line is usually really really long--and it was no exception this year either! Right behind the entrance to the Pond ice skating rink is Le Carrousel. It is a small children's carousel. It has some beautiful horses on it in addition to some unusual animals like a frog. Tickets are only $2.00 each or you can buy a discount booklet (10 rides for $15.00). While we were there, we also noticed that they were getting ready to have a Magic Show that day at 1pm just in front of the carousel. We did not stick around for it, but just know that they hold events like this from time to time. If you check the website, you will see the calendar of events, including the magic shows.Byrant Park also has a nice water fountain and several small tables to rest or dine at. We will often buy a snack from one of the Bryant Park vendors OR one of the street vendors and grab a small table inside Bryant Park. It is a nice place to vist and rest for a few minutes. I enjoy watching the small birds inside this park too. They are really cute. We enjoy walking around the park, checking out the holiday vendors, watching people ice skate & ride the carousel, and getting a chocolate covered banana stick. Overall, Bryant Park is a nice green space to visit within the city. We thoroughly enjoy our winter time visits & would recommend it to others who will be visiting in November, December or early January. I'm sure it is a nice place to visit during the other seasons too, but we have only been during the winter months. We love it & will continue to visit there while we are in town visiting the holiday tree at Rockefeller Center, Macy's Santa Land & Holiday Lane, F.A.O. Schwarz and MORE!! It is a nice way to spend the holidays.

Download the free audio tour to your MP3 Player. You can "see" all of Bryant Park in 10 minutes but what a waste that would be! Slow down! Spend an hour (at least) and you'll be glad you did!Visit the www.bryantpark.org web site and download their great audio tour to your MP3 player. It's hosted by Matthew Broderick, and he walks with you around the park, giving you insights and anecdotes that you'd never get from a travel guide. This is no facts-and-figures tour, it's an introduction to the hidden spirit of one of New York's most unique places, entertainingly delivered by someone who clearly loves it.The audio tour helped us go a little slower, and see a lot more!

Sit Back, Relax, and Enjoy the Day. Great place just to hang out after site seeing or just to waste a few hours. Nice Deli, and also a bar/grill at the back of the park. Lots of free entertainment.  www.bryantpark.org
great little park. Beautiful place to stop and relax in the summer and wonderful ice skating in the winter!

A Lovely Park. We came upon this park on our walk to Rockefeller Plaza and it was a welcome place for a rest. There were plenty of tables and chairs to sit at and if not, there is certainly a big green lawn to sit on! We decided to buy a hotdog from a nearby vendor and stay a while longer in the park and it was most enjoyable!

it is a place to rest but one problem. We went the park to relay before going back on the Metro North train to Connecticut and waking anround in New York. The one problem was the carosal it only for children not for adults and grown special needs. I was upset I cound't go on the ride became I was grown and too big. They should gotting a big carosal for evenone to enjoy.

Bryant Park. We came across this park as we had a walk after the show at radio city music hall. What a great park along with the ice rink. We sat and watch the skaters having a great time. I was surprised how long the line was to skate. The small christmas market was good but not as good as the union square one.

The Pond - ideal skating experience!. If you're there when The Pond is open in Bryant Park, it's the best place to ice skate. It's free (if you don't own skates you'll need to rent some) and very roomy. It's practically double the size of the rink at Rockefeller Center. The park itself is very beautiful, and we enjoyed shopping at the Holiday Shops that were set up for the season.

Excellent hotel at the centre of New York action. Amongst New York hotels the Bryant Park gives great value for money. A stone's throw from Broadway, Times Square and Fifth Avenue, and adjacent to Bryant Park where there is an ice-skating rink in the winter, this is exceptionally well positioned. First impressions are a little mixed as the modern decor of the reception lobby is a little dark and depressing, as is the elevator to the rooms, but the room I had was totally magnificent - modern styling, clean, large and comfortable and with good views to the park. It is adjoined by a large marble-clad bathroom with a shower independent from the bath. The cellar has a vibrant nightclub stocked with NY glitterati. Beware the cost of the hotel's restaurant (like all NY top end hotels) but there is a great (in fact totally fantastic) bistro restaurant just 50 yards to the west of the hotel called Pain Quotidien ('Daily bread' in French) where you can get a much better breakfast than served in the hotel for a fraction of the price.The combination of this hotel and the Pain Quotidien, makes this a really great place to stay. I'll certainly go back.

A slice of paradise. This is my first review of an attraction. I've never been compelled before.......But Bryant Park....oh my!!!! This is absolutely my favorite place in NYC now. You must experience it. It's amazing this slice of heaven still exists right in midtown, not far from Times Square. What a world away.There is an outdoor reading room, a food stand, hundreders of tables to eat or relax, a big grassy area for sunning, and several nice restaurants/bars with wonderful patios and great views.Please make time to stop and relax here while you are in the city!FYI - Bryand Park is headquarters for "Fasion Week" as seen on Project Runway.

Wonderful. A wonderful, relaxing park in the middle of everything. I had heard of it, but was pleasantly suprised at the beauty of the park and the upkeep - the flowers and lawn was nicely maintained. My wife and I enjoyed a break from the hustle and bustle of NEw York with some time here.In the summer, they offer free movies every Monday night on a huge screen. We were there just before show time and it looked really fun!

Exceeded Expectations. Stayed on 12th floor in deluxe room. Booked through hotels.com at $289/night special rate for 2 nights in June 2008. Room has good light, is quiet., and has wood floors. Marble bathroom with both tub and shower. Very clean room, queen bed with duvet and comfy sheets. LCD/HD TV. Bose DVD player. 2 phones. Intimacy kit in mini bar. Courteous, professional staff. Great location. Not too busy for being close to Times Square. Definitely recommend for singles & young couples. Not for families. Cellar bar lower level. Happenin' crown. Japanese restaurant. 24 hour room service.

Relaxing time out. I visited Bryant Park when we needed some down time from seeing the sights. It was a beautiful day, 74 degrees and sunny. The park was very busy, from businessmen to college students, and of courst toursit like myself. There was a live band playing. I lay down on the grass in the sun and let the band and lovely weather take me to another world.

A Slice of New York City. I love, love, LOVE this fabulous park!! It's located just behind the New York Public Library at 42nd street (between 5th and 6th). It's a great place to stop and enjoy an outdoor lunch when the weather co-operates.The fountain is beautiful, and just behind that sits the Bryant Park Hotel which is another piece of New York history - originally known as the American Radiator building. The black facade tipped with gold is absolutely stunning. Check it out the next time you're in New York City!!
Favorite park in New York. What a wonderful place! Hundreds of seats, beautiful flowers, lots of people. We had a great time there.

Other parks should learn from them.. Ok...so the park is heavily over ruled by security guards, it's still one of the best public spaces I've ever been to. On a pack hot Sunday...I was able to find seating without a problem. Got a seat right next to the fountain, which was great with a sandwich from 'WichCraft. The scenery was great as was the atmosphere. This park is ideal for lounging around not really intended for any physical activity. I didn't use the wireless internet but it looked like it was offered. Overall, I was overly impressed with this park and made unscheduled visits whenever possible.
